title: Very nice evening
comment: Lovely place and nice staff. Highly recommend! It was my husband’s birthday, he really enjoyed it. A bit expensive but definitely worth it for some special ocassions. Our waiter was Giuseppe - thank you for nice service! :)

title: A memorable night
comment: Came here on my 11 months with my girlfriend. The staff were so lovely, especially Terri who was extremely helpful and sweet!! The food was incredible, it’s difficult to find GOOD vegan sushi options but this did not disappoint!! It’s definitely not cheap but if you’re looking for a place to celebrate a special occasion, SushiSamba is the place to go.

title: Exceptional sushi and desserts
comment: Exceptional sushi and desserts. Unforgettable experience. The staff is super professional and kind. The comments about this place being expensive are just pathetic - everyone knows that this place is very exclusive. We will come back.

title: Pretty good!!! Great service,
comment: Pretty good!!! Great service, good food, drinks did take a while but when you got the views it’s the one!!

title: Sublime Sushi
comment: Thoroughly enjoyed a birthday dinner here and it gets a 10/10 from me. Food and drinks were exceptional alongside excellent and friendly service.

title: nice view, but the worst experience
comment: We book a table for 9pm, they didn't have a seat until 10pm (strictly under £ 40 booking). once we sat down we had a cocktail and they informed us that it would be the last order, I complained to the manager and he told me that I had to understand the period.  Food can be better, anyway the italian girl at the bar and the bartender were very nice and polite but it still remains the worst experience in London.

title: Ms
comment: Disappointing food. Even worse customer service. Lunch today. Xmas maki role description included caviar and truffle. Caviar was tasteless and Truffle - was not truffle but truffle oil. Manager refused to accept there was anything wrong with the quality of the food and proclaimed she knew everything about truffles.

title: Great Experience
comment: Their cocktails are always superb. The shrimp tempura had perfect coating and was very delicious. Skewers and sushi melt in the mouth. Banana moist and forest cake desserts were amazing. Lovely experience!

title: Served by Manuel
comment: My friends and I came for dinner on the 10th of December and we had a lovely time dining in the 39th floor the food was good and the ambiance too! We were served by Manuel who was very friendly and professional! We ended up eating everything he recommended and enjoyed it!

title: Intimidating and chaotic
comment: 15th of December, just the end of a lunch time... I was trying to get a table... Oh no! We have a place for you... Just come to the bar... said a waitress.  Downstairs... trying to execute the invitation... Whatever they said upstairs doesn't count! said the bouncer... Move out, I have people coming. After some phone calls and freezing outside we where upstairs - no apologies... No view, place at the bar but convenient.  A bit slow but nice service... What a surprise when a manager came to the "table" and said that I have to go home... as some other guests are coming and that the limit per person is something over the hour... Unbelievable! The bill already was around 200 pounds... and I was waiting for my (very important) guest...  By the way - I was promised a "normal" table but received one (very small) in the waiting area... My VIP friend has arrived and than one more surprise... they need this table... right now! We had no choice

title: Great views boring food
comment: Wouldn’t rush back food lacking very mediocre  Service 1 waiter was good  Manager came across rude Great views that’s what your paying for. Not the food as that not great.

title: Sushisamba
comment: El Topo is a must try! We had el topo, neo tokyo, california maki and tiger maki! All very delicious rolls! Also Manuel offered us 10/10 service - was super friendly and helpful!  Will definitely be back again

title: Anniversary treat.
comment: We had a lovely time at Sushi Samba. We had a fantastic table overlooking London, the red wine we had was lush, and the food absolutely delicious. Gorgeous ambience and service with a smile. Downsides were that we had to wait about 15 to 20 minutes for our table despite hava reservation which was irritating given there's a 2 hour limit on bookings, also the pisco sours taste horrible in my opinion, nothing like lemon at all! But still, had an amazing evening.

title: Pleasant visit
comment: My twin and I celebrated our birthday here on a Monday after work for dinner and drinks and definitely left content and feeling special. We were served by Manuel all evening and he was so professional and so welcoming the entire evening we visited. He explained the cocktail menu to us to start with and recommended a cocktail to our taste. We were asked midway if we were happy with our choices and if not they would change this for us. Needless to say, the cocktails were spot on. We had the lychee cooler and the shiso fine. The sushi menu was full of flavours which were unusual but so moreish! Thank you Manuel for such a lovely experience! We will definitely be back after such a pleasant experience :)

title: Disappointed with the kitchen
comment: We are happy with the view and the service until we get disappointed when we tried to order T-bone. The waiter told us that the T-bone weight around 1 kilo more than enough for 2 people. My husband proceed to order with special request because he likes medium rare and I like medium well (no blood). He explained to the waiter because he knows that kind of request sometimes annoys the kitchen. The waiter came back and told us that the chef suggested to cook it medium and if I can’t really eat it we can return it to the kitchen. My husband explained that he like his meat medium rare and me medium well. We asked him to check with the chef if they can cut a portion of the meat and cook it medium well and the rest medium rare. When the waiter came back he told us that the kitchen said they cannot do it. It’s clear the kitchen doesn’t want to do it. Disappointed we just decided to order other things just to finish the dinner because we already lose the appetite. I wanted to understand if our request is impossible to execute so I asked my husband since he also work in the kitchen. What he usually does when they received a similar request. My husband said “I usually cut a portion and cook it first, when it’s halfway cook, I will cook the other half so it will be cooked at the same time.

title: Great views
comment: I just love eating sushi with these views and with the best company....we will be back..good attention!!!!

title: Breathtaking anniversary
comment: We’ve been at SUSHISAMBA for our anniversary dinner and the experience overall was simply amazing! The food was great, definitely suggest to try the yellowtail crispy taquitos and the Neo Tokyo and Tiger Maki rolls, as well as the service, we’ve been looking after from Cristina which was very kind, attentive and professional.  Thank you, we’ll be back!

title: Wow what a great experience
comment: Weekend trip to London with 2 aspiringly trendy 11 year old boys. Saw Heron Tower and that there was a restaurant at the top, and zoomed 39 floors up in the lift. Warm welcome and sat out in the open garden for super views, gorgeous food and cocktails. Friendly staff made it an experience to be remembered, we don't have any restaurants higher than 1st floor in Norfolk, its pretty flat.

title: We came here on my cousins
comment: We came here on my cousins birthday. Great food, drinks and atmosphere and they even reserved us a great table at the bar complete with a great view! Would definitely come back here again as we had such a great time considering everything closed at 10. On the plus side very instagrammable.

title: LIVE MAGGOT in food and rude staff
comment: After reporting a maggot in our food and following up with countless amounts of emails, we was told that this is not a maggot and that’s its’s part of the stalk, I’m not sure how the manager was trying to tell me a moving animal is part of a vegetarian dish! He then went to explain how their food is not fresh and is frozen and has been there for months (explains the maggot if you ask me) after going to the bar for a drink we were greeted with the rudest bar staff who asked us why we were sitting there and told us that we could not have a drink there. After waiting ages we finally got a drink and left. The follow up from the manager was unacceptable, I have never experienced such bad management before.

title: Plain and mediocre
comment: It is a beautiful venue, but apart from the lobster taquitos, the food was plain and mediocre. The ceviche lacked flavour, spice and finesse. The sushi was forgettable and the pieces small and tasteless. For the price it was very underwhelming.

title: Average
comment: Ok so the view is amazing and the restaurant is very pretty but unfortunately, the food and service let it down.  The staff were very friendly and welcoming but for a £170 lunch I wanted impeccable, seamless service, but this was not what was on offer.  The server couldn't answer simple questions about the menu items; we waited too long for our order to be taken, and then our empty plates were left on the table when we had finished, rather than being cleared promptly. First world problems, I know.  The tempura, sushi, and desserts were very good but we ordered a steak dish that was very fatty and tough, and the "dips"(?!) it was served with were not fresh. I'd go again but stick with the sushi :)

title: Shockingly poor service
comment: Our children bought my husband and I a gift card last Xmas to enjoy some cocktails and a meal at Sushi Samba in the Heron Tower, Liverpool Street. Due to Covid19, the treat was delayed until 26th September. At the time of booking, I was asked to give my credit card details so that £40 could be taken in case of a 'no show'. I was reassured that no money would be taken out of my account unless of course the amount on the gift card did not cover the cost of the meal and drinks.  On arriving at the restaurant, we were told that we had to vacate our table by 2.30pm. So we had an hour and 30 minutes maximum to have lunch and cocktails, not my idea of a leisurely relaxing meal. At the end, we asked for the bill and were surprised to find that we had not spent all the money on the gift card. We were ushered promptly out of the dining room as other people wanted our table and it was at this point we looked at the bill. There we found that £40 from my credit card had been added to the bill as had a discretionary service charge of 13.5%. This meant we still had money on the gift card. I asked to see the manager to ask why this had occurred and was told we would have to contact their booking office as they could not help us. Accordingly we did this only to find, we now had to send an email with our problem so that they could sort this out. Whether we will actually get a refund or not, far from feeling relaxed having enjoyed a lovely meal, I feel stressed and wired.  Sushi Samba, you need to sort out your admin and quickly. Additionally, stop trying to cram in diners. The food is not cheap and if I wanted to stuff my face quickly, I could have gone to a McDonalds!

title: Great birthday treat
comment: I booked this for my hubby’s birthday. I kinda should have looked at the menu because as common folk we didn’t really understand it and were to afraid To ask..... But we lucked in. Food was delicious and service was good. The view was spectacular. Not cheap though but you get what you pay for. Thank you

title: Excellent fusion of world cuisines
comment: Did not go for a special occasion or anything like that. My wife and I just wanted to try this place we had heard so much about. The food was excellent ! The presentation of the dishes was fab and creative. Loved the MUSHROOM TOBANYAKI (poached egg, assorted mushrooms, yuzu soy, garlic chip), the sushi and nature rolls and fir dessert, the MAZAMORRA (yuzu sphere, maiz morada pudding, orange emulsion, milk and cinnamon ice cream). The atmosphere was relaxed, nice Latin american music. The service was great, on time and faultless.

title: Perfect evening
comment: Visited Sushi Samba several times.We took family beginning of September.It was a lovely evening.The food and service were top class.At the end of our meal we sat out on the terrace to have our deserts.The view was breathtaking.A perfect evening thank you SS.

title: A beautiful lunch for our 10 year anniversary!
comment: My husband and I went here for our 10 year anniversary and loved it. The green bean tempura with alioli was amazing, as was the maki! The lamb was beautifully cooked and the chocolate banana cake was out of this world. They also brought out a 'happy anniversary' dish as a little extra! Very sweet of them.

title: Very bad service / average food
comment: For the money which you pay, you would expect to receive better customer service from the staff. Food is average. There are better alternatives for sushi.

title: Good food / bad service and rude staff
comment: I visitited Sushi Samba first for business dinner. Staff was rude but food was good. Gave it a second chance for food quality but staff was as rude as the first time. There are many other places with good sushi in London. I will definitely will not visiti this place again

title: Food only good but too expensive
comment: The quality of the food was so so nothing unusual pretty standard! Sushi was on the other hand delicious! Great wine card we all have pretty nice time in the sky!

title: Well worth a visit
comment: Great atmosphere with beautiful view. The staffs were attentive & friendly, food was excellent. Would highly recommend!

title: Simply brilliant!
comment: Brilliant restaurant, brilliant food, excellent service and location. There is nothing to complain about this restaurant. Must go if you're in London!

title: Amazing Black Cod
comment: From the lift experience to the culinary delight in my mouth, our experience last night was amazing. The Savichi and Sushi was fresh and tasty, I recommend the black cod, it melts in your mouth. Marc Emmanuel is an amazing host and commands his team with military precision. The expertise and professionalism of SS staff is commendable! They all deserve a pay rise as they work so hard to make the customer experience one to remember. Thank you SS we will be back in November for Zaks 21st birthday celebration.

title: Outstanding service!
comment: Lovely place, enjoyed the atmosphere and the food!! The place was incredibly classy. Absolutely recommended

title: Underwhelming experience, great food.
comment: My girlfriends and i booked sushisamba as our first trip out together post-lockdown and i wish we had gone elsewhere.  Before we arrived, we were warned about a reduced menu which they'd sent to us via email - it still all looked wonderful and there was enough to choose from. Upon arrival, we were told there was no hot food that evening; this cut the already limited menu in half and meant there were 0 meat options!  The second annoyance came when we tried to order a bottle of wine, only to be told they didnt have that either, and the only option they had was £8 more expensive, and they couldnt (or wouldn't) honour the price!  Thirdly, we booked to eat on the terrace, however we found our table to be in a bit of a corridor with absolutely 0 views and people walking past every 30 seconds which is hardly relaxing.  Fourthly there was a hair in the wasabi. This was found right at the end of the meal which made us feel really uncomfortable.  Finally, whilst we were enjoying the food, there was a cleaner mopping the floor around and under the table, so close that it brushed my friends foot. We laughed it off and put it down to the restaurant taking precautions to be covid safe which we fully appreciated, until we were trying to leave, the maitre d’ tried to shove us in a lift with 5 strangers! The lift would have been tight for 9 on a normal night, let alone during a pandemic when everyone is trying to keep their distance. Frankly, it made the mopping feel like a bit of a contradiction.  It’s a real shame because the food was exquisite, but the experience has made us question whether we would ever return.

title: Sushi gorgeous but terrible service-14.09.2020
comment: The sushi was delicious but the service was a complete disaster. I had to call the waiter's attention to order. No friendliness from the manager of the restaurant but the others were friendly. It was not even asked whether we like the food or whether we would like something to drink. When we finished eating, the plates weren't cleared. I put everything together myself and then asked the waiter to take the empty plates with me. Even then there was no question whether we would like to have a drink or eat a dessert. A cheeky 13.5% tip for it. What did I tip 13.5% for? Could you give me an answer for that. Thank you!  You could tell that the atmosphere in the team wasn't really nice

title: We went to sushi samba for
comment: We went to sushi samba for the first time last night and had an amazing time. The food was outstanding, we had a window seat overlooking London with great views and the staff were incredibly welcoming. In particular Sylvain our waiter was very attentive and friendly. Will definitely be going back again!

title: Vinnie, the best waiter at all.
comment: I had heard a lot about Sushisamba for its food. Incredible. Highest quality and impeccable arrangement on the plate. What impressed me most was the service. I worked as a waiter and I know what a complex job it is. Vinnie greeted us with a huge smile, taking care of our requests and anticipating our choices. At one point I asked him if he could bring us the meat and he replied "it's already on its way". Special note of the attention to allergies, since my girlfriend has milk intolerance.

title: Fantastic food
comment: We ate here for my husbands Birthday as we had wanted to try it for a while. We had drinks first and then were taken to the restaurant. The views are spectacular and the staff were all friendly. The reason why it didn’t get 5 stars was the drinks service was slow but it didn’t ruin the evening and we would certainly return. The sushi was delicious and my husband was given a birthday treat on a plate which was a lovely touch

title: excellent, friendly service
comment: I went here with a group of friends yesterday and was very impressed with how friendly and welcoming the staff was. In particularly George who was from Greece that was working on the door and Vida who was cleaning the ladies toilets. She was very polite and chatty and even helped us find my friends phone that she misplaced. Both were an absolute asset to the team and make us want to go back based on their hospitality alone.

title: Great drinks at Sushisamba
comment: We visited Sushisamba for some drinks. Staff were very welcoming and friendly. We had a lovely table outside and the drinks flowed. It was a really nice experience in what are difficult times. Thank you Sushisamba!

title: Sushisamba visit
comment: We visited Sushisamba before a football match on a Saturday afternoon. The staff we great, welcoming and knowledgeable on the menu. Our server recommended a selection of food and it was just great! Will definitely be going again.

title: Very disappointed - shop around
comment: Very disappointed, advertised as perfect restaurant in London, but service was poor and the food was average.

title: First time and not the last
comment: Went in to experience the views and the cocktails. Bar man was great, the views stunning and the cocktails not bad either. A great experience and would recommend.

title: Don’t go there
comment: Decided to go for a nice drink with my boyfriend for our anniversary. Got in, lovely bar with lovely scenic view had been really excited to try this place. When we sat down we ordered a bottle of wine. When the lady brought us our bottle of wine, she didn’t show us the bottle and didn’t ask us if we wanted to try it, however we took no heed. As she poured the wine she proceeded to spill it and pour some on my designer handbag, however we decided not to let that ruin our night. After enjoying a lovely night in the scenic bar, I went to pay for the bottle of wine. When I asked for the bill, having looked at it, it was double the amount stated on the wine menu. When asking the supposed manager if he could rectify the situation, he went on to treating me as the soul proprietor for any problem caused. While dealing with the situation discreetly, he then found it necessary to start talking louder and making it apparent to every other guest in the vicinity that there was a dispute taking place, (causing heads to turn) I am not wealthy and to some this would have been a minor inconvenience but it was the principal of asking for 1 thing and being sold another. I have never been so embarrassed and some what mortified at a situation that could have been handled so differently from such a prestigious venue that I was so looking forward to spending my evening in.  I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy

title: Perfect place
comment: One of the best Japanese places in the city. Loved the food, affordable prices. Great experience! I will be back!

title: Nice place
comment: Awesome sushi place, everything was perfect. Everybody was super nice. Food is great. Totaly worth the price

title: Best sushi place in London
comment: One of my fav restaurants in London. I've been there twice and the result has been wonderful. The team is super nice and the views are unique. It's an amazing experience if you travel or live in London. The only "problem" is that the tips are in line with what you order on the menu (which is usually quite a lot).

title: One of my favourites
comment: One of my favourite restaurants in London! Food is divine, definitely the best Japanese I have tasted. This place is a must try. I hope to visit soon

title: Sylvan was amazing. Attentive.
comment: Sylvan was amazing. Attentive. Focused on making my experience as positive as possible. Fun-loving guy. Very hospitable. What more can I say? Go to this place and ask to be looked after by this guy. You won’t find anyone working in hospitality anywhere in the world who will care more about you than this guy.

title: Amazing ‘
comment: The location it’s amazing! Friendly service. Food and drink a bit expensive but it worth it! The view it’s beautiful!

title: Birthday Celebration Experience
comment: Beautiful views, lovely decor and atmosphere, delicious and exquisite food and the most amazing cocktails. Only down side, the dining space is smaller than expected and quite compacted, also as heavenly as the food is here, it is a bit over priced for the portions you actually get. I wouldn’t advise coming here expecting to leave full, unless you can afford a good few of their large plates to fill you up, although they do recommend their dishes as sharing plates. Unfortunately I personally left still hungry, with a bill of over £350, which only £60 of it was on drinks for a party of 5. But overall I recommend coming here for the experience and service. Staff are warm, welcoming and very attentive and their selection of cocktails and wines are to die for!

title: Sushisamba is a restaurant
comment: Sushisamba is a restaurant situated on the top of the Herron Tower providing a spectral at core of London city. It is the favorite hangout place for sushi lovers lovers. As you step your foot into the restaurant, you are welcomed by the magnificent art deco setting, a beautiful combination of minimalist features and an immense luxury of modernity. Every table gives you a clear view of the chef working in the kitchen. Those, with no prior reservation, are welcomed to wait into the front restaurant with comfortable armchairs. The lounge has wall to ceiling windows and a beautiful terrace.  The menu offers a wide variety of delicious and mouth-watering starters followed by the main course, specially designed for youngsters and adults. I had salmon rolls and tuna rolls. We completed the meal with a fabulous desert and had so many of the brilliant lychee cocktails.  All the cuisines were fresh and refreshing. The award winning chefs gave a home-made feeling using the best quality ingredients. The restaurant also offers various types of drinks, they serve one of the best wines in the region. The drinks are pricey but as previously mentioned surely worth trying. In contrast, the service was of very high quality even though it was very busy. We were attended to at our every need.  Because of the brilliant atmosphere and delicious food service, I highly recommend going to Sushisamba.

title: Fun in the sky
comment: Sushi Samba is one of our favourite restaurants and always delivers. Carnival cocktails and fusion food were the order of the evening and we weren’t disappointed.

title: Great food completely let down by poorly trained staff
comment: I booked Sushi Samba for a 60th birthday celebration. Prior to booking, I emailed the restaurant to tell them all six of us would want to have a tasting menu, but one diner is Vegetarian and one diner Coeliac (gluten-free). I wanted to know if this would be an issue, as if it wasn't possible I wouldn't have booked. I was told that would be no problem, and substitutions would be made to the tasting menu to accommodate the dietary requirements. I then called on the day of booking so double confirm this wasn't an issue, as I wanted the focus of the evening to be the birthday. Again, I was told no problem at all.  Upon arrival, I realised I had completely wasted my time and effort with Sushi Samba. The manager informed me they in fact couldn't make substitutions for dietary requirements on the tasting menu, which resulted in the vegetarian and coeliac diners being only able to eat around half of the tasting menu. An appalling lack of communication for a restaurant of this calibre. To add to this, the wait staff are completely inadequate in knowing the menu and dealing with any dietary requirement. They would put down a dish and say 'the gluten-free substitution is on its way' for it to never arrive. Completely unacceptable and misleading. The food was delicious, however the evening ended up being dominated by making our diners feel excluded and unable to dine properly with the rest of the group.  To be clear, if ordering A la carte, they do cater for coeliac and vegetarians, however I was appalled they lied about being able to provide a tasting menu experience simply to get a booking in. The 13.5% service charge was still added to my bill too!

title: Awful service. Rude staff.
comment: Went for my mother’s birthday. Arrived at 8:20pm for 8:30 booking. Sat in the bar and told the waiter our booking was 8:30. Not once did someone come to update us on our table. 20 minutes later I asked a waiter when our table was ready, they said the current table were paying their bill. 10 minutes later we were told after asking twice that they had just received their dessert. Asked 3 more times with no response until approaching the maitre d who didn’t even apologise. Disgraceful and rude service.

title: Amazing view and food
comment: I can just say that the view and the food are amazing! Around Liverpool Street, you can’t find a better place than this!!

title: Nice views, good food
comment: Nice views, good food and nice atmosphere. Just make sure to book a table in advance. Definitely worth to visit!

title: First time eating
comment: And it did not disappoint! We have been in several times for drinks but never food. Booked a table at 11pm and the atmosphere was great. The waiter was very helpful too. Clean toilets. Very busy mind

title: Excellent all the way
comment: On the 39th floor of the Heron Tower after a fun elevator ride with views over the city, you arrive at this place. No fuss just a cool, calm and collected atmosphere and attentive and professionel service. The view is incredible, but the interior design is what does the trick when coming here when the sun is down. Holy moly you're in a dream world with the shifting ambience and it's truly a nice touch. The sushi was fresh, very tasty and with great combinations. To us it felt like top quality. And the dessert with the banana, chocolate chip, vanilla ice and rum was just over the top fantastic to end the evening on. Wine was good too. All in all this is a special place and would very much recommend coming here!

title: Fabulous food and a great espresso martini!
comment: We were a group of 8 celebrating a special birthday. We had a nice table and the views are fantastic. Our waiter was super helpful and advised us on the menu and the restaurants concept of sharing. The menu is pricey but I have to say that the food was outstanding. Sadly the restaurant's popularity seems to give rise to its faults. We had finished eating but were enjoying a cocktail when we were asked to vacate the table as another group had arrived and were then ushered out of the restaurant by a lady showing us "the way out". having said that it didn't spoil the evening and we stayed in the bar for drinks. Worth a visit.

title: Amazing sushi!
comment: Always visit when I come to the UK, my girlfriend and I love this place! Not the cheapest sushi but soo worth it!

title: Near incident of broken phone
comment: Nice place to go and eat with a lovely view with the amber lighted tree. However I gave my charger to the reception for my phone to be charged. My boyfriend went over to check on the phone and was told that the charger was not working but the charger was completely fine before I even reached Sushisamba.  Later on when I came back home I realise that they have jammed the charger into my phone and luckily got out the piece of metal that was jammed in there and realised the charger is actually broken in the charging slot.   I called them in regards of this and they told me that my boyfriend said to them that the charger was Already broken and that he was okay with them for using their own charger...fairs....but then when I tried to explain the actual reason on why they had to change to their own charger (because they have obviously jammed it in too hard and thought F***) they didn’t wanna not take blame and blamed my boyfriend in apparently saying he already knew it was broken. WHICH IT WASN'T!!  I mean if I knew my charger was broken then I would’ve given it in.  Explained to the woman that in future they should be careful and she started to make out she couldn’t hear me so I gave up.  All in all CHARGE YOUR PHONES AT HOME!

title: Eat in the cloud
comment: A good friend of mine had recommended me Sushisamba and in my short stay in London, despite having booked well in advance, I found nothing better than a table for 11.30. I went there and I did very well. A view of London as far as the eye can see - though not the noble side - and truly extraordinary food. There is excellent cevice of tuna and of ceviche , wonderful sea bass in tempura and finally the sashimi. good wine ... and finally also the price ... Excellent ! The best ratio quality price !!

title: ONLY THE VIEW
comment: I start from the positive things, amazing location on 39 floor with one of best views i have ever seen in a restaurant and preparation and kindness of our waiter, really good, stop. Now the other things, i booked 10 days before, because i know that is a very trendy restaurant, and i found only 00.00 AM. Before our arrival i sent 3 mails to ask the best table possibly with view because for us was a special occasion. We arrive, last table in the corner exactly in front of cash desk and where the waiters put all the things, for all dinner a person in front of us 30 centimeters from the chair, asked for a change of table, no possible we are full, after 20 minutes arrived another couple in the table next to us, they asked for a change, done. The food, absolutely normal on the level of thousand others restaurant less famous. Check, 170GBP ( 2 people) with two dishes, sparkling water and a bottle of normal white wine, we are in London but too expensive. I'm sure that i don't go another time in this place, in London there is very much better. It deserve only if you want an amazing view nothing more

title: Memorable venue and great food !
comment: The main reason to book this venue is obviously the vue. The journey starts when we took the elevator. Then could appreciate a very nice atmosphere and an amazing vue. This was a good start ! We loved the design of the place and the fusion of different cuisines was great. The food was delicious and the service matching with what we would expect. It is a bit overpriced and the bill can grow up very quickly. I would definitely come back and recommend this restaurant.

title: Great food, service and views.
comment: Great food, service and views. As long as you are prepared to spend more than average you will enjoy your experience here. With £80/100 you will be able to have a good meal, drinks and service included. We particularly liked the miso as black cod, the sushi, ceviche and meat selection platter.

title: Vinny Stole the Show
comment: We were here on Friday night and it all just came together. The food is amazing, great cocktails the view and whole setting is great. I think a must see in London if visiting.  To top it all the staff and especially our waiter Vinny really made our night - very attentive funny and just made us feel relaxed! big thanks for the whole team and especially Vinny.

title: Pleasantly Surprised!
comment: After reading several of the negative reviews on here, I was worried about how our groups dining experience was going to go. It was nice to be pleasantly surprised! I ordered the tempura shrimp, which was a nice sized portion and had a great refreshing taste in the light dressing with a pea shoot salad. I also ordered the Wagyu gyoza, which were delicious! Like nothing I’ve ever tasted before. The California maki was tasty and fresh. The reason I felt so compelled to write a review however, is to comment on the service we received. We were served by a wonderful Hungarian man, called Florian? forgive the spelling. He was attentive, polite and friendly, and deserves a special mention and thanks for his service. Our group also had several other interactions with staff this evening, all of whom were polite. What I will say, is that even though we never experienced poor, abrupt or rude service, I could imagine how a venue of this nature, at peak times e.g weekends and holidays, could become intense and put pressure on staff. I also got the impression that management may not treat staff in a very nice way. I never witnessed anything but I had sensed the venue tries to uphold a “serious” waiting service, not a relaxed one, which is a shame, as the clientele reflect the opposite...a real lovely diverse mix of bubbly people, representing London and it’s openness. I’ve given a 4 star, as the food was great but not exceptional, the atmosphere could be lightened further (top-down) and the toilets need a massive redesign. I would definitely return to this venue but would continue to avoid busy times and weekends, in fear of experiencing some of the negative aspects mentioned in other people’s reviews.

title: Go for the view
comment: Mixes feeling about our visit. Pros: Great location- close to city  Wow views- all tables are great! Kind service, everyone is welcoming and smiling, very helpfull all the way. Cons: Even with first class ingrediends food was boooring and tastelass. I asked for recommendations and it it still was below awerage. Sushi rice no good!(Yes, been to Japan, know how it should taste) Strange experience-felt like waiter tried to push our bill up by ignorign our «no, Thanks»to water and When we asked for bill he came with dessert menu. Even due bill being for 100 £ for late lunsj  Tooo many tourits with kids, no dresscode, way to little vibe in restaurant , felt like a attraction. Maybe cause it lunch time? Anyway, not impressed by vibe. Reccomendations: Go for drinks, restaurant only to impress the dateAnyway, better that Many other rooftop bars/restaurants , so enjoy your visit !:)

title: Ripped off
comment: 5 of us Popped in on Saturday for a cocktail to celebrate my wife's birthday. I was served at the bar as it was very busy. The barman made our cocktails and i paid. Didn't realise until we got home that i was charged over £9.00 for service charge. Rip off! Won't be rushing back. I feel sorry for the tourists!! Nice view though...

title: Great view
comment: Very pretty place, great view from the 39th floor,  Sushi was really tasty and fresh, drink were good too, Relaxing place, great for catch ups and meet ups, would come back!

title: high quality sushi
comment: I've been here with my boyfriend. The quality of fish is good, it was really fresh and tasty, in particular the truffle uramaki, it was amazing! DON'T order the cheese rolls! It was a kind of sushi with mozzarella: terrible! This is the only negative point. The service is fast and professional. Also prices are good considering the fact it's one of the most popular sushi restaurants in London.

title: I visit every time when I am in the area
comment: Lovely service and breathtaking view. I don't know what I love more,the view from the restaurant or the elevator. Anyway, it's a super venue, delicious meal and friendly staff. Definitely go there !!

title: Rude Supervisor
comment: Went there to celebrate a friends meet up after years as he visited London after 6 years. Booked this place for a lovely afternoon and the food, views and table service was at its best. My friend went to the terrace to take some photographs and after a minute was told by a supervisor that the terrace needs to be closed and he can’t stay there for an additional second in very rude manner. When we asked the waitress if it’s ok to go to the terrace for memorable photographs and she cheerfully said yes we can. The same supervisor was standing there at a distance and hearing our conversation followed us to the door of terrace and said in rude way, that we can not go to the terrace is closed and didn’t tell the reason for closing. Meanwhile a security officer came and stood by quietly in confrontational body language.  When asked the reason the supervisor further rudely said its windy and you guys can go the the other terrace in the middle (which has no views). I understand the ‘Windy reason’ for health and safety but I fail to understand the rude gesture and instead of updating the waiting staff about the terrace being closed and not to send customers there. The supervisor act really unprofessional and ruined our mood for the afternoon and a special reunion at such an exclusive high end venue. Although on our way back we mentioned the behaviour to cloak room attendant and she apologised and mentioned that it will be communicated to the management too- but the afternoon was ruined anyway.

title: My paradise!
comment: This place looks like heaven to me. I simply love sushis and whenever I visit London, I stop by to enjoy the food and the view.

title: Very disappointed 5th visit and will never go back
comment: We have been to sushi samba a few times before and always enjoyed it. We went this weekend for my birthday the table for 3 was booked at 4pm at 5.05pm a manager told us we had to get off the table as it was booked for a big party of ten. We checked the confirm and explained that we had an hour and half and 5.15pm the manager sent over the bill !!! The meal was for my birthday and I found the way it was handled beyond rude I will never go back

title: Great food with amazing ambiance
comment: Great food with amazing ambiance It is a perfect place for a special occasion. Great ambiance, lots of fusionised dishes and amazing view! I had some ceviche and lots of sushi&makis! Especially I loved their ceviche the most. Very well-fusionised!  Went there quite a few months ago and I think it’s time to visit there again!

title: Amazing view
comment: You should visit and have a cocktail! The elevator is such fun as you go from the 36th floor to the ground in 5 seconds.

title: A really good venue but ultimately spoiled by front of house rudeness.
comment: Milena (manageress) Eduardo (head waiter) and Francesco (waiter) - amazing service and friendly. MILTON, who is front of house was rude, obnoxious and had no idea of how to keep his customers happy/satisfied. Steer clear of him. Our table was booked for 930pm. We arrived at 730pm to be told by Milton to 'have a drink in the bar and we'll call you when the table is ready'. Fair enough. Fast forward to 950pm and nobody has called us or kept us informed as to what is happening. As i ask Milton what is happening his response is 'seeing as you are so eager to sit i have a table that is not as good. Have that table.'!!!! WOW! No apology, no sorry sir for the wait, no reason as to why we are waiting 20 plus mins to be seated. He repeatidly kept telling us 'i'll give you a table that isn't as good!'. To say my wife and I were shocked is an understatement. Absolute fool! That said the food was brilliant and Eduardo was an absolute star. Milena was understanding and said all the things an upset customer wants to hear. MILTON needs to be retrained or better, sacked!

title: Average sushi with good views
comment: A super expensive sushi joint, the staff are nice and view is good.. but that's about it. I was recommend just coming for a cocktail upstairs at duck and waffle to take the view in and go

title: Better ambience and service at Itsu
comment: The experience was as unpalatable as the tuna ceviche. Uninformed staff, missing items from the menu, dishes not turning up, no place for coats and bags so a mess, squeezed around a table and to top it off couldn’t hear a word over the noise. The food was mediocre at best. Ridiculous prices for an evening that left everyone so uninspired we all just went home immediately after. Lack lustre.

title: Amazing Overall Experience!
comment: We enjoyed Christmas Eve lunch here and wow, what an experience! The space, view, food and service were all amazing. We started with a glass of champagne to celebrate the occasion and sampled a little bit of everything from the menu, enjoying every last bite. Prices are quite expensive, and although we can't afford to dine here frequently, we've decided that Sushi Samba, Bishopsgate will be part of our Christmas Eve tradition going forward.  We enjoyed Christmas Eve lunch here and wow, what an experience! The space, view, food and service were all amazing. We started with a glass of champagne to celebrate the occasion and sampled a little bit of everything from the menu, enjoying every last bite. Prices are quite expensive, and although we can't afford to dine here frequently, we've decided that Sushi Samba, Bishopsgate will be our Christmas Eve Lunch tradition going forward.  I hope readers will find my review and photos helpful. #TabesTravels

title: Delicious food
comment: Great experience and an awesome view. Food was outstanding and great suggestions. A little noisy but ambiance and food make up for the same. Be prepared to wait before you are seated as its very busy. A must try place if one feels like spending and experiencing a high fly taste of Sushi.

title: Lunch before Christmas
comment: We luckily made a last minute reservation for 3 for lunch 2 days before Christmas. It was packed. And the emailed reservation did say we had 1 1/2 hours. No one gave us a hard time about it, and we did overstay by only 5 minutes. Fun popular venue. It is of course a restaurant....but really more of a venue IMHO. We have been to SSs in Vegas and Miami. The lunch set was OK. My hubby's lobster special was memorable. I thought the lunch cost worth it. It is a destination restaurant more so than the 2 SSs we have been to. The quality of the food was good. The view and ambiance were top shelf.

title: Fantastic dishes, great atmosphere
comment: Fantastic dishes, great atmosphere and superb service. One of the best dining experiences and views in London.

title: no value for money
comment: Good service and decor, unfortunately spoiled by very small portions and low food quality which made the high prices unjustifiable. Was looking forward to going here so it's disappointing to receive so little value for money.

title: Breathtaking view
comment: Great selection and variety of sushi and sashimi & very tasty as well. Service is very friendly and professional. Breathtaking view from the 39th floor. Prices are very expensive but well worth it. O recommend the Lobster Maki, Kobe SAS and Samba London. (Photos attached)

title: 10/10 all round!
comment: 10/10 all round! Service was fab, the restaurant was spectacular and the food was beyond delicious!  Honestly there wasn’t anything to fault.  Check out their SHISO FINE cocktail if you fancy your drinks sweet! It was amazing!

title: Far from a great overall experience
comment: It was my brothers birthday and all family came to visit, which I mentioned to the restaurant. The table was not the nice one like requester even though there were other tables available. Service fast but not genuine, food good but not outstanding and after a big order their small surprise was a piece of cheap macaroon with a candle, which was a bit ridiculous

title: Beautiful Views and Food!
comment: Wow! This was a great spot for super food and breathtaking views of London! The service was impeccable and the restaurant was beautiful. The good was not only delicious but works of art! The cocktails were delicious too! Luckily we got to see the amazing view before the weather changed. It would be amazing to revisit in the Summer!

title: very good food and service
comment: very good food and service lovely staff. the atmosphere was nice and welcoming aswell as the menu was overall great and tasty

title: Amazing venue , service and creative food
comment: Panoramic London views , roof terraces , excellent service and some of the most creative food combinations on offer in London. Magical experience and the price point reflects what is being delivered.

title: Great!!
comment: Fantastic experience! Service was amazing, food even better!! Must try tiradito and ceviche. The view of London is spectacular from the top of restaurant.

title: delicious food with gorgeous views for birthday celebration
comment: Very tasty food, service was brilliant. Spanish guy that served us was very helpful, expalined everything and recommended delicious treats. Must admint it's pricey, and do not go on empty stomach as portions are small (my food came in small sizes). Overall nice and tasty, beautiful panoramic views and a fast lift on the 39th floor. Selection of cocktails available. Nice expierience. Would recommend, life time opportunity wehn you are in London and have a celebration. Oh and deserts were delicious!

title: Surly, bored service
comment: We went to Sushisamba for a special get together The good: The lift ride up - amazing views over London. It's breathtaking. The setting is flamboyant and makes it feel like an occasion. The food is tasty  The samba sour cocktail  The bad: The pricing of their food.  Masses of staff but mostly bored looking and surly. It feels like they don't want to be here, other than to chat to their colleagues.  After being told rather abruptly to leave our table, for the next sitting, and the bill being slapped down, when we came to pay, on rounding our 13.5% optional service down slightly, the bill was charged back up, at the card machine. It was a very small amount but when I queried the increase on my instruction, the same waiter said to us "come on, you're rich" Really bad manners.  After paying their prices for a one- off special occasion you expect more. I won't be back. P. S No one will help you find the toilets. They're all too busy standing around looking moody, to spot a customer needing help.

title: open your wallet and enjoy
comment: take the lift up to the 39th floor, have a drink in the very cool, bar with the great views; descend the piano stairs to the restaurant, get taken to your table by seemingly one of hundreds of waiting staff, order the fab food & wine from the huge menu's and enjoy your meal; yes it's expensive but you know that before you go in and it's worth it all the way; thank you SS for a lovely afternoon :)

title: Very nice place
comment: The location is just unbelievable...nice sushi, prices in line with the style and location of the restaurant. You can drink a glass of wine and have some rolls as an aperitif. Dress code is requested, no snickers allowed.

title: Overcharged several times - still chasing for refund
comment: It has been now over 2 weeks since I visited Sushi Samba with friends for 1 drink.  The barman kept asking me to re tap my card as card machine not working, I did this several times then eventually was taken indoors to retry and it worked. I asked for reassurance all the other payments wouldn’t have gone through, I was reassured this wouldn’t be the case, only 1 payment was taken. He didn’t even apologise for me waiting such a long time for just 1 drink and all the messing around to take payment.  I decided to check the next morning for peace of mind and I WAS charged several times.  So I reported this straight away, I called, I emailed with screen shots of my banks entries which we’re time stamped and I have already had to chase this complaint up 3 times. I spoke with a member of staff as they are struggling to reconcile their accounts. I provided extra details of my bank card digits and have still heard nothing else back. I have emailed again today, This is awful customer service and to think this is an error on their side I’m appalled I have to keep chasing to get my money back. Do I need to travel back up to London and visit again to demand to see another manager and not leave till I get my refund? I have visited SS several times bringing guests previously who have travelled to London, but after this bad experience which I am still no further forward with I seriously reconsider coming again.

title: Super trendy. Nice people
comment: It is a very nice place to spend your evening. It is expensive indeed but service is great,food is very good and every time I have been there there is a great atmosphere. Definitely recommend

title: Quite Disappointing
comment: The food was ok, interesting flavours, however no wow factor. The service however was disappointing. We booked the table for 1.5 hours, but were asked to leave after one hour because it was "rush hour" and this is what happens in rush hour. I showed them the email with the confirmation and the only thing we got was "wanna talk to the manager?". Not really as we were just asked to go so what difference does it make? We barely finished our food when they asked us to go, didn't have time for a dessert, another drink or even a coffee. It is not like they made an effort to serve the food faster so we could have time for a dessert. They were just after money, the sooner they get you out the sooner they can get someone else in. For a place that's charging 100 pounds a head that was just bad

title: Fun place
comment: A fun place to have a drink and hang out with friends... Beautiful view of London!  The orange tree was cool it feels like been in the jungle ..

title: Gurme taste
comment: I have never take such delicious variety of sushi even in Japan. Ambiance, decoration service and food is jut fabulous.

title: We loved it!
comment: Group of 7 had a great experience, exited over the view on the way up in the elevator. A lot of people outside, queue to get into the bar. Reservation is needed!  We had sushi to share, god good help and the staff were attentive and nice. Good food, sushi rools and nigiri.

title: Great experience !
comment: We had a really wonderful and fun experience. The manager and staff came and introduced themselves and asked about our dietary requirements. Based on that they made recommendations, which were delicious! We were very well looked after. The staff seemed to be enjoying themselves which is always a sign of good management. The atmosphere is pretty cool and buzzy. The lift to the restaurant could almost be a Winter Wonderland ride! Highly recommended for a fun night out.

title: Sushi samba
comment: Very overpriced ...created for the rich who haven't got a clue what good food is.Just saw people throwing money away to impress.Food mediocre at best.

title: Fantastic experience
comment: A fantastic restaurant in London with a view. Tasteful food that’s nice to share. We had some small dishes, sushi and wine and shared everything. Overall a memorable experience because of the modern and amazing restaurant.

title: Big liar
comment: We came for lunch on Tuesday at 2 pm without reservation.. the restaurant was already half empty .. we have been asked that we should leave at 3pm because the table is booked ... when we left the restaurant was totally empty .. no news reservation .. why do you have to lie to your customers!, I have been answered by another person of the reservation that the lady who told us to leave have done their job... ridiculous .. I hope it will be replaced by a robot soon .. food average and expensive

title: Ok
comment: Really expensive. They churn out the business set menu. The starters were ok. The beef was cold which is a shame as it would have been really good if it was hot.

title: Amazing place!
comment: The best place ever!! Amazing place and friendly staff!! Thanks to Alessandro for the amazing service, he was always helpful and taking care of us all the time! He suggest to us the amazing cocktail! We’ll come back for sure!

title: Nice atmosphere but not very good service
comment: We went there for some cocktails with friends after dinner. Because of the location and the atmosphere the prices were expected. However, it was extremely expensive and the service was soo slow even though it was not busy at all. It was a weekday so there were not many people but still they took them 20 minutes to make a cocktail. At the same time, even though we went there in June the weather was cold. The inside part is quite small and the nice part is the outside terrace obviously. But, there were no enough heatings and they were not turning on some of them. I mean, if that was a normal restaurant on the street and they did not have gas for the heaters outside obviously that would be all okay. But people come here to be in the terrace, that is all about it!. So it did not make that much sense at all.

title: Never, Ever, Ever, Ever Again
comment: They do nothing but a lot of talk and a badge, I mean ain’t worth a try this place. They serve micro-portion of tasteless plain sushi, the only Samba comes with the bill. Worst sushi in London!

title: The sushisamba experience
comment: I went on Friday with some friends because we like this restaurant, but this time was different. The food was quality sushi, and we all enjoy the dinner until we got to the desserts, you can go and have a dinner, but do not ask for desserts here, we ask for 3 different desserts and we didn’t finish any of them because they were disgusting.  I have to say i would recommend the tempura and the taquitos

title: Always a good choice
comment: Always good, always a favourite. View is amazing, food is great, service is great. Miss going here and can’t wait to go back. Love the drinks.

title: What a View!
comment: Food and service were excellent but one thing I couldn’t get my head around was that they served sushi with simple throwaway chopsticks when everyone knows you can get really beautiful ones at any shop or market for pittance.. what a huge difference in class it would make to serve classy pretty and unique chopsticks!

title: Amazing experience. Special
comment: Amazing experience. Special thank you to Laszlo Hampl who made our experience is very enjoyable . He got us a table by the window and gave best customer service throhout the evening. Definitely recommended place to visit! And wow what a view!

title: Great ambiance, mediocre management skills
comment: As we always eat at ROKA in this area we thought we would try something new. Our concierge at the Savoy kindly made a reservation for us here.  The ambience is quite cool and it’s a very hip trendy crowd. That’s what I have to say that’s positive. Two of the things on the menu that I chose were not available; when I asked them for an item that was on the lunch menu and clearly available in the kitchen they came back with a response that stupefied me.  The manager told me it was not possible to have this dish because the “system” wouldn’t take it. Otherwise she couldn’t ring it up on the register and that made it impossible!! I’ve worked in this industry for too long and know very well that you can override the system if you choose to do so. You ring in another item with the same value and let the customer know the price of what they are ordering . I just looked at her with disbelief and said “OK we will take the bill.” We will go back to Roka from now on.

title: Birthday party
comment: We had a really fun family lunch here. Exciting decor, wonderful flavours and brilliant staff. Can’t wait to come back!

title: Good food ...
comment: Have visited sushi samba on multiple occasions and have always found the food outstanding and the service on par with the rates it charges.  The challenge for the restaurant seems to be how many people it can fit around a table!! The black cod & El topo are my favourites

title: The nice new expensive eatery !
comment: This trendy joint located in the famed and happening covent garden is a delightful place to eat with friends . The charming joint a full of energy and good food . A little expensive comparatively for the pricing but the food here is mouth watering . The delightful , decor music and the location is unbeatable . The brunch here was memorable with my friends , not to be missed if you are around here . It is the Most popular high end restaurant of London and the fusion of three cultures , Japan , Brazil and a Peru - a true experience being here . View from here is incomparable .

title: Manxies on tour
comment: Birthday dinner.. recommended by a friend. On arrival all staff were very friendly and helpful. Mixed views on the food. White tuna was delicious, blackened code was overly marinated with strong soy sauce.. although very well cooked.. personal preference..Tempura prawns were amazing.. so tender.. and the octopus was super delicious.. quite pricy.. but top quality food..

title: Mr
comment: We we’re devastated about our experience and the service we received last night at Sushi Samba. First of all we were late due to disruption on the tube which we completely understand was our fault. When we reached Liverpool St Station we rang to say we where going to be slightly late to which we we’re told not to worry and everything would be fine. After arriving and being greeted the host at the restaurant we we’re told our table had been given away as we where over 15 minutes late (we where in fact 18 minutes late and rang in advance to warn the host). We we’re told to wait at the bar and they would come and find us if a table came up. 30 minutes went by and we where still sat waiting having not been reassured or even seen by any member of staff despite continuously looking over to grab the hosts attention. I went to double check with the host and he replied the table is just getting cleaned. Another 10 minutes went past before the waiter came to take us to our table.  We we’re put on a tiny table in the corner of the restaurant, one side of the table required myself to manoeuvre around a waiter and the ordering computer. Again, we tried to remain positive our waitress was obviously quite busy and once she had given us our menus 15 minutes had passed without us ordering, I proceeded to grab one of the other waiters to order. Me and my partner ordered different food, I order a main meal (which I was told that the cooking time was 30 minutes) and my partner ordered a couple of small plates. About 3 minutes later my partners food came out. We found this odd given I had just been told my food has a 30 minute cooking time. Obviously my partner didn’t want to sit there and eat whilst I was waiting for my food so we called over the waiter to ask if it could be taken back to the kitchen until my meal was ready - to which he replied I’m not sure if I can do that, let me just check. When he came back he outlined that there was three kitchens and food came out as and when it was ready. This was something that was never outlined to us. His supervisor came over (she was helpful) and said they wouldn’t take my partners food back but she would get the kitchen to prioritise my meal. Miraculously 5 minutes later my food (which has a 30 minute cooking time) was all of a sudden ready... excellent news! - (and the food was very tasty!) However by this time my partners food was almost cold. Thought out the meal we felt overcrowded by at least four to five waiters/waitresses crowding round the order computer. In fact at one point it sounded like they where having a staff meeting. This became overwhelming and we felt like we we’re part of the operation.  This experience has been one to forget and I would not return to Sushi Samba given our terrible ordeal. The service we received did not reflect the £150 bill and £100 in drinks at the bar. We understand what we where slightly late, to which we went out of our way to pre-warned the host and didn’t argue about the table being given away. However we we’re left feeling second class by the staff (especially the host on the door). Although my partner received a macaroon (which was very nice of the restaurant) as it was her birthday the whole experience ruined her birthday meal out.

title: Birthday surprise
comment: We truly had a lovely evening for a surprise 16th Birthday treat. We travelled from Liverpool after friends recommendation & we certainly will be back again.  The waiter advised us on a few dishes & we ordered a few other sharing dishes, I can honestly say it’s the best sushi We’ve had.  The staff very friendly, lift ride up is a experience on its own. Brilliant views of the city.  We will be back

title: A memorable experience
comment: We had a unique experience at Sushisamba! A perfect match of amazing freshly prepared Japanese and Peruvian food, in a warm atmosphere with an awesome skyline view. Located on the 36th floor of a ultramodern building, the experience starts with a ride in a panoramic outdoor elevator!  As we hadn’t booked a table, a had dinner straight at the bar, which allowed us not only watch the Sushimen prepare the plates, but also to have a great view from the terrace just behind the bar! We shared different starters and small plates, including prawns tempura, some unique sushi rolls and an exotic tuna ceviche!  Not a bargain, but definitively worth every pound spent!

title: Experience!
comment: Amazing food, the view is incredible and the drinks perfectly mixed! What stood out to us was the service though, our waiter took such good care of us. A little pricey, but worth it!  Tip: book a table well in advance.

title: Great food spoiled by the table..
comment: We arrived in plenty of time and took the fast lift to the 39th Floor, the place has a nice feel to it, it certainly looks the part as a swanky London restaurant. Table wasn’t quite ready so we sat outside and had a drink by the big red tree, a nice feature. The front of house lady found us to say our table was ready and we were led to a table in the far left hand corner of the restaurant behind a waiters service station. Unfortunately our table fell into the category of one of my pet hates; it was positioned literally inches away from the diners next to us with a window on the other side. Our table was so close to our neighbours that our waiter could not take our order or bring anything to our table in a normal fashion, the only way he could give us anything was over my right shoulder. In addition it felt like we were out with the couple next to us, we really did not want to be. They were so close it was impossible not to overhear their conversation, the man had made a ‘mistake’ and spent the whole night justifying and grovelling for a second chance. Sushi Samba cannot be held responsible for the content of our neighbours conversation but they can be for the ridiculous proximity of the tables. In a restaurant whereby you can rack up a £300 bill without trying too hard I expect space to enjoy my evening.  Now for the positives. The food was very good, we had a fantastic shrimp small plate starter, super tasty rolls and a large plate seafood dish, all lovely. Our waiter was excellent, very attentive and he helped us to make some good food choices even if it was over my right shoulder. The Restaurant Manager checked in on us a couple of times, perhaps aware we had not the greatest table. The nicest touch was they added a Happy Birthday décor to the Wife’s dessert without being asked, I thank them for that. The venue and the views over London are cool, all in all it’s a good restaurant but at the price I expect a better table experience.

title: Amazing service
comment: The drinks and the service is very good and the place is lovely !! But the service from Mattia is Excellent and everything you doing for my table was fabulous!! Thanks Mattia

title: Great Food, super atmosphere
comment: Me and my wife had dinner the day before yesterday.  The waiter was absolutely friendly and professional. We had meat, fish, nigiri and maki. All incredibly tasty and fine tuned. We ordered cocktail to pair with this delicious dinner.  Will do it again.

title: Fun place
comment: We loved this place. We did not have a booking, so after drinks outside we ate at the "bar" next to where they prepare the food. Very friendly, good service, excellent food - but WOW what views (lift to 38th floor is great!), and nice to drink outside next to the fantastic tree !

title: Birthday Meal
comment: Ok experience. Food is decent but so overpriced. If going just stick to the samba rolls. Service was very poor for the money we paid. We were given no advice on the menu which is difficult to navigate re quantities. Bar staff were good and cocktails nice. Views very poor when compared to sky garden or shard.

title: Not impressed
comment: Arrived 15 mins late due to traffic to be told table given away at 6pm and had to give table back in one hour, walked into restaurant half empty and no call to even tell us. Terrible service, average food. Sushi in Waitrose is better! The restaurant was very tacky and even saw tears in the seats. Wouldn’t pay my own money to go here! Credit though for the pretty bar area which was nice with the illuminated tree.

title: Book in advance!!
comment: Finally got a table here after trying each time we have come to London. So make sure you book in advance. Amazing views, attentive staff and very clean. I would say the food was over hyped, much better sushi in the city however it was still very tasty and is worth a visit at least once!

title: Nothing special
comment: As for nothing special, I don't mean the view over the city, that is incredible, but the food they serve and the service. We were there on a sunday night, it was cold inside, and the main room was badly design and very simple from what you exepect from a sushisamba.  The quality of the food itself was very good, but the sushi rolls were just so boring and did not taste as anything specia, actually they felt as normal rolls you could easely order from any fast food sushi place.  When we asked the waiter what we could order instead of the rolls, he looked at us as we were stupid and told us," the rolls that you ordered are specials, so nothing else". We asked him in another way because we thougt that he did not quite understand the point, so we cordially asked him for something that we did not order, that was a speciality for the restaurant. He once again in a very rude way told us, the rolls that you have ordered are the specialities, so nothing else." The price it's right for the position of the restaurant, but the staff, it makes everything so bad and negative. They are rude from the moment you come inside untill you leave. This is the reason of my terrible rating, they ruined an evening for us all. Will not be back

title: Amazing view
comment: This place is amazing. It has nice cocktails, great view of city and nice food. We enjoyed our evening beautifully.

title: Great experience
comment: Not fine dining, but.... good quality of food and the service was attentive. Ambience is nice and the place is always busy. The only minus point for me is the value for price comparison. Many dishes are just too small considering the price which guests are paying.

title: still one of best
comment: We arrived without a booking and very stressed and were treated like Vips. A perfect gin cocktail at lovely bar and then taken to a great table. As usual the food is a treat; melt in mouth vegetable taquitos, amazing shrimp tempura , limey refreshing tuna ceviche , different samba sushi , amazing carrots with quinoa [ so different] and top notch choccy rain forest desert. Heaven.

title: Overrated restaurant
comment: We were very excited to try this restaurant, being a big fan of Japanese and Brazilian food, this looked like an interesting mix and with very good location. Well, the food was good, nothing to tell our grandchildren about it but ok if you expect the flavour and seasoning to remind you of the food's roots. For starters, we ordered prawn tempura and some sushi rolls - the prawn was nice but no different than in other places and the sushi was really nothing special. For main, we ordered the Churrasco Rio Grande and the Sea Bass Tempura. I have to say that the flavour of the meat was nice since there was no sauce but it was everything well seasoned. There is no sides apart from a tiny bowl of spinach, which is a bit sad since you're paying 50£ only for this course. The Sea Bass was nice and had a nice presentation, the sauce came in a capsule and really gave a good balance to the fish. The expectation for the views were very high since it is at the top of the building but it was a bit disappointing, the only good view was from the entrance by the stairs. For views, we definitely recommend sky garden instead. Overall, high priced average food with a disappointing view.

title: Birthday celebrations
comment: We booked this restaurant well in advance for a birthday celebration . From the moment we arrived outside the building we were treated like VIPS . Everyone was very friendly and you are whisked up to the restaurant in a glass elevator with glorious views of London at night . The entrance is spectacular with great photo opportunities and we were shown to our table in a packed dining room . There is an outside bar area too if you’re not eating with an outdoor fire pit for winter .  The food was superb with each morsel a delightful explosion in your mouth . We left the choice of food to one of our guests who has been here before and we were not disappointed.  A great time was had by all . Thank you

title: Dinner
comment: Great place,well worth the visit ,great food,fantastic views from the top bar of city of London ,have your gold card handy as it is pricy,

title: Good food with a good view
comment: Solid delivery with friendly and attentive service. View always a plus and the weather was atrocious was still a good view

title: Not worth the hype
comment: I have booked dinner at Sushisamba City to celebrate a special occasion. The place was fully booked a month in advance and I only managed to book a very late dinner (10pm). I thought it must be a very special place since it's that popular. How wrong I was. 1. The service. On the scale from 1 to 10, I would say 5. Everyone seemed to be uninterested, unengaged, not especially friendly. Our waiter was trying, but he did not seem to be professional (stayed waaaay too close to me when taking the order, did not know the menu well, could not recommend when I asked a very specific question). 2. Atmosphere. Being to Nobu, Zuma, Akira Back and other similar places, I probably had my expectations set too high for Sushisamba. It was not special, it was not interesting, it was not anything that would make me come back.  3. Food. Just no. The quality and the taste of the rolls were like a supermarket ready-made ones. So disappointing. I did not finish ordered food, as it was simply not tasty. 4. Cocktails. To put it simply - I was served the worst Aperol Spritz in Sushisamba I have ever had. I am not sure bartenders know how this cocktail is made.

title: Amazing customer service
comment: I came for my 23rd birthday with my partner. Our first time here. The customer service was amazing, the staff look so smart and sophisticated in their uniforms; so very well represented.  Upon arrival to our table in the main restaurant CSABA our table waiter... I can not fault him honestly. He loves his job and his passion for customer service is unreal. He made our visit so special and I would definitely come back again over and over. CSABA took into consideration our dietary needs and explained/recommended the menu perfectly. The best waiter I’ve met yet.  Thanks again for an amazing birthday with a cute little birthday message and treat for afterxxxx

title: Daytime visit to Sushi Samba
comment: Me and my wife were in London for lunch and a trip to Spitalfields Market. On our way home she suggested we go to the Heron Tower and have a lunchtime drink at sushi samba which she had been to before. We were greeted by two door staff and we said we were just visiting for a drink which they said was fine .. we entered the bar area I proceeded to the bar and waited to be served. There was only one other person at the bar and two bar staff on duty. Both appeared to be busy mixing cocktails etc.. my wife told me what she wanted to drink and I continued to wait while she visited the toilet.. there was a queue at the toilet so she was at least 10 minutes. Not once during this time did either of the bar staff make eye contact with me.. not even to say we are busy but will be with you shortly . . I walked away from the bar when my wife came back from the toilet and told her we are leaving as I felt that i was totally ignored.. i may be missing something on the procedures of bar etiquette at this establishment but to be honest was a bit disappointed .

title: Not worth the money.
comment: Not worth the money. I have always wanted to come to this place but now I regret it. The service is really good but the food is definitely not worth the money. The Vegetable sasa were tasteless, the sushi my sister got was microscopic. The only good thing was the rice with the coconut sauce. Desserts weren't special either. Very disappointed and I will definitely not go back. You pay for the view and the nice restaurant but the food is poor. Shame.

title: Disappointed
comment: Lovely location but appalling food. The initial plantains were a disrespect to the original ones: they tasted like those dry plantains you buy in chips bags at the supermarket.  My samba London roll was tasteless and the smallest portion ever seen... Thank goodness I had lunch really late therefore I wasn't that hungry as I could barely see the food on my plate, that's how ridiculously small it was. The dessert was ok-ish... Nothing major but not bad. All together I was expecting much more from Sushi Samba, if it was for the view only I'd have stayed at the bar. An experience I'll never repeat.

title: Great experience, great food, amazing view, lovely staff
comment: It all started five years ago when I went to Duck-n-Waffles for a drink. And finally I could come back to the HerronTower to eat dinner at SushiSamba with a friend. We ejoyed our stay from the first to our last moment. All staff we met were very friendly and professional. We were particularly happy to have Ansom as our dedicated host - he explained the procedure and all later on all the food that was brought to our table. The choice off the menue is great and all the food we ordered was very tasty and unique. I loved the concept of this fuision kitchen - I've never tasted such unique flavours in such an amazing quality before. Since we did not know much about Sake we were helped to chose a brand. We enjoyed the fact that we could taste some different brands before we ordered. The view is absolutely unique and helps to increase the experience at SushiSamba greatly.  Of course, prices are steep - but that was clear before I ordered a table at this restaurant.  I'm looking forward to going back there to celebrate a special occasion.

title: What is the fuss about ?
comment: Great view poor overall experience. £400 for two bottles of the cheapest plonk and no more than a bento box worth of beet Urdu sry sushi. The restaurant was too hot and a waitress tried to fill your glass every sip of wine. Eat better sushi somewhere at ground level it’s not worth the eat popping elevator ride.

title: Best service and food in london
comment: From the moment i was introduced to Marc he made me feel special. A very warm and friendly professional. As this was my first time at Sushi Samba he made the experience an absolute pleasure. He helped me with food and drink choices and was spot on. Overall i would say the service, food and atmosphere made this an amazing visit. i will be back many times and i have refereed friends and family to the restaurant. Thanks Marc i will see you again soon.

title: Special Place for Special People
comment: if you wonna to feel that "Winter Is Coming" just go and visit SushiSamba! Its wonder tree makes me feel like being at Winterfel :)))) and all that vibes with ever delicious sushi! Unforgettable experience!

title: The best food experience even for a Japanese person
comment: I didn’t expect much apart from the view when I decided to visit this restaurant. But the quality of food blown my expectation. Toro with truffle was the best ever food i had in my life.

title: Date in sushishamba
comment: I cannot say something wrong about the view or the drinks. Always amazes me the service and the drink menu at sushishamba. Food is a bit overrated to be honest but is not a bad try to combine this 2 style of cuisine. The outside space near to the tree is AMAZING to have drinks and hang around. Even if you go with friends, family or a date you will find whatever you want. Keep it up.

title: Fabulous views. Ok for a cocktail
comment: Pop up here in the scarily fast glass lift if you want a nice cocktail and view of the city.  It’s fairly pricey, so we just had the one drink.  Place itself is looking a bit worn and tired.  I would go again but not if I had to queue.

title: One of the best Sashimi restaurant than I know
comment: Everything start with the elevator with his wonderfull view of London. After this you discover a bar and the sushi bar where the sushi master operate. Finally you going to the restaurant to enjoy the wonderfull taste of the food. Try the Kobe beef this is a must have.

title: Great place
comment: We had a fantastic day here. Location is just amazing, food was fantastic. Definitely raccomended...

title: It’s late, Im hungry- lone businesswoman traveling in London
