comment: It’s 11pm and I’m extremely jetlagged. Slept most of the day and woke up at 10:30pm to serious hunger. Walked to a bunch of places to realize, surprisingly, London is not a late night prime dining kind of place. The only place near my Airbnb that was even open and serving food (cause I went to two places that were open but the kitchen was closed), was Sushisamba. Really glad I stumbled on this place. The view was amazing. I sat on the bar, spoke to other single travelers. The food was great, superb presentation, the service was fantastic. Highly recommended!

title: A must visit for a super Sushi experience in London.
comment: Absolutely everything about the evening was amazing and perfect. From the moment we arrived we knew it was going to be a top notch evening. The venue is slick, hip and ultra modern. Perhaps a tad noisy however, as the food is so visually stunning and delicious one ceases to notice the noise. It was a mild, late summer evening so a predinner drink out on the terrace overlooking London was the prefect start to the evening. Bar and wait staff were super efficient and very helpful, especially with suggestions on how/what to order. The exquisitely plated food was so delicious one lingered over every mouthful. The fusion of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian came through in both the presentation and flavours of the dishes. For me the pièce de résistance of the evening was my dessert, Florest Floor. OMG, if the forest floor really tasted as good as this I could eat the Amazon. If in London do treat oneself and dine in Samba Sushi.

title: Luis is the best!
comment: I’ve been to Sushi Samba with my work colleagues a few times and it’s always been good. This time, Luis took care of our group and he was outstanding. He recommended excellent wine and food, and always made sure that we were taken care of. He was there before we even needed him, which is what makes an excellent waiter. Thank you Luis!! Sushi Samba is lucky to have you.

title: Brilliant evening
comment: Attended for a Work event and I don't eat Sushi so I thought I was going to struggle finding something I would enjoy - When the starter came out I thought this would not be enough to feed everyone but the plates just kept coming out and in the end there was too much food - the quality of the food was amazing and they offered chicken, cooked fish, sushi, stake vegan options. the 2 roof top areas are great for taking photos of the city and at night its just incredible. highly recommend for a birthday or anniversary as it was around £70.00 per person.

title: Birthday Dinner
comment: Great venue, amazing service and fantastic food. Amazing and will be back  The views are amazing by the way. Great for any occasion

title: The best Salmon Sashimi
comment: I've been here last Febraury with some friends. The view is amazing and the restaurant is very nice. The food, especially salmon sashimi, is incredible.  Even the cocktails are so good!

title: Overrated
comment: A very underwhelming experience at sushi samba. The food was extremely average, often very basic sushi rolls that are no more interesting or flavoursome than a standard box from Itsu. The items we first ordered on the menu were sold out, and the substitute white wine we were brought was served to us lukewarm. Our table also spoiled the experience somewhat, being sat immediately next to the waiter's kiosk. We felt very overlooked, with staff constantly hovering brushed up against the table and in earshot of our conversation. Service was rushed, there was a feeling of trying to move people on as quickly as possible. The staff still managed to lose our wine bottle half way through the meal despite this, meaning that we had to wait 15 minutes while they tried to look for it. The decoration inside the restaurant is plain and nothing special, although the setting at the top of Heron Tower does make for wonderful scenic views. This was perhaps the one element of the restaurant that does feel exclusive - in all other respects Sushi Samba commands a high price tag that it does not really earn. There are many better Japanese-inspired restaurants in London - try those before you try Sushi Samba.

title: Evening atmosphere
comment: Been here a couple of times with friends and in a couple. The food is out of this world- would recommend the ceviche as the flavours are unbeatable.  Also a great atmosphere in the evening upstairs for drinks either midweek or weekend. Whether it be romance or fun this place is for you

title: Outstandinf
comment: We visited SushiSamba for the first time and as soon as we walked in we were received with nothing but smiles! I mentioned at the entrance that my daughter and a friend had just finished their exams. This was lunch time, around 13:30. As soon as we took the elevator and entered the restaurant, a Receptionist took us to our table. The views are magnificent. Our Waiter was lovely and super friendly, service extremely fast and everything was pleasant. The food was divine. We ordered many dishes at different times and it all came quickly and no mistakes. At the end we had a lovely surprise, a Macarroon with letters written “Congratulations” to my daughter and her friend! What a lovely touch and way to end the meal! I wish I had asked the name of the Waiter who served us! We will definitely visit again!

title: Amazing views!
comment: Went to sushi samba just as the sun was about to set so we had beautiful views up the gorgeous elevator and then when at dinner! After dinner we went to the bar at it was gorgeous with the orange lit up tree and views of London at night. The food was very good! We tried the mae terra which was extremely delicious and very unique! We have never tried anything like that. As we were all vegetarian we ordered the veg / vegan options. The veg tempura was great as was the eggplant robata. We ordered the veg moqueca mista that we loved and the selection of veg maki and nigiri! Was a great night.

title: Birthday
comment: Always wanted to go here what a joke I’ve had better sushi at my local Chinese. I wouldn’t recommend unless you want sushi that’s taste like burger sauce. Good luck It’s only good for the nice lift that brings you up

title: special celebration
comment: great place , we loved, food was excellent, great service we really enjoyed , we had for a special occassion , it serived its purpose. fully recommend

title: amazing
comment: and Csaba is simple one of the best. i really like the view the service the food all amazing. i will def go back! Thank you Csaba!

title: Family dinner
comment: We were only able to book a table for 4pm due to availability, which actually was fine, and we weren't rushed away either. The view and setting are absolutely magnificent. The drinks were great, but the food definitely not spectacular for the price. I would recommend just coming up to the bar for drinks as opposed to dining. The service was a little late.

title: Désastre
comment: 1 star Worst service at the bar area i ve ever seen in London city over the past 5 years Completely overpriced Waitress is incompetent Bartenders like zombies Only bright side is the view of city at night...

title: Business lunch at a breathtaking location
comment: Went to Sushisamba following my wife's advice to meet some business partners yesterday. To start with, the access via an express panoramic elevator up to the 39th floor provides quite some views of the City and beyond. Up there, you find quite an eclectic and busy place with endless stunning views over the rooftops of the City of London. The Japanese-Peruvian fusion food at the inside dining area is good and tasty although somehow pricey. But I believe, the setup and rental of the place must not come cheap either... Great staff as well although the bar was quite too busy for the just 2 barmen attending it that inevitably led to almost a 15 minutes waiting queue to order a few drinks after lunch. All in all 9/10 over here

title: Not worth it!
comment: I have had my fair share of having very interesting and unique Japanese food. But this place definitely does not do justice to the dishes and also its highly overrated in price! There are definitely many better establishments that serves similar dishes at half those prices. Basically you are paying for a CONCEPT!

title: I was never treated so badly ever before
comment: I don’t usually write restaurant reviews and I’m a generally forgiving person but what happened earlier tonight was just unacceptable by any standard. I had booked a table at sushi samba city on June 26 for a dinner for a group of 6 on the 20th of August 2019, so I was expecting to receive a nice table. Little did I know that my bad experience would start even before setting foot in the restaurant.  We were a group of 3 adults and 2 children aged 13 and 10. We arrived downstairs to be greeted by security at 8:52 pm, 8 minutes ahead of my reservation at 9:00 pm. The security guard/gate keeper advised us that we will need to wait at the door of the lifts for 8 minutes since the children are not allowed to wait upstairs near the bar area until we are seated. We reluctantly agreed and were kept waiting at the ground floor in the very tight space next to the lifts for 8 minutes as in lookers kept asking us why we were not boarding the lifts. We were then told by the same security guard to step aside next to the wall to allow other people enough space to board the elevators. We were spoken to in a rude manner. It was at this point I started regretting booking again at the restaurant. We waited a full 8 minutes and were then allowed to board the lift. When we finally got up and got seated at our table we were told that the children can visit the viewing terrace, only to be told later that it was not allowed. The service was exceptionally slow, the gyoza came cold and my wife’s drink was removed without asking her if she was done with it or not.  I will never ever recommend this restaurant to anyone, the food is nothing to brag about and the service was simply unacceptable. I regret coming again to sushi samba city. There are numerous similarly priced restaurants in London where you feel like an appreciated customer.  Shame on you sushi samba, you lost a loyal customer.

title: Sushi..Fun
comment: Was there last weekend and it was so so much fun The staff and the food was lovely ! Definitely coming back for another FUN night

title: Overpriced
comment: Food was ok, but not amazing... Presentation was amazing.. but taste-wise, i was disappointed.. Very crowded and feel claustrophobic.. as many tables squeeze in small area.. Views are nice, music is good.  Would rather recommend for a drink, than for decent dinner.. :-/

title: Would probably give 3 1/2 stars
comment: Its not 3 star but its not 4 star either. Location, fun, views good although not from our table - even though we had booked one of the large booths to get a view ours was over some structure outside with no city view. 39th floor was closed for some reason so when we arrived about 20 minutes early we were invited to have a drink at the bar, which is not as enticing as it sounds as its a small unappealing bar tucked in the corner or to go outside Lovely you might think but had limited furniture and many smokers. Luckily someone else came over to us and asked us if we wanted to use the terrace off the main restaurant. Game changer - this was awesome with panoramic views and lovely comfy sofas. I struggle to understand why this wasn't offered in the first place though. We were a party of 7 celebrating a 21st birthday - so wasn't a great start. The food is pretty good, if you know what to order. My daughter ordered seasonal vegetables which arrived looking like an ash tray with minuscule pieces of beetroot, onion embedded in the ash - which I believe was edible - very odd - very much style over substance. Sashimi really good and presented in a very elaborate way. Food was good just not really great - I should be raving about it but I'm not. Atmosphere - well we had a good time but none really to think of - I think that this is probably more lively, atmospheric at night time. I guess the good thing about that was we were not rushed off our table which happens so much in London. Very expensive but we expected that. Service very pleasant. Nothing really wrong - apart from the poor welcome - but at these prices, with that location etc it should knock my socks off and it didn't.

title: Good food, good service
comment: It was a good location and nice menu for a business lunch. There are different options including set menu, tasting menu and a la carte. We decided to go for a few roles including their signature role and also one spicy one. Plus miso soup, some scallops and it was a very nice selection. Plus good service.

title: Night out
comment: I’ve been to sushi samba twice for cocktails, and I’ve yet to be dissatisfied with their service. The view is amazing, it’s definitely a nice place to chill and have drinks with friends and family.

title: Amazing view, great service, food is perfection
comment: To get a table on a Friday or Saturday evening you will need to book well in advance, but it is certainly worth the wait. Opted for... 3 starters; lobster taquitos, shrimp tempura, Wagyu gyoza. Main; Churrasco Rio Grande. Sushi; Neo Tokyo, Tiger Maki, California Maki. All dishes were delicious and cooked to perfection. We had plenty of food for 2 people.  Amazing views of the city as we were lucky enough to get a table by the window. To top it off the staff were extremely helpful and attentive. They talk you through the menu and offer great recommendations. Thank you for a wonderful evening, I hope to be back soon.

title: Terrific View
comment: Went there mid afternoon on Friday for drinks on the terrace. The weather was perfect, the settees comfortable and the views over the Thames area were amazing. The only drawback was the service was extremely slow but in saying that staff were very pleasant.

title: Superb
comment: Aside from a waiter emptying a tray of drinks onto the floor right next to us, there was nothing to fault.  Good food, good wines great service.  Super views!!!

title: Great View and High Quality Sushi, But ...
comment: ... kind of a strange vibe with a bar scene that reminded me of Vegas with a bunch of people pretending to be moneyed. Complete with a velvet rope and bouncer down on the sidewalk level, presumably to control the bar crowd at the terrace.  The restaurant was more what you’d expect for the price, with very good, fresh sushi with a bit of a fusion twist, nicely presented. I enjoyed my meal and am glad I went, but the combination with the bar scene was a bit of a turn off.

title: Medium Big Mac Meal
comment: I said to my partner as she ordered our takeaway meal at 10:45 pm. Feels a bit weird ordering McDonald's after you've spent £200 on dinner, but anyone who's been to SushiSamba will understand why. Apart from the recent ending to Game of Thrones, I don't think I've ever been more disappointed in my life. Food was bog average. If you are one of the many standard British people who think Wagamama is somehow decent, then you would probably find SushiSamba "immersive" or "superb", or whatever fits on your Instagram caption. The simple fact is that the food at SushSamba is bog average Japanese, presented in a manner to look like it was prepared by a Michelin Star chef. Then there is the food portions, they are so ridiculously small you would have to spend £1000 to be full. After we ordered our waiter told us "oh no no that is enough food", but what he forgot to add was "if you have already eaten dinner". Perhaps he said it under his breath, so technically he wasn't lying. Well played waiter, well played. Now I know what you are thinking, "It's not about the food, its about the whole experience!". True, the elevator ride was awesome, and drinking at the bar was fun...but that's it. Our table was jammed in the corner, with two seating options: Option A: Sun glaring straight into your eyes with no possible escape Option B: Sitting right behind the waiters kiosk and dealing with the constant threat of their behind parts hitting you in the back of the head. We asked to move tables but we were met with a vague shrug of the shoulders that there were no other tables. Me and my partner switched seats a couple of times just to mix things up a bit (exciting I know), but the crushing feeling of disappointment was always there. I will say though, the manager came over and apologized once we paid the bill, and gave us a free glass of champagne each. As much as I wanted to make a "say goodnight to the bad guy" Tony Montana style exit, it was a nice gesture so we left without making a scene. So in summary, maybe you will have a better experience if you get the right table, but ultimately you are paying an obscene amount of money for an Instagram Post. I highly recommend eating before you go or you will likely end up at McDonald's by the end of the night...just like we did.

title: For the view alone it's worth visiting
comment: We went to Sushisamba in the City and catapulted ourselves to the 38th floor with an absolutely stunning view on London. The interior is very lavish and the trees by the bars both inside and the balcony were a fun touch that made the place feel a bit magical. The clientele is clearly a bit on the hoity-toity side but if you feel at home hanging mids the posher crowed this is a great spot. The prices reflect the settings but so does the quality of service and dinings.

title: Fantastic location, great service amazing food
comment: Only a few mins walk from Liverpool St Station and set in the heart of the city. An amazing place with stunning views across London. From the moment you arrive to taking the lift to the 39th floor, you know you’re already in for a surprise. The team are attentive and professional. I’d pre-booked with Bee Devitt who sorted my VIP clients and reserved the large table on the terrace. The food selection is amazing and we chose the Oska menu as 9 of us, and the selections were amazing and we all were stuffed. The wines are superb and the champagne on point. If you want a location and a place to impress, then look no further.

title: Happening location , trendy and good food
comment: My second visit , this time for dinner. You must make a reservation because it’s very popular place. The moment you exit the lift on the 39th floor , you feel the excitement , hear the music and see the strong orange tones in the decor . Service is friendly and professional though I sense it’s not as warm as lunch time- maybe because of the crowd and need to get us out by the next seating.  The menu options are varied - mainly seafood, beef and vegetable choices . The rolls are very tasty and fresh. The beef cuts are limited but they are good cuts and well prepared. Generally most dishes are delicious , fresh , even unique- a blend of Brazilian , Peruvian and Japanese flavours - though some are quite plain and even dull - prawns , salads etc.. The desserts are touch and go - the chocolate banana cake with vanilla rum ice cream was excellent but the zen garden was average. Overall a great meal in a very happening atmosphere.

title: Decent experience considering the prices
comment: The food was great although the waiter gave us bottled water when we specifically asked for tap which cost us an extra £4.50. It's a great place to eat if there's no budget because it does offer a good view but even then, for the seasoned Londoner, there is certainly a lot better places to go.

title: Excellent in all
comment: I ve been there on family holidays together with another family. The food was excellent and so was the service. Congratulations to the sommelier for recommending a Gewurztraminer which was a perfect match with the dishes ordered. The when setting was excellent, and also the view and the bar.

title: Rooftop Terraces worth a visit
comment: On the 38th floor of the Heron Tower, the eye-catching red tree on the West Terrace at Sushisamba is a must-see. And if you're all about the views head to the East Terrace where you are actually looking down on the Gherkin! Walking between the terraces you pass through the main restaurant with its panoramic windows, and I especially liked the stylish seats with chairbacks that look like leather school satchels and a gorgeous shell hanging from the ceiling. Wine prices were as expected for a city rooftop bar but not ridiculous. Nice staff, nice experience.

title: Amazing atmosphere and food- service needs training
comment: Absolutely delicious. Creative innovative food. Amazing unique cocktails. Beautiful modern atmosphere and view. The servers need additional training- on several occasions brought us food and drinks intended for other tables - And apparently they gave ours to another table, which resulted in us waiting excessively long for our food. The manager thou was professional and apologetic, coming to our table personally to make amends and discounted pur final bill.

title: Great Atmosphere
comment: Been here a couple of times- once for lunch and once for drinks. Always a good atmosphere and the food is beautiful!!! Obviously it is a bit pricey but its nice for an occasion, not necessarily your everyday dinner haha.  Drinks are fun here too, great picture ops and good place as people visit after work. If it gets too much for your bank theres a Be At One down the road!

title: Unforgettable Experience
comment: Service:top-notch.  Food: quality/ selection/ variation / Price great selection and variety of fresh food.  The quality is beyond standard. little pricey though. Atmosphere: scenic view with a nice vibe. What I like best: the freshness of food. What I like least: you need to book in advance (like couple of weeks in high season) + some portions are small for the price. But overall, you must visit this restaurant if you're in London.

title: Amazing place
comment: Amazing place, the food was excellent, the sommelier has suggested a lovely wine.the blonde bartender was arrogant but the drinks were ok

title: Terrible service
comment: I have been to many bars and restaurants in London and for those cost of drinks and food the service is slow and non enthusiastic. My partner and I spent 300 pound and the service was impersonal and slow. Food was good but wait staff let it down.

title: Overpriced and overrated
comment: Sushisamba is a beautiful bar/restaurant with an extraordinary interior design and view. It wows you from the moment you step in the lift....but at what cost... The food is extremely average: high prices for such 'meh' food. I've always thought it managed to attract people merely thanks to its location, view, and 'instagram-worthy' setting. I wouldn't recommend if you are looking for a comfortable place to eat it, with actual nice, tasty food..

title: Must see in London
comment: Fantastic atmosphere, great staff and view. Food is delicious, worth every penny.  If you are looking for a special place to go this is for sure a 'must see'.

title: Mid afternoon lunch at Sushisamba.
comment: My wife and I love dining at elegant restaurants when we travel. We loved the fusion experience between Brazilian and Japanese flavors and cooking style. We each ordered cocktails but decided to swap with each other since we preferred the other's drink. I really enjoyed the Tom Yam I had. Spicy and sweet served tall. Wife enjoyed the Kaffirinha served short. We ordered the Yellowtail and the lobster taquitos, then shrimp tempura, wagyu beef gyoza, then two plates of salmon sushi. Delicious.

title: Great Taster Menu
comment: Have been before for a corporate event, but first time for a sit down meal.  Early evening, start and we did feel a little rushed given the prices we were paying. Slightly stroppy security outside.  Waiters were good, fabulous views and the taster menu was, overall, great. A couple of dishes I probably wouldn’t have again and several I would have love to have had lots more of, but that’s was a taster menu is. Great presentation and a nice evening.

title: Birthday
comment: The place is lovely we went there for a birthday. Food was great service excellent interior beautiful

title: Great buzz and experience but pricey
comment: Had a great dinner with friends, restaurant has a great atmosphere Still quite pricey, a place to go once in a while but not often.

title: High price for not so good food
comment: Overtly priced and the food isn’t great either. It not easy to get the table as it is very busy. Not many vegetarian option

title: Horrible service
comment: My friend and I had made a reservation months in advance and were looking forward to this dinner. As soon as we sat down our waitress was so rude, she didn’t even want to take our drink orders then after finally ordering and receiving them we told her we wanted to take a picture on the rooftop, she replied how do I know you’re not leaving and we replied all of our stuff is still at our seats, extremely rude to say at a nice establishment. After we ate our sushi, which was good I have to admit, we asked for our check three times and never received it until finally we asked for the fourth time and received it. Overall, food was very good but I would never go back as our waitress did the bare minimum in addition to just being flat out rude.

title: High quality
comment: The only downside was the high prices. High quality food, good service, great staff, quick service. Try to go there with a promo and it will be perfect

title: Great food, poor service
comment: Visited on for a work lunch. Great location and views. We were taken through to our booked table and quickly discovered it was not really big enough for our group of 7. Asked if we could move to the bigger table next to us but told it was already booked. Surprised then to find a family of 4 join the large table? The restaurant seems to have 1 waiter for drinks and 1 waiter for food which doesn’t really work and we kept having to repeat ourselves when the incorrect drinks arrived. One of our party finished her wine only to have the glass taken away without any offer of another drink which I’ve never experienced before. We then had to find a waiter once again. Food was first class and we may have experienced a one off poor level of service. That said, not sure I would revisit as the service to value wasn’t there for me.

title: Beautiful views and cocktails; great service
comment: My friends and I went here yesterday for my birthday cocktails before going for lunch. It was lovely and really special.  We found a table with really great views across London and had a few rounds of cocktails trying different ones which were all very different but lovely. It is pricey but nice for a special occasion. The service was really friendly and polite and the staff helpful.  The lifts are unreal especially the views across London!  Warning: it’s dark getting to the toilets and watch out for the steps!  Recommend especially on a Sunday when it seems a little quieter.

title: There’s a first time for Sushi Fusion and this certainly will not be the last.
comment: Apart from the fact that the culinary experience is on the 39th floor of a City skyscraper and spellbinding as a result, the food itself is not only beautiful but also extremely flavoursome and rewarding. The. colours and tastes keep on bombarding you in the nicest sense. It’s a must.

title: Lovely restaurant
comment: We had a lovely meal last night at sushi samba, food was lovely and Simone really looked after us and was really helpful :) would defiantly recommend.

title: A Place For Special Occasions
comment: SushiSamba is located in the Heron Tower's 38th/39th floor, just a few short blocks from the Liverpool Street tube station. My daughter chose this spot for her college graduation celebration dinner. It was an inspired choice; SushiSamba exists largely for such occasions.  The space has several outdoor areas, but even when seated inside the restaurant you get stunning views of London and the surrounding area. The food is wildly diverse, fusing - as its name suggests - Japanese and South American flavors. We hit on a lot of VERY tasty items. The Edamame is the low-key best thing on the whole menu. It comes out steaming hot with a perfect black salt sprinkled on it. Also, the Shrimp Tempura is delicious and the Wagyu Gyoza (you get five per order) are a must. We came back for more of these later in our meal. There are lots of sushi roll creations and here's what we liked best: the Samba London is very nice, but the one you should not miss is the Neo Tokyo. It combines the punch of spicy tuna, crunch of tempura, and finishes it all off with an awesome dollop of aji panca (smoky peppery Peruvian BBQ sauce).  What keeps me from giving SushiSamba five stars? The rotating cast of managers often "interrupt" the servers, disrupting their flow and rapport with your table. Also, we ordered several pieces of sushi nigiri that never came. And that may have been a blessing because for all the very good things SushiSamba offers, I don't think it's a sushi restaurant with sushi chefs preparing the finest crafted pieces of fish.  Overall, a very good, fun experience and definitely worth it for a special occasion.

title: Dinner for Anniversary
comment: very good place, extremely good food, & fantastic location. The only cons I can say( and the only reason it does not have 5*) is a bit pricey for what you get, and people too "pretentious".  Toro Tiradito and churrasco rio grande are a must!

title: Truly awful service
comment: The view is superb, the food is adequate but the service is just so awful it makes dining here an altogether disappointing experience!! Stop into SS for a drink and to experience the view but definitely dine elsewhere to avoid the hurried meal serviced by incompetent unfriendly staff!

title: Out Of This World!!
comment: We were in London for a Retirement Party and ate here the night before the big event. We had 18 people for dinner. We had a private room upstairs with incredible views of the city. The drinks was great but the food was fabulous!! We had a little bit of everything! Because our group was so large, we had prearranged to have appetizer size plates brought to the table. The food just kept coming! And everything we had was fabulous! The orange tree was pretty cool too!!

title: Amazing view & best sushi ever
comment: It was amazing! A very nice lady/ waiter Made this visit more special. We where there to celebrate our anniversary. The food was delicious. We had 5 plates to share. Every plate was a piece of art!

title: Delicious food and amazing panoramic view to London
comment: I was so happy finally realizing my dream to try this restaurant. Everything went fine and I definitely would come back again. Food was aesthetic, colorful and delicious, restaurant is in the 38th floor, so all London panoramic view is a part of your meal. Staff is very polite and ready to help. Prices, well, not very cheap, but the money you pay is definitely worth the quality you get.  Just a small clue - if you want to get there, reservation is more than highly recommended (you can't enter while just "passing by"). So, you could feel a little bit of "official" atmosphere. Also, you do not have one waiter, who serves your table - there are many of them. Maybe that's why they made a mistake, and included in my bill two drinks I didn't ordered (but mistake was quickly removed).

title: Graduation Lunch
comment: We came to Sushi Samba for our daughters graduation lunch. Mainly because we’d been to the Duck and Waffle which is upstairs and because our daughter loves Sushi and for the amazing views. The restaurant is nice but not doesn’t feel as exclusive as the Duck and Waffle. The food I’d give a 7 out of 10 when I compare it to Stix & Sushi in both Covent Garden and Chelsea (their food is just amazing). However, the staff were very polite and helpful and the views were fabulous. A nice lunch. Oh and they gave us a nice complimentary appetiser of fried plaintain. Would I come again? Probably not for the food. The willy wonka glass elevator is just fab though.

title: not even close to NYC
comment: great view, average food but horrible service. a lot of training is needed for the waiters, caught up in the middle of a shift and ignored by our waiter. not great experience to be honest

title: Ask in advance for a table with a direct view
comment: The primary reason, in my view, to go to Sushi Samba is the splendid view. It is also a bit of a scene in the evenings, but I care little about that. If you are like me and want the view of London from the 38th floor, ask in advance for a table by the window. Or else, you will probably get seated in the interior -- like I did. The food is decent, but does not match the prices (unless you add in the view).

title: Great sushi! 🍣
comment: They were renovating some of it and there was a huge crane outside the window that obstructed a lot of the view but the food here is outstanding. The veggie maki was the best sushi I’ve had. I had the poussin teriyaki and he had the sea bass tempura. Both were delightful. The cocktails left a lot to be desired; if I could go back I would unorder them and save myself £30. Mine was tangerine spritz and his was I think raspberry something? Can’t remember but both taste like afterthoughts. The waitress we had was lovely and they even brought a birthday plate as I’d called ahead to tell them it was his birthday. Great service and great food.

title: Amazing place, views, drinks, sushi and staff...terrible crowd!
comment: The venue and the view are stunning! We visited on Tuesday night, were sat on the restaurant terrace where the view is much better than the Tree terrace and we were extremely well looked after by the staff and the bar manager on duty.  The sushi was delicious and the cocktails even better! Nothing to fault but I have to say that the people that they let in the bar are extremely rude and tacky and they ruin the beauty of the place...no wander the staff can be grumpy! We saw girls at the bar jumping on tables to take pictures like they were in a sort of night club, and were extremely aggressive and annoyed when asked to step down. Overall, the visit was pleasant and I am looking forward to go back!

title: Overrated
comment: Well... A bit dissapointed. The hype is real. The location is awesome, the sushi was at best average and some of the staff a bit grumpy...

title: Great bar
comment: Amazing location and views. Great drinks options with a good wine list. Can be chilly outside but blankets provided alongside heaters. Fab for after dinner drinks with friendly staff and service

title: Too high expectations
comment: Yeah, the view is amazing and the drinks are nice. The starter soup was awful!! Really untasteful and tasted like a barn, if that makes sense...( I'm not sure what's it called again, started with a M) We haven't even ordered another course because of the first dish. So, we paid £25 (30 euros) for 2 soda's and 2 soups.. which we even didn't finish.

title: Don´t waste your money
comment: Located in a great spot in Covent Garden, this is a very expensive restaurant that doesn´t worth the price. The food and the service are not at the level required for the money we spent. If someone is looking for a fancy, good and expensive place, there are several better options.

title: Won't add a guest and won't let us cancel without taking money
comment: This restaurant refused an additional person on a booking and then extends their cancellation fees to beyond their 24 hour/no show policy without compromise- Charging each person £20. With an ethos like that in the 21st Century it is suffice to say: Don't even bother.

title: Wonderful location
comment: Been doing a bit of a tour of Londons rooftop gardens/ restaurants. Sushisamba is one of the best ! Different/ fusion food- clue is in the name - sushi and other Japanese dishes with South American dishes too !! Quality food which is also very well presented on plate. Best to visit after dark when the lights are amazing ! Great staff.

title: Very good food but very slow drink service
comment: What a location and view, what a shame we had to wait ages twice for our drinks to arrive. Surely if you are going to sell cocktails you should put on the staff to cope. Food service was very good.

title: Amazing ice ball
comment: Experience in the To-do-list in london, perfect location and fantastic food. The waitress Letizia is super sweet and lovely. Love the ice ball in my cocktail! And the view of course

title: Can't fault it. A fabulous birthday experience.
comment: A surprise birthday treat from my husband as I've been dying to go for years now. It didn't disappoint. From the fab food to the spectacular views (desire the very British weather) to the decor and service, the experience was faultless. Once we'd ordered the dishes started coming thick and fast, some looking so good I didn't even think to snap them before digging in. The staff were all too happy to accommodate the entitled tourist that started out on the table next to us when she decided she needed a 'better' table (excellent news for us) which I thought was very good of them given she was was pushy and loud. They ensured that everyone was given a table with a view during this quiet Tuesday lunchtime and despite a shift change part way through our meal, the service was consistently excellent. I'll definitely be going back soon!

title: Trashy crowd of people, what a let down to what it could have been a nice place!
comment: The bar is full of wanna be posh people, most girls dressed in horribly trashy outfits. You can tell it's kind of place where girls try to get with banker types, and they will do that with no self respect whats so ever. Atmosphere was also terrible people fighting over seats outside literally! as there is very limited seating area! what a weird place!

title: Work party
comment: Came to Sushi Samba for a work party last week. What an incredible venue!! It is absolutely stunning with amazing views of the city. Highly recommend a visit for a brilliant experience. Food was great!!

title: Good restaurant, diabolical outside bar service
comment: The meal was excellent and would merit 4 stars. However, the service in the outside bar area is dreadful. Two serving (and both incapable of a greeting or a smile - or of making sure they serve people in the right order) and a 15-minute wait for service. It wasn't even exceptionally full. The prices are premium but the service is as bad as any of the worst pubs you can imagine. A sad advert for what should be a fine experience. 'Manager' was duly informed, but half an hour later the same two were serving and the service was as bad as before the complaint.

title: About last night
comment: Great location and good music but the service was really poor, unprofessional and not organised at all.  The waitress made a mistake with the table and then she had given us the wrong order. When she realised that our order was different, took the plates away while we were eating.  We have never received this kind of treatment. The Sushi wasn’t fresh. I would recommend it only for the location.

title: What a find!! Beautiful sunset indulgence
comment: So pleased that we were given this sushi recommendation. We expected great things and it did not disappoint! We sat on the outside terrace (which I think was probably the nicest spot). Being removed from the busy London streets was lovely. Fresh sushi platter with a glass of Champagne watching the sunset - what's not to love!! Staff were attentive but not intrusive. Front entrance staff weren't overly welcoming (considering this was the first point of contact for the restaurant) but ignoring this, it was a thoroughly enjoyable evening.

title: Wow! Expensive, but worth it!
comment: Superb location, one of the staff hinted that it will close down soon and be a bar only! So get there ASAP. Superb views, superb cocktails, the staff are lovely and polite, the sushi was great too! The glass elevator was brilliant.  Theres a giant aquarium on the ground floor, but security don't want you taking pics of it (they own the photons in the air or something..) so take the pics as soon as you go in, then disappear! The elevator for the top floor restaurants is to the right of the main entrance! We Went for lunch, no real dress code, but everyone looked smart anyway. Well worth it if you want to impress someone, not overly busy at 12.30, and the views were stunning, a true 5* place!

title: Too expensive!
comment: The onky positive thing is the view.. For the rest is too expensive. 6 shot of tequila at the bar 105£ including the 13.5 of service charge. Unbelievable!

title: Wonderfully Tasteful
comment: Sushisamba is a fabulous restaurant with an eclectic menu of tasteful sharer plates that play wonderfully on the palate.  Being vegetarian we sampled several of the vegetarian dishes, each one unique in flavour and ingredients. The dishes were presented artistically, providing a feast for the eyes and tasted equally as scrumptious. I would totally recommend the vegetable taquitos they were so delightful, we ordered another helping :) Would totally visit again, special thanks to Joshua our waiter who welcomed us warmly

title: Celebratory work drinks
comment: My colleagues and I went to Sushi Samba on a Tuesday night for some celebratory work drinks and it had a really nice atmosphere. We sat by the bar and drank a range of cocktails all of which were lovely especially the lychee one. The staff were also very friendly and attentive.  It is quite expensive but for the views and nice atmosphere you can't complain. This is my second time coming and will definitely be coming back for drinks.

title: Amazing views.
comment: My wife and I went to SushiSamba for dinner with friends, the view was outstanding and the food quite nice however the servings were quite small. The wait staff were very attentive without being obtrusive and the time between order and serving was quite fast. Obviously, due to the restaurants location it is rather expensive however it is good for a special occasion or if you have overseas visitors to entertain.

title: Fabulous views, beautifully presented food, left feeling hungry.
comment: This place is fabulous from when you enter and storm up 38 floors, until you go back down those 38 floors.  The cocktails were delicious, I had a Plum Negroni and the flavour was incredible.  The food was very tasty and presented beautifully however, do not come here if you are Hungry. This is a place where you go to enjoy the view, and enjoy the divine tastes of the various flavours of Sushi - not somewhere where you want to scoff your face silly.  The staff were well presented and friendly, and service was exceptional.  Thank you very much.

title: Birthday Dinner
comment: Went here for my Birthday dinners, sushi was fantastic and so was dessert!  The waitress spilled our cocktails and left without a word, not even acknowledging the fact! So we were not impressed with the service, tended to be on the miserable side! Views were great, the lift was an experience so were the ladies toilets!

title: Fantastic food (vegan) and great views
comment: I went to Sushisamba for dinner with a friend on the Sunday before the May Bank Holiday - glad we booked a table (on the day) as it was very busy. We had a drink in the bar before being seated, and the drinks were actually quite reasonably priced. When we sat down for our meal, we were lucky enough to get a table by the windows - so the views across London were incredible. Service was very friendly and attentive, and our waitress made some very good recommendations for food and wine. They had a separate vegan menu, which we both ordered from - and the food was absolutely delicious. I would definitely recommend!

title: Expensive but nice
comment: Came on a Wednesday or Friday with friends The food was nice. The drinks were okay but the setting was so beautiful  We are giving reviews of everywhere we’ve been  This was the _” most sophisticated place “  Maybe to fancy for us but we had a great time  Will visit when I come back. Quite expensive but very kind staff Awesome Vacation  We loved Covent Garden

title: Little bit pretentious
comment: Ok .. food was good .. service was attentive but a little inexperienced in knowledge of their menu. Trip in the lift and views to the Gherkin and beyond to Tower Bridge are stunning.

title: Roland Dekker
comment: OMG. The most pretentious miss-match of food in London. Food was suspiciously under cooked, luke warm, and without a "fresh taste" if you get my point. However the worst of the experience, aside the masses of tourists and wide-boy city types, was the miserableness of the staff. There was a suspicion of people trafficking as none of the waiter/resses seamed happy to be there. Definitely a miss. Luckily they won't be long in the market.

title: Best place with views for dinner in London that's for sure
comment: My colleagues and I visited for a leaving meal and we all were so impressed. Great food, service and views. We decided to share things on the table my favourite being the salmon ceviche which was heavenly. Accompanied by numerous cocktails which I enjoyed but some of the flavourings were not to my taste. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to go on a special occasion. I hope I will be going to sushi samba again in the future!

title: Stunning views and great drinks!
comment: What a gorgeous place! The views of London as the sun was setting was incredible! The drinks were so yummy as well and the sushi was super fresh! We didn’t have a booking so we went to the bar area and it was still really nice! Managed to find a seat right by the window.

title: Amazing experience
comment: Went there a few days ago with my boyfriend. We had no reservation but Fatima the lady from reception was very kind and professional. She offered us a table with outstanding views. The food was simply amazing! We can't wait to be back!

title: Why have a roof terrace if it’s out of bounds?
comment: Here with my daughters for a birthday. Food nice, but wanted to go on the roof terrace for a photo. Told it is closed because of weather conditions... but it is a calm spring May day and still daylight. Hate it when you get BS. If it’s closed because they are under staffed or (more likely), because some officious security guy says so, tell it as it is...

title: Views and decor are nice....
comment: We were told that we could only have a 7pm reservation so we rushed our day because this restaurant was recommended.... upon finishing our meal there were a ton of empty tables. The food was good( not the best sushi I have had) and the ambience was nice.

title: Great views
comment: Great views of london especially at night. The bar service is ok prices are slightly more expensive then similar places in london but acceptable. The have heaters outside which is nice when gets bit cold and also provide lovely blankets which is a nice touch. Defo worth a visit even if its just for the views.

title: The most average sushi you'll ever eat
comment: It was OK, sushi wasnt mind blowing, cocktails were a bit watered (or iced) down....massively overpriced, the only thing saving it from 2 stars in my opinion was the amazing Kobe beef..that stuff was incredible! There are MUCH better sushi places for a fraction of the cost. Go here for the beef.

title: Aesthetically stunning rolls comprising of interesting, original flavors and tasting absolutely gorgeous, all in a wonde
comment: I had really been looking forward to having lunch here for ages and came away with mixed feelings. The location is special and the menu is wonderfully eclectic. I really fancied sushi and their rolls are unique and things of beauty but it’s a shame one can not have a variety and has to order full portions of one roll instead of offering a selection, on this there was zero flexibility. My experience did not get off to a great start as it took forever for me to get anything to drink, eventually they kindly gave it to me complimentary which was nice but it seemed bizarre both my mocktail and simply water look 20minutes to arrive. I found the sommelier much more attentive, enthused and helpful than the actual wait staff throughout. The rolls I ordered were aesthetically stunning compromising of interesting, original flavors and tasted absolutely gorgeous. I found the whole experience pleasant and left feeling it had been a treat with a few practical hiccups. Great ambiance and a fun crowd.

title: Afternoon cocktails
comment: Popped in for afternoon drinks and snacks. The cocktails are absolutely delicious and the bar menu is okey. Sitting by the window overlooking London is priceless!

title: Average
comment: Decent place but slightly an all fur coat no knickers situation. The food is okay, drinks menu complex but not appealing, meaning the the saving point of this restaurant is the view. I went for my birthday and bought 1 of their cakes (£40 for 1-4 ppl) in advance. Not only was it not worth it in terms of taste and size, but our waiter was not aware until I informed him. I’ve been a second time on the outdoor spot just for standard drinks since, and they are unbelievably overpriced. The view isn’t enough to make me go back.

title: appalling
comment: This was probably one of the worst meals I have suffered in years. Expensive, sushi in sainsburys is better! Go for a ridiculous 15gbp cocktail and then go to a good restaurant for dinner such as le pont de la tour. So embarrassing to take our largest supplier of 1,000 tonnes of seafood from India to this.

title: Fabulous!
comment: Celebrated husbands birthday with Sunday lunch. Both vegan and menu was amazing. Definitely going back.

title: Completely overrated and appalling customer service
comment: A group of 6 friends, we booked dinner a couple of months in advance. The bar was busy but nothing more than you'd expect for a Saturday. Security were having an argument with another group on arrival so wasn't the best first impression. The barman was also miserable and disinterested. The front of house staff, especially the maitre d', were abysmal, rude and also disinterested.  We were sat down roughly on time and the waiter we had was the best thing about the place; very attentive and friendly. A shame his management don't follow his example. He put together a varied menu for us. The food was decent, nothing more.  Once we'd stopped ordering any more alcohol or food, and were enjoying coffee, we were asked to vacate the table. The front of house staff very abrupt and abrasive with this request, which was embarrassing for them and us.  Finally, the toilets were in a disgusting state. When the maitre d' was informed of that, she half heartedly apologised with a smirk on her face. Again, completely disinterested. We paid £150 per head for the meal. For this sort of money, you'd expect impeccable food and service to match. It wasn't. The food was mediocre and the service disgraceful (except our waiter). The overriding sense given by the staff was one of arrogance, probably driven by how busy and booked upthey get. They don't need to worry about repeat business - yet. However, once this place goes out of fashion (and it will very quickly judging by the other reviews), it will fade away like many others. A shame, as could be so much better if managed properly.  Am expecting the stock response from management of "we're known for impeccable and attentive service" or such like. Looking at the reviews, they really are not.

title: Extremely tasty food, stunningly presented but not perfect.
comment: To be honest, I'm shocked at some of the other reviews, I don't feel like they can give a fair representation of the restaurant as the food was incredible. I have never eaten sushi prepared in that way, and I'm a fan. We ordered a mixture of small plates, sashimi and sushi rolls and we ate as much as we wanted. The meal was reasonable, probably because two of us ordered a glass of wine and then stuck to water. It's easily affordable if you don't go crazy on the booze, just the same as another relatively fancy restaurant in London. The service was the only reason I did not give five stars. The waiters seemed sometimes confused about what food was meant for our table, and there didn't seem to be more than one waiter that was taking orders. It always took a while to catch anyone's attention, and the service was pretty rushed and not the warmest. However there were a few waitresses that gave us genuinely warm smiles and our plates were cleared between each course efficiently.  The view is brilliant, but I'm not too sure how one gets a window table with a view...maybe you have to be lucky?  I would really recommend this restaurant and I will be back. Wonderful, incredible food.

title: Great Place
comment: Lovely place with great view staff and food. Mark is a super good manager. Highly recommend it. Super place

title: Good Service ....Good Vibes
comment: I would recommend this place. The service was very good. Our waiter was very personable and very efficient. Our food was very good and the prices were fair.

title: Taste Sensations
comment: Loved our night here. Best sushi I’ve ever tasted. The food was delicious. The service was tops....from our lovely Danish lady. Highly recommended.

title: Dinner
comment: Best place ever. Near underground and busses. We had dinner and wanted to order again when we finished

title: Beautiful
comment: I am going with my girlfriend on Sunday and we are so good with the food... the location is very romantic and we like the music...Becky is our waitress and she is so kind and professional. we recommend it

title: Beautiful venue
comment: Good location, just two minute walk from liverpool street station. It got a lovely view , and nice music.

title: Fantastic as always
comment: Been here a few times just for drinks in the bar. I visited last on the bank holiday morning at around 4pm. It was quite quiet and wasn’t too busy so there was plenty of space to sit. We first sat outside because it was a lovely day but was a bit windy so we went inside. We sad on the next by the window where you have a good view of the Gherkin building. We had a few drinks and enjoyed our time there. The service was great as always

title: First time, will be back
comment: This was my first visit to sushi samba and i can see why so many people recommend it. I have found that "fusion" food can be very hit and miss but this was refreshingly different. The sushi although pricey, is fantastically fresh and of a discernibly different quality to the average sushi offering. Can't not mention the wonderful views and ability to enjoy a glass of wine under the copper tree full of fairy lights as the sun sets over the city.

title: Birthday celebration
comment: Food was divine, service Excellent and spectacular views. Couldn’t be happier. Great birthday day. I am quite sure everyone would find something for themselves and enjoy this great place. Highly recommend!

title: Stunning Samba
comment: We went here a while ago and had a difficult night. Decided to give it another try with the whole family and from start to finish we LOVED the whole evening. The cocktail bar was good, the setting is stunning and the food was delicious. You need a small fortune to go but it’s worth saving and going. A charming waitress talked us through the menu and from start to finish her recommendations were superb.

title: Great Sushi!
comment: Great views and outstanding sushi! I loved the outdoor fire pit and the beautiful bar on the 39th floor.

title: Nice place
comment: First time to this place , really enjoyed it, very cool place with nice music , the food was surprisingly very good, staff very friendly. The only problem was the girl at the entrance that was giving us an attitude as we went with our two kids and as soon as she saw us gave us a bad face, obvious that she didn t like kids and asked me if i can fold the buggy and put it aside with an attitude. I just dont like people that dont like kids .That made me negative about the place but afterwards the rest of the staff was so good that changed my mood. But i would ask the manager to actually talk to this horrible person not to repeat this to other people. At Covent Garden!

title: Overhyped
comment: Amazing views and decorations but the sushi is quite average and the staff are not very nice. They like to pretend that it's more fancy than it actually is. A bit overpriced but worth it for the views.

title: Great customer service
comment: I was in the restaurant for Lunch (Monday 15/04/19). I didn’t have reservations but the hostess (spanish lady) welcome me very friendly and offered me a table. I was impressed with the view and I got table close to the windows. The service was fast , the food delicious and the cocktails Okey. I was just disappointed about the toilet look very dirty and smelly.

title: Very bad service!!!
comment: Don‘t sign up for the waiting list. They call you to let you know that there is an availability and when you show up, they can’t find your reservation and ask you to leave.

title: Great Night - Expensive Drinks!
comment: Beautiful views of the city, exactly what was expected. I've been here before, and I am never disappointed. The menu is a little pricey - but something to be expected of such an exquisite dining space. Attended in the early hours of the morning, it was the perfect bar to wind down.

title: Very average
comment: The views were spectacular and we particularly enjoyed the truffle sushi. However the service we had was TERRIBLE. I’d get better service at McDonald’s. The waiter (Bearded European male) wasn’t friendly, got our order wrong, seemed unwilling to explain the menu, didn’t offer the drinks menu and showed a bit of an attitude when we asked him to explain some items on the food menu. He definitely brought the mood down. Considering it was a Monday night when the restaurant wasn’t completely full, we were shocked at the service.

title: Great views and amazing combinations
comment: The food combinations are excellent. There’s food that I’ve never even imagined testing. So weird (in a good way) and delicious food. The drinks were also great. But the view WOW.

title: Very good
comment: Amazing restaurant stunning ambiance very creative menu service is slow but the food here is very good

title: Lovely bar with a great view!
comment: We have been here for some drinks, actually at floor 41. Amazing space with great views, ok prices, for a 41 floor bar. Plenty of choices, sitting on terrace, heaters, blankets, you can eat sushi. Really nice place and recommend if in London.

title: Great View, thats it
comment: Restaurants with great views on high floors often fail to live up to expectation when it comes to the rest of the experience and as such I go with somewhat lowered expectations. Sushisamba however managed to surprise me by how poor it was despite this. There are always better and worse tables in restaurants, then some restaurants have tables that simply should not be a table they would allocate to a paying guest. Here however they are quite happy to sit you at a table with no view right by the clearing station / order desk. Upon being taken to this table we simply asked to sit elsewhere as I don't think anyone should be subjected to that table especially at these prices. They to be fair after 10 minutes did indeed move us, this was however only after making it clear we would simply leave and eat elsewhere that stay at the table. The table moved to was far better, not amazing, but it certainly very nice and we were happy with it. Bottle of champagne ordered, warm bottle of champagne served. When I pointed this out upon tasting I received a reaction of I had no idea what I was talking about, I suggested they try it themselves, sure enough it was accepted the champagne was not chilled properly and rather than offer to replace it they got a large bucket of ice and offered to chill it while we finished the drinks we had ordered at the start. The food was nice, certainly nothing that's going to win any awards or make you think wow. What did make you think wow was the speed of service. Despite the issue with the table and the champagne problems they managed to serve us the entire order in under 1 hour of stepping out of the lift. To be clear we ordered various items and the first of which turned up within 1 minute of the waiter leaving the table. We did complain and to be fair they apologised and adjusted the bill with an offer that we should contact them before returning so they can show how it should be. Normally I am open to giving somewhere another chance but on this occasion I didn't get the sense there was any point. The place is designed to extract as much cash from you in the shortest amount of time with little regard for service and average food. The view is that good but it's not worth compromising your evening meal for.

title: Lovely restaurant, with very helpful staff
comment: Kudos to Cristian at the bar for managing to make up a non-alcoholic drink for me on the spot, and well done to David in the restaurant for guiding my group through the intricacies of fine-dining sushi-style!  Pleasantly surprised by how nice this experience turned out to be!

title: Lovely views and food
comment: Fun lift ride started our lunch off well. Great bar staff entertained before lovely food. Tables quite close but enjoyed the experience.

title: The worst experience in London
comment: The sushi bar is bad and the service is even worst. I had to cancel the order and leave because no food arrived after more than 1 hour waiting. They promise a view but you only get it through the elevator.

title: The location is the star - along with the fashion Sushi!
comment: I was lucky enough to attend a business event booked here. It’s one of the ‘must visit’ London venues. The fusion sushi is really delicious. I guess modelled on the Japanese / Brazilian fusion food and history in Brazil (go read up about it!).  Unfortunately I didn’t get any pictures of the amazingly tasty little tasters being served - but trust me - the food is to die for. The bar was very well stocked. Venue, 39th floor, a level above the restaurant, is almost two separate rooms. One with a view over the orange lit tree with monkey and limited London skyline view. The other ‘room’ has better views but looks eastwards - so views are generally less impressive particularly at night.  The dedicated glass lift has better views over the city during the day or evening but strangely, the City looks less distinct late at night. Still, London; what an amazing city - day or night. I would like to go back and try out the restaurant - for that very special occasion maybe. The thing here is this; you go for the exclusivity of the place. The food is good / looks good but you’ll find better dining elsewhere I’m sure. I expected better views which were really only available in the dedicated high speed lift accessed separately from the main Heron Tower skyscraper.

title: Amazing
comment: I went here last night for dinner, the food was amazing and the service outstanding. The food came out as it was cooked so didn’t get really any photos but all the dishes were of the same high quality. The staff couldn’t do enough to help us and our particular waitress was lovely. Views were incredible. Look forward to going back one day.

title: Amazing venue fantastic food and service
comment: We came here for my daughters 21 st and sons 18 th last night ! We were treated like royalty from the word go .... the service was exceptional with very attentive waiters. We tried lots of small plates and starters and they were all delicious . The miso cod , popcorn shrimp and teriyaki chicken we would highly recommend .  The views across London were stunning and we watched the sunset and then the twinkling lights of London . A perfect venue we will be BACK

title: Worst experience of my life
comment: Absolute disaster. Had booked 3 months in advance for 8 persons and when we got there a KID in the bar decided that he would not serve one guy (totally uncalled for), and then said "for security reasons", meaning they cancelled our table 5mins before our booked time. Worst restaurant experience (and shortest...), treatment and unfriendly staff I have ever heard of. Be aware of this place!

title: Stunning view, interesting food!
comment: Stunning view from the 38 floor, amazing modern decor. Don't miss the outdoor dining terras and the lighting tree. Great menu for sushi lovers and good choice of other dishes and wine. There is a vegan menu, but it has less choice. Recommend to make a reservation in advance and to ask for a table near the window. Enjoy it!

title: Expensive place but value for money
comment: Very good quality food  Goes Ealing up to £50/ head. Good views from top of city but highly priced. Worth visiting once for views of London.

title: Food great.
comment: My sister and I wanted to eat one time very fancy. That's how we came at the sushi samba website and we wanted to give it a try. When we arrived we went in the lift to the 39th floor, which was amazing to see the view. We came at the restaurant they welcomed us very friendly. Other hand our host was not that friendly. He reacted grumpy. Luckily after a while we got a new host. He was very nice and polite. But was not special service for the price you pay. and a guest had training clothes on.. The sushi we orders were great. Sushi samba create new mix of taste which are great. Thank you!

title: New set menu is AMAZING
comment: Usually sushi samba is not always the first choice for lunch as it can be a little pricey however thanks to their amazing 3 course set menu it is now my first choice for an amazing lunch that won’t break the bank. Sushi samba is an eclectic mix of Japan meets Peru and funky meets contemporary.. even if you only get to their terrace bar, it has got to be done once in your life!

title: Gorgeous food and stunning views
comment: You have to book quite early and in advance but it was worth the wait. The staff were generally friendly as were the guys at the door. The food was delicious although portion sizes were quite small

title: Enjoayable
comment: Nice views and fantastic atmosphere, had to wait a while for our food. A little pricey but this is London

title: Spectacular
comment: Got advised to try Sushisamba from the concierge of the hotel I was staying in. I have visited twice now (wish I was in London longer). Everything we tried was amazing. Also service is really good.Prices are high but I think its worth it. Highly recommended.

title: Mothers Day Menu
comment: Amazing brunch menu and staff really made a great effort to go above and beyond for this occasion. Loved it!

title: Good view
comment: The place was fully booked when we went at lunch time so ended up at the bar enjoying some good sake. Too bad we could not sample any of the dishes but have enjoyed the tasty sakes, good service and great view. Next time we need to think ahead and book.

title: Excellent Service and Great Views
comment: Visited the restaurant on a weekend, and although it was busy we were seated straight away and had a fantastic view. All of the serving staff were very friendly and explained all of the menu options. The atmosphere and ambience was relaxing and the decor and natural light from the views made for a nice experience.The food was well presented and tasted great too.  We will be returning to SushiSamba again.

title: Breathtaking view with great food
comment: Located on 110 Bishopsgate, London, Sushisamba is a Japanese-Brazilian-Peruvian sushi restaurant in cool design setting with 38th-floor Heron Tower overlooking the beautiful city. The Place We booked three weeks in advance since it’s known to always be fully booked. Situated in a lovely tower, from the moment you step into the elevator, you start to see all on the city from above where you can explore the magical view. The place is beautifully decorated, bustling with music and people. They have the main dining area and the bar area. Their outside bar has a beautiful tree which lights up in the evening.  The Food We ordered a variety of sushi and Negri. The food was great and each Maki roll was incredible. A burst of different flavours and ingredients told each story. My absolute favourite dish was the Kobe slider. A cheaper, smaller bite of the Japanese style beef but with equal decadent flavour. It was a was melt in the mouth and full of flavour. We concluded our experience with the famous banana cake. The Verdict Nothing I say will dent the popularity of Sushisamba. I was always prepared for the appeal and value of Sushisamba to be limited to the view and decor, but I was still taken aback by just how expensive the £70 Shoji menu was. There are some amazing dishes in there, but at this price, you can do so much better in London.  Would definitely recommend this place for a fine dining experience. I loved the vibe and the extra courteous servers.

title: Fabulous view, expensive drinks
comment: Went her with colleagues for a drink only. Once we had been patted down we got up the lift and were able to drop our work bags in a cloak room which was great. The views were fantastic, so approaching the bar I knew I was in for a bit of a hefty bill. Now, I appreciate I am in London, and you are paying for the view, it £47 for 3 G&Ts made my eyes water. I could have bought 2 bottles of the gin for that. I was even more surprised when reflecting on my receipts from the night out showed they had added a 13.5% service charge on to my bill! Now, call me old fashioned, but what service? I stood by the bar, waited for the difficult task of pouring 3 gins into a jigger and opening 3 bottles of tonic, then carried my guns back to our table. And that deserves a £5.47 charge! Needless to say I will definitely be getting those removed if I ever go here again, but I can’t argue the view was fantastic.

title: Average
comment: When you hear about sushisamba you have high expectations from the service until the quality of drinks and food. Despite the good selection of Japanese whiskey, beer etc was no really value for the money. The service needs to be improved as we had the card to pay the bill on the table and the waiter just came and took it without asking if he may be allowed for it. It look a little bit strange and the service was really rushed. Overall, average, you pay the name and not the quality of the service. Are better roof top bars in London and cheaper .

title: Going up & high in City
comment: Having pass by many times in front of the entrance of this place, always with a queue, didn't consider visit or booking a table but there was something appealing in the concept of go up & high and the fusion of South American & Japanese food. Soooo, me and friends randomly pop at the entrance on a Friday afternoon and we were thinking just get to the bar and have a pulse of the place but probably they wouldn't let us without booking. Funny enough, we just pass through the people that were queuing for the restaurant and we went straight in because we were going to the bar. Lift up, speedy one! 39th...floor maybe, got confused as there's communicating spiral stairs between these floors above. Anyway at the bar, strange arrangement in a central station were the bartenders actually walk around and serve costumers either standing or in the very few seating places. The place is way too small for the number of people but ok, our drinks took 25 min to be prepared... meanwhile we've asked to take a seat on one of the available booths which was reserved but for later so we got to seat as probably they don't like empty spaces. After the drinks delay, excuses etc, we got our cocktails and compensation champagne and water... nice!  Chilling, chatting just have a good time, we asked if it would be possible to eat something and surprise! They said they could arrange for a place in the restaurant below, oooookey! Decided to give a go to this fusion gastronomy.  Did I mention the prices of the drinks? Be ready to be shocked! Restaurant, easy peasy, again too small for the number of people hence some extra room in the place above that serve the food from the restaurant... and the outdoor space in the restaurant level only in warm days, good luck with that! We seat at the round counter where the chefs were preparing, we've got tempura shrimps, samba rolls sushi, poussin teriyaki (chicken) which probably not the best examples of the fusion food but there was somehow a twist here and there that speaks both cultures I guess. I did mention the drinks cost, so the meal wasn't a surprise when three digits bill arrived!!! All good, fun experience and everybody had a good time, the views are quite striking and it's obviously a very glamourous place to be and to be seen I guess.

title: Amazing view and vibes
comment: I went there a couple of times for lunch. Good sushi and good meat. I would recommend you to take a table by a window to enjoy the experience :)

title: Gorgeous place, delicious food
comment: We went here to celebrate my partner’s birthday and were not disappointed. We got stuck in traffic and was late but they still let us in, we didn’t get our ideal table but it was alright. The place was stunning the view was magical. We ordered the taste menu for 2 and was super satisfied, we got to taste to many things we haven’t tried before. My favorite was yuca plantation, absolutely stunning dish, it was sweet like dessert. Highly recommend this place if you want to treat your SO or any celebrations overall. Our waiter was super nice and attentive too.

title: One of my favorites in London
comment: Love their El Topo; get it every time I am in London. Make reservations (30) days in advance to guarantee, the date and times you prefer. Waiters are well versed in the food and pairing you with the appropriate wines.

title: Overrated, Overhyped, Expensive with mediocre food and terrible service
comment: The title says it all. Lift is usually not working, employees can’t find your reservation, prices are very high for the lack of quality. Food is very average and everything but Japanese, you some mediocre brazilianish stuff, mediocre sushi, pretend Peruvian (which is sooo 2009), overpriced drinks. Even the things you would expect to function smoothly like the service in a trendy place more known by their after hour escorts lounging around in the outside bar than for anything else don’t. Employees are rude, full of crap and will as a norm refuse even the most reasonable normal requests. Also expect to wait A LOT for your table even if you are early there was no one before you and you had a reservation. Oh cocktails are okaish (if expensive) that’s kind of the highlight.

title: Work Event
comment: My second visit, great atmosphere and one of the nicest bars in town. Even the journey in the lift is inspirational with great views of town. Already planning my next visit.

title: Expensive
comment: Amazing decor, very impressive design poor service, mediocre food, expecting better with this very expensive price ticket !

title: Didn’t disappoint
comment: I’d wanted to visit sushisamba for a couple of years but had never been organised enough to book a table in time for a weekend visit. I eventually managed to get a Friday evening table for my birthday (but you have to book quite far in advance for a prime time). I’d read some mixed reviews and was actually a bit cautious thinking perhaps we’d be paying more for the environment than we would be for the quality of the food. However, I was wrong. We turned up about ten minutes before our booking and were seated straight away in a window seat which was beautiful. The staff were lovely (unlike some of the reviews on here suggest). The food was delicious, perhaps not the best we’ve had but definitely up there. What made it more delicious we’re the interesting combinations of flavours. I would definitely recommend the yellowtail taquitos, the Neo Tokyo rolls, green bean tempura and wagyu gyozas. We also used the cloakroom to check in a small cabin suitcase. After reading some really terrible reviews I was a bit concerned about this but it was absolutely fine. My only complaints would be that we each ordered a cocktail when we were first seated and it took about 15/20 minutes for them to come, arriving after our first couple of dishes. This meant we weren’t able to order the wine we were looking forward to with our mains. Also, we asked the waiter to take the service charge off the bill and we would pay that with cash. He didn’t and instead took two service charges and unfortunately we only noticed after we’d left so couldn’t do anything about it. I’ve read a few reviews suggesting they’re a bit sticky fingered with the bill so I would definitely recommend checking this.

title: Great place for a date night ♥️
comment: . Place where fantastic view combine with a fabulous flavor experience what else you need for a great date? . Stylish Terrace with its own bar and a tree will definitely helps to make your selfie shots brighter . Open kitchen area for an entertainment lovers  . Big restaurant area has a perfect city view from literally any spot . Value - mid- range . Best time to visit before sunset to get beautiful

title: Average
comment: This place has to be good to live up to the hype - and waiting list to get a table. Sadly, it underperformed. It was ok. I’ve had better meals in better surroundings, with more attentive waiting staff. If you want a special meal out with your other half then I’d avoid this place and go somewhere that pays more attention to service than it does to maintaining its ego. There was a 30 minute wait at the (tiny) bar on arrival to get a drink, and they tried to usher us to our table because you have a time limited sitting. Food was of a good standard but was nothing special. Yes it has a nice outside bar and good views but you can get these elsewhere. Nothing special upon which I can reflect that would draw us back.

title: Club dining with a wonderful view!
comment: Make sure to book in advance, and don't be late because you loose your booking! However, solved on arrival! The lift up to floor 39 gives you a stunning view over London if the weather permits! Great cocktail's and drinks served from inside as well as outside located bars! We were lucky enough to get a table by the window, we ordered various dishes that tasted great!. Friendly, efficient and professional staff! Really a great dinner experience worth visiting, a bonus if you like Japanese style of food! Thank you for reading! Br/Stefan

title: Managed to get in finally and it was pretty good
comment: Some pretty varied reviews made me a bit worried about having booked through Amex for my wife's birthday but we enjoyed it. The elevator up is a highlight but the food didn't disappoint either - we had a to wait in the bar for about 15 minutes whilst our table was sorted but we enjoyed some cocktails. Our table was by the windows and the views are amazing. As for food, the lobster taquitos, yellowtail tiradito and teriyaki poussin were great, the black cod very good (although I've had better) and the samba london rolls nice enough. We found the staff quite attentive and good humoured, whilst the atmosphere was quite nice, in contrast perhaps to some of the reviews. Maybe we got lucky? All in all really enjoyed it and we'd go back, if we can get in!

title: Awful Customer Service
