comment: I booked a table for a client business dinner at SushiSamba Bishopsgate.  The front of house staff were unfriendly and rude and advised continuously that our table would be ready in 5 minutes. Unfortunately I had to go back to the front of house for an update every 5 minutes for 40 minutes before we insisted that we spoke with the manager. The front of house did not show any empathy or apologise for the delay during our wait. No member of the Sushi Samba staff came to speak with us or even offer the possibility to order a drink.  The staff were unfriendly and I am shocked at the poor level of customer service and communication despite it taking 50 minutes after our booking that we were seated. I will not return to eat or entertain any other clients at this restaurant, it is over rated and the customer service is poor. There are plenty of other restaurants on the city with equally good views of the London skyline and offer a better customer experience.

title: Amazing food and atmosphere
comment: My boyfriend and I adore sushi, so visited Sushi Samba for our third anniversary and we weren't disappointed. It had a fab selection, great food and drink and an amazing atmosphere. Quite pricey but definitely worth it.

title: Disappointing
comment: Although the food was good and the venue had a good vibe and views it was let down by the service we received. Firstly, you are made to queue outside in the cold to even enter the building. The bouncer was also very rough when patting down the men. Half the food we ordered didn’t even arrive and when we pointed this out to the waiter he was very quick to say that he was sure it had already been given to us. Conclusion: there are lots of places with nice views in London - don’t waste your money here.

title: Tasty with a view
comment: Place like this can be hit and miss sometimes because of the high volumes but my visit was amazing.  From the cocktails at the bar to the dessert with London at our feet everything was balanced and tasty. I would like to thank all the front of house staff as everyone we crossed were friendly and efficient. Thanks

title: amazing
comment: for me it was the best sushi I had and good view too! Hopefully, they will add more time for guest to stay longer to enjoy their food!

title: Good But Not Perfect
comment: First time in this restaurant last week and we were very excited because we did want to visit for a long time now. The view is amazing, perfect place to enjoy yourself even if you go only for a drink at the bar. The overall experience was positive for our first time. The food was really good but not perfect and some of the dishes were way overpriced. I guess you have to pay some extra cash for the view as well. The staff was absolutely fantastic I have to admit, apart from two situations. First, when you arrive in a place like this you expect at least to be welcomed with a smile. Maybe on that day the dark short haired lady who was the hostess had a bad morning because her mood was like you owed her some money or something like that. Second, when the bill arrived I told the waiter that I didn't want to pay the suggested (13.50%!) service charge in the bill and before I finish my sentence he had an angry look in his face without saying anything. I said to him that I prefer to pay the tip in cash. That would be 10% of the final bill. From my point of view I believe that it was enough for the quality of the food, the service and the overall experience. After all, the view costs money...

title: Good all round
comment: A good fun night out with great views food and service. Waiting times were a slight issue however our patience was worth it.

title: Great food but watch out for the sommelier
comment: Had a great experience overall, food and vibe all amazing. On arrival we were approached by one of the sommeliers and he suggested the we let him choose a wine for us that would pretty much go with everything on the menu and of course we decided to go with his suggestion, our mistake was never asking for the price as only when we asked for another bottle did another sommelier come and tell us that it was one of their premier wines and it was £190 per bottle... can’t help but feel that it was done on purpose, so watch out for the sommelier.

title: Wonderful Everytime I Visit. There is no restaurant like this
comment: The food is amazing, the location is amazing and the staff are amazing. One of my most favourite restaurants in London. You have to try the lobster Tacos, they are EPIC. Thank you for a wonderful experience, time and time again. This also applies to their branch in Covent Garden.

title: Great experience
comment: Really enjoyed the ambience, view and service. The waiter recommended too much food bit we adjusted it to about 2 items per person which was perfect! Food was excellent with just the right amount of adventure. Don’t miss the outdoor tree patio and enjoy the elevator view!

title: Birthday Celebration
comment: Having been before a while ago ,we thought this would be a good venue for my sons 21st birthday so came with a family party of 8. The food was very good but the service was dreadful. The waiter was clearly a bit cheesed off that we were going to choose our selection our selves instead of his suggestions and warned us before we started that we only had the the table for a couple of hours so needed to order everything immediately, despite the fact there were empty tables around us. There were no smiles and clearly no acknowledgement of any birthday . Some of our selections didn't arrive and our waiter was incredibly rude , telling us we hadnt ordered them, he was aggressive ,arrogant and nasty and left us with a bad taste, ruining our family 21st celebration. A very nice Irish waiter apologised and we were offered dessert but by then, we just wanted to leave. This is not a cheap restaurant and the prices charged are not reflected in the poor level of service which goes not match the decent quality of food. There are many good restaurants in London and I will not be returning here. Ģ

title: Fun night in the City of London
comment: Going up to the 39th floor  You know you are somewhere special. Amazing views, great food if you like variety and good support

title: Sushi samba is racist and the security guards beat us up
comment: Me and my family went sushi samba for a bday meal and as we were leaving, the three big massive security guards were telling us to shut up and were being rude. They kept shouting at us so we shouted back and because of this they started pushing us. One of the big security guards grabbed my cousin and threw him. They were all pushing us and pushing women and girls and two small uni lads. We were tiny compared to the security. They were then throwing my brother and cousin on the floor and kicking them and even pushed a little girl. The security guards were white and when the police came they were white too and didn’t help us at all and instantly sided with the security guards. The people watching were white and were also blaming us. We are brown asian muslims and because of this no one helped us and still aren’t helping us. Do not eat at sushi samba.

title: It’s pricey but it’s worth it, and the lift ride is free.
comment: Everyone has heard of SushiSamba and it is somewhere I have always wanted to visit so on arrival at Heron Tower, I was excited. As reputation suggests I am unsurprised to see a number of 6ft odd bouncers stood behind a red rope and a row of eager looking diners. As we took our places behind other smartly dressed couples I couldn’t help but notice a group of very confident looking 18 year olds waltz up to the bouncers, ignoring the queue, clearly assuming that with their tiny skirts, overly blow dried hair and try hard look, they would be whisked to the front of the queue. It was pleasing then, when the bouncer took one look and signalled that they return to the back, no favours were being done. The couple in front were ID’d, they did not have a reservation and put to one side. As I scrambled for mine we reached the front, on announcing that I had reservation, I was promptly let in no questions asked and guided to a lift. We felt somewhat like rockstars, so lesson learnt, reservation is key !  On entering into the lift your expectations are further set alight, as a fast-moving lift as it whizzes up 39 floors, whisking you away from the hustle and bustle of Liverpool Street.  Upon leaving the lift you make your way through a decorative bamboo arch way and are greeted by a host who whisks away your coat and hands you a number card, with a strict instruction NOT to lose it. Noted! The bar area upstairs is shut for a private event, but its the first hint to SushiSamba's famous indoor trees, with a gorgeous cherry blossom tree overhanging the bar. We make our way down the stair case and into a buzzy bar at this point the seated restaurant still remains tantalisingly around the corner, hidden from view. Crowds of young instagrammers huddle in corners urgently taking as many selfies and pictures of them drinking cocktails as possible, interspersed with city workers, well dressed and vibrant and couples. We find our way to yet another reception desk and are greeted by some rather stone faced hosts, who ooze cool and make you feel rather un glamorous no matter what you are wearing ! However, once again it seems that this is done to put off the punters, those who have not planned ahead and booked ! And once we’d given our name to the hostess and been granted entry we were whisked away by a grinning host who had an animated discussion about what our experience would entail. As we rounded the curved corner detailing the famous graffiti style art work we suddenly entered into the main restaurant. An immense room with 360 degree panoramic windows, lit by what seemed like an eternity of dangling globe pendant lights, made it seem almost as if we were walking into the Great Hall at Hogwarts with its magical ceiling. Above this stunning canopy stands a bamboo look frame which curves downwards to join the floor.  At first as were seated, I couldn’t help but feel disappointed, yes we were put near the window but in the furthest most corner of the restaurant, crammed in behind the Host service station, meaning we couldn’t get out of our table without asking the congregating waiters to move, my husbands view was alright, although to the side just of crane. But for me just a stack of napkins, the till and the backs of waiters. But due to how busy the restaurant was and because my husband hates it, I agreed not to say anything ! It now came to the painstaking process of narrowing down our food choices to a ‘reasonable amount’ for two people. A process that I was so overwhelmed by I had to order a cocktail before I could consider it. The menu comprises of a selection of small dishes and larger platters from decadent sushi rolls to succulent sashimi. Our cocktails arrived, I had ordered the Tom Yam off the ‘Culinary Cocktail List’ the description said that my drink would have an accompanying Turbot Nigiri, I assumed on the side, but oh no - it was on top of my drink.. yes there was Sushi IN MY COCKTAIL. I must say I was a little unsure about this and picked it off and ate it, it was a delicious hint of what was to come. The cocktail its self was a punchy coriander, ginger, lime leaf and chilli infusion. Served long and spiked with Reyka vodka.  Once I had finely plucked up the courage to wade through the menu we made our choice, skipping the large plates we decided to share more small dishes. It is hard to ignore some the eye watering prices on the menu. For example the Kobe Beef Ishiyaki, 1kg of beef served on a hot stone with dipping sauces and pickled plums at £1000, and yes that is correct I did not slip on the key board ! Or the Kobe Churrasco, which is a ribeye steak, chorizo & fillet. I am a foodie but I really am not sure if this price would be worth it and is frankly showy ! So what did we go for; well we started with the crispy taquitos stuffed with lobster and avocado and drizzled with lime which were refreshing, cleansing and a divine mixture of textures and flavours. Soft lobster and smooth avocado mingled with saji amarillo, jalapeno, lime, maize, morado and the crisp bite of the outer shell (Yeh, no I don’t know what those ingredients are either - but boy they work). We then tried Tuna ceviche, which looked fantastic, but in reality was our least favourite, the slightly poncey foam adding nothing to the dish and the pomegranate leche de tigre too sharp and completely overpowered the tuna, the maiz morado pleasant but boring, wasabi peas completely lost and the basil… didn’t know it was there.  But this was a minor blip and the rest of the food was heavenly.  We ate our way through the plethora of dishes with as much glee as children in a sweet shop. Each of the dishes seemed to complement one another even though they were all very different. The Salmon Sashimi so creamy it melted on my tongue, and every other dish that appeared on my tastebuds at first perplexed and then delighted, the depths of flavours truly sensational. The Neo Tokyo Samba Roll though deserves its own mention, my husband had to check several time that I was okay and was still alive. The spicy tuna, tempura crunch, lotus root, aji panca, spicy mayo marinated into flavour explosion, a harmony and truly perfect balance of flavours - is that Umami ? I couldn’t help but feel disappointed as we reached our last dish. Just as we were discussing ordering one more, although I was ignoring the fact that I definitely was feeling quite full, our exuberant host shot over with a complimentary plate of Wagyu Gyoza with a kabocha puree and a sweet soy sauce. I am sure this luxury is thrown on upon many, but no one else around us seemed to have received this so we couldn’t help but feel smug !  Dessert felt like a step too far and I desperately did not want to feel sluggish particularly because we were about to shoot down 38 floors at some speed in an elevator.  The atmosphere around us was great, although most of it I think I missed because my tastebuds were so distracted by this exuberant dinner-time dance and we were in deep discussion about the marriage of flavours and cuisines we were enjoying. Of course though you can’t help but remember that it is an instagrammers dream, and for many it is a chance to show off, not a problem, but grating. The couple next to us talking too loudly about the champagne they’d ordered the massive dish of Lobster Maki, lobster, nashi pear, grilled white asparagus, truffle aji amarillo, 10g oscietra caviar, 5g black truffle, crispy nori plus other dishes all of which were £65+ and then once they’d arrived seemingly had zero idea as to what they had ordered. I don’t want to sound arrogant but hearing someone ask if a £65 plate of succulent lobster was seabass made me want to get up, take the dish away and say you don’t deserve this (not okay I know !) What I think we proved though was that you don’t have to pay stupid money for dishes at SushiSamba, we paid no more than £17 per dish and they were sensational. It’s the perfect place for a special occasion, a romantic evening or just a moment to drink in the real beauty of the city that we often miss when rushing from tube to office. It’s pricey but it’s worth it, and the lift ride is free.

title: Great buzz and food
comment: Went there with a few friends, great buzz, friendly staff. Food was great, it’s pricy but worth the money.

title: excellant venue
comment: Great place to visit if in London. The glass lift is fantastic albeit a little daunting... good food, great outside bar and very good service

title: Great Cocktails
comment: I was there about a week ago.I had to wait a little long for the Service to take notice of me as I just sat down without being seated. However everything that happened after was at a very professional level. Great cocktails they serve. I would definitely return.

title: Very nice restaurant and club
comment: I had a business dinner in a nice and relaxing atmosphere. The food was great and the location was fantastic especially the lift to reach the 38th floor.  I have enjoyed the view over the Gherkin and also the outside patio. The service at the bar was slow, unfortunately.  However, I recommend this place.

title: Wow
comment: Wow, what a great venue for a restaurant, good views over London while you are enjoying some wonderful food.  Great flavours as you would expect from this cuisine, and good service.

title: Hyped up place matches the hyped up prices
comment: 39th floor of Salesforce tower (ex Heron Tower). A place to be seen! Good cocktail bar, but limited seating and busy on a friday night at 6.30. Sushi was delicious. Fusion food with Peruvian was very tasty. No view from where we were seated which is the whole point n'est pas? Drinks are expensive and cost as much as the meal, all up £100 /head. Not worth it.

title: Must get El Topo sushi! Strict time policy
comment: I have been to sushi samba a few times and definitely one of my favourite spots for a celebratory dinner. On this occasion was dinner with friends for their birthday. One thing to note they are super strict with table timing and you will have your dinner cut off ( we were told we couldn’t order dessert). Shame. Other than that great views, stunning deco and the best sushi!

title: Got sick after I had the sushi
comment: Beautiful restaurant with very friendly staff. But damn, I got sick after the visit. Ordered sushi and had to go to the toilet right after the food...

title: Disappointing Visit
comment: I had read and heard a lot about this place, all being good and highly recommended. However I visited for my friends birthday in a group of 6 and overall would only rate the experience as 3. The service was average, some staff were nice and helpful whereas others had an attitude. I had read about this on previous reviews and can agree with them. The food that we had I would argue is overpriced for what it was. The view is lovely and ambience great but I would not return.

title: Poorest service ever
comment: We went there for Valentin's day and obviously the staff wasn't prepared. We booked the table at 10pm and had to wait 1 hour to get the table (even though they email you before saying that if you don't show up at 10:15 they give your table to someone else...).  The staff ask you to go the bar while waiting HOWEVER they don't come to pick you up when the table is ready, no, you have to come and check from time to time yourself, as otherwise they give your table to someone else. Unbelievable! Regarding the food, maybe it was due to Valentin's day special menu, but it was very average for such a renowned place.  The only thing that is worth it, is the view and the place itself, it is very pretty and I would recommend just going there for the cocktail bar and enjoy a drink outside on the terrasse. Do not waste your money on the food and go to Itsu instead.

title: Quite an experience
comment: On the top of the city, at 39th and 40th floor of the Bishop Gate. So breathtaking elevator ride and London panorama. Great choice of both Japaneese and Scottish whiskies...just take care, some of them have also breathtaking prices... They also have a terrace...but the view from there is completely obstruated, so better stay inside. Food is rather sushi and music rather samba!

title: Amazing food
comment: had been here before the food was spectacular and the service too, but we had a good experience. thank sushisamba I will be back soon!!!

title: Great if you like heights!
comment: Was taken for drinks by some business friends...great experience if you don’t mind heights. Floor to ceiling glass windows and an outside bar/eating area which I didn’t venture into because of my vertigo, however the group I was with said views were spectacular. Had just eaten elsewhere so just had drinks, service was good...late on a Friday afternoon and atmosphere was good.

title: Great birthday lunch with superb service
comment: We had a wonderful lunch at SushiSamba, the food was superb and the service fantastic and would like to put a shout out for Chubba who went out of his way to make the visit something special for our son on his birthday. All staff wished him a happy birthday which just added to the visit

title: Bad service poor drinks
comment: Really poor slow service, so pretentious full of instagramers. Couldn’t make a G&T, in a high ball glass that you get from weatherspoons. Poor bar staff, take both your hosts and stick them on bar service. 1. Your customers would have a better time. 2. You would actually take more money on your over priced weather spoons drinks :)  The view of cranes was the best, why do you not have someone on the outside bar? Literally like no body understands what the customer journey, experience should be. Amateur hour, when it could be so much better.

title: Good sushi, amazing view.
comment: The food here is good. I went in knowing it wasn’t cheap; glad to have tried it once. The sushi is good, not the best I’ve had in London, but tasty. The resturant itself is nice, staff are friendly, and the view is amazing.  I had the Dragon roll, Veggie Roll, California roll, and the tempura shrimp. Everything was good, especially the dragon roll.

title: Fantastic Dining Experience
comment: Incredible sushi, great atmosphere, good service and outstanding view. We had 4 dishes between 2 including sashimi, 2 sets of crab rolls and tempura prawns and all were very tasty and it wasn't too pricey either. Good portion sizes too. The only thing you have to make sure of is to book quite a way in advance.

title: Delicious
comment: I visited with my girlfriends in November 2018, and then with my husband and another couple in January 2019. That's how good it was. Both times I booked 2 months in advance to get the dates and times that we wanted - sells out so quick! So worth it though. The experience starts with the lift where we were fortunate to have clear skies for a beautiful lit up view over to the west of London over the City. A visit to the tree is almost a ritual, and then in for dinner. The service is exceptional. I like the way you can tell the waiter how hungry you are, what you like - they then add some other options and you can decide - and then dishes arrive...And every one was spot on. By the time we got to dessert (which was also very good), we were nicely full. Wine service was also very good and you don't have to break the bank. All told, including service, it was around £100pp. We didn't need anything else. Saying that, both times I visited, I chose a spot close by that has excellent happy hour(s) for pre-dinner drinks as the price tag is higher here for drinks at the bar. Highly recommend, and am looking forward to returning.

title: Great service, nice food
comment: New restaurant (to me). Besides a great location, the restaurant has a lot going for it. I enjoyed the nice cocktail bar, followed by a great meal. Service is great, loved it.

title: Excellent food, location and service
comment: My husband and I had lunch from the vegan menu. The sushi was outstanding and the mushroom tobanyaki was delicious. My husband received complimentary sorbet as it was his birthday. The servers were really attentive and accommodating. We look forward to going back for lunch.

title: Amazing
comment: Nice view! Amazing atmosphere! Friendly and professional staff! High quality and good food! Highly recommended!

title: Great!
comment: Amazing place, spectacular view high up, super wow sushi, incredible service.  Quite expensive, but it’s worth the visit!

title: Great atmosphere
comment: We had a lovely dinner at this place. The atmosphere is brilliant, the food was tasty and special. A bit expensive but in this location is normal. Definitely we will visit again.

title: Saturday lunch
comment: Took my 14 year old daughter for her birthday. Location obviously great, food delicious if you can get your head round paying £50 for 9 pieces of raw fish on a large pile of crushed ice. But nevertheless you know it’s pricey but the foods fantastic.  Only small gripe is pipework in ceiling is filthy, needs a good dust and other half commented on toilets looking a bit tatty. Maybe resting on their location and food laurels. Overall if you’ve never been go but you won’t get much change out of £100/ head for a light lunch.

title: Beautiful place and delicious food
comment: A bit £££, but totally worth it! The fusion of the theee cultures gives a unique touch you will hardly see anywhere else. Great enviroment and menu! Book in advance to get the amazong view of the city!

title: Worth the hype?
comment: This is my second visit to this bar and safe to say last. Yes the lift up is cool along with decor but really it’s a tiny space with one good view point. The drinks are over priced and nothing special. The lounge room is dull and the place just lacks atmosphere.  Take a visitor to the city by all means but don’t stay long!

title: We had a great time
comment: The sushi was delicious. The desert was fresh, we loved it. The staff was very polite and helpful. But most of all we enjoyed the breathtaking view, from our table.

title: Disappointing
comment: Took my daughter for her 18th birthday bc she loves sushi. Ceviche was too saucy, couldn’t taste the fish. Gyoza wasn’t amazing, tasted like store bought, teriyaki chicken was burnt and too tangy. Below average, over priced food. Cocktails nice and inventive. Lamb chops super tasty. Super disappointing meal. Another over hyped London restaurant chain. Ho hum...

title: Good food, poor ambience and awful service
comment: We dined as a group of 5 for a friends birthday recently and had quite high expectations and had wanted to visit for a while.  The food is very good and there is a lot of choice, we really enjoyed every one of our dishes and ordered another one of nearly all of them as they were so delicious. The ambience and service however is shocking and left us really disappointed and quite upset.  The bar area is really nice and buzzy, but the restaurant is just really nothing special, especially if you don’t get a seat close to a window so no view. The service was dreadful, we had different waiters and had to keep asking for water etc. To be topped up, they got a drinks order wrong and tried to argue it was our fault. Then when the bill finally came it was completely wrong and they had added a £129 dish on that we had not ordered, I think they think if you are a group that has had a few drinks you won’t notice and try to get away with adding things on! Lucky we checked and told the man who brought the bill over, he was so rude no apology, when I asked how that happened he just shrugged and said I don’t know mistake. We were then rushed to leave they couldn’t get us out quick enough, we hadn’t even finished our drinks and they practically threw us out. I’ve honestly never met someone so rude working in hospitality in my whole life. We also witnessed and overheard the waiters talking about people at the tills ( as our table was right by there) which a lot of other people have noted too.  In all I would never come back here due to the shocking service and rude staff, when you are paying £400 plus for a meal the service should be exceptional and it sadly wasn’t.  The door men however were lovely and polite!

title: Consistently great food, excellent service, just maybe a bit pricey
comment: Have been here a dozen times and it is consistently very good quality food. The service is exceptional and the setting is incredible, 40 floors high up with an excellent view of the London skyline.  The only drawback is that it is rather expensive. Having said that they have me hooked as I keep going back.

title: Amazing food and staff
comment: I took my partner for his birthday. I managed to get a cancellation and I’m so happy I did. The food from start to finish was fantastic. I would highly recommend their staff and food. It was worth every penny

title: All about the view
comment: Popped in for an unplanned visit. The views are why people come here, the restaurant looks great but the service and value of the food are poor, add to that toilets that resembled a nightclub at 2am and it really does beg the question why anyone would pay £100 per head for lunch. Sake was delicious, I’d recommend having a drink on the outside terrace on a sunny day.

title: Drinks
comment: Popped in to Sushi Samba after dinner elsewhere, views are lovely, cocktails were a little over priced that is to be expected but they were lovely. It was a nice atmosphere in there and we would return.

title: Over priced
comment: Really disappointed, I've been there the last week, I organise a surprise for a birthday. We was 7, only 2 of us have them drinks then we had to wait 15 minutes for 3 more and finally they forget 2 so we had to order them again so we had to wait 30 minutes only for drinks. The service was really bad, we had a nice waiter but all the rest of the time we had différents waiters coming at our table. Really disappointed for a beautiful restaurant like this one.

title: Perfect food, interesting venue
comment: This Sushisamba offers a great view of parts of London overlooking the Gherkin, Tower of London and St Paul’s. It has a restaurant area with glass walls, a small bar and eating are (seating around the chefs at work and a super, reasonably sized outdoor area (with its own bar). A wonderful canopy of orange lights is provided by a giant tree, creating a wonderful, cosy glow. This is a popular place and queues are a regular occurrence - so booking is essential if you want a guaranteed place here. Prices are high but you get absolute quality in the food and drinks. A unique experience.

title: Expensive but delightful ambiance, food, service, view.
comment: Really distinctive décor and great view from 40th floor. Food was interesting and good with good service. Great for lunch or dinner view and ambiance. Expensive but worth it for the experience.

title: Stunning looking restaurant but food and service absolutely terrible!
comment: We went as a family of four (13,11) kids loved the lift and restaurant is just stunning, it's a lot smaller than what we thought it was going to be. View is out of this world, note that window tables are only tables for 2 so we had the next table in line, it was fine still had a lovely view of the City. Food is shocking, if you know your food then don't go here, tempura prawns are not tempura prawns look and taste like calamaris, black cod was cut terribly by the waiter. Service is a shambles we had 3 different waiters serving us throughout our time there. Ordered a a beautiful bottle of wine each time our glasses were empty we had to call over a waiter to pour. We were questioning the black cod and the waiter said he wouldn't know the answer as he had never been to a Japanese restaurant really?!?! and you work in Sushi Samba! Prices are high but you are nowhere near getting the same quality of food, food is awful will not be going back here ever!!

title: Special place for my Friends Birthday
comment: I took my friend there on her birthday as I had previosuly dined there a couple of years ago. It was still a great place with great atmosphere and lovely presented food and lots of bubbles. Looking for somewhere special and trendy with great views over London then this is the pace to go, I highly recommend this place

title: Amazing experience
comment: The place and views are amazing! Really proffessional and attentive service. To celebrate a special occasion is the perfect place. High prices due to quality of food.

title: Birthday dinner with a view
comment: Great attentive service, great views, great food. It is really pricey though, but it is a special place for special occasions.

title: Birthday Treat
comment: My 16year old daughter surprised me with dinner here as it was on my list of places to go. Living in London you sometimes forget to take advantage of the amazing places we have and I would say this place is unique and memorable. The lift is an experience in itself, the view is amazing and the set up is perfect. The only thing that lets it down is the service and for me service its everything it can make or break somewhere. There are many reviews that say the service isn't good but clearly it must come from the top as nothing is being done about it. We thought the price and food where good especially for a nice place in London so wasn't shocked by that in any way. All I would say is if you want value for money which should and normally means good service as well don't even think of going here you will most definitely be disappointed.

title: Magical place with unbelievable view!
comment: The atmosphere, the view, the music around and the food makes everything special and suggestive. I really recommend the place to have a special dinner but, you have to book early your special time Here!

title: Amazing dining experience
comment: We booked SushiSamba for a family xmas break dinner / treat and we were not disappointed. The views are excellent and ambience one of the best we have been. The food was excellent, a fine balance of innovative and delicious cuisine. The service as you would expect was first class too. We heard great things about this resturant and it lived up to the high expectations!

title: Good views and food but expensive
comment: Four of us had dinner. The views are impressive as it sits effectively as a transparent box on the top of the Heron Tower. Some of the food was excellent, such as the tempura prawns and wagyu gyoza. The rest was good. Service was attentive but a bit corporately remote. Judge yourself whether £85 per head is expensive given we had one bottle of wine and a small flask of sake between us. I do object to supposedly 'discretionary' service charges of 13.5% being added to the bill. 10% maybe, but this seems an excessive default level.

title: They know to apologize
comment: To make an online reservation there is a specific process that you need to be patient with, after asking for a few prerequisites. We arrived on time because if you delay 15 minutes you lose your reservation and have a penalty of 20 pounds per person. But they gave us a table with a 45-minute delay, which overturned our entire program and this in London costs if you have made other reservations after dinner. The shopkeepers were greatly apologized for winning us a glass of champagne and three first dishes, about 45 pounds. I got a lot of meats that I loved very much and all the accompanying dishes were of high quality, both in their presentation and in their taste. The service was also of a high standard, for the space I do not have much to say, just on the 38 floor of a skyscraper everything seems amazing.

title: Awesome views
comment: Sushi samba has amazing views and great food. The have very authentic Japanese cuisine. Their sushi’s are really worth trying.

title: Terrible service for brunch in City
comment: I’ve been wanting to come here for ages but was hugely disappointed. The food was nice and beautifully presented, but the service was awful! Miserable, argumentative and inflexible waiters who had no empowerment to decide and no knowledge of the food they served. I had to hail for water refills. Our main came whilst we were eating our starters.

title: Tres Chic. Beautiful decor, fantastic service and fab food!
comment: Absolutely stunning decor. Well thought out! Effervescent and lively atmosphere which gives an excitable vibe. It has a roof terrace which was hip and lively with music playing and gives an opportunity to boogy on down. I ordered the lamb chops which were succulent and well cooked. Fantastic choice of cocktails and wine. A must do at least once whilst you're in London.

title: way too expensive
comment: Popped in here for a drink after going to The Ned for food - thought we would indulge in a cocktail or 2 , thank god it was only 1  there was 3 of us 2 cocktails and a vodka and lemonade for £45,97 I'm sorry I know we are in the City but come on ?? nearly £50 for 3 drinks ?  Never again will I go in here actually felt robbed

title: Top!
comment: 38th floor: beautiful place and top quality! Mix of brasilian and jappo cuisine. The best tacos of my life! Rain forest (dessert) is very very good and particular!

title: Highest outdoor Cherry Tree Terrace
comment: Heron Tower's crown jewel, SUSHISAMBA City, located on the 38th and 39th floors at 110 Bishopsgate is a unique blend of Japanese, Brazilian, and Peruvian cuisine featuring the highest outdoor dining terraces in Europe overlooking the City of London. My menu: Green Bean Tempura, Samba London Rolls, Tiger Maki Rolls, Ebi Nigiri and Moqueca Mista w/ a delicious Kaffirinha signature cocktail (Kaffir lime leaves infused in Velho Barreiro cachaça, churned with lime and sugar. Served short over crushed ice). Ideal for a romantic dinner.

title: Very Disappointed
comment: The view is fantastic, the food even though quite expensive, is good..However having spent nearly 700 pounds that evening, being told in no uncertain terms that we were to leave as we had already been given 20 mins over our 2hr slot, was very shocking to say the least ! The head waiter was very aggressive and had no finesse. We were not even able to finish our wine or order a dessert. I have been to many restaurants in many countries, and have never been treated like this. The manager then came to tell us that it is written ( in very small print ) that there is a maximum 2 hr policy. We had not seen this, so be warned and quite honestly when eating out at a restaurant that has a reputation of class and quality, one does not expect to be treated like this. I will not ever return to this restaurant and shall not be recommending it to anybody as the way we were treated completely ruined our evening.

title: Birthday dinner
comment: For my pre-birthday dinner we headed to Sushisamba and got lovely seating outside in their terrace. For starters we got: ➡️ Shrimp tempura, this was so good that my fiancé had to get 2! ➡️ Wagyu gyoza (placed on kabocha purée & sweet soy). I found these okay, nothing special. I felt like it lacked flavour. For mains we got: ➡️ Lamb chops. This on the other-hand was absolutely delicious! We opted for medium rare and with sauces it was just  ➡️ Inkarri samba rolls (lobster, nashi pear, grilled white asparagus, truffle aji amarillo, 10g oscietra caviar, 5g black truffle, crispy nori). The lobster was so so good! They definitely weren’t being stingy with it and it was my first time trying caviar. Kinda salty but was tasty with the sushi. ➡️ Chocolate banana cake (maple butter, plantain chip, vanilla rum ice cream). My oh my am I loving dessert more and more. This was so yummy. The portion given was perfect because too much of this can be sickening. ➡️ Plantain punch (Bacardi Carta Negra rum, plantain purée and aromatized wine shaken with egg white, banana, cacao and a coffee infusion. Served on the rocks) I’ve got to say the plantain colada I got at The Rum Kitchen will always be my favourite!

title: The view is jusy breath taking
comment: Simply... WOW!! amazing view from 40th floor in the center of London. One of the places that i want to visit again.

title: Disappointed and terrible service
comment: We came to spend an nice and relaxing lunch. But nothing was to our expectation.  The place is pretty with a lots of potential, nevertheless the service wasn’t good.  It started with the receptionist asking us to wait without giving any explanation and I had to go back and ask what’s going on.  When we sat down two plates were sent to us by accident, then we had to wait ages to order.  And we had to wait at least 10min between each plate we order. I am fine with the concept « comes when it’s ready » but it shouldn’t been so long.  If we haven’t to wait that time, we would have ordered more and dessert.  The service looked lost and we had to ask for water several times..On multiple occasions. Not what we expected on Christmas Day!

title: Great location, good food - very rushed and feeling more like a rip off
comment: Good food, nice views and atmosphere. ~30% overpriced, but that is to be expected knowing the brand/setup. 2 stars because you are thoroughly rushed as tables are sold multiple times per dinner (>3 times). In and out in 90 minutes, including desert. Asked to leave the table and head to the bar while after dinner cocktails were still full (because of following booking). When the bar was filled up asked to drink the cocktail standing, without no apology whatsoever. We left after that. Pretty agggresive behaviour considering we spent >150 GBP per person. What not come again due to that experience, makes you feel ripped off.

title: Something gone wrong there..
comment: Been there several times and yesterday was the last one. We were 2 couples and ordered 4 dishes, we got one dish at a time within 5 minutes between every time and after that ny dish was delayed for 40 minutes ( just a samba roll..) so everybody finished eating and I haven't started... really dissapointing from that type of restaurant.

title: Exceptional Sushi, Great views of London and tasty cocktails
comment: We had the best lunch here, literally faultless food, love the fusion between Japanese and South American cuisine. It is very trendy and I think is aiming at pulling in a young cool clientele, but if you love sushi this is a must visit location! We had a really fun time here, can't recommend highly enough!

title: Client Entertainment
comment: We booked lunch here for client entertainment. We had the set menu. We all had such an amazing time. Good food, great cocktails and lovely wine. The sushi is just absolutely delicious. I’m definitely going back again.

title: Beautiful place overviewing London
comment: The location is absolutely beautiful, we had a lovely view from the 40th floor. It has great decor inside and outside as well. The El Topo sushi was my favourite, definitely recommendable. A bit on the pricy side, but Sushi Samba is worth the visit!

title: Just a tourist attraction!
comment: The views are stunning and the staff is very attentive, but that's about it. Two of us on a Sunday brunch asked for 2 of the £48 set menu and were disappointed with the food. Food was displayed beautifully but lacked flavor and for the price we paid we expected way more. Would come back for a casual drink, but not to have a meal. We ended up spending nearly £170 for 2 and realized that we could have done better someplace else and for less money.

title: Great view, food and price!
comment: The place is great, with an amazing view of all London. the food is quite particular, but very good. That being said, you will be remembered of the view and of the quality of the food when the bill comes. If you are willing to spend a lot of money, this place is worth it.

title: Great for cocktails
comment: Saturday night cocktails with a definite buzz - the place is busy, it's just fabulous. The drinks are great, will try the food next time. It's expensive, but you get what you pay for and that view is stunning !

title: Spectacular views
comment: See London in a total different light. The food is a mix of sushi and Peruvian delicacies.  We had a great time and will certainly visit again.

title: Great view, average quality, overpriced
comment: We visited this restaurant, which is located on the 38th floor, while on a business trip. The view is stunning as you basically overlook all of London. We ordered sushi and some fusion sushi, which we all considered about average. There is a lot of staff constantly around you but it is sometimes hard to catch their attention. The food was definitely overpriced. If you really want to enjoy great sushi, you might want to consider other places. If it is for the view, it is a great choice.

title: One of my favourite restaurants in London - gorgeous food, gorgeous view!
comment: Everything about this restaurant is smooth and classy, from the ride up to the 38th floor, the service from when you are greeted to your exit, and the sheer quality of the food on offer. it is quite expensive, but it is completely worth it for the food they are providing and the incredible venue you get to enjoy it in. Have been dozens of times and will no doubt be returning dozens more times.

title: A Totally Wonderful Experience
comment: My daughter and I had a 11.45 reservation for lunch as a pre Christmas treat and we were absolutely enchanted by the experience. We were greeted very efficiently and given a window seat overlooking the London skyline in this amazing restaurant. The decor is very contemporary and it has an excellent ambiance. We chose the suggested lunchtime menu with sparkling water and cocktails, a passion fruit alcoholic one for my daughter and a coconut and lychee non alcoholic one for me. Both were tip top. Everyone of the dishes on this menus was carefully prepared and very tasty. Plantain chips, Yellowtail Taquitos, Waycyu Gyoza and much more, ending with chocolate banana cake and jasmine tea. Thoroughly scrumptious. Service was very attentive. Thoroughly recommended.

title: First time for sushi
comment: First time I tried Sushi and it’s actually not that bad. I mean I didn’t try it raw but more cooked. This place has a lovely setting which is located quite high up in the building, you’re actually situated higher than London’s gherkin. There’s an amazing view of London from up here and a lovely roof garden.  If you’re going to ask me about what I ate, I couldn’t tell you but I do remember the squid was really nice. Please see pics. The only draw back is the tables were to close together.  I would go again and next time I’ll try the raw selection.

title: Amazing views & Delicious food!
comment: Visited SushiSamba for a work lunch. The service is excellent and a relaxing atmosphere to enjoy one of the best Sushi in the city and have a conversation.

title: A quality place
comment: Sushi samba is amazing, can't really fault it, we had a great experience here, top food, great views, nice atmosphere, the staff were polite and welcoming. Loved the sohomare Sake. Highly reccommend the shrimp tempura, amazing. Would definitely go back.

title: Great View and Good Sushi and Drinks
comment: The Elevators take you up to an amazing view, as long as the sky is not too grey, which is often the case in London unfortunately, so go on a clear day. Good variety and quality of food, sushi and Brazilian style dishes. Good drinks and atmosphere to stay after lunch or dinner. A bit off the track as it’s in the City so a bit far if you are in the center.

title: Best view of London
comment: Better than the London Eye for city views, plus fantastic sushi. The views from the 39th floor are amazing. The food was fun and delicious with excellent service. We really enjoyed the multiple bars, with great specialty drinks, before and after dinner giving us the feeling of having gone to a night club. An absolute must visit.

title: Views!
comment: Ahh! When we were planning our trip, this restaurant was probably the first thing on our list. Sushi Samba not only has a better view than the London Eye but the food and ambience is top notch. They recommend reservations but we just swung by as our trip was pretty jam packed and they served us so well with minimal waiting. Usually I find it difficult eating out since I’m a vegetarian, but here they had a bunch of choices for me! And to top it off the matcha ice cream at the end was AMAZING. My boyfriend had never tried it before and now he’s hooked! He looks for it every time we visit a Japanese restaurant.  Sushi samba.. hold tight—we’ll be back!

title: Factory
comment: People who say this is great we don't understand... ok the view is nice but thats it. You feel you have to eat in 30minutes, food is ready very fast and the table is loaded with orders... we went at 21.30 and ended leaving at 22.20! The food is expensive but thats London, if u want sushi/sashimi then please take another place!

title: Good food, Great atmosphere
comment: Had a lovely afternoon on the 38th floor, overlooking the city of London. the atmosphere is good and the food was tasty as well. Great service from the staff and the prices are reasonable for the whole experience,

title: Lovely although not amazing
comment: Birthday/anniversary celebration with friends and teenage kids who are sushi fans. Table didn’t have a view which was a shame. Food good. Felt busy and maybe not as much attention to service as we’d hoped for. Took quite a long time to get drinks served which was disappointing. Given the cost, expected it to be more stand out.

title: such a dream
comment: this restaurant is just wooooooooow! love it, very good people working in there, smily and very happy staff! will come back

title: Birthday present
comment: Great view, great food!!! Love it! Perfect for special occasions. View starts from elevator, bar with terrace and lovely restaurant.

title: Views!
comment: I attended a part here - a great spot for hosting a party of 100 people or so - everything was well organised. Amazing views of London! Worth a visit!

title: What a surprise
comment: Amazing food combined with ambience, athmospher.As you enter the place you are welcomed by a magnificent setting and a view to cry for.Despite the high price of the food and the not so attentive waiters´ service except the last one that was portuguese, I had a pleasant dining experience with food of the most exquisite flavours.

title: They called to cancel a reservation on the day
comment: I have heard of total arrogance in restaurants but this one takes the biscuit. Made a lunch reservation for Dec 10 on Oct 19. On Dec 10 in the morning I received a call saying they are over booked.  Completely unprofessional. Had been there several times before. Never going again

title: Food and view to a kill!
comment: Visited Sushi Samba with friends to celebrate a 40th birthday. We had a few minutes wait for a lift, which then zips you up to the restaurant in double quick times. Having not been before I wasn’t exactly sure what to expect, however it didn’t disappoint. Even at 7pm it’s buzzing and busy, the restaurant has a great vibe and fantastic views over London. Loved all the ceiling lighting too. The food was amazing, our waiter wasn’t overly helpful in terms of advising, but we just went with what we thought and it was all delicious.  The food comes pretty quickly once ordered, so we ordered a couple of dishes at a time, enjoyed those and then ordered more. The tempura sea bass, taquitos, California maki, lamb chop and rib eye dishes were all excellent. Amazing flavours. I would go back in a heartbeat - more of a special occasion venue rather than an average meal for me!

title: Bar with a view
comment: We went just for drinks. Sat at the bar overlooking the Gherkin with a couple of glasses of wine. Michael our waiter was very friendly and attentive. Speedy lift up to the top we had no booking but were allowed in as only drinking and we were there late afternoon. Go just for the view and ambience if nothing else.

title: Impressive and expensive
comment: A friend had the idea that this would be a special place to come. It sure is fancy, with views and an eclectic menu. The waiters can't pronounce the names of the Brazilian food (what's a mokeka?!) and the sommelier sold us overpriced wine, but admittedly we heartily enjoyed both too.

title: Great experience
comment: Took my wife to Sushisamba on a weekday - after a 6 weeks wait. You really need to plan way ahead to get a table at this place. The views are amazing and the food is really good. I recommend the prawn tempura which was juicy and delicious. We also enjoyed their cocktails. Only let down is that it took quite some waiting time to put our order to the waitress. Otherwise a great opportunity to pamper your partner.

title: A pretty good experience
comment: I have never been to Sushisamba only because you have to book well in advance for a table. But finally I booked and managed to get a table for an early dinner.  Well surprisingly the service was very good and attentive. The staff were accommodating and gave us an amazing table with a gorgeous view of bright lights of City of London. The food was good the tacos were delicious and I wanted more. The salmon ceviche was good but the yellowtail dish was outstanding as well as the tiger maki.  I did not taste any of the meat fishes because they were not halal sadly.  Good to go at least once although I m tempted to again if trying to obtain a table was not difficult!!

title: This is a place to enjoy view and drinks
comment: 34th floor in the middle of city! Whether you eat bread and onion with water or sushi with some fantastic cocktails, the view, terrace and atmosphere would do the job! Difficult to get disappointed at this place! Drinks are not much expensive than an ordinary pub! Booking is must usually if you are 5+ or so people.  Try a cocktail even if you are a solid beer drinker:)  Enjoy it!

title: Great experience!
comment: My friends surprised me for my birthday and we all had an amazing experience. We tried as much as we could from the menu and it's honestly hard to go wrong with anything. Our waiter (a Hungarian gentleman) made our experience truly amazing with his suggestions, professionalism, and kindness. We'll definitely come back!

title: Good food if you’re willing to pay
comment: Love coming here for a drink and a bit of sushi with a view. Lines can be very long over the weekends so if you’re considering booking it for a special occasion, booking in advance is highly recommended.  During week days and off-peak times you can usually find a table without a booking so if you have the flexibility, it’s worth popping in mid-afternoon.  Cocktails are ok, but they do have an amazing selection of sake. Probably the best in London.

title: Sushi with a view
comment: Once you negotiate the unfriendly and ineffective security on the ground floor, the lift speeds upwards to some great sushi. It's very expensive but delicious. Staff are helpful and the views over London always interesting. Food is a mix of sushi and South America, with the emphasis on the former.

title: Great views!
comment: The restaurant is super beautiful, great views of London and service was also excellent.  Food wise it could be a little improved. But it was still worth it as I love Japanese food.

title: Sushied Away
comment: Beautiful view of the city and great food. I recommend the wagyu beef that you can cook yourself, beware it is a small portion consideribg the price but the quality is there. Despite the fact i am not a vegetarian I also tried the mushroom dish and it was succulent.

title: Lied by receptionist
comment: Arrived before kitchen closing time but no one was there to receive us. After waiting 10 minutes the receptionist (Alina) arrived and said we were late and the kitchen was now closed. An obvious lie to cover her unprofessionalism Shameful

title: Great views of london
comment: Visited for a special occasion and the location and ambience did not disappoint. The views and the interior is stunning and really needs to be seen to experience. We had 6 small plates to share and while the lamb Robata was sensational, other dishes were fairly standard. Service was okay but not great- we ordered 2 glasses of wine and got 2 of our small plates before drinks even arrived and then I had to ask the waiter to chase them. Also were not provided with any soy and had to call over staff despite all other tables having this available. Definitely great for a special occasion but would try other Japanese restaurants for food before returning.

title: Terrible service
comment: One of the worst dining experiences I've ever encountered. I came here for a surprise birthday dinner. On arrival, the guy at the front desk said we had 1hour and 30mins on the table as we were late to our reservation. Half an hour in and at the middle of eating our mains, the waitress in a very rude manner, interrupted us while we were eating and asked if we wanted to order desserts, rushing us to finish our mains, despite having an hour left on the table. After we finished we asked one of the other waitress if it would be okay to order a cake as a surprise for our friend as we didn't want her to find out. Instead, on return from the toilet, we find the bill had been presented to the birthday girl! I asked our waitress if she received the order I placed with her colleague and she rudely replied 'I asked you earlier if you wanted dessert and you said no!'. We paid the bill and left with 30 minutes to spare on the table as we couldn't tolerate such terrible service any longer. We all expected a top quality dining experience from sushi samba and instead it felt like we were unwelcome diners!

title: Delicious food.
comment: I’m not a Suchi fan but the choice of dishes here didn’t disappoint. The staff were very attentive without being too formal. I was surprised that the place had been open for only 2 weeks. Everything was run very smoothly.  I’d recommend you give it a try. We didn’t have the Kobe Ishiyaki, a bit pricey !! The food we chose was delicious and different.  Recommend California Maki.  I’d been recommended the deconstructed lemon meringue pie- sadly not available.

title: Poor customer treatment
comment: Great food but our meal was ruined due to the fact we were rushed off our table after just over an hour. We were not informed that we only had an allotted amount of time on the table either at the time of booking or on arrival. However, our waitress rushed us off the table as soon as we finished our mains telling us that reception should have informed us we only had one hour and a half as this is their standard policy. When we told her nobody had mentioned this previously she said there was nothing she could do and we had to vacate the table. We were not even given the opportunity to have dessert. We were informed there was a table at the bar we could use to finish our drinks but when we got to the bar all tables were taken leaving us nowhere to sit. This is an outrageous way to be treated especially since we were spending so much money on the meal.

title: Amazing views
comment: Have been before but the views never disappoint. Only went for drinks on this visit so we could relax and enjoy the views.  The lift in itself is an amazing experience ( even if you have a little apprehension it’s certainly worth it )  Staff as always are attentive but discreet.  Thank you again

title: Incredible location
comment: Location is amazing, food is very very nice and cocktails are super. Rooftop is a little bit windy because you are around 40th floor but the place worth the wind. Sushi Samba is so famous that is very often fully booked.

title: What a place for great fusion food!
comment: We ate here on a gourmet weekend. With my wife, I was a walk up on a busy Saturday night. We were directed to the bar for a drink while they waited for a table to come free. We waited about 30 minutes, which I do not feel is excessive for a busy evening on a speculative attendance. Once seated, the server was fantastic, knew the menu inside out and made great recommendations for both food and drinks. All the dishes were absolutely delicious, and the range of Sake was very very complimentary (if not cheap). I can't wait to go back again. Loved this place.

title: Believe the hype
comment: As most of high end restaurants in London, finding a table within a reasonable time for lunch or dinner is a challenge, so book in advance. Raul, our waiter, suggested that we go for the chef special, and we did, which ended up being the best thing we could do. The special was for Raul and the chef to send their favourites. So the only thing we had to worry was to pick the wine. The starters, a couple of lobster and fish "tacos" were great. Then shrimps were brought to the table, gyozas followed and then sushi arrived. Everything was delicious.  Then for dessert had alfajores and mazzamora  A good Argentinian wine and great company made the perfect date night. Thank you amorcito. Loved everything about yesterday  And for all that we ate and drank was not expensive... recommended 100 %

title: Nice cocktails
comment: Nicely decorated, amazing city view and good cocktails. Food is good too you can have sushi by the bar. I usually have my cocktail by the terrace there is a nice heat too. Good for dates!

title: Cool concept
comment: It is a very nice concept!! We really enjoyed it and it is very well priced....variety is great and it is up to the standard one would expect...atmosphere is good and service is good as well...i would go back for sure

title: Worth the hype
comment: Definatly worth the hype, the sushi is one of the best I’ve come across.  Service is amazing, absolutely nothing to fault.

title: Spectacular location and food
comment: We had a fantastic evening and culinary journey at samba sushi. The food was fantastic but at the end we ordered too much. We were three people and the wonderful nice waiter recommend 6 dishes but in hindsight we could have done w 5 as we had two appetizer. The tempura green beans w truffle mayo is a must. As well as the wagyu dumplings , the cod fish and tempura shrimps. We had two maki roles and one would have probably been enough and than the sirloin platter which was too big at the end . But nevertheless there was still room for desert which was wonderful as well. Try their range of funky cocktails . Japanese fusion style food is just amazing .

title: Wow!
comment: Amazing views! Just had drinks no food. Lovely place to gaze out the window and just going up in the lift is an experience in itself! Brilliant.

title: Lovely Lunchtime Treat
comment: Amazing lunch 38 floors above London. Great venue, amazing vibe, super service. Highly recommended!! Thanks to all at SushiSamba!

title: Great Place
comment: All great. Just had to wait for 30 minutes to get the table that was reserved. With the restriction that if you are more than 15 minutes late you may loose the table reservation , we expected that the table will be ready on our arrival.

title: Great location
comment: I visited Sushi Samba last weekend, such nice place and great views...very chilled place, staff were okay. very expensive so make sure you are backed up financially. Visit this place is a great experience.

title: Great place!
comment: Love this place, great ambient and music! Have been a few times for drinks and love it. Next time I will go try out the food...

title: Romantic London weekend break
comment: Fabulous location for magical views over London and cosy drinks by fire pit on the terrace. Sushi is amazing......so relaxing.

title: wonderful ambiance and food
comment: on the 39th floor with spectacular views, food and ambience ..our wonderful waitress from lithuania recommended the food for the table ,,she did an amazing job and the meal was perfect .. the south american japanese fusion meal was varied and interesting ..loved the ceviche ..the sommelier was very helpful and we loved the wine she helped us choose..this is a fun and interesting dinning experience

title: Excellent place to hang out with great food
comment: I visited this place as part of the official party, the first thing was the glass elevator, that may scare folks who are scared of heights, but wow the elevator was fast, we were given a private place to accommodate 30 odd folks, and then the fun starts. Since there were mix of people with pure vegan, pure vegetarian, no pork, no beef etc. so there were all sort of choices were there but to our surprise they were able to meet all of our expectations and choices and the meal was a great combination of all the tastes. Food were superb, presentation was awesome and service was great. I am not in lot of Japanese food, but I loved the food.

title: Dissapointed...
comment: Having travelled all over the world and eaten in some super cool places, I was excited to go to SushiSamba... How disappointing. :( The sushi was pleasant, not the best I have ever eaten and my friends and I love sushi! The cocktails were average and nothing to wave a flag about - super, super expensive though! I realise I live in London, but seriously, £8 for a bottle of beer!!! The view in the lift up was cool, but the view from the outside bar was extremely underwhelming. The roof needed cleaning and it was ram packed with snooty office types, all drunk by 630pm... Most classy........ Will I go back? Nope. Will my friends go back? Most likely not. Go somewhere else and have a way better experience - just my opinion...

title: Food with a view
comment: Absolutely fabulous experience, with a range of cocktails, wines and sake... and great sushi with the backdrop of our beautiful city skyline to look at couldn’t have asked for more! The service from the coat check through to all our servers was impeccable... & even though we did get asked to return the table for the next seating, it was well after we had finished dessert and done in an extremely polite manner. After my last skyline dining experience at the Shard I was thoroughly pleased by the service, food, and skyline. The seating was great too. We had a combination of cocktails and red wine - the valpolicella was the cheapest on their wine list but light and fruity! We had a number of sharing platters, but want to give a shout out for the lobster taquitos, lamb chops with miso and lime and the eggplant! Amongst the sushi the Neo Tokyo and the El Topo were a favourite amongst our group... I was too full for dessert but the rest of our group shared the dulce de leche and chocolate and banana cake which were delish! After dinner we enjoyed an after dinner drink at the rooftop bar albeit by the gas heaters and the gorgeous view! Would definitely recommend to anyone who enjoys sushi and looking for dining with a view!

title: Alright food, awful chef. Second visit is my last for sure.
comment: Went to Sushisamba for a family birthday lunch. Booked by phone in advance, but the restaurant did not record the reservation. Got a table anyway. Waiters were very attentive and polite, but the kitchen clearly is not working well. Very long wait times, even though the restaurant was far from full. My 10-year-old sister saw a desert on a table next to us, we asked for the same. Waiters went to the kitchen twice but the chef *refused* to serve it as it is part of the (cheap) set menu while we were ordering from (expensive!) a la carte. Why?? First time i see a restaurant do this, and that is after spending 100 pounds per person. City views are good, food is alright (not exceptional), but that goes without saying for a not-so-cheap London venue. My second time at Sushisamba, and definitely my last one. Come here if you want to spend 100 quid a person and get the chef's ordinary food and awful treatment.

title: Pretentious
comment: The food is good but predictably expensive. Service is efficient but a little surly and patronising. It wasn’t great having to queue outside in freezing November rain behind a red rope while the ‘security’ pick and choose who can come in for just a drink and who can’t and check ID when you have a dinner reservation. Surely they could sort out two queues, one for the bar and one for the restaurant. View from the lift is good but wouldn’t make me come back after they put the bill on our table exactly two hours after we arrived and said our time was up. I appreciate they say on the confirmation email that you only have two hours but surely they could work their tables better to enable customers an extra ten minutes if necessary.  I’ve given this restaurant a second chance but won’t be coming back. Visit once for an experience but there are a lot better London restaurants out there.

title: Food is good, terrific view, staff needs improvement
comment: We went there upon reservation cause we were interested and curious. We initially feared the food would be average and the view would be the only pro. We were mistaken. Food was good, the view is terrific but the service was definitely poor. The staff kept on bringing away our plates without even let us finish eating in tranquility. They kept on asking if we wanted something else and pour water constantly into our glasses. A little bit more manners would be highly appreciated.

title: A Dinner In The Sky
comment: Amazing place to have a drink or even better a dinner , the view from the restaurant is amazing no mention the delicious food and the first class customer service

title: Quite pricey but worth it
comment: The food here is superb, we let the waiter choose the food for us and it did lead to a superb selection of food. But this was quite an expensive route to take. But to be fair we enjoyed every dish and it was definitely worth it. Even ordered extra of some of the choices. Will certainly be back. A definite must visit place if you are in London.

title: Please could you reply to my email of complaint
comment: Hi, we booked a table for 5 on the 12th October to celebrate my daughters 21st. Firstly we were made to wait on the pavement outside for 19 minutes as my 16year old son was not allowed up to the restaurant until our reservation at 7.30pm. At 7.30pm we approached the reception desk who informed us our table was not available and we would have to wait in a busy corridor. For your interest the doorman was polite the receptionist was not. We finally got to sit down at 7.40pm. We were asked if we wanted to order cocktails by 4 different waiters and asked to order our food by three waiters. When we said we needed a few more minutes the response was we need the table back! Had we been allowed to sit down at the appropriate time there may not have been such a panic! My husbands chair was knocked every time a waiter passed by which made it very uncomfortable for him. I feel at near on £400 for five this is not the standard to service I should expect. I would appreciate your comments on the said feedback. (no feedback given ) Shame on you Sushi Samba

title: Booking
comment: The guy taking phone bookings (i.e. the first point of call for customer service for the restaurant) is beyond rude and disrespectful. An absolutely appalling representative for Sushi Samba.

title: So over priced
comment: We took our mum for her birthday. Everything was way too expensive. Drinks was so over priced. The view was amazing the layout of the dining area was lovely. The toilets were too dark and dismal! Food was lovely but not enough and totally overpriced. Very busy with work people too and loud. Staff were all polite and friendly. Although we had to ask about when can we go in and eat! Views were great but there was a lot of building work going on so we saw lots of cranes. Wouldn't go again and probably if honest wouldn't recommend.

title: Dinner on the top
comment: I had dinner with my family, as we were a party of 8 I had to reserve the table almost a month in advance in order to eat not so late. The location is beautiful with an amazing view of London by night. The food was very good, they have a good choice even for not fun of Japanese. We had a selection of different Samba Roll and meat on hot stone. Desserts was something that you cant missed in this place, the looking and taste was amazing. Service was ok but not great but I can understand it as it was really busy. Bill high as the location but understandable.

title: The best!
comment: My husband and I absolutely LOVE Sushi Samba, the ambience, food and staff are amazing. We always go to SS when we celebrate an occasion and it is just spectacular every single time. A huge thank you to everybody at SS for making our visits wonderful. Love!

title: Great view okay food
comment: Some of the best views of london. The restaurant has a great vibe. But the sushi was underwhelming. Bit disappointed.

title: Very nice bar
comment: Been to this bar twice and it didn’t disappoint both times, cocktails selection is very good; and oh, the view from the 39th floor is not shabby either.

title: Stunning views over London
comment: I was there for a business event on a warm October evening, so we could enjoy the excellent drink and nibbles, with great views over the City. It has been a while since I dined there, but I had such a good time that I felt that I must remedy that quite soon.

title: Venue to celebrate anything and everything.
comment: My husband and I always find an excuse to go to Sushi Samba. My hen do, job promotion celebrations, date night and most recently our first wedding anniversary . Last night we celebrated a whole year of being married and there are many reasons we keep going back, the atmosphere feels special and friendly and despite the price tag it doesn’t feel arrogant. The service is always 10/10. The staff know everything about their food and drinks menu but not over the top. And of course the food, anyone who goes must have the Shrimp Tempura. We always get two portions in the end but always pretend that we should limit it to one. We have been going here for years and it tastes the same every time we go.  Everyone should go to Sushi Samba at least once.. we have been to different ones all over the world but London is our favourite.

title: Amazing sushi food!
comment: I love sushi and here you can eat fresh salmon and tuna. Was great decoration and friendly staff. Se Will back for sure!!!

title: It's a "why not" while in London
comment: Came here after seen some good reviews, made a booking from the website and it was pretty straight forward. On the day we arrived at the venue we was told that our booking was cancelled as I didn't confirm the booking email although I have made the deposit and so forth, so I checked my emails and it was sent a day before on a Saturday while we were on our summer holiday. A little annoying but they still let us have a table which was helpful. So make sure if you book check your emails days before and confirm your reservation. Before I go into the food, I would like to just say the service was impeccable, thank you the South American Waiter of ours, I am sorry I can't remember your name. The food was hit or just ok, we live in Asia and have lots of Japanese and South American influenced food here so I guess we are usually spoilt. The view is definatly great, and you do feel like you are in somewhere special. Unfortunately, our booking was in the day time as the evenings are all fully booked, we didn't get to experience the evening vibes, however I would say it would be pretty cool. Go if you would like to have nice views and decent food, if you are new to Peruvian/ Brazilian and Japanese cuisine and you would like a little taster along with cool venue this is the right place.

title: Amazing experience
comment: I ate here yesterday which was a Thursday afternoon. The food was incredible and delicious. The service was first class. The views are sensational across the city of London. The atmosphere is very cool. There was free Wifi. The food was mainly Asian and sushi in particular, however there were other options such as pork chops and vegetarian dishes. Overall I would highly recommend this place to other diners.

title: The SushiSamba Experience
comment: I really don't know how someone can rate this place less than 5 stars. The experience is wow, food is great and drinks the same. The price is absolutely aligned with the above. And let's face it, if you want to eat at Sushi Samba, price hasn't to be a problem

title: London scene
comment: SushiSamba is a great night out. It caters if you are just wanting a 5* dinner with drinks, or if you are looking to view London from with a few cocktails and music from a height. I have come here a lot and always don’t want to leave, only my bank account does. Great vibes all the time.

title: SUSHISAMBA in London
comment: It was super nice and cool to have the amazing view over London and drive with the speed elevator up to the 40th floor and get Into the fancy Bar/Restaurant! The food and the drinks were awesome If i am back again in London would do it again!

title: Amazing.
comment: Amazing dinner and view from the roofs. Very nice. Service was good and food as well. Definitely we come back.

title: Breathtaking!
comment: Absolutely delicious fresh food- well presented and a range of excellent wine choices. Staff are attentive and welcoming and the restaurant decor is stunning. The most remarkable views of London (see photos). Would certainly recommend and visit again. Not the cheapest but you pay for quality. p.s. Book in advance as timings were limited.

title: Great views and food ruined by an unnecessary incident
comment: I wanted to surprise my girlfriend with a nice meal with amazing views of London as we were there for a weekend and decided on Sushisamba. The lift was a good experience with a great view of St Paul's cathedral and London. We arrived early for drinks and I enquired to see if our table was ready earlier, unfortunately it wasn't so we explored the outdoor bar and purchased some drinks. After we purchased drinks we decided to sit indoors on some available sofa seats opposite the bar, as we sat for a maximum of 20 seconds an obnoxious arrogant waitress approached us aggressively and indicated we had to move from the area. Unknown to me the seats were reserved and I asked her if our table was now ready, she only replied with "you have to move now" 3 times and then implied that i have to ask someone else if my table was ready. This made me feel like we weren't good enough to be there and despite the area being reserved and her doing her job, i felt she could have explained this in a more respectful way, after all our money is a good as anyone else! Neither of us are big fans of seafood as we are both vegetarian however I was impressed as we were provided with a separate vegetarian/vegan menu which had plenty of choice. The food itself was tasty with a fusion of flavours and a tapas style menu. The service whilst we were seated was fantastic and our table waitress was very attentive and explained the menu well. The prices were reasonable for a up market London restaurant with good views and a nice ambience, unfortunately the terrace was close and this is dependant on weather conditions, however the outside bar was open with sofas and blankets to relax with a good atmosphere. My only regret is not getting the name of the waitress who was rude so I could make a formal complaint, apart from that it was a good experience.

title: Nice location, inconsistent food
comment: Sushi samba was one of my favourite restaurants in London for late diners and amazing views. My last visit was a bit of disappointment as the quality has declined and food is inconsistent.

title: Disappointed
comment: Came here with my niece we were really looking forward to a nice evening something different rang said don't need to book for food if only 2 people big mistake! Recommend that you do we went in fabulous views had cocktails we said do they know we are waiting for food nobody had explained how it works there! Anyhow we went done to restaurant she said half HR 2hrs later we still hadn't eaten spent £100 in cocktails easy to do there we left no food they said if we wait another 30mins I was fed up with the lies! Fab views fab cocktails staff disappointing needs someone to organise a bit better!!!!

title: Impressive
comment: Amazing view, great cocktails and atmosphere. Service was very helpful! We loved the elevator. Totally recommend it!

title: ... Average!
