comment: My husband and I went for dinner... And it was... fine! Neither of us were hugely hungry and shared 4 small plates. One wasn't great (salmon seviche - super gloopy and cloying flavour), 2 were OK - california crab maki and salmon sashimi (a bit stingy on the amount...) and one was yummy - tiger maki. Beautifully presented. We had 2 drinks each and were there for about an hour and a half. The views are spectacular and the decour is beautiful. I think it's probably great for city workers looking for a quick meal if they have lots of money to drop; however, defo not worth the £120 or so to me. There are also a bewildering number of staff - I think we must have had at least 6 waiters? It would have been fine if we didn't keep being asked the same questions, (e.g. whether we wanted a drink when we'd already ordered one). Little bit chaotic - but the number of staff explains the 13.5% service charge I guess?! The staff also seemed quite disappointed when we decide not to have edamame, another drink, dessert, etc... We even were told as we were paid our bill that next time we really should have dessert. It just felt like a little bit of pushy upselling. Nothing worth complaining about, I think it's just the place is. Just a bit average and not quite living up to the hype. Stunning, stunning views though and the elevator is amazing!

title: Teenage Birthday
comment: Very expensive but great for a special occasion. We arrived at 18:00 and left at 20:00. By the time we left we could barely hear ourselves speak. The food was an unusual fusion of Japanese, Brazilian and Portuguese. Everything was tasty. Tempura fish was excellent and the nigiri some of the best I’ve had. Let down by a poor experience with the front of house and the noise in the restaurant.

title: Overpriced and uncomfortable
comment: We went there for a cocktail for my birthday, the service was snobby.  The serving staff didn't come and take our order, so we went to the bar to order - they then charged us table service so 2 cocktails were over £32. The outside bar was too busy so we sat inside and it was so hot it made my partner and I feel really unwell so we left after one drink.

title: Good, but it should be!
comment: Went to sushi samba on Friday night after work for dinner and drinks. Greeting was prompt and fine, waiter incredibly helpful. Food fantastic. Drinks OK. After dinner the staff reserved us a table at the bar which was great. We had a great evening and food was fantastic, it is incredibly expensive so i would expect nothing less to be honest. It is a lot smaller than i expected, very loud, and very busy. So i wouldnt call it a fine dining experience, but you do pay a fine dining price. Didnt really get to make the most of the views as we did not have a table by the window. Ive been, and i enjoyed it. But i would go else where for the price.

title: Hip, pricey, quality, view
comment: Had a non sushi eater with us and she truly enjoyed trying. Yellowtail tacos were great, toro very fresh. Service was fine, view outstanding on a sunny London day after a rain.

title: A little underwhelmed
comment: I had some high expectations from sushi samba and apart from the view I can say that it was not all that. The furniture in the bar area were old and rickety to a point of almost dangerous as the stools were not stable. The cocktail they suggested to be their version of a porn star martini was more like a lychee martini. The food was bland and the prices for what you get were outrageous.

title: Invited back but still problematic service
comment: I visited SushiSamba in July 2018 as a party of 4. Unfortunately there were a couple of issues with the service that the restaurant later contacted me and graciously offered my party of 4 a complimentary round of "bubbles and snacks" on my next visit. I was hosting a business client and accepted their offer - but for only 2 guests. The restaurant confirmed the arrangement would be noted to staff to ensure I wouldn’t have to explain myself to anyone in front of my client. We arrived on time but no staff were aware of the arrangement. We sat at a table for 2 with a fantastic view. I whispered in the ear of our waiter regarding the offer. He knew nothing about it. After much investigation and waiting we received 2 glasses of Prosecco. My client is Italian and I knew that in such a fine ambiance I would need to order champagne for which I was charged. The only ‘snacks’ we received was 1 (one) small appetiser on a small plate between the two of us. It was an embarrassment and a shambles as no further drink or snacks was offered not even water. To save face in front of my client I ordered food and drink for which I was charged almost £150. Even though I was offered complimentary “bubbles and snacks” in writing for a party of 4....SushiSamba couldn't deliver on their promisory offer - not even for a party of two.

title: Totally shameful. An embarrassment.
comment: I used to love this place. I would come here for a first date or drinks with the girls but this place has seriously gone downhill.Came here for a drink after work with a friend and was denied entry. Was “greeted” at the door by the bouncer, not with a greeting but with a “how much have you had?”. To which our answer was one glass of wine with dinner (ok it was a glass and a half as we had shared a bottle). He then said we weren’t allowed to come in and told us to leave. He was so rude I almost cried. I have never been treated so bluntly and rudely as that at a club entrance before. My advice is don’t try to go there unless all you want is a cup of tea with a view and some bad manners from staff to go with it.

title: AVOID!!!!!
comment: Oh dear!! This place promises so much and delivers so little! They totally rely on the location and treat their clientele with contempt and disrespect.  I’m still so embarrassed for last night’s dining experience to the point that I won’t even comment on the food.  The entire staff couldn’t care less and never make any attempt to either engage or enhance the experience. Lackadaisical doesn’t come close... Our party asked questions about the menu, ingredients, timings and preparation and were met with unclear answers that gave us no reassurance and more often than not, confused our choices. Talk about the blind leading the blind... After blindly (no pun intended) making some food choices we were dismayed and bewildered when our first dish appeared 3 mins later, a minute after our drinks arrived - naturally we questioned this but again our USELESS WAITER nonchalantly waved our gesticulations away. He’d also ignored numerous requests to separate dishes, genres and timings etc.  The compulsory 13.5% service charge is a disgrace and has diluted an already poor performing staff. They couldn’t care less and have no idea how a high-end restaurant should be run. We (well, not me) challenged the management in the hope they’d maybe address our issues and do something but their attitude was so lacklustre we quickly realised there was no hope.  Such a shame.

title: Come for the fantastic view and drinks
comment: I've been to Sushisamba several times and loved it. The view and ambience are fantastic, and I've had great service every time. To be honest the food was just so-so, and very pricey but for a special occasion it would be worth it.

title: Over priced crap
comment: Do not go here, overpriced in the extreme, so I take my kids and their partners, 8 of us, bill £800 for the equivalent amount of good each of maybe a cheese burger from Mc’ds, outrageous. Go to Roka instead, cheaper, and you leave having been fed, eating all over london, this is the first place in 15 years i would not go back to, wild horses could not drag me back CRAP

title: Stunning views
comment: I was quite hesitant after reading some of the reviews. We found the staff to be friendly and not invasive. Service was great and fast. The waiter even gave us some advice on quantities of food. You do have to be willing to try new foods to come here, the menu isn’t very self explanatory but this makes it more exciting. The views were stunning and the food was great. Would definitely recommend!

title: Appalling Door Staff & Security
comment: We’d traveling from the midlands to London for my birthday so we could celebrate over a few cocktails and a good view, smartly dressed of course. We’d arrived at the venue on the 29th September around 22:00 to be welcomed by the rudest, and quite frankly dumbest door staff I’d come across. The two ladies ahead of us had just wiggled their way through the door staff using the same ID, even though the door men took a ‘good look’ at their photographic ID, but were still clearly oblivious. I stepped forward, they looked me up and down along with a well-built (rugby player) friend behind me and said we weren’t coming in.  Of course we asked ‘why?’ to which they responded, ‘I think you’ve had too much to drink’ just to clarify we’d had 1 G&T before we got there. A colleague of his, (another waste of space) then stepped directly in front of me, which wasn’t the most professional thing to do to try and intimidate us. I’d asked how they’d come to that conclusion considering what had just happened in front of us with the ID, after a quick blank look at one another, they then had nothing to say.  The staff at this venue are unbelievably rude, and it was such a disappointment. They’re clearly power obsessed and by the looks of things, think it’s their responsibility to let who they like the look of in which also seemed to be mainly females.  I don’t usually write reviews but this got to me due to the fact the door staff think they are better than the customers walking through the door. Which is absurd, as we’re the one’s going in to spend our money, they’re just standing there trying to earn some.  Will not be returning and would not recommend this place to a friend.

title: Amazing Decor
comment: This place is truly wonderful, from start to finish amazing. The lift up is spectacular, with amazing views of London. The price is expensive but this is central London so it is expected. I would say go here for a meal, as you get the most for the views. Just for a drink you are limited to views but still nice. Also friendly staff would go again!!

title: London
comment: Great venue for events and parties for sure. Not only the views from the terrace but fenomenal service just as well. Very thankful to Sharon to provide very pleasant and friendly experience to us.

title: great view, good coktails, average food, awful stuff
comment: Yes, the view is great and everyone goes here for this.  The cocktails are good or actually great as well. A lot of research goes into them and they're very, very nice. I would recommend them. The food itself instead is average, at this price especially, can't be more than average. The main problem are the servers. I was approached by this Italian server ( a dark hair, short, Italian girl) that came to us with the bill for both the food and the drinks we've ordered, long before the food was served. I said that I would have rather paid after the food and the drinks were to be served. I'm Italian and I was there with some other Italian friends. She was clearly Italian as well, but said that because of my nationality, I wouldn't know that the custom, in England, is to pay before the food, and in general when the server wants to, for this reason I could have either paid now or open a tap at the counter. She then went on asking me, how long have I lived in England without knowing this. This whole event was completely surreal, It was embarrassing for me in front of my friends and for her, clearly not used to deal with customers In the end, unfortunately I would not recommend this place to anybody. The view is nice, but the risk of having a bad time with the servers seem just too big.

title: Service Terrible and rude
comment: The views are fantastic. The drinks are well made. The ride in the lift is awesome and memorable.  The service at the outside bar? Truly horrible. If the manager reads these reviews, please take action and retrain the two ladies that were working the seating areas last night. The batsmen are also unsmiling and miserable. Where do we start? The staff taking orders are borderline hostile. Fair enough, maybe they’d all had a bad day. It took 15 minutes to get the eye of the bar staff even though they didn’t seem especially busy.  They messed up our order twice on the same cocktail and seemed angry / put out that we dared to question them - now, we are perfectly nice and reasonable people and everyone makes mistakes - but we didn’t expect to see the extra (incorrect) drinks added to the bill. Upon being asked to correct this, the look we got was akin to the look of someone who’s trodden in dog mess.  One lady was busy moving chairs around for no apparent reason other than to look busy. She repeatedly ignored our polite request to buy (another) £50 round of drinks so she could focus on the essential task of moving a chair a few feet and shuffle the VIP rope a few inches.  We weren’t the only ones that found the staff’s attitude bizarre. If you work with the public, you best enjoy it or act like you do.  We’ve been many times and one of our party was considering hosting his Xmas party here for hundreds of his staff. You blew it.

title: Birthday celebration! 5*
comment: Heard great things about this place so we booked it up for my mums birthday celebration. We had a table booked at 6pm, not mega busy at this time but probably half full.  Located very close to Liverpool St Station, so nice and easy to get to, the building is huge and you can’t miss the big SushiSamba sign on the outside. The entrance is the same as to Duck and Waffle.  You head up 38 floors, at speed on the all glass elevator and it’s a great view of London! Worth taking a photo :)  The restaurant itself is very nice with lots of warm lighting but colourful and elegant furniture, fairy lights on the trees in the outdoor bar area, views of London on all sides of the glass walls, it’s all very picturesque.  Started with some cocktails, espresso martinis and fruity cocktails ordered & went down a real treat! The beer selection was limited, but expected. They had a vast selection of wine and saki to choose if that’s more your thing however.  Now down to the food, I’m a sushi fan, and wow, this place didn’t disappoint! Seriously fresh ingredients, including freshly grated wasabi at the table (at an extra £4 supplement), I highly recommend trying the fresh stuff! It’s a lot more subtle than the normal wasabi and very flavoursome! The standard wasabi was also good however!  We ordered a mix of everything on the menu, obviously a variety of sushi, sashimi, nigiri, a large plate of mushrooms with a steamed egg all in a sauce which was immense (if your looking to order something a little different and your not sure what to get, go for this!), some gyozas, buns and vegetables along with tempura dishes, we also tried the Kobe beef sashimi, more intrigued more than anything else - but yes, it was melt in the mouth and full of flavour! I would also recommend trying if your visiting!  In the end we ordered the equivalent of probably 2 dishes each, and this was enough with the mix of large sushi platers and large mushroom dish.  Some more cocktails on order and then we went for dessert, everyone loved theirs, however I’m not a dessert fan, but I ventured away from my normal order of ‘double shot of espresso please’ and went for the fruit selection, the exotic fruit which contained dragon fruit & lychees come out in a martini glass accompanied with a cocktail shaker which contained watermelon crushed ice and a shot of citrus on the side! The idea being you mix the citrus in with the cocktail mixer containing the melon and eat / drink combined! Was a nice, fun and very refreshing way to end the meal. Overall a fantastic venue, great service, an excellent experience, with great views over London and of course, very good food & drink.  I would return for sure! A real treat. :-)

title: A massive Disappointment
comment: This was not a great meal. I had been put off the idea of peruvian, Brazilian, Japanese fusion for a while, and now I have experienced it, I know why. Service was hap-hazard and food very hit and miss; most of the dishes were gloopy and under whelming. This is certainly not even close t Japanese restaurants such as Roka. The views are wonderful however this does not justify the price tag.

title: Impressive food and fantastic views
comment: Sushisamba never ceases to amaze. It remains one of my favourite city of London restaurants without a doubt owing to it's stunning and mouthwateing delicacies. The gorgeous views of the London skyline might play a part too. Also the service is always impeccable.  On this visit we tried the buns, the rock shrimp, the lamb chops, lobster tacos which were all delicious. We topped off with the most delicious desert ever - the chocolate banana cake. I will let you decide.

title: Horrible receptionist
comment: I booked a month ago for lunch, I arrived at 13:00 and I walked to the reception desk where was an unfriendly young lady with a very high ego who was unable to look me in the eye and told me to sit down until the time of my reservation (girl with dark hair cut to the shoulders ) after 15 min I pass to the restaurant. The food was really good, the views amazing and great decoration.

title: Loved it
comment: Ok, this place isn’t cheap by any means but it’s well worth it. We went as a four for a birthday do. From the superb views of London, the outside terrace and the excellent food, it’s a real treat. I am sorry other reviewers found staff rude - we did not have that experience. Our waitress was very good at discussing the menu and we were efficiently and politely served. The food was superb and we will go again but this time as a couple so we can have a window seat!

title: Rude waiters
comment: We celebrated a birthday here recently. Our meal was delicious and beautifully presented but the service ranged from indifferent to rude, with the exception of two delightful waiters. The restaurant had so many waiters - there appeared to be an upper level of supervising waiters and these were amongst the most rude. Within earshot I heard them discussing guests (well behaved) at another table which obviously made me question what these waiters were saying about us! The first waiter who explained the menu to us was bored out of his brain and showed it. This waiter virtually rolled his eyes with the sommelier when we declined his offer of a second bottle of wine. Another very charming waiter was having a chat with us and was literally pulled away mid-sentence by his superior, without any reference to us, as plates were thrust into his hands for another table ...  For me, a major part of the enjoyment of eating out is the interaction with the staff and the ambience. Sushi samba definitely failed my expectations of the former. The rude waiters would put me off returning there. Meanwhile thank you to Indrid (and a colleague who worked in the outside bar) whose friendliness and super service saved the evening.  The three stars were awarded because the food was delicious ... I’d award one for service.

title: Outstanding
comment: Probably the best Japanese food we have ever had : a cut above everything we experienced before. The decoration is modern and the atmosphere at about 600 feet above the ground extremely refined. Do not forget to confirm your reservation but once this is done and your are on time you will greatly enjoy this place. I must say the staff were nice especially JJ who was extremely patient and helpful. We will be back !

title: Amazing venue, average food & service, poor value
comment: Didn't start well with a rather aggressive bouncer detaining our party on the street to check our dress code was OK. The venue has a dress code of no sportswear which is fine, but we watched many casually dressed people enter whilst we were held outside before entrance was allowed. Not the most auspicious start The good bit- 38 floors up, fab views, and decor is outstanding- fab to walk through a copy of a famous shinto shrine where we've recently been. However after that the positives stop. Food was average with one or two above average dishes. Service haphazard- we had empty water glasses frequently and no-one checked. Finally- price is a rip off for the quality and quantity of food served Many better Japanese food options in London

title: 10 out of 10
comment: Perfect from Start to Finish. The staff was attentive, knowledgeable and courteous without being intrusive. We enjoyed an early dinner from 5pm and even had drinks at the bar afterwards to watch the sunset, The food was very tasty and cooked to perfection.

title: Sushi samba
comment: Great variety of sushi. Very interesting concept. I loved the tuna. Very fresh. Will definitely be back soon

title: Amazing view
comment: We had an amazing meal. Food was delicious and waiter was lovely as well.. the view is amazing.. just for perfect view it’s worth to visit this place.. will defiantly recommend and will defiantly come back

title: Good View, Good Service, Decent Food
comment: Spectacular view of London, especially during dinner time. Service is definitely top notch with very attentive staff. Food is well prepared however it fall short of expectation given the high service level and location. Nothing really special about the food given that there are better choices out in London. It is still worth a visit if you are visiting the first time.

title: night out to remember
comment: Good waiting staff, sexy atmosphere, amazing food, sushi samba is born to be the perfect night out in town.Really fun and we will keep memories of this romantic night out! my partner was also very impressed by the views.

title: Sushi with samba
comment: For starters amazing location you can see whole London from up there  Music is just superb  Food is second to none  Loved every minute spending here

title: Great food but don’t look up!
comment: As expected the food was good but I couldn’t help but feel a bit green around the gills when I looked up and saw the dusty lighting over our head. It’s the little details that matter so much and the thought of all that dead skin above me while eating really creeped me out! Get a ladder and a duster and sort it out!

title: Lovely views
comment: Lovely place!! Spectacular views! I really enjoyed in the lift! Also the place is really good, the staff was ok

title: Poor
comment: I have to say , every time I have been there it has been amazing  However I have not been there for over a year. And I think the place has deteriorated big style since then There is dust on all the bamboo and ducting above / the walls are in need of repairs / cleaning / decoration  The staff are not as attentive as last year It is like this place has been relegated from the premier ship to the championship  Food was ok .. but nothing special  12 months ago every dish blew your mind .. But now it has had its time  It needs to repair its self and readdress what it was ..

title: Overpriced
comment: Nice view and great for entertaining and special occasions, but if you want sushi there are better places in London for cheaper. Couldn't get a seat for 30 mins -- and that was just in the bar area. Service so so. Seems you have to book a month in advance to get a table. Many posers and Eurotrash. And I'm gonna create a new term: Dubaitrash. However, it does stay open late so is good for a late drink.

title: Fabulously yummy
comment: For a special treat this is the place to go. Situated near to the Gherkin and on 38th floor of a very tall building this restaurant has everything and more. The view of London is spectacular and seeing the River Thames meandering through the city makes one realise how important the river is in the daily life of the city. The restaurant is modern and lively with a good atmosphere. The staff attentive and friendly. The food was superb and we ordered a number of dishes which were delivered to our table as soon as they were prepared by the chefs. A nice bottle of wine and food for 3 cost about about £150. We left the restaurant very happy.

title: A culinary delight with incredible views of london
comment: Went for a lunch with two colleagues and enjoyed a delicious meal of fusion food based around sushi dishes but all with some sort of twist. It promises a blend of Japanese and Brazilian (and maybe some Portuguese) influences and delivers something very tasty. Service is excellent and the added bonus is the views across London from the top of the Heron Tower where the restaurant is situated - if you don't like heights then be aware there's a glass elevator ride up to the restaurant which left one of my colleagues slightly on edge!

title: A must in London
comment: I’ve been there twice this week to this beautiful place. Whether you’re dining on the terrace or inside you will always have one of the best views in London. We had the El Topo roll, Samba London, Octopus, Nikkei, Wagyu Gyoza, Lobster crispy Taquitos, and the black cod. All dishes were amazing and delicious. Also, the cocktails were perfect. I will be there soon on my next trip to London.

title: Bar with a view
comment: Went here for a work drink at lunchtime. The views are fab on a good day but it is (unsurprisingly given the location) expensive and starting to feel a little tired decor wise, with the windows needing a clean when we visited. The Tree Bar is the best bit.

title: Great sushi, great venue
comment: Went here with Daughter #1 for lunch. Booking well ahead is essential, but worth it. The food is great, as are the views over london. We had a range of dishes & some green tea - everything lovely. It isn’t cheap, but you get what you pay for eating out in London. Looking at the price of the beef, I was delighted my daughter is a vegetarian.....

title: Belated review!
comment: This is an long overdue review. Amazing time with friends! Expensive but worth every penny as the service is service is second to none!

title: Not worth it
comment: Yes, the location is nice. Service doesn't meet the expectations. Food is so overpriced for what it is. You basically pay the view. Pass.

title: Great views, nice cocktails
comment: Like Duck & Waffle above it, you pay for the views but they are definitely worth it. We just came for a drink but the cocktail menu was extensive and our drinks were nice. There is an outdoor space with firepits and a great atmosphere, as well as an indoor bar and the restaurant. Worth the lift up there alone!

title: What Samba has to do with Sushi?
comment: When I first heard about this place, this was the first question that popped on my mind. Well, I still couldn't find the connection but the result is pretty cool. Excelent view, service and food. Of course the prices are a litlle high, so you better be prepared to spend tom amount of money around here.

title: Top of the world
comment: Visited the place on a Friday evening. It was vow. On the 40th floor one can see the entire London from the top  Bar area was all.packed with people and good music and choice of drinks and snacks Must visit if you are in town.All the best to the team.

title: Tired of 'Destination' Restaurants
comment: Great food (as ever), appalling service at the bar. Slow, lazy, and inaccurate billing. If you want this experience (ie the view + Japanese food), suggest you have a drink in the Duck & Waffle and head down to Moshi Moshi in Liverpool St Station

title: GOOD place
comment: It was a nice place. It has really good views of London. The drinks are awesome. The Gin&Tonic with yuzu was incredible!!

title: Amazing experiance
comment: One of the best places where i have been in London.  Location is amazing, both internally and externally (super terrace bar).  Food is great, had the best combination of sushi ever tried.  Downsides? A bit pricier than expected and long reservation queue.

title: Lunch
comment: Well you get everything you want here: the view and the spectacular food. The pricing is of what you make it. I believe 2 dishes is enough & I’m a big eater. However if there are a few of you and you’re all ordering your own dish’s then they come out at different times so be patient. Drinks service was slow but you have to understand it’s busy. Great place to come and sit outside when the weather is pleasant.

title: Lunch time visit
comment: Food was great, service efficient (mopped up the water I dropped straight away!!) and the setting was vibrant. The only criticism I have is that the cleaners take some time to look up at the ceiling where each pendulum light/eddison bulb was caked with dust. Quite off-putting but after the first tasty dish arrived I ignored it! Could put some others off their food though and nothing that can't be fixed quickly.

title: Great for a night out
comment: Cocktails and live dj are amazing!  Saturday nights are a must and great night out.  We had an amazing time.

title: Gone downhill
comment: My partner and I first went to Sushi Samba in 2013, and it was a wonderful experience. Friendly staff, beautiful food, which was expensive, but in our opinion worth it as it felt like a special experience. We returned recently and were left very disappointed. I just couldn’t believe how little food we got for the price. One sashimi dish was £14 (not including VAT) and arrived as 2 (!) wafer thin slices of fish on a rock salt slab. I also remember ordering sushi maki on our first visit and them arriving as big, whole rolls. This time the maki portions were thin and mean. Including 2 cocktails each we spent in excess of £200 and left hungry. I’m happy to pay for good food and a nice experience, but I cannot say that this was worth what we spent. Staff were ok and views obviously amazing, but Heron Tower doesn’t have the monopoly on dining with a view, and if that were my aim I’d go elsewhere.

title: Balcony views, great cocktail and fantastic food
comment: If you sit outside on the balcony you can get great views over London whilst sipping on incredible cocktails (The Nashi Martini, Sake Spritz and coconut seviche were my faves). The food is as good as you’d expect and worth every penny. Recommendations would be the Taquitos, California Maki and Wagyu Gyoza.

title: Well folks,that is a view
comment: Can’t admit it it’s a wonderful view of the town especially in small hours. Good for night out or to impress a date. Great place always enjoy it!

title: Bar is fantastic with great view!
comment: Definitely the place to go for good drinks and a great view to end the night absolutely loved it and the cocktails and bartenders are very talented

title: Very special but a bit pricey
comment: Great place for cocktails and light bites. Great weekend atmosphere with pleasant terrace for both summer and winter evenings. The restaurant is fantastic, with terrific service from staff but a couple can easily run up a £500+ bill. The quality is there but there are other places around London where you may get better ‘value for money’, in more vibrant locations and that might offer something different. We still go and love it here though!

title: Fun dinner.
comment: We book this place a few weeks in advance and I was so excited to take my friend there as I’ve been here before.  The location it’s amazing and the view you get from this restaurant is breathtaking.  We had a lovely table on the corner, we were very pleased with the service and the food. the highlight of our night was the dessert, which was a super delicious and done beautifully.  The interior of the restaurant itself needs a bit of attention, some of the table edges are also broken... however a new location is coming up and if they keep the food quality and service I can’t see why wouldn’t go back to this great restaurant.

title: Great food great view
comment: Can’t stop coming here to eat lovely food we ate at the sushi bar rather than the restaurant, the service as always was fantastic the food was unbelievable. Also the views from the balcony were great will be dinning again for sure.

title: Great sushi, better view
comment: I have to say that everything in sushisamba is like a theatre. Starting from the lift witch gonna take you to the top of tower. Very good music and excellent views showing that it's serious experience.  Sushi is like a art. From the way how its looks like to the way how its taste like everything is amazing. Have to try a cocktail. Enjoy your time there.

title: Shocking!
comment: If you would like a pre made negroni from a non labelled bottle for £32 - Sushi Samba is a place for you!

title: NOTHING TO WRITE HOME ABOUT
comment: Disappointed by the service and the manner of the staff. Food tasty but not memorable, cocktails ok, view was cool, but I've seen better.  Thought I was the only one who felt this way, but have read a lot of similar reviews on Tripadvisor.  Worth going if just for drinks on the terrace, but otherwise the experience wasn't much.  Found the restaurant hostess extremely rude and condescending. The wait staff were ok, but made us wait over an hour for our tempura as it had "been missed off the order". An hour into the meal, you could feel them getting antsy to turn the table as they then started wiping up around us. No dessert menu offered, as we were being rushed out for the next guests.  Just all in all, felt like a bit of a waste of time and money. Best thing about the place is the lift.

title: Over Priced Under Whelmed
comment: Booked 2 months in advanced for my sons graduation. Arrived on time to be told a private party has been booked and we would have less time to eat. Food was just OK but extremely small portions. Service attentive. The restaurant was busy but when the staff began clearing for the private event in front of us we felt an unwanted nuisance. Not good for a *very expensive* menu that adds a big ‘discretionary service charge’ for a rushed experience. We won’t be returning.

title: Amazing service and food
comment: What can I say? Neringa first of all, provided the best service I’ve had in a long time. She smiled, she had some great recommendations and her knowledge was top notch. The food was absolutely gorgeous, my boyfriend and I finished every plate. My first experience here and it was just perfect. I would defiantly come again and I would love Neringa to be our waitress again as she made the experience even better. Manager is lucky to have her on the team, she should be awarded!

title: Drinks
comment: A bit disappointing that they refuse entry if you are wearing flip flops especially with the summer we have just had.

title: Tasty sushi but service underwhelming
comment: We came here with friends and booked 2 months in advance due to it being near to impossible to reserve a table for a saturday evening. I was therefore very excited about the meal expecting something amazing!  The food was very tasty but overpriced compared to other sushi I have eaten in the past. We were also told by the doorman on the ground floor that as we had arrived at 6.45 for a 7pm table reservation, a private function in the restaurant meant our table was not ready so we had to go to the duck and waffle bar to wait. When we then asked a hostess at 7pm whether our table was ready they said it had always been ready - basically they got us to spend £50 on cocktails in their bar when we could have been at our table.  Then whilst we were eating, a cleaner was walking around the dining room mopping the floor even under our table which was particularly unpleasant. I was very surprised to see this was happening even under the watchful eye of the supposed manager who just seemed to watch the whole dining room for the 2 hours we were there and didn’t do anything. For a restaurant with such a beautiful view and tasty food made by the chefs, the waiting staff let down the experience and chefs with few smiles (until it came to paying the bill when the guy taking the payment was very smiley!). Whilst it was nice to go once, we will not be returning again for these prices and service.

title: Best Roof Top Bar and Restaurant in London
comment: Highest and best views of London City. Great bar and incredible Asian Fusion food. Somehow expensive, but is a must visit.

title: Contrived. Expensive. Glasshouse.
comment: The food is good, not great. It’s not air conditioned so it’s uncomfortably hot at this time of year. The staff are so-so bordering on being super pleased with themselves. Not worth the money.

title: Rip Off
comment: The view is hidden behind a fence. The service was average. The drinks prices are horrific. Would not recommend to anyone

title: Amazing food with a view
comment: I recently entertained some overseas guests in London and chose here for supper. We were very lucky to get an outside table - at level 38 (I think) an experience per se - and the weather was stunning. The service is great, the cocktails and food truly special and my guests very happy. Definitely worth a treat from time to time.

title: Worst food and service EVER !!!
comment: This place should be called into question. We waited over an hour for our food . It was so overpriced I’m ashamed to mention what the bill came to for 6 people . £24 for 2 micro slices of beef is a disgrace. It’s ok if your a banker on expenses but to treat jo public like this I’m appalled . I will be bringing this to the attention of the manger and wanting explanations . It ruined a lovely family reunion. We feel ripped off and upset to be quite honest . Avoid this place like the plague . A take away kebab or Chinese would be so much nicer .......and £600 cheaper ..... shame on them .

title: My favorite place in London
comment: On of my favorite restaurants in London. The food is amazing you could order anything from the menu and end up liking it. First time sushi eaters would love it. Great experience , lovely view and amazind food. The waiters are super nice and fast. We missed the terrace because of bad weather. And for a non drinker they made excellent mocktails.  If you want to book a table do it in advance as it usually fully booked.

title: Great Sushi Restaurant with view
comment: Nice view, proper food, decent service and a nice environment, what else can you was for when going to a restaurant?

title: Dinner @ Sushi Samba
comment: Birthday dinner !! Views were spectacular and the elevator to the top was brilliant. Pre dinner Drinks at the bar were ok but steep at £14 for a cocktail or mixer. Opted to not do the tasting menu as we had a pescatarian with us and the restaurant was unable/ unwilling to swap out the meat dishes.  Meal was ok, however the Sushi was sub par comparable to wasabi or yo sushi etc . The Brazilian portion of the meal was much nicer and the moqueca was delicious.  A lotta been made of the dress code and we made sure to dress accordingly .... however people were seated in ripped jeans tshirts etc. The meal at around £100 each was expensive. Oh yeah, called up prior to see if we could bring a birthday cake and told that would incur a cost of £7.50 per person!!! I have never heard of corkage on Birthday cake!!! Declined .. they did bring the birthday girl a small dessert with a candle, whoopee! I recommend just going to the bar for the views and ambience and getting some bar snack if needed.

title: Ok....not amazing!
comment: This is the second time i've been here and i've got to say that for the cost I would expect more from a restaurant of this level. The crispy taquitos were amazing but everything else was nice but not quite enough to bring me back again! Disappointed i must say....

title: Birthday girl
comment: Had the pleasure to go to sushisamba on my birthday. Been craving for this day for a while as I’ve really good feedback of this restaurant and I’m a huge Japanese and South American food fan. Best combo ever! The place itself is amazing, with a beautiful view over London. The staff is super kind, always paying attention and making sure that we are well served, and the food... oh that food was fantastic! The flavours were just incredible and the presentation was spot on! I definitely recommend everyone to go to sushisamba in London. A bit pricy but it worths every single penny! PS > I didn’t find the cocktails that amazing, so order something simple like a beer or juice and get a cocktail somewhere else.

title: Sensational Views but you pay for it
comment: Went for lunch and the setting is fantastic. From the ride up in the glass elevator to being seated with a panoramic view of London, the experience is great. The food was good also but it is very pricey for Sushi and for the portions you get. I enjoyed everything I had but I wasn't blown away by anything either. Worth the visit just to sit and gaze out over London but the wine and food are both pricey.

title: Great food, terrible atmosphere
comment: We spent £300 for two people - is it asking too much to expect a clean bathroom!? Disgusting, I’ve been on construction sites with better loos. In addition, hostess was lacking. Food spectacular, but for the price you expect the full experience. #misocod

title: Perfect lunch date
comment: We went for lunch with friends . Exceptional service and excellent food. Get there early and have a drink on the terrace outside. With stunning panoramic views across the city of London. The set lunch is really good especially if you don’t really know what to choose off the menu. It comes with half a bottle of champagne each and two cocktails so really good value and great mix of flavours and types of food.

title: Worth It!
comment: Been to SushiSamba a few time now and every time I've been there service has been great and food/drinks has been outstanding! I'd definitely recommend this for business meals, couples and if you want a good time with some friends.

title: To do for the exceptional view!
comment: We were there for the aperitif and the dinner but the real protagosnista of the evening was the extraordinary view.The cocktails served were mediocre but the restaurant dishes are as good as table service.Overall it was a pleasant evening!!!

title: Amazing meal and worth the proce
comment: The restaurant is beautiful and sits high above London so you have an unparalleled view of the city. The food is amazing! I highly recommend trying some of the sushi, not focusing most of your attention to the radials aspect of the menu as the sushi is good, but there is better and cheaper sushi to be had. The meat on the menu and the seafood dishes are amazing and so good. Will be coming back the next chance I get! The Moqueca Mista was amazing and I even tried to recreate it at home using the recipe they provided in their website; however, I feel the recipe on the website is not exactly the same as what they offer in restaurant and I can see why when now I want to go back just to have this dish alone!

title: SushiSamba
comment: Wasn’t admitted in because of my shoes. Walked all the way across town to meet friends here for dinner and was turned away. It’s sad and will not spend my money here. Terrible service that leaves a bad look on the city of London.

title: Glittery and Tight
comment: So what is Sushisamba? Well this is a bar and restaurant servibg some very interesting japanese food. The bar which is highly sought after by locals is no doubt busy all week round. If you can make it past the stylish man at the door, he will direct you to floor 38 and on the way you will take in some stunning views of London. The same cannot be said once you get to the top as the rooftop bar is quite small and has very limited seating. The views suffer from the outdoor bar, but the lobby area bar is complimented by slightly better scenes. Staff are friendly enough and as you would expect from a business of this stature. In summary i would recommend having a few drinks here ( if you can find a seat) and moving on....I would classify this restaurant as one with premium prices but not necessarily a premium approach to the food and experience.

title: Absolutely Amazing
comment: First time here but highly recommended by friends. Before arriving in London we had made this reservation. Be warned you have to now book 3-months in advance so I think that speaks for itself on what this restaurant delivers. An interesting and unique blend of Japanese, Peruvian and Brazilian flavours.

title: london-styled sushi
comment: creative sushi selection! really good combinations! probably the best sushi i ever had. the view is just amazing. you have to book a table otherwise you’ll have no chance. service was really friendly. cannot complain at all! such a great atmosphere and food.

title: Birthday Lunch
comment: As it was only me and my friend we managed to have a seat by the window that overlooked the city, which was so lovely.  Service: Was good, the waitress constantly topped water and we drink a lot of water so I was thankful for that. Perhaps our fault for not directly asking but we were hoping that the waitress would give a little help on what is best from the menu. However, the table next to us managed to get insights on the menu and good suggestions.  Food: The food was really nice, especially the octopus. My friend arranged a surprise cake which was probably the best cake I have ever had! The food is filling also. Atmosphere: The main bit was a little smaller than the pictures made out but I thought it made it feel nice, little bit more intimate. The décor is really nice too.The lift is fun and gives a great view. Though expensive for what the food is, i think its justifiable by the fact that you get to be 38 stories high with good service. I really would go back again and recommend it to friends and family.

title: ‘Casual Elegance’
comment: Came along for some cocktails & was turned away by your snooty bouncer as they were only letting in people with a ‘casual elegance’ dress code. Obviously shorts on a hot summers day aren’t allowed when drinking overpriced cocktails & eating average sushi!  Won’t be back, definitely won’t be recommending to anyone & that’s a couple of hundred quid you lost! Disappointing & just plain rude!

title: Great service, great food, great views
comment: Thank you Sushisamba. Visited for a friend's bachelor party dinner and had a great evening. The staff were extremely friendly and treated our party really well. We had the pleasure of being served by Malou who went above and beyond to ensure that we all knew what we were ordering. The evening was definitely one to remember and we sure will be coming back again. Thank you all.

title: Food was great, service OK
comment: We came for dinner and drinks. It was busy, we were seated right away(group of 7). The drink service was sadly a bit slow. Not sure if they were understaffed for the night, but it was one of those order multiple drinks at one time since you aren't sure when the server will return. That being said the food was out of this world. The presentation was flawless, the flavors spot on. We found it best just to order multiple rolls and share them. The views from the outside bar and the outside deck are amazing. The outside bar also gives fleece blankets out if you are cold. Great time. e

title: Not worth it for the food. Grubby toilets
comment: Yes, the views are great and the decor of the restaurant and bar is really lovely. You can get much better (or the same) standard and style of food at sooooo many other places in London, without paying c£18 for 8 pieces of not-special sushi. I found the service a bit clumsy - with waiters constantly leaning right over me to take things from the table. They were very friendly and kind though. One thing that was unforgivable is the very poor state of the toilets. Grubby drips down the walls and bits of tissue on the cubicle floors. It felt like a grubby nightclub. It's inexcusable when you're charging so much to dine there.

title: Great food and drinks, great service
comment: We visit the Sushi Samba yesterday night, and to be a Sunday evening seemed quite busy to me. We first ordered a drink, that Sake Spritz was amazing by the way, got a table in the bar area but then decided to get a table and get some food. Our waiter gave us menus and offered some more drinks. We then proceed with the order few minutes after, and as we were not sure about what to order (except for the Kobe steak) he made great recommendations and explained us all about the cut of the meats, included the story behind the meat. My partner can't eat fish but all the dishes I've smelled and looked delicious. We start with some veggie sushi and the moved on to the Kobe. Sylvain served it and showed us how to cook it on the well-presented hot stone. It was a superb meat with a perfect matching sauces on the side, even though i believe you don't even need them. We ordered as well the rib-eye picanha chorizo board. Again, it was superb. We followed our server recommendation for the dessert and they were both delicious.  Cocktail were amazing, the place is lovely and view from the terrace is amazing.  It is a bit pricey, but not too much being on top of a tower in the City of London.  Thanks againg Sylvain for looking after us.

title: Perfect dinner
comment: I was here with some friends. We ordered sushi, probably the best i ever had. The restaurant is very beautifull and elegant. There is an amazing view!! The service was excelent!  They are the best!

title: Beware letting waitress select
comment: Four of us went for a business lunch here today. I’ve been several times before and it has been excellent. Each time we have let the waiter or waitress choose dishes for us. However this time waitress chose some dire dishes – an almost inedible carrot shaving salad, a surfeit of deep fried tasteless vegetables and seafood. But the most annoying part was that a couple of dishes were surprisingly expensive – blackened cod was over £40 for example. So a meal for four of us was £350 with one bottle of wine. It also took almost 2 hours to be rolled out by which time 2 of us had had to leave and we missed the maki which was the one dish that I specified we wanted.  I like this place normally but I don’t think I’ll return because I felt that our trust in the waitress was abused by her ordering for us so many poor dishes and one or two unusually expensive ones. I felt she was taking us for a ride.

title: Almost in heaven
comment: One of my favorite place in London despite the price, but it's actually Worth it. Cocktails are delicious and the quality of the food is great too. They're always providing an excellent service.Definitly recommand.

title: Great night out
comment: We arrived and were warmly greeted at the door by Cleo, went through security and up the elevator with a beautiful view of the city. Our table was ready when we arrived and our waiter arrived promptly and was listened intently to my niece with her allergy restrictions. It was very reassuring that he knew the menu well and was able to advise her on what to avoid. Through the meal we could see that they had a great team as our food was brought out by whoever was available when it was ready. I liked that. Also my niece accidentally knocked over her drink after just a couple sips, not only was someone there in an instant to save our clothes from the spill and clean it up, but a minute later someone else showed up with a replacement . The food was delicious, and so were the drinks. We stayed and chilled at their other 2 bars for ours after our meal...great night out to celebrate graduation!

title: Amazing views! Average overpriced food though
comment: Would visit sushisamba again but purely for the views. It was nice but I wouldn't say it was worth the price... I've had better sushi elsewhere for cheaper too. The staff were very attentive though which was good

title: You’re gonna be paying for the rent, solely!
comment: The view was astonishing, one of the best in London. However, when we waited in the queue, the porter was overexcited, and kept checking my girlfriend out until he let us in. When we arrived on the 39th floor we could not find any member of staff to get us to our table. A rude receptionist finally got us to our table, where the servers were, admittedly, extremely polite. This kind of service is unacceptable for an establishment that charges £1/g for its steak. With respect to the food, apart from the tiger maki, nothing was special.

title: Fantastic view, food and service
comment: I was warned that the food was pricey but it was worth it. What more could one ask for- great weather and a great setting looking over London. My friends and I (for my friend’s 40th birthday) managed to get a table on the terrace and to celebrate ( including Englands win as well) we had cocktails. All the dishes we had tasted delicious and the service by Han was very professional. I definitely want to go back.

title: Pricy but totally worth it!
comment: It was a great experience for me! The view was incredible and the food...divine. Brand new flavours, great presentation, etc It's a rather expensive restaurant but it's a really different experience from what you're used to and you're gonna love it!

title: Birthday surprise
comment: This was an amazing birthday surprise!! Being dairy intolerance I wasn't to sure this place would cater for me but was I wrong. That had a vegan menue. The food not only looked look it tasted great. We had told our waiter that i have an intolrerance to dairy and recommends drinks that i can have which disappointigley were 2 of the whole drinks menue but they tasted great. Through out our lunch we were approched my the maitre ď if all was well. We sat outside on the terrace with the view of London, just beautiful veiw.

title: worth the money
comment: it took a bit of effort to book a table. Reducing the number of diners from 5 to 4 cancelled the booking so we had to go through it all again to find a date and time. But the food was great, the wine was lovely and of course there is the view. Nothing disappointed. Strange to have an open fire going on the terrace bar though, considering it was one of the hottest days in London

title: Great meal with great views
comment: Came here for our daughter's birthday and we had a lovely time. The bar is buzzy and fun and then we were shown to our table. Food was really good and the waiter advised us what to have. The views of London are exceptional! We had a great time! The only downside is that the prices are very expensive - but I suppose this is a prime London location!

title: A little overpriced for what it offers
comment: The view does not show best part office city. The restaurant is really really hot during a hot summer day, even waiters complain!  We had sushi, tempura, chicken teriyaki,lamb and moqueca. The lamb is not big but really tasty, Hickman teriyaki also really tender and nicely done. Moqueca was my favourite. I’d say sushi wasn’t best compared to what’s in the market. All in all nice experience but not sure if I’ll come back.

title: Sky high experience at a costly price
comment: I have wanted to eat at sushisamba for a long time as was so pleased to be able to go at last.  My partner and I received good service throughout our meal, the waiters were very attentive and informative throughout.  The food is amazing if you like sushi (obviously), if you are an adventurous foodie this place is for you. If you are a meat and two veg person do not entertain it.  The atmosphere is brilliant, although the seats were very uncomfortable.  The highlight of the whole experience was the views. It really was spectacular and we were allowed to enjoy them for as long as we wanted. After dinner we had drinks at the bar and looked out over London- it was perfect.  The only down-side of the whole thing is that I feel the views and experience were more memorable than the food. Additionally, it is very expensive but that is too be expected.

title: Private event
comment: We had a private event, with a sit down meal for about 40 people, and I would highly recommend. Kat in the events team was fantastic, as were the staff on the night. There was a lot of food, all of which was amazing. It goes without saying that the views are spectacular, and those of us that stayed on for a late drink thought the terrace was beautiful. The next day I heard nothing but positive comments from the attendees.

title: As per Manager’s request, here is our feedback.
comment: Hi, We`ve been advised by Marc Emmanuel (restaurant Manager) to share our feedback as it would be relevant for the team to learn from their mistake. Here we go. Sushi Samba is an amazing place for its venue and menu. We feel quiet privileged passing the door waiting for the elevator, which offered an incredible view over the city of London. Upon arrival to the restaurant, we were rapidly served and informed that our table would be ready as per booking time. (7pm) No problem at all, we were early to enjoy the fantastic cocktail menu and enjoy our time. It was a team night out that we wanted to be special. It definitely became special from there. Our table was ready with a delay of 20min, despite the clear instruction for customer to be on time, dress code etc. However, that`s not a problem we were very understanding. We sat enjoyed the view and panorama, once again incredible. Florian, then arrived introducing himself as our waiter for the night. We explained that it was our first time and we did not know how it worked. We also had three persons with dietary requirement (pregnant and coeliac + dairy allergy). He barely acknowledged that with an ‘OK’ and continue his speech of introduction. All in all, we managed to understand the menu, get the necessary information (because our friend emailed your team prior to our visit to avoid any misunderstanding) and place our order. It was explained that everything more or less comes together as it is a sharing concept, still no worries there. The worries started here. One then two individual dishes turned up. Then a big one with three different kind of rolls on it that we ordered. Then all the other dishes turned up finishing by the ‘Lamb chops’ on two plates (we ordered three portions). Putting them on the table, Florian reassured us that a third plate of lamb chops was coming. We were still missing one order of Ezo rolls thus enquired about it. The plates looked stunning so we took loads of pictures. Pictures we showed to Florian to assure him that we were indeed missing a dish. For such a ‘fancy’ place, the decent customer service would have been for him to refuse and believe us instead of eagerly wanting to see the pictures proving us right. Apparently “the chefs are difficult in the kitchen”, ok fine. After a while, no sign of the third plate of lamb nor the Ezo. So we asked again. Only then Florian mentioned that the three portions have been served to us already split onto the two plates. “I was confused too” he says. Here is a simple question, if your waiter himself was confused by the way dishes were served, how could we, first time customers, know? The two portions were eaten by two people, and were still short of two dishes. The simple thing to do here would have been to apologise and get the last portion made and brought to the table. Instead Florian argued and disappear without a word. A second man, suited, then approached our table asking “is everything ok?” to which we responded “no, but your colleague is sorting it, so no worries”. Should we have known that this man was the Manager offering his help, would have avoided us another load of delay and argument. I could go on and on, but I`m sure we can agree that this email is already too long. It was an important occasion for us and we wanted to have a special time in a special place. The dishes and cocktails received were absolutely fantastic. But the service recovery, atrocious. Florian should have owned up to his mistake and sorted it out. Marc, should have introduced himself has a Manager instead of arguing childishly that we sent him away so he would not help us. His body language is also questionable. Whilst trying to resolve the issue with a member of our party, he was towering over her, using a condescending tone. I don`t think this has ever made anyone feel comfortable and heard. All members of our party work in catering industry and therefore know very well that sometimes mistake happens and we would have never been difficult about it. Insinuating that we are lying, and switching the error onto us is definitely another story. I know I lost it with Florian, and for that I`m very sorry. For such a unique and high standard restaurant like yours, the aforementioned is truly disheartening.

title: Worst service!
comment: We wanted to watch a World Cup game and somebody told us about this place, when we got there the hostess told us there was no available tables at the bar, since we were a party of 12 we understood but when we saw there were several empty tables we asked to be seated even if we were not together and they agreed, we ordered the food and we were told that since we were ordering a lot of food that they give priority to reserved tables, non sense to me but anyway, we asked for ponzu sauce and spicy mayo we were told that they were 1pound each, which was ok for us, we never got the sauces, when we got the check we were charged 6pounds for sauces that never got there, we were a table of 4 and we were paying 300pounds but when we said we never got the sauces they didn’t want to remove them from the check! It is not like 6pounds would make any difference but the least they could do was take them away!  At the end we felt they were doing us a favor by serving us food. I will have only one positive thing to say, the restaurant looks really nice, we were seating at the bar, hopefully the service in the restaurant is better it’s a shame I will never know since I have no intention of coming here again!

title: Perfect dinner date
comment: First time coming here and absolutely loved everything about this place! We came on such a beautifully clear evening and as our reservation was for 9pm we were able to watch the sunset as we ate our meal. The food was fantastic, really tasty and fresh and extremely well-presented. Probably the best sushi I have had in London to date. Definitely recommend!

title: NOT GOOD VALUE........
comment: Went for lunch to celebrate wedding anniversary and was shown nice table by the window....seated immediately as the restaurant was not very busy. Staff were very helpful and polite....service was very good.....music was good. Now the negatives.......do not go expecting great views over London as the restaurant is pointing in the wrong direction.. Food is totally overpriced and small portions. Wine list is extensive but a lot of silly prices....... Forget what they say about the dress code as far as I could see it did not exist.. Tables do appear to be on top of each other and I think if restaurant was fully booked it would not be that comfortable. Can fully recommend the Drift Bar (ground floor...Heron tower round the corner) for a pre dinner drink . Now the big question....would I go again or recommend to friends.....no because it really is not value for money.

title: Stylish/modern/fresh
comment: This is one of my favorite restaurants in London. Sushisamba’s glass-walled express lift hurtles up the outside of Salesforce Tower, taking you 38 storeys above the City in under 30 seconds. Once you're up there, Sushisamba also has a pretty impressive rooftop lounge. Exceptional cocktails and great Japanese food. Service is the weakest point if the place as they aren’t very friendly or professional. Really should improve this!

title: Delicious with great views
comment: I had a great lunch here yesterday, sat outside on the terrace. The food was delicious. Thoroughly enjoyable mix of sushi, sashimi, tempura, black cod, lamb chops and pork skewers and not that expensive. Fabulous

title: Its more the name and view rather than the food.
comment: I've been many times in Sushisamba, frankly speaking if you are there for the food then it is definitely not the place. Food is fresh and good quality but the sushi is very average, ceviche and the salads are nothing special. But if you are there for the ambience and view then enjoy one of the nice places in London.

title: Best sushi ever
comment: We did not book and had to wait for an hour to get a table. We had a few cocktails that was delicious and then had a variety of sushi that was unbelievable. The chef is brilliant and the staff excellent. They have a wide selection of drinks and food on menu. It is very affordable. Book in advance.

title: So disappointing and very rude
comment: Having heard about Sushi Samba and all the hype surrounding it, I was excited to go. As someone who eats out at least 3 times a week and have eaten in many places all over the world, all I can say is that I was disappointed and actually disgusted by the whole experience from start to finish. We were greeted by a very rude and obnoxious door man who clearly thought he was checking us in to a much finer establishment than it actually is. He told my daughter that she couldn’t come in with the shoes that she was wearing (luckily my friend had some she could wear) my daughter’s shoes were beautiful summer sandals (pictures to follow) after this frosty greeting, which put me off instantly as I saw the other diners he was allowing in with terrible dress attire. We then were checked by security, I understand the need for this of course, acting very aggressively and so pretentious the security check was a quick glance in my handbag which was utterly pointless and did not fill me with any reassurance that security is taken seriously. The ride in the elevator was the best bit overlooking the spectacular views of the city. We arrived and spoke to the hostess who said she would find us when the table was ready . We ordered drinks at the bar and my daughter changed back into her original shoes as there were several women in the same style of summer sandal and indeed some wearing flip flops and scruffy trainers. As soon as she did this, the rudest security guard wearing an ear piece and acting like he was in the secret service came over and told her to put the original shoes on. I pointed out the other women wearing similar and worse shoes and he just told me that she had to wear the other shoes. I asked to see the manager immediately. The manager accepted my point and apologised and said she could wear her shoes. This whole episode was completely unnecessary and really annoyed me and obviously tainted my first impressions. The venue is pretty but seriously not worth the hype. We had to search for the hostess to sit us- way after our reservation time which again is sloppy and unprofessional. For quite a pricey restaurant I expect much better service than we got. The food was actually nice, the waiters are atrocious. We had all of our dishes except one sushi plate, which after 45 minutes of waiting asked for it to be cancelled as we weren’t hungry anymore. (How does sushi take 45 mins to come out?) The staff were possibly the rudest and most pretentious people I have ever met. They clearly think this place sushi samba is the place to be! It really isn’t. It is terrible and their attitudes are really disgusting.

title: Amazing First Experience!
comment: I have to say for my first experience it was amazing.  We actually managed to get a table at very short notice (1 week) and even managed to get a window seat with the amazing view.  It was lush watching the sun go down - along with the complimentary glass of champagne.  The food was delish and I would highly recommend this restaurant. The LOBSTER is beautiful. It is a shame that the outside terrace isnt alittle bigger as it can get rather crowded outside.  I shall be returning.

title: What a great place...
comment: It was our first time in Sushisamba and I really adored it! Great food, spectacular view, amazing service! What else could you ask for???

title: Best sushi ever
comment: I would like to share my experience at sushi samba. Was such a great choice. You have the best city view especially in the evening and the whole atmosphere is lovely. The only thing you have to think is to book in advance as is very busy and you might not find a place or you will have to wait ages to get a table.

title: A favourite place!
comment: Been coming here for few years now. Last time it was Friday evening, we didn’t even have a reservation and we get for in drinks without waiting. Interior is amazing, you can walk around, terrace is cool, views are great, music was perfect for our taste, not too loud. And I really enjoy every bits of the food that we’ve ordered. Great place fir a night out!

title: Stop using plastic straws
comment: When I go to a nice restaurant I expect good service, our waiter was just not interested and looked bored and almost like he was doing us a favour by taking our order. No one explained the menu and we had a look around to find out waiter when we wanted to order food and drink. Secondly please stop using plastic straws and swap to biodegradable straws. It amazing when even small restaurants and bars are moving away from using plastic straws you are adding 2 straws to the cocktail you served us, shocking and completely put me off ever coming back to sushi samba.

title: Ewwwwwwww....
comment: Beautiful tower restaurant serving delicious food. But I couldn’t help feeling like it was a setup. The experience from the start was quite disappointing. OK, I get the frisking and metal detector environment at the ground floor. But the CLIENTELE! I’m sorry, it’s been a while since I have seen that much unsightly exposed flesh in one place at one time. The over-the-top security guards everywhere, the loudness and Kardashian-esque drama is overwhelming. It’s hard to be somewhere when the clients clearly do not appreciate what they are eating or where they are. It must be hell for the staff and chefs. It’s like one of those giant pool parties in Vegas, nobody realizes they are waste deep in pee. But hey, it’s a free world.

title: Relaxed evening, delicious dinner
comment: The location offers stunning views over London, contemporary interior design, friendly survive snd yummy dishes.

title: Great experience
comment: Beautiful place with amazing view and good service. Thank you Petro !! ( sorry if I wrote wrong your name). I recommend it!!

title: Amazing food!
comment: I’ve been there for the birthday of my best friend. We had to book a month before! The place is wonderful always full the elevator is incredible for the view! The food was on fire! So tasty and fresh! I love it! The only bad note was the service...we been a bit disappointed, we ordered a bottle of wine and once our glasses been empty we had to wait almost half an hour to get back the bottle cause the bottle wasn’t let in the table after opened. Anyway the food was fantastic!

title: shopping trip
comment: Disappointing really the food was not to bad, but not value for money. The staff made me feel uncomfortable, and we waited a long time for a drink, and a table, when booking I was told it was not nessarserry for lunch time, but I would reserve a table if I ever went again, although I can’t see any reason to go back.

title: Very recommendable and with incredible views of London from 39th floor
comment: When entering you take a glass elevator which will take you 39th floor with nice speed, cool experience! The decoration is nice and elegant. The views of London from the 39th floor are really impressive, even more at night. The service very professional and really attentive. The food also quite good, really oriental food. We went for dinner and they bring different type of small dishes of meat, vegetables and also sushi of course. In the floor 38th the have a bar with music and even a tree :). It is a place that can make your lunch or dinner special. I will come back for sure.

title: Rooftop bar
comment: Visited the bar yesterday Saturday 16th June. Great views of London. Over priced drinks with 12.5% service charge. Staff tried short changing by £10.50, then were rude when I challenged it

title: Lovely drink
comment: Visited last night for a Couple of drinks before a cruise. The atmosphere was lovely and it was quite busy although not packed. The glass roof which you overlook while admiring the view could do with a good clean! Drinks were lovely but pricey  Heaters were very useful early evening as it got a bit chilly. Second time I have visited and would go again

title: High location/High price
comment: Sushisamba is a place where you pay a high price for a view from the 38th floor and a not that spectacular view. We had my son's 30th birthday party there Sunday lunchtime 17th June. The atmosphere was not as good as we imagined it would be and perhaps it is better at night. Service left something to be desired. Food was good. There are a number of these fusion restaurants in New York such as Zuma, China Grill and Buddakan where they seem to do things much better and create a real special atmosphere with such attentive service. A bit disappointed but still the food was good.

title: Real treat for a special occasion!
comment: We visited for an 18th birthday and it was perfect as a real treat. The staff, especially in the restaurant, were really friendly and attentive without being over the top. The cocktails were lovely, and the food amazing. The whole concept of sharing small but fabulously tasty treats was a good social way of eating. The birthday girl was brought a surprise plate for dessert with a macaron and Happy Birthday which was a nice touch. We would thoroughly recommend for a special occasion but with a warning that it is an expensive night out. The view is amazing and the balcony bar really cool, overall we would go for another milestone birthday or anniversary.

title: World Cup Game Broadcasting: Reservation team doesn't know what's going on in the bar
comment: I had a very disappointing experience with Sushisamba London on Sunday May 17th, 2018. I live in London and my friends with kids came over from Germany and Middle East. I saw in an article that Sushisamba was broadcasting world cup football games so I called the reservation team to confirm it was the case. I'd been told that they did broadcast all football games indeed. In two hours time, my friends - two couples with kids - arrived at the restaurant, went up to the 38th floor but the host on duty told them that they were not going to broadcast the game we wanted to watch. They said the venue was closed for private hire. My friends with kids had to go back to their hotel. I arrived a bit later and called the reservation team to ask what was going on there and they didn't have an answer but promised to call back. 30 minutes later they called me back and said they were experiencing a technical problem. All in all my friends and I missed the first half of the game, incurred some costs taking a cab to the restaurant and back and had to arrange an alternative very fast. The reservation team manager Maris called me the following day and offered a round of drinks and snacks in the bar, if we wanted to come back. This doesn't help really as my friends flying out of the city and have lots of other arrangements... I've been to Sushisamba many times before privately and on business but seems like this relationship is over now...

title: Excellent
comment: Sushi Samba is not just a meal is a great experience starting from a speedy glassy lift up and great view on London... very funcy modern interior with roof terrace, great music.. I kept the food on the end but in my opinion best sushi in London! I been them several times usually on occasion as it is a bit pricey but definitely woth it!! Highly recommended!!!

title: Really Awesome
comment: Awesome view  Awesome food  Awesome waiters  Awesome environment  Awesome sound @ the Bar Awesome experience

title: What a surprise !
comment: Visited the restuanrt with business colleagues Was the only veggie so worried about choice of food Really surprised had 4 course if great sushi and Brazilian food Portions are modest but loved eating with lengthy breaks between courses Great views of London add to the enjoyment of their place

title: Amazing Restaurant, but as expected a little pricey
comment: Had dinner with my boyfriend for Brazilian Valentine's day here. We were very impressed with the types of food and the fusion aspect of the restaurant. Food came very quickly, which was unexpected! Had a samba performance which was cool. The desserts and drinks were also fabulous!

title: Nice view, food Ok, service is bad
comment: bad service... limited time for the table 1,5 hour and the service was super slow.. plus they forget some food that we ordered...  So the view is the only reason to visit Samba sushi...

title: Great time with friends
comment: Visited as a group of 5. Staff very friendly. Their knowledge of products was fantastic and service was absolutely brilliant. Delicious food. Bit pricey but what can you expect in Central London! View from the terrace is breathtaking.

title: Wonderful views..
comment: Fantastic views across London, only went to the bar - the food smelled absolutely divine though. Drinks were overpriced at £16.50 for a martini, but it is in the finance district of London and 85% of the clientele in there were probably more used to bottles of wine that cost hundreds.  The drinks are great, the vibe is relaxed yet refined - will be returning to sample whatever it was I could smell cooking haha

title: Very thoughtful staff
comment: The Staff noted it was our wedding anniversary and brought out a lovely plate inscribed Happy Anniversary in chocolate with some complimentary pudding. Very thoughtful and made it feel special. They also seated us near the window. Oh and the sushi is amazing

title: Leaving dinner for work colleague
comment: Good food, the large plate of black god was delicious as well as the prawn tempura & chicken teriyaki.  Very expensive though for what it is. Wines start generally at £45.  Service was attentive & views are pretty cool.

title: Back for the views but service gone down
comment: I think this is my second or third review for Sushi Samba, I only come here for the views and drinks.  What I noticed last week though was how the quality of the crowd has gone down. Earlier they were particular about the dress code - now they let anyone enter as long as you show a valid I.D. People were walking around in shorts, slippers, casual T-shirts, and sneakers on a Saturday night. A couple next to us ordered a drink at the bar, and because of the loud music, the bartender was unable to hear them so instead starting yelling at them for not speaking proper English - scary stuff!! The staff will always support each other, poor couple got so scared they went and sat in a corner. Definitely avoiding this place for a while because it's become too crowded since anyone is being let in.  On the other hand, I tried their old fashioned and loved it!!

title: The view with the Wow factor
comment: Beautiful location and amazing view from there, the cod it is pretty nice as the sushi is, average wine list in my opinion. One of the best “romantic” place in London

title: Amazing views, decor, and great food
comment: Not as expensive as I was worried it might be. The views are unbeatable, and the terrace is very nicely done if you want to have a drink before your meal.
