The fusion of Japanese, Brazilian, and Peruvian works very well - we had an assortment of ceviches, sushis, and grilled meat. The octopus was the star of the show, and we also indulged in the Kobe beef (which is slightly overpriced but the rest was affordable).  Would definitely go again for a special occasion.

title: Edwin C.
comment: Ambience is superb but our table is not by the window which is I booked in advance. Food is ok but not that amazing and confusing and pricy.Tempura Prawn a bit salty. Edamame served in our table it takes more than 15 minutes. We order Tea but cup are dirty and water glass is also dirty with lips marked. Security should be use laser detector not touching guest body and no globes.We noticed some guest wearing ordinary clothes not formal casual as company policy.

title: Saturday afternoon drinks
comment: My friend, my manager, her husband and I all enjoyed cocktails here outside by the fire. It's a really beautiful restaurant but you don't have to just ear there, you can go for drinks too. They have a lovely outdoor area with a gorgeous tree that lights up and a fire pit. Or you can sit on the other side where you can see the Ghurken right up close. Amazing cocktails!!!

title: An unforgettable experience
comment: Visited with a group of 8 people. The Heron tower was the first wow moment and then we had drinks at the bar that had nice atmosphere despite lots of people. Then moved to our table that had great views. We did the set menu and loved every bite. My guests had little experience with sushi but loved every dish. Lots of nice presentation touches in the food that made for good conversation at the table. Service was good and we left happy. For the value I would say that the promotion is really in line with the delivery and quality. Will go again.

title: Jacobs
comment: Delicate tasty but small portions of very overpriced too fussy Japanese dishes. Ok views from very high building. To be avoided if you do not appreciate over heated noisy and crowded venues. Claim to have a dress code requiring stylish but this not enforced at all. Plain white tee shirts and jeans don't fit. My friends are very stylish

title: OUT OF THIS WORLD!
comment: Situated on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower, Sushisamba gives you stunning views across London. We were lucky to visit on a stunning day so views were immense! The restaurant itself is bright, modern and airy. Be sure to try and get a window seat to appreciate the views more. Staff were very attentive too. Onto the food! Wow! Our first delight of the day was the green bean tempura with truffle and aioli dip! Amazing! We then opted for shrimp tempura which for me was my dish of the day! Absolutely mouthwatering and bursting with flavours! We then chose the lobster taquito and raw tuna. Every mouthful was interesting and flavoursome. We then chose lamb chop and pork belly which didn’t disappoint and lastly we opted for the California Maki and Tiger Maki both equally as stunning! All in all the standard of food was exceptional and I can’t wait to return! My favourite restaurant EVER I would say.

title: Erratic dress policy, means once is enough
comment: Tried the tasting menu which had a number of new dishes for me and some were great, there were 12 items on that menu so I wouldn’t expect everyone to be great but I was pleased with all the different tastes- ironically there was not much sushi and what there was was pretty average. Getting into the restaurant was a problem as I was warned that my trousers and shoes did not comply with there “casual elegance” policy that I must have signed up for when making a reservation! I wanted some great food not to read a load of ifs and buts regarding their idea of what they want their customers to wear - the meal came to £221 for two plus a free critique of my casual elegance from a very humorless chap on the door. Annoyingly, looking around I saw T-shirts and trainers but they must have been the ‘right’ kind. Once was enough- I’ll take the hint on their preferred demographic.

title: Disappointed
comment: Went here for a business lunch and was frowned upon at the door due to our dress. When we were escorted into the restaurant we realized that not everyone was meeting the “casual elegance “ standard. Unbelievably i had a hair wrapped into my roll and it wasn’t even taken off of the bill!

title: Amazing view
comment: Only been here for a drink. Had a sesame old fashioned, which was just superb. And the view to enjoy it with is amazing.

title: Fantastic family lunch
comment: Amazing food and cocktails. We took our sushi loving five year old and he had the best time. The views are outstanding and the chocolate banana cake and ice cream was a hit as was the sushi nigiri. We loved the more adventurous set lunch. A special mention has to go to the many, many staff who all went out of their way to say hi to our boy and make him welcome, and the thoughtful gesture of kids chopsticks. Rarely have we eaten somewhere which treats younger guests so kindly.

title: great dining experience with great service
comment: We turned up an hour early for our booking and they fitted us in. From our first drink to the last the restaurant staff were great, food was amazing and we felt very happy that we chose SushiSamba. This was our second time and it was just as good as the first.

title: Birthday lunch - delicious food, great service but view wasn't as good as I expected!
comment: I went for a late lunch with my mum to celebrate my birthday - I had requested a table by the window which I got however compared to the Shard the views aren't so striking (in the day time) but it was still fun to be so high up! The restaurant is really bright with high ceilings etc too. Waiters were all very lovely and attentive - they went the extra mile an surprised me with a little macaroon with a candle and Happy Birthday written in chocolate which I thought was really sweet! Food was delicious but small portions and you are paying for the whole experience (view/ 38th floor!) We went to the bar afterwards which had a lovely buzz as it was a sunny hot day - also there is a viewing platform outside the restaurant which is great for photos as you have the Shard right next to you! I would definitely return but at night next time as I feel the view would be much better!!!

title: One of Top 3 Meals
comment: Fantastic meal and a true food experience. The staff were on their game, setting was impeccable, drinks delicious and dishes were unforgettable. There was plenty of choice for the vegans in our group and we were all remembering this meal for days to come. It is definitely one of the pricier places but well worth it

title: Amazing
comment: I had seen good and not so good reviews so I was really interested to see what this restaurant was like! We were all (4 of us) really delighted with the whole experience! We eat a lot of sushi and all really love it and we weren’t disappointed! The views are a huge part of the experience and the cocktails were fabulous! It was my daughters birthday and they put happy birthday on her desert without being prompted! When we arrived they wished her happy birthday (I had already mentioned it was her birthday when booking) but had obviously written down or remembered of the 2 woman she was the birthday girl! The food was outstanding and although yes it wasn’t cheap we had been wise enough to look at the menu and make the decision it wasn’t going to stop us going! Definitely worth going for a special occasion and a wonderful experience! The young waitress was particularly helpful and took several photos for us! Just wish I could remember her name but she was short and pretty and had straight bobbed hair! So if you are reading this thank you, you helped make it a lovely evening for us!

title: Somewhat disappointing
comment: I have had better Japanese food and have had better Brazilian food. The place & crowd are pretentious, food is well overpriced, view is not great at all. Sorry but I won’t return

title: Fantastic view
comment: Sushisamba is one of my favourite restaurants in London and I tend to go out very very often. The restaurant has a great combination of delish food, nice environment, with good vibes, and attentive staff. Whenever I have friends visiting me in the town, I bring them here and they are always impressed! Ps: might not be recomended if you have agoraphobia, as you need to take a panoramic lift and the restaurant is located on the 40th floor.

title: Ok for a cocktail stop on a nice day
comment: Looking on the website you imagine the bar area to be large but the outside area is tiny. Staff hover around you in the inside bar areas constantly looking for you to reorder. Yes their cocktails are good, but everyone is packed into small areas that don't have particularly good viewing points and I thought the bar menu was overpriced. This is ok for a cocktail stop on a lovely day to say you've been, but really just a tourist trap and best avoided. Over £100 for 2 round of drinks for 2 and some crisps and corn snacks is a tad too much even if they were tasty.

title: A lofty experience worth the price !!
comment: Sushisamba, Bishopsgate is located on the 38th floor offering panaromic views of London with floor to ceiling glass windows. The place is usually packed and hence an advance reservation is required.  The bar is well stocked and the energy in the room by itself can raise your spirits !!. We spent time in the bar with a nice wine accompanied by Edamame and Wagyu Gyoza - throughly enjoyed the views, wine and small plates. Was seated at our table at the appointed time - enjoyed Octopus, Churrasco Rio Grande and Moqueca Mista - excellent food and ambience. The staff engaged with us and ensured we truly enjoyed our food and experience. Will definitely recommend to all visitors to London - looking forward to a repeat visit !!

title: Good Times, Great Food, Amazing Views
comment: SushiSamba is an experience in and of itself. When you first arrive you are "greeted" by a doorman/security guard at the street level, which is a bit weird for a restaurant, but a minor inconvenience. After getting a pat down from security we took the glass enclosed elevator up to the 39th floor which gives you spectacular views of the city for about 30 seconds during the ride. We arrived early for our reservation so we got a drink at the bar and waited for our table. An Old Fashion is my drink of choice so I ordered their Sesame Old Fashioned which was a letdown. If you love the taste of sesame then you might enjoy this, but I couldn't even finish the drink because it tasted so bad. Luckily the food made up for it. We ordered the Lobster Taquitos and Kobe Sliders for starters and both were delicious. For mains we had 4 different rolls and all of them were terrific. It is absolutely not traditional sushi rolls, as each one is given a dousing of sauces and toppings, but the seafood tasted fresh and the ingredients in each roll worked well together. This is a once every few years or a very special occasion kind of place, but we will be back in due time.

title: A must see!
comment: If you are coming to London you should definitely visit this place. It's stunning with panoramic views and great food. Can't recommend it highly enough!

title: 75 pounds 4 gin tonic tanquery is crazy.... 0 service
comment: I work in hospitality but this is a real scam, you order 4 gin tonic and Bill is 75 pound? What? Again... What????

title: Great view, tasty food, polite staff.
comment: He view (as mentioned in other reviews) is spectacular and the lift ride up to the 28th floor is fabulous. The staff we encountered were very helpful and polite, even though they were busy. The food is good - is it worth the price? I guess you're paying for the location.

title: Not Bad
comment: Went on a Friday night after reciving a call saying they had a cancellation. I was very excited about going, it very close to Liverpool st station and easy to find.  Was suprised that there were only limited places you could sit and enjoy the views. The best views were walking down the stairs to the lower floor, to restaurant area. The outdoor terrace was nice but you cannot enjoy views from there, instead the bar and tree with orange lights takes centre stage.  We sat with our drinks near the window almost under the stairs being very careful not to hit out heads.  The drinks were lovely, the waiting staff at the bar area were very keen to take out glasses away even when we had not finished our drinks. I had to stop them twice, after spending £13 on a drink you want to finish it.  Our table was booked for 8.15 it was ready for 8.30, we ordered a mixture of items all were very nice but we all agreed that the vegan cucumber maki was bland and very fishy in taste. The desserts were beautifully presented and different to the usual standard dessert you normally get. The chocolate banana cake was strange but the more you try it the better it became.  Overall it was a lovely evening, the waiting staff in the restaurant were very polite attentive and knowlegable about the menu. I found the menu even though in english is still very hard to understand, or this maybe because I am not familiar with japanese food. I very much appreciated the waiters help when ordering.

title: Take a few quid !!
comment: We went there for lunch a couple of weeks ago and came out a few hundred quid lighter....There were 8 of us and we stupidly let the waiter chose our dishes.. Cut a long story short the food was a reasonable quality, the waiter was very efficient in his job and an excellent salesman. We sat at the table for a little over 2 hours and the bill came to £1,388.25 ......A shade under £175.00 a person. It was a lovely view up there but will not be visiting again based upon purely the cost .

title: Good night but very slow service
comment: Food was great so as the cocktails but the service was average and was very slow. We had to pre-order 2 drinks at a time to ensure we always have one in hand as it was taking so long for our cocktails to come through.

title: Overpriced, just the view is good
comment: This was the first time here. Worth to visit once only. View is nice but they focus more on selling instead of caring for their customers. Food was mediocre. It was also very busy and noisy.

title: Atmospheric, Luxurious, Delicious
comment: Lovely skyline view on the outside terrace with a cosy fire pit and seating area. Beautiful interior design with Japanese vibes. They do not serve food outside however they did cater to our needs since it was a group of 20 people. Food and bar area are quite small however the restaurant area is huge inside. Absolutely stunning interior as mentioned before. Quite pricey, as Japanese food tends to be in London so that is not unexpected. Very pleasant night overall.

title: Non traditional Sushi, great views
comment: I called to make a reservation for the following day, and was told that the dress code was business formal. When I showed up, I saw that many people had on athletic shoes and regular street wear. I was disappointed that as a tourist I have to find a new outfit to go eat here, yet others or able to wear whatever they had on. The ride up to the 39th floor was awesome, the place has great views. The downfalls were that the food is very overpriced for the amount of food that you receive, there were no beverage options other than alcoholic beverages and water or fruit juices, the sushi rolls described We’re not traditional sushi rolls. That being said you cannot go there and order your typical shrimp tempura or tuna or California roll. I personally was not a big fan of most of their plates, therefore I would not recommend going to this place. If you are not very hungry and you’d like to try different food then this might be a place for you to go.

title: Great food, bad service
comment: I really liked this place. Great food and spectaculare View. Trendy place and I want to give it a 5, but cant because of the staff. Almost all the staff missunderstood their job att the place. They are walking around trying to be cool with stiff faces and No smiles thinking that THEY are the highlight of the place, almost Looking down on guests. Management should teach them to give service and still be a cool place. But again, really Nice food and View, worth going Anyway.

title: Delicious with wonderful views
comment: Food was great, we ordered a selection of dishes to share whilst enjoying the spectacular London scenery. Service was good. The only thing i didnt enjoy was my avocado cocktail, i shouldn't have been so adventurous and stuck to what i know i like!  All my sushi has since been compared to here . Havent found a new winneemr yet

title: Outstanding
comment: I celebrate my birthday and it was absolutely perfect . The food it’s incredible and also the service . The atmosphere in the restaurant it’s perfect and make the difference if you are beside the window... Congrats !!

title: Not just for the view
comment: Of course the view was excellent. The food nicely varied. Advice on new items to one, pleasantly explained. The only problem was the high tempo of service. A bit 'Fast Food'. Price matched that which was offered.

title: Rude staff and overpriced food
comment: Went with my friend for the very first time today for late lunch. Ladies from the reception were really not helpful at all and rude. They’ve seat down us next to the bar like we ask without the drinks menu. When I went to ask them one of the girls said “is on the table can’t you see” I founded this very unprofessional and rude. Firstly they have should train the staff how to be nice and polite. We order some maki rolls - which basically I could get better in taste somewhere else and cheaper. Everything is over price there and the place is dirty! Not recommended!

title: Some of the best Japanese food I've ever had!
comment: A friend of mine recommended this place and boy was it one of the best recommendations I've ever gotten! Came here with a co-worker that was celebrating his birthday and they were amazing in making sure we had the best time ever. The food was absolutely amazing I could've literally ordered the whole menu twice! The service was extremely attentive and were so sweet in helping me secure a birthday cake surprise for my co-worker. I've been to Japan and have experienced the real thing and SushiSamba was by far the best Japanese food I've had outside of Japan. The views are breath taking which just adds to the whole experience. Couldn't recommend highly enough and I can't wait to be back!

title: Food poisoning beware
comment: My partner and I went here for a date night. The food was nice, though expensive (the total bill came to £177). We ordered a range of things including the chicken and assortment of fish sushi nigiri. When we got home that night, my partner began violently vomiting throughout the night. The next morning it hit me also and I spent the day vomiting, fevery and achy. When we told Sushi Samba about this, they carried out a ‘3 week process’ to finally come back and tell us, predictably, that it was not their fault. Obviously would not recommend as not only did we get food poisoning but they do not take responsibility for this either.

title: Worth the one time experience. Pricey!!!
comment: Loved the views and the decor. The whole experience is great in terms of the food. We were seated beside the window and had a delicious meal. Small points are the food is very expensive. I am aware the location is in the city and your paying for the views but a lot for sushi. We also decided to have a drink after our food and wanted around 15 minutes. Clearly the high roller bankers who flood the bar get preference. We paid around £34.00 for 2 cocktails and the waitress asked did i want change from £40.00 even though service is included at 12.5%?? Were not all bankers with deep pockets...

title: Perfect anniversary date night
comment: We went for dinner recently and this resturant truly did live up to the name. The decor is lovely. The resturant had a nice ambience and the waiters were all very polite. The food however was absolutely amazing. Each bite got better and better. We highly recommend the mushroom main course, the tuna and salmon sushi and yellow fin tacos. The cocktails are also unique and well blended, the lychee cooler was a personal favourite. The only thing that could have been improved was the chocolate dessert, although it was highly recommended it was slightly rich. All in all it’s a lovely resturant, remember to book in advance!

title: What A view!! What an atmosohere!
comment: Sushisamba is everything you expect it to be. The view and the atmosohere are amazing. They have an entirely vegan menu. Nice and original food combinations - every dish is to share, so that makes diner more romantic ❤️ but it also comes with a cost, eating here is not cheap.

title: Great evening
comment: It was like a new experience for me- lovely new taste of the food, beautiful view, loved the tree decoration in the open roof. We had ordered a bit of everything so in the end it’s come up a bit pricey.

title: Amazing Food, Vibe, Drinks, View
comment: Went to SushiSamba London for dinner and, WOW, what an experience. Was blown away by the drinks menu and selection. The food was just sublime. We had a selection of plates including the taquitos, sushi, Kobe beef sliders, ceviche and steak. For dessert we had the edible Zen garden which was a culinary experience of note! All of the dishes were incredibly presented, and tasty. The service was attentive and friendly, too. Would definitely recommend this to friends for dinner and to see London from 39 floors up. My only negative about this restaurant is that it can be on the pricey side, but it's a real treat.

title: Amazing food and place
comment: The place is wonderful at the top of the city, the staff is really kind. And the food is so good ! Well done for that

title: Meh... there are better choices
comment: I was traveling with my sister and our two boys-23 and 18 yrs. my nephew loves sushi so we booked Sushi Samba . The meal was very expensive and the food was good but not great. At this level- the food should have blown us away. The atmosphere was beautiful as it is on the rooftop and has an outdoor bar with a beautiful red tree in the center. After this experience- we would choose Zuma instead of Sushi Samba

title: Disappointing
comment: We booked, we looked forward to and very much enjoyed the ‘experience’ of being on the 39th floor with fabulous views across London. The service was ok, if a little rushed but the place was heaving. Unfortunately we were extremely disappointed with the food- simply tasteless. They should concentrate on serving less people and looking after them properly. Felt ripped off by what is a failing fast food outlet.

title: Overpriced bar and presumptious service charge
comment: Went to the 38th floor bar with my wife. Found a table in the outside area. No cocktail menus on the table so went to the bar to collect them. Having selected our drinks, it became apparent that table service was not being offered. So back to the bar I went and ordered two cocktails at £13 each. I decided to pay for them at the bar as we were only staying for one drink. The bar tender gave me the bill which had had 12.5% service charge added. I asked why. Her response was "for the service". I informed her that up to that point I hadn't received any service and told her to remove the charge, which she reluctantly did. If you're only coming for a drink here, don't bother. The drinks are overpriced and the policy of adding 12.5% for bar-purchased items is appalling.

title: Overpriced drinks, miserable bar tender
comment: There’s no doubt this is a great venue, especially on a warm day as you can sit in the outside bar 38 floors up. We’ve been here a couple of times but won’t rush back. The drinks are expensive (£15 for a rum and coke) and the bar tender in the outside bar is miserable and rude. It’s the second time he’s been like this. We took my mum for her birthday but his attitude spoilt the visit. Shame, as it’s in a good location with lovely views of London.

title: Fusion of flavours but pricey
comment: Amazing sushi alongside clear views of London. Staff were great and even managed to move us to sit by the window. Fusion of flavours in your mouth. Definitly worth trying at least once if you are a sushi lover. Bit on the pricey side.

title: Night-time on 38th Floor
comment: About 10 minutes walk from Liverpool Street Tube. Use exit Bishopsgate West and turn right. The glass lift (elevator) took 46 seconds to get to the 38th Floor. Excellent choice of food and drink. Beautiful lighting, helpful staff. Unfortunately, this will not allow me to post the 30-second video showing the lift descending.

title: Face doesn’t fit
comment: It pains me to write this having written such a glowing review last year. I was out with two friends on a Saturday afternoon (circa 3pm) and wanted to have a couple of cocktails and showcase the great venue and views. Yes I had ripped jeans on, I had worn the same pair at the previous visit. This time they didn’t let me in even though we’d just seen people in similar attire and even sneakers just get waived through. I understand dress codes and looking smart - I feel we were of the same attire as equivalents being allowed up so to that point there’s no dress code on their website specifically calling out ripped jeans and secondly what I cannot abide is lack of consistency and ‘bouncers’ on power trips Poor show SS, poor show. Didn’t want your £7 beers anyway

title: Little disappointed
comment: We have been trying to get into the restaurant at sushi samba for a while and we’re incredibly excited when we managed to nab a spot for my boyfriends birthday. I had communicated really easily with sushi samba regarding this occasion as I wanted a dessert at the end to be a surprise. I was informed I needed to order a birthday cake as that was all they offered, which I did, which were incredibly expensive at £40 for a cake portion for 1-4 people but I thought hey ho it’s a birthday. They brought the cake over once we had asked for the bill and when my boyfriend asked for a knife to cut the cake we were informed it was a further £7 for this or they could box it up for us to take it away for free. This wasn’t communicated to me over the phone, which was disappointing as we were getting the train there and back carrying a cake box wasn’t ideal. Just a warning for anyone wanting to celebrate a birthday. Food was great and the staff friendly and happy to advise from the menu/bar with some great choices which we loved.

title: Good view but ...
comment: I went there with one friend. Had to queue but enjoyed the view. Amazing. However drinks are expensive as well as food even if not really good. You can drink and eat for much cheaper around. I wanted to bring my girlfriend there but only the view is worth it

title: Good
comment: Good food good service nice and cousy atmosphere lovely staff good location we will make another visit soon

title: Top notch quality and location
comment: We've been there to celebrate my wife's birthday, and must say that the location is simply stunning; you have a 360° view of London above more than 100 m. height. It's clearly a place catering to very affluent people. The food we had was simply delicious, the quality of nigiri and rolls was simply perfect, same thing with ceviches and the other dishes we tried. Thumbs up also for the service, very quick, nice and attentive. The price of dinner is what you can expect at a restaurant like this, whilst found the wines to be a bit overpriced. The only thing we did not like of the experience was the volume of the music, you could barely understand what the waitress tries to explain, and makes keeping a conversation a bit challenging. In any case, a very good place for a celebration or for an informal business dinner.

title: Very tasty!
comment: I love this place an the food! It is in the Sales Force Building... I think it was floor 37.. there a a few floors of bars an the restaurant as well. You could have a drink, to have dinner.. there is a terrace as well, where i nice weather you could spend really nice time ;)) Would definitely recommend!

title: Very bad service
comment: Restaurant and bar is amazing. Couldn’t fault the food but the service of higher management (waiter was very polite) is absolutely shocking. We had a waiter who explained the menu and looked after us well. The manager came to take our payment and with a 12.5% discretionary tip, we asked him to remove this and we will pay our tip separately which he did. The manager then returned to say we were a few pound short which I explained was the discretionary service charge which needed to be removed. We had put down a £20 tip and I explained this..for the manager to then reply ‘good’, give us a dirty look and then walk off. I have no problem with tipping and feel £20 as a tip is more than appropriate regardless of being a high end restaurant in London. For that reason alone I wouldn’t return to the restaurant which is very disappointing as the food was lovely but the full experience just wasn’t there. I’m sure one persons review isn’t any skin of their nose but judging by the other reviews which have been left regarding their disgusting attitudes it’s perhaps something they should take on board..you’re not the only sushi restaurant in London.

title: Oh my, just perfect food
comment: My son took me here for a treat and boy, what a treat it was. The restaurant is on the 39th floor, overlooking the Gherkin. The restaurant has vast views of the city making it an exciting venue to eat in. We were in the lounge and also spent time on the open terrace outside. The service was perfect and the food is very impressive. Kobe beef was a highlight. Visit here for a high quality and special experience but be prepared for an equally high price tag.

title: Disappointed and disgusted
comment: Me and my friends had been planning on visiting SushiSamba for some time, so when we finally planned to go we were looking forward to trying good food and enjoying the views.  As soon as we were seated, as in, not a minute had passed, we were seen by a waiter who asked us what we wanted to drink (we hadn’t even seen the menus), he sped through a list of options, incredibly quickly to which we said, can we just have a minute to look at the menu. He then said ok and I’ll bring you tap water. A few minutes after he returned and took our order, the three of us had an incredibly busy day and neither had a chance to eat so we were looking forward to food even more, we started our order and our waiter stopped us. He then said, this is too much food, we were so confused and he told us to stop ordering and that what we have is enough. I had actually only placed an order for myself and two sushi plates to share. My other two friends hadn’t even ordered. He re-iterated that we have enough food and that’s it, we felt so pressured to shut up we didn’t know what else to say. He left and a few minutes after we were wondering what just happened. We decided we were being silly and to just order what we each wanted, another gentleman saw we were looking for a waiter and asked us, we added two additional dishes. Moments after the original waiter came back and essentially told us off. He said, I’ve heard you want to order more, again telling us it’s too much and what we were going to do when we don’t eat it. We were so completely taken aback. We asked what the issue was and that surely, if we didn’t finish something, we could take it away if that was the issue, to which he said, no you can’t do that, this is too much. By this point we were so fed up, he said fine, your choice and walked off.  Just to put into context, three of us ordered a small plate each as a starter and shared some sushi plates. I then ordered the cod for a main and my two friends shared the seafood plate. That was it. We ate what we ordered, paid and left feeling incredibly frustrated and as if we had been shamed for eating what we did. I am so incredibly disgusted by your waiters behaviour and neither of us will be returning. What an awful awful experience. Don’t waste your time.

title: Amazing sushi, rude and obnoxious waitress...
comment: Very disappointing visit to Sushisamba today with my boyfriend. Despite the amazing sushi, which is not at all to be forgotten, the service was very unsatisfactory! The waitress was rude and obnoxious, as well as patronising and dismissive...I am sure if we was dressed in suits and dresses the service would have been very different! It’s definitely worth the visit for the views, and of course the sushi is amazing, but be prepared to be treated like a fool by the waitress!

title: Best lunch
comment: Wow what a place this is, was passing by & walked in for lunch, you go up 39 floors to this amazing roof terrace Bars & restaurant, stunning views across London & the best lunch we have had I ages, the restaurant required reservation & was fully booked but we were able to sit at the bar & eat, little pricy but worth every penny, the food was amazing & lovely wine to match, great vibe in this place, cannot wait to return

title: Arrogant
comment: I have been many tines and the place has always been great- but expensive.  Where does the arrogance and unfriendliness come from!? They’re adding 12.5% service charge but the entire staffs’ attitude stinks.  Arrogant, condescending, slow service, pushy sales to push up the price... I won’t be back.  The quantity of salt in everything was over powering.  £150 per person!! We were reminded upon booking, upon confirming, upon arrival and upon being seated that they must have the table back by 22.00.  As we left at 22.15 most tables were empty.  Has the bubble burst on what had been one of London’s great eating places?  I hope not; but the staff don’t deserve for its success to continue.

title: Great Business Lunch
comment: Had a business lunch here and can recommend both the food and the experience. From a business meeting point of view, as you order several smaller courses, the meal is dragged out giving ample time to discuss business if you need to. There's not a lot of ambient noise in the restaurant and the tables are sufficiently spaced out that you can hold a private conversation. The food was excellent, especially the Black Cod. The waiter was very helpful in answering our questions about the menu and he made suggestions on what to order (how many dishes to serve 3 people, what the dishes were comprised of etc). We probably ordered too much food to be fair and one large plate easily served 3 of us (4 would have been a push) considering we had lots of smaller plates, nigiri and sashimi etc. The dishes don't come out in any structured order, just when they're ready, so it's best to order for the table rather than individuals as some will be eating whilst others are still waiting.  It's top end in terms of price, but an excellent experience for a special occasion or, like me, the supplier is paying! Go up a floor to the bar for after dinner drinks and to finish your discussions.

title: Not as good as it used to be!
comment: I used to use this place for business lunches at least twice month but in the last month to six weeks the level of service has dropped significantly. Time for a break.

title: Shocking discrimination - ageist policy
comment: Queued with a friend, both over 40, questioned about how much we had had to drink (minimal) younger people in queue could not even stand straight but allowed in. Clearly an age discrimination policy. I have least ten times the amount of money that young jonny has in my bank account and a mass of influential friends who will nnow boycott this place on the grounds of discriminatory appearance policy. Been here many times. Don't bother unless you're young super trendy, booked a restaurant or friends with the security. Ageist policy.  .

title: Food great, staff please improve
comment: Food great, waitress who took care of me was good. She helped me with order and recommended then I tips her 5£ for not look down at me.

title: Classy Restaurant serving unique Dishes!
comment: Great place for a business lunch. Fancy restaurant and bar with great cocktails where there is a dress code to enter ( no tracksuits etc). Food is very unique and presented well. Service was very good. You need to reserve a table as it gets very busy.  The view from the restaurant on London is exquisite.

title: London trip
comment: Every year I visit my closest friend and we plan to either do an activity or go too a restaurant we haven’t ever been too before.  We decided on Sushi Samba, we booked a month in advance as this restaurant gets booked up very quickly. So I advise to book early as you cannot book earlier than a month before.  We went for lunch, the table view was amazing. We had a table over looking the sky line of London over Spitalfield Market.  The food was tasty and reasonably priced.  I would recommend going just for the experience.

title: Food and view worth going!
comment: Located at the 39th Flor of the tower, good news is that for lunch, they’re not too picky on your attire, I guess “smart dressing” is more for the evening (still don’t bring your sneakers if you want to be sure to eat, but shirt is not mandatory and jeans are ok). Japanese style mixed with a dash of Brezilian colors work great! Cocktails are great, we tried the Batida and the Samba Sour, and loved it! Food is awesome as well. Tempuras are perfect, the sushi offer a rainbow of colors and tastes, and the Boquequa (I hope the writing is right) was also full of flavors! An experience definitely worth going!

title: Worth the visit
comment: I was taken here for my birthday and we had a nice (far more casual than advertised online) meal. The venue is more casual/ laid back than I expected and the staff were very professional and really really friendly and fun!  My partner and I were sat at the bar upstairs as we were early- couldn't fault the bar tender as she asked what we liked and made us some personlised cocktails which we were very impressed with!  The food was very nice but certainly not the best I've had nor would I rush to go back in all honesty.  We had two dishes from the specials (octopus and pork belly) which we loved, we had the tuna ceviche whch was delicious and fresh, the fresh water eel was very soft and tasty and loved the green bean tempura with truffle aioli. Not impressed with the shrimp tempura and wouldnt reccomnd it. The food overall was tasty and I enjoyed the service as the waitors awere very attentive but I don't quite think that all in all it merits the price as we had 7 small dishes, four beers and two cocktails which came to just under £300. I wasn't expecting the meal to be cheap but at that price, I guess I was left feeling a little underwhelmed.

title: Sushi
comment: Was apprehensive as an expensive restaurant. and unsure what to order. So asked the advice of our waitress and gave her our budget of £65 per person and left her to decide upon the menu. We were amazed with the choice of food and yes, the presentation was excellent and each course was explained to us in detail.

title: Cocktails
comment: Recently had our first visit at Sushi Samba for drinks (I wasn’t allowed in last time as I was wearing ripped jeans - be prepared to feel very judged by the doormen even when they do let you in!) the bar and waiting staff were chatty and attentive - the bar, although on the smaller side, is decorated beautifully. Two cocktails cost £30 inc tip, the menu had a vast selection and a lot of combos I have not seen before. Would certainly return!

title: Amazing city views, informative staff, incredible food!
comment: I’ve visited with my partner in February and we were lucky to be seated in the best table in the restaurant overlooking the city skyline! The staff was friendly and informative. They were able to recommend good drinks to go with our food. Mushrooms from the vegan menu are extraordinarily delicious, we’ve never tasted such rich and satisfying mushroom dish! Starters and dessert were also full of flavour and tasty. Beautiful presentation! It’s not a cheap place, but really worth the price! Highly recommend for an evening out. A truly fine dining with the best view :) Need I say more?

title: Shocking service
comment: Highlights to the food were the rolls and the churarsco steak. The service was an absolute mess, no attention to detail, no explanation of the dishes, no one around that could give us service. 20 minutes to get a cocktail round in (we had to order the next round upon delivery of one). There were waiters who were literally breathing down our neck to tell us to give their table back the whole time we were there... not being funny, if you wanted your table back you would get it, as long as we get the food and drinks that we ordered/want? Repeating this to us every 10 minutes and rushing us to order all of our food just made us stressed and was completely unnecessary. Not coming again for food.

title: A strange experience
comment: All ok with booking but then when you get there you feel like you are so packed in that every word will be overheard by the 3 or 4 tables around you. That isn’t helped by the acoustics which mean you have to shout everything to your fellow diner and the waiter.  Food was obviously very fresh and beautifully prepared. I do though find some of the flavour combinations challenging. Does Japanese sushi really fit that well with South America cuisine. ?  All that said, some of the straight sushi was brilliant and the ceviche was excellent too.

title: It is too expensive and service is not good enough
comment: Everyone can visit Sushi Samba for free and many people walk around restaurant. After had my starter, my husband and I want to take photo outdoor. We have told the staff we wanted to go out to take a photo and came back for the main course later. After took photo, we found that my table is cleared and all drinks were gone. We wants to ask the staff that we served us before. The manager just come to ask us "Do you have a reservation?" and i said "I sit there before". Then the manager said "ok" then he left. I had a bad feeling on his response. I did not expect this kind of service was happened in this restaurant. For food, is it kind of fusion food which I like traditional Japanese food more.

title: Lovely experience
comment: SUSHISAMBA is really good. It's a place I would highly recommend, especially for a special occasion i.e anniversary, birthday etc. I didn't have very high expectations when I arrived after looking at the menus online, but I was pleasantly surprised. I ate from the vegetarian/vegan menu and each dish was amazing and so tasty. The brunch/lunch slot is a good time and you can get decent views of the city. This is a must do in London.

title: A must try!
comment: Very interesting menu. We where seated at our table on time. At first a Wine Connoisseur introduced himself and explained the different wines of the house. He was very helpful and offered to make us taste the different wines. He was very courteous and obliged to our needs. Amazing food and presentation. Servicing staff all very polite and helpful. Bonus is the breathtaking view.

title: Excellent Food
comment: Excellent Food, superb service, authentic cocktails and one of best views in London. SUSHISAMBA never disappoints me

title: Visit after a meeting
comment: Second visit but excellent service from start to finish . We also ordered a few pre starters and they we also very nice .

title: Nice views ok sushi
comment: I was a bit disappointed after all the buzz. Great views but that’s about it. The sushi was nothing exceptional, the crowd and decor a bit tacky, the service decent.

title: COCKTAILS WITH A VIEW.....! 🍹🍹🍹🍹
comment: Glass lift transports you to the 37th floor of this iconic building.....amazing views! Excellent cocktails ....great vibe ...!

title: Birthday lunch - first and only visit
comment: So special birthday lunch: Beautiful views Not enough seating in the bar Combination of excellent service and very rude service (waiter thought we couldn’t hear him) Poor selection of vegetarian choices that were not available!!!!!!! Excellent gyoza  Great for good sushi/views but the all round experience in the Duck and Waffle is much more impressive! Go two floors up!

title: COCTAILS & BEER
comment: Great views of London from the 38th floor sadly another building has come up next to it and has blocked the view but still is a great experience to go up there  Will recommend to everyone to go there nice staff friendly

title: Incredible Food!
comment: Went here for lunch as part of a celebration for my son's 21st birthday. First of, the location and views - outstanding. We had a drink in the bar beforehand and the staff were friendly and polite. The waiting staff at our table was very helpful and talked us through the menu and made some suggestions which was very helpful. The food is just unbelievable and there were some such interesting flavor combinations. Great experience and can't wait to return although it is quite expensive.

title: 25th Wedding Anniversary
comment: My wife and I celebrated our 25th wedding anniversary at Sushisamba. The food was amazing and so was the view of London from the 38th floor where the restaurant is located. Our two sons flew into London from Washington DC to surprise my wife at dinner and once the management discovered it was our 25th anniversary they were very accommodation and the manager of the restaurant even made himself available for the entire night to assist the server with our table.  I would recommend this restaurant to all who would like to have a memorable occasion.

title: It fell very short.......
comment: ......Firstly a long wait for a reservation. When we arrived, we were bustled into the bar area where we waited. It was a fight to get a seat - not everybody was there for the restaurant! Then not called for our table at our booking time and we had to press to be taken through to dine. A very poor start.    At the table we were faced with a fusion of dining dishes and the waitress who took our order, seemed set on telling us what to order without listening to what we said - some of our party had eaten here before and we didn't need to be told! Her English was also very poor and I'm not sure how much she understood us! The food was tasty and arrived very quickly but the clearing of the dishes was almost as fast and two platters went without being finished - and at these prices, you'd want to eat every bite.  We decided to terminate the meal after the final dish of eight dishes and move on for our dessert and coffees. It was very noisy and not at all relaxed - the plethora of staff seemed to fall over each other and consequently, good service got lost. I wondered what they were all employed to do as many of them were suited and watching?  London has many beautiful restaurants and as locals, we have visited a lot of them. This doesn't make the grade though. Far too expensive, not enough food per platter and terrible service. I would love to train these staff in how to discreetly deliver a brilliant service as the views could do the rest but I think I'd never be able to break through the pomp. Which is a shame as the food was good but with so much choice in London, I wont be back!

title: Very nice place!
comment: Very good food, prepared fresh by chefs in front of customers! Impressive views and nice staff. I am knocking off one star though because it is very expensive for what it is.

title: Fantastic blend of Japanese and Latino
comment: Loved everything. Great food, you can’t make your choice. Really to taste a maximum of dishes to be shared.  My favorite: the veggies the carrots and aubergine with chicken teriyaki.  Don’t miss the dessert in particular the chocolate and banana cake.

title: Quintessential food and experience!!
comment: The experience I have had in this place is one of the best I have ever had on my life!! This place is simply unique and you definitely need to try i once in your life. The location is first of all beautiful and it is an added value to your visit. Fine dining on the top of a skyscraper is something always extremely cool! Also the atmosphere and the lights! Everything is looked after and you are treat as a prince. The waiters are definitely kind and guide you choosing the maybe not immediately easy to understand menu with competence and sympaty. I recommend you trying something of everything varying between the Sushi, the Brazilian and the Peruvian kitchen. Everything will be amazing!I rarely had such flavours and decoration in a dish and all is an explosion of flavours and colors. I suggest you trying especially the Samba rolls, the large churrasco plate and also to conclude with some of the delicious desserts offered. You can of course imagine all of this don't come in a cheap way, but I can assure you I was happy to pay for what I had. For a good dining here without renouncing to anything expect to pay between 70 and 100 £ each. But if you want have a little appetizer for accompany a lovely cocktail, of course the bill will be under 50. Congratulations to all the Staff and the Chefs.

title: Disappointing
comment: Having been to other Sushi Sambas around the globe. This one is unfortunately the hardest to get in and least impressive. Don't get me wrong it is still of a very good quality and the view is amazing but, it's not worth a 2.5 month waiting list. The food is ok and would equal a medium range sushi house. I expected more.

title: Excellent, but also very expensive
comment: Sushi Samba is an excellent Japanese Brazilian Peruvian fusion restaurant with really delicious and creative food - both sushi and the cooked dishes. It’s also on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower so you get beautiful views of London, and the service is very attentive. Sushi Samba is expensive though, but then you get what you paid for because the food, service, and atmosphere are top notch. Needless to say, I suggest you keep Sushisamba for special occasions or romantic dates when you are looking to impress.

title: Chic and fabulous
comment: Was there for my birthday and started with delicious cocktails in 39th floor with stunning view and continued in 38th with the restaurant.it was a great experience and enjoyed the dinner a lot!service and food was great.do not forget to eat salted caramal chocolate cake....

title: Great Sushi and Amazing views
comment: The atmosphere was amazing the views were stunning over London. The Sushi was also really good.  The service was also very good however the only only downside was that they charged us a £50 serving fee for a birthday cake even though we ordered desserts as well. We informed our waiter of this but they showed little interest and were not willing to take it off the bill. This been said I would recommend this place to anyone.

title: Birthday beware!
comment: Just had a lovely meal - excellent sushi - the El Topo maki rolls was delicious as was the spicy tuna maki. The shrimp tempura was the best I’ve had. We went for a friends birthday- her sister had bought her a cake as a surprise, we however had a surprise when the waitress informed us that we had to pay £7 per person to eat he cake we had bought! I can understand a fee of maybe £1 or £2 per person, but £7 per person is extortionate for a side plate and a spoon in my opinion. We decided to save the cake and have the chocolate and banana cake from the menu instead - which was also delicious.

title: Great and amazing experience!
comment: Was in this restaurant for my girlfriend’s birthday and was very a good experience! They have a lot kind of food..Japanese, Asian or fusion..it’s very expensive but the view is very beautiful, you have to choice this place if you want do a good impression! Recommended!

title: Only one complaint
comment: My husband had visited a while ago for a business function and was so blown away that he’d promised our student daughter a trip there as a reward for doing well. We were equally blown away by the fantastic and imaginative food and interesting cocktails not to mention the decor and view! We were very pleasantly surprised by the desserts too - Zen Garden and Rainforest were just stunning and my husbands chocolate banana pudding was delicious too. Yes it’s expensive with a couple of eye watering prices on the menu, but really worth it.  The one complaint wasn’t that it was really busy and noisy - which it was but just added to the great vibe - but that there was a cleaning lady with a mop working her way round the place even under tables where people were sitting which struck us as a bit odd and could perhaps have been better done only when staff were very efficiently turning tables for the next booking. I do accept the need for good hygiene and to keep the place looking at its best but it was a little intrusive and out of place. However that wouldn’t stop us from going again when we next have an opportunity to do so - we just need another great excuse to treat ourselves! BTW we experienced no judgmental staff, ageism (I’m 57) or fashion policing (why would anyone go to an expensive restaurant in scruffy clothes anyway!)

title: Mothers Day Treat
comment: The journey up to the restaurant in the lift made your ears pop. The view across the city - wow. The maitre de was helpful did not take a note of his name - talked us through the menu, advised us of the size of dishes so we did not over-order. Cocktails strong, choices of dishes - very varied and tasty. One disappointment dishes came out at different times, so some waiting involved to eat together. I’ve never had a cocktail that had sushi in it or a burger held together with a 5”screw. Given 15 minutes notice to vacate table at the end our 2.5hr seating - cocktails taken out onto the deck to take pictures. A memorable evening, enjoyable food and drink with amazing views, very expensive though.

title: Birthday Lunch
comment: Lovely lunch! I have been to Sushisamba for dinner a few times so going for lunch and being able to see the panoramic view of London during the day was a treat. Each dish was beautifully presented and flavoursome and the cocktails are a generous size. The staff were professional, welcoming and warm towards our dietary requirements. Will definitely be returning again.

title: Great food poor service
comment: To start with I had to call multiple times to ensure my reservation was confirmed as I never received a confirmation email from them after submitting 3 different email addresses, each time I called they assured me a confirmation email would be sent but I never received one. One the day of arrival all seemed well however after some time I was told by security that my time was up, I queried this as I had no knowledge of a time limit and was told it was in the confirmation email, which I never got! I was then told because I had spent a certain amount they had allowed me and my partner to stay a little extra, I found this rather insulting, there were 2 clear opportunities to convey the seating period was for only 2 hours, once at the hostess desk and another when we were seated at the table, had we been reminded prior I would not off have an issue with being told to leave. The amount spent should not be a concern, providing good customer service should take precedence. Regardless I didn't argue however asked that the bottle of champagne which we was half empty be transferred to the bar, this was agreed and I was told to speak with the bar staff. We went to the bar and there was no knowledge of the above, at this point myself and my partner were very frustrated. so we took our leave. I fairness we only went for the Kobe beef which was not a disappointment, however in terms of sushi quality there are far better places in London.

title: Really not overly impressed at all :(
comment: Really gutted to be honest as I was so looking forward to this meal. I absolutely LOVE sushi and eat it all around London so I had high hopes for somewhere that you would think specializes in sushi. I eat in amazing places all the time and I am more than happy to spend £60 - £90 ahead of it's really worth it, however in this instance I just really wasn't impressed by anything all evening, The restaurant itself is very nice, good ambience, although the waiters seemed quite disorganised (not knowing which table some dishes were supposed to go to, and also just crowded together at times looking lost) and not as attentive as you'd expect - although a head waiter was very polite and helpful with explaining the menu. The only prosecco they had on the menu was £53 which I would quite extortionate... The menu itself is okay we managed to pick out 7 dishes to share which I guess was enough to fill two ladies up but probably not if you had a big appetite! The sushi was very average unfortunately - the crab was extremely fishy, almost tuna like. And the mushroom dish we had the egg was not cooked all the way through. All in all, we had a good evening but only because of the nice ambiance and great company. (We chose a £33 pinto grigio in the end which was lovely) I thought this would be a new place to add to my list of incredible London restaurants but unfortunately I do not think I would come back here as I can think of many other places to eat amazing sushi, and wouldn't want to be disappointed again. Gutted!

title: Sushi Hype
comment: Sushi Samba was recommended to me by a freind who is a regular and even in winter with freezing temperatures and wind that prevented us from going outside to take in the spectacular view it didn’t disappoint.  Booking is essential most days but you can always try your luck. We were there on a Friday and it was super busy.  Good menu and selection of wine and after being in Thailand where vino is extremely expensive the costs were palatable.  The tuna and salmon Sashimi was great presentation was excellent but I must confess the rest of the menu was under whelming. But All in all well worth a visit with possible the best view of the Gerkin in London.

title: You will remember
comment: OK, the location iteself is well worthy a visit. You are on the top of the Heron Tower, just aside the Gherkin. Nice bar to drink something waiting for the dinner, and very good sushi/sashimi in a good Japanese/Brazilian fusion. The bill,.....as you may expect.

title: Loved it!
comment: We spend a lovely Family Sushi evening here. Even we came late a few minutes our reservation was not canceled. This place is on the 38th floor and I have experienced the fastest elevator from which you have a nice view over London. Our table was placed in the middle of the restaurant and we could view the nice lamp filled tree which was nicely decorated. We have ordered different kinds of sushi which was amazing! Our little girl got a special chicken meal which was prepared on a few minutes. I don’t find the right words to describe this amazing evening just check out the pics. SushiSamba is a most go in London.

title: Nice place , but less impressive than expected
comment: Nice and sophisticated restaurant in the Heron Tower, in the City area of London.  Very elegant, but food was a bit dissapointed considering prices and sitting is quite packed, I expected being such a nice , elegant , posh and exclusive point you will get a bit more of privacy whlie eating, but tables are very close to each others.

title: You pay for the views
comment: This restaurant isn’t cheap, and it’s not particularly easy to get a dinner reservation at a normal time either, but it’s worth it for the views out of the restaurant over the city. The food was good, but I’ve had better at half the price - nothing really blew me away.

title: Excedded expectations
comment: where does one start. a must visit; however, do note that there is a waiting list the length of the Mall. The view is breath taking and a table with a view must be requested and it will make the dinner experience worth it. The entire experience can not be under estimated and although it will turn out to be pricey; it will be worth it. Our waiter was knowledgible, professional and friendly. I requested my steak medium and was done to perfection as it sat on a line of hot stones as it sizzled. This is a must do restaurant.

title: Love this place, planning my third visit
comment: I absolutely love this place and would go more often if only you didn’t have to book 4-6 weeks in advance. The experience starts with the trip up the escalator which is exhilarating and the views are stunning. The food is always absolutely amazing and the waiting staff very attentive. Sushi is brilliant, quality of the fish and the rolling very good. Can’t wait to come again!

title: Amazing
comment: My favourite restaurant in London the food and the service was fantastic the drinks were really nice and a massive selection also the views over London were unreal. Highly recommended it’s also a great place to have a drink this is normally where I start off.  PS The lift is a experience in itself.

title: Outstanding
comment: Well sometimes it’s impossible to put into words the experiences we have in life and this is one such occasion. Though I struggled with the glass elevator, I’m so glad that I did! The food was exceptional, with absolute attention to detail. The service and the knowledge of the waiting staff was second to none and the views were incredible. I cannot wait to experience this absolute gem of a place again. See you soon!

title: Door Security Ruinet It
comment: Booked this for one of my bosses, who just came back and really annoyed and offended with the security staff on the door. They searched her bag on entry and instated she threw out her bottle of water. She was late to meet a client. The security guard was rude, told her that was the policy, she had to throw it away or she wouldn't be allowed entry, pointed at her and made her feel really embarrassed and angry.  She had to walk down the road to the nearest bin to throw it away. When she came back she had to be searched again.  When she reached the restaurant the host asked how she was and she explained her experience downstairs, they replied saying that is not the policy. The restaurant experience was lovely but the check-in ruined it. I won't book her there again.

title: Very nice
comment: Really nice experience. I had a great view of London from my table. The food was lovely and I love my sushi!  The staff were very friendly and attentive. I went mid week so there were a lot of business meetings on the tables around me.

title: Super fresh ingredients, delicious & beautiful
comment: We came here with my girls to celebrate my birthday. The only available time was 4:30pm, which i thought sucked, but how mistaken I was! Honestly this was the best time to visit this place, because you get to experience it in daylight and sunset - BEAUTIFUL! Atmosphere When you get to the 38th floor by super was elevator you're amazed how high you are! There are two areas of the restaurant one is bar (split between two floors) and the dining area. Bar area that was on the same level as dining hall was quite crowded as you would expect it, but dining area was very spacious with glass windows all around, so the view is stunning. I also loved decor of small light bulbs hanging from the ceiling and when it got darker the room turned into a magic place. There are couple of balconies where you can go, enjoy the view and take nice photos. I absolutely loved the tree with lights - God how beautiful it was. Really something magical and well done to the designers. Food We were four and we ordered 4 types of rolls, 3 miso soups and scallop ceviche to try. it was plenty of food for all of us. Also left space for dessert - I went for beetroot flavoured dessert (Samabeet), my friends chose chocolate cake & banana cake and Welcome to the rainforest. I loved my dessert as it was unusual to try and it was delicious. My friends thought that chocolate and banana cake was a bit too sweet. Sushi were perfect. I especially loved California maki, which was made with actual crab meat and not crab flavoured fish meat/stick. This roll came with truffle oil sauce and the combination of crab meat and this oil was an absolute delight. We also ordered Ezo maki, Samba London and Unagi Maki. Scallop ceviche was too small to share, but we just wanted to try it. Too sweet for me, but depends on what you like in favour combinations. The scallops were raw, but incredibly fresh. I had many ceviche in my life and to be honest I have had much better, but as I say it is a matter of preference. Drinks I had crushed mango drink, can't remember the name of it, but loved every bit of it as I like mango. I had non alcoholic version and tried the same with alcohol, but it was was too strong for me so was happy with my choice. Service I really enjoyed how polite were waiters and how much attention they dedicated to guests as it really added to the experience.  Price Yes - it is expensive, you are 38 floors above the ground after all :) However it is well worth the money as food was really, really fresh. For 4 people we paid £188 inclusive of service charge and drinks, so not so bad. Cons We ordered drinks together and they were brought first for two people and then after 30 minutes to other two, which i found quite strange. So to have a toast for my birthday we needed to wait until everyone had a drink. But I think there was some kind of a mess up in the bar, which caused the delay. There were two waiters who served us food. The first one just came and left the food on the table, we started to eat and then the second person came to explain what each dish was about. To be honest I was expecting this to be done by one and the same person rather than when we're already eating and someone is coming to interrupt and explain the dishes. The whole experience would have been much better, because I was surprised why the first waiter didn't bother to comment anything on what he brought. Also dessert was brought to us when not all people where at the table, so ice-cream on top of the cake was melting while some people got back to the table from bathroom.  So this element of service definitely needs to be improved as if restaurant is charging so much money for the experience it needs to deliver up to price. Especially knowing that people are willing to wait for many months to get a table. There are definitely enough waiters on the floor to observe dining dynamic of each table and provide high class service. Overall recommendation Definitely go and choose for your special occasion or simply treat yourself. I will definitely come again and hopefully service will be improved. and thank you very much for a little macaroon with the birthday candle - it was a nice touch!

title: Great food but pricy
comment: At the 38th floor you’ll find a very stylish restaurant with a spectacular view over London city. Food is great, very tasteful but pricy. The outside terrace is great during summer time.

title: wonderful
comment: Omg What a wonderful outdoor patio! I found the hostess and bartender to be all smiles and welcoming (*eh hm* unlike the 40th floor restaurant, which we escaped due to the cold reception we experienced). Anyone can take the elevator up to the 38th floor here to grab a drink at the bar - no rezzo's needed unless you want to dine in. Warning - that elevator ride is crazy fast and dizzying! On a lovely day or perhaps as the sun is seeing, it is nice to be out on the patio bar under that beautiful lit tree.

title: Great view with tasty dining
comment: Amazing place on the 38th floor , very nice and elegant The food was very tasty on well organized plates  The service was very good, nice and kind atmosphere

title: Expensive and dress code discrimination
comment: Very nice and friendly environment, amazing cocktails but quite expensive. I must say the discrimination I experienced when it came to the dress code was enough to never go back again! Although I've been to this place 5 times because of the lovely view, having dinner and lunch the security guys at the entrance didn't let me come in because I was wearing black nike-sporty shoes. I totally understand that and I agree. But unfortunately someone else with apparently more money, wearing suit with white sporty shoes was coming out at the same time. This is so unfair, unprofessional and I'm sure nothing like that is included in the policy of the place.

title: One of the best Place for the view
comment: In couples or with friend I recommend this place that will be magic for the view and also for the dish and good music .. house more or less deep and the magnificent of the wall the entry and the decoration is the place to be !

title: Perfect
comment: Perfect view, cocktails and service. The design of the place is amazing and the service is excellent.

title: Sad, Shameful & Frustrating
comment: Can staff be more rude? Can a restaurant care less of customer? Can you meet all of these these while dining at a supposedly high end restaurant? Then you are in Sushi Samba.

title: Amazing view but not the best customer service
comment: Came here with 3 other friends to have dinner. The restaurant is absolutely amazing, has an outstanding view especially during the night, but is to fancy. You'll see people dressing very smart and elegant as you have a dress code to get in.  At the beginning, one of the waitresses was really nice but when we order a couple of things just to try she became a bit rude, I imagine it was because we didn't order the most expensive dishes which is a shame, at the end it doesn't matter if we look rich or not, if I go to a place like this is because I can afford it and I expect a good customer service. The second waitress was more kind but we were already disappointed. About the food, some dishes are quite expensive and we decided to try 3 different types of sushi, moqueca, and other dishes. Although the restaurant is nice, I've had better sushi and desserts for much less.  You should go and try, every person has a different experience in the same place. Unfortunately, I will not be coming back to this restaurant.

title: Very Hot Place.
comment: You MUST be very punctual. We arrived 7mn late due to the traffic, our reservation was gone. We had a drink at the terrasse for 45mn and we got our table. I was very Zen, so it was ok. The food and service are good, very good, but the view is spectacular.

title: One of my best view of London
comment: One of my best view of London, amazing place and very high level service. The food is fine, but so much for the price you pay. We went for lunch on Sunday and we paid £50 for a plate of maki and a starter per each, without wine. The quality of sushi was good but not excellent. Basically you pay the view and the place. I recommend to go there once to enjoy the amazing rooftop and the stunning view.

title: Vegan menu
comment: Visited Sushi samba on a saturday evening for a special occasion. We loved the whole experience, and ordering from the separate vegan menu is always handy rather than scanning through the whole regular menu. We had a fab corner window table, and all bar 1 dish we received we absolutely loved. It's always refreshing when the vegan items are given as much care and attention as the rest of the food! The nigiri / maki selection in particular was incredible.. the £4 for fresh wasabi was a bit ridiculous considering the price of the dishes it should be free of charge..  The lychee and mango cooler cocktails were to.die.for! Even if you go for drinks you will have a wonderful time, it's a shame the terrace wasn't open but it was a freezing cold night.  The toilets are the only place where they could have been improvement - they were dirty, dark and so cold. For somewhere where people are regularly spending into the £££s this really needs to be addressed. Would love to see their vegan menu be expanded further and we would definitely return!

title: Great view but the food not.
comment: You must be punctual with your booking. Over complicated and additional of unnecessary sauces and mayonnaises.

title: Great view and great food
comment: For an upscale lunch , great vibes, amazing view and of course delicious food, sushisamba is just perfect!! The food was delicious, the service was great and the vibes were amazing! Only down side were the restrooms because they weren't clean honestly! Other than that all was amazin

title: Very Good Sushi and Great Service
comment: Nice view, great food and great service at a reasonable price! Outdoor sitting is still closed due to the weather conditions. It's a great place for a special occasion. I love the interior of the place. Requires reservation.

title: Peanut butter
comment: I like peanut butter. I really really like bimishu. And peanut butter. I love acqua gas 50cl and bimishu with peanut butter inside. Peanut butter❤

title: Fabulous views ridiculous price
comment: Travelling to the 39th Floor to the incredible views across the City of London and beyond is the best experience. And the light, clean lines of the dining room means everyone gets to see the view. But we arrived, having booked lunch, to 'no gas' which meant half the dishes on the menu were off. No compensation offered and the waiter suggested he put a meal together for us of different tastes which was indeed stupid as the 6 dishes he chose (in fact we now count 8 on the bill) came to £144. We asked for tap water and got a costly bottle + two glasses of wine and some Saki - the total bill with service came to a staggering £247.50. For lunch. And that was in a restaurant full of smartly dressed waiters with a kitchen that wasn't working properly. Difficult to justify and they didn't seem to care that we couldn't choose the dishes we wanted. Very disappointing indeed and stupid as we live in London and entertain guests in restaurants frequently. Not there, sadly.

title: Beautiful Sushi
comment: Thanks for an amazing evening, the food was incredible as ever and the atmosphere was fantastic. First time I’ve been in the evening and the views are just stunning with London all lit up. See you again soon!!

title: Amazing view and amazing food
comment: Expensive restaurant on top of Heron Tower but worth every penny! The view from the restaurant is stunning, the wine selection was excellent and the food was absolutely divine. The presentation of the dessert was incredible and I'll definitely try to come back as soon as possible

title: Fantastic veiws
comment: Amazing views and great cocktails. I’m not a sushi lover but is was beautifully presented and I liked the hot selection. We arrived a little late so sat at the counter which was great watching them prepaid the sushi a few dishes weren’t available which was a shame. The cocktails however were delicious and inventive a fun place to eat and watch.

title: Spectacular
comment: Location on the 39th floor of a skyscraper with a speed elevator worth the visit. Excellent food and service. Ambience very well curated and designed. Outside bar has a spectacular three and a fantastic view. Prices are higher than average but perfect for a special occasion. Highly recommended!!!

title: No sparkle
comment: After having a great experience in NYC we are excited to visit the London branch. What a disappointment! Other than our waiter who was pleasant the staff were all quite miserable and in some cases too cool for school! Environment felt temporary, as if all the fixtures could be moved out in a day. Bathrooms dirty. Entrance underwhelming Food however was very nice, but so it should be at that price! Loved the Toro Sushi

title: Complacency has set in
comment: Upsetting experience on entry, arriving at 1.45 for a 2.15 reservation today (Sunday 18th Feb) encountering the very rude cloak room lady - snapped at me when passing her our coats and when I commented became very confrontational and aggressive in front of my young children - unacceptable behaviour overshadowing what should have been a special occasion to celebrate my daughters 14th birthday.  Improved with excellent bar service and cocktail bar person. Then on taking our table, we were somewhat confused by the very onerous “it’s all about Samba Sushi and not about the customer” RULES on how we were allowed to spend a significant amount of money with this restaurant - with 2 children we were not allowed to order 2 of the larger/expensive and 2 of the smaller less expensive set menus as the whole table had to have the same - a rule without any logical reason or justification as of course, if we had separated and seated on different tables this would have been OK - I offered to put the children on the next door table to make the point. So although the food was pretty good and the service was timely, we were left with that feeling that the restaurant believed that is was bigger than the customer - complacency derived from location and with the competitive nature of the London market, one that usually comes back to bite you on the sashimi. A very cold dining experience leaving us feeling uninspired and not likely to repeat or recommend.

title: Outstanding
comment: Amazing atmosphere, nice view, great service...what else? Such an amazing restaurant and bar! If you don’t eat sushi, there are different another dishes.. I’ll come back surly!

title: Will definitely be returning
comment: I visited Sushi Samba recently for drinks with some friends. We didn't book but as we were not eating we didn't have an issue getting in.  The views of London in the bar are absolutely outstanding and well worth visiting for, if only for one drink. Drinks were pricey (£14 per cocktail) but were delicious and the service was excellent.  The decor is fantastic and the place has some great photo opportunities. It is well worth a visit and definitely offers something a bit unique for an evening out.

title: Amazing food amazing atmosphere great service
comment: I have heard a lot about Sushi Samba and finally I was going. so we arrived and up to the top we went. The views to start of with are amazing and then you are greeted with the tree, which its self is impressive. We were there for a friends birthday and the atmosphere lively and fun. The food was great the service was amazing Sebastian our waiter \ manager was brilliant even when we were a bit drunk he was taking pictures of us as well with us, He was funny and he really made our evening more enjoyable than it would of been any way. We had such a great time and look forward to going back....

title: Love going back
comment: Ok I’ve been here about 10 times, yes it’s not cheap but it’s the wife birthday. Booking was easy getting in was easy as someone just looked in my bag (a bit of a joke but he needed to do his job) The girl on the clock room was just rude!!!! Ok the the main event food and wine great great great views over London

title: Better than the hype
comment: I've wanted to come here for a long time, as my boyfriend is half-Peruvian and we also love Japanese and Brazilian food - I was slightly worried it wouldn't live up to the hype but OH MY it does! For starters the view is just incredible - even on a rainy day in January. Staff are impeccable and it has a lovely calm, yet vibrant atmosphere.  We were recommended to have 6-9 dishes, and we got 6 plus a little platain chip aji amarillo snack to start - this was actually more than enough food.
