We thought the portions would be smaller, but most were actually very decent - the smallest was the taquitos, but they were absolutely delicious. By far the best ceviche I've ever eaten, and the best Pisco Sour. Cocktails are to die for, would come back just for those! The desserts were actually really big - mine could have done the two of us, again, surprising portions for this kind of place. It is pretty expensive, but worth it for a bit of a treat. Every single thing we ate was mouth-watering, we were so impressed and will absolutely be coming back!

title: Wife's Birthday Treat
comment: I brought my wife here for her birthday last Friday. This venue has all the WOW factor you could possibly want for a special occasion. The difference here is that beyond the WOW the substance of this place keeps delivering. Sensational food, great, imaginative cocktails (please try a Cheeky Monkey!). A chilled vibe, an amazing view but above all brilliant service. 10/10

title: Great food. Unacceptable service
comment: We went there for my daughter’s 19th birthday and we were visiting from the US. It’s a beautiful setting and all the food was amazing. We were greeted by a cold hostess who kept us waiting for our 5:30 reservation. We ordered a couple of rounds of drinks, starters, sushi rolls etc. At several times during the dinner we waited for 15 min for the next course or even three glasses of wine. At 90 minutes in the waiter told us we had 30 min left. Now we felt rushed and pressured to order dessert, eat and pay the bill. This really put a damper on an otherwise good experience. If they need to turn tables faster they just need to speed up the service. It’s that simple!! Why piss off the paying patron?? The bill was over $300.

title: Well worth it, if you can afford it
comment: Tried to book valentines two weeks ago with no luck so went with Monday 12th at 4:30, that was the best time for the next two weeks, this place is crazy busy. It is also very expensive, but please don’t let this put you off, we spent the entire evening there and were shocked when we realised it was 10:30 and had to run for our train. The food is mostly good, the “samba London” was actually bland but the tuna saviche was sublime, so much so that I wouldn’t let the waiter take it until I had every last drop. For desert we had “welcome to the rain forest” (pictured) actually from some part of Peru and was amazing, absolutely Devine. The staff were really nice too, professional but kind hearted too. My wife didn’t take to the female staff but he-ho. Will definitely go back, when we have saved up again. Ps. The bars here are great too, also pictured. Thank you sushi samba see you soon

title: 40th Birthday Visit
comment: 5* view 3* for the staff. Took my best mate for her 40th birthday. Loved the view, the tree on the terrace and the setting. But the staff all seemed rude, no one smiled, very broken English couldn’t understand me. I had not poured my drink out of the bottle, when I went to the toilet and came back someone had taken my clean glass away. I asked for another from a rude woman, my request was dealt with, with no warmth or apology. We ordered drinks at the bar. My friend was told by the same rude woman that she takes orders from the table so my friend sat down as she had already ordered anyway. Then when she bought us the drinks. All of three foot from the bar she charged us for doing it. We were told that we needed to move from our table as someone had booked it. They gave us 10 more minutes. Finally when we moved we went back out on the terrace. When we finished our drinks and went back inside the table was still empty so we could have finished our drinks no problem. I guess this place only caters for people with more money than sense. As I wouldn’t want to spend a massive amount of money in a place that don’t treat all people well.

title: Excellent at all
comment: Awesome view all over the London, great ambience, delicious food and lovely staff. My husband took me there to our date :) and it was one of the most romantic date we already had! Bravo !

title: Amazing pkace
comment: Amazing view on all the city!!! Beautiful atmosphere, a little chaotic but really nice! Food is good but nothing great

title: Wonderful view and amazing orange tree
comment: Went on a date night in January, sat by the window overlooking the East side of London. Spectacular view. Food was above average but nothing too special comparing to other Japanese restaurants. It's on the expensive side but as expected with the view. The atmosphere is great - good for a special occasion or if you want to be a bit fancy. Went for a drink on the balcony bar area outside near the orange tree, there are fireplaces and blankets to keep you warm. Very romantic place. At the end we also found there is a hidden corner opposite the bar indoor where you can oversee the shard, which offers great photo opportunities.

title: Good views and ambience
comment: SushiSamba offers good views over London and an eclectic variety of Japanese/South American dishes.  Service and food quality were both good, however starters and mains were all delivered together, and the meal felt a little rushed.  Good for a quick business lunch, but perhaps not for a more leisurely afternoon.

title: Great for a cocktail!
comment: We never remember to book a table either here or at Duck and Waffle, so we just go up for a drink if we are in the area. It's not cheap, but the atmosphere is great. It's trendy and modern and has spectacular views over the city on a clear night. The cocktail menu is vast and the bar staff are very knowledgeable and helpful. Perfect for a date night!

title: Good atmosphere, delicious sushi.
comment: Very good atmosphere on top of a tower building with very good city view. It's a kind of jet set place of London. Very difficult to find a table for dinner time. But if you can have it, probably you will like it a lot. Sushi is very good, both rolls and nigiri. Other main courses are above average. Service quality is good. Quite expensive but it has value of money.

title: Average service + food
comment: Been here twice both summer and winter. The food is OK not great or better, with the current pricing they offer, there are much more better choices available in London. Service looks pretentious but they have no idea what they are doing. On my both experiences, they forget to bring my drink but already included in the bill, which is not good. Staff at the bar mostly clue-less about their alcohol menu. The interior is quite shabby and needs a proper maintenance and cleaning.  It is another London rip-off venue basically, if you are living in London don't bother. Their aim is to charge foreigners or daily tourists as much as possible as they would probably never come back again.

title: Romantic dinner
comment: I don’t have any word to describe this restaurant; simply the best... if you want live an incredible experience this is the right place;

title: Fine dining sushi restaurnat with a gorgeous view
comment: While visiting sushi samba that sometimes needs reservations I advise you to book before coming. The sushi fine dining restaurnat offers a wide range of sushi with a gorgeous view. The restaurant is known the Kobe beef they have but it’s expensive to have, also the staff are welcoming and very friendly and professional. Enjoy! Highly recommend it to all!

title: Sushi samba on your tastebuds
comment: Great place for our family reunion. Food was fantastic  Service was really excellent and wine list was plentiful Views are stunning. Book as the sitting fill quickly But the 545pm sitting is fine and you have ample time. Yum.

title: Superb bar and restaurant
comment: Had a family night out in the cocktail bar and then the restaurant. The bar team made outstanding cocktails including classics not on the menu, and were really friendly and professional. Great Perfect Manhattan made by a lady whose name I missed.  We were then looked after at the table by Florian, who was an excellent host all evening and was well on top of my son’s gluten free requirements. Food and wine were faultless and the ambience perfect for a great night out with spectacular views over London by night.  Well done to the whole team and thanks. We’ll definitely be back.

title: Absolutely lovely
comment: Great atmosphere, great view, great food and drinks and great staff. Had a great time and ate till we popped. Can’t wait to go back.

title: Expensive but very good
comment: I would recommend the food there and the experience. Fusion Peruvian/Brazilian/Japanese food and lovely staff. You are on the top of a big tower so you an enjoy the view. You should be ready to spend 60.- per person at least if you don’t consider ordering the very expensive kobe meat.

title: It's nice, not over the top. But very nice
comment: So we went as a group to Sushi samba and although I wasn't blown away, it's a nice occasion with excellent service. Food wise it certainly ticks many of the boxes you look for in portion size, quality and cost, be sure to have a sharer platter as you get great variety and it certainly is not lacking in portions. The steak and the black cod were excellent and perhaps are best shared between 4 or more people, it is a costly meal and you will find yourself full up having eating the sushi share platters!. Don't let your eyes be bigger than your belly in here as the whole menu will appeal to you if you enjoy this kind of Food! It's perhaps better suited to warm days if you are going in the afternoon as you can enjoy the outdoor terraced area with a cocktail beneath the big red tree, unfortunately it was bitterly cold on the day of our visit so we stayed at the table which offered little benefit of the panoramic view. (If you are visiting London be sure to book in advance). I would like to see this venue at night as perhaps it will have more of a buzz to It, it seemed a little flat in the mid afternoon but perhaps at night in the summer when people enjoy the terrace area for cocktails that will kick it up a notch. If you want a nice venue with a view of the city, somewhere for lunch a little quieter than perhaps some of the more high street style restaurants, this will do just nicely. I would visit again for sure, at night in summer next time though!

title: Fantastic
comment: The restaurant and bars are set on the 38th and 39 th floor so spectacular views of london . The food , service and decor are equally spectacular. If you don't understand the menu ask the staff they are so helpful . For our party excellent value for money in a spectacular setting. The open balcony area allows smokers to stand admiring the view next to a beautiful lit up tree . A lovely evening but essential to book early

title: Eat here today . Main course like fishing your lucky to catch anything in dish
comment: Just the truth,  1 great starter , 2. Mix up on 2nd starter ,  Now for the main £34.00 for a soup , they put aload of sauce in dish and finding the food is like the lottery  Your odds are very low , mix up on starters , bad service , nice staff but no excuse , once in a life time is enough  Shame but this is a truthful review on a very expensive visit , don't bother if you like great food not just a view . This is my truthful review

title: Amazing view, standard food
comment: We have ordered some sushi-rolls. Want to point out that rolls are little, you need 2 or even 3 sets to have a normal lunch for 1 person. Meal was just normal, won't say these were best sushi in my life, they were just ordinary. But still price was rather high. The price for dishes could be easily explained by location of the place. The view is great, espexially if you are lucky to sit by the window. We really enjoyed interior of the main hall and open terrace with, decorated tree out there looks gorgeous.  Romantic evening in Sushisamba seems like a good idea.  Service is fine, everybody were polite. Table should be booked beforehand, and you should be right on time.

title: By far the best bar in London
comment: Exclusive for a reason. Amazing views, hospitality and fun. Staff such as Janice make this the place that everyone should go to for an epic evening

title: Best Sushi
comment: The sushi is so tasty and fresh here, I would recommend it to anyone. You also have the benefit of the amazing views, fanatic atmosphere and great staff

title: Dinner with Friends
comment: Great Restaurant...but prepare your wallet! no discussion aboit the quality and service but the portions size are small!! but in advance specially during weekends. After dinner enjoy the skyline rooftop bar or walk into Shoreditch to finish the night

title: Pleasant Anniversary
comment: Surprised my partner for our 2nd year anniversary as she is a lover of sushi. The food, service and waiter were all great, view was spectacular, the only negative is the outside bar only had the one bartender and there was a few customers waiting.

title: Sushi sambas
comment: Was taken here for my birthday by my wonderful husband. Absolutely Fantastic food!  Couldn’t fault a thing, the atmosphere, deliciously fresh sashimi and Cocktails so luscious.  What a memorable evening.  Bring a credit card!!!!

title: Not going again! Make sure you have an ID!
comment: We went to this bar and restaurant to celebrate birthday with group of 4 girls... We were the only 4 that they asked for an ID, although many other younger looking people went in without any confrontation. I feel as if we were questioned as one of the girl in our group was hearing headscarf. I felt really upset that security treated us really badly, asked us to wait on one said then next minute wanted us to stay on another side for an hour in freezing cold. Just for an ID of a 20 year old who looked over 25 according to all other customers who walked through. We managed to enter after having a long discussion with the manager. When entered the environment was not welcoming due to strict rules and securities all around the bar. So at least the manager was understanding. Not visiting again.

title: You can just go for a drink but that will also cost you
comment: Yes you dont have to book a table and eat. There are 2 bars and you can just go for a cocktail like we did. Venue is beautiful BUT service is rubbish. At the doors we were greeted by moody blond. Standing there with her arms crossed and long face. “Drink or dine”? We answered dine and she just pointed at the bar “here”. Woah curb your enthusiasm girl. If you dont like your job - someone else will. Same goes for latino barman. Who acted like superstar on centerstage. Lucky we were served by his colleague. Yet still...Sushisamba will charge you 12.5% service charge for getting your own drink standing at the bar ?! Have you ever been charge service charge for self-service? The venue is nice. Ideal instegram photo opportunity. Beautiful views. Great venue take your special someone for treat. Comes with a price tag.

title: Sublime food and wonderful service.
comment: Magnificent food, coupled with lovely friendly service and views to die for. We tried a variety of small dishes which were all perfect...great wine list too. Staff lovely (bringing me a lovely cup of green tea which I had not requested, for my sore throat!) Will definitely be visiting again on our next visit.

title: New favourite family restaurant
comment: Came here with family for birthday celebrations. Children under 18 can eat at the restaurant but cannot linger in the bar areas. The food was great again. Picking different Brazilian/Japanese plates to share between the table works well. The miso black cod is amazing and did not disappoint. The views are great. If you are a table for two you can get window views. Larger groups slightly more difficult. The quality of the food is great.

title: Birthday Treat
comment: Amazing experience at SushiSamba. Incredible cocktails, sushi and meat dishes with a superb view. The service was outstanding and the quality of the food was worth every penny. Loved it and cannot wait to go back!

title: Share to get the full benefit
comment: Firstly, make sure you bring the good credit card out, because to fully appreciate the fusion of Japan & Brazil you’ll need to load up and share. Three of us shared 9-15 dishes, getting the max from the exquisitely prepared dishes from the most excellent chefs. Black Cod is a triumph  Service is impeccable

title: Good food and nice view
comment: Celebrating GM birthday as long side with company manager dinner, located in the middle of the floor with great view.  Food wise- nice sushi and starter Well look after the light out the evening. Everyone have a lovely dinner. Dessert, Apple with vanilla, way too sweet.  Love it overall, highly recommend

title: Memorable
comment: Went by this place three years ago when visiting London, having Sushi SAMBA in Miami beach as my reference I didn't expect it to be that fancy. The guard did not let me in of course and said I have to make a reservation a few weeks ahead of time. December 2017 - visiting London again, remembered the last time and made reservation in advance, confirmed the reservation 2 days ahead as requested and was still not at the list when er arrived at the time of reservation. Luckily, I had the email confirmation and we were let in and compensated for not being on the list by being seated next to the window. The place is exquisite, just walking there was so pretty, and the view from our spot...oh wow! Then the food was superb, the service was excellent and the drinks were precise. though expensive worth the money for special occasions... would defiantly come back.

title: Loved it!!
comment: All the staff was great from when we came until we left. The food ( a lot of dishes) was utstanding. Strongly recomendate this. An as bonus you have the view...

title: Amazing
comment: Amazing view across London! Delicious cocktails. Wasn’t sure what to order so the bar man was very helpful and recommended a cocktail based on my preferences

title: Disappointing
comment: Considering how difficult it is to get a booking and how expensive the food it, the quality was truly disappointing. If you’re a sushi aficionado - don’t go. You’ll be server absolutely beautiful but tasteless sushi...

title: Must go
comment: Amazing view, nice atmosphere and excelente food. Ask a waiter’s recommendation. They know what they are doing. Before you can have a drink. The martini passion fruit is delicious (not in the menu but you can ask it). If you haven’t book a table before, try to ask a place at the balcony. The same food and also you can see the food preparation. One of the best choices: sashimi with truffle sauce

title: Over rated restaurant for the quality of food and service
comment: Went there December last year, a few weeks before Christmas. I must be honest the food was okay and the service was okay, but I felt something was missing and I would not be honest if I rated this higher than 3 stars. Just felt they wanted us in and to get us out asap...just did not feel great or relaxed, yet I have heard so much about this place, I was slightly disappointed.

title: Nice but not amazing.....feels like I've paid for the views!
comment: So, I have been meaning to go to this restaurant for a while (been there for drinks only in the past and also been to Duck & Waffle) and I was left somewhat a bit disappointed. Is a beautiful restaurant, nice friendly staff (specially the host at the door downstairs - he was super friendly, welcoming and bloody funny) and the views were amazing. The food was good but maybe my expectation was a bit too high for this place. Did I like it? Yes. Did I love to make me want to go back asap? No. Great place to go on special occasion or to impress clients, but I do have a feeling that I've paid more for the views!

title: Back again
comment: Great cocktails at great views. Drinks on the experience side but made perfectly. Accidentally given the wrong cocktail. No big deal the cocktail given tasted really good. Will definitely return. Only issue is dress code policy does not seem to be enforced by all. Why bother having a dress code if it is not going to be followed.

title: Outstanding
comment: The food ambience and the view is outstanding. The lobster Taquitos, samba salad, churrosco, tiger maki are some of the real good dishes. Excellent a must.

title: Amazing food no compensation for rude, pretentious staff
comment: In October 2017, my boyfriend and I chose Sushi Samba to celebrate our anniversary. However, even before we arrived, we were not looking forward to our visit as much as we should have been and, sadly, things did not improve. The customer service (or lack of) we received from the reservations team prior to our visit was awful – they were far from helpful and frankly, rather rude. The ‘welcoming’ staff at the bottom of Heron Tower were anything but welcoming: when we arrived, we were asked whether we had a reservation to which we answered ‘no’ (our name was still on the waiting list). We were asked to step aside to let other people in, which confused us because we were the only people at the entrance. We did as requested and, after a few minutes, were directed to the lifts.  We arrived at Sushi Samba’s reception and, as our name was still on the waiting list, we were given a table at the sushi counter (we were happy with this). Things improved when our waiter introduced himself (sadly, we didn’t get his name) – he was very polite and friendly. The only downside was that we were rushed to order and our food arrived in record speed. The reasoning behind the lightening service became clear – we were presented with our bill and asked to pay immediately because the seating time at the counter was a maximum of one hour. Neither the reservations team, nor the receptionist, mentioned this – it was the icing on the cake. The food was great, but the service completely ruined our evening. Manners, and customer service cost nothing, but go a very long way. I recently had lunch at a well-known French rooftop restaurant in the City – my experience could not have been more different. Sushi Samba could definitely learn a lot from the staff at this restaurant!  Following our visit, I wrote an email directly to the reservations team to provide feedback on our visit. I received a response and was told I would be contacted by Sushi Samba’s management team to discuss my concerns – three months later and I’m still waiting to be contacted! Needless to say, we will not be returning to this restaurant.

title: Best serviche ever!
comment: I went here with a client last week for the first time and was given a table round the edge, with fantastic views. It is worth noting that it is set up so that the smaller tables for two get the tables round the edge, which in the evening during sunset are exceptional viewing spots.  We were both on dry Jan, so can't comment on the alcohol but we made up for it on the food. We had the squid, two serviche dishes, the black cod, the samba london rolls, Ezo rolls and the smoked eel sashimi. It was hard to pick a winner, as all of it was delicious and perfectly timed in terms of delivery. The tuna seriviche was probably the tastiest thing I have had in a long time, but the black cod came a close second - the texture was delicious and it just fell apart. Great spot for a date night, but it is very expensive!

title: Romantic night out
comment: Food was great. Service was spot on. We enjoyed delicious Bulgarian wine and really tasty sushi. The view is amazing!!! I totally recommend evening visits and the restaurant wasn't too busy after 9pm. Although it's a bit pricy, it was totally worth it for enjoying a very romantic night out.

title: Not going back
comment: Food is the superstar in this place. Service is the lack that has a lot of room for improvement. Went there for my cousin’s birthday that came to London to celebrate.  At our arrival we were sat from not very smiling receptionist and after approached by this runner/waiter (you cannot really understand who is looking after your table as you have many different people approaching you and asking you to order). However water was served and asked the waiter 10 minutes to take the time to order. Few minutes late a girl came and took the drinks order, a glass of wine and 2 cocktails. The wine was delivered after 2 minutes and the cocktails were delivered after the food was served. After 15 minutes we were looking around and eventually a different girl approached and asked if we were ready. Ordered and the food was delivered pretty quickly to be honest...but as I said cocktails were served after that so at that point we could not even make a toast so we waited to have the drinks while food was on the table.  Pointless to book a table in this restaurant if you are celebrating a birthday as the little gesture with the candle was brought at the table after the bill was dropped and my aunt was wearing her coat already.  Thanks to the kitchen, food was delicious.

title: Great views and food
comment: Had a late lunch at Sushi Samba and tried to best prawn tempura I have ever had. The views are breathtaking and the food amazing. It's quite pricey but totally worth it!

title: A must visit
comment: It’s a very classy restaurant with a very professional staff in terms of welcoming , serving and all related aspects. One can not forget the imaginary view , being on the 39th floor is something that cannot be missed.

title: Breathtakingly beautiful
comment: Booked a couple of months in advanced and it was so worth it!! There is a bar on the lower level and the restaurant on the upper floor. We ordered from the Omakase menu which is like a taster menu costing £80 pp excluding wine. It was a fusion on japanese and South American food so so so glad that we did as we got to experience food that we would not have normally picked. All of it was so good esp the temporal green beans with a truffle sauce. There was so much food all of it came out on time and was exceptional. Service was phenomenal, they were friendly and attentive, the only downside was that where we were seated ( quite far to the back) I kept getting bumped by customers and staff walking by! But I saw a few people ask for free tables by the windows which is what I will do next time. This is a must go to place if you are in London and I can’t wait to go again!!

title: Best restaurant we've been to!
comment: Amazing views of London and beautiful atmosphere. We stuck to the South American meaty dishes (we'd had sushi the night before somewhere else) and loved everything we ordered. We even ordered two dishes again!  Fabulous service and great recommendations from our waiter.  We would absolutely recommend this restaurant as a must visit in London.

title: The star of this restaurant is the view
comment: I think this must be the only restaurant in London that gives you incredible views from the lift, bar and the restaurant. The lift just takes you to the 38th or 39th floor in the blink of an eye. The ride would have been uneventful if it wasn’t for the fact that this particular lift is glass, and hangs on the outside of the Heron. The open terrace is the best place to sit and and enjoy a sunny day. Those looking for the best of views and drinks would certainly enjoy. The ambiance is worth the price you pay. The real star of SushiSamba isn’t the design, or the service, or the food. It’s beautiful London. While making a reservation, mention that you would like a table next to the window. Bar at the 39th floor opens after  6 pm. Terrace offers you beautiful views so during summer time is the best place to visit since Sushisamba has the highest open-air terrace in London. Food was tasteful, though sushi-purists may say that the sushi is not spectacular. I was quite happy with the food and the cocktails. I would come back here again. Recommended!

title: Wow - amazing place
comment: We visited Sushi Samba for a friends birthday. The staff could not be more courteous. Fabulous atmosphere with breath taking views across London from the 38th floor! The food was delicious and we love the tree and outdoor fire pit! Definitely worth a visit - we’ll be back soon!

title: Great service and lovely view
comment: I went there a few months ago for a work lunch. The service was great and the food tasted delicious. Not to mention the view as it's at the top of the Salesforce Tower. Would highly recommend but your need to book quite far in advance

title: All great - except food is so so
comment: Service is fantastic. The views and setting stunning for celebrations or special ocasions. But the food is really not great at all. What a disappointment. Oh well, as per my various restaurant reviews this is not uncommon in London: grand decor, lots of buzz, good service, fancy restaurants serving mediocre food. Too bad because Nikkei food, Japanese fusion can be amazingly divine and extraordinary (I suggest Dinings for example). Yet, the views on the 38th floor and the whole atmosphere are part of the offering. So go for drinks or for the experience, not for the culinary part of SushiSamba.

title: Incredible views but take your wallet
comment: My sister-in-law recommended Sushi Samba as where she takes her Japanese clients and once I saw the dishes sailing past knew why. Each one is designed like a work of art, with a couple of guys getting a dish of assorted sushi that looked like beautiful petit fours. We had the lobster and yellowfin tuna taquitos which were delectable and the spiciest, crunchiest salt & pepper calamari ever.  We finished with the recommended Peruvian dessert Alfajores which featured a caramelised toffee-style sliver, a ice cream scoop and a chocolate covered cake. Diners included a Peruvian(?) family, romantic couples, business types and ladies who lunch. Oh, if you're afraid of heights (luckily I'm not) you may not wish to face the view from the street-facing exterior glass lift... Not a cheap lunch by any means, but it's not that often you experience this.

title: Loved our meal!
comment: We are vegetarian and our meal at sushi samba was definitely the best we had in London! Loved everything about the place, the ambience, the food, the vibe, the views except the STAFF attitude! Thats my reason for giving them one star less. They were snooty to a different level.  Coming back to the awesome food, the veg salad was a like a piece of art on a plate and tasted equally delicious, the taquitos were great, the charred carrots with quinoa was beyond delish and the veg sushi was good too! we had 2 of their desserts which are fab as well. I am definitely going back to sushi samba for a meal on my next trip to London. Hopefully by then they would have mellowed down on the attitude

title: Too good to be true..
comment: Heard many good things about Sushi Samba so thought i’d give it a shot as love sushi! Headed to London for a weekend of birthday celebrations with my other half.. We arrived 15mins beforehand as required (9:00pm - table booking @ 9:15pm) we got greeted & headed up to the 38th floor, a warm welcome & showed where to go to let the staff know were here.. i checked in with the young girl & she told that our table would be ‘a few more mins’ which was fine, due to working in this industry myself i would a expect leeway time here & there.. but having to wait 15mins for a table that you book 2months in advance in place that seemed to have a great review just didnt seem to match up with me.. hesitating around i went to ask them again how much longer our table would be still in the response i got ‘a few mins’ i could see they were busy, but to be told the same thing once being told on arrival wasn’t okay. Waiting 30mins by this time i could see other people around getting agitated too.. my other half & i decided to take a wonder around the bar outside to see the view was worth the top floor .. still no table ready for us when we came back in .. they knew we had checked in so i again going to ask & to speak with someone higher, a manager perhaps .. though no-one seemed to know what was going on, it wasn’t until i made a point of mentioning how long we had waited (45 mins) they then decided to give us compliantly drinks & snacks on the house (which this never even happened) we were still left standing being told ‘a few mins’ quite funny people coming in after just seemed to walk in & get a table?! A night that had been planned & looking forward to was a night that was not worth it at all. After FINALLY being seated 1hour & 15mins later we got no apology for the delay .. the food was okay nothing to exciting & over priced for what it was really worth.. £120 tasteless later if i’m honest. Such a shame, a night worth more hassle for what it actually was. Don’t recommend unless your willing for rude staff & a night full of nothing.

title: New Year retreat 👌🏻
comment: Went with family to this really nice restaurant and enjoyed it so much. The food is very tasty especially the hot sushi, the view is breathtaking and the staff is very polite. The elevator that took us to the 38th floor has amazing views of the city. Definitely a "going back again" destination!

title: Good fusion sushi with extraordinary view
comment: I visited this restaurant with my girlfriend for dinner. The impact of the panoramic lift and the view from the top is certainly amazing and perfect for a romantic evening.  Unfortunately our table was not directly facing the windows so it is possible (even when booking 3 months in advance) not to have the full skyline view. Besides I didn't expect so many big groups of people but this may have been an unlucky night. We had 3 sushi courses and one veg tempura, all of which were served with care, good ingredients and very peculiar flavour mix. Prices are of course higher than the standard, but fully justified by both the view and the quality food.

title: Amazing food and view
comment: Excellent food, original cuisine, spectacular view and elegant ambience Appropriate for dinner  Offers open air terrace

title: Great for drinks
comment: I went for my birthday dinner as well as a few times for drinks only. I truly recommend the bar area, great cocktails, view and decor, it can get quite busy though and it's sometimes hard to find a sitting area if you're in a group. However if you go for the food, I think it's a bit overpriced as portions are very tiny and you'll have to order a lot to have a satisfying meal. The quality is top notch though and staff is nice and helpful.

title: Good food, nice place but a bit overrated
comment: The place is one of the best in London, the view is just wow. The food is ok, not the best in my opinion. The presentation of the dishes is really nice. The service also is good. Recommended at least for the view.

title: Great views and food but terrible service
comment: The whole building is designed to give a great experience for diners however, upon arrival at the restaurant reception I stood in front of two staff members who were having a conversation. I waited patiently for them to finish and they proceeded to ignore me for about one minute, there was no acknowledgement to advise that they would be with me in a moment so I went through to the restaurant myself and found my own table where my friends had already been seated.  The table itself was wobbly, and so we asked the waiter if there was anything he could do. He kindly put a coin under one of the table legs however it didn't have much of an effect.  I think considering that this is supposed to be a high end restaurant you should be welcomed at the reception and the table's shouldn't be uneven. Last night was a real let down .  I have been to sushi samba a few time but I won't be in a rush to head back.

title: Fun Night
comment: Only there for drinks. Good view and ambience, but the service was a bit too long for a bottle of champagne.  We couldn't get a table for dinner, but definitely will try to rsvp one when we're back in London.

title: Only atmosphere and view
comment: People in the door are extremely unhelpful and rude, the availability between restaurant and bar confusing and the food poor for its reputation and very expensive. What is good is only the great view and good atmosphere

title: Nice lunch, not sure I will be back often
comment: Went there for lunch - had sushi, 2 cakes, a cocktail and some wine. It is definitely over priced for sushi and you risk spending a lot...but if you are careful you can have a solid meal with a nice view and pleasant flavours. We spent approx £160. Service is a bit scarce - you need to chase them for your order it then they leave you alone. I will only come again if it’s for a special occasion of bringing people from outside of London to have a view. But I will point out that the view is better if you go as a couple as they will sit you next to the windows if you are.

title: Amazing experience
comment: Amazing experience on the 38th floor. Cool music, nice people and a wonderful view. Best sushi we have ever tasted; special in its own way. A little bit expensive. Open on Christmas day!

title: Stunning views but expensive
comment: This place is great if you like views of London, but you can do it for free at Sky Garden. We paid £180 for 3 people - no alcohol or deserts. This was somewhat above what I expected to pay considering the small portions. The quality of the food was ok, but I have had better Japanese in London a lot less. The dishes were well presented and flavours were good, but not outstanding as one would expect for the price. Service was ok - the waiters were generally friendly but I did ask for our table to be wiped down twice. It hadn't been by the time we paid up. In summary, I'd recommend this place if you really want to impress someone with a cool setting and amazing scenery, but not so much if you are a foodie or looking for value.

title: Fantastic food, but at a high price
comment: My family and I went to Sushi Samba to celebrate my brother's graduation and boy, was it one of the most amazing lunches I have had!  The cocktail menu is exciting and innovative, using less common spirits like sake as the base to create some really fantastic flavours. The food, as it advertises, is a balance between Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian cuisine. The best way to make the most of their fun and delicious menu is to choose several plates between you and your friends/family, and dive in!  And before I forget, the views are amazing. You can see out across the whole of London. We went in the afternoon for lunch, but I am sure that the view is equally great when all the city lights come on at night. The only drawback is the prices. This is not a good place to visit if you are on a budget or don't want to spend too much, which makes it fairly inaccessible as a restaurant unless you make a lot of money on the regular, or want to celebrate an important occasion.

title: Amazing views and prices are too expensive
comment: The dishes are decorated and have an interesting and unique combination of flavors. But sitting is not pleasant due to poor acoustics. On the other hand, the view from the windows and the balconies is worth every minute. prices are too expensive

title: Beautifully done up
comment: It was my first visit to Sushi Samba but I must say I fell in love with it. It’s spread on two floors i.e. 38th and 39th floor which has the restaurant and the bar respectively. It provides a magnificent view of London city. With beautifully done up indoor and outdoor ambience this place has a vibe which can cater every genre of persons from businessmen to families. Known for its Sushi and its cocktails. Staff is very courteous.  Would recommend a prior reservation for definite seat else one can enjoy at the bar.

title: Amazing View - Don’t go for the Food
comment: If you want to visit there for an amazing view and atmosphere it’s the place to go. If you want good sushi find somewhere else to go. For what you get it was way overpriced and the service is pathetic. We were 2 couples, and our friends food came about 10 minutes before our plates arrived. They forgot part of our order and then tried to give it to us as we were about to leave and of course they tack on an automatic service charge which we had removed.  The restaurant is one floor below the disco club which pounds out booming music the entire time. You can’t talk to your friends without having to shout. It’s a place to go if you are rich and want to be seen but don’t care about the quality of the food.

title: New Year's Eve - Stunning
comment: Celebrated with my husband NYE and we were so thrilled. Fantastic level service, great food, delicious cocktails, live music, samba dancers and these views.... definitely worth to spend every penny! We will come back to enjoy a la cart experience.

title: The best thing is the view........!
comment: The bar was three deep with people waiting to order drinks from the two bar staff manning the bar one of whom was the rudest bar person I have come across. When I had the audacity to ask for something other than what was offered I was told "No", and the three choices were repeated back to me again, with slightly more attitude the second time a bit like how you would talk to a small child! The food was bland, the service slow, sent one dish back and told them I did not want anything else as it was so bad, and was offered no compensation for the inedible plate apart from the reply, "we are having a problem with the squid". This observation was at least accurate!

title: Amazing view
comment: Good food stunning view great cocktail and ambience what more do you need Btw geting lift up stairs is expirience itself

title: Excellent sushi
comment: We visit this restaurant on December of 2017 and it was really nice experience. The sushi was excellent because it was really fresh and tasty. The view from the restaurant is amazing because you will have the chance to see London from above. Its a expensive restaurant but you have to go once.

title: Absolute Disgrace
comment: I arrived at SushiSamba, attempting to have a quiet dinner for two. The doormen asked me if I had had a drink beforehand (which i had) and so refused me entry. I found this totally unacceptable considering I am a regular customer at both SushiSamba and Duck and Waffle. I have now decided to take my business elsewhere and will inform the rest of the London insurance market about my unacceptable experience.

title: Stunning Views
comment: Arriving at SushiSamba you are vetted by a doorman and once through step into a glass fronted lift that takes you quickly to the relevant floor. The bar is very trendy with an outside seating area if weather permits and you are just having drinks. The bar was expensive and we were charged £45.00 for two glasses of champagne which turned out to be a mistake and was refunded. The restaurant has fabulous views and the food is excellent. will definitely be back.

title: Disgusting service
comment: After numerous visits to sushi samba me and two friends were refused entry on the basis we had 2 drinks prior to visiting , the rude and arrogant door staff said they had a alcohol usage policy and would not allow us to come in , que 930 on the Friday before Xmas and we had 2 drinks prior to going in , none of us were drunk and i have never been refused entry to venue because we had 2 drinks prior to arriving ! Avoid this place at all costs

title: A canteen feel and staff attitude to match
comment: We were having high hopes for this place (booked in late October) as we made a Boxing day habit of dining at the places with great views over London and I must say this place was the worst of all such places in terms of service, food and general feel. The staff downstairs pretended to check my bag as we entered the premises but gave up after looking at me and then we took the lift to the 38th floor where Sushi Samba is located.  Indeed the place has some good views over London with limited views from the Tree bar area or even parts of the restaurants and bar and as we were asked to wait we ordered our cocktails in the bar area assuming the restaurant will be packed. Some 10min later we were taken in a two thirds full restaurant and placed at the first table you see when you enter the restaurant being told we will be moved to a window some 30min later!!!???? I knew straight away that something was off as soon as the staff told us that, as I could easily see free tables near the window as people who were arriving were placed straight away there, probably because the European staff assumed these touristy looking people would be higher tippers? We ordered 6 dishes (after trying to make eye contact with the staff several times but they kept looking away despite passing right near us) and even my partner who is normally easily pleased with everything did not like any of his food, either because the dishes were too small, too salty (or not having much lobster in the Tiquitos) - he said is the worst London Japanese restaurant he ever dined in. As we arrived home he had to start eating again as he was so hungry. The management moved us to a corner table in the end (having some Chinese girls near us who did not order any food or drinks but kept texting all the time and were still texting as we left!!!??), after complaining of having my chair hit by people coming and going all the time............. I could not even touch the headache inducing Champagne they offered. My partner removed the service charge imposed as the fake smiles the staff gave us, the slow management response, the terrible food and poor settings did not impress us. Maybe when packed with suits this place looks more interesting, however in holiday times this place looks more like a canteen packed with people that make you check your belongings all the time. Interestingly, as we left, I noticed another couple was set in our initial table despite most of the tables in the middle and even the ones near the window were empty: what is the staff doing in this place? Surely this would come across as strange to lots of logical thinking people.  Strange place and staff taking for granted the busy position they have in our city.

title: Amazing bar!
comment: We went to Sushisamba bar to try their cocktails while enjoying amazing view of London at night and it didn't disappoint! Cocktails were masterpiece, service very helpful and professional, and the view -just wow. Decor is fantastic, very elegant yet cosy. Music is very cool and the levels are perfectly suited for talking without the need to shout. I will definitely be back.

title: Wonderful Event Restaurant
comment: This is an expensive place but worth the visit. The glass express lift on the outside of the building takes your breath away and that’s just the start. Amazing views, two outside eating areas, 360 degree views inside and the whole of London seems small beneath you. We had a late lunch and watched a breathtaking sunset & saw all the lights of the city appear. The food was exceptional, it’s very rich, so don’t over order. Even with 3 teenage boys we couldn’t finish it. The service was really good too. Don’t bother with the cocktails - they’re expensive @ £13 and were really unpleasant (apart from the lychee one)

title: Did not disappoint !
comment: After reading excellent reviews, went here for my girlfriends birthday. Everything was fantastic , the food, the service and the ambience was ideal. Will definitely return on next special occasion.

title: Corporate business group of 10 business men refused entry despite paying £500 deposit
comment: I reserved a drinks table for 10 people on the 27th November arriving between 2300 and 2330 for My friends and business colleagues . The deposit was £50 per head so £500 pre paid in total . I received an email confirmation of the booking and payment  Upon arrival at the door we were informed by a very impolite doorman that he had no record of our reservation - he asked what time our booking was for I said 1100 - 1130 At which point he enjoyed informing us that he worked to strict 15 minute Windows for appointments and we had missed our booking so we could not enter and again reminded me that he had no record for our booking .  So I showed him the email I had received that day confirming the £500 deposit and the booking - the doorman was not really interested in reading it and again reminded us in a very arrogant aggressive manner that we had missed our booking for which he had no record  My friends and I were polite at all times and shocked about the attitude, mannerism and aggressive nature of the doorman who did not want to listen to the fact we had an email confirmation and pre paid £500  At this point having stood in the cold and facing a ruined evening my mobile phone rang - it was the manager at the restaurant asking if we were still coming !!!! I advised the manager that we had been stood outside trying to come in for 15 minutes and also rude doorman of the call - at which point he looked disappointed that we were actually telling the truth !  He went inside in a strop and spoke to his manager - and then came back outside " Mr Brennan why you didn't tell me you had booked a drinks table " once again in an aggressive tone .  At this point I had enough and walked away from the situation in dismay and utter disappointment . I lost £500 deposit . My guests advised me that the same doorman was extremely rude to other couples and guests refusing entry .  Despite me emailing the restaurant I have not received an apology - not even an attempt at contacting me.  I can only imagine how many other people have been treated in such a way

title: Sizzling Sushi Samba
comment: High above Bishopgate on the 39th floor in central London, Sushi Samba comprises a large open room with an adjacent veranda and a small bar. The restaurant accepts reservations 2 months in advance, and we were able to reserve a table at the floor-to-ceiling windows because we booked weeks ahead of our preferred date. The food is basically Asian fusion with a strong Japanese influence. The menu offers excellent choices of small and large plates, and all our food was well prepared and delicious. Fortunately, servers are extremely well versed in the menu and our server was able to offer suggestions, all of which were excellent. Despite its high ceilings, the restaurant is quite noisy and, at times, it was difficult to hear our server. Yet, we were fortunate to be seated at the windows so we could enjoy the spectacular views of London below us. This is a terrific restaurant and we hope to return the next time we are in London.

title: Great views-but nothing else
comment: Sushi Samba is one of my favorite places to go to in London, only for the views. I love the Shard as well, but Sushi Samba offers seating outside so we can enjoy the views more. I ate here last night after years and I must say the quality has gone down for sure. The drinks are amazing, vibe is great, but I think the management has really lowered their standard slightly. People are now allowed to walk- in, in casuals clothes and shoes, which was not the case earlier. Worst was- last night, in a group of 4 people sitting on the next table, 2 of them got so drunk that they were extremely loud and actually fell off a chair. I've never seen such behaviour at such a place before and I don't understand why the staff never gave them a warning.  The food service is great- all out dishes came in less than 10 minutes. But they can really improve the quality.  I will keep going to Sushi Samba, just because I can't get enough of the views-will probably avoid the food next time.

title: Disappointed with service
comment: I sent people there all the time but I need to say I was really disappointed by the service, barstaff doesn't look at you, takes people before you without apologising. There was only one waiter that really had fun in his job the (I am sorry to group it) 'oriental' looking boy, he recommended things with passion to guests and enjoyed it. The venue is nice unfortanetly the service in the bar is not great.

title: Go for the views
comment: This was a very interesting experience - after the body check - the bloke really thought I had a gun in my crutch - the lift to the restaurant was fast. The music was fun and captured the mood of the restaurant wonderfully. the narrow corridor to the bar area was rather dismal - and the bar looked oddly amiss. I suspect in high summer this is crowded and active place and the option of eating outside highly prized. The staircase going up to the next floor made the seating area behind awkward to access - but the staff were friendly and co-operative. They scored highly, especially the bar staff. The route into the restaurant passed a very colourful wall but the dining area was a huge disappointment - loads of grey and glass. I suspect the many ceiling lights made this atmospheric in the evenings, but during the day it was dead. The food was fabulous - the portions tiny, the presentation beautiful and teased the eye and the service fine. However the cost of the food was stratospheric - never have I seen such excessive prices. Wagu beef at £1,000 was one option we by-passed. Beer at £7 a bottle was toppy - it all felt incredibly mean. Clearly the S S brand permits this, but I would avoid this place like the plague.

title: Wow…………
comment: Last minute recommendation...so we tried.  Our guide had been there before .. just the lift up to the top was exciting enough ..never been vertical so quick!!   Stunning views of London lit up over the Christmas period the Gerkin next door looking awesome...  The decor the views the prices were all spine tingling .... Never been quite to a venue like this 4 cocktails and a bag of crisps plus a bowl of cooked edamame beans in soy etc very lovely £71…eek!!   The views from the outside ....a large bar, smoking area with a huge tree lit up in shades of orange yellow and red..the views weren’t as brilliant as they could have been as you were facing away from the city....not a downside really as your senses had already hit overload from the journey up your entrance and your very excellent cocktails and tasty nibbles....  Gotta try it…

title: Lost its Mojo
comment: I took my family on Sunday 3rd December for lunch. The third year running we have celebrated my son's birthday at Sushisamba. I am afraid this will be the last. We had a fairly good meal but a combination of stratospheric drinks prices, food that was marginally below the standard of previous years and really very average service made this a disappointing experience. The staff were all friendly and helpful, particularly the Sake sommelier and our initial waitress who mysteriously disapppeared, however the number of times we had to look around and wave to attract attention to order more drinks or food or get the bill or get the bill paid was ridiculous. The odd thing was that by about 2pm the restaurant was not that busy and there were certainly plenty of staff about but they all, managers included, seemed to find the computer screens at the main desk more interesting than the requirements of the customers. Each year we have spent between £100 and £150 per person and for the first two left happy, expensive but still value for the quality of food and service as well as the wonderful location. This year I think we probably spent less, not because we were watching the cost but because it simply did not flow. Not terrible, but nowhere near good enough for what Sushisamba aspires to be despite the location.

title: Great lift, poor service.
comment: The place is stunning on the 38th floor in the center of London but the service was really poor. Really impressed with the lift climbing 38 floor in 38 seconds with a stunning view of London. The bouncer told us our shoes weren't fancy enough (Stan smith / NB casual shoes) so we had to go straight to the restaurant and couldn't go the bar (fair enough). We had a reservation at 20.15 but we had to wait in the middle of the bar for 30 minutes. They didn't apologise or thanked us for waiting so long when we finally got our table. We ordered and waited another 40 minutes to get our food (still no apologies). One of us was feeling sick and couldn't eat much so we asked if we could take some food home but the waitress refused. We felt a bit pressured to order drinks, appetizers and more food although we had already ordered almost £100 worth of food for three people. The food was good but nothing that justifies the prices in my opinion (even taking in consideration the stunning location). I can't help but compare it to German Gymnasium (similar style) where the service was impeccable.

title: Don’t bother
comment: I have been to sushisamba a number of times with friends and taken clients here. However. I won’t be coming back. We was out for a family members 60th birthday. And I thought to top off the night after having an amazing meal at the ivy city garden. (Which is just around the corner) we would head here. We got in the queue and was looked up and down and told we couldn’t enter. Not because of over crowding but because we we’re to intoxicated. I mean. Really after spending the night in the ivy. We were kicked out there? So after ruining what was a brilliant night. We ended up at the shard gong bar. Don’t bother going here. It’s not worth the hype and the customer service is dreadful. Just go to the shard instead!

title: Amazing sushi in london
comment: Refined food and amazing choice of sushis. The restaurant offers an amazing view over London and the surroundings. The staff is very professional. Top star restaurant.

title: Probably the best Sushi with the best views
comment: It took us a month to get a table reservation at Sushisamba, as we wanted the window view. Having arrived at 930pm, we were greeted very professionally at the gate, and were led to the elevator- -which was actually a lot of fun, zipping up fast to the 38th floor. (you will have to pop your ears!)  The main dining hall is an impressive room, with high ceiling and dim lighting. The views were to die for and we spent an entire 15 minutes just figuring out where London's main landmarks were.  For dinner, we had salmon ceviche, lamb chops and sushi. I don't remember the particular name as I was invited for dinner.  Sushi: the most amazing ones I've had so far. Entirely fresh, delicate and full of taste. I could taste each and every element of the sushi.  All in all, a wonderful experience and am definitely going to make this a regular visit each time I come to London!  Well done to the entire team at Sushisamba!

title: Brilliant birthday
comment: Visited sushi samba London for the first time for a family birthday. The waiters were the right amount of attentive and very knowledgable.  The food was absolutely delicious. I highly recommend the black cod fish and the prawn tempura dish, we had to order more!! The atmosphere was buzzing and we had a fabulous time.

title: Great food, service and views
comment: Went for lunch today with a friend and again Sushi Samba delivered. We had the sushi selection for 2 (picture attached) and a number of Sushi rolls. All of it was presented beautifully as you would expect and tasted great, we were absolutely full by the times we finished. Service was excellent again as you would expect and great views over London from the restaurant. The place isn’t cheap but worth every penny, highly recommend.

title: Dinner last night with friend
comment: I made a reservation to eat dinner here with a friend, and we were not disappointed.  The service was fantastic, Ramon was superb with recommendations. The Pisco sours were lovey, and our food.. 5*. You have to order at least 2 of the samba rolls (they come in 8 pieces). We chose el topo and the Californian maki, which were both delicious. The wagyu gyoza and ceviche scallop were great too! We also shared a robata plate: poussin, which was tender chicken in a teriyaki sauce.. yum! Dessert was a highlight, we got the chocolate banana cake which was swimming in maple butter, and we ordered the alfajores.  For the fantastic service, premium location, great decor and superb food, the price was surprisingly reasonable (under 200£ for 2). Another important thing to note, it is not loud in here like Nobu London, so you can actually converse without shouting. Can’t wait to eat here again soon!

title: Walked out...
comment: After visiting sushi samba a few years ago we had high expectations for my birthday meal. Unfortunately poor service meant this was the first time we have ever had to walk out of a restaurant.  We were seated at our table and after the waiter explained the menu we ordered some plantain chips while we decided what to order. Half an hour later we were still waiting for the waiter to come and take our order and had not even been asked if we wanted to order some drinks (this is a particular problem when you’ve been given a strict 2 hour time slot for your table). At this point we decided to inform the manager we were leaving. We spoke to 2 managers on our way out, one of whom eventually offered us a round of drinks but by this point the experience was ruined.  Since I was last here the service has really gone downhill and unless they sort this out we will not be returning.

title: The best sushi
comment: I was happy to get a sit in a bar and experienced outstanding vegetarian sushi, excellent view and awesome service!  Will definitely be back! Highly recommended.

title: Birthday meal
comment: Arrived early to have cocktails we found the bar very crowded with no place to sit and constantly jostling for position to order drinks, bar staff were great very friendly and great choice of cocktails, shame the outside bar was not open. Our table was ready on time, with a window view as requested on booking ,the tables were far too close together for a high end restaurant. At request our waiter picked us a taster style menu to suit our palette and budget, however the space between dishes did feel a bit rushed and sometimes had two courses at the same time which didn't allow us to enjoy the food as much as we would like. Position sizes were huge!! Which for us as a couple we felt it was a bit of a disadvantage as a over kill on the same flavour on some dishes. Overall the service was good and very attentive , the view was great, however I have had better Japanese in London. Would recommend more for groups than couples.

title: Amazing views and this time amazing food too
comment: Started the chilly evening with a bottle of bubbles outside with our orange blankets under the orange tree. A better visit than my previous, I think primarily because we chose our dishes rather than relying upon staff recommendations entirely. We thoroughly enjoyed all our choices, pretty much something from every section of the menu! Some lovely wine, with good recommendations from the sommelier.

title: The view is excellent, the service is nice and kind, the food delicious and the cocktails alone would justify the visit!
comment: Absolutely enjoyable: the atmosphere is great, the location is superb, the food very tasty and the even bigger surprise were the drinks: I would have dig back in a far away past to find memories of cocktails that have impressed and surprised me so favourably! Tom Yam (cocktail): Number one!!!

title: Disappointed
comment: I had a reservation for the restaurant, as I wanted to bring a friend of mine to a nice rooftop, and I have chosen SUSHISAMBA as I always heard it’s nice place..  When we arrived I’ve informed the receptionist that we wanted to have only a drink .. and not a meal, and told us that we could have sit at the bar, which was ok for us. So... Bar very tiny .. with only one side view and by the window it’s not possible to take a picture of the city view because there isn’t any space.  Drinks .. I asked if they could do a Moscow Mule (as I assumed it’s a high standard cocktail bar) which they’ve done, but it was very disappointed, it was vodka,ginger ale and a piece of lime, and charged me £13 + service. I haven’t mention anything.. but I was expecting a better drink and a better view at least.

title: Outstanding Experience
comment: The views over London are phenomenal. We made a booking for dinner so did not have any wait on ground level to take the lift up. When we got to the top, the hostess did ask us to wait as the previous table had not left as yet. This was the only negative part of the night as we had to wait and the hostess was not very friendly. We had a drink at the bar while waiting and then were seated at the restaurant. The service and food in the restaurant was really good. The fusion food [we only had the vegetarian food] was full of flavour and presented very well. The dinner was a bit on the pricey side [not fine dining, but more than mid-range], but the atmosphere and food experience was worth it. Later in the evening we had a few more drinks on the outside terrace bar [fortunately heated] which had a nice upmarket bar feel. Overall would recommend this for anyone looking for a good night out in London town with great food and vibe.

title: Excellent quality
comment: I came here for dinner on a Sunday evening, staying less than a mile away.  It doesn't take long to determine the quality of the sushi and the first two pieces I ordered told me all I needed to know. The mackerel sushi in particular was quite lovely. I also tried a wonderful Alaska roll and some very nice green tea. On the flip side the sushi selection is very limited. One other small negative - I used their website to request a reservation and never received a confirmation beyond an acknowledgement of my request. Fortunately they were able to seat me. In all a very pleasant visit that I'd be happy to repeat.

title: Best place in town
comment: I loved the view from above. The staff was great and really polite. Fabulous cocktails! A little expensive but worth it

title: Fusion with a view
comment: Had a lovely Friday lunch here. Loved the food - the lite bite starters are so good you may get full before any main - Lobster enchiladas amazing. If you do get to main - the Lamb was delectable.  Add to that the views 40 floors up and it’s a great venue for that special occasion.  Will go back.

title: Bit tired - could do with a refresh
comment: Wasn't bad, but wasn't the premium experience I expected. Food ok, service mediocre. Given the price tag I would have expected more.

title: Delicious Food - you won’t regret it
comment: Wow. It is such an enjoyable restaurant. The service is good without being pompous and the food is to die for. I would eat here every night if I could get a table...and won the lottery!

title: A must
comment: Had an absolutely amazing time. The bar area with the sushi kitchen on show was amazing. Such skill on show before even getting to your table was a unique experience and even tho I do not eat fish was amazing to see. We had an amazing table by the window with again amazing views of London. The food was great, fresh and full of flavour. I had the veggie option and I couldn’t believe the amount of flavour in a mushroom dish. Our server, lazlo, was so helpful in helping my girlfriend decide what dish’s to choose and was attentive and funny. His service made the evening all the more enjoyable. Thanks for a great night

title: Great concept , fun atmosphere
comment: Friend recommend you went there for New Year’s Eve . Suggest you book well ahead but we managed to get seats at the bar . Thought the menu was very original and enjoyed the sushi Prosecco was good value

title: Appalling
comment: Turned up 15 minutes early which didn't go down well - told to take a seat in the bar until our table was ready, except there weren't any seats. Waited, standing up in the bar and not one of the waiters or waitresses offered us a drink. Finally got shown through to our seats on time (yes, she made us wait until our allocated time had been reached) only to find the restaurant half empty - so the waiting for a table to be ready thing was just nonsense. Things went from bad to worse when we asked for the GF menu as it is genuinely appalling. I only booked here as they say they cater for gluten free and I feel ripped off. Asked if they could could cook cod or another dish similar to the blackened cod but got a resounding no. If it's not on the menu......... Don't waste your time on this place, overrated with badly trained staff. It's sushi McDonalds with a view, and even that is facing the wrong way. Bottle of wine £61, an inadequate salad and 6 pieces of calamari a further £50.  Disappointed.

title: Starters and main dishes are fab! But dessert was a dissapointment
comment: The arrival experience was not the best. It's raining and cold and they queue people outside to ask if there is a reservation (which we had). Can't they do it indoors?? The food was very good, except the Cod and the dessert. Service was very good given the fact that the restaurant was full.

title: Love the rooftop bar and lit up orange tree!
comment: Pressed our luck for early dinner on a Saturday night, there were no tables available, but we were able to sit at the Sushi counter immediately. They had a 1-hour time limit but did not feel pressed to leave early as we ran over a little bit. The waiter recommended several original options of the Brazilain- Japanese sushi and our taste buds were delighted! Fantastic food and cozy ambiance. The tree outside on the rooftop bar gave the whole restaurant a sexy orange glow. There were several places to sit and enjoy a cocktail and take in the view inside as well. The elevator ride up gives an amazing view of the city. Highly recommend this place, but make reservations in advance.

title: Absolute joke
comment: Talk about up themselves. Previous visit I vowed not to return due to rude and unhelpful bar staff who think they are above those they are SERVING. Only to return to be told my one rip in my jeans are not allowed despite wearing smart clothes. It's the 21st century. Worst place!

title: Wow!!
comment: The place turn to be "in" in London, up to the 38th floor with breath taking views, ask for a window table , reservation need to e mad in advance. My best Bloody Mary ever, well done, cooled down and not mixed. All dishes where superb in quality and taste, in deed a place to visit in London

title: Lunch in the sky above London
comment: Went here for a Friday lunch with my wife and student daughter.  The place was quite busy, but we were welcomed by an attentive staff and asked to wait in the bar, as we were a little early.  Our table was ready at our requested time with a great view towards south-east London.  Our waiter was very helpful in suggesting a meal combination that suited our wishes.  We had lobster tacos, Kobe beef sliders, lamb chops, sea bass and the most wonderful sashimi and sushi dishes ever.  The lunch was completed by a perfect coffee with sake.  After lunch we went out on the terrace on floor 38 to watch the sun set over London. Fabulous !

title: Small but cosy
comment: We stayed in a bar area outside. There is a very well illuminated tree in the bar area that is beautiful. I have not tried the food.

title: Must try
comment: Amazing food, great service and outstanding view on London. I have been there for a special occasion with my wife ... and it is really worth it. Great experience!

title: Pretentious and disappointing
comment: 0 stars if possible for this over-hyped and poorly serviced restaurant.  Tables weren't available for our business lunch (we were 15 mins early) and was recommended to get a drink by the bar. All seats taken so we walked to the outside bar area where it was empty in all aspects (including lack of staff). Thought someone would take initiative to ask us for a drink but alas. I had to go into the bar to pay for my £14 cocktails.  Weren't allowed to be seated at the table until the whole party arrived - considering we were still waiting for 6 people, pretty outrageous I couldn't sit at the table I booked, reasoning being the kitchen would think we're ready to receive food... at a half empty table? If our clients arrived first, how embarrassing would it be if they were turned away. Anyway overall table service average, forgotten drinks a few times, mixed things up, robata overcooked but sashimi decent (I suppose they only had to slice the meat). Shame as it was my first time and I was looking forward to this pretty renowned location. Definitely will not be returning with either clients or personally. For the price I pay, I can get much better quality food, drink, atmosphere and service pretty much anywhere else.

title: London skyline
comment: Visiting sushi Samba is an experience and a must if in London. It is a unique dining experience and fantastic to celebrate a special occasion . The food is good but nothing special , it is more about the unique view and experience . Have LONDON at your feet !!!

title: AMAZING
comment: we have been wanting to visit sushi samba for ages and have only heard great things. we were blown away by the whole experience. location and decor are second to none. and the food is out of this world! can't wait to visit again !

title: Really disappoinrdd
comment: Visited after having this place on the wish list for months, and unfortunately was very disappointed. The sushi itself was really bland in my opinion - it barely tasted in anything! I’ve had much better sushi locally. The tuna tacquitos were nice, and the edamame, but I didn’t really enjoy the squid, scallop ceviche or Sushi rolls :( little sad as I was really excited to visit.

title: What a fantastic lunch
comment: We were invited for lunch in Sushisamba and what a treat, the food, the service was excellent, I think that for what we had it's an excellent value, the vue from the restaurant you feel on the top of the world. The degustation menu is a fantastic selection and the all team make us feel special, I will be back for sure

title: Awesome cocktails
comment: We had several cocktails at Sushisamba! The bar person was super professional and took his time in making them correctly with with care!

title: Drinks in Sushi Samba
comment: I have been coming to Sushi samba for some time, however the staff in there just gets worst and worst. I have arrived for bday drinks and as we ordered the bartender did even looked bothered to take our order. When he did eventually it took about 15 minutes for the drinks to arrive, which was quite good for the amount of people in place. The view is incredible, but unfortunately it comes with very expensive drinks. We have paid for one round £70 for four people. And the drinks were even not that great. After that when I tried to pay and at the same time tried to have a conversation with the bartender he did not even care. Anyway the summary overpriced drinks with unfriendly staff but very cool view.

title: Lovley
comment: This place was so good I am struggling to find another reservation. Book well in advance. If you go in pairs you tend to be guaranteed a spot next to the window as this only accommodates twos. The food portions are good and money is well worth it. The view to the outside bar everything is amazing. Not a bad word to say about this place. A must go to place even just for drinks if in the area.

title: Dessert only
comment: My friend and I had a beautiful meal prior to our visit to SushiSamba. Ideally we only wanted dessert and coffee. We were told they don't usually allow this but thankfully they excused us for this instance which was kind of them.  The views are breathtaking and the atmosphere is amazing. Everything about the surroundings is amazing you just want to stay as long as possible. We managed to get a glimpse of the sunset which was left us lost for words. The desserts were nice but very tiny portions as with any fine dining places. It was lovely, tad over priced evening but was a lovely experience.

title: Beautiful views; great food & cocktails
comment: We've visited several times, always good service & delicious food. The views from the restaurant are incredible. Great outdoor area for drinks; beautiful tree in the middle of the bar adorned with orange leaves & lights. Classy venue, great ambience.

title: Evening drinks
comment: Visit just for evening drinks, cool setting with the lit up tree and scenery however I have Seen better views of London at other bars. Cocktails were amazing but be warned you get charged service charge for the staff to make it! Wouldn't mind if it was table service but this was not the case. Nice place to go just for a few

title: Poor service, great food
comment: Such a disappointment! This was not my first time and the last time I went to Sushisamba was such a special night that the service I received makes it even more painful. We were greeted by a stony faced hostess, who seemed displeased I helped her find my name on the computer screen. At the table our waiter was clearly in a bad mood and acted as if we were annoying him. When asked if the food we ordered was enough he snarled back “no” without offering any suggestions. He then proceeded to fill our glasses with water and splashing all around on the table.  A requested for some regular cutlery was received with an air of disdain and said cutlery was almost thrown on the table. During the meal, one waitress passing by decided to top up the glasses of water, not caring to ask if we were drinking either sparkling or still. The food was great and the venue is just stunning, so it is really a shame that they are let down by rude staff. I hope they get their act together soon.

title: A slightly deflated surprise celebration!
comment: Had booked the sushi Samba 2 months ago as a surprise celebration meal for my son's Uni Graduation family celebration. Had received a few e mails confirming that the reservation was fine but had to be at a slightly later time than requested as earlier times had already been booked. My husband and I flew in from abroad that day and arranged to meet my son and daughter for pre dinner cocktails at 20.15 hrs ( our table was due at 21.15 and we were reminded by e mail twice that we had to be on time or table would be given away). On reception we were told we could go into the garden area to have cocktails/ drinks etc which, we thought, would add to the surprise for my son as views were spectacular!! However, sadly we were greeted by 2 very frosty outside bar staff who informed us that there was no bar menu outside nor would they organise cocktails..... just beers and wine! (A completely different reception and story to the bar staff inside). Non the less we continued in high spirits and ensured we were back inside for our table at 21.15. After 5 attempts to get information from the lady at restaurant reception ( and made to feel in the way while waiting in bar area) we were finally shown to our table at 21.50 by a rather embarrassed maitre d who had been unaware of our situation. Fortunately the evening redeemed itself as the waitress at the table was delightful and food delicious. While I understand that Sushi Samba is a restaurant that Is in high demand ATM it saddens me that the elitist attitude of the outside bar staff and the lackadaisical attitude of the restaurant reception staff somewhat dampened what was supposed to be a wonderful celebratory ( costly) evening for us! Sadly, despite the great view and delicious food we were all somewhat deflated by the experience. Fortunately the graduation ceremony the following day was second to none :)

title: Fun and original experience, very daring flavours
