comment: The food was delicious and unique, with very daring flavours’ associations (yuzu, sesame and truffle, for example...) and beautifully presented. Very nice atmosphere, not uptight at all despite the standard of the food and layout. Friendly service. The lift ride is impressive, too. An absolute must-go for anyone who stays in London, but beware that the bill is hefty. The price, though, is well justified.

title: Very rude guy at the entrance
comment: If you'd ask me to rate this restaurant after my first visit I would have given it five stars, indeed I recommended this place to family and friends. I visited again after one week of my first visit, when I first was there I was very casual dressed and I did notice that everyone else was very fancy dressed therefor I decided to wear a dress the second time I visited, as I have a bad back I could not wear high heels and therefor decided to wear it with sneakers. Once we arrived we got greeted by a very rude guy at the entrance, he ask us several times if we had a reservation and after I agreed he told me that I should have checked the email. I said I did not receive an email, so he told me to read the email, I responded that I did not get an email, after 5 min I found the email in the spam and I read it. He was like did you not even bother to dress according to the dress code, I told him that I did not understand as I was wearing a skirt and a v-neck blouse. Another 5 minutes went by where he was just ignoring me until he told me that I could not get in as I was wearing sneakers (the same I wore the week before). Listen, I do understand that a client has to dress according to the dress code and if the guy would had told me friendly that unfortunately he can't let me in due to my shoes I would have understood- but this guy was so rude that I have to give this business 1 star. A SHAME.

title: Ahhhmaazzzing
comment: Absolutely stunning food, drinks, scenery, service and overall experience. Allergies and intolerances informed upon booking, with gluten free menus provided on arrival with excellent explanation of all food. Can’t wait for our next SushiSamba experience

title: Unforgettable
comment: That was awesome!  Excellent service & food with the best view on the rooftop.You must go there and don’t forget to make reservation .The place is amazing !!!

title: Fantastic visit to SushiSamba!
comment: My partner & I had our first visit to SushiSamba. We were greeted by friendly staff who was able to provide recommendations on which dishes to choose. It safes to safe that we wasn’t disappointed! The views are great and the service fantastic. I wouldn’t hesitate to return. Perfect for a real treat. Enjoy :) P.s try the Samba London rolls & Shrimp Tempura

title: Rude door men
comment: A group of young girls and I tried to gain entry to sushi samba and were told that I was too ‘drunk’... this came as a surprise to me especially as I was the designated driver and had not had a sip of alcohol the whole night.. and also as it was the first stop on our night out so the other girls had not had a chance to drink anything yet. The door men were incredibly rude. We visited on the 26/10/17 and the men on the door were poor judge of character and homophobic and sexist. The men they let in before us in the queue that were allowed in wee even surprised that we were not allowed in as they agreed that they were clearly drunk and we were not. Again we asked the men at the doors why we weren’t allowed entry ways and they were lost for words and couldn’t respond to our query of not being allowed in and could not explain to us why we weren’t allowed entry after I had told them that I hadn’t had a sip of alcohol. I am disgusted at how they treated us tonight, especially how they have let us in previously when one of us was parallactic, but miraculously was allowed in escorted by a male... this makes me believe that sushi samba is homophobic and I do not think that is ok at this day and age. I think it is beyond old fashioned and you should be ashamed in yourselves. You have missed out on valueable customers and I assure we will not be revisiting and I will be sure to tell everyone I know that sushi samba is rude and disrespectful and unprofessional. I would like to reiterate the fact that I am appalled at your customer service and I think as we are in the 21st century I feel as if you should be ashamed of our denial of entry as we could have been valueable customers who were willing to spend a large amount of money of which you have missed out on.

title: Spectacular view and friendly staff
comment: Can I start by stating that I am terrified of heights but mustered up the courage to take a trip up to the coveted outside cocktail bar. What an experience! What a view! That gold leaf tree is beautiful and worth seeing in person. The staff were fantastic and I had possibly the best cocktail I have ever tasted - Lychee cooler. Put it on your bucket list and take a trip, you won't regret it.

title: Outstanding food and service
comment: I came with my sister to celebrate her birthday. We were given a wonderful window seat and enjoyed incredible food (beef waygu is a must!) and cocktails (lychee cooler). Our server, Sergio provided outstanding service. He had amazing product knowledge and really made our experience unforgettable. Yannis on the bar also provided a wonderful, friendly service and the cocktails he made were delicious. All the staff were attentive, the food was out of this world and the views are stunning. 100% would recommend a visit.

title: Still operates terrible 12.5% bar bill scam
comment: Without the view this nothing of note.  Staff miserable and not interested, led my management attitude of ripping everyone off. The old conn of adding 12.5% service charge on drinks even when bought at the bar, no table service is still carried out here.  This practice is avoided by the industry now as it shows contempt for clients.... not here though !! I spent £260 at the bar, I queued and waited to boy my drinks and carried them back to my table each time, no table service. All the staff did was open fridge, grab beers and put on bar top in front of me.  When I asked for the bill there was £33 worth of service charges ! For what !!! It’s a scam Avoid

title: Great experience
comment: I have been there three times and I enjoyed it every-time. The food is elaborated and very taste. The view is spectacular and there is also a bar outside where you can drink an original cocktail. I like it and I usually bring in this restaurant someone who came to visit the city. It’s worth it!

title: Amazing
comment: Amazing as always. The kitchen runs perfectly thanks to the team. Wagyu gyozas 10/10 kobe churrasko 10/10 , moqueca 20/10  ❤️

title: Dinner
comment: Booked for an early dinner as hardly any availability. Service is really great and really enjoyed the food. View is amazing. Prices are quite high but expected

title: Stubunf
comment: There is hardly anything to fault with the place. Amazing food and views. Will return as I win the lottery.

title: Bestest time to this porch place 🙌🏻
comment: One of the best places I have ever been! If you wanna go out for a drink or brunch with your friends to a glamorous place then this is the place you must visit! So impressive so...beautiful so nicely decorated with an incredibly, unbelievably amazing view of the city that it literally overwhelmed me (in a good way always)!!!

title: Loved It !!!
comment: Amazing views of a beautiful city from the whole restaurant and outside space which is  great - they have a dress code so everyone is well dressed which is so rare these days! It could have been style over substance but it wasn't. The service was excellent and the food was just divine ! Everything we had to eat was amazing - cannot wait to go there again at Xmas - thank you.

title: Good experience but need to improve their services
comment: 5 days prior our arrival, we booked a table for 14 Guess. Nathalia The lady in charge of our booking was very nice and very helpfull and also shared a good recommandation. The D - Day will arrive à litlle bit early and we asked in case if our table was ready ! The lady in charge of The welcoming was very rude and answered your booking is at 9.30 pm so you have to wait ! At least , she could nicier rather than being agressive !  Finally we have to wait 1h30 Minutes because even at 9.30 pm our table was not ready and they did for 10 guests instead of 14 !  However , The food is a good surprise and very amazing ! The concept mixed Brazilian and Japan food is just impressed.  This is definitively a great experience that I could recommend to all of you even if you are not feeling very welcomed by the réception guest

title: Birthday Rups and Kets
comment: I was taken there for my birthday OMG what a place , a amazing experience and this place is so big. Get taken up in a glass lift to the 36th floor I think . Lovely food and service with a smile which always helps , not cheap at all it’s for sure top end party of 4 £668 includes two bottles of wine and a few drinks at the bar and coffees please note we did not have mains or desserts but loads of starters .

title: Awesomeness
comment: I took my family here last Sunday after making a booking. The elevator ride up was exciting. Great views of London city from 39 floors above. The service was excellent and ambience eclectic. Drinks were good and the food amazing. The quantity was sumptuous.  Great for special occasions. Will definitely recommend to sushi lovers. Will surely go back next time in London.

title: Best sushi in London
comment: Words can not describe this place , it was like a nightclub that's serves amazing food... if you are planning a trip to London you should definitely make reservations at this place.. you will not regret it!!!

title: worst service in London
comment: place is trying to imitate NY's rooftop bar but it is barely successful in doing so. And they still charge very expensive price for average drinks. We ordered several drinks and were standing at the bar. Mine fell when I tried to grab it (the bar was wet and gross) and broke on the floor.  They didn't offer to replace it.  When you charge 15£ a cocktail with so little alcohol in it the least you can do is replace it. I told the manager who saw it happening and didn't do anything. He said I received my drinks 15min before and after 15 minutes they don't replace the drinks ?????????!!!!!!! We just had them. We ordered for more than 100£ during the night (again, very expensive drinks), my drink was full (he could see my friends's drinks which were barely touched as we just received them) and wtf is that rule Will not go again. Astonished by the service. View is not amazing. Too expensive and not worth it. Rude staff.

title: "Banana fries and taco "
comment: Last night has been a great night, we spent a beautiful time and the bartender was amazing. And the banana fries and taco was delicious.

title: A great introduction to Sushi
comment: We went for lunch. There are great views from the 35th? floor. I had never had sushi before and the menu could be a bit daunting to novice sushi eaters. Fortunately I was with someone who had some idea of what to order. The waitress did offer suggestions however.  The sushi was excellent as was the dessert which we shared. This is not a cheap place to eat so be warned.

title: Style over substance...
comment: Views are nice, beautiful even at sunset but that’s it. Food is mediocre, blandness and lack of flavour of food that can’t justify such prices and too many checks from door to restaurant...one staff checking bookings and/or availabilities at the door to the building, pat down security check before the elevator, check for bar, terrasse or restaurant after exiting the elevator followed by another reservation/availability check 10 yards later after having passed the sushi bar lobby area. All in all, nice atmosphere for a friends night out and the views but sadly nothing else.

title: not the best value for money
comment: I spent a few hours outside by the bar on Sunday evening. The rooftop is breathtaking however bartenders and drink verrrrry average. I had to wait about 15 minutes for two drinks. Nah, it wasn't busy at all. Amaretto sour wasn't that sour. The bartender was lazy and she didn't have an idea that she should speed up. I'm a bit disappointed. The place would be one of the best venue in London, but the staff failed last night. ps I'm not that person who demands a lot.

title: great lunch and cocktails
comment: We went for lunch and the food was really good. We then drank cocktails by the outside bar; the view was lovely but the cocktails were average. Be prepared to spend a fair amount!

title: Not my favourite
comment: I wouldnt say that this is the best sushi in London. The views are quite incredible but the interior is looking shabby and in need of some attention. The waiter was unattentive and disinterested. I am not sure I would visit again.

title: Perfect birthday meal spot
comment: My girlfriend had booked this place for my birthday after I mentioned the fact they do Kobe beef, and even though that was the highlight of the meal for sure, everything was fantastic too. Great wine, great views, great service and a booming atmosphere in both bars and the restaurant area. Was just a shame about the rain. Make sure you book in advance, I'd also recommend researching the menu a bit before you go. PS the Kobe beef was an experience.

title: Too expensive
comment: Everything almost perfect except for the service .... They really need to talk each other ... Asked if I can seat outside and the receptionist says no .... But after the waiter moved us ....too much tables to much chairs we can barely move the arms ...  On the other hand stunning view of the city and outstanding and overpriced food ......

title: Amazing
comment: Amazing experience, top high location skyscraper in the City, warm ambient, nice food (and rare ie the yucca plate), good wine/sake selection, too cold the vegetables tempura. Service at the average.

title: Love this place!
comment: The perfect place, has a great view and the sushi is really nice. Went with a friend and really enjoyed this place. The sushi was delicious with good flavour. It was presented well and it wasn't that expensive. Out of all the things I ordered which was tiger maki, plantain chips and the chocolate banana cake without the alcohol the cake was probably my least favourite. It was overpriced for what it was but none the less the sushi was good. The view is amazing and would be perfect to watch during sunset. The outside bar area is very pretty too.  One annoying thing was I had to throw my water bottle away before going in. Would recommend this place for birthdays or a date night.

title: Amazing views!
comment: This is the perfect place for a romantic evening or for a birthday celebration. The views are amazing from the glass lift and then you can marvel at London from the rooftop bar with professionally made cocktails! I will be going back for sure...just need to remember that you will be paying at least £15 per cocktail so it could end up an expensive night but well worth it for a one off.

title: Horrific Door Staff
comment: Never have I been so poorly treated by door staff. Aggressive, rude and completely unreasonable.  Will not be returning and shall be recommending my company dine elsewhere from now on.

title: Bad impressiom
comment: It was a special night for me and my boyfriend and was around liverpool street, so I decided to show him this stunning view and also food as I heard good feedback from friends and colleague that used to work there.  I came in without a booking around 17h30 and asked if they had any availability.  As soon as we mentioned that we didn't have any reservation, the face expression changed, like if we were bothering them. It was really bad. Then they asked us if we were happy to sit on the sushi bar.. which we said we were.  From there, i didn't get it. They booked us for the Sushi bar or something, and asked us to wait on the right side. ( sushi bar was empty) we waited for a good 5 minutes standing like chicken in an empty bar. No sits has even been offered to us while waiting.  3 mins later we decided to sit and waited for any sign of life from the hostesses.  No one came to take our order for drinks.... empty bar as i said.  I looked at my boyfriend ant agreed to go somewhere else.  Not impress at all by the welcome. You must remember that Hostesses set the game of guest experience.  Will not even brother going there a next time... I looked like an idiot to my boyfriend after praising this restaurant. Shame as I am sure the food is really nice.

title: Disrespectful security at the door downstairs.
comment: It was supposed to be my 5th visit to Sushi Samba this year. I never had any trouble with getting in until last Friday. I was wearing the same sneakers (NOT trainers) as always and the security guard looked at me as if I was a piece of trash. " You're not getting in with these ones, sir! " Decided to go to Zuma instead and it ended up being an awesome night :)

title: Cool experience
comment: We went here as part of my birthday. It was quite the experience the service was excellent and the food was gourmet. We had a wonderful time. As you would expect this is all reflected in the price but it was worth it. My only small issue was the toilets were very very dirty which surprised us considering the quality of everything else.

title: Couple dinner
comment: I had the pleasure to pass by for dinner with my wife at this amazing spot in London where we find great atmosphere for our special occasion.  All in all was perfect crew,barman(Italian) with such a great knowledge give to us the right tips and help to select the right dishes&drinks.

title: For the price tag, this place should certainly deliver better quality!
comment: Fun food with a cool twist yet lacking the complexity in flavour one would expect. For the price tag, there are a host of other places that deliver better, but for the ambiance, the place is well worth it.

title: Oh My!!! What an Experience....
comment: This restaurant has obviously been built to wow people, it is superbly set out with glass all the way around giving one views from the 38th or 39th floor out over the whole of London from wherever you sit, whether it be the bar area, the outside bar or the restaurant. The first encounter was with the security on the bottom floor at the entrance, my advice is don't go without a reservation because they are arrogantly strict!! We whizzed up in the elevator, I'm sure it is jet propelled as I have never been in such a fast elevator! Once upstairs we sat in the bar area firstly for a drink and to admire the view and then were taken to our table. The hostesses were not the most helpful, and we had to ask several times to be shown to our table, they just kept looking confused. Once seated though the wait staff were well trained and very helpful with choosing dishes off the menu, and everything we ate was deliciously tasty and beautifully presented. The whole evening at SushiSamba is an experience to be savoured and enjoyed. I didn't see the bill so have no idea what it cost, but I will remember the wonderful evening out for a long time to come, it was very special.

title: Not what I expected!!
comment: Having been to the bar many times, we thought it be nice to impress clients with the restaurant. It is fancy but with the prices and not the food. Service felt like we were on the clock and before we were full, we got the bill rather then being asked if we wanted anything else. Like all these fancy London restaurants, it has a restricted booking policy and overly priced.

title: Very good!
comment: I like this restaurant so much! The food is good, but what I liked most was the view and the place, I think it's so beautiful, good music and it's worth it!

title: The best sushi I have ever had!
comment: Wow! this is a fabulous restaurant. The location is A1, even though it was an appalling day when we went. The sushi is the best I have ever eaten. Supermarket and other places like Yo Sushi given Sushi a bad name in my view. This stuff is nothing like that! Can't wait to go back.

title: Nice little roof top bar
comment: Just went here for drinks so cannot comment on the food. The terrace is lovely with a big tree covered with lights as the focal point. Also the elevator ride up is amazing as you see all the city lights of London.

title: Lunch
comment: They are very strict with footwear  it is expensive but the food was divine! So this makes up for the funny looks given by the staff when you are walking in!  It was £170 for all this food and water and one glass white wine for one person. If you are sight seeing around London then you are not exactly going to wear smart shoes. So I think they need to realise that people who dress comfortably still have money to pay for the food!  The view is great but you can just go for a drink at the bar and take a few pics if you want a view.

title: All the fuss is about the view
comment: I can admit the view was stunning but other than that, I did not find anything worth remembering. Even the interior could be a little more elegant. The cuisine is mediocre, don't recommend their special Kobe meat, as it tastes more like fat. Still, I think it is a great option for a romantic night out.

title: Based on my 1st visit
comment: We visited this place unexpectedly on late Saturday night and had an epic time. There was less queue at the door as well as the outside bar on 39th floor. However on my second visit on Thursday night to be served at the bar was a nightmare not because it was busy but the muscled tattooed bartender was so rude and selective of who he wanted to serve. He even told us not to occupy the two bar chair in front of him. Maybe he was reserving it for the single ladies.

title: Incredible place, amazing food!
comment: This is a truly phenomenal place, amazing views and truly incredible food, topped by wonderful service from really lovely staff who completely made our evening! Had a brilliant time and would recommend highly.

title: Atmosphere and view!
comment: Outstanding terrace bar with a massive tree at the center of the bar.Good cocktails. Good food, pretty and delicate decor.  Awful service, they lost my fur coat and didn't seem, at all, to be bothered about it, managed to found it after 1 hour and didn't even apologized for it... Over-priced as all the fuss is about the view!

title: Amazing views, great cocktails
comment: Loved the glass lift to the restaurant. Great views and seated area. Loved the quirky cocktails and the snacks. Staff were friendly and attentive. Loved the outside area too

title: Expensive – and terrible security staff
comment: We had a night at Sushi Samba London ruined by intrusive security staff. Multiple emails to Sushi Samba continue to be bounced back when trying to get their thoughts on this. Submission through their web contact form goes ignored. They obviously don’t want to hear feedback. The location is impressive. The food is lovely – even if so very expensive. But the security staff were the problem.  Getting in was fine. We had a reservation for dinner so front staff just checked the name and sent us in. If you don’t have a reservation I suspect you are running the gauntlet of whether they like you are not. Some other reviews on this site hint at that.  We had a drink at the bar waiting for our table. This was delayed so we were kept waiting in the bar for 20 mins or so, which wasn’t a big problem. Atmosphere in the restaurant was great. Waiters were very attentive. Food was lovely. Expect to pay for this experience though – it isn’t cheap. A couple of bottles of their cheaper wine plus food for 4 meant a £500+ bill. So to the main problem. We left the restaurant and headed to the bar. Its there where we were chatting and laughing that the security guard came over and told us to quieten down. Apparently with people eating around the sushi bar we could be disturbing them. This in a bar with pretty loud music! We weren’t going to stay after that so finished our drinks before leaving. Before going we found another security guard. We asked to speak to the manager. He said he was the manager (although I am pretty sure he wasn’t). We explained the situation and that the other security staff’s rudeness. He said he would look for the other security staff member and asked for a description. He then left us and never came back. The staff attitude pretty much spoilt the evening. You spend so much cash in a place and have a nice meal then get spoken to like naughty schoolchildren. It feels like this place is trying a little too desperately to stay a cool place to be.  Ive been there a couple of times but won’t go back now. Very disappointed in not only the attitude of the staff but also the inability to feedback via their email addresses (multiple emails bounced back) or the ignoring of my comments through their web site. If you want to pay for a lovely location and some great food – then fill your boots. But don’t expect a great customer experience – and keep your voice down to avoid a trip to the naughty step.

title: Lives up to it's reputation.
comment: Awesome restaurant, awesome views and atmosphere. Scary prices! Definitely worth a visit, but start saving now.

title: Best sushi ever!
comment: Funny enough the first impression is not so good. You have to stand outside in line and wait for an arrogant guy to let you pass. The next thing you know you go through a security check with mister not so nice nr. 2. Accept it, step in the elevator and go up. The moment you get out you are o.k. The restaurant has a great atmosphere, overlooking London. The staff is correct and the food is top, top, top.

title: 3 Star foos 1 star service
comment: great bar and one of the most visually impressive restaurants in London, complemented by breath taking views of the city. this is where the positives stop, the food is way inferior to other Japanese and south american restaurants of the same price; Coya, Roka etc. the service is very amateur and I wouldn't go there again to eat. Ever.

title: That lift is scary!!
comment: So I didn't eat here I just went for some drinks with a view and my goodness I thought I wouldn't get back down to the ground level, the lift was so fast and as it has a glass back so you can see just how high you are going! It was definitely a thrill and well worth it. Once you get to the bar you have spectacular views of London, we spotted Tower of London, St Pauls and the Gherkin is very close so there is a good view of that.  I would recommend visiting this bar for a birthday or special occasion.

title: Most amazing venue, amazing food and amazing service!
comment: Went here for my birthday and it was unreal! The food was amazing! So lovely and the cocktails are great too! The waiters where so attentive and we're very good at recommending food! The dessert menu had such a good choice was so hard to decide what to have, went for the zen garden which I couldn't quite believe was all edible and it even came out with a board saying happy birthday and a candle, made my day so special! I would definitely recommend this. Such a special day.

title: Such a good start
comment: Aside from the bill of tow glasses of whiskey, the locations of the restaurant and the terrace are stunning. Fancy place, it's recommend a good pair of shoes, luxury snikers are not welcome.

title: Truly awful
comment: Visited for late night drinks. Over priced even for London. We believe that it would be exclusive and therefore cool and worthwhile. It is in itself a tourist attraction for the views only. The wine and cocktails are terrible and music lacking originality. I'm bring very harsh... but for such a place with so much hype, I had huge expectations that were not met. Don't go

title: Great place for a special occasion
comment: We were in London for our friend's Bday and went to Sushi Samba for Lunch Great atmosphere, amazing view, very friendly service. And most importantly great food. We are Peruvians, and tried the cebiche. (It is not a Peruvian cebiche, but that was expected)  The Sushi is really good, we kept ordering more and more (try the Tokyo... one it is spicy and full of flavour) The peruvian corn (canchita) is also really good. The wine lady was super helpful and nice, they do not try to upsell you at all, Great experience

title: Birthday dinner
comment: We visited Sushisamba to celebrate my boyfriends birthday.  First of all I would like to give my kudos to all staff. From the reservation team, to the guy on the door, to our waiters (yes, we had two!) they impressed me with their smiley faces, politeness and excellent service.  The food was divine as well! I highly recommend the rib eye and chorizo for main, the meat was melting in the mouth. My other favourite waa the shrimps with spicy mayonaise... delish!!  The view is stunning and the music really good, so overall a fantastic experience that worth every penny.

title: Fabulous
comment: We had a family visit for lunch. The food is exquisite, unique, and as good as it gets. The view is fabulous. The service is 5 star+. Needless to say it is a bit on the expensive side, but has to be viewed as one of life's great experiences!!

title: Unforgettable London Views
comment: Reservation was made a month before arrival. this is definitely one of the hot spots in london. we got a table next to the window which was amazing and super romantic.  food was sexy & tasty. hight quality service. and we also got to see GOT acter who plays Theon Greyjoy seating next to us. awesome experience!

title: Lunch in the City
comment: Wow! What a place, exquisite food and service. Level 38 looking over London you expect to pay top dollar and we did, but the food and service made it feel worth it! Lamb chops were amazing!!!!!!!

title: Experimental but not as good as Brazilian sushi
comment: I had high expectations as I was recommended by friends. I was only in London for 48 hours and wasn't able to get a dinner reservation so went by myself at lunch. They suggested 3-4 dishes. I chose 4 but 3 would've been fine. I might've just misordered but I wouldn't say anything particularly stood out. I had toro tacquitos, salmon ceviche, tuna sashimi with truffle and yuzu and a California roll with snow crab. The best thing was the California roll which is surprising because you would think it was the most boring choice of the 4. The service was great and the view was incredible but not sure I'd hurry back next time I'm in town.

title: First class
comment: From the second I arrived I was blown away truly stunning setting. Visited just for drinks was recommended some by the barman best cocktail ever. Great staff around helpful and friendly. Will definitely be back for food

title: Expensive
comment: High up a skyscraper ,our experience started with a bag search by a gruff security guard, necessary ,yes, but not a welcome that was appreciated..overcast and windy day didn't help the view so no outside areas were open for our lunch..Service was smooth and professional, the food ,Japanese with Peruvian and Brazilian influences with Brazilian wait staff.. the yellowtail tuna tacos ,a highlight for me, interesting presentation..deserts for all of us , slightly over the top..lots of businessmen on expenses for a midweek lunch...expensive for us, but for a special treat on a fine day, the experience could be worth it.

title: Amazing Dining with an Amazing View
comment: I dined at this restaurant with family and friends and my whole experience was fantastic. The food was delicious and the view was the icing on top of the cake!

title: High end sushi
comment: Nice sushi restaurant on the 38th floor. If you are lucky you enjoy an impressive view of London seated at the window tables.  Food was good, creative and quality comes with a price. Drinks are maybe a bit overpriced tough.

title: Breathtaking views !!
comment: Absolutely beautiful bar, the ambience, the staff, the views. An absolute must visit!  We arrived around 8 PM and it wasn't too busy so the bar is easy to get to. We had a table beside the window overlooking the city and the view was absolutely beautiful. We watched the sunset and the city light up at night. The beer is only bottled Japanese beer, but very nice and an ample selection of cocktails. Prices are very reasonable for this high quality establishment especially being in Central London. They have a beautiful orange tree in the middle of the bar outside, however the outside bar was closed when we arrived. You can sit outside in the smoking area, it is a large area again with views over the city. Although it was very windy and chilly, they provide blankets for you to use should you wish to sit outside. I have visited other rooftop bars in London and this is by far the best, for views, staff and atmosphere. Will be back next time I'm in Central for sure !

title: Wonderful - food, views, ambience and service!
comment: Had a wonderful lunch here with my husband to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Was impressed with the Gluten Free menu and the servers expertise and advice. She assisted our choice of food in a really pleasant and relaxed manner unlike the waiting staff in some other top London restaurants who can be a little intimidating and impatient. The cocktail menu is a delight! So many interesting and innovative drinks to choose from.  The sashimi and maki were wonderful, fresh and flavoursome, and beautifully presented. The churrasco meat dish was perfectly cooked and extremely tasty.  I look forward to visiting again for the great atmosphere and to try more of the dishes and a few cocktails. I also loved the lift journey up to the restaurant, a shame it travels so fast as its a great view over the City and London as a whole.

title: Horrible places never again
comment: Location: London, 110 Bishopgate Date & Time of visit: 25/08/2017 @10pm Number of guests: 10 Waiter: Male I visited the restaurant for my birthday and have tried to get in touch to no avail so I have now been advised to follow up with this complaint via email and hope this receives you well. My overall experience at Sushi Samba was undeniably very poor and as a result am a highly satisfied customer for the following reasons: 1. - Upon arrival with my 10 guests I was immediately told the table was the only size they could offer. We initially booked for 8 people and then increased the number to 10 in advance of the visit. However when we arrived the table was only dressed for 8. There was loads of awkward shuffling, however we all got in but we couldn't move it was so tight. One of the waiters then suggested that the "bigger men step out and the slimmer women replace their seats on the inner side of the table". From all my experiences of restaurant dining i have NEVER had to take into consideration the size/figure/shape of my guests would be fit for purpose. My guests felt body shamed and offended. 2. - The temperature of the restaurant was so hot and was uncomfortable for us all, particularly because everyone's knees were tightly locked in and causing friction and heat under the table. 3. - The food is nice a lot of options available but our waiter was impatient and just rude. He spilt water pouring our drinks. When it came to ordering he decided he would choose what we should have for dinner. We agreed reluctantly as he really insisted. However when we asked to review his choices he got very agitated and stroppy. He read out the options so quick we couldn't understand what we we're going to eat so every dish that came out was a surprise order. 4. - Our bill came up to about £600 including a £60 service charge. I was annoyed that we had to pay so much service with a complete lack of service. The views are beautiful but service is absolutely terrible. We we're greeted nicely upon arrival. But no one wished me a happy birthday and we weren't thanked for joining them and no one said bye on the way out. As we were leaving the building the manager demanded another £8.75 gets paid as they failed to calculate the total payments made and put us in an embarrassing position. Terrible!!! Terrible!!!! Unfortunately I wouldn't go back again.

title: Not good for large groups
comment: Wouldn't recommend the set menu for large groups.  Waiters were not quite clear on who was eating what. Dropped a few dishes when placing them down, and didn't replace or clean up what fell out.  Probably won't return to here. More about the view than anything else.  Mocktails were nice.

title: Classy fusion
comment: Family reunion lunch, it was 9 of us! 6 adults and 3 kid.. I was quiet excited to try this prime London destination and to experience this unique blend of Japanese/Brazilian/Peruvian flavours! The lift trip is already quite something to do! The decor is really nice with bright orange leafs tree outside to high decorated ceilings inside with some breathtaking view!  The menu is amazing with great selection from sushi to other fusion dishes.. we went for the tasting menu with Japanese tacos, Péruvien ceviche, sushi selection and some very tasty main course.. everything was devine. The only disappointment was that the menu was served sharing style and i felt that for the price you pay you want to have your own bowl of ceviche and all other dishes.. you don't want to share it with 3 others even if they are friends and family it still felt uncomfortable taking more than 2 spoon.. it was delicious but it felt like small Portion as it was served sharing.  ( plate on the picture were each shared between 4 of us..) But other than that all perfect! The cocktails were really nice too :)  You quickly see why it's in the best london restaurant rank!  GO

title: Good but not great
comment: No question - outstanding views and a place to be seen and instagram friendly. Food was good - rolls especially - large plates tempura sea bass, black cod and the seafood curry especially were very good. The Hamachi Kama was really disappointing - not well presented , dry and bland. There were lots of waiting staff but they seemed disinterested and at times not particularly helpful. Overall therefore good - but just lacking that added extra, that you expect for the price, to make it great.

title: It was great ... But risky considering the cost
comment: I have fed back to sushisamba directly, but will write here that while the food was outstanding, not everything was up to par. Should you go? If I were you I would read through the reviews, look at menus and pictures and then decide. If you go - hope for a night of perfect food and views - but remember there are no guarantees. This sounds ominous, but its not a cheap experience.

title: Great setting. Average Sushi.
comment: Went here for a special occasion recently.  Great venue. Perfect location, amazing views. Nice bar.  Only sad thing was the sushi wasn't what I'd hoped for. For me you get better in itsu. Perhaps I should have gone to ROKA which was what a few friends had suggested.

title: Cool place.
comment: The atmosphere of the restaurant is very swell. The service was prompt and helpful. The three on the outside balcony is so cool. We will be there again. Nice gluten free options.

title: Great birthday/anniversary treat
comment: I would like to say THANK YOU for such a great evening.  Even though we had to wait 45 mins for our table (reserved) to be ready , once seated we've been served with complimentary champagne and starter. Great staff great food and great place.  Was our 1st time but definitely not the last one.

title: Sambatastic!
comment: Celebrated my daughter's 21st birthday here, and were not disappointed. Initially, I was worried it wouldn't live up to expectations and wouldn't be worth the price tag! However, we had a fabulous evening, and my daughter loved all the photo opportunities. We had a cocktail on arrival at the bar, not too busy. At the table we ordered a variety of dishes 'small plates' - roughly 5 per couple and we had plenty of food, which arrived quickly and was delicious. The lift ride and the views are fantastic, you are paying for the view, but in my opinion it was worth it!

title: Dining in the sky!
comment: This year being lucky I was finally able to make a reservation! The excitement was unreal, I couldn't wait to be dining in the sky!  Whilst entering the building you're required to have yourself and your bag searched before you enter the lifts. Sushisamba is located on the 38th floor and I kid you not the lifts are super fast!  When you first walk in, you'll be asked to wait in the designated smoking area where the bar is situated ( not much of a view ) but there is the beautiful orange tree which is great to look at and have a drink by. When you're showed to your table either inside or outside, the view is spectacular! The staff are very friendly and offer you blankets if you're dining in the sky outside, which is great!  The food was amazing, however a bit pricy; but it's understanding as the setting is beautiful. The staff make the experience even better as they're very helpful with providing the perfect customer service!  I will definitely revisit soon for the bar :)

title: Beautiful place, terrible experience
comment: Stumbled upon the place with my fiancé as we were visiting London on a few weeks ago on Friday night. Everyone seemed nice and the Dj was playing good music. After being there for aprox 4hours and spending quite an amount. A waiter came to my fiancé and told him "We have overstayed our welcome and have to leave" despite us doing nothing and even offering to share our table as the place was crowded.  We did leave peacefully despite the shock, but the waiter insisted on holding my fiancés hands on his back as to show he was kicking him out.  Found the whole situation wrong. I never write reviews but felt as though, I need to share the experience.

title: Excellent throughout
comment: Fab food and service. Sat at bar area on a Friday lunch at 1245 no booking necessary. Busy but nice experience. Waiters explain dishes and they're delectable. Scallop dish had wow factor!! Will visit again. We ate until we popped and it was £140 no alcohol. Amazing food and experience 10/10

title: Wonderful food, great views, but not cheap
comment: We ate at Sushisamba on a lovely summer evening and were lucky enough to be moved to a window table almost as soon as we were seated so had excellent views. It was full (you need to book well in advance) and you feel you are somewhere special. The food is an unusual combination of South American and Japanese with good vegetarian options. We had 3 small plates each following some good advice from our very helpful waiter. All of them were delicious and unusual. Firstly the vegetable and the lobster taquitos, then the corn and tuna seviche and finally the Teriyaki Poussin and the aubergine dish. We finished with the very complex and indulgent 'rainforest' chocolate desert and the moochi which are Japanese rice-cakes filled with ice cream. The portions are not huge but we had the right amount for us. There is a wide range of cocktails and wines and a huge Sake list. There is not much under £50 on the wine list.  It has to be said that this is not a cheap place to eat, if you went big on sushi or went anywhere near the Kobe beef the bill could be huge. We paid £160 for 2 with wine but overall still thought it was good value for the location food, service and the overall experience.

title: Simply stunning
comment: Had a business dinner at Sushi Samba and must say was probably the finest dining experience iv had. Ok it's expensive but if your a beef lover this is utopia. Even the salads are tremendous. Superb.

title: No better place for a drink!
comment: We visitef the roof top terrace for a drink before going to dinner. Marvelous drinks and a modern Dj combined with a girl playing the trumpet made it to a magic moment overlooking the sunset. The elevator trip is great knowing what to expect at the top! A must in London!

title: Expensive but worth going
comment: Expensive dishes, but location is astonishing, if you want to have all the pros just take a cocktail at the bar, you will discover the location without spend too much on Japanese food that cost 1/2 the price. It is a GO but for the bar, restaurant is busy, services is average, food is good, prices are at the top.

title: Superb
comment: I went with a friend and I really loved it, the food was very nice, I really liked the calamari, the spicy tuna roll and the california. Please ensure you leave space for the chocolate dessert. The service was phenomenal. Thanks Gary the guy wearing the suit for getting us the table on time. He was very polite and knowledgable, I will be back for sure.

title: GREAT FOOD AND VIEWS!!!!
comment: We were excited we stopped by. It all starts with the ride up in the elevator to the restaurant. After passing security you enter the elevator which has an open view to the city as you rise 38 stories to the restaurant in about 25 seconds. After exiting the elevator you walk down a narrow hallway which opens up into an amazing lounge/bar area. Continuing through the lounge area you'll walk down another narrow passageway which leads to the main dining area. The decor was awesome and modern.The dining area looks like it can hold about 120 people comfortable. If your party is small enough (2 maybe 3 or less) there's seating along the window on the far end of the restaurant that appears to have a great view of London. There's also 2 outdoor areas, 1 leading to an open deck which appears to be dedicated to large parties (ie. 50 people or more) and another outdoor area with a bar surrounding an orange colored tree. Getting to the meals, we were very very happy with our choices of CORAZÓN DE POLLO, POUSSIN, LAMB CHOP, SALT AND PEPPER SQUID, and HAMACHI KAMA. As I'm writing this I'm checking availability of locations in the states. It was just that good that either we head back to London or fly to another state. When it comes to drinks I'm an addict for a good Old Fashioned. Sushisamba has a drink on the menu that's a twist on an Old Fashioned and I was very very pleased. All of the food came in a timely manner and the drinks were great. The staff was very good at explaining the menu and how the process went. We had a great time and look forward to our next experience with Sushisamba whether it be London or here in the US. I hope the US can uphold London standards!!!!

title: A nice surprise
comment: At the 38th floor of the heron tower, a view that justifies displacement. They could have been satisfied with the view but the food is delicious! The dishes are original (fusion between Japanese cuisines, Brazilian and Peruvian) and very tasty.  The service is impeccable and there is a large selection of Japanese whiskey and sake

title: Great place for a special occassion
comment: Love this place, great views, amazing cocktails and food never disappoints. On the pricey side but nice for special occassions. Need to book in advance.

title: Excellent service
comment: Sushi samba is AMAZING. Food out of this world especially all of the sushi and the pork dumplings. The view and atmosphere is amazing. Have been twice now. Customer service outstanding and all the waiters are very attentive and help with anything you have questions about from the menu. Been twice now. HIGHLY recommend. Also the roof top bar is so cool.

title: Awesome
comment: Great service, food, drinks, view! I'm speechless  Be sure to make reservations though so you don't miss out on this when you're in London.

title: Stunning location
comment: I had heard such good reviews and now I understand why! While we didn't go for food - which is meant to be amazing, however we really enjoyed the cocktails and were spoilt for choice due to the large menu.  Perfect venue for drinks with friends/as a couple  The views and interiors are absolutely stunning. The elevator up to the bar is an experience in itself! I'm already planning my trip back.

title: Can't even label menus!
comment: I chose Sushisamba because it had appeared to have good range of vegetarian dishes. It even has a vegan menu. I discovered however that many of the items which looked vegetarian are not. Not only is nothing labelled as vegetarian but our waitress didn't seem to understand what vegetarianism was. What sort of restaurant can't label it's menu in this day and age? If Pizza Express can manage to do it, why can't somewhere as upmarket as Sushisamba? Very poor.

title: Love this place....
comment: Came here last night with friends. We all absolutely loved SushiSamba. The view from the bar and terrace is amazing and the atmosphere in the bar was great. Our waiter was very friendly and had great suggestions for fun and exciting cocktails as well as tasty snacks. Would definitely recommend and hope to come back soon...

title: Fabulous Cocktails!
comment: We popped in for pre-lunch cocktails recently and had a lovely experience.  The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable without being pretentious and our waitress had the perfect knack of knowing when we were ready to order more drinks or nibbles without them running dry. The truffle crisps were so moorish, I've never paid £5.00 for bag of crisps before, but I would happily have bought another bag if we didn't have to leave to make our lunch reservation.  The views were fabulous and the general feel of the bar/terrace was relaxed and welcoming.

title: Beautiful views and best sushi!
comment: As I am a sushi lover I had to visit this place. Firstly when I arrived with my girlfriend we ordered cocktails. Bar was really busy and we had to wait for a while before I was served. Cocktails were good but quite expansive. After short time we sat down in the restaurant and straight away waiters looked after us. Service was best I've ever seen! Food was great, especially Ezo and El Topo rolls. It is expensive but it's worth it. Highly recommend!

title: Amazing view & atmosphere
comment: Had a great time dining at SushiSamba for an almost midnight dinner. The view and design of the restaurant is amazing. The food was well prepared and uniquely presented. Excellent food, service and a great view.

title: Expensive taste
comment: Came for cocktails with friends in Aug 2017. The outside bar area is really pretty, but I imagine it would be impossible to find a seat on warm day. It was just starting to drizzle when we arrived, so seats were clearing and we ordered from the outside bar and hoped for the best. Unfortunately the weather got worse and seating inside was limited as we weren't eating - understandably enough. The service was excellent, and when one of our party spilled a soft drink, the staff rushed to help mop up and replaced free of charge. All very friendly and polite. Our first cocktails were pretty average, especially for £15, and we would have left then except we noticed that the indoor cocktail menu was much larger. We all found our favourites and agreed that the second round was worth it, especially as a few seats near the window opened up. Amazing view. Worth doing once, but not sure I'd go back unless I reserved a table for food. The cost and lack of available seating just doesn't justify it for me, but it's obviously popular amongst the cool kids :)

title: Gorgeous views and a nice atmosphere....
comment: The wife and I went here for a drink whilst we were staying in London.  Staff were friendly, service was good and the views of the city were spectacular. Definitely worth a visit...

title: Amazing food, different sushi concept
comment: A nice buzzing place with a nice view. We ordered many dishes on the menu but I would like to go there again and try more items. All the dished we ordered were delicious and as I mentioned it is not the regular dished you get at a regular Sushi place, all have a Peruvian influence.

title: The best sushi with wonderful view!!!
comment: The best spice sushi ever I had!U must book in advance for a table inside the restaurant! I went there with my sister and my partner both loved !!! Or you can have super cocktails on the terrace! Highly recommended!!! x

title: Good, not quite great
comment: We love it here and have written several reviews before, and while our visit yesterday was very good there were three issues that could've been better - the lamb dish was very fatty, more fat than meat, and when we said this to the waiter he didn't seem to acknowledge or understand what we were saying - rare to complain about this but the food comes too quickly, this place is a fine dining experience with amazing views, so when half your food appears within 5mins of ordering it can feel very rushed - and the outside bar area is often just too busy to be enjoyable, no room to breath sometimes.

title: Evening drinks with a view
comment: Great place in bishopsgate. Security on door and a very fast glass elevator awats to speed you up to the dizzy heights of restaurant and bar.  We only went for drinks on this occasion. Cocktails on the roof looking over London.  Plenty of seats to lounge in with heaters all round the area. Had a lychee based one and a cucumber cocktail. Both mixed expertly and tasted superb. Speed of elevator has to be experienced.

title: Great!!!
comment: Visited on Saturday with a number of friends. Reserved 2 months in advance and had asked for a booth and told them it was for a bday meal.  They pulled out all of the stops to ensure we had an amazing time. Service was fantastic and good was brilliant

title: Excellent Asian/ Latin Fusion Food, Great Location and Decor
comment: Went here for my birthday, with a group of friends. We ordered a variety of dishes, all of which were completely yummy (no complaints). We were also kept busy with lots and lots of bespoke cocktails from the bar man.  The decor is superb, the staff were super knowledgeable about the menu. Very pricey.

title: Overrated
comment: Oh dear. This place is certainly not what it is cracked up to be. It seems to be basking in the glory of its early days. Some of the food is very good. Some of it is only average, and some of it is well below average when you consider the price tag. The service is bad. I can see how the staff might have little respect for bus loads of out-of-towners, but their money is as good as anyone's. I witnessed plenty of off-hand, snide remarks aimed at those sitting near me. I can see very dark clouds looming for this concept if they don't improve their service and attitude. Take away the rooftop view and you have a very expensive but fairly average 'fusion restaurant'.

title: Delightful cocktails
comment: We did not eat here but the food smelt very good. We had cocktails which although expensive were the best I have had. I would recommend the Plantain punch. What is most special about the Sushisamba is the ambience. It is situated on the 38th floor of the Heron tower building and you go up to it in a glass elevator where you get wonderful views of London. It was twilight when we got there on a relatively quiet Monday evening. We found some seats overlooking the Gherkin and lots of London sights. Most amazing is the outside bar where the tree is with glowing orange fairy lights and all around are glowing calor gas lights which give a lovely warm glow. As the night gets darker the views seem more amazing with all the different coloured lights from the buildings and the traffic far below. I definitely recommend a visit.

title: WORST SUSHI EVER
comment: Me and my friends ordered miso soup, edamame and three types of rolls, we all got NAUSEA ( sushi had a weird taste )

title: Beautiful restaurant
comment: Beautiful restaurants and wonderful drinks but the food is overpriced. Nice views though! I'd prefer it for drinks rather tan dinner.

title: Amazing experience
comment: Simply put. Great service, great food, great atmosphere, great location , great rooftop. Book few days in advance to guarantee rooftop or by the window table.

title: Fabulous but expensive
comment: Started the evening in the bar outside on the terrace before we went inside to our table and stood next to the fire pit  Our table was next to the window and we thought it was easier to order Tapas style and they arranged for all the plates to have 8 pieces..... as there was 8 of us at the table.  The food was sublime and we had a lot to eat and quite a lot to drink but in the bigger scheme of things this place is extortionately expensive.  This is our second time here and will save it for very special times but we may have to raid the piggy bank for our next visit

title: Terrible service and even worse guest treatment
comment: I do have to say that I have been to Sushi Samba previously and always had a good time because the food is usually very good, however, the service has always been a bit hit and miss.  This time, however, on making a complaint it was the way I was treated that was the most shocking. Even though I was the one who had booked that table, ordered for the table and raised the issue, the waiter and then the manager kept only speaking to some of my male colleagues. When I tried to speak to him, he then replied 'I would prefer to speak to the gentlemen on the matter' and refused to acknowledge anything I had to say.  The didn't react as I was so shocked, but we decided just to leave, on paying the bill, they then took my credit card and handed it to a male colleague to pay.  It's been a long time since I have seen such terrible service and then handling of an issue, openly ignoring any female opinions or presence, insisting to only speak to the males in the group.

title: Between average and very good 3.5
comment: Great location, but the views from Duck & Waffle two floors above are better. Didn't like the security pat down and bag search before you go up the lift. But the lift journey up made for some good views! They make you wait for your table at the bar area which is large and spacious, of course to entice you to buy drinks. (Even if you pre-booked) Went with a group of 5, no-one said the food was outstanding. But was it was above average and presented well. The service was fine. The best thing about the place is probably the ambience/atmosphere. But you do have to pay the price for it as it isn't on the cheap side.

title: Delightful afternoon
comment: I organised a table in advance for a work get together which was incredibly simple but effective to do online.  The actual outing was superb. Our table was booked for 1pm and we were able to sit and enjoy the view with some champagne before hand. The service was immaculate with fresh plates, serviettes and smiles. A new glass presented to taste the 2nd bottle of white wine. Presentation of food absolutely excellent and the staff were able to explain what was offered to us. Afterwards, a short walk to softer seating to enjoy the late afternoon sun with some cocktails.  Truly fantastic - thoroughly recommend. Although a business meeting, recommend for a special family/couple meal. I will be back to hopefully enjoy this good weather and love the views over London.

title: Hen party
comment: Booking the table was fairly easy and we had a 9pm reservation which was perfect for a summer evening, managed to get some great views over the city as night came. Our waitress was really good and explained the whole menu as some of the girls have specific eating preferences. The food was amazing, and the sharing concept of the dishes was really good especially amongst friends. All the girls loved their drinks and it was really good that all the cocktails could be made without alcohol.

title: Not to be missed!
comment: Went to SushiSamba for dinner, its the place not to be missed if you are visiting London! Amazing view, nice Latino music and very good food!

title: Lunch
comment: The restaurant was recommend and the view and the quality of the food are certainly good. Reservation is needed and there is a dress code. Staff are kind but not all of them are native speakers which sometimes makes it hard to understand them as they speak very fast (due to the fact that they are very busy?).

title: Great date night
comment: We made the mistake of not making a reservation but luckily there was space at the bar when we arrived. The sushi was incredible and you could see everything being freshly made. Whilst the sushi was amazing, the cocktails were the highlight for me! They are quite expensive but for central London and paired with the view it's worth it. We will definitely be coming back soon!

title: Fabulous food, wonderful service!
comment: We ate lunch here last Thursday and were blown away by the quality of the food. Had a selection of sushi and grill dishes and all of superlative standard. We ordered some Riesling wine to accompany our meal, which was also absolutely delicious. However, when we received the bill it appeared that we had been charged for a vintage Riesling of the same name. On further exploration we had actually been served the vintage wine, although we had wanted the much cheaper alternative! Once brought to their attention the staff could not have been nicer and more helpful. The manager, Mr Sausdravas, apologised profusely, charged us for the much cheaper bottle that we originally ordered, and gave us a glass of bubbly each! Everything was handled discreetly and with grace. Fabulous food and exemplary service. Thanks for an insanely good lunch!

title: For the view, outside bar and japanese food
comment: Access from an outside door elevator  The japanese food is great, the wine too, the views are stunning I would says 4.5 For 2 people taking: 2 champagne glasses Fine Japanese food something like 6 dishes to share Water and a bottle of wine The bill was over 200 pounds The place has outside terraces Nice place i will go back there You have to book in advance like many restaurants like aqua roka nobu etc

title: Great food, awful service
comment: Yes, sushi samba offers flavoursome food and a great view.  But no, you will not be treated with respect or anything like service.  At the door, we were faced with insolent and rude security staff who treated us with complete disdain. Then, at the end of our meal, after paying the bill including the discretionary charge (less 75p), we had one of the waitresses scoff at us and say "urghhhh, if you don't pay the full service charge, we don't get a tip". Quite frankly astonishing and won't be returning.

title: Great instagram place
comment: Despite the views and the decoration were amazing, I have to say we got a bit disappointed by the sushi which was average. However, the rest of the dishes we order apart from sushi were a surprise! Green bean tempura, shrimp tempura and wagyu gyozas. Dessert (alfajores) was good but nothing special. As stated, views and settle up are completely awesome and if you are searching for a cool picture from your London trip... this is definitely the place to be!

title: Outstanding Experience!
comment: We had a great evening here. My wife and I took our son (11) to celebrate his getting into the high school he wanted. It was a great treat: great food, fantastic view, really good decor and atmosphere and really excellent service. Alvaro took excellent care of us! The food is really good - delicious, imaginative and well presented. We weren't sure what to expect from Japanese/Brazilian/Colombian fusion, but we were not disappointed. It's hard to describe as it is quite different to the traditional dishes, but it was really good. We had a great view of the the sunset over London as we dined, and then Alvaro took us onto a viewing deck afterwards where we god some really spectacular views of London. The restaurant also has a bar that extends outside. Very nice views from here too. Wine list is not very extensive, but it is ok and you come here for the food, atmosphere and view Would recommend very highly!

title: Very expensive and not filling
comment: Have been here on 2 separate occasions and unfortunately the same review for both. Food is lovely, however, left hungry and around £250 down between 2 people. You are paying for the view here rather than the food. Have been to sushisamba in both New York and Vegas where the food was just as good but around half the price!

title: Fantastic food and atmosphere
comment: The venue is great. Lovely atmosphere and the food is delicious. Stunning views of London. I would not hesitate to recommend.

title: Nice food but the amount of dust .
comment: went to Sushi samba for lunch , Drinks very nice, endamame came with starters shortly followed by sea bass tempura, Black cod and a selection of raw sushi. just could not beleive the amount of dust that was on the lights and ceiling.it was actually off-puttingl. Management need to sort out quickly....Still cant beleive it as i am writing.......

title: Good food but ..
comment: Was so glad to find that someone besides me in this review found the staff condescending... as we entered sushi samba before getting into the elevators the man who greeted us to 'check ' our reservation before security was the epitome of rudeness. Hence the whole experience post that to me was strictly ok .. we were 8 of us ( 2 families ) with kids - food was tasty , sushi good - not the best ,dessert was divine !! Just as the taste of the dessert lingered on in my mouth , and we got off the elevator, mr. Rude with not a polite greeting or goodbye had that lovely taste from my mouth vanish in a jiffy !

title: SushiSamba...Sushi Chic!
comment: SushiSamba in central London is an upmarket nouveau Japanese sushi restaurant with Brazilian and Peruvian influences. This is definitely not traditional sushi and Japanese cuisine so don't expect chicken teriyaki maki rolls. The food is delectable, finely plated, beautiful dishes with exquisite flavours. Definitely not low-end from a price perspective but well worth it if you appreciate exciting cuisine. Situated on the 38th floor gives diners a great view of London. Outdoor seating is available together with blankets if it gets chilly. Loved it!

title: Fantastic food and amazing views
comment: Had a wonderful time here. Food was superb. Staff brilliant. And location out-of-this-world. Highlight recommended. Just make sure you plan your trip well in advance as it's tricky to get a slot. We booked eight weeks in advance.

title: Delicious cocktails!
comment: My sister and I had taken my cousin out for her birthday to Duck and Waffle and decided that afterwards, as it was such a lovely day, we would go to Sushi Samba to sit outside and have a cocktail before we headed off. We sat outside which was really lovely, however a lot of the bench we were sitting on was quite sticky (to the point where it actually marked my cousins trousers) and there were a lot of small bugs flying around which was a bit disappointing as it just made it all seem very unclean. We only sat there for about 5 mins and luckily a small group left a different table so we were able to move so that was better. In spite of this, the bar staff are all incredibly friendly and helpful and the cocktails are delicious and very well presented. I had a Chucumber (please excuse the spelling if i got that wrong) which I would highly recommend.  Yes, the prices are on the top end of the scale for London cocktails but the views are beautiful and the drinks, staff and decor is all very nice.  All in all it is a lovely place which I will still look to go back to one day, but i do think that just a little bit of attention to detail needs to take place with the outside space (just having a quick wipe down of the table isn't enough of a clean in my opinion), but we still had a really lovely time on her birthday

title: Lunch at Sushi Samba-mixed
comment: We had a lovely lunch on the rooftop restaurant- food and drinks were amazing but the waiter and waitress were very rude and unhelpful. It was only when I asked for the manager that he was of help. The waitress sat us down and listed the things NOT available from the menu then left us. I had to command attention of a different member of staff to have our drinks order taken. We placed our order- I once again had to command attention for this order to be taken.We ordered what we thought was sushi but obviously mistakenly ordered the wrong thing (would have been better had the menu been explained in the first place.) The manager saw that this was replaced with what we originally thought we ordered and was very nice and helpful. However at the end of the meal the waiter slapped down a pen and a review sheet- really abruptly and rude and just said "fill this in." Management here is very professional but waiter and waitresses very snobby and rude (that wad my experience of the 2 I dealt with.)

title: Very dissapointing
comment: My sister booked sushisamba for her 30th birthday and i was so excited as ive always wanted to go there myself. We were a little early for our 7.15 reservation so thought we would have a cocktail in the bar and look at the veiw from the window, whilst we were stood at the window one of the waitresses was extreamly rude to my mum and askes her to move, then continued to barge her out the way to get through to the bar, this waitress continued to look miserable and be extremly rude. We were seated at our table and explained the menu and the specials. Some of us wanted the specials but wasnt allowed it unless we all had it which i found a little od so we decided to order off the normal menu. It was uncomfortably hot in the resturant so we asked if it was possible to turn the aircon on to which the waiter said i doubt it. During the meal us girls needed to use the bathroom and it was discusting three of the cubicles were un useable with one of them having toilet paper covered in poo all over the floor. Our meal came to over £700 for this money i expect clean toilets, good service, smiles on your staff and good food. I will not be going back here or telling friends about it. For my sisters 30th they gave her a macaroon on a happy birthday plate just awful for the prices there charging.

title: Very lovely meal
comment: Came here with my parents to celebrate. The views are brilliant. The staff are wonderful. The food is delicious. I haven't got any complaints. And will definitely be back!  Yes it's expensive. Yes you have to book in advance. But that aside. If you accept that some of the cost is paying for the view and experience then there is nothing to moan about! Brilliant meal.

title: Amazing birthday meal!!
comment: My partner and I went here for my birthday on Saturday night. The ambience was bubbly and booming we had a meal in the dining area followed by cocktails on The outside terrace. The staff were friendly, acknowldeging us from the moment we entered. First of all the view from sushi samba is breath taking as it looks over all of London. The waiter who served us was extremely helpful with explaining the menu and recommending dishes. The food we had came beautifully presented and tasted delicious. (Images below)  Cocktails we had were refreshing.  For dessert we had Assorted Mochi a soft Japanese rice cake filled with ice cream; was also very tasty!  Would recommend Sushisamba to anyone looking for great food/drinks in a beautiful surrounding overlooking London. We will defo be returning again

title: Amazing food, amazing service - what more could you want?
comment: So the answer to my question is perhaps for it to be a little cheaper! Sushisamba is excellent, and they make you pay for it ... rightly so. I'd recommend this place to anyone - it's a massive treat, but we always enjoy every moment.

title: Drinks on top of London......
comment: Stopped in for drinks on Saturday night and was surprised by the very young and trendy crowd here. Fantastic views across the whole of London and outside area was fabulous with a huge fire pit. Well worth a visit, but beware of prices as drinks are very expensive and on top of the price you have to pay service at 12% even when served at the bar? I think this is totally unacceptable and just a rip-off sadly.  In summary - great location and views, drinks expensive and service charge at bar is unnecessary, surely they must be paying the staff a minimum wage, without evry customer having to subsidize them?

title: Fantastic views.
comment: The view is the best part. The service and staff are great but they need to be because the menu is so original (and a bit complicated). You can be really adventurous (who would have thought of merging Japanese and Brazilian cuisine??). It is expensive though.

title: Drinks not up to the views
comment: Went here for drinks after a meal in the Duck and Waffle above. My wife ordered a Cosmo which she undrinkable. Turns out the bar man had put apple liqueur in instead of orange!!! He re-made this for her but this time didn't bother to do the orange around the rim of the glass as he had for the previous one. Seriously, at £14 a go you expect better. If they concentrated more on the quality of the drinks rather doing stupid bottle juggling tricks it would be expensive but acceptable considering the venue and location.

title: Pretty venue, but over priced and average food
comment: I had been looking forward to trying this venue for a while, so when I finally got to go I was a little underwhelmed. The venue itself is pretty impressive, but the ambience away from the bar, in the restaurant was a little strange. The tables and design didn't quite fit...  The food was ridiculously overpriced for what it was, and wasn't even that nice. I did enjoy the pork belly but that was it, and for me, I am quite easily pleased when it comes to Japanese food.  I don't know if I went on a bad night, and maybe I need to try again, but I am a little reluctant with the excessive pricing!

title: Stunning views
comment: What a lovely place! We enjoyed the food very much! But the views ... wow ! It's worth a visit!! We loved every second of our lunch ! Thank you

title: Missed the mark
comment: Our first visit here for a meal. We passed through the security area and went up in the lift. We entered what we later realised was the bar area. We waited with several other people at the entrance of the room, looking a bit confused in regards to whether we should just walk in or wait to be approached by a member of staff.  Feeling awkward we looked around for some sort of acknowledgement or assistance from the staff. No such luck. Several of us commented that none of the staff looked happy. Not one of them would even make eye contact. Finally someone at the front spotted the Maitre 'd Stand on the opposite side of the room. Once they had finished we went over to the Two somber looking ladies stood behind the stand. We explained we had reservation for a party of 7. They took our name, Once again, very little eye contact and no smile whatsoever. As we were waiting for the rest of our party to arrive (parking the car) we were instructed to have a drink at the bar while we waited. Finally everyone had arrived and we went back to the Two somber ladies behind the stand, we were instructed to go into the next room,(dining room) where we were approached by smiling, happier staff. Our waiter Lazlo introduced himself as he escorted us to out table. Finally, it all seemed to be coming together. We ordered an assortment of food, drinks and cocktails which all tasted nice.  It was an overcast day with the occasional rain showers, We were sat in the middle of the room, so the views became redundant. Looking around what was apparent was that the staff would smile and have a friendly chat but as soon as they turned away from the person and people at the table the smile disappeared quickly... We had read your reviews before coming and all i can say is, Sushisamba you're not as good as you think you are. I was left unimpressed and deflated from my experience, especially from your staff.  Just a reminder," You're as good as your guest think you are" and "You're not doing customers a favour by opening a restaurant, customers are doing you a favour by eating in your restaurant". Will i return, the answer is a simply no. There are now plenty of restaurants that provide amazing food, friendly service with a smile and great views.  Please read my review of Searcys at The Gherkin of how it should be done.

title: Sushisamba
comment: We went to drink at this amazing place and we love it! There is a place to eat too, i didn't try cause i don't like sushi but the drinks are very good. Is expensive but it worth.  To repeat! ✔

title: Worth it. Best Sushi, great atmosphere.
comment: I was wonderful. Hands down best Sushi I've had in ages. And the setting is great. Wonderful views from the terrace, though it was windy the night we came so we kept to the restaurant.

title: Awesome food and experience
comment: My wife and I took our 10 year old daughter and had a fantastic meal. The waiter explained the food to us and gave us a steer, having asked a few questions. We had a selection of fish and a chicken option, all of which were excellent. Great flavours. We hadn't quite ordered enough and so ordered a beef dish (not the Kobe one), which was served on hot rocks, and was really good. Wine and drinks are overly expensive, but then you're paying for the location. If you want a real treat, give it a go. There is an outside area, which children are allowed in. There is also an outside bar area, which does not allow children.

title: Nuggets
comment: The condescending staff ruin everything. train yournuggetstaff sushi samba  Do not recommend to anyone Two star for the views and food.

title: Wowsers
comment: What a fab restaurant. The lift up to the restaurant is an experience and the views from the top are beautiful! There is a nice rooftop bar although it was raining so we didn't spend long out there. The menu is vast and so the waiter recommended a selection for us and he chose well, it was absolutely delicious! My favourites were the black cod, sashimi and the California roll. I cannot wait to go back!

title: Sushi delayed and not that great!
comment: After visiting sushisamba, I have come to the conclusion that the sushi is not that great. I think wasabi sushi does a better job and a bigger portion! The service was incredibly slow despite not being awfully busy and the explanation of the sushi was confusing. To their credit, my friend and I received a glass of champagne after chasing our food two times. I would recommend for the view but it's not a restaurant I would visit any time soon.

title: Wonderful cocktails!
comment: Staff at Sushisamba are wonderful compared to Duck & Waffle. Went SS for a snack and a cocktail straight after lunch at D&W on 28.07.17.

title: was not fair
comment: I was very disappointed with the work of the staff, they looked like they had to decide who would go there or not.  Я и мои друзья были разочарованы

title: Regrettable service
comment: Fourteen of us visited Sushi Samba in the afternoon on a weekday and prepaid. Our reservation was at 3pm, upon arrival we were not greeted by anyone after coming out of the lift so all fourteen of us walked to the bar. We were told the table wasn't ready and had to wait 30 minutes for the table to be prepared,15 of those standing outside without a drink.  Food was delivered to the table by mistake and then taken away, and the food we ordered took a long time to arrive.
