The team did knock off the service charge and gave us bar snacks later on but for the prices at Sushi Samba you expect the service to be first class, matching the food. Sadly, it was very poor. Would not visit again

title: Dinner (very limited choices) - Elegantly average
comment: Our reservation was for 8pm (note: this was originally for 7:30 and were told it was cancelled) When we entered the bar area, we were told to have a drink at the bar and that we would be escorted to the table. This didn't happen until 8:10 and I had to go to counter to followup. Once seated, the waiter advised us the "fryer is not working" so basically things like tempura and fried items weren't available. This combined with the fact I don't eat beef, left us with limited choices. I feel for a restaurant of this standard, the fryer not working in inexcusable as it forces the customer to order items they wouldn't necessarily order. Obviously to get a booking due to the popularity of this restaurant is difficult so it would be silly to walk out. However, the cocktails ordered were delicious and the samba rolls/large plate we ordered were tasty and nicely presented (large plate was a mushroom dish which was a tad salty). The waiters were very attentive though, topping up waters etc. All in all, an average experience for me. Had x3 cocktails £43 and food bill £98. I would personally recommend only coming up for drinks/ special occasion rather than dinner.

title: Fantastic!
comment: We have been here today to see the great view and taste some japanese-peruvian food. We have been surprised by the kindness of our waitress called Elena, she's very gentle, professional and she speaks Italian very well! 10 stars for you M&A

title: Beautiful view and restaurant, and that's where it stops
comment: The food and the service are definitely to be missed. If you want to visit for the view, it's lovely, and you can usually find a bit of space in the bar area outside. Skip the dinner.

title: Overpriced sushi but only for special occasions
comment: First of all our waiter Alvaro from Cadiz in Spain was great. Very friendly and made some good recommendations. As it was our anniversary the restaurant arranged a seat by the window which was a nice touch along with a complimentary dessert at the end. Food was good but overpriced in my opinion you are basically paying a premium for the view but as it was raining there was not much of a view. There are other better options. The banana dessert was very nice and highly recommend it.

title: Great place, feel like it's slightly over-rated
comment: The waiter did a very good job on the 'upsell' !  This is not a cheap place to eat and you are paying top end London prices  That said - the food was good.  I just get the feeling that the brand and the clientele try to make it slightly more pretentious than it needs to be The location of course is great and the views are amazing and I would definitely return here for a night out - but wouldn't rush as it is pricey

title: Amazing views
comment: I only went for drinks here. It is really worth a visit, the views are amazing. The bar staff were extremely friendly. I was a bit worried about the express glass lift but it was great,very quick and if you're worried then just stand at the back. You probably need to book as it does get busy, even just got drinks.

title: Birthday treat!
comment: We came here for my friends birthday. The food is delicious, quite expensive, small portions so you have to order quite a few. Cocktails are lovely, we got a free glass of champagne each as a little birthday treat. Overall very positive experience, prepare to pay bit more to dine here.

title: Underwhelmed & Staff Self Important
comment: Want a great view with arrogant staff and mediocre food? This is the place. Expectations very high for this "fashion" restaurant. They completely let themselves down on not being able to prepare eel properly (pretty basic in even an fusion restaurant). Mostly the attitude of the staff. They got completely carried away with the brand and forget clients happen to exist. I do not recommend.

title: Was Refused entry
comment: Wow - I got refused entry here- the first ever place I've ever been refused. Apparently wearing leggings was against clothing policy although when I asked for that in writing their policy said no sportswear - custom made leggings with gold sparkles are not sportswear! Then they let a girl in with jeggings and trainers?!?! Outraged at their mis guided fashion laws!

title: Bday dinner
comment: True gem of place in London Must visit. Brilliant atmosphere. Pre book as mostly full all the time. Food drinks service are all brilliant

title: Wedding Aniversary
comment: Absolutely fantastic food that we could not fault. The presentation and quality of the food is excellent. It's not cheap but you get what you pay for and despite a large bill we were happy as the service location and food are top notch. This was our fourth visit and we will definitely be back to experience this special restaurant again. The best dishes we had were the veggi maki but the best of all was the tiger maki which was divine.

title: Great
comment: Love this place - great food, service, cocktails etc - outside rooftop area too when it's warm. Fabulous Japanese food and certainly not just fish, plenty of awesome meat dishes too. Definitely worth trying but book ahead.  The lift up is great too!

title: Sushisuperb!
comment: We were given gift voucher of £150 for Sushi Samba for Christmas, we spent every penny & some but it was well worth it, the taste experience was amazing, the staff was very good & polite, they was clued up on all what was on the menu. They say there is a long waiting list to get in, so book with plenty of time in advance or do what we did, we got there almost opening time on a Saturday & asked to sit at the bar but luckily we got a table with the most amazing view overlooking. Truly a wonderful place to eat.

title: Sky high views for sky high prices
comment: Incredibly busy bar area with very slow service, clearly very popular with people living on the east side of London. Fabulous views on a clear day.  The food was much better than I had expected, but had a mixed experience, which is not great at these prices. Because many dishes are quite small, you need to eat a fair few (we had 9-10 for 3), which makes the bill high. Some of our better dishes were the Moqueca, squid and black cod; some good sake and cocktails. Restaurant service was very good. £440 for 3, although nearly 1/2 was drinks. Average value given the quality.  A fair representation of the type of Japanese food you see in places like Sao Paulo with its big ethnic Japanese population from the early 1900's; but at slightly different prices. Because it is unusual and not cheap, the restaurant has an odd mix of some quite large loud groups (eg birthdays) and poshed up quiet "special occasion" couples, so choose your table carefully ! They almost need different areas for the 2.

title: Top experience - small bites
comment: I can't say anything bad about Sushi Samba, the experience and the service were great.  The only small note is that you will risk to step out from the table still hungry.  The portions are relatively small compared with the price.  They are perfectly prepared and very scenic though. The style in the place is top so great to come up if you want to make a strong impression.

title: Over hyped and overpriced
comment: Had. Went to the Heron Tower bar. Efore which is great. Outdoor and indoor bar. We decided to. Oil dinner one night. The food is good but expensive for portion size. We had 5 small plates and a. Ottlenof wine for 150 pounds. Bit steep. Service was a bit complacent. More for the tourists for the views than Londoners.

title: Rock shrinp tenpura, wagyu and what a view
comment: 40 th floor of Heron Tower.. Club lounge welcome and super drink on terrace.  Our favorites are the taquitos (small tacos with tuna or lobster) and the must try rock shrinp tempura.  On a clear day the view is amazing and the Best in London. Its a favorite for sushi together with Roka

title: Top taste, sky-high style
comment: Map not quite accurate, entrance is on Bishopsgate. Lift zooms to top, face the wall if vertigo. Complicated menu, we let them choose our feast and what a feast it was, several moderate size sharing dishes followed by Kobe beef cooked on stone - more marbling than muscle and what an amazing flavour. Then cod to share. Then the most beautiful and unusual sushi. Extraordinary tastes throughout. Puddings a work of art. Finally sit outside and enjoy the panorama. £764.72 for 5 including 12.5% service charge: great service.

title: Birthday visit
comment: Today my friends and I went here for a quick drink.  First of all, the speed of the lift up made me feel sick as it went so fast. We weren't allowed to take a bottle of water in our bags upstairs to the bar because they sold them up there. We always carry water and was unsure why this was such a problem. We bought 4 cocktails that came to just under £60. We refused to pay the service charge because quite frankly they really only made the cocktails.  Yes the scenery from the toilets was alright but nothing spectacular.  Wouldn't go here again.  However the cocktails were very nice.

title: Average at best
comment: Not the best rooftop bar in London. Views are very limited and drinks incur a "discretionary " 12.5% charge? Why?  Either add it to the prices or let me decide what the service is actually worth!

title: Just Okay
comment: Sadly disappointed after hearing so much. Not that anything was bad, just that everything seemed to miss the mark a tad. Service good, but not interesting or fun. View great, but blocked in many areas. Food... well, I've had better at dozens of places. Prices are high but in line with what SushiSamba is trying to achieve. I doubt we'll return.

title: Awesome
comment: To me this place offer nice food nice view and nice service I can't remember the lady who took care of me she has sweet face and very professional serviced, the 9raw sasimi does worth my cash but for the tempura is not it came like a prawn salad which is way too weird lol ,so if you need to eat authentic sushi this is not the place but for the service or a place to hang out as a trendy lifestyle I highly reccommend however I think the staffs are very welcoming :) but don't go on peak time if you like to chill otherwise you will be hasten by next customers lol

title: Pleasantly surprised
comment: We weren't sure what to expect because of the mixed reviews but had a lovely time. The main restaurant is smaller than I expected and the views don't compare to Aqua Shard. However, the food was lovely. The Moqueca Mista was amazing, large plate which myself and friend shared. The fish was plentiful and there was lots of it. We shared 3 small plates, 1 large plate, 1 samba London roll (delicious - 8 pieces) and a cocktail each, bottle of still water the total price incl service charge was £68 each, which we felt was reasonable. Having said that when we left we were very full. Service was excellent, very good. The service in the bar was incredibly slow, at times the barman looked as though he didn't realise there was a queue for 4 people waiting. I've had better bar service at TGI Fridays and without the service charge. The dress code is confusing, we made an effort but lots of people didn't. We saw ladies with open toe sandals (not flip flops though), a couple of people with ripped jeans (the website says this is a no no) and those dressed super casual. Our table was 5.30pm so I don't know if they are stricter later in the evening but its disappointing to dress up when not many others do the same.  We had the table until 7.30pm but were given the bill at 6.50pm. We didn't ask for it so I felt this was rude. It also made my friend feel as though we should pay and go. I told her we had our table until 7.30 and we were staying!. We left around 7.25pm but this spoilt it a little. Anyway, all in all a lovely time. I would go again but would go later in the evening. We booked 2 months ahead and 5.30 was the only time we could get. Give it a try and enjoy the lift which was fun.

title: Great Views Over London
comment: We had Sunday Lunch here, late, but the restaurant was full and we got a perfect table by the window so was able to look out over London. I was a little disappointed with the food because I imagined being a fusion restaurant of three cusines would have made it different from all the other fusion Japanese restaurants. However, I didn't detect much Peruvian cusine in the cooking and only a little Brazilian it is mostly Sushi with a little "Samba". The more expensive dishes are more interesting but Kobe filet for £1,000 is one I wouldn't order! We ordered too much the main dishes are quite large so good to share with someone. However, the service was faultless and very obliging. Angela served us and explained the menu beautifully. The Sommelier also knows his wines very well.

title: Fund but pricey
comment: Amazing location with a grest view of London. The choice on the menu is much more influenced by japanese rather than south american cuisine. The staff is very polite and helpful, and cocktails are great. Very expensiv but if you boom a table here that is what your should expect.

title: Amazing food with great views over east London
comment: Super tasty Japanese and Brazilian food with great cocktails, brilliant views, outside and inside bar for pre and post supper drinks.

title: Great place, great view
comment: Best Sushi ever, beautiful view over London, and quality service. Also suitable for vegetarians. Thank you SushiSamba we'll be back

title: Delicious food with an amazing London view
comment: Great place to come for delicious food. Plenty of choices on the unique menu which is a Japanese and South American fusion. Views are amazing. However, as this is a classier restaurant it is a bit pricey. Service was great.

title: Very Nice
comment: It was high in the sky which was amazing but had an airport lounge feel about it ! Very nice cocktails atmosphere was relaxing with a Spanish vibe not like los gatos in Swindon. Manager was not drunk and very friendly x

title: Refused entrance because of grooming
comment: We've been refused the entrance just because we were wearing too much casual to get access in there... So not really much to review. I can only say that from what other friends told me about the food is not worth to even step in the queue to go and eat... Order justeat and you might get even better sushi.

title: Food amazing, service a bit slow
comment: We went here with friends on a Monday night and had a drink outside first and dinner outside. Initially the service was great, my allergy was tended too well and the menu was explained. We went for the option of telling them how much a head we wanted to spend then they would bring out the chef's selection.I would highly recommend this all the food we had was amazing. Bright fresh so well seasoned. The view was amazing outside as well, although it did get chilly and they ran out of blankets for guests. We did ask when one came free if they could bring it over but hey did not and instead gave them to guests who just arrived which was a bit frustrating. We waited a long time for the wine to arrive, I like to have my wine before my food starts to arrive but this did not happen. We also had to constantly ask to have our drinks topped up as the wine was too far away to pour ourselves and our glasses were always empty. I am glad they did not try to turn the table over (We have a 715) booking as the service was pretty slow and it took ages to get our bill asking three different servers.  All in all it was a good experience however it they were looking to move us in 2 hours, I can see how that would not have worked well. The servers we had were very friendly but perhaps a bit stretched. We will definitely be back as we did have a great time and amazing food.

title: Stunning Ambience
comment: It is always difficult to get a table here. We had to book well in advance for a special occasion. The service is prompt, the dress code is formal and the ambience is spectacular. The food is very good, but not exceptional or out of world. We tried the prawn tempura, the nigari sushi, and the samba rolls. Washed it down with cold sake. All very nicely done.Due to the exceptional ambience, we really enjoyed our evening.

title: Graduation Celebration
comment: Having Visited the Heron tower previously i just had try the restaurant... Well I was not disappointed the service was everything you come to expect from a high class restaurant in London.. The food was Amazing equal to other Asian / Sushi Restaurants But not better than.... the Staff were very very good and made us feel very Special....and we stayed after the meal on the 38th floor Terrace for drinks and to watch the sun go down... Wow

title: Gorgeous View, Nice Cocktails but...
comment: Decided to pop in for some cocktails on Sunday afternoon and must say we were not disappointed as always. Lovely service at the bar area as well, very friendly and attentive. Decided to have some sushi after all and enjoy a bit of the outside terrace but were told by receptionist that no main course each - no table. I have never come across a rule like that in any of the places I dined before. The restaurant was half empty and the receptionist was not polite at all and probably just needs some more training. Decided to go for food elsewhere instead. Shame, because the quality of food never disappoints here as well.

title: Sensational Sushi Samba
comment: I have to say first that last night we went to Nobu.  We told the manager, Zafir Chorbeski that we went there last night, and we weren't completely thrilled about it. He said, I will show you an experience. Well he did. Everything was absolutely amazing. The sushi, the rolls, the sake he chose, the flavors and the tastes, all the way to the presentation- were out of this world. If you're in South Beach or Miami, I would absolutely tell you to swing by Sushi Samba and ask for the manager or also our waiter, Greg. They are wonderful. They only want you to have the best experience possible.  What a fantastic no and experience we had.  Thank you Greg.  Thank you Zafir.

title: Stunning views and delicious food
comment: Booked this restaurant for lunch to celebrate my son's graduation. It didn't disappoint. Gorgeous airy restaurant with fantastic panoramic views of London and an outdoor terrace.  Wait staff are amazing and great at explaining the dishes. Very attentive without being intrusive.  We tried many dishes - hard to pick stand out favourites as everything was great. We tried shrimp and vegetable tempura, steak beautifully presented on hot stones, Kobe beef slider, tuna nigri, squid, sea bass, tuna ceviche.  Go and try for yourself!!

title: Incredible meal and view
comment: Our last night in London and what a meal and view! We'd tried booking in advance to no avail, but the concierge at our hotel got us in last minute after our show at the theater. We sat right against the glass in a corner table with London spread out below on two sides.  Other than Gyoza, we selected sushi rolls/nigiri for our dinner. All incredible and with a Sushi Samba twist, but the Wagyu Gyoza and the Tokyo Sky Tree roll were our favorites. Incredible food in an amazing setting on the 38th floor. Staff was quite good but seemed rushed at times. One waitress seemed a bit full of herself. My wife asked her a question while we were ordering and missed part of the answer. She asked her to repeat it and the waitress seemed put out. The rest of the staff were quite good: friendly and helpful. 5 stars food. 4 stars staff.

title: Great location and amazing view!
comment: We were at Sushi Samba for a drink and some food on the bar terrace. The place is really cool and the view is amazing, perfect to enjoy the best sunset of London. The service was great, Ambra was really nice and gave us suggestion about the menu, she was super friendly and very efficient. She refilled our drinks, cleared our plates away and organised the dessert to be served on a slate with "happy birthday" written on it at short notice. Anyway we were not surprised about the food (bar menu) just for the dessert, something different and enjoyable (zen garden).  A special thanks to Ambra, she looked after us well and she has made our experience really nice.

title: Perfection!
comment: The food at Sushisamba is as close to perfection as one gets in this genere! The attention to details and complexity of flavours is next to none! Impressive wine list and the sommelier is extremely knowledgeable elevation our meal further! Spectacular views and good cocktails to round of a perfect night! Considering the quality of food/wine/drinks and location; it is absolutely a good value for money place! Will continue to be a returning customer!

title: Lovely
comment: Me and my girlfriend visited Sushi Samba as part of our weekend to London. It was lovely, granted booking a decent time was tough (2months in advance), but it was worth it. We ate on the terrace overlooking the City. We ordered too much food but what we ate and ordered was lovely. Recommend the tempura prawns and black cod (although it was £44!).

title: Cocktails atop London
comment: Friends & I went for sundowner cocktails over London, we were not let down. A 55 sec speed elevator to the top & you're greeted by quirky cool surroundings, with a view over the city from just about every angle.  Cocktails are interesting & well presented, but be prepared, they are rather pricey! At least you'll find some interesting concoctions that you may not find elsewhere. This place will make any occasion memorable. Our waitress was a darling & very attentive.

title: Bit let down
comment: Been here before and had an amazing meal with first class service. For this reason we returned last night for our anniversary. The food was still good and came out quickly. The service however, really let it down. We sat in the bar first and ordered drinks which never came and had to go an re-order at the bar. We're then called up to collect them ourselves where others had theirs delivered to them - and was then charged service charge!? At the table took ages to order wine and then the waiter came back to double check the order. Despite this when the wine arrived (when we'd finished the mains). It was wrong and the server asked if I'd changed my mind!? Obviously my response was no. During the meal we ordered a chefs selection of sushi which was just put down not told what meats we actually had in front of us - so still not sure what we ate. Not the kind of service I expect from a place like this. Still gave three stars because of the food and the view!

title: Excellent views matched by the food.
comment: The food was very good and the view from the 38th floor outdoor table section is amazing. Their cocktails were some of the best I have had. Very imaginative. I was a little concerned about their dress code after reading a few reviews here and sent them an email in the morning of the reservation (for lunch) to cancel my reservation but they replied promptly and explained that it was not as fussy as some people have made it out to be. I appreciated the reply and clarification and decided to go. Sports attire sneakers are a no-no but dress sneakers are ok (like Converse). Jeans and collared tee shirts were also acceptable. It is expensive but it's well worth the price. Highly recommended.

title: WOW loved it
comment: We loved our evening here. Here's some comments: - the views are outstanding, from the inside bar, outside bar and restaurant. Amazing. One of the best cocktail bars in London and I've done most.  - seating in the restaurant doesn't necessarily mean a window seat, there are only a small number. For larger groups, less chance. But that doesn't put me off. But note this.  - the food was outstanding. Similar to Nobu. The small plates were amazing, especially the Kobe English breakfast, lobster taquitos and the chicken Robata. I can't say enough.  - staff were friendly, helpful. Our waitress wasn't the best I've ever had to be honest, but others around were good and she was fine.  - the cocktails were great, there are 3-4 bars.  - it's a bit on the "be seen" crowd - in that there were lots of very well dressed people here! Not a bad thing, but as the evening went on it got to be a younger /more money crowd I think. Doesn't put me off, but this isn't a low key venue.  - prices, well it's not cheap but everything is on their website. So look first.  - there is some great out door seating if the weather is good. Stunning - NOTE for weekend evenings you need to book 2 months in advance. On the day, 2 months before. Otherwise little chance.  - the elevators/lifts in and out took 5-10 mins. Bare in mind.  Highly recommended, we will be back in 3-4 months. Loved it.

title: It's all about the view
comment: The view is amazing, you really cannot beat it especially if you're sitting at a table for two right by the window. But my boyfriend and I did not feel the food was worth the elevated price. Granted we went for more mainstream choices like ceviche and rolls, not the supremely expensive Kobe beef, but still. I think on our next visit to London we may come back here to enjoy the bar (where you can enjoy the view without a reservation) and skip dinner.

title: Great place but could do better for food
comment: The view is stunning. The dining room is very nice and comfortable and it is a nice spot for couples (we were sitting right by the window). We had two excellent cocktails. As for the food, although we had pleasure eating all that was served, I consider the quality could be better for the price charged. Dishes are either of Japanese or Peruvian inspiration. Some fusion food are very good (ceviche, Kobe burger) but some are not up-to-standard, especially the rolls and the nigiri sushi which are very mundane.  So overall pleased to have been there, but if you look for a pure gastronomy experience or a real Japanese restaurant, this is definitely not the place.

title: Amazing restaurant in an amazing location
comment: The restaurant is located on top of the 38 floor of a London high-rise. The view is great and that is only the beginning to one of the best meals we ever had.

title: Loved it!
comment: I can't fault our visit at SUSHISAMBA, it was a great night. We tried a little of everything and the food was amazing. Our sommelier was great too! She really listened and recommended a wine that meet all our criterias. The views, music, food and atmosphere makes for a great night! Book well in advance as it Get be very tricky to Get a table.

title: Fantastic view, good was awesome too!
comment: Had a business dinner here. Apart from being late by 15 minutes and losing the table reservation, the staff quickly turned around another table 10 minutes after arriving. The staff are friendly and ensure you have an amazing time. We asked the head waiter to arrange a selection for us, everything was perfect and tasted amazing. The view from the 39th floor will leave you with great memories. We dined indoors and later moved outdoors.

title: You pay for the View !
comment: Booked this place months in advance , to impress some wonderful friends from USA  There was an air of snobbery from the minute you arrive ! Glass Elevator ride was the best , we dressed for the occasion bought 3 very expensive cocktails and it went downhill from there  We was kept waiting over 45 minutes felt very unimportant , after asking why we waited so long was finally shown a table ,meal of sushi was a dissapointment end (yes we are sushi experts) followed by us exciting entrees what was so annoying they were so wrapped up in themselves ! And their ambience ! That somehow people want to eat good food to match the expensive price tag while the food looked pretty it lacked taste or enjoyment I saw the executive chef sitting with a client tasting food ! Would loved for him to of tried mine along with my comment I mentioned this to the waitress who gave me the bill ,but it fell on deaf ears !  No one interested looks was everything but it did not follow through would never go back or recommend ...

title: Great ambiance
comment: The views and overall environment are really cool. The service was great and food was yummy. If you aren't on a budget, I suggest you hit this place up during sunset or after while in London.

title: Great vibe, great food!
comment: Loved this place so much more than I thought I would! I wasn't sure about the Peruvian/Brazilian/Japanese fusion but it works! The location on 37th floor gives wonderful views of London. You can pop outside for photos of the cityscape and there is a lovely tree covered in red fairy lights to pose for selfies under. The music and atmosphere has a great Latino vibe but the service and food is what really made my experience so special. Spicy prawn tempura, Kobe beef sliders, sushi, made with fresh crab. All good apart from the sliders, which were too undercooked for me. Make your reservation in advance and enjoy this fun place to dine!

title: Delightful
comment: As always, the food is fresh and delicious and presented in a beautiful manner. The ambiance, the presentation of the food and the view almost make up for the high prices, but the price alone is why it gets 4 instead of 5 stars from me. I was lucky enough to be able to expense this meal, but I would not make it a regular habit if the price tag was coming out of my own wallet! I would, however, recommend it for special occasions.

title: Excellent. The price is high but everything was perfect. Recommendable
comment: I had lunch with a colleague. The place is absolutely amazing specially the terrace during summer. The food was really good combining different styles of food. The service was great too. I will come back when I return to London

title: Fantastic evening from start to finish
comment: Myself, sister and friend has a wonderful evening dining at sushi samba. We started off on the outside terrace bar where we each had a cocktail - mine being a beautiful smoked negroni.  Then was offered a table outside but chose to eat in due to the wind. We were served by a waitress that gave us amazing recommendations; we had the prawn tempura (best we've ever tasted), pork and veggie rolls, black cod and salmon sashimi (also delicious). Neringa then took over and was amazing!!!!  She refilled our drinks, cleared our plates away and organised the fruit salad desert to be served on a slate with "happy birthday" written on it at short notice. The whole evening was lovely and we will certainly be returning. Thank you.

title: Visit for a view!
comment: This place is probably is must visit for its view, especially it your table is outside. Service was good. Almost funny, how different servers would come one after another asking the same question and trying to take the same orders. ))Food is just good, nothing special. The recommended 5-6 dishes per table to share. We had 4 and we're satisfied with the amount. Would go to this place again to enjoy a cocktail and the view.

title: A lovely birthday treat!
comment: My partner took me here for my birthday and it was perfect. It was such a hot evening we sat outside and the views were incredible! The staff were super friendly and very efficient. Our sushi came out pretty quick after ordering, was beautifully presented and tasted delicious. It was fairly expensive but not too bad given the views, service and food.

title: Good food but service could improve
comment: Good food and great view. We were not satisfied with the service. We had table at midnight. It was not full and plenty of staff. We order a bottle of wine and constantly needed to asked to get wine from the bottle and sat most of the time with empty glasses. It felt that the staff was more eager to clean up and close then to serve us well. But the food was good but the value not because of the poor service level.

title: Everything we hoped for and more
comment: Having wanted to eat at Sushisamba for years, we went in with very high expectations  (this has previously ended in disappointment). But I'm so glad to say that we left having had a meal that far surpassed what we had expected. We had around seven different dishes and none of them disappointed, even the lowest ranking dish we had was fantastic. The highlight was without a doubt the Tiger Maki sushi rolls, but the Yellowtail Taquitos and the Lamb Robata were also brilliant. Sushisamba doesn’t have the same pretentious atmosphere that  hangs around Roka and Hakkasan like a fog. The food speaks for itself and the restaurant itself feels fun and casual. The views are incredible, we went on a Sunday afternoon at 4pm and so it was still daylight which was lovely but I'd imagine that is magical with the city lights at night. It does get booked up very quickly so its best to plan as far in advance as possible. We will definitely be back.

title: Good food, great view but...
comment: It is my second time visiting Sushisamba, and most likely I'll wait a long time to go there again. Don't get me wrong, the food is extremely tasty, but as other reviewers have written, the poor service and loud dining atmosphere bring the whole dining experience down. In both occasions, service was sloppy, and at times you feel that you're doing them a favour.  Certainly, the place itself has something special beyond the food.

title: Excellent service, food and atmosphere
comment: The place was amazing but most of all I was very impressed by the service of the waiter Salvador who made my experience absolutely incredible. Thank you Salvadore.

title: Good food but ...
comment: Sushi Samba is located in The City which is not my favourite destination for a restaurant. I have to say as you enter the reception and handling of clientele is quite poor. We were seated near the bar area a good 15 minutes before anyone asked for our drinks. Also the bar outside looked functioning but doesn't serve so you have to sit inside to have a drink before your table is ready.  The flight up to the restaurant gives it some oomf but once you're in the restaurant there is nothing so special it's more like a canteen than a dining place. The service is not that efficient had to ask several times to remove the finished edamame.  Once our waiter Manuel took the order things seemed more serious and the food was really good I have to admit.  It's not my favourite restaurant and I don't think I'll make the effort again in the near future. They should train their waiters as their mannerism is more like canteen than dining. Brought water without glasses and give you the bill of £5 to pay at the bar area before your table is ready which I found quite distasteful.

title: silly to the point of comical
comment: What can I say...? I read all the signs wrong thinking this might present some interesting new takes on sushi. My mistake. In reality this is a lot of show and not a lot of substance. The food is not bad, but it´s impossible to enjoy due to all the fuss. Too many waiters running around doing... I have no idea... music overpowering all other senses and a general feeling that not a lot of love goes into the food or service. If you are looking for a good food experience and a cosy evening with people you like. Don´t go. If you are looking for a little entertainment on the faux fancy side, and you feel you can afford it. Do go. The two stars/dots are for one of our waitresses who was actually really nice.

title: Overrated
comment: The name already sounds a bit interesting but I gave it a go, i wasnt very sure of what to expect. The space and decoration is really good, amazing views and nice decoration, amazing terraze... all seems amazing at first Then you get the food and you already know it's overrated and overpriced. It's not delicious and you are paying a Michelin Star price (after the dinner you realize you are paying the top floor of a tower, no matter if you order sushisamba or hotdogs). The cocktails were good but same as dirty martiny chain and double price. Really good restaurants if you just want to put a picture on instagram or impress people who don't appreciate good food... but not for having a delicious meal.

title: Mesmerising
comment: This was a wholesome experience based on both style and substance. The venue itself is a feast for the eyes both inside and out and you gaze across London.  The food is good, not great, but the overall experience is all encompassing from start to finish. The cocktails are also on point!

title: A great night out
comment: A fantastic meal at Sushi Samba last night. Our waiter, Manuel, really made the experience by recommending his favorites as we had no idea what to order. The food was simply awesome! I've read a lot of mixed reviews about this place, people claiming it's not real sushi blah blah blah. I could not care less, it was some of the tastiest fare I've had in a looong time. Each course was exquisite. Yes, the ambiance is brash and the restaurant busy, it's not the place for a quiet meal and it's decor is a little worn around the edges but it's not trying to be the Wosleley. As a landmark restaurant it delivers. Check your pretensions at the door and enjoy it!

title: Disappointed
comment: I have been here a number of times but this week felt let down by the staff and sommelier. The wine I chose was not available and ended up being upsold to a £120 bottle, when wanted to spend around £80. The waitress was dismissive and the meal was disappointing. Will go back as hope they were just having a bad day.

title: Amazing
comment: Sushi samba is such a nice classy modern place to go to eat and socialise! It has a nice bar and terrace and the views are amazing! Food amazing to! Had the black cod,chicken teriyaki,lobster taquiots and samba roll! All very tasty! Would highly recommend.

title: Fab sushi
comment: Fab sushi, fab cocktails and fab views!  Definitely worth going here for a treat, the sushi was insane and we only had it at the snack bar. I would definitely come back and dine in the restaurant!  Great cocktail choices with a little terrace outside you have some amazing views!  You can watch the sushi being made which is always fun! Top tips: A) Dress code is very important!  B) You need to book if having a meal!

title: Lunch
comment: Very different vibe at lunch compared to the evening as one would expect, but the evening time is the time is the best time in my view. The food was good, but I kept getting this taste and texture of egg whites in almost all the dishes, which spoilt it for me, the food was really flavoursome however. I could not have alcohol on that day so tried the non alcoholic drinks which were OK. Had to wait a long time for the food, and there was some confusion between the waiting staff, but the views were great on the terrace in the day time as much as night time.

title: Saké for dinner!
comment: My first time drinking Saké with fusion food and it was a roaring success, thank you Salvador for looking after us and taking us through the different types of Saké available. The team couldn't have been more helpful and charming. Oh and of course we had cocktails - they were absolutely delicious (we had the yuzu gin fizz, the nina freza and the pistachio and avocado batida)  . Food: I was actually surprised by the portion size, even the small plates were very decent. The Wagyu beef gyozas aren't to be missed, as are the shrimp tempura and rolls are delicious too. We also shared a Moqueca Mista, a delicious Brazilian fish stew with coconut milk and chimichurri rice.   Desserts were beautifully presented and equally delicious: Alfajores (revisited, Sushisamba style of course), Chocolate banana cake and 'Welcome to the rainforest', a signature dessert with asháninka chocolate, asháninka coffee, vanilla, pistachio, macadamia nut and sugar cane, served in a closed 'bowl' shaped like a cocoa bean.   All in all: great. There were issues with our desserts and we had to wait 40 min for them but Salvador saved the day and kindly wrote them off our bill. This was much appreciated - these things happen but not many restaurants would not charge them as token of apology for the delay.   I'm not giving 5* because you can't wear flip flops for dinner - my friend had to go and buy a pair of sandals so she could get in (her flip flops were actually more expensive than the £10 pair of shoes she bought). It's London, it's 21st century and the 'no flip flop' rule reminded me of the very stern 'you need to wear a tie' rule back in... well a long time ago. That being said, I'll dump my flip flops any day for that Wagyu beef gyoza...

title: Great vibe, service & food
comment: We rocked up to this place at about 9 PM without any reservations. My wife and I were told to wait until 11 PM for a table. Normally we would have left for somewhere else, but we had heard a lot about this place and wanted to try it out. We got a drink and went to chill in the outdoor area. There was a DJ playing good music and the crowd was quite happening. It was almost like being at a bar/lounge for drinks before dinner. Before we knew it, our table was ready and they took us to a whole new big area where all the dinner tables were located. We ordered the squid, some sushi (hot salmon with mozzarella & spicy tuna) and shrimp tempura. Food was good and price wasn't cheap, but we expected that. Overall a great and memorable experience.

title: A fine place to chill out - expensive tho!
comment: for a large group we relaxed here on the hottest day of the summer & it felt great to be honest in the air.  Service was decent, but bar staff were unfamiliar with a few basic cocktails which was surprising especially as cocktails cost between £14 - £16 Each.... so for that price you want a decent cocktail.. I am scoring this as average since its costly yet they don't know many well known cocktails which is pretty poor for its location ..

title: Great Food - Amazing Views
comment: Was taken for a special birthday celebration. Excellent Mojitos accompanied by Green Bean Tempura in black truffle aioli followed by brilliant yellowtail taquitos. Then an great selection of cerviche tapas & sushi. The views over London are spectacular. Great service .

title: Food was a major disappointment but the view and service were excellent
comment: We went for a special occasion requesting a window table. One cannot fault the service or the effort to make us feel welcome...especially Alvaro who was charming.  The food, however was truly, truly substandard. Perhaps we ordered the wrong things. Everything was so over seasoned or under seasoned. There was no balance. Salt and pepper squid was totally tasteless and had a powdery texture like it was made earlier in the evening and re-heated as was the rock shrimp tempura...both soggy and beyond tasteless. The only redeeming part of the dish was the incredible black truffle vinaigrette. The spicy mayo, also tasteless.  The scallop ceviche was so spicy that aside from the sauce, one could not taste any hint of scallop. One cannot overpower something as delicate as scallops.  We also went a little off piste with a dish recommended to us which was yucca chips on a bed of sweet potato, spicy mayo (I think) all covered in crushed black sesame seeds to make the dish look like earth with molten lava. Whilst the dish looked interesting, it was terribly sweet to the point of putting us off anything else, especially pudding.  I have to say the sushi looked better so perhaps one sticks to rolls at this restaurant.  The other rather disappointing thing was, food waste. For the sake of presentation, when the chefs in the open kitchens cut the maki rolls, they cut off the uneven end pieces and throw them in the bin. With so many restaurants now regularly giving food at the end of the day to homeless shelters, imagine the amount of 'end bits' which add up in an evening. Discarding food like this is a disgrace and a blatant ignorance for those who go hungry.  In the end, the best part of this place was arriving, viewing and departing followed by the lovely staff.

title: Expensive but nice drink stop, shame the great view is spoiled
comment: We popped here during our stay in London not knowing how expensive it was. The lady at the door looked us both up and down before we were allowed to enter which we found uncomfortable as she wasn't subtle. It was ok, nothing amazing. £13 for an expensive version of Malibu and Lemonade which didn't taste great and £7 for a beer which my fiancé really enjoyed. We're not in a rush to return though.

title: The best view and the best tapas in the City
comment: Yes, we thoroughly enjoyed our lunch. Went as suggested, for the tapas, 7 beautiful and unique dishes. Staff great, service wonderful and priced reasonably.

title: A combination of good stuff!
comment: The place has everything to guarantee you a great experience. You can hang around at the bar while you wait for your table and you'll be able to take the coolest pictures with the whole of London at the background. Enjoy the top quality cocktails and then head to your table once you're called. Expect a great customer service as you'll be hosed by awesome staff and their menu is composed of very attractive fusion cuisine. All very gourmet! If you're visiting London, the place must be included on your list.

title: review
comment: the plates were very good, so was the view and the elevator. the food was excellent taste and looks. the waiters Salvador and Alvaro were especially friendly and generally good waitors.

title: Outstanding in all ways...
comment: A superb place which gives you one of the best views in London. The service was excellent, hosts and waiters were very professional. Our host Milton was very kind to guide us to our table and checked a few times if everything was fine. The waiter gave us plenty of good suggestions. Food and drinks were to a very hight standard. A must see in London.

title: Amazing place
comment: My wife and I went to Sushi Samba last week and it was superb. The service in the restaurant was very good, the food is outstanding with a really good twist on the more traditional Nobu or Roka.  The view is just ridiculous from the lift getting up there to standing around there outdoor bar on the 38th floor!!! Very much recommended !!

title: Average sushi, spectacular view
comment: The view is complete stunning and as a sushi enthusiast it's great to have a maki roll with a view of London. We got a spot quite fast but the service was very slow. We had to chase for water and our server seemingly forgot our coffees and she brought them twenty minutes after we ordered. We shared five rolls and found this enough for three (plus edamame and friend beans). The rolls were good but we were expecting better for all the hype!

title: Great first visit here! Definitely not the last one...
comment: Fantastic location and the best sushi experience I have had so far. I was here with colleagues but can't wait to come back with my wife.

title: Rubbish
comment: Couldn't get in because my friend had the wrong style of shoes. Unbelievable that in this day and age you can't get in to a place because of shoes! If people can get in dressed in scruffy t-shirts and shorts but the right pair of shoes, they need to really readdress their dress policy! Won't be telling anyone to come here ever again. What a waste of time.

title: Amazing roof terrace cocktail bar
comment: Didn't eat so cannot comment on the food although what I saw looked good but the cocktail bar on the roof terrace is great. The views, the drinks, the setup. Everything about it in day or night was superb.

title: Views
comment: Great food and great views, still tough to get a table. Not impossible if you book far enough ahead. If you're stuck between choosing here or duck n waffle...there's no competiton. Food and drinks here are incredible. I always have the shrimp tempura and squid. Some of the best basic dishes in the world. Book it!

title: Amazing
comment: Another great night at Sushi Samba, my guests and I were very well looked after by Salvador - fantastic waiter and once again provided with excellent service and usual high quality food. I look forward to visiting again soon

title: Fine dining
comment: Great food, delicious drinks and an amazing view... but the service was terrible. We waited 45 minutes to be served and then our drinks came out after we had started eating. The restaurant was not full, and there were plenty of staff so there is no excuse for poor service.

title: Birthday lunch
comment: Great location, Great service Even as vegetarians our needs were catered for The Saké was strong but very tasty...not sure it was completely appropriate at lunch though

title: Brazil in london
comment: Despite the fact that SushiSamba is an American restaurant chain, it has nothing to do with the state. Exotic Japanese-Brazilian-Peruvian mixture can be traced not only in the names of dishes in the menu, but also in music, and even in dances, which sometimes end the evenings. London SushiSamba is the first point of the restaurant chain in Europe, and the Americans decided to open up to the grand opening: they occupied the 38th (restaurant and terraces) and the 39th (bar) floors of the newly built Skyscraper Heron (Heron Tower). The views from the new high-rise are stunning, the dishes are crazy with their scents, and the rhythms of the samba are suddenly transferred to the beaches of Rio. In general, if you need to "hang" - to you here.

title: First visit - amazing, second visit - dissapointing
comment: My first visit in early 2016 was fab! We booked a table for a splash out dinner to celebrate our anniversary - the food and service were great!  Second time round, in late 2016, we decided on dinner elsewhere and dessert/cocktail 'only' in the Sushisamba. There did not seem to be any issues with this request at the point of the booking, however on arrival we received a rather rude greeting from the server who indicated we would not get a table for dessert only. After unpleasant exchange with the server, we were eventually seated. We stayed briefly but managed to have a cocktail (or two..) each and a dessert with wine paring, spending a little fortune for just over 45 mins visit. I do not know if it was how rudely we were treated that made the WITH LOVE FROM RIO taste nowhere near as delicious, as it did the first time round... We may be back again for some cocktails in the clouds (the outdoor bar is amazing) but will stay clear of the restaurant.

title: Fantastic!
comment: We went for the bar. Even we had no reservation on a Saturday night we didn't wait. The bar is gorgeous offering a fantastic view. Cocktail are expensive (£14-16) but really good, and for once, real quantities of alcohol.  Unfortunately it is crowded and get a seat near the window is difficult. You must come early. But it is still very nice to walk around the bar to enjoy the different views. Music played is nice when you like commercial, modern and Latin songs. Clientele is very young and majority young ladies.

title: Great for night out with friends
comment: This is not really a family restaurant as we did not see any kids eating here. It's got a clublike ambiance so great for hanging out with friends or as a couple. Enjoyed their yellow tail and dragon roll

title: Dinner
comment: Really good food great service and view was amazing. Do recommend, booking is a must. Great place to take pictures of the London Skyline.

title: Great views, average food. Bland Sushi
comment: I have visited the bar at SushiSamba numerous times, and have always had a great evening in the bar area and outside terrace. This time I ate for the first time in the restaurant, the starters of edamame, green beans tempura where nice, the salt and pepper squid and prawn tempura where a let down flavour wise. We ordered about 6 different sushi rolls on recommendation of the waiter. Unfortunately these were bland and not upto expectation of SushiSamba. I really hoped it would set the standard high for London. However after being to many places in London for sushi, this is probably the worst for sushi! On top of that, service was a bit slow, only at the end of our meal did a manager come over to ask about our food, no waiter came before to check on if all was satisfying. We spoke with the manager who kindly took off some of the dishes as we didnt finish them. I will definitely come back for the bar, but not for the restaurant as the sushi was a let down.

title: Poor service!-Excellent quality of food
comment: I took my best friend to Sushisamba for a birthday dinner the second year in a row. The food was excellent as always, sushi is freshly made and the ingredients are good quality. However, the service was poor from the beginning until the last minute. We felt ignored by the hostess as well as the servers were not engaging at all throughout the service. In the end, I expected at least the server to wish my friend Happy Birthday as I mentioned it when I reserved the table. Instead, a table next to us got a candle with her dessert and written Happy Birthday on the plate where my friend was ignored and not recognized. Very disappointing and embarrassing!

title: One of the best view of london
comment: We had a wonderful time for our party for 7 at sushisamba. Sharing a lot of different and interesting dishes was fun. We ordered a bit of everything. And all the dishes were well prepared and very tasty also servise were excellent.

title: stunning experience
comment: this was just the top of the tops. the lift, the bar, the restaurant, the food, the service.. FIRST CLASS SERVICE

title: My London favourite
comment: I booked this 2 months in advance as it is so difficult to get in at a decent time. This is still my favourite place to dine in London, the food, the view, the atmosphere make for a great evening.  The mocktails themselves are delicious and different from the norm. My favourites are the tiger maki and tempura prawns, can't dine there without ordering these two staples.  As it was a special occasion I was given a nice corner table with a view and luckily we were there for sunset, all in all, I couldn't have asked for anymore. I can't recommend this place enough. The only downside is how difficult it is to get a reservation at a decent time, but it is definitely worth it!

title: An unforgettable dining experience!
comment: Orgasmic...that's the correct term to use when describing dining here. This was our last lunch of a week-long vacation in London and what a way to end! My incentive was to check out the actual architecture of the rooftop - that alone is worth having a drink in their gorgeous lounge area. But then there is the food... We had it all: the edamame, yellowtail taquitos, samba salad,tuna ceviche, the robata chicken...all so good. But then came the sushi rolls. We ordered the Samba London and Tiger Maki rolls. My husband and I basically relied on the expertise of our spunky server, as we were hesitant to order something a little too out there (I mean, how does one mix Peruvian and sushi flavors together?). OMG...it can be done! Especially the Tiger Maki...I wish we had ordered more than one. And if that wasn't enough, our spunky server *highly recommended* the chocolate banana cake. We had our two kids with us (ages 5 & 7), who we literally had to fight with to get bites...it was beyond spectacular. To add, the restaurant was great with our kids: they had the kiddie chopsticks and were super friendly with them throughout. Let's not forget how absolutely cool this place is in terms of the views (38th & 39th floors), floor to ceiling windows, amazing vaulted ceiling design. There is no element of this dining experience that wasn't thought out...extremely cohesive, inspiring and memorable. It is most definitely my go-to place anytime I go back to London.

title: Amazing views - a little touristy crowd
comment: My friends and I visited SushiSamba one late Wednesday evening, and enjoyed ourselves outside for two hours or so. Great drinks, amazing views and a cool place to visit at least once. We were lucky enough to get seats, and I’m not sure if we would have stayed for two hours if we didn’t. Prices were OK, considering the view you get as a bonus. Drinks were from £12, wine from £7.5. It wasn’t the “coolest” crowd there – we almost felt like we were surrounded by tourists. Lots and lots of selfies going on… But hey – the views! It was worth it!

title: Birthday dinner
comment: Disappointing and verging on shocking! From the moment we arrived it was unfortunately glaringly obvious that this is not a restaurant that copes well with bookings for more than 4 people in a party.  This was most disappointing as (when you book 3 months in advance!) they lead you to believe that they are geared up for such events (in our case a birthday dinner for 10.)  Having complied with requests to select cocktails, wine and menu choices before the evening, some of this information unfortunately was not passed on, leaving guests waiting in the bar without pre ordered drinks and seemingly no staff knowledge of the booking.  While the food was delicious, it was presented in such a way that made it unnecessarily complicated and a little awkward to divide between guests to serve ourselves, which was the expectation. This idea would well for a couple but not for a group of 10. The claim that vegetarians etc are catered for is technically correct, however while again this food was delicious (apparently) there was no clear explanation of what was presented.  Frankly a most disappointing evening, high in cost and low on attention to detail. Half hearted attempts were made to compensate for the many complaints but I fear the underlying problems will not be addressed, it matters not, we will not be returning to find out! Our evening was, sadly, best summarised when, after a shocking attack on London's streets last night and with the understandable transport chaos in the aftermath, diners were forced to leave the establishment. It was obviously far more important for the staff to be able to leave on time than to allow customers to secure transport options.  An overhyped, overpriced money making machine which has little regard for those greasing the wheels. Avoid except for couples who want an expensive dinner with a view but wouldn't mind being asked to leave in an emergency with no regard for personal safety.  Restaurants like this simply do not merit the necessity to book 3 months in advance. Frankly it's surprising that anyone bothers to go at all, although the view is good, visit the Shard/Eye/take a flight out of City airport to avoid the disappointment.

title: Birthday lunch - highlight being the view
comment: I had reserved the restaurant 2 months in advance as surprise birthday present for my girlfriend who loves sushi.  We were welcomed and seated promptly - lovely interior and fantastic views over London. We ordered a couple of cocktails and a variety of rolls off the menu. Although the food took a while to arrive our server kept us informed which was appreciated. But the wait did not justify the food, we found the sushi bland and tasteless.  Having eaten at numerous sushi restaurants this just didn't compare to others. What we did get was spectacular views, decent cocktails just not great food for the prices paid. We won't be rushing back but nonetheless glad we tried it.

title: Rooftop bar is amazing - restaurant avoid service not so good
comment: The rooftop bar is amazing, the atmosphere, drinks and the city view. The restaurant is beautiful, the food wasn't that great comparing to Nobu sushi but the ambience was nice.  Let me say our server ruined our experience. Avoid Salvatore - he was too worried on picking up hot chicks and joking around with other servers. We had drinks that didn't get refreshed, no soy sauce brought to our table with our sushi and we had to wait and get other servers to run the service. He took our orders and never returned.  We told management on the way out and all they did was bring us champagne. Seriously? get rid of your crappy server because there was a girl there working her but off - being attentive and doing his job while he goofed off.

title: Hair in my dinner
comment: Unfortunately, it happened to me, that there was a dark hair in my Tempura Sushi. I told the waiter and she apologised. However, I expected the manager to approach me, as this is a no go for this pricey restaurant...

title: Really lovely but pricey
comment: Visited yesterday evening for a quick drink before a meal with friends. After passing security to go in and up 36 floors it leads you to the roof terrace. Lovely views of London and overlooks the gurkin. The drinks are lovely but quite pricey with a round of 8 costing £90. The terrace is in the shade at 1800hrs and with a breeze was a little chilly but blankets are provided! Two restaurants are available which I am told serve lovely food! Recommended and a great atmosphere!

title: Four stars. Many good points
comment: Fantastic food - every dish a winner. (Particularly liked the hot sushi). The views are outstanding. A great venue for a celebration. So why 4 stars rather than 5?  The booking experience is terrible. Book months in advance and the latest time to reserve a table is 5.45 - The restaurant wants people to turn up without a reservation and spend a couple of hours drinking in the (expensive) bar. We turned up at 5.45, but our table was not available until 6.15

title: Hmmmmm
comment: London is what is is...... Let's all be honest. The quality of sushi here is equivalent to how the British take care of their teeth....... With that being said- sit back, relax, and enjoy. And as always. Say hi to your mom.

title: My favourite posh place in London
comment: I must say that this is definitely my beloved place in London. What I LOVE here is the great variety of cocktails.  It is slightly expensive but the view, the atmosphere, and the service are exceptional. Must visit when in London

title: Turned away by a very rude doorman
comment: We (mature couple) tried to eat here at 11.30pm bank holiday Sunday. The taxi driver highly recommended this place but a very rude young man on the door said 'we are not taking walk ins'...This is a fair enough policy but his attitude was very abrupt and unnecessary and he needs some lessons in customer service. Very disappointing first impression of the place.. The rest of this area had shut down early and was like a ghost town.

title: Amazing views, sushi and cocktails
comment: We visited on a Saturday afternoon about 5pm. We managed to get a window seat by the bar.. which has amazing views! Cocktails are yummy and we ordered some sushi which is the best I've ever tasted! Will definitely come back :)

title: Great views, average food.
comment: First, the atmosphere/scene here is terrific. Definitely recommend going for drinks, but I would skip the dinner. We had a group of 8 people and they forced us to have a set menu. The purpose of this is to make it easier on the cooks I guess, but it made for a poor dining experience. The things we ordered in addition to the set items were much better. Overall I would tell you that the food was average. I am glad I went once, but I would not go back.

title: Birthday lunch
comment: Having wanted to visit this restaurant for quite sometime, I was not disappointed when we got there! From the friendly security guy at the bottom of the (very fast, not for the faint-hearted) lift to the attentive, friendly staff in the restaurant. The views are amazing and the food was fabulous! I had an unforgettable birthday lunch at Sushi Samba - thank you!

title: Prime location, excellent food, service is average
comment: Sushi Samba has probably the best location in London along with the Shard. It might be a bit overrated but in the end a lot of people are still trying to get tables there. The food there is pricey for sure but excellent at the same time. It is a mix of asian and argentinian food. Average main courses's will be in the 35 to 45 GBP.  After a handful of visit, I find the service a bit average and confused.

title: An experience
comment: I'm crazy scared of heights, so this was quite the thrill haha. Unfortunately it was very foggy and we couldn't see much, but the view was still spectacular, i really enjoyed the view of the St. Mary Axe, very pretty. I would love to try eating on the balcony of sushishamba in the summertime.  The inside of the restaurant was very pretty with bamboo and rustic japanese plates, i liked the style quite a lot. The restaurant was very cold, which i prefer to too hot, but we were kinda shivering the whole meal. The music was way too loud for conversation, and it was a little hard communicating with the waiters at that volume. But the staff was helpful and the design of the food was interesting. Very good food, super delicate!

title: I will never be able to eat sushi anywhere but here!
comment: Amazing place with incredble food! We wanted to try everything in the menu cuz everything sounded so incredible good.  We ate the sushi london that was amazing, anticuchos, chicken teriyaki, kobe nigiri. DELICIOUS!!

title: Great time in!
comment: Great time here!it was exactly what I saw on internet,when I checked for details!amazing views,friendly staff,good value,good sushi

title: Outstanding as always
comment: I have been to sushi samba on numerous occasions with my partner and family and this time was no different. You do have to book quite far in advance but it's always worth it.  Great atmosphere, outstanding service and food and of course you pay for the view and the lovely outside bar.  Great cocktails. 4 of us picked 2 or 3 dishes each, a mixture of sushi, wagu burgers, fish etc. Served beautifully and tasted lovely. Will keep coming back here! Definitely worth a treat considering the price tags

title: Love the food and atmosphere
comment: You need to reserve in advance to get a table here, and although rather pricey, it is well worth it! The food is a fusion of Asian and Brazilian. Portions are small so we ordered a large variety of plates to share and we were not disappointed!  The atmosphere is very cool and luxurious and in the summer months when the outdoor terrace is open, having a cold cocktail is very nice indeed!

title: Poor staff etiquette. Great food & views.
comment: Food- 4 views - 4 Staff -2  Overall score 3 Food - We dined in a group of 9 and therefore had no choice but to dine from the set menu. Food was excellent with lots of variety and fantastic presentation. It also came out on time which was great.  The restaurant took into account various dietary requirements (vegetarian and no beef) and had a great offering.  Views and ambience - excellent.  Drinks - The non alcoholic drink selection is practically non existent and a lack of creativity means there is no improvisation.  Staff - waiters themselves were ok. No warm welcome/ smile on arrival. We were waiting for a few people to arrive before proceeding to our table. Nobody really attended to us to ask if we wanted drinks and we had all come from quite far so that was disappointing. Additionally when I myself approached the staff to say we were ready to be seated- they didn't even say they would come over and escort us. When I had a question about the deposit paid in advance - it wasn't clear who I needed to speak to and nobody could be bothered to tell me who would deal with it. £50 deposit for a £60 menu - quite ridiculous to say the least! The response was blunt and rude. Although an explanation was offered - staff seemed tired, snappy and impatient.  FYI- for people paying separately on the day, any deposit can only be refunded the day after rather than on the day.  Overall- if staff etiquette is improved this is a great place.

title: Short...Excellent!!
comment: Great experience. The restaurant looks very nice and the views are amazing!! The food was really good with a great mix of flavours and colours. Service was great especially Lazlo and Salvador were very nice. Booking process is quite difficult as the availability is limited but I guess we all understand why. After dinner we had a couple of drinks in the outside area at the bar with the orange tree, again great views, nice music and good atmosphere.

title: Yes, it's expensive but SO WORTH IT
comment: Went here in Dec 2016 for my parents' wedding anniversary. Loved the staff - they were so attentive and gave great recommendations and even presented my parents with a small free dessert with the words 'Happy Anniversary' on it. The cocktails were so original and tasty. The food was TO DIE FOR. It was absolutely stunning and, although it's pricey, it's so worth a visit. You won't regret it. Gorgeous views over London too - great photo opp!!

title: fantastic sushi, okay service
comment: Overall I really enjoyed my meal here, the sushi was great, the drinks were tasty, and the atmosphere and views lived up to my expectations. The waitstaff was a little slow, and we did have a hard time getting their attention when we did need anything, but they were friendly overall, and more than apologetic afterward. I would highly recommend the scallop seviche, the flavor was absolutely perfect. I would love to return!

title: A truly wonderful experience, atmosphere, food and cocktails. Loved it all!
comment: We celebrated a family birthday here and everyone was thrilled with the food, the service, the atmosphere, the cocktails - just about everything! Our waiter was more than helpful and friendly. He suggested putting together our meal for us and asked a few questions of things we liked, didn't like, allergies etc. His choices were excellent I must say. Everybody thoroughly enjoyed the dishes and overall it was voted a great idea to get an 'experts' help. The top dish we all felt, was the blackened cod. It was quite incredible! If you like fish, then you must try this. I'm a great fish lover and have to say this is one of the nicest fish dishes I have ever had.  I'm not a great sushi lover however but the sushi I tried at the restaurant was lovely. There wasn't anything I did not like. For desserts we choice a mixture and the rain forest dessert was absolutely scrumptious! Many cocktails were enjoyed that luncheon and for me the long mango cocktail was divine. It's a long cocktail and quite creamy with coconut milk. It was incredible. In fact all the cocktails were perfect. Just one word of warning, there is a smokey whisky cocktail and yes it is SMOKEY! Lovely if you like that but wow it's peaty! The service we had that day was perfect. So friendly and polite and courteous. Nothing was any trouble and it really made the meal all the more special because of that.  The view over London is quite spectacular and we were lucky enough on that day to have beautiful clear blue skies so could see for miles. Couldn't look down too much as not great with heights but across London the view is amazing!  The life up to the restaurant is a glass, high speed one so just a little word of warning for people (like me!) who aren't so keen on heights!  It is an expensive experience of that there is no question but for a special birthday or treat, this restaurant is one of a kind. Exquisite!

title: Meeting with friends ❤
comment: It's a must visit place in London. Great cocktails and drinks. Proffesional service and the most breattaling view I've ever seen. Night London is truly amazing It was really unforgettable experience. Everything was just wonderfull

title: Amazing place for dinner and enjoy London from a "roof"
comment: Amazing terrace - roof view. Food was really good too. I do not have a reference of price as it was a business party. That said, I will comeback for sure!

title: Great experience
comment: Its an amazing restaurant with awesome views over London. Really great experience, lovely food, great service, nice cocktails.  Only reason its not a 5* rating is it was quite pricey for our budget. In the photos I've added. 2 of the very small salmon 'bites' are £12, the price I'm used to paying for a large main course.  That said, if you can afford it or for a one off treat, its great!

title: Great restaurant and wonderful service
comment: The experience starts with the stoning location on the 38 floor with great view of the city.  Then, the atmosphere - great music, and great service.  We were lucky and got Salvador as our host and we let him pick for us the whole menu.  He didn't disappoint us.  He was so helpful and kind.  We had a great time.  We recommend every sushi lover to visit here when he come to London

title: Nice place, a bit overrated, but nice.
comment: Nice place, great decor, great staff, and the picanha dish is really good. On the japanese side, shushi was good, but nothing out of this world. Drinks made to perfection a the view pays it all, besides the London skyline isn't that beautiful....The L.A one and the Rio skyline are way more attractive. But if you consider tail to mouth, it's good enough. Go check it out and tell us what youthink too!

title: Best View
comment: Best view I have seen. Food very delicious, atmosphere cosy and friendly. Strongly recommend for those who love big city rhythm.

title: Breathtaking Views, great food
comment: Stunning views over London and beyond. Good atmosphere, nice outdoor space, good cocktails and an interesting menu. Food well presented and well cooked, one of the best set of Japanese dishes I've eaten. Great cocktails, but if you want to try the Kobe beef better take out a second mortgage!

title: Cocktails with a view!
comment: We visited Sushisamba for drinks only (no reservation and without one we wouldn't get a table until midnight). Travelling up to the 38th floor in the bullet lift is a thrill and the staff were all very pleasant and helpful. We tried some delicious cocktails and enjoyed the lively atmosphere. It felt very Sex and the City. A fun place to visit for a stunning view.

title: Great location, service and good fusion food
comment: Took my husband for his surprise bday lunch treat, totally loved the view (even though it was cloudy and dark), and the ambiance. The sushi were delicious and fresh. Had a great time, hubby loved it too. Just a bit too expensive specially the small portion Sake they offered us. Overall a god experience, worth a visit.

title: Amazing Once Again
comment: This was my third visit to SushSamba and it did not disappoint yet again. We visited on a Thursday slightly after peak lunch time and it was busy enough to have an atmosphere, but quiet enough that we had the balcony and fire pit to ourselves for our pre-dinner drinks! Food was, as always, outstanding. The yellowtail crispy taquitos was a dish I hadn't tried before and god knows why, as they were sensational. Yet again the moqueca mista and El topo samba rolls were to die for. In my opinion, the best fusion food in London. We gave our waiter our budget, the dishes we definitely wanted and then asked them to send out their best. The chef did not disappoint. Cannot recommend this place highly enough. I am hoping to visit the New York restaurant with my partner in June.

title: Food was amazing - but service can be improved
comment: We went for our weekly family dinner here and started with the cocktails. It was packed but still, it should not have taken 45 mins to come. We then ordered the food and the problem was the sheer time it took to arrive. Ofcourse then the problem is that they have limited timed seating and so we were ushered off our table to continue drinks at the bar. I was with my parents so they didnt really fancy standing in a crowded bar for a drink so we left.  Quicker service would have allowed us to enjoy the table a bit more without wasting pretty much our first hour waiting for our drinks and food to still arrive. Not sure whether I would go back with my family as didn't appreciate being rushed, especially after the delay was due to the restaurant themselves not us. That being said, the food was excellent.

title: Excellent service, delicious food & fab views
comment: The service was absolutely fantastic when we visited, the staff were extremely attentive and their timings was spot on. The food was absolutely scrumptious and surprisingly very filling. We thought we may needed to order more food but by the time dessert came we were absolutely stuffed. Nice touch on the surprise birthday plate for my boyfriend.

title: Sensational Sushi with amazing views
comment: We made our reservation online for Monday, 27th March. We arrived early for our 8pm reservation, our jackets were taken by the reception staff and enjoyed a drink a the bar. The ambience is so feel good. Our table was ready after a short wait. Our table was by the window which added to our experience. When we made the reservation, i advised them that one of us was vegan. After making ourselves comfortable at our table, our waiter introduced himself and gave us our menus, one of which was a vegan. The food was amazing, although the desert selections were a little disappointing. All in all we enjoyed our dinner.

title: More for couples
comment: Food was absolutely fantastic however the portions are more catered for parties of 4 or less. I had a table for 8 and we were a bit cramped due to them trying to accommodate which I am extremely grateful for. Views were amazing as always and will definitely be back!

title: Over rated
comment: The view is amazing, however, due to the service being terrible I would not recommend going. The food is the same as both Zuma and Roka, so may swell go there as it is better service. Waited 30 minutes between each courses and drinks. Booked for a special occasion and they forget that despite them reconfirming the booking and the birthday plate they said they would do

title: Always delivers ❤
comment: I've been to Sushisamba few times and each time more impressive than the last. This restaurant is on my list of 'restaurants to impress out of town friends' with its fantastic views of City of London and trendy rooftop bar. Took two out of town friends to dinner and mission accomplished, they were impressed. Although it was too windy for the rooftop bar, they got the picture  Now unto the food.. I'd recommend the lamb chops and poussin from the robata / grill section. The Chocolate banana cake was divine desert, warm cake, ice cream and warm caramel. Divine. No doubt I'll be back soon

title: Perfect for business or romantic dinner
comment: Go during sunset hours in spring /summer for a lovely sunset setting. Food is spectacular. Yes the service is slow but it's usually cocktails that take the longest. Worth the wait, worth the experience and the price is to match. Expect to pay £80 each for 3 courses and one cocktail.

title: Poor service and food average
comment: I came here for my birthday and i had much expectation. Unfortunately i left disappointed: whilst the bar outside was great the restaurant service was extremely poor. We asked for a drink pairing with our meal we did not get it, we were told it would arrive but it didn't: we waited so long i got up to go to the front desk. Only then did someone actually give us the drinks.  The food was average (when you consider the cost which is significant); the sushi was not exceptionally tasteful, indeed in a lineup with a preboxed set from Itsu i would find it difficult to distinguish!
