We then waited an exceptionally long time for our bill and were basically MADE to feel as though we HAD to pay the service charge.  Deeply dissappointing.

title: Disappointed
comment: We visited sushi samba today for my sisters birthday. She has wanted to come for a while & has heard good things.  Unfortunately it just did not deliver-it was a very under whelming experience. The food was nice, that I will not deny but when dining at such establishments the service needs to be on point to just make the visit that extra special. The service was A HUGE let down!! One person in our party asked for cutlery as they were not confident using the chop sticks & we had to ask twice before we got it. Nobody checked if we were ok for drinks throughout our meal although our water was constantly topped up!  We will not visit again & quite frankly it's not worth the visit even for the food....you can get the food anywhere.  Service definitely needs improvement.

title: SushiSamba :)
comment: An amazing city view!  Great food and vibe. The service was a bit slow but it was a team dinner so might be the issue. Sushi was amazing!

title: Brilliant,
comment: I always love coming here, service is exceptional and the food and drink follow suit. and after a long day its a brilliant place to dine in London

title: Great view, pretty good food
comment: Very good choice it you want a great view and good food. You can get better food at street level for less money but that is not the point of the place.

title: Great views. Great service
comment: When we entered and came up in the lift we were treated to amazing views of London. Then we passed through the lounge where we caught our first glimpse of the famous orange tree on the terrace. Dinner was yummy and our waiter, Salvador, was excellent and attentive. The scallop ceviche was the best as was the mango mochi and the yuzu (lemon) sake for dessert.

title: Impressive even if you are not a sushi fan
comment: Had friends visiting from abroad that just loves sushi (not a massive sushi fan myself) so I decided to treat them to dinner at sushi samba (obviously with the viee in mind). As I heard a lot of good things from my friends I was not suprised to find the place running perfectly. Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable (we had one gluten free person with us and they knew exactly how to deal with that). Service very swift and extreamly professional. Food wise as I said sushi is not my favourite but I appreciate good produce used in this restaurant you can feel everything is fresh and good quality. Only let down is the music that is so loud it make it almost impossible to talk over the table.

title: Service not good
comment: Had an evening at Sushisamba with some friend who were celebrating their sons 21st, first impressions were good and the fast exterior lift to the 38th floor was an experience in itself.We headed for the outside bar for some cocktails while waiting for our table that we had booked for 6 people, the view of London from the roof terrace was amazing but it all goes down hill from here.The bar staff were mainly young Spanish and not only did they speak broken English at 100mph they also didnt understand anything we said so our drinks order after waiting what seemed to be ages ended up nothing like what we had asked for,but rather than wait another year for our drinks we said we would keep what they had given us.The view of London from up there was fantastic..We then went into the restaurant and had another problem understanding anything the waiter was saying to us,we eventually ordered our meals after having to think again as few of the fish dishes had run out,the time was only 7.00pm?Food arrived and looked well presented,some meat dishes were included in chosen dishes and i must say i had more than one mouth full of inedible gristle.Our bill was nearly £400 and i must say that for nothing more than average food,bad service and a great view i felt that this was not great value.

title: Great views, loud music, food ok
comment: This is a great venue, small bar where you can also sit and eat and watch sushi being made. Outside area lush, fantastic views, would love to return in the summer and watch the sun set! Restaurant busy and noisy, music is played quite loud throughout the venue. Food was ok, didn't blow me away. We had a set menu as it was a large group, nice to try a bit of everything but very expensive! Would definitely return!

title: A top notch sushi restaurant with a gorgeous view.
comment: Had a lovely evening with my friend here in the middle of april. The resturant is situated at the top floor of a skyscraper with marvelous views over London. The food was amazing! The service good/ (restaurant) barely ok (front of house) But hey- we where in the best mood, so will not let that ruin the review. Tips- Book a table a long time in advance to get a chance to get a table. In the summertime they have a the rooftop bar opened (with a fantastic view)

title: Excellent Restaurant, Superb Food, Minor Irritants.
comment: Well, I had been waiting some time for this experience (around 2 months to be exact), and let me point out before digressing into the details, this is an experience to behold.  I attended here on the last Saturday of April. I had booked a table for 15:00 for two and thought it would be a fitting location for a date.  I had been told by many friends before visiting that it really is a special place, rather expensive but very nice. And they weren't wrong.  You enter the restaurant by what must be one of the fastest lifts in the world, and it is a spectacular view as you rocket up to the 38th floor. The entrance isn't much of a mouth opener, but once you hit the bar area, you soon see why it is quite something. The tree in the outside terrace is something of a lasting memory.  We were taken to our table which was situated with the amazing view beside us. Waiters and Waitresses attending to our requests for table water and drinks, and we did seek assistance with the menu. How much to order, what would go with what etc. Don't feel ashamed for asking for assistance, we had a couple sat next to us that clearly believed that they had won the lottery and ordered the vast majority of the menu, and the Waitress had to politely explain that they had ordered far too much. This be the problem with uneducated people who have more money than sense.  Moving on, we ordered as you will see from the photographs below, a selection of dishes and an assortment of sushi rolls which unfortunately I did not manage to snap. Please see the description next to them to understand what they are. My favourite dish had to be the Shrimp Tempura. I also absolutely loved the squid, but I found that the soya sauce that accompanied them was a tad salty. You must also select a dessert as they are too rather impressive.  The service was excellent, could have been a tad more personable, particularly as what looked to be the manager takes your payment of a vast amount of money and doesn't even bother to look as you as he punches into his little computer the amount of zero's are on your bill.  All this being said, as as much as I have nit-picked, I would strongly recommend this place, yes it is ridiculously expensive for what you actually get and you could have far nicer food on ground level, but it is about the experience and feeling a little special.  My recommendations are, (1) Visit when it is night time, this for me was one of the regrets having attended in the afternoon. (2) Don't get drawn in by the sugar daddies, or gold-diggers that seem to dine here. (3) Attend with an open mind and enjoy, don't worry about the cost, you only live once, and to be able to say you have dined there is well worth it.

title: Very enjoyable evening!
comment: The food is very good but the service is really what heightens the experience. You are thoroughly spoilt by attentive & sincere staff who seem to genuinely want you to have the best time.  Nothing was too much trouble & they gave fantastic advice for pairing dishes, wines & recommendations.  We loved everything we tried on the menu!

title: Great sushi
comment: Been the there with family and kids. Loved their sushi and portions. Service was great too and bar view with that orange tree was the best

title: Amazing food and views
comment: I love sushi samba. Views are amazing and the cocktails are delicious. It is true that the portions are tiny and massively over priced- you'll still be hungry after but I have to say that the flavour of the food was out of this world- truly delicious... just a shame there wasn't more of it! Service was great, great tasting food and drinks, amazing views but not value for money given portions. Would I return... yes... flavour was amazing and great views- although I'd eat a little before I go! It was a lovely evening

title: Shockingly disappointing service
comment: Our highly-anticipated first visit to Sushisamba will unfortunately probably be our last.  While the setting is excellent and the views over London are fantastic, our experience was ruined by rude, ignorant, pretentious and lazy bar staff.  The bar was not busy as we arrived early in the evening, yet the bartender still couldn't offer any eye contact while taking my order. I had to assume his grunt in my general direction was his invitation for me to say the cocktails we wanted. He then tried play it cool and literally fumbled his way through twirling shot glasses and alcohol bottles - dropping them as he went. I was disappointed that one of the cocktails was already pre-made and all he did was uncork a bottle, pour a measure and swirl around some ice with it. After all this, there was still the nerve to add 12.5% service charge.  Afterwards, our friends waited more than 20 minutes for their drinks - despite being the only people queuing for the first 15 of them. The bar staff were more interested in chatting with friends who'd just arrived to the bar and speaking in Spanish (clearly their preferred language) to other Spanish-speaking customers.  Yes, the location is cool and the outside section has a beautiful big orange tree. But London isn't lacking for great cocktail bars so I'd suggest going elsewhere, to a place where as a customer you aren't treated like an inconvenience.

title: Amazing views.
comment: A friend mentioned this place was something else and he was right. 20 ish seconds to go 39 floors outside a building looking over London by night was just the start. amazing layout friendly, professional service. Excellent selection of drinks and cocktails. Glass everywhere so felt big and open. Seemed very trendy but not cheesy. Real gem. Would like to eat there at some point. Smelt and looked great.

title: Fab food and view unreal - must visit
comment: Amazing atmosphere, food and view. A night to remember. The menu has lots to offer and would like to go back to try more. Setting young, good music (quite loud) and the view is just WOW.

title: RUDE!!!!
comment: Went to the bar for a drink and we were told they weren't serving alcohol despite the woman behind the bar pouring champagne for other customers. When we asked why we had been refused alcohol the staff member said we were leaning over the bar inappropriately I'm only 5'1 and were told we wouldn't be served. Ridiculous...totally discriminatory would never return

title: Great food but what a shame ...
comment: I decided to bring here my friends who were in town for a few days, so it was everyone's first time here  We were 15 minutes late and they were doing last food order before the kitchen closed which is absolutely understandable since there's a schedule the restaurant should respect, but the way we got delivered this information was rude and impolite. The lady interrupted the waiter who was trying to take us through the menu and explain it to us, she didn't even excused herself "you need to order now". It makes sense but there are different ways to tell things. Thing is, we ordered straight away as fast as we could, we were hungry so ordered a lot of food , after we finished my friend told me he wanted to add something else so I walked to our waiter within seconds and told him if he could add more rolls , this same lady was again interrupting and being rude and repeating herself, anyway she said it was "ok" at the end so there was no point in telling us we couldn't.  We felt unwelcomed. There were some few other things off about the service but the only thing we minded was rudeness  The food was amazing, we tried a lot a everything. Even the steak was to die for, the quality of the meat is outstanding and we are from Argentina/Uruguay so we were impressed . The four stars are because of our sweet waiter Alvaro, he really made the difference, was very nice to us and took us through the menu . Please thank him, if it wasn't for him we would have never come back I would have preferred writing an email instead of a review because I work in hospitality myself and always welcome feedback, but I couldn't find on . The place, atmosphere and food were great. It was a shame that this girl was like this.

title: outstanding
comment: It was a night to remember. Excellent dinner , drinks and stay . We will be back for sure. Thanks to all the waiters and bartenders.

title: Sushi panorama
comment: Sushi and some Brazilian flavors in an elegant space, on the top of a skyscraper in the City. Food is a side component, if you like the the landscape over the City, while taking a drink: small dishes and high prices. Elegant place to go for a date or to meet someone.

title: Great views, fabulous space
comment: Food was beautiful and tasty, staff very friendly and service great. The views very amazing... the cocktails were a nice icing on the cake.  Very pricey though...

title: Exceptional High Style Dining with Vibe
comment: Located on the 38th floor of Heron Tower, this innovative Japanese, Brazilian, Peruvian sushi restaurant provides a full range of sushi dishes plus excellent tempura, seafood and meat dishes. Our group of 4 shared a number of appetizer dishes as well as small plates for dinner, plus I opted for an entree of tempura sea bass and pickled vegetables. There is also a great bar area plus seating stools for those who want to eat and watch their food being prepared. Expect a tab of £100 a person service charge included of 12.5%. Food is definitely high quality and enjoyable vibe with music and views of London.

title: Terrible service! Service has Really gone down hill!
comment: Left waiting for 20 minutes when seated....loads of waiting staff walking the floor ...often doing little...but ignoring newly seated customers who want to order lunch! Black cod miso....used to be scewers of cubed fish in their stunning sauce....for around £24 ish....now only available for £44 for large plate and it apparently does not taste the same....many people are complaining. Tempura vegetables....lovely as always but we seemed to be in rations as only had 8 of them! Trying to get a 2nd drink...the bill almost impossible. Staff are not being managed, there was no floor managers visible, no one checked on you to see if food was ok....terrible service and we come here for birthdays frequently, but we won't return, for the first time ever I asked for service charge 12.5% to be removed from Bill...why pay an extra 12.5% to be ignored??

title: Dinner
comment: Sushi Samba is known for being one of the top restaurants in London and it surely lives up to its rating, Sushi Samba is a great experience that you should surely experience at least once when you are in London  The best time to dine at Sushi Samba would be in the evening, you can experience the whole London skyline and dine with a breath taking view. Getting a reservation could be an issue so you should defiantly book a table in advance. The food and drinks are amazing they provide an amazing, innovative selection of Japanese food. When you visit you should try the Black cod, the yellowtail and tuna tiradito,the shrimp tempura and the selection of sushi- these are just a few dishes you should try, but everything at Sushi Samba was amazing, for desert you should definitely have the selection of Mushi.  Sushi Samba is a defiant must try ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️  Dine with a View

title: Spectacular view and decent food but a bit pricey
comment: My girlfriend and I viisted at 3pm on Easter Monday, we arrived 5 minutes early but our table wasn't ready until 3.30pm which allowed us to check out the rooftop bar and try the cocktails. Cocktails contained a strong alcohol content though a little small for the £13 price. We were seated in the middle of the restaurant, disappointing not to get a window table but none available. The large plates menu is quite limited so was a little frustrating that churrasco rio grande meat plate was unavailable and would have been helpful to have been informed this when handed the menu. The Samba London sushi was tasty and included a spicy condiment which worked well. Good value for £16.  The moqueca mista did not contain as much fish as I'd like and too much sauce. Wouldnt pay £34 for this again. The corazon de pollo (chicken heart) was well cooked and the poussin teriyaki (chicken) tender.  The kobe beef sashimi was delicious. £24 for literally 3 bites. There is a 1kg kobe beef available for £1000 also on the menu! A nice wine selection to complement some good food and excellent service but a £200 bill.  Plan to visit again in June for drinks only.

title: Memorable Setting, Memorable Meal
comment: Our dinner at Sushi Samba exceeded our expectations. After being checked in at the street level entrance we were whisked up to the 39th floor in a glass elevator offering a terrific view of the city. Upon exiting the elevator we walked through a stylistic “gateway” entry to the hostess area. The city view overtakes you as you enter the upper bar and becomes more focal as you descend the steps to the lower bar and restaurant. The dining room itself is a perfectly proportioned setting with floor to ceiling windows on three sides. There are only tables for two along the windows, which affords the diners at the more interior larger tables a breath taking view. Extremely well done. The reason for the detailed description is that the Wow! factor makes dining here truly special.  The service was easy and professional. The plates arrived without undue delay creating a comfortable pace for the meal. I will say that once our dessert and coffee were near finished I definitely felt that it was time for us to leave. That is fine. We had an early reservation and were there for almost two hours . No big deal. The food was delicious. Although we opted to forego the £1,000 steak so we could pay rent, the more reasonably priced dishes were fantastic. We had a Kobe slider, tuna seviche, wagyu gyoza, lamb chop, London roll, El Toro roll, teriyaki poussin, and the alfajores for dessert. All was delish. The wagyu gyoza was exceptional. The sake selection was more that ample. All of this comes at a price. Our bill came to about £300, all in. But really, for the three of us in such a great setting, I would say it was worth it.

title: Great experience
comment: Food amazing, service excellent and friendly. We didn't know what to choose form the menu so left it to the waiter to suggest. He was very knowledgeable and made great choices for us. Food was delicious. Can be a very expensive menu but the setting and service make it worth it.

title: Great view - Solid Sushi
comment: The view is amazing! Night or day - it's worth the trip. Good cocktails which set up some very fresh sushi. It's a destination spot that is worth the trip.  Check out the craft cocktails on the patio. You won't be disappointed.

title: Romantic dinner
comment: We visited this place last year, I am a big fan of sushi, admit it was amazing dinner and me and my partner both enjoyed the dinner, romantic place and good view.

title: Good experience
comment: I celebrated my birthday in Sushi Samba. One of the waitresess spilled cocktails on the chair where my friend was sitting. Mark, the manager, dealt with the situation camly and apologised.  The sushi and mushroom with egg were freshly prepared. The deserts were delicious.  I think I would visit it again.

title: Great view and drinks
comment: Sushi Samba Location: in the 28th floor of the Heron tower close to Liverpool street station in East London. Sushi Samba enjoys a panorama view all over London.  Atmosphere: great place with outdoor bar, open fire and a tree – indoor bar as well as restaurant. Service: uncoordinated as you don’t seem to have one waiter serving your table it is multiple waiters and the flow of information is not great.  Food: I had been several times in Sushi Samba and I had good and bad experience. Sometimes the white is nicely child and tempura is hot on other occasions the wine is warm and the tempura was cold. It is a shame that such a nice place is not more consistent. I stopped having and just go for a drink.

title: Just gets better - amazing every time!
comment: I have been lucky enough to visit this restaurant quite a few times now and for me, it gets better every time! The service at SushiSamba is exceptional. Our waiter Salvador was super efficient, attentive, friendly and took-over our ordering with amazing recommendations. The food was incredible! Every mouthful great - I just wish I hadnt been sharing!!  My only slight issue was they had run out of the beef dish which is one of my all time favs! but it was made up by the super tasty lamb.  The venue itself is great! super luxurious with outstanding views - but at the same time does not feel stuffy or pretentious. We spent quite a lot of time in the bar after the lunch and the drinks were great - the cocktail list is impressive and yes its not the cheapest, but made up for with incredible views and very well made drinks.  The team at SushiSamba are great - the restaurant manager Kostas is super friendly and helpful and help make an amazing experience. I can not recommend this restaurant enough!

title: OMG the best restaurant ever!!!!
comment: We finally got a reservation at this restaurant after so many months of trying and it was completely worth the wait.... i loved literally everything we ate, the portions were great and the service was second to none. The view from 39 floors up is stunning which just adds to the whole experience.  We had the scallop ceviche ... wow! Lamp chop with red miso ... stunning! Black cod ... the best ever, samba london rolls .. i was in heaven!! The zen garden was a different and gorgeous dessert.  I couldn't thank Kostas enough for his and the teams hospitality.. they made the whole experience for us. Needless to say i will be going back here if i am lucky enough to get a reservation!  Thank you for a wonderful experience!

title: Over rated
comment: If you are really into your sushi, go elsewhere. We dined mid afternoon, so very little atmosphere. Seemed a little disorganised in the restaurant, even a little in need of tidying up or renovation. The food we ordered was OK but just not 'fine' sushi nor was the hot dish great. The service was just OK but the view was obviously wonderful. For the money crap value. Go elsewhere.

title: Fun and frivolous
comment: Went here for a lunch and you can't help but be impressed by the lift alone to whisk you up!  Service was attentive and helpful. The food was more than just sushi and the combinations interesting. Some things very overdone. The tuna ceviche a waste of time, prime yellow tail in a swamped dressing so strong and acidic you'd never have known tuna was in there unless told!  Sashimi was delightful and we had a range of dishes that really were sublime. The small tacos are to die for!!  If you want to make the most of this place go at night. In the daylight it's just a bit too stark and lacks it's full atmosphere. None the less an amazing view and genuinely interesting food.

title: Not really good value
comment: The food is good although quite expensive, and there is an interesting choice of unusual makis. This is a unique spot in London thanks to the view.

title: Cocktails
comment: Great cocktails and amazing views , the lift ride up the the 39th floor is like a rocket taking off , awesome views of the city

title: Lovely food
comment: After taking the lift to the 37 the floor, we had a drink at the outside terrace. Nothing special really. Cocktails £13 each. 2 drinks = £30. They add tip automatically. We sat down inside by window. Fantastic view. We did study menu at home first so we didn't look stupid ordering.  Food came up pretty quick. It actually was really tasty and loads of it. A really lovely meal.  One thing, don't bother with deserts. Not good at all. Japanese make great savoury, but lousy sweet. Overall, had a lovely evening.

title: Amazing food and view
comment: We went to sushi samba for a celebration of birthday. Dare I say the experience was absolutely stunning. I really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. I would totally recommend this restaurant and would reckon you to make a booking for the evening!

title: A very good food in the sky
comment: Amazing place in a not commercial part of London  The quality of the food is very good and also the service  But the very superbe part of this place is the view of London  There are no words to explain how a gin tonic taste at the 40th floor Suggested

title: Great place, good view and good food.
comment: Expensive I must say, nevertheless the quality is very okay in all aspects.  Book in advance otherwise will be very difficult to find a place.

title: Just beautiful!
comment: I would just like to take this opportunity to thank the management and staff for the little surprise that they did for my mother's birthday! It really made her day! Also, I wish to add that I am grateful for the now fulfilled requests that I had! I would not even mention the food- pure heaven!

title: High, very High.
comment: My wife and I popped in here on the off chance and were put off a bit by the security on the door, even if it is understandable in these times, it could have been handled better. The glass lift was an experience and my wife loved the view (I don't like heights). The bar was good and the staff better, the 'samba' part of the name relates to the south american theme that includes spirits and cocktails from there. the Bar staff walked us through the list and recommended something very nice for each of us. The restaurant staff were very helpful and found me a table that meant I didn't have to see the view while my wife could, they also helped us to chose a reasonable amount of food for two hungry people (needed as the Japanese styled menu was not as clear as it could have been). All the food was fantastic. I went there thinking that the reviews were done by people who wanted to be 'seen' to be hip, but left with the thought that while it was not cheap, it was worth it, even with me having to get back into that glass lift.

title: Exceptional
comment: Perfect food, perfect view, perfect vibes, exceptional staff.  It is a must see if you are visiting London :) RATING: 5/5

title: Absolutely excellent
comment: We actually came here on a whim, I thought we'd try our luck and after the security check by the friendly staff at the base of the building, the front of house told us they could seat us a the sushi counter but to expect a wait. We went for a delicious cocktail at the outdoor bar, yes it was expensive but no more so than similar establishments. As soon as we received our drinks, we were told our table was ready, which was great. The food itself was amazing, the dishes go a long way. I recommend trying a meat dish and a fish dish, of course one being sushi. Staff attention was also good, with our glasses being topped up consistently, and my wife was given a blanket as it got cooler as the sun set.  I fully recommend this place, unless you get vertigo, as the lift looks out onto the city as you fly up or down!

title: Lovely but pricey!
comment: Such amazing food but very spenny so unless going for a special occasion bit too pricey! We had one bottle of wine to start which was £50 and not a very nice one!

title: Must try for the sky view
comment: Situated on 38th floor, one gets a lovely view of the city. Cocktails are really good. Weekends are crowded, service at the bar may be slow. Reservation recommended.

title: Great views!
comment: It's one of those must see places if you are visiting london. If you like sushi double bonus. Prepare to be pampered and surprised. This place is a treat and you will love it!

title: unbelievable views, great atmosphere!
comment: If you ever in the city it's a must go. Great for a drink and to enjoy an incredible view of London from a 39th floor.

title: WOW!
comment: From the moment we stepped into the lift which whizzed us up to the 25 (?) th floor we were dazzled by the view, the atmosphere. The friendliness and helpfulness of the multicultural staff. The food - a fusion of Brazilian, Peruvian and Japanese - is totally amazing. I can only describe it as a tastebud orgasm. We gave our waiter a budget and he ordered for us and we were delighted. An absolute must-do when visiting London!

title: great lunch in the sun
comment: friends retirement lunch was made better by our excellent and attentive waiter Salvaa Carrasco ( i made sure to take his name as he was so helpful). The manager, an argentinian gentleman made everything smooth and as fun as possible.  Great lunch, Great service

title: Amazing food & views
comment: Had brunch here & food was stunning as were the views. Literally could reach out & touch the gherkin! Sat outside on roof garden with sun blazing down. Food pricey, £120 for 2 & only there for an hour but so tasty!

title: Valentines dinner
comment: Got to the restaurant early to have some drinks, the bar was really busy and we found it hard to get a seat. When we did the drinks took a while to arrive. But the view was amazing. We then went through for dinner. The staff were very attentive and the food was great quality. Would be a 5/5 if the bar was as good as the restaurant

title: Drinks with mates.
comment: Loved it. The views, the cocktails, the atmosphere, the decor. It's definitely where you'd go to impress your date! I went with my husband and our friends, felt slightly under dressed but we stayed for a couple to enjoy the view. The cocktails are pricey but they are well worth it. The outside bar was so pretty with a fire pit and patio heaters, if it's a dry night then it should be open. There is also a restaurant adjacent to the outside bar with fabulous views.

title: Rude obnoxious staff! Only good thing was the view!
comment: Will never be returning, staff are seriously rude! Planned to eat there but we're treated so badly we went to Benihana instead and had a great meal and felt welcomed. Opposite to how Sushi Samba staff made us feel. Shame because I was actually looking forward to going there but now I will not be returning! Sort your staff out!!

title: Special Birthday surprise
comment: Quick security check then zip up the elevator on the outside showing great views of london. You have to book the restaurant but can come to the bar . Strict policy no trainers , saw someone asked to pop back once changed into normal shoes. We first Had drinks at the bar and were called over about 20 minutes later when our table became free. The buzz was really nice and didn't mind waiting as they had outdoor heaters and a little bit of theatre around the bar, with great music. Lots of people enjoying themselves and in a good mood. Great cocktails Expressing martini  Virgin fruit mocktail  Taken through to a smart restaurant with stunning view over the city and onto the river. Starters were great and the food just came when it was ready. We had Lots of Sushi Sushimi Blackened cod Corn fed Chicken , really nice  it's a bit like tapas style eating. Good friendly service  All Finished of with a lovely cake and ice cream Will definitely go again Quite pricey though

title: The food here is amazing....
comment: Have eaten here 2 or 3 times previously, and the food remains outstanding and great in a larger group sharing a wide variety of dishes on the menu. The views are fantastic - particularly spectacular at night and the bar on the way in is also a great place to meet beforehand. Very expensive, but well worth a visit for a special occasion.

title: Great food, attentive staff and the view is ok!
comment: I've been a couple of times. The food is very good and presented fantastically well. As you would expect the service is polished without some of the pretensions of similar high end restaurants.  The views are great and you do probably pay a bit more for this but I think the food stands on its own and you'd probably still go to a less glamorous location on the strength of the food. Drinks are interesting and the bar is fun.

title: Very good music & ambience
comment: I liked the restaurant. It had a good lively atmosphere. The music was amazing! It was packed with people. My table was late by an hour, but I did not mind. If your table is not ready they encourage you to go to their bar outside and wait. I had some drinks at their bar, while my group and I waited. The bartender was nice and served me drinks she concocted that weren't listed on the menu. I thought that was sweet! The views from the elevator ride up to the restaurant itself was a great experience.

title: Lunch
comment: Great food, very fresh and refined. Good service. Advice. Prefer less traditional stuff as discovery worthwhile...

title: Amazing Food, View and Service
comment: I invited my partner for Valentine's day (booked 3 months in advance through their website). The experience is amazing, first the glazed lift that goes to the top of the tower with the view on all the City. Second, the place is beautiful, the terrace offers a nice view and everything is really romantic. Third, the food was incredible (10 courses menu) and different from any other restaurant. We can't manage to finish all as it was too many dishes. Last, the service was awesome and very discreet, they explain each plate and were very professionals. I definitively recommend this venue for a romantic dinner, but be prepare to pay the price!

title: Great viewpoint and glass lift to the 38th floor, too expensive.
comment: SushiSamba offers delicious sushi. The black cod is the best dish in the menu, although recently the restaurant frequently changes the menu and increases the price of dishes by 10%-30%.

title: One of my fav restaurants in London
comment: Excellent restaurant! Though pricey, the food and ambiance is worth it for a special occasion. The aerial view of London is impressive. The creative menu never disappoints. I've been here a few times and have always had a great experience.

title: Nice Friday evening on roof top
comment: went for drinks at the bar outside - nicely decorated, not too packed, very good music. The crowd was mixte in age, cocktails are at City prices but delicious Will def go back in the summer

title: A very pleasant evening and excellent service and great ambiance
comment: It is absolutely essential to book. The lift whisks you up to the 38th Floor where there is an outside rooftop bar and an inside bar both adjacent to the restaurant. Credit card behind the bar and they transfer the bar bill to the table when you sit down. Our waiter was Salvador and water and drinks, wine etc.. arrived quickly and then we studied the menu. We were a party of 8 and choosing and getting a good mix was clearly going to be quite a feat. Salvador stepped in and suggested that he would organise a mixture of first, second and third (main) courses and despite considerable scepticism everyone agreed this would be worth letting him do exactly that. There were one or two special requests to be included, and one non-fish eater needed to be considered. Salvador took that is his stride and it worked very well. He ordered an excellent range of different things each and every one a credit to his choices and to the chefs for a very high standard in each and every dish.  I can not only praise him for his consideration of everyone's requests but in judging it exactly right and not one person was anything other than extremely impressed.  An excellent evening, certainly not cheap, but not expensive either if you take into account the quality. You get what you pay for and nobody can object to that. One small word of advice, if you can avoid an early evening table facing west then do, as the sun was in some of our eyes for some of the time, but that didn't take away from the occasion or the overall enjoyment.

title: Wife's happy
comment: Went to sushisamba to my wife 30th birthday was a very important thing to her to we celebrate in a descente place,so I chose sushisamba! Was very late book but they found a table for us besides the window,the service is immaculate,everyone is so aware about how ur wine glass is empty or u are about to finish ur dish!we had a Portuguese waiter which was an amazing host,the food,hoo "God the food",is a mix between Peruvian,Japanese and brazilian;all of then made with such a art u got embarrassed to began to destroy it!! After the supra u can aim to the bar is a wee commercial but the drinks are really well made!! Definitely we gonna be back,as the bill was not so scared like other reviews claim!

title: The highest food quality
comment: SushiSamba is without any doubt the most uniquely located restaurant I have ever been too, but also their food is excellent. Located on the 38th floor of the Sales Force Tower in London and is only accessible through a transparent lift at the side of the building. Its lounge overviews the city from the Tower Bridge all the way to Westminster and the city landscape stretches many tens of kilometers around the centre. The dining area views to the north (which is unfortunately less spectacular than the southward city view). Nevertheless, being that high and having this view keeps you busy every second before during and after dinner. We went for lunch and I highly recommend this as all details of the city are clear. The staff can give details about the surrounding buildings and landscape. The food is a rich mix of food from the far east and Amazonia. The seafood "bouillabaise" with advocado rice was heaven. Also the Welcome to the Rainforest desert was a unique view and eat.  To find this restaurant we Googled for Rooftop Restaurants in London and we literally and figuratively got the highest food quality.

title: The best bizarre you'll ever taste
comment: I'm entirely convinced that this fusion of food came from the mind of an evil genius who is currently plotting something in a diabolical laboratory on a secret island under a volcano. That being said, if he wants world domination then I'm happy to give it to him provided he keeps cooking this way. I commented to my companion last night, in my very English way, after eating a piece of the Tokyo Sky Tree that it was "The very best kind of peculiar". I've never had food like it and I'm delighted that I now have. I would highly recommend this restaurant and it's professional and courteous staff to any and all. The view is also pretty cool and worth the death defying elevator ride.

title: Sushi Samba...you never let me down!
comment: I've been here on several times and what keeps on bringing me back to sushi samba is the guaranteed high quality food, exceptional service and buzzing atmosphere. Perfect for any occasion - I've been here for dates, meal with friends and also for a few drinks after work outside at the terrace bar where you can have a great view of London's skyline!

title: Amazing!
comment: The entrance was very dramatic and promising. Everything was ment to overwhelm you: The glass elevator, the tree on the balcony, the lights - absolutly everything was great. The service was good. The food was unique, accurate and tasty. Dishes were of the right size letting enjoy several dishes.

title: Excellent sushi place for lovely Moments
comment: As a food and travel blogger, I've been to quite a few sushi restaurants in Europe and I have to say after experiencing Sushi Samba in London I am Surprise for the first time yesterday. I think I've found my favourite restaurant. The quality is exceptional especially when you consider the affordable price. If you're a new customer they offer free miso soup and a surprise with your order. The staff were very friendly and I'll definitely be back here again!!! Really recommend this place but make sure you book a table before you come to dine.

title: Sushi dinner under the London sky
comment: The great atmosphere of the thirty-eighth floor makes it really special. Very nice spot and an attractive interior design, good quality sushi though not amazing. what really affected my positive assessment was the staff: kind and professional, especially Ambra. We had to wait longer than expected for our dining table and she took care of us kindness, minding our waiting-aperitive at the lounge bar. Ambra also supervised our everything was fine during the dinner and I should say that it was a very positive evening.

title: A Total Experience
comment: We had a dinner at this great place during the week. Firstly, the glass elevator ride to the top of the Herron Tower is a real buzz. Secondly, once there the experience is just wonderful. Having a drink on the terrace provides great views all over London is a real talking point.  We had a table of eight that was a little cramped, but the food was excellent. We had a tapas like selection provided to the table that was shared by all. The high light for me was the lobster tacos and the Kobe beef; excellent in every way. An comprehensive wine list was available, and the Sarcasse French white was an great choice. Will visit again soon.

title: Birthday Lunch no2
comment: So lucky to have been taken out for lunch here by my husband. 38th floor not for those suffering from vertigo but ask for the table away from the windows and you might be alright. So, first time sushi and what a meal! Great flavours and as I am not a great meat or fish eater I came away with a full stomach. The sea bass was so delicious cooked tempura style. Every plate was exceptionally presented. Staff service was impeccable. Discrete yet attentive. They were helpful with our choices and knew the menu well. Desert arrived with a simple birthday wish message and a single candle.

title: Good for clients and dates alike
comment: This place is amazing on three fronts. The fact its up in the clouds is fairly unique and also a good novelty, then the bar has great staff and great cocktails. then the restaurant is well set with great food.

title: Exceptional service and food as always!
comment: We turned up without a reservation midweek on what appeared to be a very busy night hoping to be squeezed in. Marc, the manager was outstanding in hosting us, he couldn't guarantee anything so we waited a bit after which he showed us to a table. The service throughout the evening was just incredible, really friendly, down to earth and importantly as manager, Marc came to check on us several times, which i was very impressed with especially considering we felt lucky just to have been given a table on such a busy night. The food at Sushi Samba is always good, from the sashimi, sushi rolls, the tempura - it is one of our favourite places to eat in London. It is obvious that the ingredients are of a high grade, as a result the end product keeps you wanting to order more!  I would recommend to anyone... we Will definitely be back!

title: Terribly disappointed by the service !!!
comment: Our second visit to the restaurant after an amazing dinner last time. The restaurant and especially the bar area looked way more busy than last time. We got taken to our table, which was not exactly what we wanted. Knowing how difficult it is to book a table at this restaurant we had booked exactly 2 months in advance at 4am, and requested a table with both of us facing the window, as we had the last time we went there. We ended up on a small table in a corner, with our neighbors pretty close to us, and it did feel pretty cramped. One of the nice table (exactly the one we had requested) became available minutes after we arrived, and we therefore asked if we could move. We got told in a fairly rude way that that table had been requested for... We did as well, so I don't know how you do to book one of those tables ?! The food was as last time amazing, especially the Shrimp Tempura and the Churrasco Rio Grande. Only thing is that it seems to us as if the portions had shrank since our last visit, even though the prices remained the same... Cocktails are very good, would definitely recommend trying them out ! Our waiter was very friendly, but was not very attentive. 4 out of our 5 meals arrived within 5 minutes of each others, and we then had to wait 40 minutes for the last one... Not the best of service for such a restaurant ! On our way out, my other half wanted to take a picture at the beginning of the stairss with the view, and after asking the receptionist he said we were not able, someone had apparently "paid for those stairs" for the evening... It was the same last time with a private event being held. After paying about £200 for a dinner, I think allowing us to take a picture in the stairs would have been nice, or at least explaining to us nicely instead of being just rude.  As I said previously the bar area was packed, and no way to seat anywhere to finish our cocktails. Even though the food was amazing once again, I think SUSHISAMBA is becoming a victim of it's own success. For the prices paid at this restaurant, the level of service is well below what's to be expected. Unfortunately following our recent experience I would not recommend this restaurant anymore, as for the same price you can get a much better service and similar food quality elsewhere ! SUSHISAMBA, you just lost customers !

title: Improved
comment: My last review was not favourable and it's been a while since this visit.  Still making it hard to get in but it's possible if you are patient.  The food was very good this time and the service improved. Albeit we had to wait over 20 minutes fir our final dish. We were forgotten and complimentary drinks were given. So fair enough.  Still way overpriced but a fun venue.

title: Excellent food , poor service.
comment: Went for a dinner party, the gentleman managing the tables was extremely pushy to the extreme to ask us to order, even thou we were waiting for another person. Waitress was the most angry looking woman I have ever seen, she did not crack a smile, considering the cost of a meal (Up to £1,400) you would expect a least a forced smile if that. Overall very very unfriendly staff, food was good, but the whole experience left us with a bad taste. Never going back there again. My suggestion would be spend your well earned money elsewhere.

title: Best experience of the weekend
comment: We got a table in Sushisamba at the last moment via the concierge at our hotel, as we were not able to get a reservation by ourselves - booked out! Luckily he knew the reservations manager of SUSHISAMBA and we got the best table in the whole restaurant - we had the most amazing view over East and Central London. When you enter SUSHISAMBA you will first be brought to a place where all the guests gather to have a pre-dinner drink. There is a DJ and a live-cooking station for appetizers. Cocktails and wines are both amazing. Prices are accordingly high. The restaurant itself is a dream. There are plenty of choices in sushi dishes but also other, warm dishes. We tried octopus and different sorts of sushi rolls. This was the best sushi we ever had. Combined with the view and the super-friendly service, this was a wonderful experience and the highlight of our trip.

title: Best Japanese, beats Nobu.
comment: Amazing food with top service. The sushi and hot dishes are one of the best I have tasted. I love the location and cocktail bar with great music and fashionable crowd.

title: Great view and food.
comment: A spectacular (pretty scary for me!) ride in the glass elevator to get to the top floor of the building gets you to this restaurant. Very pleasant bar area and well laid out spaces greats you. Very friendly staff direct you to you your table and serve very well. The food is very interesting and very tasty. Fantastic views are all around. Nice experience and a good spot for a business lunch or that special dinner in the City.

title: Great place not good sushi
comment: I came to this place expecting the best sushi in London and I left disappointed. However they offer a great service and the view is one of the best on the city.

title: Late dinner
comment: Went to sushi samba on a Thursday night at 9pm, but still needed to wait an hour.. the food was good but it wasn't worth the wait and definitely not worth the hype. There are better restaurants in London, and you can definitely get nicer sushi at a cheaper price as well. Wouldn't recommend it..

title: Good food and nice music but rude Doorman.
comment: Rudest doorman/offensive arrogant attitude man on the door with a clipboard. Other than that it was quite good. The menu has changed and it's still good. If management want customers to feel slightly welcome its best to get rid of the camp council house/chip on the shoulder clipboard guy outside. Otherwise good food and drinks yet again. This time only a 7/10. Average. Standards have dropped.

title: A very nice lunch in the sky!
comment: Close to the clouds in a wounderful setting you'll get a great fusion of Peru and Japan with a modern international touch.  We went for a mixed lunch with starters, main courses and sushi.  An absolute gem was the shrimp in the small plates section!

title: Really nice place - must see
comment: I went here for the awesome view. We went on a Saturday night, but didn't have to wait for too long to go in. It was really busy, so we stayed outside for a while and found 4 places inside afterwards, 'cause it was quite cold outside. We only had some cocktails, did not try the food, but enjoyed the atmosphere, the view, the drinks. I'd definitely go back.

title: Charming restaurant near the sky!
comment: At first you fly up to the 38-th floor in the glass elevator like in a rocket. Then you come to a fantastic restaurant with great food and atmosphere with a view to London. The prices are slightly higher than in the city but you pay a bit extra for a high quality of food and the lunch/dinner near the sky! Don't forget to book a table online. I often travel with kids and it is sometimes hard to find a restaurant where you can sit with kids (because of no kid-chairs or there is just no space). But it is not the case here. I was with my wife and two kids on a lunch and we all feeled ourslelves comfortable here. A special thanks to our waiter Ignacio. A very freindly person who knows the kitchen and which dishes suit best to each other. We were unsure what to order, and his recommended dishes were really superb. We ordered sushi rolls, sashimi and a hot dish and were satisfied with everything. It is definitely a restaurant that everyone needs to visit.  Once you visit it, you'll love it! :)

title: Horrible
comment: Booked for 6 to celebrate my brother's birthday. My dad rung them to ask if it was ok if we were 20 minutes late as we were running late. They said it was absolutely fine. My dad got there on his bike at 6:10 but waited for us to arrive outside instead of going in alone. Got there at 6:20 but when we went in they said they had given away our table and we couldn't go in. Made my 10 year old brother cry on his birthday. Thanks sushi samba.

title: A bit weird
comment: I wanted to enjoy this restaurant because it has high rating a ASmallWorld platform, where I am a member. I have previously reserved it twice, but always needed to cancel due to various reasons.  Then on Friday evening I am in London, and its a few steps away from me. I call to make the reservation, and I have a very entreating conversation on the phone. Which goes like, we might be booked to we might not be fully booked, but it all depends on your dress code, and we also have age restrictions. And brought some pepper because at my age of 37 I have never failed to pass a face control either it be London, New York or Saint Tropez.  So I was coming there expecting the crowd of A-Listers with those phone demands. NO!!! Obviously, it's a tourist trap now. Yes, the views are great. And then you are in the elevator with the strangest people you would ever see in your life. And the whole crowd is like that. It's like Hakkasan it 2006. Most boring people, and the visit here will be for them the event of the year.  So I left after 15 minutes. So trivial. But yes, the views are great!

title: No booking!!!
comment: Saw this Restaurant when we stayed at 196 Bishopsgate last May. We stopped in to try to book for around 6pm at 4pm but were immediately offered seats at the Sushi Bar. We said we'd prefer to have drinks at the bar and get a proper table, we were offered a 40 minute wait which, in reality was less than 20 minutes. Again advised we could only have table until 6pm but there was absolutely no pressure from anyone to leave.  It was a fab experience, food was really lovely. Menu confusing but Waiter on hand to advise. Drinks ok but very expensive for what we had whereas food was not cheap but not unreasonable. Like everyone the best thing was the views all around.  I would have preferred a more explanatory Menu especially the Wine List. Maybe pictures of the Sushi. All in all great experience and we would definitely go again!!

title: Just great
comment: A perfect place to visit for a drink or 2. A beeautiful view and great service. Go there before 2 pm, after that it is crowded. Recomend strongly

title: Terrible and rude service!
comment: My partner and I stood at the bar for half an hour waiting our turn. Two young girls approached the bar just as it was our turn. The waiter looked directly at me and my boyfriend before walking over to the two young girls. As he was approaching the two young girls I waved at him to remind him we were obviously next. He took a glance at me and continued to serve them. I was and am totally appalled at how ignorant the waiter was having waited half an hour in the cold. I will definitely not be going again have stood - surrounded by smokers - waiting for my rightful turn.  Just a note, the bouncers are sexist: they will let girls with ripped jeans in but not boys.

title: Beautiful views, beautiful food
comment: I've always wanted to go to sushisamba but I wasn't able to go on my birthday because it is always so busy. I booked 2 months in advanced for my boyfriends birthday and we were a party of 8 people.  The restaurant and views are spectacular (worth going just for those) and the fact that they have a bar outside with heathers it's great for smokers and non smokers. The cocktails and food are incredibly tasty but a bit overpriced (I guess you pay for the views too). We had two vegetarians (one doesn't eat aubergine, egg or mushrooms) and a gluten intolerant guest and they were incredibly accommodating. Everyone was happy with their food and they even got us a macaroon with a candle as a birthday freebie for my boyfriend. Unfortunately two guests in my party arrived an hour late and even though we had ordered and strayed to eat already, we felt a bit rushed as the table was only ours for 2 hours. I understand this is not their fault as the restaurant is so popular but it would have been nice to have the table for longer.

title: The view!
comment: The food was yummy! Totally recommend veggie, salmon (ezo rolls) and tiger maki! And the elevator ride was awesome, you should definitely have your phone/camera ready. Also, a good idea would be to book a table around 5ish so you can enjoy the view when it's light outside as well as during the night (when all buildings are light up).

title: great service !
comment: Great Restaurant ! Tthe Sushi were average but the dessert was really good! Our waitress Pauline was very attentive and kind. We followed her suggestions and she perfecly understood what we were expecting. it is quite expensive but the 38th-floor view worth it, it was amazing.

title: Great!
comment: Amazing place! The food and drinks, the vibe, the view, the service and the decor just melt together perfectly!  Great place for great moments!

title: Great food and better service
comment: we had lunch at this restaurant and followed the suggestions of Salvador, he perfectly understood what we were expecting.

title: Some fantastic dishes but left underwhelmed
comment: My partner and I arrived here for lunch a couple of weeks ago and were patted down and searched before taking the lift up to the restaurant. We waited a while for someone to take our coats and then our reservation was confirmed for a second time by two fairly cold front-of-house staff before we entered the restaurant. Our waiter was helpful & informative; he explained the menu thoroughly, making some good recommendations and suggested pairings. I felt the dishes were a little hit and miss and I don't think the South American-Japanese fusion is one that works for me. There was a sushi roll with some kind of BBQ sauce and crispy fried onions, which was a definite miss, but on the other hand the Black Cod Miso was sensational. The wine list was very interesting and included some great options - a definite plus.   If truth be told we over-ordered, but this did give us the opportunity to sample quite a wide selection of the menu. I thought the prices were a little steep given the food offered and apart from our waiter I found the staff a little cold and not particularly welcoming. An interesting experience, but not one I would rush to repeat, which is a shame.

title: Screw the view......!
comment: So I've been here 3 hours and yet to look out the window. I'm sure if I did it would be an added bonus. The general buzz around the bar and outside is superb. A mix of all walks enjoying a super smart easily accessible luxurious social scene where tunes pump out and incredible cocktails are served. For me it's whiskey and I have indulged in the best Japan has to offer. Throw in some Samba London rolls and Tiger Maki and it's just the icing on the cake. I've forgot walking into my girlfriend enjoying LPR with two random blokes and had a wonderful jolly on my own! BOOOM!  The bar manager is a DUUUUDE! And the service is impeccable (and cute x )  Thank you Sushi Samba for a much needed release of opulence.

title: Good food - Good mood
comment: Beautiful restaurant with a view over London - amazing by night The recommendation made by the waiter where really good and lived up to the expectations.  Even though, it is called SUSHI; there is more than that! It is a restaurant with Japanese and Brazil cuisine ... a great discovery

title: Fantastic View and good Food
comment: Definitely worth coming here and enjoying some very good sushi and other japanese food. The view is just great. Service is excellent. The perfect restaurant in London. The only negative point is that the music in the restaurant was a bit too loud so it was hard to talk to each other.

title: Views of the lot - and snacking
comment: Dont go If youre afraid of heights. Otherwise go! The sushi is a biproduct - the view is amazing - go for drinks If you dont fancy sushi It neighbours the gherkin and offers excellent views of all of london

title: Very disappointing dinner
comment: Had a late booking at 10pm with all the usual threats to be on-time and max 2 hours. Arrived 10 minutes early and seated 25 minutes late. Not a good start. The bar was crowded and chaotic and not the best place to wait. The whole thing felt a bit like a conveyor belt restaurant. When we finally got our table and I looked at the menu I was not impressed with the choice of food and the rather bizarre pricing structure. There seemed to be little thought to the prices of dishes based on what was on offer. The wine list was equally daft in the way it was set out with random silly priced wines in the middle of reasonable ones. Service was haphazard but generally ok. I eat out a lot, and often at high-end restaurants. This just wasn't worth the money or the hassle of booking a table. Not the experience I expect. Give me Sexy Fish every time.

title: BRILLIANT VIEW OVER LONDON
comment: The view over London is fabulous and that sums up the visit. It's a very ordinary restaurant and bar that thinks it's better than it is ! Go for 1 drink admire the view and then go for a meal and drinks elsewhere.

title: The service was a major let down
comment: This particular visit to Sushisamba unfortunately was let down considerably by the poor service we encountered throughout our visit. The saving grace of course was the food (which was devine as always) and the gorgeous views of the city. The waiter got our order wrong and instead of saying sorry (which goes a long way) and correcting the error as quickly as possible, got on the defense and was rather short with us. Eventually after a lot of back and forth, the mistake he made was corrected. I found the waiter to be extremely unfriendly and pretentious. I have been to Sushisamba many years ago with my friend for my birthday and had a much more positive experience. It is a shame that this was a first visit for my partner and my friends that I came with.

title: Favourite!
comment: Love it here, great food food, eclectic menu, good vibes! Been on various occasions and have enjoyed it, inevitably the view + building contributes a lot to the experience

title: Good place
comment: I've been to Sushi Samba the other day with a friend for cocktails. It was an Saturday afternoon and when I get there I decided that I wanted to eat and enquired for a table for 2. Surprinsily I was given a table for 2 straight away for 1 hour. I was happy with that, staff was nice, athmosphere nice too, pretty people, modern and with a good view of the town. Cocktails are exotic and food is good.  I recommend it

title: Great Experience
comment: Great food. Great ambience. Book in advance or sit at the sushi bar. Quite expensive, but great for special occasions. Best to book a selection of small plates on first visit.

title: Lovely food and amazing views
comment: Went for lunch and had a lovely experience. Ordered a few cocktails which are definitely tasty and quite strong! We ordered two starters and two sushi rolls between us. Only annoying part was three dishes came all at once and the fourth dish came after we had finished the first round of food. Thought that they could have organised that a bit better! Had a lovely table right next to the window allowing us to really take in the view. Overall would recommend.

title: London
comment: Very nice restaurant i hope i can visit again here in London my love City thanks Sushisamba restaurant

title: Amazing food and view of the city
comment: One of the best views of London, expensive but totally worth for the quality of food and service provided

title: Lovely lunch. Worth paying c. £50!
comment: This is one of the few restaurants (the only in the UK and three in the US so far) I had a lunch with a friend of mine and such a lovely location. It is a fusion between Japanese and Brazilian. You may think its not a good combination, but when you see and eat it it is really really good and good combination actually. This would be the place if you would like to try something new.  And one of the best views of London. Excellent service and quality of food. I would love to come visit again (dinner would be lovely!). Would also recommend to make reservation in advance especially dinner to get a good spot. Be aware of security check on the ground floor before taking a lift to the restaurant.

title: WOW
comment: What can I say , apart from WOW . Visited SushiSamba yesterday with a girlfriend at lunchtime and had the most amazing time. Perfect Weather for pre drinks on the terrace , followed by a fantastic table overlooking London . Our waiters were brilliant happy to explain and advise on the menu and this did not disappoint . The crispy taquitos are the best , along with the Samba London and everything else we ordered .We didn't sample the cocktail menu on this occasion as we drowned ourselves in Barcadi but will do on our next visit . Oh just one thing to remember it's on the 39th floor with a very fast glass lift which is on the outside of the building that shoots you to the restaurant in what seems a spilt second . Awesome..

title: Cool Place Food Hit & Miss
comment: Restaurant itself is very cool with incredible views of downtown London. Tuna Ceviche Appetizer was not great but Mushroom entrée was unique & delicious.

title: Sushi and Skylines
comment: Popped in for lunch this week. The meal starts with a stunning glass elevator ride to the 38th floor.  We just fancied a light snack so sat at the bar and had the 7 pieces of Nigiri times 2. It was just sublime, so fresh and full of flavour. The best sushi I've ever had, which is good as it's also easily the most expensive! The views are amazing, you can see the top of the Gherkin and the rest of London sprawls below you. Service is as you'd expect, very high class and you can take in the sites from an outside bar too. Great fun - give it a try!

title: Celebration
comment: Wonderful restaurant,stunning views of London. From the first minute to the last the staff were outstanding. Food is excellent to suit all with wonderful presentation.

title: Wow what a view!
comment: The cocktails, the view the food! What an incredible place! There is a special vegan menu which is awesome! I had the most incredible mushroom thing I'll never forget. The service was impeccable and atmosphere is lovely. I'd love to go again some time, on a special occasion as it's a pricey place, but a wonderful experience.

title: Stunning food with views of the London skyline
comment: Experienced the excellent tailored tasting menu, served over 4 courses with appetizers, grill section, sushi and dessert, washed down with Champagne, sake, white wine, a cocktail and coffee. Particularly enjoyed the grill section and sushi. A fantastic lazy way to spend a Friday afternoon. It is more intimate than appears in some of the photos. Service was generally very attentive, although a little more information could be provided by some of the staff about each of the dishes. One thing to mention is it appeared to turn into a scene from TOWIE towards the end of the afternoon as workers clock off early and start their weekend.

title: Lunch with a view
comment: First time here and a great place. The views are amazing. The staff in the bar area were attentive and polite. In the restaurant the staff were friendly and again attentive. The food was great and we tried a wide range of offerings. Tasty and varied we enjoyed them all. Great place to eat.

title: Stunning views of London 38 floors up.
comment: The glass fronted lift takes you up 38 floors in under 30 seconds. Stunning views over London. There is an outdoor terrace here as well. It is a massive venue. We had some nice cocktails and sushi. It is very popular with the City folks and bar staff said it had a club feel at weekends.

title: Best views of London, by far
comment: Not having any expectations prior to arriving I was floored by the location, the view, the view, the view. The food combination is interesting but done very tastefully and with flair. As an Australian I had to laugh with the sommelier trying to sell me a local South Australian white but nonetheless a must do, at least for the novelty factor.

title: Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian - say what!?
comment: My Sis and I needed a chilled out afternoon, filled with beautiful food, flowing champagne and awesome cocktails - so SushiSamba was our pick! This place did not disappoint.  The views are amazing, the cocktails are interesting but the food is definitely your needed sushi fix. I would highly recomment the 'Shrimp Tempura'. We experienced a variety of dishes as it was our first time, the one dish we were not too keen on was the 'Tuna Ceviche', beautiful chunks of tuna but the marinade was a bit too much for the dish.  The service is great but they do want you to keep the table for under 2 hours so when time is nearing the end, they get a bit pushy - but it is understandable as this place is very popular.  Two things to note -- firstly the lift up and down is definitely a journey to remember in itself, and secondly, this place is not an ideal romantic meal with your partner - it is live and vibrant place and perfect for parties or just a good night out.

title: It's the view
comment: You will have your own take on fusion, so this is not japanese or brazilian or whatever, and it is a bit corporate but you get a chance to peer over the old city and swank a bit...

title: Horrible experience and service
comment: We were a group of 7 people who negotiated a fix menu for lunch in order to make it easy for the restaurant to handle our lunch. We sat down at 12:30 and at 15:00 we did not receive our sushi and dessert despite having asked for our food many times. Nobody even apologised for not serving the food. Once the bill arrived, we expected a significant discount while they just took away from the bill the service charge (which service?).  The worst part was to feel that nobody really cared about the fact that we waited for 2.5hours to have our sushi.

title: Cool views. Nice inside. Grumpy rude staff. Rubbish service.
comment: Waited in a pointless queue on the street... red rope clearly there to add some theatre and exclusivity.  Get into lift... this is awesome. Super fast and city views were brilliant. We find our friends, say hi and dump our stuff. Sitting area we all had reserved was a small low table with little stools next to the stairs with lots of waiters walking past with sometimes very hot food. Felt like we were in the way a bit. Go to the bar to get a drink. £30 for too cocktails. Now I get we are in London in a prime location but that is expensive but also expected. What wasn't expected was the 20 minute wait to be served. The bar wasn't busy, don't know why it took so long. Cocktails were tasty. Next time we get a drink we decide on a bottle of champagne. £75. When we get the receipt we have been charged something like 12% service charge. SERVICE CHARGE!?!? For waiting to be served another 15 minutes and barman bending over getting a bottle out the fridge? I don't think so! Outrageous! Service charges are ok if we actually get served quickly and at our table? But neither of that happened! I asked them to take the service charge off and I got major attitude from the hipster barman. He took it off and then threw the card machine at me. He then started serving someone else. So I was left to pull the receipts out myself.  My sister got the next bottle, the bar lady persuaded her to keep the service charge on saying something like they get paid like in America and only get paid via the service charge... LIES!!!! We are in ENGLAND! I'm pretty sure there are laws about minimum wage! Stupid! So next time I get a drink served by the same lady as my sister and I refused to pay the service charge. She spent about what felt like 10minutes trying to persuade me why I should pay it... and the end I just said to her I didn't want to know and I just wanted to pay.  Meantime one of the girls in the group ordered some sushi to the tiny table (which by the way was very full of empties) literally took an hour and half to bring 3 plates at least 20 minutes apart. Absolutely ridiculous. We had to chase them up twice. By this point I locate a waiter and ask to speak to a manger. Totally rude and unapologetic. I felt like I was talking to the "ringleader" of the mean and rude crowd at school. He didn't care about our issue. Got no apology and got told that's just the way it is. Last bit of the food came around 1 and half hours after it was ordered. I only had one sushi roll, it was nice. Bit of an anti climax though after such a long wait. So basically go here if you like rude staff, terrible service and nice views. I won't ever go back. The only reason why we stayed there at all was it was a friends birthday and didn't want to create drama for her... any other time I wouldn't waste my hard earned cash.

title: Birthday Dinner
comment: Came here for my Aunt's 60th. The views across London are stunning, never mind the Shard. It has a bar and restaurant, but if you want to eat at the restaurant you have to book far in advance as it's a popular place. Luckily we managed to book it last minute the night before, as someone had cancelled their reservation. It's a great place to visit if you want to celebrate something special and as it's more pricey. There were a lot of people celebrating their birthdays, if you let them know it's a birthday during booking than they'll bring out a candle lit macaron at the end (hardly exciting though). The dishes are delicious, Japanese-Peruvian fusion works very well and the food is easily shareable.

title: VALENTINE'S DAY at SUSHI SAMBA
comment: I’ve always been 50-50 about wanting to try Sushi Samba. Love authentic Japanese food (basically Japanese food in Japan), but something about Japanese x Brazilian x Peruvian fusion food just never sounded particularly appetizing or interesting to me. In fact, it sounded pretty risky to me as the potential for major disappointment was quite high. Thus, I have been putting off trying the place for the last 7 years, but this Valentine’s Day 2017, it was finally time to man-up and my wife and I went to check out the place out for ourselves. Overall Summary Style & atmosphere : Sushi Samba is located on the 38th and 39th floors of Heron Tower, the same tower that houses Duck & Waffle on the 40th floor, and similarly to Duck & Waffle, offers a breath-taking 360 degrees view of London City. The main dining room felt a little small for me compared to Duck & Waffle, but it had a nice intimate and relaxed vibe to the place. Didn’t find the ambiance pretentious or stuffy, which was good. However, despite saying all that, the ambiance took a knock when the cleaner came out with a broom and cleaning signboard halfway through our service and started sweeping up in the main dining room. I found this quite odd as there wasn’t an immediate need to clean up due to any spillages or accidents. Up to until we paid our bill, she was constantly in-and-out of the main dining room sweeping around and it wasn’t discretely done either as she was cleaning around quite near the tables that had guests dining on them. It just wasn’t a good look to have. I checked some of the other guests’ reaction and from the way they were shooting eye-darts with one another when the cleaner appeared, they seemed just as perplexed by the situation as I was.  Food : 6.8/10. The Valentine’s Day Sharing Menu was £125 per person, which included a glass of Champagne Brut Rosé on arrival, and consisted of:  1. Plantain and Cancha with Aji Amarillo - 6/10. 2. Lobster Tempura with carrot, pumpkin, caviar, tensui emulsion, yuzu gel - 7.8/10. 3. Warm Black Cod Seviche with aji amarillo dashi, huancaina sauce, roasted peruvian potatoes – 5.5/10. 4. Confit Duck Gyoza with raisin, hazelnut, aji amarillo, crispy shallot - 6.5/10.  5. Kagoshima Ribeye with quinoa, mushroom, caramelised onion - 8/10.  6. Samba Roll Selection made up of 4 pieces of Tokyo Sky Tree (spicy bigeye tuna, tempura crunch, lotus root, aji panca, spicy mayo) – 7.3/10, 8 pieces of Samba London (crab, tuna, salmon, white fish, prawn, avocado, tempura crunch, rice cracker, japanese pickles, wasabi mayo, aji panca, soy reduction) – 7/10 and 4 pieces of Tiger Maki Takuwan (wasabi tobiko, crab meat, tempura prawn, tiger prawn, wasabi mayo, beetroot yogurt, soy reduction) – 7.4/10. 7. Alfajores with dulce de leche, coconut, alfajores biscuit, caramel, gold, and black salt – 6/10. The only memorable and tasty dishes were the Lobster Tempura, and the Kagoshima Ribeye. The Samba Roll Selection was decent enough. Everything else, unfortunately, was a little bland for my liking and lacking in flavour. Their drinks are highly noteworthy though. Since we are not fond of Champagne, the member of staff very kindly let us swap them for an Umeshu sake and Yuzu Sake, respectively. Both were delicious. We also ordered a Lychee Cooler and a Shiso Fine and both were divine to drink.  Service : 6.5/10. Basically, their service can be summed up quickly as follows, their friendly staff absolutely try their best to please you, but their execution and inconsistencies lets them down.  There was some incidences that I took a little umbrage to throughout the service which are listed as follows: - The hostess to the main dining room was unwelcoming with an uninterested attitude. - At the time of reservation and also at the time of reconfirming my reservation I asked for a window seat if possible, and was told that although they couldn’t guarantee a window seat, since it was first come first serve, they would try their best. Which is fair enough. However, when we arrived I spotted a couple of window seats empty and asked if we could sit there instead and was told that they were both reserved for guests that would be coming later. What ever happened to the first come first serve? - The table we were given was slightly wobbly, but luckily one of the staff spotted this and very kindly said he would fix it. Ten minutes later, he still had not fixed it despite him looking awfully not busy and free. After asking him again to please kindly fix the table, he again said he would, but another 8 minutes or so goes by and again, still nothing. In the end I gave up and asked a different member of staff who fixed it immediately within 10 seconds. Why the first staff couldn’t do this, or alert someone else to do this, I don’t know. - They forgot to bring out 2 of our dishes which we had to point out to them. They bypassed the Lobster Tempura and Duck Gyoza and went straight on to the Kagoshima Ribeye.  - At the time of reservation and pre-payment for this meal I had asked verbally and reconfirmed by email, whether they could do a birthday dessert plate for my wife since her birthday falls on Valentine’s Day and the staff replied that they usually don’t do birthday dessert plates, but they do arrange for little boxes of macaroons to be given instead. However, since it was going to be Valentine’s Day, I was told they were planning to give each table a little box anyway as a small gift and that he would make a note regarding my wife’s birthday on our reservation. Yup, you guessed it, nothing was given. At the end of our meal, I asked a member of staff about the macaroons and after checking our reservation details he said that no notes were made about my wife’s birthday on it and that unfortunately, since it was Valentine’s Day, they didn’t have any macaroons on hand which didn’t make any sense to me as this was the complete opposite of what I was initially told.
