To make amends, this member of staff offered us each a complimentary glass of champagne, and whilst the kind gesture was much appreciated I couldn’t help but feel disappointed as this was the same staff that we told not 2 hours earlier that we don’t like champagne and asked whether we could swap our drinks for something else. - After settling the bill, we sat there waiting for 15 minutes for them to bring our change back. In the end it turns out that they had forgotten about our change. Toilet decor & cleanliness : 6/10. The boys’ toilet was small, not very clean and on that night, there was strong whiff of smelly urine. On the contrary, I was told the girls’ toilet was nice and clean with no dodgy smell wafting around. Value for money : 5/10. The Valentine’s Day sharing menu was quite pricey, but unfortunately, the quality and quantity of the food did not warrant the high price. At the end of the meal, I left the restaurant still feeling hungry. The cocktails were worth it though. In my opinion, the order of the sharing menu should have gone like this: start with the Plantain and Cancha, then move onto one Samba Roll Selection dish, but instead of sharing, it should be one Roll Selection dish (it’s only 8 pieces) for each guest, then the Lobster Tempura dish , then the Warm Black Cod Seviche, then the Confit Duck Gyoza, then the Kagoshima Ribeye, followed by the Alfajores dish. Would I go again : Even though I’m curious to see how their normal a la carte menu would fare, I don’t think I will be visiting again for the food. Plenty of other nice Japanese restaurants out there in London to munch on. However, I wouldn’t mind chilling out at their bar again to sip on their delicious cocktails.

title: Good atmosphere, awful food
comment: I would come here ONLY for the view! The food is tasteless and the sushi not fresh. It is ok to grab some drinks at the bar, but would never come back again for the food. It is overpriced and bad quality.

title: A SOLID all-rounder
comment: Excellent views, service, ambiance and food + warm and welcoming (which is a rarity for a high profile venue). I could go into detail about each of the aforementioned but in summary, it was just extremely good in each department. My GF and I went for valentines and enjoyed the experience very much - from appetisers to desert. Lots of thought and creativity put into the food, all dishes VERY flavoursome and very well put together. A great all-rounder that delivers on expectation. Recommended.

title: Great night out
comment: Really awesome place ! Combination of good food , delicious drinks, and spectacular view . What can you want more ? Simply stunning !

title: Great experience - and then there is the food
comment: SushiSamba offers great food: An intriguing fusion of Japanese, Peruvian and Brazilian tastes nicely blended and inspiring one another. Unique and intriguing! But then there is the location, and the place: At 34th floor in Bishopsgate you have a great and unrestricted view of City and beyond in all directions. You are well above the St Pauls Cathedral, and you really enjoy look-out on London while you enjoy the food. Take time to hang out in the bar while you are there, or better: take your drinks outdoor on the terrace to enjoy a sunny day (if you are lucky). The only minus: Very difficult to get a table: From the online-booking calender, it appears that tables mostly are sold out months ahead. So book early! We would definitely come again - for the combination of grat food and great location - both for dinner and lunch.

title: Good dinner with friends
comment: It's an amazing location, they had a nice bar terrace. Food was good, I will definitely recommend and return here.

title: Superb Sushi
comment: The sushi here is excellent, very well made and fresh. The food combined with the drinks and the view are simply stunning. It is a fine dining restaurant and at the top of Heron Tower so expect to pay for that. The service is also very good and there is a large range of drinks, cocktails, wine etc.

title: Outstanding, but book early.
comment: We visited here for a 21st birthday for the first time and the only word to describe the place is outstanding. Finding the entrance is a little tricky as you only see a sign for the Duck & Waffle but, once found, you are lifted up in the escalator to the 38th floor and a view that is it hard to anywhere else, let alone London. Walking into Sushisamba you are greeted with a fairly narrow hallway where the toilets and the cloakroom are located next door - not a favourite of mine but space Is limited I guess. You then come into the bar area which is spacious and opens up onto the terrace where you have another bar and more outstanding views; upon entry into the restaurant one is taken back by the décoré.   The service throughout was sublime: always attentive and never too much so; all the staff were polite and smiled. However, the food is where this place hits another level. Looking at the menu, if you are not frequent patron of Japanese restaurants, it may look a little daunting but trust me: what ever you order will be amazing. We had a wide variety of the menu between three of us with the stand outs being the Prawn Tempura and the assortment of Sashimi, but everything was brilliant. Drinks are expensive, with wine starting around £35 and, unless you know what you're ordering exactly the need to go above £45 is there, but nothing unreasonable for London. All in all this place is deserves a 9/10, a few things such as the toilet/cloakroom location and the price of wine stop it from getting a 10 however I would always recommend - just book early.

title: Ignacio, excellent waiter
comment: The restaurant has a breath taking view and is very well located. The food was good, but, in my opinion, too many cultures are mixed. The reception is extremely slow.  We got a very good waiter, called Ignacio, who was very professional and gave us good advice.  Is a good place where to go in London!

title: Amazing, Amazing
comment: We took my daughter here for a treat and she was blown away. I've only eaten here 3 times but each time was exceptional. We ordered a selection of about 9 dishes and they were all excellent. Salt cod, Wagyu Gyozera, dumplings..all wonderful. This is NOT for the faint hearted when it comes to cost. The food is so good that heart overcomes head and you put off the pain of the bill. But once you've paid, you don't walk out talking about the cost, but of the meal you enjoyed. The views are also spectacular. We found the staff friendly and suggested dishes well. This would be a great Birthday surprise and in my opinion better than the Duck and Waffle.

title: Inappropriate Unprofessional Door Security
comment: Invited a friend to come with my husband & I to have some drinks. Two Security staff outside asked if we had a reservation? No, just wanting a couple of drinks. We were let through. My husband walked passed a 3rd Security guard near the lifts who was intimately involved with a female. I called my husband back as he hadn't been 'checked' at which point he was told to leave. Reason...too much to drink. This was absolutely untrue. The first two guards had no problem with us.The guard was clearly affronted to have been caught out and in complete contradiction to the 1st two guards. Absolutely unprofessional guard who'd you'd expect at a back street nightclub, certainly not what one expects of a high end city venue. Disgusting behaviour and unwarranted.

title: Lovely atmosphere but a bit overpriced
comment: I went here last valentines day for a £200 set menu! Although lovely, i am not a huge sushi lover and my boyfriend booked it as a surprise. The staff were lovely though and the restaurant is beautiful.  It was very expensive but it was valentines day i guess. I hope to go back and have the normal menu :)

title: Great service, stunning views, fun atmosphere.
comment: We had a girls night out and this place is perfect. Elegant and lively with some personable and professional service. I was having such fun and the cocktails were so great that I don't remember much about the food but I know that it was good (some of the sushi excellent). I'm tough to please and have been overcharged a lot over the last few months and I'm sure I was this time too but I really don't mind and Id do it again.

title: Great view and tasty food
comment: This restaurant is at top of a high building with great view of London. It serves an interesting choice of sushi and brazilian food. Great octopus, sashimi and kobe meat. I enjoyed the combination of sauges and meat brazilian style. Good food and not sonexpensive given quality.

title: Great service from Salvador our waitor
comment: We had a wonderful meal here to celebrate our anniversary. A lovely drink on the terrace with fantastic views over London, followed by a table with even better views. The food was amazing and the service great. We didn't even need to look at the menu as our waiter recommended our dishes which were excellent and just the right amount for two. I would say they did come quite quickly leaving little time for conversation or drinks. Overall though it was a great experience and we will be back again.

title: Loved it
comment: Went mid week for a late night dinner following a show. We booked about before Christmas so had no issues getting a table.  Upon arrival went to the bar for drinks as we had to wait for the table but it gave us a chance to check out the place. It did not disappoint.  Once seated our waiter recommended cocktails and made suggestions for food. Everything was great. We had two lots of the tempura prawns as they were exceptionally good. Sushi Aldi very good. Would have liked the option of a noodle / rice dish.  The atmosphere at Sushisamba is fab. It was still packed late at night and had a great buzz with music and chatting.  Our waiter was really attentive and knowledgeable. Your waiter will choose your food if you ask and having opted for a dish of his choice, the next time we attend we will go for option - just for the surprise element.  Overall a great experience. Look forward to our next visit.

title: Fantastic Food with Great Service
comment: Definitely a place to visit. Atmosphere, food and overall exemplary service all combined. As advised we chose six/seven dishes from Kobe meat to California rolls. Presented with artistry and style and better still taste was awesome. Great music in the background, attentive staff and overall an enjoyable night

title: Good food and place but a pitty of service
comment: When a place does not have good service, it affects the whole experience. I went with three friends, didn't have a waiter, each time we had a new one so when we ordered something we wouldn't get it and even in three occasions we got the wrong plates. The only person who was making an effort was the manager but certainly he does not know how to control waiters who on top of everything were extremely rude, when we told them is not our plate they would talk over us saying it is the right one. Also if this wasn't enough, when we got finally our plates they were never at the same time which completely spoiled the whole evening. The person who got their plate first had to wait until all of us had it to eat which was uncomfortable for all and just stressing. What a pitty! Something needs to be done to make this place worth it.

title: Great valentines dinner
comment: We've been to Sushisamba once before and our second visit was as magnificent as the first. We booked a set Valentine's dinner existing out of 6 courses and every single one was delicious.  The whole atmosphere is very nice and this is the place to be for someone whom wants to enjoy sushi with a twist.  Would certainly recommend.

title: amazing
comment: the whole experience was amazing. the restaurant is stunning. we had a great table by the window. even though there is a great view and its stylish the real star is still the food. we had a selection of dishes and all of them were absolute class. tasty, well presented and good sizes. will definitely be coming back.

title: Sushi, service and a view worth paying for
comment: Amazing menu, friendly, professional and knowledgeable staff and a fantastic view across North London.  Just go and experience it for yourself.

title: Birthday lunch!
comment: Amazing view and service  Food was delicious and not crazy expensive if you know what to order  Didn't feel rushed at all throughout our lunch spent about 2 and a half hours here  Would defiantly come again!

title: Beautiful food with an amazing view
comment: From the service, to the view, to the food it was all amazing!  The waiter advised us on what to have and how many plate were enough and every plate we had was so tasty!  Will definitely be coming back (once I get a reservation again!!)

title: Delectable fusion
comment: I was a bit wary of the restaurants name thought weird Sushi / South American crossover was going to take place. Presently surprised, Eldorado Rum from Guyana served 5, 10 and 25 year old with mixer £9 so off to a good start. The waiter was very knowledgeable and steered us in the direction of number of dishes to have but said they would all complement each other, he was right lobster and crab sushi roll, tempaura shrimp, squid with a delectable dip and lamb chops a must. Great value for central London meal and drinks £150 with no need to fill up on the way home, thoroughly recommended, try and get a window seat great view of the capital by night, one for the adults though quite small intimate dining would or recommend small kids

title: Beautiful experience
comment: Excellent service all the waiters are efficient and friendly. fresh fish and the location is fabulous!

title: Fantastically exquisite food
comment: Came with family and friends - staff were very accommodating with our 4 year old and our friend's 1 year old which made it all a very pleasant experience. The food was once again sensational - the green bean tempura with black truffle shavings were stunning, the prawn tempura with its spicy sauce (my all-time favourite), the miso cod (a beautiful depth of taste) and the tuna ceviche (stunning)... and lots more besides!! This is such great exciting food - it completely didn't matter that the view was shrouded in cloud!!

title: Excellent variety, expensive but worth it
comment: Sushi Samba is one of my favourite London restaurants - I just love the variety of the menu; from the Peruvian Ceviche to the Japanese sushi this place rocks. The wagyu beef dishes are exceptional and the cocktails were all great. I've been several times on business, with friends and my partner - suitable for all occasions.

title: Fantastic food and great view
comment: We had an absolutely fantastic meal here. The highlight had to be the wagyu steak and dipping sauces which were mouth watering.  Have to admit the prices are very high for what you get but you are paying for the view more than anything. Unfortunately our table was in the middle of the room so we were a bit unlucky.  The Banana Cake dessert was incredible, would definitely recommend it.

title: Good, but not great
comment: Saturday night.Freezing cold and light rain.Standing outside for 10minutes to be able to enter.I knew the restaurant is on 38, but lift wouldnt stop there.So 10minutes wasted before being told to go to 39 and walk down (one member of party with sprained ankle was not impressed) Lighting abysmal-Take torch to read menu if you need reading glasses. None of the dishes explained very well. Food okay, sushi/nigiri, very very good.Aside from that the dishes are a poor second to Nobu(park lane only), Roka and Zuma. If you are happy for the view, then go, food is edible, but was disappointing. For example all the dressing for the sea bass tempura was beneath the salad.Samba rolls not explained properly.Thought it would be like california roll, but each ingredient is seperate on top of a rice roll. Wont go back

title: You get what you pay for- beautiful surroundings.
comment: This is a perfect place for special occasions. The experience in itself is an amazing one, what with the glass elevator and 38th-floor view. The restaurant is nicely decorated, airy, with a cool vibe. Smart casual.  Service is really good and attentive, the waiters know all about the food. There is an open-plan kitchen behind you. The fusion menu is a really good amalgamation. The drinks are light and fresh, love the lychee cooler.  Expensive, but you get what you pay for.

title: Nice but too expensive
comment: Lovely surroundings we paid £31 for two corktails good service our food bill in total was £200 too expensive for sushi

title: Beautiful views, strong drinks.
comment: We came in on a sunday right before they were about to close. Although one staff member told us we wouldn't be aloud to grab a cocktail, we found another who gave us a drink and closed out our tabs.  It was pretty cold so they had the fireplaces on the terrace on. The tree is beautiful, and the views so far up are to die for.  The staff overall was accommodating.

title: Best sushi I´ve ever eaten!
comment: Every time I go back to London I can not miss my sushi time in here! I love the delicious fresh tase of their fresh fish! I love their service and the atmosphere is awesome! This restaurant is for me one of the best and I am so glad to found it! Good luck guys.

title: Highly overrated
comment: The food was mediocre and high priced. The noise was so loud you had to shout to be heard by the person next to you. I was frisked by security on the way in. Give it a great big pass.

title: Great views
comment: It is a nice posh bar with a great view of London and nice strong drinks!Quite expensive but you will pay same money at any bar with view of London!Definitely worth the visit if you are around and you like that type of bars.

title: Incredible location... But very pretentious
comment: It's definitely one of those places you have to go in London... But I was hoping it would be one of those places I'd want to come back to. The food was pretty good, and the cocktails we're up there. The crowd was there to show off though... Sitting and having a nice dinner and drinks with friends is not part of the experience. Music was too loud... And for the amount of staff they had the drinks were served really slow!

title: Impressive view - interesting concept
comment: + Impressive view!!! + Excellent concept (3 type of foods: Japanese, Peruvian and Brazilian), you will obviously find sushis; but not only; also Seviche and some interesting plates such as the fried green beans with truffle, and kobe beef. The menu is made of many small plates to share, very good concept; + Excellent service - It's a bit overpriced according to me, but the food is very good, and given they are many small plates, you can end with a "reasonable" bill I went 4 times, and will go again. If you book a table for 2, you are very likely to have a table next to the window, which is clearly a plus!

title: The right friends!
comment: A friend of mine invited me in this restaurant . I had a great experience of food .... fish is unreal tasty .. I couldn't be more happy cause I am a fish lover.. The view also... steals your breath!!!

title: They will do their service and nothing out of it!!!! Don't ask anything else
comment: I booked a dinner reservation for 23h on a Sunday night to make a surprise for the girl I'm dating. Sent them an e-mail, where Nilyay was really helpful, since was also a birthday dinner, she offered to send a cake (£40 extra). I would agree with that, but unfortunately since I was travelling with limited internet I could not arrange the form and credit card information. Nilyay said she spoke with the pastry chef and they would make the surprise anyway, that was really simple, when I asked for the dessert, would come a message: Do you want to be my girlfriend? Nothing complicated apparently, I thought. So on the night everything was ok, the food and the service (beside the fact they only serve food until 23h30 and never mentioned before, only when we were on the table), the drinks also amazing, the view fantastic.  I was able to get out of the table to confirm with the hostess my special request, and she said: "Don't worry the waitress and the kitchen know about it". So I went back to the table and guess what happened when I ask for the dessert? They send a message of Happy birthday! Ruining the special moment, of course. I sent them an e-mail on the following Monday and they only contact me on Thursday, quite a long time just to check what happened. Anyway Nilyay called me and apologize on behalf of the restaurant for what happened, saying the waitress got confused and brought another dessert. And that was all!!!! No invitation to come back and have at least a drink, no nothing. They ruin a moment and they say "I'm sorry, but someone made a mistake". After they even confirmed a reservation I have for March on another restaurant on the same place, but it's really frustrating so might cancel the other reservation, since you cannot count even for a small surprise. Coming from a back ground of Luxury Hotels this restaurant is disappointing for the price you pay....

title: Amazing Job
comment: Was in SushiSamba with a table of 5 ppl on last September, food was very good, Executive chef and his team is doing an amazing job also service was very good, we had a portuguese Waiter could be because we also are portuguese ( honestly i dont believe this is the reason ) but was very very attentive to the details of the food. Place to be back for sure . Well done Boys

title: An experience!
comment: Here is a restaurant with an excellent combination of great food, interesting concept & very nice service. The views are spectacular, the interior very special, food very well thought through & superb presentation. Top this off with professional service & you have an experience.  Don't hesitate to take an afternoon reservation giving the opportunity to enjoy the views both in daytime & in the evening. Bars are also worth a visit. Make reservation well in advance.

title: posh place, nice food and coctails and amaizing view
comment: I love to go at Shushi Samba in Liverpool street London. it is amazing place with bes food and coctails; posh place  great view; it is nice experience

title: Great music, even better cocktails
comment: This place is worth the wait if you don't have a reservation. Coming here for cocktails means a table can't be booked so you will have to brave the queue as we did but you won't wait too long. Once up on the 39th floor you are greeted by great music and an exciting atmosphere. The cocktails are incredible and you can see the real skill that goes into making them - a personal favourite was the lychee cooler - you won't be disappointed. We didn't eat here but from what I saw coming out it all looked good. There is even an outside terrace giving you excellent views of the city.

title: Food is *wow* & ambience 👌
comment: Been to sushisamba many times and consistently rate it five stars - although service could be improved.  I do love the food, massive wow factor and tonnes of flavour. Loads of highlights on the menu but personal highlights include Taquitos (yellowtail or lobster), prawn tempura and of course the black miso cod Robata. The ceviche is good too.  I see a common area of complaint from other reviews is service. I agree they could improve this, although I've never experienced anything worse than it feeling slightly disorganised - with far too many different stuff fussing around but not actually doing anything. Not bad enough to downgrade to four star but would love to see them address this.  Ambience consistently great whether a weekend or weekday, late lunch or dinner. Amazing views and if it's your first time then you'll love the trip up in the elevator.  Obviously it's not cheap, realistically it's £80+ per head but its head and shoulders above many other London restaurants charging the same price, in my opinion.  If you haven't been, then try and get a reservation in the diary, get there early, have a cocktail & enjoy the view. And please do yourself a favour & have the black cod!

title: Sushi In The Sky?
comment: We all love a good sushi? However, finding the right sushi can be a cumbersome experience, leaving you with a bad after taste. Go no further my dear friends- Sushi Samba has to be the 2nd best sushi we’ve ever had. Number one is and will always be Nobu, Park Lane. I will eventually get to writing about Nobu too, so stay tuned as that will be an epic.  Getting a reservation here is not easy, especially as we visited during the first opening week. The restaurant is located between 38th and 39th floor of the Heron Tower in Bishopsgate, a business district of London. (Equivalent to Wall St). The glass capsule lift shoots you up onto the top floor, before you had a chance to take any snaps of the amazing view of London. (Just get your camera’s ready before going into the lift).  We ordered few cocktails to begin with at the bar before getting seated. This was later followed by one of the best sushi in town. The taste and the freshness of each ingredient on the slate plate was too tempting to resist. If you ever visit here, you must try the waguyu mini burgers, am not big on red meat but these little gems were delightful! They are fairly small to say the least, about one bite size, but the taste is just phenomenal. They do say, all good things come in small packages- this is once certain example!  If you have a sweet tooth like mine, then you are in for a treat. The deserts here are just as good as the sushi. Its not very often that you get an amazing main with matching desert, but Sushi Samba does both. As someone who has deserts where ever I go, I know a good treat when I see and taste one. I was left speechless, yes it was that damn good. Their signature ‘Love from Rio’ desert, is out of this world. I love the fact that there was ice-cream, nuts and chocolate. I mean, what else could a girl ask for.. Our table was just by the window, meaning we had a fair good view out looking onto the city on this clear evening. As the evening drew to an end, we were all stunned upon what we had just discovered and it was ever more epic as we watched the sunset – a memorable evening, with great food and great company (my husband off course) – this right here ladies and gentleman is the secret to happiness!

title: Total experience
comment: Excellent food that we let the equally excellent waiter choose for us. The view is magnificent and to start i late afternoon and experiencing the city turning into nightmode was fabulous. The interior decorating is just right and we loved the orange tree. Even going up and down with the elevator was an adventure in itself.

title: Stunning view and nice food.
comment: Start at the bar by some cocktails which were quite good. Went for a second round of drinks (do not recommend you the paradise one, tropical flavour and mango stuff in, this one is quite heavy).  Good looking restaurant, stunning view and wonderful beef wagyu as expected from this meat. Sushi are great too. Service remains less than average but it doesn't affect the overall experience.  We had to ask 3 times to get some cutleries for one of our friend.  Quite pricey but you approximatively know what to expect from that sort or place.

title: Over priced
comment: Had lunch there yesterday with my daughter. Food was OK, maybe it was our choice but we didn't pick the most expensive sushi, in fact we had 4 small plates, some edamame and some plantain. 2 small glasses of wine each and finished off with a small saki  I nearly fell off my chair when the waiter produced the bill of £168. I am still in shock!!  Definitely not worth the money.

title: It's been better
comment: I've been to sushi samba a number of times and I have to say each time I've been the food has been amazing and the cocktails are delicious. That being said, I went a week ago after a year or so and I was pretty disappointed. The food is good but they have cut down the portions, increased the prices and the waiters were very pushy to rush us to order and get us out. If it wasn't for these things I would have given this place 5/5.  Based upon my most recent experience, me and my friends have decided to move on and find a new regular.

title: Friendly service all over
comment: Cool location with super friendly staff which I did not expect at all. The drinks could be improved and quality is slightly below average only. A pity. We did not try the food but what I have seen was great. Hope to try something next time. Definitely going to be back. Staff really did it!

title: Amazing place but they do not value their staff
comment: The place is gorgeous and the food is made to bring out loads of senses! The shrimp tempura, salmon ceviche and the black cod are simply incredible. The moqueca is a delicacy too with a good twist from the Brazilian version.  However, the restaurant dos not give to their staff the 12.5% they charge on top of your bill, clearly not recognising that a great part of their success comes from the good service provided by the people who work there (and basically just charging you 12.5% more on top of the menu's price on everything without a decent reason).  Having worked as a waitress myself when studying at Law School this kind of attitude from restaurant owners affects me deeply, so I will keep on refusing to pay for the service if they do not go to your staff, and give it to them directly if I can.

title: Saki..yes please
comment: We took a friend here for his 40th and we were not let down. The saki choices were incredible. The food was amazing coupled with a super bar outside and amazing views of my beautiful London.

title: Amazing experience - incredible view and best meal in a long time
comment: The entire experience was incredible. We were there for a friends birthday and enjoyed amazing food and wine. Would recommend the tuna seviche, yellowtail tostidas, and shrimp tempura, but really all the dishes we had were spot on.  Beautiful view and cool atmosphere and vibe. Definitely on the list of places to go for other special occasions.

title: Amazing
comment: My husband and I love this place, the cocktails and food are just incredible. And more importantly the service is outstanding. The staff are attentive and helpful and just really nice.  Great atmosphere and views.

title: Great Japanese Food
comment: Everything about this place was good from the minute we walked in. The Green Bean Tempura with Black Truffle aioli is a good kick compared to the traditional Edamame apertivo (although we ordered that as well!). My favourite dish of the afternoon was definitely the Tiger Maki (takuwan, wasabi tobiko, crab meat, tempura prawn, tiger prawn, wasabi mayo, beetroot yogurt, unagi tare) - it was recommended by Ignasio (Nacho), who also did an excellent job serving us. The food, interior, ambience and service was all on point. Awesome first experience at Sushi Samba!

title: Very good experience
comment: Went to Sushisamba for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon We went there for sushi and we were not disappointed but were not amazed either. Very good sushi, nice cocktails, very good atmosphere. Staff was polite and nice, view is amazing, decor is very nice. Will definitely come back, maybe at night next time.

title: Delicious Fushion!
comment: I came here for my Birthday and found the service inpeckable. Incredible views and the best sushi i've had so far! We also ordered a selection of Brazilian and Peruvian style dishes which were scrumptious! The desert was not too heavy, and with just the right amount of sweetness. This is also a great place to hang out with friends and drink cocktails.

title: Wow what a view - stopped fro drinks
comment: We stopped for some impromptu drinks - and we felt very spoilt :) managed to get a great spot in order to see the whole of London. Our server took great care of us and delivered some great eating recommendations even though it turns out to be a little tricky to do justice perched in the bar! Overall lovely but a tad on the expensive side for what we had.

title: Thank you Annalise @ SushiSamba! - Great food and service
comment: Annalise Hamilton-Smith was a terrific server and picked all our food for our group of three...which was excellent. Thanks for another great visit. Best sushi in London with amazing city views.

title: Nice atmosphere
comment: We have celebrated my mum's birthday at this restaurant. It wasn't my first visit, and as usual, everyone enjoyed food very much.  We had a selection of different sushi, fish and steak. Steak was average, fish was nice, but sushi were excellent.  However, the restaurant has a limited time you can spend at the table. As it was a birthday occasion, we have run out of time and were rushed to leave the table even that we have ordered the dessert and still it hasn't arrived. Thanks to our waiter Salvador, who made necessary rearrangements, we had the last course of our meal by the table.  The view is stunning.

title: Disappointed
comment: We had dinner here and we were underwhelmed. There are so many good reviews on TripAdvisor that maybe our expectations were too high. The four of us thought the service and food were both average.

title: Terrible service, average food.
comment: All is terrible, after writing my complaint letter to the manager (Marc (--)) regarding the poor service and a dish that was sent back. As compensation they want me to visit again by offering two complimentary sushi rolls. I requested my service charge to be refunded as the service was terrible. They tried to do everything they could to try and not refund the service charge or the full amount. It took 1 month for my complaint to be resolved. Just not worth going back. Food is overpriced for what it is, all you be paying for is the view. That is if you are lucky enough to get a window table. You are far better off going to Nobu, Zuma, Roka or Novikov.

title: Amazing service and attention to detail
comment: We went for my birthday dinner on a Tuesday night and everything was perfect. They put so much emphasis on the details (window table, candles on our desserts) and the staff genuinely made me feel special on the day. These little details made all the difference and everyone was so polite and took customer service levels to a high note.  The view is great, the food and drinks were awesome too - really can't think about any downside :) Thanks a lot, guys! Well worth it

title: Amazing amazing and amazing!
comment: I was extremely surprised when my boyfriend said to me we were coming here, as sushi was never a thing he liked, well I think he's now changed his mind too! Not to keen on the lift but that's more fear than anything else!, we walked in without a booking and they were so happy to accommodate us, we got a drink at the bar first and might I add I asked for a cocktail that suited my tastebuds and he made the perfect one!  We were taken to the table and the amazing service just kept getting better! I love sushi and all the food that comes along with it, but we left the ordering to our waiter, firstly we have the chips to start while we were deciding, then we had a warm sushi with salmon, cheese and other amazing things on it, I have never ever tasted something that bursts with so much flavour and doesn't get to much! Even my boyfriend was absolutely amazed! It was that good that we had another dish before we decided to finish off the meal, the fish and prawns were to die for also!  I'm so sorry I can't remember the waiters name but we were right in the corner to the right of the restaurant on Monday night your waiter deserves serious credit, his choices were amazing and so was his and everyone else's service was beyond fantastic! My new found favourite restaurant! For my first time In London it was an amazing experience!

title: Oh the glass lift and the bar!
comment: went for few drinks had great time! me and my girlfriend really enjoyed it the prices are fine too, but views are so nice there whole of London are visible. Not sure about the ques tho in cold whether.

title: Fantastic night
comment: The complete experience lived up to all of our expectations. From the first person who greeted us to the last, the service was really great. The only tiny fault was that my boyfriend had to ask three times for his beer before it finally arrived but it was promptly overlooked as the manager apologised and took the price of the beer off the bill. The other waiters are also very friendly and helpful. Oh the food. Really outstanding. We both love sushi and Brazilian food so we were really looking forward to this and everything was so so good. I particularly loved the eggplant small dish. Then the main dish of the churrasco rio grande came and it truly was like food heaven!  It was my boyfriend's birthday so I wanted a special touch added to the dessert and before I had finished my sentence the manager knew what I wanted, honestly, whoever the manager was that night, the service was really really great.  We also spotted Judge Rinder and his strictly come dancing partner having a great time there too. A truly wonderful night, thank you Sushisamba!

title: Great night
comment: Had come here with 5 friends for dinner and some cocktails. I had the steak served on hot stones which exceeded my expectation, it was the best steak I've had. The service was great and our waitress was nice, quirky and funny. The view is excellent and going up in the lift was really fun. Some of the cocktails that we had were okay, I had the lychee one which tasted a bit like suncream but I think I just made a bad decision. Would definitely recommend to friends.

title: Fantastic food and service
comment: Booked a table for 7. 4 adults and 3 toddlers. We had real trouble parking so were 45 mins late but we called the restaurant and they were very understanding. It's not mentioned on the menu but if you set a price they will bring you out a selection based on what you like (I know this from my visit to the Vegas restaurant). They said they did this also and recommended £75 per person. We went with their recommendation and it was perfect. The black cod skewers were particularly memorable.  They set it into 3 sections, tacos, serviche started us off then meat and fish and ended with sushi. We had just the right amount of food without feeling too full. The total bill was £318, including 12.5% service charge, edamame beans, 3 beers and a cocktail so the set menu must have come in under the £75 per person showing they don't automatically just charge the limit you set. Drinks selection is great, staff told us on arrival we'd need to leave by 7.15 which we were happy to do but in the end it was 7.45 and they offered us dessert but the kids were getting tired so we skipped. Even the lift ride was fantastic. Great to see a fancy restaurant being so family friendly. Can't wait to go again to the Vegas one later this year I hope!

title: Business Lunch
comment: Second visit to Sushisamba, the last one was 12 months ago, the menu has changed quite a bit and so has the wine menu, items we had all been looking forward to no longer there which was a real shame but change is what keeps things fresh so have to accept that. Food and wine were as always fantastic and could not be faulted at all, what was a shame is the front of house has gone down hill, no real smiles or warm friendly ness anymore, we were early so having a drink at the bar and mentioned to one of the team walking past that we had a table booked and wanted to just say we are here, promptly she pointed to the gathering of ladies around a desk to enter the restaurant and told us to go over there and tell them....sorry we bothered her as she was busy we could tell as she went and joined the ladies at the said desk and had a conversation about......well i can only assume the weather because i still had to go over and say we had arrived. There were a few other moments with coat collection etc which all just spoilt the service you expect in a place like this. In the restaurant though I could not fault the service it was excellent as always.

title: Great view, great drinks, good food, a little hyped up
comment: I prefer the NYC version but certainly the decor, the view and the drinks were great! Food good also but pricey. A little hyped up for what it is but worth a visit

title: Good but overpriced
comment: So my wife decided to surprise me for my 27th birthday. She had made reservations and asked for a window seat, which was agreed beforehand. We arrived bang on time and the security guard didn't know what he was doing. He was asking people who had not made reservations to form a line, but not distinguishing those who had... so we ended up queueing for a few minutes before realising we didn't need to. This made us 5 minutes late. Anyway, we reached the top of the restaurant and our jackets were taken. We were still made to wait in the overcrowded bar area and had to wait 20 minutes, despite having made reservations. We were then taken to our seat... it was not by the window as promised. We mentioned this but apparently there was nothing they could do. We ordered nigiri and some other types of sushi rolls and some some sort of prawn and cocktail type dish. The sushi was of a high standard but nothing out of this world. The shrimps or prawns or whatever they were, however, tasted amazing. We were slightly rushed and felt the food to be overpriced, but then again, I feel you are paying for the experience more than anything. But still.. edamame beans at 7 quid!!! Anyway, it was a lovely evening but won't be rushing back anytime soon.

title: Price point problems
comment: Ok so let's be clear - dining out in London is expected to be an expensive business - restaurants almost pride themselves on who can get away with charging the most per head.You can see from my 600 other reviews that I often visit top end restaurants and for the most part enjoy it thoroughly. But.... Sushi Samba has taken it too far and therefore do NOT represent good value at all. We went for the chefs pre selected menu which is what our waiter recommended and Our meal came to £150 per head without drinks and neither the Qaulity or Quantity could justify the price point. Big problem guys. Yes There was some ingenuity in the cooking which I appreciate greatly but that on its own cannot justify the price tag. For these sort of prices you can hire the chefs table at dinner with Heston! The best thing about the meal at sushi samba was the amazing views over london which you can get at the bar with a drink or upstairs @duck&waffle for £30.  Therefore with respect, I cannot recommend this place as value for money is important.

title: A brilliant night!
comment: An absolute must whilst visiting London!  The view is stunning, food, cocktails & service excellent. Our waiter Salvador went to great lengths to ensure an unforgettable night!

title: always delivers
comment: This was my 7th time in a year here and this place always delivers. Whether its drink at the bar or Sushi at the Sushi bar or dinner in the main restaurant or drinks by the fire, this place always delivers 100% consistency of product and great friendly service

title: I think I've fallen in love...
comment: This was my first visit to Sushisamba, and I took a business colleague for lunch. Wow - slick service from start to finish (our waitress Annalise was excellent) and the food was exquisite; portions were the correct size, the selection wide and food fresh. The views were excellent - I was fortunate enough to have a great corner seat (thank you!) and there was a real buzz around the room.

title: Very nice place to spend a special night
comment: Had a great dinner, Salvador the waiter who hosted us have been very helpful and recommended us the best dishes ever by our preferences. Hope to come back soon. Great job all the team. Thank you

title: The Best Fusion Sushi of the World
comment: I lived in London 2 years and went to Sushi Samba perhaps 10 times. Its my favourite restaurant and all the plates are wonderful. Most try pork belly and lobster crispy taquitos.  The service is outstanding and the view, well, no words. If you want to see London from the Top go and check it out, Call same day for small reservations, a day or two before for more than 4.

title: Excellent evening - will return
comment: There was a 30 minute delay to be seated. However the food was amazing, and the waiter was lovely. We asked him if he could recommend dishes for us, and he did an absolutely fantastic job. I would definitely come back again.

title: Best view and sushis in London!
comment: This is a rooftop restaurant in the financial district of London, called The City. The tower is called Heron Tower and it is right across the Liverpool St metro station. Its empty during the day and if you wanna enjoy the view - is the best time to visit. Weekends are also empty. But during the day after work hours, its always busy. The food and cocktails are very good. The restaurant and bar seperated from each other and also there is a lovely terrace. The food is to die for, sushis are excellent. This is one of my favo. spots in London.

title: special occasion restaurant .. review the bill
comment: so i am writing this review after the third visit to this place : food - is very good .. please do try their chicken teriyaki, black cod, salt and pepper squid, tiger sushi rolls ..  service - is okay can improve a lot , waiters are advised to take it easy with diners and let them enjoy their meals without disturbance and rushing them to finish or remove their plates.  booking is a must .. do book in advance and make sure to be there on time .. i am not sure how do they calculate their bill because i did order twice the same food but got charged differently on each time  .. i would really want to know why that happened ?!

title: One of the best meals of our stay!
comment: Dinner at sushisamba was one of the highlights of our stay, it was so good!! The salmon ceviche was one of the best we have ever had, and so were the black cod skewers. We also shared maki rolls which were also very good. The sliders were ok but I wouldn't order them again.  Tried the chocolate banana cake for dessert and it was excellent. We will definitely go again next time we visit London.

title: Perfect food and service in a great atmosphere!
comment: Let me start by complimenting the daily staff of SushiSamba who did the extra step, while I made a mistake with the booking. Although it was my mistake they went to extra trouble and did a great job to get me a table at SushiSamba. Especially the communication and effort by Nilyay has to be mentioned here. Furthermore the dinner was great. Most beautiful view and every time a great surprise on the plate. Try the Kobe Beef Ishiyaki.....really worth every penny! Will be back here for sure!

title: A great meal
comment: Really enjoyed my meal at Sushi Samba. View was fantastic, waiter was very polite and gave some great recommendations and most importantly the food was unreal.  Highlights were probably the Tokyo Sky Tower and the Black Cod skewers, they were fantastic.

title: Excellent experience
comment: Great atmosphere! Great view! Great servise !  Really trendy! food was beautifully presented and delicious!  Will definitely come back

title: Fantastic Bruch
comment: A fantastic idea, amazing views & super food! Myself & my wife had the best brunch ever here, ended up spending £200 without knowing it but worth it! Amazing food, great concept & so special. Sat outside in the roof garden on a lovely sunny day. One of the best meals we've ever had & we've eaten in many fine places but the sheer setting & food I've never seen or experienced before makes it one of the best.

title: Yummy sushi
comment: Great experience overall. The place is great, really nicely decorated. The day I've been there it was foggy and couldn't see from a foot away. It makes the saying "having the head in the cloud" perfect for that moment out of time.

title: Return visit
comment: Spent a second birthday here celebrating and this time brought my family along to experience with me as I had told them how amazing the food was. It didn't disappoint again. The only negatives I would say was that despite us making a reservation for a specific time we waiting over 30mins to be seated after the designated time, also the waitress whilst helpful wasn't fully informed when faced with questions and I wouldn't say was customer service focused either. Having been there before and after ordering a large quantity of food £300+ we asked for sides of rice (a dish we were offered and had ate there before), we were told in no uncertain terms we could have it it was apparently for children only and the new chef had changed the concept. The waitress made a bit song and dance about asking the chef as if we had asked for something completely off the menu that they didn't serve. Seeing as rice is one of the main ingredients of sushi and I had ate it before and offered it as a side dish I really didn't see a big issue with a couple of bowls to accompany food, in any case 15mins or more later we were finally told we were allowed to have two. The food as before was extremely good, everyone commented on the flavours and how well everything was presented, cooked and tasted. We ordered Kobe sliders, teriyaki chicken, the large ribeye and chorizo dish, sushi, black cod, the lamb dish, and a pork belly dish that wasn't on the menu. I wouldn't hesitate to return as I love the food and the ambience, it's always busy, there's good music, great drinks and even better food.  The sticky toffee and ice cream birthday dish was also really good, apart from being misled told it was going to be a large chocolate cake as they didn't do small birthday deserts any more apart from a macaroon with a candle. The desert was a normal size for one person or to share and was excellent.

title: Amazing Experience, Awesome Food.
comment: We went on holiday with my family and we decided to try SushiSamba as they recommended to us, and definitely they where right! Starting with a lovely table and the amazing view and the service of Ignacio, the head waiter who chose for us all the selection of dishes and sake to pair with. Absolutely knowledgable and attentive with us, and he also recommended to us the desserts . We left with a smile and definitely we will recommend this place and you should ask a table with Ignacio if you want your experience become a magical one!

title: Drinks amazing, sushi not that much!
comment: Sushisamba would deserve a 5 just because of the location and the Atmoshpere. I like sushi a lot, I am not an expert but I have tried it several times and I expected a little bit more from sushi samba. It left me disappointed, it wasn't that tasty. However, drinks were unbelievably good and well done! For a date is absolutely perfect!

title: Ignore the trouble on the ground floor, and you will be fine
comment: Sushisamba is not a place we would usually patronize, but a recent visit found us there with old friends, seated at a table for nine, including three youngish, well-behaved children. The highlights were the view of London at night, our waiter, Salvatore (delightful!), and the sticker shock when the bill came (overpriced, even for London). The deal at Sushisamba is that you share many exotic dishes (all the complicated rolls and special beef appetizers are really good), and try craftsman cocktails. Be careful not to end up ordering too much, and try to gird yourself for l'addition.

title: Could be excellent if someone would check the staff
comment: Tonns of waiters and waitress roaming around but never there when you would need something  Thus was my second visit to this restaurant. Once I had a lunch here now we choose to have dinner. Some of my dishes were good but others were more than disappointing!  I chose from the raw section the Tuna and specially asked from the waiter what was that but when it arrived I was more than surprised: there was almost no tuna in my dish at all.  I asked he waiter if he could find any in it and he found 2 pieces of 1x1 cm tuna in this terribly sour, vegetable composition. Then they asked me if I want more tuna in it but till that I ordered another dish: samba rolls which were just ok.  The food wasn't the best but the service is just ridiculous!  Tonns of waiters and waitresses roaming around but when you try to ask anything or pay or you have any request you have to wait long minutes (the place wasn't crowded) and this spoils the whole experience and it's annoying. Once we were waiting at least 5 minutes we saw exactly 6 of the staff just standing behind the counter and doing nothing. With the £1000 beef price they definatelly should watch out more. The decoration is wonderful though especially the tree on the balcony.  I'm not sure if we want to return... if yes then for the view.  Cocktails were great I suggest to have a drink there.

title: Rude ground floor security staff
comment: Today my wife and I had a reservation at Sushisamba at 9pm to celebrate a special occasion, which unfortunately the mood was ruined by your rude ground floor security staff. We arrived early at around 8:30 - 8:45PM, after confirming the reservation details we were about the enter the lift when your security staff stopped us and advised us that we would like to check the bag. I thought this is just the usual security thing, not a problem at all. I gladly opened by bag (a backpack). He spotted a plastic bottle drink (about 500ml half empty soft drink), which he mentioned I need to drink it since it's not allowed to bring it upstairs. I thought it's a bit rude but it's not a big deal it can be simply thrown away. I put it on the floor and Sushisamba security guy literally threw the bottle away to the corner around the check in desk area. He pointed the content of my bag, and asking what are those which I replied "food, groceries". He asked me again, what kind of food? To be honest I was stunned, I did not expect to be scrutinised about my shopping details. I put my bag on the floor wide open so he can check it himself as much as he wants, I thought. But he asked me again what food? Well I am not sure what I am suppose to do? Does Sushisamba seriously wants me to declare my grocerry shopping list there? Do I need to show him right in front of other guests my packet of steak, broccoli and cheese? This is rather insulting and degrading. Honestly, my blood boiled. I told him he could ask politely instead of repeatedly shouting "What food? What food? What food" To which he said "I did not say that". Well, yes you did. I don't think I have amnesia. Now to think about it again. Does he seriously think,we're just going to eat our own food there? We put all of our bags and coats in the cloakroom anyway. I have to say, the restaurant service and food are all excellent, as good as the previous occasions even though this will be the last time we will be going to Sushisamba. No restaurant worth the trouble and I can not accept the treatment by your security. I have to say it again, very insulting, degrading and completely ruined the mood of our evening.

title: Enjoy the panoramic view of the city while dining
comment: went to Sushi Samba with friends for dinner as usual with most of London luxury restaurants pre reservation is necessary. Location of the restaurant on the upper floors and the panoramic view from the tower gives a wonderful feature so you can see the city from under you while you dine, but unfortunately we could were not able to see anything because of heavy fog during our visit to the restaurant, decoration of the restaurant is wonderful and comfortable, as well as the general atmosphere the restaurant. Staff were friendly, polite and helpful, service were fast, majority of our selected dishes from the menu came delicious. Prices were reasonable compared to restaurants of the same level in London. I will be back to visit a restaurant and I would recommend it to everyone.

title: Overrated...
comment: I visited Sushi Samba with my family last night and it failed to live up to our expectations. We knew it wasn't a cheap place but were excited to have a nice dinner out as one of the final nights of our holiday. Whilst the location and ambience of the place is great, the food and service do not really match it.  I was really expected to be blown away given the prices on the menu. However dish after dish failed to impress me and the rest of the family. The mini burger was dry and the ceviche and sushi were as good as places that you pay a quarter of the price for. The service was OK, the staff were friendly. But had a lot of short comings e.g. taking glasses away and not asking if you would like another drink, taking plates away too quickly etc. I would consider going back for drinks but for the restaurant, definitely not.

title: Amazing drinks!
comment: I came in with a friend for a drink and I had an Italian guy as bartender. I think his name is Simone. He is one of the best bartender that I had so far in London. Very professional, polite and he had the perfect manner to the guests.  Hope that you meet him if you are looking for a drink because he could suggest you, YOUR perfect drink!

title: Beautiful place
comment: After a day out in London it was lovely to treat ourselves to a little luxury. I felt slightly underdressed with a few Christmas gatherings going on so outside seemed our best option. Lovely to sit under the tree, covered with a blanket & admire the views. Not cheap but if you want cheap go to the pub!

title: Fantastic food, great location, mixed staff, high prices!
comment: An incredible 38-floor external glass lift kicks off this experience well. The bar and restaurant areas are interestingly designed with great views (overall) and good samba music. The food was beautifully presented and delicious - we had incredible scallops ceviche, good prawn nigiri, very good avocado maki, excellent salmon and asparagus samba rolls, fantastic "London" mixed fish nigiri, yummy vegetable tempura, good miso soup, and salmon (amazing) and smoked oyster (average) sashimi. The dessert we chose was fabulous - alfajores cake, with marshmallow and dulce de leche ice-cream. The bill was INSANE - £200 (including service and 4 glasses of wine). Thankfully, it was a special occasion!! But this is not such good value as other high-rise London eating experiences and the view from the restaurant (not the bar) is high but not so exciting. The staff in the restaurant were great but those in the bar and greeting areas (not coats) were so snooty it was laughable. A great one-off but I'd head elsewhere for a future lofty, London lunch.

title: Nice but not great
comment: Too trendy for its own good is my assessment. It seems the proprietors are so used to every one wanting in to the latest trendy joint that they have forgotten about customer service. We virtually had to tackle a waiter to have our drinks order taken long after we were seated. The food was good but not great and for what we got it was certainly over priced. And when it arrived it was all at the same time rather than being staggered. As if they wanted to be rid of us in record time. A "standard " service charge ( a tip in any one else's language ) was included in our bill. When we asked for it to be removed due to what we considered to have been pretty ordinary service you would have thought by the reaction we had committed a Capital crime. In my opinion inclusive service charges breed complacency. Our experience at Sushisamba proves my point

title: New Years Day & daughters 22nd birthday
comment: We had a fabulous lunch and the staff were so professional, very attentive and superbly informative. The menu is superb covering off sushi and sashimi in an excellent style with very high grade quality ingredients. For me the 'eye opener' was the 'samba' dishes which were fantastical cooked and many of them completely new to us and so delicious. We have never had Sake before and the sommelier really helped to select a great choice to match the food for a first time drinker of Sake. They decorated my daughter's dessert plate to wish her Happy Birthday! I cannot praise this place highly enough.

title: 10 waiters and 5 bosses
comment: no wonder the food is expensive: too much staff running around, smiling but not very efficient. the location is very attractive, better then the food, just good average but we did not tried the kobe beef for 1000 pounds per kilo

title: Stunning sushi raising you to new heights.....
comment: Well I couldn't type the same old headline that everyone else did...could I?! I visited this restaurant for a friends birthday and I handled the booking, the process is a tad clunky for a such a good restaurant but still impressive once it's booked, with text message confirmation and e-mail reminders helping you out. On the day, you arrive, don't let first impressions fool you, you need to use a lift to enter the restaurant and the waiting area looks rundown, worn out, has no heating (not particularly good for a cold January day)......but once you step into the lift, everything changes. You rocket up to the 38th floor, and the view, while going up is breathtaking, you're done in about 40 seconds, you're then greeted by a very eager cloakroom helper who shows you through to reception.  The lady running reception during the early evening that day looked stressed and was helpful but I little bit too stressed for a restaurant like this, but I'll put that down to a busy bank holiday and a lot of extra guests.  We were then ushered to our table and the service was superb, totally on point, the menu is a mess though and very confusing, for a foreign visitor (my friends were German) were completely lost, it needs a cleaner layout and much bigger writing as the restaurant is dimly lit for effect. What overrides these minor points, is the constant attention (but never too much just right) the expertise on hand from all the staff, then the description once the food arrives, to how they stagger your menu so you feel like you've had a proper meal. The food was just exquisite, the sushi is on par with anything I've eaten in Japan, lovely prepared and tasted so fresh, the desserts were great, I was little underwhelmed by the ice cream rice cakes which seemed soggy and too frozen but then they served me up the banana chocolate cake which was delightful. The view is something else, and they are totally relaxed on you going "full-on" tourist and taking photos from every angle, the venue is decorated well and the tree is a sight to behold. Pictures do not do it justice. When service and food is "this good" you tend to forget the niggly bits and my friends were really impressed and that's what mattered on that evening to me. So do go, be prepared to spend some money, the view, great food and gorgeous service come at a price that I'm willing to spend. If you're just going for drinks, get there early, this place (which always is a good sign) is popular.  Let's hope they don't let standards slip, because this is something special and I hope they keep on choosing the experience for their customers instead of money and at the moment they've got it right.

title: Come for the view; that's it
comment: I've been to Sushi Samba London countless times - from the week it opened even, and each and every time I leave I think to myself, why in God's name am I handing over such an extortionate sum of money for what I've just eaten. The view is stunning. Without a doubt one of the best in London (particularly from the bar and staircase between the 38th & 39th floors) but that's where it ends. The service is hit and miss at best. The food is painfully overpriced for what it is and seems to get worse every time I go. Bland tasteless cuts of overcooked meats; miso black cod where the poor fish has been obliterated out of existence by the sauce, the sushi is just a roll of the dice. It's just disappointing but ultimately you could argue they are just resting on their laurels given the view. It's all rather unfortunate,as I rather enjoyed my first couple of meals there. Since then it has been downhill with little sign of turn around.

title: Good food and an awesome view
comment: The view over London is fantastic and the food is excellent. Definitely try the salmon nigiri, the black cod and chicken teriyaki.

title: The view !
comment: One of the few places open on the 25th of December. Fantastic view of London. Food is OK but pricy for the quality.

title: birthday dinner special occasion
comment: we went the weekend before christmas for our daughters 16th birthday meal we have twins, they only had one lift working which meant we were waiting for some time in the cold. upon arrival our table was not ready, and because the girls were 16 we could not go and get a drink we had to hang around the concerige desk. I went outside and the seating area was great views amazing of london, they had fire pits too keep you warm. we were taken to our table food was lovely just keeps flowing cocktails really good and wine excellent. our waiter was really effiecent and friendly, it is quite expensive so not somewhere you would just go everyday i think. but a nice experience

title: So much potential!
comment: This place could be excellent, but unfortunately it's always far too busy meaning that not only does the quality of service suffer, but there is a sense that they want you out quite quickly. The roof terrace is ideal in good weather and especially for those warm summer evenings. Drinks are expensive, and rightfully so given the setting, but I've never been blown away by the food. Really good, but not great!

title: Great fusion food !
comment: Came here for lunch before an appointment close to Liverpool station. No doubts that the place is perfect for dinner and private events, with a great view and great atmosphere. Even for lunch the place is a good idea, with an interesting lunch menu bargain!  Loved my pomegranate ceviche (picture)!

title: Fabulous restaurant with an amazing view!
comment: I went here for my sister for lunch. If you are in a hurry go somewhere else as this is not just a quick bite to eat! The service was impeccable as was the food and I am looking forward already to my next visit! Highly recommend!

title: Super place
comment: The experience is brilliant. The journey in the glass lift to the 39th floor is a treat in itself. We had corporate entertainment and were ensconced on the 39th floor and were served with lashings of booze and nibbles (always helps to give a positive review).  The views of the city are stunning and offers 360 degree views of the City. SUSHISAMBA’s main dining room overlooks views of London with floor-to-ceiling glass on three sides. There is a bar outside and terraces, which are the highest in Europe! The food was tasty and had multiple influences from Japan, Peru & Brazil. They also had great Hendricks and tonic, which was a winner.

title: Amazing every time
comment: Have been to SushiSamba a number of times and can say every single time I've received amazing service. Feel like you have about 5 people waiting on your one table and nothing is too much to ask. Especially this time a gentleman called Salvador made the experience that extra bit special. His customer service was second to none and his knowledge of the menu was fluent - which makes a refreshing change.

title: Amazing lunch and Service
comment: We visited with our very good friend Yoshi, (a London local). The restaurant location and view - superb, food - amazing, and if you are lucky enough to get 'Elisabetta' looking after you, life will be good. Elisabetta made our first London experience one that will be very hard to beat. Thank you!... we are here for 9 days and already booked to come back! favouritemeal #sashimicoma great mocktails :)

title: good Japanese sushi with fantastic view
comment: Came here with friends, we were meant to go to the upper restaurant but that was full so we tried this one , it's better than we thought , the view is one of the best, food is expensive for student , good for traveler who would like to see London view

title: Birthday treat
comment: Everything was perfect. Food, music and venue. Ignacio was a great waiter. Views amazing. Best sushi I've had.

title: Nina fresa
comment: I come here for cocktails and I like the wide variety of drinks present here. The atmosphere is good and people are well dressed to pass the controls on the ground floor. Cleo at the entrance is really great and makes you feel welcome. I suggest Nina Fresa or Shiso Fine as drinks.

title: Brilliant views, excellent service, good food!
comment: Certainly one of the best views in town!  But there is more: Sushi Samba has a certain buzz, a certain vibe that makes you coming back! Service is very friendly and attentive. Food is good - though do not expect the same quality as in places like Zuma or Roka! Make sure you reserve a table (as it is almost always fully booked)!

title: Miss Dubai Salama
comment: Salvador it was the best  I like him tooooo much and the food it was unbelievable ❤️ The place was amazing  100% recommended

title: After work posh cocktails with great views
comment: Sushi Samba hardly fails to deliver with its standard cocktails and nice, professional, corporate ambiance. Always well corporately dressed clientele and fine ambience makes it a pleasing place to have a cocktail. The door policy is firm enough to maintain a welcomed crowd. Typical place for the afterwork fine beverage venue or perhaps for a late hour cocktail. The lift of the Heron Tower is one of the fastest ones in the area and the place is certainly a must see for the lift experience which can be sociable at times. Overall, excellent venue for business drinks or fine beverages after work.

title: Amazing culinary experience
comment: This isn't your regular sushi restaurant. A real treat for the taste buds! All foodies and sushi lovers must try! Other than the amazing food, service was fantastic and views unparalleled. Great choice for a special occasion, ticks all the boxes!

title: Fantastic
comment: This is quite a pricy restaurant, but you get your money’s worth. First of all, the view is phenomenal. And even you're in a glass sky scraper, they decorated it to such an extent that it is really cosy. All members of staff are extremely friendly and welcoming and the food was delicious. We had three Sushi rolls as an appetizer and as a main we went with a Brazilian dish, the moqueca mixta. I would definitely recommend this place for anybody who wants a special night out.

title: Good experience - nice view, good food, attentive service
comment: We ordered for the evening on beforehand, were directed immediately to the correct floor and were well received.  our waiter was very attentive to us.  We asked them for some great ideas to have us taste the different dishes and that turned out to be a good choice for a reasonable price.We had a very nice evening in this beautiful place high in the sky. It was fully booked, so busy. But we were served well ! . We would go again a next time.

title: View and ambiance 10 , food and service less
comment: Sushi good, Kobe beef sliders very good, deserts Great, drinks hard to mess up. Terrace w orange tree awesome..view and ambiance really cool, location cool..but service and attitude of employees was not good at all. Off putting. Banker types, regular people, banking industry..no need for snobbery..that we Didn't care for at all. Only reservation we could get was 4pm? We would go to blackfriar over this if given choice just for how friendly and kind they were..too many amazing places in town to be treated this way. Will be back for drinks especially on a clear night..it must be amazing..

title: Great food and atmosphere
comment: The food here is exquisite at times, some of the best dishes I've ever eaten. However, the sushi itself isn't the main attraction, which makes the name misleading and why I haven't given it 5/5. It's expensive, but you're paying for location and the views. Even when it's foggy, you feel like you're eating in the clouds, which is great. Service is impeccable and their cocktail menu is robust and has something for everyone. Definitely worth visiting, as the non-sushi dishes are delectable. Their Brazilian seafood stew was a personal favourite of mine.

title: Nice view, too expensive for what it is
comment: The view, service and food are good (well, you go there mainly for the view I have to say). I do think that it's too pricey for the quality of the food.

title: Great Experience
comment: Couldn't recommend this place highly enough. Amazing views across London which you'd pay good money for on its own. The restaurant itself is striking and there's a great Rooftop bar with heaters and a fire pit. Salvador looked after us in the restaurant, we asked him to choose which dishes for us to order and they kept bringing out one amazing course after another. The black cod was a particular favourite. Only criticism was that it was difficult to understand what some of the dishes were as some of the servers didn't speak very clearly...having said that, if we had ordered it ourselves, we would've known what we were eating!

title: Tacky Bar and Service
comment: Introduced here by some friends who have been many times before but even they agreed it is not what is used to be. Bad attitude bar staff. Very bad wines at the bar. Only 2 beers at the bar! The view is all that this place has on offer and we will not return. We complained about the Malbec on offer at 10/glass, it was absolutely disgusting. After protesting about how bad it was they offered to only charge for 1 glass, greedy and tacky. This was a 3.00 bottle being sold at 10/glass. The furniture is old and tired from IKEA possibly, the decoration is ready for attention. Not a destination location unless you want a great view.

title: Good
comment: Great atmosphere and views across the city of London. I do feel its a tad over priced for what you get, especially the drinks, but it was 100% worth the visit and we did have a great meal. Fantastic flavours and great cooking all round. Won't go back in a hurry but well worth a visit.

title: Excellent
comment: Thanks to Ignacio one of the waiters our experience was excellent. He helped us choose a variety of food and made sure that we were very well looked after. Will def come back

title: Great food and view, poor service
comment: Heard great things about Sushi Samba so decided to treat my friends to a Christmas lunch before a few drinks in the evening.  The food quality was fantastic and I will highly recommend this to all who I know. However we were very dissatisfied with the food service element. The waiters were not attentive and also had the attitude that they were too good to serve us. They did not explain the dishes properly, showed no interest in making sure we were having a night to remember, and also made us have to ask after all the courses.  One waiter didn't want to explain what he was serving and just decided that a huff and quick departure from our table would suffice.  We are not a fussy group, though we like to spend our hard earned money on quality experiences - we thought that this would be one such an occasion but sadly the serving staff did not agree.  I would recommend this dining experience to my friends because of the food and the view, but if Sushi Samba want to be the premier establishment in London then they need to look at their serving staff.  There are a few saving graces, and we do not want to tar all of the serving staff with the same brush - that said, we would like to see more attention from the management to ensure all guests experience the same exemplary experience.  I do have exact examples that I can share with the management if they so wish to get in touch. For now, in the spirit of Christmas... Merry Christmas  Rhys

title: After meal drinks
comment: No reservation is required if you are going for drinks.  You may have to wait outside for a little while but it is never very long.  Elevator takes you straight to the sushi samba drinks bar, lovely view when going up and so quick but just prepare for your ears to pop.  Drink prices are what you expect to be on the pricey side but the view is worth it. Music is good but I wouldn't stay in here all night but that is purely because I like to fit as many bars into one night as I can.

title: Awesome place!
comment: Sushi Samba has the most stunning views of London and as you go up the glass high-speed lift you know somewhere special awaits. Try to time your meal before sunset, so you can see the views by day and then as it gets dark the restaurant is transformed.  Firstly I found the service ok, often having to wait for servers to order drinks or if I had a question. If service was a little better, I would have rated excellent. The food on the other hand was superb. Everything was just so delicious. The menu is quite extensive and some guidance is required to ensure you do not order too much or too little. A very special place to go to for special occasions. I would also suggest quite pricey, if you are planning to have some drinks with your meal, but well worth it. I would recommend the bar areas, however they do get very busy during the evenings. However has a nice vibe.. Look forward to my return...

title: Great Food and atmosphere - rushed through very quickly
comment: Love the place and setting and views are incredible Staff were very attentive and friendly, struggled to understand most of them as their english was not great. Would I go back nd recommend sure, really liked it Don't get caught withe "I only have a table for 1 hour" when you are spending £150 for two!

title: Date
comment: I had an amazing night with my girlfriend. The food was delicious and the service was perfect! Thank you

title: Hmmm...black cod!
comment: Group of five for a celebration xmas lunch. Fantastic black cod and chicken, in fact all the food was incredible if not expensive. Incredible venue so overall good value given setting and quality of food.

title: What an experience
comment: Great restaurant in a really impressive setting. The food was excellent and beautifully presented. The views and general buzz of the restaurant was really good to experience.  The staff were friendly and helpful with what can appear a complicated menus. Try it.....you won't be dissappointed

title: Great atmosphere and views
comment: Food so tasty, small portions so can try a little of everything and it came quickly. Cater portion sizes to the size of your party Service really good Views amazing on 38th floor I recommend going at night

title: Disgusting Service, Lack of Initiative and Sense
comment: Disgusting service. What Sushisamba managed to achieve over the slow course of the year was dashed by dim-wittedness and an appalling lack of initiative on behalf of the hosting staff.   We had arrived to fulfill an 11:30 booking ten minutes late, and after spending another ten minutes being patted down by security we were told that the kitchen had unfortunately closed. A fifteen minute argument later, the chefs handed another sizeable sushi tray to a server mere feet from us.
