The table could not be committed, the kitchen had closed, and the hostess' manager parroted the sentiment, apparently unable to understand the idiocy in either taking the booking, or closing the kitchen at 11:45 when the table was granted until 01:30 at night!   A whispered explanation from a sympathetic server explained that the kitchen staff had felt "tired" throughout the week and decided to take an early night off.   An appeal for a complimentary drink was similarly scuffed off, so we waited, coats in hand, for a further fifteen minutes while a table was sorted in Duck and Waffle a floor above. Suffice to say we will be spending our evenings a little bit higher from now on.

title: Miserable service
comment: Turned up to use the bar. Went up to 38th floor. Not greeted by anyone, had. No idea where to go but found the bar. It's tiny it found a tiny table ourselves and had to be pretty assertive to get a drink. Not impressed, won't be back. Trading In The view.

title: A once great restaurant now distinctly average
comment: Certainly this restaurant has some of the best in London if not the world, however on my 4th visit here the food seems to have gone from creative innovative and exciting to distinctly average. Cocktails remain fun in the bar and the view but this seems sadly all this restaurant now has to offer

title: Great office party!
comment: I visited Sushisamba as part of an office party so I admit it may not be the usual dynamic for the restaurant, but I had a great time while there. Anyone who knows this restaurant will be more than aware of the incredible views from every window. Inside the restaurant is just as beautiful with gorgeous fixtures and perfectly ambient lighting. Due to it being a private event, waiters were floating around with canapes rather than us ordering food - as a vegan, my selection was limited but still more open than I expected! Thank you very much for a great evening and I definitely intend to visit again. Highly recommended.

title: Excellent, only thing stopping 5star...
comment: ... is the price. What an excellent restaurant. The ride up in the lift in the heron tower is an excellent start. Great view. The restaurant is lovely and airy with brilliant views. The food. 5 star. The shrimps are stand out. But impossible to criticise any of the dishes. So why not 5 star? You have to go with your wallet ready to take an absolute bashing.

title: Xmas meal for 14 people
comment: the atmosphere was really great and exciting . Very swish. I'm glad to say that all 14 of us really enjoyed it. The food was excellent. our table was fro 9.30pm and was a little bit late and although we were all enjoying ourselves at the bar we were given complimentary champagne. Our main waiter Antonio was particularly helpful. Many of us didn't really know what they wanted and were changing their minds and he didn't mind at all. we were very lucky to have him. I had the job of organising everything and Daniele , the coordinator was also very helpful and efficient we will be back.

title: Extraordinary!
comment: I have dined at the top of buildings in Singapore, Bangkok, New York and London - but none compare with the absolute delight that you will get from dining at the top of the Heron Tower. What a tour de force, in all senses. Great place, simply amazing food, and an extraordinary sense of being somewhere where all is magic. Just go, and see for yourself! Mind you, the fact that I was with three lovely young women that I work with may have had something to do with the level of my enjoyment!!

title: Not good enough
comment: I had great expectations for this visit specially because we booked well in advance. The booking was easy and when we arrived the table was ready. We had a nice person looking after us but, it wasn't enough. Before I start please note that I'm very, very picky so you might think I'm overreacting...well is my money so I'm entitled to. They took our order..a mix of small dishes to share, plantain (very good but VERY small so not worth the price) gyosas.. I can't fault them..really good, green beans, some tempura beans, etc all good but small. Service arrived little by little and drinks arrived after food was served (a huge oversight In the service) they also forgot my drink..and I didnt get it until I had to ask for it..a Pisco sour! A alcohol made in Peru and Chile from grapes, usually 45 degrees alcohol.. To my horror what I received was nothing like a good pisco sour..in fact it was terrible!! So bad that I returned it.. So be aware and don't order it.. They accepted my complaint and replaced it with a tequila margarita. The margarita was well prepared but average. You can have this drink made with the same standard anywhere else.. Ok then I had tuna ceviche ..this dish was very interesting.. The flavours were all there but it was soo small that was difficult to enjoy properly..again I understand the place is trendy and they want us to believe this sharing style..again is definitely too small. If you ever go to latin America ask for a ceviche and you won't be disappointed by the size. I then had some chicken heart skewers..they were delicious..size was good and sauce was a perfect companion..all the flavours were there to enjoy.. For dessert I asked for an alfajor...well what I received was a version of alfajor that was nothing to compare with real alfajores in Latin America... As a conclusion: a complete overpriced experience with average service and pretentious fusion style that often mix and experiment so much that looses the meaning of the dish.. Sad specially as the Latin food mix with Japanese should be a good mix...unfortunately I won't go back.

title: One of the best restaurants - ever!
comment: I couldn't recommend Sushi Samba highly enough. The variety of food available is extraordinary, and we experienced tastes..we had never experienced!! We were looked after by the friendly staff from the moment we arrived, and a wonderful manager called Salvaa was always on hand to make us feel like celebrities. And then add in the view from the 39th floor.....you won't find a better way to enjoy a few hours dining with friends. Well done all!

title: Sushi in the ski with diamonds.
comment: Amazing place and quality of food in general. Mouth watering food. A must in London. At a 39th floor the views while having freshly made sushi. Very fast and prfessional service considering it was packed on a Tuesday night.  Special mention to Salva. He was very helpful and friendly. Thanks for suggesting th e "El Topo" rolls. Looking forward to visit them again i would highly recommend it.

title: great service and food
comment: Myself and my partner went into sushi samba for the first time for lunch. The service was amazing, our waiter Ignacio was very nice and attentive another manager or he seemed to be was very polite and also very helpful these two gents where both great! the food was very tasty, spicy tuna roll was the best and the miso cod i also recommend. overall the service was 100%

title: Great Food, Great View!
comment: Visited here for my 40th Birthday with a friend. As soon as you enter the restaurant the athmosphere and view are amazing. Knowing nothing about whats what with sushi we were recommended 7 dishes by the waiter, one from each section and wow, we were not dissapointed.  In the "RAW" section we had Scallop and Nikkei Salmon which was exquisite and we particularly enjoyed the Lamb Chop and Poussin in the "ROBATA" section. I am now a huge fan and cannot wait to go back.

title: A total treat!
comment: This restaurant is not to be missed. From the high speed lift to the 38th floor to the attentive service, unusual surroundings and stunningly beautiful food, Sushisamba is wonderful. We came for lunch and opted for a number of small plates and some sake. Each dish was a work of art and tasted as good as it looked. Lots of unusual ingredients and food combinations but they all work. What ever you order - it will surprise and delight you. Staff were lovely and very helpful, so attentive too. We seriously outstayed out welcome - tables are for a limited time - but they didn't hassle us and were gracious about asking us to move on - an hour after our allotted time was up! It is pricey yes, but so worth it. Fabulous experience.

title: Sushi Samba was amazing!
comment: Amazing staff.. even shared a few jokes with the waiters.. amazing location.. had no issues at all. Went as a group of 8 people. Food was beautiful. It cost us £325 including starters, cocktails and 2 large plates of sushi shared between 8 of us and got full.. would definity go again

title: Goo quality
comment: I went to sushi samba for diner their foods and service was excellent I will try again next weak

title: Very enjoyed to stay there for sushi and view
comment: Nice and comfy atmosphere with amazing view and hand made sushi  Professional service (water with lemon before dish without question)  Sushi were the best. Was right choice.  Will pop up again.

title: Foods and service
comment: I Visied the sushi samba on 02december for diner their foods quality was excellent and service was friendly

title: tea at the bar
comment: we went for a tea at the bar and it was just perfect with the location which is amazing and the view is a must

title: Great evening drinks venue
comment: Popped in one Monday, early evening. Didn't have to queue but understand it can get v busy towards the weekend. Don't bring any water bottles along - its like airport security. We had good waitress service (we had to wait half an hour for one round but they didn't charge us). It was impossible to get seats - tourists seem to have excellent tactics for getting in before we did - but still good views. Excellent outside smoking area with heaters.

title: Rude waitress
comment: I visited Sushisamba for my friends leaving dinner and drinks. While the food and atmosphere was excellent and worth the money, but that can't be said about the waitress that served us(I think she might be a manager) She was very rude with us and made annoyed facial expressions all evening. I don't think that it should be acceptable in place like that.

title: Amazing Place - Amazing food - Amazing service
comment: We arrived at 10pm and our reservations was at 10.15pm, we got a cocktail in the beautiful bar, and went on the fabolous terrace. Very punctual at 10.15 we had a wonderful table! Atmosphere young and music on background accompany delicious sushi! Shrimp tempura something amazing, and samba London too! Our waiter Ignacio very kind and friendly!!!

title: Good food, better views
comment: It has become a tourist attraction due to the views of London offered from the 38th floor. The food is good but not great. You pay for the views, so worth it once but that's it.

title: Fantastic fusion
comment: The view the atmosphere and the food, it all adds up to be a good night add to that a cocktail or two a funky DJ and a tree lit up with fairy lights and you've got a night to remember.

title: Good, but not as good as the American counterparts.
comment: Location is great with an amazing view over London. We had the chance to enjoy the view both during daylight and evening time. We visited the Vegas venue so we had some expectations. It is not by all means bad, but it doesn't compare to the American counterparts. The food was good, we tried a mix of our choices with some reccomendations from the staff. They have some interesting choice, but I still believe that the American Sushisambas have better menu selection than London one. I also tried an original cocktail which was also good, not extraordinary. Service was ...great; we had the chance to be served by a Romanian server, so that was a nice surprise. She tried hard, maybe a bit too much. Hope she will get a break in the city! It's better to make a reservation ahead at least a few days ahead in order to get a table by the window.

title: Well worth a visit
comment: Went with friends to sushisamba, food is amazing, busy with a good atmosphere. The menu a little confusing- small plates are a starter size, large plates a main course size.

title: great !!!
comment: supercool bar , inside and outside with great views over the city - the place is very very busy and "en vogue" - food was excellent , best to share dishes , also a good wine list - looking forward to coming back !

title: Extremely bad customer service
comment: The company is focused on profit profit profit, they don't care whether you are going back another time. We confirmed our booking twice then we came to the dinner 20 minutes after our booking because of the tube issue. They Said they already gave our table to someone else! How crazy is that, after confirming a booking twice and having given our credit Card details for guarantee? They made us wait 40 minutes For a new table, standing in the hall. My parents were visiting For one night so it completely ruined our night.  Also, For such an expensive restaurant, a more eloquent music is highly prefferred. People need to hear each other while talking. If we wanted a loud place we would have gone to a night club. Very loud and bad combination of songs for a family dinner. I Would not think of ever going back there.

title: Room with a view
comment: What can you say great cocktails- the Bloody Mary is one of the best - great view especially if you can blag a window seat amazing venue

title: All round lovely evening!
comment: The food was absolutely exquisite and plenty of choices on the menu - our amazing waiter Salvador was extremely good at advising how to order the right number of dishes and how to get good variety from the menu! The viewing balcony was breathtaking and the view from the restaurant whilst eating was stunning. All topped off with a little birthday treat as a surprise which we were not expecting. An all round lovely evening and would 100% return. Thank you SushiSamba!

title: Good but pricey!
comment: Very London city feel with funky decor but lots of busy suits. Menu inventive and some super yummy and beautiful dishes. But expensive. Service impersonal and not friendly at all.

title: Perfect Anniversary Dinner
comment: My husband worked in the same building as Sushi Samba and I had been bugging him for years to take me. You need to book 3 months to the day to get a booking but I can see why! The restaurant is certainly special. The outside bar with 'enchanted tree' is visually stunning as is the design of the restaurant. However the breathtaking panoramic view is really incredible. Staff were lovely and attentive and the food is interesting and exquisite. It is pricey therefore good for special occasions. I would recommend trying the more unusual fusion dishes to get the full experience. One critique - you can't take away leftovers. I am completely anti-wastage and I understand they'd like to retain a prestigious image however either they explain what they would do with the waste or they allow customers to take the food away. I've done so in even expensive and prestigious restaurants. This point is enough to put me off visiting somewhere a second time or if I do I would order much less.

title: Unforgettable
comment: Stunning views of London from a 38th floor. Friendly and educated staff and glorious food. Simply delicious. Expensive restaurant but very good value per money. Will definitely be back to enjoy it by night!

title: Flashy, but lacking substance
comment: Went with a group of 6 for a business dinner. Were informed the dishes were designed to share as a group (fine). Unfortunately as they came out I found that apart from the sushi rolls the dishes overall were poorly designed to share (soup?!), and we would have been better served ordering individually unless sharing in a more intimate couple setting. The food, however, was delicious.  Service was poor - drinks cleared without refills offered, saki for one poured for all without asking (three times!), dishes missing from table during service but appearing happily on the bill, and generally a bit of a shambles.  Would hesitate to return.

title: Great food, too noisy
comment: Setting is terrific, we weren't that lucky to get an aperitif om the terrace but the view you get going up and down on lift was completely satisfying. Food was super tasty and waiters attentive.. two down sides, one obvious for London.. 1. Very expensive; 2. Music too loud (I lost half of the conversation with one of my guests..

title: Drinks and views
comment: Did not eat here but did have late night drinks and it was an experience. The views from the 38th floor were amazing. The elevator ride up alone was an experience. Although I did not eat here I have been to the Manhattan location and it never disappoints so I can only imagine that level of food with the views of the London location.

title: Amazing food mediocre welcome
comment: Food was absolutely delicious and especially the charcoal grilled large meat plates however the hostess was not welcoming and we waited a looong time.for our table

title: Some of the most creative Sushi ever assembled
comment: Fantastic location with a great ambiance - perfect for a special occasion. The sushi is incredibly creative and tasty. As someone who loves sushi and has had it from many many different restaurants all over the globe I would rate this tops for something a little different. Really impressed and can't wait to go again.

title: Stunning
comment: I'd been dying to come here for such a long time , I was worried that id be dissapointed. Not so I'm happy to report  The bar staff need educating and a lesson in social skills but the staff in the resturant were outstanding. Our waiter recommended dishes for us and we loved everything. So ptetty too ! Wonderful views  Sublime sushi & Wonderful cocktails  I will definately be back  Ps you must book, always busy

title: Amazing view, great drinks, Great sushi
comment: Honestly I'm flabbergasted that Sushisamba only has 4 stars!  The sushi is good. London might not be known for a total sushi town but Sushisamba is an international org. and it provides great dining experiences for its customers. So, book well in advance, the queue for the elevator at the bottom adds to the excitement. You shoot up 39 floors and arrive. Wow! Spectacular views. The drinks at the bar are seasonal and whoever in charge has a good immagination. When I went with my girlfriend there was a surprisingly organic vegetable twist to the drinks. She had a summer berries and beetroot daquiri and I ordered a kale pina colada... Soo good! We ate a rather expensive but wholesome and delicious meal. Everyone working there has a lot of class and expertise. The other diners are well dressed which provides to the atmosphere. We ended our dinner with drinks on the balcony with a few pictures. Do yourself a favor and come check it out!

title: Fantastic view - a must visit in London
comment: We enjoyed very much this special experience. The view is Amazing!  We had to wait a bit for our dinner table but it is worth waiting. Food was great and my favourite is definitely any dish with Kobe beef...staffs are very friendly and efficient. We will definitely visit this place again.

title: Great food awful service
comment: Upon arrival we were told the table is not ready and we would have to wait ten minutes. After waiting for a bit over ten minutes we asked and the lady said it might take over thirty minutes however complimentary bubbles are only given out after waiting for a bit longer. After complaining we eventually were given complimentary bubbles however, we did have to wait forty minutes.  We were then escorted to our table and were not asked if we would like a drink or anything for another twenty minutes until we asked if we may order now. We ordered our drinks and food and we must say the food is great, fresh and innovative! However when ordering our Mochi as desert the waitress left the order paper on which they MUST always take off before bringing out food!!!! I have never had anything like this happen to me before. The leftover dishes were left on our table for thirty minutes until again, we asked someone to take it off the table.  Food is great but why does the service have to let this place down so much??

title: Creative, different, that view!!
comment: Firstly, the view... stunning, day or night, well worth a visit. From the elevator ride up you know you are in for an experience, and Sushisamba did not disappoint. The waiter recommended 4-5 small plates between 2 of us, making sure we ordered the miso cod - it was sublime. The crab taquitos were another standout for me, and the sushi was incredibly fresh, however we over-ordered and did not get to fully appreciate it. For the price you are paying you expect freshness and quality and they provide that. We both agreed it's not the best Japanese we've had, but it was more for the experience and was still a good meal. Recommend you visit at least once.

title: Lunch
comment: Great food, great service! Even though we had very limited time they were very understanding and gave us a good experience.

title: Good food but can be improved
comment: The environment of this restaurant is nice. The food here is good if not that salty. Very exquisite made food.

title: Could not be faulted in anyway, a must do in London
comment: I had the opportunity to dine here recently after many years of wanted to visit. I was not disappointed. The restaurant itself is based high up in the Heron Tower so has spectacular views over the city. The restaurant itself is based in almost like a large conservatory which is floor to ceiling glass so doesn't matter where you sit in the restaurant you can appreciate the views in any direction. We were lucky to have a booth table which was one of the best in my view for a larger party. If there were 2 of you you could get tables that looked directly out and next to the large window which I would suggest asking for if there is only 2 of you. The staff were super friendly and knowledgeable, one of our guest is pregnant and so unable to eat certain things but they were able to guide us through the menu and select suitable dishes. Everything we ate was beautiful, I couldn't fault it in any way, delicious flavours and just mouth watering. We especially loved the green bean tempura. I would definitely recommend to anyone. The menu and food is expensive but you won't be disappointed. I would suggest booking well in advance as it can be hard to get a table for lunch and dinner (we booked for 2:15 and managed to get booked in 2 weeks in advance) I will definitely be back for the next special occasion.

title: Unforgettable
comment: Location, Surrounding, Food, Service.. everything is extraordinary. A place to definetely visit. Absolutelz reccommendable

title: Dinner
comment: We went to Sushi Samba to bring in a friends birthday and it was a great experience. We all had a great time, the atmosphere was great and lively.

title: Top service and food!
comment: Went there for a team lunch. It was pretty packaged, we didn't get seated in a nice place - it was quite near the entrance/staff/kitchen - so people kept coming in and out. All dishes came out top quality, just that some combinations of sushi weren't the greatest? I like the authentic simple sushi, this one gets a little creative - which is good, but sometimes overwhelming.

title: Great view
comment: This restaurant has one of the best views in London. The menu is great but a bit pricey. It was very difficult to get a reservation so I would recommend booking as soon as you know you want to go here.

title: Fabulous
comment: Second time visited here and was still as good! Black cod and waguyu beef to die for!! Drank fine wine and ate everything that was recommended!!  Cost £830!!! But we did have the best the four of us!! Thought they might of given us a complimentary drink though after the amount we'd spent!!

title: Amazing food
comment: We visited on a Saturday early evening. We have wanted to come here for a long time and finally managed it! On arrival the glass lift takes you up 38 floors, overlooking London as you go. The bar area was rather busy. The upper bar is apparently closed on a Sunday so there were a lot of people trying to find somewhere to stand or sit and enjoy the view. The garden was also closed which made inside even more congested. The very small area you are able to sit at is pretty much under the stairs so you need to be very careful of your head and there are many signs and stickers warning you. We were not greeted by anyone nor did we know if there was a cloakroom, we kinda had to figure it all out ourselves. The bar staff seemed to table serve some guests but not the others. My fiancé went to the bar to get more drinks and a waitress came over took his glass and bottle and subsequently took my glass of champagne which has 1/4 still left in it. I preceded to tell her I hadn't finished as she swiped the glass and soaked herself with my champagne that I did not finish. She then put my glass down and told me she would get me some more, that never happened. My fiancé came back to the table with no glass just bottles of beer which was also not very good.  Onto trying to find out if our table was ready... we worked our way through the masses to the desk where 3 members of staff were standing. They subsequently told us our table was not ready and to wait by the bar... 15 minutes later we were still waiting so I had to chase up the staff who then said yes our table was ready! It seems no attempt was made to even find us and advise us this was ready.  Once seated we were given the menu and greeted by our waiter who asked if we needed any help with the menu. He was pleasant enough So to the food.... we chose miso soup, shrimp tempura, and the following samba rolls.. samba london, Tokyo sky tree, California maki The food was delicious so fresh and flavoursome The cocktails were just as tasty, my favourite was the Samba Sour although the sambatini and champagne was also delicious. My fiancé had the Asian lager.  Overall we had a really nice evening. The staff, in our opinion, need to be a bit more friendly and approachable but the food is undeniably delicious. Sushisamba is worth a visit non the less

title: Amazing service and food
comment: My first time visiting this place and the food was just amazing! This was topped off with amazing service from the staff ! Definitely recommend this place

title: Never Again!!!
comment: The most rude staff I've ever met in my life!!! They gave us our table 30 mins late and after one hour asked us to leave as the table was re-book. We didn't receive any apologies for the delay, seems they are please you allowing you to spend 400£ (2 pax) in their restaurant! Guys you crazy! Hope your venue will close soon! BTW fire the staff specially the manager, compliments for her rudeness!!!!

title: very posh and not for every day
comment: Arrived there at 1700 and where serviced well first at the bar and then at the Restaurant. place is very posh, portions are small and Prices are high. but the view compensates for the bill

title: Such great service, amazing cocktails
comment: I went with my bestfriend the other day on what seemed like a very busy night. We were there for the first time and had no idea where to go so we ended up at the bar, fairly confused and looking for the reception, but the girl behind the bar smiled at us, so we decided to just ask her. She was amazing, told us that we could order sashimi and rolls from the bar and basically explained the entire menu to us. However, we still could not decide on anything, so when we came back to the bar, she was nice enough to recommend a great cocktail with strawberry and pick food for us too! After that we went upstairs to the Duck and Waffle and enjoyed the beautiful view. The receipt said her name was Arvila, so cheers to Arvila for taking time for us on a very busy night and being generally lovely!

title: Not Amazed
comment: Was our Anniversary so wanted to go somewhere with a WoW factor always wanted to go to Sushi Samba but booking 3 months in advance does take planning. We arrived which was stunning big sign went up a very fast lift to the 40th floor, greeted at the floor for jackets and reservation then told we need to walk down one floor which the stairwell down had fabulous views the bar area was absolutely lovely. Greeted again at the restaurant and taken to our table , we was seated away from the window which maybe would have made it a little better if we was but I came here expecting great Sushi dishes ,our waiter was great but a little hard to understand , restaurant was noisy and was only half full. We had all sorts of sushi including the black cod and 2 cocktails , normally at any sushi place I would be full I felt disappointed and yes the food was different but to me nothing special only pricy. Service was excellent though!

title: 5* EVERYTHING
comment: I don't understand how everyone doesn't rate this place 5*?! Avid sushi fan and I have been time and time and time again. Food is always impeccable, beautiful tasting sushi, presented in such an exquisite way I almost don't want to start and ruin my plate. Food is the number one reason I come here, ambience second. Music is always kept at exactly the right level of volume, staff are always attentive and no one can fault the beauty of the London skyline at night glittering below. I have even recently branched out from just 'me and my partner' visits to dragging my never-tried-sushi-before in laws. They thought the alternative selection to sushi (ie the black cod or tempura shrimp) was excellent and the sushi they tried was superb. Only time service slipped was when there must have bee some sort of breakdown of the booking system and me and my party was left standing for an hour awaiting a table in the bar area. This was made easier by a flute of apology champagne each and when we did eventually make it to our table, the food was divine as always.

title: go and you will not forget it!
comment: This place gives you the chance to see London from above. A month after your visit, you will still remember the place and the views but not the food you have eaten. However the food is very good. Service is attentive and prompt and the waiters know a lot about the servings. One special note is that the waiter that spoke to us about the wine, was a certified level 3 from wset. If you don't know what that means, then trust me, it means a lot! So, go there have a good time, enjoy the place and the food! Would totally recommend.

title: Perfect place for dates
comment: I had one of my dates here and the ambiance was amazing. We loved the interior design of the place and just couldnt stop taking photos! It soon became one of my favourite places in London!

title: over priced place with good view
comment: You have to make reservation in advance. I like the view of London from the top floor. We had tasty sushi but for that kind of price my expectations were higher.

title: Amazing Sushi and beautiful decor!
comment: I had always wanted to try Sushi Samba, the lift alone to go up to the floor looked exciting enough. This place didn't disappoint at all, everything was beautifully made, presented and truly was a lovely experience. Can't wait to go back!

title: Amazing restaurant
comment: Been there a couple of times and always had a fantastic evening. Great ambiance, great food, great restaurant, great view. Also has a large terrace for smokers. It is just below duck&waffle and the sushisamba bar. Very sociable place, I highly recommend it if you fancy going to a fancy restaurant.

title: Awesome location. Great foot and city views.
comment: I went to SushiSamba as the original in New York is one of my favorite restaurants. The London version cannot keep up with the foot that the original has to offer but the location and the city views definitely make up for this little gap. It’s a very busy place and we had to wait for over 30 minutes despite our reservation.

title: Great bar - especially in summer
comment: After dining upstairs at the Duck & Waffle, we always pop down a couple of floors to Sushisamba for post meal chilling out. It's pricey, but again offers a great ambience allied with stunning views of the city. Balmy summer evenings are the best time to visit (if you can get in: it's almost always jam-packed with London's trendy set). One of the best places to watch the sun go down on London Town...

title: High times for views and sushi
comment: This is the type of hip space that sometimes causes a line to form outside the elevator that soars you to the top of this building in the heart of the City. The glass elevator journey is itself part of the adventure. But the food holds up. Innovative sushi combos, a spicy mayo glazed shrimp tempura, lime and salted edamame all got high marks. Super quality tuna, yellowtail etc.

title: Great views and the food is good also
comment: Nice views , good food, service a bit sloppy - dishes didn't arrive in order and dishes arrived that were not ordered. Wine list good but expensive. Service charge normal rip off I asked for it to be removed - thought I was being interviewed by the police ! When I explained that I thought the service did not warrant the service charge they couldn't hurry me out quick enough.

title: Incredible view, cocktails and food
comment: We were very lucky and had a beautiful clear and sunny day for our trip to SushiSamba. We started with cocktails in the bar which were all brilliant, then moved though to the restaurant for our meal.  We had all had Japanese fusion food before but this was our favourite experience by a long way. Our waiter, Salvador, was helping and genuine in his advice with quantity and which dishes to order.  They were all super, my favourites were the lobster taquitos, the salmon ceviche, and the tempura green beans with truffle dip.

title: Outstanding
comment: I went to this restaurant with my partner in July and have booked to go again this Friday. I am so excited as I had such an amazing experience the first time. It was a clear day, so the view was amazing! We started with cocktails outside and then moved on to the dining area (outside). The food was brilliant, and the service was on par. We had the taco starters which were incredible and I will definitely be having a few of those again this week.

title: Great sushi and service!
comment: I had a great time with my girlfriend here. We ordered sushi and a few cocktails. It was the best sushi I ever had! The view up there is really nice. It's pretty expensive, but if you plan on going to just one fancy restaurant during your visit in London, then Sushisamba should be it.

title: Great place
comment: Hello! I have recently visited Sushisamba, my boyfriend took me for my birthday and we enjoyed it a lot. The whole experience starts in the lift upstairs, great view and feeling. Then, the hostess took us to our table which was by the window so the panorama was amazing. We ordered two cocktails that were great, mine with gin and cucumber and my boyfriend´s one was wiskhey with coffee. We went for Lobster taquitos, they were great, so tasty and delicious, we had ceviche with scallops and tiger´s milk that was one of the best ceviches that I´ve ever tried, so tasty and smooth in the mouth. Then we have californian and london rolls....great sushi!!!!!!!! The place itself is very nice with lot of luighbulbs hanging from the ceiling and the moon came up when we were still there so we enjoyed London´s panorama at night. Our waitress were super nice, super good service. Great place!

title: Sushi
comment: A bit far from city Center but worth a visit amazing view with music great atmosphere very good food tried sushi checkin and wagy beef all were good

title: Very good
comment: The high views are amazing a bit noisy for my liking usual places but the place is very charming, the cuisine is rather modern than authentic but having said that the food is still very nice and flavorsome. I'm such a fan of Peruvian cuisine but whenever I fancy real flavors of Peru, then I will stick with Tierra Peru in islington or Braslian in Camden. Fun night anyhow.

title: Excellent service superb food.
comment: Visited the restaurant for my wedding anniversary recently and served by the waiter Silivan for a second time out of many visits.He was knowledgeable about the menu pairing of the wine and provided outstanding customer service. The food was outstanding and the ambiance of the resturant provided a cool fresh vibrant feel. Yes the menus prices but you pay for what you get which is great service, and food to match.

title: Great scene, great food, great service for a Sat night in the City.
comment: Kostas Suasdravas, floor manager and Salvador our waiter were both very attentive and charming. Will go again,

title: A great experience I will repeat next time I am in London
comment: The service was absolutely fantastic, and the food was amazing as well. Some of the best sushi I have ever tasted. Paired with the gorgeous view from a window table and the terrace, it is a very memorable experience.

title: Excellent service!
comment: We were served by this guy named Salvador, he served us very well. Thanks! He recommended us the 'best seller dish'. Our dining experience was great. Favorite dish: wagu gyoza.

title: Geat location
comment: We were a large party of over 18,made to wait in a tiny corridor,made to feel very unwelcome by some staff.Clearly this is a very successful restaurant with brill views but you should never let that go to your head and treat your customers with negativity making them feel small.  Jacob saved the day ,charming and apologetic but too late .The evening was spoilt!

title: Fabulous View, Great Sushi, Warm Service
comment: We visited Sushi Samba for a celebratory meal for a friend, we celebrated in style with Champagne and cocktails to start with with some small plate starters including Kobe Slider, Wagyu Gyoza - dumplings, Samba Salad and  Shrimp and Vegetable Tempura - all delicious! Highlight mains included the Sea Bass, Tokyo Sky Tree - tuna, tempura crunch, lotus root and spicy mayo and the Samba London Rolls - a great selection of Sushi. Deserts were like pieces of Art and a delicious selection of Passion fruit sorbet with Green Tea gel. We went large and finished with some additional cocktails - try the Cafe Millonari for that desert post-prandial pick me up! Dinner with great friends is the best, on top of the world even better and the universe grace us with a beautiful rainbow! A perfect way to spend a Sunday lunch time. Thanks to all the staff at Sushisamba - great job!

title: The waiting was worth it!!
comment: Booked for my sister's birthday. She loves ceviche, and I've been told Sushisamba latin flavours are very good. We waited for our table 40 minutes, had a cocktail, and when they finally took us to our table; I was very very pleased with the view. 38th floor and it was 5th November, we could see fireworks exploding all over london, almost magical. Then Salvador, who was our main waiter, help us to select a combination of plates and the Ceviche was indeed delicious. the sushi was amazing, the food was presented beautifully. Thank you Salvador, and the glass of champagne for the waiting was very much appreciated. My sister had a Happy Birthday (written in chocolate, obviously) dessert with a candle. Thank you Sushisamba, I wanted to surprise my sister with a lovely meal in a special place, and Im happy I booked your restaurant for her special day.

title: Great drinks, atmosphere and views
comment: Warm service, good drinks and lovely views from the stairs.  Just wish the views from the terrace were better.  Amazing tree!

title: Not bad but very overpriced (nice view though)
comment: The food is well presented and with good flavours, but there are more authentic Japanese restaurants in London at a much more reasonable price. My miso soup was bland and lukewarm, and although my tiger maki was good, some of my guests' choices were bland too.  At these prices, that's just not good enough.

title: Great fusion food and ambience
comment: Amazing food and fantastic service. We left the food choice to our waiter and he surprised us with some amazing dishes. Loved every bit!

title: Amazing experience!
comment: It was my first time dinning in Sushisamba and I have to say it went over the expectation! We were running 30min late due to traffic but the hosting team did their very best to reallocate us a table! Salvador, our waiter, was 5 stars from the moment we sat down until we left. Really helpful with explaining and suggesting what we should order and very attentive throughout the meal! The food was very tasty and really well presented! Definitely coming back!!!

title: A fantastic experience
comment: Stunning views. Stylish food - including the vegetarian options. Charming waiters. Crazy orange illuminated tree thing on the terrace. Sushisamba was a special treat - the only thing that left a sour taste was paying SEVEN POUNDS for a cup of green tea.

title: Rude service spoilt a birthday celebration
comment: A very rude waiter spoilt an otherwise enjoyable evening - having not been informed that the bar was closing, rather than a polite request to finish our drinks, we were very rudely told that "if you have not already noticed, the bar staff are waiting for you to finish so that they can leave" and to "hurry up" and finish our drinks. Not at all the level of service I expect when paying the prices charged at the bar. Very poor. For drinks, I would recommend trying City Social instead.

title: Favourite!
comment: Yes, it is blummin' expensive and yes, you have to book weeks/months in advance... but it's so worth it. The ambience, the views, the food - all brilliant! A fun (albeit pricey) night out, even for those who don't like sushi!

title: A rushed sushi experience
comment: We visited here following a recommendation and the love of sushi. Although we arrived slightly later the table wasn't ready, however the service was quite quick. We booked one of the last slots available at 23:30 and we got the feeling that the staff were quite impatient and felt quite rushed. The waiter didn't really explain the menu but just decided for us as we weren't sure what to order. Some of the dishes were great, others were just average; the cocktails though were very delicious. The views from the table are amazing, especially at night time.  If we eaten earlier in the evening the experience might have been totally different as wouldn't have been thinking about the time.

title: Absolutely loved it
comment: I went to this place several times and enjoyed everything about it: the food, the atmosphere, the view, the people... Yes, it is not cheap but it`s worth it and you don`t need to spend a fortune, the waiters are very good when it comes to recommending things from the menu.

title: Elevator speed
comment: We were here as a family of four for lunch. 38 floors in 30 seconds on an outside view elevator. The food is fantastic, but it takes some time to choose from the menu and the staff were a bit in a hurry but at the same time helpful.Eager to sell, the feeling however is that they do not give you enough time to make your own choices. The service is not discreet enough to make you comfortable and you can get stressed by the attention. The food is excellent and the mixture of Japanese, Brazilian, Peruavian is exciting with modern dishes and this works fine as a crossover kitchen. A minus was that once we ordered coffe and they could not sell anymore dishes, the service dissapeared and it became difficult to get attention to receive the bill and pay.  The view from the Bar is stunning and overall the experience was good because the food was excellent.

title: Food mostly delicious but service was poor.
comment: We were a family group of 6 to celebrate my son's 25th birthday. As we had lived in Tokyo for 3 years and we all love Japanese food we were hoping for a memorable experience. We were disappointed. We ordered the SHOICHI menu (£75pp) and we started with cocktails in the bar. All great so far. The first few courses were all delicious and the sake waiter helped us choose an interesting, slightly sparkling sake which went well with the food. Then just before the sushi course it all unravelled. We had sat down at 1930 and we had enjoyed all the courses up to the sushi and they all arrived at regular intervals up to around 2045. We then had a long wait for the sushi which, I have to say, was rather underwhelming: not much variety, too much salmon and prawn for my liking. Then we had another enormous wait for the desert which finally arrived around 2200. By this time we were more than ready to go home and in fact we'd asked for the bill. However....the dessert was absolutely delicious. So final verdict: food great (apart from sushi) but service just not good enough for a meal costing around £115 per head.

title: An abysmal service
comment: Having been in over 100 5* hotels and another 50 Michelin stared restaurants, I was astonished by the horrid service at Sushi Samba London, considering the fact that they position themselves as a luxury restaurant offering innovative Japanese cuisine of the finest quality. After making an attempt at reserving a table, I was told that since none were available, I could be served at the sushi bar, which was a perfectly viable solution. We (a party of 2) have arrived outside of normal meal time, yet the restaurant operates on a non-stop basis. After having passed the before mentioned sushi bar, which was empty expect for two people, we have arrived at the reception where we were told that the restaurant is fully booked (we ere offered to wait for 1.5-2 hours for a table which was not guaranteed under a pooling rain and a blistering cold, however). We asked about the bar, as we were aware of the fully booked restaurant. As we’ve seen it being empty, we thought that we will be seated immediately, but to our surprise we were told that in fact the bar is no operating at this moment (and that we’d have to also wait for 2 hours for it to open). At the same time, the bar and the tables near it were not just full, but there were people hanging over the heads of patrons, standing and waiting for the tables (some pleasant and relaxing experience there). The stated reason for all of this was the lack of waiters to serve the sushi bar. We could not resist and ask about the two people sitting at the bar and enjoying their meals - “but who are the two guests eating at the bar if it is closed?” The reply shocked me to the spine - “it’s the mangers”… So the two managers were eating and chatting about in a very leisurely manner (with the entire army of unseated guests watching them), while half of the floor (sushi bar) was closed due to the lack of personnel and the other half was packed with people who did not know where to stand and how to get a table because the two “ladies” at the reception decided that they would not bother themselves with it and just tell the people that they are only in charge of the seating at the main restaurant and that the bar area seats are on first-come-first-served basis. I believe that in such situations, it’s the mangers’ responsibility to make sure all guests are seated and served (especially that there were free places), and that in the case of lack of waiters, they can also serve food and drinks. The situation was beyond absurd, as the managers were eating and chatting between their meals (yes, they were had several services), the hostesses’ also didn’t care - they were fixing their hair (because why not - it’s more important - right?), while the guests, who were watching all of this, were literally pushing each other out of the way to get first to that one tiny table that has just freed up. After having to push around for over 20 minutes, we have managed to “sit ourselves”. After having invited the waiter for 4 times, we managed to place an order an were later served in a bizarre fashion, as our order was split into two services in a totally arbitrary manner. Regarding the food: undoubtably, the food was well prepared with ingredients of high quality. The fish was very fresh and the sushi tasted very well. Unfortunately however, the utterly despicable service has besmirched the entire experience and the good food could not fix it. Naturally, none of the personnel took it upon them to apologise or rectify the situation in any way. Inspire of the high quality cuisine, I strongly advise to NEVER visit this venue. Without prejudice or and interested behind, for people looking for high quality and innovative Japanese cuisine, I highly recommend Shibu Ya Soho - a small sushi bar in the centre of London, which prides itself on authentic and innovative sushi of the highest quality, as well as a dignified service offered by its staff.

title: Best sushi
comment: A restaurant that is really worth visiting, the views are beautiful and the sushi is with no doubt the best I have ever tried. The staff was very nice and helpful. I recommend visiting this place in the evening for even more beautiful views.

title: Never fails to impress!
comment: I had visitors from abroad which I wanted to treat to a special dining experience. Sushi Samba has never failed to impress any of my visitors and this time was no exception either! It was bonfire night which means that the dining room was even busier than usual but the atmosphere was far from being annoying. Instead it was oozing buzz, energy, and modern chic. The views were amazing and the place undoubtedly has the WOW factor. Service throughout the night was flawless with Salvador always being vigilant and uber attentive. The cocktails were amazing and so was the food. You must try the black cod skewers which are delectable! The only criticism is that the three desserts we had were not up to the same standard as the food without them being bad in any way. If it was not so hard to get a reservation at SushiSamba I would gladly visit every month!!!!

title: Birthday lunch celebration
comment: I was served by Salvador during lunchtime on 30th Oct '16 who was polite and explained to us what food to order. He was excellent in the passionfruit choice and with the happy birthday written on it. Thank you Salvadore. You need a mention from us all. Good service and you kept us all happy and content.  You deserved to be mentioned by us all. Thank you Salvador.

title: Great evening
comment: The place is stunning and the food is delicious. Highly recommended in the evening to enjoy the view.

title: Stunning
comment: Wow, great views, great food and great staff. Well worth the wait getting a booking. The food is amazing and the cocktails even better. Perfect for a special night out with friends or loved one.

title: Lovely dinner
comment: We had a great dinner with amazing views next to the window, great atmosphere and really good and friendly service from the staff. All the time very helpful with the menu. Definitely we'll come back

title: Birthday celebration
comment: Amazingly delicious food and exciting . The best sushi I've tasted in a long time . Professional , attentive waiters and the view from the 38th floor over London is quite spectacular as is the outdoor cocktail bar . Highly recommend this restaurant in more ways than one .

title: Lovely food and staff!
comment: First time to SUSHISAMBA and I will be sure to be back! The outside bar with the orange tree was a picture, the seats had blankets and heaters were on all around - it was lovely. Went through to the restaurant and was looked after by an extremely helpful gentleman. He helped us with the menu, gave suggestions and I must say it was great! The staff were super friendly and we really enjoyed our experience!

title: Not as good anymore
comment: It was one of my favorite places in London, great views and atmosphere and it had amazing food. I was disappointed the last time I went in July, the food deteriorated which is too bad.

title: all about the atmosphere!
comment: Buzzing isn't the word, last Friday when we visited. I do suspects Fridays are better anyway as it was quite a City crowd! loved the drinks, ambience and as a group of 6 we had fun. Food frankly could have been better but at 11pm after a good few drinks its ok. The food wasn't bad, just there are much better restaurants than this in the Pan Asian sector. Not for foodies but for party people who want a late night restaurant- loved not being kicked out at 12. its open till 2!

title: Best Birthday Treat
comment: My birthday dinner at Sushi Samba has been the best birthday dinner yet. The food was immaculately presented and tasted divine. The staff was very helpful and they helped my friend to organise this treat.  The cherry on the pie was my personalised birthday dessert platter.  Overall it was just perfect.

title: sushi with a twist
comment: we had a nice table with a view (not always the case if you are seated in the middle of the room) so started well started with coriander flavoured cocktail topped with turbot sushi - a blast! ordered soya beans and fried veggies with truffle mayo as starter to share then the cevice tuna, sushi with mozza and fried onions, more rolls with truffles, spicy salsa, tuna and salmon my favourite was temaki with quinoa and fried shrimp, just melting in mouth the best part was that after the dinner we could continue to the bar on the terrace outside (38th floor so the view is great), definately a good point

title: Stunning Sushi Samba!
comment: Incredible experience - what more is there to say? Can't wait to visit again. Wow. Make sure you book in advance.

title: Sushisamba
comment: The food the atmosphere the view were really great .You need to reserve the good thing about them they close at 01:00 am

title: birthday treats
comment: i had been wanting to visit sushi samba for a while and my visit did not disappoint, the view of london from our dinner table was just the start of our experience my husband and i like sushi but when looking at the menu did not know where to begin, the waitress was very helpful and gave great recommendations, which we chose to follow, the samba london, tiger maki and rio grande with ribeye, chorizo and churacso were our favourites  we also had the samabatini cocktail to accompany our food which was also recommend and they didn't hold on the alcohol, very strong just the way we like :)  wasn't cheap but price was worth it - would definitely recommend and will definitely return

title: Amazing food and wonderfull staff!!
comment: Had been here before, and once again they smash it with the service, quality of the food, attentive staff, ""Gary"" specially was fantastic, he explained everything and made really good food and sake recommendations really happy and will be back really soon!!!

title: Disappointed
comment: I'm afraid we were expecting London swank and found a slightly less than sophisticated atmosphere. Not the elegant establishment we were hoping for! Fine for a hen night. Sorry. Perhaps better on a week night.

title: Great experience
comment: I work near to SushiSamba and had heard a lot of mixed things about it, the food and the 'attitude' there, but wanted to try it. The lunch was a celebration of a good work result for an ex-colleague and I and we like 'good' food and good service. I have to say that I thoroughly enjoyed all aspects of the experience. The waiting guys were super helpful to newbies as the menu is a bit 'niche'. They explained the concept really well and gave some tips on where to start. They were incredibly friendly and the only comment I have is that a couple of the guys had incredibly strong accents and it was pretty loud (general hubbub only, nothing bad), but aside from that, my deafness is not an issue! We had a combination of the small plates, black cod and some rolls and they were gorgeous. Is the black cod a bit 'much' at £18 for two skewers? Probably, but it was delicious. The taquitos were the best of the bunch along with the Sao Paulo (I think) rolls.  We had a great bottle of Viognier that wasn't overpriced and also had two dirt martinis after in the bar which were excellent. Service was much, much friendlier than I expected for somewhere like this and I will definitely be taking different people there in future.

title: Best Sushi we have had in the UK
comment: We love sushi as a family so decided to eat high in the sky at this restaurant. The ambience and lighting were great, food amazing, so was our bill. We didn't push the boat out and it came to £190 for the 4 of us. Tempura prawns were fab. Would I go again? Yes on expenses!

title: Super!
comment: We went there for an early dinner, before we went to a musical. The food was excellent , The service impeccable, The atmosphere was great, And the view amazing.

title: Can't fault it
comment: I was a bit worried about coming here due to mixed reviews on TA. I'd heard good things from friends and it was a special occasion so we gave it a go. I am so pleased we did!! I thought everything about the place was great, the atmosphere, the service, the food.. All amazing. And of course the views! The restaurant area is beautiful as is the bar area. There's a lovely little terrace you can have drinks on too with open fires.. Food was great, lots more to choose from than just sushi! I found the staff to be fantastic and very helpful explaining the menu etc. there was a bit of a delay on food due to a large party but they kept us updated on that (without us even asking). We were celebrating birthdays and they were more than happy to decorate the desserts to say happy birthday on the plates. Yes it was expensive and yes some people seem to be there to be seen but so what, the way the tables are set out that shouldn't affect anyone's enjoyment. It is expensive at almost £100ph with a cocktail, drinks and dessert.. But for something special it's worth it.

title: Not as good as i though
comment: I went on mu birthday Food is ok The services is not that great I booked for good view to sit and got telling must finished in an hour and a half. Supposed to get good services as we order a lot of food  Well it was just ok for my birthday dinner Quite disappointed!!!!

title: Poor Service. Over Rated!
comment: I had booked a table for 5 people at 20:15. We arrived early and checked in at the restaurant reception and said we were ready to sit down at the table as soon as it was ready. We was told that unfortunately the table was not available. We waited in the bar and had a drink. There was no where to sit, no where to put our drinks down and no one offered to take our coats.  We waited for 30 minutes until our booked table at 20:15. We asked again for our table and after another 10 minutes wait we was finally seated. The restaurant was half full so I have no idea why we was made to wait for the table?  We were then rushed though our dinner within 40mins, being asked to order from the menu constantly and our wine classes continuously being topped up when they were still half full just to empty the bottle I guess and for a further bottle to be ordered? After the main meals we were finished we were asked if we wanted to have desert, we asked if we can wait 5 minutes, we was then pushed again after 3mins, we replied can we order a drink and have a desert in a bit we was then told 'no, you have to leave the table within 10mins and have a drink back at the bar.' We said to the waitress that we did not wish to go back to the bar and stand and asked if there was a table or seats available. She said no she couldn't help as it's a different department.  We then asked to speak to a manager. We were rudely greeted by 'Auelie'?. The lady arrived to the table in an annoyed and unfriendly manner.  We explained we were being asked to leave the table within 1 hour. The manger snapped back to say we had been there for 2 hours and that we should leave! We explained we were seated late and we had been rushed through our meal. She wasn't interested.  We paid our £400 bill and left. We asked to speak to someone else at reception but was told there was nobody any higher than Auelie.  The food was ok but expensive. The drinks were average and overpriced but the bad experience and the rudeness of Auelie will not allow me and my fellow guests to recommend your restaurant to others or return ourselves.  We raised this complaint via email after the meal with Marc a senior manager at the restaurant and 'Guest Relations' but neither bothered to reply.

title: Great view but service is appauling
comment: I went there with my partner to celebrate our anniversary and spent around £132.00. The place was crammed and we were sitting in the middle of 3 tables which were too close to each other! We were greeted by our waiter and ordered our drinks. When it came, the drinks were given to the table next to us which shows how unorganised the place is! The sushi arrived and it was hard and appeared to have been prepared for a while. When the dessert arrived, it had 'Happy 4th Birthday' and the waiter had sung happy birthday to me. I was absolutely shocked and embarrassed and told the waiter it wasn't my birthday.  He said sorry and stormed off. I was in disbelief as it is outrageous that he thought it was my birthday- '4th birthday!!!!' despite being asked for ID when entering the tower! Not only did he not ask for a replacement, it seemed as though it didn't matter. The waiter that introduced himself to us was never around. He even laughed about the desert disaster and told us 'nevermind' and that to leave it for 'next time' We laughed it off, not to make a big scene but seriously... What are sushisamba up to hiring these people that do not understand customer service???? When we looked around, we could see about 4 waiters standing and speaking to each other laughing and joking while there were customers needing attention. I would not recommend this place, only if you place to have a starter and a drink for the view!!! Worth going to Duck and Waffle instead as they had a better service.

title: Lived up to every expectation!
comment: Prior to my visit for dinner at SUSHISAMBA, I have been fortunate to have a cocktail or two and a Sunday lunch there. All were exciting and enjoyable! My partner and I have this deal where on each of our birthdays we pick somewhere both of us want to go. SUSHISAMBA has been on both of our lists for a long time! It did not disappoint! We both love sushi and have been lucky to sample some exquisite sushi in many different restaurants and countries but SUSHISAMBA also delivers on ambiance and hospitality. As already mentioned, we were there for a birthday, my partners birthday and as he nipped off to the bathroom, our host Gary took the opportunity to inquire was it a special occasion. Upon my confirmation, he assured me that for dessert, he would make sure a candle was present. He was true to his word, a candle did appear in our special dulce de leche dessert but apart from that, I really enjoyed and appreciated the atmosphere that Gary helped to create - it was comfortable and hospitable. From the very moment I arrived, I felt welcome and looked after. The meal was delicious ( the tempura small plate shrimp and the São Paulo sushi!!!!) but what I really enjoyed was that everyone there genuinely wanted to make sure that it was. The decor, ambiance and food are all amazing - we had a terrific night. It's not a place I can afford to go to every month (although I wish I could) but I will most definitely be back - out of all our special birthday dinners, that was by far my favourite!

title: Great experience (again)
comment: A firm favourite made extra special this time due to the excellent waiter Salvador, he went out of his way to make the meal special...even responding to eye contact from my partner who had a "oh no" moment when the table beside us were given a macaroon with a candle to celebrate a birthday. Salvador picked up on the vibe and sure enough 5 minutes later I was also the recipient of a birthday macaroon.. The food here is always excellent but to be served by somebody who goes the extra mile puts the icing on the cake.

title: Great food and a unbeatable view!!!
comment: The ride up (elevator) was beautiful, the staff where extremely service minded and the sushi was amazing!!!!

title: Sushi in the Sky with Diamonds.
comment: This has it all especially the views. Good food, staff, location and ambience. A drink at the bar followed by your meal at a table with views. Staff very knowledgeable and attentive. We decided to ask for assistance and Salvador was brilliant with what he chose for us. So if unsure just ask and be wowed.

title: Great buzz
comment: The views are amazing! The balcony is great, sushi is good. However, sometimes you get a long queue both to get to the bar and at the bar to get a drink. Dresd code is strict so beware! Worth the experience!

title: Heaven
comment: Went there with my partner. We got a table outside on the terrace. Enjoyed champagne and delicious sushi. The view is amazing. Also the atmosphere . Service really good. A 10 out of 10 restaurant.

title: Just for 1 time
comment: Amazing view from 38 floor Yoo can see all London City And nice atmosphere around  Food is not special Small portions Drinks are expensive That's nice to visit just once or at night to enjoy drinks

title: Ripoff
comment: What a total ripoff off, 4 small plates of rice wrapped in seaweed, speck of fish, don't waste your money. Hated it!

title: Poor service, snobbish staff
comment: On the positive, the view is great and the food is good. However the service is lacking. We had booked for 12 people, but only 10 turned up. They made a point that they would still charge us for all 12 people. Considering they had given us a table which only seated 10, I did not think we were blocking any unproductive space. I appreciate this was in the fine print of the reservation form, but I was disappointed they felt the need to enforce it. The food was exotic & tasty,but no one took the trouble to explain what was being served. Towards the end of the meal, they literally rushed us off our chairs.I suspect they had another reservation. If they had made that clear, we would have paced accordingly.  As a group of 10 people we had a full meal with drinks. So you can imagine we did spend a reasonable amount here. For the rates charged per person, I really would have expected better service. If you want to have that special meal at a leisurely pace and feel like you have got value for your money, I would not recommend this place.

title: Pleasantly Surprised - Business Lunch
comment: Way up in the clouds this restaurant has good atmosphere and the food to match. The views are stunning and stretch into the distance as far as the eye can see. We opted for the waiter to bring enough variety of dishes to satisfy the 3 of us. We weren't disappointed. You must try the black cod, it's divine. There is a bar you can either meet in before or after which works well. Highly recommend for a group meal, although It wouldn't be the first place I'd take a loved one.

title: Amazing view
comment: I went to sushisamba with my work colleagues. I'm not a big fan of sushi so maybe that's why I wasn't surprised by the food. Overall the staff was nice and the services were as expected. But what made this experience memorable was the view.

title: Premium because of location and setting
comment: Location - great, you're up high and if you didn't get a window seat at the restaurant, you can hand around the bar or terrace area for some (but limited) views across London. Service - As expected, good and of course you pay service charge at 12.5%. Drinks - An extensive menu of cocktails and other drinks. Presented well.  Food - Sushi Samba is a mix of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian cuisine.  The sushi is colourful but quality could be better. I'd happily go to Eat Tokyo (Soho) over the sushi here. They had a nice warm sushi, a bit different with melted cheese on top (El Topo). Their robata is standard, and the miso black cod ordered was a little burnt/over coloured (this should not be happening at £18 a dish?!). Whilst we looked at the eye-watering prices of kobe beef (one dish is priced at £1,000!!), we opted for a 'reasonable' £46 dish of CHURRASCO RIO GRANDE (ribeye, chorizo, aged picanha) which looked good (see my photo), tasted good but not amazing. We tried a few other dishes but nothing to write about. Overall, I wouldn't return. Sushi Samba is great for a special occasion due to venue and worth going for a cocktail or two but food-wise, I'd go somewhere else as at these prices, you can get much better food in London in my opinion.

title: Amazing Rooftop bar and restaurant in London's Financial centre
comment: If you had a tough day, unwind here. The location and roof top ambience is great. Excellent food at the lower level, also with good views from the windows. Closes at 2am.

title: Great night!!
comment: Last week my friends and me had a really good time at SushiSamba. The food and the cocktails were excellent and delicius. And the team members are very nice, the special service from Salvador and Gary was brilliant since the first moments. They are lovely!! Also the restaurant's atmosphere is special and the London views was amazing!! I had a fantastic night! I'm sure I'll back soon.

title: Totally overrated
comment: I visited Sushisamba at NY westvillage. My experience their was great. In NY their was a normal but excited vibe, the DJ inside and i loved the audience and the type of guest. So i wanted to visit the London venue as well. They told me that it had a great view over the city and nice roofterrace. But here we got another public, more over the top. Normally its al about the food, but here its is about being there seen there. And don't like that. The hosts are always in a rush and seems that they are working on a automatic pilot.  Although most of the food was ok and some was very good, i will not recommend this place. You can get much more better for value in london.

title: Great taste, view& ambience for a price
comment: Tasty fusion Japanese food with a great city view. Definitely need advance booking as they accept 2 mths advance booking. Had our dinner at 5:45 pm when we booked 2 weeks in advance so you can imagine. They have a relatively wide selection of Japanese sake but unusual to serve them in wine glasses. Good place for visitors to have a city view, or for that special occasion with your spouse. If you can't get a table for dinner, there is still an outdoor area for drinks where you can still enjoy the skyline.

title: Phenomenal views
comment: Absolutely amazing views with good food and great cocktails. Will be back in the summer to try their terrace outside.

title: Great lunch!
comment: Our waiter, Salvador is one of the best in London. Amazing ambience, good and service. Highly recommend Sushisamba. Salvador made our lunch so memorable and so welcoming and personable. Can't wait to return.

title: Doesn't match the hype
comment: I went to sushi samba for the first time this week with friends from work, we had high expectations as we had heard good things. However I found the restaurant quite cramped with tables close together. When I tucked out my chair I would bump into other customers tables. It was also very echoey and the service was not very attentive. The waiter could not explain the desserts and forgot what was in it. The main food was delicious and could not have been faulted, but the amosphere and service lacked

title: Dinner with a view
comment: the location is definitely amazing, the sushi is of good quality but the staff is sometimes a bit rude and give you the feeling that you have to rush with your food. apart from that I think its a good place. but definitely not the best food you can get in London.

title: Hugely disappointing
comment: Located at the top of a skyscraper in London's business district, Sushi Samba offers great views of the city. And it stops there. Anchored in Brazilian Japanese cuisine (Sao Paolo has a huge Japanese community with great and naturally fused cuisine) Sushisamba fails in every direction. The food is too greasy, too fried, much too sweet and flat. This is really a venue for the super rich foreign students who have too much cash to dispense of. You may want to stop by there for a couple of drinks and the view, but then again there is always the problem to get in. Nowadays venues like these have to put on the airs of exclusivity in order to attract the kind of nouveau clientele they aim for. All this makes Sushisamba an attraction rather than a destination for a gastronomic experience.

title: Amazing location - Average food
comment: I took my girlfriend here for her birthday and although the food wasn't as good as i expected we still had a good night.  The building is definitely striking and the lift up to the 40th floor is worth a trip to the bar alone. Luckily nearly all of the 2 seater tables in the restaurant are positioned by the windows so you do get one of the best views of London i've seen in 20 years.  The staff were friendly enough and it's worth arriving early for cocktails in the bar beforehand. We were there on a Thursday evening and there was a good DJ playing. The food itself was a bit hit and miss. Some dishes like the black miso cod were very nice where as others were rather average. I am comparing it to some rather good Japanese restaurants in town but then at these prices it should be better. We paid just over £200 for the 2 of us including drinks. The kobe beef sashimi was very disappointing considering they make such a big thing about it.  I would probably return for a drink at the bar but there are better options in London for Japanese food.

title: Awful service long queues not worth it rude staff to be avoided
comment: Awful service long queues not worth it rude staff to be avoided  Lovely views but unprofessional service when our drinks were taken away No atmosphere

title: amazing view and atmosphere, disappointed on food given the price
comment: Lovely atmosphere and view of London. Sushi samba is the perfect place to go have a cocktail when you have some friends visiting London. But big disappointment on food. For the price that they charge you the sushi is nothing special.

title: Birthday dinner
comment: Brilliant!  Food was excellent and the view was amazing! The staff were very helpful and explained everything to us! The only one thing I would say is the lift moves fast straight up to the 38th floor so my ears did pop! Would definitely recommend!

title: Disappointing, not worth the money
comment: We went anticipating a lovely anniversary lunch and came away so disappointed - the service was poor from the moment we arrived: slow checking in, no one took our coats, bad seat being sat right behind the waiters stand. We started with the small plates and they were nice, when we got to the sushi rolls we asked the waiter for his recommendations and we were advised that the El Topo was "not to be missed" but no one explained this was a hot nigiri ladened with melted mozzarella and fried battered onions. We ate half and sent it back but had to ask for it to be removed from our bill. When the Host asked what was wrong he felt the need to tell us we should have asked for advice before ordering as this was a unique dish... the squabble for asking for the £12 to be removed was embarrassing. We'd spent £160 so it was it about the money. However when we replied that in fact it was recommended but there was no mention of the fact that it was a hot dish and shouldn't be in the roll section, instead it should be in a hot dish section, he removed the £12.  I would not recommend anyone go here try Fujiyama in Brixton, or Roka if you want something more high end. Don't bother with the hype or the following of Sushisamba.

title: Amazing views!
comment: I took my girlfriend here for her birthday and it was a real treat. The views were amazing, the food was great and the cocktails were lovely! The downside from the evening - which did not ruin it - was the fact that our table was delayed by around 45 mins, which meant we did not get to eat until around 22:30. The other notable point is that this place is not cheap, but as long as you know that before you go, you'll have a great time! Well worth a visit, even if it is to see the views of London with a nice cocktail.

title: Attitude from staff doesn't match the reputation
comment: Only popped in for drinks after a work event in London and though the place itself is very interesting - good views of the city - the policies they have and some of the staff were disappointing. We were standing at the bar, and when I took my coat to the cloakroom I was asked if I had a reservation. I didn't - so was told they couldn't take my coat - despite there being ample empty spaces in the cloackroom. When I started pointing them out, the cloakroom attendent was actually quite cool and took my coat (quickly and without her superior seeing I suppose) - but to have that policy in the first place is just weird. The bar staff were a bit arsey too - very typical of fancier places where the young staff seemn to think that they are part of the attraction and the big deal - forgetting that the clients are paying their wages.

title: Meh
comment: Over priced, over rated. If you just want to enjoy the view, just go up for drinks to the 39th floor (no reservations required). Service is ok. Reservations strongly recommended for dinner though.

title: Superb!!!
comment: I went with my friend for lunch, we first went up and had drinks in the bar. Then when we went for lunch the staff were really accommodating and great. We got a window seat with a fantastic view over London. The food you only need to order a few dishes as the food is on quite big plates and really filling. The food is a mix of Japanese, South African and Asian its great and definitely worth a visit but you must book 2 months in advance.

title: A memorable experience
comment: Visiting this restaurant was such a unique experience. The food, the ambiance and views were excellent.

title: Amazing dinner !
comment: We had a great dinner there ! The lift leading to the restaurant starts the experience nicely with a great view, and then you access the bar area while you wait for your table to be ready. We initially had a small side table, but a few minutes after we sat down one of the table facing the window became free, and after asking the waiter we got moved to this great table.  The service was very nice, and we got the menu explained to us as it offers various different things ! The food is very tasty, and served quiet quickly. The view is amazing and it is a great experience to enjoy this amazing food while facing such a nice skyline ! The only downside is that the waiters are a bit too keen when it comes to cleansing the plates, it sometimes feels as if they are trying to push you out !  Overall one of our best dinners in London, we will definitely be back !!

title: Worst place ever , really bad staff and service
comment: This restaurant has great food but that's where it stops! Firstly when arriving at the restaurant it looks somewhat tired and in need of cleaning and a refit, chipped mirrors worn soft furnishings etc, although this was not my main issue!  The drinks are not great and expensive for a bar that cannot provide table service, if you want to stand like cattle and pay over the odds for drinks from rude, self important staff then this is the place to be!
