This is not the worst part of this place, first of all we were seated 45mins late with no explanation, my guess is they want to keep you in the cattle pen paying for the drinks. After telling them I was diabetic we was seated immediately to a half empty dinning room, I'm still not sure what the issue was. After being seated we was rushed though our dinner within 40mins, we was then asked if we wished to have desert, we said "can we have 5mins" we was then pushed again after 3mins, I replied "can we order a drink and have a desert in a bit" we was then told no you have to leave the table within 10mins so you can have a drink back at the bar. I informed the waitress that I did not wish to go back to the cattle pen, I therefore wanted to talk to the manager to ask why we was being pushed out of our table within 1 hour. I was greeted with a very angry and aggressive middle aged lady who ignored all of our issues and said we had been there for 2 hours and that we should leave!  We paid our £400 ish bill and left felling cheated and annoyed! Avoid at all costs!

title: A most thrilling Sushi experience
comment: Sushi Samba is situated high up in the sky in Heron Tower Bishopsgate.where you are assured of a thrilling lift ride giving you fantastic views over the City  In such a setting, if you are a lover of sushi and you have a generous Bank Manager then you will love the experience.of Sushisamba The lighting made reading the menu quite challenging. The waiters are only too  pleased to explain the dishes but listening to them talking very fast in strong accents  makes it very difficult to understand so each dish that is served comes almost as an  exciting surprise. I loved the experience of Sushisamba and I liked most of what we had. This is certainly one for a special occasion. Try for a window seat..

title: Over rated and poor quality food
comment: We went here last week for my husbands birthday, we found the outside terrace without prior notice when we booked, although the service was good, the food was awful, I have made a complaint and I am still waiting for a reply. Not only was the food terrible but I have also been ignored,

title: Birthday treat
comment: Expensive and still well worth the experience. We had the tasting menu with dishes from across the entire menu. What an amazing experience from the super fast lift that takes you up to 38th floor to the amazing views across London. At this time of the year arrive about 6 pm and watch the capital light up as the sun sets and night descends.  Check ahead before you book as there was a private party on in bar on 39th floor and it was a tad cramped in the downstairs bar

title: Nice place and ambiance to have drinks with friends
comment: I have been here a couple of times in the evenings with my friends. This is a good place which is busy all times. You get a good view from the terrace. Just grab a drink (they are expensive) and spend the time chatting there

title: Lovely food+place
comment: Went to this plae with an old friend I wanted to impress. She wasn't disappointed, and I thoroughly enjoyed the food (my wallet didn't have so much fun though). One of the best in London

title: Amazing!!! Great experience!!!!!!
comment: We went last Friday, it was a great expirience. The food was amazing, it was the first time we went there so the waiter record us some things, we really like all of them and you should try also desserts. Amazing views, great service, and amazing foot! I totally recommend this place. You should go almost once.

title: Great sushi and delicious desserts
comment: Booked a lunch table at 12.00, place was nice and quiet. The elevator ride to the 38th floor gives fantastic views across London. Service was quick and good. We ordered a variety of plates, favourite was the Samba London. Desserts are great too, try the Choc banana cake with hot toffee. If you enjoy sushi, definitely worth a visit.

title: Amazing views and reasonable (but not exceptional) food, and a very big bill.
comment: Down-Sides: The most expensive G&T I've ever had (and I work in Canary Wharf!). Disappointing sushi but some other interesting dishes. Food definitely not good value for money. Very high priced food, but you're paying for the view not the food. Tricky to know what and how much to order, but waiting staff are happy to recommend. Service reasonable but could have been better, e.g. drinks orders took ages. Up-Sides: The best views of London I've ever seen: Recommend arriving before dusk so you can see the views in daylight and night time.

title: Expensive and not that good quality
comment: Food is standard and definitely not worth the high price. Your local sushi shop is probably just as good. The sashimi was not good quality, portions are tiny and the bill is huge. Other sushi places in London are definitely much better!!

title: Great view, fun lift, expensive drinks
comment: Let's face it. The only reason why people go there is the view, and to see and be seen. On that level, it certainly delivers. Drinks were, as expected, expensive, but quite good. Service was attentive enough. My only problem with the place is that if it was anywhere else, nobody would be willing to pay those prices.You pay for the view, which is OK as long as you know it. Go there to impress a date. Otherwise, there really is little point.

title: Thursday evening night out
comment: Great location, fantastic views. Attentive staff. Good cocktails and food but pricey. Worth a visit, but plenty of other places to go before I will go back.

title: Stunning views
comment: Perfect place to catch up with friends with a few cheeky cocktails, if you can find somewhere to sit. We eventually found window seats overlooking night-time views of the city, absolutely stunning! Upon arrival we found the bouncers attitude a tad pretentious and off putting, not very welcoming.  However, once we were seated we had the perfect night. I can't remember his name but we were served all night by a lovely gentleman who went above and beyond to make sure we were happy with our drinks and he made sure we didn't leave our seats to order drinks from the bar - love this, especially when in heels!!  Would visit again but bouncers need training in social skills!

title: Birthday cocktails, stunning view, extremely slow and expensive
comment: I came here with my boyfriend on Friday night for my birthday. We had been for dinner elsewhere and then came here for cocktails.  The queue was long, so I definitely suggest you reserve a table if you wish to eat and have cocktails.  We got in and it took over half an hour to get served!  I understand on a Friday it's going to be busy but it was very very slow.  I ordered a whiskey on the rocks for my boyfriend and I ordered the batida de mango.  If I am brutally honest my cocktail wasn't very special at all, it didn't taste like a cocktail bar cocktail, just like one I could make myself at home if I'm totally honest, and it was very very expensive too at £14!  The views however are stunning, absolutely spectacular especially at night all lit up, worth it for the view.  There was a very cheeky tip charged without my permission. Automatically added to the receipt before paying. So be careful of this. £30 for 1 cocktail and a single shot of average whiskey was extremely overpriced.  Stunning lit up tree outside but it was too cold to sit out there, but again worth it just for the view.  Overall I would say it's a lovely bar but far too overpriced for the quality of the drinks and service.

title: Not impressed.
comment: The only great thing here is the view on the 40th floor.  Food is tasty but not the greatest sushi and it's obviously overpriced but not tooooo bad.  Customer service is great until you're served by an Italian lady manager which is the rudest I've found in long long time in catering services. . .  Sergio and another waiter from equador are 5* people. Very pleased to be served by them. Went with my partner and we enjoyed but 90£ for 2 starters with 2 drinks. Anyways, welcome to London. The choc fondant dessert is 5*!

title: FOOD WAS AMAZING, SERVICE WAS A DISSAPOINTMENT
comment: I recently visted Sushisamba for my leaving do with 4 of my friends, the food was amazing, however, when the bill came, we split the cost of the food between 5 of us and decided rather than splitting the £20 decrition service charge, we would pay what we feel on top. (Which is fair to do). The manager (I think) started getting very rude, he was not accepting the fact that we was doing this and started getting rude and pushy with one of my friends. Why on earth will I even pay for such service if the only reason why they act so posh is because they want the tip. I think a place like Sushisamba needs employees that provide good service because they are happy to work for the brand and want to represent the brand and not just for the tips. This is not just for other reviewers to read but hopefully the owners, other restaurants in the area because people like him should not even work there.

title: Great place
comment: Sushi Samba is styled to perfection, with a beautiful view onto the city.  Of course the good is superb, as the mix of Japanese and Latin American cuisine is just marvelous; a pairing just waiting to happen!  The service is excellent, but you have to book a table in advance (yes, this place is very popular!).  I do have to say that the trend of restaurants turned into nightclubs is not a bad idea, however if you wanna have a conversation while eating you'll have a problem here. The music is really good, but so loud that there is no way you could ever have a non screaming conversation.

title: Great date night!
comment: Had a great night out with my boyfriend on a date night we got seated with these 3 other people who by the end of the night were drinking with and just had a great chilled night with them and an amazing view thrown in the mix...definitely would recommend it!

title: what a great place!!!
comment: both the entourage, the view and the food are truly magnificent!! ones you get up to the 38th floor, you have a spactacular view the city and one you are at your table, the food turn out to be magnificent!! absolutey a place I would recommend to everyone traveling to London!!

title: Wow...incredible food and experience...not to be missed
comment: Had dinner here (eventually - had to wait 2 months for a table!) but it was worth the wait.  The menu is impressive, ranging from small plates up to a 1kg £1000 Kobe beef experience! We asked our excellent waiter for his recommendations, and other than one change (to include Wagyu Gyoza) we went with his choices - and excellent ones they were too. Right from the start with the Edamame beans with Volcanic salt the food was wonderfully presented, cooked and delicious. Particular hits were the Salt & Pepper Squid and the Prawn tempura - absolutely sensational. The Samba roll was a bit too spicy (overpowered the other flavours) but otherwise every dish was excellent. Of course you can't overlook the view which dials up the experience another notch, and I would definitely recommend a quick drink on the terrace bar under the amazing lit-up tree. Service was attentive without being obtrusive and the overall bill @ £220 including service and a £75 bottle of wine was reasonable (for fine dining). Would definitely recommend for the 'wow' factor!

title: Wahou. Stuning view!
comment: Obviously we went for the view...but we had more than that, the overall experience was amazing. We went for a late lunch, 2.30pm, what I recommend as it's less busy and we stayed almost 4 hours on a sunny day. Normally they turn table after 1h30 Food was delicious, the selection of wine is wide with a range of price up market, what you expect in this place. Service was spot on but not too much and most of all very friedly.

title: Very Good
comment: Sushis, beef, desert all of them were perfect. Location is brilliant just at the top of London. Reservation is a must since it is always full. We tasted a lot of things all of them were perfect taste and perfect scene. Service was brilliant we are thankfull to out hungarian friend who served us. The desert which is not in the menu zen garden is a piece of art, someone should try it. Only as usual to this kind of Quality it is expensive.

title: Good food but terrible service
comment: My family and I visited sushisamba to celebrate a visit to London to celebrate a birthday. I'd flown in from dubai and was really looking forward to visiting the restaurant. We were 20 minutes late to be seated despite us arriving early to enjoy a drink at the bar. When seated it was obvious that our table hadn't been occupied and "keeping you waiting" is obviously part of the experience. We ordered food which was all very nice however the service provided by our waitress for the evening was poor. We were quickly advised that we had 10 minutes to order and drink out last drink despite still having 30 minutes left before we were meant to depart the table. When we then asked to talk with the Manager on duty we were presented by an extremely unprofessional aggressive woman who was unwilling to take any comments on board regarding the service.  I'm really disappointed as the service has ruined which should of been a very good evening.

title: Happening place , great crowd
comment: Met some friends over couple of beers . The place is busy and one can have a stunning view of the city . As it is crowded you have to queue up to get your drink . It took us 1Oth min to get our drink . But a great place , must visit .

title: Exceptional restaurant
comment: The location of this restaurant on the 38 Th floor near Liverpool Street station, sets it aside. Drinks outside under the shadow of an enormous artificial illuminated tree with a bar counter lined with artificial grass creates great atmosphere. The menu is superb and the food and presentation were excellent. We chose a range of dishes and shared. The black bass was outstanding. The service was first class and the background music and ambience were also great. Watch out for the "discretionary" 12.5% tip added to every bill and don't end up adding another tip because you missed the discretionary tip!

title: Always great
comment: Never fails to deliver great fresh sushi but at a price. Unfortunately I could not sit at the sushi bar as they were short staffed. I do love this place as it is consistent. Lush sashimi and omakase uramaki

title: James
comment: Hands down the best restaurant overall in London. They have got it absolutely perfect here. Fine dining and top notch food without the pretentiousness of other places. The outside terrace bar just adds to an already perfect dining experience.

title: Review from the man who doesnt like sushi
comment: I don’t like Sushi, but I checked out the menu ahead of my business dinner here and saw plenty of non-sushi dishes, so I had no hesitation in accepting the invite. Lovely setting, and enjoyed a couple of beers in the garden ahead of sitting down to our table. We had a group of 10 and I found out once seated due to the size of the group we would not be ordering from the menu and would be enjoying the set sampler menu. As the man who didn’t like Sushi I was quite nervous by this but I decided I couldn’t do much about this and would just try everything and see what I enjoyed. There was plenty I enjoyed, eating here isn’t quite the same as eating sushi from elsewhere, I would recommend going and would recommend sampling as much as possible, its certainly not converting me to a sushi eater, but I would certainly return and eat the same again. Amazing views from the table, would recommend also the terrace for post meal drinks where you can enjoy a slightly different view of the skyline than you can from the bar.

title: Best sushi in town
comment: It was quite hard to find a table, but it totally worths the wait! Best sushi whenever in London. Yellowtail Tacos were so good that i have ordered them twice in a visit! All rolls were perfect service was great and the view form 38th floor is just sensational!! A must visit restaurant! Make sure you book a table before booking your flight.

title: My first time in a Jap dining with a great view!
comment: My partner took me here for our first date and it was a great experience. The staff were great and the view was awesome! It isn't the highest building with a view but you can still see a nice view of the capital city. The food is tasty not to forget the cocktails as well.

title: WOW WOW WOW
comment: I love sushi, I love all Japanese food and I love cocktails - this is the ultimate place for me to go and was a great day out. Me and Girlfriend went out in the day and went to Sushi Samba for dinner and drinks. We did book about 2-3 weeks in advance, however when we came out people were waiting to go in. If you want to get in 100% do book. We had a vied overlooking London and this was lovely, we even got to sit on the dinning terrace and have drinks over looking St Marys Axe.  Service was amazing and I wouldn't fault it all, they acter to your every need and are always on hand to help, I would say when helping with the menu just to go slower and not talk too fast as I couldn't quite catch everything that was said.  My friend and I had an range of foods to share from sushi to sashimi to dumplings, all of it was amazing and in my eyes was excellent value for money considering the p[lace and the location.  Would 100% go again!!

title: Delicious food
comment: The food was amazing and so was the view. The tempura I ordered was one of the best I've ever had. Totally worth it.

title: Amazing place and food
comment: Definitely my favourite place in London so far!! The location is fantastic with a nice view of the city! We had sushi, sashimi and also a really typical fish curry. All amazing!!! Definitely recommended!

title: Excellent food and great service with a fab view !
comment: We visited this restaurant as a couple for a romantic dinner on a warm Saturday night In August 2016 . The venue was busy as expected, but the food quality and service were both extremely good. We managed to get an outside table which was great with a beautiful view of the city and very comfortable given it was a rare warm evening in London. We had visited the Vegas location previously on a few occasions so hoped the food would be as good here and we weren't disappointed .  Keep up the great food and service we will definately be back !!

title: Absolutely fantastic!
comment: One word...WOW! This resurant has everything I look for when it comes to amazing food and a fabulous dining experience. The bar was cool with a wicked DJ and the most amazing views of the city, outside was fantastic and had a great vibe. The restaurant is all glass with stunning views and the food...oh my god! The portion sizes are huge compared to the likes of Nobu and I felt we really got value for our money. Definitely up there with my favourite restaurants!! Experience was fabulous!

title: Amazing food and view;) one of the best in London
comment: We went there for a 1st time on our anniversary:)Amazing food and view;) one of the best in London. Food was really good, service also. Is nice place for couple or friends to relax with glass of wine , listen music, watching incredible views specially night time;)when you get into lift , you can already see nice views because of glass lift.

title: Awesome Sushi! Awesome views!
comment: Arrived for a 6pm reservation and was kindly welcomed by doorman who took our details and allowed us to bypass a small queue forming for after work drinks.  Whisked directly to the 39th floor via the very fast glass lift and entered into a very orange floor. Cloakroom to the left and a small bar... realising the restaurant was one flight down we took the staircase surrounded by the the selfie brigade blocking every possible epic view. You can't complain, the views are magnificent, everyone understandably wants a pic or two; you just have to be patient. The restaurant is refreshingly bright orange with bulbs on black cord dropped from various hights creating quite a pattern. However, you can see the thick dust on the cords, they could really do with a clean. We were lucky to be seated by the window, although it would be nice if all the tables along that back row could be positioned at an angle so both guests have the view. It was still very nice. There are some lovely booths for groups and tables running through the middle for larger groups. Two waitors, with impeccable manners served us throughout our meal and provided excellent recommendations on cocktails and menu choices. The food was excellent, loved the Fusion of Japanese, Brazilian & Peruvian flavours and the presentation was beautiful. Portions were much bigger than I was expecting. Must try the cocktails. Overall I was extremely impressed and would definitely come back.

title: Special Occasion Sons 30th Birthday
comment: My wife and I long with my Children and their Spouses, celebrated our Sons 30th Birthday with a meal at Sushisamba.We started off in the open air bar with magnificent views with some great cocktails. We then went into the main restaurant for a really excellent meal. All the staff are second to none and helped make the evening great. The meal itself was very well presented and tasted as good as it looked. take a look on the Sushi samba website for the food on the menu, Whatever you order i don't think you would be disappointed with. The final bill for us six came to apron £72.per head . Worth the time for any special occasion

title: Happy tastebuds
comment: We had a great time enjoying not only the beautiful views but also the smaller plates - with dishes such as tuna ceviche doused in an incredible sweet/sour Pomegrante dressing and a spicy prawn tempura and quinoa hand roll it left for some very happy tastebuds...we didnt even end up bothering with main. If youre heading there during the day cross fingers for a clear sunny day, or time it so you're able to see the sun go down across the iconic London skyline. Great people watching location!

title: Stunning views in an iconic location but food slightly on the expensive side
comment: Definitely worth the visit for the amazing views, but the food itself is expensive. As with other Sushi Sambas, they try to get a bit too precious with all the "hyphenated" fusion plates, so it often ends up with the food weighted down by too many ingredients and sauces.  However, if you want to see a breaktaking London skyline, I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

title: Great place to hangout with friends for great sushi
comment: We had sushi at the sushi bar, not in the restaurant as it has a waiting list for reservations. There is also an outdoor bar overlooking the city. This is a hip place and is a great place to hangout with friends. Sushi was tasty and the menu has a variety of good eats. They also have a good sake menu and drinks menu. Service was good and will go back again and try eating in the restaurant itself.

title: Worth Every Penny...
comment: As a seasoned restaurant goer and self-confessed kitchen dodger I spent a lot of time being cooked for and sampling other people's cuisine. SUSHISAMBA provides a dining experience that is of a different level to most of the restaurants I have been to in London. The views of City are simply breathtaking and it is almost impossible to pick a bad dish - everything I have eaten here so far has been incredible. Without over-stating my point the food is simply divine... and if you don't believe me - check it out for yourself! Make sure you book in advance unless you know someone who works there ;-).

title: Impressive cocktail bar !
comment: Considering we were there on a Saturday night the wait wasn't too long as we expected and if it was it would still be worth!! This is a fantastic cocktail bar with amazing views of London from the 46th floor of the Heroen Tower. Bartenders are real professionals and the cocktails are very well priced !!  Amazing :-)

title: Favorite restaurant in London
comment: I always go there for drinks or dinner and it is always amazing! If you wanna go only for drinks there is a rooftop terrace with a fire that keeps you warm and you see London's amazing view from the 39th floor! The food at the restaurant is great and the atmosphere is always buzzing!

title: Delicious
comment: We went here as a party of 3 for one of our birthdays. First off the view is outstanding - as someone who can be a bit iffy with heights I still loved it. Relaxed environment and beautifully furnished.  We had a lot of dishes - sushi, scallop ceviche, pork belly, and squid to name a few. All beautiful, especially the pork belly. Yes it's a bit pricey but I expected this before I came and wouldn't go somewhere like this very often! All in all it was great :)

title: Place to be!
comment: The location and the drinks are awesome. The view, the atmosphere, the bar and the drinks are great!!! I can't say anything about the food, cause we go there to have some drinks and enjoy the view, but the food seemed to be very good! As a lot of people have written here that it's expensive, I have to admit yes it is, but HEY THIS IS LONDON, AND A GREAT VIEW has its price too!!!

title: Lovely place to eat and enjoy London
comment: This restaurant is amazing... Location is awesome  Sight is nice  Food is good Prices are ok ... In my view Very nice staff will make you satisfy and having a good time. Good for groups and family It looks great at night and nice in the day time .. Sushi is nice and other dishes like black rock beef is waaaaw I will come again for sure

title: Don't bother!
comment: Visited for lunch on a Sunday in September, and am very disappointed by both the food and the service. In a city where we are blessed with a truly decent offering from establishments like Roca, Nobu and Zuma, there is no reason to ever visit Sushi Samba. The food was really poor, and would have been the lowlight had it not been for the even worse service! Don't bother!!

title: Great Suchi plus & stunning view
comment: One of london classic "view" restaurant with a champagne bar on the floor above (different owner). Wonderful choices of foods and good service. During warm days, the terrace is really sublime.

title: Exquisite food and highly professional service
comment: I walked in not knowing what to expect. The venue is breathtaking and offers a gorgeous view as well as lovely decor. The staff took very good care of us without being overbearing or pushy, which is a difficult balance to achieve. The food was pricey and the starter portion was small, but each bite was incredible. This is fine dining at its best!

title: 21st birthday
comment: We had a fabulous night in your restaurant.. There were a few telephone calls before hand as I'd read reviews saying you had a 'glamorous ' door policy and we were a mixed aged group party with a granny!! Food was amazing ... We gave a price range and a meal was created for us... I can not fault the service,food, cocktails or decor After dinner we had a lovely time admiring the views  I would highly recommend

title: Lunch
comment: My boyfriend and me went there on Saturday for a lunch. The place is great, atmosphere and view is amazing, but from the beginning I was already disappointed because of waiter, when we order our food he was always trying to correct our pronunciation of words (and sometimes he was incorrect for 100%). This restaurant is not cheap and they also take 12.5% for tips, so I couldn't understand a such rude way of speaking with customer. I don't recommend to take Kobe, it's just expensive tasteless piece of meet. Sushi were really good and especially I liked the dessert- it was wonderful! (I have taken passion fruit cake ). I also uploaded some pics from our lunch:)

title: Phenomenal view, service and most importantly, food!
comment: Great place to take a loved one or impress a date. The atmosphere is perfect and if you can get a seat near the window the view is spectacular. It is on the pricey end but please let me assure you that it is worth the experience at least once if not twice.

title: Beautiful atmosphere
comment: Fantastic view terrace where drinking a nice cocktail with friends and lovely music. it was fully booked restaurant but I had the opportunity to eat at the bar. good surprise even there, excellent food and very good service.

title: very nice atmosphere, good products
comment: I had a wonderful dinner in this place last month the dishes was very tasty the service was rushed sometimes but efficient.

title: Decent but let down by service
comment: We've been meaning to get round to visiting Sushisamba for some time and we had reasonably high expectations. When you arrive at the top of the elevator it's not entirely obvious where to go, and trying to speak to a waiter proved fruitless as they just hurried past. It didn't take long to spot that we just needed to go over to the other side of the bar though. The food was certainly delicious; we had some sushi dishes (rolls) followed by the churrasco platter. No complaints there, very much enjoyable, though portion sizes were't all that large so we ordered a few more dishes to fill up. Decor and ambiance was nice when dark outside and of course the views are spectacular. To be fair to our waiter, he was friendly but just seemed to be rushing about alot. When asking for the bill he didn't even face us, just slipped the metal tray on the table and walked straight off again. Decided to have another drink before leaving...miserable barman who came accross rather arrogant, showed no friendliness or enthusiasm whatsoever, but still of course helped himself to a 12.5% service charge for opening a beer and making a gin & tonic. We enjoyed the evening, but these types of restaurant are not just about the food but the whole experience and this place falls WAY short of the mark in the service department and I won't be back in a hurry. There are far better options with impeccable service in the same price bracket. It's a shame as if they can fix that it would have been such a much better experience.

title: Great birthday with family
comment: The location is amazing and the view even more, the best sushi experience in London.The bar outside is beautiful with an 'orange tree coming out of the central bar space.  The gorgeous view from the terrace especially in the evening. SushiSamba is definitely pricey, however for this special occasion with special person , friends it was well worth the spend.  The restaurant offering a modern twist on Japanese/Brazilian/Peruvian sushi,all great food with a mix of a lot of tastes and cultures ,beautifully presented,great service. Watching the sun set on London over lovely sushi, wine make this place the most romantic spot in London . Highly recommended.  Must have a reservation.

title: Amazing food and service
comment: We visited Sushisamba for my sister's birthday and the experience was great. We had few cocktails followed by dinner. The outside bar area can get very crowded, so if you are looking for a quite place to have a drink I would not recommend. The food at the restaurant was delicious. We went for few small plates instead of having one main each. Prices might seem high but the portions were quite big, so sharing 6 small plates was more than enough for the two of us. 5 stars for the service at the restaurant.

title: Such good food, with stunning views
comment: The food was exceptional. The atmosphere and service was great too. The views over London by night are not to be missed.  Can't wait to go back, would definitely recommend!

title: Superb views & sensational sushi
comment: This was our second visit to SushiSamba and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The food and service were excellent and the design of the restaurant is also pretty cool. The views from the restaurant are obviously really cool, but I'm always disappointed that the best views are on the bar side. You do pay a premium to dine here, but the sushi is divine.

title: Lunch
comment: Hype for nothing ... One of the worse sushi restaurants I've been too... The Sushi was breaking ... The wasabi was tasteless..The tackiest chopsticks ever.. Looked like 2 lightweight wooden sticks which were flying about in the wind. The restaurant was 90% empty .. Barely 5 tables were occupied .. And when I called to booked was told they have no tables and completely sold out..Good Marketing Gimmick! Only thing good was the service! Definitely not worth visiting! Avoidable if possible  Hype created by the staff working there and people visiting the restaurant  Been to much better restaurants in London.

title: Samba without the dance
comment: We went to sushisamba for the full experience, a good drink, the views, the food and the food. We were lucky to get a window seat, great views. We ordered a mix of dishes which were mostly small portion for sharing and also ordered a mid range wine. We were told to make our order as we were last sitting for the night, however were stood over until we ordered.  The food was interesting , different and very tasty, however sometimes expensive for the size of portion served.  Good wine list and reasonable price. Near the end of our meal we were asked by the waiter to retire to the bar to finish our drinks. However when arriving at the bar we were told the bar was shut and we needed to leave. I told them I was not going to rush, had just spent over 200 pounds in the restaurant and to leave us to finish our drinks in peace. However we were made to feel very rushed and were asked again to leave a second time even though we weren't dragging our feet.  Food great, average value, however we were rushed through the meal, service polite and friendly, but not at a fine dining level. Conclusion !!! Worth a try , but don't allow a 12:30 am booking if you are going to rush the customer.

title: If you are of the privledge to afford it.
comment: What a place. In life and live they often say you need something to make more of that something. Come for the food, leave with a new friend, refinance the mortgage. The hype is real. If your the type of person who double counts every coat and is tight on every penny, please do not come. No offence naturally. We had the 337 pound waygu chorizo experience, and this blessing proves, that indeed there is a higher power at work. The Kobe is beyond your wildest dreams and probably better then anything I've eaten in Japan. When your service fee is more then a meal, know your place. Try it I'd you dare, finish with an amazinf dessert and a cocktail on the balcony. Salute to the owners who have achieved though whatever Means they could to create an unreplicable experience in this great city

title: Great sushi
comment: We have been here quiet a few times, and are always very happy with the food.. Great dishes, and always happy to return.  Review would of got 5 but it's very hard to book and get the times you ideally like, even if you do call 4 weeks in advance :( They need a different system for booking.

title: Exquisite food and amazing views
comment: We love it here and come probably twice a month for food, drinks or both! The food selection is fab and exciting - the Brazilian/ Japanese combination is incredible and every mouthful is delicious! You do get a little bit of the Essex TOWIE crowd/ A-typical bankers out on the terrace (with its beautiful full sized tree!!) but aside from them, it is perfect for a night out. Cocktails are a def with some interesting but tasty recipes!

title: Food was great, service was poor
comment: I had to agree with the review before with regards to service, especially from the bar staff and reception. I was among a party of 16 guests for a birthday lunch on the Sunday before the bank holiday. Upon arrival we were not sure where to go as the reception is not clearly visible. So we were standing there at the entrance and to our disappointment nobody even acknowledged us with only a few glances from passing staff. After waiting there for a while we noticed the barman in the outside terrace bar was free so we approached him to point us in the right direction. Even when politely asking for his attention he didn't even look at us and only after persisting a bit more did he bother to take notice. His final response to our question was "go and ask the reception" and looked away from us immediately. He wasn't serving anyone else at the time and wasn't at all busy - he was just plain rude! Feeling like we were drawing blood from a stone, we eventually found the reception staffed by two young ladies who also didn't seem to care that we were there and needed to be shown where to go to sit. Once we had entered the main first level dining area everything else after that point was fine and the serving staff were very welcoming and informative of the dishes arriving at our table. It's the initial "welcome at the door" that was a major let down because, well, there was NO welcome. I think for anyone experiencing the restaurant for the first time this is the last thing you want to "experience" and can even lead to customers just wanting to walk away. Just not acceptable at all!

title: Off the scale
comment: This was not my choice but it was amazing. The views were crazy could probably see as far as West Drayton we came at night for a family thing and the lights are huge. Like I said this is not my first choice but actually the food I had was bang on. The corn dish was really good. I went with a curry amazing taste coconut and creamy would go again just for that. The bar here is great would come on a big night out or if trying to impress someone.

title: Magnifico
comment: Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian. What a fabulous combination for tasty food! Add the most friendly and helpful staff we've experienced in a long, long time and you have wonderful evening. High above London, with spectacular views, Sushisamba was an experience we'll long remember.

title: Rip off even for london
comment: Hailing from the North, this was my first visit to sushisamba and will be my last. We have had something of a food revolution and £40 per head goes a LOT further than a few bits of chicken and a slider, and the food is much nicer. To give perspective, a 6 course tasting menu in a Michelin star restaurant costs £20 more than what I paid for today. I feel robbed.   The service was fine, until I asked for NO horseradish mayo on my kobe slider. The waitress delivered it WITH horseradish mayo. I immediately and discreetly pointed this out, also not keen on the yellow sauce it was served with. Perhaps the contents of a baby's nappy? Anyway it was such a traumatic experience for her, my new slider was returned some 20 mins later by someone else. The food was cooked well and the rest of the staff were fine, but this is a place which has style over substance.

title: Black Cod Oh My God
comment: I visited for business, so there was no celebration or occasion that prompted the visit but Sushi Samba was a restaurant that had been on my hit list for a while. It was pretty special, I'd definitely return for a special occasion.  The waiter explained the menu very thoroughly and talked about the options we had, to just order around 15 dishes between 5 people or go for more of a chefs choice. We chose the chefs choice with Kobe beef (without is a bit cheaper) and after asking some questions such as "how spicy do you like your food" and any allergies, the food started flowing. Upon reflection, I'm relieved we didn't order ourselves because we probably couldn't have picked a selection as well as the chef did and one of our guests did say that although this was his third visit, it was the best by far because of the food choice. Every dish was excellent and the favourites of the group was the Black Cod and the Tuna Ceviche. Everything was portioned for our table, so 5 of everything and there was a mix of meats, sushi rolls and raw fish. Some of the flavours were so so rich and like nothing I'd ever had before. The Beef was very nice but not nice enough for the price in my opinion. We shared 3 deserts at the end and didn't expect anything particularly great because it's not this restaurants selling point but we were pleasantly surprised. Our favourite was the Chilli Chocolate Moose, closely followed by the Chocolate Banana cake.  Our table didn't order Wine or Sake, only Beer and G&Ts so maybe we missed out on another element of culinary deliciousness but to be honest, the food was so good, I don't really care if we did. The bill was sobering at £135 a head, but we had quality food, excellent service and of course, a lovely view. My only complaint was the volume of the waiters - they were too quiet when explaining dishes and many had quite thick accents too so speaking a little slower and louder would've been better.  If you visit here then I have three tips. Go with an open mind, take your credit card and put your menu choice in the hands of the chef. Enjoy!

title: Birthday dinner
comment: I took my partner for a birthday dinner to Sushi Samba. We had a good table with view, which was really great. Shared a bottle of red, good choice. The food was ok, not spectacular. At this point it was more about the view than food. I had higher expectations. Portions were very small. The service was poor. I don't expect a waiter to lean on our table in this kind of restaurant. To be friendly is fine but stay professional

title: Outdoor patio is amazing for drinks on a beautiful night!
comment: We came by after dinner at Duck & Waffle for drinks on the outdoor patio. The view was amazing and atmosphere and vibe was so nice! Recommended for drinks, although expensive.

title: Desperate and dated
comment: Went here with my husband for dinner on a Sunday night. Our reservation was for 10pm as that was the only time slot available, so we dutifully arrived early to take in the views and have a cocktail.  Upon arriving, we had the same issue that many others did, in that there is no one to greet you when you arrive out of the elevators and into the restaurant. Seems they still haven't moved their 'reception' desk to the side where guests actually should be 'received.' After walking around aimlessly, we were finally spotted by a waitress who told us to go get a drink at the bar. After an inordinately long wait for any service and then another long wait for our drinks to arrive, I was underwhelmed by the cocktails - all smoke and mirrors. A glass overstuffed with ice and other greenery meant you had maybe 3 sips of the cocktail before it was gone. Poor value and not particularly pleasant to have ice shooting all over the place as you attempt to mix your drink.  At 10.15pm when we still hadn't been seated at our table, we were ready to leave. So I went over to the waitress and asked if our table was ready, which finally, it was. Well, when we walked into the main dining area, we were surprised to see quite a number of tables empty! So it beggars the question, why were we kept waiting for so long! Once seated, the waiter - who's uniform of black shirt and shiny polyester orange tie resembled an IT guy from 2003 trying to dress up - explained the menu and was initially quite pleasant. When 20 mins after ordering we still hadn't been served any food whatsoever, I asked politely for him to check on our order. He was reluctant to as he said it just 'comes as it comes.' I reminded him that it was 10.45pm, and we were supposed to be seated at 10pm, so it was getting pretty late and to not have even a little starter to pick at...it wasn't really good enough. He then went off in a bit of a huff mumbling something else as he walked off. This was the second point in the night where we thought, let's just leave.  Once the food arrived, it was tasty. But hard to enjoy given the long wait, the poor attitude from the waiter and the time of night. The tacos with tuna were the highlight as well as the miso cod with corn, but the rest of the dishes were average at best and unmemorable.  I haven't detailed every little issue I have with this restaurant as I think the above is enough, but suffice to say, I won't be back. Sure, the views are pretty cool but that's the best part about this place; the decor (and waiter's uniform) is dated, the music playing is maybe 15 years old, the service is rude and offhand and the food average at best.

title: Great location but very unwelcoming
comment: We visited sushisamba for a few drinks after being in the duck and waffle. It is a great location with a nice outside bar area, however this was somewhat spoiled by the unwelcoming bar staff who looked like they wanted to be anywhere else but there. This can be excused on the odd occasion with one staff member however there were several that were particularly rude. My girlfriend even commented to one of the bar staff members regarding how she was treating not just ourselves but other customers, although this was laughed at and not taken seriously.  Needless to say we left shortly after and returned to the duck and waffle.

title: Great Atmosphere, Great Food
comment: Must-go place for anybody who is visiting London and enjoys Japanese food, the view from Sushisamba is amazing! The staff is always friendly and forthcoming.

title: Just no. It's a good view.
comment: It's more concerned about creating an impression of being sophisticated than actually being sophisticated.  It's starting to look a bit shabby. The service was not welcoming. The drink (a poor take in a caipirinha) was weak an flavourless much like the welcome.    The bar outside has no view and no atmosphere.  The area when you walk in, if you haven't booked a table, is offered as a place to eat. If you like eating in a shopping mall or airport lounge, go ahead.  Really, I wouldn't bother with this place.

title: Amazing Place, Rude Staff
comment: I heard a lot about this restaurant and I decided to go with a friend of mine. The restaurant was fully booked so we had some drinks and food in the bar, everything was amazing: the food, the view and the athomosphere but the staff really ruined our mood starting from a bored bartender and a rude waitress that start to argue with my friend straight away.  I was surprise such a bad attitude for such a high level place.

title: Left a Bad Taste
comment: Ordered drinks at outside bar which is beautiful setting. Was asked if I was paying cash or card, handed over cash and then asked if I'd like a receipt, which I didn't need. Much to my surprise an apparently discretionary service charge was automatically added to the cost of the drinks, without my being asked if I was happy with this. Then having handed over cash I was not even offered my change; the waiter started serving another customer, so after a brief wait I left the bar as it became obvious there was no intention to give me my change. Two issues come to mind - if the discretionary surcharge is automatically added to the bill why not be up front and include this in the stated price for each drink on the bar list. (The surcharge issue was certainly not obvious on said bar list, if at all present.)  Secondly I was left wondering if my cash had ever got into the till and was this why I was not offered change. Altogether a bad taste left after the visit. Felt my leg had been lifted in an environment where it was assumed everyone was on expenses.

title: Great views of the city. Dining with a difference
comment: I'm sure that some people would say they could find better sushi places in London, but guarantee they would not have views like this. Try to get window seats as they are great on a clear day. Book in advance and for good food, as waiter for the most popular dishes as they were the ones which really got the taste buds going. Great service.

title: Celebrating aniversary
comment: Despite reading previous reviews of people being turned away because of not meeting their dress code, we must have met it as we were allowed into the glass lift which went up 38 floors very fast. Ear popping speed but met with pleasant staff and a fantastic view of the whole of London. We sat in side but with a window view. Plenty of chilled water and good bottle of wine. The food was amazing. Shimp tempura was their showstopper. Really wafer thin crispy batter tossed in a delicious tasting mayo dressing. Followed by superbly presented sushi wrapped in soya paper plus nigiri with fantastic toppings. Finished off with a personalised desert of hand written message in chocolate sauce to us. Service was amazing, very attentive. Excellent

title: Striking!
comment: Absolutely amazing, fabulous location, friendly staff and helpful, drinks and food are sensational! Not for everyone!, fantastic atmosphere, my husband and I will be back! xx

title: Astounding food, lovely service, spectacular location
comment: Sushisamba really is a must-do dining experience. The location is wonderful - 38 floors up with superb views of London - and the food is out of this world. Not many places can get away with a Japanese/Peruvian/Brazilian fusion, but they really do it perfectly here. Each dish has a hint of each cuisine (rather than having a section of the menu for each cuisine), and it's presented beautifully and tasted delicious. The drinks were also really good quality and very imaginative. The service was attentive and friendly - definitely not pretentious - while the bill reflected the quality of the whole place (c.£200 for two of us stufffing ourselves and having a few drinks). I'd happily go again and again, and would heartily recommend it. Don't be put off by the intimidating and prescriptive pre-arrival email ('don't be late! don't wear casual clothes! we can turn you away if we like! give the table back after 90 minutes!'), as the service in person is the complete opposite.

title: Drinks only
comment: My first visit and I loved the place. We had window side seats with an amazing view over the city as sunset. I'll definitely book window seating for future visits.

title: Fab views, good food, but service overall poor..
comment: We are discerning foodies with years of experience eating in high end restaurants all over the world. Generally we prefer under-stated restaurants where authentic, quality food is the priority, but on this occasion it was our daughter's birthday so we wanted somewhere with a bit of glitz and glamour - Sushi Samba seemed to be the perfect choice for lunch given its rooftop setting and spectacular views, especially as weather forecast for the Bank Holiday weekend was good. First impressions unfortunately not great - arrived on 38th floor and no-one there to greet us. We made our way to the outside bar (where red tree is) to have a drink before lunch. After 10 mins of waiting to be served we were told that bar was closed and if we wanted drinks out there we would need to go and order from the inside bar and take them out ourselves - very unhelpful!  The inside bar is a small area with only a handful of tables and chairs to the one side by the window. The staff there weren't particularly friendly and it felt too warm, so we ordered our drinks and headed to restaurant.  For our lunch we were given the option of a table inside the restaurant, or on the outside terrace. The outside terrace is lovely and has the best views. There is a lounge seating area at one end, and the dining area at the other. We asked the hostess if we could finish our drinks in the lounge area first, and then move to our table (further along the terrace) for lunch as we still had a bit of time. She said that was absolutely fine. Whilst having our drinks an extremely officious male member of staff in a dark suit came over and told us we couldn't sit there as that area was reserved for people who were dining in the restaurant. We explained that we had a reservation for lunch in 10 minutes time and that we were just having a quick drink first. He kept arguing with us that we shouldn't be there, and then having consulted the hostess who had originally told us we could have drinks there, reluctantly agreed we could stay. He then went on to tell us in a very condescending manner exactly what time it was, and to point out that we had a two hour time slot for our table for lunch, so if we spent too long on our drinks we would be eating into that time and they may need to give our table to someone else! The way he spoke to us was unacceptable. He put a real damper on things and at that point we were tempted to pay for our drinks and leave. However, we persevered and stayed on for lunch and things did get better. Our waiter over lunch was polite and efficient and the food was good. But the highlight for us were the views. Also worth mentioning is that in places, notably the ladies toilets, it is looking a tad tired and tatty and could do with some redecoration. Our meal for the six of us including drinks was almost £600 - we do not begrudge spending that sort of money if the overall experience is excellent, but on this occasion we felt the service fell far short of expectations, and for this reason we wouldn't recommend or dine there again.

title: Awesome....
comment: Fantastic place! Super service (thanks Harry for banana chocolate cake)! Each and every single dish we ordered was just yummi.... We were over the moon. And the wine..... Oh!

title: Nice views, decent food
comment: Nice food, good dessert choice and beautiful views. However, the entire experience was ruined by this one waiter with a terrible attitude. He had facial hair, glasses and a tie - was pushy, condescending and rude.  Note that all other staff members were very nice.

title: AVERAGE Restaurant
comment: Good Experience with average meal. Good Service. Too much hype. Although you call call for booking, they will always give you long appointment dates, but when we went it was not heavy. Unnecessary hype. Only views are good. Many more restaurants in London which are much superior. Portions of their Sushi are huge and cannot even put in mouth.

title: Shocking customer service
comment: Recently five of us ate here for a family celebratory meal. Had drinks outside before dinner. Had a knowledgable , friendly waiter and we chose a lot of dishes to share . Food was good , not exceptional. When our final bill came there were a number of drinks, including champagne , totalling £80 that had been added that we did not have. We brought this to the waiter's attention and a woman, I assume the duty manager , told us that we did have the drinks ! A half hour discussion then followed with her accusing my husband of lying by saying that she was going to check the cctv to prove she was correct. We would have been very happy for that to happen and encouraged her to do so as maybe then she would have apologised for the errors made by the bar. She eventually extremely reluctantly and with very bad grace, removed the items from our already massive bill.  I have never encountered such an unpleasant, aggressive , rude person in a customer service role. There are obviously problems in their system of ordering drinks at the bar and adding to the correct bill and a bigger problem of customer service training. Check your bill, we can't be the only customers this happens to. Mistakes happen but there is no excuse for such poor , rude , unpleasant service .

title: Great views, good food, excellent saki selection
comment: Attentive service and stunning views. The saki menu is long and difficult to navigate but Irene the sommelier was very helpful. Good sushi and wagyu too.

title: Amazing location
comment: Staff was kind and accommodated us for dinner even at late night. The place is magical both inside and outside and the food is very good. We tried sushi rolls and drank excellent cocktails. I will certainly go back

title: Burthday treat
comment: We visited sushisamba as a birthday treat- four of us. What an great place. Our lunch lasted a good three hours, service and food amazing, a great experience - could not fault. Our waiter recommended some dishes so we had three different courses, cocktails and sake and finished off with coffee - great views and atmosphere would highly recommend !

title: Very cool and hip atmosphere
comment: The venue is upscale and the views of London are great from the 39th floor of the Heron Tower. They have outside seating and a bar/lounge area. The food was very good and the presentation is a work of art. We tried the kobe slider, tempura shrimp, and ordered according to the server's recommendations. Reservations are a must!

title: Classy restaurant with incredible views
comment: This is at the top of Heron Tower. The bar is lovely and has an outdoor seating area, weather permitting. The restaurant is very nice with incredible service and delicious food- sushi and sashimi and other types of food. The presentation is absolutely over the top. When you finish eating, take in the views of London from 38 floors up. It is a restaurant that you will truly enjoy. Not too suitable for small children.

title: The place is great to celebrate with friends and see what is London at night
comment: We were six in my party , place is great the service is good , the food is typical Sushisamba so Peruvian/ Japanese combination but the highlight is the environment , the scene is great and the view is even better

title: Stunning views, decor and food
comment: Arresting decor greets you after a speedy ascent from street level. Golds and orange interior and exterior lounge space. Superb views. Welcoming and attentive service throughout. Delicate, tasty dishes from sashimi to poussin, salmon and salad. Popular menu as there were no shrimp available for our lunch. No matter. Every dish was well presented and delicious. Quite a find and worth saving up for another visit.

title: Birthday Treat
comment: A beautiful setting with views across London. The food was to die for - we ordered a range of dishes to share and enjoyed all. One of the better places for sushi in London. I would recommend diners sample a variety. For those with a sweet tooth, the dessert was especially good. Service was excellent and I look forward to visiting again.

title: Delicious - all of it.
comment: Yummy cocktails and sushi. Both were amazing. The salmon, yellow tail and salmon dishes were unbelievably fresh and delicious. Well done! Very friendly staff- drinks and courses almost came too quickly! Inside bar area is a little tiny but the views are great as are the views from under the orange tree outside. Impressed.

title: A delicious birthday lunch
comment: SushiSamba is definitely pricey, however for this special occasion with special friends it was well worth the spend. And what I particularly liked about this restaurant (unlike some of its counterparts) is that you’re not just paying for the exceptional view. The service and food is also exceptional, and the general vibe refreshingly relaxed. For me, a winning combination!

title: Great views great food
comment: I have been to sushi samba a number of times now and it never disappoints me. The first visit we booked 3 months in advance, long but definitely worth the wait, i would highly recommend the shrimp tempura, its the best thing the menu along with the samba rolls and the array of cocktails.  My second visit was on a wimp on a friday night, no booking but the staff were extremely happy to seat us at the small smaller bar which looks out of the famous orange tree outside bar area, you get exactly the same menu and level of service as if you were in the main restaurant! Pricey but always worth it for the food and views!

title: Superb food, superb service
comment: Thoroughly enjoyable, we were a table of demanding fussy foodies and the staff were incredibly knowledgeable, efficient, attentive and very charming. Special mentions go to Vlasta, Enrique, Valerio and the Sommelier, whose name I didn't get to note down...

title: Amazing
comment: All of it was amazing. Lychee cocktail was delicious. We managed to squeeze in on a table without booking which was a miracle. Very busy place. Atmosphere was great. View is absolutely stunning. Want to visit again soon.

title: Amazing views & atmosphere
comment: We went on a Thursday night without planning so had to wait for a while for a table but sat at the outside bar which was beautifully lit with an abundance of fairy lights, good music & a buzzing vibrant atmosphere. We went quite late at 11pm but people were still coming in when we left at 2am! Great food & great restaurant.

title: Great for casual drinks
comment: I have eaten here over 20 times, the food will never disappointed and I recommend the steak and ask for hot rocks to cook it to your liking. Otherwise, if you are going for casual drinks, don't expect a seat, on Friday evenings it will get packed! Let us not forget the breathtaking views of London, enjoy sipping a cocktail whilst witnessing a gorgeous sunset over St Pauls.

title: Amazing!
comment: Starting with the ride up in the lift, it's a great experience. Amazing food, service and views. We went for a work lunch and we could have stayed all day and night. The staff are attentive, really know the menu and are happy to guide you. Literally everything we ordered was incredible - we were wide eyed at the presentation too, that's when we could take our eyes off the view. Don't even think about it, just go!

title: Very unwelcoming, average but very overpriced
comment: I went there in July with a friend. The door man at the ground floor, was very arrogant, unwelcoming and actually rude to us. I am Italian and I can deal with abrupt but his behaviour was unacceptable. I had to wear orthotics as I have thorn a tendon in my foot. it was the hottest day in years and I was wearing black flip flops (my other orthotics are in boots). As I had read the dress code I had a pair of flats in my handbag. He refused to let me in in those shoes - which is acceptable - but he also refused to call the manager to check if we could make an exception. He arrogantly and rudely said he was a dancer and I was overreacting and that I just had to walk to the table. I am not complaining about the fact that he did not let me in but that- with what you pay to eat in that place he should actually be accompanying me to the table holding my bag! Well, we made it to the restaurant. The view was beautiful... out of the windows, but if you looked up the ceiling lights (on every table) are literally covered in dust, big chunks of dust. We ordered food, we waited quite a bit for the food to come, not a problem as I was there with a friend to have a good time and chat. Some food arrived, some was missing and arrived later.. anyway.. I am not expecting japanese quality fish but it was slightly superior to tesco. The fusion idea was good and some of the twists were very good but the raw fish which was in most dishes was just average which makes this restaurant very overpriced. On the way out, to my surprise I saw some people in flip flops.... I emailed the customer service who emailed back saying they will get someone to phone me and discuss further. I have never heard from them. Bottom line, I may recommend sushi samba for a drink on a night out. The view is great and the atmosphere is ok, but do not waste your time and money to go there for a meal.

title: restaurant with good london view
comment: The restaurant is in heron tower, and if you sit in the balcony, you will have very good view of london. The food here is good, delicious, but the portion is small. IF you seat outside, sometimes there will be strong wind, and you'll feel cold, but the view is really good.

title: Best London Experience
comment: My friend and I stopped here for dinner before going to the Sky Garden for drinks and the view. After experiencing SushiSamba, there was no need to go to Sky Garden as the drinks, food, and VIEWS are superb-it really blew us away-39 floors up!!! We ordered two sushi rolls and they were better than any sushi I've ever tried. The drinks were magnificent, although expensive, mine had a yellow pansy floating on top, brilliant!! But the views took our breath away-magical since we could see across the Thames to the Tower Bridge, plus it was sunset and as the sun set, all the office buildings lit up-just the most fun ever!!!

title: Nick
comment: I visited sushi samba yesterday with a group of friends for the first time. I thought the barman was rude, as I asked for a Malibu and cranberry juice and was told he doesn't like it so it won't be served there. It cost £45 for 3 cocktails that were full of ice. I would no way recommend to go. Expensive and staff were a disgrace .

title: Beer drinking and sight seeing day in London
comment: Fantastic place, great atmosphere, great views. Didn't dine as we were on a mission to see and do as much as possible.  But from what I saw, all looked good. The elevators are glass and this adds to the experience on entrance and exit to and from the bar.

title: Nice night with friends
comment: I went to SUSHISAMBA for drinks with a group of friends to show a newly arrived friend a great view of London. Firstly the views are definitely the highlight! Secondly, there is a lovely Spanish speaking bartender who was great with drink recommendations, was a real perfectionist and was very accommodating when we wanted off the menu drinks. I'm going to be very honest the lifts did not make me happy... But that's because I'm a wuss. The view when riding up was well worth them.

title: Slow service at first but food was awesome
comment: This place is on the 38th floor I believe.. Really cool elevator ride (scary if you're afraid of heights) it's a glass elevator and goes pretty fast! We didn't have a reservation so just put our name in and decided to wait outside at the bar. Awesome view.. The tree there are the bar is quite a site as well. It was very cold though so make sure to have a good jacket!!!!! While we were waiting we decided to order some appetizers.. There was one girl who was taking orders and never came up to us once.. Also her attitude was very disappointing. I would make eye contact with her and she never came over... Was weird. Anyways, once we got seated (about an hour or so later) we ordered a bottle of sake, some apps, and a few rolls. The food was excellent! And the service was good, too.

title: Lovely experience, great views but disappointed on unclear rules
comment: My family came here for my sister's 21st and had a very good evening. Service was slow to start with as the restaurant was clearly very busy, however the staff were helpful, knowledgeable and quick to pick up on things. Wine selection is minimal, but the rose is lovely (very light) and the South African white is equally nice. Food is superb, but then for the price I would expect it. The Samba salad was fantastic and very prettily presented. We picked 3-4 options from all the menus and shared between us which worked very well. Other options which were really nice were pomegranate tuna and eggplant. I personally loved the way the sushi was presented with the bright colours (just not enough wasabi and ginger on the plate). the wasabi is also very nice, has a good kick to it. Overall the experience was great and we did have a nice time, but I've given a 4/5 for their lack of clear 'rules' for their restaurant. Being a 21st birthday i had bought a small helium balloon, but when i arrived I was told I couldn't take it in to the restaurant because it didn't go well with the aesthetics (fair enough although I had checked the website first and there is no mention of this, but does state you have to wear appropriate clothing (i.e. no flip flops and trainers)). I was told told to leave it tied to a post outside, which i thought was a little unfair as i would have happily put it in the cloakroom, but apparently I couldn't take it in to the building. As there is information on their website about a dress code, i feel it should mention this as well to avoid other people doing the same. I did take a picture of it before it was stolen during dinner so at least the birthday girl got to see it.

title: Great experience
comment: A must visit....a good friend I was staying with is a regular, and shared that a booking is a must. I can understand why. Great rooftop location, good vibe with the music & crowd, friendly & professional service and great tasting food.

title: incredible
comment: Had an amazing evening the food was amazing and the drinks were great staff were really helpful the views are amazing would highly recomend

title: SushiSamba Bar
comment: We went there just for a late evening drinks - we were waiting to get up for min 10 min, but it was so worth it! Drinks were excellent - bar staff were amazing - there were couple of Lithuanian barmen's who were very professional and so cool! Great atmosphere and view! We enjoyed our evening to the fullest!

title: Lunchtime treat
comment: Went here with my son. He's been before and was sure I'd love. He was 100% right.  Staff in restaurant outstanding. I couldn't decide on a cocktail so the maitre d' asked what I liked and got the barman to make me a bespoke one. It was delicious.  Food was out of this world.

title: Fabulous view & beautiful restaurant -- super menu too!
comment: Had dinner here recently with 15 business associates and we had a very nice dinner. It was quite expensive but we had 7 courses and a set menu. The Peruvian corn was exquisite, the Kobe beef very tender and the sushi was spicy & very tasty. The view from the 38th floor is lovely and the "orange tree" is eye-catching and so original!!

title: Every time I love it more !
comment: I love the place,location,food,staff.  This is one of my favorite spot in London.  Have tried lots of orders and liked most of them.  Highly recommended.  Must have a reservation.

title: Enjoy the food with view
comment: It was really special dinner.. I like the shrimp tempura and el topo dishes. The view and sitting area are very nice as well....

title: Superb food, service and the views are fantastic
comment: We decided to go here last minute on a Sunday evening and honestly I think we lucked out - we were sat immediately outside with an amazing view. Watching the sun set on London over lovely sushi, wine and service made our day. The waiter was particularly good - suggesting his favourite wine to try (not the most expensive!) as the one we selected was out of stock. All in all, I'm looking forward to going back. Tip - go early or book in advance as when we left there was a big queue for dinner.

title: Stylish and fun place to go eat modern Japanese food
comment: I am Japanese, my partner is non-Japanese and vegetarian, and his sister had never eaten Japanese food before. But we all very much enjoyed dinner together at Sushi Samba. I LOVE the stylish ambiance and the gorgeous view from the terrace very much. We ordered all kinds of food: miso soup, tempura, sushi, robata-yaki veggies, etc.. Most of dishes were tasty. Only Kobe Beef Ishiyaki was rather for fun than taste. They bring a hot stone kit so you can grill sliced beef at the table on your own. Smoke comes up, and you get attentions from other tables, but it was so not worth £120 because beef was cut too thinly to tell if it’s Kobe beef or OG beef! As for drinks, Champaign, sake, plum sake, all were good. (Somehow we didn't try their cocktails, but next time!) Our server was not sophisticated but friendly. Basically this is a fun and stylish place to go. When it's fun, everything tastes better. I will be happy to go back there anytime!

title: Great views, disappointing and overpriced bill
comment: Great views and the dining room is interesting. The outside bars look like they might be fun. Really underwealmed by the taste of the food. The odd spin on miso soup just produced a vile tasting soup. Sushi marginally better than the supermarket variety, tempura prawn, third rate. Expensive for such incompetant food. Excellent service though.

title: Loved the vibe, loved the view
comment: After living in Dubai for the last two years Sushi Samba was a excellent welcome home for us. The drinks are a little pricey for London but all is made up with the view and elevator experience on the way up!  Sushi Samba is a must visit!

title: Sushi with a view
comment: The location is amazing and the view even more, the best sushi experience in London, to eat great sushi looking the london skyline in a modern cool experience, where else?

title: Amazing experience!
comment: We were with a group of 12 and Victoria (our server) treated us so well. The food presentation was phenomenal. We ordered the hot stone with Wagu beef slices...so delicious! Also, the sashimi and sushi tasted fantastic. Will definitely dine here again. Only complaint was the women's bathroom was so very dark and felt like a tomb. They really need to update the restroom to make it more pleasant and less spooky.

title: Amazing view and wonderful food
comment: The whole place is great - it's a fabulous restaurant to go to for a special occasion. Getting the lift up to the 30-something floor is an experience in itself! The bar outside is beautiful with an actual tree coming out of the central bar space, but the restaurant is the highlight. Food is divine and waiters were so helpful when it came to ordering if you are unsure. Will be coming back to this place for years to come!

title: Fancy!
comment: I definitely enjoyed visiting Sushisamba. The view from Heron Tower is stunning and you get to experience one of the fanciest places in London, so make sure to dress accordingly. It offers a great variety of dishes, but, like every other fancy restaurant that respects itself, won't be too generous with the portions.

title: Absolutely wonderful birthday lunch
comment: I don't believe this place can deliver bad food, drinks or customer service. We've been seated on the terrace - at our choice, which made the experience even more wonderful. From the cocktails to the sushi and the Sushisamba salad, everything had an amazing ptesentation and taste.  I definitely reccomd it and I am sure that anything on the menu will be exceptional.

title: Amazing and Stunning a Must !!
comment: went for cocktails, at the samba you go in an elevator up to the 38th floor it is stunning the views are amazing, the waiter made us up a mocktail and he could not please enough, beautiful setting, beautiful decor great atmosphere would 100% go again, you have to book in advance and need a reservation to get up there. but defo a must will go again

title: YES!
comment: AMAZING restaurant & bar. The food tasted fantastic and the cocktails we had (both alcoholic & non alcoholic) were delicious. We sat on the roof top terrace and although we were slightly scared we had a phenomenal time. A must visit place!

title: Amazing view
comment: Went for Brunch...couldn't get a table for the evening but still lovely. Would be lovely for a date. If you love sushi you will love it! The staff were very attentive and food came out in no time! Bar area and outside is lovely also for drinks! Only thing that was annoying was there seemed to be tiny flies all over the place and one landed in my drink and they could do with dusting their lights above everyone's head. There was 4 of us and came up to £150 with no alcoholic drinks. I was hungry again after 1 and half . Would I go back ? Yes for a drink at the bar outside..I'm not a big sushi fan anyway but I would go back.

title: Graduation celebration
comment: The local roll was delicious, great views and wonderful service- the waiter was attending to our every need. Reserve well in advance because it gets booked out pretty quick! If you arrive early you can chill out at the bar and see the sights from duck and waffle :) worth doing at least once whilst you're in London!

title: Great food
comment: This place has great food although staff were a little hit and miss. I would go there for the food-I tried the New York one also Which was a bit better perhaps but this was good also. Great views of the city-truly uninterrupted!Also seems a place for after work drink for those in the city.

title: A evening out in London
comment: This is a fusion restaurant offering a modern twist on Japanese/Brazilian/Peruvian sushi. While not a combination that I would think of it appears to work well and it is certainly popular. It is modern and elegantly designed with panoramic views over London. For some the settings alone would be worth it. The food is elegantly presented and like all places of this ilk it is more about presentation and quality than quantity. However they offer a lot of choice and the food is really well prepared. Some will leave here wondering whether it is good value for money, for me it is just.

title: Most beautiful place ever
comment: I visited here for drinks at the weekend. The drinks are very pricey but the views of London are so worth it. W had a lovely bar man and overall a great experience ! I cant wait to come back for food

title: Average sushi, amazing dessert
comment: Sushi Samba has the competitive advantage of being in a top location and a small scale restaurant which makes it exclusive. Yet, in my opinion the music was a bit too loud which made the evening a bit unpersonal due to the difficulty of having a normal discussion. This might be to encourage akward but fancy colleague meals.. For the service, it was a very polish service with the bad habit of filling up glasses straight after one gulp. It would have been nice to have one waiter assigned to the table to help with advice and comfort. But the restaurant is busy and this might be a reason why. Last, but not least, the food. In my opinion the sushis were very average (We had a combination of four different types) with a bit of a moist texture which I found a bit odd. The four different plates did not have much different within the taste, I was disappointed. But I have to say I am glad to have continued the experience up until the dessert because if there's a reason to go to Sushi Samba it would be for the special dessert which consists of a dulce de leche ice cream on cookie crumble with a chocolate sponge cake with a bit of coconut. This desert was delicious and one of the best I've had in London. Therefore, Sushi Samba might want to rebrand for what they are really good at: Dessert with a view. Yummy.

title: Nice for a cocktail but you have to fight to see the view
comment: I went here with a friend for a quick cocktail on a Wednesday evening after work. We really went for the view so expected the drinks to be pricey - a cocktail is £13 but they are a good size and taste great. It was quite busy as expected - we managed to get a seat outside on the balcony area but you really can't see much of the view from there as it's obscured by a roof jutting out just below this area...having said that the décor is lovely. It started raining and a really nice touch was a waiter came out and brought everyone umbrellas so we didn't have to move. They have outdoor heaters also so it is kept warm and ready for English weather. The good views are to be found in the main bar by the stairs, if you can get a seat there and have one drink it's a really lovely experience.

title: Great place
comment: Love to be here. Great atmosphere, great views, amazing sushi and great drinks. You can't fault this place. Expensive but worth it.

title: Believe some of the hype at least
comment: Ive eaten at a lot of Sushi and Fusion places, and this place, whilst above average, the real reason to head there is the view, so make sure you know that. You are also paying for the view.
