I took a couple of music buddies out for dinner, and Josh Daniel (of X Factor fame) always makes for a great canary as he is so fussy...although gets better every outing. We had a nice (expensive) Pouilly Fume, and then started ordering a selection deciding that the menu looked a little like Tapas, and complete with our South American waiter away we went. Gyoza were amazing, and the Sushi rolls that came out were too. We also sampled the steak platter, awesome. One friend was a Vegetarian so we had a selection of that food genre too, and he was happy enough it seems. Service was on point, would I go back? I do believe it to be a bit of a one off to see it place, that said though they didnt really treat the guests as such, which was good. One observation, it was too hot. Either the AC wasnt on, or the doors were not open enough and with the sun out it was like a green house for a while...even the girls were hot. The desserts I was less taken with, again we had a selection and they were just a little bland, not really any good flavours coming through on any of them, which was a shame.

title: Sushi fine - staff appalling
comment: The sushi we had was fine - not the best I have ever had but not the worst. The main issue was the staff. From the waiting staff in the restaurant either forgetting drinks to constantly pestering you as your time on the table comes to an end it all felt very uncomfortable. That, however, was nothing in comparison to the three guys behind the bar. Only one of them had a personality and the other two had the attitude of I'm too good to be here! Guys you are barmen not Tom Cruise!!! The worst was the Latin looking chap - his attitude towards all the customers was downright rude. You could let him away with such an appalling attitude if his drinks were great but they were strictly average - he needs to remember if you want customers to come back you need to at least be pleasant particularly if your drinks are not great - customer service training required urgently! I won't be back for a while in the hope that if I do come back new bar staff have been recruited or the existing ones trained properly!

title: After work drinks.
comment: Views of London more than make up for the tad pricey drinks! Service was good and atmosphere electric. Will certainly return.

title: Fantastic cocktails on the roof terrace
comment: We came here for drinks one Saturday evening on a boiling hot day in July. The staff aren't overly attentive, nor overly rude - just your normal cocktail bar staff. However they do make amazing cocktails! We nabbed a space by the bar on the roof terrace and ordered a few rounds between us as the evening went on. The atmosphere here is brilliant, even better on a hot summers evening. The downside to the place is that for a rooftop bar, you can't really see any of the London views as there are quite high walls all around you. There is one look out point, but it;s normally crowded with people. Also get here early to secure a space on the terrace / not have to fight your way through people / or to the bar. We arrived about 5/5:30pm and there was comfortable space at the bar, but by the time we left about 8pm the terrace was rammed! We had a fantastic time here, loved the atmosphere, loved the drinks - will definitely be coming back again.

title: Must visit
comment: For anyone who enjoys city lights, city nights and just phenomenal sushi this restaurant is one of the best central london has to offer. The crowd is well dressed yet casual in demeanour, the drinks are not priced too high but the ambience is superb. The elevator ride up is enough to impress one, but the warm fires and the glow of london by night is ideal for a date or impressing business colleagues.

title: amazing sushi!
comment: We ordered a mixture of meat, fish and sushi dishes. I couldn't fault any of them! All were delicious. Service was good - however dishes came at different times and waiting more than 10 mins between each dish.  Rio dessert wasn't nice but passion fruit cake was amazing.  Ambiance was lovely and view was great Overall, recommend !

title: Superb food, fantastic views, worth every penny!
comment: The food was exquisite. A pleasure for all senses, I had a sashimi platter and it was done better than I had anywhere else before. All the other meals were also extreme beautifully presented, as were the cocktails that we ordered from the bar. A real buzz for your tastebuds.  I would like to add that the service was outstanding too and that we were really looked after all night. It is worth every penny and is not overpriced at all especially for what you get.  There's also some inventive more adventurous dishes which is refreshing.

title: Oh dear Lord!
comment: What a place - view, drinks, food! I absolutely LOVE this place! Been here several times. Always amazing. If you get lost in the menu, just trust the waiter.

title: Breathtaking view of London with amazing food!
comment: We went to Sushi Samba in last week of July , It was a sun downer when the sun set ay 9 30 - So we got the evening view at 8 & night view at 10 30. The Bar area has community tables where you can get a drink at the bar & grab a seat where ever you can find place. If you're lucky you can chat up with people sitting at your table as well! There are so many things about this restaurant that I can't stop talking about as the night proceeded. A roof top restaurant in London on the 38th floor being the first, The bar has limited range of cocktails & drinks but the ambience makes up for it - The huge orange tree & grass bar counters make you feel in an outdoor-sy place instead of the regular wooden top bars. To be seated inside at the restaurant you need to make a reservation way in advance or be prepared to wait in queue for 2 hours at least. We got a table outside by 10 pm & I had no idea the view would be so damn good. We could see the tower bridge , the shard, & the gherkin all at once - all lit up. Couldn't ask for me. As the night proceeded it got very chilly - The restaurant offers a very thoughtful service with proving blankets for the diners to keep warm whilst enjoying their dinner out in the open.

title: Dinner Date
comment: Loved the entrance and lobby to the restaurant. We got there at 6pm on time for our booking, however our table wasn't ready until about 20 minutes later so we waited outside at the bar. The Bar outside was soo nice and had a pretty theme! The bartenders were lovely and the view outside was amazing. Expected the restaurant to be a bit bigger by looking at pictures beforehand so tables were quite close to each other, but still nice decor and we were sat at a good table for the view. They say typically between 2 people you should order about 5-7 dishes to share. We ordered about 4/5 and were full by the end of it. Food was yummy, especially the yellowtail taquitos we had. But dessert was probably the best; ordered a chocolate banana cake (which my partner adored and raved about) and the with love from rio dessert which was very nice too. Overall an expensive but great dining experience.

title: Fantastic view's
comment: Didn't eat there on this occasion.....but I love to be above the London streets the bar outside is just with the visit alone personally much better than the shard ...sorry .... amazing cocktails £30.00 for two tho !!!!

title: Celebratory dinner - a place to impress
comment: I went to Sushi Samba with my family on Sunday night - decided to go for it because of the wow factor and it definitely lived up to its name.  The place and decor are fabulous so it is the perfect place if you are bringing someone who's not from London.  The food was also extremely good and the presentation was delicate yet funky. We loved it! Of course you need to be prepared to the high price but we felt it was worth the money. Our waiter gave us great recommendations too.  The highlight, I must confess, was the dessert! None of us has a sweet tooth so we decided to be adventurous and ordered a dish with dark chocolate truffles, jalapeño tuile and a red pepper sorbet and - oh my days it was outstanding!  On a not so bright side, the reception team was not very friendly both when we booked over the phone and when we called to say we were 10 mins late - we were told they would have only kept the table for up to 15 mins from the booking time.  Overall, though, a memorable experience!

title: Lunch
comment: This place is so so. Good food but not "amazing". Too over priced for what you get really. I'm surprised by the comments some people have made about the staff. We found them very friendly and accommodating .  I wouldn't really choose to go here again but if I was invited by friends to join them I wouldn't complain either

title: A nice treat...
comment: I'm not a lover of sushi, but I took a loved one here since it's her favourite food and I was really impressed with the food (as you should be at the price) and now I am beginning to understand what all the fuss is about when it comes to sushi. We tried a couple of different types of sashimi, a selection of sushi rolls and the salt and pepper squid along with some cocktails and sake.  As someone for whom the idea of eating raw fish is about as appetising as tucking into Donald Trump's g-string, I actually found our food to be among the nicest mouthfuls I've ever had. I'm assured it's on par with great sushi in Japan itself, which again you'd hope so given the price, which isn't cheap but is pretty much what you'd expect for dining at one of the better-known restaurants in the capital. The staff were really nice, our waiter was very knowledgeable and helped us pick the best sake, which packed quite a punch and made the lift ride down on the way out very interesting. My only complaint would be that we waited an unusually long time for all of our drinks - most of our food had arrived before our cocktails, which were ordered quite a while before. We were hoping to be on to a glass of wine by the time the food came out so it felt a bit strange. Given the cost of drinks in these swanky places, you'd expect the business model to be getting them out as quickly as possible so that you get through them quicker and part with even more moolah! My local curry house adopts this strategy by getting us hammered before we've even ordered the food and they do very well out of us. Happy to offer a consultancy service to Sushi Samba if they're reading this. Despite the drinks thing, it was a lovely meal and the food was really great - not to mention the views across town. Even if you don't like fish - this is worth a try.

title: What a view!
comment: Total fluke getting in here for an early Friday lunch without a reservation. Stunning venue, stunning view, and stunning food. Staff are really welcoming and warm and introducing themselves by name is a lovely touch. Oh and the Lychee Cooler was to do die for!

title: Amazing view with delicious food and cocktails for a special occasion
comment: I went here with 2 friends, as a birthday present for one of them. The view is amazing, although taking the glass lift to the 38th floor is pretty scary; it goes pretty fast so feels a bit like a theme park ride! The restaurant is great, with friendly and attentive staff who explain the menu in advance - although the guy spoke so fast none of us had any idea what he said! 2 of us shared salt & pepper squid - best I've had, shrimp tempura - also amazing but not at all what we expected as the shrimps are covered in the mayo and vinaigrette rather than the sauce being served on the side and samba london - a selection of 8 sushi rolls. These were beautifully presented and all wrapped in brightly coloured seaweed. Our veggie friend had the veggie maki and eggplant robata - we ordered an extra plate of this as it was so delicious us meat eaters wanted to eat some too. Desserts were also nice and very well presented. We shared the organic red chocolate chili peppers and passion fruit cake - which came with a candle and Happy Birthday message on it. This was a lovely gesture as we'd only mentioned when we arrived that we were there to celebrate a birthday. We also had 2 cocktails each - the sambatini; their monthly special which in July was blend of sake and strawberries. We all enjoyed this. Then I had chucumber as I'm a G&T fan, while the other 2 chose different ones. After this we decided to have a drink in the Tree Bar outside. Again, very lovely although not such a great view due to the high plants around the seats. What ruined it slightly was each being charged service for a drink we ordered, paid for and collected from the bar. We all thought this was rather cheeky and a bit of a rip off! In summary, Sushi Samba is definitely worth the visit for a special occasion but be prepared for the cost and added extras!

title: Always a pleasure to come back
comment: Starting with cocktails on the terrace, we chose to try the menu and it was very good, as were the wine pairings. Extremely professional staff. The evening couldn't be faulted.

title: Surprise
comment: Have heard a lot about sushisamba  Without really knowing about the concept. Must say what a great experince. Great food with a mix of a lot of tastes and cultures. Great service  The view over London by Night is amasing. Only slight negative thing was the music it was to loud.

title: An attempted visit
comment: Visited sushi samba last night expecting a lovely night with my boyfriend. Got there, in the queue in front there were a variety of girls dressed in lots of styles, bouncer picked me from the queue (I was about 5 girls back) said I wouldn't be allowed access in flip flops - I was wearing backed sandals - I was then asked to leave the queue. The group ahead of me all looked to their feet in shock as they were standing in similar sandals, converse trainers and pumps. Here's the place to go to be assessed and misjudged before walking through the door. Disgraceful (not to mention mortifying).

title: Amazing!
comment: The food and the view were amazing! Definitely prefer sushisamba over duck and waffle. The food is amazing and they even cater to vegetarians !

title: Over Rated
comment: Average quality food. Only views are good otherwise nothing special. Over priced keeping in mind overall quality. Several other Pan Asian restaurants are much better in quality and price. Good for one visit for a drink on the terrace. Restaurant very average not worth the money spent. Wine variety very limited and too expensive.

title: Fantastic!
comment: Views - Sushi Samba is on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower and the glass lift is not for the faint hearted! The outside bar is a highlight for warm summer nights and the cocktails are up there with the best in the City.  Food - It's a fusion of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian and it far surpassed my expectations. We let our waiter choose a selection of dishes and we were not disappointed! Each one was utterly delicious. We had a huge selection of dishes and, of those, I highly recommend the following: Shrimp Tempura / Crispy Taquitos / Black Cod with Peruvian Corn (standout dish) / Poussin Teriyaki / Tiger Maki Rolls / Tokyo Sky Tree Rolls.  The desserts are also of a very high standard and were the perfect end to our meal. I recommend the banana chocolate cake pictured below. It was heavenly and of all the desserts I sampled was the standout. Drinks - The wine list is extensive and the waiting team ensure that your glass is always full, but not in a pushy manner. As I mentioned above, the cocktails are as good as you would expect from a high end restaurant / cocktail bar. You will pay circa. £12 per cocktail which is standard in London. Wine and champagne prices vary vastly as per any high end restaurant. Service - The waiting staff are excellent. Friendly and helpful. We were served by Adam who was absolutely great. Be warned - this place is popular and they will turn your table in 2 hours so don't expect to linger for longer. When the 2 hours is up your bill will be presented to you (as politely as it is possible to be given that you are being moved on) and you can move to one of the two buzzy terraces with your drinks should you wish to carry on. Price - Yes, it's expensive, but you get what you pay for and you won't feel at all cheated given the quality and culinary craftsmanship served up here. All in all a great evening.

title: The place to be... If you're someone who needs to be seen
comment: It's the standard scene to be seen. The elevator up is fast and gives a semi decent view but then you get to the restaurant/bar floor and there's not really a view. It's free to go up though if you want a drink. A 330ml asahi beer is £7, and out in the balcony bar area is full of people in suits smoking. Seriously, smokers everywhere.  It's an ok place, we didn't get food but I'm sure it's good. Just make sure all the other suits can see you eating it's it shows off your wealth.   This is not a chill out place for anyone with a personality, it's a post work crowd where everyone is trying to outdo each other. If that's your thing you'll love it, if not I recommend a normal pub for a reasonable drink at a reasonable price.

title: 12.5% service for no service
comment: Great venue and views but outrageous to charge 12.5% service to hand me a drink at the bar without even pouring it?! Lack of seating. Not impressed. Didn't live up to the hype......

title: WOW
comment: I was in this place last Sunday evening for the first time. What can I say...you pay for you get. If you want cheap you don't even come to London! Great atmosphere, nice people and I will go back soon as I can.

title: A Scene
comment: Nice views of London and a great place to watch people. Probably more about a scene than it is about the food and the dining experience. The waiters are really lovely and the service is good. I almost felt like we were being rushed to get the next cover to our table. If you want to potentially run into a WAG or a football player, come here for the that.

title: Underwhelming, overpriced and pretentious.
comment: I was pumped to visit this place knowing its premium location and reputation. I was lucky enough to visit for my birthday celebration on my first visit and really didn't find any of the food to be outstanding let alone memorable. Furthermore, drink prices given its location in the Heron Tower are astronomical. I do like the outside bar area but the views from SushiSamba are not all great on the inside unless you are lucky with seating. On my second visit, I just popped by for drinks but found the crowd to be way too formal for my liking. I've visited Sushisamba in the states and much prefer it there. It began as a simple restaurant serving amazing food but unfortunately it parades itself around as a largely overpriced, pretentious restaurant in a prime location near Liverpool Street in London just because it can. Avoid, and go somewhere else where snooty service, tiny portions and insane prices don't overshadow the food served.

title: This visit was a disappointment
comment: We have loved every visit to sushisamba over the last few years, but our last one was truly disappointing. The food was under average at best, which had so far been really good, And the ambiance lacked cheer, was rather pretentious actually.

title: Great food and great ambience
comment: We went to sushisamba for lunch as part of reunion and the food didnt disappoint. The quality of sushi was to die for and the size of them is big. We orderred hand roll, nigiri sushi and 3 extra rolls to share.  The view of the restaurant was great as well as you are on the 38th floor overlooking the city. There are a couple of bars where you can order very nice drinks, however, we didnt really use them.  The only critism I had was the speed our nirigi was delivered. We had to wait for a good 40 mins and we finished all other dishes before those nigiri sushi arrived - at which point we were almost full. I would have enjoyed those gorgeous nigiri sushi more if they came first. Price wise, slightly on the expansive side but hey, thats what you pay for the great view and good service. Ovearll, highly recommending this place and I will come back for dinner (as I heard atmosphere is even better in the evening) soon!

title: In a London Sky Japan Sushi!
comment: When you arrive to Sushi Samba you find a very careful detail place with a very greay staff and nice views. We was taking Smoked Plum Negroni, perfect Bloody Mary not spice, Don Julio shots and Yuzu Gin Fizz. The Yuzu one was our choice but after we was speaking with Luis, bartender come from Peru, he recommended us the Smoke one and he was amazing with the suggestion. Great place a little bit expensive. ;-)

title: Amazing food and fantastic views
comment: We went here as a birthday treat for me and we were NOT dissapointed!!!!! My other half was worried about the dress code but as we had a reservation we by passed the queue that was already forming. Downstairs there is a gentleman with a reservation list as well as letting people into the bar area without prior booking. Once you step into the building there is a security guard for bag checking and patting down gentleman. Then you are sent into the very fast lift all the way up to the 38th floor for the restaurant.  The food is fantastic and the views are stunning! We had a perfect evening temperature wise but they also handed out fleece blankets which was fantastic. The food was orgasmic and I highly recommend the mushrooms! The cocktails are also fantastic! We will be back soon.

title: Favourite restaurant
comment: My second visit was Sunday and I would go there everyday if I could. All staff are so friendly and attentive. Food is beautifully presented and tastes fantastic! We got sat at a table with the best views. Food service is quick and such an amazing atmosphere

title: Cocktails for a fancy night out
comment: Great views on the 40th floor over London city district. The cocktails are fantastic although pricy and very nice in summer to be outside.

title: It does worth it!
comment: I read a lot about Sushisamba before booking a table for 2. So many people were complaining about the prices and the staff that I was cautious. But curious as well. When we arrived downstairs, we were cheerfully welcomed and accessed the rooftop, being taken in charge by a hostess. Our table was not ready yet (it was 9.50 pm and we were supposed to seat at 10pm) so we had a quick tour on the crowdy terrace (no surprise, Friday night )). When we came back to the bar, another hostess came to us and drove us to our table, as required, by the window. Perfect timing for a perfect place. We ordered Kobe beef in raviolis, sushis and see food, and everything was perfect. Then, I decided to have some sake. The wine waitress came to me as the one I had ordered was unavailable, and she advised me very gently on other choices. I appreciated that she made the move, and I consider this attention as very professional. The bill was what I was supposed to pay, no problem. What do some people expect? come, drink and dine in this place for nothing? The products are really fresh, home prepared, and there is plenty of staff to take care of the business, so, that's not surprising. And the staff was very nice, should I mention it for the ones who complained about it. As a result, we spent a wonderful evening and we will come back again next time we come to London. Don't hesitate, it's worth it! Frédéric

title: Very expensive but exquisite to try
comment: This is a very interesting food fusion and though at the very top end of pricing it is worth it for the experience. They have beautiful fois gras ceviche and lobster taqueros ( tiny lobster tacos - you only get two ) and excellent Kobe beef. The toro and sake nigiri were melt In the mouth. The samba London rode was beautiful. The white wine went perfectly with the meal. As it was our anniversary we were given free macaroons which was lovely and the service was top notch. The cocktails were around £14 a pop and though my smoked plum negroni was stunning, the batida de mango was a bit gross . Over all an unforgettable evening !

title: DSLR photographers not welcome here!
comment: Sushisamba is based in the City of London at the top of one of the tall sky scrapers. It has spectacular views over London and is one of the reasons why people go there. I was taken there by my daugher as a belated Father's Day present. If I am out and about I tend to take my camera with me. Being on the 35th floor on a clear day was too much of a draw, so while waiting at the bar for some drinks I took some family photographs and some out of the window. I was told to put my camera away, "You are not allowed to use a DLSR camera here". I questioned why, but did not get any sensible reason, I can only assume that there is a perception of a security risk as you are looking over the City of London, It took the edge off of the lunch. Ironically I was allowed to use an iPhone 6S to take images, and probably ended up with larger and more detailed images as I took panorama's. Whatever idiot came up with the idea of stopping people from using DSLR's should also stop compact camera's and phones if there is truly a security risk (which I doubt). Many cameras carry similar resolutions to DLSR's.  Getting to the food and ambience, it is a pleasant enough place with good food at outrageous prices. Three of us had what can be best described as a light lunch with drinks which carried a price of £127.69. Staff are very attentive, and if you are not careful, drinks that have not been completely consumed are removed and then you are asked if you want another one. Judging from the lunch time clientele it appears to be more of a business venue for the city rather than casual dining. I expect if I was on expenses it would be on my favourites list as well. For me, there are much better Japanese Sushi restaurants in London with more reasonable prices.

title: Can't wait to go back!
comment: I was a little apprehensive about this place as my girlfriend recommended it and I know she loves pretentious places full of tools but I asked her and she chose here so I went.  And Im really glad I visited this place, the location is amazing, the view from the restaurant was spectacular. We were seated at our table overlooking London and almost every single waiter introduced themselves. We had the pleasure of being served mainly by Vlasta, he was brilliant at his job. Very friendly, very attentive and a really nice guy to talk too. As usual I ordered about 7 different things to my self, the scallops, wagu beef, some other raw fish, octopus and some other stuff. The Mrs had blackened cod and a mushroom dish. All the food was 10/10 especially the blackened cod which is highly recommend to every human being who eats there. It was cod on a skewer marinated and cooked in this sweet sauce on a BBQ or something, I don't know how else to describe it honestly but you must try it! We honestly loved it here, couldn't of asked for a better afternoon. I would recommend this place to any one for a special occasion, it's not cheap but it's worth every penny I promise you.

title: Nice drink on a rooftop
comment: The list of cocktails is not big but very fancy and it is a paradise for Gin's fan. It is always windy and full of people. You have to book almost 2 months in advance to eat. The food is not worth it and the view is not the best in London, but the ambiance make it really nice

title: Great location but!
comment: With some friends we had a drink and meal last night. The location cannot be faulted, especially on a warm sunny summer evening. The bar area was busy at first but thinned out after a while as people drifted off to eat or go on elsewhere. One downside though was the wait. We had a table booked for 7.45pm but didn't get seated until 8.20pm. It seems that waits are not uncommon, so don't go there if you want prompt seating. The food was excellent and not overpriced, unless you chose the beef. The staff helpful and polite. The biggest disappointment though was the price of drinks. Even allowing for the location £7.50 for a small 33cl bottle of beer is well over the top. The wine list also top heavy with seriously priced wines, fine perhaps for a special occasion, but for a night out with friends excessive. We initially chose a white from the lower price range (£45) and were very disappointed with it. The saki though was a real treat. One final gripe - the piped music, which was not only loud but heavy on beat, which made having a conversation difficult. To be honest, I am not sure that I would return.

title: Rude security staff
comment: I visited sushi samba for the first time with a friend at the weekend. The building / setting was amazing. However very let down by a number of things. It was full of tourists, it was absolutely packed so you couldn't move! This place would do a lot better if they made it more exclusive , instead of packing it out which looses appeal quickly.  Bar man was making a cocktail , it looked absolutely awful, he also had a very bad attitude towards people he was serving. Someone asked for a raspberry cocktail he made the wrong one, so they asked again, he literally threw the raspberries in and mashed them up a bit then pushed the drinks aggressively back at the couple. We managed to get sat outside but shortly left after one drink as my friend kept getting sat on by others due to the amount of people in there.  Security staff stood so close to us, it was as if we were ghosts, one even stood between us when we were having a conversation! Rude security staff upstairs  Staff downstairs at the door were lovely.  Not sure I would come back, the setting was good, but they really do need to make this place a little more exclusive instead of packing it out

title: Fantastic food awesome location
comment: The location is stunning with breathtaking views over the City of London. There is an extensive menu which is fit for Shushisa foodies, all wrapped up with excellent service

title: Amazing Anniversary in an Amazing Restaurant!
comment: I have been to Sushi Samba a number of times and have to say they have consistently been 10/10 on every visit. The Location is beautiful, with the best view of London. The food, service and atmosphere are beyond exceptional, and I couldnt fault them in anyway.  I would personally like to thank Oto, who has always gone out of his way to look after us when we visit, and this time was no exception. He made the effort to check on us and make sure our anniversary celebration was the best it could be. My wife and I could not praise him enough, as he is definitely a big asset to Sushi Samba!  A fantastic evening in my one of my favourite restaurants. You cant go wrong with Sushi Samba!

title: Lovely food and Venue
comment: SushiSamba is a lovely restaurant on 38th floor of Heron Towers in the City of London. Service is very good and the waiters were all very pleasant and were quite happy to explain menu and recommend dishes and quantities if you were a new diner. The restaurant was very busy and bustling and had a young fun atmosphere. The views over London were spectacular with outdoor patio areas for drinks before meal. Prices were very reasonable, particularly if you choose the sushi rolls.

title: The best sushi ever!
comment: The best sushi I have ever tried. In the mix of different flavours in a huramaki you can taste each of them one after the other. The quantity is not huge, but also not too small and the quality is very high. The service is very good even if sometimes they are a little bit importunate. It is not cheap at all but it is worth!

title: Terribly poor service at somewhere I used to enjoy going
comment: Yesterday I went to sushi samba with a few friends and for the first time I was completely appalled by the service we received there. As it was a hot day & I anticipated that the bar would be busy I made sure I called beforehand to ask if there was space & to check if we were dressed appropriately. The lovely lady confirmed that we were welcome to come & confirmed that the dress code (as it was a weekend & I usually go to SS on weekdays for business lunches or meetings) is "casual elegant" & as long as we weren't wearing ripped jeans it was ok. When we got to the door it was obvious that the doormen & the lady over the phone has different dress code guidelines as all of a sudden my friend who was wearing sandals with one strap couldn't get in as her footwear was supposedly "inappropriate" (despite seeing people leaving & within SS in Tom's espadrilles, sandals, trainers, hiking shoes to name a few). And there began an evening of terrible service. Our waitress was rude, obnoxious, aggressive and menacing. I am unsure on whether it was racially fuelled or she's was going through personal problems & taking it out on work. But quite frankly her attitude was absolutely disgusting. We addressed it to the bar manager & although he apologised, the waitress refused to apologise & was completely insolent. Which is a quite sad because I used to really like sushi samba before this experience. As you can see from my other reviews I don't tend to write unwarranted bad reviews, however I was so shocked at the service (or lack there of) we received. I frequent high end & michelin starred establishments regularly and have never been treated with such insolence. Although sushi samba is not Michelin starred its still on the above average price range & they shouldn't have people that racially profile customers or lack basic customer service skills working for them

title: Brilluant
comment: Had a lovely lunch at sushisamba, the views are incredible!! I was concerned before we went that the portions would be really small and you would need a lot of plates - that's not the case at all, there were 3 of us and we shared all the plates we ordered no problem.  Lovely cocktails and wine. The service was spot on  Would definitely recommend

title: Lovely views
comment: Visited Sushisamba yesterday with my friends, it was a lovely location as you go up in the lift over London. But the bar itself is actually very small, best for smaller groups of people! Cocktails were good but pricey but that's expected!  Only thing I didn't like was on the menu the service charge is not shown but when you go to pay, service charge is already added onto the bill, meaning you think your paying one price but you actually are paying more.

title: Great sushi great decor great London vibe
comment: As soon as you enter sushi samba after your speedy elevator ride you know that you that your in a top London venue. The atmosphere is vibrant & stylish. The backdrop of London skyline & buzz is endorsed through the huge panoramic windows.  The sushi is fabulous. I suggest for sushi novices you let the staff choose so that you enjoy the full experience.  The Resturant area is chic & comfortable. At £75 per head.  For £50 per head you can eat sushi in the other areas that are the bar & seated area from where you can observe the London skyline.  The outside bar area even though buzzy is too small and can feel a little claustrophobic. Cocktails are tasty and dangerously moorish.  Overall a good London venue at London prices.

title: Delicious cocktails
comment: The cocktails were amazing- the service was a little slow but other than that I had a wonderful evening with a fantastic view!

title: Drinks on the Terrace
comment: Sushi Samba has the most amazing views. The staff are very helpful and the cocktails are yummy but quite expensive at £14 a pop. Nice for a special treat and worth it for the stunning views.

title: 1st Anniversary
comment: Special occasion for us and the team were excellent.  We arrived 15 min early our table at the window was ready for us. The drinks menu is massive. The location is across the road from Liverpool St. The restaurant is at the top of the Heron tower...the view is beautiful. The bar with the tree in the middle is really cool. I would recommend booking at table to watch the sunset!  The staff were extremely attentive and helpful.

title: AAAAAAAA-MAZING!!!!
comment: Places have a lot of hype - most of them do not live up to it. Whatever SushiSamba's hype is - it is under-rated! Food - EXCELLENT! Drinks - EXCELLENT! Service - FLAWLESS! Next time in London, I will be visiting again - I owe it to myself!

title: Excellent food with a fantastic view
comment: Me and my husband went to Sushisamba to celebrate our ten year anniversary. Although my husband is scared of heights he ventured up and survived the thrilling elevator ride. Although we did take the service elevator down ;) We arrived one hour early to enjoy the great and tasty cocktails. The cocktails where great but maybe a little bit to sweet for my taste. When seated we asked for a table away from the view. And we got a great table in the middle of the room and my husband could look towards the area where the chefs and personnel prepared the food.  We decided to splash out and eat whatever we wanted from the exciting and diverse menu. We ate both sashimi kobe beef and other wagyu on a hot rock. Chicken hearts and fish tacos. Mochi ice cream and more drinks. Everything tasted amazing and we're so happy that we went to Sushisamba.  We highly recommend Sushisamba even though you are afraid of heights. The staff is really friendly and the service was superb!

title: Beat all my expectations!
comment: My boyfriend surprised me and took me to Sushi Samba on Sunday just gone, and I can’t even explain how amazing the experience was. From the moment you go in the lift on your journey to the 38th Floor from the moment you come down, it’s wonderful. All staff members were really friendly, extremely helpful and went above and beyond for their guests. We asked our waiter to recommend us our dishes for dinner, moments later we had exquisite dishes laid in front of us. More beautiful dishes came to follow, with our waiter always checking if we are ok, enjoying our meal and whenever we were full to say. His recommendations were divine, I can’t even say my favourite dish as they were all as specular as each other. We had the SHRIMP TEMPURA, CRISPY TAQUITOS YELLOWTAIL, SEASONAL VEGETABLE TEMPURA, BLACK COD, SÃO PAULO all magnificent. We were celebrating a anniversary and have already said we will go back for our next one. We were lucky enough to sit outside, at around 7pm so we had a magnificent view of London and sunset, it was just beyond amazing. The food, the view, the staff, it’s the ultimate experience!

title: Views are unparalleled!
comment: We went last night with our two children ages 11, 15. We were offered a table on the terrace and declined thinking it would be too hot, however there was no sun on that side of the building and we should have taken it!!! The whole restaurant is glass and it was HOT inside until the pulled the shades down. Once they pulled them down it was so lovely. Service was great. MUST ORDER BLACK COD with miso. It was the single best dish. I also enjoyed the yellowtail with jalapeño and lemongrass - clean and fresh. Did not care for the deconstructed English breakfast or the shrimp tempura or the coffee flakes over chocolate ganache. The flakes stuck to the back of your teeth ( there was so much ) and was really flavorless. should have just been the ganache and nuts. would have been much better. The shrimp tempura was soggy with too much mayo sauce on it. The vegetable tempura we saw at other tables looked a lot better. Very light and crispy. All of the cocktails looked very pretty even though we did not order any this trip. Attention to presentation is important here. All in all recommend if you are ok with the travel from central London. Took us about 37 min by taxi $$$$

title: Awful place
comment: Dreadful experience. Ridiculous prices and under par drinks (the G&T was flat).  I'd like to understand why places like this think it's OK to add 12.5% 'service charge' to a bar bill. The barman has poured out a drink - he has not spent a couple of hours waiting the table, coming and going from the kitchen, or anything similar. So why are we effectively tipping him 12.5%? When we went through to the restaurant to eat, the waiter's opening gambit was: 'Do you have any allergies?' I was tempted to answer: 'Yes, strong irritation to obnoxious, overpriced restaurants that rip their customers off'. Won't be going back.

title: Birthday dinner
comment: We went to celebrate a birthday. We were a group of 14 people. The food was good but the service very slow. It looked like the waiters didn't know what they were doing. I appreciate that we were a large group but they knew that and we had one waiter serving us. Also today was the hottest day of the year and it was like a sauna. Very unpleasant to eat while being so hot.

title: Lovely location, great views. Shocking service!
comment: The views and outside bar was beautiful, however the staff looked down their nose at us... when they eventually got round to serving us. When we asked to not pay the service charge, the cheeky bold headed waiter tried to give me £5 instead of £15. Would not recommend.

title: Great experience, good food, fab location and views
comment: We had lunch here on Monday afternoon. The lift up to the 38th floor is an experience in itself! It really does just take off! We were warmly greeted and shown to our seats in the restaurant. It is beautifully decorated and the views are just stunning. Unfortunately the weather wasn't nice enough to go outdoors but the outdoor areas looked great. We shared some taquitos which were my highlight, gyoza, a kobe slider and then opted for 3 types of nigiri sushi and California rolls. All of the food was delicious and really couldn't be faulted. A few things, however, weren't great. I felt that our waiter was a bit overbearing and was very keen to upsell to us the whole time. Also the room was unbearably hot. The other thing was the cost of the food - nearly £100 for the food and two small glasses of wine. They had added in a 12.5% service charge which I thought was steep for a quick lunch for two people. The views are definitely worth the journey up in the lift and I am glad we went to check it out but I felt we could have had better food and service elsewhere for the money we spent.

title: Day out
comment: Just a day out this place can be expensive but it very good we will be going there again it is on the 34 floor and it has a roof garden to chill and enjoy a Cocktail enjoy.

title: Lovely Food, Amazing Location and Views
comment: Visited SushiSamba a couple of weeks ago with friends, my friend had quite a hard time getting in so I had high hopes. First impressions the door staff are a little power hungry, my friend stood next to the doorman and he made her move one step to the right which seemed really petty. The thing that hits you more than anything is the amazing views, these really are spectacular of our great City. We proceeded up to the bar as we were a little early for our dinner reservation, our Husband's ordered the drinks and both said the man serving was very offish bordering rude. We went out on to the terrace which was a little chilly but they have big patio heaters that do the trick. When it was time for our table, we were about to be shown to the table when they realised they had given it to someone else so we had to wait a few minutes for another one, no really biggy. Once we got to the table, again the views amazing, and this restaurant was heaving. We ordered drinks and all opted for the tasting menu at £100 per person. Each dish arrived swiftly and the food was beautiful. Little dishes each consisting of all different delicacies. If you liked a particular dish you could have them bring you another one. When you see how small the dishes are you think you will never get full, but you do. The only weird thing I would say is on a couple of the dishes there were only 3 pieces on the plate, and there were 4 of us, strange. The service was really good and our waiter was very friendly, made up for some of the other staff who weren't quite as friendly. This is a restaurant for some who may want to visit on a special occasion, this is not a cheap restaurant by any means so take plenty of money. I would still visit SushiSamba again, but with so many other wonderful restaurants in London to try, I probably never will, but that's not too say I didn't enjoy it.

title: Excellent Japanese-Latin cuisine with panoramic view of London
comment: If you are expecting typical or traditional Japanese cuisine , this is not the Place . If you want Japanese type cuisine With a Latin twist - this is THE place . The decor is bright , creative and colourful - orange splashes and a great autumn tree in near the bar. The dining hall has bamboo bent overhead.  Service is very friendly , menu is explained simply . Florian guided us and persuaded us to try the Omakase menu - about £65 per person - bit pricey but a very good selection , adequate quantity and good Combination of menu items .  The sushis are very tasty with different seasonings. Teriyaki chicken is tangy , sour and tender . The cod is simply fresh , soft and full of flavour . Each item is presented very thoughtfully and nice to just admire before you eat it. Drinks selection is very good as well . Worth a visit at night too especially to see the city all lit up .

title: Enjoyable 1st time....
comment: I booked a table of 8 to celebrate my daughter's graduation, and it was the perfect spot for such an occasion. Very loud and lively, I suppose you could say hip and trendy. I was amazed at just how busy the place was as early as 7pm. An outside cocktail bar on the 38th floor is an odd experience but yet more proof of how 'happening' London is. We were very pleased with the food as the menu was difficult to figure out, so I asked the very helpful waiter to serve us a variety based upon a fixed price per head, and it worked perfectly. We had more than enough food and a very good mix of different stuff both hot and cold, meat and fish. Drinks were reasonably priced for London and although they told us on booking we had to vacate the table after 2 hours, we stayed much longer and were never bothered. All In all, a very memorable night, which was always our hope, and the friendly efficient staff helped make it happen. On reflection, leaving the choice to the waiter was a good move as I had no idea what was what and didn't want to spend all evening debating around a table of 8, what to choose.

title: Does it live up to the hype? YES YES YES!
comment: Had been keen to try our SUSHISAMBA for some time, so when I booked recently I was hoping it wouldn't be an anticlimax. I needn't have worried - everything about the experience was spot-on (and I genuinely mean practically perfect). The setting for one thing is mind-boggling - a view across London that takes your breath away. There's only one thing that beats it, and that's the menu. The Brazilian, Peruvian and Japanese elements combine in a tour de force of exciting and exotic dishes, and each was as tasty as the last. I can't recommend the scallop seviche enough (melt-in-the-mouth is an overused cliche but I'm going to apply it anyway), and the lamb chops soaked in miso just exuded bursts of the best umami flavour I've encountered. The sea bass tempura was as tasty as it was beautiful, and I've never had California Rolls that had so much intricate detail, and combined so well. But the star dish was the black cod skewers - sticky, caramelised, and falling apart in pearly white flakes. Also important to mention the staff were incredible - friendly, warm, and oh so helpful (our waiter Yannick was a dream.) Whether it's a special occasion, a chance to experience incredible food, or just to fall in love with London some more, a visit to SUSHISAMBA is a must!

title: Great sushi great drinks
comment: As expected the food and drinks are pricey, but its definitely worth the splurge (even just to go for one drink). The views of London are amazing at night!

title: Birthday treat
comment: Spectacular setting, very attentive staff, unhurried and delicious food. Not cheap, however, the service, outlook over London and quality of food provide the value

title: Quite enjoyable overall
comment: The food was very nice however not phenomenal for the very high price tag which was a bit disappointing. Sushi rolls with 6/8 pieces costing around £16 and tasting good but not amazing was a bit of a let down. Went to look at another part of the restaurant and we had the concierge run after us and escort us out as we did not have a reservation at ' that part of the restaurant ' (but we did in another). Explaining we just wanted to have a look for future reference we were still asked to leave which just made the experience feel pretentious.

title: Excellent food in a spectacular setting
comment: The fast lift whizzed us up to the 38th floor in seconds, and the views all round were spectacular - looking down on the Gherkin next door, at the Olympic Park in the East, and so on. The bar was already getting busy at 5pm, so we went to our table in the very impressive restaurant - full height glass on 3 sides and a very funky bamboo and pendant ceiling assembly. We'd booked way in advance but the only available dinner slot for a Tuesday was 5pm... so book early - booking start 2 months in advance and I think it wise to get in fast! Service was helpful, prompt and polite - and almost a touch over the top - but no worries about being left without a drink.  We had a mix of Japanese and Peruvian food which worked well and was really superb. The barbecued Teriyaki style poussin was excellent, as was the Crispy Lobster Taquitos and the Shrimp Tempura. However having a Wagyu 1Kg Kobe beef on the menu for £1,000 seemed a bit daft and to me risked appealing to the ostentatious and usually noisy Bolly brigade I'd prefer to avoid. The choice of Sakis is massive and we enjoyed chatting through which ones to try - and loved the one we chose. Dessert was similarly spectacular. It sounds really expensive, but actually for 2 of us, with our choice of six dishes, dessert and Saki, and including service, it was £150. Not cheap, but for such excellent food in such spectacular surroundings, I'd say that's quite reasonable.

title: Excellent
comment: Constant excellent food ambience and service. I have been going to this place for a few years now and it has never disappointed me. Their menu is a mixed of Peruvian, Japanese and other cuisines so it is not only sushi.

title: Nice food and drinks
comment: I have been to Sushisamba the second time on a business trip. It is really amazing. The view over London is great. Food was served as flying buffet and of great taste and quality. Drinks were served as Japanese Beer which was quite good and Caipirinha. Since they had to produce a lot of Caipirinha during the evening, I think they adjusted the recipe (sugarsirup and lime juice instead of the real ingredients, only a slice of lime on top). But the taste was still great, served in a painted can it was a good drink.  I would return, but prices are London style of course.

title: A treat to remember
comment: Our daughters took us to SushiSamba as an anniversary treat. The views were amazing as you go up in the lift and from the bar area. We weren't sure what to order but the waiter helped make a good selection for us and all the courses were delicious. The prices were pretty high but quality and taste of food was great.

title: BREATHTAKING
comment: What a venue, glass lift, fantastic views across London and amazing food, we had a sampler menu for 4, not something we'd usually do, but with the expert help from our waiter, well worth doing

title: Lunch with family and friends
comment: Had a late lunch with my friend and her mum on a Monday afternoon. Really nice food and excellent service!  Very expensive, but it's worth it eating in the beautiful restaurant with panorama view over London.  Special thanks to our waiter (whose name I've unfortunately forgot) who put up with us even when we were a bit annoying!

title: Everything good except the sushi
comment: We were expecting outstanding sushi especially since the restaurant was named sushisamba. What we got was sushi that was wrapped in an amateurish manner. The rice was spilling out from the sides. Restaurant served the Dewa-zakura at reasonable price. Beautiful views of London. Service was excellent.

title: Great late night food
comment: Amazing venue - we booked a late night table as at a concert - food was amazing cocktails were Devine - great view of the city and a buzzing atmosphere

title: Best Dining Experience in London
comment: This is an absolute MUST if you are going to London and are a sushi lover. Not only some of the best sushi we have ever had, but an all around amazing dining experience! Great views as you look over London. Excellent cocktails - try the cucumber cocktail with gin...it is AMAZING! It is a pricey dining experience, but worth every penny. Also, make reservations ASAP if you are planning a London trip. It books up fast!

title: Overcrowded
comment: Very crowded people cue for hours and if you have booked a table , waiters come to ask you when you leave ! :( I don't find this ok ...

title: Good but expensive food
comment: We went for lunch in SushiSamba on a Monday in July. Its located in the heart of London city on the 38th floor of the Sales Force tower and the stomach churning ride up in the glass elevator is spectacular. The glass walled room has 360 degree views of London. We ordered some small plates including yellowtail and avocado tacuitos, gyoza and a bite sizes kobe beef slider. The tacos were particularly amazing and I would happily have eaten a plate of these. The sushi followed, a California roll and a selection of Nigiri, like the rest of our food it was of a very high standard. However there were a few drawbacks, the room was too hot, the service was slightly heavy handed, up-selling etc. Our bill was £100 for a relatively small amount of food including a compulsory 12.5% service which was a bit much for a 45 minute lunch for 2 people. Lunch in a Michellen starred restaurant would be cheaper. Nice food but you are paying for the views.

title: Excellent delicate dishes
comment: I met a client here for lunch a few weeks ago. Was slightly intimidated by trying to help them navigate the menu! No need the excellent staff suggested we left it to them, after answering a few questions a succession of well balanced delicate dishes which were beautifully presented arrived! Took all the stress out if it and allowed much greater time for discussion. Great view from outward facing window table! Reasonably priced considering too! Will certainly go again!

title: Samba family experience
comment: Lovely experience at Sushisamba on a "thank you" meal my brother and his wife treated my mum and I to. From the security on ground floor, to lift up, seating staff, waiters and chef's to the food presentation, taste, choice and quality, it was definitely a treat to remember. Not to forget of course the amazing views up there.  We ordered pretty much half the menu and each dish was divine; my fav being the Samba London and salt and pepper squid. Despite this I still couldn't help getting food envy when our neighbouring tables were served the dishes we hadn't ordered! We had main, a bottle of rose for dinner, desserts and expresso martinis to finish off. Our waiters IGNACIO JAKUB were excellent, recommended lots, answered our questions and provided great service with a smile. My mum isn't great using chop sticks so our waiter kindly got the easy chopsticks (a mini tong like utensil usually used by children, made from plastic, flattened with grip midway and joined at one end making it easier to grip and hold the food), she wasn't made to feel uncomfortable and was able to join the rest of us. Overall lovely food, staff, atmosphere, experience. Although I didn't pay I was aware how pricey it was and can honestly say you get the quality you pay for and would 100% recommend.

title: Amazing views! Average food!
comment: With fabulous views of London over the setting sun; the set up was magical! But alas the food failed to live up to the standards! Didn't enjoy it at all. For a vegetarian all the different dishes tasted the same and very less variety!  But we enjoyed the beautiful setting ! eps the bar ard the tree!  go for the ambience and the drinks!

title: Average Food, View is great but there are other places better to go
comment: This is the second time we had dined here and the first time was much better, the food was good but so it should be for the price. Had to wait a long time for the main course to come. If its a great view you want dine at the shard

title: Amazing food, fantastic view
comment: Tries 5 dishes all of them great. The service is very attentive. All the dishes are to share and I appreciated that they served them in the "right order" not simply when they were ready. Booking is essential. You should really try this.

title: Great restaurant let down by very poor bar service
comment: Came here for a work dinner. Food was interestingly presented, highly original and delicious. The service in the restaurant was also excellent, friendly and punctual. The views across London as the sun went down are to die for, but unlike other restaurants in similar locations you never felt that that this was more important than the food.  What let the whole place down was the appalling service in the outside bar. Upon arrival we headed outside for an aperitif before dinner. 15 minutes later we were still standing there waiting. What made it far worse was the unwillingness of the barman to acknowledge us or make any concession to the fact that there were paying customers waiting for a long time. How hard would it to say "I'll be with you in a minute sir" or "I am sorry for the wait". Instead he wandered around at a snails pace seemingly spending hours crushing ice or talking to his colleagues. When he finally deigned to serve us, we were informed of this privilege by the merest nod of his head in our direction and a raised eyebrow. The order was duly taken, served (5 minutes later) and paid for without him uttering a single syllable. Perhaps he is mute and therefore I am being unfair. As it was we were left with the impression of a supercilious oaf, who clearly felt he was far too cool to bother with anything remotely resembling manners or service.  Such a shame because everything else was 10 out of 10.

title: Great location. Impressive food
comment: This is clearly a place where appearances matter. Typically in such a place you would expect the food to be second best. Nonetheless I was very very pleasantly surprised. Food is truly innovative and different. The South American twist came through in all the dishes. Everything was exceptionally good. Coupled with the ambiance and the views, this makes for a very special place.
This is by far the best food I have ever eaten. You pay for what you get so don't expect cheap and cheerful but if you're willing to pay a little more you won't be disappointed.

title: Cool corporate gig
comment: Apart from being a bit hot at the venue, it was really good.  It was a corporate reception so perhaps not a true reflection on the normal dining experience but some really nice eclectic canapés paired with nice wine and saki. Staff friendly and of course a great view.  Prices on looked steep, but I wasn't paying .

title: Sushi with a view
comment: I've been to this restaurant a couple of time and I have to say that the views are the best it has to offer.  As you wait for the table on the bar lounge you can enjoy great views but the cocktails are overpriced and not very good. The food is a fusion of Japanese and Brazilian cuisine and I would say is pretty good but very expensive. Overall is a good experience both with friends or for couples. You must at least try it once.

title: Sensational food, fantastic views
comment: Window seat looking out over the city for a start - fantastic views. And then the food - we took advice from the waiter and had some stunning dishes - the taquitos were fantastic; the prawn tempura was so lightly battered that it just melted in your mouth with the lightest of mouthwatering crunches - stunning, had to reorder another portion of that! - some delicious samba rolls. Can't fault any of the food - all really delicious. And the staff too - really passionate about what they're serving and offering great advice. Best meal I've had in a while!

title: Had an unforgettable birthday dinner here - highly recommend
comment: Going to Sushisamba was a great experience - the escalator to get to the top is a cool start, views are incredible, really Ambient atmosphere and staff are friendly and accommodating. Although the potions are quite small, food was delicious. Nice to be able to go to the bar for drinks after dinner too... Also good for celebrity spotting!

title: Very good food! Bas service.
comment: Very good food good taste and quality, amazing!.... The service was quite bad by the host... Anyway after we were in our table waiter was extraordinary and the rest of the evening was great. Nice rooftop. I wil Come back.

title: Top location and amazing food!
comment: The location is pretty awesome. You need to book otherwise you wait long for the table. Very tasty and fresh food. The service was professional and quick. "Faultless" Watchout for the prices. Enjoy your experience!!

title: Amazing venue great food
comment: Came here for a private business event but sampled the incredible sushi, fantastic view and very funky decor. Lovely place to one too and a good open rooftop bar for a balmy London summer night.

title: Disappointing
comment: Good view but everything else between poor and average. Aloof staff. Drinks way overpriced! Loads of staff milling around doing naff all but nobody on the bar. Bizarre. Wouldn't believe the hype. Didn't eat so maybe that's worth it.

title: Great views but miserable bar staff
comment: Great views and nice outside space but miserable bar staff and you have a 12.5% service charge added to the drinks bill even if you go to the bar yourself!!

title: Amazing Views and Ambience, Delicious Food
comment: The views from the balcony were just WOW! Service was brilliant, as we had the mosty attentive waiter. The food was beautifully presented and all the dishes we had were really delicious. Everyone (3 of us), were really happy with our choices. Cost was a little above average as we paid just under £100 each, including drinks.

title: Amazing views, average food
comment: Visited Sushi Samba for my birthday recently. The heron tower is incredible and the views over London are amazing. The bar and outside area was beautiful and definitely nicer than the restaurant dining area. We love sushi and have eaten in every possible sushi restaurant we could have in London, and this one? It was okay. Food is really nothing special and ridiculously overpriced.  I don't want to say this was an overall awful experience, but it was hopelessly average. We arrived at 5.45 to fairly unpleasant and bored staff, that really did not seem happy to see their customers and really just didn't want to be there.  We ordered starters and then mains after, which we waited a very long time for. Considering we have a 2 hour table, we waited for food more than we actually ate, so much so, that we didn't have time to order dessert as our sitting was up. Not great service for a fancy restaurant.  The food was good, but not worth the price. The sushi was no better than anywhere else, which was disappointing.  It was a nice experience saved by the views, atmosphere and good cocktails. But if you are coming here to be blown away, expect to be disappointed. Would only recommend coming here for drinks and a few bites, not worth the overpriced dinner for average sushi.

title: Great food and view
comment: Authentic food in a good balance between Japanese and Brazilian cuisine. Ideal place for special occasions, the view is astonishing and the food sharing concept allows us to taste different dishes. Special like to the desert: "With love from Rio" is a surprising experience of velvet melting white chocolate and mousse inside with the right doses of chocolate intensity.

title: A one timer
comment: Sushi samba has beautiful views, quality food and a nice ambience to it. Its one of these restaurants u go to once. Their scallop ceviche is great. The black cod skewers are amazing and the makis are great as well but not the best ive tried. The bloody mary on the 38th with wasabi instead of hot sauce is one of the best ive tried. However i must say and agree with a lot of other reviewers that tht staff that take you in are a bit arrogant and ur table is never ready until the last minute of ur exact booking.

title: Best place for sushi in London
comment: I had a great time here with friends. The ride up was beautiful. The restaurant is high up with lovely views of the city. They have a great patio with heaters and fire pits. The service was attentive. Their food was well thought out and the flavours were on point. We ordered a variety of things and the price wasn't too bad considering they have waygu for €1000 per portion. I would definitely recommend the cod and yellowtail with truffle. There were other dishes but those two were just spectacular. Will definitely come back.

title: Great food with amazing views!
comment: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and although the only reservation we could get on a Friday night was at 11pm it was well worth it! The views are breath-taking and the food is delicious! Would definitely recommend celebrating a special occasion here!

title: Fabulous Food, Disappointing Experience
comment: This is a very trendy, lively Sushi Restaurant, where the food is fabulous, although the portions are small and expensive, with fabulous views, although for me, facing the less picturesque side of the City, unless you go out on the terrace to see The Shard etc. The service was reasonable, but with quite fluctuating periods of time between getting food before drinks, long pauses with no food and then a hurrying service, denying us coffees as they wanted to table back, and directing us to the bar area. We felt that they took our £400 and wanted to throw us out as quickly as possible and really weren't bothered where too!!! We did sit outside round the fire pit, but the bar was not open outside, the seating was all wet and dishevelled and just very underwhelming, not a very nice ending to our evening. I had mentioned on our internet booking, and over the telephone that this was a birthday celebration, but they did noting to celebrate this event. They appeared to do Happy Birthday plates for other tables, but they obviously forgot us! All four of us agreed that the restaurant experience was nice, but would not return again. Such a shame.

title: the view alone is worth it!
comment: It was a rainy day in London (surprise) and this place was recommended by a business acquaintance I had me earlier that day. Conveniently located near the Liverpool Street underground station. Japanese/Peruvian/Brasilian fusion sounded interesting and this place amazingly pulls it off. We can highly recommend the Salt and pepper squid, Black cod robata and the taquitos. Make sure you request a seat by the window.

title: Not quite what I expected
comment: After reading all the reviews suggesting this was almost a fine dining experience I managed to book a table for a special anniversary. Booking is not that convenient and tables seem to be reserved a long time in advance. The view from this 38th floor restaurant over London is tremendous and the staff were helpful and knowledgeable. Service was generally quick although there was one prolonged gap between plates that should not have happened. We felt the food was good but not exceptional and the atmosphere was noisy and a bit cramped. The recommended sake was extremely good. Overall this was a lot more casual than the reviews, and the restaurant website, would suggest and for that reason I would not go there it if you were looking for a special evening out.  Go for the view though, but that should not be what a restaurant is best-known for!

title: Sushi at Great Heights
comment: Fabulous venue and gorgeous selection of sushi and drinks. Outdoor space and fabulous views of London town.

title: Sushi Fusion
comment: Really fresh sushi, imaginative fusion of Sushi and South American food. The amazing food and a killer view does comes at a price though. Definitley should try the Black cod and Lamb Chops

title: Frustating experience getting in due to rude bouncer
comment: Bouncers refuse to let us in at the rooftop terrace because I was wearing New Balance sneaker and they have a "smart casual" dress code. The guy was very rude & arogant. In front of us a few guys got in wearing shorts :))) So I guess getting in is a gamble , this never happened to me anywhere else in the world so a little dissapointed by their service.

title: fantastic Japanese food. Top level
comment: what a fantastic view during Lunch. real japanese culture with fantastic service. amazing dishes. would definitely recon for special occasions

title: Upbeat
comment: I love SUSHISAMBA. The views from the top are impressive and you are treated like a celebrity throughout your experience- only if you have a reservation. It is so difficult to reserve a table at the exact time and date that you want (you have to do it months in advance unless you don't mind dining really early or late).  The food is delicious- order everything on the menu but stay away from the sushi rolls. They do look beautiful but for me they didn't taste good.

title: Great food
comment: Came here for a birthday. Food was great with a lot of varieties of sushi. However it was really busy and too noisy, it was quite difficult to have a conversation and it wasnt very spacious even for the waiters and waitresses to move around. However our food was amazing and would like to come back again! :)

title: Buena Comida 😉
comment: I've been recommended by friends for dinner with family . They are a fusion of Brazilian and Japanese .  Loved the food , loved the view and super helpful staff . I am not sure what cocktail I had as my wife ordered but it was amazing .  The only down side was very very very tiny portions . Expensive place due to a great view and location but food portion was under my expectations .  If it was a standard portion would have given more , hence three stars .

title: Amazing!
comment: I've been here twice with clients. They loved the wonderful view of London but best of all the food. The food just melted in our mouths and it was great the staff knew the food well and made great recommendations. I can't wait to go back.

title: GreatView ! Shame about the staff !
comment: Where does it say in the handbook of the staff to be more stuck up than the customers ! As the picture added shows we can be too ! Ordered a small fortune of dom p for friend and myself as a celebration and were told ! "Just because you drink champagne doesn't give you a seat " we didn't ask for one ! Just a lovely passing comment made by a rude staff Member when my friend asked "any chance we can grab a seat soon ? "  Want a view ..... Well there's tower 42 for a start with polite staff ! Shocking samba shame on you

title: Delicious, amazing views and great service!
comment: Came here for our engagement meal and it was honestly so lovely, the waiters and the food were amazing, best sushi in a while, and the atomsphere and views are of course incredible. You gotta go atleast once in your life! Do it!

title: Amazing views and superb quality sushi!
comment: We went to Sushi Samba for late night drinks and dinner and it was amazing! The quality of sushi was superb! And it is all prepared in front of you! I think these were the best sushi i have ever had! The sharing platters are however quite small but I imagine that's what you should expect in a fine dining place like that. Quality overtakes the quantity here! However, the waiting staff wasn't as lovely! We were ignored on a couple occasions when asked for the card machine.The night was pretty busy but I do believe, however busy you are, you should attend promptly to your customer's needs.

title: Best Sushi I have ever had!!
comment: I really loved this place. Great vibe, excellent food and outstanding service. On top of that, you have a spectacular view.

title: Just beautiful!
comment: Were invited with 2 other couples for Father's Day get together last Saturday afternoon - we chose a 4.00 p.m. slot which was perfect for us - the glass elevator is an experience in itself whizzing you up to the 38th floor in a matter of seconds!! The Restaurant and both bar areas were very busy, but enjoyably busy- all the staff were friendly and very helpful. We chose starters to share, tempura prawns, salt and pepper squid, beef dumplings and vegetable tempura - absolutely delicious - gorgeous fresh flavours and cooked to perfection. We chose varied mains - myself and my husband chose the fish stew/soup - first class - served with some beautiful green sticky rice - a must to try if you enjoy seafood. A couple of desserts were shared also although I didn't try any, but were told they were fab too - an exceptional restaurant. Definitely worth a visit if you are in London and have time to make a booking beforehand.

title: Really great and unusual food experience
comment: We originally booking a two hour dining slot although no-one moved us on when we stayed later than expected. The glass elevator is a great fun start and you should get your cameras ready for the view. At first glance the food seemed expensive but as you order a selection of dishes, you'll probably find that you choose a mix of cheap and mid priced dishes and only one or two of the pricey ones. The presentation is lovely and although the portions might look small, if you follow the recommendations of the staff you'll get an exciting and filling combination. The wait staff were great and were happy to talk through the menu and explain all the ingredients and heritage of the restaurant. Highly recommend for a special night out.

title: Emperor's New Clothes
comment: I'd think very carefully before eating here. From reviews and reputation I'd expected high quality and an experience. To be fair, this could have been my perception and misunderstanding.  It starts well with an impressive ascent to the 38/39th floor. We decided on a pre-meal drink. It wasn't particularly busy at the bar but the lady who served us could not have been less welcoming. Didn't set a great tone. Atmosphere/ambience of bar was ok but could have been anywhere.  The restaurant was better situated with good views towards east London. Staff in restaurant much more professional, knowledgeable and welcoming.  Again, to be fair, I'm not a sushi expert. I do like different food experiences however. I found the menu less than clear. The waiter made an attempt to explain but his recommendation really was around the number of dishes rather than content.  The food when it came was good. I'd say that I made one bad choice for my taste but others may have enjoyed the dish.  Again, and I may have misunderstood the character of this restaurant, I can't help but reflect that the ambience and quality of food do not match the 'hype'.  I can't quite work out why I needed to book three months in advance.  I don't want to rubbish the establishment for the sake of it. I'd just think carefully before embarking on an average experience.

title: Seems great.
comment: My wife will never eat here -as she has a phobia about lifts. But she loves their food. We always eat at the Sushisamba stand at Taste of London. We went today and had excellent Kobe bacon nigiri and the SASA.

title: Amazing food, fantastic service.
comment: What can I say about this restaurant? The food is AMAZING!!! Visited on Monday with friends and have to say this is one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. The service was superb along with the views of the city. The black cod skewers where a particular highlight! I can't think of any negative points. Keep up the good work!

title: Amazing Food Amazing Views
comment: Each time I have been here is for a business lunch and each time I get blown away. The food is amazing, its Japanese/Brazilian fusion which sounds odd but works. The dishes are small so I would recommend going with a group so as to sample as many dishes as possible. The staff were friendly and attentive and the views are amazing.

title: Fantastic late lunch at this beautiful restaurant in the sky!
comment: I visited last week as a birthday treat from my wife. We were shown to a great table with fantastic views looking to the north of London unspoilt by towering office blocks. Our first table was nice but we asked to be moved to another table with a slightly better view. I wasn't sure if they could but they did. Not many places like people moving tables but they were very happy to make our experience more enjoyable.  The waiting staff were fantastic at explaining the food and drinks menu. The cocktails were incredible and the food was perfect. we had tiger shrimp, tacos, some chicken, veg dishes which were all amazing and cooked to perfection. I can't remember the exact dishes we ordered but left feeling content and shared ice cream desert. still gorgeous.  The big show that we got for free and the best seats in London was the crazy thunder and lightning storm over London last week. From that height watching the sky and rainstorm really was once in a lifetime. The best freebie ever. the bill was very reasonable too considering we ordered a starter, 5 main dishes, desert, and 6 cocktails all under £130 including service charges. then we moved on to the bar area which overlooks the river, the gherkin and some of the other big landmarks of london including St pauls cathedral, but we thought we would try the bar at duck and waffle which was 2 floors up. big mistake, as the stucture of the building has beams which block the view at eye level and I didn't like the veg themed cocktails.

title: Absolute must if you're in London!
comment: This review could have definitely been 3 stars because we were a bit disappointed with the food...BUT the service is extraordinary for a restaurant in London. Our server was absolutely beautiful, friendly and extremely professional. What a pleasure she was!!! Salt and Pepper squid was amazing...Kobe beef Gyoza was bland but instantly better when dipped in sauce from squid appetizer. Sauces with £120 hot stone way gyu beef were ordinary and rolls were just ok as well...Nobu food much better but service and atmosphere propels this place to another level. I will be back!!!

title: Delicious fusion food with a fabulous view
comment: My daughter and I had lunch at Sushisamba - a selection of sushi, sashimi and hot dishes. Our favourites were the chevices (tuna and yellowtail tiradito) and black cod although everything was delicious. The dishes were small, but there was enough to share between two people. We sat in the middle of the restaurant floor, but the views were great regardless - London at your feet! Service was attentive and we were looked after several knowledgeable waiters.
