Afterwards we sat at the bar admiring the views. There is also a garden bar, perfect for hot weather. The restaurant is not cheap, but they are upfront about it, so no surprises there. I'll go back. Definitely!

title: Fantastic experience!
comment: The five of us had dinner here in June 2016. This is a really cool place! The restaurant is on the 38th floor and the dining experience begins with the lift. It's an outside glass lift that is really fast but amazingly smooth. I don't usually talk about lifts but the view and experience was great! The food was excellent. Japanese food with a South American twist. Sounds familiar? There is a world wide chain with a similar theme but I think this Sushisamba is much more fun! Food is delicious and beautifully presented. The views are great. Couples can especially have a fantastic view because the tables for two are right up against the windows. It is quite a vibrant restaurant but without being excessively noisy.  I would especially recommend the sushi rolls. Beautifully presented, absolutely delicious and probably the best value items on the menu. It is a sharing type menu and the sushi rolls are cut into about 6-8 pieces each. With a careful choice of wine, your bill can be less than 50 GBP per person. (As with most good restaurants, a bottle of wine can cost anything from 50 GBP to several hundred pounds.) Desserts were great so make sure you leave some room.  There is an outdoor roof-top type bar which you must try when dining here. It was a little crowded there when we arrived for our meal so we decided to have a drink outside after dinner instead. Really nice views and a great vibe. Drink prices are not prohibitively priced and probably quite appropriately for what the venue provides. I would highly recommend this place!

title: Great Place to have a Dinner
comment: This place was great, but expensive, but great! As a starter I had "English Breakfast" which was single best part of the dinner. From my PoV it was a fusion version of a hotdog with a bacon and egg - it was just awesome for my taste palate! :) Sushis were very good as well so I can recommend this one for everyone. But remember - it was bit more expensive I tought.

title: Great views, great tastes, too expensive - it's for a very special occasion
comment: This is a place to go to impress. The food is unique and quite good, the service is excellent, the view is spectacular. With that comes very high prices and it can be a bit difficult to get to.

title: Afternoon cocktails
comment: We came here after a recommendation from a friend. Incredible views, the lift scared me a bit. Understandable expense to the cocktails just don't agree with the service charge added on without any say of it. Made a £13 cocktail £15. The only down side.

title: My favourite!!!
comment: Great service and explanation of dishes, small portions but the place is more than worthy to try..  We had a table by the window and the view was incredible!

title: Food did not disappoint
comment: We met for my daughter's birthday meal and enjoyed Gin and tonic and beer on the bar. One minor irritant , a barman tried to take away and unfinished beer glass ! Instead of apologising he seemed to query my reaction. Naughty ! Rest of staff very good. Food really was very good. Noteworthy dishes inckuded lobster tachos , seviche (sic) , prawn dish and chocolate chilli number. There are Japanese fusion restaurants in London that will dent the pocket less and are as good / better. But view is great and good atmosphere with pleasant South American music and cool decor.

title: Amazing views
comment: Went for after work drinks with my husband. Really busy; a bit pricey on the drinks as expected. Will definitely go back after pay day!

title: Went for drinks
comment: Loved the lift ride to the bar with friends -Great view(best bit). Bar staff not very friendly and would have spent a lot more...

title: Great Food, Great Atmosphere
comment: Top of the line sushi served atop one of London's iconic buildings. You always meet interesting people here. The wait staff is fantastic. The hosts/hostesses/bartenders hit the mark 80% of the time.

title: Interesting tasty food! Wonderful atmosphere!
comment: I went with my parents, and the view and atmosphere was incredible. The food was so tasty. My dad is a carnivore but me and my mom are vegetarians and all three of us were very happy!

title: First class food and service. Superb location.
comment: I and my wife joined my daughter for her birthday celebration. The restaurant is located on the 18th floor of Heron Tower and is accessed via its own external glass-clad elevator. A special approach! There are at least two roof terraces with stunning views of London. You look down on the 'Gerkin'. Pre-dinner drinks and service was excellent. The food, a mix of Peruvian and Brazilian Japanese related sushi, was really good and the service excellent, bright and cheerful. Wines were good as were cocktails. Towards the end of our meal, the young waitress, upon learning we were celebrating my daughter's birthday, returned 10 minutes later with a small cake with a single candle on a plate with a birthday message written beautifully in dark chocolate. I am sure she created this herself on her own initiative. So thoughtful. Definitely going again.

title: Panoramic views of the city
comment: Lovely views of the city Great first stop for a cheeky drink but relatively expensive so just the odd one or two before moving on.

title: Amazing view and food
comment: The view is amazing and the food is delicious. Customer service is top notch. The atmosphere is more on the relaxed with smart casual attire which was quite refreshing (compared to e.g. Hutong on the Shard). Thoroughly memorable experience.

title: Amazing sushi
comment: I've been here for my first time last week with my sister and we enjoyed everything! Good food and nice staff! We will come back

title: Better than last time.
comment: This is my second visit as a friend insisted we should go. I actually gave this place a bad review last time but I have to admit it was much better on this occasion. Service was much improved. The food was great. They have really interesting favour combinations.

title: Very rude staff but lovely food
comment: Came here for a friends birthday meal in June. The views are incredible and the food exquisite, but the waiters were extremely rude and frosty towards us. We felt very unwelcome. Overall, I probably wouldn't go back.

title: Ok but nothing special
comment: The food was average at best - service great and view great - but obvs that's the big plus point .....I wouldn't go again and it's very overpriced but I guess it's ticked off the things to do in London

title: Amazing!! Couldn't fault it
comment: Went here for my sisters birthday, the view is amazing. Would personally like to thank Jeff for making our time even better. Food was all to a high standard and definitely the best sushi in London. Would come back here in a heartbeat!

title: High Altitude
comment: If you don't get a nose bleed, this sushi venue certainly stands out tall above the rest... Not only is the fare truly original, despite it being at the core of the very trendy Asian fusion, it's important to point out that Sushisamba is reflective of a very real Japanese culture that exists in Brazil (especially Sao Paolo)... So don't get to up strung about being too mainstream - this one is above the crowds.  Enjoy the lift!

title: Rude staff
comment: Amazing views / amazing food / amazing cocktails. But very unwelcoming and rude staff in the restaurant. Moved us off the table as soon as we finished food to upstairs at the bar. Considering we booked a table , we would have liked a place to sit and drink our cocktails!

title: Excellent evening
comment: I'll keep this one quick - I took my wife to Sushi Samba for her birthday after she had wanted to go for at least a few years. It's definitely an expensive place - our meal ended up being about £150 for two of us. But if you have money to spare or want to have a celebration meal, Sushi Samba is a perfect place. Location first of all is unbeatable. The views are stunning at sunset and the restaurant itself is decorated nicely. The biggest surprise was the food - we expected average food since the restaurant has such a great location. It was anything but average - every dish was seriously unique and good. Drinks as well didn't dissappoint. Lastly the service had no faults whatsoever - very attentive but not annoying. In summary, my wife and I expected a nice location restaurant with decent food and service. We were surprised that on top of the location the food and service was excellent. I definitely recommend trying Sushi Samba at least once.

title: Great view
comment: The view is amazing as it is located on the 38th floor and you can basically see most of the city. The bar is rich with good cocktails, i had the passion fruit cocktail which was delicious. Do not go without reservations, as we had to wait at the bar for exactly 2 hours to get seats for dinner. The food was good also.

title: Amazing views, average bar
comment: PROS: the lift ride to Sushisamba, the views from the 38th and 39th floors (to die for), the décor and the cocktails (pretty delicious).  CONS: the barman's attitude wasn't very good. The bar on level 38 feels like a busy railway station bar, with a continuous flow of people coming and going - it's hardly a place where one can enjoy a cozy drink with friends, the 12.5% service charge, when ordering at the bar, is truly criminal and people should refuse to pay it.  IN SUMMARY: the location alone is worth 5 stars, but the ambiance and the service charge at the bar leaves a bitter taste. 2.5 stars

title: perfect
comment: overall experience amazing, one of the best sushi tryied in london and price balanced with the service and the perfect view of london from the top. highly raccomended to everyone visiting or living in london.

title: Great choice of food and great views.
comment: The food was amazing, menu was a Japanese/Brazilian fusion, with an interesting range of dishes at varying prieces and sizes, I'd say 2-3 dishes per person would be adequate, with larger groups you can try and share more dishes. The staff were friendly and explained the process of ordering. Everytime they bought a dish out they didn't just put it down and walk away they took the time to explain what the dish was and what it contaned. They also helped to reccomend dishes that went well together. The lift from the ground floor up to the 38th floor travels at an incredible speed and has a glass front so you can see the buildings and street around you disappear as you shoot up to the 38th floor.

title: Wow
comment: Arrived early to find the place very busy. It was beautiful surrounding. We sat at the food bar and watched the skilful staff prepare a lot of the food, it was so entertaining. The selection of food was great and we selected a little of everything. The food was magical and lit up all of my taste buds

title: Cocktail with a view
comment: Just went for drinks - not cheap - about £15 a drink with service charge but worth it for the experience. At 4.30 on a Saturday the place was packed. A great atmosphere. The views are amazing (especially from the toilets !) - you are just above the height of the Gherkin so try and get a seat near the window or go out to the outside bar. The glass lift up is also an experience if you dare look down or out !

title: All style no substance - What a let down!
comment: Where to begin. Booked about 3 months in advance for my boyfriends birthday and was really looking forward to spoiling him and having a lovely evening out.  Turned up bang on time and were told our table wasn't ready (no apology or expectation of how long table would be). Then stood for about 15 minutes constantly in the way of others with numerous staff talking amongst themselves to eventually be told our table was now ready, entered he restaurant and there were about 15 tables empty! Waitress spoke poor English, had no knowledge of the menu, lacked any service skills and made us feel like outcasts as (unlike the table next to us) we hadn't ordered the £1000 Kobe beef. Tried to order more food but could not get any waiters attention, had to sit with empty plates on the table for at least 20 minutes as staff were too busy fussing around with the 'more important tables'. Completely unacceptable, with average prices per dish of £10-£20 (and they recommend you ordered 7) and only about 30 tables in the room I would expect more attentive service. Would never return and would certainly never recommend. If you want a good view go to the Shard! If you want a good dining experience go to CitySocial.

title: SUSHISHAMBLES
comment: Booked months in advance and we were only able to get a table for 5pm. When we arrived we had to wait for our table to be ready only to be lead to an almost empty restaurant, which lead me to wonder what the staff had been doing.  Once seated we were inexplicably ignored on several occasions while waiters and waitresses served other tables (maybe it was because we weren't ordering the Kobe beef?!).  The food was over priced and average at best. I would recommend Hawksmoor or City Social for an far better meal for comparable price. When we advised the waiter we were not paying the service charge and explained why he simply mumbled his apologies. We then left the restaurant unsatisfied and had dessert elsewhere, safe to say I would not go back unless under duress.

title: Let down.
comment: Unlike some of the other reviews where people were ignored by the staff and left with empty plates in front of them for hours, we were the complete opposite. We constantly had the waiters hanging over us waiting for us to finish. We felt under pressure to finish our drinks and food. The entire time. They pounced on us as soon as we put the chopsticks down, looked disappointed when we said we would like a dessert and brought the bill without us asking.  We have seen the head cocktail maker sampling his cocktails on the channel4 tv show Sunday Brunch many a time and were looking forward to trying the cocktails. They were a complete let down, and overpriced for what they were.  My boyfriend found a small black fly on his taquitos. We informed the waiter who asked if it was ok. We said no we did not want to eat food that had flies crawling over it. He then spoke to the manager. The manager came to our table and asked if everything was OK. We said that no it was not, we had to explain again that not we did not want to eat food that had had a fly on it. The manager asked if we were still OK to eat it! We had to ask them to replace the food. They grudgingly replaced it and did not deduct the inconvenience from our bill which any other fine establishment would have done.  I truly believe this restaurant depends on new clients every visit. I cannot understand how people would return after one visit to this over priced hyped up restaurant that does not live up to expectations.

title: Loved loved loved !!!
comment: Went here for cocktails yesterday for our friends birthday ... Service was beyond perfection !! Superb cocktails . Just wonderful !

title: Great food and views of London
comment: I had booked the restaurant for a friends Birthday and can honestly say it was an amazing experience. As we came to the building we were greeted by Clio who was the doorman on the day we went, he was possibly the most energetic and happy person we met at sushisamba. The lift ride to the restaurant was so much fun and allows you to see London in a completely different view!. We were told to wait as we might be able to get a window seat, however none were available. We sat down on a table which accommodates 4 people, 5 minutes late we saw a window seat become available so we asked if we could move and the manager agreed!! The views were amazing and the food was great! We did not feel rushed and all our waiters were so polite. It was a very memorable evening.

title: Stunning views of London
comment: we only had cocktails on this occupation, the surroundings are absolutely stunning and the staff are amazing, but the cocktails we had were not that great in particular the lychee cooler was a let down - the coconut milk was completely overpowering and the milk started splitting as it was served over ice.

title: A Beer in the Sky
comment: “Only Visited for drinks, but really Impressive Bar area and the views are incredible. Drinks are expensive but you are paying for the views and vibe of the place"

title: Amazing place, rather bewildering range of dishes.
comment: I was treated to 'supper' here by my cousins. Early reservation is highly recommended as we ended up having our meal at 4:00 as we couldn't get a later slot. The waiters were fantastic and attentive without being intrusive. The range of dishes is impressive, and are an interesting fusion of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian cuisine. As someone who's only experience of Sushi is that bought from M&S ;) I found the huge range of dishes and prices (some of which were staggeringly expensive) quite bewildering, and as a first visit I would have benefitted from having a Taster Menu to allow me to try a range of the restaurant most popular dishes. My dinner companions seemed to have no such problem choosing their dishes, and ordered a number of to share. The Kobe Beef Ishiyaki and the Black Cod were a particular highlight. The prices are expensive, but given the restaurant's location right next to the Gherkin it's not too surprising. As well as the restaurant Sushisamba also has a popular Cocktail bar which has amazing views. All in all, I enjoyed my first to Sushisamba and would definitely recommend it for a special occasion. Do though note that the restaurant has a dress code which though smart casual ", is worth checking before you go to avoid disappointment. A great place to spend time people watching.

title: Pre drinks
comment: Had a table booked at duck and waffle so decided to have a pre drink first.  What rude staff !!! My daughter asked for drinks menu 3 times only to be ignored!! The waitress outside completely ignored us to how hard can it be to get a drink ?!

title: Sushi on another level
comment: If you like Sushi then you're in for a treat, it's simply fantastic and the Brazilian inspired Samba rolls are a delight.  The seafood is so fresh you can smell the sea... can't wait to go back.

title: Birthday celebration - buzzing atmosphere with top quality food
comment: Fabulous atmopsphere with great buzz. Top cocktails, efficient and friendly staff with top quality food. Not cheap but great for a special occasion. The staff with guide you with your order if you are unsure how much to request. Book as always busy!

title: meh
comment: The views are lovely, and it's beautifully decorated - definitely worth popping up in the lift for that alone. However, the staff inside are unfriendly, and I didn't find the cocktail list that exciting. I didn't eat here, but I think if I did visit the Heron Tower again I'd be much more interested in visiting & eating at Duck & Waffle.

title: Amazing place
comment: I been here many times, is always amazing been there. last time i celebrated my and my best friend birthday and her Hen Party. Was an amazing Lunch and Nando was really helpful. I will definetely go back.

title: Amazing food to match the amazing view
comment: Amazing food to match the amazing view - but don't expect it to be cheap. Its an expensive meal, its great food and the service is excellent.

title: Head on up :)
comment: Only visited for a quick drink after dinner to experience while we were in London.  It was a great bar with an amazing view and different cocktails. The outdoor bar (which was closed at the time) looked like it would be a great area especially for functions though it didn't have a view like the opposite side.  Didn't dine here but have heard that it is definitely worth a taste.  And I have to mention the elevator ride up which was worth it in itself. Just be prepared for a fast take off.

title: Beautiful view!
comment: The place is quite small but the views are incredible (even in the bathroom!)  The cocktail list is exciting, and I can say that the Lychee Cooler is delicious. My only problem was the waiter that served us. He acted very rude and inconsiderate. It was really noisy and he got the order wrong. Once I have said that it is not what I order I got such a look! He didn't say sorry or my bad or anything! Threw away the cocktail and served our drinks afterwards in such an impolite manner. Will I go again? Probably yes as the views are well worth it as well as the menu!

title: Insanely good
comment: Regular business lunches here. Never get bored. Food is heavenly, service amazing and views are extraordinary. Staff will help with recommendations if you want to explore the menu. A must visit. The trip in the outside elevator is one of the highlights - but if you're scared of heights - keep your eyes shut. It's worth it.

title: Perfect place for date
comment: My husband booked for us to go here for one our date nights.  We had a table booked for 3pm so we could see London in the day light and in the dark.The view is out of this world.  The food was amazing even now we always talk how good it was. Especially the pork.  The cocktails were also great we had a few of those. X

title: A special treat for a special birthday
comment: We had booked this way in advance and wanted it to be special and it didn't disappoint. The service, views and food was very good and we all had a super time. We tried lots of special dishes but were never quite sure of what would arrive from the menu to the table - empty plates showed we all enjoyed it mind. Thanks for a lovely time.

title: Beautiful view, bad service
comment: My friends and I came here to celebrate my birthday. Firstly there was a guy downstairs who was super rude to my friends and I.....that wasn't a great first impression. I'm not sure why people like that are given the job of front of house if they do not even have manners. Anyway, once we got to the restaurant it looked great, we were asked to wait as we were slightly early which was fair enough, after 15 minutes I went back to ask how long we would need to wait and we were not given a straight answer. We were seated about 20 minutes after our initial booking, without an apology, but this was fine as I was looking forward to trying the food. We had a waiter who was great, he was funny and helpful, unfortuantly his shift ended (which he apologised for) and we had another lady who seemed to come to us every 3-5 minutes asking if we wanted more water when we clearly had drinks and told her no already....this irriated us a little bit. All in all I thought the restaurant was great, but the food wasn't as great as I expected, I've had better sushi so I wouldn't return for dinner but I would def return to have drinks in the terrace as that was probably the highlight.

title: Great view good food awsome SA wine
comment: Tried this out as it is a mix if suchi and meat and has a great view of London the staff are very friendly and the building is very strict on security which is nice, food well presented and tasty the wine is very well presented at the table would recommend this place to anyone

title: Deliciously expensive
comment: I came here for my birthday (could only afford to come for a special occasion haha) and the food was great. Was a fun experience being up the tower although our table wasn't near a window! We went to the bar for a drink beforehand which was nice and the staff were very helpful and kind.  Highly recommend!

title: Bar is very cool. No reservation required.
comment: I went to the Sushi Samba bar (different from the restaurant). You dont need a reservation but on busy nights there is a long queue. The bar also has a snack bar, which for me was enough for a full meal. The blend of Sushi with Brazilian is genius (Sushi with melted cheese!). Staff was super friendly and professional. Views are spectacular. A perfect short visit while in London!

title: Recommended! A must see!
comment: The location is very charming and cool and you have to book well in advance but very convenient directly from the website, the day before of the lunch/dinner they contact you for confirmation. Combinations refined and appropriate price , service in a very pleasant room and helpful. The only downside was the rudeness of the ladies at the desk of the restaurant ( not the ones who are on the ground floor, but the girls who welcome right at the entrance of the restaurant - next to lounge) , too bad! Rudeness is a lousy business card.

title: Wow
comment: Loved the view, the restaurant, the setting, staff, cocktails, food.. what more can I say. Black Cod was incredible, as were the wage sliders. Cannot wait to go back.

title: Very good food!
comment: The fusion japanese latin america is amazing! Taste are fabulous and some you would not expect at all! All good. Very pleased with service as well. The place has a lot of light and the views are amazing. If you can ask for a table near the window when booking! It is expensive but to be expected!

title: Room for improvement
comment: This was a new experience for me. The views from the Heron Tower were spectacular, the decor was great and the food was delicious. The service however was poor - the waiters did not speak good English and it was a struggle to understand what they were saying, especially on top of an already noisy atmosphere. We explained that we were not sure what to order but it wasn't until about 40 minutes later after pondering the menu that the waiter came to take our order and finally decided to suggest a menu for us given our tastes and budget. This would have saved us a lot of time if he had done this initially. The dishes were explained to us but again it was difficult to understand. We felt rather neglected and we sat for ages waiting to order dessert and coffee and decided not to bother in the end. Not overly impressed. - especially as we paid 12.5% service charge!

title: Great meal fab lift!!
comment: Had a great meal, really helpful waitress, food excellent and atmosphere far more relaxed than we had anticipated. Amazing view at night, lovely cocktails. The waitress explained the menu to us. Lovely fish and belly pork

title: Wonderful views and interesting fusion dishes
comment: The view from the restaurant is excellent. The menu is a really interesting mix of flavours from Japan and South America. Hey it works! Be adventurous in your choice but beware the prices are high. Most offputting thing was my friend being patted down (searched) before we were allowed in the lift. Don't go there if you don't like heights-external glass lift will be scary for some. And note they demand your credit card details when you book as there is a stiff fee for no shows and you only have a 15 minute window to be late.

title: Only the view...
comment: If you want wonderful view of London it's ok. If you want good food forget it; we were in a group of 16 people; the waiter attending my side of the table was very professional and helpfull with my food preferences but overall our table's service was poor, especially for quantitiy of food and wine served. Regarding food...value for money is 0. Food is rather more than basic, no quality, no creativity.  Prices of star rated michelin restaurant but quality of bad streetfodd. Will suggest to all my friends to avoid this place. You pay only the view.

title: First Class!
comment: I took my daughter to Sushi Samba and once she got over the fear from going up in the glass lift extremely quickly she loved it! The views from the bar and restaurant are fantastic. We booked lunch over a month previous and it was certainly worth it. The waitress explained the best way to order from the menu and we chose five different dishes to share. The tuna served raw with pomegranate and wasabi peas was absolutely fantastic, but the Samba London rolls were something else entirely! Best sushi I have ever tried! Service was excellent and we felt very relaxed, so relaxed we got talked into having a dessert. I'm glad we did because the chocolate banana cake was beyond any dessert I have tried before; seriously gorgeous! The afternoon was a real pleasure and not over priced like some places in London. I look forward to my next trip to Sushi Samba and would certainly recommend it to anybody. First class!

title: What a view
comment: Went to meet friends after work for a couple well the cocktails are so nice you end up staying. The views are amazing ( shame it was overcast ) and considering how busy it was for a Tuesday the staff where very attentive and great at mixing cocktails.... The Bloody Mary & cucumber gin to die for

title: Fantastic view, very expensive and disappointing service
comment: I was lucky enough to be taken here for a business lunch and was excited to do so. I'd been to the duck and waffle bar on a similar floor a few times before so knew the view would be amazing.. We arrived on a clear day so could see for miles. The sushi was as expected with some nice hot dishes of black cod and squid.. I appreciate I wasn't paying the bill, however the waiting staff all spoke in European accents we found hard to understand and would often "sell up". In one instance we decided to order a little bit more at the end of the meal and we received double our order of nigiri and sashimi and at £4 per piece this hugely increased the bill. From approx 21 to 42 for a "Final extra plate". We actually sent the excess back and re ordered what we had originally asked for but if we had have been more "British" .. We may have ended up keeping this.. Overall I felt the food wasn't good value. If I were with my wife, would personally have a drink in the duck and waffle and then head to a sushi bar near by for good value sushi especially given we have eaten the same sushi in Japan for 40p per piece of nigiri as opposed to £4.

title: Good food, appalling service
comment: Good food, nothing spectacular. Rushed service. Please don't top my wine glass up every time I take a sip it's incredibly frustrating! We felt like cattle being herded in and out. I asked what two of the garnishes were on our plate and none of the staff could tell us! Our waitress was not happy when we asked to waive the service charge, seem to have forgotten that this is OPTIONAL. I suppose one positive was the view, although better views to be had at 20 Fenchurch street. Recommend Tajima-Tei in Hatton garden over this overpriced average establishment.

title: Beautiful
comment: Great view and service. Delicious food. My friend and I shared the tempura vegetable, tempura prawn, lamb, poussin teriyaki and the São Paulo samba roll. All was packed full of gorgeous flavours. My husband had the steak and chorizo large plate and thoroughly enjoyed it. Tried a few different cocktails, loved the nashi martini.  Best part though was the Passionfruit cake dessert, absolutely divine. My friend loved her chocolate coffee dessert aswell! Would definitely recommend when visiting London, especially on a sunny day.

title: Wow
comment: We had read all the reviews but we're still a little sceptical.  We visited at the end of March and the whole experience was wonderful.  Superb service, very attentive but not ott.  The food was to die for, absolutely first class.  The lift ride up, the views, the ambience are all stunning and most enjoyable evening.

title: Service is terrible but the venue is superb
comment: A fabulous venue that was let down by the service. I was charged for service automatically on my bill when I WENT to the bar and ordered champagne. I did not realise until later the extra charge. I had to send the champagne back anyway as it was not cold enough. The bar staff were too familiar; he called me "darling" I am nearly 60yrs old. They seemed more interested in talking to each other than paying attention to waiting customers. We asked one restaurant staff member for closing times. They did not know and spent about five minutes looking for somebody else to confirm. We had a meal in the restaurant that was very good. The Kobe beef was delicious, but we were a bit dismayed that we had to cook it ourselves. It is an expensive item that we could have ruined. I'd rather an expert chef had cooked it.  I did write to Sushi Samba about my experiences but was passed around. The General Manager, David Seccombe, did not reply despite several emails from me over a period of months and a scan of my bill. So, I was forced to write this review.

title: Amazing food and location ...... pity about
comment: As a location ...... fantastic. As for venue ...... magical. As for food ...... delicious, imaginative, unique.  As for service ...... really unimpressed, especially the 2 guys at the outside bar who were more interested in chatting to themselves, totally uninterested and verging on rude. The wait for a drink and the awful service is not a great start to your experience. It definitely doesn't justify the obligatory service charge for no service or worse than that, bad service.

title: Out Of The World
comment: Absolutely sensational.  Took my colleagues here for a team lunch - we have been to a number of other places locally (Shard etc) and found SushiSamba to be worlds ahead in terms of service and quality of food. Everything we ate was out of this world - we had a couple of meat platters and fish coconut curries to share, plus pork belly, a selection of Sushi, battered squid, battered green beans, edamame and Seabass. Everything was wonderful, but especially the pork belly and the cooked salmon sushi with mozzarella cheese and fried onions (so good I would have ordered again if we weren't so full!). Highly recommended. Pricey for those on a budget but worth it. With drinks, we spent about £120 per head. It was my second visit, but will definitely return.

title: The perfect celebratory dinner!
comment: I have been to Sushisamba many times before and it is always the perfect experience where every tiny detail is thought of. From the welcome when you arrive, to the bar staff, to the waiters excellent recommendations, the staff go above and beyond!  The food, whilst not cheap, is worth every penny and really does have the most amazing flavours. The lamb and tempura prawns are always my favourite dishes. This visit we were there to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and they bought desert with candles and a happy birthday message. It really was the perfect dinner!

title: Terrible Experience - 10th Wedding Anniversary Completely Ruined
comment: Our reservation was made online along with a polite request for a window table if at all possible, however on arrival we were seated between the cutlery station and another couple who were blocking the view. It wasn’t exactly what we had pictured for our romantic meal. We noticed there was another, much better table sitting empty and 5 minutes later when it was still empty, we asked if we could please move to it. We were told no we couldn’t sit there because it was being held for another couple! Why was this other couple more important than us? It made us feel very belittled and it was a huge disappointment. We would have been more than happy to wait in the bar for a nicer table if given the option. The next issue was when trying to order some Saki – On our two attempts at ordering, the Saki “expert” told us we weren’t ordering the correct option to go with our meal and he then obliged us to order what he thought was best. It was extremely condescending and we felt forced to spend more than we wanted to on the Saki that he felt we should be having. After all of that we made the best of things and tried to enjoy ourselves, but then we were still waiting for one of our main dishes 15 minutes after finishing everything else (we had specifically asked for everything to be served together). A waitress started to clear or table and we enquired as to where this dish was, we were told it was just coming, however it then took another 20 mins for it to arrive? This was hugely inconvenient as by this time we had finished our 2nd carafe of Saki and didn’t want to order more and so we had to eat our last plate without anything to drink. When the waiter brought our bill, he asked if we had enjoyed everything and I explained what happened with the last plate being delayed. He simply shrugged it off and said it was given to another table by mistake and that there was some staff training issues. I told him again that we weren’t happy because it was inconvenient that we had to wait and he responded by asking me if I had enjoyed the dish anyway and completely undermined me. His attitude was appalling, I don’t appreciate being treated like that. It was the final straw in our disastrous experience with Sushisamba. When I wrote to explain what happened and how unhappy we were, I received an email from guest relations saying they took my complain to heart and the restaurant Manager would be in touch shortly. It then took them over a month to get back to me, the Assistant Restaurant Manager, Marc, finally called me to apologise and invited us back for a complimentary drink to make up for our disappointment, he said all I had to do was email him to let him know when we’d be coming and he’ll look after us. Well I emailed him last Wednesday to say we’d like to come on Saturday and he never even responded. The whole experience has left us feeling completely ripped off and bitterly disappointed.

title: Shabby service, average food & a huge anti-climax
comment: I booked here to suprise my friend last week for her Birthday and was very excited after hearing mainly good things. I love japanese and frequently eat in Roka, Nobu, Zuma and from the price of the Sushi Samba menu, I was expecting similar things. Absolutely not.  I cannot re-call much of the food we actually ate as it was all so sub-standard and the sushi rolls we had were not great (the signature ones, whatever they are...). Shrimp/prawn tempura is often my go-to dish in Japanese restaurants....here it came out pre-drenched in sauce, which was not only over-powering, but it also left the tempura completely soggy and a bit grim. The service was pretty bad ; I counted 5 different waiters who ended up serving us so no relationship could be built up, it was all really confusing and no one really knew what the hell was going on. I had to ask twice to get our wine filled, and as we left, no-one said thankyou or goodbye from the handful of un-interested waiters we had! I eat out like 3 times a week in London and have never felt compelled to write a negative review but this left a bad taste in my mouth.  Fortunately we went upstairs to Duck & Waffle (worth a go!) for a post-eat cocktail and as always, the staff there were lovely, accomadating and took the edge of the horror of Sushi Samba below. I am sure we were unlucky on that particular night (it was a Sunday), but I absolutely would never go back. Save your money and go elsewhere.

title: TERRIBLE STAFF!
comment: I went to sushi samba with my family to fancy a drink. We went there twice. The first one, one guy told me that it was full, and we couldn't go inside. He tell me to come back the day after around 9pm. I asked him if I could book a table or something to be sure to go in. But he told me it was not possible just to have a drink. Fair enough. I went there the day after with my family. Two blond guys, absolutely not nice told us that it was full as well and we needed an appointment. I explained the situation and they never accepted to let us go inside. I saw a lot of other people without reservation to go there. But.. it was a group of severals girls, wearing short dresses, not like us and my family of course. I just think they select people, not in the good way. They just let go inside beautifull person, young and pretty. Poor you if you are just normal. It's just absolutely not respectfull at all tolet people waste their time and give different excuse everytime because you didn't wanted us to come inside.

title: Absolutely Superb
comment: What more can I say than the title? Saturday lunch time with great blue skies making this venue stunning. The service was crisp and exacting which was perfect. We had a good mix of dishes including the Glazed Belly Pork (stunning!), gyozo (cooked perfectly and delicious), Ezo roll (lovely). The actual sushi was superb, perhaps genuinely the best sushi I've had in the country, so the fish must have been very fresh and very high-grade. Even Tempura Veg and Edamame Beans were just made delicious. I ordered a costly wine (£170+), and probably this was my main regret as I don't think it was worth the difference over the much cheaper equivalent grape type, so don't get carried away on the wine. But this is a minor gripe of my own doing. Overall I would say this was a superb dining experience. I was surprised to see a few negatives on here, I just don't think they could have had the same experience we had. Fingers crossed for a repeat of our time at Sushisamba next time we go then!

title: Brasil meets Japan
comment: What an excellent night out. Great food, lovely staff. The roof terrace is amazing. I can highly recommend this sky high gourmand heaven where sushi and brasil food meet.

title: Excellent birthday meal
comment: I have visited Duck and Waffle several times but this was the first visit to Sushi Samba and it didn't disappoint. From arrival, we were greeted by our friendly waiter and the manager also took the time to introduce himself which was a nice touch. I can't drink alcohol and they took the time to make a mocktail that wasn't in the menu which again showed the great service. The food was better than expected, we took some of the waiters recommendations and ordered a selection of Peruvian and Japanese food, a particular highlight was the mozzarella and jalapeño sushi! But the main highlight was the dessert; a chocolate and banana cake which was one of the best desserts I have ever tasted. All of this on top of the great view- what more could you ask for! We will definitely be back!

title: Groovy place!
comment: What a delightful experience - a dinner at Suchi Samba. The views are great, all over London, the atmosphere is cool ( lounge bar style, which is not so abundant in London) , great service and of course food. We tried Edaname soybean for appetitive, black cod ( still craving), sasa and São Paulo rolls, both fantastic ...and kobe nigiri as a treat - outstanding, do not miss it ever. That's the best beef in the world! We had passion fruit cake for dessert, which was refreshing!  The house cocktails are fantastic, we tried four of them and were not disappointed. Our waiter Ignacio was super kind.  Definitely worth visiting! But book in advance , as it's popular. The bar area was also pretty cool, so if the restaurant in not available at your chosen time, try the bar.

title: Worst service ever and average food
comment: I appreciate that the location is great but this shouldn't allow the staff to be arrogant and rude. I have a very bad memory of this experience I would not advice any of my friends and family to go. Money wasted.

title: Taste food and great atmosphere
comment: We were a group of 5 people, need to pre-book in advance otherwise small chance to have a table, the elevator taking to the 39 floor is super fast, the place have great view to London.  Atmosphere is nice, service is best, food is great some what expensive but worth it.

title: Great views of London
comment: Difficult to get a table as it is a popular place. Great views of London but overall a busy restaurant with staff that could've had a bit more focus on customer experience rather than revenue. Good was creative and good!

title: Best sushi in London
comment: 10 out of 5! The staff will go the extra mile to make sure you are happy and comfortable. Anyone can advise you on the menu which I found very helpful. They do know it in detail. And it the food is worth every penny they're charging you for it.

title: Great atmosphere
comment: Wow the food was amazing services everything. Must try black cod delicious. I always search for the quality of food and they provide an excellent method.

title: Fantastic
comment: I came with my wife on a Friday evening and we both left having had the most fabulous meal. We started with a mixture of sushi, nigiri/sashimi/rolls which was all of the very highest quality and then complimented this with prawn tempura, pork belly, chilli squid. All of the food we could not fault. We then had the cod skewers and the steak on the stone. The service was spot on and very friendly, the sommelier helped us choose a superb wine to accompany our meal and the general manager (Oto) also checked in on us which was a nice touch. He clearly runs a very well polished team. The views are fantastic to top if off. One for your shortlist when in London.

title: Good fushion of food
comment: I went for my mum's birthday and was very well treated. Staff were great. We tried a taster menu where they bring out any food at random so you can taste a bit of everything. Food was good, I was expecting japanese food so a mixture of other food was a nice surprise. I would recommend the black cod.

title: Birthday Lunch
comment: A late lunch - excellent service, delicious food, great views. A first time eating sushi, was surprised at how much we enjoyed it. It is expensive but it is London and if you can afford it, you will have a wonderful experience, we did!

title: Couples meal - brief review
comment: What a great place this one is! We'd heard positive things before going about the bar, the setting and the food and it's fair to say we were very impressed with all 3. The place oozes quality from the entrance at the ground floor as you arrive you're welcomed by the many staff happy to take your coats etc. We were shown to our table and the waiting staff were excellent at offering advice on both the food and cocktail menu. The food itself tastes great and it's best to be open minded and try new things. It's pricey however no more than you expect at this sort of place. I'd recommend the Kobe beef and the "London Sushi" combo was a great dish to get started with. The latter would also be a great lunch option. The views from the top are fantastic and I'd imagine in summer the outdoor area will be one of the best places to be in London. Well worth a visit - will be sure to go again.

title: Overpriced and overrated.
comment: We were sat at a table with a view of part of the roof and none of the skyline. The cocktails were mediocre and they have ridiculous extra surcharges such as plating fees to serve birthday cake, which is miserably tight.  It's nice for people to go and get glammed up and perhaps get a great view if sat at the right place, or enjoy the lift up to it or the view from the bar. The mix of cuisines is great with some very tasty food but portions are incredibly small and expensive. So many other amazing restaurants to eat in London with better prices and better portion sizes.

title: Fabulous for pre party dinner
comment: My boyfriend and I visited here one Saturday late afternoon (4pm) for an early dinner as it was the only table available when we booked! Was a little bit early but we were desperate to try it out whilst we are in London. As it happens it was perfect time as you get to see the view in full day light and as it turns dark! We were a little bit jaded after a heavy night but the vibe in this place was really amazing, an instant pick up!! The cocktails were amazing, the atmosphere was buzzing and the food was epic! We just ordered a few plates of food to share at a time and then kept going until we had enough. The staff were very knowledgable about their menu and really added to the experience!! Once we'd finished we popped up to the duck and waffle a few more cocktails as well before moving on for a boogie! Cannot wait to return to sushi samba... Definitely my fave London restaurant!

title: Exciting!
comment: What a restaurant! The lift up is glass and moves very fast, the welcome is warm and friendly and the restaurant waiters and waitresses were attentive and interested in your enjoyment!  The food was fabulous.  Keep it for a special occasion unless you have a large disposable income!

title: Amazing Food
comment: I reserved my table here months in advance and it was definitely worth all the wait and hype. The different types of sushi they have are so unique and I loved everything I ordered. Mostly stuck to ordering starters and they were definitely some of the best food I've ever eaten. The ambience of the restaurant is also fantastic and it has the most amazing view of London. I've also gone there for drinks and their cocktails are so delicious.

title: Fantastic
comment: Amazing food, amazing service, amazing view and amazing prices to match! It is expensive, but worth it for a special treat... can;t wait to return!

title: worth it
comment: Fluked a last minute ressie a few days out and went in with moderate expectations given the hype. Have to say, the evening was spectacular. Good service and drinks, quality food and sensational desserts. Next time I'll just have 3no of the dark chocolate ganache.

title: Miss Louise Harvey
comment: After waiting 2 months for reservation was so looking forward to eating at sushi samba, arrived at the herin tower went for cocktails first at the bar and the cocktails were delicious and the view was amazing.  The staff then showed us to the table , we were then given our waiter who was very good, all going good so far, then we order and I must say it was a complete disappointment, food was a complete let down.  We started with tempura prawns and squid, and it was not tempura the prawns were like frozen ones you get from tescos, very bland sauce over them.  Then we had the yellow tail which again was nothing special, (Defo better in Nobu) I was told to have the pork belly and that was the worst, it was served cold and chewy not at all with a little crunch, I don't know about most people but that's how I would like pork cooked! I could go on and after paying £250 on a meal I expected a lot more, I would not recommend this restaurant, if you want good food I would either go Nobus or Gilgamesh much better food! oh and 1 more thing they decide half way though the meal to close the smoking area, so had to go all the way back in the lift then outside so was not to happy about that especially after paying that amount on crap food, then to be told have to go all the way out the building for a cigarette!!

title: Fun time
comment: Fun times with my cousins for her 18th lovely food 10/10 good views 10/10 service 8/10 all in all good times would defo recommend going for drink and a good time it's a must .

title: Lovely food with great views
comment: A personal favourite in London. Love the samba rolls and the tiger maki. Also like the MOQUECA MISTA. Very nice flavour

title: Absolutely fabulous
comment: Absolutely fabulous. Delicious food, excellent service and stunning views over London. We visited for late lunch on a Monday, so only had to book a few days ahead. Definitely worth a visit

title: tasty drinks
comment: Helpful team, good drinks and beautiful view, must come back to try sushi, hard to book a table, dress code is a bit annoying part..

title: Overrated and over priced!
comment: I have been looking forward to eating at SushiSamba since it first opened and finally got around to booking it for a meal last Friday. The only time they had available was 4pm even though we booked at least a month in advance but as we were celebrating we decided to book the early slot and make an evening of it.  Sadly, I didn't enjoy the experience at all and felt it is far from on par with Duck and Waffle. We arrived slightly early and sat in the bar for a cocktail. Mine turned out to be a glorified gin and tonic with some rather old looking lemon grass and pips from the lemon floating around which wasn't what you'd expect for around £13 a drink. I left half my drink and we moved through to the restaurant.  The restaurant has very high ceilings and is bright and airy. Unfortunately the weather was awful so we couldn't see a thing out of the window. I really didn't enjoy the atmosphere and it seems to be a venue for loud corporate lunches with some arrogant people downing bottles of wine (from the bottle) and cheering! Not what you'd expect for a £200+ meal. These people need to have more respect or be asked to leave.  The food is varied and the menu includes a lot of meat options which I wasn't expecting for a sushi restaurant. We were there for the sushi so focused on those sections of the menu and I have to say they were very nice.  Drinks are extremely expensive and 250ml of sake will set you back around £28. The food was served quickly and is good quality. I couldn't help feeling that I'd rather be at Sticks and Sushi spending half the amount of money but having a much nicer time.  I certainly won't be coming back and feel like this restaurant is much better suited to corporate types looking for a meal they can charge back to work. Definitely not an environment for a romantic meal.

title: Fabulous food, views and cocktails!
comment: I had been looking forward to visiting Sushi Samba and i wasn't disappointed. My sister and i were sat right by the window and had an amazing view over london! The staff were very attentive and could not be more helpful. The cocktails and food were gorgeous, the Yellow tail taquitos and Sashimi must be tried! I will definitely be back!

title: Overpriced and overrated
comment: Went with the intention of having a few drinks but only ended up having one. Place lacks atmosphere. Drinks are overpriced for their taste. View is ok, nothing amazing. Seating is not comfortable/relaxing. Interior needs a bit of an upgrade. Fail to see the hype.

title: Great views for drinks
comment: We ate in Duck and Waffle but had drinks in the sushisamba lounge area in the outside part. It's very nice but they could do with some more heaters

title: Great view , 5* costumer service, and best sushi i had in london.
comment: the service at sushi samba is always Top. costumer service 5* food is amazing  the view is spectacular starting from the moment you step on the lift and enjoy looking down at london town.  if you are lucky you may be greeted by gorgeous samba dancers and performed on special occasions .  their cocktail are excellent. you will find people from all background, some tourist, some regulars, some business people. its expensive But worthy for special occasions like birthdays , if you are visiting the town ,or on a date.

title: Drinks
comment: We went up to grab a few drinks there was one Barman outside on the terrace and two Barman inside at the bar...  We waited 25mins still couldn't get served.. Complete waste of 25mins, but there's loads of staff... Don't get it...!  Don't waste your time guys... I will not be going back!

title: No confusion fushion
comment: Great service. Staff seem to actually take personal ownership of the restaurant and treat customers accordingly. Everything on the menu was explained patiently and recommendations made.  Everything was exquisite, but I'd particularly recommend the black cod. Restaurant is a lot smaller than it seems in pictures, but didn't feel overcrowded. Went in October for dinner, but would gladly go back for lunch or early dinner in the summer to enjoy the views from the terrace.

title: Business Dinner
comment: Amazing ambience, service and food. We had over a dozen of people across Europe and we all thought it was one of the best meals and evenings ever.

title: Amazing view , great cocktails , but a bit overpriced for the quality of food and service
comment: Well, I said it all in the headline . Very nice, but probably a bit too overrated. Not sure if It's worthy to visit more than once

title: Simple the most beautiful place I've ever eaten
comment: This place is amazing, from the second you step into the lift, to the bar area, to the restaurant, the view is great, then comes the food… Sushi like you’ve never had before, the taste’s they’ve generated were beautiful, 3 people, 7 dishes was more than enough – Favourites: Salt & Pepper Squid, Blackend Cod, Heritage Carrots, Samba London…. Please don’t leave without trying the Banana & Chocolate Cake also…

title: Fab Views & Great Service
comment: We visited Sushisamba for a Sunday afternoon Family Lunch in late March. The restaurant has a great buzz no doubt helped by the extensive cocktail options that are available. The food is excellent and the service is a match for it. One cannot finish a review without mentioning the views of London which are on a par with The Shard, although slightly less spectacular because of the direction the building faces and the external architecture of the Heron Tower. That said, I highly recommend the restaurant and will be returning there soon.

title: good service but not a great food
comment: Maybe because it is too fusion, that is why the food is not that great. It is quite fatty and oily.  The sauce should be adapted to be something more healthy.

title: Sushi Samba - Sumptuous, Sizzling & Spectacular
comment: I am lucky enough to say that I've visited Sushi Samba many times; four of those occasions were for a meal & the rest of the time for drinks. Whilst it's difficult to review Sushi Samba without commenting on the high prices.. I feel that a superior experience like this is relative to the higher than average prices. I struggle to think of a comparable experience to being situated 38 floors above ground with views across all of London, a two story bar serving almost any cocktail you ask for, a restaurant serving exemplary food; specifically Japanese with a Brazilian/Peruvian twist, & a roof terrace to rival all others, topped off with their stunning & unique orange tree feature! Sushi Samba always gets me in the party mood. The stunning decor, views across London & lively latin/samba-style music all add to an ambiance that you cannot observe in many other top London venues. I should add that you need to book in advance if you wish to dine in Sushi Samba - sometimes you need more than a month's notice to book dinner there. You cannot make a booking if you are just going for drinks, so if you're going to Sushi Samba on a popular night (such as a Friday) I would turn up early to avoid disappointment, since much of the bar space is reserved for first refusal of the dining guests. From the drinks menu, their espresso martini's, passion fruit cocktails & old fashioned are especially good. From the food menu, the black cod is amazing, as is the Kobe beef on hot stones & of course the sushi rolls.

title: Very Disappointed! :(
comment: The orercharged me for two Monkey 47 Gin+ tonic £41 pound,wich wasent even on the menu and waiter wich was serving as didn't informed about the price. Each shot of Gin 50ml was £19.50 wich is to much+ mixer (each £1:00) The price for this Gin can be max £15:00 per shot, Even that is to much. Very disappointed.

title: Spectacular dining room with far reaching views and decent food.
comment: For those with vertigo the lift up to the 38th floor where Sushi Samba is located very nearly caused a grown man to adopt the fetal position in the corner and cry an amazon of tears of fear . that man was me , its like , i imagine Charlie may have felt in the Great Glass Elevator. That said when i had regained a moderate level of composure . the thrill ride up was worth the jelly like knees. The bar offers a wide selection of beverages and the staff were busy mixing and making up clients requests,  There is also an outside area to take your drink but at such an elevated position it was pretty windy so after a quick peek i flaked out back inside.  The dining room itself is a visual treat and with London laid out below its a really great spot to take dinner. The food itself was excellent and the servers were knowledgeable and swift to deliver the various choices we made.  Some may find the price point a little lofty but actually i think it is in line with the experience .. the food , service and fabulous location.  Sushi Samba hit the mark and i will return and heartily recommend .

title: Incredible service and outstanding sushi!
comment: Went for dinner last weekend and I fell in love with this place! The sushi was beautiful and extremely tasty. The service was second to none and the waiters were extremely attentive. The views were stunning and the outside terrace bar was perfect for just a drink after dinner. The only thing there was is that the service at the outside terrace was extremely slow. However, all in all I would highly recommend this place and can't wait to go again!

title: Striking and very Miami
comment: Feels like being in Miami. The food is good and the atmosphere/attitude is sometimes a bit over the top, but I have lived in Miami so it did not feel out of place. Prices vary from high to very high.

title: Great view! Polite staff!
comment: Spectacular view! Going up with the lift is fun experience.Good food.  The staff is polite, Cleo is amazing! Definitely worth visiting.

title: Quality food with great London views.
comment: The food is amazing here. You will love it 100% sure of that.  one of the best restaurants in London for sure.  service is very good.  views are stunning. I prefer Lunch there to enjoy the view more. Must have a reservation.

title: Stunning views & great buzzy atmosphere
comment: Love this bar! -- great to sit with friends, family, partner and natter the night away. Great views & amazing food & drinks. Can not fault this place except they charge you service for getting your own drinks at the bar! Happy to pay that if someone is serving me at a table, but not if I have to get up. All in all though, love this place and would recommend.

title: Rude arrogant Door Staff
comment: Have been here a few time, never once experienced rudeness of last night. The main doorman said we could not go in due to being drunk, we had just eaten dinner and had a few drinks. Felt as though he was picking and choosing based on who he wanted in there. He was rude, arrogant and could be deemed as intimidating.  We headed round to another bar where there was a family celebrating there triplets 21st they were also not let in for being too drunk, the one which had been told this was sober. I'm pretty outraged by the behaviour and feel in this day and age people should not be victimised based on looks and age. I understand that they may want a certain clientele in there but there are ways this could have been communicated instead of just saying people are drunk. He refused to give us is name but was quite happy to put his ipad in my friends face saying he was filming her and would pass it on to her work, pretty sure that breaks data protection. I work in a client based profession and I would never dream of treating people the way we were treated last night What made me laugh the most is how drunk people were leaving, falling all over the place as they came out, front of house staff should be welcoming and friendly, not rude and arrogant. The food here is good, ruined by outside staff one in particular the other guy outside was very pleasant and polite

title: Great views, average at best on everything else
comment: The service is too poor for the type of restaurant they are trying to be. Staff was distracted and constantly staring at our plates waiting to finish to food than they would jump in to pick up the plate. Felt like we need to eat and get out. Tried several sea dishes, they were mostly ok, but still average. Price is too high for the quality and atmosphere. Maybe the meat is better. Would recommend going simply as it is an iconic location.

title: 21st treat
comment: My dad brought me here for my birthday and I loved it! food was lovely and our waiter was very friendly. Would definitely go back again :)

title: nice location and environment
comment: Too expensive. Nice location, view and environment. Ok service.  Although too expensive for sushi and a drink.

title: exquisite food, great service and amazing view
comment: Great restaurant for special occasions. The architecture and decor are unique (very nice outside terrace, open during summer). I especially recommend the shrimp tempura, they also have a vegan menu. We had a very good time and will definitely go back there.

title: Very Surprising
comment: Once I read the menu I was very  confused as this is not your typical Sushi Restaurant. This is a fusion of Japanese, Peruvian and several other cuisines, but it works. The food was different and delicious the service was attentive with a smile. All in all I could not fault this place. Go with an open mind and enjoy.

title: Spectacular setting and an enjoyable overall experience
comment: Tried for the first time and found the restaurant setting offered very good view though the orientation is somewhat better in the bar area as from there one gets the river views. One had the impression that the clientele are mainly youngish and well-heeled or on corporate expenses, which is useful given the relatively hefty menu prices, some of which are very extravagant.  The food was very good in the main as we sampled the miso soup, samba salad (rather delayed in re-presentation after its first appearance with dressing that had been requested on the side), vegetable tempura, kanpachi tiradorito and a quite disappointing (and very expensive for what it was) kobe tiradito that seemed to be lacking in most aspects.  The seviche salmon and lamb chops were very good but the teryaki poussin was escellent. Black cod seemed to go down well too.  The dessert menu had some good choices and we settled for mochi ice creams and the exotic fruit salad, the mochi being a very good and nicely presented selection.  The ambience was buzzy and service was alright, but not super-attentive as it ought to be at these prices Overall, Very Good.

title: Spectacular views, good service & reasonable food
comment: Enjoyable modern lounge bar, with stunning views of London. All aspects were good but not really outstanding apart from the Tuba sashimi. Expensive too.

title: Amazing but broke the bank!
comment: What a lovely lovely evening. While it was expensive £320 bill for 2 ! We walked out stuffed like little piggies and had drunken wine and had cocktails... it was lovely - waiter picked our food for us. The feeling of place is very entertaining and beautiful views.

title: Great food
comment: I organised my friends hen do here for lunch and although it was hard to make a booking here we throughly enjoyed it. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable as there was a lot of choice on the menu. It is steeply priced but then you do get a lot of seafood instead of big portions of rice. The food was great and the cocktails were lovely. Shame about the weather on the day though as we didn't see much out of the window, we still had a fantastic time and made the most out of it. Will defiantly recommend for a special occasion.

title: Best pork belly
comment: Booking this restaurant was one of the best decisions I've made as the food was exceptional. It wasn't only the food that gave us such a good experience, but the atmosphere and setting to. Although the menu was slightly confusing to understand to begin with, the helpful waitress guided us through and explained it. I recommend the pork belly as up until this day, I crave it 24/7 and want it on my taste buds just one last time. Prices were high but definitely worth it, best meal had in a while. Cocktails were strong.

title: Afternoon drinks - nightmare!
comment: Arrived at this place to be welcomed or rather told off by the host / table booker / maitre d' for not waiting in line before getting in the lift, even though they appeared to be chatting to a friend. Anyway, they told us to get the lift to the 40th floor for drinks in the bar, this was incorrect, we needed the 38th floor. Had to go all the way back down to zero to speak to the helpful host and he said go to 38 for now. So we arrived at the 38th floor and made our way to the bar, was greeted by the bar tend and ordered drinks, pricey but reasonable for location and views. Drinks were served and paid bill only to find a service charge was added after paying, we didn't get to see the receipt before paying, be aware of this. Overall service was crap but views and quality of drinks made up for it. Rating terrible because I think first impressions count and this failed straight away.

title: Celebrating a friend's 50th birthday.
comment: I understood that it was difficult to secure tables at the restaurant due to it's popularity and so as we wanted to book a table for a special occasion, I made sure that we were onto it straight away with plenty of time in advance. I did try to telephone a few times but was more successful booking on-line. I also had to email as I wanted to order a birthday cake etc., which again was no problem and dealt with very quickly. The evening was delightful. The cocktails were fantastic. As it was a special occasion we had asked for a 'good table' and it was evident that they had listened. Unfortunately on the evening, it was raining and so the view wasn't exceptional. The waiter was very helpful in recommending a variety of dishes for us to try which we did. We thoroughly enjoyed our evening.

title: The beautiful view
comment: We went to sushi samba for dinner. All of us were impressed by view and we really liked the terrace on the roof. The food was fancy, but tasty, drinks and cocktails as well. We really enjoyed the experience and will definitely return.

title: Lovely
comment: After spending ages trying to get a reservation the day finally came. I wasn't disappointed at all. Food was lovely dessert was gorgeous, bar was cool. I'm attempting to book again but the booking service is so long !!

title: Trendy and funny...sushi by the way!
comment: I know the Sushisamba Miami well, so I wanted to try the London version.  Location: fantastic! 38th floor in a London bridge area skyscraper, the whole city at your feet Crowd: trendy sexy young n cool at night, tourist and few locals during the day. Food: as the name suggests, sushi with a Brazil flavor. Some combinations are interesting, some not so much. Miami version is definitely better. Raw materials quality average. The rice definitely not. They play it all on presentation and appearance, which I must admit is out standing. General impression: if you want to have fun with friends in a trendy place and do not care so much about top quality, this place is for you! Nice music, beautiful food, great cocktails (even if there's always too much ice). Location and the view make up for the rest. Price is on the high side, we spent the same amount the other night in Defune, so it depends on what you are looking for. If top quality it's definitely Defune! If medium quality but super cool, then it's Sushisamba...

title: Good food and nice bar - book in advance!
comment: must book in advance to dine here - gets very busy in the evening but service and food was good although portion sizes are a little small. also has a great bar with outdoor terrace that does great selection of wine and cocktails (no need to book for drinks really)

title: Sushi, Drinks & London skyline views!!!
comment: Second time visiting Sushi, once for lunch and this second time round for dinner. I must say, I was surprised we got a reservation because it its one of the most busiest restaurants in London! We got to see the sun set and the city turn into night which was amazing. I definitely would recommend the "El Topo", Samba London & the SASA shrimp Tempura.  Only thing I can criticise is the Samba menu should be a tiny bit larger and accommodate more dishes.

title: Visit with my daughter and brother
comment: Oh my god !! Amazing!! Our waitress annalise was amazing!! Setting breath taking!! Food... Well !! It is best food I've ever tasted .. You must come and visit..,atmosphere.., setting , service and veiws..

title: Food was good, but you pay for it.
comment: I'm not going to beat around the bush, SUSHISAMBA served some of the best food I have ever tasted in my life, the calamari was beautiful and the Kobe beef on the sizzling stone was a different level. Saying this though, it is expensive.. The mini burger picture I have uploaded will set you back a cool £6 or if you're really high end you can order the £1000 Kobe platter. The waitress seeing to us was awesome and really knew her stuff about everything on the menu, this unfortunately was countered by the rudeness of the bar staff who seem to be the judges of who is worthy of being there. And unless they think you're packing a wad of 50's it's unlikely you'll get served quickly. I have give 4 stars and not five basically because of the prices being so high.  But like I said Before, if you can afford it and get a reservation then you definitely need to try it out....and the views not bad either.

title: average sushi
comment: I did not see the appeal of this place, apart from the views! The sushi was too creative, so the flavors did not go together, and our server did not even speak english! better places out there

title: Great views great food
comment: This is really quite a cool place with a buzzy bar selling creative cocktails and a place to enjoy the views - both of London as well as the trendy clientele. A wide range of dishes - all looking stunning and mostly an eating experience to match. This place is well worth a visit if only for the Willy Wonka style glass elevator that whips up and down the building side.

title: Impressive place but pricey.
comment: I want to sushisamba with colleagues for dinner and some drinks. As it is located in and skyscraper, you take a towards-outside superquick lift that drops you at the restaurant-bar where you are welcomed. First we had some cocktails, overpriced but good, in the bar area with amazing views over the city, it has got a terrace for smokers on the other side as well, where you can admire London from the top.  Then we had dinner into the dinning area (separated from the bar area). Place was noisy, they should keep an eye on the type of customers they accept, it was just ordinary from a venue with its reputation, I found what you see in Wetherspoon!! The food was totally overpriced. I prefer to avoid comments regarding our bill but such a joke. Portions are just ridiculous. Not given one star because of the venue and the drinks.

title: We loved it!
comment: WOW! What a great place for a sushi meal! It is not hard to find sushi in London but this place rocks! Fish is super fresh and the rolls are very tasty like none..we'll definitely come back here.

title: Good food but expensive
comment: Food super good and well served. That is my third time in there.  I know the food and drinks are extremely, super expensive. But the atmosphere and environment you know what you are paying for.  However on my latest visit the service let me really down. We sat down and it took ages for the server to come and ask if we need drink or something.  In the end we had to raise arms and shout and alternately it was not the server that was suppose to serve our table. Then he had to call someone else.  Anyway the rest of our night was fun and delightful.

title: lovely! !
comment: my friend and I came to sushi samba after a conference in the area. greeted by lovely staff and very friendly bar staff. The barman made us a champagne cocktail which was wonderful and this was followed by some super tasty sushi. The waitress was very friendly and made some excellent recommendations. seafood lovers should definitely try the tempura prawns. ..... yummy.  The views are amazing and yes it was pricey but a nice treat. had a great time and will return next time I am in London.

title: Beautiful food and views
comment: Came here the other night with my friend. We had a lovely evening. Not going to lie it isn't cheap but it is an experience and if you love sushi then you need to try this place! Our servers Luke and alexandra (i believe her name was) were extremely professional and friendly. Luke had excellent knowledge of the menu as I hadn't a clue what I was eating but it was good! I would come back here again but probably only on a special occasion as it is pricey. Superb cocktails too i will add !

title: Food and views: not at the same level
comment: Outstanding views - best ever for a restaurant. But food is average. I was specting something crazy, as exotic as the name. Service is great and the atmosphere is amazing though.

title: Amazing Food and Venue
comment: Today to visited Sushi Samba for cocktails and lunch and we were not disappointed.  The restaurant had great design features and stunning views of the city. Our drinks a food arrived quickly and everyone in our group enjoyed their meals. Everything was presented really well and the staff were very helpful with any questions we had about the menu.  We would love to return for an evening booking to experience the restaurant at night with the amazing lights and views.

title: Great sushi with amazing views over London
comment: We booked a couple of weeks ahead since this was a special occasion, but it was well worth it. The ambience of the place, plus the views over London are superb. Food was of great quality - the sushi was delicious and the marinated lamb was absolutely first class. The meal was a bit pricey, but expected and worth it for the overall experience. The only downside was the bar area where the service was incredibly slow and with not many places to sit, despite it not being all that busy. Also, I thought the wait staff (while friendly) were a little over-bearing - felt like every 5 minutes we were being asked how the food was and our plates were taken away literally the moment we'd taken the last piece of sushi. Just felt like we were being rushed, which soured it slightly. All-in-all though, a really lovely dining experience. Definitely would like to return again.

title: Nothing to shout about...
comment: Have you ever been to a food court within a shopping centre where various fast food establishments are all under one roof? Well, this was similar to that in that there was a cleaner constantly cleaning with a big yellow sign throughout our entire meal- exactly what you'd experience in a food court! I had never eaten sushi before and I'm vegetarian but I enjoyed the vege maki however, my partner on the other hand had loves sushi for a long time and was utterly disappointed. The waitress didn't leave us alone at first which was just annoying and we had several people come and speak to us while we were trying to decide on our food.  Nice restaurant (although the light bulbs above need a good dusting) and amazing views but the food and wine is completely over priced and the biggest size wine you can get by the glass is 125ml for £10 a glass (on average). Also, it would be nice if the menu described what each dish was as if you're not a sushi expert, you won't have a clue!

title: The Essential London Experience
comment: A great reminder of what makes London so vibrant - stunning views from the 39th floor, a thoroughly cosmopolitan buzz and a world class cuisine.
