We were carefully guided through the options available on the menu and on the recommendation of our manager we opted for the set price menu which was a delight in its variety, the pacing of the delivery and the friendliness of the serving staff. Not to be missed fi you have the opportunity to go there!

title: Nice view and lovely food
comment: Really nice view from the restaurant which is located on the 39-40th floor of a skyscraper. Delicious food (pricey though - you can try some good stuff for 50-60 pounds for two people and still feel hungry), which is made just in front of you if you are sitting at the bar. Overall, a good place to spend a couple of hours with your friends (especially those who have never been to London!) and enjoy the lovely view.

title: Excellent Sushi, Great Views
comment: really good food with great service. would have preferred a greater selection or beers but overall really liked it. beef on the hot plate was outstanding.

title: Nice views decent food but clinetelle?
comment: You get in a lift diagonally opposite Liverpool Street station, and zip up to the 39th floor of the Heron building, not the greatest looking building. After depositing bags and coats, you the walk down to the bar reception area. As we'd arrived early we elected to take drinks in the bar and take in the views. Slightly oddly I thought, I was asked to surrender my credit cad, in exchange for a tab card. Begs the question what sort of clientele do they expect here? runners? We were seated promptly at our appointed time in a mediocre central table, next to a family with a small child. The first server's description of the menu was unintelligible, but thankfully it was repeated by another waiter with better English. We had an interesting mix of tempura, South American style ceviche, and sushi, and marinaded grilled black cod, chicken and lamb chops. Food was very good. Nice bottle of Washington state riesling a bit pricey at £55. All was going well until the father on the table next to us sent something flying, splattering us and requiring a major clean up. My daughter's new boots got splattered, but fortunately we escaped any other major damage. Not a word f apology from our next door rude diners. Thankfully the staff moved us to a table some way off and nearer the window. So in summary this place is not bad, but it seems to attract some rather inconsiderate clientele, not their fault I guess.

title: Really tasty sushi rolls in the most amazing location. Save for a special event
comment: I have eaten at Sushisamba twice before; both were to celebrate special occasions as the views and terrace really add to the whole experience, and the food is so tasty - get a few sushi rolls/sashimi and hot plates to share. It is expensive but worth it for a special occasion - wine list is expensive as are the cocktails but the bar will really make anything for you if you ask the waiter, and the wine is amazing. The meats on hot coals are so tender and you can have such a varied meal every time you go. Love it

title: Excellent views and an overall fantastic dining experience
comment: We had dinner here and thought the food was fantastic. We had a range of dishes from sushi to calamari to pork belly and loved it all. We were especially pleased with the dessert oh and the amazing view of the London skyline.

title: TOP PLACE
comment: Good sushi, amazing place. Next time i'll bring my son to try this kind of food. Hot drinks and nice people.

title: Good views average food
comment: Certainly good service and an outstanding location. The food is very average. The combination of South American mixed with Japanese leaves a lot to be desired. The Japanese element outshining the SA influence by some way. Many other options on a city full of choice.

title: Sheek and great for dates :)
comment: I came here on a date for the first time and was extremely impressed by the interior design and the high level of service. The Manager I believe, introduced himself a few minutes after we had ordered some drinks to start. I never had this at any other restaurant and I do expect quite high standard service so this exceeded my expectations. The food portions were rich but a little on the small size. I do suggest that if you are a big eater, do prepare to order more than the usual. We didn't get to sit next to the window as we came quite late and was very busy on a Sunday but viewing the restaurant and window seating, you will be very impressed! Just book in advance as it is a popular restaurant! I want to go back and try out new foods and was very happy when I heard the chef was Brazilian and they served Port Wine from Portugal as I am Portuguese! The waiter did give us a little background story to how it came about that they had Portuguese inspired cuisines on the menu. Thank you so much for a great experience!

title: AMAZING PLACE
comment: One of the best restaurants i have been in my whole life! Great view, amazing food! A bit pricey but totally worth it! The decoration and the lighting also made all the differente.

title: Afternoon lunch
comment: Food was really nice & views are outstanding - cocktails seemed a little overprice & although the restaurant was immaculate inside, the windows needed a clean in the outside ( considering you're paying for the view ) Would definitely go back

title: Great place, great service
comment: Up on the 39 floor, light & warm. Attractive ambiance with an open space available for smokers and others, well designed to make you relax and enjoy a few drinks. We were told it would take 30' for a table but we were seated afetr 7 minutes. Small table but very warm welcome. The staff are very friendly and willing to spend time to make your visit enjoyable, willing to explain the manu and help you order. The food came pretty quick ( I hate waiting 20' + for the first dish to arrive) and always with a full explanation of the precise ingredients used. A saki somallier available to offer a hamble explanation of the selected drink and a waiter by our site to ensure he acted accordingly. It was a very pleasant meal and I recommend visiting either for lunch or early dinner so you can absorb the beautiful views or this restaurant.

title: A "must do"
comment: I'd always wanted to go here to eat and booked a table for my sister in law's 30th birthday. This is a really beautiful restaurant with amazing views of London. I had been here before for cocktails, which are always amazing. I did on this visit think the place was looking a bit tired and could do with a bit of a refurb. The ladies in particular had a few broken taps, bins etc. The food we had was gorgeous with excellent flavours and we tried a selection of sushi and beef dishes. It is however eye-wateringly expensive and portion sizes are very small so don't expect a big meal. The staff were all very friendly and attentive and not too in your face. All in all we enjoyed our visit but now that I've been I wouldn't rush back.

title: Great mix of flavours!
comment: Visited with brother, his girlfriend and her sister. Great option of dishes and drinks. The atmosphere was awesome and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The flavours of the dishes are a mix of Japanese and South American. The cocktails are very interesting.

title: Breathtaking view & best sushi in London
comment: I've been at Sushisamba three times, with my boyfriend and with friends as well, and each time has been great. The view, it goes without saying, is breathtaking, from every side of the restaurant you are watching. Even the interior decor of the restaurant is very nice, especially at night, charming. Staff very friendly and attentive and always ready to chat. I have tried many other well-known sushi restaurant in town, but I've never tasted a so good sushi: a combination of tastes, colors, composition that makes every dish a masterpiece. Worth the price, no doubt, absolutely normal in this city. Good cocktails as well.  And, to be honest, not that hard to book a table.

title: Outstanding!
comment: We were lucky enough to get a last minute booking and watched the sun set over London. Service is impeccable - they don't like to see a glass empty or a table messy! The staff are freon sly and attentive without being overbearing. Our waiter helped us navigate the menu and made fabulous suggestions. Every dish was beautifully presented and the flavours were extraordinary. We Weill certainly be back.

title: Lovely views but £500 and still hungry
comment: We had to book over a month in advance to get in here. We weren't disappointed with the decor or the views. It had a really good atmosphere and the place looked wow. However we didn't find the food wow. It was nice but not as good as somewhere like Hakassan. We had a good time but not sure we would go back. The bill for 4 of us was over £500 and we were still hungry. There's other towers with views. The waiters were a bit stern too.

title: If you like pretentiousness, and watered down cocktails....
comment: Lovely ambience high above the city... but i tend to shy away from pretentious nightspots where the staff acts as they're doing you a favor by letting you in... And when pretentious slips over to tacky it really gets to be too much... The staff was friendly but also rather clueless... A friend ordered a drink specifically *without* lemon peel in it (a health issue)... when the drink came, it had lemon peel in it... when my friend pointed this out, the server took it back to the bar and surreptitiously took the lemon peel out and then brought it back.... tacky tacky! As if my friend couldn't have removed the lemon peel herself if that was the only issue ... Only then did the server return to the bar, ostentatiously pour out the drink with a flourish, and have a new one made... tacky tacky... And when the cocktails came... Well, there *might* have been a bit of alcohol in them, but it was hard to tell... And I won't even mention that caipirinhas are made with muddled limes, not lime chunks, which kinda defeats the purpose of the limes... Which left me as the tacky one as i squeezed the limes! :) For much better cocktails at better prices, try "Be at One" just down the street...

title: Sushi Seduction!
comment: I couldn't love Sushi Samba anymore. Having previously dined in the Miami eatery a few years ago I was thrilled to find we had one in London. I have since visited on numerous occasions and cannot recommend it enough.  On my last visit we had an amazing experience, a fantastic waiter and had super delicious Mojito's at the bar. We were given Sake to try as we had never tasted it before and the informative waiter recommended the Green Bean Tempura which was simply amazing!  I have a reservation coming up and I literally cannot wait.

title: Good food beautiful design
comment: Recent dinner with drinks. Hadn't eaten for a while and remembered straight away how some dishes felt a little small. All the food tastes amazing and if you are able to get a window seat the views are impressive.  Interior design still looks great with the contrast colours though the layout did seem to have changed slightly. Atmosphere can be loud which may put some people off but on the occasions I have been the its been a fairly young crowd so never a problem for us, not sure the hard of hearing parents would enjoy it.  The bar is great and the terrace with the copper tree is quite striking, the terrace can get quite busy though and even the seating area means someone is almost standing on your toes.  Sake cocktails are great and worth trying. I would always choose Sushisamba over Duck & Waffle and even if you don't fancy the restaurant make sure you have a few drinks in the bar on an early summer evening.

title: Great views and nice outdoor seating area.
comment: Very busy and bubbly restaurant high up with great views over London. Great food although pricy its more an experience than food heaven.

title: 5 stars for food, 4 for service
comment: It was my second visit here, and I'll keep coming back because of the food and view. The service is overall good, but varies. On to details... Food: we had about 5-6 starters/small plates and one large plate to share among 3 people. The sushis were excellent, creative, tasty and beautifully served. The moqueca is delicious, creamy, but not enough sea food in it - last time the plate was more generous. Service: we came on a clear day for a late lunch and the place was full. The 1st waiter who came said he would be with us during our visit, but we had to reach to different people all the time to get our orders, some with more knowledge of the dishes than others but all good. Our food took a bit too long to come. Receptionists could smile a bit more. But... our wine glasses were always filled after just a few sips by the sommelier, and knowing it was my husband's birthday they sent a dessert decorated with small candles and a happy b-day message. View: amazing, even if you are not seating by the window.

title: Frequent visitors...never again
comment: We have loved coming to sushi samba for years and have recommended it to many of our friends (including San Fran and New York). The food, views and atmosphere have been fantastic. However, we went to take our two good friends here for a couple of drinks one afternoon and were rudely turned away at the door. We were given the pathetic, obnoxious reason that you could only book to come for drinks, which, being regulars we knew was a blatant lie. Two girls were sent up without bookings in front of us. This was a case of utter discrimination based on our image...Even though we were all in smart casual attire, perfectly suitable for the venue. For this reason we will never be returning.

title: good atmosphere
comment: we came here for post dinner drinks and the atmosphere was great. The views were amazing. We can def recommend sushi samba!

title: Sushi with a view
comment: The concept of Japanese South American fusion sounds dodgy but the food is fantastic. The salt & pepper squid was excellent. Tuna cerviche was very good. The view over the city is great. We had a leisurely lunch with no pressure to rush from the extremely helpful staff. It's not cheap, even if you don't have the Kobe beef but it's very very good.

title: Good food, good view
comment: Great place to try world class Kobe beef, service was good, it is a 'hyped' restaurant, so expectations were high, and food was good, but something lacking, not sure what....

title: Overpriced and discrimination! A place to avoid in London
comment: What was supposed to be a very exciting and nice Valentines' lunch, turned out to be the worst experience I have ever had. I did not want to write a review but upon reading the latest reviews, I felt the need to add in my experience. When we arrived at the entrance, the doorman was flirting and taking pictures with three girls not particularly well-dressed, and sent them up. When it turned to us, his behaviour completely changed. First he said that our booking was one hour earlier, which was not true. Following this he said that my friend was not dressed well enough to access the restaurant emphasising there was a dress-code. However, the only difference between my friend and I, that he is Indian and I am White Caucasian. We were dressed similarly. This was a case of utter discrimination based on the skin colour, even though we were in smart casual clothes, perfectly suitable for the venue. I was speechless....It seems that many other people have experienced this discrimination, even though the manager said he would take action.

title: Love This Place But Food Quantity Not Much!
comment: Absolutely fell in love with this venue. The views are stunning! When you go in glass the elevator and see all of London beneath you as you reach the 39th floor is just speechless! You need to reserve a place at least a couple of weeks in advance (i reserved three weeks in advcance for a table of 6 and there was only 1 time slot left!) As for the food, if it's your first time the waiters are very helpful in making you decide on what to have. Their cocktails are fab. Only negative about this place is that the food is tasty but very small portions and not very filling (but i guess that's maybe sushi in general?) - Overall lovely place to go as a treat with STUNNING views of London.

title: Miss This And Miss Out
comment: You have to book in advance but don't be put off its well worth the wait. I booked some 6 weeks ahead so planning was required. Well just going up in the lift was a treat to start with, we had pre dinner margaritas in the bar I must say I prefer the bar at the Duck and Waffle which is one floor above, but you can easily go there first connecting stair case directly to Sushi samba so don't worry about getting lost. Ok so down to business we were shown to our table right by the window we had a 5.30 booking so the sun was just setting Wow the view was perfect. We were introduced to Yannick our waiter, he was polite friendly and very well informed, having never been before we asked how best to choose from the menu and both my son and I decided to let him choose our meal for us he asked about or allergies and food preferences and what kind of budget we had in mind, simple all his choices were perfect I realise this kind of thing isn't for everyone but sometimes I think letting someone else takeover means you go out of your comfort zone and try something new. Every dish was amazing.

title: I hate sushi and loved it here!
comment: Being a vegetarian who hates fish, I was expecting to leave starving hungry. The food was spectacular, something for everyone.  Views were out of this world and service was second to none. Can't wait to return.

title: Interesting and good food.
comment: Came here as my friends were treating me to my birthday. The food is really good and I generally enjoy the South American - East Asian fusion of flavours.  I found booking quite easy, but I did it through a third party.

title: Exqusite food, exceptional views of London,
comment: This was my first visit to Sushisamba, although I had heard how good it is from friends. The food is divine, the presentation and colour combinations are South American and the dishes Japanese. Every dish was outstanding. The food coupled with views from the 38th floor of the Heron tower are a wining combination.. The service was slick, professional possibly a tad on the cool side, the décor is fantastic, huge open dining room with floor to ceiling height windows obviously this leads to higher noise levels so not the best place for a romantic meal but for a group it was perfect.

title: Wat a view!
comment: wow dinner with a view and in summer a great bar for a drink after dinner with a view from the 39th floor. Very good food sushi and robata. Vibrant and busy ambiance. We are going back. Special attention for allergies, perfect service

title: A once off...
comment: We went knowing it would be expensive and with some vigorous up selling from the staff and that proved to be the case.As to the food,it is actually pretty good and to be fair the staff did not overestimate what we would need,not straightforward with the almost tapas style system.  The place was certainly buzzing and is seriously popular. However,the actual views over the London were not as good as we had hoped and not on the scale of the Shard. Good value ? Probably not.Our bill was £270 for four,Ok this included two bottles of wine and two puds so it could be done more economically

title: Belated Mother's Day lunch
comment: Didn't know what to expect from this restaurant, but it was amazing. Fabulous food, amazing views and extremely attentive staff.

title: One amazing November's evening
comment: The restaurant is impressive, the food was good, the view is more than breathtaking. My friends and me spent great time there, I would like to visit this place during the summer. The prices were good. For four people we paid around 130 pound as we ordered one bottle of wine, four small plates and sushi as well.  Unfortunately, we had some problems with the reservations. We reserved table two months in advance and we did not receive confirmation. Аlthough we tried to make a contact with the staff, but never succeeded. So we did not know whether will we have reserved table and decided to take the risk and to go there. Luckily, everything was fine and we spent a great evening at Sushi Samba.

title: Beautiful restaurant! Amazing view of London!
comment: A beautiful restaurant with good Japanese food, great music and great service. You should try the cocktails at the bar while enjoy the view of London!

title: Nice cocktails and decoration
comment: I went to to this place few times for drinks with friends and the big tree style object with lights on the terrace it can go very packed up sometimes too crowded for me but it depends if it's weekday or during the week end. Expensive drinks but interesting choice and set up with different levels and stairs loved the orange light as it is warm colour and bring a bit of feeric atmosphere to the evening.

title: Beautiful sushi and great views
comment: Came here last week with friends. Absolutely loved the sushi, try the mozzarella dish. Drinks were great too, especially the lychee liqueur cocktail. The view is amazing. The only reason I give 3 stars is because I was a bit put off by the staff. I guess we don't look like we fit in there as we are young and didn't dress up much and I found them to be a little rude and pretentious. Otherwise, fantastic experience.

title: Great view, unique Japanese-Brazilian-Peruvian food experience
comment: Great place for a special dinner. Amazing view, service, food, atmosphere, design, music. We were very happy with our order: shrimp tempura, sea bass tempura, samba rolls london, maki, tuna ceviche. All very tasty with the good choice of wine list. Highly recommended.

title: Great place for after work drinks
comment: A quick stop on the way back to the station after lunch and the drinks and garden are fabulous. Highly recommended!

title: Quick visit, expensive but worth it for the view!
comment: We visited here during a trip to London, as we wanted to look into all these fancy places that London had to offer!  From our experience, there are 2 restaurants, a bar and the outdoor terrace, unfortunately the terrace was closed whilst we were there, but we still had amazing views of central London!  The drinks are, as expected, very expensive! £7 for a 330ml London pilsner, and £12 upwards for cocktails! Despite this, I would highly recommend this place for the view and just for visiting somewhere different :)

title: Fantastic Service and view
comment: This is my third visit now for dinner .  Food is absolutely fresh and quality you find ever .  Service is a top Noch and was little fraustated not getting a window seat even though my reserved it month ago !!!!! I will be back again but hope you guys keep up with guest .

title: Amazing food amazing service amazing views but a bit noisy
comment: We went there on a family visit and the food was the most delicious food I have ever tasted. It was so delicious that I had to give it a five star review. It also had an amazing view over looking the city and a really strange lift up to the restaurant. The only problem was it was to noisy so we could not get a proper chat going.

title: What a view!
comment: Went for my mother's 60th and really lived up to expectations. For those of us that do not eat seafood we were fully catered for and the whole meal was actually an awful lot cheaper than expected. Cracking

title: Great food shame they did not follow H&S procedures
comment: Visited pre Christmas as had been wanting to go for ages. We had already spoke to the restaurant that my partner was recovering from ankle surgery and on crutches however this was ignored as the waitress took us down a the spiral staircase to our table (found out later there was a lift all along!). The food was exceptional, the rock shrimp tempura was to die for along with the lima rolls and other courses we are. Apart from the blip at the beginning all we going well until the fire alarm sounded and there was no control whatsoever. The staff were telling us to sit down. Some people were walking out (apparently the chefs were first to make their way outside). There was no procedure for the disabled or my partner on crutches and when we asked our waiter what was going on he replied he was only the waiter!! Furious that they had not followed basis h&s procedure by evacuating the building even if it was a false alarm my mother and I complained. The manager gave us the meal on the house which was very kind however not really much comfort if that had been a real threat or fire.  I cannot believe in the midst of high alert relating to terrorism a well known restaurant would not have or follow legal H&S requirements. This spoilt a very good meal.

title: Romantic Place on the top of the world
comment: Service is flawless! Food is incredibly delicious. No wonder you need to book a table at least a day in advance. Great selection of veg, meat and fish dishes. Big thank you to the Chef! A bit to pricy, but worth every penny!

title: Good Food
comment: Went for lunch with a friend end of February. Food was fantastic, view amazing. Staff was making us feel unwelcome though. Will not rush back.

title: Perfection
comment: I have been twice now. Once for lunch and once for dinner. Exemplary service each time and outstanding creative food. Hopefully next time I will be lucky enough to get a window seat but this did not detract the amazing experience.

title: Amazing view but.. awful cocktails and smallest portions
comment: I went to this place many times because it probably has the best view of London. However, the food is extra expensive compared to the size of the portions. I would not recommend cocktails since they all taste the same (water) and they're quite expensive as well. The good things apart from the view are the service and free cloakroom.

title: Top
comment: The elevator to the 40th floor is amazing. It leave you breathless. And the view from the top, sipping you drink has no price. The atmosphere is real London. Cocktails are ok. But location wins.

title: Service on bar service - seriously
comment: Met here for a drink in the bar with two other mums and daughters.... Whilst the view is spectacular the bar is not. Although it is busy - it is too small and appears too dark What should be an amazing bar is only mediocre with the view the star attraction. To pay for service when you've gone to the bar yourself for drinks seems a step too far - the barman is surely already manning the bar and not providing any extra service??? Dining - I am told - is an entirely different experience .....

title: Top restaurant
comment: What a great sensitive experience. Fantastic fusion sushi with an astonishing view. Expensive but worth every penny. Very professional staff.

title: Unique experience
comment: Went for a drink initially, then decided to stay for dinner. At 10:20 PM on a monday we finally got a table after 20-30 mins on waiting list. The drinks area is small but the lovely outdoor terrace makes up for it. The sushi was not great and the entree of soggy tortilla with wet cilantro was terrible, BUT the atmosphere is so special that it is worth going.  Would definitely go again but order something else.

title: Very expensive but very nice
comment: You get what you pay for, quality food and quality service. The pork and the cod are great and the specials they offer are always great. Choose the right wine to go and do ask if unsure.  Great views and two good bars. Make the most of the external lift ride :-)

title: Nice for special occasions
comment: Surprisingly good variety for vegetarians, bit expensive but a good option for s special occasion. Always busy so point in going there without reservation.

title: Great views shame, fantastic service, ok food.
comment: This was my birthday treat from my family, from the concierge to the waiters and waitresses upstairs service was impeccable. It was raining so couldn't see those lovely views very well until it was dark then that glistening London scene was just amazing. Food was good but didn't reflect the price I felt, it is highly priced and wasn't worth it. I wont be going back here but it was a good experience.

title: Too hyped
comment: The food is good, not as exciting as one could hope. The service is ok, could be more attentive but nothing wrong with it. In terms of views its really lacking, yes it will be great if you are two and placed by the windows, but for bigger groups you don't see anything

title: That little something different!
comment: We headed to SushiSamba after a lovely brunch upstairs previously. The staff were really helpful due to the fact a proposal was going to happen in our group halfway through the meal...this changed and the staff accommodated our every request throughout..she said yes! The waiter was knowledgable and helped with the menu choices and every dish delivered was superb.  The Kobe beef was a great choice and highly recommended. Overall a great experience from start to finish. Highly recommended if you are looking for that something a little different and special.

title: Amazing
comment: Came for a friends birthday and the food was amazing. It was full of flavour and everything was presented amazingly. There has a great selection of cocktails and an amazing orange lit tree on their balcony over looking london. it was a great night out and would recommend for that special night out.

title: A lovely ambience
comment: My now beautiful girlfriend and I had our first fate here. We met for lunch rather than dinner but menus were quite similar throughout the day and we didn't feel we missed out. The ambience is calming with a Panoramic view of the London skyline that we and other diners (mainly couples) delighted in. As the name suggests SushiSamba is an eclectic fusion of East meets West and Latin meets East Asian. The sushi itself was heaven to taste as was the tempura vegetables. The service was fast without giving a fast food feel and the waiters were knowledgeable about both the menu and the building itself. It's worth a trip to SushiSamba on the 38th floor of London's iconic Heron Tower for the lift ride and glistening orange 'tree of life' in the outside bar area. Maybe I'm bias because I had met the woman I am now growing stronger and happier with each passing day at this restaurant.  However, even in my most conservative frame of mind I'd have to give SushiSamba top marks and say it comes highly recommended.

title: Sushi heaven!
comment: I celebrated my 21st birthday here and couldnt have asked for a better evening. The view from sushi samba is stunning, there is such an exciting atmosphere to the restaurant. Our waiter provided a brilliant service and the cocktails are totally worth paying extra for! I recommend the "Shiso Fine". We ordered a mix of dishes as there was so much choice! The Tiger Maki is the best sushi I have ever tasted and the black cod is heaven! Cooked and presented beautifully. I wish I could dine here every weekend!

title: Great sushi, amazing place and views
comment: I brought my sister and mum who were visiting in London and they totally loved it. The place is amazing with great views of the city. The food is delicious and great cocktails. The only downside is that it is expensive and you will not stand up from the table very full but it is worth going at least once.

title: Went for drinks, wouldn't be bothered if I didn't go again
comment: After queuing about 15 minutes to get into the lift area as we weren't a table booking we eventually went up. They didn't tell up the top floor was closed due to a private party so we got out, we were then politely informed we had to go down one floor, got in the lift again but it took us straight back to the bottom. The security asked us to leave I explained we hadn't yet been to the bar, I was then rudely told to 'stop playing in the lifts' like we were 10 year olds with nothing better to do. Considering the queue at the bar we were served quite quickly, there were fire pits outside and blankets provided, the seating was comfortable and the decor outside impressive. The view wasn't the best in London but it was ok. Prices were average for drinks for the area.

title: Only if you are in the City
comment: Pretty chic / trendy place with its unusual Brazilian Japanese menu. As the dining options in the City are usually pretty grim, the ambiance of this place is fun and the food very good.  The Rabata grilled chicken is very good and smells divine. The sashimi is also good.  My only reservations are the following. First, the whole dining experience consists of a somewhat unusual medley of mini-meals that are meant to be shared. Second, the views while nice are not the most interesting angles over London. You are mostly looking north towards the Olympic park. Not that much of visual interest but in the Spring the outdoor terrace opens and that must be more interesting. Finally I felt that the menu was reasonably priced overall but there were irrationally priced exceptions. For example, the Kobe beef is worth more than bullion.

title: Disappointed
comment: We were given a voucher to spend for Christmas and was very much looking forward to the visit despite reading the bad reviews. We had a bottle of beer and a cocktail in the bar before (£22!) and then went to our table. The views were very good and we were given a seat next to the window. There were staff everywhere! Almost too many, we had a different member of staff serve us every time!  We dined on 2 x of the sushi samba rolls which were very good and enjoyed, then ordered a few other dishes and some Kobe beef sushimi (4 bits of average tasting thin meat). All in all the food was good but nothing special. We had a few other bottles of beer and 2 glasses of wine...bill over £200 !!  Wow, I guess you are paying for the location. If you are looking for a fine dining restaurant then this isn't it, this felt like a gimmick restaurant, one to say you have been too and pay a fortune for the privilege. We would definitely not come back.

title: Just DIVINE
comment: Lychee cocktail is a must to start!! Value for money, food was delicious and despite a tiny hair on the side of our calamari dish everything was amazing. We were given 2 rounds of champagne to say sorry but food was amazing. Eaten in numerous sushi restaurants all over the world and this one was definitely up there with one of my favorites!!

title: Should be issued with torch on entry
comment: Can't really fault Sushisamba - food was really good, service very attentive (wine took a while to arrive and we were offered a glass of champagne as apology) and friendly, ambience lovely, the lift going up to the 39th floor is downright sexy! Only niggle was it was so dimly lit we could hardly read the menu but to sum up; buzzy, vibrant place with a fabulous view, worth a visit.

title: Best Restaurant in London
comment: I've been to nearly every Sushisamba around the world and London's has the be the best. The service is impeccable, the food is fantastic, and the view is incredible! The journey to the top of London! It is nearly impossible to get a prime time seating, so book ahead. This restaurant is so good, there is a velvet rope to manage the crowd wanting to get in. An experience that MUST be had!!!

title: Ordered 17 Taquitos. No regrets
comment: Words cannot truly express my family's adoration of this restaurant. We used to go somewhere new for every special occasion. In the past 25 years we've only returned to the same places a couple times as normally one of us has found something new they want to try. However since coming here, it's like we found our place in the world. No-one wants to go anywhere new because, in our opinion, it just can't get better. Most of us are vegetarian, me and my father being meat eaters and yet we all have plenty to choose from and find that the vegetarian options are not only as good as the meat but often better. The reason I'm writing this is because we have another reservation in a couple days and just before we go I start dreaming of their veg taquitos. As a philosophy student, I don't know if there's is some all powerful creator but those taquitos are the best damn evidence for one I've ever seen.

title: Very lovely experience
comment: I usually don't write rewiews but this time I had a great experience and since there are a lot of bad rewiwes about this place I want to say that the place is beautiful. Portions are small and it is a bit expensive, but overall it is worthed. If you wanna be "filled up" with a few quid go to mcdonalds. The service was excellent, Carolina is great person. They also gave us free glasses of champagne and a some sweets after dinner. I'll go again.

title: Sushi-Convert
comment: I have been here for a friends birthday because she loves sushi and we haven't been disappointed by the food which was nicely presented and very tasty. Personally I am not the biggest fan of sushi but I can definitely recommend the place. Not only a beautiful place to dine, have a cocktail or to enjoy the nice view over London it is authentic food. The service was alright but a bit slow. We had to remind the waiter twice that food was missing and the constant refill of tab water without asking was a bit annoying.

title: Favourite bar in London
comment: I've been to the bar at Sushi Samba twice now and I think I'm growing to love it more and more every time I go. I love the lift experience. The drinks are expensive. A beer is about £7 but the views are well worth that in my eyes.

title: ...ok
comment: I went here a while back and never really bothered to review the place because it struck me as neither here nor there.  The restaurant inside is impressive to look at, with the huge orange beams overhead and the grand tree twinkling outside on the terrace. However, the place felt like a massive canteen. Service was rushed with waiters literally power walking up and down the long rows of tables and there was no personal touch whatsoever.  Because the place is so big and airy there's an overwhelming noise to contend with - no good if you're on a date or romantic meal.  Food was really nice but the waiters didn't bother to explain what each section was and it was more just a lucky dip when we ordered.  Overall I'd say it's good to go once for the experience but I wouldn't go again.

title: Incredible evening. First class food.
comment: Totally lived up to the hype. The bar area was beautifully lit by a gorgeous fairylit tree, and although busy, it was a nice buzzy type bustle. We had a group of 8 booked into the restaurant later. Our waiter made incredible recommendations to cater to all tastes and to allow the table to try a little bit of everything that Sushisamba offers. Not one of the dishes disappointed- even those I would not have chosen if I had picked myself. The sushi was incredible, but as were the other dishes and the saki. The restaurant was lovely and buzzy, but not overbearing. All of us had a very enjoyable and memorable dinner- we will definitely return. Very much recommend.

title: Smart, funky, worth a visit
comment: Managed to swing a Saturday night booking. The food, ambience and views did not disappoint. Main courses are deceptively filling, especially after sushi rolls, so don't over order if you are light eaters like us. Save your tummies for the cocktails or desserts. My missus had a lychee/mint cocktail and loved it. I loved the green bean tempura starter with the dip. We retired to the bar after eating and watched as the beautiful crowd waited for tables after 10pm. Well worth a visit for a special occasion. Apparently, you can rock up without a booking and get a dinner table within an hour or so on most nights. Not absurdly priced and, to their credit, serves tap water. We would return with friends, especially if they are visiting from overseas. Annelies, our server, was super friendly. If anything, the staffing is a tad too attentive. At least 5 people tried to clear our plates when they appeared finished (they weren't). Perhaps they need to allocate just one or two servers per table to avoid this slight annoyance.

title: Ok here is the deal
comment: First of all the food is a 3.5 to me maybe 4 but thats the worst part. The environment is probably my favorite for an amazing view of any particular city. This just happens to be the best view in London. It's atmosphere is incredible and the staff was actually amazing. We showed up early on a Saturday and got in at the bar no problems but the lines when we left looked long. I will gladly come back

title: High rise heaven at a price
comment: Being a country dweller, the novelty of eating Sushi on the 39th floor of a building overlooking the Gherkin, will undoubtedly influence one's opinion. Arriving at the ground floor entrance of the Heron Tower and bypassing the queue of hopefuls who had not booked 2 months in advance, added to the air of mystique.  Arriving in the bar, populated with pretty young things and an impressive outdoor 'tree' sculpture further imbued the sense that this was a special place.  Not being desensitised to London prices, the shock of cocktails at £13 + gradually wore off as the delicious combination of flavours worked their magic.  Whilst south American food doesn't obviously mix with Sushi, in this case the quality and ingenuity of the dishes is something to behold.  If I said this was probably my second best tasting experience, only beaten by Heston's Fat Duck then there is little more you need to know.  Some may not appreciate the open canteen style room, which can be noisy, or the slightly incongruous house DJ, but in our cocktail invigorated state it was perfect.  Probably a one off visit, given the heady cost, but one I wouldn't have missed.

title: Excellent food with a fantastic view....
comment: My colleague and I hosted a client lunch at SuhiSamba and I now realise why it gets such rave reviews. The view alone is breathtaking, from the lift which rides the side of the building, to the bar looking over the Gherkin, to the panorama offered by the restaurant. The menu is extensive and not really knowing what to order we asked our waitress to provide a selection. The food that came was truly superb, from blackened cod on skewers, pork belly, tempura shrimp to sushi to finish. highly recommended and looking forward to dining with friends and family in the future.

title: Fabulous
comment: By far the best sushi I have ever had! The views were breath taking and the cocktails were amazing. The lychee cocktail is a must.

title: Went here for cocktails
comment: Went for a drink here and loved it, never tried the food and it is expensive but great to go for one or two cocktails to enjoy the view. Expresso Martini is the way forward!

title: Paying for the setting
comment: Please only visit Sushisamba if you are a sushi lover! If you're looking to be adventurous or try something new, then don't bother with this restaurant. The views are amazing and it's definitely a hot spot for drinks, but that's about it. Service was quite slow & food was very expensive. How can I leave spending over £200 and still be hungry? We left completely dissatisfied...not worth it.

title: Great venue, great food, great service (mostly!)
comment: We went for dinner on Friday evening around 11pm and we loved the venue as soon as we walked in! The atmosphere was incredible, music was spot on and the restaurant has incredible views.  The food was great, personally I'd recommend the black cod and the São Paulo wrap. Wine was great and the staff knew the menu through and through. Most of the staff were great, very friendly and welcoming etc but there were a couple of 'unfriendly faces' knocking around who were a little brash!  Overall it was a cracking night and everything was very good. Only thing I'd say, especially after reading other reviews on here, is they should give a couple of their staff (and it really is one or two and one has been mentioned regularly on other reviews!) a bit of a talking to and remind them that we're the customer and they're not doing us a favour letting us eat in this restaurant!  We'll definitely be back though!

title: Fantastic meal with a wonderful view
comment: I booked a table for two for lunch at Sushi Samba. When we arrived, the impressive lift ride takes you up to floor 38. The restaurant is flooded with natural light which makes for a great atmosphere and an amazing view of London. The waiter we had was brilliant. We ordered 3 small plates and two lots of sushi between us. The food was delicious and it arrives quickly, as and when it is ready. After lunch we went to the bar and had a cocktail, again this area was bustling with a great atmosphere. I would definitely recommend this for an impressive meal!

title: Perfect for Business and Pleasure
comment: Went here for business lunch with clients. Very easy to book on line and received a text to remind me a couple of days before and to confirm. The setting is excellent with some great views over London. We had to wait around twenty minutes for a pre booked table, so was not impressed at that stage. However when we did get seated the staff were accommodating to our tastes and dietary requirements. The black cod was absolutely fantastic. We chose a taster menu so we could try a bit of everything. We were here for nearly three hours, but were not rushed by the staff. Although the food is excellent, it is not the cheapest restaurant, so for special occasions, or if someone else is paying!!

title: A place to be seen as opposed to eat
comment: Sushisamba is definitely a place to be seen as it is full of trendy people. Both the food and drinks I've had there have been very tasty but it is exceedingly overpriced and the waiting staff are very pushy trying to upsell and encourage to have the kobi beef. The acoustics aren't great if there are more than two people at the table, any more than this and you will struggle to hear what is being said and join in any conversation. The bar area is non-existent and wherever you stand is the wrong place. There are a few seats but you have to be very lucky to actually get one. The whole layout of the bar is terrible, you are either stood in the way of the main corridor between the bathrooms and the restaurant, or you are in the way of the bar staff coming back and forth. This is a place to go to only once for the experience the great views, but take plenty of money with you.

title: Lovely view
comment: Went there for a drink. The place is very nice and the the view is absolutely fantastic!!! I really enjoyed the time at the 38 floor. The place is busy but not chaotic. The atmosphere is nice and the smell of sushi is really a pleasure. Next time I will definitely try some food as well.

title: Stunning location and sights
comment: A lively place that gets very busy and had a lovely meal. The cocktails are delicious and staff are knowledgable and attentive. Spread over two floors, with the choice being on the Terrace that is well heated and had great views over London. A booking is a must and the food and beverage is on the pricey side, but nothing unusual for the location and service.

title: Wonderful evening
comment: Food, drink, atmosphere is all high quality and delivered with great service. Perfect location for a special location or for drinks with an impressive view.

title: Friends 50th Birthday Dinner
comment: Friend booked to have dinner for 6 of us and what a lovely celebration we had. We were given a great table and the staff were excellent in explaining all the choices on the menu. The cocktails were great as was the food. Prices were reasonable. To get to the restaurant it had an amazing fast lift which we had to go up and down twice!! The views over looking London at night from the main staircase to the restaurant were amazing and it had an outside bar with a stunning tree. Very much looking forward to returning.

title: Awesome view, fascinating food
comment: I booked this on the recommendation of my guest and was not disappointed. It was a bright if not sunny winters day and being on the 38th floor in the City of London, with windows all around made it very special.  The food was fascinating. Very different. Perfect for people who like grazing- we had lots of mini dishes to share and the flavours were great. The salad was a work of art and tasted great. This is probably not a good place for someone with a huge appetite as in the Japanese way we left the table three quarters full.  Service was excellent.  So why have I awarded a 4 not a 5. Firstly the price is so high. I knew what I was letting myself in for so it was not a surprise but it is ridiculous. Our lunch for two was over £200. In my case this was a justifiable business expense but I wouldn't dine here on anything but a special occasion.  Second while the service was good my guest and I both found we could not understand anything the waiting staff said. None of the five or six people who spoke to us were native English speakers - no problem you might think. But this is a nosey restaurant and an unusual and unfamiliar menu that needs some explanation. We did fine but every time something was brought to the table the staff would explain it (great) we would ask for a repeat and then gave up - looking at each other and saying 'did you get any of that - no - me neither'. I think part of the problems is the staff are busy and they speak very fast saying what is to them very familiar things. (Just to be clear I don't care where these great waiting staff come from - I care that I had little idea what I was eating. ) Overall though this is an amazing place to eat.

title: Top cocktails
comment: Visited this time just for cocktails. They were amazing as usual. The views of London are breathtaking. Worth paying the high prices

title: AwefulService
comment: I went to Sushi Samba today for my anniversary lunch with Hubby. I am a strict vegetarian which did tell them clearly as soon as i started ordering. cocktails (I tried tom-yum) was great & so was the "vegetable-small plates" which i order as appetizer. For mains, i order "MUSHROOM TOBANYAKI" & my husband ordered some "Kobe beef dumplings" (not sure about the name yet, but attaching the picture for reference), So the waiter served me the dumplings without mentioning it was beef, so ate 3 out of 4, that when he served the veg TOBANYAKI. Its when i realized the damage was done. Being a strict Hindu & vegetarian above all, i am deeply offended at so many levels. I am never going there again & would stop any strict veterinarians. At least you expect a decent service is such an expensive place.

title: Superb evening
comment: I took my daughter for her 18th birthday celebration. We had a delicious cocktail. .followed by a superb meal. The menu was explained by a very attentive, friendly and happy member of staff..I happened to say we were celebrating a birthday, but didn't think any more about it.. and after our meal they presented my daughter with a candle on a macaroon..which was a lovely personal touch. We both loved the experience and will be back. Plus you get a fantastic view of London.

title: Great views and good food but disappointing service
comment: Food was very good albeit a bit pricey. Other than the sushi I would suggest the black cod or teriyaki poussin robata, yellowtail taquito, wagyu ishiyaki and the banana and chocolate cake with ice cream. Service unfortunately was not up to scratch. Although they were happy to seat us closer to the windows rather than squeezed next to the entrance as originally seated, the waiters forgot to explain the menu, they were more attentive to larger groups and forgot to bring some sushi that we ordered - and effectively we cancelled this item. The sake sommelier this time round wasn't up to scratch either - I was expecting a lot input and advice on the sake options. Other than that, atmosphere is great and views are stunning.

title: Breathtaking
comment: The food is amazing and the service excellent! ! I totally recommend it to anyone wanting to enjoy the Japanese cuisine and feel the city beneath him !

title: Great food ruined by snotty front of house lady
comment: I never understand why restaurants that demand £100 a head insist on employing jumped up staff who raise their eyes to heaven if you ask them to put your coat in the cloakroom. The waiters are excellent but the hostesses are shocking. I think this is an important message to all expensive restaurants. Many people save up to come for very special occasions and expect to be treated in an amazing way. I will be writing to the manager of sushi samba.

title: amazing time
comment: What a wonderful place to spend the evening, if you don-t mind splashing out grab a couple of good friends head out for a nice dinner and drinks in this breathtaking place.  great view over all of the city of london.  Fantastic drinks, wonderful atmosphere and people.

title: Nice place
comment: The view was spectacular and food was amazing ! It's always nice how they prepare the sushi! The chicken heart were a surprise!

title: Awesome view and food too
comment: Took my girlfriend her for a treat as she wanted to go for a while  What can I say absolutely amazing venue , staff were super friendly and super efficient without being overbearing  Food was absolutely awesome really great flavours textures and portion sizes were more than generous  Really lovely place and worth the money these guys got it right and the staff just make the place  Well done guys defo one of my top picks in London

title: Very bad experience
comment: We came here last year.  Despite making it very clear that we are vegan, and ordering from the vegan menu, one of our main dishes arrived with an egg yolk on top. We sent the food back, and the exact same dish was returned to us with the egg yolk scraped off. You could still see the indentation.  We were convinced to try some sake. We ordered one glass. When the bill came, it didn't look right. Turns out they had charged us for a whole bottle of sake. I regret not asking them to waive the service charge. For such an expensive place, this just didn't cut it. Oh, and by the way, if you order a drink from the bar, expect to be ripped off.

title: Prices are not justified
comment: The food was quite good, but nothing extraordinary to justify the insane prices! If you want a great view, there are plenty of fantastic restaurants in London that will have great food too!

title: The spectacular view comes second to the amazing food
comment: Whilst the location and venue of Sushisamba is somewhat of a novelty, the food is anything but that.  I would recommend arriving early to have a drink at the bar because although the bar is usually packed it's worth the view.  The room is very nicely decorated with big ceilings. If you can, I might ask for a table at a window because there are quite a few tables in the middle with not as good views.  The view is great but certainly doesn't over shadow the amazing food. The menu is a little confusing at first as it s amid of Brazilian, Peruvian and Japanese but the waiter was very helpful and went right through the menu explaining the various dishes and their origins. We ordered our wine and after quite some time the waiter came back saying he didn't have the wine we ordered and suggested another wine which happens but it was a little annoying as our first two dishes had already arrived at this point. The dishes mostly come out quite quickly by the way.  We had 8 dishes between 3 (and two deserts) and that was about enough. We were nicely full after it.  The scallop seviche was amazing to taste - full of flavor and a bit different. It looked amazing also. Black cod miso was some of the most succulent pieces of fish I've had and although it was a little sweet which is not to my taste it was really good and I enjoyed it immensely.  After four dishes there was a change of staff and our waiter introduced a new a waiter and said he would be looking after us, unfortunately he didn't really look after us and we were waiting a long time for the next four dishes. We didn't mind as we were there for a nice long lunch and in fact it was a good thing but less patient guests may not be happy with similar service.  The next four dishes arrived which was mostly sushi and sashimi and the samba rolls. All looked and tasted amazing and really some of the best sushi I've had in London.  The location and food are simply amazing and although the staff and service were slightly patchy over all both were also good. It's not the cheapest restaurant but personally I didn't mind paying a bit of money for good food and a good meal and you will definitely get that here.

title: Great view, grumpy service
comment: I went here for lunch with a friend during the week. The view is incredible and I really enjoyed seeing London from a completely new angle.  However, when we arrived we were told that we would have to sit at the sushi bar as they were fully booked. I don't understand why places like this don't keep any walk-in tables in their main restaurant space. The staff member who told us was very offhand and unapologetic - almost as though we were interrupting his day.  We decided to get a drink at the bar while we waited to see if we would be able to get a table. We waited for about 20 minutes and nobody offered to take our coats or seat us elsewhere.  We ended up sitting at the sushi bar and ordered a few dishes, including two of the black cod. We also had Diet Cokes, which came flat with very little ice. When our dishes arrived, there was only one black cod. We had to wait while they processed the other one. The waitress who served us was very sweet and accommodating, but her colleagues barely smiled at all. The food was excellent and I cannot fault it. I can understand why people may not worry about the service when the food is so good!  However, it felt like a lot of other tourist destinations - when most people only visit once, they don't care about giving an all-round experience.

title: What a View
comment: This review is for the downstairs bar (on 38?). The views are amazing. It gets very crowded and there is very limited indoor seating if you are only having drinks. Make sure you aren't wearing trainers/sneakers.

title: Amazing place, bonfire at the terrace
comment: food not up to standards, would prefer other sushi places. However i come here for the view and drinks

title: Loved it
comment: Try the spicy tuna rolls they're spectacular Wonderful setting - incredible view of the city  Brilliant service  One down side is the entrance is pretty uninspiring. I felt like I had come through the back door

title: Professional staff and delicious food
comment: Our party of 5 visited this restaurant on a Friday evening in early December. When we arrived the table was not ready and we went to the bar area for a drink. The bar area was very full with nowhere to sit. We ordered drinks and after a further wait of approx 15 minutes were called to our table. The restaurant is very modern looking and has good views of London. Our waiter introduced himself and explained the menu, he was knowledgeable about the menu and happy to make suggestions when asked. He took our order and advised that the sommelier would soon be over to take any drink order. We ordered our wine and the plates of food soon started to arrive. As each dish was presented at the table, the waiter explained what it was. The food was delicious and well presented. We finished off the evening with coffees and final drinks.  In all I would recommend SushiSamba, the staff are professional and pleasant and take time to look after you. My only other comment is that the restaurant was extremely busy on the Friday night that we visited, with the bar area feeling over crowed and the general vibe being quite young and vibrant. I am sure that is is to be expected and quite normal for a Friday night in London, however my suggestion for those wishing for a quieter experience may wish to go during a week night.

title: Very Good SUSHI
comment: We booked a table 3 months in advance and after our meal we all thought it was well worth it. Its certainly not cheap but price can be justified by high quality sushi and great service. I am so glad we now have a local sushi restaurant called Inso Pan Asian as they too offer very high quality and fresh sushi in Northwood Hills London for a fraction of the price.

title: High expectations met.
comment: Very good quality, very well presented food. Dizzy heights and breathtaking view of London. Service was good, basically I closed the menu and asked them to order for the 4 of us, the selection they chose was perfect, a great mix of meat dishes and sushi works of art. Bar is OK but I wouldn't rush back there just for the bar, I will absolutely be returning for the food. The dishes we had which were exceptional were Black Cod, Shrimp Tempura, Wagyu Gyoza, Lamb Chops, Tiger Maki roll and the Love Rio desert.

title: Fantastic food - even for veges!!
comment: I booked this restaurant 3 months in advance for my boyfriends birthday and I was pretty nervous as I'm vegetarian. I need not have worried!! Our waiter was brilliant and helped me pick some of the best vege dishes and they were completely delicious! I had the veg tempura, veg taquitos and eggplant robata. My boyfriend was also incredibly happy as his food was equally divine!  The desserts are a must- we ordered three between us (we just couldn't decide) and we could have happily eaten them all again several times over. There is a great lovely atmosphere here and the views are obviously great! A must visit!!!

title: Best place ever
comment: Sushi Samba is my favourite restaurant in London. The view, the atmosphere, the staff, everything about this place is terrific. Also DONOT forget to try their dessert platter With Love from Rio. It's a platter from heaven. And yes the sea bass tempuras are no less. Everything about this place is on point!

title: Great
comment: Lunch and the Food is magnificent. Lovely sushi and sashimi. I really liked it. Had a great lunch. Sake was nice. The service was ok, a very busy lunch time so not perfect.

title: Great spot for a drink or two in the evening
comment: Ok so it's London and it's a swanky bar so clearly it's not going to be cheap! That aside, the views are great and the staff are pleasant. We went for espresso martinis which are amazing, but there's a good range of drinks to order. We were there on a Friday, and although late on it became less City/London folk and quite Essex, it had a great atmosphere and we didn't feel too out of place!

title: Sushi is fine, service is terrible
comment: I have eaten at many Sushi Sambas in the world, but for some reason this one always manages to disappoint on service. After being manhandled by a snobby doorman, our waiter literally forgot every other item we ordered. You would not think it was so difficult to remember a £15 sushi roll, but he forgot on multiple occasions and then told me he thought I was still deciding. He basically tried to flirt instead of just doing his job. While I find the sushi nice, the staff is just a bit too much. And when you have a corporate budget to go anywhere, isn't I nicer to at least pick a spot with decent service.

title: Vibrant, friendly atmosphere
comment: We booked for an early dinner at 6.00pm, which was lucky as the restaurant was full within the hour! This didn't effect the attentive service we received all evening nor the speed at which the food was served! Great service, fantastic food! Definitely recommend if you're not on a budget!

title: Amazing Lunch
comment: We had lunch on Saturday at Sushisamba and was not sure what to expect. However we were not disappointed. The trip in the external glass lift to the 39th floor was amazing. The service was great and the food was exceptional. We can recommend the Black Cod and the Pork belly. The cocktails were great and the wine selection was great. The restaurant has a good atmosphere and the views are breathtaking - we had the advantage of a sunny afternoon. The cocktail bar was buzzing and I would definitely recommend a visit - it would be equally stunning at night. Pity it was too cold (and windy) to sit outside, but it was January. Would definitely go back.

title: Superb
comment: For everybody that likes great sushi in an extravagant atmosphere a must! Fancy, classy, cool!! Super service.  Enjoy your food with a great few over London!

title: Excellent food, excellent drinks and excellent views
comment: My friend and I have been planning on visiting sushi samba for a very long time and finally went this January. Things got off to a very nice start with a Shiso Fine cocktail. We then consulted our waiter on his recommendations and mostly followed his advice. We ordered the pork belly, lobster taquitos, salt and pepper squid, tuna tiradito, miso black cod anticuchos and yoyogi rolls. They were all delicious and I simply couldn't pick a favourite. We ordered a very reasonable bottle of wine with the meal and finished things off with passionfruit cake and some sparkling sake. We then had a couple more cocktails in the bar area, admiring the views. All in all it wasn't a cheap night out at £160 each, but definitely worth splashing out as a treat. I personally much preferred the experience to Duck and Waffle.

title: Amazing view and food!!!
comment: Sushisamba is one of my fav places in London because it has all the elements that I love great sushi, cocktails, music and amazing view. The place it is so modern and nice, the service it's fantastic and they play Latin American tunes all the time... The food is a fantastic infusion of Japanese with Latin American food...the sushi is tasty and unique..you cannot go wrong with any sushi, if you don't have an adventurous palette, maybe dot experiment tooooo much...stay with basics!!! The dessert us fantastic and if you go make sure you have a table with a view.... Decent sized portions, however they are bit small and a little bit pricy...but it is worth it!

title: One of the best restaurant experiances
comment: Not sure where to start, the views are amazing especially in the bar which is great for a drink, they have an extensive cocktail menu which is different from other restaurants rather than just the standard ones. Its light and bright and not too noisy but there is plenty going on around you. The food was great and surprising filling we shared 4 dishes between two and couldn't eat another thing. Everything tasted fresh, we liked how they brought the dishes out one by one rather then all at once. The staff were very friendly and helped us with the menu recommending certain dishes. I can't wait to go again (when I can afford it!)

title: Elegance, Class and Cocktails
comment: This place was one of my highlights when visiting London, the cocktails were amazing and THE VIEWS! The views are the main reason to visit this place, we went at night and thought they were breath taking however, I would have quite liked to see them through the day. Can't wait to go back to this place again in April on my next London trip.

title: Easily - one of the best restaurants in London
comment: I have eaten at S.Samba many times now; its difficult to describe this stunning restaurant. Its not only the amazing and varied food - its the venue and the amazing views + the impeccable service, delivered by the floor Manager, Oto and his team. We celebrated our son's 29th Birthday with his wife. From start to finish everything any anything was perfect. We had a range of dishes, including tempura prawns, salt and pepper squid, Kobe beef. I dont think the most miserable nit-picker could find fault. I am quite hard to please if I pay high end prices; its not cheap here and it not ridiculous prices either. Its 100% tip top quality. Great value for money. Go there !!

title: Simply Yum
comment: amazing venue, amazing food, wonderful wines ....a true treat...for the max 35 crowd, it seemed - oh well, am young at heart:-)

title: Great food, disappointing service
comment: I have been to Sushi Samba twice - once for lunch and once for dinner. Both times, the food has been amazing - beautifully presented sushi made with fresh fish and the robata is super tender and fantastic. The drinks are also fantastic. Considering the fact that you are going to spend easily upwards of £100 on food here, I think it is disgraceful that I need to ask for ANYTHING, let alone several things (staff forgetting to take drink orders, food taking upwards of 45 minutes to come, not refilling water glasses, all when the restaurant wasn't busy). That being said, the view is amazing and the food is great but it is a shame that Sushi Samba sullies the experience with their poor service.

title: Stunning Views & Stunning Food
comment: What an experience! Wallops of flavour and style with each dish. Great wine list and all perfectly in tune. The staff were helpful and patient for sushi novices. A quick cocktail afterwards overlooking London is the best way to finish the evening.

title: Absolutely Fantastic
comment: Easily one of my favourite places in London. The food was absolutely superb, cocktails were brilliant, service faultless and the view stunning. Our waiter took the time to fully explain the menu and make recommendations which was a great touch. Would not hesitate to come back for lunch again and already looking for the next opportunity

title: Drinks with a view.
comment: One of the best views in London in my opinion. Friendly staff from the outset and a smart casual dress code keeps it relaxed for drinks. Perfect place to take someone who isn't often in the city! Lovely cocktails and selection of beers and wine. Would like to return in the evening to see the skyline lit up!

title: The best view👏
comment: The best view in London but flexibel with nonamesafety is very strong.Elite venue and elite people.Manzara ve mekan süper

title: Great views, Great Cocktails, Shame about the Food
comment: I've visited Sushi Samba on quite a few occasions, this time we ate the bar. The food was okay, maybe we were over the food as we waited 2 hours for a table but overall the food was disappointing. Great cocktails as always.

title: Really disappointed
comment: We went for dinner with 6 friends on Friday night...probably the first mistake. Absolutely heaving and so noisy! At one point I looked around the restaurant and everyone was sitting in silence or on their phones as noone could hear each other. The service was ok but again hard to hear. Food was ok ish, my cocktail was not great and overall had so much better. My friend thought the restaurant reminded him of a modern service station! It was not a relaxing experience. It may be a place I would feel differently about if I went midweek lunch/dinner but Friday was horrible! It actually was hard to focus on the food.

title: Likeable food - experience is a bit of a let down
comment: Sadly our visit got off to a bad start with hazard tape all over the cracked windows on the lift shaft and some cones making a small space waiting for the lift to arrive very cramped.  Once we did head up we couldnt go to the restaurant floor but had to go to the bar floor instead, however no-one seemed to know we where there - we were told we would be called when our table was ready and our drinks at the bar could be charged to the table bill, not the case, we had to pay for them seperately when one of our party who had been running late was taken straight to the restaurant and called to see where we were! Once we got to the right floor and went to check our coats and bags into the cloakroom the attendant got halfway through dealing with us before stopping to deal with another customer, one assumes they were more important than us, our complaints ignored completely. Had this not been a business lunch and my boss insisted we stay as our clients had not witnessed the problem, I would have happily walked away at that point. Fortunately the staff inside the restaurant were a lot better but sadly the quality of the setting is not. Not sure if the decor is intended to look 'shabby chic' but in the end looks simply cheap and tired, added to the small tables for the style of eating the experience is pretty dismal. As for the view, pretty sure there is one but a lot of the tables really dont get to see much of it and you would have to intrude into other table spaces to actually see it. The food? Great....really great. We opted for the 'sampler' style dishes, a steady stream of different bite sized dishes to share and too many good ones to remember.  Would I go again - probably not, the food definitely justifies the price but the place warrants something more roadside cafe.

title: Dissapointing
comment: My friends and I were looking forward for this dinner for 3 weeks and were absolutely excited when the day finally came. Unfortunately right before ever we had a chance to try our meals our excitement was knocked to the floor.. Before we even got in a security guy at the door three times shouted in my face to speak louder as he cannot hear me I can assure you I was loud enough to be heard. Then he dropped a comment that we should quickly move on as he has no time for us and other are waiting.. When we got up we had to wait for the table to be ready, we booked it for 5.15pm and the table was only ready at 6pm - that's the whole 45 minutes.. When we finally sat down at our table we were approached by one of the waiters (he was Asian, middle aged man) who was completely disrespectful to my friend. While he was explaining what food they have he started clicking his fingers right in her face and saying 'Hello, hello!!! you look lost madam! Can you pay attention!! (clicking fingers again) Hello, hello!! Can you listen when I talk to you!' .. Absolutely disgraceful! I could not believe my eyes that we have been served like that in a finest restaurant. Thankfully after another waiter come over (this time younger) who said he will serve us as the other man was just covering him. Unfortunately by them we were completely put off. Still tried to have a good time spend a £100 (£250 between three of us) and altho0ugh the food was amazing I would not recommend this finest restaurant only because of their service...Disappointing...

title: Very poor - from great to poor
comment: What has happened to this place?! No welcome on arrival. 25 minute wait, after 3 reminders, for cocktails, which were poor. Ordered drinks with mixers on the side and arrived drowned.  Food previously excellent was very poor.  Lacked atmosphere. Now crammed with tables.  Won't be back. Such a shame.

title: Nice food great location - stunning setting
comment: Beautiful setting and the staff were very friendly and attentive, especially since there was quite a large group. 14 of us.  We had a nice selection chosen for us, both fish and meat and a fairly good selection of wine. We also had a bottle of Saki, which was a good accompaniment and a nice change - although I did return to the wine.  The outside space and views are stunning.

title: Good... but not excellent.
comment: As one of London's most talked about restaurants, I was really looking forward to giving Sushi Samba a go. Booking wasn't the easiest, we booked around three weeks in advance but couldn't get a table at a more sociable time than 10:15pm (even further ahead was all booked up at peak times too). However I viewed that as a good sign in light of the obvious popularity. Perhaps the best thing about the restaurant is the venue. On the 39th floor of the Heron Tower in the City, the views are incredible. Food wise, we had five dishes between the two of us and despite exclusive flavours (I recommend the wagyu beef), but I left not really full but certainly a few quid lighter. A great experience, but you do pay for it. Certainly worth a try, but perhaps save for a special occasion.

title: Wow sushi with a view
comment: The best sushi I've eaten, delightful cocktails and what a view. Excellent service, atmosphere and choice of food (not just fish). Can't wait to visit again. Just getting the lift up to the restaurant was fun.

title: Went to a cocktail party
comment: Excellent venue for a cocktail party - great eats and super cocktails. The sake was especially good and I had a chance to sample many different varieties. Superb views over London!

title: Been there done it
comment: As a lover of both sushi and cocktails couldn't wait to visit. Average taste, and the price was like the way in.....highly elevated

title: AMAZING!!!!
comment: I was there this week! OMG the view is just amazing ...food was excellent. I've never eaten maki like this.. I really recommand this bar/resto . I will definitely go back there again when I will be in London!!!!-

title: Best meal in London!
comment: The food and service is excellent! Especially loved the São Paulo sushi roll, very delicious! We also got a lovely sit by the window and enjoyed the amazing night view. Highly recommended!

title: Can't wait to go back!! Love this place ❤️
comment: We went to sushi samba for a few drinks, the view was mind blowing!! We ended up having dinner at duck and waffle in the building and loved it. The fact it has an outside area so high up with the views and small open fires to keep you warm is great for smokers. The staff were sooo friendly and made us feel very welcome. I've heard you can book breakfast and watch the sunrise over London...can't wait to go back in the summer and see this! 100% recommend going here.

title: Amazing view, Okay-ish food
comment: Seviche dishes were very nice, but I wouldn't order sushi again- it didn't taste authentic. The atmosphere was great for a night out, but I didn't like their music lists.

title: Sushi Samba - great location but work to be done
comment: Expectations were high for our visit to Sushi Samba as we have heard such great things and the location, view and setting of the restaurant did not disappoint! The restaurant looks top notch and the view (including the elevator ride) is incredible however we left disappointed which was such a shame. The main reason was the service was bad and when you're paying a lot of money you expect it to be good. We had a late lunch sitting at 3.45pm and during the service they clearly changed staff and we were unfortunately forgotten - the waitress that occasionally did attend our table made us feel like we were an annoyance! The food was good but not excellent - living in Melbourne we are spoilt for good Japanese food and this just didn't stand out as we had hoped. I will say - we had the prawn tempura and this was by far my favourite dish I would probably still go back just for this dish (but just to the bar) and the edamame was great. The other dishes that we had (black miso cod, tuna seviche and samba London sushi rolls) were good but not great. In my opinion the black miso cod at Nobu is better and the Samba London sushi rolls were small and a little uninspiring.
