One other thing that I did not like is that 12.5% service charge is automatically added to the bill - I know that this is standard practice for US restaurants but it's not something I like - I will always tip if the service is good but given the sullen waitress was the one who eventually brought the bill I didn't feel comfortable telling her I wanted it taken off so we just paid it even though it was definitely not deserved. In conclusion, Sushi Samba is great to experience for the view and settings but if your main driver is the food quality and service I would say there is better for far less elsewhere in central London.

title: still my favourite
comment: This place never disappoints , the view , the food , the service , its a real date place with a wow, a perfect treat both for the eyes and the mouth. Yuzu martini cocktails , shrimp tempura , tuna ceviche, samba rolls , a girl couldn't ask for more on a dark January day.

title: Business lunch with amazing view
comment: Located in the city, good for business lunches, it offers an amazing view from the 39th floor. Was was very good and the service excellent, good advice on what to choose from

title: Great sushi and even better view!
comment: I have yet to eat anything bad from Sushisamba! One of my favourite things on the menu is green bean tempura - doesn't sound like much, but really is amazing! Get you server to bring you some to munch on while you're looking at the menu. Another one of my favourite things is the taquitos, but like I said I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu!

title: Rude woman at the door! An elevator ride to die for and so so food.
comment: Seriously, the dark skinned woman with the big hair at the door was seriously rude and took the edge of the whole experience. We'd booked a table, dressed up according to the webpage suggestions, but wasn't sure about the entrance. When asking her, very clear that she was the porter, if this was the entrance to SushiSamba she said, in a very superior voice: "You are not welcome! One need to have a table booked."... O.M.G!!!  Well, that goes without commenting... Just appalling. why we just didn't leave I don't know to this day, because that welcome really affected the whole evening.  Very "spacy" elevator ride up to the restaurant and bar! Supercool outdoor bar, nice restaurant, Absolutely nothing to complain about the food (nothing exceptional though). Supernice cocktails and stunning desserts. But of course it all comes with a fairly edgy bill as well... Only thing to mark is that the whole restaurant was very dark. Too dark to be able to read the menus (we still have our eye sight in order ;-)) and what worse is too dark to even experience the food with our eyes. Although that was in itself a quite interesting experience. Just to use all the taste senses to experience what we ate. Well, replace that rude women at the door and it will be an experience well worth the money.

title: Amazing Place!
comment: for me it's the best room in london great attention to detail and stunning views of selected personnel to price cutting edge short everything perfect would spend every night to enjoy the atmosphere of this lovely place

title: If you like amazing sushi...
comment: Served at an amazing location (38th floor) and willing to spend some money; go here! Best sushi we ever tasted we think. Very good quality, very friendly and skilled staff.  Make reservations, they are very popular.

title: New Year's Day lunch with a view
comment: SushiSamba has a great reputation and I was taken by my boyfriend as a surprise for my birthday. The lift up was really exciting, and the interior of the restaurant is absolutely gorgeous. The view on the 39th floor was amazing. The main dining room was airy, spacious and very modern. We were taken to our table near the window which meant we could have a good view of the city.  Obviously it's important to understand that this restaurant isn't cheap, so we took that with a pinch of salt. We ordered several things off the menu, including sashimi, nigiri, a couple of rolls, a couple of starters and one of their grilled meat dishes. The rolls were hit and miss; we could have lived without them. The sashimi and the nigiri were great, and you could tell the fish was of very high quality. The stand out dish was the lamb robato; if you go, please order this.  Yes, the food was great, but the service did not match up. It all felt very impersonal and slightly rushed. Perhaps everyone had a heavy New Year's party the night before, I don't know, but the servers were all quite cold and quick to move us onto the next thing.  I would say visit SushiSamba for the view, the interior of the restaurant, and to a certain extent, the food. However avoid if you don't like impersonal and cold service.

title: Amazing "chic" sushi
comment: Very fancy place in one of the highest tower in London , in the heart of the City.  Quite expensive though but the quality of fish is really good and the service is perfect (lots of advices given) I recommend it for business or romantic dinner

title: Great atmosphere and view!
comment: Go for a drink. The place is magical! Good bar and music! Great service and cocktails!! The food is nice but nothing more,doesn't worth the prices. I spouse there are better restaurants with excellent food and view. I recommend the chef to visit 'Moon' restaurant in Tel Aviv, well....That's a sushibar!

title: Interesting experience, would definitely come back
comment: Great place to have a restaurant, on the top of London. Stylishly done and hip atmosphere, without being snobbish in any way. Very friendly place. The dishes are very interesting, being a fusion of dishes from Peru, Brazil and Japan. All dishes are shared, giving everyone a chance to try many different things. A great way of eating and definitely a place to visit again.

title: Wonderful sushi and more
comment: During Christmas we decided to take a break from turkey and lunched here. It was fabulous. Fantastic service, perfect portion sizes and a fine flavours. Not everyone in our party of 6 were sushi fans and this restaurant was perfect for everyone. We sampled all the sushi and found each delicious in their own way. The kobe breakfast was a big hit with the meat lovers as were the delicious yakitori.  A lot of reviewers mention the view. Make sure you make time to have a drink in the bar. It has a view south over the city; the view from the restaurant is to the north and east so not many landmarks aside from the Olympic site.

title: Wow
comment: Heard lots of good things about this place but it truly was amazing. It was out first visit but we would definitely recommend and go back again ourselves. We arrived an hour early and sat in the lounge / bar on floor 39 until our table was ready. The cocktails were really well made and there was a good atmosphere & great views.  The food was so good, one of the best places we have eaten. We had the belly pork, black cod, terriaki chicken and also the beef and chorizo dish along with a side of sticky white rice. All were cooked to perfection and the flavours were amazing. I would recommend any of the dishes.  We also had the passion fruit cake to share at the end of the night which was brought out with a candle / happy birthday message as it was my birthday at midnight. The staff were attentive, friendly and knowledgable and they also moved us to a window seat when one was available. The only downside was the bar outside the restaurant area & outside area was closed when we had paid the bill & left the restaurant. the bar on floor 39 had already closed at 11pm prior to us being sat at our table also so we were unable to enjoy more of the cocktails

title: AMAZING
comment: I think it was one of the highlight of my Europe tour. Well done guys, It couldn't be any beautiful than it already is.

title: Views, Ambience and Amazing Food
comment: Still a restaurant in demand, where you can only book well in advance, but it was certainly worth the wait for my birthday treat. The decor itself is interesting with some quirky furniture, orange trees and dare I say it, 70's kitsch touches. The views from both the bar and restaurant are breathtaking and it is well worth going in the evening when everything is lit up. We took advice from our waitress as to what to order - 5 to 7 dishes is what she recommended. The black cod was a particular stand out. We loved our meal here and our free round of cocktails, in celebration of my birthday. Fabulous birthday treat. Well worth the money.

title: Sushi Samba review
comment: Top experience! Excellent dishes in taste and presentation. . .! The service was one of the best there is! The atmosphere was warm and delicate. The breathtaking view was the icing on the cake. . . Bravo!

title: Amazing food, great service
comment: Came here for my birthday on the 23rd december. Wow, what a view! Incredible location. The food was absolutely delicious and the service provided was amazing. My partner is blind and the waiters attending to us went out of their way to make sure we were well catered for and explain what things were to him without patronising him. Can't wait to visit again! I only wish i could remember the name of our waiter, he was so great.

title: Amazing!
comment: Having booked well in advance, my daughter and I have just returned from a wonderful post-Christmas lunch at Sushisamba. Located on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower, the views from the bar, the terrace and the restaurant are sensational - however, I phoned prior to our visit when I realised there was an exterior glass-walled lift, which I just couldn't have coped with. Without hesitation, I was told I could use the staff lift and when we arrived, Jacob, the charming restaurant manager, came down to the ground floor reception specially to accompany me up to the restaurant. Nothing was too much trouble and he did the same to go down when we left. My daughter took the outside lift, which was a great experience in itself. Our waiter was equally helpful, attentive and friendly, explaining anything on the menu and recommending dishes without being at all intrusive. We were made to feel very comfortable so took our time to enjoy the atmosphere, the cocktails and the food and were not rushed at any time. Everything we ordered was delicious and beautifully presented - cocktails, tempuras, lamb chops, poussin and sushi rolls highly recommended. We were lucky to have enjoyed the restaurant's stunning views on such a bright, sunny day for December. A great experience - not cheap but certainly worth it for a special occasion. We will definitely return, next time for dinner and the views of London by night.

title: Visit for the gorgeous view!
comment: Take a lychee cocktail, and sit back and enjoy the view!  Recommend going before the sun goes down and enjoying some nice views between daylight..and the night rolling in.  Fantastic cocktails and would definitely return!

title: Sheer perfection
comment: This is the 4th time I've had lunch at Sushisamba. It's always been for business but I thought I should give it a try on Christmas Day as my family was visiting from France and I really like the place.  My initial impressions remained unchanged: service is impeccable and friendly, food is delightful from start to finish and cocktails are to die for.  If like me, you're a picky eater who doesn't eat fish nor seafood fret not as you will find lots of wonders of the menu!

title: A joke
comment: Upon arrival the security guard commented on my dress code (I was wearing new balance sneakers) and pointed out that next time I should not wear sport shoes. We thought.. fair enough ! We sat at the sushi bar and waiter told us that we could only stay for one hour max. We thought... rather unusual but.. ok ! Then the waiter came and asked for our credit card. We quite did not understand but he told us that they have a problem of clients leaving without paying the bill so as a policy, the restaurant confiscates the clients credit card as soon as they arrive!! We thought ... outrageous! and what kind of clients does this place get ??? Finally the food and drinks arrived. And this was the worst part. The only comment I have about the food is.. really terrible. And the cocktails: even worse. This place is a total (expensive and pretentious) joke.... The only good part was the view from the elevator!

title: Great Atmosphere and food
comment: Great view and atmosphere at the top of the tower. Reasonably loud music but it's a trendy place. Service is very attentive and they have a fusion food-sushi menu. The sushi choices and prices are so-so, but the rest of the fusion menu is great and reasonably priced for the type of venue. Great choice of Sakes. Wine a little overpriced. I wouldn't actually go for the sushi, more for the fusion food (ceviche was awesome), and the view/atmosphere with great service.

title: Just for cocktails, the view is amazing
comment: Just stopped for cocktails in the lounge and loved the place.  Very buzzy, amazing views and great cocktails.  Have rated here in the past but never reviewed it. Good spot for a memorable evening.

title: Fantastic food and drinks with an amazing view
comment: The food was impeccable. We had a selection of sushi and wagyu beef. The cocktails are really well done and I'd highly recommend them even if you aren't normally a cocktail person. The portions are small and we ordered more than the waiter thought we'd want and easily ate it all. This is the place to try it all because everything is done with delicate perfection. My only complaint is how close the tables are together. There was barely room between us and the neighbouring table to squeeze through and even still we had to move our drinks so they weren't bumped. They should think a bit more creatively about the table layout of the two tops so that your not dining so close to others that you might as well be one party. We will return again.

title: F.A.N.T.A.S.T.I.C!
comment: What can I say? It's just fantastic! The view is stunning, the food is to die for and the staff that was in charge of our table was great ! Brazilian of course!!! Lol!! Very friendly and gave us great tips! It's a must go!! Great place,fab deco, and amazing food! Only one thing that it was the downside - too dark to ready the menu..! Ahhh the caipirinha ( famous bra dualism drink had far too much ice! for its price!!!

title: Excellent
comment: Amazing view and exotic food. Pretty expensive but definitely worth it for the very good food and service. Tip: If you want to get a taste of Kobe beef without paying a fortune go for the sliders.

title: Experience of life
comment: Amazing view on the 39 floor spectacular atmosphere the food is a different case wagu beef the highest restaurant in London or maybe Europe don't miss it's not a must you should travel for

title: Excellent food...amazing views
comment: What a place, decor is first class, staff are first class. ...views are great. ..food is excellent. Fresh, tasty....and different. Cocktail menu is impressive too.

title: Very good food and view but noisy
comment: The scene is amazing especially that my first time was back in Dec 2014 in a private function. The toilet view was amazing back then which we messed up but staff were great and phoned us back to make sure were OK. The key to sushi for me is the freshness and the rice and I've recently been in the Philippines and had a great fresh sushi in a not so swanky place but nevertheless both are faultless. London experience is what you pay for in this place but it is worth the spend but far too many people - is that fine dining?

title: Melt in your mouth food, fantastic but pricey!
comment: I booked this as a treat for my partners birthday so I was under no illusion it would be a cheap meal out, I had heard great things about Sushisamba and thought it would be a great experience. When we arrived the waiter asked if we had been before and asked us what kind of food we both liked and recommended plates based on this. You have to try the black cod! Amazing. The food was superb and just melted in your mouth. Fantastic views of London. Will be back when I have saved some more pennies!

title: Lovely food amazing views
comment: Lovely food great service expensive but worth it for a special meal. We went for a birthday lunch for my 16 year old son. Service was excellent made us feel very special, I hadn't ordered a cake or mentioned the birthday but they picked it up and added a candle to his pudding - that's service . It is pricy but for a special meal worth it. If I had unlimited money i would be a regular

title: SushiSamba London Heron Tower
comment: Full of high pressure atmosphere. Difficult to get a booking as it's so popular. Generally, for those in their 20's, 30's and 40's. The service was slick and professional. The standard of the food and drink were high. Jacob from the Czech Republic who served my table was excellent. My only complaint is the difficulty, if you come by car, of finding parking nearby. I dropped my guests at the entrance to Heron Tower, and then struggled to find a car park or street space. Found a space after about 15 minutes of driving around.

title: Great food and amazing views
comment: Remember to book your table well in advance. Food is absolutely amazing, great service and massive choice of sake. Highly recommended.

title: Great food, great views
comment: Fantastic place on top of the Heron Building. The food is excellent and the views are amazing. The menu is pretty eclectic with a pretty wide choice to pick from. Very good cocktails too, and extensive choice of sake. Service was generally fine and pretty efficient. Some of the dishes took a while to get there, but it was very busy on the day we were there. The views are amazing. There is a nice outdoor terrace, which I imagine must be packed when the weather is nicer. Quite a buzzy atmosphere, without being oppressive or too loud. The dining room itself is very cool: windows with views on three sides, very high ceiling. Location is easy to get to: 2 minute walk from Liverpool Street Station. The elevator ride up to the restaurant is not for the faint hearted! Overall, a great place. Good for a business lunch in the city on a weekday, as well as a family lunch on a weekend or bank holiday. We really enjoyed it. The prices are on the high side, but worth it for a special occasion.

title: Unusual fresh flavours.
comment: We went as a family of six on Christmas eve and had a fantastic meal. Ordered six small plate dishes, of which the Kobe English breakfast was amazing. Also raw tuna, Robata and selection of Samba Rolls. Everything was fresh with amazing flavours. Service was first class. Will certainly return.

title: The best sushi in the world
comment: This is absolutely the best sushi i ever been in my life. It's a rooftop sushi, so you can see all the lights of the city . it's OK with friend or couples. Try the gunkan

title: Night& Day Lovely!!
comment: Perfect view delicious food ambiance music adotable in every hour. Coctails bar is crazy...Go and enjoy with London!

title: Great food
comment: Had a fantastic dining experience in a vibrant atmosphere with the added bonus of great views over the whole of London

title: Great food and atmosphere
comment: I visited Sushi Samba as part of a work group on a busy lunchtime. Having previously eaten here before I knew what to expect and second time round didn’t disappoint. The menu is vast and can be a little overwhelming, so we asked the waiter to recommend some dishes to share between six people. We has the crispy taquitos, shrimp tempura which were both delicious. We then had the seviche and tried the tuna, which was so good, we ordered another. We then had the black cod, this was served on skewers and served with Peruvian corn, this had to be my best dish of the meal, the cod melted in your mouth. We then had Kobe beef and finished with a selection of the sushi. All in all amazing food. The service was excellent, often coming over to refresh our water and suggesting wine. Atmosphere is brilliant and the view is pretty spectacular. We finished the meal with an espresso martini, perfect!

title: Best Sushi
comment: Located on 38th Floor amazing views, Best sushi I have had here. Staff very helpful and welcoming. its very busy place always recommend to book in advance.

title: Great views and great food
comment: Didn't get off to the best of starts when the restaurant were 45 minutes late seating us for our reservation without even an apology. After a little persuasion we were given a free round if drinks. The waiting staff are very knowledgeable and helpful - dint be frightened to ask for their advice. I am not a great seafood fan but don't let this put you off there is so much choice on the menue you won't be disappointed. The atmosphere is great and the views over London are fantastic. We were lucky enough to watch the sun set and to experience both day time and also night time views. Be warned the glass lifts are very very fast !!!!

title: fantastic sushi with a difference plus brilliant view over London
comment: We visited Sushi Samba for a birthday treat and it was a real treat. The Fusion of Japanese with South American cuisines was superb. Everything we tried was wonderful. I cannot recommend one dish as they were all equally good. The waiter was brilliant and very helpful with his recommendations. Well worth a visit whatever the occasion.

title: Good food, average dessert, lacklustre service
comment: The setting is stunning, lift ride is the highlight. Sushi was actually very God, dessert not so much, what we didn't like was the rushed service and the fact that we had 5 different waiters asking the same questions all the time and the bill was given to us before being requested and half an hour before our reservation was over. All in all average, enjoy the lift ride

title: Great service and amazing view of London
comment: We went for drinks at the bar, the service was great, the lady that served us was very nice. Service with a smile. Def will be back

title: Amazing food, lives up to its reputation
comment: Been trying to get into Sushi Samba for a long time, decided to book in for lunch for the festive period.  The view going from the lift in the Heron Tower is different to many that you see from other buildings in London (in a good way!) We were given a great seat by the window, the view looks to Stratford and Olympic Park. The service was attentive and our server was very helpful in explaining the way the menu works and giving his recommendations. He recommended five dishes, a mixture of small plates,large plates and sushi. Portion sizes were very big and we were full after a small plate and tiger maki!  The downside was that we were not allowed to package the leftovers, I wouldn't normally mind, but it means we left a whole portion of teriyaki chicken as we were just too full to eat it.  I was very impressed by the taste of the food itself and has probably shot up as one of my favourite restaurants in London,I will definitely be back (if I can get in!)

title: Turned away
comment: I came to london and I wanted to get some really good suhi, so I decided to go to SUSHISAMBA as it had a good reputation. I got to the door as it opened so I could get in. The Doorman told me that it was full and I could not come. So I decided I would come back tomorrow. Once again I came to the door as it opened and the doorman told me  "Look this place is not for people like you" Bearing in mind I was wearing jeans, a shirt and a nice coat and was presentable and had plenty of money on my as I knew it was expensive. There was no dresscode so I just came in a casual but not scruffy look yet I get refused entry. I have been to 5 star resturants that have not been as rude, I can undestand if I came in shorts and a tank top you may not want me but I was presentable. you have lost a customer and my money so I decided to find another sushi resturant nearby and I went in with no quarrel and had a nice meal. A awful way to conduct businees and I would not reccomend it.

title: this is reviewed under Heron Tower
comment: fantastic food, priced accordingly. awesome surroundings and view, stellar service, outstanding food. Special occasion. Views of the greatest city in the world. Gaze and be amazed, with you stomach full of amazing tastes.

title: See the view, eat elsewhere
comment: Atmosphere 5 out of 5. Unbeatable. Amazing outside terrace and bar - even at night in winter. Bring a credit card with plenty of room. Service 3.5 out of 5. Not bad, nothing to write home about Food & Wine 2 out of 5. No better than your common variety high street Japanese chain. Wine - good selection but expect to pay double what you would in any other restaurant. Perhaps that's the price of the amazing venue.

title: Lots of waiting and slow service
comment: First the positives. Great view, nice atmosphere, and lovely food. The trouble is the wait. The service was very slow. It got to the stage where we were all looking around trying to catch someone's eye. Course came in dribs and drabs. It was the same with the wine service. We ordered a bottle but, after our first half glass after tasting it was put in a shared ice bucket out of reach. We waited and waited for someone to come and refill our glasses. At one point I thought about getting up and helping myself, but decided to wait. I was also put off by a comment from the waiter. When taking our drinks order he asked whether we wanted still or sparkling water. I asked for plain tap water (the water in London is usually fine). I think he might have been trying joke, but his reply was "As long as I get a good tip" I've never heard that said before, and I felt extremely uncomfortable. In the end the tip was included, so he must have been trying to make light of the matter, but it felt wrong. I am glad we went, despite the wait for food and refills of wine.

title: both the food and the view are breath taking
comment: Went here for our 1st anniversary after it was booked by mistake instead of the restaurant above. The food was amazing, staff really helpful and well informed. It was a weekday lunch but the restaurant was fully staffed.

title: Fantastic view, great food, fun atmosphere
comment: I dined here last Thursday evening as part of my work Xmas night out. We booked the table about 3 months in advance (as soon as they were released) to guarantee a seat. We had requested a window table and, although this wasn't promised, we were very pleased to see that this request had been granted when we arrived. The views from the restaurant are stunning, even in the rain. It's just a shame we could not get out onto the terrace to truly appreciate them. The menu was quite daunting on first look, as the Japanese/Brazilian/Peruvian blend can seem quite confusing, but the staff were very forthcoming in recommending options, all of which were delicious. We ordered about 12 dishes between 5 of us, followed by dessert, which was more than enough food. Each dish was exceptional, beautiful tasting and well presented. The ceviche and black cod miso are a must! Cocktails were delicious. The only negative is that drinks are priced above average even for a London restaurant, in my opinion. Waiting staff were attentive with regards to the food, but the drinks orders took some time and our first order was incorrect (one cocktail arrived with alcohol for a non-alcohol drinker!).  Overall, I highly recommend Sushi Samba, perfect for a special occasion. Just book well in advance!

title: Roof top terrace - excellent atmosphere
comment: I met some colleagues here for a business dinner and drinks on the roof terrace and it was fabulous. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was electric. I sampled quite a few cocktails from the extensive menu and they were delicious. Highly recommended

title: Reaching new hieghts
comment: We had dinner here with friends and it was superb. The service was excellent and the food just as good. But the view was as good, what a place. Well worth a visit for that special night out when in town!

title: Delicious food
comment: I went sushi samba on Saturday 5 Dec with a friend, (had to book 2 months in advance!!). The lift is super quick and provides stunning views over London. Once you walk in, the bar area is quite cosy. You then walk down the stairs where there is another bar area and the restaurant. The food was delicious , if you not into raw fish etc panic not!! There's plenty of other dishes you can try.. I had El Topo (def recommend this!), miso soup, shrimp tempura. All very nice. It's not a restaurant where you get starter/main etc, you basically pick random dishes and share with your friend/friends- a bit like tapas. There is a lovely rooftop terrace , with seats, heaters and blankets! Overall I recommend . We enjoyed our food/night.

title: Great Again!
comment: Whilst in London on business, I brought a colleague here to try the sushi with caviar. It didn't disappoint. My colleague was impressed and my reputation was saved. Finally, on a cold night and with warm saki in our stomachs, we ventured out on to the terrace for a great view of Christmas time London.

title: Best mojito in town
comment: Best views in Londond had my favorite cocktail Mojito made by Alexanda the Barman. Managed to get seat right by the window London looking its best all lit can't beat it best City in the World. The outside area was all lit up with fairy xmas lights getting everybody in the mood.

title: The views are stunning
comment: The best thing about Sushi Samba is the views and the atmosphere - the food though nice in comparison to similar restaurants does not hit the spot.

title: Birthday treat
comment: I was taking to Sushisamba as a birthday surprise to which I was not disappointed! The food is fantastic from starter to dessert and the staff made you feel very welcome. The view was the icing on the cake to a great birthday!

title: Tremendous place but be ready for the bill
comment: The location as mentioned in other reviews is excellent, unfortunately it was very windy on the night we went so couldn't use the roof terrace so it was a little crowded. Not sure why but each time we ordered drinks I had to ask for mine as it was forgotten. The food was excellent but expect to pay over £100 per person, not my normal budget but it was my son's birthday and he loves Japanese food!

title: Bling bling fusion
comment: Great execution and quality ingredients. The restaurant offers spectacular views and the dining room is sleek yet whimsical decorated. Service was friendly but inconsistently present. The cocktails were outstanding and the black cod rebate was memorable for both its flavor and it's texture.  Go there to eat, drink see and be seen.

title: The manager with a black earring ruins the night ...service without a smile from him!
comment: A fantastic night lovely setting superb food was ruined by an extraordinary event when a restaurant manager accused us of drinking another tables white wine .Admittedly the wine bucket right next to our table wasn't ours we didn't know and a drink was poured ( but not drunk as recipient was having a cheeky ciggy outside ) but at the time the rest of us were drinking red so when the manager came up it was slightly bizarre we were clearly in his eyes guilty until proven innocent "so have you all been enjoying the lovely wine "was his opening sarcastic line with an accusing stare .Are you kidding me £120 per head and I get accused of stealing wine ?15 minutes later after telling us how expensive the other wine was and that the other table had accused us of drinking their wine all night he either got bored or realised he had got it wrong the argument was ended when I suggested "make us pay extra or leave us alone either way please leave you are ruining our night".Everyone around the table was livid at the accusation and the interruption was so avoidable . So sushi samba next time your manager has this problem get him to 1 check with our waiter who had been happily been pouring our wine all night to see if we had been naughty and perhaps 2/ don't put the ice bucket with wine 8 feet away from table it is supposedly for and dont leave it by the table it is not meant for and when you are that busy make sure the customer is aware so if the wine is taking a while to be poured the guest don't help themselves to the wrong wine ! Rant now over I do love this place the food is stunning the cocktails are great but the manager with the black earring learn how to do the job with sensitivity or try a new career .The staff didn't get the £80 tip from us which is a shame as all the other staff were great, bit guilty about that but on this occasion it just wasn't right .

title: Great View, Average Food, Rubbish Service....
comment: Went here with a team from the office for a Christmas celebration, the venue itself it really well presented and the view over London was great. However - the food was nice enough, but no better than a Wasabi takeout available for a fifth of the price at most big london stations, anything cold was fine as nothing seemed cooked fresh when ordered, anything warm was hit and miss as to how well the re-heating / keeping warm had been done. The service was terrible, we were eating before the evening rush really kicked off and they still couldn't get a drink to the table inside of 20 minutes and kept forgetting things we'd ordered. When it came to time to leave, they'd lost my credit card which was behind the bar for security and kept insisting I had it back until we got a manager involved and when I finally got that back, we had to go for drinks in the bar downstairs while they tried to find the two coats and a bag they'd lost in the cloakroom for 3 others from our party of just 10. Personally if you want to go, I'd go for a cocktail at the bar, to see the view, then leave, and don't give them your card or your coat!

title: A novelty only
comment: Ok, it's on the 39th floor and offers great views with an uber trendy interior. The menu did my head in. I can get around sushi quite well, but throw in a South American influence and it was confusing. But that said, when the food came, it was pretty good. The most frustrating bit by far is the service. Seemingly handpicked from a model agency of a hairdresser, it was chaotic and annoying. Food arrived and didn't arrive. Other things we asked for were ignored or forgotten. Good looking but amateurs, and it puts me off going back again. Oh, and it's not cheap either!

title: Beautiful from tip to toe
comment: The venue screams sophistication. Perfect date venue for sushi fusion lovers and those who like to sip fine cocktail. Price is at the high mid-end but worth it if your into the menu. Views are great from one of the highest roof top bars in London. Various spaces to get lost in booking recommended for large groups males be aware there is a shoes only policy.

title: Great but not excellent
comment: Offering a wonderful view and great ambience together with interesting and innovative fusion cuisine, sushi samba almost has it all. There is plenty of staff offering friendly advice and making sure you're not missing a thing. Unfortunately they somehow managed to lose our drinks and it took three reminders until we finally received them. Not a big deal though. The reason sushi samba is not getting a five star rating from me is that the food is great, but not more. It's that little something that's missing for the food to get to the next level truly deserving of five stars. You go more for the experience and remember to book a table far in advance!

title: delish, glam, attentive, worth the wait
comment: this place looks exactly like it does in the pics and the food and ambience is to die for, the staff are helpful and everything is expertly organised well worth the 3 month wait to get through the door

title: Lovely meal
comment: The service was pretty shocking, food came out with no drinks until we had eaten a lot of the first few dishes. Felt as though it was a bit of a rush to get us out the food just kept on coming out and previously we felt as though it was more of a dining experience as it was a slow and enjoyable time taking in each and every moment and mouthful of food. Upon arrival our waiter introduced himself name etc. And then he never came back and we had a different man who didn't introduce himself at all? The waiter was a bit snappy when we asked things such as "we are still waiting for our first drinks" he replied "yes!!! They are coming!" We had to order a cocktail every time we got one in order to have one at a reasonable time. We would finish our cocktail regardless, and would be waiting for the next.  Food is very very salty I woke up absolutely dying for a drink of water and you know that feeling when you just feel dehydrated from food.  Overall the food is fantastic, our first visit was faultless, it is a shame that this time didn't feel so special and that we felt as though the waiter wasn't too interested in serving us. The Kobe beef was lovely, squid and pork belly was gorgeous! Lovely restaurant just a shame about a few things, will possibly return soon.

title: Good food, terrible reception staff service
comment: I took my mum here as we had been looking to try SushiSamba and see what the fuss was all about, and I know the viewed were great. We arrived on time for our booking - 7pm on a Monday - and on arrival we were greater by extremely unpleasant Ladies at the reception desk who didn't even smile or show by welcoming gestures. When I said I had s reservation for 7pm, she said our table was ready and we had to wait 10-15 minutes and we could wait at the bar. I thought fair enough, it's a Monday and were not in a rush for anything. It came to 7.20pm and I hadn't heard anything so I went to ask what's happening with our table - SushiSamba explicitly mention in their booking confirmation email that if you don't show up after 15min, your table will be given to someone else etc - the lady at reception said a huge group had been delayed and they were waiting for them to pay and then we would get our 2 seat table. I said ok, and how much longer will that be, she said 5-10mins. I said it's a shame You don't call the customer to let them know their table will be delayed or something - it's the least you expect from somewhere so famous and pricey too, it's not like there isn't enough staff around. And if that wasn't enough the staff member said it wasn't her fault the big table had run over and made us late, but she'd pass my feedback to her manager. I thought that was disrespectful as they take their timings and bookings so seriously. Anyway, by 7.30pm - 30 mins late - we were at our table. Service at the main restaurant was good staff were friendly, vet differ bet from the arrogant moody staff at reception - shame as that is the first contact you have at Sushi Samba.  Food was good, but not the Best sushi in London.

title: First time, won't be the last
comment: Was so much fun, really enjoyed ourselves! Food was top marks, service good... Was my birthday and they treated us to a little cake. Thanks

title: Great food, great atmosphere as always
comment: Whether I have visited on a weekday lunch time or at dinner time on the weekend, Sushisamba is always buzzing. The atmosphere is great and the food is very good. Not the best desserts but the mains and starters are well wortth venturing out for.

title: Marvellous for special occasions - delicious but pricey
comment: I just can't believe the queues outside the heron Tower. ~make sure that you get a booking. We were a group of 5 so we started off with a bottle of wine for 4. My friend didn't have her glasses on, and alas that costs £38. The food was divine, and the service from the Portuguese waiter was superb. We had lots of asian fusion tapas. plus another bottle of wine ...and the bill was £450. Not what we were expecting to pay, but certainly the food, the service, the surroundings were superb

title: Cool but
comment: An amazing view and also an amazing experience, staff are fantastic and the location is wonderful, BUT THE FOOD IT'S GOOD, NOT GREAT

title: Awesome rooftop bar
comment: We didn't eat here, but I did enjoy the rooftop bar. Great view of the city, relaxed and great music. Loads of people come here but it doesn't get too busy. There's a nice crowd and great vibe. The drinks aren't cheap though.

title: Fabulous!
comment: Amazing location, stunning views and interesting and gorgeous food. Excellent Service - can't wait to go back.

title: Amazing - go
comment: Beautiful room, amazing views ......... and I was, I have to admit, afraid that would be it. Over hyped city restaurant blah blah ...... but no, absolutely not. The food was superb, excellent combinations of tastes, well presented and very good service. We started with cocktails which were unusual and very, very good. We were well advised on the main courses and had dish after dish of perfect flavours. The desserts also were interesting, tasty and faultless. Not cheap but one of the best restaurants I can ever remember going to. VERY impressed!

title: Great food in a great Location
comment: Having wanted to visit this restaurant for 2 years i was lucky enough to eat here twice in two days. Friday evening at the sushi bar in the bar area watching the chefs make the Sushi and Saturday afternoon in the main dining room. Both experiences were superb for different reasons  The atmosphere in the bar area was buzzing the dinning room much more chilled and relaxed. The decor is cool and trendy and the staff very attentive but understated. The food was fresh and Delicious  The wine list was good with out being over pretentious The views over London were spectacular worth a visit for these alone but add in good food and cocktails its a must do. Cant wait to go again

title: Amazing food
comment: This place is amongst the must sees. The food is amazing, service has been very friendly and quick. Price is absolutely ok for what you get. Astounding views and architecture make it a great stay.

title: Excellent food, superb service, stunning view, great atmosphere but comes with a price tag
comment: Had dinner at Sushi Samba with business partners and it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience all round. Location, ambience, design and the views are spectacular, our waiter could describe every dish on the menu, it's texture, flavours, what it goes with and why you would like it and we ended up trusting him to put together a selection of dishes for us matched with sake and it was absolutely superb. Not cheap but worth it for a special occasion or even just for a drink to soak up the views. A true dining experience!

title: Customer dissatisfaction
comment: I went to this restaurant on Saturday with my wife. When I arrived I was informed that no hot food could be served; the gas was switched off due to the wind damaging the extractor fan. Although not the restaurants fault, this massively affected the dining experience. However, I strongly believe that when something like this happens, customers should be given a free round of drinks or a material discount to their food bill; they shouldn't have to ask!

title: Great location, impressive decor and exquisite food
comment: It is a win win situation with sushi samba's signature food paired with a great location and fun and impressive decor. It is pricey but worth the experience. If the weather is nice, a drind at the outside bar is a must.

title: Beautiful trendy restaurant with excellent views and food!
comment: Yes, it's a bit pricey, but worth it! The largest sake menu I've ever seen. Kobe Beef both large and small plates that are pricey! I used to love Sushi Samba in NYC (I have no idea if they are owned by the same people) but it doesn't hold a candle to this one! Take the elevator up. The downstairs portion of the restaurant is the Sushi Bar inside and outside Bar. Upstairs is the Bar and DJ. Amazing place!

title: A drink with a view
comment: This is a great place to take friends and family who may not have seen London from above! The views are some of the best and argument-ally better than the shard. The drinks are reasonably priced for the location, although there is not much room to sit as this is mostly just made for a restaurant.

title: Fusion food in an amazing location
comment: A year ago, I wanted to visit SushiSamba, but I was completely unaware of the reservations massive queue. This time, I booked 2 months in advance.  I knew it would not be a budget dinner, but it's not a place you visit every weekend. The food is a mix of Peruvian/Chilean + Brazilian + Japanese. Amazingly tasty, great presentation, and not "sample sized". Our waiter was a true expert. He offered his personal taste and recommended the "best sellers". I don't know if we could have gone for any better options, but what we had was superb (the tempura prawns we got for starters were to die for!)... and the views...  I absolutely recommend it. Treat yourself, seriously.

title: Good food...pity about the after effects
comment: The food was really good and the service was very attentive. However unfortunately my partner was very unwell after, with stomach cramps and diarrhoea. I felt unwell too but not as bad as him. This lasted about 24 hours. I contacted the restaurant 5 days ago when the incident occurred on the guest relations email, as well as the reservation email, and I am disappointed I have not received an acknowledgement as of yet. You would expect some sort of reply from management about a serious issue such as this. I wanted to just enquire if other guests had contacted them with a similar problem. Overall the food was very tasty but obviously something was not right that evening. Not sure I will be returning.

title: Disappointing, not at all what we were expecting
comment: Sneaked a last minute reservation for 4pm on a Sunday and we were hoping for something a bit special.  We're big fans of Japanese and Latin American food and have been lucky enough to have eaten in some fantastic restaurants around the world, both high-end and low-end/street. Unfortunately, the whole experience of SushiSamba left us feeling underwhelmed and flat. The guy on the door at ground level was pleasant but as we were waiting for the lift (which was probably the most impressive part of the whole night) we were rudely frisked by security. Once we got up to the top, the views were great, especially of the Gherkin. I will say though, if you've ever been up the Shard, then you won't be as impressed with this view. Our table wasn't ready on time so we sat at the bar and had a couple of lovely cocktails. Because the weather was pretty horrific, the outside 'tree bar' wasn't really up and running, so we were stuck inside. The place had an air of chaos about it, lots of people sat or stood in a relatively small bar waiting for their tables. Once we finally got to our window table, I have to say that we weren't that impressed. Again, I think we'd been spoiled with the views from the Shard. Also, the general ambience of the place wasn't great. The music wasn't quite loud enough to give the restaurant a decent buzz. The vibe was lacking. Then came the food. What a disappointment. I can honestly say that the prices they charge must be for the 38th floor views because the food was standard at best. The Samba Rolls were very plain, the scallop cerviche was average. The service was ok, a bit slow but they were busy. All in all, the whole experience was so average that we ended up going to a much cheaper Japanese restaurant in Soho to fill ourselves up, after paying close to £150. If you're planning on coming for a romantic night out, there are much better options for similar prices in the Shard. Maybe this place is better for groups. If you're a foody and coming for a culinary experience then prepare to be disappointed. You can get the same food or better for a 1/3 price elsewhere.

title: Best location in London
comment: I try Sushisamba on a monday evening, after dinner. Cocktails are good but the best thing is obviously the location! Really amazing! Quite expensive (13 pounds for a cocktail) but not so much if you consider that you are in one of London's best location. Next time I hope to try sushi for dinner!

title: A memorable experience
comment: While not a sushi fan my partner insisted we go and I am glad we did. Our waiter was wonderful and made some excellent recommendations. Not your run of the mill sushi, the menu was interesting and varied ! Loved all the dishes we tried. View was amazing and the atmosphere enjoyable although found the black and white floors detracted from the overall vibe of the decor........regardless well worth the visit !

title: Fantastic food, brilliant views, expensive drinks, servcie: hit-and-miss
comment: Well worth a visit - we were a group of 8 and the food certainly exceeded all of our expectations. The 'tapas style' portion sizes creates a relaxed atmosphere and good food sharing experience (easily being able to order more as you eat & realize how good the food is!). Plenty of waiting staff and it's always easy to grab someones attention - some are extremely friendly and helpful, giving great suggestions, others were a bit pushy and not too helpful! Drinks - cocktails are delicious but typical London prices. We had some good wine too - but also expensive. Finally the view, simply fantastic - just as good as the food . The food, view and vibrant atmosphere makes it an overall great experience.

title: Dinner and cocktails with great London Views
comment: Great dining with a decent menu and excellent cuisine. Staff were vigilant and polite an experience to no doubt be repeated.

title: Great food but very expensive
comment: Came here with some friends for lunch, food is delicious and great views across the city, but not sure it's worth it for the price, very expensive food and cocktails aren't cheap either. Worth it as a one-off treat though

title: Thanks bartenders
comment: Everyone talk about this place likes if they ever not seen another place in their entire life...yes the view is fantastic like Marino and Camillo, our bartenders of the night, but sincerely they place is not really nice the bathrooms are simply ridiculous for a place like that and the tables under the stairs is for me Dangerous! The restaurant looks like a canteen...anyway we tasted some cocktails perfectly made by the bartenders and that made our night OK.

title: Drinks just for the view! A must to start an evening out in London
comment: We just went there for cocktails and the views. Fantastic. Enjoy the lift ride up to the 39th/40th floor. The drinks are expensive, but that is almost normal with such a view. It's quiet busy around 21 h, so if you want to sit at the tables directly facing the great views, you have to be early.I cannot say anything about the quality of the food, the menu looked small but interesting.

title: A Big Let Down
comment: It all started to go wrong as I checked into the restaurant. The host was rude, dismissive and acted like he was doing me a favor by letting me eat at his restaurant after I waited almost two months for a reservation. It was a special occasion and it was ruined. The food was ok and the views were spectacular. We also had three different waiters during our meal so that was confusing as well. in the end, Manuel, our last waiter was excellent and tried to make up for the challenges throughout our visit. My wife wants to try again and give them another chance. I'm inclined to move on. There are too many wonderful restaurants in London to put up with poor service.

title: Awesome place with the most breathtaking view in London
comment: Me and my boyfriend visited Sushisamba two times in one week and it was an amazing experience. Even though, the service might be a little bit slow it is understandable due to the amount of people that come into the restaurant. You don't need to book anything early if you just want to enjoy drinks and the sushi bar downstairs. Food is pretty expensive but very nice. It is usually quite cold next to the balcony and in this case they offer you blankets. The waiter was extremely polite and cooperative. Won't say a word about the view - you should see it with your own eyes. Highly recommended for couples or just friends/colleagues.

title: Exquisite food, great views, expensive
comment: Four of us had lunch today. We had a very attentive and helpful waitress. The sommelier guided us thru' different types of sake.  The food was exquisite and had beautiful flavours. An unexpected bonus were the desserts - the banana cake was a delight.

title: Sushi and expensive drinks from above
comment: It is based on Heron Tower at 110 Bishopsgate. You get up to floor 39 and can have sushi and drinks enjoying the views. It is very crowded and drinks are expensive. For small glass of average wine and a vodka/orange we paid 25 pounds.

title: Birthday celebration
comment: Went there to celebrate my birthday with my family (who had come to visit me in London for the occasion). The place itself is beautiful, perfect to celebrate something special. We were lucky to have a nice table, the food was nice the presentation very original and the cocktail that I ordered great! Overall a great experience although it's is £££ the service was great specially our French waiter. On the bad side I have to say it's awfully difficult to book a table (I did it two months in advance) and still they gave me no guarantee to have a table with views, not even when I explained 4 people were coming from another country and the birthday itself. That was not 5 star customer service.

title: Amazing venue, and not as pricey as I thought it would be!
comment: Went for our anniversary, and was surprised to be able to get a table a week in advance, although for 10pm. Lift is amazing as are the views. I've been to Vertigo 42 and Oblix before, and the views were great. Waiter was friendly and helpful, suggesting a variety of different things. The meal along with a carafe of Sake came to £125 which is not to bad really. The bar was expensive - £22.50 for 2 small glasses of red. But you're paying for the view. I'd go again. A bet it's heaving in the summer though. The service on the bar could have been quicker - they seems a little uninterested and there were lots of people waiting and they were not exactly rushing to serve people, but all in all a great experience, amazing food, not as expensive as I thought, and a great venue with lovely views.

title: Definetely a must!
comment: we have been twice in few days!!! No surprise that it is almost impossible to get a table in this restaurant. The fusion among japanese food and "pollution" from Brazil and Perù it makes an extremely intriguing experience. The food is great on top of that location, ambiance and the staff makes it almost fantastic! The staff is extremely kind and dedicated and with passion they dedicate you all necessary time to explain the single dishes. Even if you are noi a sommier it is worth to go on the terrace and give a look at the panorama, A visit to sushisamb is therefore definetly a must!!!

title: Dont miss this spot
comment: Great place to have drinks and see London from the sky! I celebrated my 50 anniversary there, driniking faboulous batidas, in front of the fire!  I recommend it!

title: On Holidays is a must
comment: If you are on Holy in London you must visit sushisamba in the high building. Very nice cocktails and wine as well

title: Terrible and slow service
comment: At Sunday night we came here for dinner for the famous city view. The coat room girl is very rude and no smile at all. We ordered a starter, two plates of sushi, and a black cod. After starter and sushi, we waited half of an hour about the black cod fish without anyone asking. The waiter was rude and said he was waiting for us to finish the small plates, which is ridiculous as we had finished 30 mins ago.  Apart from that, almost all the staff stood in the front, without checking on the customers.  Therefore definitely won't come again and won't recommend

title: I love this place, great food and an upbeat atmosphere
comment: It's the second time I've been and the food was as good as I remember from my first visit! We had cocktails in the bar first and managed to get a seat by the window (on a Saturday night, which was a bit of luck). The cocktails were good and service was quick enough at the bar.  Once we sat down to eat the service was excellent (despite some of the reviews I've read, which so really surprise me based on my experience) and the final price for four people with wine and cocktails was just over £100 per head, which I felt for the whole experience was really good value. I should point out we didn't go too crazy on wine, (two bottles at the lower priced end of the wine menu, but it was lovely wine none the less). Some of the favourite dishes on our table were; the green bean tempura with aioli, crispy taquitos, yellowtail and avocado, pork belly, and of course the blackened cod! The sushi was also absolutely lovely. The atmosphere was really good as well, there was a real buzz all evening which ensured a good fun night all round. Even if I was trying to pick a fault I'd find it hard. I do wonder if some people arrive with sky high (maybe slightly unrealistic) expectations, especially when it's a special occasion?! Maybe this is why some reviews are less favourable..... or maybe there is just a slight lack of consistency in service?!? I'm not sure, either way, I must say I look forward to eating there again in the future, as I really do love Sushisamba!  All in all highly recommended!

title: Disheartened, out of pocket and utterly disappointed...And you'd better eat up quick! 14/11/15
comment: Not recommended for working class people who have to work hard in order to afford such a pricey and one off experience.....particularly as the staff were judgemental, crass and unprofessional. We were blatantly not "allowed" the same dining experience as other diners as we were not about to spend £100 plus on a bottle of Lanson. By simply looking around the room we could see other women being offered blankets as it is fairly cool in the lounge, however I was not offered one. My partner and I witnessed a server being admonished for not giving the gentleman next to us a glass with his beer yet my partner was to drink out of a bottle.  I am not one to write reviews but this was a special occasion that was essentially ruined by the serving staff who for some reason didn't feel our money was as good as everyone else's in the room. Our plates were continuously taken away without being asked if we were finished, beer taken away without being finished and at one point the waiter asked us who was eating the two remaining sushi rolls with his hands on our plate. Please bear in mind we were supposed to have the table for another hour however they clearly wanted us out of there and the feeling, quite frankly, was mutual. For the sake of trying to end the evening nicely we decided to go for a drink in the downstairs bar, we stopped to take a picture of ourselves and look at the views of London when we're rudely ushered off the stairs by the bouncer. We gave up at the point. I feel it could of been a fantastic evening, the views are fantastic and the food was beautiful but being made to feel worthless just isn't worth it for a second. Utterly disappointed.

title: Fantastic service and great food!
comment: Was treated like royalty from the moment me and my girlfriend walked in. The service was top class and the food was possibly some of the finest I've had in a long time. It was mine and my girlfriend's anniversary, and the staff duly went out of their way to make it an even more special atmosphere in that regards. Great staff, great food and fantastic service. A must!

title: Sushi with a great view
comment: On the 37 floor of the heron tower. Great atmosphere but a mixture of sushi and Peruvian food. Good selection but high prices for small bites. Good for a celebration . Need to book in advance

title: NEVER AGAIN!
comment: Worst customer service ever! Cheap, rude, incompetent, inconsiderate staff. Don't waste your money there, it's a scam! The view and interior are beautiful but definitely don't make up for the unfriendly service. Nothing worst than spending hundreds of pounds for a dinner with your family but being left with the feeling you're not welcome or worthy of dining there? I left angry and felt as if someone had just taken advantage of me.

title: Good but not out of this world
comment: Booked a table in this beautiful restaurant at the top of the Bishopsgate Tower in central London. Amazing view, pleasant staff. The menu was explained - fusion of Hispanic/Brazilian and Japanese. We chose some classic Japanese and some of their own key dishes and the latter were better - particularly liked the gyoza and mushroom hotpot. Sushi was less pleasant, with carrot inside instead of the rice. The meal cost well less than we expected, but at £9.00 for a small glass of mediocre red wine, the drinks were all seriously overpriced. Service at all times faultless, though I got the impression that the waiting staff were on edge and anxious. The loos are singularly unpleasant, being black (showing dirt) and the walls were not clean.

title: Paying for the view...and tasty cocktails.
comment: We just went for drinks on a Sunday evening and there was no need to book.  There is no fee, but you do pay for the view in drink prices. Most cocktails are £13 for a small amount, but they all taste amazing. Beer bottles are £7.  The view is definitely worth it though. There is a nice heated outside seating area too.  I would definitely recommend going for one cocktail.

title: 21st birthday dissapointment
comment: I had chosen to spend this important birthday somewhere nice. However the waiter accidentally ordered me the wrong food (lamb) when he knew i had asked for chicken.  We ate the dish thinking it was the steak we had also ordered, then the steak arrived so i asked the waiter and he realised his mistake and said he would bring the chicken i had ordered.  His english wasn't great and after a few minutes he said it wasn't coming now.. I just said okay but i was a bit confused and pissed off i didn't get what i had ordered or much of an apology. He then came back to say the chicken was coming.. We felt better but when the bill came we had been charged for the wrong dish although if wasn't our mistake? As well as the chicken.. Yes we ate them both but personally I think if the waiter makes a mistake we shouldn't have to pay for it as we ate it thinking it was what we had ordered!!!! I wanted to argue it but I already felt like I was not wanted there as they seemed in a rush to get us out and didn't want to tarnish my birthday experience by having to complain.  Also mentioned it was my birthday as i came in and no fuss whatsoever was made although i noticed another table getting candles with their food... Maybe they spent more? But what does that matter?! We spend 150 and the food was delicious, however i wouldn't go back purely because of the poor customer service, seems they just wanted my money and didn't care how i felt.

title: MUST go to this bar!
comment: I went there with my boyfriend last Sunday, we didn't have a reservation we just told the security guy that we were there for a drink. There are two bars and one restaurant: the first bar is at the 38th floor and the restaurant and a small bar at the 40th. We went to the small bar at the 40th floor and the view is amazing. There's a small terrace where you can smoke (and you have heaters,,,) We waited like 15/20min and no one paid attention to us until we went to order at the bar (and we did pay service charge...) The customer service was bad, because no one paid attention to us but I have to say that this place deserve a visit,

title: Over priced, average food
comment: I waited a long time to eat in SushiSamba. I heard really good things but I was very disappointed.  I thought the food was very average, over priced and i was not sold on the whole experience.  The staff were attentive. Considering you have to book 2 months in advance, there were a lot of empty tables.  I liked the bar areas and the cocktails were good, although also over priced. Then again, I guess you are paying for the view.

title: Good
comment: Good drinks...seems quieter than it used to be which is nice. Cocktails are expensive but usually good.

title: Very superficial! Dirty toilets, medium service, loud music and a stupid vigil
comment: The vigil let everybody in the queue waiting but let in - without queuing - anybody who went to see him directly BAGGING to enter. He really enjoys the small power they gave him! We won't bag somebody to enter a restaurant where we booked 3weeks in advance and where we paid 250p for a dinner! How crazy is that! The toilets were dirty and the service medium, the music is very loud. Prostitutes!  The food was good but I will never go back there again!

title: What's happened to SUSHISAMBA
comment: This will have been the fourth time I have visited SUSHISAMBA and to be quite frank what an earth has happened?  I went on a Sunday afternoon, food, as always was fantastic but service was a bit shocking. I waited 30 minutes for my drink, thank god for tap water and a further 40 minutes from our first course (which we didn't even realize was our first course - as we had ordered everything together, and was told it would come as and when) to our second main. When I politely asked the waiter where the rest of the food was (I genuinely thought that they had forgotten, as the last 3 times that I had visited there has never been such a delay) he was rude and told me most guests like a break in-between courses, 40 minutes is not a break, it is a marathon...  Overall, I love SUSHISAMBA and have recommended it countless times, I am hoping that this was just an off day, if not can I suggest you change your staff - it seems like I am not the only one who has noticed the inconsistency in service.

title: Sky high dinner..!
comment: Trendy place with a mixed atmosphere of Japanese and Brazilian. Before hand it all starts with a free ride on the lift up to the 39th floor of Heron Tower, then, when inside, nice views of London, catchy music and beautiful people. The service is very warm and recommendations are not obligations, menu offer is huge and you can even go for Kobe certified meat, as long as you can afford it. The quality of the ingredients and preparation was awesome. Everything very tasty. Only negative point to the wine. All in all, pleasant experience and cannot miss if you come over London and want to have a different dinner with friends or your couple.

title: Service was poor
comment: Worst customer service ever, waiter was rude and started to argue with me. The food and drinks are over priced and it wasn't even nice.

title: Good food very pricy
comment: Me and my boyfriend visited sushisamba as a treat for his birthday as he loves Sushi the food was amazing and the staff were very friendly and helpful considering we had never been there before for two of us the bill came to £170 so be prepared to part with your pennies! We will deffo be returning but not just for any occasion at these prices. P.s the views are great!

title: Fantastic food!
comment: We have been here twice now, the first time in April 2014 and the second in April 2015. The restaurant is fantastic and the views amazing. We had a beautiful sunny day and it was the perfect place to be.  The cocktails are amazing but pricey. The food and especially desserts are creative and innovative and everything was delicious. On our second visit we were really looking forward to the amazing ribs we had enjoyed the first time, but we were really dismayed to see they had been dropped from the menu! Bring the ribs back!!  The only real negative was that the waiter wanted to hurry us along at the end of our meal as another booking was due. As a party of 2 we had originally been sat in the middle of the restaurant in a table for 4, but early on in the evening we had been asked if we'd like to move to a window view 2-seater table. We gladly obliged but it was disappointing that this meant we were rushed along at the end of the night. The waiter was really nice about it though and did offer us a glass of prosecco each to make up for the inconvenience, which was a nice gesture.

title: expensive but great view and creative cocktails
comment: this place has an amazing view of london and if you happen to come for sunset to enjoy some cocktails and live music, this place is great. the cocktails are quite expensive in our opinion (14 GBP), but as you pay no entrance fee, it`s worth for what you are getting with the whole atmosphere. we didn`t eat here, so can`t really say anything about the food. the place has different levels and its worth having a look around all of them.

title: Great Experience
comment: Reseverved a table for SushiSamba long time ago. two days prior the visit date, the restaurant sends a text to confirm the reservation. Upon arrival to the SalesForce Tower (Heron Tower), we went on the 38th floor and were taken to our table that was ready despite we arrived 10 minutes earlier.  At the table we gave our coats to the receptionist who took them in the cloakroom. Our waiter was gentle and funny. He explained us the menu and advised that food will arrive as it is ready. The restaurant offers a combination of japanese, peruvian and brazilian cuisine, therefore there is something for every taste.We ordered a fillet steak, pork belly, Samba London and ezo.  Food was served quickly and we enjoyed our meal in our table by the window. Perhaps the only suggestion would be to ask for coats at the reception and not at the table but this is just a minor thing.

title: Amazing food but a bit pricey
comment: Went here a few months ago and it was probably one of the best meals I've ever had, it is a pricey place so definitely somewhere for special occasions. Amazing views over london and lovely terrace and bar area outside. Can't wait to return. Be warned to make a reservation you will need to do it about 2 months in advance for decent time, as it gets booked up pretty quick! Also Only a 5 minute walk from Liverpool street station.

title: Great food, Bad service
comment: I've been to SushiSamba a couple of times. The food is delicious, quite expensive but totally worth it in my opinion. However the service really frustrates me - from the doorman who greeted me at the street entrance, the cloakroom attendant in particular & also the bar staff. Their approach is really unfriendly & frankly arrogant. By the time I'd got my G&T I was left feeling totally deflated by it all.

title: Categorically the worst service I have ever encountered!
comment: Categorically the worst service I have ever encountered! I took work colleagues from abroad for dinner last night and could not believe the low standard of waiting staff in the restaurant? Yes the view is amazing, decor super stylish and the food is impeccable but way over priced! I have eaten in the Miami branch and the service was on point. Our waiter had a serious attitude problem and made us all feel very uncomfortable from the minute we sat down. We waited 20 minutes for any form of acknowledgment, once we ordered it all went down hill. Many dishes were forgotten and we had to remind waiter of what was missing, cocktails ordered were also forgotten and no form of apology? Just an irritated face from the waiter as if we were bothering him ........ I had to ask 3 different waiters for the bill, I'm not sure what the issue is but all the staff but 1 were rude and lazy! Very cheap staff that obviously have had no real training? When you pay £350 for dinner you expect the best of the best! The focus is defiantly on cramping as many people as you can in the bars and getting them drunk! The restaurant needs to hire new staff or train the ones you have! Managment should know better, tourists may get caught up in the hype but I'm from London, well travelled and have eaten in the best of the best .... I know the difference! For this reason alone we will never return to this restaurant. When we left no one saw us off, they just all stood around in a line staring at us as if we were aliens? I swear 15 waiters just looking and watching my wife struggle to get the buggy out of the restaurant, not one waiter offered to help move chairs .... SHOCKING! Then with 1 lift down we waited 25 mins for a free lift, greeted by another rude security guy! Don't buy into the hype of this place as they clearly have not taken the customer service as top priority. For example; Food and service in Roka put this place to shame! I could list many more in London .....

title: Great meal!
comment: We had a fantastic meal at sushi samba last night, 3rd time visiting here. There was a great atmosphere,lovely food and an amazing view. I would recommend this place for couples. The menu we went for was slightly smaller then the main menu, but food was still of a good standard. I highly recommend from the small plates the yellowtail and the lobster.. Most definitely the black cod, and if you like sushi then the samba London. Only negative is the restaurant is hard to book into, and difficult to park.

title: Amazing view, nice staff
comment: Stunning views of the city, great atmosphere and good food. Waitress was very helpful and friendly. Very nice place!

title: One of my favourite restaurants!
comment: I visited Sushi Samba last January to celebrate my birthday and it was one of the best meal I have ever had! The food was absolutely stunning and the staff were so helpful and professional! The interior and the view was exceptional! I would certainly recommend and would return again and again!

title: Yum
comment: What a great restaurant. We were walking past and decided to give this place a try after hearing good things. We didn't sit in the restaurant as it was fully booked but the staff were more than helpful in getting us a seat in the main bar room. If you like a lot of food like myself be aware that you will have to order a few dishes and it's isn't the cheapest place in the world. That being said you get what you pay for and the food here is wonderful. Full of flavour and cooked to perfection. Great for a romantic meal or casual with friends and the view is amazinh

title: Great place
comment: Great place, fantastic view, terrace for the smokers. Sophisticated drinks, elegant people, great partying.

title: Incorrect change
comment: Re: Incorrect change I was in your establishment on 23rd October as a guest. As I arrived early, I treated myself to a glass of rose, this was £8.44 and I gave £8.50 to the bar attendant; this employee decided to give me five pence change without any further explanation (?) regarding the missing one penny. I informed him that he short changed me and his face to my astonishment, was one of disbelief that I dared to ask for the correct change. Hi finally (after a while) gave me one penny out of his personal coin-purse without any apology. I was astonished with his behaviour and attitude, furthermore, I thought that talking in Italian with your guest waiting for service is incredibly rude but to then, talk about this guest in a very rude and ungracious manner was below the pale. I happened to speak Italian, but as I was a guest I did not want to create the fuss. The money was not the issue here; it is the perception that your staff project onto the client like me, and that is one of acceptable culture of dishonesty, rudeness, sloppiness etc. Very, very, sad indeed. With so many restaurant in this fabulous city of ours one is spoiled for choice. PS I was on your terrace at 11.57 AM and there were cigarette butts from the night before and the whole area looked ‘’unloved’’ and in the need of TLC EVEN THOUGH THE SERVICE IN THE RESTUARANT WAS RATHER PLEASENT I AM ONLY GIVING YOU POOR FOR THE ABOVE REASONS

title: amazing view
comment: lovely food ,great drinks and a wonderful view of the city skyline at night its really pretty. Fab roof top terrace too!!

title: Unbelievable dinner; fantastic food, stunning setting and impeccable service!
comment: I visited with a friend having waited 2 months to get a table on a Friday nigh at a reasonable time. The wait was worth it. We are both foodies and after visiting many similar establishments in London in the past couple of years, this one stood out head and shoulders above the others. Not only is the setting stunning (particularly the rooftop bar), the service was fantastic. All the staff (including at the bar) are just genuinely friendly and fall over themselves to be helpful. The recommendations they gave were great and everything we ordered was to die for. The manager came over several times during our meal and couldn't have been nicer. My only disappointment was that we didn't manage to try more dishes!

title: Fantastic!
comment: Great views of London and a really nice rooftop garden with a lemon tree in the centre. Drinks are very expensive but it's too be expected in the city of London and it's fine for special occasions. Loved it!

title: What a restaurant!!
comment: Every single thing ordered was amazing, Each dish was creative and had so much flavour. The service made the meal even more enjoyable, we got good food recommendations of how much to order and things to try as first time diners and also personalised cocktails for us on what we preferred!  It was fantastic!

title: Relaxed and impressive client entertaining
comment: Great if you want something informal but impressive. We shared a selection of dishes which isn't everybody's cup of tea but it was great for the group. The round tables at the side of the restaurant made conversation easy too

title: The best sushi in London
comment: It was one of the best experience I ever had. The sushi was absolutely marvellous. The atmosphere was amazing and the view is incredible from the 36th floor. Overall, it is a little bit expensive but it worth the money. P.S the bar is remarkable too.

title: Throughly disappointed !
comment: We have been anting to try this restaurant for a long time but unfortunately it just did not live up to the hype surrounding this restaurant. The food was terrible, the food was bland if anything. I was expecting an assault on my taste buds but it was just all very mediocre and given the price this was very disappointing.

title: Amazing food!
comment: We went here for our 5th wedding anniversary and the food was amazing.  We were advised to have 5-7 dishes, we went for 7 and 5 of the dishes we had were recommendations from our waiter. He was spot on, the food was great and better than we ever imagined it would taste. The views were amazing and we had a seat right next to the window which made our night even more special. The only downsides were the greeting from one of the staff on the door at ground level and the bar staff on the 39th floor. The bar staff seemed to serve whoever they liked and didn't really seem to have an order in which they were serving. The first drinks we bought took 25 minutes for the barman to serve us even though some people walked up to the bar and were served immediately. However the food and views were amazing, our waiter was great and made us feel very relaxed and at ease and able to enjoy our night. We can't wait to go back!
