title: Great food and views, mixed service
comment: We dined here on a Saturday night. After arriving slightly early, they asked us to wait at the bar area. They were around 20 min delayed in seating us, but we were rewarded for our wait with an excellent window table right in the corner of the restaurant. Our waiter was very friendly and he enthusiastically recommended a number of dishes for us. The suggestion is to order 5-7 items for a party of 2, unless you go for one of the ‘large plates’, in which case they suggest 2-3 additional smaller items. We went for the former option and mostly followed the advice of our waiter. I’d rate our dishes as follows: Excellent – shrimp tempura, kobe gyoza. Very good – green bean tempura, lobster taquitos, yellowtail tiradito, black cod, ‘el topo’ sushi. Average – chicken teriyaki (this was too dry). Although we were quite stuffed by this point, we did try the ‘Love from Rio’ dessert, which was very good. Most of the dessert menu options sounded a bit strange, this was the only one that tempted us. We had mixed feelings about the service. In the beginning they were a bit too efficient. Items of food were delivered as separate courses, but 7 out of our 8 savoury items appeared in very quick succession. I couldn’t help thinking this was driven by their stated 1.5 hour time limit on the table (1.5 hours, really!!). However, towards the end of the meal there was a dramatic shift and service became very slow. We waited ages for our 8th savoury item, as well as for dessert. Drinks orders were quite slow to be delivered throughout the meal. Having said that, all of the staff were really friendly and pleasant to deal with. We did end up spending over 2 hours at our table… The bill for our massive meal came to around £220, of which £70 was spent on drinks. This felt like a fair price, given the venue. On the whole, we really enjoyed this outing. The food, décor and views far outshadowed the mixed service. I’m sure I will return in future.

title: pleasantly surprised!
comment: Had a really lovely evening at Sushisamba on Saturday night. Feeling slightly apprehensive beforehand after reading reviews of bad customer service and having a less than friendly encounter with a woman downstairs with a clipboard (!), we were pleasantly surprised by the time we arrived at the 38th floor, everyone was really lovely to us. Our two waiters were very friendly and helpful and talked us through the menu, there was a great choice of drinks and our food was delicious, and beautifully presented. We had a fantastic table by the window with great views over London. Despite our reservations, we had a great time and would certainly go back.

title: Amazing experiance
comment: Great atmosphere, love the fusion of the flavours, especially when comes to their Kobe beef plates. Should try desserts - deferentially caught my intention and I'm not a "sweets" person. Selection of wines - everyone could fine their favourite bottle.

title: Beautiful food with great cocktails!
comment: Had a business dinner, to celebrate a great month. Espresso Martinis are the best I've had in a long time. The food is incredible - the black cod is my favourite and SushiSamba know how to do it. The service was excellent, and our waiter was very knowledgable of the menu, recommending some of the most incredible things I've eaten. Highly recommend a trip here, even on a wet day, the views are spectacular.

title: Excellent
comment: Came here for our anniversary , a must is the porn star martini cocktails , service was fantastic , and the staff was very helpful in helping us choose our dinner , food was cooked to perfection, I really enjoyed this restaurant, the view was also amazing , expensive but defiantly worth a visit

title: sibling lunch
comment: Caught up with my jet setting siblings at this fabulous venue, not a great lover of sushi myself however couldn't fault the other dishes, waiting staff all helpful and professional. Will definitely go back.

title: Amazing Sushi Rolls!
comment: Came here for an anniversary with my girlfriend. The sushi rolls were the best dishes I have ever had in a restaurant. I had the Sao Paulo, and the spicy tuna roll (can't recall the name) and I savoured every bite. The other dishes, though delicious, weren't absolutely spectacular if compared to the sushi rolls, so best save the money and get more sushi rolls!

title: Amazing views and great cocktails!! A must visit place in London! :-)
comment: What a great place!! On the 40th floor of the Sales Force Tower this is the tallest building in London and if your scared of heights I wouldn't bother. Sushi Samba offers an amazing roof terrace bar with amazing views of the city, the bar is a huge tree completed covered in orange fairy lights and I must say the clientèle is also very impressive :-) Overall a must visit place, however make sure you pre book and try some of the amazing cocktails. Chocolate and Blue Cheese a strange but very tasty cocktail! also be warned is around £20 - £25 a cocktail !!

title: Nice view, nice food, just nice.
comment: We decided to visit Sushi Samba as it was a special occasion. The lift ride up was great fun and it was a beautiful clear evening.  First impressions - The décor is quite tacky and dated. (the main restaurant area was much better) The space felt cramped with most of the seating not facing the beautiful view! After a frosty greeting we waited in the bar area until our table became available. We all ordered a cocktail. They were OK, mine was not well balanced.  Once seated we were quickly given menus and offered advice on what to order. The waiting staff were very friendly and attentive throughout the meal. The portions were very small and overpriced but very tasty. We had to wait for a sommelier when ordering the wine which felt a little pretentious, especially as they were just trying to up-sell overpriced sake. The wine was OK but again overpriced. All in all it was a nice meal but far too expensive. You are essentially paying for the view and a lift ride up. They could do so much more with this place! A friendly welcome goes a long way.

title: Beautiful evening all round
comment: A group of 7 friends and I booked Sushi Samba to celebrate a 25th birthday. The experience was fantastic!  The staff are all very professional, knowledgeable and friendly. They can't do enough to help, drinks are never empty and they are so on the ball with who ordered which item from the menu. If a napkin is dropped they are by your side in seconds handing you a new one.  The food was delicious. Personally I tried the pork belly, filler steak (Robata) and Ezo samba rolls. I can't fault any of it! I also tried the sea bass tempura which a friend ordered, which was a large plate and absolutely delicious.  The view is great - from the experience viewing London whilst travelling up the lift (although this wouldn't be great for those afraid of heights) to the outside terrace. The ambience is perfect for a evening with friends, if you want to impress a date or even a business dinner.  I would definitely recommend trying this restaurant at least once, or even just venture up for a cocktail and to enjoy the view.

title: One of my must go to restaurants in London
comment: This is one of my favorite restaurants in London, which i visit during every trip to London. The menu has a wonderful blend of food which always tastes good, the service is always good, the people are friendly, the atmosphere is nice, and the stunning views of the city. Highly recommended

title: Really enjoyable evening
comment: Really enjoyed our night here, no special occasion just dinner, but it was lovely. Our waiter was so helpful and made excellent recommendations. We had expected it to be a rather expensive evening but ordered everything we wanted, and I couldn't eat any more before the last dish arrived - much to my other halves delight. The bill was just over £150 including drinks before, during and after the meal - we were chuffed. I would happily come again in a small or large group. Really lovely social atmosphere in both the bar and the restaurant.

title: Possibly the best spot in London by far
comment: I've been here a few times during the past few months. The venue itself is great and conveniently located a few steps away from Liverpool Station...i.e. it is in the hearth of the City. Glam and fancy people are attending the venue and a breathtaking view of London is for sure worthwhile for a really advance booking. The restaurant is quite often fully booked therefore it makes sense to book at least 10 days in advance. Food is good and of course also the service is great.

title: Love love love this restuarant!
comment: Despite this restaurant being frequented by some undeservedly arrogant people, it is a fantastic venue! Having been for dates and business visits alike - it is the perfect setting for almost any occasion.  I would highly recommend the Seasonal Vegetable Tempura, Black Cod with Peruvian Corn and Akami Tuna.  Beautiful outdoor space, lovely for having a drink even on a chilly night.  It is priced at the higher end, but you get the quality, ambience and views that you pay for. Cannot recommend enough!

title: a sushi lovers heaven
comment: I recently took my family here when they came to visit me as my sister and mother are big sushi fans and it was incredible. the waitress was very helpful with suggestions, maybe slightly pushy, but was very good at explaining dishes and recommending them. My brother and I aren't as big on sushi so we tried some other dishes and they were phenomenal. Highly recommend the lobster taquitos! great views, however we weren't close to a window but we went out on the balcony after our meal. Decor is fab.

title: She said yes!
comment: We were recommended by a friend and visited on a Friday lunchtime to book in for the following Saturday night. Venue is 3 mins walk from Liverpool St Station. Lift ride.. well, if Carlsberg did lift rides.... its fast, smooth and the views are amazing, 38 floors up, awesome! so far so good. After being shown to our table I mentioned to the manager, Mark, that I was going to propose, he was very helpful. 5 mins later, to our surprise Mark had arranged a table next to the window with a stunning view. Our waiter Jakob explained the menu and was very knowledgeable. Im a coeliac (Gluten free) and was provided with a GF free menu, no hassle. Food was great and service first class, the whole place was lively and had a great atmosphere. After food I popped the question and she said yes, phew! We enjoyed a glass of champagne and shared a fruit desert on the house, another welcome surprise. Mark and his team made the whole nerve-racking proposal a lot easier and I owe them a big thanks. If you looking to impress with a cool, trendy stylish dinner this is the place,as a couple,group of friends or workmates this place suits all.

title: Epic food and overall experience
comment: Such a superb location, view and overall presentation was amazing. Food faultless and we tried as much as we could. Can't wait to go back

title: Not as good as it thinks it is
comment: The place is across the road from my office so I visit often with clients and colleagues. The room the restaurant in is beautiful with great views so it is very impressive for people who have not been here before. Some of the food is fantastic eg the rock shrimp tempura, black cod and the fish taquitos. However some of it is just odd. The ceviches are mostly liquid and vegetables with a small amount of fish. Larger meat portions are often dry.nd it is very very expensive, even for London. Service is mixed. Last time we were there and sat in the bar we had a great friendly and efficient waiter but too often service is distracted and too busy chatting to their friends to look after you properly. They also are apparently always sold out but every time we have been there throughout lunch there will be many tables empty. Still a good place to go when someone else is paying but would I go there with my husband for a great dinner? No

title: Great Terrace to View London & Lip Smacking Food
comment: The view here is out out of the world.. with restaurant and bar divided onto few levels.. its perfecto for view, drinks, dining, dating... the food is also and the service nothing but impeccable... do ask your server for recommendations they really know their menu back of their hand...

title: Terrible experience!
comment: I had a reservation for 9.30pm and, after several talks with the receptionists, ended up getting seated around 11pm. I was always told that the table was not ready yet but never given a proper reason for that or any apology. At some point, we were offered champagne which although a nice gesture, didn't make up for the inconvenience. I had a table booked for some reason and they all seemed to ignore that. After 1h of waiting up standing, one of the receptionists took us to the terrace and at some point, after being so cold outside I had a chat with the manager and the only table available for us after a hour and a half was on the Lounge, where the menu was not the same and much shorter. The food was good but waiting for so long to be seated was something I never expected from a place like Sushisamba. I was really looking forward to this experience and being the first time like this I am definitely not coming back any time sooner.

title: Good experience!
comment: The service was good, we had an attentive waiter. Great cocktails! Sushi is good, but not great. View of London from the elevator and the restaurant is impressive.

title: Best in the City
comment: Visited on a Thursday evening for a birthday celebration - excellent location and view. Service was impeccable and good suggestions from the menu. Food was superb - fresh, presentation and delicious. If you like Roka, you will find this a notch above. No faults

title: Great food, disgusting staff
comment: Stunning views from the restaurant and amazing food. However, had an episode where something was in the wine glass and was made to feel like I put it there and virtually accused me of being after a free meal. Was utterly mortified and disgusted. Having frequented numerous high class restaurants around the world I have never come across such a disgusting Sommelier. He said it was probably some dust, surely not my fault. Eventually they changed the glass of wine. After looking up the ceiling lights and ducts are covered in greasy dust - disgusting. I have written to the restaurant to complain. As yet not response. Also disgusting. An apology is all that should have been in order. This was a birthday celebration with friends which slightly took the edge off the occasion. Extremely disappointing.

title: Very Nice view! Some food are very good!!!
comment: Some special dishes are really good! We loved some dishes in the list of Special Rolls, but the standard Nigiri or Temaki are just ok! The staff attended us very well also

title: Fantastic food/views - experience ruined select staff with "attitude"
comment: How to begin... Decided on great food with awesome nights views of London over dinner hence this restaurant. Yep, amazing views and delicious food (fusion of Japanese with a Tapas twist) true to its website...so looking forward to it then the customer experience began...  As an overseas visitor to this venue for first time, earliest booking was mid-August on Friday 11.15pm (booked about a month in advance via Opentable website) but happily booked timeslot as food reviews seemed great.  Email confirmations from restaurant tell you they will cancel if not arriving within 15 mins of timeslot (and if not confirmed when receiving email confirmation prior to day, slot gets reallocated ?!). We were in transit and only by chance, had wi-fi access late afternoon by train to check awaiting email sent day of reservation.. so had to call even though our booking had been confirmed via website ? hmmm. Only back to London that evening but arrived an hour earlier at 10pm to enjoy a few cocktails pre-dinner. Shame about the reception staff and waiters at outdoor bar.  Supper drinks/Cocktail hour: We struggled to get bar service, let alone a spare table ..it was Sunday at 10pm. Two waiters chatting to each other then just looked at me without a word - when I dared to interrupt to order a cocktail, arrogant attitude continued until we waited for cocktails about 15 minutes later (between chatter) - guess customers seemed an inconvenience to them (and better/quicker service at a local pub to be honest), bar tables scattered with empty cocktail glasses/full ashtrays .. we should have seen the signs. Feel sad for the owner as staff represent the "face" of the restaurant that could make or break such a place if it weren't for the views/venue here. Our dinner experience: expected a little longer dining sitting than just over hour when the kitchen closed and we were last 2-3 tables there around 12.30am). For what we paid, seemed one of the most expensive even for London/Australian standards. Where it mattered though, once in the restaurant floor itself did make up for initial experience - great vibe, amazing views/ dishes and attentive floor waiter/staff. Just could not shake off the attitude of booking/reception desk staff prior to getting there - as the initial "face" of the restaurant - knowing we had arrived early and upon polite enquiry, still did not seat us at our scheduled timeslot even though many tables starting to become available by 11pm - turned us off the remaining night's high expectations/experience for us really. Once inside the restaurant - our table/drinks waiters were wonderful - so attentive, polite, friendly (didn't mind us asking for photo) and professional service until the end.  We were one of the last tables by 12.30am and felt a bit rushed as kitchen was closing by then. For what we paid for (even double tipped not realising they added a service charge to bill in the fine print) and just a little over an hour of dining .. we couldn't help but be disappointed.  Overall, if you don't care about staff with "booking" attitude, "fashion police" staff out front (is this a club?) and manage to avoid select few staff (who seem to think it was a privilege to be graced by their presence) and just focus on amazing London views, great waiters once in dining room to impress us for the time we dined there and the food itself was a quite special fanfare.  Just felt a bit rushed as would have ordered more with time permitting and for same cost, can get a full Degustation menu for more than an hour of fine dining elsewhere.  Romance killed by the loud music. Expected some dance floor to open up any moment. First ever dinner reservation at a restaurant for 11pm (and probably the last) so recommend booking earlier to avoid disappointment if you are game enough to take your chances to avoid feeling second class to the staff.

title: Stunning
comment: Simply stunning views both from the glass elevator and then inside the restaurant itself. The staff were really helpful and the food was vibrant, immaculately presented and really tasty. This wasn't just a meal, it was an experience and great fun.

title: Great food, great view, fun night
comment: Went with my family (includes a toddler) a Thursday night. Everything was perfect. Great staff, food, drinks and experience. Fun for a night out.

title: Squashed and ripped off
comment: Came here to the bar for drinks. It was too crowded, even though they have bouncers on the door. Took ages to get served by a none too friendly barman. They have the cheek to add 12.5% service charge even when you have to go to the bar to get your drinks! I was going to quibble but the guy before me did and it took 5 minutes to sort out. Too loud to hear as it was too packed.

title: Disappointing
comment: Went for a birthday celebration. Place was far too hot. Wine we ordered wasn't available and no second choice suggested. Food was lack lustre as was the service. Birthday cake totally forgotten and we had to send back the wagyu beef as it was overcooked.

title: excellent for date night
comment: This place was great , I must admit I was a little perturbed when we showed up since the bar was buzzing and the restaurant seemed noisy and crowded but once we sat down this all seemed to disappear and we drifted into the ambience. Well maybe the cocktails we ordered shortly thereafter helped with that. the waitress was friendly and explained the concept and the menu and this really helped as we weren't sure what to order. We had several dishes and all were amazing. I would particularly recommend the prawn maki

title: Excellent food, good service and a great evening!
comment: I've visited with a group of colleagues from work, we had an excellent table, good service and great food. I loved the interior and the view was of course amazing! I'm a little concerned to read some of the 'not so positive' reviews as I'm going with friends in the coming month. I do note most of the less favourable reviews seem to regard the bar and service, but in my experience both were excellent - lets hope I've not spoke too soon before my next visit! We ordered food for the table which was great as we were able to try a variety of dishes. The shrimp tempura, pork belly, scallops, black cod miso, fillet steak, samba rolls and all the nigiri were excellent! (the balck cod was a particular favourite, this is a dish I've had in a number of 'top' restaurants and this was by far the best!) In addition the cocktails were superb as was the view! All in all an excellent evening!

title: still my favourite restaurant
comment: We just love this place more and more , especially in the autumn sunshine as we arrived early and could enjoy a cocktail before the marvellous food . Of course its not cheap , but why should it be and its best to dress up to avoid trouble on the door [ but you should dress up , this is a great place to respect]. Lots of veggy things to love ; I could just eat plate after plate of the taquitos. Plus the sushi is the most fun you can get in London and the deserts are perfect. Attentive staff. Great views . The best treat you can have.

title: Very disappointing!!
comment: Took the missus here for a drink on her birthday before moving on to one of our favourite cocktail spots nearby (Satan’s Whiskers). It was a Sunday so there was live music which was really cool, the views were good for a short while, but not worth the prices we ended up paying for drinks…in fact going up in the lift was probably the highlight view wise! The location is novel, but as I mentioned, prices are extortionate to say the least! We ordered 2 standard drinks (brandy and coke and a G&T) and this cost us £24! We even had to pay a 12.5% service charge - for what?! We managed to find a seat outside, however, the blankets had already run out and the heater next to our table was broken – which is probably why the table was free in the first place! The decorations outside are really nice, but we definitely didn’t feel that we got our money’s worth and it’s doubtful we’d bother again.

title: Delicious food and beautiful venue!
comment: I visited this place on a Thursday evening. This was a last minute plan and so could not obtain a table in the main restaurant however was offered a table on the floor above which is a smaller area with more of a bar feel. Unfortunately due to traffic we were running a few minutes late, having informed the restaurant they were kind enough to advise the table would still be available should we be 15-20 minutes over. Upon arrival we were greeted by a welcoming door man whom was happy to invite us in regardless of the booking. The elevator ride was stunning! With the magical views of London becoming more apparent as you ascend! Once in the restaurant we were greeted by a lovely lady whom advised that if we prefer to dine in the main restaurant we were welcome to do so an hour after out arrival. We were shown to the beautiful terrace bar which had a beautiful lit tree and stunning views over the city. The cocktails were interesting with very unusual mixes. At our time of dining, we were attended to promptly with continual top ups of our wine! Our waiter was extremely knowledgable on the menu and made some great suggestions of food to chose as it can feel a tad overwhelming. One of our dishes was the black cod, beautifully cooked and just melted your mouth. We had chose 4 dishes amongst 2 which was an ample amount! In fact we couldn't finish it all but every single dish as delicious as the other. Our bill came in at over 100 however was all worth it considering our food and drink choices. I found the service to be friendly, professional and prompt. The venue was beautiful with a buzzing atmosphere. I would definitely return!

title: Lunch on top of the world
comment: Excellent lunch on a clear day with London's views all around you. Very lucky to be sitting near the window, enjoying the view while eating your meal.. Food very delicately arranged ,small bites but tasty, rather expensive for the portions. Signature cocktails excellent. Starters of samba rolls, followed by shrimp tempura was very good. Selected 3 side dishes of coconut rice, plantain chips and Peruvian corn with a plate of teriyaki poussin was well chosen. Shared a dessert of passion cake which was very good. Wonderful ambience and very busy for a weekday. What a view travelling in the glass lift up to the 38th floor, an experience ,not to be missed. Highly recommended when in London.

title: Great fusion cuisine restaurant with a stunning view + open air terrace
comment: This is great top notch restaurant for special occasions or deep pockets, it's very expensive but overall I think it's really worth trying it. Not easy to get a late booking unless you know people there. If you like raw meat and fish you'll love their menu.

title: stunning
comment: came here for my birthday outing. The building is nice enjoyed the lift to the restaurant glass lift. Once in and take to our table the service is excellent. The views from the windows are breathtaking to see the city glowing. The food was absolutely amazing the London samba excellent the tempora prawns heavenly. The pork belly stunning and the beef wonderful. The food was so good we re ordered the pork and prawns. The service was excellent the waiter brilliant polite. so all in all I highly recommend this restaurant I will be back.

title: Nice food not happy with staff
comment: We arrived where we had to wait for the lift becomes one was out of order and then as soon as we was at are table they told us we only had 1 hour to eat everyone we turned around they was washing us and tooling at the time ,the waiter kept taking stuff from are table for no reason music was way to loud couldn't hear my friends talking to me do t thing I will be back again

title: Amazing Cocktails!
comment: Saturday afternoon drinks with friends. Lovely views and atmosphere. Cocktails are gorgeous and all made fresh. Bar staff attentive and will adapt cocktails to suit. Be warned £13 a cocktail. A bit pricey but that's London for you.

title: Sensational Sushisamba
comment: Wow this is a fantastic restaurant. I was taken for my Birthday and it is definitely for a special occasion as it is not cheap. The views are amazing. The ambience is magic. The staff are so friendly and the service is good. The food is in a class of its own. It is beautifully presented and mouth wateringly delicious. I canno praise it highly enough. My only criticism is that when I went to book the site was offline. I rang and held on for an hour! I was then told there was one cancellation at 2.15. However when I was at the restaurant it was more than half empty. My friend said exactly the same thing happened to him when he tried to book!n

title: What a view!
comment: Went for drinks with a view! Very nice place! Cool ride up with the elevator on the outside. Some quing to get in because of the elevator. Wonderful view of London from the restaurant!

title: Disgusting Food & good atmosphere
comment: Well, atmosphere and service 6 stars, but food was so disgusting that we returned 3 of the dishes. The only good things were the soda water, wine and edamame. Avoid this place if you're expecting good food.

title: Worth the Wait
comment: 5* Service I went as a group ( 5 Girls) to celebrate a friends birthday, we did book a few weeks in advance which was needed. From the moment we were greeted at the door to the moment we left our table we were looked after exceptionally well. This was our first visit to Sushisamba, so we gave our server free rein on picking our dishes. The range of dishes we received were all exceptional, they were all presented well and tasted amazing. We made our way through the cocktail menu and they even produced mock tails for our non drinker. It was a little pricy but worth it. I am already looking for the next reason to return.

title: Amazing view and excellent service
comment: I went with my boyfriend to celebrate my 24 bday and we had amazing time. Karolina provide great service, view was beautiful also we had a nice table by the window.

title: Amazing !!
comment: My partner and I went to celebrate our first Anniversary and we spent one of our best nights since we moved to London! Thank you very much especially to Tariq who treated us like royalty & even brought us a plate with macaroons saying Happy Anniversary. Tariq is a credit to the restaurant. We will definitley be back again. Amazing views, exquisite food & perfect service.

title: Staff Training
comment: The restaurant itself is amazing with stunning view of London on the 36th floor of this office building. However, on my second visit, I called for reservation and was told that I could come to the restaurant and be seated at the bar area as the restaurant it self was fully booked. Upon arrival, I was told (by a very rude security guard) that the place was closed for a private function. Pity the lady on the phone could not tell me that. It would have saved me a trip all the way there.

title: Absolutely disgraceful service!!
comment: We booked a table for a birthday dinner, first welcomed with a fake smile and no reference whatsoever that it was my husbands special day!  Brazilian waiter over eagerly tries to advise us on the speciality dishes which aren't cheap mind you given the size of the portions served. Looked around and wondered why on earth one had to book at least a month in advance and basically the eating area isn't at all large! Service was fine so far ,the usual over enthusiastic waiter smiles especially after ordering a bottle of bollinger. After 20mins, our so called friendly waiter asked me how the food was, I had only just started to explain and he ignored me and dashed like a dog to the newly seated Arab guys beside us and just ignored my husband and I. My husband called him over to explain how rude he was to me which left him flustered. After watching all the waiters and managers running frantically and returning good these Arabs weren't happy about, the floor manager who was on duty on September 30th came over and apologised about the waiters behaviour,but wait it doesn't end there, his apology was so insincere that as he was talking to us he kept looking at the Arab guys next to us!you would think after this extreme rudeness, the 12.5% discretionary service charge would be waivered or a small gesture on the dessert front but no no no! Unless you want to be treated second class even though we splashed at least £400  there, by all means we wish you luck! Terrible service and wouldn't recommend this place to any sane individual!!     wondered what the whole hype about this place was

title: As brilliant as ever
comment: Totally superb restaurant high up with stunning views. Great service and delicious food. The modern sushi is superb and so tasty , the brochettes of black cod, the lamb chops the Kobe beef, all of the food really delicious and a good atmosphere and provided it's not too windy you can pop outside for an aperitif.

title: Way overrated!
comment: I've heard about Sushi Samba since I arrived in London, 3 years ago, and always wanted to go as it has the reputation of a very classy trendy place with an amazing view. I discovered that the bar organises Sunday Jazz evenings so my boyfriend booked a table, asking to be at the bar and explaining it was only for drinks on Sunday 27th September. The website described the dress code as "Casual Elegance" so we dressed appropriately. Well, the two things that went as planned were the view and the band. As for the rest... We arrived and, even though we confirmed the booking an hour before, the waitress couldn't find the name on her listing. She asked to see the confirmation email once we were in the middle of the bar and told him we were supposed to be in the lounge and not in the bar - even though we asked to be at the bar in the first place. We didn't want to be in the lounge because it was quite far from the band and very empty. She found us a table on the side, next to the bar, mostly because the bar was...almost empty.  At the complete opposite of what the website says, the dress code for the bar was more "tourists & co" with a lot of people wearing trainers, dirty jeans and even football shirts. Not really what I was expecting.  As we were at a table next to the bar, we received several splashes and our table got knocked several times. Eventually, one waiter knocked our wine on to my dress. He barely apologised but the manager was very helpful and polite, offering to pay for the dry cleaning and brought us 2 glasses of wine. I wouldn`t advise you to go to Sushi Samba, as it was kind of an expensive evening for a very poor experience overall.

title: Incredible Food
comment: This was my first trip to Sushisamba and I wasn't disappointed. The food was incredible. Some of the best food I've eaten and accompanied by some great wine.  The staff were very helpful and when we ordered a dish that wasn't to our taste it was taken off the bill even though there was nothing wrong with it!  The cocktails were great but took quite a while to be made and served.  I'm looking forward to my next visit.

title: Great evening and perfect for our anniversary
comment: Amazing views and atmosphere, great service and friendly staff and most importantly Sensational food.  The Pork Belly, Chocolate Banana Cake and the black cod is a MUST (their black cod is far better than Zuma) Only downfall ......was that they had an external event taking place so we waited 20 mins to be seated. Overall a must if you fancy Japanese cuisine with a twist!

title: Awful service
comment: Last weekend me and my boyfriend celebrated our anniversary at Sushi Samba, from when we sat down we waited 40 minutes to order our food, the waiter incorrectly told me what one of the dishes were so when it arrived I was disappointed. He asked if we wanted more bottled water- we said no, however he put one on our table which we didn't drink and charged us for it anyway. He took one dish away when it was half eaten and we had not finished it, I told him this when he reappeared and he just said sorry. Then to top if off as we were still finishing our meal he decided to clear up our table to rush us out. Complete disappointment and left us feeling underwhelmed.

title: Cool, trendy and very tasty
comment: The cocktails are fantastic. The food eclectic and the restaurant very cool as it is 39 floors up! The menu is varied and great fun. Black cod is wonderful and the south america dishes on the menu are really fun!

title: Hip and happening place
comment: I loved this place even its far from central london but worth it. The sushi is good with nice hip twist on taste  Nice music and hip atmosphere, alive place

title: Great views
comment: We came to admire the views without breaking the bank and booking in advance. We ordered some iced latte and enjoyed the afternoon sun at the windows. We can recommend coming around 3 pm as it doesn't get too busy.

title: Went for lunch, good food, good view
comment: I went here for lunch in october, we got a table outside and it was very warm and nice. The staff were friendly and the wester twist they put on the style of the food was good. Do you go if you are scared of heights though, as the lift up is on the outside of the bulding.

title: Gourmet delight in the sky.
comment: Went here for a special meal and it had to be lunch due to difficulty of booking dinner. Lovely clear day so could see over all Greater London and beyond. Great decor - simple and effective. The cocktails and starters set the standard, high and different from the start. The Tom Yam culinary cocktail was a revelation; the Cafe Millonario is best with dessert. The yellowtail taquitos, Tokyo sky tree, yellowtail tiradito, shrimp tempura and eggplant mustard miso with hijiki brown seaweed were all delicious. The "Kaze, No Mori, Muroka, Nama, Genshu, Junami, Nara" sake was a revelation. Never knew the stuff could taste so good, and the tasting notes were spot on. Even the desserts - organic red chocolate chili peppers and assorted mochi were both superb. Wasn't the cheapest of meals I've had but was worth every penny! Highly expert staff provide excellent guidance. NARA

title: Amazing viiew and food
comment: The waiters were extremly attentive, the food was amazing and the view was incredible. Highly recommend for a special night out as it is quite expensive, but worth it, even if you just go to the bar for a cocoktail.

title: Really posh birthday celebration
comment: Went for lunch with my partner to celebrate Birthday, booked very early lunch, the food was delicious. Had a bottle of Spanish wine. The staff was very friendly and professional, the waitress at the end of our meal brought to us a plate with a macaroon and written in chocolate Happy Birthday, that was a very sweet gesture. Very good way to celebrate in style.

title: Amazing! Highly recommend.
comment: This is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to. The views of the city are stunning, food is exquisite, cocktails are delicious.... I can't fault it at all. Definitely a must-see in London.

title: Bitterly disappointing experience!
comment: We visited here on Saturday 25th for an evening for a meal, table reservation was at 21:45. I was really looking forward to this as we have visited here many time before and has been exceptional, now however its a shambles. It started off all wrong when we saw a long queue to see the hostess, and seeing everyone getting turned around to the already very busy bar. The hostess informed us that they are very busy and that our table will be ready in 15 mins LIE #1 We ordered 4 drinks at the bar costing 50 pound and 15 minutes later went to check with the hostess if our table was ready, she answered with the other guests are paying the bill, just give us a few minutes to get your table ready LIE#2 Another 15 minutes later we went to the hostess again to ask what was going on and were greeted by someone telling us they are very busy and getting the table ready, and offered to get us a drink, nice gestures but too late to be honest. LIE#3 Around 22:30 we were taken to our table finally, ordered a bottle of water, some wine and the food.  Surprisingly, the food appeared instantly, I thought there would be quite a wait as the place was so busy. As one of the dishes we ordered the Churrasco Rio Grande, which we knew would be coming last. We ate some rice with the previous courses so in anticipation for the Rio Grande I asked our server Tareq to bring us more rice to enjoy with the meat platter, he responded with no problem. The rice did not arrive until there was 1 sliver of meat remaining on the stones, so naturally I told the server that its too late we have finished. He ran off to get Tareq who stormed back to the table and said "You only ordered this when the rio grande was on the table" LIE #4 How rude of waiter to speak to customers like that. Once the table was cleared we said we'd like to see the dessert menu, Tareq appeared and slammed them down so aggressively on the table he almost knocked over a glass of wine. Desserts were tasty but we quickly ordered the bill. On seeing the bill we were amazed to see we were charged for the rice as well as 2 bottles of water, we only ordered 1 so when we explained to Tareq, he angrily stated that we ordered two, when we see we hadn't he said he had opened 2 for us and kept one to the side we told him he should not have done that so he rolled his eyes and stormed off. 10 mins later he returned huffing and puffing with the bill. We swiftly paid and left. The worst experience in my life. I previously rated this place no1 in London. It has slumped a lot and I would not recommend anyone. Staff need training on how treat customers in this industry. Hostesses need trained on how to do their job and not lie to customers 3 times. Truly disgusting. I am so disappointed in this place it needs a totally revamp of their staff. Would give 0 stars if possible. Much better places to visit than this.

title: Good service great view nice food
comment: Visited with family at first evening in London . Very hip cool trendy restaurant. Very crowed even on a week day.They sale many time slots. Advance reservation is a must in London almost every were . Very hip cool trendy restaurant crowed even on a week day. Very tantative waiters fast service. Enjoyed the evening . Food is considerably good. Reasonable price for the food. View was breat taking.

title: High end Asian Fusion restaurant with amazing views
comment: We visited SushiSamba for a birthday celebration. The ambience, service and vibe of the bar and restaurant was incredibly unique with amazing views of the London skyline after a speedy experience in the lift to the top! There was a whole host of team to serve us, there was a real buzz in the restaurant and there is plenty to choose from and experience on the menu. We enjoyed the 'shared tapas' way of eating however it wasn't the best sushi we've experienced compared to other restaurants which was the main opportunity for us. The cocktails were great but the bill was quite high for what we felt we had.

title: Beaut view with food to match!
comment: I think this is the best sushi I have ever had, and I have eaten a lot of sushi! The views are unreal and if your lucky to get a table for 7:30, you get the best of day and night over looking London. We had a mixed dinner selection from all the menus but the sushi was definitely the star of the show. So many textures, colors and flavors to choose from it was brilliant. As we were celebrating a birthday the servers arranged for one of our deserts to come out with candles which was a great way to end the meal.

title: Top London views but very mediocre food, overly priced. Enjoy the view over drinks!
comment: The views are amazing, great terraces and bar. Go for drinks, but not for a meal! I was greatly disappointed. The food was very mediocre, very small portions and expensive, totally over priced for what it is. The scallop ceviche was specially disappointing, presented in a bowl filled with a lemony liquid, raw stir fry veggies with very few pieces of fish. In order to eat a proper meal, one would have to order a lot of dishes and then end up with a very hefty bill at the end. The service was friendly.

title: Great!!!
comment: The food was excellent , from starters to desserts. We enjoyed everything . The views were amazing. The service was of high quality! We had a great time

title: Lovely views but expensive
comment: I came here for a couple of drinks with my friend and we really enjoyed it. The outside area is lovely but we did find the cocktails very expensive...but you are paying for the view!

title: Extremely expensive!
comment: It doesn´t worth going there. The food is very expensive and the plates are too small. The place is small. The only good thing is the view. The restaurant is very famous, but I really don´t recommend it.

title: Amazing
comment: One of the best restaurants, the food, the staff, the cocktails and the drinks. Definitely coming back again. Was about £60 per head.

title: Beautiful views and decor
comment: View - 10/10 - can see why you would put a bar on the 39th floor of a building  Decor - 10/10 - the tree is absolutely stunning with all the lights on the terrace outside by far the prettiest tree I've ever seen  Drinks - 7/10 - especially with the confusing menu as we really were not sure what cocktails we were ordering but they were very well presented  Seating - 9/10 - had nice variety of seating but had to share table with strangers

title: Gastro Treat
comment: Went for a meal as a present . It took a long time to book so plan well ahead. The lift to the 38/9th floor is super fast and the views spectacular. The menu is a mix of Japanese and Peruvian. It's not easy to follow we went with a selection of sushi and a large seafood dish for main and a chillies with chocolate dessert. We had a bottle of white wine. Prices are very high , the cheapest wine is £33 a bottle. You can order a Kobe steak for a grand ! So be prepared , you will not eat here for less than£100 , but saying that the food was very good and your paying for the location .

title: Fantastic food and service
comment: Really great food and service here. Hard to get a table is the only downside. Apart from that meal was perfect in a good location great for couples

title: Drink and sushi with a great view
comment: Popped in here last Saturday night fantastic views from the bar we had no intention of eating but decided to order some sushi which was the best also great service so well worth a visit

title: Good Cocktails, Average Food
comment: Amazing ambience. Best time to visit is during sunset. Beautiful view, amazing cocktails. Though, food isn't that great and isn't value for money.

title: Great service!
comment: Went to celebrate my birthday, great location and ambient. Our waiter, Gary was very friendly and helpful. Food was amazing and I love the idea of little dishes to share. Desserts are great too!

title: I wish we had gone somewhere else with good food/service/wine. Close to hopeless!
comment: We arrived a little earlier than we had booked for dinner. They said our table was not ready (even though the restaurant had only a few tables occupied) and I found the attitude poor.....they did not suggest we have a drink or show us anywhere. So we wondered into the outside bar and asked for a Bellini and a coke. I was advised by one of the barmen that the peach puree was “not very nice” so I switched to a glass of champagne. A totally unnecessary wait of 5 minutes ensued while the barman had a chat with a member of staff and generally went slow....while I stood by the bar like a spare part. The bar was hardly busy.  My champagne, when it finally arrived was bordering on being warm and it tasted sweet and really nasty. I exchanged it for a glass of water to remove the foul taste. The barman apologised and tipped the contents of my champagne glass into an ice bucket right in front of me...as if this happens often. Perhaps it does? The house champagne that they serve by the glass is Bruno Paillard extra brut Premiere Cuvee, Reims....vile! They also have a blanc de blancs, Reserve Privee Grand Cru. Reims.....but I wasn't given a choice at the bar otherwise I would have gone for it.....although I doubt it is either much better or is served any colder! The funny part is that the wine list boasts, " Sushisamba is proud to feature the largest collection of Bruno Paillard Champagne in the UK from the Maison de Champagne's Library collection." I'd keep quiet about that if I were them!  Bar tables were not clean. Why? I asked if they had any bar nibbles.....I received a blank look. I explained, "crisps or nuts or olives?" This 2nd barman gave me a one word answer....NO. By now he had my credit card and I had a Sushi Samba tab. Would they credit the unused, binned by barman, glass of champagne at end of dinner, I wondered? The views are great but that doesn't excuse poor service and possibly the worst glass of champagne I've ever tasted. Avoid it....whatever you do. I can't imagine why the Bellini could be so bad but if they used this horrible champagne instead of a decent Prosecco as they do at Harry’s bar in Venice and most good bars, then no peach juice in the world would stand a chance of impressing.....the result would be blighted.  I had to find the receptionists to ask for our table after our appointed time otherwise we could have ended up being late for the theatre. I had told them where we were. That’s twice these two ladies were pointless and useless. The view from the restaurant is good .....but you can't eat the view and plenty of other restaurants in London with far better food and service also offer good views. The loo wasn't great.....no tissues or paper to use to manually turn off the horrible water tap after washing hands so one recollects the germs. A friend, who owns a great up market chain of restaurants in the USA even has a tissue dispenser by the exit door to the loo (WC/toilet) for people who have just washed their hands to avoid touching the loo door handle...a great idea. Here there are no tissues or any sort of paper dispenser around door area or basins. The clientele vary.....some guys were shorts. Don't bother dressing up to come here.  The seating in the restaurant....all large leather chairs......very wide to accommodate wide people.....but also very hard and uncomfortable to sit on. Our stone table for two in the far right corner on entering the room was chipped all over. Above the diners is a high ceiling with lighting thick with dust.....i hope it doesn't fall off into the food.  My main course, very long strips of vegetables on top of a nasty green sauce which looked great and tasted vile. Also impossible to eat properly with chopsticks. The next course, billed as a "large plate" requiring, so I was told by our waiter, no extra vegetable dishes, was in fact small and more like an horderve that I was so hungry afterwards that I ordered a plate of Avocado Maki. What a surprise! AT LAST......something great....the avocado maki were the best I have ever seen or tasted anywhere in the world.....absolutely fantastic and for these alone, this restaurant will not receive a low score.  My wife left her vegetable tempura. They were really greasy....nowhere near as good as even at Yo Sushi! Her black cod was ok but nothing special. My vegan main was passable. They brought the wrong dish at first.....with an egg in the centre....not very vegan...even though it was ordered off their vegan menu. To have a menu for vegans is admirable...so why deliver the dish ordered WITH AN EGG IN THE MIDDLE OF IT? Vegans don’t eat dairy products. This was another case of the staff being badly trained and useless. Too many are busy trying to be “cool” and failing miserably. This restaurant isn’t “cool” but it is funny....in a 3rd rate sort of a way. A manager in a shiny blue suit then asked how we had enjoyed the food. I only got as far as my wife's starter being too greasy.....before he helpfully explained...going on and on to me, that tempura is "fried in oil!" really? Well fancy that. And 2 + 2 is 4. I know more about food and restaurants than this guy ever will. Then the waiter clearing the table dropped the chop sticks. We were at their Las Vegas branch at Christmas.....with a very annoying waitress. The Vegas version was fairly grim. Food-wise, this no better. The service here was barely passable.  Then my wife did something ever so brave...she ordered a desert. It was terrific. I think the management needs changing as all that happened is down to poor management. Wakey wakey Shimon, Matthew and Danielle who own this restaurant. I’m sure you pay a fortune in rent to be at the top of The Heron......so perhaps pay the staff a little more and improve the service? That’s a tip from someone who really knows! But my best tip is...don’t bother. Go to Zuma if you want to a big bill but great food/service/atmosphere/everything....or Yo Sushi. Finally, due to desert (pudding) and the great Maki, I would have given the 2nd lowest score instead of the lowest.....but the doorman on the ground floor at the ropes, with his I-pad, is just so welcoming and helpful both on arriving and on leaving (he went to great pains to show us exactly, on his I-pad, where to walk to reach the Barbican Theatre (where we were due at 7pm to see Hamlet) that I’m not even going to give the 2nd bottom score but will go one higher. This guy’s service standards are not repeated upstairs by anyone in the bar, or by the silly receptionists or by many of the waiters.

title: Good view, but pricy
comment: The sushi is definitely great. The service good. The cocktails are pretty standard and expensive. Eventually a place to go once a year with a great date but not daily.

title: 2nd visit
comment: The best sushi I have eaten for a good long while. The ingredients fresh and full of flavour. The view and the experience are well worth the visit. I have been twice.

title: It's the view! (& the food...)
comment: We were lucky to get a reservation just a couple of days ahead. But had to settle for lunch; which was perfect. Our waiter guided us through the menu; and advised us what to taste to get the best from both (Peruvian & Japanese) kitchen. I especially was surprised by the Peruvian part, less known, but very tasteful! We had a great time, lovely looking (&tasting) dishes and off course: the view!

title: Yummy food and great service
comment: It's a lovely place to dine in. We had a lot of baggage but the staff were very friendly and placed it in the hold section straight away. It was our first time there so the waiter was very welcoming and provided many recommendations. Everyone that worked there was very helpful and it had a lively atmosphere. The food arrived beautifully presented and as there was a group of us we were able to try lots of different things. I would definitely recommend getting a few samba rolls to share! My favourite part of the meal was the dessert though, they came out in huge portions and each one tasted delicious. The best one in my opinion was the passionfruit cake.

title: Okay food, good view, worst service I have ever experienced
comment: View is good, although from the inside of the restaurant you can't see much at night. Food is okay but not a patch on other Asian restaurants in London. Service however is shockingly rude. Approached the hostess about my table and she replied "I am busy," I waited 10 minutes before approaching her again and she completely blanked me. In the end I had to speak to a manager to be seated. So rude and unnecessary and meant the night got off to a very bad start. Other waitresses not as attentive either, would not waste my money here again.

title: Top of London place!
comment: Just the perfect place to feel the high standard and spirit of London in a combination with excellent Japanese food! Exquisite and modern ambience. Friendly staff, always made proper recommendation about the menu. Consider to make a reservation, because we waited 40min at the bar for a place to sit and have dinner.

title: Top sushi quality with a spectacular view
comment: Trendy 38 floor level restaurant and bar at city center location. Sushi friends will love the top quality and variety of fresh seafood dishes. Single dish orders are between 8-11 pounds, but a group of 4 easily sums up to >250 pounds with coctails and full dinner. An open terrace allows for a cigarette or drink outside. Liked it for a sunday lunch when families, couples and hipsters join for a relaxed time. Service is organized and friendly but seems a little pushy to increase consumption (heard that they show stiff lips when you order only a small plate or single drink at the tables. The bar seating area then seems a good alternative if you mainly want to enjoy the view.)

title: Fabulous
comment: The food was amazing. The staff were very friendly and really helpful with the menu choices. I loved it & would love to go again & again.

title: A dining experience
comment: On a recent weekend visit to my son in London, he took me to SushiSamba for dinner. What an experience, this is an awesome restaurant. To start with, the views from the 38th floor are just wonderful, the sun was just going down when we arrived and the glow across the buildings below us was breathtaking. The food was amazing, the service was excellent. If you are in London you must visit this restaurant, it's a dining experience and I recommend it. I will most definitely be back.

title: Amazing experience!
comment: Starting from hair-raising lift ride up to the restaurant, the food, our waiter Javier from Madrid, it was all first class. The views were spectacular. Food mouth-watering and the service friendly to the max! Javier helped us to select a perfect menu and wine. We can't wait to be back. Thank you guys for a memorable lunch! Javi & Vesa

title: Excellent restaurant, shame about the volume
comment: Went to SushiSamba with my wife for a late dinner. We had to wait, despite booking in advance. We were then offered a better table, which turned out to be a worse table, considerably so. When we asked to be moved again, we were moved to a much nicer table. The food was superb. The service was great. Unfortunately, while the bar was extremely loud, very loud music was also playing in the restaurant itself, making it almost impossible to hear each other or the waiters. Given the high prices, I'd expect a better atmosphere.

title: Fantastic food with first class service!
comment: I have been to Sushi Samba London many times with friends and family and it never disappoints. No matter how busy the food is always wonderful but more importantly the people that work there always make it a fabulous experience. Charming, attentive and go out of their way to look after your every need! Oh and the views cannot be beat!!

title: Overrated!
comment: Girl behind the bar very snobby and unfriendly. Overpriced and overrated. Should have gone to duck and waffle instead!

title: A wonderful restaurant
comment: This bar / restaurant is 38-40 floors up the Heron Tower. It's expensive but the food is great, the service is excellent and the panoramic views over London are spectacular. The glass lift goes 40 floors in 10 seconds but is very comfortable if a little unusual. Smart dress required. As I said, expensive but would definitely go again for the experience for a special occasion.

title: Fabulous afternoon with delicious food
comment: Went to sushisamba yesterday for lunch, such a fantastic experience. Our waiter was very helpful and offered us advice on what to order, some of which we accepted and did not regret! Everything we ate was of superior quality, cannot recommend the miso black cod enough and the samba salad was a work of art! We enjoyed a selection of rolls and cocktails, the chucumber was a particular favourite with our group! Overall a really lovely afternoon and while an expensive lunch, definitely a worthwhile dining experience! Having eaten in sushisamba in both Miami and NYC, it is understandable that London's sushisamba is so often referenced, with its exceptional views over the city. Would recommend to anyone looking for great food with a view with a relaxed atmosphere!

title: Service a joke
comment: Visited with a group for drinks. The ride up and down in the lift was excellent, not for the faint hearted if afraid of heights. We were positioned at the outside bar with the wonderful orange tree. Great views. Drinks expensive as you would expect but the service charge is a joke because the bar tenders wouldn't know the meaning of the word. Not a smile, hello or thank you and after pouring several glasses of wine for our group the waiter was asked what glass had what variety of wine. His reply was "do nt know". Not good enough for the prices paid.

title: Amazing view! Excellent service!
comment: Coconut Rice great! Mini kobe burger tasty! Staff lovely! Prawn as starter is the best! The only thing you could worried about is the bill.. £50 pp :P

title: Lovely food lovely views good service
comment: My husband has been here many times and rated it highly and always said he wanted to bring me here. The waiter was very attentive. My husband had a particular cloudy sake last time he visited but couldn't remember which one. The waiter went out of his way trying to find out which one it was and opened a bottle for my husband to try. When he tried it and said it wasn't the one the waiter took the bottle away and it wasn't a problem and we chose a bottle of wine to have followed by another!! The food was lovely I couldn't fault it, we ordered lots of different dishes. All of the dishes were beautifully presented. The views from the restaurant and bar were pretty spectacular. After our meal we had a few cocktails before going to a champagne bar a taxi ride away. The food and drinks were lovely and we had a lovely time but when we got home I asked out of interest how much our evening was and he had spent close to £600!!! He is used to going to this type of "expensive" restaurant however I cannot justify it even if it is the best food in the world!! Food is food. I would rather spend £600 on something I have to show for it. After sushi amber we went to Madison champagne bar which still had spectacular views but for the same cocktails they were a third of the price less. I think a brilliant experience but over rated and over priced but people who fine frequently n london can convince themselves that a meal is worth that much.

title: Wow!!
comment: What a fantastic place. A very busy, lively atmosphere which I wouldn't normally enjoy but didn't affect the experience at all. Fantastic views and fantastic food. The terrace overlooking London was lovely with a beautifully lit-up tree as the centrepiece. Drinks and food isn't cheap but well worth every penny. Easily spent £200 between the 2 of us and would happily do it again. Sushi with caviar was probably the nicest thing I've ever eaten. Major brownie-points from the lady!!

title: excellent food and service
comment: Fantastic panoramic views of London. Excellent service and great food. The waiters are really good and attentive. A bit pricey but you get what you pay for.

title: Great as ever!
comment: It is still my favourite place in London, great atmosphere, stunning views, attentive service and amazing food. Yes it is pricey, but worth every penny.

title: Amazing food, not so good service.
comment: Went here for dinner after finally waiting a very long time to book a table here. However when I arrived at the door to enter, we were made to queue, which I guess is fine. We then ended up being late to the table by 10 minutes, and our table has been given away and we were asked to wait. I could have understood if we were late and it was our fault but it was actually due to door staff. We were not taken in to the restaurant but put in the bar area on stools, which was great. The food however was incredible!! And the views were amazing. Cocktails were also delicious. I would recommend but service needs to improve

title: Combination Japanese samurai warrior with South American revolutionary fervour
comment: Sushi Samba on the top floor of the Heron Tower in London is a restaurant -bar with with Japanese - Brazilian -Peruvian inspired food that forges a Japanese Damascan bladed knife with the fancy foot work of football star Neymar. Real Kobe beef can be enjoyed with the1kg Kobe beef ishiyaki setting you back £1000. Bring your Barcelona, Real Madrid, Chelsea footballer friend to pick up the tab. For us mere plebs one can choose from the nigiri,sashimi,the robata grill and samba rolls. Cocktails are quite good, their smoke plum negroni is delish. On a clear London day, one will have sweeping views of London from the terrace area. Dress appropriately or the doormen won’t let you up the clear lifts,so download your favourite Salsa playlist and enjoy the revolution.

title: Awesome as usual...
comment: I have been to Sushi Samba quite a few times with my friends because it is by far one of our favourite restaurant/bars and one of the main reasons why we love it is because they offer cocktails prepared with the stunning Peruvian national drink, Pisco. Those drinks are a must!!!

title: amazing view over London and fancy japanese-brasilian dishes
comment: inspired from Sushi Samba in New York, the london one has nothing to envy to its US cousins. The foods is tasty, the cocktails are amazing as well as the set up of the restaurant located in Heron Tower and offering a stellar view on London

title: Very nice lunch
comment: We were here for a birthday lunch. The views and the general ambiance were spectacular. To be honest we didn't understand what everything was on the menu- but the waitress patiently explained it all. Its a Peruvian/ Japanese mix which worked very well indeed, Rather to our surprise the hot dishes came first-- including dumplings, steak and mini kobe burgers. All looked and good .Later the sushi arrived - which was the best presented and most tasty Ive seen and eaten. We were very full by then so didn't have rom for the desserts. So will have to go back! It is of course quite expensive-- but not as bad as I had feared-- and worth it for a special occasion

title: Disappointing
comment: My husband and I thought we would try Sushi Samba and I wasn't very impressed. The place has a nice airy feel to it. We got a table by the window and strangely enough the chairs face the restaurant rather than out to the view! The vegetarian choice is about 5 dishes and some of them not special at all. However my husband did enjoy his black cod and pork belly. The waiter was aware that we were not sharing our food and he decided to bring all the food together! Not very fine dining if they think its ok for us to eat our food cold! Unfortunately the view is also on the wrong side of the building.  All in all I wouldn't recommend it. I can see it as a nice place to take visitors to the city but nothing more.

title: what a sight, what a venue.....
comment: Decided to have a 'different' type of Sunday Lunch, booked without any issues as i know the place can get very busy. Service out of this world, everything explained to our young daughter (us learning lots too), high prices, but what you would expect for such a prominent venue, well worth a visit, the food was amazing.

title: Beautifully dressed dishes on the 38th floor
comment: The elevator Ride to the 38th floor is beautiful. The interiors of the restaurant are well designed and the people who served us were helpful and knowledgeable Needless to say the food was mind blowing..

title: Great views + good food
comment: Located on the 38th floor of Heron Tower, the place offers great views of North London (if sitting in the main dining area) and the City (from the bar). A good menu with a fair number of sushi options to chose from. Prices are obviously on the higher side but after all, you do pay a premium for the views (and the food is really good).

title: Awesome sushi and great cocktails and service with amazing views and ambiance
comment: Went for my daughters 20th birthday, her choice as it's pretty cool, but totally with my blessing! The guy at the lift was brilliant, camp, fabulous, warm, just the best, then the crazy ride in the glass lift, OMG, and then the main event. Initial service a bit patchy, but combination of waiter recommendations and what we chose were amazing. It's 'British sushi' I'd say, having been to the Far East, but it's British in the very best sense, different, creative, slightly bonkers, and the best ever. Incredible fusion of tastes, and beautiful presentation. Food to make you go 'mmmmmmm'! With a huge smile! Expensive, but worth it, you do get what you pay for generally in life. Cocktails are good and the view and ambiance are fabulous.

title: Great view, tasty food but it gets expensive if you want to have a proper dinner
comment: The place is amazing, the best view you will have of London (even from the toilets!) However, waiters are snob people who almost oblige you to order more foods than you want and judge you if you only take one small course. The food is excellent but very expensive. To sum up, go there for the view and for one drink but don't stay much more.

title: Expensive dirty arrogant staff.
comment: This was a birthday celebration for my mother in law. Ouch. The lift journey is spectacular and the lift was spotless. However the bar and the terrace needed attention. They were filthy. The views are spectacular, and for this reason a trip to the sushi bar would be fun. We ate in the main restaurant. The waiters!! They definitely need training from Fernando at the Ivy, little attention to detail. We asked for the air conditioning to be put on, and the waiter said he did not know if they had any!! Oddly some time later after we had finished, the air con went on. The menu is well explained, and this was the the best part of the meal. Portions were lets say nano based, and very expensive. The food was not breathtaking and it reminded me of Benihama, but the food at Beniham was fresher and tastier at this chain!! So I will not return!!! shame

title: Rude bar staff..
comment: The bar staff and other staff in the bar area on the same floor as the terrace are amongst the worst staff I have experienced in London. A friend and I knew we couldn't get a reservation by just dropping in so we opted for bar snacks instead. One barwoman in particular decided to serve two other people who reached the bar after me and when I pointed out I was waiting first she snapped that I was still choosing my drink. I had chosen what I wanted before I even got to the bar yet I'm being told by a psychic member of staff that I didn't know what I wanted. Another member of staff spoke very little English so we had trouble trying to order bar food and he walked off. A female waitress in the bar area said she would bring us food menus to the terrace and never returned. This would have been one star had I not have always been impressed with the friendly staff within the restaurant area but unfortunately the bar staff definitely require further training.

title: Underwhelmed
comment: The views were outstanding. The waiter was very good and the food was nice (not great). What still sticks with me nearly two weeks later is the food hall like feel of the restaurant. Loud music permeates the restaurant. It's OK when you're at the bar, I expect that. But it was distracting at dinner.  We had an 11.15pm booking - the dinner felt rushed as we had to get our order in by 11.30pm (we were ready to order straight away) and the dessert course had to be in by a certain time. The late time wasn't our preference, it was the only available slot we had. However, if a restaurant is going to start a meal sitting at 11.15pm, don't expect it to be over by 12.30am.  I would recommend spending your money elsewhere.

title: Late family dinner
comment: We ate here about 2 weeks ago with our 9 and 12 yr old. It was a great dinner. We arrived there on time but the table was still occupied. The hostess managed to put us at a slightly bigger table. We had a great dinner and the kids loved it.

title: the absolute view!!
comment: excellent view!!very nice enviroment!!i went there with friends and tried some coctails!the coctails costed around 12$ each.the service was also great!!i have been there for two times while i was visiting London and i definately want to go again in the future!

title: Loved the sushi samba experience
comment: I had no expectations when I went as i had never heard of the place. I actively recommend to go if you haven't yet.  High above London the bar has the best view, stop unwind before you meal with a fantastically made cocktail.  The restaurant is large and airy with a fantastic arsenal of attentive staff. Celebrating a birthday was completed in style thanks to the recommendations of our waitress.  I would 100% recommend Sushi Samba.

title: Great views going up in lift and from bar, but disappointing from the roof.
comment: I just visited the bars so I can't comment on the food and restaurant which looked absolutely stunning. Jaw dropping view from the lift going all the way up (breathe!) and inner windows from the bar but very disappointing from the roof top bar, which is the jewel in the crown I really went for. Stepped out holding my breath but was sharply disappointed on seeing a huge flat roof on the lower floor blocking the view of the city. The view was only partial and really got on my curves. However, it is still nice to be on a roof top bar in the City at night and the bar outside is very pretty, especially at night and blankets are available for those chilly evenings. At this altitude the wind definitely blows in your hair, or should I say: blows off your hair - and it was mid August folks. Drinks here are generally exorbitant but I knew that before going, and restaurant prices are the same, though I would go again to try the food and atmosphere and enjoy that lift experience again! Definitely worth a visit, go after dark, but calm yourself about the rooftop view. You will still get a great view from the inner bars though and good music and atmosphere.

title: Drinks and disappointment
comment: Went here with a few friends after work for a drink, fantastic journey up in the elevator and brilliant views. The bar area was smaller than I anticipated, and honestly, looked a little shabby and tired. The bar staff are functional, certainly not warm, friendly or even polite, but they got the job done. Drinks were extortionate, I expect to pay £5+ for a beer in London, but £7 for a 300ml bottle of lager is ridiculous. Poor selection of wine, I get that they specialise in cocktails, but more than 3 reds and 3 whites would be decent. Very disappointed with the view from the terrace, completely obstructed by a flat roof from the floor below. Clearly I am not the target clientele, maybe my expectations were too high, but I was really underwhelmed with the whole experience. Despite the fact that this bar is in my office building, and therefore very conveniently located, I will not be returning.

title: A perfect, unforgettable birthday dinner and drinks!!
comment: So I am writing this review a year after we visited (July 2014) and I still remember it perfectly (that's how amazing it was). Firstly, the location is fantastic, the Heron Tower is awesome with its lift overlooking the street below and being so up high, the restaurant has ridiculous views of London! Service was phenomenal, hostesses were friendly and the restaurant design is gorgeous. We had the fillet steak (fantastic, although small), two rolls which consisted of the best maki I have ever had (and I have had loads of sushi all over the globe). The fish was so fresh and just melted in your mouth. The maki rolls we had were:  tokyo sky tree and the tiger maki.  The drinks were fabulous (had sake and a cocktail). They have an extensive Sake menu that's for sure! we went onto the terrace for the drinks after our dinner and it overlooked London with stunning views up on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower. It was a romantic setting and definitely finished our night off wonderfully.  The dessert wasn't the best but they personalised it for my boyfriend's birthday.  Definitely try the vegetable tempura (seriously some of the best I've had as well). The onlt complaint is that as a student it's quite pricey so couldn't go again since then. However, if you have the money to spend on a good meal, this is a no-brainer. You must try this place. My boyfriend and I keep trying out the top rated sushi places whenever we travel but we almost always compare it to sushisamba. Love this place!!!

title: Great venue and views of London
comment: This venue is great for winding down with friends over a couple of cocktails after work and watching the beautiful views of the sunset over London. Has excellent cocktail makers too who can clearly make good cocktails.

title: Best view, best time in London.
comment: Not only do you get a great view of London (from the East), outside terrace for cocktails which although crowded is great way to start the evening. Great waiter (Jacob from CZ), guided us through some exquisite dishes, we had a ball.

title: Awesome experience
comment: Food, service and location were superb. Special thanks to Jacobo for acommodating us. We will certainly be returning!

title: Fantastic food, cocktails and beautiful views across London!
comment: My partner took me here for my birthday on Friday evening. He had booked a table for 6pm to coincide with sunset and this worked out fabulously. The weather was lovely and when we got there we got two cocktails from the bar and went onto the outside terrace to make the most of the views. We were given a choice to sit inside or outside, and we opted to sit inside by the window. The views are incredible and watching the sunset whilst eating the meal was beautiful.  Our waiter was lovely and he explained the menu and also made some suggestions. We took him up on most of his suggestions and they were all fantastic. We ordered a selection of things and they were all brought out to us in stages which was very nice. The quality and presentation of the food was superb, we really couldn't fault it. We particularly enjoyed the fillet steak and the Samba Rolls. My partner had informed the staff that it was my birthday, and they brought out the most beautiful dessert of passionfruit cake with raspberry sorbet. The plate was decorated to say Happy Birthday and there was a candle for me to blow out. After the meal we stayed for a couple of hours at the outside bar area to work our way through the cocktails! We had a fantastic meal here and the service was very good. We would definitely recommend coming here if you want to be impressed!

title: Great food, location, atmosphere
comment: It is a lovely restaurant. The bars are a bit small and covered in hedges, so if you are sitting down, you can't admire the views. The restaurant however is lovely and good size. Food is excellent if you have a taste of Japanese food. If you are first time goers or haven't had Japanese sushi experience before, then I would recommend to order two small plates and two sambas (4 to 6 pieces each plate). That would be enough for 2 people. You can of course order other delights like sashimi which are raw meats etc,delicious, but not too filling.  The ambience is lovely and so is the service. Your waiter will explain you the menu and also give recommendation. Location is great.  We were the two of us, had 2 glasses of wine each. Ordered 5 dishes and paid in all 97 quid. The food was reasonably priced, considering it was lovely and considering the service, location and ambience of the hotel. The drinks however were a bit expensive. £8 for bottled beer and £10 for a small glass of wine. The cocktails on the other hand were £14.  Food plates are each between £14 -17 .  Overall, we would return for the experience. We really had a good time.

title: Amazing food just not enough of it!
comment: Ok so with this place needless to say you have stunning views. Service was great. The menu was unfamiliar to me but the waiter helped us choose the right dishes. Now the food was absolutely delicious and I tasted flavours that I had never tasted before but the portions were absolutely tiny. I could have eaten out again after.
