I wasn't expecting massive portions but these really were small. I don't think its right that the portions are so small given the extravagant pricing.im glad I've been but I think the price would put me off returning but having said that the food was of top quality there was just very little.

title: What a view!
comment: After a long day and almost 3 weeks trying to get a reservation in sushi samba (worth the waiting I guess) here we are are! The view is breathtaking and the food is superb. Staff knowledgable and relaxed! Can't wait to come back !

title: Mr&Mrs Ali from the corinthia hotel
comment: The Resturant is rated as high end Resturant but we were disappointed by the bad attitude of the receptionist who was NOT professional and badly mannered and Careless with most of the clients that we witnessed . She lack the basic role of hospitality . Although we arrived on time she kept us waiting for 40 minutes in top of her bad behavior and unprofessional attitude .  But the staff serving were so professional and friendly , we have been served by Ruta one of hostesses whom she made up our night as pleasant as we expected to enjoy SUSHISAMBA  she was serving her area with big and pleasant smile , CLAUDIO was also so friendly and welcoming , he did his at most to please us and apologize for the bad experience from the receptionist .  SUSHISAMBA has good reputation and deserve to have highly professional staff to be able to carry this reputation like Ruta and Claudio .

title: Read the one star reviews
comment: The majority of people who use Trip Advisor will vote either 5 stars or 1 star because they cannot fathom the intricacies of moderation. This is a rare example of a venue earning its one star rating. I went here last week with some friends to celebrate a birthday. We were really only here for a couple of drinks before dinner at a proper restaurant somewhere else. But oh boy were those drinks overpriced! I complained about the price of my girlfriend's Ashahi. £7 when you can get 8 of the same bottles for a tenner in Tesco. Now I know it's London but let's not be silly here. As I was expressing my disdain, Slick on the cramped sofa next to me eyed me with disapproval, as though to say "here be a country mouse come to visit the city." He was trying to get in the knickers of a young debutante so was probably trying to impress her with the 'I'm a man of wealth and refined tastes spiel.' Regardless, my partner and I are on very good salaries, but we're not stupid with our money and wouldn't throw it away when we can get the same product for a fraction of the price elsewhere. Ashahi is Ashahi and the taste is consistent. Cocktails were nice but massively overpriced at £13 each, especially considering that they were mostly made up of crushed ice. Drank it in a few minutes. Food from the sushi grill was likewise overpriced, tiny, and there was no table to eat it on, which resulted in my spilling oil all over my trousers. After trying and failing to pay for a long time, we finally got a cocktail waitress to bring us our bill. When she found out we wanted to split it she flew into a rage and shouted "You should have told me this when you ordered!" Erm.. we did. Anyway, after grumbling for another 5 minutes and completely ruining the atmosphere, we paid our £200+ something bill (we'd barely ordered anything!) and swiftly departed because we no longer felt safe. The waitress looked like she wanted to stave our heads in with her serving tray. The views are quite good but good luck getting a spot near the windows. Greedy management lets too many people in at once.

title: Great food and views!
comment: This restaurant is on the 39th floor of the Heron tower, entry is by a rather fast glass lift so you get some pretty impressive views before you even get there. We had a table booked for 19.45 and arrived early so had a cocktail before dinner in the spacious bar. Bar staff new their stuff and good quality Old Fashioned were delivered quickly.  The table booking was delayed by around 15 minutes as the place was busy but the staff provided us all (table of 7) with a free glass of champagne to compensate. Our waiting staff were very good and knew a lot about the food, they offered to choose for us once they had established from the table what people didn’t like so they could avoid bring any food that might disappoint. After some discussion we took them up on the offer  The food that was bought out was excellent, everything I ate was really nice. Drinks are a little on the pricy side but overall an excellent mean in a great restaurant and location.

title: 5 star visit!
comment: My boyfriend and I visited Sushi Samba for my birthday celebrations. From the very start of our visit the staff made us feel welcome and valued. The bar on the balcony outside is very impressive with lots of lights and a very impressive ambiance. The rugs provided allow you to spend as much time as you want enjoying the view. Once we sat down for our meal our waitress was extremely helpful guiding us through the menu. This was especially appreciated as my boyfriend has a few allergies so her advise was much appreciated. The food was spectacular and definitely worth the spectacular prices! All in all the ambiance, food and service made this a 5* evening!

title: Friends 40th birthday
comment: Amazing venue  Beautiful decor  Sushi food little expensive but perfect for special occasion  Very good service

title: Delicious
comment: Amazing food, sushi was superb and equally the meats delicious! service was a little slow at times. Cocktail were also incredible

title: Great views and even better drinks :)
comment: First went here for lunch and was impressed with the food and the really marvelous view. Then went back for drinks more recently and was once again impressed. The sushi is really great and it's an all round great location to just hang out with friends on a Saturday afternoon.

title: Tasty food, cocktails and splendid views.
comment: Excellent atmosphere, tasty and fresh food, stunning views of the city; slightly pricey because of the location.

title: Early Dinner -Amazing !
comment: What an amazing place, the food was exquisite! We sat outside and overlooked London. The views were breath taking and the service was first class. The restaurant and bar area has a really buzz and would be a great place to go for drinks as well as dinner. Fantastic place will definitely be returning.

title: A London Experience
comment: Here for a night out in London so we used only the bar not restaurant. This is a lovely experience going up a glass lift to the 40th floor. The bar is gorgeous with a large lit up tree on the roof and a gorgeous view around London. Drinks are over £12 each for like a single rum and coke etc so expensive but you don't mid due to the surroundings. They play nice chilled house music which gives it an overall cosmopolitan and upper class vibe. everyone was smart and was an enjoyable bar.

title: Sushi Samba
comment: Based at the top of Heron Tower across from Liverpool Street you get to Sushi Samba by a very fast glass lift which is an experience in itself! The quality of food is very good as is the service or enjoy a drink on the vast veranda with magnificent views across London. All in all quite and experience.

title: Amazing views at night!
comment: I was visiting London with my mum, during our first day we were told about Sushi Samba & it's amazing views! We visited for drinks that evening and weren't disappointed! The glass lift up was brilliant, inside was fabulously decorated and the staff were very friendly. We had wine and went to the outside terrace which is beautifully amazing, the bar & views are a must for anyone around this side of London!you won't be disappointed! I certainly will be coming again on my next visit!

title: Vibrant Place Great Food! "Sushi in the sky!"
comment: My husband & I took our teenager and his friend to Sushi Samba last night, we were celebrating exam results! The staff were very attentive proffesional & friendly. I adore sushi however my husband is not a great fish fan. However there was plenty for him to choose from. Although he did me proud and ate a piece of Sashimi! Very fresh food gorgeous cocktails on the terrace bar beforehand - busy as it was a very warm evening but we got served very quickly.  One of my favourites at the moment and I will be returning very soon. 1 negative though. The girl at the door on the ground floor has a slight attitude problem and should learn decorum.  Did not spoil our night at all.

title: Really Enjoyed the Food
comment: We had dinner here on a Friday evening a couple of weeks ago. It wasn't quite warm enough to eat in the outside restaurant area, but we managed to get a window table, so we had the view. Although its over the east side of London, so not as interesting, as the view from the outside restaurant. Service was very friendly and I really enjoyed the food, which was just a little bit different. Liked the décor and the trendy feel to the place. Service was fast, so the secret is to order one or two dishes at a time. I enjoyed sampling the different flavours. The outside bar was really busy, and sheltered, so a great place to come just for a drink. The price was kind of what we expected, but so expensive I went 'dutch' with my husband ! We'll certainly need to save up to visit again. Well worth a trip if you can afford it.

title: Delicious food with a view
comment: Went to Sushi Samba for lunch in July 2015. Friendly staff welcomed us and we were seated in the beautiful and bright dining area. The menu features many favourites, I highly recommend the pork belly - it's probably the best I ever had. A must try when in London.

title: Birthday treat
comment: The restaurant is on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower which means that the views are awesome. You are higher than the top of the gherkin. The bar area seemed mildly chaotic but service was good, cocktails good and the views stunning. The restaurant was excellent. Great views, good helpful service and delicious sushi. All in all highly recommended.

title: Nice Restaurant
comment: Amazing location, the food is delicious and so the drinks.Staff are very friendly. A bit expensive but worth it.

title: Delicious food and cocktails, with a great view!
comment: After visiting Sushi Samba for my boyfriend's birthday, I cannot speak highly enough of this place. The food was absolutely declicious and had great cocktails. We were unsure whether we ordered enough/too little but the waiter assured us that we ordered enough and he was right. The food was fresh, well presented and very tasty. I will definitely be returning, it's just a shame there is such a long waiting time.

title: Fresh
comment: Visited for early dinner on Saturday night and we had a beautiful window table with amazing views.  The staff are attentive and the recommendations we got were very good, although dangerous as we ordered a lot of food! But nothing was left to waste!  The deep fried squid is so fresh and crunchy it's out of this world!  I'd recommend ordering as you go along as you may end up ordering too much!  We didn't order dessert as we were too full but the table next to us ordered and it looked good.  Highly recommend

title: Great place, great food, great desserts and great view!
comment: My colleague and I decided to take a trip to Sushi Samba, we had to wait a while as it was fully reserved for a couple of months, the wait was so worth it. The place is delightful, beautiful views, very friendly staff and the food to die for!! I would recommend black cod it's the best i had in London. I could probably keep going but this would probably a very long review. Go you will not be disappointed!

title: Fantastic food, views and service
comment: Usually I don't listen to waiters pushing different foods as I'm a cynic and believe they're just trying to push up the bill to get a bigger tip. Not here, each one of the suggested dishes was better then anything we chose outside of the suggestions (and with 6 hungry people we tried a lot!) u must try to shrimp tempura and save room for the banana chocolate something dessert.

title: Beautiful
comment: I always base a restaurants review on its customer service first and then it's food after. The service is faultless. Attentive staff and well presented.  We were given a table by the window and the view was great despite it being a dull and rainy day. I'd visited the bar previously but never the restaurant. As I'm not a sushi person I ordered the sea bass tempura - nice portion size.  However for two girls that don't really eat a lot and don't consume alcohol it was extremely expensive. We ordered 1 very small starter, a small sushi platter, 1 main course, 1 mocktail and a bottle of water and it came up to circa £80

title: Experience ruined by foul doorman
comment: I went to Sushi Samba on a Saturday evening to celebrate my Aunty arriving from South Africa having not seen her for years. I picked Sushi Samba having had previous great experience. It was a hot summer day so I wore flip flops with smart leggings and smart top. My sister also wore a form of flip flop too. Upon arrival we were told abruptly to 'wait' by the doorman and weren't let in for a couple of minutes (not sure why). We then came to the door and told him our booking and time (we were about twenty minutes late due to train delays but my Aunty had already arrived about ten minutes early for our booking and was sitting at the table waiting). He checked his iPad which had all the tables on it and tried to tell us that there wasn't a booking in our name. We explained that my Aunty was waiting upstairs already and we definitely did have a booking... he then looked us up and down and told us that I couldn't come in anyway because I was wearing flip flops. He wasn't aplogetic or pleasent about telling me at all though, you could tell that he got complete and utter satisfaction out of not letting me in over my shoes and was just all round unpleasant and arrogant with no reason to be. As a result, we politely argued it and explained that we had had the booking for two months and it was a really important one. He rudely shot us down and said that it was the dress code (fair enough). He then went on to say it was actually health and safety reasons as if i slipped and tripped and cracked my head open I could then sue them. I personally think it is a bit of a ridiculous rule as anybody could sip over and crack their head open anywhere and sue for it. What bothered us most is that he just absolutely loved telling us. We waited to the side to discuss what we were going to do about it and then watched him also rudely tell some other people they weren't allowed in due to their footwear. My sister was also wearing sandals, just some casual ones but as hers had a bar across the top of her foot, she was allowed in. Bizarre really as she was just as likely to 'slip over' in hers as i was in mine. We pleaded again but he was adament to not let us in. Not once did he say sorry. No shops were open as it was a Saturday night so there was nowhere for us to possibly buy some appropriate shoes and he knew that. However, luckily my sisters office was two minutes down the road and she had some spare heels under her desk which we got and came back. Oh boy was he not happy to see us again! I think he thought he had won and we had gone home. Anyway, he finally let us in about twenty five minutes later down the line and we finally sat down. But the whole experience was tainted by the unpleasant doorman. All of the other staff are lovely and helpful but still. Funnily enough, when we sat down, my Aunty had also thought he was unpleasant.  I understand that Sushi Samba has a dress code & health and safety rules but there is a way in which you tell somebody this. Especially at a place like this, you would expect the best service. The doorman was just a doorman, not the owner of Sushi Samba... so no reason to be so arrogant!  However, putting all this beside, the food was delicious as always, i can't fault it. But when you come across such unpleasant staff, it really taints the experience. The doorman needs taking down a peg or two. He does Sushi Samba no justice at all!

title: Absolutely amazing
comment: this place is excellent. Have been back a few times with my wife and with a group of friends. Food is epic, service is amazing and all staff very knowledgeable  Would visit again tomorrow!!!!!!  Only downside is i wish the dress code was more strict as we always make 100% effort (trousers, jacket, collar) and to sit next to someone in sports shorts and a polo shirt is a bit disappointing

title: Friends birthday dinner
comment: After booking 6 weeks in advance after always wanting to go to Sushi Samba, we finally made it here 38 floors up (with amazing views) in the beautiful Heron Tower. We arrived at 8pm and had some drinks in the Duck and Waffle bar by the window before our reservation at Sushi Samba. At 9pm (our reservation time), we went back to Sushi Samba and were surprised to find we had to wait half an hour to be seated, despite booking 6 weeks in advance. Unhappy and hungry, it was very annoying to see others go into the restaurant before us (perhaps they thought we were young and weren't going to spend a lot of money - when actually I was attending the restaurant to see if it was suitable for clients). The manager bought us a glass of champagne and thanked us for waiting. Once at dinner, it was well worth the wait, our waiter (Inassio) was amazing, explaining the menu in detail and recommending dishes when we got stuck. He made us smile, and made the overall experience more enjoyable. The sushi is some of the best that I've tasted, and at the end they bought out a little birthday surprise for my friend after noticing some cards on our table. This was such a nice touch, I will be visiting Sushi Samba again and it is now one of my favourite places in London.

title: Great food, slightly over-priced but horredous service
comment: This restaurant has huge potential, the food was very good however you would expect it to be with the price they charge, the view speaks for itself, but the service... you get better service in Pizza Express, it is full or lazy and arrogant waiters who know they are getting their 12.5% on top of your bill regardless of the way they behave, they ruin the experience. The cloakroom is totally unattended, so much so that after waiting for five minutes to retrieve my boyfriends suit jacket and umbrella and having asked a waiter to help, we just helped ourselves... it was open to everyone!! They need to stop depending on the view and start upping their game with service. We as a couple eat out a lot, in nice restaurants throughout London and this is by far the worst service, nothing compared to Nobu, Sumosan, Hakkasen...

title: Deliciously expensive
comment: Visited here on a Sunday afternoon as this was the only time we could get a booking during our trip to London.  The food was delicious! The Kobe sliders were sensational, definitely would recommend even if they are £6 each.  The potion sizes were quite small and my partner left still hungry even after spending £120 on dinner and 1 cocktail.  Our server Tom was great and attentive at the right times! However for some reason the management would berate him within earshot of us. This happened consistently through tour meal which we found extremely unprofessional and uncomfortable.

title: Not so happy birthday
comment: We did a group booking of 10 people and were given a set menu by the booking team. At the start our seating arrangement was like for 8 people but 10 of had to squeeze in which was very uncomfortable , the after speaking to the manger we managed to squeeze another chair. When we made the intial booking we requested that we order when we get there as the quantity of the food can be decided depending on the dish portion , however the booking person said they can't allow us to order on the day but they assured us that there will be plenty of food for group . WHICH WASNT THE CASE!! We ended up ordering on top of the set menu ! The set menu was more like for 8 people . So if you are booking for large group I would suggest that to confirm the portion and try if you can order on day.  Had high expectation but turned out very poor experience . Management need to re think their group menus!

title: Wow, wow, wow
comment: What can you say about this place. Firstly the views, breath taking. Luckily the night I visited was clear and my friend I enjoyed a beautiful sunset over London.  Amazing atmosphere, there was a live band playing old and new songs. The singer had such a beautiful voice. Lovely to listen to whilst eating. The food - I didn't realise it's a mix of Japanese/Brazilian (I think, it's at least South American anyway). Guess the clue is in the name. My friend and I had a host of dishes so I can't remember them all. We definitely had the Sushisamba sushi mix and mini Kobe burgers; both absolutely delicious. Had something with chicken hearts which was interesting and quite enjoyable if you forget what it is. The cocktails were beautiful and we finished the night with a selection of Japanese rice puddings - yum. We ate every last morsel.  Lovely staff. Super nice.  Oh, the lift is not for the faint hearted! Enjoyable but scary. Perfect place for a special occasion as it's not the cheapest. I look forward to my next visit. Hope it's soon.

title: More style than substance
comment: Great venue which makes it a great experience. Food good but not world class but surroundings amazing especially if the outside terrace is open. Very expensive so watch what you order soon mounts up!

title: Cocktails, Delicious Expensive Food, Stunning Views, Fun Atmosphere
comment: Went on a Thursday evening after work around 1800; didn't reserve a table but got offered two seats at the bar to dine. Cocktails were lovely. Food was very good and delicious. We knew it was an expensive place so knew what to expect price-wise.  Weather was a bit cloudy and strong winds so outside bar would have been cold - though seen staff handing blankets out. Inside bar was quite lively and it did get busy. The seats by the bar were only available for an hour or so; hence we had to clear up, but that was okay considering we didn't really book a place. The view of the gherkin is probably best from the ladies toilets :-).  All in all we had a great time; food definitely tasty and cocktails were excellent. Good spot for people watching for sure.

title: Delicious food perfect location
comment: I went there with a friend, the food is delicious and the location can't be better but it was a cloudy day so I couldn't actually enjoy the views. Portions are very small, and you ended up paying a lot. I would recommend to go on a sunny day.

title: Amazing views and food
comment: Go here quite regularly for lunch. What an amazing location if you can take the lift ride. Not recommended for those with vertigo. Outside bar is also very cool. In terms of food just ask the waiter to recommend a selection, it never disappoints.

title: The Best Sushi in London
comment: Getting a reservation is a must at Sushisamba and you will be so glad you did. And don't be late or you will not be seated. We came after a day of sightseeing in London and this was by far the best of the day. We were seated immediately at our scheduled reservation time. Wishing for a table near a window is tough with 4 people but you can try. The wait staff was excellent and took time to go over the menu and drinks with us. Our waiter was excellent in his recommendations for cocktails! Just amazing combinations of fresh juices and liquor. We allowed our waiter to recommend food and that proved to be excellent too. They have "favorites" and we were not disappointed. Be sure to order dessert- it was a great treat at the end of a long day. We will enjoy SushiSamba again when in London.

title: The best sushi in town
comment: Sushisamba is probably the best sushi I have tasted in London. The menu is large enough that everyone can be accommodated to, and the waiting staff are very friendly and helpful. Although pricey, the food is definitely worth it. As it is up in a tower, the views are spectacular, so try and get a table at the window. There is also outdoor seating to have drinks, with an incredible view across London. A must see!

title: Amazing view, authentic sushi and great staff
comment: I went here with my mother, father and sister upon her recommendation to try it, honestly one of the best places iv ever at sushi and the best iv had and iv actually tried authentic japense sushi at its best in many resturants to top it off there was great views cold drinks and friendly staff on hand to help at our beck and call

title: Fantastic
comment: Staff were attentive and accommodating,food wonderful and views of London were amazing. Worth a visit.

title: High quality food and service and a bit different
comment: Service in particular was excellent. Very attentive, friendly and smiley and plenty of staff running around keeping busy.Only aspect of service I didn't like was the team at the front door are a bit like "are you deserving of being here" in their attitude. Food was very good, varied & fresh, The 3 different cuisines thing works well. Different enough without being too so. Going as a small group (we were 4) prob best recommended as it is a bit tapas style, so sharing a variety of menu items, but not amongst too many, works. Not easy to book coz it is still very popular. To get a table for 4 we had to go 2 months out. A bit Chichi, all round but a nice experience and happy we went. There is plenty on the menu that is in a sensible price range but, given you need to order several items each and the wine list is good but high end, don't expect anything other than a large bill. We didn't venture to the 1kg Kobe beef for £1000.

title: Amazing service!
comment: We came for my boyfriends birthday and I was a bit skeptical about the service due to the reviews however we were treated with the upmost respect and felt like royalty! Our waiter, Jacob (pronounced in English) was great fun, he really took the time and effort to go through the menu with us individually and was so helpful especially seeing as I don't eat fish so after a few laughs of coming to a sushi restaurant and not eating fish he was extremely helpful. He then even went through the whole menu for my partner too. When I booked the table I added on the bottom that it was my boyfriends birthday but didn't really have an expectation as I understand what a busy restaurant it is. However to my surprise they have is a window seat without request and a small dessert with happy birthday on it and a candle free of charge! I recommend getting a later reservation as the atmosphere isn't so loud and busy and I feel the staff there have a lot more time for you. Thanks so much Jacob you made it a lovely experience! Oh and try the Lychee Cooler cocktail! Yummy!

title: Very promising hight
comment: A place you have to go once. The online reservation told us the first available spot was in september. When we arrived there was enough place. The food was excellent, but too crowdy, noisy not at the level of it's reputation. The wine card is poor. The view was super. Afterwards in the bar: nice view, bad wine for such a place and too expensive.  Like i said : you go there once

title: Lovely evening...
comment: Had to wait two months to get a Saturday evening reservation so was expecting something special and was pleasantly surprised. The cocktails are gorgeous. We we a group of 4 friends who were unsure what to opt for, our waiter was very helpful asked us what we did and didn't like and selected us a number of dishes to be sent out so we all could taste a variety of options.everything was delicious, fantastic views and good decor.

title: Good but way over priced- and I am use to paying a lot
comment: Sushi is great, view is amazing, and the service is good. But that is probably not worth the hundreds of pounds you will be spending for raw fish. A good place to go if someone else is paying

title: About booking
comment: Staff not helpful at all when trying to book a table by phone if anyone even bothers to answer.If you want to do so online forget it. I think this is definitely a marketing ploy as I've tried all dates to end of November. If you want a place where you get a great experience which starts with their booking regime then this isn't it.

title: Amazing!
comment: Amazing views, amazing food, amazing cocktails! What more could you want?! The service was fantastic and the menu was well explained. The waiter offered recommendations and suggestions for an amount of food to order. The chucumber cocktail is a must as is the pork belly and tuna nigiri. I will definitely be visiting again.

title: Unmissable View
comment: Food was really good! I would recommend sitting by the window as the view is truly mesmerizing. My sister took me for my birthday, and they brought me over a dessert with a candle..very nice touch! I would recommend booking in advance as it is extremely difficult to book, but going there you will understand why!

title: Amazing view, good food, mediocre wine
comment: I went to Sushi Samba with a groups of friends for a birthday. The restaurant and view are amazing and have real wow factor. We ordered many dishes from across the menu and were happy with the quality and presentation of the food. The only downside was the wine. We ordered two bottles from the white wine selection. Both bottles were mid range £40-£50. They were not chilled enough and after one sip we were all regretting not having stuck to soft drinks!

title: Great service and food
comment: The most amazing quality sushi. I Will definitely be going back to try other dishes. Our waiter was so helpful, she went above and beyond to explain numerous dishes to us and took many pictures for us (it was a special occasion).

title: Amazing views, stunning food and moreish cocktails!
comment: We are here last a couple of weeks ago for my fiancee's birthday meal. First impressions are fantastic & the lift is an experience (think Charlie & The Chocolate Factory!) - beautiful decor and absolutely stunning environment to sit in. Our waiter was great and friendly, he explained how the menu worked in a way that said he knew we hadn't been before but we weren't patronised. Food was beautiful and in our opinion more than worth the money. Everything came out hot too. We found the food really filled us up but had to save space for desert - the passion fruit cake is yummy! The only things that let us down ever so slightly were having to signal the staff for a while to get another drink and desert not going to plan. I had requested that a Happy Birthday message was put on my partners desert but it wasn't. I pointed this out to the manager who quickly rectified this with a commentary macaron plate which had the message. The gesture was quick and much appreciated, it hits would have been nice not to have to ask for this in front of my girlfriend as it was meant to be a surprise! All in all though, a fantastic night and we will return at some point. It is not as expensive as many reviews suggest too.

title: You pay for the view, table permitting
comment: The food is nice, original and well presented. Some dishes are interesting and some other hit and miss (slimy yellow curry with Martian curry - greenish). The tableware is beautiful and the presentation is nice. Service is friendly. However, the same food can be food in many other places at a much more reasonable cost. The Yuzu, neck of it, is staff meal in many other places, here it is served as main course. The view is probably nice if your table allows to actually see it. Staff can be a bit weird. Mixed couple my Asian partners was checked top to bottom as if he had just stolen the (second hand) Louis Vuiton bag he was carrying or was out of place. On the other hand our waiter was very good and knowledgeable,  Good to impress a business but not really for any other purpose. Same if not better elsewhere as it is overpriced. And of course, you need to book 3 months in advance to get a table at a decent time in the evening.

title: Amazing restaurant
comment: What a beautiful restaurant, it really is a different experience than going to the bar. The restaurant it's self is beautiful the waiter we had was very friendly and attentive. He explained all the menu to us. The food was lovely. I also had an amazing strawberry mojito. We sat outside on the terrace and enjoyed drinks as we watched London light up. Really lovely experience all round.

title: Luxury italian shoes aren't enough to be allowed at the bar AGAIN
comment: Same story again!! I was not allowed to enter Sushi Samba because my Italian black loafers which cost more than the doorman's suit were not considered appropriate for the bar. It is really sad that a trendy bar has yet to teach their employees what casual smart means!

title: Horrible Staff, Horrible Experience
comment: Wow, this place really is horrific! From idiotic doormen kicking around rubbish outside, to a vile and nasty staff member actively heckling customers in the lifts - a truly terrible experience!! I had made a reservation for Sushi Samba a few months ago and was rather looking forward to the evening. However, despite my reservation, we were placed in the darkest, deepest corner of the restaurant with blinds pulled down blocking any natural light....I thought I was meant to be 39 floors in the sky, not 39 floors in the ground!!! When I requested to move I was told that the other tables - which were empty - had been reserved.....strange given the fact I had made a reservation for a window table?!  Indeed the staff member proceeded to put his arm around me and offer an even worse alternative! Please, get your hands off me, I am not your friend and don't want you to touch me!  Enough was enough, we had to walk out 5 minutes into our visit.  I honestly can't believe how atrocious this place is! Not only were the staff in all sections of the venue odious and ignorant but the venue resembles a teenage pool party in Ibiza!! In future train your staff appropriately and add a bit of class to the venue! Terrible!!! PS: One star is far too generous, wish I could give this mockery of a restaurant zero stars. A response and apology from senior management would be the least that you could do...

title: Business Lunch
comment: thoroughly enjoyable afternoon sampling the delights of Sushisamba. staff should however be mindful that not everyone enjoys sushi and that those that are strictly carnivores who enjoy their food cooked are not to be patronised or ridiculed - especially at the eye watering prices charged by this restaurant. service generally pretty good but some confusion with the various waiting staff as to who was serving what to who and when.

title: Terrible! The lift up was better service...
comment: Me and my girlfriend always wanted to eat here and thought we would go during the day as it always seems busy, within 5 minutes we walked out! It was a rainy day so we arrived abit wet and the staff looked at us with disgust! They seated us at the bar area and I don't mind paying money for a good meal but this place is so overpriced! We waited ages for someone to serve us so we walked out. Don't bother... Yo sushi is a lot better!

title: Loved it
comment: Went here for my birthday and loved it. Neither my boyfriend or I are massive sushi fans but the food was amazing. The waitress talked us through the menu, making recommendations, taking into account we didn't like raw fish. We moved from our table and had numerous cocktails overlooking london. Such a good atmosphere and not too pretentious (a worry of mine before visiting). It isn't cheap but if you are willing to pay it is a good place!

title: left with mixed feelings
comment: You go for the views which is expected but what isn't is the mixed service received. When entering you are politely greeted and shown to the lift then shoot up to the 40th floor. We decided to have drinks at the tree bar with three bar staff and me waiting a long time to even be acknowledged never mind served as staff walked around the bar looking at me and looking away. I started to lose my patience when i did eventually get served only prompted by me saying I'm i going to get served? the lady came over with a face suggesting she was ready to jump off the roof. Not once did i see her teeth (smile goes a long way) and the only thing she said to me was £22.95...terrible service! Through out the evening we decided to eat and spoke to what seemed to be the floor manager who's service was excellent. he even helped a couple find seating outside which was very busy. He told us we would be called when there was seating available inside to eat which indeed happened. We enjoyed our meal finishing off the evening with drinks and a spectacular view overlooking the St Mary Axe building. Overall, mixed service, obviously overpriced but that's to be expected, good food with great views.

title: Suishi Samba serves up a treat
comment: went here on recommendation for a business lunch, the trip in the elevator to the 38th floor is not going to appeal to those with a weak stomach or no head for heights. The bar area itself is ok but entering the restaurant area certainly has the wow factor, we were lucky enough to be able to eat outside with an amazing view of the London skyline. The restaurant is a strange fusion of Japanese and Brazilian food and takes a little bit of help from the waiters to decphier how much is an appropriate amount of food to order. wanting to try as diverse a range as possible we had yellowtail taquiris (surprised to see them come out as a taco shell rather than the rolled tube), coconut rice (just the right side of sweet and sticky), shrimp tempura (rather overpowered by the sweet sauce so hard to judge the quality of the tempura), butterfish sashimi (nope) as well as the London samba roll (a mix of 8 small suishi rolls which were sweet and spicy with a refreshing crunch to them). Overall, the food was well presented and tasty although some dishes were better than others. Being around £60 per head including drinks it is not a cheap experience, and one I suspect you save for a special occasion rather than as a regular haunt, but will come again in due course.

title: Tremendous sushi-shocking service
comment: Had been desperate to go to sushi samba for months, and decided to go as a treat 2 weekends ago. We had practically no time to decide what we wanted before the waiter was over at us taking our order, and quickly picked a few dishes each. The food was absolutely delicious, best sushi I have ever had. The squid was melt in the mouth. The service however was unbelievably bad. After being rushed at the beginning , we had to ask for more drinks, and we waited for over 30 minutes for them. We were given an apology and told they were 'on the house' (they weren't, full price on bill) to have to wait a further 10 minutes, to be told the wine wasn't cold enough and my friend had to pick something else! Really expected a better service than we got, it wasn't cheap food! Service charge was a complete kick in the teeth after that as it was all that let them down

title: Great food with wonderful views
comment: Had lunch here a week ago . It was super food in a wonderful location . The menue is large and a bit confusing but that was soon solved by the waiter who suggested he serve us a selection the most popular dishes ! We had a good cross section and every dish was delicious , including a selection of puddings ! The staff were extremely helpful . We had excellent cocktails prior to our meal .

title: Generally good food and space, okay view. Would recommend!
comment: Favorite dish has always been the Samba Salad, what a great presentation! The wagu beef dishes they were trying to sell were too overpriced for small quantity...too small to taste the quality...the wagu ceviche was practically the same ingredients as our tuna ceviche dish...there was barely noticeable beef, and the raw tuna chunks didn't feel elegant to eat. The sushi has generally been a good choice, the one we had w cooked fish and crispy onions on the outside was tasty. The dessert is less than stellar, but okay. The drinks list is good, tasty moon-rabbit wine or sweet plum wine. Overall a good experience in a nice space (tho not much view), would go back again! Also good options for vegetarians/vegans

title: Bad experience
comment: We arrived late but we called in advance to see if it was ok. When we arrived they had given away our table. This is understandable as lateness can have a knock on effect on other bookings, but they should have contacted us. Instead they said they offered a table that would be available in 10-30mins. Fine.... So we went to the bar for cocktails. The bar wasn't busy but the two bar men failed to serve us. When we asked one of them , he was dismissive and insisted that he was serving in the correct order.  They said they would come and find us but after about 25min we went to enquire about our table. Fortunately the hostess seated us after we had to enquire. The cocktail that I ordered at the table (samba sour) left me wishing I had ordered something else. It was smooth and sweet, but the flavour was indistinct, and the eggy foam had strange smell. My friends seemed happy with there's.  The food we received was well presented and the flavours were...nice. We waited for our last sushi roll ("El topo") to come out of the kitchen, and after we enquired with waiter, he insisted that it had already come to the table and we had eaten it. He didn't check with the kitchen. So we ordered a couple more dishes, but soon after "El topo" arrived at the table, with our additional orders. We would have not ordered these additional items if we new it was going to eventually come. It was however quite delicious.  We asked for the desert menu on several occasions but instead of getting it, about 20-30mins later they asked us to leave as another guest was waiting for our table. We hadn't been there for long and if we knew we has been given a short time limit we would have gone somewhere else. In summary, there is a discrepancy between the service and standard of food, and the pricing. Perhaps our lateness had a knock on effect, but the way they dealt with this left a bitter taste in my mouth. The view is good though.

title: Great food, great view, service can be improved
comment: Me and my friend went to the restaurant on Friday evening. Food was nicer than what I was expected, really enjoyed them. Two of us ordered wagyu goyza, 2 samba rolls, black cod, raw yellow tail, 2 desserts and 2 cocktails. It was more than enough for 2 girls and none of them disappoint us. The only thing really annoying us is the waiter took away the finished plate without asking us, we tried to stop him said we haven't finished. But afterwards he done it again with another plate! Also done it AGAIN, took away my finished dessert plate while my friend still eating. I understand they are busy and under pressure, but I would expect for the price I pay for the food and 'the service'. I think it's really rude while there's still people in the same table eating and the waiter start cleaning the table. Feels like they are rushing you to eat. Especially not even asking! I also been to duck and waffle before and the service was perfect. Overall, I still really like the food and the view was amazing. But really, the service need to be improved to match up.

title: Amazing!
comment: The food was delicious. I tried the one in NYC that is really good but this one is also better! And the other point is the View and the location!! Absolutely gorgeous!

title: 2nd visit with a friend
comment: Tuesday afternoon so both floors were not open. It did not spoil or experience. We managed to get seats by the window. Fantastic views. Enjoyed a cocktail each. Did not mind the price as views were worth it. Shall definitely be back again for a treat. I think in the evening with everything lit up it will be even more stunning. Definitely check out this place people. You won't regret it.

title: Horrible Staff, Horrible Experience
comment: Wow, this place really is horrific! From idiotic doormen kicking around rubbish outside, to a vile and nasty staff member actively heckling customers in the lifts - a truly terrible experience!! I had made a reservation for Sushi Samba a few months ago and was rather looking forward to the evening. However, despite my reservation, we were placed in the darkest, deepest corner of the restaurant with blinds pulled down blocking any natural light....I thought I was meant to be 39 floors in the sky, not 39 floors in the ground!!! When I requested to move I was told that the other tables - which were empty - had been reserved.....strange given the fact I had made a reservation for a window table?!  Indeed the staff member proceeded to put his arm around me and offer an even worse alternative! Please, get your hands off me, I am not your friend and don't want you to touch me!  Enough was enough, we had to walk out 5 minutes into our visit.  I honestly can't believe how atrocious this place is! Not only were the staff in all sections of the venue odious and ignorant but the venue resembles a teenage pool party in Ibiza!! In future train your staff appropriately and add a bit of class to the venue! Terrible!!! PS: One star is far too generous, wish I could give this mockery of a restaurant zero stars. A response and apology from senior management would be the least that you could do...

title: Wonderful views of the City
comment: We had cocktails here whilst admiring views of The Tower of London, St Paul's cathedral etc. the cost of the cocktails at £13 each were not expensive considering the fantastic views. Very knowledgeable waitress who advised on which cocktail to have. Excellent service.

title: Amazing! If you love sushi go here. Plush but expensive to be expected in London.
comment: Amazing! If you love sushi go here. Lovely terrace for drinks before and the sushi is amazing. defo going back

title: Stunning Views & delicious cocktails & tantalising sushi 😊
comment: Sunset views across London, romantic & exquisite.  Food & cocktails spectacular, all served fresh & well presented. From the snaps below speaks for itself. The waiter was attentive & friendly but not disturbing the ambience at the table. We were not rushed & enjoyed the entire experience  Highly recomended!

title: Great view and sushi
comment: This place is pricey and slightly posey but sometimes this can be fun. Everyone seems to be loaded drinking expensive drinks and there is a wait for tables it is best to book. It is on a high level of a building..the roof top so there is a great view. The sushi was good. Me and my partner blew £200 here....I would go back but I would get a table rather than sit at bar as we did not book.

title: Wow Great Place to dine
comment: If you want an amazing dining experience this is the place to go, unfortunately the weather was grim which interrupted the view. The food and service was exceptional, will definitely eat here again.

title: sunset romancing - stunning
comment: Sipping Exquisite cocktails while watching sunset across London Skyline absolutely spectacular.  Sushi served up timely fresh / delicious & filling the fish outstanding.  Cocktails - let's say you can't just have the one the pictures speak for themselves .... :) Perfect date venue the staff welcoming & friendly.  Busy need to make a advance booking highly recommended for dates! Enjoy!!!

title: Fantastic birthday treat - really was a treat!
comment: Was taken here last year and the food, service and views etc were outstanding! If you are thinking of going, don't just think....book it. Fantabulous venue!

title: Lovely food and views at a high price
comment: £225 we paid for two people.  We did order a glass of wine each but no desert.  The views are great. Food is really good but I have had nicer sushi at half the price. Waiting staff can be hit and miss depending on who you get. A waitress spilt a drink on me and hardly apologised. Sticks n sushi is just as good in terms of food at half the price.

title: Great experience.
comment: Great views & amazing food. Not cheap, but worth it for that special occasion.Service very friendly & efficient.

title: Great fusion of Brazilian and Japanese food with a view.
comment: We took my daughter and her sisters for a birthday meal. Had to eat inside as it was raining which was a shame. Excellent cocktails and food. The blackened Cod and a Brazilian fish stew were particularly memorable.

title: Great fusion Japanese food + awesome view
comment: Do ensure you make an early reservation else you'll end up having to settle for a crappy time slot. The view of London from the 38th floor is spectacular and we were blessed that it was a very sunny day. Service is impeccable, food is pricey but the taste makes up for it! Might be a good place for celebrations!

title: Did not live up to expectations at all
comment: This place is all about being 'seen' which isn't my thing at all. When we arrived the bar area was rammed full of people posing and preening and although we had booked a table for 7.30 we had to wait 45 minutes in the bar before we were seated. The drinks in the bar are extortionate but I suppose you are paying for the view...which is pretty nice. Once we finally got to our table I will say that the food we ordered was pretty good but again not worth the price tag. Our server was very attentive so no problems there either. Overall this place is trading on it's 'cool' factor but with nothing to really back it up other than the view....the rest of it is average at best except the bill.....ouch!

title: Birthday dinner
comment: My other half booked this for my birthday. On arrival we were not greeted by anyone, or told where to go, we eventually found a host, who was to busy arguing with another customer about a booking to be interested in us. When eventually someone asked us if we were okay, we explained we were half hour early for our booking, but were going to have a drink at the bar, we were abruptly told to come back at our reservation time.  We went onto the terrace and asked the man behind the bar for a cocktail menu, he disappeared for a while and came back with a menu, when we tried to order drinks, we were told the outside bar was closed? Why not tell us this straight away? Went to the inside bar only for anyone with a tab to be served before us.  Eventually ordered our drinks and had some time to admire the amazing view before our dinner reservation. The staff inside the restaurant were the opposite to the bar staff/hosts they could not of been more helpful and our waiter made some great suggestions for food for us to try, the food was amazing and the atmosphere in the restaurant was a lot more enjoyable than that of the bar.  The food and drinks are pricey but that is a given for an establishment like this.  Would return for food, but would not go for drinks or bar snacks after the service received.

title: Wonderful evening
comment: We arrived slightly early so went to the bar and had a drink outside by the beautiful tree and took in the breathtaking views whilst we waited for our table. 5 minutes before our table should have been ready, one of the ladies came outside to get us and take us to our table. We had the most attentive and thoughtful waiter, I wish I could remember his name but we made sure to tell the manager who had introduced himself to us earlier on that evening how great our waiter was and how memorable he had made our evening. The food is truly delightful and we enjoyed the Japanese ice-cream (this is a must if visiting!!)  I would definitely visit again.

title: Amazing view, romantic but still cool! And amazing food of course.
comment: I've been there with my boyfriend a couple of times, it's such a nice place with a great vibe and cool atmosphere. There's a beautiful terrace also, quite lovely when the weather is nice. Service is really good. Perfect also for a casual "aperitivo" after work.

title: Don't look down
comment: Attended SS bar as part of date night in the late evening.  If you are afraid of heights, like myself, you may want to consider finder another point of interest with great views. The first challenge was the elevator ride, which is completely see-through and moves VERY FAST! If you are good with heights, you'll love the views with the ride up to the 38th floor.  The decor is very modern, creative and colourful. Upon attendance it was extremely busy and we were unable to access the outside area at all. However, there were still amazing views through the floor to ceiling glass windows that surrounded the bar. After waiting a while at the bar, we were finally served and decided to get a cocktail each. It was only affordable to buy one drink, as they were very over priced! Although the barman took time in creating the cocktails, i can't justify spending this much on each one.  There was plenty of overall floor space but very limited seating. There were only a few places to rest your drink down, aside from the bar. This left us standing and shouting at each other, in order to hear our own voices. SS was a nice one-off luxury to soak up the night atmosphere and admire the London landscape at night. I wouldn't recommend the bar for many other occasions, other than to experience it once.

title: Nice atmosphere
comment: Lovely cocktails and lovely food, we sat at the bar and it was quite busy in this area but nice for people watching and music. The outside bar wasn't open until later I thought that was a bit odd as it does get quite busy on a Saturday. Good service.

title: The view is the only highlight.
comment: I recently went to Sushi Samba for a romantic dinner for two. I was quite excited as I heard so many wonderful reviews about this place. Upon entering the restaurant from the lift, it was very unclear as to where we should go to check in. Once we arrived at the front of house, we were not greeted. Once finally acknowledged (5 mins later) with no smile or a politeness we were told our table was taken as we were a few minutes late so we would have to wait at the bar. Drink in hand we were eventually seated 15 mins later. No one offered to take our jackets which I thought was pretty poor service. Our waitress was sincere and accommodating however, the food was below par. I ordered the scallop ceviche which was ok, but the sauce it was in was far too acidic. We also ordered salt and pepper calamari which was under seasoned and tasteless to say the least. Overall, the staff were pretty snooty except our waitress and the food wasn't what I was expecting considering the price tag. If you fancy some peruvian inspired japanese food head on over to Chotto Matte in Soho. Far better service and food. Shame.

title: Views are amazing!
comment: However, drinks are over priced and service is very very slow. I noticed a few smashed glasses on the floors next to the windows, and a lot of empty glasses around which made the place look untidy. They were possibly understaffed. Unsure to whether i would re-visit..

title: Great Food, Poor Service
comment: This was my 3rd time to Sushi Samba and as always the food was impeccable, truly some of he finest food in London with breathtaking views. The service however was terrible, I believe it was about 15mins before we were asked if we wanted any drinks and when we did order drinks they came about 10mins later, the service for the night on the whole was extremely poor however as I said the quality of food makes it worth it

title: OK as a destination venue
comment: Swanky setting, nice touches with the blankets for the outside bar. As a small group we ate and then drank cocktails outside. I liked the venue - fairly spacious in the restaurant although the bar area was too busy - people pushing past you from the stairs / going to restroom / bar, just like being in a corridor. Restaurant itself i thought was nice. Staff OK, menus a bit confusing, portions v small and stupidly priced really (£12-£15 for a say 5 small chopstick pinches), although not as badly priced as the wine where you struggle to find anything less than £50 a bottle. However some of the food was great, recommend black cod, the lamb, coconut rice, fillet steak, tempura prawns.Net net i thought the place was good but slightly over-trading, at circa £80 a head (excluding post meal cocktails!) for a cocktail, some small plates and wine it's probably 20% more pricey than it should be all things considered. Not really a romantic place (most views from bar and restaurant of the less attractive parts of town) - good for small groups of 4 or 6 I'd say. Nonetheless go if you can secure a table and aren't fussed about burning up to £100 a cover for a full night out.

title: Great London views, but you pay for it
comment: All in all, a good place for drinks. Incredible views from the roof. Unusual to get those views in London. Drinks were well made. Good time overall.

title: Enjoyable experience
comment: Great view of the Gerkin Extremely helpful and friendly waiting staff (kudos to our waiter for the evening - Jacob) and decor was typical modern Japanese look Cocktails for interesting - I ended up having three this evening Food wise....OK Nothing to write home about, if you are a Japanese connoisseur - if not, you'll probably enjoy it a lot I mentioned in another review of a modern Japanese restaurant that sashimi should be served cold and not room temperature  However, the Cod that was recommended by our waiter turned out to be our favorite dish that evening - go for it if you decided to eat here It's not cheap, but then again, I didn't spend as much as I actually anticipated

title: fantastic food with a view
comment: i've visited the new york outpost of this establishment and really enjoyed it so i was excited to visit it's london branch. the food and views are fantastic. the service could use some improvement however.

title: Amazing (if expensive) experience
comment: My partner and I wanted to have a special dinner and managed to get a last minute reservation at Sushisamba. What an experience: from the incredible views to the service to the stunning food, this was a night to remember. Once we'd ascended to the restaurant in the speedy glass lift, we were quickly and efficiently shown to our table. Despite there being a large group of what appeared to be business people at the next table, our waiter didn't once neglect us whilst also serving them. The manager also popped by to help us choose from the menu. The food - a unique fusion of Asian and South American - was simply stunning. We chose several small tapas and nothing disappointed. Each was served as it became ready and was served in a variety of beautiful dishes. The fillet steak and tempura prawns were highlights, as were the tuna taquitos. After dinner we had a drink in the outside bar with its wonderful orange tree (only slightly ruined by all the smokers). We then had one last drink inside, sitting on stools against the window and looking down on the Gherkin and other famous London landmarks. It's not cheap. A bottle of beer for example will set you back £7, but you could pay a lot more to just have the view. An unforgettable evening.

title: Excellent experience all round.
comment: The service was as we expected. Very subtle but attentive. We had the Edamame with Volcanic Salt, Tempura Green Beans, Lobster Taquitos, El Topo Rolls, Kobi Beef Burgers and Various Mochi Flavours.  Great experience. Would highly advise to book well in advance.

title: Unforgettable views!
comment: I went to Sushi Samba for drinks and I have to say that I didn't have very good impression of the staff as they were looking at people up and down. Also, when they were serving us a cocktail, the one that appeared to be the supervisor was checking on the waiters and putting strange faces and looking at them a bit angrily... It is not nice for the customer to see that. Thanks that at least one of the waiters was smiley and knew what customer service is. Apart from that, the views are awesome!!! It's one of the best places that I have been to concerning the views!! Totally worth it!!

title: Sushi yeaaaah
comment: I had an awesome birthday lunch. I had brazilian, peruvian and Japanese food, all of them tasty with a nice presentation.

title: Phenomenal!!
comment: Never tasted so many great combinations of flavors in a sushi. Everything we ordered was excellent including Kobe sushi, but I mostly enjoyed the rolls we ordered. Some had pickles and mayo, and we had the most amazing black cod on skewers. Just have to try this place! View is a killer and ambience is second to none.

title: Beautiful food - definitely book!
comment: Been meaning to go for months and finally made it! And it didn't disappoint - fabulous food, impeccable service and wonderful views. Only disappointment was the number of children there - apologies but paying so much money and wanting to chill having at least a dozen children there shouting to one another took the edge off of what could have been a perfect, romantic meal.

title: Wow!
comment: Fantastic experience. I was worried that this restaurant may be more style than substance, but not at all. The glass lifts, the views, the food, the service - all outstanding.

title: Amazing sushi place with very special views
comment: The biggest issue I've had with sushi samba is actually finding a reservation before 10:30pm! Also note the open table system for booking has or at least had a glitch where a ghost 3/4pm table was always available. Anyways, the views at the right time are spectacular, the food is lovely and tasty without bankrupting you. The service can be hit and miss but generally I've not had any problems. Booking in advance is fundamental unless you call direct and try and get a cancellation. Highly recommended. The black cod is particularly good.

title: stunning view, delicious food and great service
comment: .. this place is amazing! the view are fantastic (feels like you could touch the Gerkin), food is delicious (one of the best sushi I ever had!) and the service is top class .. our waiter was friendly, helpful and made very good suggestions for cocktails and food! we went for drinks and had food in the bar area .. everything was perfect! at 6:30pm they started live music on top floor bar and was really lovely... we are definitively going back to try dinner in the restaurant... when we can find a table (is very popular so you need to book well in advance!)..

title: Close to heaven!
comment: A fabulous drinking and dining venue in the heart of the City. The external lift whooshes you up too many floors to count and disgorges you into a funky bar with a roof terrace. The cocktails there are absolutely superb and beautifully presented. You are then led through to your table in a big glass-walled room, with high-level views over London. The food is original, fresh and delicious, with a mix of Latin American and Japanese influences. You have to try the taquitos and the samba rolls and the Gunma beef. At £1000.00, I couldn't stretch to the Kobe beef! It isn't cheap, obviously, but for this quality, you should extend yourself a bit. The sake is particularly fine.

title: even better this time
comment: I enjoy eating here more and more , especially as today the sun was shining and London was at its best. I love the way you can travel around the whole world in just a few mouthfuls . We shared ; amazing vegetable taquitos , lovely refreshing tuna seviche, grilled asparagus , excellent signature samba London sushi [ so colourful like a plate of toy food from the Magic roundabout] and then one of the finest deserts ever; Love rio chocolate mousse with Tonka bean ice cream . Words cannot describe! Service was brilliant , so many well trained staff so everything goes so smooth . I just wish the wine wasn't so expensive then I could eat here more often . It is such a treat.

title: Nothing extraordinary, good food at a premium due to location
comment: I go to Sushi Samba regularly for drinks and stayed at couple of times for dinner. Whilst the food is good its nothing spectacular considering you could eat better for less money in a few places in London. But then none of them will give you the experience that this place is. I recommend the warm dishes as they are more particular. The sushi rolls are good but nothing special. The views are simply beautiful and the bar makes really really good cocktails.

title: In a word: Disappointing
comment: My partner and I were keen to visit Sushi Samba after it was recommended to us by a friend. Unfortunately however, our visit was severely tainted by the service, which was decidedly rude and unprofessional. The issue was a small one: we were served a dish that we hadn't ordered, of which we informed the server. However, instead of simply removing the dish, the waitress who took our order came over and insisted that we had definitely ordered it (we hadn't - it was a misunderstanding), and would not take it away! After she went away (dish still on our table), a third server came over to the table and tried to convince us to take the dish, saying that he would 'just leave it there... maybe you'll change your mind'. At this, we explicitly requested it to be taken back to the kitchen. And finally, they gave in. This was all extremely embarrassing and by the end of it our waitress basically didn't engage with us at all. We were never asked how our meal was and indeed all she did was clear up once we had finished, ask if we needed anything else (we didn't) and then said, rather brusquely, 'Just the bill, then?' Er, what? Now, this all seems rather ridiculous; however I have honestly never experienced such rude service in my life. Having worked in hospitality myself I would never treat, nor expect my staff to treat, customers in such a disrespectful manner. It really is a great shame because the food (especially the tataki) was quite excellent, but this place left nothing but a bad taste in our mouths.

title: Fantastic food and service
comment: My sisters took me here for my birthday and it did not disappoint. The food was excellent - we shared yellowtail taquitos, grilled asparagus and black cod as well as the large steak dish! We enjoy our food! We then had an extra portion of cod and taquitos! I'm sure the staff thought we were mad! There are excellent views over London and you aren't sitting so close that you can hear the next table talking! The floor manager, Oto was walking around keeping an eye on everything and the day was made by our waiters, Felix and Nelson who were an absolute blast! I think we all fell in love with them a bit and wanted to take them home with us at the end of the meal! The service was impeccable and I would thoroughly recommend eating here, even if you only do it once! I would love to eat here every week, but, I'm not sure my bank balance would cope!

title: A great experience
comment: i went last night for cocktails with 8 others for my daughters birthday. The lift to get there is glass and extremely fast and actually it can be quite scared if you don't like heights, like me! So I apologise to the random young man I clung to on the way up! But once up at the bar the views over London are beyond beautiful. The staff were all very pleasant, they even have a supply of blankets to put around your shoulders if you get a bit chilly.  The only criticisms is there is not enough seating and the service was pretty slow. But it's a must place to go in my opinion. It is expensive for drinks but I would say you are paying for the whole experience so with that in mind I would say good value

title: Date night
comment: What a great night out food and service was on point! A little pricey but you expect that in London! Great views and great cocktails. We were supposed to leave to go to another bar but ended up staying all night drinking on the out door terrace by the Orange tree!

title: Wow a fantastic meal in a great location
comment: This is a great restaurant. The selection of South American and Japanese dishes is stunning. The perfect approach is to work your way through a number of dishes. Portions of each were enough for four of us to share. The flavours and quality of cooking were superb. By the end of the meal we still could not agree on our favourites and none, except the puddings disappointed. The service was slick and friendly. The views stunning. Expensive but the restaurant is modern, highly quality and distinctive.

title: Quality!!
comment: We visited this restaurant on Thurs after it was recommended by a friend and everything about it was first class. Situated on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower the location is absolutely fabulous, everything was spot on, from being greeted on the ground floor to the attentive and knowledgable staff and the food was impeccable and there was something there to cater for everyone's taste, not just sushi. We had about six or seven dishes between the two of us and that was plenty. The pork belly and the steak just melted in your mouth and the sides of coconut rice and fancy chips was a perfect accompaniment, the cocktails were fantastic too and we tried a couple of happened beers too which just finished the night off perfectly. The views over London when the sun was going down just added to the whole experience. It was expensive but you get what you pay for and we thought for the quality and location it was well worth it and would highly recommend it.

title: Fantastic experience, worth the money!!
comment: I was taken here by my family for my 18th birthday after having raved about the delicious sounding menu at sushi samba.  I have to say I was not in the slightest bit disappointed. The staff and waiters were absolutely excellent in helping us with the menu and what to order and the food was exquisite. We were told to order around 9-11 dishes between the 4 of us and it turned out to be just the perfect amount of food. A favourite of all of ours was the sea bass tempura that came in some kind of coriander sauce, which we were informed to mix in with the sea bass for the best flavour (they were right!). All of the food we ordered exuded flavour and you could tell how passionate the waiters were about the food, which is always a good sign.  The only issue we had was that my mum informed them multiple times that it was my 18th birthday and she was told that a special birthday dessert was going to be brought out, however it never came, which was slightly disappointing but not the end of the world. We did end up just ordering dessert of the menu instead, which was delicious. My sister and I shared the 'With love from Rio' (dark chocolate ganache, coffee mousse, tonk a bean ice cream and caramelised macadamia) and the chocolate banana cake.  Although the food here is really expensive, which can be quite off-putting, I really can't recommend it enough and tell you that it's absolutely worth it. We've already planned another visit for September and I can't wait!

title: Fantastic
comment: We had a lunch today in this stunning restaurant. As the weather was lovely we were offered a table on the terasse. We enjoyed the amazing view of london. After 5 minutes, we decided to go inside the restaurant as it was getting far too hot. The staff was charming and helped us move inside. They explained the menu to us and were very helpful through out. The food was all delicious each dish different in looks and taste. It was expensive but we expected it. We will return in the evening next time.

title: Hair in my Sushi that left me disgusted
comment: I visited sushi samba with my partner towards the end of June. The food was nice until I found a hair in the middle of my sushi. I was disgusted and could not continue to finish the dish. Considering this dish was £16 it was a shame and a waste of money. I did not want to kick off a fuss as the restaurant was busy and there were others around. Furthermore my waiter did not seem like she would be helpful as she did not pay much attention to us. Instead I left once paying my bill. I did not expect this in a restaurant that was meant to be very clean.

title: Gorgeous views - leisurely lunch
comment: We found the staff to be really helpful and polite, willing to explain the menu and making recommendations for those of us unfamiliar with the food on the menu. The food is good - not amazing but very good - and it's nice to share a number of small plates to get a taste of lots of different flavours. Enjoyed the Shrimp Tempura and Teryiaki Poussin especially. Lots of cocktails to try (but these will quickly bump up the cost of your meal!) and our desserts were delicious. The best thing about the restaurant, however, is the view. On a lovely sunny afternoon, the view across the City, out towards southern England was amazing. We had lunch and weren't hurried along. My only disappointment was the bar. It's actually very enclosed and doesn't enjoy the views that the restaurant has. Everyone there seemed to be smoking and even though it was outside, the smell of cigarettes was nasty and spoilt it for me. A shame because the tree in the centre of the bar looks great and I expect it's even better at night.

title: Once you should go
comment: Or for the food or for the view but once you should be go if you stay in London.  View is without word, service excellent and food great.  You also expect to spend more...is not cheap but value for price is well balanced

title: Disappointing
comment: We thought it would be a nice idea to pop into samba for pre dinner cocktails - what a bad idea - ridiculous queus for cocktails that are special but over priced, NO one seemed to know if the outside bar area was open or closed (for eve prep ) at 5 in the afternoon ?? Surely that's there busiest time? ? But the worst thing was no one seemed to know what was going on, lots of customers complaining, but to the wrong people. Overpriced, under staffed, a bad experience. We will not be returning.

title: A place to come over and over again
comment: More expensive than other branches in US, one of the best places in London. Good food, good atmosphere, good views. Probably one of the best venues in London.

title: Overpriced
comment: Went here last week for a lunch which was not great as its view. view was breathtaking but service was awful so many staff but tool 15 minutes to take our order. Food was really expensive but portion really small spend almost 100 pound but still hungry. May be will go for drink but for food big no no

title: Lovely dinner
comment: Lovely mojitos out on the roof terrace and then dinner inside at the bar. Very good service and lovely food at reasonable prices.

title: Good food, great view but overpriced
comment: We were a group of six here last week for lunch. Initially I wanted to make a dinner reservation but would of had to do this two months in advance! So could only make a lunch reservation. Since the Tube was on strike that day so we had to walk to the restaurant and arrived 45mins late. I had called to inform them of our delay and expected to be turned away upon arrival, or having to wait for another available table, but when we arrived we were immediately brought to our table without any fuss. Maybe because it was "only" lunch and they weren't that full.  Have to say, the waitress we had was overly friendly and helpful, so no complaints there. However, they are not so friendly when you book over the phone and go through their call center.  The dishes we ordered were delicious, but the food and drinks were extremely overpriced. So fully agree with others' comments. Don't understand how so many people have no problem with spending so much money. Guess that's just London.  Anyway, overall food delicious, view fantastic, prices way over the top.

title: Customer service appalling
comment: My friends and I had a terrible experience at sushi samba. We booked a table for lunch following a morning shopping. On arrival staff asked if they could take our shopping bags off us to store in the cloak room. We enjoyed a lovely lunch together were we had some tasty sushi. Unfortunately it was all tainted by the following events. On leaving we went to collect our bags. The staff member said something had happened to our belongings but would not elaborate until her senior had arrived. We discovered all our bags were soaked through, ruining the contents. On closer inspection we realised this was in fact sewage from a toilet leak (something they were trying to say was water). The staff didn't know how to react, were unapologetic and we were asked to email their manager who was not in that day. The 'cloakroom' we discover was simply a broom cupboard so I recommend not leaving any of your personal items there. Two weeks after our complaint email and we are still waiting for their response. They have yet to apologise. I am quite frankly appalled.

title: Wonderful view, great food and drinks.
comment: Great atmosphere with excellent food and great drinks. Unbelievable and wonderful view, very elegant with a modern atmosphere. Sushi samba is a good choice for dinner. I'll back soon.

title: Overrated
comment: I suspect other reviewers many have mentioned that the best bit about dining here is the journey in the lift: the view is indeed incredible. However everything went downhill from there.  We were seated at what must be the only table in that restaurant without a view and we were facing the open robata grill, which made a very hot day much hotter. We had to continually flag staff down to be given menus, to order drinks and to place a food order. Considering how many staff were walking around the restaurant (with the obligatory cool-restaurant FBI earpiece) I was amazed at how little attention they were giving the guests. Mention must go, however, to the sommelier, who was wonderful and seemed to be the only person to notice we were in need of attention.  The food when it arrived tasted good. I cannot deny that. The portions were disappointingly small. The descriptions of the dishes from the staff were hurried and mostly hard to hear and it really felt like no one cared about the food at all.  Obviously this restaurant is expensive and we knew that going in. We probably expected that you would be paying for the view as well. It was still galling to receive the enormous bill at the end of the meal given how poor both the service and view were. It's such a pity as I think the menu could have been really interesting and the potential for a fun evening was there, it all just seemed badly executed.

title: Stunning view!
comment: It a wonderful place to be for a drink after a busy day. The place is very convinient and easy accessible. Great coctails.

title: Wow!!
comment: Loved every single moment of my dinner last night, Great food, Great wine and to top it of a great view of London. Simply stunning

title: Beautiful food and even better service
comment: I went here quite a few months ago. I'd been planning to go for a while as I had heard great things about the place. The bar I wasn't as keen on - mainly due to the clientel which were boozie city types who think they are above everyone, but in fact were a little chavvy. The restaurant though was lovely. The staff were very attentive and polite, keen to help as much as they could.
