The food was absolutely beautiful, the cocktails delicious (although they didn't seem very strong) and the views stunning. Looking forward to visiting again.

title: The Sushisamba Bar
comment: This is the second time I have visited, the first for a meal which was not great, also was amazed how expensive the drinks were. The second time just for drinks, it was busy, and the bar out on the terrace was closed. So you had to buy drinks inside, there was one barman working, with at least 20 people at the bar waiting to buy drinks, and several staff standing around not doing anything. When I asked why there was just one barman he said the other one had just gone on his break! unbelievable! I did complain, but as far as I could see there was no management of the bar at all. Very overpriced, and badly run.

title: amazing restaurant
comment: My husband booked here for my 30th as a surprise. The staff are attentive, the views incredible and the food amazing. The only point is how extremely expensive the food is, it is lovely but not sure it warrants the food at £100per head. A great place for a special occasion

title: Incredible
comment: I visited Sushi Samba for the second time in May and once again it was fantastic. The staff are lovely, cocktails are tasty and the food is pretty delicious. Drinks are pricey but the food is reasonable as most things are for sharing. Oh and the view of London is mega!

title: Pricy
comment: Lovely food, great drinks, great design of the restaurant. The only downside is the price, it's on the expensive side for what you get. I don't mind paying for a good meal but this was testing my value for money.  Staff were very friendly, attentive -and lots of them. We visited for lunch. Unless you like loud music only go for lunch.

title: Great views & good drinks
comment: The place in based on 38-39thg floor and you do get spectacular views of London by night. I was there only for drinks as you have to book a month in advance in order to get a dinner table during the weekend. I was dressed really casually and had no problem getting in however most of the women are really dressed up. The place has a great terrace outside with huge tree in the middle. Looks really cool. The drinks are good but not perfect. Great place to grab a drink before going out.

title: Brilliant Friday night
comment: We met up with my friend at sushi samba for the first time. We only had drinks but the staff were really friendly, the atmosphere was great and the view was amazing. We found the prices to be reasonable for what you get. Would definitely recommend it!

title: Japanese food with a spectacular view
comment: The lunch was not bad, with good selection of food and a spectacular view, service was exceptional, and the server paid attention to every details.  So far the experience was good, and if you want a good Japanese meal, this would be highly recommended.

title: Delish but pricey!
comment: A friend and I booked a lunchtime reservation at Sushi Sambi several weeks in advance. We were initially concerned about the dress code as I had heard through other friends that diners dress up as if they are going to a bar/club. As you can imagine, I was a little worried as my friend and I had dedicated that whole day to shopping and I didn't particularly fancy wearing heels and a dress. I ended up wearing smart, dark wash jeans, a white work top with smart flats. Whilst I was let in OK, I did feel very under dressed compared to most other diners there who were dressed in suits and smart dresses. The venue itself is very impressive. When you arrive at the Heron Tower, you need to use the glass lift to get to Sushi Samba which provides an amazing view of the city and certainly gives the experience a wow factor from the start. Unfortunately, our table didn't give us the best view, but the place was completely full so I understand they couldn't have moved us. The service was amazing - our waiter was very attentive and detailed, but not intrusive. We got a "hello" from every staff member we passed on our way in which was a nice touch. The food was excellent albeit very pricey. We ordered and shared the black cod, shrimp tempura and some sushi. Neither of us ordered any alcohol, yet we became very aware that our bill was already going to be high, so we stopped ordering despite feeling we could have eaten more!  In all, I'm glad I tried this place. It is the sort of restaurant I wouldn't mind spending money at for special occasions only, as it's not cheap enough to do regularly, but I really did like it.

title: Go there if you need to impress a friend
comment: The view is simply amazing, the atmosphere is good and the menu has few gems that you should try. The negative side? Staff is okay-ish, prices are expensive and the bars are often overcrowded. I suggest going there for dining rather than drinking.

title: Wonderful all-round
comment: To get the obvious out of the way, let me start by saying... it ain't cheap! Having said that, we found it well worth the price. The location is spectacular - situated near the top of Heron Tower, the cavernous main hall feels grand, with large glass walls providing a high altitude view. There's also an al fresco section and a separate outdoor bar area.  We arrived for an early lunch and were able to get a corner table with a view (sadly the North London view on offer on that side of the building was a bit bland). Tables are spaced out enough to have a private conversation, but there's still a lively atmosphere when the restaurant fills up.  The service from our waitress, Ruta, was superb. Friendly and attentive without being overbearing, she offered knowledgeable advice on the menu.  The menu is interesting as it is divided into different regional sections for Japanese, Brazilian, and Peruvian dishes. They are mostly small dishes that are easy to share. Virtually everything we ordered was excellent, apart from the just 'fairly good' lamb chops. The shrimp tempura and black cod were highlights, as was the dessert combo. Also worth trying are the custom cocktails on offer. Again, not cheap, but considering the location definitely above par for the price. The lychee cooler is one I'd come back for! This was one of our best dining experiences in recent memory. Not one to visit regularly unless you have deep pockets, but definitely worth considering for special occasions.

title: Was lovely weather made it ☀️
comment: Had to book ahead a considerable no of weeks even for a table at 515 as this place is popular even on a Wednesday. The weather was amazing and just being 38 floors up the view is going to be good over the city. The food is nice but for two of us it was expensive. Also we were there quite early and I asked for a table outside on the terrace, as did a guy just before me (perhaps a regular) and for him it was a given and for my friend and I not, which I found very disappointing. Would return but as it's so expensive I think it's not a regular place.

title: Fantastic experience
comment: We sat outside on the hottest day of the year so far, had an amazing view of London landmarks including the winding of the river Thames and the open tower bridge. The food was amazing and waitress very helpful, her suggested menu was perfect and the mojito went down a treat. Can definitely recommend.

title: Under the orange tree
comment: Been a regular since 2013 and I probably still be in few years time if I ever continue living in London. The dynamic and mood changes with the management staff from time to time, but I've never been treated badly. Food and drinks are overpriced for what they are but the venue and the view make up for it. Love the terrace during the summer. The crowd is okay-ish (the city boys are the worst)but bearable.  Overall, SS is a great place to hang out at if u seek good (and fancy) vibes and chill out drinks (or if u want to impress ur date/friends/family with a stunning venue).

title: Disappointment with Bar tender
comment: I have been to sushi samba several times always been treated with respect, food has been awesome, service excellent, ambience unbeatable .  But today I have come back home with great disappointment , insult because of one bar tender "Tom " at the bar .  The story follows --- I had ordered four drinks, while he was making the second drink I asked for one more drink the answer that I got from him, that you should have told me earlier you want one more drink. The others wouldn't have wasted time because of you waiting in the queue it was a matter of 4 seconds whereas I waited for 20 minutes for a drunk. I was still placing an order, my tab was still on. He was still making my 3 rd drink in the first order.  He was really bias to other customers either he was drunk or may be we were not from the same country .  He insulted me thrice in front of others by throwing attitude and making all sort of faces, and passing some rude comments . Even when I told him I was still placing an order he was still behaving very badly and rudely. It was extremely rude at a place like sushi samba . I would really request sushi Samba higher authorities to take strict actions against him and the way I was insulted in front of others and even my wife, I have already spoken to David the manager but I still hope for some action and I am visiting the place next week again expect for some respect a customer ...

title: Food impressive, drinks impressive, staff rude
comment: second visit to sushi samba.  Food fantastic again!  Cocktails fantastic again  Staff rude......again  Evening door staff are extremely rude!! I realise that the bar gets very busy but, it is not necessary to speak to the customers in the manner that they do.  Also, put bag in cloak room it was lost, they have not responded to my emails ever since.

title: A mediocre restaurant with a big name
comment: I heard about the restaurant for long but was never able to try it until most recently with two months' advanced booking. At arrival, the service appeared to be good and welcoming by the manager, but when it came to ordering, the waiter really needed some training. Since it was our first time and it is Japanese food, we were not sure about the portion. So we asked the waiter whether it was enough or not. He just told us not enough seeing that we have ordered a few big plates for sharing. In the end, we could not finish even half of the beef. With still quite some food on the table, the waiter asked whether he could clear the table. We thought he meant to pack the food to go. Later we were told that the policy did not allow boxing the food away! Then why would they advise us to order beyond our capacity?!! The more disappointing thing was that when we asked for taking the left-over food away and complained about the service, unlike any other good restaurants we experienced before, the manager gave a lot of explanations instead of simply apologizing and letting it go. Then he offered to give us a desert as complimentary, and it turned out that it came with a hair... I won't go back to that place again. With the price charged, there are a lot more better restaurants to go. The view may be an advantage, but comparing with Shard, it is nothing!

title: Out of this world
comment: Amazing restaurant, I couldn't believe how much me and my boyfriend enjoyed this place for our anniversary. If like to thank all the staff for being on point and for looking after us so gracefully. I couldn't thank you guys enough.

title: Left disappointed
comment: Had been looking forward to trying Sushisamba for some time and left somewhat disappointed. The table wasn't ready when we arrived (we were 10 minutes early), which was fine and we were happy to have a drink at the bar. There was absolutely no seating at the bar so we stood. Waitress collecting glasses just pushed me out the way to get past with no apology. Cocktails were mediocre, nothing spectacular. After 40 minutes, the table still wasn't ready but after some persistence we were eventually seated, almost an hour after we arrived and we were given a window seat which was lovely. The waiter was helpful with suggestions, all of which were pretty good and the food arrived pretty soon after ordering. The lobster taquitos and black cod were both particularly tasty. We were still hungry at the end so we ordered another plate of samba rolls. Surprisingly when we initially ordered our food arrived very quickly despite the restaurant being completely packed. However ordering one extra plate of samba rolls when the restaurant was clearing meant a half hour wait, which we eventually got fed up with and cancelled. A minute later the rolls arrived, although we were told that we wouldn't be charged for them due to the long wait. Desserts were disappointing. Overall, the food was pretty good (of course it's overpriced but that was to be expected), however we were let down by the service and some rude staff. I'm not sure if we would return.

title: Fabulous
comment: Awesome restaurant. The food is second to none, great service, great cocktails, amazing views and crikey what a ride in the lift.

title: Vibrant breath taking
comment: It's Monday in sunny London and the city doesn't sleep....Knowledgeable sommelier recommend Argentinian white. Food sushi and pan Asian fusion. Waiter managed to suit all of our complicated pallets! The sun was setting and they were in no hurry to remove us...we sat relaxed and absorbed the atmosphere with our teenage girls and guests from New York. Quality was found at a chain restaurant!

title: Amazing
comment: Visited the restaurant for my cousins 50th birthday. The service was amazing. The food delicious. A must have is the passion fruit cake for dessert. But the highlight, for me, was the truly amazing Amaretto Sour made by one of their bar staff. A young blond girl with dreadlocks.

title: Amazing London views
comment: I probably echo what many of the people that have reviewed have said when I say the view is amazing but the price of drinks is crazy.......even for London..... The staff as well are odd.....for the price you are paying for drinks the minimum expectation is that the staff would be impeccable but to be honest I have received far better service in much cheaper bars around London. Its a shame though as the view is insane .....

title: Great night out
comment: We went to Sushi Samba after the theatre. The atmosphere was electric. Cocktails pricey but worth it for buzz! Waiters knew their cocktails! The food was excellent, tasty and different. Although pricey, this is fusion food at its best. Service could have been better but all in all a great night out.

title: Great views - Uncivilized door men
comment: I have visited here before with friends and loved this place. The view from the top is great and some good choice of drinks. But had a very unpleasant experience last evening. The 3 door men on the ground floor - 2 guards and 1 other guy ( who decides who is allowed to get in) refused us entry. Not sure what the problem was but he rudely claimed that the bar was packed. But he would allow many others to get in right in front of us. When I questioned his decision, he simply said "they have been here before". The door men in the past were quite polite, but now this group which cannot even speak proper English are very insulting. The tone of their language is also very uncultured. I am very surprised SushiSamba has let these guys be their front. Liverpool street is a very lively area and there are lots of other bars which are more welcoming. Will never b visiting this place again.

title: What happened...
comment: All I can say is it went from high up there in our expectations after the first visit to, oh dear... what happened...?!?! The food is still superb, however this was over shadowed by the absolute lack of attention to detail and poor service. If you'd have asked me a week ago I would have said it was one of our top places to dine, now on the other hand I'd say avoid it purely for the extremely poor service.

title: A wonderful food experience with a view you'll never forget!
comment: I enjoy eating in nice places, Michelin-starred and Good Food Guide recommended, and I have to say that Sushisamba has made it onto my top-places-to-eat-in-London list. Yes it's expensive, but food this good should be. I had quite a few of the small plates and some mixed sashimi, which was expertly prepared. Each dish was served at the perfect temperature (I'm quite fussy about that) and every bite had so much flavour. I particularly recommend the salt and pepper squid. The ambience was special, exclusive and the views of London really are something to experience. Their cocktails were well-made, not too overly-sweetened with sugar and all made with very obviously fresh ingredients. Service was very good. DEFINITELY GO!

title: Amazing amazing amazing
comment: Visited here on a Friday night and it was fantastic!  The buzz is electric on a Friday night and the views to die for! The waiting staff are so attentive and knowledgable about the menus offering guidance and advice on a good selection of dishes to order. The food was absolutely delicious and each and every dish was well presented and amazing it's own way. The yellowfin tuna sashimi was the belle of the ball as it was so fresh and flavoursome and the sushi samba rolls also delicious.  The wine and cocktail were also fantastic and the espresso martinis ordered after dinner (instead of espressos) were also excellent. I want to go here every weekend! Definitely recommend this place for couples and groups of friends.

title: Birthday treat
comment: My wife treated me to a meal at sushisamba for my birthday Great place, great views, fantastic service & food. Choice of bars both inside & outside & al fresco dining  You can just turn up here for a drink but if it's full priority is given to pre booked diners & you won't get entry, you need to book 2 months in advance to be sure to get a place. We were seated on the outside terrace, right on the edge, absolutely stunning views of London while dining. They provide you with blankets to keep warm if you request one, and have flaming heaters, all a nice touch. Drinks are a little expensive but only what you would expect for this calibre of restaurant, food reasonably priced

title: Lunch with friend
comment: Very nice place, great atmosphere, good food (lots of dishes to share between two or three people), busy but nice staff. A great lunch or dinner experience

title: Amazing View...Great Food
comment: The decor is very modern and trendy..the view is amazing..and the food is mouth-watering. Highly recommended.

title: All about the view, not so much the food
comment: Visited for the first time on a beautiful, sunny Saturday afternoon for lunch. The journey starts with being beamed up in the glass lift and soaring above the London skyline as you climb. It is a beautiful restaurant and bar area. Because it was such a lovely the day, the terrace bar and dining areas were full also. We were fortunate to get a table by a window with views across North and East London, w,onderful. There was a mixed crowd there, couples groups and friends, a few families and even two hen party groups. After having the menu explained, there was a longer than customary delay to take our order - and I am not the fastest person to make selections from extensive menus! I have to say other than this minor hiccup the service was extremely good and the floor manager also checked how how we were enjoying our experience and showed genuine warmth. But why are you here ultimately? The food. I suppose my comparisons, in terms of venue, ambience and pricing, is with the likes of Zuma and Nobu Berkeley. Similar places which will strip your wallet of a large sum for high-grade Japanese food, but where you have also had a high-grade gastronomic experience. I am afraid The food at Sushisamba simply does not hit those notes. We bookended our savoury dishes with the excellent lobster taquitos, but the other dishes we had were simply average. Salt and pepper squid had great textture but no fire and flavour; yellowtail tiradito was good but not the traditional style of tiradito with chopped fish so was more in sashimi form, which I love, but wanted something different hence choosing tiradito; pork belly was marginally dry; sea bass tempura large dish, the fish was nicely cooked but the tempura looked the crispiness and lightness one would expect; outside of the taquitos, the black cod was the highlight, soft, firm, perfectly cooked. Passion fruit cake dessert with green tea an chocolate grenache and raspberry sorbet was an assault on the eyes with the colour but lacked finesse and subtlety. When I go to a restaurant of this style and with these prices, I know I am in for an expensive haul, but I keep prolonging the ride through the menu because it is so thrilling and the highs are exhilirating. At Sushisamba, I was happy to stop the food ride and continue with the view.

title: Amazing view - arrogant waiters
comment: We were two couples from Norway visiting friday 19th. The view was amazing and the restaurant design very nice . The food was very good but somewhat overpriced. This is not surprising since this is a popular restaurant. Our real disappointment was booking and service. We got a written confirmation and checked upon arrival. We still had to wait 40 min before seating. This is very unfortunate for guests having a late dinner ( e.g. 10 pm) since closing time is 1230 am. We have noticed similar experiences from other guests.  Some of the waiters were quite arrogant. Your management should look into this if you want to keep a good reputation.

title: Not great!
comment: Lovely views but not a great service. Waiters aren't fast enough and because of speaking with colleagues make mistakes quite often!!

title: Cool bar, ok,view
comment: Didnt eat there. Cocktailsbwere good but I think,you,do pay a bit of a premium for the view which frankly is actually a lot prettier from the Canary Wharf end if you are looking for a London skyline. Quite a poser crowd, which is to be expected.

title: Super sushi!
comment: Super fresh sushi and delicious Asian eats. My, it's high! The lift to the 38th floor is fast so not for the squeamish. If you can stomach the ride, a stunning view of the city awaits and a Mojito will soon help to settle any wobbles.

title: lovely location
comment: Fancy lovely location but they are better sushi / fusion restaurant in london. I would go back for the service, drinks and the beautiful location in bishop gate/ liverpool street!

title: Magical experience
comment: Went for my boyfriends birthday, I booked about a month in advance and still only managed to get a 5pm reservation for a Friday night which I guess isn't too bad as this place is always booked up...the restaurant was quiet at this time but was completely full by 6pm. When booking online, I left a note saying it was our first time at Sushi Samba and a birthday treat for my boyfriend whose birthday it was on that day, which probably really did help make the experience very magical. Our waiters were kind and very helpful by giving us great advice on what to choose on the menu. They even helped us choose a bottle of wine according to our taste and to compliment the dishes we were ordering. We sat by the window and had incredible views of south London and the Gerkin. Although we were surrounded by people, the team made us feel like we were the only 2 people in the room as they were exceptionally attentive. After our meal, as we still half a bottle of wine left, we were taken upstairs to a private lounge which only had a few people in there, we were seated by the window overlooking the Gerkin where we carried on drinking into the late night with some amazing cocktails!

title: Great food, fantastic cocktail terrace!
comment: Eating at SS is a great experience, which begins with the ride up in the glass lifts. The views are particularly amazing at night.  The food is an unusual mix which works well - think in terms of tapas and order several dishes for the table. It's also a great way to sample sake.  The cocktail terrace is amazing. Again, visit at night for the best views!

title: Popped in for some drinks
comment: terrible service, bar staff have no idea how to create atmosphere, be polite, spoke to quietly, tried to serve multiple guests and got the order wrong and called me mate, you get better service in a weatherspoons, when you pay top dollar you expect good service, standards have dropped through the floor in this place, great views and great food with terrible service

title: Amazing Views, Amazing Food
comment: Great view and decor. Attentive waiters. Delicious cocktails. Mouth-watering food. Can't recommend this place enough definitely worth a visit (although could do without the glass lift to get there!).

title: Great food and delicious sushi....
comment: My boyfriend and I ate on the terrace on a beautiful summer's evening. The view was fabulous and the food was to a very high standard. The sushi and black cod were amazing dishes, however there are a few dishes which I wouldn't have again but nonetheless it was still a very good dining experience. The service wasn't great, my boyfriend had to wait for 20 mins for another drink but in fairness they removed this from the bill. This may also have been because the terrace was open so there were more tables than usual.

title: Underwhelmed and Annoyyed
comment: Positives: Great views of the city.  SO SOs: The food and cocktails. Negatives: Price, Service, Atmosphere. Had a reservation here on a Tuesday evening for a specific table (for a view). When we arrived, we got "big-dogged" and was told by the host that table was now being held for the chef's friend. When we got seated to a random table, now less then 4 people asked if we wanted to order drinks, in the first 10 minutes. An hour in, we ordered a couple drinks because they would not stop asking and we thought maybe there was a drink minimum. we got a couple of cups filled with crushed ice and little bit of water down fluid and a stick ($24USD). The waiter suggested and swore by the fried squid. It was crap. It reminded me or a bag of stale pork skins minus the seasoning. I also got some miso soup, which was the worst and most expensive miso soup I've ever had. We ordered some other appetizers, some steak think, pork belly, tempera shrimp; all pretty good, but not worth the cost at all. Also ordered 2 or 3 sushi rolls. Again, good, but not anywhere near worth the money. Service was pretty questionable too. It wasn't bad, just lackluster. Floaters would come around, but seemed bothered if we asked for something, and we seemed to be always looking for our waiter. For the type of money we spent (over $100USD a person) I expect the waiter to telepathically read my mind. All and all a pretty crappy experience for the kind of reviews this place has. if you come, its 100% for the views.

title: Stunning views, atmosphere and drinks
comment: Came to Sushisamba for evening cocktails and night views over London and had a fantastic experience. Will definitely be back once in London.

title: Overpriced and over rated but quality drinks and food.
comment: I am a big fan of roof top terraces and anywhere that has amazing views.  The service from the staff was amazing and the quality of drinks and food was fabulous. It is extremely over priced though. The service was far too slow. Myself and my friend were not served for 25 minutes. I was slowly becoming furious and i have great patience. the drinks were fantastic and the food was beautiful. But they need to get on top of their staff and service issues.

title: Amazing Father's Day lunch
comment: Visited Sunday for fathers day lunch . Food was great service was perfect , we had our young son with us and he was made a huge fuss of which made the day even more enjoyable.  The staff where great and have nothing negative to say about the whole day Thanks again sushi samba !!

title: Yum as ever, but shouldn't have changed Samba London roll!
comment: Went for a late dinner earlier this month and we had a drink while we waited for our table to get ready. What we ate: - Truffle tempura (prawn): so delicious and one of my favourites! Flavour wasn't overwhelming and it was nice and crispy. - Wagyu Gyoza (beef): initially skeptical of beef in gyoza but it worked very well, definitely recommend. - Teriyaki poussin robata: very generous proportion, nice sauce - Samba London roll: I preferred the earlier version which came with 6 pieces and a different meat/fish on each but now its 8 pieces with 2 of each type...not as visually appealing but still tasted good - El topo roll: this sounded better than it tasted, jalapenos and cheese didn't work together and will give it a miss next time. Otherwise - one of my favourites in London!

title: Expensive, and some dishes quite common
comment: I would choose your dishes carefully and go for the more unusual ones that you wouldn't fine elsewhere. I guess you are paying partly for the view and their rental. I did like the monkfish, but some of the other dishes were quite normal and i would expect more for the prices

title: Awesome, but need to improve service
comment: This place ticks all the boxes for me. Great ambience and views, the food is fantastic (the sashimi, including Kobe is one of the best I ever had), great drinks, etc. Amazing terrace to top it off. I notice some remarks about value for money but I don't really agree. Firstly, this place is more or less unique. Then, if you compare to similar places in NY, HK, Paris, prices will be the same or even higher (Paris much higher).  However - we had to wait way too long for service after seated. 30 minutes lead time to first drink is not acceptable when the tab for two persons land at GBP 400. Also had to re-order from different waiters a couple of times as drinks/dishes did not arrive. Such a shame, as this place would have been a solid 5/5 if service up to par.

title: Worth it for the view, food, drinks and atmosphere
comment: Fully booked, but lucked out as I phoned to try and get a last minute table... Not only did we get a table, but when they needed it for the next sitting they reserved us the best table on the terrace so we could enjoy an awesome view for part 2 of our evening. We enjoyed our dessert and more drinks with a great view. Service was excellent, food was amazing, drinks were great! It's a must if you have never been.

title: Amazing Food , Attentive Staff, but .....
comment: You can't fault the food in taste or presentation it was amazing. The staff were super helpful when explaining the menu and attentive to all our needs. The only thing that lets the place down is the cleanliness ! We sat outside for a pre drink meal. It was empty to start as it had been raining earlier. The tables were dirty as was the floor and there were dirty ash trays on the table . The dirt was more than earlier use, it was obvious the outside area hadn't been cleaned properly since the night before . For the meal we sat by the window and had a fantastic view over North London. But looking around I noticed how grubby the upholstery was on the booth chairs and a general feeling of tiredness in all the furniture . This didn't affect our visit and wouldn't stop me returning , but it bothered me and I felt it deserved to be mentioned.

title: Amazing!
comment: Went here for my boyfriends 30th birthday, had quite high expectations from all the reviews and I must say that this place was totally amazing and a really must for all foodies. We loved everything about it from the elevator, service at arrival, our waiter and especially the interior and must of all the view. All of this without even having mentioned the food. We shared five dishes; small plates and some sushi, all of which were our waiters recommendations. The food blew our tastes away! Our favorites were the shrimp tempura and spicy tuna sushi. We drank traditional sake with everything. The view is worth mentioning once again. We had a lovely table at the terrace. Absolutely recommend sushi samba for any special occasion!!

title: Fantastic cocktails, outstanding views
comment: My brother took me to sushi samba for a few cocktails as a treat after his 21st birthday and prior to my birthday. I almost died going up the glass lift. But once adjusted to the spectacular views from all around us I loved it. We went to the roof garden and afterwards was able to get seats inside. I tested out 3 cocktails whilst my brother had beers and a coke. We were looked after very well, I thought my cocktails tasted fantastic. I had no complaints. I definitely will return. I think this place is great for a well deserved treat and to experience the amazing views. I highly recommend others come and try sushi samba the price is worth it just to go up and down the glass lift and to relax with great company and music whilst chatting and tasting the amazing drinks. I'm sure eating here must be great too.

title: 5 star in all areas!
comment: I feel this is by far the best restaurant in London and would recommend it to all. We decided to book for my wife's birthday and are still talking about how great our evening was..already booked a table for a birthday in July and I can't wait! This restaurant definitely has the wow factor and is 5 star on all fronts. The food was absolutely incredible as we ordered everything from sushi to kobe steak, and I couldn't fault one single dish. The staff were very welcoming and we were lucky enough to have Oto take care of us for the evening, who kept my group entertained and laughing literally all evening! With his help we were able to understand the menu a little better and order some amazing food and customized cocktails that didn't disappoint. The location mixed with the decor, view and atmosphere makes Sushi Samba an incredible experience and perfect for all occasions. I would personally like to thank Oto for taking care of us and I can't wait to for our next trip down to the best restaurant in London!

title: Great venue, not so great service
comment: Me and my friends visited the bar in this establishment after recommendations from people we knew, and the building itself is beautiful. We went to the bar on the 39th floor and we went in the glass lift to get up there and at night the view is incredible. The bar itself was gorgeous, the music was great and we were really happy with the venue. I stood at the bar to order a drink and there were quite a few people waiting so I stood patiently waiting for people before me to get served. 15 minutes passed, still not served. I eventually catch the female bartenders eye, and everyone that was there before me had been served so I assumed it was my turn next. She approaches me and as I open my mouth to order my drink, she takes the order of the man stood directly behind me, making me feel like I'm clearly invisible. She carried on as if I wasn't there. I then waited another 5 minutes, and a different bartender eventually took my order. I pay, and return to my friends to enjoy my drink after the effort of trying to obtain it. I'm then made aware by my friends that the bartenders automatically add a 12.5% service charge to any drink orders you make, which I really wouldn't mind, but 1) they should at least make it optional, not just immediately deduct it, and 2) I didn't feel like I actually received the service warranted to that 12.5% extra charge seeing as though I was initially ignored. I'm hoping that the female bartender was just having an off night and this isn't how she usually treats customers, but it did leave a bad taste in my mouth about a venue I was initially very excited about.

title: Overpriced, over-rated and just about the worst service in London!
comment: A gorgeous view as the lift whisks you to the 38th floor ... Ample bar staff, wasn't too busy, lovely setting and great music ... Then we tried to order a drink. Any barman in any good Irish bar could have served everyone in 10 minutes max and in the order they arrived. Here you might as well be invisible ... They came to serve us and my boyfriend said "this couple were here first" so he came back to us next right?! Nope! More than 20 minutes after arriving we got served ... £24 for an Asahi beer and a lemonade ...? NEVER AGAIN! Head two floors up to Duck & Waffle ... Excellent bar snacks, weird but delicious cocktails and simply brilliant service !

title: Birthday treat for daughter birthday!
comment: Great place, great food....try everything! This is a fab venue, fabulous views to go with the food. Service special and the outside bar is very different.

title: Amazing, Funky and quirky
comment: This is a great quick bite eat resturant, up in the sky you are lifted away by a glass elevator which overlooks London. The decor is amazing and staff efficent. But you usually have to book in advance and it is a bit pricey. But still reccomend it.

title: Excellent
comment: I went here for a corporate event and was impressed by the location, views, quality of food and service.  The service was excellent in particular Edison and Ruta (took their names down because I will specifically be asking for them next time I go!) All round excellent experience and would recommend going to anyone (and I'm not a sushi fan either).

title: Great food, Great service, Great views
comment: We had a great experience at Sushi Samba, cocktails were unusual but you won't be disappointed trying them. The food was delicious and the service was great too. We only mentioned a particular dish did not taste as good compared to the others and it was replaced not that it was bad dish, I was very pleasantly surprised at how attentive and knowledgeable the staff were.

title: Amazing view
comment: Amazing view and the best time is between 19:00-20:00 so you can see the beautiful sun go down. Cocktails and sushi was good, but I thought the view was more amazing. The elevator is also a hell of a party ;-) and don't forget to drink a last drink upstairs before you leave.

title: Nice food with a breathtaking view
comment: Food is nice, a good combination of several cultures.  View over London is breathtaking. Cocktails are also great. Service was a little chaotic. We had 3 waiters trying their best. Yet starters and main dishes came at the same time (both very quick).

title: AMAZING VIEW
comment: What makes Sushi Samba so unique in addition to its cuisine (blend of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian cusines), is its view on the City and East London. So make sure you ask for the table next to the window, or if the weather is nice at the terrace.The menu looks amazing. I loved every single dish! We started with Wagyu Gyoza. It was cooked perfectly, with crispy edges but soft on the inside. The filling was kabocha puree (Japanese pumpkin), and was served with sesam and su-shoyu dipping sauce. It dissapeared from the plate within seconds!

title: Excellent
comment: I would highly recommend this restaurant for the London views, and food! the staff are amazing and make you feel so welcome! also the menu has a lot to offer, not just sushi so there's something for everyone. the food is reasonably priced too. The food here is amazing, and beautifully presented.wonderful location for a birthday, special ocassion, or just becasue.

title: Rude staff!
comment: Went here with two girlfriends one evening for cocktails. On the ground floor, we were warmly welcomed by the most dashing gentlemen who directed us to the glass elevator that goes right to the 38th floor, where we then entered Sushi Samba. The views were absolutely impressive from the bar, as well as from the outdoor terrace. We proceeded to the bar to order our cocktails, and were greeted by a very friendly and knowledgable bartender who pleasantly took our order and made us the most delicious cocktails. Here is where it all went downhill: As soon as he placed the cocktails on the bar, one of the female wait staff came by, dipped a straw in the cocktails, and went on to taste them right in front of us (I think she thought they were for customers in the restaurant)... she then made a face to the bartender as if she were being naughty and funny... he did not laugh, nor did we. This was highly inappropriate, as the bartender himself acknowledged. Following this, we experienced the rudeness of the other female waitstaff in the manner of pushing us out of their way as they tried to get drink orders from the bar, giving us dirty looks, and treating us as if we were not customers deserving of being in their very presence. For a high end restaurant, the service is lacking. I don't think I would ever eat here, as who knows what the female servers may do to the food and drink before bringing it to the table?! I have to say it was disappointing. My standards far exceed what was delivered.

title: Magnificent view, magnificent prices
comment: If you want the wow factor as far as ambience is concerned this is the place. Service attentive. Excellent cocktails , but food is expensive for what it is. Does anyone actually pay £1000 for 1kg of Kobe beef. Perhaps it's a challenge for the City types? Even a Wagyu steak is priced at £145. This was our third visit. We have also been to Sushi Samba in NYC and Miami, so we do like it. Expect to pay close to £100 per head, without going mad

title: Pricey and tight
comment: This is a review for the bar only. Dont get me wrong, the bar is pretty, staff are cute and kind. Cocktails are pricey as unfortunately they are at such places but hey we were prepared. Its a pretty tight bar. I just wanted to check it out really. Music wasnt that great. Not sure if i'd visit again.

title: Very good food, only downside was flat tonic water.
comment: Wonderful view, friendly staff, lovely champagne and delicious food. Very good restaurant/bar. Only downside was that the tonic water was flat, but this is a very meagre criticism! Very good.

title: Wow!
comment: We had been to Sushi Samba in Vegas and loved it, so naturally we couldn't wait to visit again in the London restaurant. It was our 2nd Wedding Anniversary. We waited 30 mins for our table to become available, but we passed the time by having a couple of (seriously good) cocktails at the bar and enjoying the views.  When we were escorted to our table, they apologised for the wait and sat us down at the best table in the house. The views were incredible. We we're also greeted by the restaurant manager with two glasses of champagne to apologise for the wait.  The food is simply outstanding. Its the best sushi we have ever eaten, and we have been fortunate enough to dine in some of the finest establishments around the world, but this is by far the best. I cannot recommend it enough.

title: Very average cocktails, high prices
comment: Visited sushi samba on Sunday afternoon with my parents for a quick cocktail. The views, as always were spectacular from this building . We settled down at a table (that was quite sticky) and I had to go to the bar for service... I seem to remember it was table service last time I came here , although I might be wrong.  Behind the bar looked chaos, despite it being quiet, with stuff stacked everywhere. The barman unenthusiastically made our cocktails as he shifted boxes of fruit and bunches of mint to get to the bottles of booze underneath. I know a little about cocktail shaking, and I know they should be shaken for about 12 seconds, any decent bartender will tell you the same... Ours were shaken for barely 5 seconds before they were poured into very plain glasses and garnished, unimaginatively, with a tired old bit of rolled up cucumber (a remnant from Saturday night perhaps) , an equally tired stinging nettle looking leaf (not sure what it was) and a bamboo straw, none of which added anything to the cocktails, they didn't even look that pretty.  Them came the bill, £34 for three drinks, one of which was a fresh lime and soda for the designated driver. In my opinion, this is overpriced for what we received. For a far superior cocktail with a view, head to nearby city social.

title: Beautifull Beautifull place!
comment: I went there on a business dinner, and from the moment we got in the elevator untill the very end it was perfect. The service was perfection, we got a super nice waitress who spoke portuguese, super nice, got to try the most exquisit things... didn't like the black cod... i'm portuguese so cod has to be our way :)  The magical tree in the night was beautifull, and have i mentioned the view?? oh breath taking view over London. Great place. Hope to come back really soon

title: Oh My Goodness, what a fabulous place!
comment: This place is amazing. The location is almost out of this world with fabulous views over the night sky of London. If you have a fear of heights, don't look down when you travel up to the top of the tower in a glass-sided lift! The decor inside the restaurant is stunning but with glass from floor to ceiling you can enjoy the views over the roof tops. We went to celebrate my daughter's birthday and despite being slightly late, due to the evening traffic, we were treated like royalty. The service was constant and attentive without it being intrusive, and the cocktails were divine with a great variety of different and unusual ones but with all the usual suspects for the Cosmo and Mohito lovers amongst us. The food was suitably out of this world too, to go with the views. There were six of us so we ordered just about everything on the menu from the sushi and sashimi side and then ordered it all again. My favourite was the salmon sashimi which just melted in the mouth. Although it was a very busy Friday evening, we were not rushed nor left waiting, and we did not feel that the restaurant was overcrowded, despite it being full. The ambience was spot on. Otto, the GM mentioned in a previous review, was attentive and charming and the perfect host as he orchestrated all his staff without fuss. A fabulous treat and will definitely be returning for a significant birthday next year!

title: Excellent Asian fusion menu means you're spoilt for choice
comment: Having had a growing appreciation of sushi over the last few years, I've wanted to go to a top sushi restaurant for a little while and Sushi Samba was the one recommended by most. It definitely did not disappoint. The first thing that captivates you is the incredible venue situated on the 38th floor of Heron Tower, which offers fantastic views of the city and contemporary Asian interior design. Even the glass lift is a great experience in which the view across the London rooftops opens up as it speeds upwards. When it comes to the food, it's all about the small sharing dishes which enable you and your table to enjoy a larger variety of the menu. We tried to cover as much as possible so ordered the prawn tempura and lobster taquitos from the small plates, lamb chop and asparagus off the robata grill then the tiger maki samba roll and the mini burgers (not on the menu). Hard to pick a standout dish as each was worthy of the excellent reputation this place has.  A few reviews seem to discredit the service but it was decent enough while we were there. The waitress was happy to talk us through the menu and attentive enough throughout. The only thing I would say is make sure you bring plenty of cash as this place is not cheap!

title: Birthday celebration for our grandaughter and myself
comment: Dining at Sushii Samba is a very different experience from other resturants first of all dining on the 38th floor with a great view of London and as to the food and service is second to none drinks are great too, we go to the one in South beach Miami quite regularly but the food here is far better although it's the same menu try the fish tacos they are fabulous .a little expensive but worth every penny for the experience

title: Horrific service
comment: Went for a birthday dinner andd besides the view, meals and cocktails being good the staff have a very cocky attitude! Got served by a different waiter each time and we were told we have the table for 2 hours but after an hour and 3 quaters got told we must leave even though I had just ordered a drink! For the money you spend wouldnt recommend it!

title: Birthday Lunch
comment: Much anticipated Birthday lunch for my Son. Our welcome was excellent, as was our table, waiter, service, ambience.... The food was AMAZING! A wonderful, fabulous experience. We were relaxed and happy at the end of our celebration.

title: Perfect Birthday Lunch
comment: This is the most exciting place to take your teenager/young adult for a Birthday celebration. The ride to the top, combined with the amazing views is quite breathtaking. The decor and vibe is funky and fresh.  The staff are swish, expert and knowledgeable  The food is a treat for the eye as well as the palate......take time to savour each dish. It was great fun just taking our time and deciding which dish to try, one after the other. THE FOOD IS VERY VERY GOOD!! Try Tiger Maki Samba Rolls.

title: Our anniversary
comment: Me and my wife went to sushi samba on an anniversary and we absolutely loved it the London views are amazing from so high above were looking out the window. The food was exquisite the service was very good and overall I give it 10 out of 10 will definitely be going back - but bearing in mind its quite pricey but worth every penny:)

title: Sunny afternoon drinks
comment: Visited just for drinks as part of a London day out - lift scared me to death but was looking forward to getting to the top for the great views which didn't disappoint. The outside terrace bar wasn't open yet so everyone was crowded around the small-ish inside bar. Waited about 10 minutes to place our order for cocktails and didn't really see why I should pay a 12.5% service charge which clearly stated it was discretionary. If I had been using a waiter service than fair enough but I'd been standing at the bar for 15 minutes by the time I got a drink. The lady bartender was not very happy with this and said I should have told her this when I placed the order! Overall the great views are what you're going for - drinks & service are average

title: A very good dinner with a spectacular view
comment: We went as a group of ten on a Friday evening. Although our friend did the reservation for 8 people, they found a way to fit us all (it was a tight fit :), in spite that it was full. The service was fast in terms of food but a bit sloppy and the waiter was irritated and with a bad attitude.  The food on the other hand was very good overall - we tried the black cod in miso (must try, it is delicious!) , salmon sashimi (really fresh and good) , tempura shrimps, pork belly (I don't eat pork but my friends said it was good), beef (not so good) some maki rolls etc. What we really liked about the place except for the food was the wonderful location at the 38th floor and terrace with the spectacular bar area. Although pretty expensive and with not so great service, we would definitely come back for the location, lovely ambiance and lots of the dishes.

title: Sushi Samtastic!!
comment: Me and my husband went to sushi samba to celebrate our 7th anniversary.  We was advised to order 2 plates from each kitchen(of which there are 3).  The food was top notch. The only disappointed bit was the fillet steak which was okay.  As a manager working in a customer related industry, I must say the service was 5* We was first served by a waitress called Alexandra(might have got the name wrong) who took our order with a lovely smile. We noticed a seat near the window and asked if we can be moved. She did one better and got a table by the window (the view was beautiful)instead. We was then served by a waiter called Gatian. Very funny man but professional. He definitely made our meal there more enjoyable. When we ordered dessert, it was presented in a plate with the words ' Happy 7th Anniversary' I will definitely recommend Sushi Samba for a date/special occasion. It is pricey but worth it for the food, view, and the service.

title: Spectacular View
comment: I was here a couple of weeks ago with a friend during our one day trip to London. The view from the top was amazing at night. However, it was a pity we didn't get to enjoy the balcony view as it was raining that night. Although we made a reservation, it did take a while for our table to be ready as it was really crowded. The service was quick and someone explained the menu to us in a very detailed manner. The food was quite tasty and we especially enjoyed the dessert. Although the food was indeed quite pricey and might not be totally value for money, we appreciate the fact that there is a price to pay for such a gorgeous view. I'm not sure whether I will be coming back here anytime soon for the food but I would probably come back for a cocktail soon!

title: Excellent Asian fusion food
comment: If you like Japanese and Asian cooking this is one of the best. Excellent cooking, chic environment and impeccable service, a destination place that's vibrant and lively. Probably best if you're under 40 though as it's buzzy and not for parents and a quiet night of nice food. The food was superb, we had a mixture of everything (sushi, sashimi, kobe beef etc) and it was all exquisite, i'm not even a sushi fan and i loved it, these guys are experts. It's surprisingly well priced (for a high class place like this) just concentrate on the food and not on expensive wine would be my view. Booking essential, probably a couple of months in advance if you want Friday or Sat, but check. Enjoy!

title: Very good....BUT you'll be rushed.
comment: Took a friend here for dinner when I had previously been for lunch. My prior lunch visit was much better as I didnt feel we were being rushed out. So I'd recommend that if you want a relaxed meal to go when its likely to be less busy, ie in the week at lunch time.  I realise this place is expensive, its a destination restaurant and the food is excellent and interesting. However the Churrasco in particular is too expensive at £45 for the small amount of meat you get. In summary, go for an occasion but only expect a couple of hours max before you are hassled out or go for luch and relax and enjoy the food and view. Its a bit too pricey in my view but not crazy.

title: Top quality and tasty
comment: Top location (literally!) and excellent food. Ambience is quite unique and dinner aside there is a wide range of things that can be done, like having a cocktail on the terrace or in one od the bars indoors. Can't really go wrong with this place.

title: 2nd visit - better than the 1st; Terrific place but expensive
comment: The views are well noted. It was a sunny day last Saturday and we went to this terrific restaurant. It was my 2nd time and my wife's first. Had champagne in a rather shady part of the outer terrace facing the East End. All good. Inside - we just went mad and ordered and then ordered more. Food portions vary to the price. Sushi, salt squid, pork belly, prawns and a terrific (and large) seafood dish with green rice. Had two bottles of Sake - warm as it should be. Had coffee on the south facing terrace in the sunshine. The GM, Otto, popped over for a chat. The bill was £340 for three of us. We were there for three hours. Well worth it. Even the most miserable nit-picker would be hard pushed to find a fault.

title: Rude barmaid
comment: Took some colleagues here for a pre-dinner drink and was served by the rudest girl I have probably ever been served by in London. Spilt red wine all over the bottom of the glass and didn't wipe it up (I had to ask for a cloth to do it myself) then, when I asked for a receipt she was extremely unpleasant and mumbled something and walked off. It was clearly a huge inconvenience for her. When she finally got the receipt for me it was promptly shoved in my hand accompanied by a look of utter disgust. Perhaps she was having a bad day? But for the price of the drinks served here I really would expect much better service. She was really unpleasant. I have worked in bars myself and I appreciate it can be very hard work but they were not even that busy and I was polite. It was something we were all looking forward to but were very disappointed with.

title: 20th Birthday
comment: Incredible views even on a somewhat cloudy day, the lift ride alone is impressive. Food was 5*, waiter 'paced' the meal so nobody felt left out at any point, Kobe sliders and Tiger Maki Rolls were particularly excellent.  Service was good although we had a few wrong dishes brought over which the staff took off the bill. One spillage left a guest soaked in water, however the member of staff retired after taking them to the toilet with a complimentary drink.  In short, service could be improved, views and food are unique and make it very much worth it.

title: Excellent
comment: Came here for my Birthday with three friends on a very busy Friday night. Food was excellent as was the service. I had salt & pepper squid, samba london sushi and fillet steak with coconut rice. It was all delicious. My only gripe would be that whilst our waiter was very efficient, his strong accent made him almost impossible to understand. I will definitely be going back.

title: Superb
comment: My hubby took me there for dinner. We had to wait for a table over an hour which was a bit frustrating but they got us complimentary cocktails!  It was worth the wait, well worth! Highly recommend it. Simply superb - the atmosphere too.

title: Delicious food, amazing views and good vibes
comment: I've been here twice now, once with a group of friends for a birthday and once with my boyfriend for a date. Each time I've been I've had amazing food and fantastic cocktails. The music, the interior, the view and quirky touches here and there combine to create a fun but relaxed vibe.

title: great venue, good food
comment: Very impressed by the space, the view across the City of London and the food. Excellent service even though we just sat at the bar tables and the food was delicious.

title: A consistently wonderful experience
comment: I've now been to Sushisamba at least 5-7 times and it never fails to impress. While getting a table for dinner can be quite difficult nowadays, you can always also go as a walk-in for brunch on a weekend and you're sure to find a good spot. The staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable, and I'm sure they'll be great guides, but I wouldn't miss the Shrimp Tempura, the Black Cod and the El Topo.

title: If it were not for the service...
comment: However friendly the staff tried to be - they were really rushing us through the meal! The bill came when we were half way through desert and they kept asking if we had finished the main dishes even when we were eating. I understand there was a long queue for the table but to be honest they could have taken our orders more quickly instead of hurrying us up when we were trying to enjoy the food - which was much better than expected though!

title: Hideously ExpensiveAverage Food
comment: Booked Sushi Samba 3 months ago for partner's 40th birthday celebration. Requested window seat however our table was placed so only one of us got a view. Our main waitress (blonde foreign girl with black glasses) was attentive and incredibly helpful. However we had to wait 20 minutes for our drinks (not her fault) the cocktail glass was full to the top with ice so we essentially paid £15 for a shot of vodka and the congealed rice we ordered arrived after we'd eaten everything else. The tacitos and pork belly were delicious, sashimi and samba rolls VERY average, steak was well done even though we ordered it medium-rare. We were served by 4 different waiters throughout the evening who essentially threw our food on the table without explaining what it was and were asked to leave our table because our '2 hour time slot' was up, quite rude as we still had unfinished drinks and hadn't even been offered the dessert menu...considering the miniscule portion sizes and mostly average food this restaurant is very expensive...most of the staff are rude and pretensious yet still expect the service charge to be paid. A birthday let down, we won't be back...

title: Amazing, food, view, and customer service
comment: Great visit to SUSHISAMBA this weekend. My in-laws from Australia booked us a lunch for 6 on the weekend. Great first impressions as we walked into the building and jumped in the elevator to the 38th floor of the Heron Tower. Very smooth and fast ride to an amazing view. We were seated promptly and coats and bags taken without fuss. Beautiful decor, with well organised seating. We ordered a large selection from the menu for sharing, including Wagu beef (which was on special as it was Wagu week). The waiters were very engaging and helpful, all with great sense's of humour. When we ordered a bottle of wine from the sommelier and it wasn't what we expected, he took it away and asked us to choose another without hesitation. When we jokingly made a comment to our waiter about a possible discount because the weather was so terrible, he asked the manager over. The manager then proceeded to chat and joke with us for the next ten minutes. After learning we were all meeting up from different sides of the world he left and returned with champagne for all, so we could make the most of each others company. Overall….. a wonderful experience, great food, with fantastic staff. Thank you for making the time with my family such a perfect experience.

title: On the terrace
comment: Lovely lunch up on the 38th floor terrace on a beautiful day in May. Very good service, though a very small table and, as my guest commented, the guy who served us looked as though he worked for an Eastern European secret service with his dark suit and ear piece. Nice food. This is not cheap - £165 for two with no alcohol, dessert or coffees. However we're talking the City and it's a sensational location especially outside in the sunshine. My real negative is the state of the men's toilets - absolutely disgusting. Apart from a lack of cleaning, they are so shabby they look as though they've not seen paint in 20 years. Now how long has the Heron Building been built........?

title: Fushion with a view
comment: A trendy place at 38th floor. Very exciting menu and the food was excellent. Attentive and nice service. Since this is obviously a very popular and trendy place, there is a slight feeling of rush to eating here. The different meal came in a hasty order, giving you a slight feeling that they really wanted you to eat, pay and leave. I fully understand that this is not the place to linger, but even though, the hastiness was a bit too obvious to my taste. The outdoor bar was cool, but we only had a look, since the temperature was not tempting for an outdoor drink. Go if you want a combination of trend factor, view and new dishes.

title: Exceptionally rude staff
comment: It really is a shame that such a beautiful location with amazing potential lets itself down by providing such outrageously poor service. It is clear to see that the level of respect given to you directly corresponds to how much money you are prepared to spend in their establishment. I disagree fundamentally with anywhere that has such a disgraceful policy of reserving manners for the wealthiest of customers.  My friends and I dressed up for smart afternoon drinks, and headed up to the 39th floor (great ride in the lift). It was clear from the outset that as we were not dining in the restaurant we were not going to be treated with respect at all. The views are only good from one balcony on one side of the restaurant, which myself and a friend asked if we could quickly go out to when there was noone else out on the balcony. We were treated with absolute disgust; the waiter slammed down his pen, shrugged, and loudly complained to other staff about us. Is it really that surprising that after paying over £8 for a small 125 ml of glass of wine (very standard wine, price included service charge which was most definitely not deserved), I wished to have a quick look at the view which we had travelled across London to see?! I also saw a waiter blocking the path of a fellow customer who also wished to be allowed to appreciate the outdoor balcony and nice view! To clarify, the door was open to the outside balcony and noone was out there. So all in all, a real shame that rudeness ruined our afternoon drinks. Management clearly has no respect for customers

title: Interesting
comment: (A little late on the review, dined here about a month ago). We were running a little late on the night so I called the restaurant to inform, the lady over the phone certainly didn't mince her words nor thank me for calling, clear that turning tables around over customer service was more important. So we got there as quickly as possible but as it was raining quite heavily we couldn't really see a thing! The ambiance in the restaurant was lovely however and we were seated and served promptly. Our lovely waiter recommended lots of items from the menu and being greedy, we ordered it all. The flavours were interesting to say the least, melted cheese in the samba rolls? Hmmm. It was an experience however and the pork belly was, wow...melt in your mouth! I found the black cod unimpressive and it arrived very late. We were suitably stuffed but managed to work our way through the chocolate banana cake...yum! Overall, it was a positive dining experience but I'd try other restaurants before returning.

title: Fantastic place for an evening cocktail
comment: My wife and I came here for a pre-dinner cocktail, as we had seen some incredible photos on tripadvisor. The place certainly doesn't disappoint. You get into the restaurant through a seperate entrance and glass elevator, which whooshes up the side of the building at a rate of knots. The way you rapidly ascend from street level to above all the local buildings is breathtaking. Once inside, the restuarant and bars are spread over a number of levels. There is a very cool looking outside space which was closed on our visit (March), but looks to be worth investigating in sunnier weathers. We managed to grab a table to sit at on the upper floors, right by a window. The views out over the city were incredible. My wife had some decent fizz, and I had a couple of cocktails. I had a Cosmopolitan which was made with bone marrow - it sounds odd, but it was absolutely first-rate, I recommend you give it a go. we will be coming back here to eat, as it is a very funky and engaging space, with a great looking menu. If you are looking for somewhere to stop for a classy drink, I think this place does the job very well.

title: Thank you for a wonderful evening...
comment: Just back from a night out at Sushis Samba and delighted with the food and service. The manager took great care to make us feel welcome and our table waiter Pablo provided his authentic advice on the dishes to go for. The ambiance and food was fantastic... But I must say the staff really made our night special... The Black Cod is the best this side of London... Very impressed and defo recommend for a couples night out...

title: Only visit for food, not the bar
comment: Firstly I haven't eaten here, but the sushi did look fresh and very nice. We visited for a quick drink as we had heard the terrace bar was good. It isn't!! The view is non existent unless you sit inside, and you will pay £8 a bottle of beer for the privilege. The decor needs refurbishing for a city bar!!  I will try the food one day though, especially if I ca. Get a seat in the eastern terrace

title: Love!!
comment: Love the views, the decor, the atmosphere, the drinks and the wagu beef on hot rocks is divine! One of my new favourites when in London!

title: Come on, give us a smile and get an excellent as opposed to good!
comment: late lunch overlooking the roof tops of London, delirious Asian fusion food, fresh and really tasty. Great vodka tonic and wine with meal...it's all great except the staff who are obviously too cool to smile or talk at any level. It's cool, but not that cool and being that busy they should certainly have something to smile about! Come on, give us a smile! It's quite cool to be happy!

title: More then a restaurant, it's an experience
comment: Sushi Samba is more then a restaurant, it's an experience. When I have friends or family over I always take them here l. It starts with the glass elevator ride up that takes you to the 38th floor which is an exciting experience on it's own, it feels like you are taking of with a plane, the views of London are truly stunning. The bar area and restaurant look beautiful and there is even an outside area. Food is pricy but what do you expect at a place like this. Service is good as well.  I strongly recommend this place, make sure to make a reservation at least two weeks in advance when you are looking to go in the weekend.

title: Great place
comment: Nice atmosphere food excellent. Dinamic Place , is romantic, funny, ,elegant so for all kind of celebration sushi samba is a right choise.i'll back sooner.

title: Wow!
comment: My absolute favourite restaurant /view and experience in london! It's pricey and you only book for a couple of hours but the food is VERY good!!! You will need to book in advance as they are very busy, go for a special occasion it's quite an experience the service is excellent!

title: bad experience..
comment: came with friend for a drink on a sunday early around 4pm and we could not go just because of my friend was wearing converse trainers... while in the queue someone went through with trendy trainers...disappointed..

title: without imperfection
comment: although this is a relatively expensive restaurant it it without doubt one of the most special places in London to eat. Firstly the building itself is a trip within itself, the exhilarating glass lift transports you to a first class view over the city. the food and cocktails are exquisite, the flavours are unique and incredibly special. I never wanted the meal to end. there was no dish that was not outstandingly beautiful. having eaten in many high quality places before all around the world this was without doubt the top place for sushi.

title: Great Food Great Staff
comment: Me and my partner had come here on a Saturday night. The service was great and the food was amazing. The staff were very friendly and very helpful with suggestions. We were given the best table in the house upon request with an amazing view.  It was definitely a brilliant experience and I would recommend to visit here if in London.

title: One of the best restaurants in London!
comment: Excellent cocktails, Delicious gourmet starters and unmatched service from the staff. Totally worth the money spent. No wonder you cant get a table booking for months in advance. Would love to go there again just for the cocktails and starters.

title: Cocktails and view
comment: We went there just for a drink whitout reservation. Obviously there were no free tables and outside was pretty cold but we didn't care, the view up there is simply amazing! The cocktails are expansive: 15£  Nothing to complain about the quality of the drinks. They were definitely good, but really, 15 £ is too much.

title: Tastebud heaven!
comment: Based on many of the reviews on trip advisor, we just had to make a stop over to this restaurant. As we are not both such lovers, we were happy to see a complete menu to satisfy our needs. We decided on fish and a tofu plate whereby which the sauces, the presentation was well worth the price of the food.  The decor, the ambiance and the service was amazing. Upper levels had an inside bar as there is also a roof top bar which apparently is the highest one in Europe!  Well worth the visit, make sure you dress smart for this place as well as reserve a table as you will not have a prayer of eating there.

title: Good food, excellent location but prices and service slight let downs
comment: Cannot fault the quality of the food or the drinks, the food was very tasty and well presented - we particularly enjoyed the sashimi and the cerviche. However portions are not the biggest and the bill soon racks up as this isn't the cheapest of places.  Service was reasonable, as others have said you tend to get a number of different people serving you and so you don't get the feeling of being looked after that you get in other restaurants of this price range. The location is what makes it, the bar is a little cramped and getting tatty in places but the restaurant is fine and fantastic views.

title: Great view but overpriced
comment: Booked a table for drinks in the main restaurant for my sons birthday. Sadly the weather was bad, which impaired the long awaited view of London. Arrived on time at 11pm, to be told that we now could not sit in the restaurant unless we were eating. Plenty of free tables so why the problem? Head waiter was arrogant and somewhat rude. If you are planning a visit, either just go to the bar for a drink or take a large wedge of cash with you.

title: Fantastic experience
comment: I came for lunch with a colleague and had a absolutely fantastic experience. The fantastic view is a given, but it was the food and service that made this restaurant special. Our waitress was great with helping us choose from the vast menu. The sommelier was brilliant with the sake choices and even allowed us to have a taster of some sparkling sake (which we had not tried before). The food was perfect. Definitely one to visit.

title: Great food and service
comment: I came with my boyfriend last Sunday and everything was delicious! My favourite cocktail was one with Lychee, can't remember the name but definitely recommend. Also the food was fantastic, enjoyed everything really.  The waiter was French and the funniest and friendliest!  It's a must visit :)

title: great meal
comment: Although I'm not a big fan of sushi but I loved the food there , very tasty and well presented.had a meal with hubby and a friend and really enjoyed the ambience and food, staff were very helpful and nice. would love to go back again.

title: Discovering sushi again.. with astonishing view
comment: Name of the restaurant says everything. You can see and taste sushi in the form you have probably never did before. This comes with amazing view from Heron Tower. Maybe it is just me but because of rather small portions and tasting lots of different dishes I was always ending up with very solid bill in there.

title: Sushi sensational!!
comment: This was our second visit and both evenings have been hugely enjoyable. Reserve well ahead. This is a venue for a big glamorous exciting long night out with unbeatable views and a vibrant trendy atmosphere. Come in the knowledge that you may well be spending £100 a head for your evening and you should have a fantastic night out. We met for drinks at 7 in the bar on the outside terrace and managed to get a table. We moved in for dinner on plan at 8 30 in line with our reservation and left it to the excellent staff to feed us. The many different small plates were all excellent and tasty. The black cod was one of the best dishes ever. A Malbec and a Kiwi Sauvignon Blanc were pricey but just what you'd expect of a high end restaurant or hotel. After dinner we went over to one of the bars inside and sat by the window admiring the gherkin, the Thames and the rest of london below. All the staff who served us throughout the five hours we stayed were friendly and keen to ensure we had a great time.

title: Mr. Sunny
comment: Excellent food quality and service best expirence ever. Mr. Nando gives the best recomendation for food and excellent service. Thank you

title: great setting, complex flavours
comment: Okay so I had dishes from the vegan menu, which were pretty so so, but the 4 people I ate with had the normal menu and absolutely loved it. I believe the tempura shrimp was very popular, and the really expensive sushi - the one where you get 4 pieces on a plate! The We enjoyed the saki and the £50 white wine as well as the incredible setting. It was my girlfriend's birthday and they decorated the passion fruit cake with 'happy birthday' which was super kind. The atmosphere is quite posh, but all the staff were friendly enough to prevent that from feeling intimidating.

title: Tasty, tasty
comment: Took out my wife and son for dinner during our visti. Very good service and extremely good food that has a great taste

title: Great but paying for the view
comment: Great food , we love sushi and we loved the twist on the food, the only slight negative and i mean slight, is the price you pay for the view, and a great view of London it is .

title: Good food
comment: The food is great on the pricey side but it is fresh fair done well. Atmosphere is great, only issue the last couple of times has been the service, relatively slow and not very attentive.

title: Fantastic Views! Good Food!
comment: This was our first visit to Sushisamba - we were drawn by the menu and the view. The place was crowded on a Sunday night. Definitely make reservations! It is mostly an Asian-Peruvian fusion menu. The waiters will make recommendations if asked, which it is probably a help. It was disconcerting however in that we had 4-5 different waitstaff during our meal. Things we loved: Black Cod Robato; Yellowtail Tiradito with Lemongrass and Jalapeno Sauce; Mixto Ceviche (with Octopus); London Roll with Wagyu Beef, Yellowtail Tuna, Shrimp,, Scallop, and Whitefish; Tiger Maki: Eggplant with Mustard and Soy: and Grilled Asparagus with Sweet Soy. The Moqueca Mista sounded interesting, but fell short. Desserts were excellent: With Love From Rio (Coffee mousse, Chocolate ganache and Vanilla ice cream) and Chocolate Banan Cake with Rum ice cream were favorites. Overall, food was excellent but we thought overpriced. Service was of uneven quality and due to the many different servers, we never felt that we were truly taken care of.  Cocktails were mediocre. We are not sure if we will give it another try, though the views are fantastic! It is a short walk from the Liverpool tube station.

title: Ok food but massively over priced, insincere service. Style over substance, just come for a cocktail and the view.
comment: I was very excited to visit Sushisamba after reading positive reviews and a recommendation from a couple of friends. I was also excited to be treating a special friend for her 40th birthday. We both love sushi and I thought that this would be the perfect setting. We arrived ok and ordered a cocktail at the bar. Fairly expensive cocktail prices but this wasn't an issue, it was more the 12.5% service charge that was compulsory...even though we were ordering at the bar. Never mind I thought, it's a treat for my friend. We then walked down to the restaurant and checked in with the girl on the front desk, we were then taken to our table by another member of staff. I'd asked for a window seat when I booked 3 months in advance. We did have a window seat, but the only view was the outdoor terrace. Ah well. A third member of staff came over to give us the menu, then a fourth member of staff came over to explain the menu and make some recommendations. Strangely, almost all the recommendations he made were the most expensive items on the menu, which we both found distasteful. We both found the waiter very insincere, as though he was reading a script. The wine list was extensive but eye-wateringly expensive.
