I hadn't planned on ordering the cheapest bottle as I was treating my friend, but the cheapest bottle was just under £40, which I think is ridiculous. But, as I did have a budget, that's what I ordered. The wine was very average, and not cold enough when it was served. My local Sainsbury's do a bottle of Languedoc for £8.50 which tastes far better than the wine we had. I ordered a range of dishes for us to share, and then we waited for the food. We didn't have to wait long, but the food was brought out by a fifth member of staff. We started with some deep fried squid with a dipping sauce. Some of the pieces were sliced too thinly so had dried out during the cooking process, and the dipping sauce just tasted like vinegar. My local Vietnamese restaurant does a deep fried squid dish that is better. Some of the other dishes were better - a ceviche, and sushi, and the star of the night was some delicious fresh sashimi which we couldn't fault. The service however, was not up to standard. In total we counted 9 different staff that we had encountered since arriving at the restaurant. It didn't feel like we were being 'looked after' by one particular member of staff, and it felt very much like a production line. One of the sushi dishes had a physalis garnish, which I wanted to eat after the sushi, but as soon as I had eaten the sushi, the plate was whisked away. The waitress also cleared our plates even though we had said we might want to look at the menu again if we hadn't quite ordered enough. Our glasses of wine were topped up constantly, even though we sometimes refused the top up - firstly, because both of us like to have a smaller amount of white wine in our glasses so it doesn't get warm, and also there was no way I could order a second bottle at that price. And when the waiter poured the last glasses for us from the bottle, he took it away with wine still in the bottom of the bottle - at least another half glass! After dinner we went to the bar for another cocktail, but I had to wait over 10 minutes to be served at the bar, and again a 12.5% service charge was added. So, overall - a special location with amazing views, so I would recommend friends to go for a cocktail, but perhaps not in the evening so they didn't have to wait so long. But the rest of the experience was very disappointing. I knew the meal would not be cheap - that was the whole point - I was treating my friend. I have eaten in many of London's top restaurants, so I know what excellent meals should taste like, and how much they cost, and what service should be like, at those prices. But I have had much better food in less swanky establishments - my local Vietnamese & turkish restaurants, a favourite little sushi place in Angel - at a fraction of the cost. If those prices are going to be charged, then the quality of the food, wine and service must match up. My friend still enjoyed her treat, but I felt absolutely gutted that I could have spent the money better elsewhere. Sadly I won't visit again.

title: Amazing view, food but, but, but
comment: Would have been 2/5 if it wasn't thanks to the location and the very good kitchen. Service is very lousy. We had to wait 30 min for our drinks and also had to order from seven (!) different service people, despite spending a total of GBP 450. Their sashimi is great, including the  Kobe beef. Amazing views

title: Great buzz!
comment: This place has a real buzz about it and the interior and stunning views make it very special.  Our waiter was fantastic, recommending the perfect selection of dishes and the food really was incredible. However...they have a serious drain problem, the toilets smelt like a sewage factory and this smell was also apparent on the "exquisite" terrace outside. So overall it was an amazing experience but if you're planning romance I'd check that they've sorted their plumbing out first or you could find yourself explaining to your beloved all evening that "seriously it's not me it's the city of London sewers".

title: Lived up to the reputation about which we'd heard!
comment: My husband and I, and our daughter and son-in-law had a wonderful meal at Sushi Samba in London. Our daughter had said it was supposed to be very good, pretty pricey, and had an amazing view. She was spot on, and we enjoyed it very much! I tried to take pics of everything we had, but there were a few dishes I missed. We shared everything, and every single dish they brought was delicious!!!

title: Amazing
comment: One of the best meals we have had. Great food, great service. Yes it is expensive, but you get what you pay for.

title: Posh but great location
comment: On the 40th floor of famous Heron tower. Booking beforehand is a must otherwise there is almost no way you can get a table for dinner. The food quite delicious, especially the sushi. The waiters are from all around Europe but their English is quite understandable.

title: Excellent meal
comment: The view is in itself worth the dinner with wonderful views over London. The service was also of the highest standards. The food was overall very good - the spicy tuna roll is probably the best I've ever had, and the grilled cod with miso is also very much recommended.  It fell slightly short of 5 stars on some of the other dishes, in particular the vegetable tempura and tuna ceviche, which did not match the quality of the sushi. And the very hefty price tag does leave you wondering how much of it is due to the view premium rather than the food itself.

title: Great atmosphere
comment: Been to a Sushi Samba for lunch with girl friends recently and was impressed by the menu. Best sushi I ever had!!! I can not say the view is the best I have seen - Galvin at windows is still my favourite in London- but atmosphere was lovely. Found it quite pricey, but I guess that`s expected. Mixture of the staff as some was excellent and had provided the best service where as some was not really paying attention (some waiters bumped into my and my friends chair couple of times) at all.

title: SUSHI SAMABA Restaurant - excellent cuisine and service
comment: Had a rather unfortunate experience when visiting the restaurant the last time when it had to close due to a fire emergency in their building which rather but a dampener on my arrangements for a major anniversary. However re-booked and Sushi Samaba pulled out all the stops to make up for it which was really appreciated. Restaurant is on the 38th Floor of the Heron Tower next to Liverpool Street station. On arrival courteous receptionist advised our table was being prepared and to have a drink at the bar for 5 minutes - girl behind bar was busy so didn't get a drink but before you knew it our table was ready and were shown to a fabulous banquette table with magnificent views over North London. Restaurant Manager acknowledged previous hiccup and presented us with a complimentary dish of seared tuna and Peruvian red potato which was really nice. Ordered an Asahi Beer each - although really should have gone for one of the many saki on offer, and bottled sparkling water. Started off with Miso soup - very nice with different types of mushroom followed by Shrimp tempura and Suzuki usuzukuri(white raw fish on bed of pickled veg and sauce) - excellent. Next had fillet teriyaki and kanpachi tiradto (raw white fish with truffle oil) -really well prepared and wonderful. Next we ordered Samba roll (8 pieces of mixed sushi, colourful and different) and Tiger Maki. Their sushi is really different with texture, crunch and excellent flavours and not "gluey". We meant to stop here - but couldn't resist another round so settled on Lobster taquitos (lobster in tacos type shell) and yellow tail taquitos. Mouth watering and well worth it. To top it all we were then presented with a desert of rum baba type cakes(without the rum) on a bed of sweet icing and thin biscuit shells and when they discovered it was my birthday as well presented us with a candle lit macaroon!  Well needless to say I had a absolutely fabulous time and experience - cuisine is extremely fresh, different and a whole new complexion on traditional Japanese food - a fusion of South American and Japanese - which is for the better. Service was impeccable, informative and friendly. Highly recommend SushiSamba . Our bill for 2 including service of 12.5% was £156 - well worth every penny!

title: Excellent
comment: Having never eaten sushi before I was slightly apprehensive about going to Sushi Samba. These fears vanished immediately as I stepped inside the impressive glass lift and arrived at the restaurant. I was greeted by a friendly member of staff who specifically cleared a table by the window to allow me to look at the fantastic views. The views are second however to the food which is excellent. The only downside is that it is a little pricey but with views like that who cares! I would certainly recommend Sushi Samba, even to those who aren't massive sushi fans!

title: Excellent Japanese cuisine with a Brazilian atmosphere and a view
comment: I highly recommend the place for the cuisine, for the view, for the decorating, for the vibe.All the ingredients are there to have a wonderful time. The cod was excellent probably the best I ever had.

title: Arrogant, Overrated, The only good thing is the view
comment: When you book 8 weeks ahead as it's the only way to get in to dinner, they say do NOT BE LATE or your table will be given away. So we arrived 20 minutes early for a 22.00 table. Having sat at the the over priced bar and given the reception as much pressure as possible we sat down to eat at 22.50. 50 minutes late with hardly an apology. We said it showed absolutely no respect to clients who spend decent money to eat a nice meal. They offered us 2 glasses of champagne to apologise. These were warm so we told them to take them back. And the brand was a cheapie!!! The food was Ok but nothing more. Sushi was 6 out of 10. Black Cod 9 out of 10, Nothing that you would write home about. They offered us free some green bean tempura - so generous.  We then had Mochis for dessert. They said 6 - but it was 6 halves - so 3.  They were also the worst Mochi's we have had anywhere. This restaurant is over hyped and frankly a rip off. with arrogant un caring staff, except our waiter!!! Thank god for the view

title: Excellent food and views
comment: Amazing location. But most importantly amazing food. I wasn't sure what to expect from half Japanese half Brazilian but it was utterly fabulous. Very vibrant fresh tastes that made me think I was being healthy (I'm sure I wasn't). Service was prompt and friendly although I wish they could have just left water on the table rather than always popping back to top up. I'll definitely be back.

title: Amazing as always
comment: Sushi Samba never fails to impress, great food great staff!!! Only thing that could be improved on is the time it takes to get a cocktail at the bar or at your table, other then that it was fabulous!!!'

title: High end prices for delicious food
comment: Location is great, go at night to appreciate the atmosphere, lighting and views. Food is delicious but portions are small and bill can rack up at a rate of knots so beware. Bill with bottle of wine (£40), 2 cocktails, and 5 small dishes between was £275. Had to eat again later.

title: Brilliant
comment: Came here for a business lunch with 5 others, the restaurant is on the 38th floor of the Heron Building in Bishopsgate, London. You start with a very quick glass fronted lift ride so get to see out across London as you travel up. When you arrive you are get a very friendly greeting and are shown into the bar area which was very lively. There is a sushi bar there where you can see the chefs working away making sushi. Once led through to the main restaurant you get a true feel of the class of this restaurant and the wonderful décor. The waiters are obviously well trained and knowledgeable about the dishes on the menu and are happy to explain what's on offer. As none of us had been here before our waiter suggested that we go for a mixture of dishes which we all agreed was probably best and basically we left it to him to choose the selection of dishes. We had far too many to go through in detail but everything we had was excellent. My favourites were probably a prawn dish and the lamb chops. But really all were just fantastic. There's a good selection of wines and cocktails, although my one criticism would be that the cocktails were a bit too strange for me. Cucumber cocktail! Just glad I wasn't paying the bill. Would definitely love to go again.

title: Bar girl with blonde dreadlocks - you spoilt the experience, luv
comment: We had been to Duck and Waffle and wanted to check out Sushisamba which is a few floors down. It was a bit chilly but we wanted to have a drink outside and admire the view. Err problem - there is no view so be warned. There is however a beautiful orange leafed tree outside which is lit up - be lovely in summer. Drinks are extortionate! A bottle of beer 7 quid! A cocktail 12 and don't forget service charge 12.5%. Didn't have food but looked equally as extortionate. If I am paying this much money I expect good service and that ain't what we got. Foreign bar girl with ratty blonde dreadlocks (you know who you are) totally ignored us when we went to the bar and then went: what do you want then? Then dismissed us with a flick of her rat tails and didn't do much as smile. To sum up, it was an average experience and we certainly won't waste our money going back.

title: Nice view
comment: We went for a nightcap on the upstairs floor. . The guards at the ground floor were very polite. The ride up was fun. When we got in we feel the vibe of the place which was very nice. We found a nook at the side whith a view of the gherkin. It was a lovely evening.

title: The black cod is superb!
comment: We dropped in on the off-chance one Saturday afternoon in February, around 3.30pm, expecting that we would be able to get a table without any problem.  However, this restaurant is so popular - and rightly so - that we could only get seats at the sushi bar. As it turned out, this was absolutely fine. We enjoyed the same menu as the main restaurant and we got all the buzz from the bar. The views are spectacular and the food is amazing. We went with the waiter's recommendation and he was spot on with every dish. The cocktails are also out of this world. It's not cheap, but as a special treat, it's thoroughly recommended.

title: Wow!
comment: As the title reads..wow! This place is a real gem. We booked here for Saturday night dinner. Shown to our table by a friendly host and then waitress took a drinks order in a timely manner. food was exceptional and the view outside was magical. Considering all this it wasn't as expensive as I thought. Would defiantly recommend and return!

title: Excellent view, ambiance, food and service
comment: This restaurant was just great. Very pricey but worthed every penny. Every dish was great. View, ambiance also hard to match. Couldn't be better. Loved it

title: Excellent food, great ambiance
comment: We arrived a tad early at the venue and unfortunately our table was not ready yet. We were invited to sip a drink at the bar. The music played rather loud and the place was very crowded. Although it was a bit chilly, we sat outside at the orange leafed tree. When we got to our table we were greeted by a lovely waiter whom aided us in choosing a dish. We got a lovely cocktail and some samba rolls and I have to say it was the best sushi I had so far. Certainly it was an expensive evening but it was more than worth it. Would go again.

title: Absolutely disgusting experience
comment: I have never encountered such rude and disgraceful staff as we did on visiting Sushisamba yesterday.  We had travelled up and hour and a half on my mother-in-laws birthday for some cocktails. We had been told on the phone to get there around 3 for a good chance of just having drinks, so we did. We were greeting by a rude man on the door who looked us up and down, demanded to know the ages of the party of 5 (all 21 to 60) and told us to come back two and a half hours later.  We stayed in the local area waiting until 6.30 when we believed we would be able to enter.  Upon re-arrival the same gentleman told us we couldn't go in. He said my partner, who was dressed in a shirt, black jeans, black leather shoes and a Barber coat, was dressed "too casual". My partner asked him why he couldn't have told us this 2.5 hours earlier instead of telling us to come back and us waiting nearby for all this time. The man, who said he was the manager, was extremely obnoxious and snooty, answered that he didn't notice what he was wearing earlier. He then said my partner was "too scruffy" for the venue which was absolutely ridiculous given what he was wearing was just as smart as others entering.  The said manager was raising his voice and upsetting my mother in law who just wanted a nice birthday. He then went on to say "well fine you can't go in because SHE (pointing to me) is wearing sneakers". I had on suit trousers, a black roll neck top, a smart overcoat, and all black smart "sneakers"/pumps.  What came next is, I'm afraid, just disgusting for any member of staff, let alone a manager. As we walked away, having been embarrassed and judged, the man followed my partner walking away from the door, raising his voice and looking to provoke an argument. He had to be stopped by the security man next to him.  I've never encountered such unprofessionalism and absolute rudeness by any staff, let alone manager. I am a journalist for a national lifestyle magazine and attend similar venues regularly but had never been to Sushisamba. I had been looking forward to the visit but was left shocked, appalled and upset at how the family birthday had been ruined. I've never encountered such shocking behaviour in any other restaurant or bar before and would suggest you  avoid this place.

title: A Fantastic Experience
comment: Visited last night and had a fantastic time. The staff were friendly and helpful, all of them smiled and said good evening. Our table was ready on time and we were not rushed at all. This was my first experience of Japannese food and all of it was delicious, especially the black cod. The atmosphere was great if a little noisy. Not sure how much the meal cost as my son paid the bill but I'm sure it was worth every penny. Would definitely return.

title: Lift was the highlight of the evening
comment: We had a reservation for 8.15. Arrived at 8.10 and had to wait until 8.30 to be noticed. A strict looking blond woman looked at my 14 year-old son and announced "minors are not allowed in the bar area and I will do my best to accomodate you. I will move people around so that you will have a table as soon as possible. But you must stay at this place and not move." I actually pre-informed them on the phone that I would be coming with my 14 year-old son. They seemed happy about it. Eventually we were seated (and we were made feel like a great favour was done for us). That is to take into account that on the phone they said "make sure you arrive on time or you will lose your reservation". The waitresses and waiters were roaming around, giving us empty smiles but once they realised we were not interested in their wine list they completely lost interest in us. When they finally took our order and delivered half of it, we had to chase up for the rest. In the end we had about 3/4 of what we ordered but were tired of the experience and asked for the bill. 12.5% of service charge was added (although there was no indication of this on the menue or anywhere on the website). It's ok. We did not quibble. But it was amusing that (as I paid in cash) the waiter disappered with extra £15 on the top of the total an it took him 10 minutes to come back (even though I could actually see him at the till standing and waiting for us to go). Out of principle I was not prepared to let that money go (they just did not deserve it in my opinion). In the end he brought me the change and literally threw it on the table in front of me. Yuck. What an unstylish way to treat customers. I thought it was rude throughout. And to expect a mother with a teenager to order wine in front of her child - that is disgusting. There was a positive moment of course. Trip up and down the lift was an exciting experience and also the view from the windows was stunning. If you have not got a "minor" you will also be allowed to the terrace - where I think you could see a lot more. Well, that was our day out. Hope that it will be helpful. Also, I must say that the place is intended for you to spend as much money as possible. They expect you to leave a lot of your earnings there (including tips on top of service charge). Some dishes are several hunderd pounds (one is £1000). If you are on a middle income staff looks humiliatingly down at you. You start feeling like the heroine of Julia Roberts in Pretty Woman...

title: Great food
comment: The food and the cocktails here were absolutely delicious. Desperate to go back so we can try some more of the menu!

title: Diabolical cocktail and unpleasant visit
comment: After wanting to go for a while my wife and I thought we would pop up for some cocktails. We perused the cocktail menu and settled on a kaffirhina (caiprhina with kaffirihnia lime leaves) 14 pounds each which I was happy to pay for a decent cocktail and also the views. I can almost not describe how dissapointing the cocktail was devoid of any flavour it tasted like sugar water. With no fresh limes muddle into the drink it had two old and sad looking wedges place on top. There was four kaffir lime leaves (not fresh looked like it was taken off someone's old thai green curry) place on top and the actual drink being void of any of this flavour too. They placed a gallon of ice in the drink actually having a mound well exceeding the rim if the glass. Me and my wife took the first sip and both decided we needed to complain. We got the attention of the barman and complained he looked at us with some distaste and said there was nothing wrong with it. He took out the bottle of cashacha and directed us to smell the bottle. I pointed out that on the menu it specifically said made with leblon cashacha and the brand he gave us to smell wasn't. He muttered it was premium and that he made the cocktail and it was fine - remember the customer is always wrong must be a motto for sushi samba staff. After sipping down three measly sips of the rest of our sugar water we left dejected and dissapointed despite.

title: Worth the long elevator ride for the food and service
comment: Although the "unique blend of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian culture and cuisine" seems a little odd at first, since it's mostly tapas-style small portions to share, it works, weirdly. Service was prompt, friendly (although we felt a little pressed to order quickly) and we didn't have a bad food item. Our favorites were the black cod, the pork belly, the tempura shrimp and the taquitos. Don't place too much hope on the cocktail bar, though - the servers were inexperienced and working in a complete mess, while the clientele were the local city folk getting super-drunk, super-fast, with no intention of dining there. The roof terrace looked beautiful, but it was closed for high winds.

title: Cannot be faulted!
comment: My daughter's 21st. Superb friendly service. Menu was exceptional. Food was an experience. We all loved the various plates that we shared, especially the sushi rolls and tempura (much better than the meat dishes). Desserts to die for! Ride up and down in the glass lift was a great treat. Would thoroughly recommend for a special occasion. Bar scene afterwards was buzzing.

title: smart friendly good food good service good views
comment: Great place for dinner with friends or just someone special, recommend the back cod very tasty sadly disliked salt & pepper squid

title: Great location, disappointing meal, woeful customer service
comment: The location is excellent and it's worth going just for that. Most of the food is excellent but on both the occasions I've been, the waiter has forgotten part of our meal. The most recent time he forgot a sushi dish and one of the mains, which never turned up - unfortunately the waiters memorise rather than write down your order. A disappointing meal. It took 3 emails of complaint to get a response from Sushi Samba regarding this, and then nohing... Customer service leaves a lot to be desired. It's a great location, but if you want good sushi with service that matches, go to Zuma or Roka.

title: Excellent, vibrant & unique!
comment: For my 30th birthday my girlfriend surprised me with a trip to London and on her itinerary was a stop off at Sushisamba as she knows I like the different side to life. As you approach the Herron building your experience starts. Entering at ground floor the glass fronted lift races you up 39 floors minimising London below to a model size town in seconds. As you reach the 39th floor your anticipation and excitement grows exponentially. As the doors of the lift open you walk through a dark mood evoking corridor and out into a bury of life. People talk of "vibe" this place had it! There was cocktails everywhere people at the sushi bar it was great. We were greeted by a very energetic staff member who guided us to reception. Here they swiftly and pleasantly navigated us to the main dining arena. What a space lighter than light with a view of practically the whole of London stunning! The decor was right up my street you could sense the design was centred around the three cultures fused into one.  Our very friendly waiter was the highlight of my meal he he guided us through the menu and suggested ideas to make a nice selection of bites as it was our first time eating there. He continued to be attentive and efficient till the very end.  We order a selection of bites from the menu such an unusual taste experience but however it worked exceptionally well. Stand out dishes were the black cod and the tiger maki rolls. We also order a cocktail each as we thought they would be fitting with our meal, once again our waiter was helpful in advising us on taste and pallet. I must say I am 100% a real ale man but these none pretentious cocktails were brilliant so light and refreshing. As we recieved our bill we more than happy to pay and the matradie asked if everything was ok and I replied "excellent especially the service"! I also mentioned in a passing comment that it was my 30th birthday. As we approached the lift to leave the matradie rushed out with a happy birthday macaroon with a candle in!! I thought that was a really nice touch even though it made me blush a little!  Overall this experience left me leaving with a smile which not many restraunts achieve well done you are clearly doing it right. I would strongly recommend people try sushisamba even if it's just for after work drinks. Love it!

title: Unique experience!
comment: Hello, A couple, dinning for the first time at sushisamba. Thank you so much for this unique high in the sky experience. From being introduced to our seat, our lovely waiter Edison came to welcome us and give us the whole concept in few words. Recommending dishes from the menu, aware of my allergies he was very understanding. The wine list is good and varied in prices. The sommelier has interesting stories about wine, I am sure that he has plenty more for you if you care to learn! Lovely food, I recommend the black cod was splendid! All the staff around is super professional and happy to be there, and very helpful. Big thanks to the floor manager would changes us table at the beginning. And big shout out to Mantas who made us the whole tour until duck and waffles for a last drink. Best regards

title: Pretty nice view... A bit expensive though
comment: We have been there for special occasion and we were delighted with the place, very nice design, very good food and brilliant view from the 40th floor of the City.. If I had a negative point to highlight it would be the price...

title: Amazing food, stunning view and great staff.
comment: I had dinner here the other night, it was a Monday but the place was still buzzing and had a great atmosphere. The view is amazing and the roof terrace is really cool for before dinner drinks. The food is off the clock good and in particular the black cod and rock shrimp tempura are hard to beat! great for a special occasion or just a more interesting night out.

title: Fabulous
comment: I went here with a friend on a Friday night at about 9PM Cocktails were gorgeous and the atmosphere was lovely- quite hard to find a seat but people are constantly coming and going so would just advise you keep an eye open! Quite scary fires when it's windy but that just meant we were nice and warm and also views are fab!  Worth a visit!!

title: Amazing views, Amazing food & cocktails
comment: We had a brilliant time here back in freezing cold January. We waited in the cocktail lounge and enjoyed the views. We couldn't fault the food or cocktails. Dessert was to die for. After we went outside to the terrace, kept warm around a roaring external fire and took in the views of London. We are planning to return.

title: Fabulous
comment: The view.. the food.. the service and the drinks.. it was definitely worth the price and experience..  I was immediately made to feel welcomed in Sushi Samba.. would deffo visit again  The veggie options are outstanding!

title: Could be great...
comment: ...but isn't. This was our third visit and each time we go in the hope that Sushisamba will finally live up to its potential - and each time we are disappointed. We will not be going back. If like us you weren't organised enough to be at your PC exactly 2 months before your dining date, you probably got an odd time slot (we were at 9.15pm). So far no problem - the anticipation (and a snack) will probably make that work.  Sadly, the anticipation was the best part.  On the day, we arrived slightly early and were told to wait. Kept waiting while the girls at reception chatted with customers that did not have reservations and were trying to sweet talk them into giving them a table. I don't know if giving away unreserved tables is a side business but the girls were happy to ignore the line of customers with reservations to go on chatting.  Having been seated late, we gave our drinks order immediately and asked to give the food order in 5 mins. Drinks arrived 20 mins later - odd because we only ordered beer and wine - and they got that wrong too. Kept waiting for the right drinks - no sign of them for about 30 further minutes.  Taking a pause from the horror, one must admit the food has maintained its high standards - the tiger maki is great as are some of the other rolls. Black cod was decent (although nothing comes close to Nobu) and shrimp tempura was also good. However, the overall experience leaves you dissatisfied at best, angry at worst. Everything from the exclusive night-club like velvet rope at the entry to the glass lift up 38 floors and the great decor/view/music and even food set the stage for an evening that ultimately disappoints - and that really takes some doing!

title: Insulting
comment: I have been to the main restaurant twice before and have had a very nice time. However the 39th Floor 'annex' is a different experience. The Sunday evening jazz band were extremely good but the volume in the room next to the bar was so high it was difficult to have a conversation. The service was appalling and the minute menu made it difficult to choose anything that was appealing. The waiter told us he wasn't able to deliver food from the main restaurant - I've no idea why they couldn't bring it up 1 flight of stairs and whether the bar has a separate kitchen, doubtful. The drinks took forever to arrive, the food too. We had at least 4 if not 5 different people serving us and the service was an utter shambles. The portions were microscopic but the prices were anything but! The idea of a jazz band in the bar is a great idea on a Sunday evening but treating the food-eating customers as an inconvenience and afterthought is totally unacceptable. I will stick to Roka from now on.

title: Good food but nothing else
comment: It's spectacular to go upwards with the elevator and enjoy the view from there. To the Sushisamba itself its fair to say the only reason to go there is the food because service and atmosphere are not what someone expects and the restaurant claims themselves. The main course was served before the starters arrived. Somewhen later finally our wine arrived but no one cared that we had finished our meal at least half.

title: a experience in beautiful surroundings
comment: I went to this restaurant not sure what to expect you definitely have to book in advance and confirm on the day, as its very popular and busy first you go into a lift of which you go up to the 38 floor and see the whole of London has a terrace to sit and a sushi bar, but I did the restaurant you have the table for 2 hours if you 2 people and longer for more so check that as well, the food is wonderful and tasty and service is good and not cheap and not dear I think for three of us the bill was 250 pounds but we have 4 starters 2 mains and salad and one desertand bottle champagne and beautiful seeting

title: A brilliant Experience
comment: I was lucky enough to get a table at the last minute and we had a wonderful evening. The food was wonderful, the view amazing and the staff very attentive. We were able to take drinks on the outside patio underneath the amazing orange coloured tree. The bar staff were very knowledgeable and worked the bar correctly, no-one felt that they were being served at the incorrect time. I will definitely be back. I thought that the atmosphere was electric and the you felt that you could hold a conversation with your table without being overheard and without having to shout either. I loved the roof with the bamboo effect that seemed to frame the view of London wonderfully. It is a shame that you cannot see very far west but the views North, East and South are breathtaking.

title: Supersonic Sushi!
comment: My husband took me as a birthday treat after having had his work's Christmas party there. The atmosphere, food, drinks, service and view are all fabulous, not to mention the supersonic ride to the top of Heron Tower! We arrived at 7.30pm (last Friday, mid April) so we were able to appreciate the change from dusk to dark as London and the restaurant slowly lit up.  I was a little confused to begin with as to how the menu worked, so bear in mind you choose a selection of plates and share them. We had five between two of us but no dessert. I couldn't begin to say which was the best though.  It's definitely got the wow factor and is a great place for a group of friends.

title: Lovely lunch
comment: Just a minute walk from Liverpool street station on the grand Heron Tower floor39, wisking you up on an amazingly fast lift, ears popping. We got a wildo table with views over London. The menu its a bit cryptic so the waiter would offer you to recomend a few items. We agreed and the food its delicious. Cocktails are great but at £18 some of them you have to control yourself a bit.  Been on a separate occassion for just drinks. And the terrace has a lovely atmosphere. Theres a beautiful lit tree by the bar. Quite expensive. But great restaurant. Great treat.

title: Awesome food & view.
comment: Great sushi and totally sick place (on the top of the skyscraper) with a crazy view. Ideal for celebrating life.

title: The most terrible restaurant experience of my life
comment: Dear Sushisamba, I love your food, your cocktails, the view from your bar, even your orange tree! Really, I love it. I just have one problem: I feel like you go out of your way to make your customer feel the opposite of being valued for their custom! I have dined in your restaurant in the past. I absolutely loved the experience - perhaps because I was in a party of 10, and we spent around £200 per head. The food was great. Service not to write home about, but adequate.  This evening however, I felt extremely disappointed. Again, your cocktail was great. The view was great. The orange tree was great. I even discovered the monkey in your tree, that was great too. The evening took a little turn when I fancied nothing on your menu but a little glass of Japanese plum wine - I see it at the bar, and had it in my first cocktail, but apparently you can't serve it to me because there is no button to push on your till. Fair enough, I had another cocktails with something sprayed on top to satisfy my food-colouring craving of the day.  I said to my partner, let's try get some food. He enquired with a member of staff, waiting time 1.5 hours, but apparently we can wait for seating at the bar. Fair enough I thought, we didn't book. 30 mins later, a couple got up and left. Having waited behind them for long enough I jumped in the chair. Great, I thought, let's order! A waiter came over: you should have asked to be seated over there, there might be a queue, let me check. 'Oh ok, I'm sorry we didn't know.' I replied. 'We did ask and the lady told us to wait for seats at the bar. Please can we have a menu?' 20 mins later, we watched as the same waiter disappeared into the restaurant area with a tray of drinks. Having given up on ever getting a menu from him, we asked another waitress she brought it to us within 30 seconds. The waiter returned, apparently a little annoyed that we couldn't wait for him. 'How many rolls are in the samba rolls dish?' I asked. 'Wait, he said. Let me explain you the menu.' Another 20 mins passed before he eventually returned and took our order. During this time I watched him flirt with the girls at the other end of the bar. Another 25 mins passed before our food eventually arrived. I was too tired at this point to enjoy my food (this was past 11pm on a school night). I have been around on the London social scene for a decade. I understand the need for a lovely place like sushisamba to sometimes be a little snobby - some people feel the harder they have to work to get a table the more they want to come here. Then they can boast to their mates. After all, you can't make it as easy as it is to get a table at dirty dicks down the road. But really, this was the most terrible service I have received. I want to come back and rate your place to my friends, please give me a reason to. Kind regards, A disappointed customer

title: Great sushi, great views
comment: As sushi in the City goes, it's expensive. The views and atmosphere, however, are well worth paying for. The outside drinks terrace (with the infamous illuminated tree) is great for an aperitif in the summer.

title: Great view
comment: To start with, note that there is dresscode in Sushi Samba, in particular regarding the shoes. They seem to be very strict about it. The elevator is fun to ride, since you admire the view in extra speed. We went to the bar (almost 40th floor) and overall it was really nice, but not amazing. The bartenders were fun to watch and if you manage to find some space by the stair between the two upper floors, the view is indeed great. Overall, we enjoyed it and I recommend it. There is also a balcony and it must be really nice to be there in summer.

title: Great food and service
comment: Went for a work lunch. The staff is very polite and really at your service. They explained the menu to us and suggested recommended dishes. Had a selection of sharing plates loved the scallop seviche and the dish with quail egg. But everything was really good. The dessert was superb. Had the chilli chocolate dish. Truly amazing to the palate and eyes. This lunch really deserves 10 out of 10.

title: A sensory sensation
comment: Stunning views over London and really delicious food and drinks. The atmosphere is very calm and pleasant and to my surprise, not half as pretentious as I had expected. All the staff were very friendly. Our waiter was Italian and knew how to do his job very well. At the end of the meal He gave us a personalised dessert. A great, unique experience.

title: Lovely vibe with great views
comment: The views are amazing. The bar is a little small and slow in service but I guess being a cocktail bar that is the nature of it.  Only went there for drinks and prices were a bit high but great for a special occasion.

title: Very nice place, though waiters can be rude and arrogant
comment: We have visited Sushisamaba several times, food and cocktails are fantastic, the view is great. though the bar staff can be unbelively rude and arrogent, ignoring the customer, don't go there expecting good customer service. We had to complain when we were there last time, they appologied and offered complimentary drinks to us, but the rude behaviour of the bar staff really ruined our night, which was supposed to be nice and fun.

title: Average to indifferent service, nice food.
comment: Nice very expensive food with lovely views. I arrived with my niece and nephew to an unfriendly and off-putting doorman who asked me 20 questions before he deemed me acceptable to be let in ie where was I going, did I have a reservation, my name etc. My husband who arrived separately had the same uncomfortable experience. My daughter (aged 22) arrived shortly after and was waved in with a smile and a have a nice evening. Perhaps he doesn't realise it is very expensive restaurant rather than a nightclub. The rest of the staff were ok. For that reason, as there are so many other much more welcoming restaurants in London, I will not bother visiting again. As with other comments it should be an amazing experience to visit this restaurant but I have had a nicer welcome in my local Pizza Express!

title: Amazing Experience
comment: Sushi Shamba is on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower in the heart of the City of London. The food is excellent but very expensive - I was not paying! The atmosphere is great, the staff are very knowledgeable about the menu which can be confusing without taking their advice. The views are stunning, try to go so that you arrive at sunset and then watch the lights coming on all over the city. The lift to go up is on the outside of the building and extremely quick. Dress code is smart casual. Don't go if you don't like heights, but if you don't mind heights go as a special treat. When we went it was my birthday and they made a fuss of me!

title: If it wasn't for the view no one would go
comment: For some reason I was under the impression this was an upmarket bar and restaurant, the location and prices would certainly suggest it but it is quite the contrary. After being interrogated by a most unfriendly doorman who seemed to not wish to permit us entrance (for what reason, I am unsure) we went up in the lift admiring the great view. Sadly it was all down hill from there. The venue is tacky and decor is cheap. Bem Brazil and Las Iguanas spring to mind. The staff all look mismatched and hapless. There is NO table service in the bar which when you are paying 30 quid for two cocktails you would expect as a minimum, yet there is a service charge?? For what, serving myself? Declined to pay the service and the barman was sacastic and patronising about it. Honest to god I have absolutely no idea why this place is so popular. In summation: average drinks at ridiculous prices pathetic 'service' (if you can call it that). If this place was on the ground floor it would have gone out of business years ago.

title: Great views! Not so great prices..
comment: Fab for the views.. But not for the pocket! Lovely to look over the London skyline however drinks are pricey with a service charge for them just making your drink and handing it to you over the bar! Stick to the tap water!

title: Good for special occasion but cannot forgive ukp7.50 for cup of green tea!
comment: Sushisamba is on the 37th floor of the Heron Building accessed via it's own exclusive express lift - even the lift is an experience as you see the city through the glass elevator. The restaurant is through the bar/sushi bar however you could always come up here for a drink and some sushi with the spectacular views. The sushi rolls were excellent - less so the cerviche which just does nothing for me. Obviously it is not cheap here but I don't mind paying for quality food however I could not believe that they were charging UKP7.50 for a single cup of green tea even it was Jing tea! How can that possibly be justified - left a sour taste. If you do come here for that special occasion - avoid the cerviche and the green tea,

title: Awesome
comment: Awesome views and great food. A real treat for a special occasion! Look forward to going back soon!!!

title: Remortgage your home and have a grat night at Sushi Samba
comment: We had a good time at Sushi Samba. The ride in the lift was a highlight. The view is truly spectacular, and I would rate this venue over the (equally overpriced) restaurants in the Shard. The food is better here. We didn't have sushi, but the seafood dishes were tasty (if a bit similar in a salty, braised/seared/blackened way). Who knows if this is really a fusion of Brazillian, Peruvian and Japanese cuisine - what a bizarre concept! - but it makes for great tapas-like fun food-to-share.  The bill, however, is not fun at all. For these prices, you could be eating somewhere far more serious about food....and service....and ambiance. While the view is great, the atmosphere is touristy and a bit cheap. I would guess stock brokers come here hoping to meet models (and vice versa).  Did I mention the view is great? Save yourself a small fortune by riding the lift up and down, and then going to Moshi Moshi Sushi in Liverpool Street station.

title: Fantastic Views with Good Food
comment: Firstly the views are amazing and the terraced grill area is superb! Amazing 360 views of London, you have a 2 hour slot to enjoy a few drinks take in the view and have your dinner, staff are friendly and do not rush you at all! There are a lot of choices on the menu and they have a vegan menu which was great! Staff more than happy to go through the menu if you're unsure of what to try! Food had good flavours and was very well presented, there just needed to be double the serving sizes!!  Definitely recommended for a special occasion.

title: Fantastic lunch
comment: If you come here expect to pay a lot for a meal, but it truly is something special. I went with my boyfriend's family and had a truly wonderful experience. It was our first time at Sushisamba and our waiter was fantastic in helping us order, He suggested a fantastic combination of dishes, while making sure they were in our price range. All the dishes were delicious, especially the sushi. The fusion element works really well and the presentation of the dishes is also something to be highlighted. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal, if you are looking for a splurge, definitely give this a go.

title: nice place for drinks
comment: nice place for drinks it the city with a view and outside space. little pricey but service is good. They will do table service if you open a tab.

title: Lovely expensive evening out
comment: Visited Sushisamba on Saturday arrived slightly late which was not a problem, my guests arrived even later the staff were very accommodating and we were only rushed at the end. The waiter suggested meals to share due to one member of my party having a food allergy we agreed to get the starters and the main course that he suggested the food was decent I especially loved the lamb chops. I do feel like in these establishments your paying for the view And personally I prefer The view from duckandwaffle. The service was really good, the decor of the restaurant is nice, I would love to visit in the summer and sit on the terrace. The only faults I have were that we were not sat by the window which would have been my preference (unsure if they have window tables for three) additionally it felt quite drafty (cold) in the restaurant. Overall a good experience would recommend even if you only go once in your life.

title: Londons Best
comment: Amazing food and amazing atmosphere. Perfect night out in London. Glass lift up to the restaurant is insane. incredible views, floor to ceiling windows. The city best views

title: Great Food, Great Service, Awesome Venue
comment: Me and my partner booked a table at Sushisamba for a pre-theatre meal. After a swift ride in the lift (hold your stomach!), we arrived early for our table and we were advised that it was ready but we could have a drink in the bar if we wanted. We took this option and managed to get a seat in the window, it was a glorious sunny evening and the views across London were outstanding!  Had possibly one of the nicest gin and tonics..... As we went through to our table, someone was soon there with a tray to carry our drinks for us. The service was attentive, but not overbearing. As this was a first visit, they explained the menu clearly and advised that 5-7 dishes between the two of us would be ideal. The waitress also highlighted the Sambatini from the cocktail menu...a gin infused drink with mandarin....a truly lovely drink!  The food arrived at intervals....I personally would recommend the salt and pepper squid...but all dishes were amazing. Instead of a pudding my partner tried another dish, I, however, ordered a pudding....it was the best pudding that I have ever tasted. Chocolate, chilli, raspberry and red pepper concoction...unbelievably good. However, don't expect a low budget meal by any stretch, but expect great food, efficient and informative service and amazing food. The stunning view also helped. Tables for two are mainly based in the best places so that you get fabulous views. Pre-theatre was a great time to go, it did start getting busy as we left. Thank you Sushisamba for a great start to our evening.

title: Love this place!
comment: Unforgettable! Excellent food, outstanding views and music...  The Sky bar in the terrace serves good drinks, recommended before/after dinner or both! Definitely Good value for money.

title: Samba at Sushi Samba
comment: Situated high above London's skyline on the 38th floor of Heron tower, you get a great view at night of the city. There is a glass lift which takes you up to the restaurant so if you are afraid of heights you might want to keep your eyes closed for the seconds it takes to ascend to the restaurant floor. It is quite hard to book a table for prime dinner time (7-10.30pm) but if you keep ringing up or are happy dining quite late then you will get a table. On arrival there is a bar which you are show to whist your table is getting prepared. The drinks menu boasts some impressive cocktails. and the mixologists at work is an impressive sight. Sushi Samba has a great atmosphere and the food is even better. A fusion of Japanese, Peruvian and Brazilian food, the spices and delicately prepared dishes create an explosion of flavors on your taste buds. The waiters are very friendly and talk you through the menu explaining the types of cuisine and how the dish comes. Great restaurant for a special occasion and also can accommodate groups of friends. Be prepared to spend a bit more though as this isn't cheap, but it is worth it!

title: Mediocre
comment: If you're looking for overpriced mediocre sushi, you have come to the right place. The portions are poor and the taste regular. The prices are extortionate. The only thing going for this place is the view. You're better off at some of the restaurants in the Shard.

title: Average, slightly overpriced.
comment: We came here a few months ago so please excuse the tardy review time! Me and the other half got a reservation on a whim for a Saturday lunchtime. We were looking forward to the views and also trying the fusion aspect of the sushi - a cross between japanese and peruvian from what could tell. We entered the restaurant and it was all very cordial. Pleasant hosts and server and the restaurant has been done in a lovely style. We ordered 4 or 5 items off of the menu and decided to share them. When the food arrived it was unfortunately just overpriced and average. I've had much better sushi in far less expensive places and did feel slightly ripped off when the bill came. We also had 2 cocktails which were tasty but expensive. We travel all over the world and have eaten at other similar par eateries - for example Nobu next door in NYC and Koya in London - which we feel are far better value for money. Overall not a bad experience just not quite what we had imagined it might be. Also it might be worth noting that when we were there it felt a little like the set from Made in Chelsea - something we didn't expect being based in the city! A lot of pastel and cardigans thrown over Ralph Lauren shirts. Not a negative per se but just not something we expected.

title: sushi fusion, great view
comment: Food is fantastic, innovative creations and combination of asian and latin american food. View outside on the terrace is magnificent, beautiful skyline of London. The receptionist was an unfriendly young girl who didn´t smile and thought she was better than us. she gave us a crappy table facing the kitchen, the windows with the view were behind us, although it was almost 11pm and the restaurant almost empty. She said the other tables were reserved. but we were able to switch the table, after we met someone from a previous visit and were shown a table in the middle. fantastic service after that.

title: It's not bad.
comment: I think the food are quite good. But quite overpriced. I suggest to ask the waiters about the food you want before ordering because my friend misunderstood the menu description and had to pay about £14 for a piece of sushi (which was its specials, apparently). Yeah, a piece of sushi. The service was really really excellent and the interior was amazing especially at night.

title: Decent, if a touch pricey
comment: Had a fun evening here the other day - points were lost for both the prices of some items on the menu and the attitude of some of the bar staff (restaurant staff were 100% lovely). The views were outstanding, and really made it work.  A fun experience overall, and maybe somewhere to take guests. Not somewhere I would go regularly.

title: Delicious food, amazing view
comment: I had a birthday dinner at Sushisamba and the food was absolutely incredible. The lamb chops with miso glaze, wagyu beef taquitos, and the blackened cod were highlights. The portions are small as main dishes, but they're perfect for ordering a bit of everything to share. The pricing is expensive, so I recommend going on a special occasion to treat yourself. The view of London from the restaurant is really beautiful. Though the staff were friendly, they were not quick. Especially towards the end of our meal, after dessert none of the waiters took our plates or asked if we would like the bill until at least half an hour later. Also, I am Brazilian and didn't find any Brazilian dishes on the menu, despite the restaurant being advertised as Peruvian-Japanese-Brazilian fusion (we were in the lounge which I was told has a limited menu than the main restaurant, but still). Overall a great experience, worth it.

title: yummy food with an amazing view!
comment: i went here to celebrate a 30th birthday and the surroundings of this place is quite spectacular. The food was really good, kobe beef is a must try. The seafood paella was really tasty and the desserts are all very nice and big portions so probably recommend to share. Service was quick and staff very friendly and vert knowledgable on menu and how to order. Going back for sure. Expect pricey though but worth it!!

title: Good but not great
comment: We went for lunch and was seated by the window which gave us excellent view. The restaurant was busy but you still got attentive service. I was just a bit surprised when we were charged £7 per green tea. I really did't taste anything special for that green tea. The food is OK but nothing WOW. If you are a true sushi fan, then this is not a place. This is a restaurant for the view. But it's nice to see so many family in the restaurant.

title: #goodtimes
comment: Managed to make a booking for my girlfriend's birthday (29/03/15) and I will say it was a good idea. On arrival, the gentlemen on the ground floor were welcoming and directed us to the 39th floor but unfortunately, the second welcoming wasn't any good. we informed the lady on this floor that we had a booking there and she checked and directed us downstairs even after we told her again it was on the 39th floor. Having gone a floor down, we were sent back up but thankfully, this new lady took it in her hands to make sure we got up and to our table instead of just directing us. All this aside, We had a wonderful time after that and had some great food, drinks, live band and to top it off a lovely view of London. Our waiter was wonderful and we were sad to hear we would be leaving since because we plan on going back. Prices are high but its what you get for quality and the desserts woooow to the CHOCOLATE BANANA CAKE.

title: Wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was
comment: Five of us went for a birthday and although it was very expensive for what it was, (nearly £500 with only a qrt of saki alcohol wise) it was very good. The food was very tasty, the chap looking after us and actually all the rest too were very nice, charming and looked after us very well. Best dish was the fillet steak and the puddings were fantastic. Oh and the venue is fun too!

title: Brilliant as always
comment: Everyone should visit SS as much as possible. The food is off the scale good. Their sushi and their tostadas are as good as anything you will eat. The views are stunning. Issues? Contrary to other reports I felt some of the waiting staff were a bit self involved - takes a long time to get a drink as the bar is out in the main bar area. Lastly, I know this is going to be expensive, but it's almost prohibitedly so to the point that you feel you are being really ripped off... Look I know this and having been 5 times I'll go back another 5 so I'm not exactly voting with my feet, but when I spend 150 quid in a couple of snacks and a few cocktails I'd like to feel like I don't want to swing past McDonald's once I've stepped out of the lift.

title: Amazing food & Experience - but not cheap !
comment: Was invited here with my work last month - if you don't do heights then ensure you have some alcohol beforehand :-) but once you are up there on the 40 something floor you will have a great time. We had a selection of food every single part of it was exceptional, the service was decent (what you would expect for the price you pay) the wine and champagne is always good - but as you would expect with the city of London it does come with a price - so ensure you have emptied every penny from your piggy bank because you will need it -if you can get over that then the experience and food is exceptional !! Has to be a recommend !

title: Severe food poisoning
comment: Visited the London one last night and had a horrific experience! I got severe food poisoning from something I ate, within an hour I was vomiting non-stop! The manager kept trying to persuade me that I was having an allergic reaction.I kept running in and out of the toilet throwing up and after the 4th time it then it started coming out of the other end.  I was there for about 2 hours in their toilets trying not to pass out. Their bouncer was told to go in there to keep eye on the situation. He was picking arguments with me and my friends, you would expect that they would be trying to help the situation instead of behaving like this! We were waiting for the ambulance to arrive and he kept saying to women coming into use the toilets - I think she is on drugs, as she isn't saying anything! I'm a person who doesn't drink alcohol and do drugs. How dare he try and make such litigious remarks! Where was the manager at this point, why wasn't he dealing with the situation, instead of this neanderthal of a guy! They were trying very hard not to let anyone know I had food poisoning. It's very severe if a person gets this sort of reaction after an hour of eating! I closed and locked the door as I needed to use the toilet again and the security guy unlocked the door and pushed the door open, while I was on the toilet!!! Are you kidding me, I am throwing my guts up and suffering from cramps and I have to deal with a pervert too! They were trying very hard to get the ambulance crew to say it was an allergic reaction, as there were lots of people in the restaurant observing, however the ambulance crew said they would have to examine me before they could say anything. They took me out on a wheelchair to the ambulance outside and concluded it was food poisoning.  The restaurant has my details and have they contacted me - no. I contacted them the next day have they replied no. Not a place I would ever visit again or recommend to anyone else. I have also reported them to the Health and Safety organisation, as they have no duty of care towards their clients and I do not wish anyone to experience what I did that night. Two days later and I am still dealing with the after effects, its ruined my Easter wkend, as well as my friends and families, as all our plans have been ruined.

title: Average to good, but not great
comment: Family birthday and treat for my oldest daughter leaving us for a year. On-line booking successful and reasonably simple; they checked we were still coming by phone but when we arrived an hour early (allowing for traffic and parking that was much easier than expected due to Sunday timing) we noticed there were plenty of spare tables so we went in early. I thought the place is a little tired and worn, seen in the harsh light of day- at night i am sure it will still seem magical but I noticed the worn paintwork in the gents toilets - did not have a sense of fine dining quality. Table top chipped and worn too. Still we had pleasant service, even if our waiter was a little hard to understand. The food arrives in the order cooked, not necessarily as you may expect, but it goes to the middle of the table so we could all share. Food was good, I loved their salad dish for example which was full of colour, textures, flavours and fun.  Cocktails with the food were relatively expensive; typically £13- at night given the view i can understand that, but midday these seem steep. Wine by the glass was reasonable price and quality.  All of the cooking was good, but there were no "wow" dishes other than the salad. We had a main dish of Moqueca Mista: jumbo shrimp, squid, sea bass, mussels, clams, coconut milk, dendê oil, chimichurri rice - which was tasty but one jumbo shrimp 6 clams and mussels and a little squid did not feel great value relative to the standard dishes we had along side. Puddings were an Easter special and with love from Brazil which was chocolate and coffee with a few nuts plus a delicious biscuit- all very sweet but none of the other diners wanted to share it. Service was OK; I splashed some of the juice from the main course on my shirt- the waiter quickly offered to get some soda water, then did not get it, and pretended to ignore the table and the offer (despite the place not being that busy) so i had to go to the gents and sort it out myself- very odd- my family reminded him while i was away and he said he had to discuss it with the manager but never followed it up- perhaps they were out of soda water or have a policy of not assisting guests with spilled food?   More worrying was the bill; we had an extra, expensive dish added that we did not have, and i could not even see on the menu. I pointed it out, they went into a huddle and came back with "computer error", no "sorry"- took bill away, re-printed, nothing said. Hmm- if i return, i would keep a careful track of what I ordered next time in case it is not so easy to see. I think this is a serious error which at least they have to apologize for.- as it was, it felt odd, almost as if they thought they were right and we had forgotten we had this mystery dish (of a description and price which was not on current menu).  Despite indifferent service they add 12.5% "discretionary" service. In this case it was not good enough, given that this is a fairly expensive place. If it were not for the view, I would not consider returning- as there is a great view, i might go back in an evening sometime, but given how booked up this place is, if my experience is typical i think they are living on novelty and location more than on quality of food and service.

title: Memorable food, strange service
comment: We were looking forward to visiting Sushi Samba for a long time and eventually managed to book on a Sunday evening. I'd definitely recommend it as an extravagant introduction to fusion sushi. As recommended, we shared a selection of sushi and small plates. It's always good to see Padron peppers on the menu, and the prawn hand rolls showed me that quinoa can have flavour. The service was strange though - our waiter was difficult to understand, misheard our drink order and cleared away my husband's starter plate while he was still eating from it! We finished with the delicious chocolate chilli dessert - try it! We'll be back for more when we're millionaires.

title: Amazing view and most cheerful staff
comment: The sushi we've ever tried. Thanks to Lucy for warm welcome and high standard service. We loved it a lot.

title: Worst service I've come across for a long, long time
comment: It's always a real shame when you find a great space with fantastic views - and then absolutely fire service. The management of this place are relying on the strategy of attracting one off visits due to the novelty of the view. Repeat business obviously hasn't occurred to them. Maybe the restaurant is better, but the service in the bar was shocking. In a bad way. There must've been at least ten "waiters" milling around the bar, only two of them serving.  There were not even very many customers at the bar - it certainly wasn't full - but every single one of them was upset 'cause they'd been standing there waiting for a good 20-30 minutes! The two that did serve were pretentious and slow, it seemed like they were purposely taking their time pouring the drinks in as slow a style as they could, seemingly not at all bothered about customer service. I really cannot comprehend why, as a bar owner, your strategy wouldn't be to give your visitors a good experience?! Why have ten barstaff and only two pretentious gits serving drinks?! And why employ complete tools? Definitely won't be going back or recommending to anyone. Too bad I work in PR - plenty of my friends love these kind of posh venues - we defo won't be bringing our journalist friends here for drinks!!

title: Overrated
comment: Given all the good things I heard about this place, I was expecting it to be better. We found it very overrated. The food is definitely good, but far too expensive for what it was. I would expect better for sure. You can't really see the view from most of the tables, and there is too much staff running around and asking you if you are alright all the time. I would not come back.

title: High price tag for sky dining. Also CHECK YOUR RECEIPTS!!
comment: My husband and I came here with a 6:30 pm Wednesday evening reservation. The downstairs bar area wasn't very busy or full of atmosphere and the upstairs bar wasn't even open. We went through to our table and were greeted by almost all the staff members we passed which was nice. The restaurant itself is very funky and has a great view. I suspect this would be better if you are blessed enough to get a table near the front facing window. We ordered two cocktails after being seated for 15 minutes which were delicious - highly recommend the 'Nina Fresh'. We then ordered 7 plates from various sections on the menu and liked the Tuna handroll (sorry I cannot remember the full name), lamb rabata and the pork belly. None were exceptionally spectacular though. It was clear about halfway through the meal we weren't paying for the food but rather the view and service. If you do eat here I would suggest for two people around 5-6 plates is enough. We were stuffed by the time the 4th plate came out and the waiter were good enough to cancel one of our final orders which was late in arriving because we simply couldn't eat any more. The wait staff were friendly and attentive without being overpowering or pushy. The drinks are slow to come out but this is understandable when almost everyone orders a complex cocktail. After dinner we took our drinks and went through to the bar for a few more. As I was paying for a round that cost £22 (two drinks) I checked the card machine before entering my pin and noticed the staff member had charged me £29.50. I DO NOT think for a second this was a mistake. I DO think he was trying to underpay the til which is so common in London at the moment so it pays to be diligent when paying by card. All in all we had a lovely evening but that was more on the company rather than this establishment. After paying over £250 for the evening we can both agree there MUCH better places to eat for a fraction of the price. Would suggest for 1-2 cocktails with a small group.

title: Brilliant Food and Service
comment: Firstly, the lift up to the 38th Floor really is something exciting in itself...a glass box of emotion sends you up at near rocket speed looking over the views of the City. On arrival of the 38th, and after you've recovered from your ears popping you're walking along into the bar area, where you can enjoy a cocktail with more incredible views, or watch some skilled craftsmen making art for your mouths in the sushi kitchen (which you can eat at). Once shown to our table, we were greeted by the area manager, (Jacob??) who introduced himself and asked what we liked to drink, we said what we were in the mood for and he suggested some cocktails that we went with, and boy were we glad that we did! The current Sambatini is like a citrussy Gin concoction that tastes as though an angel is crying her lemony flavoured tears into your mouth, it's that good. The other one that really caught the eye, or the mouth, was the one that tasted like a boozy Solero ice cream, I couldn't tell you what was in it, but trust me it's good. We ordered a couple of small plates to get us started, sharing some Salt and Pepper Squid, and some Pork Belly. We were upsold into having their Kobe Beef Burger sliders, and weren't disappointed by them. Whilst small in size, they were huge in flavour. Beef burgers that melt in the mouth, and complimented by some horseradish mayo.  I feel I should probably write a whole paragraph on the Squid, as I happen to be in a relationship with a self-confessed squid addict, but it's really something special. Light, crispy, full of taste, and beautifully presented, enough about myself, but the Squid was also the same. The pork belly I'd eaten on a previous trip, and it was every bit as good as I remembered. I'd recommend both as must-eats. We then ordered off the waiter's advice some fillet beef and lamb as mains, which were cooked to perfection, and again presented beautifully. We asked if we needed anything else and were advised that we'd ordered plenty, and it was refreshing not to be told to keep ordering. We finished with a Samba London sushi platter which was the best sushi I've ever eaten, admittedly not much of an expert but it's 100x better than Wasabi, Tesco etc, obviously. We were too full for dessert, but there are some quite sexy looking desserts if you fancy a sweet ending to your meal.  We had some more cocktails throughout the meal, which were all lovely, and the beer is a nice Japanese one (Asahi from memory).  The service throughout was impeccable. The food incredible. The views very good. At the end of the meal, a few pounds lighter in the wallet, and a few heavier at the waist, we left via the Lift that wouldn't be out of place in Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (you know the scene) and descended at lightning speed back down to normality.

title: Best Service (Confident and hospitable), and food can possibly be a hit or miss
comment: The service by Rocco was impeccable. Every need was attended to, from starting cocktails to dessert. It wasn't particularly busy, but there was a fair amount of people at around 8-9pm, so cheers to the service. I ordered an Uni Temaki, and Rocco promised me that if it was not fresh he would not charge it for me, and he even got the chef to pick the pieces would I like for my uni myself. This is top service and surely this was way beyond the call of what he could have done. With regard to the food, the black cod miso was the best. The seafood large plate with chimichurri rice was good too. The tomyam cocktail was good too. Middling foods for me were the kobe cocktail, the mushroom large plate, and the kobe tiradito. I'm pretty sure the famous kobe cocktail can and should taste better, but even with my experience with whiskeys I couldn't pinpoint the kobe wash nor the salted caramel. The hints of maple were only present after the swig. Ultimately, I would return here to try the rest of the menu, and grab myself a black cod miso along the way.

title: LOVED IT
comment: Came here for a romantic date with my boyfriend, and it did not disappoint. We had amazing cocktails and some of the best sushi I've had in a long time. If it wasn't so expensive, I would go back constantly.

title: Amazing Sushi on the top of London!
comment: The Restaurant is located on the top of Heron building and is the second highest in London. The view from the place is breathtaking, and the food is really good but a bit expensive ( but I think it's worth it ). I really liked also the passion fruit cake as a dessert. In addition, the staff is very friendly. I'd recommend it for every sushi lover.

title: AMAZING SUSHI
comment: So so yummy I had the tiger roll, the california maki and ceviche dishes the services was great out waitress offered to take a photo of us - which normally at these places you feel a bit awkward asking for  Had a really great time and felt so comfortable  visited around 6pm and didnt feel rushed at all  will definitely be returning  Quite expensive - they had a special menu which had a mini burger. This tiny burger was £6! but it was a one off treat I guess.

title: Love lifts me up ...
comment: ... to the 38th floor of the Heron Tower. For the height phobic among us the MOST important thing I need to tell you about this restaurant is that to get there one must ascend in a glass elevator that travels on the outside of the building : however the ride is quick and smooth, and the views worth the vertiginous vagaries. You could always pretend you are Charlie in the Great Glass Elevator if it helps! The food was lovely, the service efficient and we had a lovely waiter Pablo. Not a budget lunch by any means, when you factor in the location, staffing levels etc I understand why. Tough work to get a reservation according to Mr Loafer. I would love to return in the evening to appreciate the night time view.

title: Birthday treat
comment: I'd never heard of sushi samba before but my daughter picked it and booked it for my birthday on Wednesday, 4 of us came along and had a great late afternoon/evening at the restaurant. The staff were all very helpful and attentive advising us on what to have. Nothing was a disappointment every dish looked and tasted superb. We had a lovely bottle of Rośe forgot to get the name of it £48 for a bottle! We all enjoyed our meal and at some stage when we are next in London we will be back......ps loved the lift.

title: High Rise Ambrosial Delight
comment: Booked this for my Mum's 80th Birthday, arranged it so we got there for late lunch and stayed through the setting sun and into the night. Stayed over three hours and it was spectacular. Had a lovely cocktail in the bar area before being escorted through to the restaurant. My Wife, Mother and I were given a table that looked out to the East and it was fantastic. Our waiter was brilliant and so kind to my Mum when he realised it was her birthday. We couldn't decide which dishes to have so we put our trust in our waiter and he did not disappoint. He brought a spectacular array of beautifully presented and tasty dishes that were ambrosial, so much so we ordered seconds of three of the items he brought. All washed down with a couple of bottles of Pink Champagne.  Can't recommend this restaurant highly enough. One unfortunate point. Because Sushi Samba was so good I then visited Duck and Waffle a fortnight later, which is not fit to lick the boots of Sushi Samba!

title: Dishes worthy to try, friendly and slow service
comment: I went to one of the restaurants from this chain in Bishopsgate, Heron Tower, in London to celebrate my daughter's birthday. It seems that this restaurant chain is fashionable in London at the moment. This location has a wonderful view of London, since the restaurant is in the 39 floor of the tower. The food was good with some really delicious dishes, like the shrimp tempura and some taquitos made of wagyu beef with avocado, and some just ok dishes for my taste. The place suppose to have dishes that are Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian and sometimes a mix of them. However, there was just ceviche for Peruvian and a drink (caipirinha) on Brazilian side. We were in a table at the bar due to not getting a table when trying to do reservations 3 days before. So maybe at the restaurant they might have more offers, since seems that they have different menus. The desserts were great. But then you know, in order to get a table in the restaurant you need more than 3 days in advance (for this location). The service although friendly, certainly can improve. We wait far more time to get a wine than we wait to get cocktails. To have an idea, we finished our first round of small dishes and we didn't get yet our wine. Same was for the bill.

title: Greay view, ok food
comment: Great view from the restaurant. Food is okay to eat but pricey . I suppose you have to pay for the view?

title: WOW!
comment: This place became the highlight of my trip! From the greeting to the door, and the lift ride on the way up you could tell this place was going to be awesome and professional! On entering the lift, make sure you get your camera out to take a picture of London's skyline! We arrived here at 4pm on a Friday afternoon, we had no reservation but just thought we would chance it, we was in luck! The bar was booming with a great corporate clientèle, DJ playing, and just an awesome Buzz.. this is my kind of place! After ordering a drink we was taken through the the restaurant. a 360 glass view of London kind of made it a great start, the service was professional and prompt and the waiter explained the whole menu and the concept of sharing dishes before we ordered. Dishes are served as and when they are ready and each dish was so carefully presented and tasted AMAZING! Unfortunately my girlfriend had to go to work at 5:30pm so our visit was cut kinda short however we will definitely be back... One gripe was the cost.. 4 small plates, a bottle of beer and glass of champagne came to over £110, not the cheapest lunch I have had but I guess you get what you pay for!

title: Beautiful place, delicious food, expensive, great for a special occasion
