comment: It took ages to get a booking for a Saturday night but finally achieved it by booking 2 months in advance.  Having heard the hype I wanted to be underwhelmed but the place is BEAUTIFUL. The terrace is stunning, and a perfect place to have a drink before sitting down to eat, even on a chilly night as there are heaters and open fire pits.  We had to wait over 30 minutes for our table but we were given a glass of champagne each as compensation. Otherwise the service was excellent. The waiting staff were very attentive.  We ordered an array of dishes - gyoza, sushi (of course), mini burgers, prawns and steak. Dishes are small but very tasty. Super tasty in fact. Expensive though. We spent over £200 for 3 people which included 1 cocktail each and no wine. And I could have eaten a few more dishes on my own - we joked about getting a kebab on the way home just to fill ourselves up.  Would defintely recommend for a special occasion for a couple or a sophisticated girls' night out.

title: Most favourite restaurant of mine in London
comment: Beautiful view, beautiful restaurant, beautiful ambiance, great seafood and meat dishes. I love this beautiful restaurant. I try to go as many times as I can.

title: AMAZING
comment: Went to Sushi Samba for my birthday and what a treat it was. Went as a table of 4 and we had to book two months in advance, but it was well worth it.  The express lift that takes you up to Sushi Samba is extremely quick and for someone like me that is not great with heights, quite an experience. We put our coats in the cloakroom and went to let the restaurant know that we had arrived - even though we were a bit early for the table. We decided to have a drink at the bar and go out on the terrace for a drink as it was a lovely evening. Amazing views. The meal itself was wonderful - we had a mixture of sushi, Peruvian and Brazilian food a lot of which was recommended by our waiter who was knowledgeable about all the dishes. We finished off with a couple of deserts which were to die for.  Okay this place is expensive and not an everyday meal, but for a special occasion worth a visit.

title: One of the best place ever been..
comment: Need a few words to describe it.. Strawberry and Champagne while waiting for our table...amazing view to go upstairs and even eating...original sushi, good ambient, right music, excellent service and good wine...whenever will come back in London, I have to return here!

title: Very good experience
comment: This was one of my best meals for many reasons. Been there on my birthday, the food was nice (portions were a bit small but you could leave full), the staff was amazing and the view was fantastic. You clearly pay a lot for the view but it worths it on a special occasion. We met the chef who is greek and really talented and we really enjoyed it. It is a place where you can go for a meal and meet a lot of interesting people, it's very classy, you'll see people there for their business meals, etc. Toilets were not that good, and the lift just before you enter the restaurant is a bit scary (if you're afraid of heights).

title: Amazing food and views!
comment: After having some problems with my reservation, I was welcomed by the restaurant manager and offered free cocktails in the bar while we waited for our table. The cocktails were excellent and this was the start of a fantastic evening! We had a table by the window and the view of the city is amazing. A selection of dishes were recommended by our waiter and every single item was completely faultess and absolutely delicious. We ordered a selection of dishes and several more cocktails and all the staff we very friendly and attentive throughout the evening. We finished with more drinks in the outside bar area which again offers excellent views. Overall a wonderful dining experience - can't wait to come back! (Although it does take 2 months to get a table!)

title: Great Experience
comment: Just had a great Birthday experience at SushiSamba. Jacob, the manager in charge on Friday night, made the four of us feel very welcome - he was super kind, always respectful, and let us hold our table longer than our allotted time without ever being pushy. Dio, our waiter, was pleasant and informative and guided us through the menu with ease. We finished with a delicious desert called "With love from Rio" that came with a lighted candle. I should say though that the starters and main courses weren't the most inspired, albeit everything was well cooked and presented, the food all seemed a little ordinary but it did fill us up. Nevertheless, the decor, atmosphere, view and service overall was superb. I highly recommend and will certainly return.

title: Amazing place,seriously but the food not t
comment: Ok guys the view it's really amazing  I'm fanatic of asian food, here I tried the gyoza but wasn't cooked properly, the "tiradito" was nice and then caviary also too.. I preferred the views then he food, sorry

title: Amazing Sushi + Latin fusion concept
comment: Came here on a business lunch and feasted. The sushi rolls were fantastic as were the tacos. I would highly recommend this place. It is expensive, but in my opinion, worth the cost.

title: Definitely check out if in London and don't mind a pricey meal with great atmosphere
comment: We were on a family trip with our teenage daughters and wanted to do something memory worthy. The ride up to the 38th floor in the glass elevator was fun and great peek at London. The view was even better when we got to the top and checked out the patio with the giant tree lit up with orange lights, The atmosphere was very modern and fun. I have been to SushiSamba in Vegas so I knew the food already and I knew it was going to be pricey. We ordered some rolls and robata beef, veggie tempura and coconut rice. We shared and had a great time. Service was great. All in all a fun time just beware of cost, it adds up when you are hungry, small servings. We didn't drink but all cocktails and wine were more than we wanted to spend on our vacation. This was good for teenagers, I wouldn't bring any young children here.

title: Terrible staff. Rude, obnoxious and judgemental. Stay away!
comment: I used to visit Sushisamba roughly once a month when I had international clients in town. I would take them up to the bar and show them the views of London. We would often dine in the restaurant. It was a very popular venue. I had a particularly important client in town last week and decided to take her for a drink and lunch in the restaurant but had not booked. I was asked at the entrance by a very rude man if we had a reservation to which I replied we didn't but would happily settle for drinks at the bar. He proceeded to look my guest and I up and down and then declared we were not dressed smart enough for the venue. We were wearing jeans, shoes and winter coats as it was a cold day. I have always been dressed in a similar manner every time I have visited in the past. The two ladies in front of us were wearing sports shoes and were granted access. I have never been so humiliated in front of a client. She also took great offence at this man's comments. She was wearing a wrist watch which I imagine is equal in value to this man's annual wages! She is a very successful and well known doctor in the US and I don't think she is used to being spoken to and judged in such a way by a glorified and jumped up doorman. His name was Cleo (apparently). When I asked for his name, he said he could only give it to me if I gave him my name also. He seemed to think he was very clever. We decided to head across to the Shard instead where we had a fantastic meal at Aqua. The view is also infinitely better. They were very welcoming and clearly know how to treat their customers with some dignity and respect. From now on I know where I'll be taking future international clients and guests who wish to see the London sights. I will not be taking any future business to Sushisamba and will be recommending all of my acquaintances both professional and personal steer clear of the venue. I sincerely hope the management look further into the lack of professionalism and disgusting, judgemental attitude of their staff.

title: Excellent service and atmosphere
comment: We visited this restuatant for a late lunch. The reservation staff were very helpful as I had booked last minute. The staff explained the menu and gave recommendations- this was very useful and tempted us to try some new dishes. The food was delicious especially the Salt and Pepper Squid and Blackened Cod. The views are amazing and the whole party had an excellent time.

title: Fantastic
comment: We visited for a family birthday and had a fantastic whole experience. The staff were very helpful and polite as it was our first time there we weren't too familiar with the menu - they pretty much chose for us and everything was sublime!  Not only the effort they made to make sure the family member who's birthday it was had a "birthday moment". It is pricey but the view and food cannot fault it! The black miso cod is incredible! Certainly recommend - you must visit.

title: Great decor but delivery of meal a real nightmare.
comment: Decor music atmosphere great but they served child's portions in such a way that we got the last meal about half an hour after the first. I left feeling ripped off and hungry despite 45 per head without drinks.

title: Sushi-sational!!!
comment: I booked lunch for my partner as a birthday surprise. We always said that we would visit, but never seemed to get round to it. So finally here we were. Going upstairs in the lift was swift. We were greeted by a lady who took our coats and then we made our way to the reception desk. We decided to go straight to our table as the bar area was filling up. I did notice that there was seating and outdoor heaters too to maximize the rather small bar area. The restaurant had lots of covers and I had anticipated the restaurant would be quieter as is with most places in the City on a weekend. Wrong! By the time we had left, and a few tables had been reset, the place was packed. This did not detract from the service one bit. Our waiters introduced themselves. Memorably Jacob was the waiter that impressed us the most. His excellent knowledge of the menu and helpful suggestions added to our dining experience. Although, neither of us fancied the £28 cocktail or the £1000 Kobe option. I was so glad my partner opted for neither of those as I was paying! I have to say, we have eaten sushi all over the world and this was some of the most innovative, visually-appealing and to die-for flavours that we had ever experienced. The desserts were also great and Jacob had organised for my partner's dessert to be presented with Happy Birthday written in chocolate and a candle too. Discreet and charming.  Why did we leave it so long before trying out this great addition to the London dining circuit?Here's hoping we will be back soon.

title: The food made it worth it
comment: Booked 2 months in advanced and requested a window table (like everyone probably does). Came a lil late for our reservation and when we came they said our table wasn't ready and they would let us know when it was ready. Waited in bar area which was a lil crowded but we just sat and waited. After about 20 mins I went to ask about our table and it was ready for a while but no one came to tell us. We were seated in a booth for a group and it was a bit big for just 2 of us and probably the worse place to sit but it was busy so I guess someone has to get the rubbish seat. We had a different waiting staff at our table every single time which got a bit confusing because when we asked for the bill, we had to ask four different staff before we finally got it. The food was amazing, best sushi I've had which is why I'm giving it a 3 stars. Because we didn't get to see the view and the service was average considering how many of them were working, I can't give it any higher than this. Would I go back? Maybe but not anytime soon

title: Sweet Welsh Victory
comment: Happy Birthday to me, and I could not believe the excellent night I had awaiting me.  Firstly the welcome from the staff at the entrance to this imposing tower was very warm and welcoming( first box ticked )Then the 38 floors of a perfect view of Western London with too much land marks to take in on one elevator trip so please take several! So now we received a warm welcome by front of house team then to the bar and what a bar, not a typical up your nose clientele but a fun conversational crowd most polite. Then again you see the splendour of the London vista. Bar staff unbelievable as the Welsh Rugby team had won earlier on I asked the bar staff to make me a calibration cocktail ,they prepared me a JD based drink which we called the "Sweet Welsh Victory "and what a victory this was absolutely delicious. After been shown to our table by again a very courteous waitress my fellow dinners and my self found the lighting to low to properly read the menu so we followed the advice of our waitress and if you are not familiar with type of fare this girl made a very good choice. The dishes came a bit to long between each course for our liking but each course was very well presented and tasty with each dish explained upon presentation. I would recommend this restaurant and stay away from Nobu (previous review)

title: Spectacular but food is variable
comment: The service is outstanding, the views are amazing. The food is variable - some dishes are spectacular (the chilli chocolate desert is probably the best chocolate dish on the planet) but others are more hype than substance. This is definately an experience not to be missed but it's not a place I'd visit twice.

title: Top Class
comment: Set in Heron Tower, Sushi Samba is really one of the top Sushi restaurants in London.  The lift is pretty cool too, apparently they have slowed it down but it was pretty fast as far as I was concerned.

title: Birthday lunch was made special because of a very attentive waiter - Rocco!
comment: I took my husband to Sushi Samba for a birthday lunch and everything was great , what impressed me the most was a waiter - who wasn't even waiting on our table- when he went off to get the bill he overheard us talking about me paying as it was hubbys birthday, and before bringing over card machine , he brought out a dish with a small cake/pastry on it and a candle with happy birthday written in chocolate, very nice touch, thank you Rocco for that top waiter!

title: Quite literally - One of the Closest Experiences to heaven you'll ever have,
comment: Not kidding …..it’s absolute and literal. – a 2 minute walk from the Eastern (Bishopshate) exit of Liverpool Street station - Sushi Samba is on the 42 floor of the Heron Tower…..Closer to heaven than most other London (Global ????) restaurants. If the high speed glass walled lift does not persuade you then the views from the terrace surely will.  I do not feel qualified to talk about the Sushi Samba restaurants in other countries so as is my norm….I’ll direct these comments towards the restaurant I experienced. – Sushi samba – very near to Bishopsgate, London First and foremost if you visit, persevere because during the rare quiet moments the entrance is not blatantly obvious or grand. However from 6pm onwards things get very, very busy indeed and you will find a doorman welcoming you and shepherding the queues which can become very lengthy on Thursday and Friday and Saturday.  In my experience EVERY member of staff I ever met here across three visits gave a friendly, warming welcome and was willing to help me wherever and however possible in fully enjoying my visit. This extends from the doorman on the street to the reception staff and right through to the (extremely talented) cocktail barmen, chefs, waiters, waitresses, managers and senior managers.  One of the latter is now a casual friend / strong acquaintance and has assisted me with the table bookings situation from time to time so it’s well worth reciprocating the attitude and mind set built into the ambience of this marvellous place.  So ……having travelled half the planet working for airlines and often travelling first class on business …what makes this place so outrageously special.  It is not the price.  (Do not be put off – this place is designed to be a special treat – a true life event – something to almost save up for then savour the moments when you get there. But, if £75 per head is going to break the bank please do not read any further.)  If, like me, you truly believe you get what “you get what you pay for in life” then this restaurant is the epitome however, you don’t just get …………you REALLY GET………here’s what you get and I doubt this list is exhaustive.  Here’s what I got (on three separate repeated occasions) • The street level welcome was warm, friendly , amicable and helpful • The queue for the lift was acceptable, a 10 minute delay, in a crowd of really quite excited and expectant people of seemingly of a similar mind set • The lift is as scary as hell first time and only slightly more fun after that • The view from the lift gets better and better – target the sunset period for your arrival – amazing. • The reception area staff welcomed us, took our coats , guided us towards the bars and the terraces and cross checked our bookings and details – VERY professional, warm, and friendly • The Bar – COCKTAILS – O.M.G – treat your senses to some novel delights Totally amazing  • Nothing in the restaurant is low priced - EVERYTHING is worth every penny and good value • The clientele – I hope it is accidental but nature runs its cause at this place – so people who understand the finer things in life take the time trouble and money to enjoy this experience I hope this doesn’t come across wrong but some clever self marketing must be going on somewhere  • The restaurant itself is fairly standard – i.e I really do not recall the chairs or table type. But each time I visited we were comfortable whilst eating. • What is truly memorable is sitting outside on the piazza eating our dinner whilst the sun set and the moon rose – marvellous. • The food menu is Sushi combined with quality South American beef based plates of food. I recommend focusing around the Sushi but the waiter gave excellent guidance towards some of the most popular dishes – every mouthful enjoyed.  • The presentation of the food was such that we felt compelled ot take phots and the taste surpassed the expectation set by the eyes.  • Accompanying drinks remained expensive but appropriately so. The view alone makes the price good value but you do not get service, presentation, flavour, balance and ambience with a view for a low cost • So the final thing we got was the bill and a feeling of sadness when we had to leave !! We recommend you book some time in advance because it gets really busy and the queues get long ….very long. Our tip would be to go at a quieter time. The subtle ambience is more than a little spoiled when the bars get very busy  So if you would like to experience something more than a little bit special then try this place….. Pretty close to heaven and in our experience – almost flawless.

title: Great views and overall experience
comment: The views from Sushi Samba are magnificent. The staff are professional and offer immaculate service. They offer an exquisite dinning experience, and world-class cocktails. I'm truly impressed by the experience and would recommend it to anyone to get the chance and view scenic London from the top floor of Heron tower.

title: Fabulous food
comment: Dining with the London skyline view was great. The feature lighting of the restaurant, particularly with the light tree on the outside balcony are great touches, Sushi Samba is very much about presentation. Our waiter was friendly and attentive, happily explaining dishes and making recommendations without being too much. The food itself was fabulous, the last time I ate sushi was in Tokyo and I was not disappointed. The belly tuna sashimi was delightful, though larger cuts would be welcome. Our sashimi was very fresh and melted in your mouth. The samba rolls were great, with the recommendation of Tokyo skytree begin so good we ordered it again. The dessert menu should not be overlooked. My chilli mousse was a great combination of flavours as was the passion fruit cake.  The major short coming is getting to the dining experience. The position of the host desk is tactless- you have to negotiate the crowds to make your way to it and in turn wait for your table frequently- booking or not. The crowd itself is a very self important bunch which is off putting and makes getting to the bar a long winded task. Bear with it, the rest of the experience is great.

title: Very nice!
comment: Great location with amazing view over London and really nice ambience setting. The waiters are only very friendly and give you'll guide throughout the menu making good suggestions. The food is very tasty but with a light touch so you'll have just enough space for one of their great desserts. It's a bit expensive but you definitely get what you pay for - an unforgettable experience!

title: Sushi Samba disaster - thank god for Don Fernandos in Richmond!
comment: Took day off to take partner on major anniversary to Sushi Samba near Liverpool Street Station for fusion menu and views. However arrived at Heron Building to find big steel barrier across entrance to building and restaurant and two security types who told us there had been an emergency fire evacuation and there was no possibility of entering and offered advice on alternative restaurants in area! At 2.20 received voicemail to advise that due to kitchen loss of gas and emergency they would only be able to offer cold dishes - sushi/sashimi. However at 2.45 pm they called again to advise that they could not open the restaurant due to the fire emergency and offering apologies. 15 minutes before our booked time! Feeling like a couple of plums and not knowing alternatives in the area decided to go to our old faithful restaurant in Richmond - Don Fernandos. Had a fantastic selection of tapas and Spanish beer and really should have gone there in the first place! Funnily enough Don Fernandos came to the rescue in similar circumstances some time ago when Gaucho in Richmond also ran out of gas!

title: Spectacular!!
comment: Best Japanese food I found in London, incredible view, excellent ambient... Absolutely nothing to complain about!

title: Wonderful lunch
comment: Having visited the Duck and Waffle the previous month I came back to the Heron Tower with my Mother to eat in Sushi Samba. As with the D&W the views were stunning and worth the elevator ride. We had a wonderful window seat and the food was amazing. The waitress Karolina was amazingly helpful and guided us skilfully through the menu so we were sure to order what we both wanted to eat (it can be a bit over powering all the choice!).

title: Amazing view, average food + blend of bad/excellent service - just go for a drink!
comment: Went here with my GF for a very late din dins booking at 9:30pm on a Tuesday.  On arrival at the base of Heron Tower, a bouncer let us into the building and we took a glass lift to the 38th floor. The lift up to the 38th is good fun and you get a taste of the great views to enjoy from the restaurant/bar. Once we got to the 38th we walked to the entrance of the restaurant (nobody greeted us which I thought was poor) and after flagging down some help, we were told to walk across the restaurant to a "check in" desk (this should really have been at the entrance). We confirmed our booking/name – no smile, no welcome, just "ok, take a seat guys by the bar and we'll call you when ready". I'm not sure if it was just the day/time (Tuesday, 9pm) but the place was full of suits. To go with this a fair few couples and a number of girls that looked like they'd just come off the set of TOWIE (doing their best to get the attention of the suits).  We grabbed 2 rounds of cocktails (£13 x 2) + beers (£7 x 2) at the bar – a little surprised that service charge is added to the bill as they don't do much + the service was rather unfriendly. There were a number of inebriated city types screaming/elbowing each other by the bar/trying to cut in front of us so I ended up having to hand one of them off – a bit like going to a secondary school disco in a village hall. We lucked out and managed to get a seat right by the window looking out over the Gherkin. The view is by far the best thing about Sushi Samba in my opinion – absolutely amazing.  At 9:30 we got up, walked over to the check in desk type thing only to be told our table wasn't ready. We lost our great seats and ended up standing around like muppets with a number of other couples that also couldn't be seated. Cut a long, boring story short we didn't get seated until 10:05. In fairness, the lady was very apologetic.  We sat down, looked at the menu then asked 2 members of staff to take our order – neither of them could as that was apparently beyond their remit. We decided that if no one came to take the order within 5 minutes, we'd just leave. Luckily, an extremely helpful gentleman appeared and talked us through the menu/made some suggestions. We ordered: SHRIMP TEMPURA snap pea julienne, spicy mayo, black truffle vinaigrette 14.00 CRISPY TAQUITOS two per order YELLOWTAIL avocado and roasted corn miso 12.00 KUROMITSU GLAZED PORK BELLY WRAPS palmito, orange, bibb lettuce 12.00 BLACK COD miso 18.50 EL TOPO® salmon, jalapeño, shiso leaf, fresh melted mozzarella, crispy onion 12.00 The tempura was poor, the yellowtail taquitos were very nice, the pork belly wraps were fine, the black cod was nice but nothing special. The el topo was fine but again nothing special. By this point (around 11:10) we just wanted to go home.  In summary, I really don't think the food is anything special – style (limited in parts) over substance. I must say I'm not a fan of fusion food in general but even still, the food just wasn't that good in my opinion. It'd be better to just go to a good Japanese restaurant or a good steakhouse/churrascaria.  However, the view is amazing. Fellas take your special ones here – they'll love it.  The service was hot and cold. In general the floor staff and bar staff were poor. When you go to any restaurant (especially a fancier one) you should get a warm welcome, people should be smiling and attentive not stressed out and rude. The gentleman that took our order (appeared to be almost like the front of house) was excellent – friendly, charming, knowledgeable – if only all the staff were ½ as good, the experience would have been 2 times better. I wouldn't bother eating here again but would come back for a drink. I'd recommend you do the same.

title: Fabulous views and great food
comment: Heron Tower is the perfect place for dining. Fabulous views across London (and the view of the Gherkin is spectacular), plus the atmosphere is very relaxed. The Kobe mini burger was melt in the mouth, the yellowfin fish with lemongrass was like an explosion of tastes and the teriyaki dishes were simply gorgeous. The dessert of chocolate ganache, popcorn and nuts with coffee mousse (to share) was simple but very well executed and presented. Put simply, this place is fabulous if you want a view of London, cheaper and nicer food than other well known 'up high' London venues, and great service with a few cocktails thrown in. I will definitely return…

title: Amazing view and love the food!
comment: We had a great night out at sushi samba. The view is stunning and the place has a lot of atmosphere. We really enjoyed the food and it wasn't as expensive as we feared! Not cheap though! Our waiter was excellent and really helped us with choices. Would definitely go again.

title: Excellent
comment: We ate at Sushi Samba this January with a group of friends. We started of with drinks in their lovely bar. Unfortunately the beautiful outside bar with the lit up tree in the middle was closed (but he what do you expect in January). After drinks we were brought to our lovely round table in the middle of the restaurant. Due to the number of people we were with we got to try a lot of different dishes because everything was put in the middle of the table. The fish was fresh, everything was home made and the flavour combinations were outstanding. Couldn't fault one little thing. Can't wait to return!

title: Drink with a view
comment: What a view, an amazing band doing covers with a twist, great food, fabulous atmosphere, A little expensive, but worth the money if you want a truly great experience.

title: Grown too big for its boots
comment: I have been a very regular customer @ Sushi Samba for the past 3 or so years.  I first visited with friends for dinner. I really didn't think much of the food back then as it was so overpriced, the stuffy service didn't help. The atmosphere in the bar however was really good. So since then I have been a regular to the bar only!  I had noticed on my last few visits that things were going down hill. When you are paying £7 for a small bottle of beer or £17 for a cocktail you kind of expect a nice drink and a certain level of service.  Instead I've noticed the quality of both have severely gone downhill and the service is downright rude.  On one of my recent visits I waited at the bar for 30 mins only for the barman to tell me I wasn't going I be served because I was standing at the wrong section of the bar. He had just served someone standing next to me!  When I explained that I had been waiting 30 mins and asked if I moved if he would serve me, I was ignored.  I was so annoyed I just got my stuff and left with the rest of my party. I was still fuming a few days later so I sent a complaint via email.  Within a few days I received a response from the managements of the bar apologising and asking if I would like to come back for complimentary drinks and snacks to prove my experience was a one off. I took up this offer and actually thought we we would be taken care of. I was told to go to the front desk and tell them I have an area reserved in my name and me and my party would be taken care of. Well we got there and no one had a clue about such reservation. I was told to speak to Gareth (the duty manager on the night) if any issues. Gareth couldn't be located for 20 minutes.  When we finally tracked him down he did know of the reservation but didn't bother to actually reserve any seats, so we had to be wait whilst he run around trying to find somewhere. There wasn't any food as promised but we was given £125 on tab. This sounds great and you are probably thinking why am I still not satisfied. Each drink took over 30 mins to arrive again!!  This was so annoying and actually spoiled our night.  We ended up using the money on tab and leaving straight away.  We went to the alchemist for decent cocktails at half the price all served with a smile. I'm not generally one to complain but this place clearly thinks it's something great.

title: Sushi sambaaaaaaaa
comment: Amazing views, fantastic vibrant atmosphere, scrumptious food, servers with great attitudes. This place is a class act minus the snobbery. Not for folks who are looking to limit costs. This is the place to splash out!!!!

title: For memorable and special occasions!
comment: I have been to the Sushi Samba bar before but I took my friend recently there who was visiting London. We did not book in advance and did not get a table in the main restaurant but we still had an amazing time. We arrived half hour before sunset and watched the heaven transform over a drink. We then got space at the Sushi bar where we had an amazing dinner. The food had amazing flavours and presentation. The veggie options were limited but the food is recommendable. I would advise to book a table well in advance and keep this for special occasions as it ain't cheap.

title: Fantastiv views! Good food! Lethal drinks!
comment: I had gone with my girlfriend for her birthday in July. The view from the restaurant is to die for. Sweeping views of London and beyond and on a clear day its a treat!  The service was attentive and prompt. I would say the food was good but by no means extra-ordinary. I guess you are paying for the view and the ambience more than anything else. The bar section was pretty full with people standing around and chatting away with the drinks in their hands.  The best tip I could give you is to have your lunch or dinner indoors and then sit outside in the verandah for your desserts and coffee with the whole of London spread out in front of you! A must visit for the beautiful views and amazing drinks.

title: Incredible views, beautiful bar, average cocktails
comment: The bar is so lovely, decorated beautifully and all the staff are very attentive. Yes the cocktails are quite expensive, but I feel like you're paying for exceptional surroundings and atmosphere, not just the drinks themselves. However my vodka martini was amazingly average, it really didn't taste particularly nice so I left half of it. The other cocktails I tried were nice, a little too sweet for my taste, and when I specifically requested one that wasn't too sweet I was still given a sugar overload. Maybe if I went back again I would be a little more specific with cocktail requests.

title: Great Experience!
comment: My daughter was keen to go here having read about it recently. The trip up to the 38th floor in the super fast lift was breathtaking! Not for the faint hearted.  I had asked for a table next to the window which we were given. On arrival in the reception everyone was so friendly and welcoming and made us feel very special.  Our dedicated waiter was very difficult to understand when he explained the different food options to us. He was friendly and professional though.  There was a mistake with one of our orders, which was taken away without any fuss. The food was so well presented, unusual with a truly contemporary twist to it. Everything was delicious. Interesting combinations of flavours, with so many choices from the menu.  The whole restaurant was buzzing and just had a lovely feel to it. The views are amazing. Why pay to go to the top of The Shard when you can go here? In all a lovely atmosphere. The prices are typically high London prices of course.  The journey going down in the lift seemed to be even faster!! I would recommend not having too many cocktails!!

title: Fantastic Venue for Corporate Event
comment: What a view over the City of London at a recent Corporate Event. The venue itself is great and the staff very attentive. We had a disco and a Samba dancing team which were great and the costumes terrific. Drinks were paid for but buying them yourselves would have been very expensive.

title: mothers day celebration lunch
comment: having been to almost all of the restaurants situated within the new London's iconic buildings this one is one of the best as far as food is concerned. Lacks the panoramic views the others offer but has a great lift that is situated on the outside of the building so guess the views are there whilst going up or down in the lifts but apart from that highly recommend it

title: Skyscraper gourmet heaven
comment: Delicious fusion Peruvian, Japanese and Brazilian food, every dish better than the previous one. We were a party of six and had the opportunity to share fourteen different dishes.  Service very attentive.  Views impressive.

title: Professional
comment: Very average price to have the best suchi on the 38th floor  Very professional team .the best service especially Ruta whom served us perfectly  Thanks Ruta and we will go back

title:
Breathtaking view
Exotic bar
Excellent sushi
comment: As we visited the place twice the feeling was very strong both times. The entrance to the bar becomes a big smile as you see the view outside and the terrace bar is unique in that hight! The restaurant represents the epitomy of dinner art and the cuisine is fantastic, we loved the sushi London plate. Enjoy the elevator as it's going in absolute silence to the 38th floor!!!

title: An exquisite dining experience
comment: From the moment your are rapidly whisked from the street to the 38th floor of the Heron Tower, you know from the awesome decor of the restaurant and the stunning views of London that this will be a special evening. And the bar and the kitchen do not disappoint. The evening started with a perfectly mixed "chucumber." We stuck with the small plates which included shrimp tempura, crispy taquitos, seviche scallops, pork ribs and eggplant -- all of which were stunning in their presentation and flavor.  Dessert was the passion fruit cake and "with love from Rio"  All in all -- a memorable evening.

title: Beautiful place and views but a little over expensive!
comment: Visited here with a friend. The bar is beautiful and staff very good, the views upstairs are well worth the visit however £24 for a vodka coke and a bottle of lager seemed steep and looking at the wine menu there is very little choice and a basic bottle of White was £65!

title: Excellent views
comment: Stunning views and good food! I'm not usually a fan of Japanese cuisine but was surprised by how much I enjoyed it here.  On request, the bartender made non-alcoholic cocktails for me which were some of the best I've ever had!!

title: Excellent choice for a celebration
comment: Fantastic views from the terrace and fantastic food - cocktails were also excellent and the evening we were in they had a visiting troupe of Brazilian dancers which created a carnival type atmosphere! Service was discrete but attentive and some excellent suggestions were provided for food choice. All in all superb experience and highly recommended!

title: For the foodie
comment: No arguments here regarding the food. The chefs are no only artistic with the way in which they present the meals, but the flavours are divine. It's just a shame that the service does not match up to the talents of those in the kitchen. My fiancé and I went for dinner over the weekend to celebrate my 29th and from the moment we arrived the restaurant staff were overly snotty. We ordered 7-8 small dishes to sample over the course of the evening (the table was reserved for 2 hours) and within 10minutes of placing the order we were surrounded by waiters aggressively trying to force the plates onto our table instead of bringing the dishes out once space had been made available. Twice our dedicated waiter had to remove dishes from our table due to the eagerness of the supplementary restaurant staff. Anyway, the food is great, but expect rudeness from those employed there... it's just that sort of place.

title: Wow! Wow! Wow!
comment: Wow for the spectacular night views over London, wow for the great buzzy atmosphere in the restaurant, and wow again for the excellent attentive staff. And a fourth WOW! for the fabulous food served by Sushisamba. My wife and I have been married for more than forty years, and we both agreed that it was one of the finest meals we've ever had. Firstly, it was beautifully presented, then the aromas were mouth watering, thirdly the ingredients were both fresh and good quality, but most importantly it all tasted so damn good! Among the dishes we tried were shrimp tempura, yellowtail taquitos, scallop seviche, churrasco Rio Grande, and salmon sashimi, all of which sent us into raptures. Our party also shared puddings, and I am happy to tell you that they were all up to the same standard. This was our second visit to this restaurant in two years, and, while we enjoyed the first meal, this latest one was a class above.

title: No amount of good food could make up for that awful servoce
comment: Rude. That's the first word that pops into my mind when I think about our meal at Sushi Samba. So much so, that even when the food came (which was actually good), we couldn't really enjoy it. The chefs are being seriously let down by the front of house staff. Being herded from station to station. Waiting at the front desk for someone to come and take my name. But they couldn't take me to my table. I had to wait for another earpiece wielding suit to come along. Who then forgot what table he was taking me to.  Fortunately, my friend had arrived before me, so I could take us to my table. The staff seem to want to put up every barrier possible to actually get into the restaurant. It took my fiance 20 minutes from arriving at the front desk downstairs, to actually sitting with us at the table. One of my friends was arriving later to meet us for a drink at the bar. She'd arrived a bit early, whilst we were just finishing up, but wasn't allowed to come into the dining room to see us.  When asking for recommendations, three of the five staff who served us seemed totally uninterested in talking to us. One suggested edamame beans, and then when we didn't answer straight away (we were clearly reading the description, as he hadn't given us any more information or choices), he actually said "Hello?!" is that patronising, stroppy way that you expect from grumpy teenagers or arrogant, highly strung executives. The bar was nice, but very little outside seating. The terrace is beautiful, but we didn't hang about because it was absolutely freezing, and only one heat lamp seemed to be working. There is an amazing fire pit, but, as you would expect, it was quite crowded. I, for one, shan't be going there again. Rude.

title: Great Food but questionable people skills….
comment: It is really difficult to get a reservation for this restaurant and that is of course due to the location, the view, the venue and the Chef!! The food was really good, well presented and tasty. Do yourself a favour and try the Samba Rolls - Lawdy Lawd, they were amazing!!! Of course this is not the place you go to for an 'affordable' meal… our bill for three people including one drink each was £55 per person. But certainly well worth it.  The staff are rather assertive in letting you know until what time you have the table and will remind you once your time is up. Again not a problem, due to the popularity of the restaurant. However, we had a number of staff serving our table at various points in time but we were aware that we had a allocated Waitron. She made it rather clear that she did not particularly enjoy our table, which I presume was due to the questions we asked as it was our first time. The rest of the waiters continued to pass my chair and continually bumped into it and not once did they apologise. I did my best to push my chair in as much as possible, but they were intent on serving food and little regard was given to the rude behaviour that they were engaging in. Of course it is a busy restaurant but it was blatantly rude. And of course we were promptly ushered out at 9pm after the 12,5% service charge was included. In fairness, the restaurant was there before the staff so it is well worth a visit. Even if you don't have a meal just go for an enjoyable evening at the Bar. A must-do when in London!

title: Wow
comment: This place is fantastic i was with my partner for a dinner. we were served by an Italian guy who comes from Sicily and all of his suggestions have made our dinner an unforgettable journey of unique flavors. fresh fish and presented in an appealing manner.

title: One of London's best....
comment: Truly delicious food. Great views. Superb service. Relaxed but stylish ambience. A beautiful outdoor terrace with bar high above the city. An elevator so fast it makes your ears pop! We loved it.

title: An unforgettable experience
comment: Been in sushi samba London just one ( due the price...) But I've no problem to recommend this restaurant on top of a skyscraper of London. Not a sushi lover this experience changed my mind. Absolutely amazing the food, specially the desserts, just fireworks in your mouth. The place was busy and needs to be reserved with at least a week to get a Friday or Saturday night table not very early or very late. The service was helpful, explaining what I would like because I had not much experience about it. The terrace is a must see place in the city, with an impressive view of the city from the Heron Tower, seeing the Gherkin very close! As I said a 100% recommended restaurant if you know how much cost...

title: The view comes with a price, but what a view it is!
comment: I went to Sushi Samba for drinks with a few Friends after work and the view captivated me! The cocktails are delicious yet a bit on the expensive side. The sushi bar was a hit with my friends and is quite good value.

title: Super Atmosphere and Views
comment: This place is always busy and buzzy and difficult to get a reservation , the reason is simple , the place is designed beautifully with the most amazing views over London and you are served the most fantastic food . It is not cheap but on par with top class London restaurants , a little bit out from the west end but worth the trip .

title: Superb!
comment: This was a Birthday celebration, we had the best table in the restaurant with an amazing view. The food and cocktails were outstanding and the service was excellent. The staff are really attentive and helpful, they made this a very memorable evening, thoroughly enjoyed by all.

title: Nice sushi in a loud place
comment: The view is of course breathtaking, the sushi pretty nice (also if not special) and overpriced; the atmosphere....oh my God! Loud, with people around screaming and a place probably much more for teenagers. I won't come back again!

title: a special treat
comment: Had a great time here, food was expensive but tasty. Great views over London - especially the Gherkin building across the road. Special dinner had been looking forward to it for the whole trip. Wasn't dissapointed, wasn't blown away though either.

title: Bit of a let down
comment: The service is fantastic; from the very prompt reply to my late request for a table to the dessert celebrating our anniversary, which was a lovely touch and really appreciated. The views over London are amazing and I can imagine how lovely it is in Summer when you can sit outside on the terrace. The food, for me, was just OK, nothing special. We tried a variety of dishes but nothing "wowed" us. Having been to Nobu and Roka, this restaurant is just as expensive (if not more so), yet it didn't feel as if we'd indulged ourselves for a special occasion, we felt a bit ripped off really. I would expect to be salivating at the thought of the meal we had, I'm not. Shame.

title: Cocktails made with love and served with love
comment: Fab outdoor cocktail bar! Bartenders knowledge of cocktails was impressive and even the 'non alcholic' options were delicious. The waitresses knowledge of the menu was commendable and the recommendations were delectable.

title: Ask for Jacob
comment: I had a fabulous long lunch at Sushisamba, made particularly special by our host Jacob. He was so knowledgable, enthusiastic and engaged with the menu that we just asked him to order for us. A great decision. Most of what he ordered - in tasting portions sizes so we could really explore everything - we might never have chosen, but all were just delicious. Really enjoyable. And what a pleasure not to have to make any decisions!  Just ask for Jacob.

title: Family lunch
comment: Great view,excellent service,the food was well presented and tasty but not excellent. I mostly enjoy  the atmosphere of the place.

title: It had the Wow factor
comment: My daughter and son in law took me here for a birthday treat, we ate in the restaurant where we were served by very helpful and friendly staff. The view was amazing and the food was so very different. The combination of sushi and South America worked, it was delightful. Thank you for a very memorable occasion.

title: Food, drink, service, atmosphere and view - all excellent
comment: I came here on a Saturday lunch time with some friends and it was a really good experience. The atmosphere was just right and the service was very good. Couldn't fault the food at all and the cocktails were very good. I Would definitely recommend it.

title: Tired, dusty & in need of TLC, £250 bill for an average birthday lunch,
comment: Took 25 minutes to get served by a bored disengaged barman, a smile would have been nice when he asked for £54 for an average bottle of Italian wine, View fantastic, weather sunny & our Spanish waiter was lovely. The starters were tasty as was the 'In between' course of black cod as recommended by the waiter but the Sushi was very disappointing, the rice was dry & hard & the fish on top had curled up at the edges so wonder if it has been made in bulk the day before! I don't expect to pay £23 for 6 individual rolls of dried up Sushi from a 'sushi' restaurant when you could buy fresher for under £5 at a supermarket :-( The dangling lights were eye catching but were covered in clumpy dust and the red velour wrap around seats were all stained and dirty. sorry Sushisamba you need an upgrade or a deep clean as you are past your sell by date.

title: Too late to samba
comment: I visited this great restuarant for perhaps the 6th time and was, for the first time, a little disappointed. Due to never being able to book at a 'normal' time ( early or late only) our table was booked for 21:45. This was already a stretch for my friend as he had landed from New York early that morning!! Our table was not available until 22:20 and the only offer we got was a glass of cheap cava to placate our impatience. We complained and - to be fair to the restuarant) they wrote off our pre dinner bar drinks. I appreciate it is difficult to 'move' people but at that late hour sime pressure needs to be put on lingering guests. When finally seated the table service and the food was (as usual) excellent.!! I will soon be returning and only hope the timing is improved.

title: Great view, amazing food!
comment: Sushisamba are fast becoming one of the trendiest places to go for food and drink in the city of London. Your experience starts with an glass lift shooting you up 38 floors in a matter of seconds offering you an amazing view from the minute you start your ride until you reach the entrance to the restaurant. When you arrive you will walk down a narrow corridor and arrive at a less than impressive (small) bar with three staff on it seeming like they're struggling with the demands of the three or four deep throng of newly arrived customers but don't rush, take a look out on the amazing roof terrace space and grab a quick glance of another aspect of London's skyline that you wouldn't have got from the lift ride (that also has a bar on it, though this would only be open in the summer months and not in February when I was there). Once you've settled in, I suggest you take a walk up the orange spiral staircase to the 39th floor where a longer bar awaits you; less rushed and better equipped with less flustered bar staff manning it. Cocktails here are amazing but not cheap - £12 - £18 each is the norm but the craft used to make them is well worth watching :-) Take in the views and chat the small stuff, the Brazilian samba music soundtrack gives this venue a very cool yet relaxed vibe and you could easily order 2, 3 or even 4 rounds of cocktails without looking at your watch once.  Should you however have booked a table for the restaurant, ensure you arrive at the check-in desk on time otherwise you are likely to lose your reservation; we were told they were running slightly late and to wait in the bar so we went outside on the terrace and then when they couldn't find us, we nearly lost our table (so wouldn't be pleased after booking it 8 weeks earlier!) but once in the restaurant and having ordered, the food came swiftly and was presented immaculately. The waiters were all very friendly and helpful, describing each dish in detail and not rushing us to finish any course at any point. The food is a Japanese/Brazilian/Peruvian fusion so needs a little explaining but the items we ordered were simply amazing!  A meal here is an event, a special treat and definitely memorable for all the right reasons, do be prepared however to spend more than you would in lots of other places, 3 rounds of cocktails and 6 sushi dishes between 2 of us came to £230.00 so not a cheap night but WOW, no regrets on any of it - it made our weekend!!

title: Fabulous view and good sushi
comment: Somewhere a bit different although pretty hard to get a reservation - this was surprising as the restaurant wasn't full when I visited. The bar area is nice, and the restaurant area is very cool although there is one duff table for two which basically looks straight into two guys cooking and no perspective of anything else (ask for a table by a window). Fortunately, we were able to change table - otherwise I would not have stayed especially given the price tag. Sushi was great although the Brazilian options are limited. Worth a visit.

title: On top 10
comment: Service is very good and knowledgable. Food is fresh and taste amazing. There is an extensive choice even for vegans! The black cod is the best in town. Have outdoor sitting on beautiful days. Extra fast lift to way up, open on the city, breathtaking view! One of the vet best places (i only had many lunch there, no dinners, i m sure views are equaly fantastic)

title: Amazing view!!
comment: Went here on the weekend for a meal. In absolutely petrified of heights so was not looking forward to the lift journey, the lift goes fast very fast and extremely high. We was lucky enough to get a window sit, great for my partner anyways I didn't dare to look out. When I did catch a glimpse though, the view is amazing. You could literally see the whole of London was really breathtaking. Anyways back to the food, i ordered a fish dish, mmmmm it was amazing i have definitely ate better. The staff was so friendly and very smiley which was nice. It is expensive for the two of us, two mains, two deserts and one bottle of house wine and the bill came to £130. I would definitely recommend going for the views and maybe just for drinks instead. It's also nice for a quiet intimate dinner, the musics very low and calm and the atmosphere feels very chilled. I would Go back but maybe next time just for drinks.

title: Amazing
comment: Went to Sushi Samba for daughter's birthday. The view was amazing.Outstanding food and service.Otto, Errol and Martina were exceptional staff. Highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Amazing views! Food.......
comment: So was quite nervous about going here because I'm quite nervous about Heights and I'm very nervous about lifts. The lift journey was scary, it goes very fast and wow it's high very high. We was lucky enough to get an excellent table right by the window which was really breathtaking the view is just something else, you can literally see the whole of London and it's even more beautiful at night time. The staff was friendly and smiley. The food however I didn't find too amazing. Maybe it's just me I don't know but if I'm paying £40 for one main I kinda want it to be amazing. The setting in there is very calm, the music is low and calm, the lights are very dim. I wouldn't recommend it for a group of girls looking to have fun it's more for a romantic quiet dinner. I would go back defiantly for the views, maybe next time just drinks though.

title: The best landscape in London
comment: Been here few times and the last timeI have been here with my bf for our anniversary.... What can I say about this place....Everything perfect, the sushi , the atmosphere ,the view and the staff. Definatelly to try, highly recommended !

title: Great food and ambiance
comment: I'm lucky enough to have been here twice - once for an informal business lunch during the week, and this time for pure pleasure with the other half on a Saturday lunchtime. We had a selection of the cocktails, and food from various parts of the menu, as well as desserts. It really was all excellent and a bit different to the sort of places I would usually eat. We found the sushi and the fusion elements inventive and excellent in taste and presentation. The staff were friendly, knowledgable, and helpful (without lingering too much), the decor and ambiance were very striking, and the views on a clear day are great. I find upscale restaurants can be stuffy and too full of "suits" or too busy trying to be clever and delivering meagre portions, but that is not the case here - just great food, with a good mixed crowd, even on a weekday lunchtime. It works best if you are in a small group then you can really order lots of different things to try, but my most recent visit was as a couple and we still had some good variety (with advice from the server on quantities). Overall one of my favourite restaurants. The only downside is the wait for a reservation (it is popular), and it is pricey (so a special treat rather than a regular haunt).

title: Great experience for a special occasion
comment: We went as a family of five for dinner. The experience is amazing. The view, the atmosphere and the food are fantastic. It adds up on your bill but it worth every penny for a special occasion. We tried the Kobe beef (a tiny portion as the other one is not affordable), really expensive but a real experience. I have never tasted meet like this before. The mix between Peruvian Brazilian and Japanese is a success and quite unique I think.

title: Lovely sushi
comment: Went for dinner and had a lovely experience at Sushi Samba. Views are amazing and the food was good - will definitely go back. Go for the black cod!

title: Amazing dessert, good food
comment: I went here for my birthday meal with my family. The food was really impressive, as were the drinks, the range of choice made it great for sharing a number of plates. What stood out in particular were the desserts, which were amazing, as well as the view obviously.

title: Good views food service
comment: Good food service and views packed restaurant very impressive a very city crowd. Bar had a good scene will be back good for large groups and celebrations. Lift is awesome

title: Ok...
comment: Been here plenty of times, at least 3 times a month, the service seems to have dropped a lot from when I first visited it ...Perhaps because of the amounts of people coming in ...incredibly hard to get a table which is pretty annoying ... Don't go for the Brazilian dishes as they are not authentic Brazilian... I am Brazilian ... I always order the tacos with beef and fish and the São Paulo roll is to die for ! The best thing in the menu by far ! It'sj a shame they don't have more cuts of tuna... GReat atmosphere..

title: Late lunch
comment: Visited "Sushi Samba" yesterday for a late lunch, 5 of us arrived, coats were taken and shown through to the restaurant. Certainly impresses (and loved the glass lift up to the 38th floor too), the view is amazing and we had a great table near the window. Overall I really liked it, few observations that are worth mentioning. Our main waiter (we seem to have about 4, this might explain things later) was great, very friendly and explained the menu very well. He advised that most dishes were quite small and a certain number should be ordered for the table. The waiter suggested I think it was a "churacas" meat platter, this was ordered along with a hot stone wagyu beef dish, sadly these never arrived and on chasing these after all the other food had been finished, it transpired the request for those never made it to the kitchen and the waiter had now disappeared. This happened once more with a drinks order too unfortunately,perhaps it was down to multiple waiters serving but it was a bit frustrating.. It is definitely a very expensive place to eat,and some dishes provide better value than others as others comments suggest, food at that price requires a high level of service though and that mark was just missed on this occasion.

title: Worth the price
comment: Excellent food coupled with spectacular views. Had a celebratory business lunch for a colleague. The food was first class the rolls are both tasty and filling. Yes the price is high but given so many City restaurants charge top dollar for average food here you getr excellent food with unique views as well.

title: Beautifully designed space- incredible views
comment: The restaurant looks incredible and boasts amazing views of the city. If you are just going to the bar: Sometimes it seems they make people queue at the bottom even when there is plenty of space just to create hype (I find that a bit annoying). Food is excellent, a heated twist on traditional sushi, though a bit over priced. Overall, a must for visitors to London.

title: Apart from the view, this is simply terrible
comment: I'm sorry but don't believe the hype. The view is amazing and the lift to the 38th floor is cool and quite an experience. But, and it's a big but, the food and service are simply terrible.  This is not a cheap place to eat and personally, I've had better seafood & sushi at Itsu for lunch costing me £7. The service was equally as bad, we were being brought next courses before the last course empty plates had been taken away and astonishingly, rather than take the old plates away, they actually just pushed them to one side to put the new food down!!! So we sat with a table cramped full of empty and dirty plates as new food was squashed in alonsgide. At a restaurant where the cheapest red wine is £54 for an average (i.e £8 from Waitorse) Rioja, you expect a little more when your total bill is well into the £hundreds.  I love food, and I appreciate you get good and bad. I've eaten street food to 3 Michelin stars and had good and bad experiences and this was by far, the biggest let down I've ever had when you compare hype, reputation, cost and the actual experience - complacency at its worst and I wish we'd never gone - waste if money, however they do have a nice view!!

title: Good but needs a bit of TLC
comment: We popped along here for pre dinner drinks for my wife's birthday. The trip to the 39th floor and the views are stunning. Drink service was a bit slow even though it wasn't overly busy but the staff were very welcoming. I can't comment on the food. The views were great albeit the best view of the shard has been obstructed by a new building which is annoying and obviously out of control of the owners, but this venue is in need of some serious TLC. The toilets were run down and tired. The flush for one of the urinals was smashed so there was no way to flush it, the wood work around the sinks was rotten and fixtures and fittings were dirty and broken. I know this is a busy venue but they really need to give it a little tlc to bring it up to the standards of other london venues.

title: Amazing food!
comment: We absolutely love the food here. The last time we came here was the first time we had been on a Saturday night, so we had a few cocktails too which were also delicious. The shrimp tempura is absolutely gorgeous - I could eat it forever! If you have room for desert then I would recommend the chocolate banana cake! The views and atmosphere are also really good and the outdoor bar is lovely! Yes, it is pricey, but for a treat I think it is worth it!

title: Beautiful venue, good food!
comment: The key feature of this restaurant is the views of London city! The food was really good and fresh, couldn't fault it. However, service was a bit on the average side and took a while to get drinks. I still enjoyed my dinner and it's a nice restaurant to take visitors!

title: Another dose please...
comment: Loved everything. The place is on high sky tower, is super cool full of lights and decoration with a stunning view of London. The crew and people working there are kind and friendly, the guy who served us gave perfect suggestion on the choice, I probably had the best sushi of my life! An amazing tasty mozzarella, with some barbecue sauce and I don't remember what else…any way in one word I have to go back my palate is requesting me "another dose" of such incredible mix of food…easy to get addicted...

title: Mediocre at best
comment: Having heard so much about this place (and previous visit to the [much better] Duck and Waffle upstairs), a group of friends and I decided to give this a whirl.  I left with the feeling that I had just been "had" - for a number of reasons:  1) The cocktail (which was on the upper end of the London price average) was mostly tasteless, as were all of them in fact - we were a group of 6 and all underwhelmed  2) The sushi was mediocre. Nice fresh sashimi (probably some of the best I have had)but the rest of it was no different from the quality you can get in Itsu for a fraction of the price. Vastly, vastly overpriced for what it was - £14 for 4 Maki rolls, no thank you very much! I understand paying a premium for good food, but the quality MUST match up which for me, it did not...  3) The service - a friend of mine who was with us in the group was raving about the last time he had been to Sushisamba and said the waiter he and his girlfriend had was literally doing cartwheels out of the kitchen as he was so excited to serve them and be enthusiastic about the food. Instead for us, a very dour waiter came over with an attitude like we were being a nuisance for even thinking we would like to be served. Distinct lack of knowledge about the menu or what to recommend and forgot about us numerous times, we had to crane our necks to get his attention. When the bill finally came (after a lot of effort to get said waiter's attention), we split the bill and all sat with our cards at the ready on the table. Various waiters sashayed by and ignored us, until the floor manager spotted that we had our cards out and came over and we were finally able to pay.  For the amount of money you shell out and the great location of this restaurant, one would expect both higher quality food and service. I have had considerably better food and service for the same price in other establishments in London, and am in no hurry to go back to Sushisamba

title: Sushi City
comment: I visited the bar only, on my way to the Duck & Waffle, which is a few floors up. Had some great cocktails and were also given a tour of the upstairs and VIP areas. Drinks were great, may return for food another time, but the real star of the show of this place is the view - it is absolutely incredible, worth going up in the lift just for that!

title: Exceptional food, service and location
comment: It's hard to think how this place could be improved. Beautiful food, super service and one of the most amazing locations, and views definitely in the UK, if not the world. Ok, so it's not cheap, but if you want to impress someone then there are few better places to do it.

title: Amazing Food & Views
comment: We went as a group of four (two couples) on a Friday evening about 18:30 and the restaurant was already super busy. The atmosphere was fantastic and the views of London from the 38th floor were incredible.  We ordered a lot of food as we wanted to try as much as possible. Every dish we ordered was absolutely delicious and we couldn't stop praising it whilst we were there.  Some people have mentioned they had poor service on here, but we didn't. The service was fantastic, our waiter was so knowledgeable and talked us through the menu and gave us recommendations too. Sushi Samba is expensive and it's not a restaurant I'd go regularly as it is a 'treat' but we absolutely loved it and I would definitely go back.

title: Quite a nice Restaurant
comment: I visited the restaurant after having to book weeks in advance. It's generally a decent restaurant, we were given a view by the window and the view of London city was magnificent. The food was nice and it's definitely a place to visit at least once.

title: Nothing special
comment: Had a lot of things about the place but majority of them were not good. Went to visit myself and the only cool thing is the lift and the view. Not so impressed by the menu and service.

title: Fusion food
comment: We are sushi samba lovers, I guess the one in Vegas is our favorite restaurant, we went there so many times. I wanted to taste the one in London, it was quite difficult to get a reservation, because it's really a famous and good restaurant. The place is on top of the heron tower, so the view is beautiful.  The food is just awesome, it was the Kobe week and we took the kobe to cook on hot stone at your table. If you don't know the meat you definitely have to taste it, it is so good… We drank sake with the food and it goes really with it. The waiter was really helpful with the choice.  The food is as good as the one in Vegas, the only difference is that the place is really nice but not as exotic as the one in Vegas.

title: Lovely evening, great views
comment: Visited on a Friday night for the bar. If you aren't going for food make sure you specify that you are only going for the bar otherwise you could end up stuck in queue. The views are stunning. Service is a bit slow but the cocktails were nice. Will definitely come again, next time to try the food.

title: Great food, flawless service and amazing view, but overpriced
comment: Although it is an amazing restaurant, you should be prepared for a overpriced bill. However the experience is incredible, and totally worthy. The tiraditos are amazing and the dessert is delicious as well (try the chocolate banana cake or the passion fruit cake).

title: Amazing!
comment: Loved everything about this place.  Going up the sky tower with a stunning view of London was the highlight.  The staff are on the ball, and we were given a brilliant service from the moment we got there. The food itself was divine. I can honestly say I have not tasted food like this before. The only negative was the bbq'ed beef we ate - rubbery :(  This is a place for a special occasion!

title: nice amtosphere
comment: it may not be the best sushi you've ever eaten but its more than worth the price as its pretty cheap for a london top restaurnt. the design is something new and the view beautiful. its perfect to bring someone who wasnt in london before.

title: Birthday Treat
comment: Although the highly overrated Sushisamba delivered on experience the food was not that great for the price we paid. Would recommend this place only for drinks and view, definitely not for food.

title: What a treat !!
comment: A fantastic treat courtesy of our son and daughter-in-law. Completely lived up to our expectations and then exceeded them. Unrivalled views above London, original and delicious cuisine, relaxed atmosphere, helpful and friendly staff. 10/10. Can't really comment on the price as we weren't paying. Hooray !!

title: Amazing Views, amazing food
comment: Beautiful interiors and a lovely lounge to have a drink, this restaurant screams luxury, special occasions and delicious dining. The views from the roof terrace are picturesque and the heaters keep you warm in the colder months. The food, right from the appetisers are mind blowing, things as simple as fried green beans with garlic and truffle dipping sauce were a delight to taste. Once the time for the table was up we were moved to a private dining area, a lot more secluded and quiet, perfect for a couple on a date. The views from the 39th floor were even more stunning and breathtaking, and made the evening much more special. The staff are attentive and the bar is lively for drinks before or after your meal. I would definitely recommend going, even for a vegetarian such as myself. Divine food in gorgeous surroundings.

title: Very Pricey and Service Charge at BAR?
comment: Went for drinks and cocktails last Saturday and had to que at the bar to be served. When we finally did get served a small bottle of larger and a Vodka Tonic it was £22:00?! To add insult to injury however we were also charged a 12.5% 'Service Charge' for being served at the bar?! Not sure how long the Height Novelty will last and people will realise what a rip-off this bar is?

title: Mostly good service
comment: As part of my Xmas gift my wife took us for dinner here. Largely the service was great. When arriving we were made available a better table by the window which was a key reasonto diner in the Heron tower. Unfortunately our main waiter after moving tables was very abrupt and gave one word answers while immediately leaving our table. The teriyaki sauce on the chicken was thin and very disappointing. We were offered a replacement dish and chose beef. For me you shouldn't have the choice of how it was cooked, from the width of the steak it should have been very pink, so was my mistake to request medium rare. The sushi itself was really delicious and when next visiting we will only dine on this with the outstanding cocktails which was one of the best I ever tried. So in summary I would say avoid the hot food and enjoy the view, customer service moved this review from 3 to 4/5

title: Service to be improved...
comment: Food - delicious (Samba London especially). View - great! Service - bad! When we got our bill we noticed we were charged for something what we didn't order (the amount to be paid was doubled...), after asking the waiter for the correct bill, again we received the wrong one (still some items which were not ours)! Only third attempt was ok...

title: Expensive Drinks - you might wait for the view...
comment: Went for a few beers in Sushisamba. The restaurant is spread over 2 floors with an outside area too. This is a very popular spot in the heart of the city. If you go there after work, expect all the best viewing spots by the windows to be occupied. In fact, if you are unlucky you could spend some time prowling the area looking for people who look like they might be leaving. There are plenty of areas to sit - just a lot of them are away from the windows. Beer was Asahi. And was expensive. View (when we got there) was terrific.

title: Wow what a view
comment: Had a business meeting over a lunchtime at Sushisamba. The team were very informative on the menu and keen to share their favourites which was really helpful as there is quite a bit to choose from. It was quite busy on the day I was there but it did't stop the team giving a great service to us and all the tables around us. There is a great bar outside which I am sure is great in the warmer weather. The restaurant is on the 38th floor with great views over the city and London. The food was really tasty, black cod was good and so was the sushi we had.

title: Amazing Food....not so great service.
comment: I visited Sushi Samba with two friends for dinner and cannot fault the food, our server Rocco and the incredible view. We couldn't decide from the menu what we wanted so we left it to Rocco to decide and he made excellent choices, without a huge bill at the end. The cocktails were also delicious, although enjoyed after a 20 minute wait at the bar.  Unfortunately my experience was dampened by the poor service of the hostess who upon our arrival (on time) told us our table wasn't ready and she would find us at the bar when it was. 20 minutes later we were still waiting and when I asked her again she said 2 minutes. Another 15 and we are still waiting. When I asked a second time I was barely acknowledged and she proceeded to help four other waiting groups, with me clearly standing there. A waitress then appeared to take me and my party to our table, however none of this was explained.  My expectations were exceeded with the amazing food, however I would think twice about visiting again based on the service of the hostess.

title: Truly Amazing Experience
comment: This is a wonderful restaurant and we had one of the most amazing meals, thanks for a great experience.  Upon entry you are greeted and offered a drink at the bar prior to sitting, which we enjoyed with the amazing panoramic view of London. I can really recommend the Shiso Fine cocktail as the was beautiful and delicious.  Then when taken through to the dining area it is beautifully decorated with the main focus being the views the restaurant offers. We were welcomed by our waiter (Felix) and sat at our table. We spent some time looking at what was on offer, struggling to narrow the menu down. Our waiter spent some time getting to know us, what we like to eat and having discussed these he was able to suggest the best combination of items from the menu and really feel that having taken his suggestion we had some of the most delicious food I have ever had.  I even had a dessert 'Chocolate Bana Cake' which was out of this world and if you can do save room for this. I really do recommend this restaurant and cannot wait for a return visit.

title: Amazing Food
comment: So I was dreading being taken to this restaurant for two reasons. One, I do not like heights. Two, I've never really got sushi! I was a little freaked at walking into the bar, and looking down on The Gherkin building. This restaurant is very high!  So a business colleague phoned ahead and let them know I was not crazy about the height, and could they please sit us in the middle of the room. We were given a lovely booth right in the middle of room and within 10 minutes I was feeling absolutely fine.  The waiter was very knowledgeable about the food, he explained that Sushi Samba is Sushi meets Brazilian and Peruvian, and we asked him for some recommendations. We ordered everything he recommended. This is a great sharing restaurant, and you can order lots of little plates to share. We ordered about 10 plates between five of us. Really enjoyed the Black Cod, Sea Bass Tempura, Toro Sashimi, and Kobe Beef burgers. Chocolate Banana Cake dessert is heavenly. Fully recommend this restaurant! Did not want to leave the restaurant, as the lift lobby is all glass you can see all the way down to the ground. My colleagues pulled me into the lift backwards with my eyes closed. Was glad to get back on the ground, but the food really was worth my visit to the top floor!

title: Wow
comment: This was my first dining experience in sushi samba and definitely won't be the last.The atmosphere and the staff were amazing-very nice,friendly,attentive just lovely.We asked to be moved to a table by the window which was accommodated-huge thank you for that.Also many thanks to the staff - Martina,Felix,Fernando(or Nando really bad with names).However,Rumen was outstanding - we were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and he took care of us very well and we got small birthday cake with candle.Nice little touch but it made big impact and put smiles on our faces.Thank you once again we will be back :)

title: Deservingly fashionable
comment: We have visited Sushisamba twice this year so far. Generally the food has been very good although the interpretation of tempura prawn is questionable. Like many, I like my tempura crisp and not soggy. The pork belly wrap was very tasty but it was a shame that it was served luke warm. The tiger rolls were absolutely amazing and the vegan and vegetarian menu pleased our table greatly although the tofu dish was bland. Despite being early for both of our reservations we were kept waiting in the bar for half an hour each time but the ambience of the restaurant made up for this and the management apologised both times with complimentary drinks. Service was good. Overall, we really enjoyed ourselves !

title: Awesome dining
comment: food was amazing, the nigiri with mozzarella was awesome as was the flambé steak skewers. Pork belly also recommended. Not the cheapest sushi but if your coming here expecting it to be then your not realising where your eating. Already booking to go back.
