title: Amazing view, but awful bar staff!
comment: After hearing great things about sushisamba, me and my girlfriend decided to stop off there on our way back to liverpool street after a great day in london. We was first told that we couldnt come in because i was wearing clothing which was not allowed, although i had checked the website previously and none of which i was wearing was against the dress code. The security then decided to let us in on the exception it was 'Valentine day'.  After going outside to take a look at the view from the outside area we went inside to get a drink from the bar, after queing for only a few minutes i asked if they sold pina coladas. I was rudely thrown a cocktail menu and told to look before i order.  After deciding to order a bottle of beer for myself and a sambatini for my girlfriend the bartender proceeded to make 2 sambatinis which i then told him i only wanted 1 as i had the bottle of beer. He then threw the drink and glass straight into the bin out of frustration, the guy in question was a male who i belived to be italian or spanish and was very rude.  After finally paying for the 2 drinks, which may i add cost an extortionate £22.50, we finished those and swiftly made our way for the exit. Overall, i would strongly advise no body to visit this bar. Unless you are willing to put up with extremely rude staff and overpriced drinks.

title: Probably the best restaurant in London right now
comment: Try to get yourself a table and you won't regret it. Once you get in, you'll understand what all the hype is about. The food is a great, the service is flawless and the views are simply second to none.

title: Beautiful place, sushi could be better
comment: I was amazed by the place, really nice and beautiful view! Also the service has been good, the food well presented but too small for my taste and i don't like the use of crabsticks... if you ask for that kind of money at least use the real crab meat!

title: Great Lunch at Sushisamba
comment: My husband took me here for lunch for my birthday and it was lovely. The waiter was very charming and attentive and explained the menu really well. I thoroughly enjoyed our lunch but I have to say - I was expecting the restaurant to be slightly more opulent and although we had a great meal, it wasn't one of my favourites. I've heard so much hype about this restaurant, but some how it didn't reach my expectations!

title: Wow
comment: My wife and I went here after I failed to secure dinner at the Shard. It was an unexpected treat. From the amazing views from the lift, to the stunning food. We relaxed in the bar before hand. It was on multiple doors where the views are exceptional and the selection of cocktails and champagnes are excellent. We then had one of the most stunning meals, where we devoured a number of varied small dishes - each one as nice as the last.  Everyone was dressed smartly. There looked to be a beautiful outside area but it was too cold for us to venture out. Highly recommended!

title: Good lunch, but irritating booking procedure
comment: Amazing location, and really good views of London from this Japanese/South -American restaurant on the 38th floor of the Heron building. This was a special treat, and it worked really well, although I did not like to booking system, as you had to confirm again a day before that you would come. I left a message on a tape and then I was left wondering if our table had actually been confirmed.  Having arrived at the restaurant we were well looked after by Otto, who spent a lot of time explaining the menu to us. He managed this well without becoming patronizing. We had 6-7 dishes and all of them were good and well prepared. In the end I asked for some more sauce, which never arrived, but the restaurant gave us a discount on the bill instead. We all really enjoyed our visit to this resaurant

title: incredible flavors, awesome view, good service
comment: As stated many times before this resturant has an amazing location. My wife and I had an early dinner here and we were blown away by the amazing flavors and the great view.  We were in London for a romantic getaway and this restaurant made it happen.

title: Yet More Food With a View
comment: Have been meaning to go here for a while but it usually needs to be booked quite a while in advance (about 6 weeks in this case). Stunning views of London of course day and night. The food, a mash up of Peruvian, Brazilian and Japanese, pretty good all round. We had five or so dishes to share with the table, then added another couple, all decent, some delicious, then dessert, which was a delicious chili, chocolate and red pepper confection. The dessert was a little larger than expected based on previous courses, so we could probably have managed with one but managed to finish, too good to leave!

title: Lovely bar
comment: Lovely bar, beautiful cocktails and crowd, but once past the lift on the way up there is no sight of the amazing view!!! We were lucky enough to get a seat on the edge of a table whether we were meant to sit there or not I don't know, but it meant the waitress came over and let us order more drinks without having to queue up. She also didn't charge extra, overall a lovely evening with friends :))

title: Amazing food and great food
comment: The view from this restaurant is amazing, the restaurant and bar area has a great atmosphere. Really friendly waiting staff on hand to guide you through the menu. The food was simply delicious, a great twist on regular sushi. Would recommend this restaurant for a great night out.

title: Blue sky dining... and a glass elevator
comment: The glass elevator that delivered us to the restaurant was a great start to a great night... we had a friendly welcome and this continued throughout the meal. Our waiter was genuinely welcoming and informative. The food is delicious and beautifully presented and the cocktails are divine. Loved it!

title: flawless
comment: everything was delicious, get the gyoza or regret it. i have a feeling this may be said for alot of what is on the menu here. sushi samba is worth going to for drinks alone beautiful and decadent. very friendly waiting staff which is not always the case in london, thankyou as i believe this makes a difference to your clientel and despite being an elite establishment it does not have a thick atmosphere of pretentiousness. quite the opposite, happy couples enjoying dining. would definately return. if i was to return again i would definately bring a friend and probably book for the evening time, i recommend booking in advance!

title: Fab food
comment: Second visit to the restaurant - our first was when it just opened back in 2012. Didn't disappoint with the food or service, both were top notch and we were glad we went back. Nice to see the shrimp tempura is still on the menu - used to be called rock shrimp tempura. Think they've changed the formula a little but still tasted great. We decided to go with the restaurant's selection - shrimp tempura, yellowtail tiradito, wagyu Gyoza, black cod with miso sauce, el topo plus a few of our own selections. Couldn't fault their recommendations. The burst of flavours was delightful and we could have carried on eating except for the fact that we wanted to save space for desserts!  Highly recommended but make sure you book way ahead of time, we saw lots of people trying to get into the bar as walk ins with the hope of securing a table at bar but waiting time was roughly between 10mins to 2.5 hours at 7pm on a Friday night. At one stage there were just too many people at the bar they stopped people from riding the lifts up to the 38 floor. We were just glad we booked!

title: Food as spectacular as the view
comment: Excellent food, service, atmosphere and of course the view, I will definitely be going back and recommending. The Tacitos were to die for!

title: Excellent as always!
comment: Each time I come to London a visit to Sushi Samba is a must! Apart from the excellent food and location(overlooking most of London!) the atmosphere is always buzzing. The array of cocktails on offer are equally excellent and you always leave the place feeling satisfied. Recommendations would be the yellow tail taquitos and the el topo sushi platter! Soo good!

title: Never again
comment: I had the misfortune of taking my other half for a meal here. I was told by my teenage waiter that there was adequate choice for vegetarian - clearly he does not know the meaning of adequate or vegetarian! Bought us a £16 salad with 3 mushrooms wrapped in lettuce - really?! After waiting 45 minutes in the bar waiting for our the table I was really not in the mood for jokes! I declined the offer of a meal at which point the manager came out who looked like he was out of his face snivelling all over us and offered his card if we were to ever return again. Sorry I think I'll pass. food uninventive and wait is not worth the view. Will not be returning.

title: Great Lunch- With a Great View
comment: I have been to Sushi Samba before, but had not been back for a while. And things have not changed It was Fantastic. I asked the waiter to choose a selection of things. He chose the Prawns, some Sushi, Beef and a few other dishes. Each one was a taste sensation. He bought the right amount of food for us, and he listened to what we liked. The service was great; I need to come back again soon

title: Unbelievable!
comment: First visit to this restaurant, and will not come back. Firstly, the menu offered was sub par, the selection of sashimi is simply terrible, how can a supposed high end restaurant not have otoro?or even just plain tuna? We ordered the uni and ikura (salmon egg) sashimi, and i have to say i could have bought better quality sushi at a local fishmonger. For our main course we had the wagyu, and I must say the only acceptable part of it was the pickled plums which had a rich flavour. I specifically asked for mine to be medium rare, meaning I expect to see a notch of red and pink, not a well done overcooked steak. The main point of eating wagyu is the succulent taste, and tang the juices give off with the rich meat, not a flat iron steak I can buy in NYC for 20 dollars anywhere. Finally I DO NOT expect to be argued with by waiters, then being forced to pay a 12% service charge. The waitress dared to argue back on our selection of drinks when a female client asked for vermouth to be mixed in with her drink. If a client asks for a hint of vermouth which has an extremely low shop price, we simply do not expect an argument saying "vermouth kills the taste of the cocktail".  Will not be returning, and nor will any of my clients.

title: My fav, just keeps getting better!!
comment: So I have dined at Sushisamba regularly for the past two years, with friends, family, partner, for lunch and dinner dates, fun group dinners or for catch ups over a cocktail or two in the bar or terrace! The service just keeps getting better, the food gets tastier, the view from 38th floor never gets old and atmosphere is always great.. What more can I say! It's the restaurant I recommend to everyone, and as a self-confessed restaurant life addict I have been to many of the finest in London but Sushisamba is and always will be my fav! I'm sorry its taken me so long to review but had to thank the staff for the complimentary champagne further to slight delay in seating us when I visited with a party of 6 last weekend, keep up the good work.. I shall be back soon!

title: Too pretentious for all the wrong reasons
comment: Glamorous location and setting great views, food not too bad grill options outshone the sushi, though i am not convinced in this new idea of fusing these two food concepts together. Service was a bit all over the place with several different waiters asking us the same questions again and again. Felt like waiting staff not that truly interested in giving an intimate attention to our table. A bit of new money poser place. Hip and trendy. Setting amazing. The only thing that put me off was leaving the venue and walking through the bar, it was full of rude, over dressed, too much make up, new money types who just wanted to be seen. No class really. Some tables where in terrible positions in waiting staff corridor beside till etc. i wouldn't be bothered going back

title: Very fresh sushi rolls.
comment: FOOD QUALITY  We ve felt mostly like having sushi rolls so thats only what we ve eaten. RECOMENDATIONS SO YOU KNOW : I was very desapointed by the "samba London" one and I would not recomend it. Plus its surprisingly the most expensive while poor in flavors despite the diversity of ingredients. That been said if you like spicy the TOKYO sky tree is Fabulous and very well presented. El topo is a baked roll and it was my second favorite one! The atmosphere is really nice but try to go for dinner to make the most of it. Keep some space for the original and exotic deserts!! I was lucky enough to try them all through a desert combo (offered by the house following a complain 》》 that is service ;) and makes me want to go back ). I cant recomend you a desert more than another one because I really liked them all seriously. Be adventurous in your choice ! Its not a gastronomic restaurant, the service isnt PERFECT and some people will find it a bit overpriced but you gotta go and appreciate the environment at night.

title: Absolutely amazing!
comment: Not sure if you can find any better combination of food, service, atmosphere, view and elegance all in one!  Have been to Sushi Samba in Miami also, the London experience is something different.  A must try.

title: The perfect place for special occasions
comment: If you are in London Sushi Samba is the perfect place for special occasions. We ate here for a romantic birthday dinner. The food, the view and the atmosphere were amazing. If I'll be in London for another special occasion I definitely will plan a dinner at sushi samba. It's necessary to book your table via their website and to respect their dress code (smart casual).

title: One of the best sushi that I had!!!
comment: The beautiful place for romantic dinner and amazing view. Thank you Carolina for a great costumer service... P.S With love from Rio desert to die for ;-)

title: High quality food, drink and service
comment: Food and cocktails were excellent, along with the ambience and service. Really couldn't fault anything! Will definitely return for a meal but would be just as good just for a few drinks.

title: Uh la la!
comment: I won't bore you with theatrics, Sushisamba is everything they say it is! The glitz, the glam, and the views are breathtaking! I loved the entire evening, the energetic waiters, the free champagne (our table was late) - perfect! Try the KUROMITSU GLAZED PORK BELLY WRAPS, (from the small plates) possibly the best pork belly I've ever eaten. Beware! You will revel in enjoyment but it'll leave a noticeable dent in your pocket. Selah!

title: Amazing view of London
comment: Not a sushi lover so I was more impressed by the view, the decor and the ambiance than by the food. Loved the bar and the open air terrace that should be amazing in summer. The view is breathtaking. I love London so a restaurant with a view from the top is exceptional. A must when in London.

title: great experiance!
comment: This restaurant is lovely from the moment you step into the lift and go up to the 38th floor, the views over london are amazing, the service is fantastic, the waiters are very polite, attentive and knowledgeable, and of course the food is delicious, would highly recommend this place for any occaision.

title: Best thing is the view
comment: The view is one of the best you'll get in London and far cheaper than the Shard. However this comes at a price and isn't the cheapest place for drinks and nibbles. We queued for 15 minutes to get the lift to the top and once inside the staff weren't the best but certainly no worse than average. If you want a drink with a great view you won't top this!

title: Disappointment
comment: Disappointed, waste of my night. I will start with the positive feed back. The raw food was excellent, the fish was so fresh it was really good. The service was appalling, our waiter wasn't really knowledgeable on menu items. She was dealing with us as if we were nuisance. It took us ages to grab any of the waiters attention. It was really frustration in the end I really wanted the bill, left without dessert cause it seems that to grab a menu was a difficult job for the waitress to do.  Conclusion, never again. Nothing here that Zuma, Hakasan or Novikov couldn't give me without the attitude or the long drive.

title: Simply spectacular
comment: I could not do this place enough justice with my review..... If you're in London you must go here. Book a Saturday evening and enjoy the amazing views, amazing cuisine and amazing cocktails sushi samba has to offer! P.s. order the Tacitos, they are a must!!

title: Good food and a good view
comment: I visited Sushi Samba for a friends birthday - there were three of us and as the birthday girl was running a bit late, I noticed a very good table very central and by the window. The staff were more than happy to let us move and this was great - the experience wouldn't have been the same where we were originally seated so very grateful for that! We had a couple of cocktails and were recommended to order plates to share. We particularly enjoyed the black cod (really is to die for), Wagyu tataki with foie gras and a fried quail egg (see pics) and the fish tacos. The sushi was good but not the best - it comes across overcomplicated which to me made it seem less fresh (especially when it had warm toppings). Overall the food was great and so was the service. The bill wasn't too bad - about 80 quid each which I'd say is very reasonable. I would definitely return and look forward to trying different items on the menu.

title: Thee only thing missing is a dance floor
comment: Came here on a business trip and by recommendation of my boss. I went straight for their signature rolls : Samba London, which is a fantastic sampler, and then the El Topo - truly unique!!  Was here during the week of the month that they highlight Kobe beef. Had to definitely order some. Wasn't disappointed.  I like bourbon so I went for the Japanese Manhattan. Excellent.  High atop the 40th floor, the 5 second ride up the glass elevator has breathtaking views. Enjoy.

title: Intimidating atmosphere but food was good
comment: My partner and I were visiting London for 4 days, and for a Christmas present we received a £40 voucher for Sushi Samba.  As huge fans of Yo Sushi, we were excited to visit Sushi Samba, although after scanning the menu online we realised £40 wasn't going to stretch too far. Neither of us have ever been 'fine diners', opting for bar meals rather than fancy restaurants, but this place was highly recommended to us. I put on a nice frock for our visit - and I was glad I didn't rock up in my leggings! The view from the restaurant is amazing - not that we saw much of it as we were sat as far from a decent view as possible! The waiters are very 'hands on', too involved and too fussy - but this is just not what we are used to, I felt quite uncomfortable but once we had ordered our first round of food, we didn't care! I ordered some kind of terriyaki fillet steak (rare) and to share, some sushi rolls. The beef was amazing. Amazing. We ordered some more kinds of sushi - all very good.  The bill came to £97 and I almost fell off my chair. But to visit Sushi Samba, you should know you'll leave with a lighter purse.  After we ate, we stepped out on to the terrace to experience the view. To be honest - the view was better from the lift. For a one-time experience, Sushi Samba was great. The food really was amazing but on any normal day, I wouldn't pay the prices here. Definitely visit - even if just for the view. Apparently they do good cocktails too.

title: Incredible
comment: What an experience! Had an amazing experience in this place. A few cheeky drinks in the bar (with stunning views) then we were taken inside the restaurant. Our booking was 10 minutes overdue and when we were seated, they gave us a free champagne. Service was immaculate, staff so efficient and friendly, and the food was absolutely superb. I cannot wait to take more people to this wonderful place. HIGHLY recommend.

title: Amazing
comment: Lovely birthday present, great views over London with a great terrace and fire pit. Highly recommend to anyone

title: Amazeballs
comment: We've all had that hyperbole experience. Like that film that friends raved about that you went to see which you thought was rubbish. Or that incredible restaurant with the amazing views across London with food that melts in the mouth only to find that you thought it was underwhelming. Well in the case of Sushisamba, it does for once live up to the hype. Everyone I spoke to was gushing in their of this restaurant and I now know why. The food here is just insanely good. The menu was hard to decipher so we took the risk of allowing our waitress to choose for us - a huge leap of faith! The dishes just kept coming over a period of an hour and a half and I can honestly say I've not tasted food this good. EVER. The black cod was out of this world. To be fair, it all was. Delicate flavours, textures and colours the likes of which you will not seen before. I was pleasantly surprised at the prices too. When the bill came it worked out to be £80 per head including a **mountain of food**, plenty of alcohol and 12.5% service, which given the quality of the fare offered up was worth every single penny. The only tiny gripe was that we were told in advance that our table was only available for our use for a maximum of 2.5 hours. When the 2.5 hours were up, we told in no uncertain terms that we had to leave as the next party of six had arrived. Having just given them over £500 we thought this was a bit mean spirited but understood and reluctantly moved through to the bar. It didn't spoil our evening though and we'd would highly recommend to our friends and will definitely return again.

title: Amazing view
comment: We had a table with a beautiful view and our waitresses were the best in town. All the food was delicious Our wine was perfectly chilled and the music was great. We will definitely revisit also expect to see £££ on the menu. Well worth it if you plan on spending a lot for an spectacular view and food.

title: OMG
comment: The best sushi I have ever had. The food was just impeccable. The selection was very creative and it tasted amazing. If you get a seat by the window you would enjoy the views, but if you don't, the decor is very impressive. And to top it all off, the service was just perfect. Attentive and personable but not over bearing.

title: Delicious
comment: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday as he is a huge sushi lover. The service was good and the food was perfect. The waiter explained everything well when we asked questions. We visited the bar outside which was beautiful but slightly cold. The heaters weren't great outside and there is no shelter if it rains but I assume it's beautiful in the summer. This is a costly night out but very worth it. Would recommend! I would say if you don't like sushi don't eat here as there is not many other options for you to choose from but thankfully I had more than enough options to choose from

title: Simply Brilliant
comment: Incredible food, incredible views, and incredible service. I cannot fault this place whether it be for drinks, work related meals, or personal related meals. Inventive and fresh, this is in my Top 3 in the whole of London.

title: Stunning
comment: The view from this place is one of the best you will find in London. The food is delicious and the staff are great too. Not cheap but worth it for a treat.

title: Happy Days, Good times!!
comment: Where do I begin. The lift ride was something else. Then the views. Table ready and our waiter Jacob guided us through the menu. We asked him to recommend and after checking our likes and dislikes we ordered 5 plates to share. All absolutely delicious especially the Black Cod. We then shared a pudding and had espresso martinis to end. The atmosphere was great and people watching was eye opening! Cheap no, but a throughly enjoyable evening.

title: lovely lunch
comment: My business partner and i took two clients for lunch.The first wow factor was the glass lift up tp the 38th floor views were amazing but we are not too good with heights. The bar area was ok the service wasn't too great we had to go up to the bar to order our drinks but that was ok.Once in the restaurant the staff helped us choose all the dishes which were all amazing really great food and service will be going again. We did venture out on the terrace to have a look at the view which was amazing well worth a visit.

title: Melt in the mouth Sushi
comment: Amazing views. Attentive, friendly, helpful and knowledgeable waiting staff.  The food is out of this world and we had the most wonderful evening for my partners birthday. Would definitely visit again.  You could spend a small fortune but can also go for an average spend. All depends what you order and how much you want.

title: Over rated
comment: Small table for 7 we were knocking elbows all the meal. The waitress was clearly trying to sell us as much expensive food and drink as possible. The most expensive meal per head Ive ever had (£100) but not the best dining experience!

title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
comment: THE GOOD: The fun starts from the glass lift, going up and seeing London’s dazzling lights all around you … the greeting warm, the restaurant beautiful, the seating comfortable. The staff are beyond wonderful: efficient, friendly, polite, fast. There was such a wonderful buzz, we loved every minute, even before the food came. The desert : “With love from Rio” is to.die.for The salt and pepper squid is divine. The Yellow tail taquitos are different and delicious. The presentation is out of this world. And above all, I thought the meal was very good value !  THE BAD The black cod is a bit of a let down, and inferior to say Zuma’s. The green tea is vile, and made more unpalatable by the price of 7 quid a cup. THE UGLY: After what was a great night, great food, laughs with the staff, we were giddy and giggly with happiness and walked through the bar, checking out the terrace, debating whether to have a nightcap there, going to the loo … the usual … but what was unusual and horrible was the presence of ‘minders’ or bodyguards who were hovering around behind us, looking disapprovingly (no we were not loud and lairy, we don’t drink alcohol and my mother who is 80 was with us). They followed us around as if we were trespassing, and so intimidating were they that we decided against the nightcap and fled, before they ruin our lovely evening. I must say that was a very strange experience that I am going to email the restaurant separately, as I’ve not experienced anything quite like this.  Don’t let that put you off what is a really fun experience. Will I go there again ? I’m not so sure now, because of the security men who made me feel very very unwelcome in the bar.

title: Food Poisoning!
comment: Don't eat here unless you fancy writing off the next 2 days with food poisoning. In Dec 14 that happened to me. I notified the manager & they have basically refused to believe that I ate there ( despite my emailing them receipts) & have not even offered me a refund. Also not enough seats or room in the bar & overpriced drinks. Go to Madison in new change or shard for a far better experience & views.

title: Imaginary
comment: Amazing place, with amazing interior layout, which keeps telling you what a wonderful place I am at. Very good dishes and it was a big pleasure to eat such a wonderful place. Most delicious menu I have ever eaten. Thank you again

title: Glad I came but won't be back
comment: So yes, Sushi Samba is one of those restaurants in London that you have to test at least once, just to say you've tried it. I'm personnally not a fan of expensive restaurants that charge you a lot of money for a meal the size of a green pea. But I guess it's all about the experience, and I can't deny that it's quite impressive. In terms of food, it was very tasty. We tried the Kobe beef (super expensive but so good!), some taquitos that were lovely!, samba rolls. Honestly I've tasted much better rolls in London and at a much cheaper price. So yes, tasty food, but not super impressed. Our waitress (shame I don't remember her name) was really nice and gave us good recommendations. We were lucky to have a table with a great view by the window, the only problem was that we were right under the ventilation, so it was a bit chilly. Our waitress offered to use a blanket though. Overall, I'm really glad I came and I had an amazing evening. But it was more due the company than to the food.

title: Best sushi ever!
comment: We had a fantastic evening on Sunday at Sushi Samba. My brother and his wife ended up joining us and they were very accommodating at extending our booking to 4 people which was great considering how busy it was. The staff are so fun and friendly, the atmosphere had a great buzz and we all rated the sushi as the best we had ever tasted! The black cod, prawn tempura, the Samba London are all delicious and we would thoroughly recommend ordering things to share because it makes the experience really fun! I loved the nice touch at the end of the evening to mark my boyfriend's birthday - it made a very memorable night and the views out of this world too - a fantastic experience for all senses! Thanks Sushi Samba!

title: Amazing evening - 5 stars!
comment: I booked a table for 8pm at Sushisamba for my boyriends birthday. When you arrive you head up to the restaurant in a glass lift which provides fantastic views of London! Unfortunately the previous people hadn't quite finished their meal, so we were apologised to and asked if we wouldnt mind waiting in the bar. They were very polite and apologetic and the bar was pretty with a nice ambiance so we ordered two cocktails and took a seat. Less than ten minutes waiting and we were escorted to our table. The restaurant is gorgeous with nice lighting and beautiful views across London. There is background music, but it is not so loud you can't have a conversation - it just helps to provide a vibe. We took a seat and was immediately given two glasses of champagne on the house to apologise for the wait and as a celebratory treat for the special occasion (really nice surprise!). We were introduced to our waiter and then the floor manager who checks on each table. We both are not particularly familiar with the cuisine, but our waiter listened to what we did and didn't like and made some suggestions (its best to order between 5-8 small plates between two). We went with his suggestions and were very pleased, each and every dish was delicious! We also went for dessert and were both very pleased. The waiter had heard earlier that it was my boyfriends birthday and so brought over a complimentary happy birthday macaroon, candle and Happy Birthday message which was an unexpected and nice touch. Price wise we found it really reasonable, but as I know everyone has different budgets I will give you an idea of pricing. We had: 5-6 small dishes, including black cod. Two cocktails Bottle of water Two desserts Expresso Total: 133 and that included 12.5 percent service charge The service was impeccable from start to end, the food was served fast, the ambience is nice and the settings were lovely. Its a great restaurant for a treat night or special occasion.

title: View To A Thrill !
comment: My son invited me here for a birthday treat, it's over the road from Liverpool Street Station, a nod to the guy on the door and straight into the lift and skywards with only the thickness of glass to separate you from the tops of buildings which one races past at an indecent speed. Once you have overcome the altitude sickness the check in is all very smooth and professional and if you're lucky you can grab a seat by the window and admire the really spectacular view. It's all there, ancient, old and modern, some fabulous landmarks and old churches together with a few architectural horrors! Politely ushered to our table in the large glass sided dining room we didn't bother too much with the menu and asked our incredibly helpful waiter to suggest some dishes which he managed perfectly, leaving room for one of the tastiest and most exotic looking desserts I have seen, the ice creams within rice cakes. We had an enjoyable and interesting conversation with a Manager who had been in London for ten years and described the effects working so high up amidst some dramatic weather patterns and overall lunch was an extremely enjoyable experience. I have no idea of the cost, you would need to ask my son!

title: Disappointing second visit
comment: Loved it here the first time, around 2 years ago. Delicate flavours and well presented. Top notch quality. Staff were just the right side of attentive.  What happened guys?  Ridiculous service for one. One chap said he would be waiting on us for the evening, only for us to be bombarded by Many different staff, every 2 minutes. We literally found it impossible to communicate at the table...subtle and less subtle hints were ignored. My friends wife didnt want the over zealous chap pouring her drink and ended up having to guard it like a lioness guards her cubs, which the staff oddly found quite amusing. At one stage even the security guy seemed to be waiting on us! Onto the food.. Oh dear. We started with a signature house cocktail. It tasted like alco Sunny D basically. Any present flavours of plum infused sake were drowned out. I let my friend order for us as it was his first time. We all agreed the Kobe mini burgers and tacos were pretty good. We were still smiling at this stage. With everything else, around 10 small dishes in all, the flavours were ill thought out and came amateurishly presented. The fish skewers with corn were barely edible, drowned in oil/overdone didnt taste fresh. The kobe slices were similarly drowned in an 'ice cream' sauce and I think that one came with torn up stale tasting bread, soaked in squid ink.  The pudding.. It had 'Rio' in the title.. The friends wife exclaimed "that's got to be the worst presentation I have ever seen, it looks just like s**t wiped on the edge of a toilet bowl" And she was right.  300 quid for 3. Hard to justify, even with that lift experience and view.

title: Divine
comment: I liked everything about this restaurant and if you think you know sushi, try the Sushi Samba to prove you wrong! Excellent food, venue, view, great staff and fantastic cocktails.

title: Amazing
comment: My boyfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary here. We both never been to Sushi Samba before and we absolutely adore sushi, so wanted to give it a try! The elevator journey itself was quite amazing, LED-lights on the floor and completely made of glass so you could enjoy the view as you were going upwards to the restaurant. The Lounge is also very nice decorated, we managed to get a spot at the window and enjoyed some interesting cocktails.  The staff are very friendly and professional and we enjoyed some amazing sushi dishes! I definitly recommend to go to this restaurant!

title: For just a drink, in winter, its average and expensive...and the views are usually taken :-(
comment: Having not booked in here for dinner we just popped up for a drink. I had to laugh when the "bouncers" were pronouncing the place as full and then you got up there and there was loads of room! The bar however, was clearly understaffed as it was taking an age to get served, not what you want when you really fancy a drink and are on a time for a dinner reservation. The views, whilst Amazing, can only really be got at from the windows and you have to be ultra early or lucky. The prices are expensive to! £20 for a glass of rose champagne!? Really???

title: One word: Amazing!
comment: My boyfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary and we both never been to Sushisamba before and as absolute sushi-lovers, we wanted to try it out. We already booked 3 weeks in advance and managed to get the last table! The elevator-journey itself was already quite amazing; you walk in a elevator made of glass and colorful LED-lights in the floor. The elevator shoots you upwards to the restaurant with an amazing view of London. We were quite early and decided to start with a cocktail, we managed to get a perfect spot at the big windows with the view over London. The cocktails were very interesting but very tasty. The staff are friendly and professional and give you all the information you need about the menu.The dishes are amazing, full of flavour and something different of what you would usualy have. We both enjoyed it very much and would like to go here more often!

title: One incredible meal!
comment: True 5/5! Always wanted to visit sushi samba, finally got a reservation that suited us. Arrived early so we could enjoy drinks on the outside terrace. Waiter was fantastic, even advising us if he though we had ordered too much food. Each dish was presented impeccably and tasted incredible. Have been fortunate to visit some amazing restaurants around the world and this really is in the top few! As a number one the food was incredible, location brilliant, service great and the atmosphere to match! Cant wait to go again and try other things on the menu!

title: What a view
comment: If you want great views over th London City skyline then look no further. This is a unique restaurant with interesting food and outstanding views. It is hip and fun.

title: Modern... Eclectic... Welcoming...
comment: I can't begin to tell you how excited I was to get a table at Sushisamba. After trying OpenTable and not getting a hit on a lunchtime slot until Spring 2015; I decided to email the restaurant direct. Lo and behold I got a booking for the date I wanted at the time I wanted. No fuss. Confirmed. Great stuff! For those that don't know, Sushisamba do fusion; blending Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian cuisine. The menu comprises of numerous options including small plates, raw, robato, large plates, sushi, sashimi, meat and fish! Too many to even know where to start! We went with small plates, robato and sushi. All were absolutely delicious and don't get me started on the cocktails and dessert... It's not a cheap lunch venue, but there is that old adage 'you get what you pay for'. To read the full review, check out http://bit.ly/1Byg7tn.

title: Experience!
comment: It's been couple of years since I've been to Sushi Samba. My first experience was good but nothing to shout about so I decided to have a go again. The evening hasn't started well. Our table has been delayed but nobody came to apologise or inform us how long will we be waiting. We were not really bothered though as we went to get a drink at the bar. We were served by one of the bar managers- really nice guy and his cocktails were delicious. After a while we've been approached by one of the host and taken to our table. We were sat right in front of kitchen which was probably the worst table in a restaurant. No view at all.  It took a while to get any sort of attention of our waitress- polish lady not very pleasant! So here we are, waiting 45 min for our table, being sat at the worst table in a restaurant and being served by a lady that was not bothered to smile one bit. Our evening took a whole different direction when one of the managers- Otto approached our table. He could see we were not impressed and his only intention was to make it right.  He managed to change our table to one by the window and ultimately our server has changed also.  We were looked after by couple of Jacob's and it was amazing. Both of them were such a nice guys but still overshadowed by Otto who was running his own show in the restaurant. You could see him joking with us, other tables and his staff and he created such a nice unforgettable atmosphere. I asked him to create my menu and to include Kobe ribeye which he did and every single dish was fantastic. Kobe ribeye stood our as you'd expect. It was an evening which could've ended as a massive disappointment. Instead here I am taking my time to write this review to express my gratitude to Otto and his team for such an amazing evening!

title: Worth a Visit
comment: I visited this restaurant on a Saturday around 5:30pm. The advance booking was easy and we were seated relatively quickly. I liked this restaurant, the staff were polite and friendly and there was a good atmosphere. I enjoyed the food. I would definitely visit again.

title: Funky and exciting lunch venue
comment: Went for lunch in January for the first time. The venue is fantastic - fun lift journey up and quite stunning views. Foodwise it wasn't bad at all. Perhaps the weakest point was the sushi itself (it was ok, but everything else was great) so maybe try somewhere else if sushi is your main reason for going! Seemed to be quite a glam clientele even at 2pm on a January Tuesday..

title: The venue is amazing, but the staff is so bad!
comment: We came here on Sunday and we were told that a private party was being held (we checked the website and there was nothing about it there) but that we could come on Monday, no reservation required. We came again and they said we couldn't go in without a reservation. As it was the same guy I told him about what he told us and he said "we were wasting his time". So rude for such an amazing place. This kind of costumer service makes a difference between a 5* place and a plain wannabe. Funniest thing is he kept on saying "this is Sushi Samba, you can't come without a reservation" lol  It's worth dealing with such rude people for the views though.

title: Stunning Food and Views
comment: Great place for a celebration. Although booking required well in advance. The staff were very attentive and since we were early for our table the hostess found us a table for drinks with a window-side view. We fortunately also had a table with a view for our meal. During the meal the staff were vigilant without being over-bearing and our dishes arrived at well spaced intervals without a rush or any undue delay. The dishes themselves had a vast range of flavours and were very well presented. Since one of our group had a birthday, the desert was hand decorated with birthday wishes which was a very nice touch.

title: Amazing evening
comment: I booked a table for 8pm at Sushisamba for my boyriends birthday. When you arrive you head up to the restaurant in a glass lift which provides fantastic views of London! Unfortunately the previous people hadn't quite finished their meal, so we were apologised to and asked if we wouldnt mind waiting in the bar. They were very polite and apologetic and the bar was pretty with a nice ambiance so we ordered two cocktails and took a seat. Less than ten minutes waiting and we were escorted to our table.  The restaurant is gorgeous with nice lighting and beautiful views across London. There is background music, but it is not so loud you can't have a conversation - it just helps to provide a vibe. We took a seat and was immediately given two glasses of champagne on the house to apologise for the wait and as a celebratory treat for the special occasion (really nice surprise!). We were introduced to our waiter and then the floor manager who checks on each table.  We both are not particularly familiar with the cuisine, but our waiter listened to what we did and didn't like and made some suggestions (its best to order between 5-8 small plates between two). We went with his suggestions and were very pleased, each and every dish was delicious! We also went for dessert and were both very pleased.  The waiter had heard earlier that it was my boyfriends birthday and so brought over a complimentary happy birthday macaroon, candle and Happy Birthday message which was an unexpected and nice touch. Price wise we found it really reasonable, but as I know everyone has different budgets I will give you an idea of pricing. We had: 5-6 small dishes, including black cod. Two cocktails Bottle of water Two desserts Expresso Total: 133 and that included 12.5 percent service charge The service was impeccable from start to end, the food was served fast, the ambience is nice and the settings were lovely. Its a great restaurant for a treat night or special occasion.

title: Special birthday evening
comment: This is definitely somewhere worth trying. The food was amazing and all the staff were so lovely and friendly. I will definitely be returning... Great spot in London! :-)

title: Excellent food & service with an amazing view of London
comment: I had a lovely time visiting Sushisamba with my boyfriend. From the moment you step in the lift the fun begins :) The restaurant is on the 38th floor of the Heron tower so it is quite a thrill. It is fairly expensive but definitely worth a visit. Highly recommended!

title: Views are priceless!
comment: Stunning views of the city but cocktails were really expensive. Stayed for 1 drink, soaked up the atmosphere and left. If your looking to splurge- this is the place!

title: I love this place
comment: What can I say about sushi samba? Only good things for certain!! Every time I went there it was just a great experience from the restaurants to the bars and the lounge area.. BELLISSIMO!! The view the atmosphere the staff everything is on point ! Is great just to got there for drinks and music but Also great for the food!! And is affordable too which makes me want to go there even more. I love this place so much That is one of my favourites in London. Doormans are a bit rude and selective tho..but didn't mind too much. Would recommend to anyone

title: Spectacular view
comment: We visited this restaurant last Christmas eve. From the time we entered the glass elevator were very excited, you see over London. When we arrived upstairs the view was amazing. The restaurant s decoration is very nice minimal and elegant. Staff was very pleasant and polite. The food was ok but I wasn't very impressed. Also is very expensive but I recommend it at least for one visit.

title: A must do if you love amazing taste sensations in an incredible environment.
comment: After needing a stiff drink after exiting the high speed elevator to SushiSamba I could relax and take in the incredible fusion of food, impeccable service and that view. Faultless ! We had our 10 year old son with us who wasn't himself that night and the waitstaff bent over backwards to cheer him up. It's not a cheap exercise dining in this establishment but in the end you pay for what you get and SushiSamba did not disappoint. Try the pork wraps !!!

title: Beautiful experiance
comment: We went as a group of four , we had a great evening !! The view was amazing after cocktails at bar we where taken to our table the room itself was beautiful , the service was great and the food was suburb !!! Will be going back again , lots of people saying over priced I totally disagree and actually found it to be very reasonable

title: lovely food in a great location
comment: I had to book weeks and weeks in advance to get a dinner reservation here, and even then only managed to secure an early dinner. I'm a massive sushi fan and had been looking forward to going for a long time. Going up in the glass lift is not for the faint hearted/people afraid of heights but is a very quick journey. The decor of the restaurant is beautiful, there are lots of tables so there is a bit of a buzz and good atmosphere, but also has the feel of being really open and airy. We were sat in a window seat which was absolutely fantastic as even though it was dark it was still a beautiful view of the twinkling lights of the London sky line. I had previously been very cynical of the fusion concept but decided to just give it a go and was guided by the waiter. We had a mixture of hot plates and cold plates, as well as sushi. All of the food was absolutely delicious and varied, it's definitely exciting if you're looking for something different to the standard fare. The one thing which my Dad and I didn't like was the butterfish sashimi. Butterfish is a beautiful fish to eat but they'd cut the sashimi much thicker than normal. This gave it a really rubbery texture and it was all a bit much. But everything else was really lovely, and the waiters were really helpful and friendly. If, like us, it's all a bit rich for your blood then don't faint too much when you look at the prices of the wine list. We had a glass of plum sake each (and the beer price isn't too bad) and they weren't too pricey. But some tables were necking down bottles of wine at hundreds of pounds so definitely a rich clientèle.  A really special experience for a sushi lover, and well worth the wait.

title: Excellent location at floor 38 of Heron tower overlooking London for this exotic restaurant
comment: Very nice decoration and seating area with also a bar side. Leather chairs and heavy tables - we liked it. Their (worldspread) concept is to mix Japanese, Peruvian and Brazilian cuisines. Good quality of ingredients, good recipes and nice variety of dishes. Tasty food nicely presented. Service is friendly but too slow to do a quick lunch. Wine list is fine, enough selection to find your fit.  Prices are in the high side, for some items kind of overpriced. In summary: we all liked the place, the outstanding view and quality of food. We will certainly come again.

title: Superb venue & food
comment: I was lucky enough to be taken here by a supplier in the week before Christmas and what a fantastic experience. There was no wait for out table (though it had been booked a few weeks earlier) and the waiting staff were just perfect, knowing when to approach us. Our waiter asked each of us what we liked to eat and then brought a selection of dishes for us, all of which were sublime. We were not rushed at all and the atmosphere was amazing. The 360 views on a clear evening just added to that, we could see so far. The outside terrace is worth seeing, even when cold and if you're not a smoker :-) I can't comment on value for money as we didn't pick up the tab, but on glancing at the menu I think the prices were not unreasonable for Central london. Looking forward to my next visit.

title: Beautiful food and view!!! Very impressive!
comment: I went with my husband, my sister in law and her husband and we were quite impressed with the amazing food and views! The attention to the details and the staff knowledge was also incredible! We ordered different dishes to share and they were all great! The bar outside looks great but it was a chilled so we couldn't go outside. Expensive but a very Special restaurant!!! I would recommend and really want to go back!

title: Gorgeous restaurant
comment: I took my son to sushi samba on the 4th of January for his 19th birthday. Unfortunately the upstair bar was closed and it was a cold night and the building was covered in a fog. The fog cleared later and the view was amazing, the cocktails in the downstairs bar were excellent. Would recommend the Chucumber. The food was exquisite and the teriyaki chicken and miso black cod were mouth watering, the vegetable tempura and samba rolls were delicious. I called up earlier and asked the restaurant to put a Birth day greeting on the table but to my greatest disappointment they did nothing and eventually I had to ask for a candle and the candle was brought on a tiny little macaroon.

title: Nice atmosphere. Interesting flavours
comment: Went for dinner with friend. Good start to the evening when we were whisked to the 38th floor. What a great view of London! Not the friendliest or most welcoming staff on arrival. Is not cool anymore to be friendly to diners?! Waiting staff were a bit better. Some more knowledgable than others. Very expensive -but nice-cocktails. Had the famous black cod and it was amazing. Prawn and lobster rolls where also very nice.  Ambience is what we expected for this sort of place . Busy. Loud a bit touristy but not too bad- just.  Would be back at some point

title: Best Sushi's ever over the roof's of London
comment: During our stay in London between Christmas and new year we had the chance to have a table reserved at the Sushi Samba Restaurant on top of the Heron Tower. It all begins with an astonishing travel to the 40th floor to the Restaurant and an breath taking view over the city. But the best hase to come...we had the best Sushi's ever...the best dessert's...very good wine and all this with a very good service. I just can recommand to every one visiting London to visit and try this Restaurant. The price is high but ok ( 70,-/person) for this kind of quality food and this very spectacular situation.

title: Unique flavours and location
comment: Going up in the lift is a great start to the experience (although I did find queuing for a while at the man with the Clipboard a little off putting especially in the wind and rain). On a Friday night the bars were packed and the views were incredible. There were four of us and they initially tried to rob us off by squeezing all four of us into a semi circular banquette and telling us to squash up. After my husband pointed out that this was unacceptable we were eventually move to a table that would fit us and given some complimentary edamame and green beans (!). The views are great here but it is the food that steals the show. We gorged ourselves on sashimi, fish, Kobe beef burgers etc. This does not come cheap as we paid £567 for four of us. The prawn ponzu and black cod were amazing. Everything came beautifully presented and the flavours were sensational. Staff were knowledgeable, helpful and not overly hovering.

title: This is a great place - especially the venue
comment: The food, don't take me wrong, was excellent. I always enjoy fusion as you are sure to get a few surprises that really wake up the taste buds. The cocktails are expensive, but they are so good, you just have to try them. They are also copiously made. Really, most of the reason you want to go here is it is just a great place to hang out. Phenomenal views of London and a very buzzing atmosphere. Enjoy.

title: Great for special occasion, amazing view, great food, friendly and knowledgeable staff
comment: I have booked SushiSamba for my boyfriend's Birthday based on recommendations from my friends and we were really not disappointed. The staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about the food and sakes which was needed because we have tried this type of cousine for the first time. The decor and of course the view from the restaurant (38th floor) were outstanding and we felt very chilled and comfortable in there. We will definitely go there again, it's a bit pricey but the quality of food and venue are definitely worth it.

title: A special sushi that samba's right up to your taste buds
comment: Booked this ages in advance as part our wedding anniversary celebrations and was well worth the wait. Friday night at 8 is always going to be busy and so it was, however we were given extra bubbly to sweeten the delay and it worked a treat! The food and service were excellent the maître'd found as a great table next to the window. The staff took their time to explain the menu a great combination and they and the chef even created a special dessert to mark our celebration. Well done to all!

title: Great atmosphere, delicious food, tasty cocktails
comment: We have been here a few times and have loved it every time. We have been fortunate to have gone to sushi samba in London, NYC, vegas and Miami and I have to say London is our favourite atmosphere wise and it is joint with Miami on the food. Superb views over London city at the top of the heron tower. I would recommend going to the bar for a drink before or after for cocktails, they make great cosmopolitans and berry mojitos.The food is delicious, i am a vegetarian and there is plenty of choice and the waiters always do good at recommending new dishes and adapting dishes to meet requirements. My fiancé loves the wagu beef sliders and the rock shrimp tempura. If you want to get in an evening, especially a Thursday, Friday or Saturday book a few months in advance as it is hard to get a reservation at peak time 7-9! Our next visit is February looking forward to returning again!

title: Great service and decor!
comment: This was a surprise. My husband booked it as we needed some 'us' time. As soon as we got out of Liverpool Street, we were able to see the heron building. This was quite impressive. The door man let us in and the lift took us swiftly to the 38th floor. We were early so decided to have drinks on the 39th floor, although bar was closed we were able to have waiter service. Our table was delayed by 30 minutes but we weren't too bothered. Our table was by the window so had amazing view of London. I grew up in London but the view still took me back. Service was amazing and really helpful, they had a full vegan menu for my other half and the normal menu was a fish eaters delight. I could've ordered everything. I ordered RBI nigiri, salt cod croquettes and Seabass tempura. The tempura unfortunately had the skin on and was just too fishy even for me. We were given complementary champagne for the wait but due to the time of year we were asked to leave. A shame as we don't get much time together. Nonetheless I enjoyed the night and would love to go again with friends as it's a great sharing place.

title: Spectacular in allways
comment: Had lunch here with my family while visiting London on vacation and this was one of the highlights of our trip. Food, service and views were all excellent. We sampled many small dishes and especially liked the taqquitos, shrimp tempura and a meat dish served on hot stones.  Expensive but well worth it for a special occasion.

title: The Wow Factor
comment: Great night had by our group. Defo somewhere to dine for that "Wow Factor". From the lift up to the stunning views, great menus and fantastic service! A beautiful experience but on the pricey side.

title: perfectly divine fun
comment: This really is my favourite place for a special occasion , the marvellous views , bar area , great staff and such fun food ,it is really special and London at its best. So many choices of exciting food to try too. we had ; an amazing tomato ceviche [ how can tomato be so exciting] , crispy vegetable tempura , wow tuna ceviche , excellent grilled Japanese asparagus , sake sashimi , sasa prawn tempura sushi , mocha ice cream and a sencha tea . This is as great as my favourite places in the states . A perfect treat . Well worth booking in advance then arriving early for champagne at the bar .

title: For a special night out with great views and quality food...Sushisamba will not disappoint
comment: As they say in life, you get what you pay for. The same can be said about Sushisamba. Yes there are restaurants offering food somewhat similar, however, the location (38 floors), the food and service make this place a special one in the heart of London.

title: Vibrant, trendy bar London city!
comment: This was a very nice, trendy bar where I went with my cousin. On this occasion we didn't have dinner but only drinks. Drinks were a little slow and very busy. Only 1 or 2 bar staff so took some time but I guess it was worth the wait. On the 48th and 49th floor so a good view of London East Central. A lovely view of almost touching distance of the 'gherkin' tower and the Bank of England. St. Pauls Cathedral and Tower Bridge are also visible. I appreciated the view at night but will try in the day time also.‎ Love Brazilian food and also had Peruvian and Japanese food before so will be open to trying it in the summer when next home. I had a few cocktails the Kaffirinha made of lime, crushed ice and cognac. Similar to a mojito. ‎My favourite was the Lychee cooler...I like creamy cocktails. it had grey goose which is subtle for a vodka and to my liking, vanila and of course Lychee. There is a nice outdoors bar section but days before Christmas in London, probably a 'little' too cold. Lovely glass lift, pretty fast with an amazing view, similar to that of the previous world trade centre in New York.‎

title: nice if its nice weather
comment: food is nice but you can find same nice three times cheaper. very nice to go to this place if its nice weather. if not don't go.

title: Beautiful
comment: A birthday meal for two, with serious advance booking required. Greeted at the bottom by the doorman, followed swiftly by a spectacular ride to the 38th floor. I was certainly unprepared for just how high up this place is, though if you hail from the States or the Far East you may be less impressed. No queuing required as we were shown to our table. The room is not particularly large, with tables for two around the edges and larger tables in the middle. Service throughout was prompt and professional, not too intrusive. Perfect for us. Ordered seven small plates between us which was sufficient, consisting of ribs, mixed ceviche, temaki and rolls. All exquisitely prepared with stunning flavour combinations, The Samba London roll was a particular highlight, with the ceviche the least accomplished of our selection being a little bland and floating in too much of its own juice. In terms of drinks the bar is very popular with the business set and the flavours again are fresh and beautifully thought out, though very sweet so may disappoint hardcore cocktail lovers. One minor niggle is the accessibility of those famous views - you do really need to be sat along the North or East side of the room to appreciate them, which we were not. Nonetheless, forget the Shard and spend a little more for beautiful food in beautiful surroundings and a view to die for.

title: Fantastic views, cocktails & Food!
comment: Loved the views, especially at night - I was lucky to be there on a beautifully clear night. The cocktail patio is fab as are the cocktails - especially the Chewcumber (Hendricks based, obviously!). Did not eat this time, but previously its been fabulous. Great place to sip a few drinks before dinner. Highly recommended

title: Wow, what a view
comment: Sushi Samba is on the 37th and 38th floors of the Heren Tower right in the heart of the City. As you enter the building, on a red carpet, you are treated by the most friendliest of staff to either help you find your destination or establish whether or not there is a table ready for you.  The lifts are made of glass so the views as you go up the lift are simply stunning. The lift ride itself was fast, but not too fast as to give you that dreadful feeling in your stomach. As you enter the 38th floor, you are able to check your coat and bags in and order cocktails at the bar. Everywhere you turn you can see stunning views if the city. The clientele is mainly city people but I would say that it is accessible to everyone. Cocktails average at about £10 but are amazing. Staff are friendly, know what they are doing but be prepared to wait to be served as there are not many staff to the ratio of people.  The restaurant itself if clean and bright. The menu is surprisingly varied when you consider its name, sushi samba. They serve food from at least three country's including Brazil. Waiters are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and the food came pretty quickly. When it came it was hot and simply delightful, really good quality and tasty.  Overall, though pricey, and it was really pricey, it was a good experience and one which I will appreciate again.

title: Trading on its views, tired and dated
comment: Sushi Samba much like Duck and Waffle (which are connected by a stair case) is tired and dated and trading on its views. The views alone are not enough. Restaurants like these should offer high spec gorgeous surroundings. It doesn't. Its tired and dated, very tired and dated the food is good but at £15 a plate it is not worth it given in the surroundings. The crowd is a bit touristy and the staff are just ok. I did, on my last visit have to complain because my table left to have a cigarette on the roof terrace only to be chased after by the waiter demanding we leave a card while we were away. I asked him where did he think we were going to go, we were on the 39th floor, there is security and other diners are doing the same. He said he had been asked to get us at his manager's request. I was very embarrassed being called out in front of all the other diners. I spoke to his manager who denied that he had asked his waiter to do that, apologised profusely and gave us a round of drinks. It really spoilt our evening and I won't be returning given all the above.

title: You're just paying for the view
comment: Booked a month in advance and got a 10.45 slot. When they phoned to confirm two days earlier, I was pleased to be able to secure a booking for 6.15 after I asked if there was anything earlier. So cool, 6.15 booking sorted. We arrived early enough to have drinks in the bar area and admire the awesome views. The decor and views were truly spectacular. We were sat at our table on time and then the waiter spilled one of our beers over. No apology, just wiped it up. I would have thought he might offer another beer, but he didn't. Drinks were so overpriced - £7 a beer; he must have spilt about £3 of it.  Anyway, he took our orders and then plates came at various times. They try to have a 'tapas' kind of thing going, where people share plates, but that's not possible really when someone is vegetarian and can't partake in what we're eating, and another person is eating meat and others eat fish. I mean, if you can't get all the orders out at the same time, then just say so? If we wanted to go to a tapas bar, we would go there. One person's sea urchin sashimi didn't arrive, so we had to feed him our rolls to keep him from passing out from hunger. His salmon nigiri didn't come either. We asked waiters as they came past (interestingly, the original waiter pretty much avoided us after spilling our beer and taking our orders). One waiter said the beef and sea urchin were coming later. Then another one didn't know where the sea urchin was, then another one brought seven nigiri, which no one ordered but it appears they must have misheard our friend say 'seven nigiri' instead of 'salmon nigiri' and refused to take it back to the kitchen, saying he must have it! So the poor guy so far hasn't had his sea urchin and has got the wrong order, but ate it anyway because he was hungry. We asked another waiter where the sea urchin was and he asked, 'haven't you had it already?' Um, no. Finally, we got an answer out of one of the waiters - there was no sea urchin! Why they couldn't just tell us that from the outset I don't know. No apology again. So I said that is unacceptable. If he'd known it wasn't available, he would have ordered something else - he's sat the whole evening thinking it was coming! The waiter said he'd get the manager. Manager came, again no real apology but he could get one dessert free. This wasn't very impressive to him of course, as he'd had no real meal, but he accepted. Then 6 glasses of Prosecco came as well, which the waiter said hoped 'would put a smile on our faces'. We weren't grumpy or anything, mostly just bemused by the fact that not one waiter told us that sea urchin wasn't in fact available two hours after we ordered it. It was almost like they were hoping we wouldn't notice and would be charged for it. The bill came and it was lovely to see that the 'discretionary' service charge of 12.5% had been applied to our table. Not sure what service we had really, from spilling our beer to getting our order wrong and then not providing one of the orders and failing to tell us it wasn't available, and then no apologies for any of the errors.  Anyway, we can now say we've been here, and that it is indeed average. Other than the awesome views, the food is very tasty but not good value for money. I couldn't believe how small the beef fillet was!

title: Glamorous place
comment: I came here for lunch before Christmas and had a lovely time. Note: you have to book well in advance to guarantee time and slot you want and I already knew this so that helped, but it is all done online so no snooty phone tennis:) The nice thing about this place is that there is a LOT of staff, someone to take your coat, then someone to walk you though, then a waiter, and if you come in the evening there is someone in the lift, someone at the door etc. You're never left to walk around aimlessly. If you don't want attention then don't come here! I was with a friend and we had 4 cocktails between us and a nice lunch and with service - came to £150. I don't often spend £75 on lunch but every now and then why not. Cocktails are really a highlight and at £14 ish each - puts to shame those London establishments that stick a novice on the bar to make standard forumlaic cocktails at the same price. If you're going to spend £14 on a drink - only do it where they employ expert cocktail makers, like here. Food was tasty but I've had nicer food at Ceviche, Andina and Nobu for less money, however I am a bit spoilt when it comes to food:) Very impressed to see REAL crab in the Calfornia rolls as opposed to crab sticks - I would hope so, but you just never know. Lobster taquitos were a festive special and amazing at that but just tiny and at £14 for two tiny shells, it is a bit of a liberty, and that is probably where Ceviche shines a bit brighter- it is a lot more 'value for money'.  Would I come again? Yes! The great service and amazing cocktails helped smooth over my tiny annoynaces about teeny portions etc. Decor and views are unique and we saw a celebrity on our visit which added to the glamour:)

title: Great place to go out in London
comment: this is just a right place to be on the Friday night and the view is breath taking. mind the dresscode - you have to wear some appropriate clothes but the experience is very well worth it. perfectly organised, nice people.

title: Amazing!
comment: I came here yesterday night with my boyfriend for his birthday. It was our first time at sushisamba and our waiter Felix took the time to explain the menu to us and answered all our questions about what was in each dish. Really excellent service from him. He even offered to take a photo of us.  The food was amazing, we especially liked the salt and pepper squid and the pork belly wraps. The sashimi was really fresh and lovely. When I booked I mentioned in the booking it was my boyfriends birthday and when we ordered dessert it came out with a candle and 'happy birthday' written on the plate, really lovely attention to detail. Definitely will be back in the future!

title: Great decor and view - average overpriced food
comment: We were a group of 12 and forced to have a set menu which didn't have any of the dishes I would of selected from the menu on. We were required to sign about 6 forms prior to booking and return before the reservation would be confirmed! We wended up ordering extra as the set menu was sparse and all over very average if not below. It was not explained we would incur a £20 per person entrance on our bill as well as £75 person and of course service charge and drinks!  I have never been one to complain about spending money on a food meal/experience and rarely write a bad or average review but the whole experience left a bad taste in my mouth.  The bar outside is great...however I would say that it is worth visiting and going to the bar and elsewhere for actual good food.  I would not recommend going here as a group unless you like to pay over the odds for not a lot.

title: Great dining sensational view
comment: We had an impromptu lunch here on 27th December. Excellently prepared food, sushi superb as was the ceviche and the pork starter followed by beef steak and pork ribs. Portions are small so not sure it's the place to take two hungry teenagers. Have wanted to visit for a while though and it was worth it. £200 for the six of us

title: First Visit! Beautiful views, nice Sushi!
comment: First visit. We had a drink first at the bar and admired the views by night, amazing. We were taken to our table at 9.15pm. The service was very good, can't fault the waiters at all. They advised to order 1 main dish and 3/4 smaller dishes. The Sushi we chose was lovely and we shared it amongst 3 enough for 2 each. We also chose the Poussin in Teryaki sauce which was lovely. The mushrooms and filet steak both nice. The main which was mixed seafood with green rice was tasty but not much seafood to share amongst 3. However all in all the food is nice here. After the meal, we walked up the stairs to next floor where the bar was fairly busy and a DJ was playing nice music. We also walked up to next level bar too, lovely place to have a drink. Would defo return, ambiance and atmosphere very pleasant.

title: Enjoyed Experience
comment: Joined my family for a special celebration at Sushi Samba. Although my first time eating Sushi, enjoyed all food. Wine very good. Service very friendly and not at all intimidating. Views and atmosphere first class. Expensive, but expected that. Would love to try the Kobi Beef, but at that price it's just not going to happen! The lift is just great.

title: Has that WOW factor !!
comment: This is a great place to have cocktails or have some decent food. Located high up on the Heron Tower it has a cracking atmosphere. Great for a first date or an anniversary or even just a night out. Has an amazing outside bar - just hope its not too cold or windy!! The food is what i call bite size, almost snack food but its all fresh, tasty and really filling.  Strange number of staff to customers, some who think they are something out of men in black or some gangster movie. But the service is smooth and almost seamless.  Overall a great evening was had. I was disappointed with the upstairs bar where nobody asked us if we wanted drinks... i had to go to the bar myself and ask after being sat for 15 mins. Others were asked just not us, guess we were disguised as Hobbits !!! Apart from this i think Sushisamba is a great place to go.

title: Just Beautiful
comment: Wait to get in with beautiful people. Enjoy beautiful cocktails with beautiful people and if you're hungry, dine with beautiful people.  Yes, Sushi Samba is unashamedly for beautiful people who want a top night in town - and show some symptoms of shallowness as I do.  Top tip #1 - Thursday is bankers night out and Sushi Samba will often fill up fast with suits, so arrive early doors to avoid a long wait to get in.

title: Watch your bill
comment: I went for drinks last week Wednesday evening, I was told by a female barmaid a bottle of bubbly was £81, however going through my receipts yesterday this included a 12% service charge! I was at the bar - ripping off customers is not a good thing.

title: Nice atmosphere
comment: This was the location for a few Xmas drinks with colleagues and business associates. Great place to meet and enjoyed the evening. Background music a little loud for conversations. Did not eat so can not comment on food.

title: Excellent restaurant
comment: This is my second visit and surely will. Not be the last. Fabulous food and service. Wonderful scenic views.

title: Excellent for the views and neat cocktails
comment: Can take a while to get in but the views and some of the cocktails on the menu make it worth it. There is plenty of space as they have 3 floors. The service is reasonably prompt for a place so busy and the drinks are not prohibitively expensive.

title: Waited for 35 minutes for our table! Received apology though
comment: I visited SushiSamba with my father. Our table was for 21:45. We got to the restaurant exactly on time. Yet were told our table would be ready shortly.  We walked around, took photos, etc.  10 minutes - not ready.  15 minutes - not ready.  30 minutes...still not ready!  My Dad had to catch a plane at 3 AM. We had already gone to get our coats when a waiter emerged saying that a table has just become available.  Well, thanks.  At this point the only reason we stayed is because my Dad had a plane at 3 AM and was really hungry. The head manager did come and apologized and we received complementary champagne and snacks from the chef.  Food was indeed impeccable. Tried 3 kinds of rolls, coconut rice and scallop seviche - everything absolutely delicious, great selection of wines by the glass! And prices are absolutely reasonable for the quality and quantity of food on offer.  The view is phenomenal, breathtaking, especially whilst skyrocketing in the elevator. Lovely terrace, but may be closed if it's windy outside. I would say this is THE place for a romantic date (especially the 2-person tables right by the panoramic window).  My advice to the management: please fix your table allocation system. This restaurant scores highly on food quality, ambience and general service. Yet the experience we had is fully capable of ruining an evening.  Which is why I am giving it 4 stars.

title: Heavenly sushi, oh yes!!!
comment: You like sushi? Like, you really like sushi?..and a spectacular view? Okay,.booom! I found your perfect destination! Enough said, see it for yourself and you know what I am on about! Like many other sky restaurants make sure to get a nice view by the window. If you're vegan, you going to be even more pleased! Epic vegan options, fantastic booze! And the service.. Gold!!! Please get yourself up here

title: Can't comment on the food but...
comment: we have been here a couple of times for drinks and you do just come for the views. Rarely is there anytwhere to sit and the bar is small and crowded with people jostling for space. And no-where to put your coat that we found. Last time we were here, we sat outside with the fire pit going and blankets around us. It was festive and cosy with a really nice ambience. Forward a number of months and this time, one could only gaze longingly at the outside area as it was closed off - perhaps because it was Sunday? Both times having been here in winter months, unsure of the difference. Bought a bottle of wine at the bar, 3 glasses as you do. Had to stand at the bar as there is no where to place the bottle and having looked at the bill we were charged 12.5% service charge for the pleasure of someone opening a bottle of wine (possibly a screw top) and giving us 3 glasses - that's £4.38 on a £35 bottle of wine. I am unsure where the service was at this point and it's just all really money grabbing. Go for the views, but only go for the one drink as there are plenty of nicer places to spend your money.

title: Special place
comment: I was treated to a fantastic lunch to celebrate our anniversary. Amazing views. Amazing cocktails. Food also very good but a tad salty. Service was excellent. We had a table on the terrace. The whole meal experience took hours. Fabulous. A real treat.

title: Great dinner & drinks with friends
comment: We popped in about 45 minutes before our table time and was immediately shown to the bar area. Cocktails of various flavours were consumed and we headed off to our table. ( at our leisure ) We were never rushed and helped really well with our food choices and amounts to order.. I suggested we order more to our waitress and she was brilliant in saying "see how you go first then if you like, order more". So they are not just trying to take you for every penny.
