The place is'nt cheap but then have a look around you and see the views, decor and everything else. Plus the food was fantastic...  I will certainly be returning for food and will definately even just pop in for drinks when passing...

title: Fantastic experience
comment: Absolutely amazing. The service was second to none. Visited on a Sunday for a 50th birthday celebration. The food was beautifully presented and equally as tasty.

title: Beautiful food, stunning views, amazing treat.
comment: My boyfriend took me here for my 25th birthday, (december 2014) it was one of the best meals we have both had! The food was delicious, we had two sushi rolls Ezo and El Topo® and we also had a starter Kuromitsu glazed pork belly wraps. We shared them all and just took in all of the flavours.  The waiters were lovely, they introduced them selves and gave us the menu low down and even an example menu based on what we already like! The sky was clear so luckily we had beautiful night time views over the whole of london. The lift up to the restaurant was breathtaking. We ordered a passion fruit cake for desert and it came with a candle and a song (: The staff know all too well how exciting it is to eat here and asked if we would like our picture taken, so you don't need to feel silly! The only thing we thought was that the drinks were extremely expensive, £7 for a bottle of asahi beer, but we gathered that some people will just come up to the bar to see the view and not eat. Maybe different priced drinks if you eat too? We did have water on the table though. And because of the taste and the lovely waiters, I will be sure to wrangle and event to go again!

title: Oh dear Sushi Samba
comment: I arrived at Sushi Samba last night for my table and was greeted at the entrance to the restaurant by a stressed looking girl with an armful of coats. We were directed to the restaurant reception in the distance where we were 'greeted' by two girls who looked equally as stressed, but mixed with a bit of anger and disdain. I felt like I had approached two people who had just had an argument and my opinion and presence was far from welcome.....I knew we were in for a bumpy ride. I was told instantly that there was a "delay on all tables tonight", with no apology. I was given this info in a very matter of fact fashion, in almost the same way that airlines inform you of a 2 hour delay. Tough luck, it's too late, your bags are checked in. We were shown to the bar area which was naturally busy at this time of year, and ordered drinks from the very efficient bar staff. No complaints here. We managed to grab a table by the window and were approached by the waitress who had obviously been hanging out with the cloak room girl and the two girls on reception for too long. Perhaps she was involved in the argument. She looked stressed, tired and frankly like she wanted to be anywhere other than sushi samba. No smile, no warm hospitality. I wanted to give her a hug and send her home early. Eventually we ate, but after a 20 minute wait. The food was good. Mediocre and expensive. It is almost like the food is here to act as a side show to the view, which it shouldn't....especially at £15 a plate of sushi. I know better than most how stressed and tired staff can get in December in the restaurant/bar industry in London as I managed 15 large west end based venues for a number of years with hundreds of staff. Staff are exhausted by the first week of December by the relentless influx of drunk, hungry and loud guests that don't stop coming.....but for some reason the staff at sushi samba aren't happy, in fact they are clearly unhappy. This made me unhappy. If you want exquisite Japanese food in central London then go elsewhere, if you want a good view and a good cocktail then come here. Just don't expect service with a smile......shame really because it's a stunning venue with some of the the best views in London. The view will never get old.........and thats a good thing for Sushi Samba.

title: Fabulous views, food and atmosphere
comment: Great restaurant, lovely views and the food combinations really work. Cannot wait to go back! Lovely bar for a pre or post dinner drink too.

title: Perfect - just spot on
comment: Greeted at the door extremely politely which i have come to find at places like this a rarity in London. Was asked about my coat by the doorman then asked if we had a reservation or simply wanted drinks. They promptly checked our reservation and invited us into the lift. We were greeted by an extremely polite host and told our table was slightly delayed (15mins) and she would come and find us. Which she did outside on the terrace admiring some of the finest views London has to offer. The views will literally speak for themselves. We were given a table right in the corner at the window. The best seat in the house (in our option and our waiters) The waiting staff got the perfect balance between being informative and allowing you do enjoy the incredible food on offer here. The black cod along with the samba London sushi rolls are a must. Had a lovely chat at the end with the 'boss', the staff really made the evening. We followed our meal with drinks in the upstairs bar. This place is a Must!!! It puts some of the pomp and arrogance of some of the best Michelin Star Restaurants to shame, and to be honest so does the food! Can't wait to return. Thank you sushi samba.

title: Fantastic food and service
comment: Recently enjoyed a fantastic night at Sushi Samba we had drinks before our meal enjoying the views to the west end. Once seated at a window table facing the east end we had a wonderful meal with lobster taco to start (out of this world) leading to sushi rolls and finishing with the rock shrimp ( again out of this world) I have had meals all over london and I must say the food here is in another league. The service from start to finish was perfect which is always the experience I have known for several years since I started to eat here. Always book well ahead however try calling reservations if you haven't because they will try to fit you in if they can.

title: Fantastic Experience
comment: Celebrated my nephews 18th with the family here on Sunday 14th December..... staff couldn't have been more friendly, cocktails fab, we all managed to sit down in the bar area, views stunning, we have the best views don't we, food delicious. Great fun evening, service great and lots of attention to detail.....amazing considering the time of year. Well done Sushisamba.

title: Breathtaking View With Superior Oxygen
comment: Let's face it, at this altitude you are paying for oxygen, not the food, wine, scotch or beer. I visited Sushi Samba in London, England with friends and by myself on two separate occasions. The food is what you would expect: costly and refined – perception. The drinks? Hyper-inflated liquid courage. Word of advice, do not take cash with you, use your credit card. The bartender gave me back £45 pounds in change. I was walking around and jingling the whole night like Santa Claus in Sept. Jokes aside; I had a great experience downstairs on the terrace. Let's face it, I didn't go there for the food or the drinks. I went there for the view and the swanky vibe you get from being there. The demographics? Young, aspirational, affluent, middle-aged, wealthy, established, classy, refined. Great place to take someone you care about, or a great place to impress yourself.

title: TOP FOOD & SERVICE ON TOP OF THE WORLD X
comment: A MUST VISIT RESTAURANT FOR ANYONE LOOKING FOR FANTASTIC FOOD, BRILLIANT SERVICE AND VIEWS THAT TAKE YOUR BREATH AWAY!!!!! Every member of staff is so friendly, helpful and attentative. Well Done to Marc, Otto, Mantas and the team for giving us such a memorable experience. Ask the staff about Signature dishes that taste so GOOOOOOOD X

title: Ambiance before food
comment: As a venue, this place is spectacular: it (quite rightly) boasts of best views over the City and the whole ambiance of the place is reminiscent of high-rise diners of the Far East (Hong Kong, Tokyo, Shanghai). The place was quite busy, as one expects at this time of the year, but it didn't spoil the experience and rather enhanced it. The bar is well-stocked with some rather unusual features (e.g. a wide selection of Japanese whiskeys), the service at the bar is quick and no-nonsense. As you proceed to the dining area, your impressions start to go downhill. While the atmosphere, the decor, and the overall ambiance are still there, both the cuisine and the service let you down. As far as the latter is concerned, the major problem is the lengthy waiting periods in between the courses. It could well be 15-20 minutes after the plates have been cleared that the next course is placed on your table... and you discover it is lukewarm. The waiters do try to be helpful and engaging but they rarely succeed in being efficient at the same time. The service gets slower and slower as the evening progresses, which is rather bizarre taking into account how busy the place is and how difficult it is to book a place there. In the end, having spent more than 3 hours there, we deiced to leave without the pudding: the wait became excruciating. After having waited 15 min extra to be seated (now, I can understand why: with the speed of service they have, it is a wonder that anyone gets a seat at all), we were guided to our table... No excuses were offered though, and not a single smile either. As for the cuisine, it is mixed and, overall, a rather sad affair. The fusion of Japanese and Latin American has been tried before many times and with very mixed results. Ten years after it first arrived to London shores, the novelty of the idea has pretty much worn off, taking away 90% of all the excitement. You are not surprised anymore but, as you know quite well what you'll get, your expectations regarding the standards of cooking get high. This is when the disappointment kicks in. Firstly, as I have said before, uneven and chaotic service does not contribute to the experience. Dishes arrive out of order (course number 4 before course number 3, for example) with some of them being almost cold. The portions that are supposed to be shared by the diners ofter are of grudgingly small size as if they have been intended originally for individual rather than communal enjoyment. Having had half of the meal, you are left with a distinct impression that the meal hasn't started yet and you've been enjoying drinks with nibbles instead. "The order of the service" is also rather ill-thought: for example, sushi are being served just before the dessert course (the one that we've decided to abandon) and after the main course. Sushi's position in the menu was so obviously wrong and out of place that several people at our table checked the menu to make sure there were no mistake. Secondly, the cooking is disappointing. Take the sushi course, for example. Wassabi that goes with it is so mild that one can barely taste it, say nothing about the expectation of heat and full flavour. Hamachi Kama (char-grilled collar of the yellowtail fish) is charred rather than grilled and it did arrive at out table stone-cold. Shrimp tempura had the appearance and the taste of a "out-of-the-bag-quickly-microwaved-grub" with now crispiness at all. Churrasco Rio Grande was served hot (for a change) but that was the best thing one can say about the plate: while the presentation was striking (the meats resting on a bed of hot stones), the plates themselves (we've ordered several) were cooked to different standards (one of them was between "medium" and "well done" while the other one was "medium rare") and the meats were of different standards themselves too: one of the rib-eyes was barely edible. This is where another service saga started: an answer to the routine question of a waiter "How is you meat?" ("This rib-eye is not particularly good") provoked a defensive and lengthy tirade from the waiter advocating the good standard of the dish. Obviously, he was right while at least 4 people around the table were wrong. No polite excuses were offered at this time either. When we decided to finish the meal without the pudding and asked for the remaining sushi to be packed in a takeaway bag, the best entertainment of evening followed. One of the waiters readily agreed to do so before disappearing altogether. Some half an hour later, another waiter, after being prompted, claimed that wouldn't be possible as this type of service wasn't customary at the place. A small group of grumpy waiters (c.f. an unkindness of ravens) turned up at the table demanding a physical description of the server who had previously agreed to do the honours. By the look of their faces, if identified, the renegade would have been lynched. It was hilarious.  Overall, these dramas didn't spoil the evening but that was owing to the company at the table rather than cuisine or service. Sadly, after my first visit to this place, I can confidently say that I won't be coming back there any time soon: there are plenty of similarly interesting venues around enjoying the same, if not better, views over London and cosmopolitan and busy ambiance and offering much better standards of service as well as much more refined and interesting cuisine. Even more sadly, I can't recommend this place for a dinner either.

title: Fantastic Restaurant and Amazing views.
comment: Having lived around the world including Japan and California (two Sushi loving places) I found it hard to get truely good sushi in London. I can say hands down the sushi is absolutely fantastic and the best I've had in London. The theme in the bars/restaurants along with the views over London are spectacular. A special mention for the floorstaff and the floor manager Oto who was top class and made it his business to introduce himself and make sure everything you wanted was catered for. Overall 5*

title: Nothing special except location
comment: I was visiting Sushi Samba with high expectations as I heard so much about this restaurant. To be honest I was disappointed from the overall experience. The location is impressive on the 39th floor with fantastic views of London. The service was really good as our waiter was exceptionally good and really made a difference in our dinner. The food was ok nothing special BUT very expensive. We were 6 persons and paid 360 pounds which for the overall experience It was too much.  What was really poor was the ambience and the decoration which was very poor for what it should be.  There was also a smell coming from the open kitchen which was really uncomfortable to smell.  Overall an average experience especially with the choice given in London for sushi restaurants.

title: Fab cocktails even better with THE VIEW
comment: Cocktails with work colleagues, superb view and a real treat. Unusual ingredients, highly alcoholic. Fantastic to see London from such a height.

title: Top of the Heron, top quality (and top prices)
comment: Fantastic location with vertigo inducing views of the London skyline. Superb quality sushi with a twist and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. A really buzzing atmosphere means it's hard not to recommend a visit to anyone who likes ghis kind of food. Plenty to choose from so we'll have to go back!

title: Sushi Samba is a success
comment: I took my boyfriend to Sushi Samba for his birthday and he has labelled it as "probably the best meal he has ever eaten" so thank you Sushi Samba for making me look good! We took the lift (great experience in itself) up to the 38th floor and stepped out to the most wonderfully decorated restaurant with impressive lighting, decor and outside bar and seating area. As we were staying for lunch and it was a lovely summer's day, we decided to sit outside in full view of the Gherkin. We were seated by a very polite and helpful waiter who then proceeded to recommend us cocktails and also some of the most popular dishes all of which we ordered.  When the food came out we were amazed. Everything was beautifully presented, from the gyozas we started with, to the sushi platter and finally the birthday dessert plate they had prepared for my boyfriend.  Overall we spent about two hours eating and drinking. The views were breathtaking and the food even more so. If you are prepared to pay a little extra for an experience that is unforgettable then definitely try SS out. Well done Sushi Samba, you are a sushi success!

title: Up in the Staff Lift!
comment: We were celebrating my best friend's birthday. I would like to mention the name of Roger Barnett, the security guy, who was so kind, polite and patient with me as I was the only one of the group who was afraid to go on the lift, so he took me up on the staff one. Gorgeous food, drinks and service! Thank you!

title: Hot spot with great view
comment: I went to sushi samba this december(2014) and i can say that is a unique experience. The location is fantastic with amazing view of london town and with a fantastic terrace which unfortunatelly was closed due to cold . The food was indeed superb . A strong reccomedation from my side

title: Never again!!
comment: We went to this restaurant, world-famous. We had to schedule it a month in advance, as there were no reasonable hours available for a dinner (availability for the whole month was only after 10pm). Busy place, nice reviews, looked like it would be a nice family dinner in a special place! Actually, it was a big mistake. Loud place, with a crowded, sophisticated, under-served, expensive for its value, and noisy bar in the entrance, an incompetent reception desk with two under-trained staff members, who nicely explained to us that our reservation for 21:15 would be delayed by 15 minutes. Not bad, 15 minutes, right? Wrong! After several "15 minutes" later, after a lot of arguing at the reception desk with the rude Brazilian and its kind but completely lost and incompetent companion, we finally got a table after a 65 minutes waiting time! A manager came helping the incompetent duo and found us the “best available table”, right in front of the robata kitchen, a very smokey experience! A while later they told us we could move to a "better" table, which was much smaller compared to the initial one, but we took anyway just to get away from the smoke. As a matter of compensation, he offered us two glasses of champagne and some appetisers, which we took, and a 100 Pounds voucher for our next meal at the place, which I declined telling him I had no intention of ever going back there, with such customer treat! Food menu is a mix of Brazilian, Japanese and Peruvian cuisines. Nice proposition right? Well, the food was good, but the bill was very expensive as the sake and beverages in general are very expensive. Value for the money definitely not worth. I have been to several nice and expensive restaurants, all worth their prices, but this one is sort of a tourist-trap with the promise of a nice view. Only good thing on this restaurant was the waiter Pablo, who tried his best to make us happy. Two words: never again!!

title: What's not to love?
comment: Mouthwateringly memorable meal. We were unsure what to order so left everything in the hands of our wonderful waiter, he (and the chefs) did not disappoint. Cocktails on the terrace afterwards, perfect.

title: I Don't Like Sushi But I Like SushiSamba!
comment: As the name suggests, I'm not a big fan of sushi so the menu was gibberish to me. The waiter very nicely explained the menu and recommended dishes based on my taste. They were amazing and I even tried the sushi although it's not for me! The views were amazing although the weather was too bad to go outside onto the terrace

title: Amazing cocktails
comment: The view is absolutely stunning and we sampled the cocktails and were not dissapointed. A must if you are in London

title: Great views fab food..
comment: We had a late dinner 10.30pm and really enjoyed the views the bar is very busy but we managed to get seats while we waited for our table.. The lift is super speedy to the 38 floor. Food was tasty our only complaint was the music was very loud in the restaurant so over a table of four we were struggling to hear each other and our waitress...

title: Great atnosphere great view
comment: We went for drinks mainly for the view but ended up having sushi as well. Not an expert on sushi the drinks a little 'weak' but the view of london from the 38th floor stunning. Service good everyone willing to help with everything from seating to explaining the sushi dishes. Would love to go again when the outdoor area is open.

title: Amazing meal and location: just make sure your wallet is full
comment: I was taken here on a special occassion so the bill landed elsewhere, (£360 for 2) it was fantastic though. I've never eaten steak like it in my life. Impecable service and delicious interesting food. Very well worth getting up there. drop in for a cocktail if the price of dinner is too steep.

title: one of the best meals we've had
comment: This place is amazing. The service was brilliant, very attentive staff who were extremely knowledgable. The food was outstanding, this immediately shot up to one of our top 2 restaurants (and we are foodies!) Literally a must go. The only draw back is that it takes around 2 months to get a decent evening booking.

title: Delicious food but too expensive for what it is
comment: Sushi Samba is located on the 38th floor at 110 Bishopsgate with a lovely view of the Gherkin when you come up in a glass elevator. The three of us booked couple of days in advance as a work night out on a trip to London. Given short notice, we were able to get only a late seating, but that didn't bother us. The restaurant offers a mixture of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian cuisine which we fancy trying. On the day we arrived promptly but our table was not ready for another 10-15mins. We decided to have a drink at the bar and wait for the table to become available. The 360 degrees view of the city skyline is lovely and adds a nice touch to your dining experience. We ordered assortment of ceviches, wagyu gyoza and Tokyo Sky Tree for starter and moqueca mixta, seabass temputa and pork ribs for main. We has sides of Peruvian corn and plantain chips. We washed it down with a lovely Hungarian souvignon blanc recommended to us by our waiter. The food on the day was delicious but too expensive for what it was. We paid £65 per person for food that in South America would cost us less than £20. Although we enjoyed the night, we would not be hurrying back.

title: Pretentious; lacking substance; rude fake staff. Great views though!
comment: I had no intention of dining at SushiSamba this evening, I thought I had made a reservation for Duck & Waffle on the next floor up, but they couldn't find our booking when we arrived. I showed them the email and they told me it was for SushiSamba instead. First disappointment of the evening, as I had made the reservation two months ago and had been looking forward to the meal for quite some time. This was not to be the last disappointment. We went downstairs and joined a queue to 'check in' with the host. We waited quite some time. In the mean time, a typical city slicker joined the queue beside us. We were almost jockeying for position as he kept trying to push ahead of us. Another member of staff swanned over to the desk and opened up another till just for him while we were left to wait for minutes more. It turned out he didn't even have a reservation and he was told to wait in the bar. We were told our table wasn't quite ready and directed to the bar. A long queue had formed and there was a suit behind us blocking the aisle with a suitcase. As I started to step round him a member of staff came bustling over and stood right in my way without acknowledging me at all while she fussed over the man's suitcase. We were actually touching, not once did she look up and say "sorry" or "excuse me". Awkward! The bar staff are vacant and unchivalrous and give off the vibe that THEY are doing YOU a favour by letting you into their fancy restaurant. No one gives you right of way when moving around. Whilst seated, a waitress came over and very pointedly put serviettes under our drinks, but failed to do this to any of the other adjoining tables. We had arrived at about 6:45 for out 7:00 table. At 7:20 we were still waiting to no avail. We weren't sure this whether we were supposed to go back at a certain time or whether someone was coming to get us. No offer was made to take our coats so we had to sit with them awkwardly. The service in the restaurant was much better, the waiters were very attentive, although it seems to be a big free for all as to who serves which area. We were asked multiple times if we wanted drinks or were ready to order, they really need a better system here.  The food was just okay, I can't comment too much on that - I am no sushi expert. The fusion concept seems gimimck-y however, I'd rather have gone to a Wahaca. The restaurant experience almost made up for the bad time at the bar, were it not for the fact that as we were finishing our desert the head waiter came over and told us he would need the table back in 10 minutes, so we were rushed out. We had barely stood up from the table when the next party were being shown to our seats!  Pretentious, disingenuous staff. Perhaps this is actually part of the City experience? New marketing angle? We considered leaving feedback at the time but didn't think anyone would care enough to address it. Maybe through writing this review I can help someone to make a better choice, although I am sure it will have no bearing on the restaurant's coffers as city bores and mediocre IT-crowd types flock here in their droves. To add insult to injury, I have now checked my emails, and I DID email Duck & Waffle for a reservation. Fantastic!

title: Drinks with friends
comment: We tried to go for drinks yesterday but got turned away at about 2pm as it was too busy. We went back at around 4pm and it was ok to go up.  I was told there was a dress code of smart casual which was fine but nearly everyone else who visited were tourists dressed in jeans and trainers just looking to take pictures of the view. Not as exclusive or stylish as you would expect from Sushi Samba. Bar area floor plan was awkward as walkways had to be kept clear even though it was rammed, with poor/inadequate seating (tiny stools that tipple over)  I just think more could be done to enhance the experience through effective layout of the bar area.  Dining area, however is great.

title: Amazing!
comment: I have been here a few times but never got around to reviewing. This is my fave sushi restuarant by far. Great view from the top of the Heron Tower. Great service the waiters always checking how your food is. Very high quality food. Yes it's not cheap, but it's very nice for a treat now and again! I would come back!

title: Fantastic
comment: Came here for a special lunch with the kids. It was absolutely fantastic. The view is amazing, our waiter could not have been nicer or more willing to accommodate us, giving us pointers on the most kid-friendly items on the menu, and the food was absolutely amazing from start to finish (including really spectacular desserts, so make sure you leave some space!). We ordered 10 small plates for 6 plus a couple of sides, and it was just about right with a dessert to follow. Ribs and plantain chips were a particular hit withe the kids, as were some of the samba rolls. It was definitely an expensive meal out but we will all remember it for a long time. The only small disappointment was that we weren't able to go outside on the terrace to look at the view better as it was too windy.

title: Cool, Elegant and what a view!
comment: There are plenty of good things to say about this place - the presentation of the food is precise and wonderful and the ambience is brilliant.  What I would say is that I personally don't get the 'fusion' aspect of this restaurant. I ordered the more Japanese plates, which were gorgeous, but one of the waiting staff tried to point me in the direction of a particular 'Samba Roll' that comprised of, amongst others, salmon and mozzarella. I cannot see how in any dimension this combination could work - I didn't try it, so I probably shouldn't judge!  When we arrived at the restaurant itself there was no one to greet us, so we were slightly confused as to where to go. We wandered to the bar and were then pointed in the direction of the main restaurant. Despite the shaky start, the rest of our experience was almost flawless. We had a very long and languid lunch with very attentive staff in a great setting. I would happily spend many more afternoons at Sushi Samba, and probably will before too long

title: Expensive, but good food - the bar lets it down
comment: I work 2 minutes away from Sushi Samba, so spend a lot of time 'wining and dining' in EC3 in London. Sushi Samba is one of the 'hottest' restaurants in the square mile, and is notoriously difficult to secure a booking for. Here's the good and the bad - but in a nutshell, there are better places to spend your money on in London.  THE GOOD. - The view needs to be mentioned up front. It really is that good.  - The dining room is lovely - light, airy, and with most tables giving you a great vantage point for making the most of the view. It's noisy though - this isn't a snug little romantic bolt hole, so you need to be prepared for buzz and chatter.  - The food in the restaurant is great - but not spectacular. Prices are high, but the sushi, sashimi and ceviche are fresh and tasty. The grill / robarta fare is average for the price - you can eat much nicer Peruvian style / Latin American food at better restaurants with less pretension in London, Andina or Ceviche being a good example.  THE BAD - The prices. The food, and especially the cocktails, just aren't good enough to justify the prices. You can get spectacular cocktails in London for around the 8 pound mark, and Sushi Samba's standard price is around 14 pounds. For that, I expect mixology magic.  - The Bar - whilst I'm talking about the drinks, the bar here is dreadful. The staff are rude and pretentious, the service bad and the wait to get a drink appalling when they charge through the nose. Particularly when you've spent several hundred pounds dining with them, it's a bit galling to get attitude when you order a night cap. Again - this is London, there are much better bars you can drop your cash at.  - The crowd. Oscillates between happy snapper tourists in jeans and runners and pretentious investment banker types wearing suits with their ties loosened. Really not my scene, and detracts from the chic atmosphere Sushi Samba is trying to cultivate. A much better crowd and atmosphere 10 minutes up the road in Hackney.  Overall, I'd rate Sushi Samba as 'overrated'. I've been there 3 times now, and I think my last visit will remain just that - my last visit.

title: A REAL TREAT
comment: This is a great place to book as a birthday treat. The fun begins with the fast glass lift up to the 38th floor, looking down on the gherkin. The environment is busy, with slick service. When ordering, work on the principle that you probably will never have heard of many of the dishes - a fusion of Japanese and South American. In our party of six we nominated two people to order, taking advice from the well-informed waiter - it is great to choose shared plates and be adventurous. Everything was delicious so dig in and have fun.

title: Wow
comment: Were fortunate to have been able to wangle a last minute booking here last week. Such a lovely venue, perfect for groups and couples alike. Cool little bar area serving a nice cocktail selection. We were a little late being seated but didn't mind since we'd been given one of the best tables in the restaurant, overlooking the city from the 38th floor! The food was fabulous, the kind where you just don't want it to end! Highlights of the menu were poussin, pork wraps and outstanding prawn tempura. Staff was fantastic. Will be returning very soon and recommending to friends.

title: Fantastic first meal, great view!
comment: From the moment you travel up the 38 floors at speed to this restaurant you know you're going to be in for a treat. The staff are so polite, very helpful with the menu and food is delicious. Great view over the city and atmosphere is very cool.

title: Perfectly special!
comment: So I took my Daughter to Sushi Samba as a treat and since we both like sushi we sort of had our own expectations, we arrived a little early having been told about the strict timings and imagined that we'd be rushed or less relaxed, how wrong, we sat in the bar / reception area and had a glass of champagne each and then when we were ready we we taken to our table. What a great place! only a little disappointed about the view being that it was foggy but being 38 floors up this would have been magnificent! Our waiters introduced themselves and explained the menu in a very friendly and helpful way expecting that some of the dishes may take some explaining, this alone was mouth watering. We made our selection and waited having time to enjoy the decoration and environment Our food arrived and frankly it was superb from the Miso soup to the WAGYU TATAKI, every mouthful was a delight, you MUST have the Black Cod, how do they do that?? You MUST have the Black Cod and Wagyu Tataki!! Combine this with Green Field Saki & sparkling Saki wine and you'll have a meal to match the best you may have had. We loved it anyway and I'd have no doubts about recommending this restaurant. As it turned out we must have had about 4 dishes each plus desert, the staff are knowledgeable, friendly and polite and certainly not overbearing as I have experienced in some other restaurants. We went there on a weekday for noon, by 1 it was very busy, everyone was watching the variety and "design" of the food as it arrived, all very smart but relaxed. Go when the weather is better, what an experience! 5 stars! book first!

title: Wonderful Evening, With a Spectacular View.
comment: Went to Shushi Samba in Mid November 2014 and it is just spectacular. The ambiance is very nice. The view at night is to die for. The sparkling lights of London and a Chilled Beer with friends and family just does the job for a perfect night. Its a little expensive but all worth it for the view and the ambiance. In essence Amazing Place would definitely recommend you check it out.

title: Top class!
comment: 2nd visit to SushiSamba as a birthday treat for one of my friends, it's an amazing place a real buzz in the air, fabulous decor, the food was absolutely stunning my friends all agreed one of the best meals we have eaten. The staff are fabulous friendly, attentive cannot do enough for you. When we finished our meal we were escorted to the 40th floor where there was another bar very busy but we were shown into a side area with tables and chairs where we were well looked after and what a view over London stunning!!! A must visit!

title: Difficult one to review
comment: Hmmmm, as the title says this is a hard one to review. I think the safest place to start is with the expectations, it takes a long while to get a reservation, it's expensive and this is where the in crowd eats. So the expectations are quite high. We went to celebrate Mrs G's birthday and to give her a chance to wear her sparkly Jimmy Choos. This is definitely the place to do that. The decor is nice, the ride up in the lift with a view of the city is worth something by itself and the ambience is excellent. A noisy buzz with nice music and attentive but not pushy staff - we were also engaged Maitre'd who asked us whether we were enjoying ourselves, which I like. And the food (the point of the exercise) is, well, unremarkable and left me slightly wondering what all the fuss was about. Excellent ingredients that somehow seem to add up to less than the sum of its parts. We had tempura prawns, mixed cerviche, blackened cod (recommended) and the £45 mixed beef on hot stones number, which to be honest probably isn't.  So in summary, very nice and an enjoyable experience but not better than lots of other places which I think I thought it would be. You'll have a nice evening, and without the waiting list and a notch or two down on the price I'd go again. But there are better places to pick in London's wide selection so the suggestion would that unless you really want the in crowd experience to pick one of them.

title: Gorgeous setting, a little above average dining
comment: The setting is amazing, there is no doubt about that. And the service is outstanding. The food was good but nothing mind blowing and it certainly is quite expensive. Worth a visit, though.

title: Special place with great views
comment: We have been to this place few times and keep going back. I guess it's the Cevice starters. The service is very good and the view looking down at the Gherkin is amazing. They also do fantastic cocktails. On the down side it is over priced, but we have never left disappointed with the experience. The original one in Manhattan is more down to earth.

title: Delicious and Creative Food
comment: We dined in late afternoon and had the chance of seeing both day and night time. The food was great both for vegetarians and carnivores. Service was great, fast, warm and informative. Will definitely go back.

title: Superb flavour
comment: This is a pricey restaurant set at the top of one of London's most popular towers. Its not cheap but then the food is not your average meal. Great infusion cuisine for that special occassion.

title: Loved it
comment: Came here as a treat for Christmas. The decor is beautiful, the waiters are very helpful and polite and the food is to die for. I had a fantastic time here and will be treating myself again this year.

title: Wonderful evening
comment: After the lift experience you need a drink. I was pretty scared in that glass elevator but it all adds to the experience. Beautiful restaurant. Extremely helpful waiters although they changed our waiter twice. Food was to die for. I love black cod. The views were spectacular of London late at night. Very pricey but was worth every penny.  The only downside was the lighting was very low which made me feel a little tired and unable to read the menu properly but that's it. Love this place and will definitely be going back for another Christmas treat to myself.

title: Excellent location
comment: We visited this restaurant for a Sunday lunch to celebrate a family birthday. The view is fantastic and is even nicer on a bright sunny day. The service is exceptional and the waiters there are very helpful. The food is very good with a mixture of Sushi and South American specialities. It is to die for albeit somewhat expensive.

title: Consistently excellent
comment: Yet another excellent night at sushisamba. It really is one of the best restaurants in London. I was really lucky to get in at short notice. It was really busy when we got there on a soggy Winter Wednesday night. The bars (inside and out) were heaving so it was hard to get a drink within 20 minutes so I went straight to the table in the restaurant. We got a great table (no view I'm afraid as the clouds had come in). The atmosphere was wonderful. At night the restaurant is very romantic. The service was excellent - the sushisamba waiters all have great personalities and are very enthusiastic about their jobs and the food and can't do enough to help you. The manager Otto came to say hello and thank me for coming back which was a lovely touch. My boyfriend hadnt been there before and the waiters do an excellent job of guiding you through the menu and highlighting the extra special dishes. The shrimp tempura, yellowtail tirodito and black cod miso are must haves if you love fish. We also had the tiger maki roll and the wagyu beef. There was not one thing we could complain about. The wine was fantastic and they kept us topped up all night. I can't rave about this place enough. The place is excellent and not too stuffy and the food is second to none.

title: Staggering - The lift, the cocktails, the food, the service, the price!
comment: We decided to treat ourselves to Sushi Samba after all the rave comments we received. The first challenge was the lift, fastest in Europe apparently and strapped to the outside of the building, not for the faint hearted but much easier on the stomach than the roller-coaster reputation it has. The next challenge was the bar, the 38th floor where the restaurant is located had a hectic cocktail bar inside and an overpriced champagne bar on the terrace. We waited patiently for the bar staff to take out order and my wife was ignored twice by the surly waitress, thankfully I had wandered up to the bar on the 39th which was less busy and far quicker to be served. The cocktails were tasty and original even though we did find it difficult to find someone willing to take an order for a second round. The off to the table for dinner, the restaurant is basically a big glass box on top of the building so acoustics can be a little hard and hence it was a god send when the waitress offered to look after us novices and recommend a menu. Her choices were fabulous and we felt we really had an opportunity to try all tat was unique to this venue. The service at the table was fantastic, attentive but not overbearing, even to the point of sticking a candle in my pudding with Happy Birthday written on it. The bill finally came which was a shock, although the overall experience was worth it, I would do it again but this time during the day and hopefully have a view of the ground instead of the rain.

title: One of the best dinners
comment: I love Sushi Samba and especially this one! The great view when you arrive to the top, delicious food and great cocktails. I will come back.

title: Amazing
comment: Very amazing place , wonderful view , marvelous food , could be better for special occasion because it was over price , every thing was unique starter , main dish ( Moqueca ) every one should try it , and yumy yumy dessert . Sure i will be there again ❤️

title: Special Ocasion
comment: The place and the food is amazing as well as the view but everything ends here. On the entrance there was a massive q and people at the entrance are quite unhelpful. While making the reservation I have mentioned at least tree times that I have bday, even when they call me to confirm the booking I have told them that I am celebrating bday there. No body agnoledge it. There was not even happy bday from our waiters. They were all so busy and until the end of the night I didn't really know who our waiter is as they keep on coming different people to our table. I had nearly 3 different waiters serving us. No body explained us the menu and I had the impression they didn't know it as well. From the sommelier there was no recommendation on wine. I ordered a wine but I asked her if it is dry as I wanted dry wine with the food but actually was quite fruity and sweet.  We had a good evening overall but as I am a restaurant manager and had high expectations for this place I am quite disappointed.  I will not recommend the place because with this prices is really unacceptable to receive this services. I still paid the 12,5% service charge which was not deserved at all. I don't like giving bad review but on my special occasion this is quite disappointing :((((

title: lived up to hype
comment: All my friends have been banging on about sushi samba so I was glad to finally go! It was quite pricey but actually worth it - it was for my friend's birthday, so a good treat. One of the few places I have been to that lived up to the hype. The view really makes it too.

title: Bamboo, chrome & glass fusion
comment: Discovered Sushi Samba via exceptional word of mouth and a spotting from atop the neighboring gherkin. From the quick whisk up the high speed glass elevators, through the bamboo caged atrium dining room and out onto the sky terrace overlooking the Thames, the visuals did not disappoint. Quality of food and service- an equal or better match. We entrusted our order to the knowledgable waiter and sampled an unequaled meld of sino-latino flavors. Yes, pricey. Yes, your time up there is limited. But it IS a one of a kind dining experience in London, especially on a lovely day. Reservations well (weeks) in advance essential.

title: Best service in London
comment: We were fortunate enough to be invited to this spectacular venue. Looking down on London and the Gherkin is something else a real window to the city. The food was exceptionally good - mix of Japanese and South American. Great selection of wines. But I think that the USP of this restaurant is the service - honestly I havent had this service in London in the last couple of years. Not only professional, but friendly and not over friendly. Well done to the staff - you are a real credit to this special venu - without you it would not be so impressive.

title: Lovely lunch in beautiful weather
comment: Shared a birthday lunch with my daughter- had visited before and not disappointed on second visit. Food great- think we over ordered but amazing and she loved it. Thank you

title: SUSHI SAMBA SUSHI AWESOMEEEEE!!
comment: Well folks, another fancy restaurant to try, this one had a 3...yes 3 month waiting list to even get in. It was my wife's birthday and she adores Sushi so this place looked the bomb. This is place is literally by Liverpool Street Station (Central Line - Famous for weekly suicides...) anyway, it's a 5 minute walk from there and even before you get in there are 2 bouncers and a crowd of groupies trying to negociate to get on the evening's diners list. Firstly, there is a glass elevator which allows you to see a nice bit of London, once you get in the service from the staff really couldn't have been better. From the moment you walk in, your treated like royalty any issue is not a problem, we were promptly seated (Make sure you request seats by the window for a nice view). While my wife went away, the waiter asked me whether it was a special occasion, when saying it was her birthday and without me evening asking he said when you order a dessert we will put happy birthday on, wife was delighted when this happened later in the evening. The waiter and staff were extremely informative, explaining the menu in depth, giving recommendations and always keeping good eye for detail. Now, lets get to the food. My wife is the master of sushi and extremely picky about it, she said the sushi here was the best she had ever, this includes sushi she had in Asia. I on the other hand hate sushi, if your sushi lover we suggest you go for Sao Paulo known as the 'Samba Rolls'. If your not a sushi lover try the starters of Wagyu Gyoza this dumplings are out of this world! The thing with this place, which differs from other western/asia restaurants is that the food you chose is based on the Spanish Tapas, so we suggest you pick a number of dishes and share. The only food, which I was disappointed with was 'Robata - Black Cod' it's grilled but the smokiness is far too much, which destroys the taste, if you do try this, what ever you do dont put the bloody lime on it, wrong choice. Apart from this all the sushi and cooked food we had was well above standard, perfect. Drinks wise, my wife went for a cocktail, Lychee Cooler, which was tasty, I went for Matcha-Pisco, another amazing choice by my wife but I chose an awful one as the Matcha was extremely bitter, to save disappointment, go for the champayne. Our bill was around £150 thats for a helping for 2 people, 2 cocktails and desserts. Well worth it and would have gladly paid over £200 for it. Customer service, Food and Atmosphere 10/10 Book Now!!!!!!!

title: Breathtaking views of London & mind-blowing sushi
comment: I cannot think of a better place to unwind after a tough week. Up in the Gods, with a commanding view of one of the finest cities in the world, Sushi Samba sets you up feeling (literally) on top of the world. Hendricks gin served with cucumber in lieu of lemon is perfect to induce a relaxed state & the sushi was mouth wateringly devine. The service staff were extremely attentive & I'll definately be returning very soon!

title: Perfectly Placed
comment: With one of the best views in the City, this place is really quite special, while the crowd is rather mixed - tourists & the usual City types - it's all good fun, though it's worth remembering to explore at the beginning not at the end of the evening....

title: Breathtaking views of London...
comment: The views (starting from the moment you get in the lift) are quite spectacular - as loby as it's not to cloudy/foggy of course.  The menu is interesting, Japanese / peruvian fusion - high quality ingredients, creative and successful dishes, but nonetheless I wouldn't go back just for the food it's a little overpriced - throwing the views in changes the equation though. The salmon (cooked) and mozzarella roll is very unique, worth a try if you're looking for something very different. Other roles are not as unique but still very good - I particularly enjoyed the spicy tuna and spicy crab rolls. From rhe hot dishes the seabass tempura was very well done, but I wouldn't bother with the hot stone wagyu (meat is only good, portion size very small). Finally for dessert, I had my eye set on the banana chocolate cake, which had unfortunately run out. In its absence the mochi ice cream and the banana mouse both went down well.

title: Definitely overpriced!!!!
comment: Just came back from the restaurant.... Not sure where to start from, yes, the view it's nice (although nothing compared to the Shard), but from the restaurant you cannot really see much and the bar is too crowded to actually appreciate the view properly. Price wise is crazy.... Obviously we didn't expect to go to a cheap restaurant but I think they can win an award for the most expensive green tea ever (which is in fact not a proper green tea but a powder tea or something similar)...£8.50 for a glass, no refill, literally this is the price for a tiny glass of boiled water. We got the assorted raw fish ... £23 for 6 tiny extremely thin pieces of fish (literally you could see through them). Ate in many Sushi places but the fish was so thin you couldn't even taste it.... We had a tiny bottle of sake for £35....and they couldn't even keep it warm and therefore got cold after 5 mins... The only thing that was worth the money was the dessert which was a good portion. Service wise, all looked really good at the beginning, our waitress introduce herself and told us she was going to look after us but then never saw her again.... So not sure what that was about. I told them at time of booking this was our first wedding anniversary and no one mentioned or did anything for us. Didn't expect a cake or anything, but a "congratulation" would have been nice, just to recognise us considering I also sent them an email before coming. I work in hospitality too and I know that doesn't take too much to recognise a customer and made them feel special. So yeah... You could go there and just order a dessert.... But nothing else.

title: awful
comment: terrible terrible experience. Have been twice in two months and both have been well below average. The sushi rice was ice cold and the fish also over chilled. Like ice. Receptionist not overly welcoming, and service was forced. The same price as a meal at zuma and believe me not remotely in the same league.

title: Great sushi, a tad pretentious
comment: I came here for lunch with a friend for my birthday which I booked months in advance (I wish it wasnt so difficult to get a reservation). I am a huge sushi fan, and I couldn't fault the sushi, it was delicious. Expensive but you get what you pay for. I wanted champagne as it was my birthday but I had to order several glasses for £16 each because one teaspoon drop comes in the glass. Sadly I felt like the staff were a little snobbish and judging guests. I've also seen other reviews on here of people being turned away or made to feel uncomfortable based on their appearance or outfit. I work in a high-end restaurant and I know that you can't always tell how much money someone will spend just by looking at them. However I will return for the sushi.

title: Impressive location, poor service and food
comment: I was there for a corporate event, they book the whole 39th floor. The location is impressive: wonderful views from the top on London night. This place wants to be very trendy, and the design reflect this. However it lacks substnce: music was too high for a corporate event, it was impossible to talk. Staff was very unprofessional, they had no time to answer questions from guests or to satisfy any request. Drinks are ok, food very poor: the typical creative-international type which is so popular if you want to pretend to be soemthing but you do not have a proper food education and culture.

title: Pricey - but both food and drinks were amazing
comment: We visited Sushi Samba to celebrate an anniversary and we weren't disappointed. I was a bit dubious about the price of drinks - very expensive so definitely not somewhere I would go if I wanted to drink a lot. However the drinks we ordered were delicious, firstly we tried some Sake, as recommended by the waiter, and then we ordered a cocktail each after dinner. We didn't have a bottle of anything like we usually would just because it would have been so expensive, but were really happy with what we had. In terms of the food, plates arrived sporadically, which was good because you could concentrate on one or two dishes at a time, although there was a rather long gap before we got our last sushi dish. The pork belly was amazing, as were the yellowfin tacos, was not so impressed with the tuna cerviche, it was really tasty but I would have liked more tuna! All of the portions were a little small so you have to order quite a few. We were still too full for dessert though - had to just go with the cocktail, but they brought us some complimentary macaroons to celebrate our anniversay - which was a really nice touch. Overall, the staff were really welcoming, friendly and helpful - except for the prices I can't really fault it - but you have to expect high prices for this location and view, although the view was kind of cloudy and not so great the day we went!

title: Very cool atmosphere!
comment: we popped in for cocktails on a night out in the city and what a great place! Unfortunately the outside area was closed due to the weather but nether the less the view was amazeballs! Definitely coming back to try the restaurant

title: Amazing food
comment: Went for a birthday celebration with my husband on a weeknight - table was booked for 5.15pm as no other times available even though restaurant appeared quite empty even when we left).  It was outlet first visit and the waitress explained the menu and was very helpful. We had a number of waiters/waitresses  attending to us. All were very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable. The food was amazing. Yes portions are small and expensive but you get quality and something that's different! Loves the yellow tail taquitos, the calamari chicarron and the sushi samba london roll the most.  Desserts were delicious too - would have liked a happy birthday message for my husband as had mentioned the occasion during booking and also when ordering the champagne but to be honest -  it didn't matter. It was a lovely evening. We spent £200 for two and it was worth it.  Felt much happier than when having spent similar amount at the shard earlier this year, also for a special occasion, where service and food just didn't add up.

title: Special occasion
comment: we went for a family celebration knowing that the view from the 34 floor would be amazing. Not only was the bird's eye view of London breathtaking, but the service was excellent and the food inspired, I look forward to eating there again when I'm in London

title: Classy touch.
comment: Samba is the place to be in and hog them food. I became an ardent fan after one visit and end up eating a bit more when i go around here.Rock Shrimp Tempura, Tiger Maki Ezo and Samba london of all, come as being some of my favourites. Though the starters are usually limited to Edamame beans, Love the ambiance and summers are good to enjoy cocktails. The only problem is getting a booking, it can be quite a wait.

title: CANNOT GET ENOUGH OF THIS PLACE
comment: Have reviewed before and called in a few days ok for late lunch/early dinner and this place never fails. Excellent on all levels. Love it and love the Chucumber.

title: Beautiful place, but...
comment: This restaurant is very impressed with itself. The service was great, the venue (view and ambiance) is amazing, but before you even get in the door the website tells you how much time you are allotted for your reservation. We were told, not once, not twice, but three times when our time was up. We actually waited for the bill and asked twice to get it.  We live in Florida, there is a Sushisamba there too-- we found the sushi so so--we've had much better. The plates are small, the portions are small and the prices are HUGE. Just know, you're paying for the venue, the name and then your time is up! Not worth all of the hype.

title: Sushi Tapas of Very Good Quality
comment: On the 38th floor with amazing views of London which are truly breath-taking. You are whisked to the top by an express glass lift at ear-popping speed. Out into the restaurant - bustling, noisy, busy and very impressed with itself. You must then check in at reception and stand against a wall (like kids outside the headmaster's study) waiting your table. But then, the maitre d' arrives with a platter with two glasses of prosecco and your off. Tables by the windows are considered the best in the house boasting breath-taking views over London's night sky. Atmosphere is created by booming music. Hmmm - not my taste BUT that is the vibe in the place and they do it well. Helpful waiter with proper recommendations who took into account what we did and didn't want to eat.  The raw fish was excellent. The vegetable salad was, frankly, poor - dirty carrot, a few leaves and a nondescript dressing lying in wait at the bottom of the bowl. The speed of service was well-paced (although the cut rolls take longer to arrive than any other item).  On the whole the food is really good - the portions are not enormous (although the cut rolls are generous).  You must understand that this is a top location, and it is "sushi tapas" in the style of Dinings (whilst never quite achieving the finesse of that restaurant, it beats it hands down for the sexy skyline location). Our bill, for two: 8 courses with gin and tonic and 2 large bottles of sparkling water, was £135 including service. For London, this is not bad. A word about the staff - don't believe what you read in some of the reviews - the staff were ALL excellent - from the bus boys and girls, to the waiter, to the floor manager (Oto) and the maitre d' (Errol). They were friendly, helpful, hospitable, funny and generous with their time. Just on that basis alone we would return. Verdi: It's well worth a visit.

title: Ridiculous reservation system
comment: Booked a table for 2 months in advance. The day after making the booking I was advised that my reservation could not be honoured as the restaurant would be closed for a private event. I tried to book for the following week over the phone but was advised that booking was not yet open. I asked if they could make an exception, given that they had already made a mistake with my booking, but was told this is not possible. The contact only seemed interested in trying to push reservations at the sister restaurant in the same building. Very disappointed with the service so far - I hope the food is worth the wait!

title: Simply the best sushi
comment: Pure class - The sushi is on another level. Wonderfully modern and ladies if you want to get dressed up and feel posh the bar and terrace is a great spot for a drink but be willing to pay for it. I went for a meal here last year, I had previously been for drinks here and was amazed by the views and venue - its beautiful. We were greeted and sat down straight away and was assigned our waiter who was unbelievably good at giving great service. I didn't have too look up once to get someone's attention - he was on the ball the whole time. Shame I cant remember hes name, anyway the waiter recommended lots of dishes so we said go for it and everyone was a explosion of new tastes I have never experienced before, was such an experience, me and my aunt had steak and the black cod and they were both to die for. we then had some plates of sushi which were just heaven, yeah this place is expensive but you get what you pay for its divine. Highly recommend to sushi lovers and people who like to experience class and beauty in a restaurant. Top notch.

title: Great atmosphere and views!
comment: Well, I would say it's much better to go up jusy for drinks than booking a table to have dinner there. The dinning room is a bit boring compared to the busy lounges around... you have 3 floors to choose to stay, inside or outside around the fireplaces... It's really nice! And you can also enjoy amazing views of London, specially from the Gherkin...

title: Beyond belief
comment: Went to sushi samba last night but was refused entry by the security staff. They advised me I was dressed inappropriately as I had a top on with a hood. Although this top was expensive and clean and I also had shoes on with a pair of jeans this was unacceptable. I would t mind but initially I was told I needed a reservation and only when I called people that were already inside did they bring up the dress code issue. It was like they looked at me and decided I could not afford to eat or drink there

title: Views to die for-Brazilian Asian Fusion Dishes Not Bad Either
comment: Setting on the 38th floor of high rise building in the center of downtown London makes the entire experience completely unique. The restaurant-there is another one sharing the top two floors-has its own exterior high speed elevator which is in itself a treat. The outdoor bar terrace views, atmosphere and the overall scene-the millennial crowds contributing are wonderful. The menu highlights include a unique combination of Japanese sushi rolls with a south american flare in terms of tastes. Other dishes more adventuresome. Deserts well worth indulging again for their unexpected combinations of tastes, textures and colors. Service inconsistent but the "scene" in the main dining room is more than enough positive distraction.

title: 2nd visit andimpressed
comment: I was initially impressed with my previous experience here. I will say however the cocktails were better the first time round.  I can't fault the good and service a great deal. Waiters are attentive and you're rarely waiting on them to order drinks.  We ordered a dish and ended up not liking it. No big deal as its tapas and we were trying many things.  A waiter went to remove the plate and asked if it was ok. I said it wasn't to our taste and not to worry to which he said no problem. The manager came over and said that he would take it off the bill as we didn't like it. This is a touch and was appreciated.  Lovely views. Nice cocktails and good service. A must do in London Highly recommend!

title: Amazing view!
comment: I visited this fantastic bar/restaurants recently and I'm still thinking when I could go back in summer time! This terrace bar on the 34th floor of the Heron Tower left me without words. The view of the City skyline is breathtaking and the atmosphere make you feel like to be on the set of Sex and the City. Drinks are quite expensive but trust me the location is really super!!!!

title: What a great view!
comment: Just a magnificient view overlooking the city of London. +/- 200 meters high enjoying some sushi! Do not wear any sneakers when you just want to go up and have a drink because they will say they are fully booked :-). Do not forget: pay attention of the speed of the elevator.

title: Best Sushi in the UK
comment: Went here for the first time for lunch after a number of recommendations from friends and colleagues. I would recommend asking the waiter to choose for you as what came back was superb. The Sushi is world class with incredible flavours. A very special meal. Only negative is our waiter was a tad arrogant and service could have been faster.

title: Location + food = good choice
comment: Interesting venue. When the weather in London is not miserable the outdoor terrace is a must!.  They offer a good mix of signature cocktails that are worth exploring. Food is a mix of sushi, peruvian, and some mexican. There is a good variety and I am sure you can find something that meet your needs. We were 4 folks so we asked for a variety of different starters and mains and had the chance to try a bit of all :)  The menu is not a never ending list which i personally believe is a great decision.

title: 60 th birthday
comment: My self and my two daughters booked at table for 0811/21014 as it was my 60th birthday on 09/11/2014. At the time of booking we were told the only available table was at 16-30. Did not have a problem with the time but the restaurant was half full until the time we left at 18-30 so not sure why we could not have gone later . The staff were okay but for a top restaurant not impressed with the customer service. We ordered several dishes which were all very nice but asked for rice which we never recieved . It was a big celebration for me and was not even acknowledged by the staff. I wasn't expecting a massive birthday cake but at least maybe a candle on the pudding. The food was tasty and cooked to perfection  Would I recommend to friends, no . A different experience and yes glad we went but will not be returning .

title: Posh place - great for a cocktail!
comment: I have been there just for a cocktail, so my experience is limited to pretty coulored drinks, prepared with meticuolous care by a team of hyper professional barmen. Great experience, pretty expensive, but the location and the terrace are definitely worth it! Tip: please note that while you need to wait for months to have a table to the restaurant, no reservation is needed to have a cocktail - just start queuing outside and after a 30 mins you will have the acces to one of the best view over London.

title: Really nice food - easy to spend 50 each without wine
comment: My wife and I were in London this Saturday and as a treat we wanted to take in the view and food of Sushi Samba. The lift up to floor 38 was great as you look out over London and not as ear popping quick as I had hoped. Where is the go faster button? Great decor awaited us, nicely decorated. The bar area low tools allowing people to sit and drink while taking in the panorama - selfie's being taken at will.  Bamboo lattice made a glass and steel building seem more authentic which was nice. I loved the orange ties on the staff contrasting with the black shirts - awesome brand colouring.  We were squeezed in before the booking for 1 hour which was great as 1 hour is sufficient as the service is prompt. As the menu is fusion - and again without really knowledge of starter/main/side we let the waiter guide us and he did a great job.  Crispy Taquitos - Yellow tail - these were small tacos filled with loveliness - rich guacamole, tuna, and a lovely corn miso foam - really nice - £12 for these which were really two bites.  Anticuchos - flank Skirt - As Michel Roux grand dad said on his death bed - " just a bit of skirt please" meaning the flank steak - this is the butchers own cut and gorgeous - served medium though really more medium rare - melted in the mouth - delicious - £17 for two skewers of three cubes - the corn accompaniment was fun too - big sweet corn Shrimp Tempura - sizeable bowl of food for 14 - lots of lightly batted prawns in a delicious dressing - my wife thought this was the best dish we had. Wagyu Tataki - was several thin slices of wagyu beef - just seared beautiful beef - didn't need chewing - just melted - top ingredients. Cooked foie gras never adds anything my view - same could have been achieved with cooked cheese. Nigri - tuna - similar to other places - however the tuna cooked really fresh and the wasabi was the real McCoy - not coloured horseradish - my nose was certiantly clear after that..wowsers.  Finally - we had the salted code fish cake balls - BOLINHOS DE BACALHAU - which were more potato than cod. Again a sizeable plate of food.  Overall - everything was served well.. Taquitos - best wow factor for eating with the eyes Prawns / Wagyu/ Flank for taste. Bill came to 95 for the two of us - without wine - just soda. 12.5% service automatically added.

title: Great experience!
comment: I went to sushisamba for a few drinks and had a great experience from the moment we got there. The door manager was lovely and looked after us like we were VIPs. He walked us to the lift. When we got to the bar we ordered a bottle of champagne and the barman offered to carry it to our table which was kind of him. The whole experience was amazing including the views what a night to remember! My best moment was when leaving the tower the door staff remembered me and wished me a safe journey! I would recommend to everyone!!

title: Samba London...
comment: ...Samba London is one of the rolls we had that night of early October indeed. The view from the lift is just amazing. Good service. To be honest I did not expect to eat as good as I ate. We shared five plates. Delicious the shrimps, the black cod, the pork belly and the Tokyo roll. The Samba London roll was just normal, the toilette as well (the best toilette with view in London is @ Hutong on top of the Shard)

title: Excellent
comment: Excellent food Excellent service Excellent views and ambience Went on Saturday for my daughters 18th Birthday We were a little worried by previous negative reviews but were very happy with our experience Great reception Food was delicious and well presented Waiter was very good and managers all wished my daughter happy birthday on departure Expensive but worth it

title: Excellent!
comment: My sister and I went to Sushi Samba for her birthday not long ago and I was a bit worried to find stuck up staff, small portions and a scary trip up and down the lift! I could not be more wrong!! Everything was spectacular from start to finish. The pork belly was to die for and I have thoroughly enjoyed my sparkling sake. The Italian waitress was superb ( sorry I have forgot her name!). I now want to go there for my birthday in the summer. Only problem was the fog that, that night made impossible for us to see the spectacular views, but that is only expected when the weather is bad.

title: Fantastic Location
comment: Incredible nice location, in the middle of the city, above a skyscraper. The view is awesome, the prices are into the middle to high bracket but it's well deserved.  We went there for a drink i have no feedback for the food.

title: Excellent
comment: This place is incredible. We had to eat late in the evening but spent time beforehand in the outside bar area, which has a great ambience and fantastic views. The food was beautifully presented and full of flavour. I would definitely return!

title: Oooo la la Restaurant at its Best
comment: Booked this restaurant for my Birthday lunch (11 October) and enjoyed every second of it. Very easy to find, nearest station Liverpool street. Lovely looking restaurant even during the afternoon, provided us a personal butler who took care of us throughout. We were given seats next to the giant window so the view was amazing. Very delicious food specially Tofu dish and coconut rice. Received our meal very quickly. So thank you for that! Would love to go back just to see how beautiful it looks in the evening (and for food of course). Make sure you plan and book in advance to avoid disappointment. Can be expensive if you try a bit of everything from the menu but it is actually worth it for the service you get.  I tried 4 dishes and 2 cocktails and had a bill of £90 including service tax 12%. Sounds  Lovely faces, sophisticated service, amazing food! Great experience.  P.s. They wrote 'Happy Birthday' on my Dessert, a very nice courtesy.

title: Great cocktails!!!!
comment: Went here with my friends , had a great time , good food good music , good service , amazing Veiw , loved it !!

title: Great food, service and view of London
comment: Managed to get a reservation for a Sunday afternoon and was a great experience. The views on the lift ride up to the restaurant were brilliant - it did make your ears pop a bit though. We were seated near the window and saw the sun set over London as we ate. Food was amazing ( highly recommend the moqueca mista) portion sizes are huge so be prepared and go on an empty stomach. Service was good waiters very attentitive, the manager even came to our table to ask if we were happy with everything which is rare. Overall go for the views if nothing else.

title: Sushi Shambles!
comment: I phoned around 10 separate times to try and book via telephone - no joy. 3 separate e-mails - no joy. It seems you can't give them your money! Finally went through top table and the only table they had was 11:30 - interesting time but I took it. I arrived at the 38th floor to be greeted by a maintenance mans bum crack! and a restaurant that was clearly not ready for service. On the plus, the food, staff & views were great. Unfortunately the experience was tainted by a restaurant that even now have not replied to my original booking & complaint of no reply to booking e-mail. Near enough £400 for 3 people is not cheap, you would expect them to be able to use the phone, e-mail and start service on time!

title: Superb dining experience
comment: With a group of friends and ask the waiter for suggestions and to keep bringing food till we said stop. Service was superb, great atmosphere and fantastic food. Pricey but worth every penny

title: Great Views if you can get them.
comment: Got there about 7pm, had no ques and went straight in as just going for drinks. The bar is quite small and it took a while to get served but understandable as a popular place. The drinks were OK, but we felt the overall choice of cocktails was quite small in its offering. The problem we have is the layout of this place, The exit/entrance to the bar for the people working behind it is right next to the window, meaning that no customers can really stand here as its a walkway for the staff. Bizarre really as its the customers paying a premium for the drinks so that they can take in the views, but its the staff that benefit more!! Another problem which doesn't come across on other reviews is the large tree in the middle of the bar. Yes it does look great, however the tree is outside on the terrace, so you are out in the elements, great for summer but not so good for winter and wet weather. The lift is amazingly fast and the trip down in it is fab. You are speeding towards the ground and can see it coming towards you, then at the last moment the lift slows down and touchdown. What a rush. We'd probably go back to try the food, but the views are only great from inside near the bar as the views from the terrace are of north London and not much to see. They really need to sort the layout so that more customers can benefit from the great views over the Thames etc.

title: Just drinks
comment: Went for drinks rather than dinner. The views were amazing but the terrace was a little cramped. We paid £16 for two glasses of very fine Sauvignon blanc. Enjoyable experience!

title: Great but security guy.......!!!!!!
comment: Great evening! Fantastic food! Perfectly welcome reception!!! Great service!!!! But...... Security guy damage my evening to stop bartender serve more drinks for us!!!! Obviously I think he was jealous coz I was with beautiful girl so some how HE wanted to show himself what he can do!!!!!! That I spot this after already waiting for my coctail 10 min by bar. So was quiet unprofessional even for bartender to don't let me know what's going on!!!! So no.3 for bartender!!! And no.1 for security!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Manager of the place upstairs finally offered us drink on the house but it was to late!!!! Good feeling and good mood was already gone!!!!

title: Perfect way to start your Night on the Town
comment: Okay, maybe calling it a "hype" is the wrong word…. Sushisamba has been around for some time now, but it is still notoriously difficult to get a table a couple of days before you want to go. Took us about 8 weeks … and even then could only book a Sat eve time slot around 23.30. On the positive side: we booked a table for 4 persons but our 3 friends whom we met up with for a drink at the bar beforehand were able to join.  Sushi Samba remains an experience. From the moment you get through the entrance and are being 'warped' to the 38th floor in a super-fast lift, you feel excited to be in London. The views are spectacular, especially at night. Before you head to the restaurant, you pass through a cool bar with an in- and outside area. Yes; drinks can be considered pricey, but it's London on a night out; what do you expect???  Let me skip straight to the more relevant info: the food and the dining experience. It is absolutely amazing. The upside of a big group is that you can share many, MANY dishes. So i would say i've tried a good portion of the menu. My verdict? …. From the presentation to the bold flavors … you are in for an experience! My favorites? The black cod, the Poussin chicken and the El Topo samba roll. But i could have easily picked another 5 dishes to re-order. You know how you can tell that the food is great? Three reasons …. number 1: people eagerly look forward to the next dish …. number 2: people become quiet when they are tasting … and finally number 3: yummie noises followed by empty plates. :) In summary: it was a great night out. Staff was helpful to explain the menu but never too pushy. We all tried to guess the bill at the end of the evening and everyone was overestimating by at least 100 pounds, so the 'damage' was not that bad. I hope you try … you will enjoy.

title: People make a difference
comment: Had a little run with the Jobsworths on the ground floor - controlling the elevator got a bit stressful for them so they had a melt down. So was introduced to Adam, the restaurant General Manager - now there is a guy who understands customer service - note to the owners, look after this guy he along with the view is your greatest asset!!

title: Great food and service
comment: Sushi is the one of the best in London - special of the day which was fatty tuna was just amazing! Service was amazing too.

title: Top Food in a Superb Setting
comment: Attention to detail is excellent and the food menu brilliant. Cocktails beforehand are not cheap but well worth it for the views. The restaurant food is an Asian / Brazilian combo and absolutely wonderful without being exorbitant (for the setting).

title: The highest restaurant in London
comment: Stunning view, great cocktail and the food is good. I would definitely recommend for an Amazing night

title: Adam-customer service supremo
comment: After a mix up with Sushi Samba phone staff Adam went out of his way to ensure our two families (visited at 6.00pm and out for 7.)
