He is a customer service supremo-and ensured that both 'dads' will return with clients in the very near future-well done Adam, you capped a brilliant day in London!!

title: Excellent
comment: Amazing "fusion" sushi.. Very good and lovely place. Location is perfect! I love so much that place!  I'll come back as soon as I (And they..) can!

title: Top view!!
comment: I've only been here for cocktails and the view blew me away! It's a very busy place, but once you get your drink and step outside (summertime is perfect) or get a table close to the big window.. it's worthy the elevator ride!

title: Just for the view
comment: In the 38th floor of Heron Tower, with a beautiful and breathtaking view of London and -a bit windy- open terrace ! more of a drink place to enjoy the view rather than food venue, even if there is a nice selection of sushi, maki and other Asian fusion food. Worth the trip.

title: Super night !
comment: After weeks of reserving we finally had dinner with my friend a couple of days ago. The atmosphere is so nice ! with amazing views of London. I would definitely recommend it

title: worth every penny
comment: My wife treated me to lunch after visiting with business contacts. I was not totally convinced of the culinary marriage between Brazilian and Japanese food but wow! It really works and I wish them a long and happy relationship! we ate a selection of very tasty dishes. each of them a treat for the eyes too. The top floor restaurant and roof top bar command excellent views of London. I look forward to going in the evening and seeing the place at night when my wife says the atmosphere is way better service was only ok. I expected better for the price but I really like this place

title: Total disappointment
comment: Went for a night out for my friends birthday. The place was tiny, drinks a bit over priced and the music jarring however the dj seemed to be having a time of her life. Stayed for about an hr before blowing that joint. Would I go back? Sure, if everywhere else was closed.

title: Vastly overrated and ridiculously priced
comment: One of those venues that survives on hype that it is supposedly THE place to be and be seen. It's like a loud cattle market with crazy prices and pretty lousy service. We started at the outside bar only to dsicover they don't serve anything as cheap and lowly as soft drinks. Only wine and champagne. We pushed our way back inside where it was hot, noisy and unpleasant. When we asked about our table the waitress snootily told us we should have checked in. How were me supposed to know that? She said she would do it for us but we never saw her again so went to find the table ourselves. The restaurant waiter had no idea bout the food - how many pieces you got in each dish etc so we were left clueless as to how much to order. The food is OK, nothing special. The prices are totally and utterly ridiculous for such mediocre everything. £100 oer head and we weren't even drinking a lot! Don't bother. Far better places to go.

title: Amazing views, fun night out, spectacular food
comment: I love SushiSamba, especially in the summer when you can sit on the roof terrace drinking nice cocktails before dinner. The food is consistently excellent, I asked for the chef to select the food for the table and we most definitely were not disappointed! A fantastic selection of starters and sushi including rock shrimp tempura with a spicy mayo dressing which was beautiful.  The atmosphere is great, with loud Samba music playing on the back terrace overlooking the Gherkin. It made for an incredible evening. The staff in the restaurant were very attentive and the manager made a special effort to accommodate us when our reservation details changed, and ensured we had an excellent evening. Highly recommend SushiSamba.

title: Great atmosphere
comment: Great place, amazing view. Great food but the size of the portions very small for the price that you pay.

title: Ok
comment: Cool. Slow service at bar and drinks expensive. Too small. But good vibe. Outdoor area nice in summer.

title: Unforgettable experience with breathtaking views
comment: Trip down memory lane to the UK, and was recommended SSamba. Arrived without a reservation for lunch and after a quick check by floor manager, they managed to find a spot for us. Polite staff with quick service attended to us - with smiles and polite words. Suggested few items on the menu to try, wasn't pushy nor indifferent.  Food was up in 10 minutes with a brief description of what they were, and offered to plate up our dishes - Something you'd expect from a fine dining establishment but not an upmarket restaurant.  Food was amazing! Wasn't traditional Japanese but to be fair, they've never claimed to be. The fusion between Jap and Brazillian was a breath of fresh air. The only downer was green tea which came in at 8 pounds per cup. The price of food though was outstanding given its location and target market. (we had MOQUECA MISTA at 32quid, SASA at 11 quid, HAMACHI KAMA 14quid) We walked away feeling very satisfied.  Recommended? Most definitely.

title: Amazing sushi and rooftop patio with fireplace
comment: The sushi was beautiful and flavourful. Clear glass escalator provides spectacular view of the city. Stylish interior, happening place, and novel rooftop patio for wine and champagne complete with outdoor fire tables.

title: Great!
comment: Had a brilliant meal here on Friday evening. Had to book a couple of months in advance and could only get a 5pm sitting or 11pm, so be sure to plan in advance. Service was quick and efficient and good recommendations on what to have/quantities of food we should order! Definitely try a cocktail or two as well! Overall a very pleasant experience, accompanied by a fabulous view....particularly as it got dark!

title: It's a must!
comment: Came here with a few friends for my birthday. As soon as you walk in your hit by a buzzing atmosphere. The place was packed, to be expected I suppose for a Friday night. We had drinks on the terrace before dinner, which is a fantastic space and amazing view over the city.  As for the food, I think it's best to be adventurous and order lots of different things-easy if your with a group. One word of advice- if you order the meat that's cooked on hot stones. Make sure you don't mistake a stone for a piece of meat!!!! It's painful :-() This place isn't cheap but it's worth it, not just the food, but the atmosphere too.

title: Overpriced, overrated
comment: Went for my birthday. The place is crowded, plus you have to wait ages to be served. Music is horrible. I'm in no hurry to go back. And would only recommend it as a toture.

title: Great place
comment: Great place, amazing food, good service, outdoor sitting and views! Vegan menu available. I highly recommand vegetarian tacos! Awesome!

title: Overpriced but nice place, beautiful view
comment: Tiny little portions and you have to wait an hour to have your order, but is very posh and you have to reserve in advance. I was invited so i decided to try this place, average sushi to be honest, but nicely located and well presented.

title: Great for cocktails
comment: This bar is buzzing every time I visit . Great to be standing on the terrace overlooking the City of London at night . Dress to impress as this is a smart venue and have your credit card ready !

title: Views impress.
comment: A colleague had booked lunch here and I had no idea of what to expect. The elevator up to the restaurant and the views are great and put you in a good mood from the start. The restaurant is bright, especially on a sunny day and it is modern and clean. Good waiter who explained things well and the food was very fresh and tasted great. We ordered a number of dishes and it was all good quality. The cocktail bar has the best view of the gherkin. Good experience, not overpriced and would take my wife next time.

title: Fantastic experience
comment: Panoromic views of London, great atmosphere, incredible service, food and cocktails. Absolute winner for a special night out. I can't wait to return.

title: You'll never go back to Tesco sushi packs!
comment: Situated on floor 39 of the infamous Heron Tower, Sushi Samba isn't just a restaurant but it's a rite of passage for any Londoner. Aim to go in the wee hours of the morning for an indulgent dinner post-drinking, as we did and you'll get an extra thrill out of it. The sushi itself doesn't come cheap, and a meal for 2 with a glass of sake each will come to around £80. The quality of the service and presentation justify the price, although you do wonder if 1-2 extra rolls on a plate might not make the portions a little bit more substantial. The food is simply divine, each creation feels like a piece of art and the flavours are just right.  Definitely worth a visit as a checkbox exercise (and if you can't get into Duck & Waffle you're likely to get a table here, making that elevator ride up to the 40th floor more than just a jolly).

title: Horrible service, staff tried to trick us into buying bottles of champagne
comment: The view is lovely. This is where our good experience began and ended. We visited as a group attending a private event so perhaps it's not always this bad... After paying £40 entrance fee we were presented with a drinks menu which only included bottles and were told we could only order by the bottle. Our waitress patronisingly explained to us that "that was kind of the point of the event" and if we wanted to keep our table we'd have to order "bottles". When I queried this with the manager he said this wasn't true and allowed us to order cocktails. This clearly infuriated our waitress who told us to leave our table and go to the bar. To be clear: we had ordered food and only just finished eating. The room was half empty and no one was waiting. We were made to feel like second class citizens despite paying over £100 per head. Food was average, greasy and minimal. Cocktails were sub par. Overall a disappointing experience.

title: Superb food and great view
comment: We visited on a Friday around 1800 hrs, we were a family group (including our mother) and felt very comfortable ie music wasn't overly loud, the clientele were mixed age-wise and the bar wasn't heaving, yet there was still a buzzy atmosphere. After a cocktail, we sat down to eat in the restaurant. The food was great, as always (this is my third time), especially the calamari and the Japanese mushrooms. Other favourites were the pork ribs and the wagyu gyoza. The desserts were to die for. We had the passion fruit cake and 'with love from Rio' and shared these between 5 of us (not quite enough but we were all fairly full). The only downside was that the wine was overly expensive which meant that we didn't drink as much as we would normally (probably not a bad thing!). Service was very good, attentive but not too intrusive. View was amazing. Overall we had a very lovely evening, a nice place for a celebratory meal.

title: High flying drinks, a must do in the city
comment: Enjoyed drinks here. Barman went all out for my wifes mocktail ,listened to her likes and created something on the spot which was so good I nearly had one! My japanese style cherry cocktail delicious also. I thought prices reflected quality and the views. Took in all the views on each side which are amazing. Loved the outside terrace and could have settled in here for the long hall if my other half was drinking.  Lift is nice and fast also, a great place for drinks.

title: Stunning views
comment: Busy place with stunning views. Food is Japanese, Brazilian und Peruvian fusion and amazing. Staff is friendly and helpful. Reservation recommended.

title: Superb view superb food excellent staff
comment: We went to sushi samba for lunch on Sunday and had the most excellent meal in most excellent surroundings,very professional staff nothing was too much trouble! We did have sushi dishes but loved the prawn tempura and the pork belly!, in fact we had it twice!!,can't wait to go again but think I will go for the day next time!!

title: A Gherkin view
comment: I was here with a couple of friends for some early evening champagne and was appeased with the London view. The open terrace a staircase down is pretty nice too.

title: Very bad customer service
comment: 1. Very bad customer service 2. Not polite at the entrance  3. Very far from central London  4. Dress policy too funny 5. Zuma and Nobu all the way

title: Ambience and stunning views of London
comment: El hecho de que hagas una fila de minimo 30 minutos en una fria y humeda calle de Londres no necesariamente te va a garantizar que la experiencia sera satisfactoria. Pues en el caso de este Sushi Samba si lo es. Desde tomar el elevador con vista 360° de London City, la recepcion cuando llegas y el servicio en general del staff es muy bueno! The cocktails are amazing. The ambience at the exterior terrace are unique and of course the food menu is very good also. But be prepare because you will spend money there. Even was expensive (at least for me) the overall experience me and my friends had I would come back for sure.

title: Delicious!!!
comment: Loved it! Amazing food!! Make sure you book in advance though as it is a very popular place! The outdoor bar was very nicely done as well! it was the perfect place to have a drink or to end your romantic evening.

title: Great Views - Fully Priced
comment: We were fortunate to get a last minute table - be certain to call as booking services don't have all the tables.  The door staff were rather pernickety insisting I go through one section even though no one else was there.  Lovely table next to a window.  We ate primarily vegetarian which was good. The seaweed tasted very fishy so beware if you don't like the taste of fish!  Tempura vegetables particularly tasty.  Given only one alcoholic drink (a gin and tonic) the rest being tap water the bill of almost £50 per head fully loaded.  The bill could just about be justified as we had a table by the window. If we had been in the middle I would have been very disappointed.

title: Fantastic experience!
comment: I went to SushiSamba with 2 foodie friends - we all love to cook and experiment with new food....we loved what we ate here - all expertly prepared. It is not a place for hearty portions or many carbs for that matter though....the whole dining experience was enjoyable from the welcoming, warm hosts, wine waiters and exceptional head waiter who came to talk to us after we'd found our lamb excessively fatty (it was removed from the bill immediately) you felt really special dining here and the surroundings are stunning - complete with a glamorous roof-top bar and breathtaking views of London - an absolute must do for everyone!

title: A Night to Remember
comment: I'll be brief, I've never thought about using this app until I visited this restaurant. It was truly that amazing that I feel I need to spread the word. I reserved a table at 6pm on Saturday night, perfect time as it's just before the restaurant gets busy. I was impressed with every aspect of the restaurant, starting from the lift taking you up 38 floors to enable you to enter the restaurant. I must stress that the food is on the expensive side, but it's worth it just for the experience. I usually eat out 3x per week at nice places and sushi samba literally blew me away. The sushi and especially the pork belly were extremely tasty. The staff were very attentive and friendly, making sure every need was met. The views from the bar after we finished our meals were spectacular, a must see at night time to appreciate the London skyline.

title: Amazing food, excellent service
comment: Everything was amazing. Sushi was incredible, could not fault it. Service was really good apart from a wine spill, apart from that we were always really well looked after.  And the view is the icing on the cake...you have to see it for yourself!

title: Excellance at its best
comment: A fun evening, good food, great cocktails, service second to none, a shout out to Adrian who was one the most welcoming hosts we have had the pleasure to meet, an awesome way to start our evening, will definitely be back.

title: FANTASTIC FOOD
comment: Very particular restaurant, fantastic view on London city from the high floor. High level japanese food , room too noisy, it is not suitable for romantic evenings; recommended for evenings in the company of friends. The price is not low, but widely in the media considering that we are in the center of London and the food is really very very good.

title: loved this place
comment: Went for pre dinner drinks here - amazing, the views are superb - loved it!! will be back :) The atmosphere was great. We didn't eat here but the experience was just great.

title: A must
comment: This was my first time at this place went for my birthday. Got in the lift that took you 38 floors up was shown to our table all staff was excellent at their job. And sat down and the view was amazing of London the food was excellent could not fault anything you could go outside and have a drink weather permitting overall this is a must do place if in the area but you must book in advance my son done it 3months in advance highly recommend .

title: Rude waiter
comment: My boyfriend and I took a couple to Sushi Samba that were honeymooning in London. Everything was very good as always until we asked for the bill. When the waiter brought the bill he said: “There’s a McDonalds 24/7 around the corner!” We couldn’t believe he was insulting us over the amount of food we ordered. It was very late in the night and we’ve ordered 2 large dishes to share and some drinks. Although my boyfriend and I have been there few times before - we’ve promised ourselves now, never to go back there. We believe in customer respect and clearly the waiter doesn’t know what that is. Going out for a late dinner doesn’t mean we have to order lots of food. We had all the ingredients for a perfect night if it wasn't for our rude waiter.

title: Lovely views
comment: We popped into Sushi Samba for drinks and bar nibbles. We had a fantastic time, the atmosphere was great and the views stunning. We enjoyed lots of different bar nibbles and they were different and outstanding in quality and taste. We quaffed away on champagne and a very good puilly fume - and was very well looked after by a lovely waitress. Fabulous time had by all!

title: Bad service at the bar
comment: I went there with a friend on a Friday night. The place is beautiful, with that tree outside in the middle of the bar. The service, however, was not what we expected. The barman ignored us for awhile and when we finally got to choose, he pretended not to understand the i only wanted a glass of wine and opened up a bottle. I explained the issue and he served me my glass. I waited for him to pour my friend's whisky before i took my glass, and that's when the super nice barman took my glass and put it in front of me with a very rude attitude saying "i won't fill it up". That was very upsetting.

title: Don't believe the Hype
comment: I was worried when my wife told me we were going to a Japanese, Brazilian, Peruvian fusion restaurant. I just couldn't see how that would work and after being there we both agreed it didn't work and overall the whole experience was a let down. Sure all the waiters are super friendly and attentive (overly so in some cases) the food is well explained, the wine list extensive, the cocktails interesting. However, it's busy, really busy and crowded. It's also wasn't clear to us that you have to walk down the stairs to the restaurant from the lift. The view from some window seats is great, at other tables I don't suppose you'd notice you were anywhere other than a large busy London restaurant. As for the food, well we didn't eat anything that wowed us but we ate plenty that left us disappointed. If you love Japanese food my advice would be to avoid this place. Nobu it most certainly is not.

title: Overrated and overpriced
comment: The service was flawless and the view was great although the evening we went there was strong winds so there was not much opportunity to be outside. My view is perhaps slightly biased since I lived in Latin America for a couple of years. Firstly, a little history. Brazil is home to the world's largest Japanese community outside Japan, followed by Peru. The flood of migration began in the 1800s for various reasons. Thus it is no surprise that over time the mixing of cultures brought this new cuisine termed Nikkei. Thus the concept for me was not new at all. There are certainly other Nikkei restaurants in major cities. I give this place a point for raising the profile of this cuisine to the populous though. The portions were ridiculously small for the price. While the view maybe great but there are lots of places to go around London for great views of the city. I wouldn't return personally.

title: Amazing
comment: Trully amazing. The food very tasty, the place very elegant, the view, breathtaking. A bit expensive but worth the visit

title: Loved it
comment: Went were with a couple of friends, because my colleges recommended it. Thanks to them we really enjoyed it!!! Amazing view, very good food, super atmosphere…. !!!

title: Lunch in the clouds
comment: This is my first ever review on Trip Advisor and decided to take the plunge after an amazing Sunday lunch to celebrate my daughters 21st. From the moment we arrived in the foyer we were given 5 star treatment. The service was spot on and the waiter helped explain the concept and menu choices. The food was out of this world with presentation and flavour to die for. The finishing birthday plate dessert completed the experience and the view was just the icing on the cake. Good job sushi samba team! We will be back

title: Just drinks
comment: My daughter and I called in to Sushi Samba for cocktails to begin her birthday celebrations tonight. I can't comment on the food or service in the restaurant but I wouldn't be in a hurry to revisit the place given some fundamental flaws in treatment of customers. We waited nearly half an hour to be served at the bar, not because it was 5 deep with people but because there was no awareness from the very few bar staff of who had been waiting the longest, so if you shouted across the bar at them, as most of the men did, you got served. When we did get served the service was brusk and given the price of the drinks it was disappointing that the manhattan was only just over half a glass full. To then find out that service was automatically included at over 10% added insult to injury. The bar staff all looked miserable and didn't engage with the customers at all. We asked what a drink was that a barman was making and he grunted at us. We wondered did the bar staff get the tips that customers were charged for. If so, they have no reason to be so grumpy and should make much more of an effort, if not then management is scandalous. If it hadn't been my daughter's birthday I would have spoken to the manager. There is no doubt the view is great, the bar looks lovely but the service was awful, there isn't enough seating and there was a yobbish feel to the bar. We went to The Drift downstairs and had a lovely time afterwards.

title: Amazing Experience!
comment: I was there with my husband and I must say that it was the most amazing asian-fusion experience I ever had! the location is unique and the food marvellous! the staff is really expert and extra-kind, wery welcoming and friendly! highly recommended!

title: What a place!
comment: I guess I didn't expect to have such a great evening, the bar is exceptional on the 38th floor with an orange tree and overlooking the skyline of London, worth to see it! The menu is excellent and I like the kitchen fusion of Japan, Brazil and Peru. Very tasty awesome flavours

title: The Views
comment: When you see Heron Tower you dont think it could possibly play host to any spectacular views. Up into the lift to 39th floor for an event and you are taken back by the glass lift like Charlie and the Chocolate Factory. When you enter the Sushi Samba you are not blown away by the décor nor the crowds but I guess for the views hoards of people can be expected....even on a Wednesday! I was here for an event where we were swifty told to go to the back room which was small and cramped with far too many people and not enough space to move. It overlooked the restaurant which looked spectacular. Its bamboo ceilings are breathtaking. We tried a few canapés which were very well presented and excellent quality. The only problem was there were no napkins to wipe away the sushi from your hands. A small bar was set up but no one was there to serve us. We wondered the entire restaurant and bar areas which was very busy. Stopped to take in the WOW views even from the ladies. Recommend to go enjoy some drinks and sushi.

title: Excellent
comment: Went with our colleagues from New York and all had a great evening. Not normally a sushi fan but the food was excellent. I would certainly go back again both with work and with friends.

title: one of a kind asian experience
comment: one of the nicest view in London, friendly& helpful staff, very hip restaurant with exquisite asian food.Everything one the menu was excellent.Will be back again very highly recommend.

title: What an AMAZING place!!!
comment: Entering the lift and being taken up 38 floors with THE amazing view of London. The place is unbeleivable. The bar and inside decor is absolutely amazing. I was really inpressed. The food was great. I would recommend this place to anyone, and eventhough it is a bit expensive, the views and atmosphere make up for it. It was the first time I booked and wasnt given one of the best tables I believe. If I booked again, I would certainly asked to be placed at a table next to the window so that I could have a better view from up there. I read some comments that the staff and service were not very good, but we honestly had no issues. It was a saturday night and the place was packed, but still the service was good. Of course I am not a person who expects to chita chat with the waiters etc etc. They were courteous and served our food promptly and politely, that is enough for me. Until next time Sushi Samba...!!!

title: Very nice restaurant
comment: I really liked the idea of a multiethnic restaurant, both Chinese and Brazilian food were absolutely tasty. Unfortunately I couldn't try the Peruvian one but I hope to return there soon and try it! The price is a bit high but I think it's not a real problem if you think about the great place. I found the waiters really kind and helpful. If you wanna come and eat here you'd better book about 2 weeks before or earlier because it is really difficult to book at a "normal" hour (between 7 pm and 9pm)

title: Not as good as expected
comment: Had a high expectation on it, however it turns out an average standard for food quality and a very expensive bill! Only worth one visit but no more!

title: Good foor and Very POOR Service!
comment: Unfortunately we had a very dissapointing experience this time at Sushi Samba.  When me and my partner arrived we were sited by the sushi bar where we had a lovely cellection of sushi and drinks. Since we were expectiing one person to join us we have asked the waiter if we can take one extra chair on what we received an answear that she doesn’t know and we should ask someone else. And she walked away. Really?! Well, being a nice customers we did what we have been told to do and asked someone else. Here was our luck and the gentelmen in a black suit was extreamly helpful! For what we say a big thank you! As we couldn’t have an extra chair he relocated us to the lounge area were we have ordered some more food and drinks. Food arrived very quickly however drinks took ages. We have ordered two cocktails and a shot of tequilla. It took 20 min for the cocktails to arrive…no sign of tequilla. I guess it was coming all the way from Mexico. Cocktails were not good at all and tasted more like a juice rather than an alcoholic drink. So basically paying £14per drink you are getting a juice with the splash of alcohol in it –great! My partner did send the drink back and it took another 15min for it to arrive but this time with the tequila. Let me point out that we were only 3 people at the table and there was only 5 tables occupied, so no excuse that they were slammed and the bar couldn’t cope. Waiter didn’t seem to care either. Unfortunately it did ruin the whole experience and we decided to leave and go elsewhere. Bill arrived very quickly. As I understood it was presented by the manager or a supervisor who very quitely said that he took tequilla and one cocktail off the bill, as we waited too long, and he left. No much of explanation or “we are sorry”…nothing! What to my oppinion is unexceptable for such a place as Sushi Samba. And guess what?! – the service charge was there.  Dear management, if the service is bad you need to remove it from the bill as your customers are paying for a good service not for a bad experience! At this point I would rather pay for the drinks than the service charge, as service was bad and you were well aware of it!!!

title: Super cool, refreshingly different flavours and stunning location!
comment: Great views over London from the moment you step into the lift... The food is a Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian fusion. Every dish is presented beautifully and sensationally flavoured. The only negative I would say is the wine prices...

title: Stunning location - disappointing service and average food
comment: There is a pretty cool vibe in the restaurant and the glass elevators that whisk you up give you an amazing view of London. However, the server for our table wasn't friendly nor helpful in suggesting dishes for the table. The food was just about okay for the price paid and you're definitely paying for the view. Shame that we got allocated a table in the middle of the restaurant and not one by the window! If you wanted to eat sushi, a better alternative would be value for money 'Eat Tokyo'. Only one dish was really memorable throughout the whole meal and that would be the 'El Topo' sushi roll. Have since been to Nobu in Mayfair and, despite losing their michelin star, their food was much better quality than Sushisamba at only a small increase in price.

title: Fantastic!
comment: We went for a family lunch on Saturday to celebrate a birthday and had an unforgettable meal! The staff were extremely polite and professional from the moment we took the lift up to the 38th floor (which is in itself an experience!) Our waitress Ruta was simply delightful. She was cheerful, very well informed on all aspects of the menu and even helped my youngest (fussy eater!) to choose something, saying that they could make her anything in the kitchen! She definitely made our experience all the more enjoyable. The rest of the staff were also very attentive and pleasant. The food was superb and beautifully presented-we had quite a selection of everything on the menu and shared. Everything was delicious and very unusual (the fusion of flavours really worked) The prices were roughly what one can expect in this type of restaurant, in this kind of location-it is high end. I cannot wait to go again and next time it will be for dinner because I can imagine it is beautiful at night.

title: Average at best
comment: Food was nice, portions are too small though for the price. View is nice enough, not that I think London has a brilliant skyline anyway (it's no NYC!) and if it's foggy you are screwed!  I'd rather go to Nobu, Sticks n Sushi or the new Ramusake in South Ken over this place.  I honestly think this is a place to go if you have your company card and want to spend big on it. I can see how people get lured in for special occasions though... I don't think I'll be going back. As a footnote: Seems their new NYE deal is a load of rubbish also. Last seating for dinner is around 7pm... At a restaurant. Appears they want to turn the place into a club for the night as they are doing bottle service. LOL.

title: amazing
comment: Excellent food, incredible flavours and plenty to choose from even if you're not a sushi lover. The sushi is the highlight though particularly El Topo. Staff are attentive and informative about the menu. This was my second visit and was as good as, if not better than my first time. Good view of London to top it all off. Highly reccommend.

title: Best restaurant in town
comment: Was initially disappointed by decor as heard so much about the place was expecting a huge wow factor. But the food, service, vibe and view more than make up for it1

title: Good but overrated
comment: I went with friends to Sushi Samba and we had the chef selection. The food was good but I was expecting better given all the buzz around this restaurant. Despite all the hype about the mix of cultures (etc...) it was fairly common and very much in line with all the other restaurants of this type like Zuma. The prices are also very high given the overall experience. Not sure I will return.

title: Great service and food
comment: I was very happy with my visit to Sushi samba. Initially we could not get a table for Saturday but then booked through Open table (former top table). Greeted by a friendly hostess we were shown to our table by the window. The view was magnificent but on a negative side there was quite a strong draft to the point that the menu was flapping, so had to keep our blazers on.  Our main waiter was great, he suggested ordering 5-6 small dishes would be enough for 2. The food is a fusion of Japanese, Peruvian and Brazilian. I liked all the dishes that we had. There was a lot of googling beforehand at home as the menu has a lot of complicated names and dishes that I did not know the meaning of. But actually there was no need as each dish was explained to us when served. Service was on a very high level. There was a lot of staff, each time I got up/sat down, the chair was pulled for me. I asked where the toilet was and instead of usual pointing, I was actually taken to the door. Prices were not too bad either. For 6 small dishes, 2 deserts and a cocktail we paid £135. We also spent some time in the bar upstairs. The music was nice and I liked it a lot but my older husband thought that the crowd was rather young. I would recommend this place.

title: Wow
comment: From the moment you enter the lift that whisks you up 38 floors while you look over London you say to yourself wow! The greeting on arrival is second to none ,the staff all night were top draw.the bar area is relaxed and the open terrace is again superb,must be wow in the summer.the restaurant is more formal but not in a stuffy way and the views across London are just wow.the whole ambiance is outstanding ,a real experience.the food is a new experience with many dishes presented in a wows way.the staff explain the menus well as it would be easy to get it wrong.the four of us have quite a variety of dishes all outstanding.your wallet may say ouch not wow as this top notch venue is not cheap.

title: Hilarious excellent
comment: Some would say there worst nightmare would be when a waitress spills a whole cocktail over you when you are eating your lunch, but not for me. Due to the unfortunate incident, we got the 5 star treatment. We had free cocktails, our meals were sent back out to us despite all ready eating half of them. They gave us a sharing platter for dessert which consisted of 4 large servings of their most popular desserts and only charged for 5 dishes. They were so apologetic and frankly brilliant. Things like this happen, it's an accident. But honestly if that what happens when a cocktail gets spilt on you, every time I go there I want that to happen to me! Thanks for the brilliant time, sushi samba! Black cod, waygu gyozas and the desserts were too die for!

title: Amazing Black Cod!
comment: Black cod tastes really good. We ordered two times. Also the atmosphere and the decor is fascinating. You must see there!

title: Great food, view and service
comment: I've been to Sushi Samba in both NYC, Miami and Las Vegas and had a great experience. But I absolutely loved London! The service was second to none. The ambience was fantastic. The views were awesome. But the food was magnificent. I can't recommend this place enough. The hardest thing is getting a table LOL! Top tip book well in advance, it really is worth the wait!

title: Cool venue, great food and amazing views.
comment: Asked our concierge at Browns Hotel for the coolest restaurant with views in London. I wanted to impress my 18 year old son and remind him that his mum isnt past it just yet. I thought he might say the Shard but he recommended Sushisamba. I was a bit dubious, I couldn't imagine what Brazilian, Peruvian and Japanese fusion might mean. I had one of the best meals I have ever had. The place was buzzing, the waiters were fantastic and I am actually considering a trip to London just so that I can have the tempura prawns again. The tempura batter was so thin it was invisible but somehow so crispy too. The sushi was amazing, so fresh and beautifully presented. The banana desserts were sublime. We were full after two starters, two sushi, some spare ribs (sooo good) a couple of glasses of saki and a couple of drinks and the bill was just under £150. I think that is GREAT value. Thanks so much to all the staff there my son was delighted with my choice. Please open one in Edinburgh.

title: Great views... how much fusion is too much fusion?
comment: I rate Sushi Samba highly because of the quality of it's cocktails (albeit it, very pricey!) and the incredible views of London. If you don't have a reservation and want to just have drinks, prepare to wait for at least 30 - 40 mins on any evening. Don't expect to get a table for dinner without a reservation. Food is.... decent! Portions were bigger than you'd expect from a poncey place like this. Lots of deep fried food. The king prawns are delicious. And the black miso cod is superb. But honestly, it brags about being a Asian/Brazilian fusion and it seems like the food is Asian, the drinks are Brazilian. Is that fusion!? Drinks-wise I'd recommend any of the caipirinhas.... Customer service is always great from the waiting staff. They do make you feel special! The concierge and receptionists... unless you have a booking, don't expect too much. But the views... they are priceless. Well worth it. I suggest getting a drink there and then heading to Duck & Waffle! D

title: Birthday Treat
comment: Would really recommend this restaurant for a special occasion. Went for my 25th birthday, was given the best seat in the house but did arrive nice and early. Staff were so attentive and well mannered, they really knew the menu and could explain items we weren't too sure about. We even went with the choices the waitress recommended and all of us found something we loved. The salmon was one of the best foods I have ever eaten! Very pricey but again somewhere to go as a treat! Would go back again for definite.

title: Simply the best
comment: Fabulous food, great service, cool vibe and great wine list! My favourite London restaurant and can't wait to go back!

title: Outstanding ....be young again .......
comment: Ate here recently , newish venue ......everything I normally detest , heavily promoted ....door men , long queues .....was guest so had no choice ......have to say worth experience but prob a little old to attend .....young attractive set , great views , great bars .....everyone having fantastic time , food really quite good ....will try again this week but really is a venue to try for dinner ....and impress a lady .....

title: One off experiences
comment: We had a "ladies night out" to the resteraunt. Location was fab, and unfortunately they did not have the terrace open where is the side with the best view (opposite to the bar side). We ordered several dishes for share, the small plates and starters plates are quite small, but the large plates were ok. I have a small appetite, so for those who has an average or big appetite, might need spend quite bit to fill up ur stomach. Seafood rice main and belly pork starter were amazing. But I think the services were not so impressive, I guessed they might be short of staff. One thing I cannot accept is that I ordered green tea after sweets, which cost more than a glass of wine and the green tea was in a glass cup with funny green colour, not even in a pot, £8, I cannot believe it. Somewhere I do not think I will go back again, not value for money, one off experiences!

title: Wow
comment: Amazing views of the city!! It was spectacular at night. We waited in a queue for around 15 mins at the bottom of the tower - this was to be expected as it was 10.30pm on Friday night.  Dress smartly! They don't let people with trainers or casual clothes in.  Didn't eat here. But we had tasty but expensive cocktails. Stunning decor and patio with bar outside. Would go back for the views alone

title: Expense account only I feel
comment: It's actually a 3.5. Service excellent & we enjoyed our lunch but considering the cost - it just didn't add up to the sum of its parts. The food looks beautiful - but the reaction is 'so what' - not oh my god this is the best thing I've ever had & some of it didn't add up to much at all. Best things - the mixed california rolls & the bacalhao. A mixed meat grill was nice but considering the quality of steak out on the streets of London these days, didn't overwhelm. It was great fun & obviously the view is terrific. The restaurant is showing some signs of wear - the banquettes were looking a bit shabby in places. I'd say go but don't panic if you can't get a reservation & for us, having 'done' it, if I didn't go back, wouldn't make much difference. A cocktail definitely worth doing.

title: Pretty pricey but worth the view
comment: I have been to Sushisamba a few times now and it never disappoints. The glass lift that fires you up to the 40+ floor is an amazing experience in itself. The bar area is set out well but does lack seating space for just drinkers but gives you great Birdseye view of the Gherkin. The outdoor bar & terrace is truly fabulous with a huge orange tree in the middle and wonderful views across the whole of London. Drinks are a little pricey we had a bottle of wine which was £50 & the cocktails are around £10, which isn’t so bad. As a visitor to London I would always pop in for a visit and recommend anyone else does too.

title: Very disappointed
comment: The booking process was chaotic and disorganised, I felt that they were doing me a favour by even allowing a party of twelve. On arrival we were told the outside bar was closed, however the inside bar had one barman who virtually ignored us, waiters were rude, even refused to take a photo of our party, very very overpriced, the only good thing was the ride in the lift. This is the first review I have ever written. This place is too big for its own boots!

title: Recommend to All
comment: This restaurant was recommended to us , also the fact at the top of Heron Tower was different, Staff1st class , cocktails expensive , but different. Taken to our table , the views and seating Brilliant , staff friendly and the Food 1 St Class , will go again .

title: Excellent food and view
comment: I had lunch with my wife at Sushisamba and we loved it. This is not just a restaurant, it is an experience. The food is beautiful and tasty. You choose several small dishes. There's a mix of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian food. The view is excellent and it is worth going to the 38th floor! It is not cheap though. We paid around £130 for 6 dishes, two deserts, 2 bottles of water and two glasses of wine. The atmosphere is very good, as it is the service. It is worth a visit for a special occasion and the view!!

title: Fab night out in City of London
comment: A real experience in the city, if you are looking for a buzzing atmosphere and spectacular views...plus great ( and a bit different) food, this is the place for you. It's a bit professional and hip at the same time, so good for a bit of people watching too!  The terrace bar was busy but not too busy and London was looking pretty spectacular at dusk. Re food...I recommend the cod dish (one of the nicest dishes I've tasted) and the samba rolls as mains. 4 of us for dinner treated it more like a tapas menu so we just shared all sorts of things....that's probably a good way to try the menu. Don't expect to leave dinner, stuffed to the gills...but the food is delicious. It's not cheap but for a special evening it's pretty memorable and worth it.

title: Friends meal
comment: A fabulous entrance from the lifts outstanding views across London. Food was very expensive but exquisite. Furthermore a little platter of sushi is all you need as it is rich in flavour. We ordered two rounds and regretted it as it was too much to eat. Fabulous outside terrace breath taking views furthermore blankets are offered if it's a chilly night. Exiting the restaurant is by lifts somewhat thrilling as the speed of the elevator brings the sense of it's going to crash down "a movie clip" very busy atmosphere but a fabulous place to experience

title: Stunning Views of London
comment: Chose to go to Sushi Samba for our 1 year anniversary, we pass Heron Tower daily on our way to work and we had always discussed going there.  Made a last minute reservation and were lucky to get a table, when we got there the place was buzzing with interesting people, a nice mix of business people relaxing after work, groups and dining couples. The lift is an experience it self as it takes less than 30 seconds to get to the 38th floor and once you walk into the restaurant you feel a vibrant and lively atmosphere that whisks you away.  Had drinks outside before our reservation and the bar staff are very friendly and efficient, as we went to our table we were kindly escorted by a hostess who explained a little bit about Sushi Samba and who they are(helpful as this was our first time there). We were lucky to get a window seat as the views are stunning all around! The waiter was very cold towards us and after we mentioned it was our first time here he gave us 'recommendations', I understand he should try to up sell the items on the menu but recommending the most expensive items on the menu made us weary of his choices. We had a mix of Sushi and Samba but The 'Samba London' (rolls) turned out to be a great choice as we had a selection of different rolls with fresh fish and well steamed rice.  The waiters (as opposed to the bar staff outside) were unfriendly, offered a rushed service and did not seem to care that we were there (or the tables around us for that matter).  As we had been rushed by both waiters serving us you would have expected them to bring the bill out quickly but we had to wait over 15 minutes to get the bill and another 5 minutes for them to bring the change.  All in all we had a nice evening as the views are stunning, the atmosphere was great and the food was very tasty. It is a shame that the bar staff outside are so helpful and friendly and the waiters were so poor. We expected it to be expensive so we were not shocked and it was a special occasion so it was definitely worth it

title: Fun,vibrant and playfully chic....
comment: Just dined tonight at SUSHISAMBA. The venue was amazing with its fun, vibrant and playfully chic decor & the view was spectacular showing off the City of London. The service was friendly, prompt and knowledgable with no up sales. But the food was what draws you to really come to SUSHISAMBA. We had at our table the following: Shiso Fine cocktails w/ Green Bean tempura for a starter...Yum! Followed with Rock Shrimp Tempura, Wagyu Gyoza and the Tuna Sashimi Seviche....amazing! Then came out the Samba Rolls staring the London Roll, El Topo and São Paulo....all beautifully plated and out of this world. But of course you need dessert so out came the 'Chocolate Banana Cake' with Maple butter, plantain chips & vanilla rum ice cream and also 'With Love From Rio' with dark chocolate ganache, coffee mousse, tonka bean ice cream & caramelized macadamia. You will not be disappointed but amazed - a reservation is a must!

title: Appalled
comment: Towards the end of a night out (pub, curry), myself and a group of friends had hoped to visit SUSHISAMBA, as we had heard good things about it. However, upon arrival, we were (not very politely) told by the staff on the door that they couldn't let us in, "because there are too many guys and it will make our ratio unbalanced". I have three problems with this. Firstly, it's a restaurant, so surely "ratios" shouldn't matter. Secondly, they were assuming that all of us were heterosexual, and wanting to be with girls. And thirdly, they were assuming that the only reason we were going was to pull, and there has to be an equal number so that everyone can pull and be happy. The only thing I can see coming from this is more and more sexism and objectification, and if I'd known this was how they treat people who are willing to give them their money, I wouldn't have gone near the place.

title: India's 21st
comment: India and I visited at the end of August to make sure it was a suitable venue and the staff helpfully showed us around. On the evening we were made most welcome and our guests got the full VIP treatment. It was a truly memorable experience. The birthday cake created by the pastry chef was amazing. I can highly recommend Sushi Samba.

title: Expensive, but excellent views and food
comment: Most definitely worth a visit once in your life. I've been here for a work lunch and with friends, it was great for both. Firstly, the glass lift is pretty cool (and feels quite fast). Amazing views of London at night and during the day. Food isn't just sushi, they have many hot dishes that are excellent. I'm not a massive fan of sushi but I did like the sushi here. I'd recommend the black cod and ribs in particular. I'd advise getting a bunch of dishes and sharing. There's a nice bar area as well, with indoor and outdoor seating. It is all pretty expensive but well worth it for a special occasion.

title: Rushed out of table
comment: Me and my friends had been really looking forward to our meal at Sushi Samba. One of us is leaving the country soon and as a result we have pulled together a bucket list of 'must dos' in London before she goes. Sushi Samba was on that list, and we'd even taken a day off the next day so that time was not an issue. We arrived and to be honest felt instantly judged. We are not your typical city types, which seems to be what this restaurant caters for. We are however massive foodies and have eaten in fabulous restaurants worldwide. We were shown to our table and the staff were highly attentive, almost to the point of crowding us, but really cannot fault them. The food arrived almost one plate at a time which was a little infuriating but still not too annoying. I would say that the tiradito and black cod were delicious but the ceviche had no fish to speak of, the bacalao balls very mediocre and the sushi pretty sub standard to be honest. Neverless we enjoyed it and gobbled it up, really determined to enjoy our surroundings. I will also say that the cocktail at the start was amazing! We finished our mains and were then handed the pudding menu. We decided we were too full to have a pudding but that we would like a coffee and a glass of wine to finish off our night. Normally at any restaurant this is not an issue. Here however, we were told that the manager had asked if we could have the coffee and wine outside at the bar. When asked if they actually meant 'outside' as in on the terrace, the reply was yes. This was only two days ago and by 8 ish it was pretty chilly outside. We declined the offer and asked for the bill. When it arrived we asked for the service charge to come off being explicit that it was not the wait staffs fault, but their manager, who had essentially asked us to leave before our meal was finished. We called him over to the table to chat about it and were told that there were people waiting for our table. We could see actively free tables and also were aware that there were tables of 2, 4 and 6 sitting around us that had been there long before we even arrived. We were also asked 'if we've ever been to this type of restaurant before'? Which is just pretty insult in TBH. Overall we were made to feel pretty unwelcome and would certainly not be going back. If you like flashing the cash but don't really have much taste, this is the place for you. We went to the shard afterwards for a glass of fizz to cheer us up and the service there was on another level. Loved it!

title: Vibrant and lively athmosphere
comment: We have visited this great place after our dinner at Duck&Whaffle. It is very lively and great athmosphere, you feel like in a garden but 38th floor up. I would definitely recommend and pay another visit

title: Vibrant atmosphere
comment: Took my girlfriend here for her birthday and she loved it! SushiSamba is located on the 38th floor of Heron Tower in Liverpool Street. When we got out of the lift no one greeted us or anything, staff seemed to be lost and don't know what they're doing. Straight to bar outside where a lit up tree is the focal point. On a Monday night this place is packed and hard to get a seat luckily we were quick enough to grab a table by the window. Great view and great cocktails but very expensive but it's what you'll expect on a place like this.

title: Was nice place great view
comment: Nice place, good food and fun staff! Outside terrace was fabulous! And tree and open fire in the bar in the evening was mind blowing!

title: Up Up and Away
comment: What a great place to a) enjoy a delightful meal and b) see London from above. Friendly, professional service, which I can not say enough about. Diverse menu. Excellent food. It was a memorable experience.

title: London view from 38th floor
comment: This is a must be seen place if you are living in London even just for its view. They are serving one of the best sushi meals I have ever had.

title: Dinner with a view
comment: Great sushi place with an impresssive view of downtown London, located in the 40th floor of the Heron Tower. The restaurant is very trendy and gets really crowded (advance reservations required), they also offer a terrace which was closed during our visit due to high winds. They also play music all time so you can enjoy after dinner drinks. The menu is similar to other sushi samba restaurants in the US.

title: spent a large amount for a very frosty unprofessional service, however the food was excellent
comment: Having read the positive & negative reviews both online and from colleagues and acquaintances , I decided to go ahead and advise my partner to book the restaurant as we have been to Sushi Samba in NYC and enjoyed the experience and service along with the great menu so I was hoping for a similar experience here in London and have a good memory last Month. Sadly this did not materialise except for a few exceptions. Having read the website and statements in terms of experience , etiquette and service I disagree on this too. On arrival we were greeted well and shown to the lift, but shared a lift with a young group who were dressed very casual and was surprised when they entered the sushi Samba with us.  Once we arrived we were shown through to reception, where if I am honest I was frostily greeted by the host and told we have time before our meal and to go onto the terrace where we can have drinks. 15 minutes later, being ignored by the waiter to serve a group of women who arrived 5 minutes after us, we waited patiently, with one bar man and a lot of other guests forming a queue we decided to sit on our table and order drinks from there. Also, there was a foul smell close to the bar which may have been due to the bags of rubbish or cut up fruit I noticed below. I did make the reception host aware of the long wait for drinks but again we were greeted with a frosty answer. On the positive side, we were seated with a nice view, our table waiter saved the evening he was very attentive and very informative RE our dishes, but sadly again the drinks service let us down, of the 5 drinks we ordered 2 possibly or even 3 were watered down or had no spirit, our waiter agreed and immediately changed our drinks.

title: Great views and great food
comment: Went with a large group , food was fantastic . Views were spectacular and were breathtaking, and worth the visit by themselves . Mixed cooked and sushi Food , it was fantastic and mixture of different dishes black cod , ribs, prawn rolls, and heavenly coconut based seafood soup dish....the list goes on. Staff were very attentive in spite of some of our party being late and we quickly chaperoned to another lounge for our desserts ...which were all good . It was my daughter bday and they took the time to make her feel special ! parking was easy on a sat as there were parking behind the buildings and walking distance from Liverpool street . Bar and DJ and lively place for drinks

title: Great Restaurant
comment: I had lunch with colleagues last week at Sushi Samba and did not know what to expect from the reviews. I will not go on about food as plenty to choose from and we all found our lunches excellent, only fault the menu could have been a bit more self-explanatory but minor fault. Staff where excellent from the lady at the first door and all the other staff, The charge was a lot cheaper than we thought it may of come too in fact a lot cheaper, although I am aware each individual will have a price they are prepared to pay. The view was excellent with a great outside bar, I will certainly be going again. Thanks

title: Nice view, decent cocktails but variable service.
comment: Have been here 5-10 times over the past year for drinks and eating in the front sushi bar - have never eaten in the main restaurant.  Food: Like I say have only eaten from the front section. The Sushi-fusion style is really not my thing, but friends like it so I keep going! They do what they do quite well it just doesn't suit my taste – would rather go upstairs or across the Skyline to Searcy’s @ The Gherkin. Anyway;  Drinks: Nice range of cocktails - if variable time of service, beer is £7 a pop if I remember rightly, champagne is reasonably priced and best enjoyed on the Veuve terrace outside.  Service: Table service girls inside are friendly and attentive, bar staff - not so much, beyond arrogant at times with quite a dollop of attitude. Not asking for curtsies and bow’s but perhaps a smile, please, Thank you and a bit of general courtesy. Obviously a broad generalisation, but this is my general experience and the place’s main downside. Staff who manage booking for food/ upstairs communication has always been flawless and helpful. Let's be honest, you go here for the view, when friends are in town/ for a bit of a blow out on Friday. This place will always thrive off tourist trade and the views, but with a little attention to service it could be so much better.

title: GREAT, OTHER THAN THE DOORMAN!
comment: I was meeting some friends here, they got there first so were waiting inside for me. I was not familiar with the place but followed their directions and joined the queue to go in. When I made it to the front of the queue, I found myself being looked up and down in a really degrading way by the Doorman - like I was in no way worthy of visiting such a place - I am not that bad looking!! He then said that I had open toed shoes which was against their dress code - I have never heard such a thing - it was a hot day!! Trainers, jeans etc understandable - but sandals (not scruffy flip flops) apparently are not allowed, he said however he would make an exception as i was meeting friends already inside! My self esteem hit the ground as I stepped into the lift to floor 38! Once there however the place was amazing, stunning views across London! A little cramped and not the most comfy seats, but still great. The waitress was really helpful when we didn't know what sushi to order, she made some recommendations, and wow - absolutely scrummy! I was initially put off by the Doorman, but everyone else was friendly - check their dress code to save being humiliated as I was!

title: Overrated!
comment: Overrated and Over priced! What I ordered was awful (Moqueca Mista) as soon as I expressed this to the waiter he avoided me for the rest of the night. Probably because the waiter told me it could take 30 mins to cook and it came out in 10. Thats when the service stopped being the highlight of the night. Dry ambience but good music. Amazing view of London but you can visit much better restaurants in the city with similar views. Waste of my pennies and Addison Lee and not forgetting I went home hungry...

title: Price just for the view, horrible food.
comment: Mayonnaise inside the sushi. At an unbearably high price. Amazing view, must say. But if you want good japanese food, do not go.

title: ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING SERVICE
comment: Avoid this place at all cost. The waitress (blonde European) was extremely rude throughout, she clearly does not belong in the service industry. The management were equally unwelcoming and rude. The entire establishment does not value their customers, I would advise everyone to save your money and time, as there are many other places in London which you can enjoy.

title: AVOID!!!!!!!
comment: Worst customer service you will ever receive. Overpriced drinks and food. DO NOT GO TO THIS POORLY RAN ESTABLISHMENT!!!!!

title: Disgusting sushis
comment: Côme on , how comes I Found hair in my Sushi. Was so disgusting, i paid so much for this ? The staff, even the Sushi guys are so disgusting, never smile, just Look like if you talk to them , they snob you . I Will not return or recommand to Anybody. And dont Forget dont go there ugly people, except if you are ultra rich, they not gonna let you in !!

title: Out of this world sushis !!!
comment: I think I'm now been officially spoiled... Won't be able to eat sushis anywhere now... More seriously, this place is just fabulous ... It starts when you take the lift to go to the 39th floor, it's all about the speed and the view ... Arriving in a pretty busy place on a Friday evening, we had a booking for 9.30pm. Our friends were running late so we got a cocktail waiting for them. The whole place is busy, groovy and just simply beautiful. This might be a bit too loud for some as Latin American inspired lounge music is pumped throughout the place.  When we were seated, the restaurant is as beautiful as the rest. Orders were quickly made but we had to wait a bit for the first dishes to be delivered. However, it was totally worth the wait... Those sushis were absolutely incredible ! The ones with a little bit of black truffle on top were the best ... I would consider walking up the 39 floors to eat them ! Service was good and efficient and again the food simply superb ! Prices are high but the quality offered, this is certainly not exaggerated .  We were invited by our friends and we can't thank them enough for this experience !

title: Sushi overlooking London's skyline
comment: Absolutely fabulous 360 degree views of central London coupled with some of the best sushi and dessert one can only imagine!! And with good service to boot - it is an all around incredible experience!! If you fancy sushi and you fancy divine combinations of hot spicy and sweet - Samba Sushi will be able to find something to fit your palatte. Of course, youwill ahve to make reservations, but you can also head up to the open air terrace bar on the 40th floor of he Heron Tower...now that experience in itself is worth the wait. The service again was perfect, everyone tending to your every need as if there weren't another 200 persons needing the same attention - but you felt like no. 1 always. Take friends and have a blast...great place to be!!

title: 1 year anniversary
comment: Good food, excellent service and lovely views.... but very poor housekeeping over the entire restaurant (i.e. broken tiles on the floor, untidy cables coming out of the floor, dirty seats, unclean windows, dusty window frames, etc...)

title: Sushi Samba, amazing!
comment: Sunday afternoon photography session led us from Coq d'Argent to Liverpool Street. We stumbled across this wonderful oasis on the 39th floor. Staff are charming, clientele cool, the food is amazing, delicious and different, sushi with a twist. I tried El Topo and it was delicious; we were lucky it was between the lunch and supper crowd so we managed to get a chair watching the chefs at work. These guys are artisans and prepare the most delicious and freshest food, handle with a skilful touch. As for the views, they are amazing. I was told the Heron Tower has the highest restaurant in Europe. We just enjoyed the atmosphere, chilled drinks and delicious food. While writing about Finn McHugh, in Carrom, Michael Fitzalan, published by LULU press, I tried to find a restaurant worthy of Finn McCool, the closest I got was Simpson's but now I think he would approve of Sushi Samba. I am working on The Gunpowder Plot and Markham (Lulu publishers, Michael Fitzalan) my eighth book and going somewhere like this helps to reconnect with the city today rather than Stuart England. I would love to come back with a reservation for lunch one Sunday or one Friday or Saturday evening when the city is lit up, it must be amazing.

title: lovely views
comment: good food, best service and some lovely views above City of London....but poor maintenance of the restaurant.

title: Great views....
comment: There is no question the venue is impressive - on the 38th floor, right in the heart of the City - great, uninterrupted views of more or less the whole of London and it's surroundings. The interior is decked out in stylish schemes with barely identifiable decor and art work adorning the walls and suspended from the ceilings.  There were also a few dishes that were incredible - the belly of pork, the Wagu dumplings and the black cod - not to mention a very impressive choice of desserts.  Having said the above - and rating highly for the view, the venue and a few of the dishes (on just these it would be a straight 5 stars) I have lowered my overall mark because of the rest of my experience.  Firstly although we had reserved a table we ended up queuing, despite two burly men with ear pieces standing around pointlessly. Eventually when we cottoned on that some people were walking straight in we realised that the queue was not for those with reservations. Having traveled up the super fast lifts we then emerged into a reception area that was without any staff. We aimlessly stood for a moment until I hailed a passing person who I assumed (luckily correctly) worked for the restaurant - she pointed across the bar to another desk which was for the restaurant.  We enjoyed a drink at the bar before our allotted time slot for the restaurant. This is where you see how beautiful London can be - with the meandering Thames and the sheer size of the city stretching out in every direction.  We took our seats in the restaurant but had been assigned a table with slightly obscured views and with a door right behind me. My wife had specifically asked for a window seat with a view and although there were two empty tables perfectly fitting that description we were told they had been reserved by others.  My wife's first proper request to be moved was rejected - although we only found this out when, having waited 10 minutes for the person to find out whether we could move, we managed to get their attention and they then told us we couldn't move. They were apologetic - but seemingly unmotivated to encourage us to thoroughly enjoy our experience with them.  Eventually after 20 more minutes of being buffeted by the wind every time anyone used the door (and having had my eye on the resolutely empty tables with great views) I asked again whether we could move - however this time I asked someone wearing a jacket. This time we were re-seated. After this I had no more issues with the service and everything was what one would expect from a top-end restaurant.  I don't think I would want to come back here - I think it's probably just too cool for me - a place where the slightly disdainful looks from the staff are supposed to give the place an edge....

title: Great Location
comment: This restaurant is in a great location at the top of the Heron Tower overlooking the City, great views. It's like going to the Shard without having to pay an entrance fee. The menu is a mix of Brazilian, Sushi and Argentinian. The dishes are really imaginative and unusual and the quality is fantastic. Sadly the portions are very much on the small side, especially for the high prices charged, this restaurant is not cheap, especially if you are hungry. These are the only negative points. Service was swift and very friendly, there is also a great outside courtyard bar. A really great place to visit.

title: Good vibe, good food, great night out
comment: I really liked the outside bar on a nice night it would be a cool place for some drinks before dinner.  The food was great especially the Moqueca Mista. The service was also outstanding the waiters were very helpful and nice. We had to wait a little bit beyond our reservation time to get to our table but it was alright.

title: Great food, great service and great views....
comment: I went to Sushisamba for a business lunch recently and was very impressed. Stunning views - my 'non-London' guests were particularly taken aback. The service was terrific and in addition/ most importantly the food was excellent and all chosen for us by our waiter. I would have given it a five star rating if it wasn't for the fact that it was expensive but what do you expect in London with a view like that? There was a great buzz in the place and we all felt very spoiled.

title: Wow wow wow
comment: Visited this amazing restaurant for our anniversary. The most delicious food I think I've ever tasted. Fantastic service and a stunning view. If u need somewhere for a special occasion, this is the one. Amazing experience.

title: Tummy left on floor of lift but amazing food
comment: Loved this place but getting to the top of the Heron Tower requires a strong stomach and head for heights. I have nether but on arrival, looking a little pale and upset the staff couldn't have been more lovely. Food and wine amazing, views fabulous and you're treated so well, oh and they let me go down in the enclosed service lift. Great birthday treat for my hubby in a place that goes the extra mile.

title: only drinks but wow !!
comment: im not a lover of heights and was lied to about where we were going lol ,, and from the moment i saw where we were going my heart was filled with dread lol , but i put a brave face on and got into the lift which is on the outside surrounded by glass not the most pleasurable time in my life i must admit but we got to the top and i can only say the views from sushi samba are breathtaking ,the outside terrace is amazing with the lit up tree surrounded by the bar was amazing we went at night so it was a bit chilly but the pit fire soon put paid to that ,downside i guess a little expensive but how can you argue when you have those views ,,fantastic cant wait to go back !!

title: Birthday Fun!
comment: Sushi is my favourite food so was taken here as a bday treat. Alot smaller than i expected, but lovely enviroment. The seabass tempura was to completely die for... Cant wait to go back!

title: Best Sushi selection in London
comment: I have been to Roka, Nobu, Sushinho, Benihana and several other Japanese restaurants in London. Sushi Samba excels and exceeds anything its competitors can deliver...in my opinion.  The variety of Sushi, the selection, the flavours and the look and feel of the restaurant take things to a whole new level (pardon the pun when you are on the 38th floor).  The management team are fabulous and so accommodating. Oto, the floor manager, is an absolute legend. Any problems, ask for him and he will sort it.  Faultless.

title: What a hit!
comment: We went there on a busy Saturday and we thankfully were lucky enough to get a table. We ordered with a lot of assistance by the very helpful staff a couple of dishes each, there were four of us so we ordered things with four or more pieces so we could share. It was fantastic! We have never had anything like this before! It wasn't a cheap meal but such a wonderful experience. The view from the tower is unbelievable, we could almost touch the gherkin! Definatly worth a visit!

title: Best Sushi ever with stunnign view over the City
comment: The Henron Tower is just near Liverpool Street Station. we booked a table using Opentable and we went to the restaurant for dinner. The elevator goes fast to 38th floor where the restaurant is. Before the restaurant there is a wonderful rooftop terrace with view on the City...incredibly high and nice to stay there a while. After few minutes we sat at table and we ordered sushi, nigiri, rolls and a final dessert which was delicious (small icecreams with different flavours). The wine list is really good, but prices are quite high: we decided to go with 2 glasses of red wine each (medium price) and end our dinner with 2 espresso each. Final bill was: 70 BGP each, which is quite expensive. But Sushi was really the best one I ate in my life: tasty and smooth. The fish was fresh and vegetables as well. A very good culinary experience!

title: very good experience.
comment: Great selection of food, good service, private dining makes it all the more special, and the waiters are committed to making sure you have all you need.

title: Great food, poor service, overpriced.
comment: I went to Sushi Samba with girlfriends to celebrate a birthday. We arrived mid afternoon, about 3.30pm. We went to the bar to order drinks first, and despite being the only guests at the bar the staff were far too busy chatting to each other and clearing up to even acknowledge our presence. They did come across as quite snooty, a little too pretentious. Eventually a young man decided to take our order but managed to be painfully slow, mainly because he was still chatting to his colleague. Drinks at last, we sat down to enjoy them, and the cocktails were very good. We were taken to our table and as one of our party had lived in Japan she was very comfortable ordering for us all. I don't think the waiter liked this as he tried to push several options on us but she was quite clear in what we should order. The food arrived and I have to say it was just delicious. No problems there. My overall opinion is that the food and drinks are great, but the staff are a bit 'up themselves' and it's quite expensive for what you get. I won't return because of the attitude of the staff.

title: Attentive Staff, Great views, Tasty Dishes
comment: Sushi Samba went beyond my expectations in a recent visit. The staff took every effort to meet my dietary requirements and adjust the menu to still give me a great dining experience. Combined with the food, company and array of dishes, it was a fantastic night out! Highly Recommended!

title: Stunning Views & A different Kind Of Menu
comment: A really excellent restaurant with delicious & unusual dishes!  All staff are excellent at explaining the menu and are very knowledgeable also about the extensive range of Sake available!  If you can manage to pick a fine day, the views across London are breathtaking and you can get a great perspective on the Gherkin!

title: Delicious Sushi on the top of London!
comment: Really enjoyed going to this restaurant. Breathtaking views over London, nice design, great food... Well, one of the best Sushi restaurants in London and even in the UK!

title: Make up Birthday
comment: My boyfriend took me in a desperate bid to make up for his failed attempts. He hates sushi! But my passion for sushi and the fact that not everything was raw fish made the experience amazing. The service was amazing the environment relaxed and cool. And I discovered I love Japanese whiskey. Scenery wasn't to bad either

title: Great food, service and evening
comment: I had a lovely evening meal one Tuesday after work with a friend. Arrived at the restaurant and got taken straight to our seat. The staff were well informative of the menu and explained everything very clearly, giving suggestions. We took a few on board and they were lovely. We had yellowfin tacos which were lovely, sushi which was the best sushi i've had, scallops, the cod which was so tasty and would highly recommend along with the beef which had a gorgeous flavour. The bill came to £123 which included all these dishes and a glass of rose which I didn't think was bad at all. We went on the terrace aftewards for cocktails, although we couldn't see the view as was very busy it was still enjoyable.

title: Go the view and the flashy decor ...
comment: ... But not the food, which is average at best. Good things: the breathtaking view, the flashy setting and the outside bar area. Disappointing things: the food. Party of 7 for an early evening meal after business meeting. We were fortunate to be allocated seating in the very centre of the room on a table that could have easily accommodated 12. Other similar sized parties to ours were cramped around much smaller circular tables and that looked to be a squeeze. Service was slowish. To a certain extent this was just part of the style, comfortable and unfussy erring on the right side of informality. Our waiter was very well informed when asked about several menu choices. The food itself was average in a way that was disappointing for the price point.

title: One word...... WOW
comment: Amazing service, we was completely waited on hand and foot. Food was spectacular and really really tasty. Different kind of menu and by far the best sushi I have tried. Last but not least the views was unbelievable and really stunned me.  I would defiantly recommend a visit here.

title: Visit for a Birthday
comment: The sense of excitement builds as you go up the lift on the outside of the building from the street to near to top of Heron Building. The views from the restaurant are some of the best I've seen in the City. The selection of drinks in the bar are good with a variety that I've never seen before. The atmosphere is good and the staff attentive. The food was a little confusing with a mix of pan asian/japanese dishes with a South American influence! It did however taste very good and the freshness of the ingredients was obvious. The price was a little steep however and would be my only draw back, I felt that I was paying somewhat for the views. I would return but it wouldn't be to pop in, it would definitely be for a special occassion. A lovely lunch for a Birthday.

title: Overrated!
comment: Been here for a night out with friends and not really impressed. We booked a table for 10pm and we've been seated at 11pm without any particular apologies. Food was quite nice but honestly not worth the price. Great view from the bar .

title: I dont like Sushi but i like Sushi Samba
comment: From the moment we bypassed the 20 strong queue having reserved a table I knew the Sushi Samba dining experience had begun, the lift shot us up 30 odd floors high up into the London skyline and I felt like Charlie Bucket in the Chocolate factory. I was already speechless and taken aback by the stunning views of London!
