When you first enter you come face to face with the bar area which as you would expect for a city jaunt full of young professionals trying to impress each other and members of the opposite sex, bit loud but not annoyingly loud like other city bars, more a buzz lets say and a friendly atmosphere with massive trays of sushi floating back and forth like colourful flying saucers! We were led into the main dining room which was still office block like but given a few bent bamboo trees and concave lampshades the ambience was nice enough, don’t have to try to hard when you have such great views (I like my views) in one of London’s tallest buildings on a lovely summer’s day with your special lady! Our waiter was very personable, not to pushy and wasn’t trying to make us buy the most expensive items on the menu. Instead he kindly told us his favourites, how spicy we liked our food and just how much to order in order to taste a varied selection and insure our appetites were satisfied. He also promised to keep an eye on the football scores for me! Im really not a fan of Sushi, I much prefer a fine piece of steak or pizza to appease my appetite, I find sushi to delicate and somewhat confused at times. However entwined with great service I was pleasantly surprised and on this rare occasion enjoyed everything I put inside my lovely mouth! So as a food lover I recommend the green bean tempura to start (naughty but nice!), scallop temaki, lamp chops were amazing (worth paying extra for a 4th one!), TIGER MAKI (MUST HAVE!) and for pure greed EL TOPO, when is the next time you are going to have sushi with jalapenos and mozzarella!  I had previously dined at the Las Vegas restaurant and had a bad experience so to make it up to me, my girlfriend and I received complimentary glasses of champagne and our own personal dessert was which was immaculate and well appreciated! So as we watched the sun go down, bellies full of lovely morsels of food, sipping our champagne we both agreed this was one of our best dining experiences in London, and by far my favourite Sushi related restaurant in the world!

title: Good food and great service
comment: We went for a business lunch. The waiters where super friendly but also very pushy in getting my business partners to order more food. We had a laugh about it in the end but thinking about it it was super pushy and someone might not like it.  The food was very good! We had half of the menu on our table and only managed to eat half of the ordered amount, but it was very good. Overall I would go back, but I would order less and enjoy more the experience in some nice food instead of mixing up too much. Price wise it's very expensive, for London city standards that's relatively normal though.

title: Overrated!
comment: Been here for a night out with friends and not really impressed. We booked a table for 10pm and we've been seated at 11pm without any particular apologies. Food was quite nice but honestly not worth the price. Great view from the bar .

title: WOW! views, but the food is the star !
comment: First time at Sushsamba, to celebrate our 3rd wedding anniversary, and already looking forwards to returning! Exceptional experience - From initial cocktail, throughout all the incredible dishes, with impeccable service throughout... Thanks Gloria! :)  Highly recommended for the originality alone, but backed up by delicious and memorable dishes ...and those views!!

title: helpful staff and quality food
comment: This is set in a wonderful location, up the heron tower, 38 stories high and so offers great views of london. The staff were very helpful and explained that the food was a mixture of japanese, peruvian and brazilian dishes. The food was good and me and my partner enjoyed sharing one another dishes. Cocktails were very delicious also. Of course the only down side was the price but this was to be expected, ensure you book well in advance if you want to get a seat at your desired time. The toilets weee clean which is always a bonus.

title: Not what I expected
comment: Friday evening started at the rooftop of Sushi Samba, which lead to dinner. I must say the staff do not have much clue about the drinks or the food menu, or maybe we just got the wrong one each time. At first the barman served me the wrong wine, did not take any notice, this pattern continued through our evening. Very disappointed!!

title: My girlfriend birthday!
comment: Very nice place and good food but service was horrible.  When I book a table I've ask for a nice table as I was going to take my girlfriend to celebrate her birthday. Table was booked for 8.30pm and conf. email clearly state to be there on time as they are not going to hold the table for more than 15 min. At exactly 8.30 we were there and we been told by the receptionist to wait there and the table was going to be ready in few minute. After more than 5 minute we ask again and receptionist said that the table wasn't ready and she suggest us to get a drink at the bar and she was going to call us. We went to the bar. Bar was pact and we had few line of people ahead of us. By the time we manage to get to the bar the table was ready so we did't have chance to get a drink. Table was the first on the left corner as you walk inside the room,close to the waiter station whit no view at all. I did't ask for the best table but not even for the worst.. To order we have to ask for service even thought we were seat exactly next to the waiter station. We had a btl of champagne and a bit of food. Food was great. After we finish the food my girlfriend went for a sigaret and I ask for a dessert whit a candle and went in toilette. When I come back the table was completely clear of and ready for next guest even thought we had a dessert still to go and a bit of champagne left in the glasses and in the btl. Waiter apologise and took back the glasses and set up the table for dessert. At the and we ask for bill and of course we had call the waiter to take the payment.  I was aspecting a big special evening in a hight special place over looking london, but the only hight and big special thing we had was the bill.

title: Reall brilliant experience
comment: We visited this restaurant for my girlfriend's birthday and had an excellent afternoon. We were met by very friendly staff and the good service continued throughout the meal. Our questions about the menu and drinks were answered politely and the suggestions made were varied and very helpful.  The food itself was wonderful, a real mix of flavours and techniques that made for a very exciting meal. There is plenty of choice to cater for different tastes so if you don't usually eat sushi, don't rule out this restaurant, it has plenty of other options.  The location and view really rounded off which was a brilliant afternoon. Whilst not cheap, this was not as expensive as had been made out to me and i was pleasantly surprised. 10 dishes between 3 people cost approximately £200. This also included drinks (cocktails no less) and service. All in all, a great experience for a treat.

title: Great Service Food Over Priced
comment: Was so looking forward to going for a late lunch at Sushi Samba, The cocktails are amazing and I had the Passionfruit Mojito which was divine. Plantation chips ( are just like crisps so not hot )  King Prawn Tempura starter and scallops which were both fantastic in flavour but the portions are small Main Course: had the three different meats cooked on stones, again quality was fantastic but it was for 4 people and I could have eaten it all just for me :-) So the bottom line is - great atmosphere, great drinks, great view but portions and prices are not what I would expect

title: What a great evening!
comment: I was taken to Sushi Samba by my family for a major birthday celebration, and I was somewhat reticent as I had never been before and it sounded like it could possibly be all style and no substance. I was also mortified when I browsed their wine list online to find very little under £50 a bottle. However, once we had arrived, all my reservations disappeared! What a splendid venue - fantastic views, great vibe, terrific soundtrack and highly professional service. And the wine prices? Well, once you've seen the venue and experienced the whole dynamic experience, it's only a small quibble!

title: Fun experience but overrated
comment: We arrived at Sushisumba a little early for our 6:45pm reservation and were asked to wait in the crowded bar area for our table. The only problem was trying to purchase a drink from the bar was a waste of time as there were only two staff and most of the patrons were ordering cocktails which take some time to prepare. Thirsty we were still waiting for our table at 7pm. That said, once we were seated in the restaurant, the service was excellent and our food arrived in quick succession. As we did not wish to be rushed we ate our last main course slowly and deliberately. The dessert of passion fruit cake, raspberry sorbet, coconut and crunchy macadamia was fresh and delicious. The decor is fun and this place certainly has a buzz about it.

title: My favorite Bar in London !
comment: Love the view, love the terrace, love the music, love the atmosphere, I even love the lift ! This in MY favourite place in London so far !  A shame that the service at the bar to have cocktails is a bit long… as well as the queue downstairs if you’re coming late… I had never been lucky enough to be invited at the restaurant....

title: Outstanding location and outstanding concept
comment: This is a great all rounder for an exciting day out: great food, great drinks, great views. We had a combination of small plates and rolls, which was a fantastic way to get a taste for the place. I was particularly wowed by the pork belly wraps, but every dish stood out in its own way. Definitely worth a visit!

title: Wonderful food and experience but expect to pay a fortune
comment: Excellent tasty food, lovely view across London and fab cocktails. Very busy so requires booking well in advance! Very expensive so be prepared for a big bill!

title: Dinner terrible
comment: I eat at all of London's best restaurants. Just last weekend I had an incredible meal at Zuma. I had a meal at Sushisamba last night. The dishes were pretentious and untasteful except one or two of the meat dishes that were really good. The sushi itself is good but not great. Really poor considering it's meant to be a top end restaurant. The staff are friendly and helpful but the service is disjointed. They have a head waiter who comes round and is clearly good but the other staff look out of their depth. One person takes the order, someone else comes and says have you ordered? That's pretty poor. The wine I had was poor as well. A meal for myself and my wife mainly, and we took along our 3 and 5 yr old kids, £260 in total, which is not terribly expensive, but the trouble is that the meal wasn't worth the money at all. The restaurant no doubt depends heavily on the magnificent location being near the top of the heron building. However for that view I could have just paid £50 to go up the shard. Frankly the meal was awful and service poor. I was very disappointed.

title: Great food, superb view
comment: Eat while in the bar with friends. Great food. Lovely outdoor bar - a fantastic location for a warm summer's evening.

title: Great food & Views
comment: I had some visitors in town, who wanted to try this venue out, so yesterday went along without a prior booking as I could not get one for a week or so ahead (as so popular due to the fantastic views). Initially went to the roof top bar area, we would have been happy with a couple of cocktails, but managed to get a table for 3 people by asking at the main restaurant, albeit for a Limited 2 hour window - that was plenty of time. Our Waitress Gloria, made ordering things really easy for us as my guests English was limited - so after checking for any dislikes or allergy issues she created a menu of dishes for us. The courses (lost count of how many) kept coming and the food was outstanding. Bill for 3 was £183 (including service) - £ 61 per head including cocktails from the bar area earlier (admittedly no wine with the meal) but consider this very good value. All the staff were extremely helpful and very pleasant. If you like an impressive venue and great food - this is the venue for you.  Tips - It is worth trying if you cannot get a booking but earlier in evening is better - 5.30 to 6.00pm After a great meal went to near by trendy Shoreditch to the Comedy Theatre Rivington St.and a bit of dancing at one of the many bars in Shoreditch high St.

title: One of London's best restaurants
comment: Sushi Samba was recommended to me by a friend so I was concerned that I may have unreal high expectations for it. I was seriously impressed.  The decor was beautiful, bright and trendy. The view is breathtaking. The service was excellent. The food was great. The desserts could have been better and the ceviches were average but that does not affect the overall impression. The dishes were creative and tasty.  Definitely worth more than one visit.

title: Great Buzz, Great Food
comment: Fabulous cocktails at the bar outside on the 38 th floor of the Heron Tower amazing views across London. Sushi Samba restaurant friendly helpful service food absolutely delicious total buzz would recommend

title: Amazing food, experience and view!
comment: Took my boyfriend here on a Friday evening for his birthday. We both agreed it was the best restaraunt we have ever been to (and we eat out a lot).  Firstly, the lift up to the restaraunt floor is a great experience and sets you up for the evening. We were met by really friendly staff as we waited for our table in the bar area. We had a couple of cocktails which were very nice although a little pricey - the view from the bar balcony is amazing. It was quite busy however so I would not have wanted to stay on the crowded terrace for long. We were taken to our table and we immediatly felt we were being treated like stars! The waiter was so friendly and helpful, talking to my boyfriend about the dishes in detail and recommending dishes. The food was amazing, we had lots of 'small plates' so we could try a lot. The black cod and pork belly were particularly nice. The head waiter came round and talked to us which was also really nice. We had the BEST view also and we couldn't get over it the whole meal. The atmosphere was great - busy, happy and we didn't feel out of place (we were a bit worried it might be a bit posh for us).  There were some famous people in that evening as well (sitting on the table next to us) and we still got great treatment. I wish I could remember our waiter's name as he was so great. He even got a message written on the desert to say happy birthday. Overall I really recommend for a special meal. We spent about £170 including service which, although a lot to us, we felt was well worth it.

title: You pay for the views as much as the food, but well worth it
comment: The food here is excellent. Really good quality, and great taste. The yellowfish tacos were especially good. The portions however are not very big: two of us had 2 starters, 2 mains, and 2 lots of Sushi and all of it was amazing, but I felt like I could eat more afterwards. Also, it's quite pricey, at £100 for the meal. You could eat equally good food elsewhere for cheaper, but then you wouldn't get the views or the unique flavours and combinations that they create at SushiSamba. And the views from the outdoor area are spectacular, make sure you take your camera.

title: Gorgeous Food ... Gorgeous Interior ... Gorgeous Views ... But ££££
comment: This place has a fantastic concept ...three bars and a restaurant over three floors with outside bar and roof terrace to boot. The food is gorgeous but small ... And as expected for this part of town, pricey. 2 champagne cocktails for £30! But it's worth the experience and the views are awesome ... day or night. I would save this place for a special occasion unless you're full of ££££££.  Visited on Saturday night (my birthday treat); and although busy, the atmosphere was a little flat and bartenders are slow ...but you don't have to stay there all night especially not with these prices. That being said ... Planning to take my other half for his birthday drinks after we visit Hawksmore restaurant.

title: Regular visitor. BEWARE the random "dress-code".
comment: I come to this venue very regularly, so I have the benefit, not just of one visit, but of frequent visits, so I personally qualify my review as being better informed than those of some one-time visitors with a one-time experience. Consider that somewhat arrogant statement as you might. I have however, never been for food apart from bar snacks (to which my food score applies). Only drinks. The good stuff... the venue is without doubt one of the best I've visited in my almost five years living in London. The view is no doubt the best I high-rise view I've been to in all of London. Forget The Shard (my review elsewhere), THIS is the best viewing deck in the city. I love the view from the window, I love the terrace, the firepit and the outdoor bar. I come here with friends, visitors to London, family and business associates and everyone loves it too! It's never too busy, especially at the weekends and although it is expensive, you're getting the venue as well as the drink, so I'm actually OK with that. The lift journey alone is worth the laugh! Makes me smile every time! ...and now, the not so good stuff... I can tell you that it is consistently my experience that the service at the bar here is always poor. It's slow and a little inept. If you order a cocktail, it seems to taste a bit different each time. I shrug and consider this to be totally forgivable... It really doesn't spoil the experience and if you stick to wine, it'll be quick and consistent. What DOES spoil the experience and in fact makes me very angry is that *sometimes* when you arrive, there's a power-trip bouncer on the door who says they have a "dress-code". I've been coming here for over a year and a half and I probably get admitted eight times out of ten. Now, I always dress smart-casual. I don't look shabby or unkempt and with it in mind that I've spent thousands of pounds here over that period of time and have brought others here in droves, I actually take powerful exception to being told on a Sunday afternoon "sorry mate, not today... you need a better pair of shoes" (genuine example). I asked if it was busy and he said no. I said I planned to buy a bottle of wine (what; about £50? It's not nothing) and he still said no admittance. A couple of reasonably trashy-looking girls were let in straight behind us, who were not well dressed by anyone's assessment. There are any number of conceited elitist bars, policed by arrogant self-important bouncers in London that I can't get in to because I'm not a sexy woman and I don't know some guy who knows some guy and I do hope the proprietors of Sushisamba don't allow their fine establishment to become just another one of those. The city will lose something special if that happens. I guess a part of the problem there is that it is inconsistent. I have also been on a Friday evening when it's busy in a smart t-shirt with no quibble. So to sum up; would I recommend it?! Yes, absolutely! Great spot! Be patient with the service -it's worth the wait and I do hope when you visit, you won't get "bounced"! Enjoy the best views of the city with my recommendation!

title: Fantastic food and views
comment: My boyfriend and I were to Sushisamba to celebrate our 8th anniversary and the restaurant did not disappoint. The food was absolutely fantastic and the service was very diligent. We shared several starters, the yellow tail fish tacos and the scallop ceviche both really nice. We then ordered a variety of Sushi rolls and some chicken Teriyaki. We had no alcohol and no dessert, still the bill was about £50 per person. In my opinion a bit pricey but the quality of the food is very good and you are also paying for the views. This restaurant is in the Heron tower which has a glass elevator where you can see the city as you go up and down. The views from the restaurant are very beautiful and if you are lucky and the day is sunny you can eat outside in the terrace. Enjoy!!

title: Bank holiday treat
comment: It was a wet bank holiday mon and we decided to try sushi samba. It brought a smile to the damp weather... It was a fast trip up in the lift 38-floors, and i was surprised there was some tables in the restaurant available... The service was excellent & efficient and they were very knowable... The food was also excellent esp the desserts, which i wouldn't of expected at a restaurant with a spectacular view... We also found out that they run the duck & waffle pub upstairs, also they have a balcony for the summer... We'll defiantly go back, one of my fav places in London....

title: Great venue...but too expensive!
comment: You can't really beat the view and and the atmosphere of Sushi Samba: you have the chance to have dinner while looking at London's beautiful skyline, it's just awesome! Interiors are great, lovely furniture, warm lights... it really is a cool restaurant and it's easy to understand why it's so popular. We knew that it was going to be pricey, but unfortunately it was much more expensive that what we were expecting... You get really TINY plates for what you're paying (they're like small tapas, but with main dishes prices), and the food is generally not filling at all. The food itself is quite weird, but I wouldn't complain about that, as we knew it was going to be a mix of japanese and south american cuisine. It was great to have the chance to see this place and to have dinner there, but I don't think we would go back for a second round, as it was way too pricey.

title: Awesome view,food not that testy
comment: Food was really not that good there are much better restaurants in London what really makes the difference at this place is the awesome view of London.This is the only reason someone should visit.

title: Cocktails are just ok (Review of Bar)
comment: The view is the best part of having cocktails in the terrace. The cocktails per se seem spectacular on paper but are just average on the glass. Overall feels just normal mojitos or cosmopolitans desperately trying to be sophisticated without real creativity behind.

title: Beautiful view and great atmosphere
comment: It starts with the journey up to the 40th floor in the glass elevator, bliss!!!! Onto the beautiful rooftop terrace styled like a beach bar with the sexy Brazilian beats going on a clear blue sky Friday evening - am I really in the square mile!?!? Fantastic! The cocktails are ok, all strangely very sweet but the service is fabulous. Great fusion dishes thoroughly enjoyed by the whole table

title: Good Food, Fantastic View but Pushy Service
comment: Visited here for a girls night out - have wanted to go for a long time! After we selected some wine ourselves, the Sommelier came over and tried to suggest some other wines - he became pushy, trying to explain that the £100 bottle of wine would compliment the food better - personally i wanted to ask why the one we chose was even on the menu but decided to bite my tongue! The pushiness continued into our food order - the waiter then kept pushing certain foods on the menu that we weren't that interested in - however, we gave in with the sushi platter and ordered according to his suggestion. Disspointed!!! After saying no to various other bits he tried to push, he became slightly cold, uninterested and abit rude going on to drop the sweetcorn appetizer onto my friend! Fantastic View and a lovely bar also!

title: One of the best meals I've ever eaten ...
comment: I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough ! Described as a fusion of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian cuisine, this can sound a little daunting, but put yourself in the hands of the highly knowledgable staff, and you can't fail to enjoy excellent food beautifully presented.  One of the signature dishes is black cod miso served on skewers - I don't remember tasting better. For pudding, if you like chocolate, try 'With love from Rio' - stands comparison with anything, anywhere !  Arrive a little early and try a cocktail in the bar, looking over London from 38 floors up, but if you suffer from vertigo, close your eyes on the lift, a glass cube travelling up the side of the building !

title: Amazing Suhi Samba
comment: Great atmosphere , excellent service ! Great food ..I will be back . the food was very particular attention to the smallest details! Australian wine was very good !!

title: Good food but not a lot for your money
comment: In a nutshell the food and service is great but for your money you don't get much of it to eat. Would have got 5/5 if there was more of the delicious food to eat, and would have got 3/5 if there wasn't an amazing view of London, which there is from the top of this building on the 38th floor. For the record: We are all small people and still felt like we needed more and didn't want to pay through the nose for a dessert. £115 between 3 of us without starters or desserts but with cocktails which are £15 each.

title: Amaze all food
comment: I have visited twice here,firstly the lift is a great experience- super quick with a taster view! The bar serves delicious cocktails and has amazing views looking right over London. The food is some of the best I have tasted great Japanese and South American with a twist. We have been to this restaurant in Miami and enjoyed it but London certainly far better for us. Great waiting staff, service quick which is what we like!

title: Sushi Samba
comment: Our reservation was at 8:45pm, we were seated at 9:45pm, and not a single bit of food went into my mouth until 10:30pm ! by which time I was starving, can you blame me. 4 drinks cost £70, which is kind of expected, however the bartenders were soooo slooooow, no vigour or style in making the drinks, hardly what I would call cocktail bartenders. The food was okay, nothing mind blowing. Plus points were: great view, nice decor and outdoor seating. Wouldn't go back.

title: Beautiful view but there are better japanese restaurants in London
comment: The view is beautiful. I suggest you arrive 30 min before to get a drink in the bar before sitting at the restaurant. You have to book at least 2 months in advance for the weekend.  Although the view is worth price and experience, food is good but there are better and cheaper japanese restaurant in London.

title: Poor
comment: If you like tacky pretentious places ğo to this restaurant where Los vegus meets london Over the top service with a massive garish tree in the bar Lots of young trends drinking very expensive good cocktails food good expensive but far from great There are at least 30 better suchi bars in london

title: Paul thank you
comment: Wow, this restaurant was recommended by a friend. The meal was delicious, the atmosphere and view were excellent, but the main attraction was Paul recchia made our visit over the top with his personalized service. Thank you Paul. You're the best. The establishment is much better for having you as an integral part. Laura, Joyce and Sarah

title: Views matched by awesome food and spectacular service
comment: We entertained a client over lunch, one in the party was gluten free and ate off the gluten free menu, which was quite extensive. The others shared various treats. The tempura prawns were a particular succulent treat. When our gluten free member strayed from her course and sampled a slice of chorizo off our platter the waitron appeared as if out of nowhere to reprimand her. Great attention to detail. Only downside is that it is pricey! Very pricey!

title: Cheap Service
comment: Every time I have ever been here I was always happy with their service aside from this evening... We went for my Dads 61st Birthday as a party of 7, I've been here a couple of times so I knew what to order.. Our first waiter was rude, pushy and extremely persistent in making us order so much more than we can actually eat which annoyed me from the start, he kept trying to get us to order foods that we don't even eat! Secondly, we ordered 3 portions of the Cod which is 6 skewers... the table was uneven and a drink spilled on the Cod... Before that happened my dad ate 1 of the 6 skewers and they replaced the rest of the 5 after the accident instead of bringing us a new dish... At the end when the bill came they charged us from not only the 3 portions we ordered but also the 2 other portions that the drinks dropped on (which was not our fault) I found that extremely cheap for such a prestigious restaurant! When I told them to change the bill they returned it with yet another stupid addition they charged us for the 3 portions of Cod as we ordered them and 1 skewer which we never ate! It was like they were trying to shame us to get us to pay, I've been to a number of high class restaurants around London, NYC and many more countries and this is the first time ever I've experienced such snobby behavior... Again they changed the bill after embarrassing us for the second time and we paid and left... I will say atmosphere, view, food and music was great but for a big group of people not great because this time quality of service was very poor!

title: Incredible views of London
comment: The highlight of Sushi Samba is definitely the views. Just going up in the glass lift in itself was an experience. Great bar with the big gold tree but service was very slow and the bar staff were a bit snooty, delicious cocktails though. The food was delicious and our waiter was so helpful and polite. It's on the more expensive side vs what you are getting but I guess you are paying for the location and view. Not going to rush to go back but would recommend as a one off experience.

title: Definitely worthwhile to go for the view
comment: Went there in a Friday night for cocktails after dinner. The view was amazing, the bartenders were very nice, the atmosphere fun. We would like to thank dj Will for accommodating our request and the excellent choice of music! The experience definitely worth the pricey cocktails. Can't wait to go back to try the food!

title: Excellent food but watch the drinks bill
comment: The food is really good - the view is not bad from the bar - Duck and Waffle has better views. The black cod is not to be missed. Add alcohol and you're looking at a large bill so lunch is definitely the option for business lunches.

title: Favourite place in the world.
comment: I tend to go here on a regular basis and it just occurred to me that I still haven't written a review on it.  The views are phenomenal, if you go I definitely recommend sitting outside as it's a lot nicer and sometimes it can get a bit crowded inside.  Drinks; the cocktails are fab. We tend to have a drink with our meal and then after our meal we go to the outdoor bar which just has a lovely atmosphere.  Can't fault the food! My advice is don't play it safe, and don't get their vegetables because they are very plain for the price you're paying.  Desert is incredible!! Just melts in your mouth.  The staff are the loveliest people you'll meet! The general manager is so kind, always checking you're okay.  It's an expensive restaurant but once you enter sushi samba you realise why it's expensive and then you don't mind spending that money!

title: Great birthday celebration
comment: I dined here with 8 friends for a colleagues birthday. We were sat around a rather small table and the chairs are heavy and large making it difficult to manoeuvre into your seat. We first ordered drinks at the bar, where they added a service charge on top, although we were at the bar and they didn't do much work. The bar area isn't laid out well and was very busy.  7 of the party ordered various sushi dishes and 2 ordered separate foods. The waitress was slightly bossy trying to dictate our order. However we took control and ordered some amazing food. The food arrived at different times which lead to the 2 people ordering different food to eat after everyone else. The food was delicious although unsurprisingly expensive.  Overall a good experience with friends.

title: Amazing food... Rude floor manager!
comment: We had been looking forward to our visit to Sushi Samba for a while and the food did not disappoint. We were advised how much to order and also some recommendations from our server - which were great! The 2 hour timings on the table didn't appear to be a problem, the food was served at a nice lesuirely pace... Until the floor manager, Mantas, decided to tell us in a quite a rude manner that we were 'running out of time'. I think for a minute he forgot we were paying customers! We were really disappointed in this aspect of the service - safe to say his manner ruined our evening. I would like to go back, for the food - yes, it was that good but may be I will try and book for when Mantas is on holiday!!!

title: incredible setting, but wildly expensive
comment: i came here to meet a group of friends and it was exquisite. the scenery was fabulous. however, i ordered one glass of wine and NO sushi as i was extremely wide-eyed at the price list.

title: Amazing amazing amazing!!!!!
comment: By far the best place I've been so far in London. The view was insane, the atmosphere was electric and the food was to die for. Unfortunately I have had better sushi, however that didn't matter as their other dishes where fantastic, especially the Shrimp Tempura-absolutely phenomenal! As was the black cod, and the beef tacos !  The place was extremely pricey but worth every penny for the food, service, atmosphere and view!  I would go back in a flash. Most amazing birthday treat ever! Thank you Sushi Samba it was a pleasure!

title: Dress code is a load of crap
comment: Really lovely food, amazing views and fun to be up there having lunch on the 38th floor. But a dress code for such an expensive restaurant is really ridiculous. If I'm gonna spend the money, I can wear what I want. Surely they wouldn't turn away Lady GaGa in her briefs and stilettos. Load of crap. So the guys in suits actually made me feel like I was still in work.. Also, I had to let 4 different people know about the booking before being seated. Too much over done service. A bit extreme.

title: For fine dining prices, food is only average but a great view
comment: So I've been to Sushisamba twice now and it does have it's strong points, service is good, the view is amazing and desserts are delicious. However it is quite expensive for in my opinion, standard fare Japanese food. If you also, don't happen to get a table either outside on the balcony or next to the window, then half the experience is lost. We had a great outside table the first time, but unfortunately not the second and were sitting in the middle of the dining room.  Also, the bar area could be better cleaned and polished (menus were dirty, seats look wore and tacky). If you're in London town it's worth a visit if you can afford it for the view alone.  Pros: Great view Strong service Great Moochie Ball desserts Cons: Price Price No views if you're stuck in the middle

title: Amazing
comment: Wow i love it !!! Sushi Samba is a destination restaurant and worth it. Fabulous 38 th floor view and the most amazing gold tree outside by the seating area and bar. It certainly gas the wow factor. And the meal was sumptuous. I will post picture because words fail me.  The tempura prawns and black cod were the highlight of the meal. Save up and go - it's expensive 15 or so a dish and we had 6 nor huge but so perfect that every mouthful is a delight.I want to put up photos - but can't see how - what a shame.

title: All style, no real substance
comment: I've been to SushiSamba a few times for drinks and had a real good time, as if you get a window seat, then you get lovely views of london, and the terrace is a nice experience...however, dinner was a totally different experience. We had a really nice table by the window, which gave great views of london at night, however that was the only real highlight of our night. We ordered a variety of different sushi, sashimi and hot mains, none of which were of any great standard, and i've had significantly better at independent sushi places in london. Each of our dishes took longer than they should have to arrive, and our drinks took longer still, after asking twice. Overall, i wasn't too impressed. If you're sold on views and deco (something i couldn't fault) then it's a nice place, but if you're after good sushi then this isn't the place for you, as you can get better for cheaper else-where in London.

title: Lovely sushi and great views of the city.
comment: Very nice sushi, cocktails are on the high end but that comes with the location. Nice place to spend an evening with friends or a birthday.

title: Nice views & atmosphere, interesting food ruined by terrible service
comment: Food was decent. Nothing special about the large plates, robatas & rolls (had better made & better tasting rolls at much cheaper restaurants), although we did enjoy the starters and desserts. However, the service was HORRIBLE!!! Hostess was unobservant AND RUDE... waiter was disinterested & impatient... and doorman was rude!!! Shocking that a nice restaurant like this has such lousy service. Ruined our whole experience here!!!!!

title: Unique experience!!
comment: Sushisamba is a great restaurant with a fantastic view! Several recommandations for the food: go for the padron pepper in appertizers, try the tacos with seabass and have some sushis! It is reasonably priced, especially if you consider the environment. Last tip: book a looooong time in advance! i booked it 2 months in advance when I was at Sushisamba Miami! :) Enjoy!

title: The view!!!!
comment: I went to Sushisamba with a work colleague for drinks and it is a fantastic venue! The views of London are outstanding - almost like being on the London Eye! The cocktails were very well made, tasty and actually not as pricey as expected! Lovely to take someone who's visiting London or a romantic drink/evening.

title: Beautiful view
comment: Is a very nice place, with an incredible view over the city of London. The cocktails are also wonderful. But i don't think it's ok to put the service charge on the bill if you are asking for a beer at the bar. But any way this is not so important because the place is just incredible!

title: Fantastic
comment: Only went for afternoon drinks, haven't tried the restaurant. The cocktails were superb, the bar staff were wonderful and put all their attention and time into each individual cocktail. They were on the pricy side though, at £13 each. I understand it's a rooftop bar but I didn't feel they were overly worth quite that much. I thought it was good that there was a smart casual dress code policy. Would have liked to see more of the view, we couldn't actually see over the hedges..! We booked to try the restaurant straight after.

title: Overrated and overpriced
comment: The drinks are ok, but the food is bland and extremely expensive.  The security at the door is ridiculous and there is a strict dress code, which I always find obnoxious.  The last time I went, I was with a group of 10 people and one person was wearing brand new All Stars - we had to bargain our way in because of that, and we were told this was the last time they allowed that.  The place is stuck up, and it takes quite a long time to order drinks if you're seating outside.  However, the view is spectacular, there is no denying that.

title: place with an amazing view
comment: Drinks are really nice, pricy, but it's worth going. The view is amazing even on a rainy day. Have not tried the food though. And also queues are not that bad for the drinks. Enjoy

title: Amazing view, great food, awesome service!!
comment: I have been in there before but was long time ago and we decided to take advantage about the summer and visit one of the best view places in London. We loved the food and drinks we had nina fresa for cocktail to start with then we were sitted on the sushi counter in there Nichola our waiter was very attentive and caring about us and he recommended a selection of small dishes to share. The assorted of tiraditos, wagyu gyoza, yellowtail taquitos where just unbelievable all that pairing very good with a lovely glass of sake. All the elements made an unforgivebable night and for sure we are coming back again.

title: Delicious food and special location
comment: The food is delicious - try the black cod and the yellow tail! We had lots of different small plates were all great. The sushi was disappointing though - you ca have better sushi in cheaper restaurants, so don't go there for sushi. Try all the fusion food instead, you won't be disappointed. It feels like such a special place, it's great to be so high up! Perfect atmosphere for a dinner date or dinner with friends. However, if you want the view, just go to the bar. You don't see much from the restaurant.

title: great view, average food
comment: We went along to the restaurant to celebrate a birthday, having been to the bar a few times before. The external lifts and views make visiting here worthwhile, even if just for a drink. The meal we got was mixed - really good steak but very poor signature dish of lemon sole, which was basically bones and batter. However, they were very nice when we gave them feedback, and knocked dessert off the bill.

title: Great place
comment: Lovely place, excellent views of London city The staff is very friendly and smiley Love the drinks and selection of wines, the peruvian food could be much better some of the ceviches are just okay. The desserts are lovely.

title: Outstanding Food, Cocktails and Service
comment: Booked here for a Sunday lunchtime. I was concerned as, of course, it is very "hip" at the moment and thought it may all be hype. How wrong was I? Our waiter was friendly and helpful. He guided us through the cocktail list, wine list and menu. We started with cocktails (watermelon baja, shiso fine and a nina fresa- all lovely) and tempura green beans. We then had Kuromitso pork belly (amazing), tempura prawns, yuzo scallops. Followed by the black cod skewers which were outstanding before our "big plate" of Churrasco Rio Grande (rib eye, wagyu and chorizo served sizzling on hot stones). Our eyes were definitely bigger than our stomachs and we ordered a dessert each - Chocolate banana cake, banana mousse and red chocolate chilli peppers. All of these were creative and delicious but probably too rich given the amount we had eaten already. I really love the way the food comes out tapas style and it is all shared. Just as well, as it gives you the opportunity to try a range of dishes. I had banked on £100 a head and it actually came in at £80 a head including service. Worth every penny! Great food, great setting, great drinks, great service. Hope to go back soon!

title: Amazing food
comment: The food is delicious - try the black cod and the yellow tail! We had lots of different small plates were all great. The sushi was disappointing though - you ca have better sushi in cheaper restaurants, so don't go there for sushi. Try all the fusion food instead, you won't be disappointed. It feels like such a special place, it's great to be so high up! Perfect atmosphere for a dinner date or dinner with friends. However, if you want the view, just go to the bar. You don't see much from the restaurant.

title: Love it!
comment: This is by far my most favourite restaurant in London. The food is a taste sensation and service impeccable. So many great things about this restaurant - but I need to stress the fantastic view over London. If you looking for something special - Sushi Samba doesn't fail to impress.

title: wow absolutely amazing place
comment: a must visit when in London, eccentric, exciting, wonderful, unique! atmosphere was great, setting , view and the while look of this place is really different and interesting

title: Dinner with a view
comment: Nice food and cocktails but a little overpriced. Amazing view and the lift ride is an experience! Definite place to visit when in London, if only for the view!

title: Fantastic food and London view
comment: This is an amazing restaurant. Elevator is crazy fast with glass walls. Reservation is a must. Food is delicious, service is brillant and the view is fantastic. Give yourself a lot of photo shooting time. You will gonna love the place.

title: Great fun - recommended!
comment: This is such a fab, fun, unique place - if you're looking for something different, this is it. My husband took me there for lunch and right from the ear popping lift whooshing up to the top of Heron Tower it was great. Shame the girl at the entrance to the bar had a bit of an attitude, but we ignored her and other than that the staff were very nice, especially the lovely waitress who served us in the restaurant. We had the best table - right on the far side in the middle on the edge with the whole view of London to gaze upon. The interior architecture is wonderful and quirky, as is the art work and, it goes without saying, the exotic food was delicious. Packed to the rafters with a great looking crowd guaranteed a super buzz and good ambience. We enjoyed the whole experience so much we're planning to go back one evening soon to try some other delicious things off the menu and linger a bit longer in the bar this time - the cocktails are amazing!

title: Must try at least because of view
comment: Well me and my friend we are not from uk so we had no reservation. Reception lady put as in front of very hot open kitchen we were very upset and ready to go but suddenly italian manager came to us and found amazing table. What a surprise! He made our dinner very special! He took care from A to Z. Food is really amazing! Especially black code. View is really impressive. This is something special in uk. Price is very normal as well.

title: Great food with an incredible view
comment: High quality of food along with high quality service with the addition of an incredible view of London. The building itself is inspiring along with the restaurant's excellent interior design. Make sure you book in advance and check out the exterior seating areas too; oh and their cocktails!

title: Great location, average food & high prices
comment: The real highlight of SushiSamba is the location, and the wonderful view it offers. The interiors are surprisingly modern, original and charming. The Staff was nice and welcoming, and our two waiters were very friendly and helpful. We tasted the sushis, they were good, but overpriced, and not that extraordinary. It was crowded and the music was a bit too loud, but nothing unbearable. In conclusion, if you want to have a great view of London and a good time, SushiSamba is the place you're looking for, however be willing to pay for it.

title: Amazing views
comment: I have been to sushi samba many times and I understand everyone talking about how difficult it is to get a reservation here but I always seem to manage to get one or if you go on the day they do keep some sushi bar seats available for walk ins. Starting off with the outside terrace bar love the cocktails and the mixologists they are fantastic especially Pavel who always recognises me which is a nice touch. The views and cocktails from the terrace are great so it's highly recommended to get there a bit earlier and enjoy the view with a nice drink (on Fridays and Saturdays especially in the summer the terrace does get rather busy so bare that in mind). The food in my opinion is delicious however sometimes the flavours don't match the previous visits I recommend the yellow tail tacos they are amazing and the black cod is so delicious and half the price of any other top restaurant in London. Dining at sushi samba is an experience not to be missed when you take in the breath taking views, fantastic cocktails and sumptuous food. Definitely worth the visit.

title: Terrible service and very average overpriced food
comment: The service was very slow and we had to prompt waiters to clear our plates, bring drinks, top up water and clear mess from the sharing plates on the table. The waiters weren't very friendly, just putting dishes down without saying what they were. For the prices they charge, one would think that the wait staff wouldn't act like they were doing you a favor. Average sushi, nothing special.  Overall my advice would be don't go unless you don't mind paying a premium for average food and poor service.

title: Absolutely no customer service!
comment: Our party (16) visited on a Sunday evening and despite having paid in excess of £2000 we were rushed from the table the moment we had paid our bill and made to feel less than welcome when discouraged by staff, including the manager, not to return to the bar area after our meal. I will not be re-visiting this establishment!

title: I love this place
comment: I really enjoyed Sushisamba. The ambience is spectacular and the food is amazing too. In particular yellowtail sashimi was excellent, and lobster taco from the daily special menu was outstanding as well. The black cod anticuchos is another great dish, and I find the black cod is better balanced than in Nobu (it can get too sweet). One dish I could have left out was the maki rolls - while good, relatively little flavour and very filling with rice in comparison. But then, some people like it. The service was outstanding as well, very friendly, efficient, great recommendations. It comes across that members of staff are happy and enjoy working there. Everyone was very friendly. The only fault is they expect tip on top of the tip. One only needs to point out that the tip is already included. Everything else is excellent.

title: My favourite restaurant so far
comment: What an incredible experience and something that must be tried!! Sushi Samba is on the 38th floor, which is an experience in itself. The atmosphere and decor is amazing, and the outdoor areas are something to experience. The inside is also comfortable with gorgeous views of the city. We ordered multiple dishes, and each one just got better and better. The crispy taquitos, black cod and lamb chops were my favourite and the passion fruit cake was phenomenal, the best dessert I have ever had and the most amazing way to end the meal. If you love Asian fusion-Do yourself a favour and try Sushi Samba!

title: WOW
comment: Fabulous place, fabulous views, fabulous food, attentative waiters. we order about 7 small plates, everyone was an explosion of tastes, cocktails yummy. It is expensive but even if you only do it once its an experience, would go back in a heartbeat. Wallet permitting. !!!!!!!!

title: Spot on
comment: We came to Sushi Samba to celebrate my sons 21st. I have eaten here before and loved it but this time it simply exceeded all our expectations.The service was friendly and attentive but not intrusive. We ordered all the 3 specials which were wonderful. As always the tuna with lemon grass and jalapeno, shrimp tempura and the belly pork wraps - all superb. My favorite was the black cod skewers - the best black cod I have ever eaten. At the end of the meal my son was presented with a desert with a candle - a lovely touch. It isn't cheap here but the view, the service, drinks and food are top quality so you get what you pay for.

title: Amazing Food
comment: I'd heard a lot about this restaurant before I visited but nothing prepared me for the fantastic ambience, the amazing views over London and the outstanding food. Even the ride in the panoramic lift to the 38th floor was good. As soon as you step into the restaurant you are greeted by a friendly atmosphere. We started in the outside bar with some fantastic views over London. The cocktails were very good and then we moved into the restaurant. I have to say that the staff are very attentive and have heaps of personality. The food however was a standout for me. I have eaten at many top restaurants in London but the quality of food, presentation and taste were possibly the best I've ever had. The black cod was quite simply amazing. The evening was finished with drinks on the terrace. A great evening and a restaurant I would highly recommend. It wasn't cheap but you only live once.

title: Bar staff is really rude and ignoring customers
comment: This would be such a great place if they'd hire nice staff at the bar with the tree... We were waiting for 30 mins until decided to complain to the hostess who spoke with one of the bartenders to serve us immediately. Thank you for that, really! One of the bartenders was wearing sunglasses: SERIOUSLY? I am paying £15 + 12.5% service charge per cocktail for this treatment? I would advise people to avoid the bar at all cost. It looks pretty but the guys behind the bars were soooo slow, so not giving a s**t about any costumer. Why would I want to go there again?  The restaurant: TOTALLY DIFFERENT STORY. We were served by a Brazilian lovely man, and he even got the kitchen to write Happy Anniversary on our desert plate. If it wasn't for this nice waiter and the AMAZING FOOD, this would have been a ruined evening at SushiSamba, which is not cheap, trust me. The view is also very lovely and it's worth going to Sushi Samba rather than the Shard :)

title: Wow!
comment: I suggest everyone to spend at least one night in this amazing place, where you can either eat Japanese food (not as good as in other places in London) or have a cocktail enjoying the great view from the 42nd floor of the Heron Tower.

title: Cocktails
comment: Took our 1 year old up to the top in the lift it was a great experience. Staff were very accommodating. Drinks were expensive though.

title: overall fantastic!
comment: I went there with my friend on a Saturday but knew that the prices were high therefore we had something to eat prior arriving. The food was unbelievable! The cocktails were divine. Amazing views and great service! Highly recommended! I will definitely be coming back and will suggest this restaurant to my boss for business lunch or dinner with her clients.

title: Great ambient for drinks and amazing view
comment: I have been to Sushisamba several times and I love the ambient, the drinks and the view. The food is very good and unique albeit pricey. The service however is not so good, especially on a busy weekend. It can be frustrating if you walk in for dinner without reservation.

title: Do it once!
comment: Well I've actually been up twice for drinks. It's pricey and the staff and patrons tend to be trendy rather than a relaxed friendly environment you might find elsewhere. I'd recommend getting in early (prior to 5pm) or booking to ensure you don't have to queue. The view is stunning and pretty good value compared to the Shard where you'd also pay £50 for a great view but wouldn't get a bottle of wine!!!

title: Amazing lunch ..... stunning views!
comment: Probably one of the best lunch venues I have been to in London. Perfect afternoon, sat outside in the sun and was served excellent food and wine. Service from Max (aka Richard Gere) could not be faulted.

title: Fortunate to have a son working in the city
comment: Well this was a fitting end to a great couple of days in London !! we met our son at Liverpool Station and he took us here for a bite to eat and cocktails. Super location, super views and super cocktails. What great decor and lovely staff, hope I have a return visit, soon !!!!!!!!!

title: Unfortunately, no good views from tables
comment: We had dinner at SUSHISAMBA a few days ago. The food and service were impeccable. Unfortunately, though, the view from the tables was not as expected. The restaurant area doesn't face the 'interesting' part of the city and only the tables for 2 get to sit next to the windows. I would recommend to come here for the bar (from where you can see the Gherkin, for instance) and not the restaurant. Oh yes, and the music in the background was fairly strange...

title: Wow .. As good as the hype
comment: Having taken months to get a booking and only being able to get 10 pm on a Saturday ... I was gearing myself up to be disappointed . The initial contact was poor .. I had to find someone to ask where the restaurant entrance was .. There are bar areas to get through first and it's down the small staircase . After that however it was almost faultless . I would definitely go again at 10 pm because the place was buzzing , great music , cool decor ... Loved it . The food was delicious : order the prawn tempura .. I wasn't going to because you think you've had it so many times but here ... The delicately thin coating was a joyous experience .. definitely have the wagyu gyoza , the London samba rolls , squid , and the ribs were so sumptuous we ordered them again . Equally good were the yellowfish Tacitos although the wagyu beef ones weren't quite as delicious .  I have to mention the fantastic level of service , great explanation and help , 2 servers per table .. Couldn't fault it .  The wine though has massive markup ( cloudy bay in the shops is £22 which has shop profit in it and is £67 here) .. The Pinot Noir we had at £85 was lovely but not fabulous . The worst part of the meal was the cocktail to start .. The most bitter caipirinha I've ever had .. Sticking a stick of sugar cane in doesn't sweeten the drink ... I've had them in lots of places including Rio and they don't taste like that .  Fusion food at its best here and I can't wait to return . Btw : Couples get the best seats around the windows .  In a word ... Wow

title: Great experience but complicated menu
comment: It's definitely a special occasion place as the menu is pricey but when you see the amazing views, experience the great service and dine on what I think it the best sushi I've ever eaten, you can see why people flock to it!  The menu is complicated, but the helpful waiters and sommelier helped helped us choose a delicious feast for five, encouraging shared dining. There's a two hour turnaround on tables and they are aren't afraid to tell you when your time is up so don't take to long choosing your food!  We dined on sushi with an exotic twist, washed down with tropical cocktails served in bamboo shaped glasses.  The atmosphere is bright and buzzy with a dj playing club music on the terrace. The venue was heaving with city boys and women having after work drinks.  I recommend this restaurant/bar for a special occasion. It's social atmosphere make it a great place for a birthday but not sure it's appropriate for a romantic meal.

title: Innovative Concept, Delicious Food.
comment: Sushi Samba is located in the Heron Tower in the City. It is across the road from Liverpool Street Station. The concept is sushi, Brazillian, South American fusion. The views are good and the food was creative and tasty. This isn't traditonal sushi. It is very much fusion. Although unlike anything I've had before - think yellowtail taquitos with roasted corn miso or a big eye tuna roll with a spicy latin sauce - the flavors worked and were delicious. The food is very pricey, very diffferent and very good. Sometimes fusion doesn't work, this time it definitely did.

title: Good - will return.
comment: Went for some lunch on a Saturday - good vibe and had some very nice food - rather pricey for what it was but I guess the view is second to none - all in all nice time had by all

title: Singular views, gauche decor, ok food
comment: Firstly, the view is literally incredible- you have to see it, and experience your ears popping as you fly up 38 floors in a rocket elevator.  However, as soon as you arrive it's all dubai decor and fake orange trees outside, banging cheesy house music in your face and wealthy russian smokers congregating in a busy heap by the bar making it literally impossible to get served. It feels like someone with tonnes of money and no taste has been let loose on an interior decor scheme which is actually very similar to the japanese-peruvian-brazilian cuisine, ie, high on ideas, but to be totally honest, kind of low on taste.  We Had the shrimp tempura (ok, but the sauce was a bit sweet), black cod, (ok but again kind of honeyed out of taste) and london sushi (kind of ok but ruined by a sweet sauce again). We also had the pork belly which was actually amazing so kudos for that. All in all, this could have been outstanding because of the view and the high end cuisine but is made as sickly sweet as the fake orange tree that hangs over the outdoor bar area by an overwhelming profusion of tastes and influences - sometimes simplicity is best.  Don't go unless you are loaded (our meal was 160 quid with a bottle of wine) but do go if you are feeling extravagant and chintzy. Oh and the service is great Tip: ask for an outdoor seat in the summer to get the best tables and views across East London towards canary wharf

title: SUPERB
comment: Booked for husband's birthday last month. All I can say really is...thank you for contributing to a perfect evening! Food was delicious and the venue has some great views of the city and cool interior design; this is a fab place to dine!

title: Japanese fusion cuisine with the best view in London
comment: Fantastic food, cocktails (try the lychee cooler) and a view you must see! Favourite things were the Black Cod miso Anticuchos skewers – served with peruvian corn and the wagyu beef – grade 9 Ishiyaki 120g cooked at the table on hot stones with dipping sauces, pickled plums and the crsipy Taquitos with yellowtail and avocado and roasted corn miso.

title: High class joint with relaxed atmosphere
comment: Obviously views were absolutely stunning at sushi samba, especially if eating outside or sitting near the indoor bar. We saw through day light to the night sky with the glittering city all round us. Food came at a price but every dish had its own twist and tasted fab. Service was brilliant and I can't wait to do it again.

title: Amazing View - OK Drinks
comment: The view is the reason to go there. Only tried the drinks in a Sunday afternoon. The atmosphere was great, but the drinks were a bit disappointing.

title: Great meal, Great evening and Great Hosts
comment: My wife and i went for dinner as part of our 5 year Anniversary celebration. Our meals here have always been great and this time was no exception. The service was great and it was the little surprise after tour initial drinks order that really helped top this night off.  My wife was 5 months pregnant and when she got up to powder her nose, the floor manager 'Remy' moved us right next to the Window and this was made more beautiful by the sun setting. Once again, that really topped off a lovely evening and meal. Going back very soon....its a shame it is always soooooo fully booked....

title: Didn't enjoy it
comment: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday, we weren't sat near a window so he asked if we could change seats, our waiter checked with his manager and moved us straight away so that was brilliant. However we had never ordered sushi before and we asked for advice, I explained I didn't like anything spicy. The waiter advised us to pick 5-7 dishes, we are only 19 and the place is expensive so we chose 5, because we didn't even know if we were going to like it! When we ordered, our waiter said that's not enough to order, you'll need to order a starter too. We felt quite pressured.. We didn't even want a starter! We were looking at the menu for ages because we struggled to find something we liked the look of! In the end the waiter said he had one in mind and he'll add that to our choices. We just went along with it, it was kinda loud so we couldn't really hear him plus his English wasn't great so he was hard to listen too! The starter came and it was the spiciest thing I'd ever tasted. Not impressed we paid for something we didn't want in the first place, especially after me saying I don't like anything spicy! The other dishes came out but we only ate the meat options as the rest of it just wasn't for us. The views are amazing and we'd come back for the bar but I wouldn't eat there again as I felt the staff were pushy and made us feel like we weren't allowed to eat there unless we spent over £100.

title: Amazing!
comment: Was treated to a meal here and I loved it. We were given a seat by the window and the views are wonderful. Have been to the top of many of the London high rises and this did not disappoint. The service was very good. We asked for advice and was given it enthusiastically. The food is very different - as previously noted in reviews, not your usual Sushi - and everything is presented beautifully. This was a thursday late lunch and the place was very busy. For a special occasion this was a perfect venue.

title: For the wow factor! Great service, food and atmosphere!
comment: If you want to impress someone then definitely take them here. It's a great place to go for drinks as well as food. Drinks might be a bit too quirky for me (and I don't like that they add on a service charge to one drink) but the food was really good! We had the Wagyu beef and it was very nice as well as the sushi. The restaurant has a really nice atmosphere to it and they even brought in some Samba dancers for a little show. Think it was mainly because Brazil were playing but it was appreciated!

title: Very pleasant
comment: Sushi is my favourite food and I also enjoy fresh fusion barbecue styles like Brazilian so this restaurant excited me greatly. Overall it does what you expect - great food, cool atmosphere, great service and those obligatory expensive slightly ott prices! I still found that I felt 'a little out of place' even though I'm reasonably young, attractive and fun...I was declined a table outside Nd fobbed off with those being reserved and VIP (so if Cheryl Cole arrives my custom is no longer good?) and the bar is a little too small and pretentious...it doesn't compare with the roof top restaurants of California.

title: Impressive views
comment: We went there last Saturday night and I must say that it had beautiful views of London. The rooftop bar was brimming with people (albeit a bit too crowded) but we enjoyed it very much. As you'd expect, drinks were ridiculously expensive. We paid £40 for two rum+coke and two beers! The whole experience is definitely worth it if you visit London. The best bit was actually the elevator! It goes up quite quickly and the views from there are superb. Maybe not for the faint hearted who have fear of height. Definitely a must visit.

title: Overrated
comment: You pay for the height + views - if you do manage to step outside. The food is very average - over-priced for what it is, if you go there, perhaps stick to the bar - those too are pricey cocktails. A place to try once, but not a place I'd return to.

title: Fantastic
comment: We went there for my girlfriend B-day. From the reservation to the quality of food and service, everything was just perfect.   Many thanks to Marina from reservations who made this important evening become possible. She did her job very well and really helped us.   Food is insane good. Service is on high standard, they really care of you, warm people specially the french guy Clemont ( not sure about the name ) . Not to mention that desert was from the house ( !!! ) just like that, including the b-day cake. Even the security, he noticed we just finished dinner and allowed us to avoid the queue and enter back on terrace.   View is amazing ( 38th floor ), prices might be a bit spicy but it is understandable for the location, services and food quality.  Thank you !

title: Amazing!!
comment: This place definitely has the wow factor! Went here for a spontaneous night out last Saturday. We got straight in but if you don't want to stand in line it might be worth to book in advance. Had to wait a bit for a free table, but that was no problem. When we were seated the restaurant did not disappoint, great service and the best food we have eaten out in a long time...the calamari was the best we have ever had. After dinner we had drinks on the roof terrace...a bit crowded but that did not bother us....it was a beautiful summer evening so great to be outside. The place is a bit pricy, but the I three floors with restaurants/bars and views of London are amazing so well worth it!

title: absolutely amazing
comment: please, if you're frustrated don't make bad comment abaout this wonderful restaurant, i've been here several times, and alway had best tasty food ever, incredible service, and the venue is amazing. a perfect organization. the price is right for this place. and if is always crowded that tells you something.

title: delirious
comment: absolutely mouth watering experience! I cannot describe enough how fantastically delicious each bit is!  Tasty tips: green tempura beans and the calamari are perfection! did not like the mixto from the raw section. Practical tips: book way in advance. During evenings the restaurant is very lively with loud music and young atmosphere. So beautiful to sit on the terrace overlooking the Gurkin Tower and London Bridge while sipping a glass of wine! A well deserved treat and perfect present for your loved ones on a special occasion.

title: Well worth the wait
comment: Let's be honest even after 2 years this is one of the most popular restaurants in London. Because of this I have no issues waiting a while for our reservation tonight, especially as it was so good. The staff are friendly and attentive with a special mention to our waiter Vincent who was not only attentive but genuinely friendly with a good insight to the menu.  I have read some of the bad reviews about this restaurant and yes it is obviously a place to be 'seen' but I can honestly say the friendly banter of the staff, including some interesting bathroom directions, made this a happy place to while the hours away. Added to all of this the food was amazing and if you can get a reservation make it a definite stop whilst in London.

title: We will be back
comment: Absolutely amazing , the food was very tasty, service very attentive , quirky cocktails and of course views to die for! Cannot wait to go back! Thank you sushisamba for a great evening!

title: Second to none!
comment: Wow wow wow...  Once we arrived in to the bar area staff were friendly the bar was very busy but the drinks were perfect and I can't complain about the price, the atmosphere was wicked so lively and bubbly I couldn't wait to get our table.  After just receiving our first drink we were shown to our table and we were lucky enough to be right next to the window with 5* views which was perfect.  I honestly cannot remember everything we ordered all I know is everything I ate was 10/10 and had the wow factor. Because it was our first time and a special occasion we went all out and tried everything we wanted to.  Our waiter was mediocre I wanted more info on the food as it was my first time I thought he would be more knowledgeable and helpful but maybe he was busy! luckily the food and drinks made up for it :)  The only thing I wasn't happy with was dessert I had some sort of mousse and it was warm very weird didn't like it. but my partner enjoyed his so of course he was made to share!  Be prepared for a healthy bill it's not the kind of place to go if you can't enjoy it and experiment, our bill was £230 I was drinking champagne and my partner old fashioned. Definitely can be done cheaper if your not big drinkers like us.

title: Superb
comment: I have previously not been a fan of sushi and definitely expect to enjoy the food as much as I did! I cannot stop raving about the food here. I visited for a business meetings but cannot wait to take my wife back here as a treat.  The staff were friendly and unpretentious whilst the views were phenomenal, not to mention the elevator!  The tuna, gyoza and sea bass were my favourites though every dish was beautiful. I'd recommend getting an array of small plates and sharing, as it means you get to samples loads of different flavours while you are here. The peruvian corn is also great!  As you can expect, it is pricey but well worth it for the quality and experience, so not complaining at all, just a heads up! I cannot wait to come back.

title: Amazing View!!
comment: My family of four went here a couple of weeks ago, and it was amazing!! I had been to Sushi Samba before in Miami, but my brother, sister, & Dad had never been, so it was exciting to experience this. Unfortunately, it had just stopped raining before we got there, so we were not able to sit outside. After taking the elevator to the 38th floor, you walk through the bar area to the hostess, and they take you through a hall to the restaurant. As you can see from pictures, the décor is simply beautiful!! We went right as the sun was setting so it was beautiful to watch it from the 38th floor and the waiters were all very attentive in moving around the room and lowering/raising the blinds so that the sun did not blind anyone.  Because this is a tapas style restaurant, we ordered a bunch of small plates to split amoung the four of us. Our favorites were the shrimp tempura, the wagyu gyoza, and the steak teriyaki skewers. The California rolls that we ordered were amazing as well! For dessert, we were pretty stuffed, so we ordered chocolate truffles for us to all share. Our server was very attentive, and we left very satisfied!! On our way out, we noticed that the terrace was open, so we went out there to take some pictures, and one of the waiters passing by offered to take a picture of us. Overall, it was an amazing experience, and I am so happy we had decided to go there! Definitely a restaurant to return to - especially with a view like that!!

title: Beautiful but...
comment: ...over-expensive 100GBP for a mediocre bottle of wine? No thank you ..otherwise food is delicious and the views are awe

title: Best view, food & service
comment: With million dollar views of London, food that is so tasty I wanted to lick the plates clean and very good service from the knowledgable staff, it's no wonder that SushiSamba is one of my new favourite restaurants! I would recommend ordering many dishes and sharing them all, this way you can taste all of the amazing flavours, texture and genius behind each dish! Remember to book atleast 2 months in advance!

title: What a FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE at SUSHISAMBA
comment: I took my Mum & Daughter to SUSHISAMBA for a surprise birthday treat & everything was perfect!!! The quality of the food & great service matches the views..that you would pay good money for anywhere in the world. Marc, Mantis & all the team there get Gold Stars for going the extra mile. England might might not do football or cricket very well..but when it comes to high altitude dining it doesn't get any better!!(even though we do need a little help from the Brazilians, Peruvians & Japanese!!). For assistance with the menu be sure to ask any of the staff for info & recommendations..we will be back soon x For booking assistance as the place is popular try booking online from the SUSHISAMBA website & be prepared to be flexible with table timings. Your PERSISTANCE will be rewarded..A GASTRONOMIC TREAT x

title: Lovely food
comment: Food was amazing. Quite pricey buy extremely yummy. Not enough men there though to keep me there for the whole evening. 90% female.  Fantastic non alcoholic cocktails. Im training so don't drink. Had a great lychee one then a berry mango one. Steak was incredible. Fun times had by all.

title: Wasn't alloved to go up without reservation
comment: The little black man at the entrance wouldn't let me go up because I didn't have a reservation. Really? I think you gonna loose a lot of business because of this now. Messing with the wrong person. I am going to leave it at that.

title: Gorgeous rooftop restaurant
comment: Incredible atmosphere and wonderful vegetarian options. The team were really friendly and helpful. It was a really special night and we were very well taken care of. Would and will recommend.

title: Cool outdoor bar
comment: Came here on a business dinner and absolutely loved it. Started with drinks on their rooftop bar terrace which is very unique, especially at that height! The taster menu we then had was stunning. Best Japanese beef I've ever tired. Very well presented and felt very special. Would definitely recommend.

title: Suprisingly tasty!
comment: Sushisamba has an extensive and interesting menu. Our party of four managed to share about 12 different dishes from the menu and each one of those dishes was very tasty and nicely presented. Our favourites were the green beans in tempura batter (£6.50), black cod £17.50), lobster tataki (?) (daily special) and banana chocolate cake dessert (£10). The tempura sea bass (£23) and wagyu beef (£49) dishes were ok but not worth the cost. The restaurant 'look' is stylish modern and probably as to be expected in a restaurant using space in an office block! We found the service provided to be very good. We all said we would definitely like to eat there again and I suppose the special location, good service and the very tasty food just about justifies the high prices.

title: Second visit didn't disappoint
comment: Fabulous meal once again at Sushi Samba. This time we took friends and its always tricky when you have raved about a place only to find that you remembered it through "rose tinted" glasses. This visit lived up to our hype. It really delivers what it says it will. Our waiter was a little over exuberant but he recommended dishes for us and he took on board our likes and dislikes. Whilst it is quite expensive it really is worth pushing out the boat for that extra special occasion. It rained whilst we were inside so having a digestive outside later was tricky. It was only early when we left our table 21.00 so outside could have been dried up and the chairs put out then we would have been encouraged to stay longer. Disappointed that people through their cigarette ends off the balcony to a ledge below! Smokers, please deal with your tabs appropriately and don't spoil the view for the rest of us.

title: Great view and tasty food
comment: My friend took me here as a treat today and I was blown away by the service, the food and the view! Staff were very friendly and helpful and the food was delicious!

title: View worth paying for!
comment: Went there on a Wednesday evening. Just wanted a cocktail - got thoroughly looked upon on arrival, do not try wearing jeans there.. Views are amazing, cocktails pricey but worth it (they managed to fit a quarter of a watermelon in my glass); very international clientele. did not try the food so will not comment.  Overall, nice for a glam start to a night out!

title: Visitors beware
comment: Spent a lovely, though hot, day in London on Saturday with girl friends, Hatton Garden, cocktails, dinner and then onto the O2 for a concert. All going well until we got to Sushi Samba for cocktails at 4.30 to be turned away because we had 'flip flops' on. Readers please note, we were dressed well (long dresses not short), good jewellery, make up etc and the 'flip flops' that were deemed to be offensive were top of the range 'evening attire' Fit Flops - for those not in the know they don't come cheap.
