We had a friend with us from overseas who was very much looking forward to having cocktails looking over the London skyline, and so as not to upset what had up until that stage been a lovely day out, I 'questioned' their policy but did not take it any further as it appeared to be quite clear there were no exceptions. To add insult to injury, the next couple waiting to get in were in standard summer 'sightseeing' clothing and had what looked like cheap 'sandals' on which had far less foot coverage than our footwear, but because there was a small strap going round the back of the heel they were acceptable. I could even understand it if we were there later in the evening when people were dining, but it was 4.30pm for goodness sake. Oh, and had we arrived half an hour earlier we would have been let in!! Readers can make their own minds up about the rights or wrongs of this policy, but personally I believe this establishment needs to get over itself and enter the 21st century. We instead went to the 1901 bar at the 5 star Andaz hotel, which may not have the views, but is still a beautiful bar with welcoming staff who obviously were not 'embarrassed' by our attire.

title: Great views and nice staff
comment: Nice place to have a drink in the late afternoon. Fantastic views towards the City and the Swiss Re tower. Nice and unpretending staff, which was a good surprise in this kind of place. The super-fast glass elevator which gets you there is by itself worth the experience!

title: Believe the hype - but be prepared to pay for it
comment: A great location - and views are terrific. Bar area has a real buzz to it - and offers some intersting cocktails - things I've not seend before. Service was great and menu innovative - and as someone who generally doesn't eat sushi - this I actually really enjoyed - give it a try. We were advised to order one dish form each "section" of the menu for each 2 people - 5 or 6 I think -this was a little more than needed - but not too much so. Service was great - friendly and attentive throughout. Bill was very expensive - one of the highest I've paid in London - so strictly for business or VERY special occaisions.

title: amazing food,views and atmosphere
comment: what an amazing experience...from the lift, the views, the very knowledgeable, friendly staff...the food which was simply stunning...it is a bit expensive however you get what you pay for and was worth every penny...really wanted to experience the outside bar however they was no 'smoke free' zone so a bit disappointed there however the atmosphere and buzz from the restaurant made up for it.

title: Great location ... better food!
comment: Normally I find that location/venue based restaurants fail to deliver in some major way - the venue / view may be amazing but the food / service lacks. SushiSamba does not at all. The venue is amazing, great roof top terrace for drinks, and the combination menu is very varied and allows a lot of experimentation. Burgers with Sushi.....check..... tempura prawns with fillet steak check!  Let your waiter guide you through the decision making process and be prepared to experiment would be my recommendation... But do leave room for the desert sampler plate.... at £25 not cheap....but a very good showpiece to end the meal. We came with a seven year old for dinner...and whilst getting some funny looks from other diners, the waiters and rest of staff didn't blink at all. Even made her a special burger (wagyu beef !). Well recommended. Enjoy every second.

title: Wow
comment: Very, very nice restaurant. It's a beautiful place, with beautiful food. Sit on the terrace at night time if you can it's mind blowing!!! Very expensive, but sometimes it's worth it and this place is worth it.

title: Wonderful experience
comment: We went for a Sunday lunch. The service was great and so was the food. The pork belly we had for starters was absolutely fantastic. I would go back just to have it again. The view was great as well. All in all, a very memorable meal. I totally recommend it.

title: Pure excellence
comment: I went to this restaurant yesterday. I had some drinks in the terrace. I was served by a really friendly Hungarian bartender called Mathias. I had a lovely time, the atmosphere was relaxing and the drinks absolutely delicious. Thank you so much!

title: the six from the 40th floor ventured down to the 38th floor
comment: Popped in for a look after lunch in the Duck & Waffle, when I say popped in, we ended up staying for four hours! Drinks and bar snacks thats all we had and a throughly nice time. Unfortunately the weather wasn't that good so we had to sit inside. However very few seats but we managed to get hold of some after about 30 mins. Will come back and try the food at some point but he atmosphere was great and by the time we left at 8PM it was quite busy.

title: Amazing!! Best night!
comment: We came to sushi samba for a friends birthday and I can not fault it! Amazing food, amazing atmosphere, amazing service and of course amazing views! I look forward to returning again soon!

title: Perfect Lunch
comment: We had lovely lunch in this Restaurant. Table next to the window with a beautiful views, all the staff is very nice, in special our waiter, his name is Max, we followed all his recommendations and he made our lunch perfect. The food was delicious, shrimps, cod, sushi...After lunch we moved to the bar where we could enjoy a cocktail with another amazing views. It is true that is expensive but for us the experience was worthy.

title: Nice for a drink and dinner
comment: Friday evening, 7pm: we waited around 30min to get in - but worth the wait- and reach the 38floor! I had the luggage with me and they have free of charge service to keep bags and jackets. We had a drink on the rooftop (24£), while waiting to be seated at the bar inside for dinner (40min wait, but good if you have a drink in the meanwhile). We had 2 small plate, 1 big, 1 dessert and water (76£). The waiter was nice and suggested us a very good dessert! I will go again!

title: Delicious. Delicious. Delicious.
comment: The kitchen is lead by the young executive head chef Claudio Cardoso. He is a rising star in the culinary world and is one to watch. Sushi Samba is located on the 38th floor of the imposing Heron Tower on Bishopsgate in the City of London (right opposite Liverpool St Station). The entrance is a short, fast ride in the glass lift on the exterior of the building giving commanding views of the west end and beyond. On entering your nerves will be immediately settled by the lovely bar serving an eclectic range of cocktails through to a fine selection of wines. Once suitably refreshed you are led into the main dining room where all the tables have been carefully arranged to offer optimum comfort and viewing. The set up is over two floors with a second bar upstairs and a private area as well. The food is offered both 'a la carte' or as a legacy from their American roots 'family style' where a selection of signature dishes are brought out for you to experience and enjoy amongst friends. The style is Peruvian meet Brazil meet Japan and what results this combination brings to the table. From the sushi to the Chilean sea bass in a miso marinade with a multitude of delights in between you will not be disappointed.  They serve the most delectable lobster tostadas and the lightest tempura I have had in recent times. This place is set to stay and is consistent with their other global locations in both high quality service and ingredients used. The chefs creativity knows no bounds it seems. I have little doubt we will be seeing more of them soon. Meanwhile you can see more of me on Twitter @busy_dan

title: Great View
comment: Well worth visiting for the view and the elevator ride! We went there at lunch and each had a beer (before going somewhere else for lunch) and it was over $50! I have eaten the food there before, good but very expensive.

title: A beautiful bar overlooking London, and incredible Sushi
comment: A bar like this is expensive, of course, in the City of London at the top of the Heron tower it is going to be. But it is a really treat for a special occasion. We had a drink in the bar and admired the views, and ordered some sushi to enjoy whilst there. The sit down restaurant looked gorgeous and we shall certainly be back to experience it. We didn't have a reservation as it was midweek, but usually you would need to have one. Dress nicely and enjoy a cocktail and sushi side dishes whilst looking at the gorgeous city.

title: More about the place than the food
comment: sushi samba is the place to go to for a special occasion - and eat leisurely over a couple of hours with your loved ones. The view (it's on the 38th floor) is spectacular - always ask for a table by the window or close to it. Booking may be a tedious process and they are often booked out so advisable to call with due notice (they do dinner tables until 1130pm on weekends and you can hold a table for three hours ). But the best slot to book is around 730pm in the summer when you see the sunset and earlier if it's winter.  Service - always courteous. The waiter's recommendations are spot on usually but they may try to rush you (not in a rude way).. I felt there was an emphasis on getting the order out of the way quickly . But hold your own and take your time with your food - they leave you alone once you indicate you don't want to rush ;) my advice is to order lots of small plates to share and not everything at once so you can eat at leisure . Portions are small so order several plates. Food - it's Japanese- Peruvian fusion cuisine (just lots of small plates of seafood and meats to share as well as veg options). Their food is not the best given the price tag but it's good. My recommendations are the fried calamari (which is well seasoned and yum), the stir fried prawns dish, the fried beans, and the tacos (if you like fish ). The jalapeño yellow tail sashimi is also nice, sushi is decent too. Black cod is excellent and in the big plate mushroom dish with plain rice is another favourite - ask for it without egg (that way they put more sauce in it and it's nicer). In desserts - rio - it's made of dark chocolate, milk chocolate and coffee is the best (even though I don't like dark chocolate it's a very nice flavour not too bitter) , also like the banana cake. The rest of it pretty average and the Peruvian chocolate with chilli sounds exotic but didn't meet my expectations. For vegetarians there is not too much choice but once you inform your server they go out of their way to create dishes for you. Avoid the sushi though as just didn't work in veg.   Dress code - smart casual. For lunch people are casually dressed (didn't see any shorts though) and gets a bit more dressy towards evening. Jeans and a shirt/smart top should do just fine although I make an extra effort every time I go. Price tag - Atleast 50pounds per head and could go up to around 80-100 depending on how much you drink. Directions - opposite Liverpool street station - 5 minute walk

title: Great views, excellent food & fantastic service!
comment: I would highly recommend Sushi Samba if you are looking for great food with a perfect atmosphere. So many great restaurants lack in ambience, but not here. From start to finish we had an amazing experience. This is a perfect venue for an intimate dinner or for a night out with friends. Yes it was on the pricey side, however I have often paid the same elsewhere & left feeling that something was lacking. Sushi Samba ticked every box for us, can't wait to return!

title: SushiSamba London - amazing!
comment: I visited SushiSamba with six work colleagues as we wanted to try somewhere a bit different, and we weren't disappointed!! Everything about this place is great. Our server Pablo was on hand and explained the food and its background, and suggested some very tasty dishes indeed, and our wine glass was never empty!  I was a little hesitant looking at the menu online as it looked rather complicated, but I needn't have been! I would suggest having lots of smaller dishes as opposed to one big dish, especially if you are in a large group, there's plenty to go around and it only takes 5-10 minutes if you wish to order another lot. (We ordered the pork belly dish three times!!) On top of the service and food there is obviously the view as you are 38 floors up... it's amazing! We went at 5 so was very light outside, but I can image when the sun goes down, or at night it will be even better! As for price, I personally think it's good value, but I am from London so used to paying it. It's on average £13 a dish, which usually 4-6 people can share, and you'll need around 10 of them. For a table of 6 people, with a few bottles of wine and plenty of food, your looking at £300, so £50 each - which I don't think is half bad! Oh - and don't be a fraidy-cat about the lift that catapults you to the top in no time like I was.  Hope you enjoy it as much as I did!

title: Expensive but well worth it
comment: If you go on a sunny day as we did last week then this place is very impressive. Really nice food with good Pan Asian infusion and decent wines plus very good service. But it's the view and the terrace bar with it's cocktails etc that this place is all about. Stunning

title: Views and Sushi at SushiSamba
comment: Loved the Laid back feel that the bar area exudes. On site DJ et al. Went for drinks and sushi and Loved it to celebrate my last week end in London. Sushi was divine. Our group opted for Champas but the cocktails was interestingly presented and equally delicious from the sips I had. The sunset views are stunning and in true adventurer style decided to do a trip to the top bar which was my favourite. Very swanky!

title: Get what you pay for
comment: Obviously sushi samba is expensive and has some of the best views over London, but is also serves equally as good food. I ate here in on a Saturday night in October 2013, the bar/restaurant clientel was a mix of buisness class, couples and tourists, all taking in the view of the London skyline. Staff were helpful and efficient, they allowed us to stay in the bar for a while before sitting down so it made us feel like they werent in the buisness of flipping tables.  The food is by far the best i have had in a while, each item comes bueatifully presented and perfect amount to leave you wanting more.  It does cost more than other restaurants in the area but id say it is worth every penny. Tip; book well in advance unless you are well connected

title: Incredible
comment: We have chosen this restaurant because it is at the 38th floor of the Heron Tower and we wanted to have a good view. We thought that the food would be OK. In fact, the view was indeed nice but the food was even better! The sushis are very good, and the beef made with Brasilian style is awesome. There are moreover plenty of different very good sakes. The service was also very good. To be recommended for special occasions! Do not forget to book in advance.

title: Excellent service
comment: Went to sushi samba with some girlfriends. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. The view and the bar outside has an amazing view. Beautiful watching the sun go down.

title: Excellent service
comment: Went to sushi samba with my girlfriends this week. Excellent service and food. Amazing view of the sun going down at the outside bar,

title: Rude and useless staff....
comment: This is one of the most impressive bars I have been to, a great location with a great view. Unfortunately the staff are arrogant, slow and VERY rude and the drinks are over priced, even for the City. I waited 15 minutes for 2 drinks, not because the bar was busy but because the over inflated 'pretty boy' waiters were serving ladies first and ignoring male customers. They staff were then making rude and disrespectful remarks about the ladies when they left the bar area. This is a clearly a great bar but run my inept management.  Sushisamba staff, get over yourselves, you are barmen, be barmen/women and try and be a bit more professional.

title: Chick, dream, and good food
comment: When my friends took us there we first thought "oh my gosh! can we afford it?" But turnned out to be ok.. Worth every minute. The view, the bar wait, the service, the excelent cuisine. We loved it and would go back.

title: What a surprise!
comment: Went with 4 friends the other night and I have to say wasn't too optimistic as I do not like sushi as the title suggests. Never heard of the place before but started off well with a panoramic lift view from 40 stories. We were ushered into the terrace bar where the service was quite appalling, only 2 people to serve dozens as this is obviously also a well known City drinking haunt. Took 30 mins to get served mainly as there were lots of people having cocktails and the barmen couldn't cope. Things improved dramatically though when we got to the table. Our Polish waitress Karolina really looked after us and in fact dictated - in the nicest way - what we should have. Effectively lots of small dishes rather like Tapas but these were Brazilian and Japanese as far as I knew. And they were amazingly tasty especially the pork belly finishing off with a great pudding which I can't remember! Certainly recommend this restaurant for all tastes as they really manage to mix all the flavours. Great experience.

title: Restaurant with a view
comment: Since it was a short notice the only table reservation we could get for a table was 11.15 pm. A 20+ minute taxi ride from Mayfair brought us to the restaurant which is on the 38th floor of Heron Tower. A long narrow passage from the elevator led us into a large bar, the restaurant was adjoining the bar. Immediately after we were seated we were told that the last order was 11.45 and we should order the food even before ordering drinks.  The ambiance and food were good, but we could not order anything more after the first order as the kitchen staff had left. The waiting staff was friendly and the service good.

title: Wow, Wow, Wow,Wow!!!!
comment: Love it, Love it, Love it - expensive but just simply deevine and worth every single penny - the views are breathtaking, the food a taste adventure, and the service outstanding - a MUST. Visit when in London!!!! Can not wait for my next visit!

title: Delicious, creative food with good service and great view
comment: The restaurant is on the 38th/39th floor and offers a great view of the city. The food is neither Japanese nor Brazilian; it is more of a fusion of Japanese and South America. Regardless, the food is well prepared and very delicious. Some of my favorites are black cod robata (a must-try dish), sea bass tempura and pork belly. For dessert, we got From Rio with Love, which is to die for.  The portions are not big, but are adequate for someone with a normal appetite. The service was very good, and the waitress was attentive but not intrusive.

title: Seviche with an Ssssss at Tast of London
comment: lovely tuna ceviche with a Leche de Tigre sauce thingy magiggy and a basil beetroot Macaroon on top... fresh zesty flavours... macaroon was fantastic,,I thought the wasabi peas and black eyed peas if that is what they were, were too dry but I understand they added them for texture... otherwise very good.

title: Meal of a lifetime
comment: We booked up to go to Sushi Samba for my girlfriend's birthday meal. The restaurant is situated on level 38 in Heron Tower, which is a stones throw from London Liverpool Street Station. To say the lift was quick was an understatement, with people turning into miniature size ants within seconds. We had great seats, a beautiful panorama of London and it was irresistible not to take photos.  The waiters were incredibly attentive without being pushy or encroaching. The waiter we had was a charming man who recommended us to pick 5-6 smaller plates and dishes as it was our first time to get a broader feel of the food.  The food was as aforementioned a fusion between Brazilian and Japanese. The most breathtaking dish I had was the El Topo, which included salmon, coated in freshly melted mozzarella, and had Jalapeño in it. The shrimp tempura was also phenomenal and I would definitely recommend that to start with, creamy and extremely appetising. Every time the waiters and waitresses brought out the dishes, they explained carefully what was in the dish. Which was a nice touch, as I for one wasn't familiar with some of the ingredients in some of the dishes. And the staff were on hand to explain in a non-patronising, friendly manner. Moreover the cocktails were sublime, the real cherry on top.  All in all, the novelty of eating up a skyscraper, the superb food, attentive staff, made for an unforgettable evening. Whole-heartedly recommend.

title: A real treat
comment: Finally managed to secure a table at this unique venue - had been trying for ages. Visited on a Friday night in a group of 7. The ride up to the 38th floor in a glass elevator makes for a great entrance and offers unparalleled views of London - which I tried but failed to make a video of on my smartphone! The bar was buzzing and the restaurant was busy too. Tables are well spaced and the accompanying soundtrack (and excellent sound system) makes you want to get up and dance. We were seated in the centre of the restaurant - next time I would opt for a seat near the window to make the most of the views. The popular rooftop bar has one of the highest terraces in London and upon stepping out on to it I realised what all the rave reviews were about - it was also a real thrill to see the orange tree light up as the sun went down. We tucked into small plates (including the very lovely yuzu scallops), followed by raw and then grilled fish, as well as samba rolls, all expertly prepared (you can watch the chefs at work in the nearby open kitchen) and beautifully presented. I loved the Shiso Fine cocktail in particular which is (Ketel One) vodka- based with a decorative bleed of creme de cassis it looks as good as it tastes. The staff were welcoming and very attentive and really helped make our visit an enjoyable experience - I really cannot fault anything! The bars on the floors above including the Duck and Waffle bar are also worth a visit. All in all, Sushi Samba made for a bit of a pricey night but we left very satisfied customers.

title: Don't visit this Bar overpriced with Awful service
comment: Just experienced the worst service ever at this over priced bar. If a premium price is charged you should expect to be served by helpful curteous staff. Not the case and this establishment should be avoided.

title: Average food, good views
comment: You pay a lot for the view here and so it was particularly frustrating that the main terrace with 'the view' off the dining room was reserved for a private party. No warning of this in advance and no way you could go out for a quick peek. Poor.  The food was just ok, certainly not worth the price tag. The sushi was particularly disappointing and no better than your average Itsu. The black cod was great though.  Only go here if you want to pose, it's not a serious food place. Try the Shard for drinks and somewhere like City Social for decent food, high up in the sky!

title: Drinks with a view
comment: Didn't eat here, but had cocktails. Sat outside on the terrace. Great views. Enjoyed the very quick glass lift to the top. Friendly staff and worth a visit. Just avoid the cucumber cocktail. Really, really vile and repeated on me all afternoon.

title: Average Sushi - Fun Experience
comment: This place is always packed, weekdays, weekends - you'll need to book in advance. The interior is nice and of course there is the novelty of the fast lift and multiple views. It's vibrant and busy whether for after work drinks or dinner (even when our table was at 11.30pm).  Most people dress smartly, which is nice but it's relatively unpretentious so don't feel you have to necessarily dress 'up'. On the contrary you'll have a higher chance of 'drinks at the bar' when they are busy if you dress above the code. They can, and will refuse entry - whether full or not.  The service is nice in the restaurant and also the top bar (cocktails are more interesting here). The roof terrace bar service leaves a lot to be desired, particularly when busy. I've visited twice in the last month and drinks have taken a ridiculous amount of time/been wrong etc. It's off putting. Far from the best Sushi I've eaten in London - some might be a little disappointed given the price. The scallops were unimpressive, as were a few other dishes - I wasn't happy with the Wasabi type substitute (silly pet hate). The wagu beef, however, is worth is worth a try. On a more positive note we all loved the view, buzzy atmosphere, ambience and have had fun evenings here. There is a clear 'feel good factor' drinking and dining here - being predominantly a young crowd, people are out to enjoy themselves. Time spent here is not about fine Sushi but a fun, social experience everybody should try once.

title: Great view ineffective staff
comment: In recent months the staff here have got a bit too big for their boots. Visited Saturday afternoon and got a drink first, at one stage their was 6 (YES SIX) members of staff behind the bar and the only person serving decided to start cleaning, sorting the float out, rearranging bottles etc, anything apart from serving customers. Then when they serve you they talk down to their customers and very patronising. The place could and should be amazing, but the staff let it down. They put at 12.5% service charge on drinks you have to queue and collect yourself, disgraceful.

title: Tourist Attraction v Relaxing Bar
comment: I visited around 6pm Sunday evening with my husband for a drink. We did not eat there. We went to the 40th floor. We were greeted as we entered and shown to a couple of spaces where we were immediately served some iced water before being served our drinks.. The service was good, the staff polite. The view was amazing. However, this not the place to come for a relaxing atmosphere. There were far too many people loitering on the stairs taking photographs which made the place feel like a tourist attraction rather than the relaxing bar it is meant to be.  I can't understand why an iconic place such as this, has rickety, old, uncomfortable bar stools. What are they thinking of? The stool I had had uneven feet so it was constantly wobbling about! Some of the light bulbs in the bar were not working and I was not impressed by the extremely tatty paper drinks menus ( without prices ) ywe were handed - surely they could have been presented in menu holders to keep them looking presentable and I would also have appreciated some prices. Our 2 glasses of wine cost £27 inc.service. I can only recommend Sushi Samba as a tourist attraction and not a place to have a quiet drink and relax in comfortable, stylish surroundings.

title: Is great view enough to pay over £100 for a bill?
comment: My first advice for those who wish to dine at SushiSamba - book in advance. We had to book a table one and a half month in advance in order to come at an adequate time.  Then, I'll be honest - the view is just stunning, the restaurant and terrace look great, very modern and cozy. We really liked the service, all waiters were very attentive and polite. I was also quite lucky with my cocktail - something with mango and passion fruit. But... When we first looked at the prices, we thought it was quite reasonable. £15 - £20 for a dish, why not? Later,the waiter explained to us that we had to choose at least 5 or 6 dishes for a proper dinner as the portions were very small and apparently, he was right. We ordered a mix of seafood, meaty and poultry dishes and the very best one was Poussin Teriyaki. Other dishes, some of which described as signature, were OK, but definitely not the best ones we have ever tried.  At the end, we were brought a bill of £140 and normally I would not complain taking into account such a great location and the exceptional view of SushiSamba. However, this time I really thought it was too much for a dinner we got. Simply because the food was nothing special.  So, overall, great place for cocktails and atmosphere. Full stop.

title: Delicious with a great view
comment: Loved the meal at SushiSamba. Apart from the amazing view, the thrilling ride up the external elevator and the funky decor, the meal itself was lovely. The ribs are to die for and all of the flavours combined beautifully. Highly recommended.

title: Very tasty and beautifully presented.
comment: My partner and I went on a Sunday afternoon to finish off a birthday weekend in London. We arrived about an hour before our reservation and had a cocktail in the bar whilst enjoying the amazing view.  In a lot of cases having an amazing view quite often means the service and food are poor by comparison. Not the case here!! Our friendly waitress gave us some great recommendations on the food which took and were glad we did. A must is the Tuna taquitos which don't sound particularly Japanese but were so good they hit the top of my list of what we had. Another must is the tiger maki which were superbly presented and unbelievably tasty. Overall we ordered 5 dishes which was a perfect amount for two people and left us room for dessert which is not to be missed.

title: Unbelievable view
comment: While on a business trip to London I had a chance to dine at Sushi Samba. First of all, I’m a sushi junkie. I eat sushi at least 2-3 times per month and love sampling at different restaurants. I was completely underwhelmed by the food. I’m not saying the food was terrible, but I’ve had FAR FAR better sushi and given the décor and dining experience at Sushi Samba one would expect nothing but the best. At one point I asked for smoked salmon nigiri, one of my Go-To selections. I was told they only had regular salmon. I then asked for peppercorn tuna nigiri, one of my second Go-To selections. I was told they only had regular tuna. Huh? The restaurant brought us a variety of fusion options from the appetizer menu. Some of the items were really creative and interesting, but most of them were average at best. The pork belly was delicious.  This restaurant is ALL about the view. 38 floors up, the outdoor bar and patio area cannot be beat. A 270+ degree view of London from 38 floors up with a glass of wine in your hand is unbeatable. WOW. I did get the feeling this is a “seen and be seen” establishment for locals in London. At least that was my experience. Overall the scenic view, bar, and happy hour experience earned a solid A+. The food quality. Meh. I’ll give it a D+ AT BEST.

title: Brilliant for beginning of the evening cocktails
comment: We arrived at the Heron Tower at about 6:30pm on a Thursday and were able to go straight up in the vertigo-inducing lift to the bar. There is an outdoor area with beautiful fires you can stand next to to keep warm. The views, especially once the sun goes down, are stunning and it feels quite special. The cocktails were about £15, so on the pricey side, but no watering down goes on here. They were absolutely delicious!! I really want to go back just to have the one with shiso again, it was so good! We did not eat anything here, as we found the sushi on the bar menu extremely overpriced, which was a shame, as I would have liked to have tried it.

title: Good view, good food
comment: Marvellous view over the city and excellent fusion food: Peruvian and Japanese. Reservation is a must. Ideal to impress guests from abroad.

title: amazing view
comment: The view is amazing, the local as well, but is very expensive to get a drink here and if you want to eat something, the porzion is very small. I recommend to go only to have something to drink and enjoying the view of London.

title: Sushi at altitude
comment: Not only is the view one of the most amazing it is matched with really good food and excellent service. We were lucky enough to be there on a warm summer evening and got to see a great sunset.

title: Dizzy Heights
comment: Well this is one of the restaurants on the must go to list so we went. My summary is as follows. Amazing entrance, flying high over London in a glass lift that travels at the most incredible speed. The outside bar on a sunny evening is fab but the service was so slow.... I mean really slow. If they had had more staff I think their takings would increase by at least 25%. Cocktail bars need plenty of people serving as the drinks take so long to prepare. When we did get our drinks they were good and the views are amazing. So on to the food. Well if I am honest I didn't like the menu it was a bit confusing. We ended up going with the waiters advice. Everything was expensive as you would expect but you don't get much for your money. Service was patchy, very camp at times and a few of the staff were a bit grumpy. At this level of cost you expect nothing but the best.The actual restaurant has a wow factor going on but if you want a great food experience have drinks here and then go to Le Trois Garcon just up the road. Overall a good night but not the wow night we were expecting. I was honestly expecting so much more.

title: Great food with a view!
comment: We walked by the entrance of this restaurant by accident. As we were curious how the view will be on top of the building we wanted to try it out and got lucky as usually a reservation is required to go up (it was on a Sunday evening). Already the very fast glass elevator was a cool experience to see the city from top. When we ordered the food it got explained that the concept is about the fusion between Japanese, Brasilian and Peruanian food. We just ordered a wide range of different items and shared them eating with sticks. It was absolutely delicious. We had only little waiting time and the quality was top notch. Also they have a pretty cool outdoor bar with lounge sofas to enjoy the view and listen to well selected background music.

title: Always an unforgettable experience
comment: Sushisamba never fails to disappoint! The restaurant itself is beautiful; cool modern style with incredible views over London. The food is a fantastic combination of flavours. Dinner at Sushisamba is an overall positive experience, the waiters are attentive and make you feel at home. In particular Remi, one of the managers, is very friendly and helps make an already wonderful moment even better! I highly recommend Sushisamba for any occasion, its worth every penny.

title: Top bar
comment: Really great bar- amazing cocktails- blue cheese and chocolate, parma violet.... not sure about the one in a polystyrene cup but the bottle and bagged one looked great!  Exciting ride up in the lift to the 39th floor (and down- scary!) really lovely staff who explained everything to us. Luxuriously wacky décor- kitsch trees and chandeliers. Great night out. Will take friends for the experience.

title: Amazing experience
comment: Busy bar and the terrace was full but the restaurant service was impeccable. Amazing service from the manager Remy and our French server. Helpful with the menu and a gift desert to commemorate our anniversary meal. Good views and an awesome time were had by my wife and I. Top marks.

title: Amazing sushi and views
comment: Some of the best sushi I have ever had anywhere in the world. Lovely cocktails and fantastic service. No problem with the door staff, they were polite and helpful. I've read a few of the other reviews and found them a little confusing, so my advise is: - It's a top London restaurant, so dress smart or they are within their rights to refuse you entry (would you wear jeans and trainers to Le Gavroche? - It's not cheap, it's an amazing venue and their rent is probably sky high - Book in advance, it's a top quality restaurant a d will be busy

title: The view is for 5*, sushi though is for 3*
comment: Sushi Samba was the coolest London sushi restaurant to go to 2 years ago. Since then, the food quality is not the same. The view is indeed fantastic, the décor amazing (kind of sex and the city style), the service is excellent but the sushi is just good. And for a London Michelin restaurant where competition is high, just good is simply not good enough. Sushi lacks creativity and real taste.  I think though that someone should go there at least once for the experience and the view. Be prepared to book way in advance and of course pay the relevant amount of having lunch/dinner to one of the London skyscrapers.

title: The view is everything
comment: You can't say anything. Who wants to spend this amount of money on sushis or an average bottle of "non french" white wine? You go there for the amazing view and it totally worths it!

title: Incredible view....expensive bad sushi
comment: I was really excited to try this restaurant after being waiting for on month to get a booking during the weekend. When you arrive to the 38th floor, the views and the place is stunning, you have almost 360º view from london. The decoration is different and elegant and the service is really quick and attentive. The menu is a mixed japanese and brazilian as it was expected and you will be really disappointed if you expect a proper japanese style food. We tried some appetizers, small dishes and samba rolls. All of them have been poor in term of quality, portions and price. But without a doubt the worse has been the samba rolls, tasteless, full of different rare sauces and you need a kilo of wasabi to get the tiny bit of spice taste you love on maki rolls. If you would like to pay for the views, go on, incredible place, if you are looking for incredible food, don´t even dare to expect anything more than average for at least 70 pound per person.

title: Spoilt by inept management
comment: Disastrous staff led by General Manager harris who has no concern for customer service! They pack the diners and bar customers in but then fail to treat customers well.  The problem with this is if you are charging high prices, for instance £18 for some champagne, you had better provide the value! The atmosphere is chaotic and akin to All Bar One, which probably offers better customer service!  The food is average for the high prices and again the service is really nothing special. The saving grace is the view - but there are other better places. Summary suggestion: Please: - avoid spending a long time here - make it one scenic drink and book elsewhere smarter for dinner and drinks. - avoid overspending on drinks in return for underwhelming service.

title: Nice view, expensive, average food
comment: First of all, it is quite expensive for the value. Ok, the view is fine, and the fast climbing elevator makes an impression. When you get there it looks just like an average trendy bar. They could have done much better in terms of decoration. The food itself is just ok, not really good. They've obviously put an effort on the make-up of the dishes and they actually look nice. But the taste would not beat a £40 diner anywhere in London. The problem is that there you'll end with a minimum of £90 per person if you don't drink wine. Nice premium for the view!

title: Worth the splurge!
comment: If you feel like getting dressed up and rubbing shoulders with Russian oligarchs in shiny suits then you could do worse than Sushisamba. It's not subtle and you will guess this from the neon lift that shoots to the roof-top and gives you incredible views over London. It's a lot of fun. I would expect the staff to be aloof and a little chilly in a place like this but they're surprisingly nice and were more than happy to talk us through the menu which is a fusion of Japanese (sushi) and Brazilian (samba). This may sound dubious but I can assure you our food was delicious. The tastiest dish being the monkfish in butter. Yum. Our waiter recommended a very reasonably priced bottle of wine, some were extortionate! The view, the food, the expensively clad clientele and the lovely roof terrace are well worth the trip to the top of the Heron. It's perfect for a celebration or special occasion.

title: Great views good hot food
comment: A great location, much better views than the one in NYC. Went with family. The hot food is very good. The Maki rolls were decent but not the best I have had. Service is very timely and attentive which is good for such a busy place. The views are really nice if you are lucky to be seated by a window. The patio area is also nice for a summer outing. Second floor lounge for people that like to drink. The main attraction of this place, I would say, is the ambience and views rather than the food. Recommended for a business dinner or a romantic outing.

title: Food and view
comment: This is a sumptuous place in the Heron tower up on the 38th floor I think. It is a 3-story restaurant that has breathtaking views of the city and delicious food. It is a bit expensive, but that is understandable given the fine cuisine, the expensive decor and the sights from the outside bar.

title: Fab restaurant
comment: The staff are attentive and helped recommending the excellent dishes.The cocktails were superb and the outside area was a lovely way to have an after dinner drink .Fabulous views

title: Brilliant sushi and great view
comment: I visited the place with few friends for dinner. We had a starter and a main each plus 2 desserts. Great food, amazing plating and good fusion of different cosines. The service was excellent. And the view from there is stunning. Great overall experience. Recommended dishes: samba London, black cod miso and organic red chocolate chilly peppers.

title: Views were amazing!
comment: This place is amazing! DJs, samba dancing and cocktails inspired for the upcoming World Cup! I tried the take for England, the keeper. The drink is made with elder flower, tanqueray gin and IPA. The cost £13! the views were excellent and cocktail wasn't too bad either!

title: Go for everything but the sushi!
comment: Fantastic trip up the lift as everyone has mentioned, and lovely decor in the restaurant. Suffered the usual annoying "Rain Man" waiter (I always seem to get!) who didn't write any of my extensive order down (I assume to show off his memory skills) but then forgot an order and also two other requests we had. There was always some incredulous excuse as well for the delay which started to wear thin. In summary what Samba has done is take a lot of ingredients that people "have always wanted to try but just a little bit of, in case they don't like it". We had Foie Gras on Wagyu Beef Tataki (delicious) Turbot Sashimi (Chewy and massively overpowered by the truffle oil) and Black Cod skewers (delicious). The vegan dish of Daikon seemed to be more Japanese mushrooms than Daikon but A1 on presentation. I don't understand why it was named Daikon, they would get more orders if it was named a Mushroom dish! The Sushi was dreadful, and everything that poorly made fusion dishes are all about. Boring, skimping on the actual fish, and lacking any of the texture that good Nori and Sashimi have. The Wagyu beef on hot stones was a lovely gimmick and tasty too, though for 49 pounds I would have hoped so. Cocktails also were boring for what they were and the price charged. I spent 235 in total for two people - borderline three michelin star restaurant prices. Avoid unless you are happy going to a sushi restaurant and not having sushi - as funnily enough you could have a good meal in that case!

title: Love a roof top bar...
comment: Views leaving me shouting "we live in London" cocktails leaving my bank manager shouting "I can tell". A little expensive but a truly great experience. The food is delightful however the drinks service a little slow but I can forgive as its such a great setting.  One of my faves in London!!

title: Amazing Space. Very Trendy
comment: Came to this place for drinks only. It is spread over three floors in an office building very near Liverpool Street Station, each floor has a bar and restaurant, each a different style, all very busy with a young, trendy and rather good looking crowd. One of there restaurant is open 24/7, so there's no excuse to not come!

title: What gem!
comment: I booked for my husbands 40th. The staff were great the food was amazing and so were the cocktails AND with all this combined the views are fantastic. A great place to hang out or celebrate a special occasion. We had such a great time .. Highly recommended. Need to book to avoid disappointment.

title: One of the best restaurants in London!
comment: Booking in advance is must of you want to secure a good seating location. Scenery breathtaking, would recommend going before sunset to enjoy the top view for London. The Heron tower is a piece of architectural art on its own, with the restaurant on top. The bar also has very nice seating overlooking the city. Good place for a special occasion. The sushi and salmon we pretty well cooked and served. Amazing night..

title: Not that amazing!
comment: Well me and my boyfriend were so excited to visit here as we love visiting the skyscraper cocktail bars around London but I think this one is the worst. Firstly when we arrived there were no spaces around which is not their fault but with not much space for those visiting the bar, it made it hard for us to feel relaxed. When it comes to buying drinks... Cocktails were £13 each. Now I don't mind spending that much on a cocktail but to be honest there wasn't much choice of cocktails. Also to make things better they add a 12.5% service charge automatically but like someone said below, it is not worth it for one round of drinks and no service at all! Some people may be in to this but I am not but I must say the staff were nice :).

title: Expected something great and got even more!
comment: Right from the time you get into the lift that whisks you up 38 floors your mind turns to wonder if the adventure you are embarking on is worth it. Yes dining at the top of one of London's imposing glass structures brings with it great expectation but having been disappointed previously due to 'gimmicks' like great views left me skeptical. We were first greeted at the entry and had arrived early. I didn't know the extent of the bar at the restaurant but this can comfortably hold 20 - 40 guests and offer a wide range of 'Sushi Samba' inspired cocktails as well as the classics. I asked for a Rob Roy (this isn’t on the menu or considered a normal classic) and was fantastic. We were seated one table away from the window but still had a great view out over the city. We quickly had our orders taken where our food arrived shortly after. A wide range of choices are on offer which suited our varied range of tastes. Taking advantage of the tapas styled meals the first dish arrived quickly. Each was well presented and had great taste. Each time a new dish was presented the waiter was able to describe the dish and give hints of how to mix flavors depending on your tasting. We started with sushi and gyoza and ended with a Brazilian themed meat dish. Each time a plate was presented, the bar was raised. We made some quick changes to our order half way through the meal and this seemed no hassle to the staff. In terms of overall cost it is leaning towards the expensive side and for a table of 4 the bill just fell short of £200 (including drinks and service charge). For the quality of the meals and the excellent service given at this venue it was great value for money.

title: Amazing view, decent food, high price!
comment: The view really is lovely, we were sat directly by a window, however directly under an air conditioning vent. Considering the saying a view and good food dont go together, the food was quite good but nothing crazy. I recommend the tempura string beans with truffle aioli. The scallops were uneventful, the rest was good but not spectacular. 2 cocktails and 3 small dishes per person amounted to 90 pounds per person so pricey

title: The bar is a joke!
comment: First the down side; waiting 20 minutes to be served at the bar is a joke. There were 4/5 staff doing odd jobs from cleaning to stacking glasses as 2 people served drinks. Come on guys get your act together.  Now the upside; fantastic views, great food, wonderful decor, experienced sommelier who was informative, amusing and without any arrogance.  I'm going back but will perhaps avoid the bar or pre order my drinks!!!

title: Amazing!
comment: The views are amazing. I booked a reservation for three people at 5:30 in the week, we ordered 5 dishes to share and then 1 desert each and 2 cocktails, the total come to £150.00, all dishes were amazing, the staff were very helpful and knew the restaurant inside out. The bar looked lively full of business men and women that had not long finished work, we didn't go into the bar, however definitely going back to the restaurant, I will also check out the bar too very soon.

title: Amazing,posh & fancy nights
comment: Beautiful place for a drink , many corporate suits but apart from that beautiful place and scenic views

title: Best sushi in London
comment: I went to Sushi Samba for lunch with my sister. The venue was amazing with very good views of the city. The staff were attentive and friendly and we had an amazing dining experience. São Paolo is the best sushi rolls I've tasted in London! It melts in your mouth and Samba London was beautifully made too. Our starters of grilled egg plant and dessert of passion fruit cake was delicious too. I eould definitely recommend Sushi Samba, especially for the sushi!

title: Amazing drinks and place
comment: This place is the place to go. Just when we arrived there for dinner and took the elevator we started to get suprised, amazing view on London. Try to leave the coat and umbrella in the cloakroom sorry it's full fair enough !!!! we wanted to get a table for dinner, at the reception they said it was full, so we will get a seat at the bar to eat when some space will be available.little bit disapointed but we are here to relax no problem. we went to the bar which was very busy and order some delicious Cocktail, nice fresh !!! don't remember the exotic name but the one with Hendrix is very refreshing. After 3 rounds, somebody came and offer us a table inside the restaurant, so nice. Suddenly some space in the cloakroom !!!!  i understand that there isn't enough space for all customers and they prefer to give privilege to restaurant customer. this is only the bad point. We order several platters to share a mix of everything and i can say the waiter was right and he knows perfectly the menu. Amzaing food very tasty , the sushi were delicious , right perfect. don't use the soy sauce just eat like that and enjoy. Tried the beef and the chorizo, served cooked on the hot stones.With a nice Pinot noir from south africa it was perfect. service is fast and professional, very nice people waiter, manager. Definitely we will come back soon to try some more fancy food and cocktail. Price is expensive but what to expect in a beautiful restaurant with amazing food.

title: Best atmosphere at great heights..
comment: The welcome to the restaurant was very warm and welcoming. The view of London from the 38th floor was amazing. It was a special occassion and all the food we selected was delicious. The restaurant was very busy, yet the service was excellent. I would recommend this restaurant to those who enjoy good food, service and atmosphere.

title: Delicious food, great views, trendy
comment: My partner took me here to celebrate my birthday, on a Friday evening. The first thing that strikes you is the decor -- very trendy, bright colours and pumping music. Our table wasn't ready so we had a drink at the bar. The Lychee Cooler is very nice, if a little sweet for my taste. We eventually got our table about 10 minutes late. Service was somewhat of a tag-team between two overly enthusiastic young waiters. Food was delicious, the Wagyu Gyoza was to die for, and the Moqueca Mista was a great sharing dish. After an hour and a half, they asked us for the table back.The bill included water which we hadn't ordered so they had to correct the bill, which took quite a long time. Overall, really nice food, great view, but they really do try to turnover the tables. Worth a visit on a special occasion as it's not cheap. The pumping music got somewhat tiring after an hour :)

title: Great food and amazing service
comment: Went to sushi samba to celebrate my daughters birthday. We had heard a lot about it and our expectations were very high. Although the place didn't have that wow factor (compared to other places I have been to), the food was really good and the service was excellent. I have not experienced service like this anywhere else in London or the UK. The waiters were very attentive and gave good advice and recommendations as 2 of us were vegetarian and substituted dishes to accommodate us. Other restauranteurs should visit this place and get tips on how to deliver customer service. Would thoroughly recommend this place.

title: Great location and great food
comment: The experience for this restaurant starts once you enter the lift. The bar offers great views. The food is superb and an ideal choice to come with friends to share. Afterwards try the bar a few floors up.

title: Great Location
comment: This is a must go place for a dinner in London due to its terrific location at the top of a high rise building. London night rom the restaurant is splendid & the restaurant decoration is very nice. It is a vibrant & happening place. Food is average & it is very hard to find a place so you need to book quite a long time ahead.

title: Is the lift journey the best part?
comment: The food and service were both good, we have been here twice now.  I enjoyed the wagu beef taquitos and the bass skewers with giant Peruvian corn Not cheap, especially the drinks but you are paying for the views which are obviously amazing. There were on both occasions an interesting mix of people here. Make sure you ask for a window seat so you can see the views over the city.  The journey in the lift is amazing and made my legs go weak when I looked down!

title: Birthday Lunch
comment: I booked this well in advance for my husbands birthday so I was really pleased when we arrived that we got one of the tables by the window with fantastic views.  I wasn't a sushi lover but my husband always has been so I thought we give this go and it was brilliant! Yes pricey but you are paying for the view and the service which was undoubtedly good. We ordered arguably too much but enjoyed it all but the sushi fusion rolls in particular were a highlight. Our waiter was great at advising us and helping with the menu (which can be intimidating on first look) even if we did ignore him and order extra!  We visited on a Saturday lunchtime when it had a really nice and friendly feel to it. We visited the bar a couple of weeks later on a Thurs evening and the outdoor area was packed on a cold spring night so I expect it gets rammed in the summer.  If you enjoy sushi and have a few extra pounds to spend on a view then give Sushi Samba a go, we enjoyed it and would go back.

title: Thank you Remi Blanc and team at Sushi Samba for a night I will never forget!!
comment: My fiancé arranged a special dinner to celebrate both my birthday and our engagement at Sushi Samba in London. The team led by Remi Blanc, made me feel so special and provided exceptional service. The food recommended by their team, was exceptional!! We enjoyed the romantic and beautiful view and atmosphere. I'd highly recommend this restaurant and especially for a special occasion. This restaurant is a MUST for those visiting London!!  Thank you Remi and team for making this night so special. I will always remember it and look forward to coming back when I'm in London.

title: Amazing venue, food and views
comment: Really exciting place for dinner, good for lunch too but the evening atmosphere is best. Just let the waiters guide you on what to order, everything is good, but dont miss out on the black cod.

title: Great location, good food but overall expensive for what it offers
comment: The ride up to the restaurant via the glass elevator is an experience in itself, the views across London are amazing on a clear day. There is a bar area including some outside seating, the inside and outside bar areas were very busy when we were there for a pre-dinner drink, with people cruising around looking for a free spot to sit. When booking I had told them it was for a special occasion and if it was possible to have a window table. When we arrived we were shown to a table which was ok but not exactly a great window view - we asked about moving to another table that was by the window and was free but were told it was 'not available' - that free table sat empty for our entire meal - that's just bad service really! The restaurant area itself was light and airy although it had a cafeteria style about it rather than a swanky restaurant feel. The food itself was delicious and we ordered a selection of various dishes to sample. We tried the wagu beef that you cook on hot rocks which was good to do although in our opinion it was not worth the £50 price tag. There was a reasonable selection of wines and cocktails although again all with a hefty price tag. Dinner for two with desert and drinks (and service) came to a whopping £280. We have eaten equally delicious food in other restaurants of similar cusine in London but where the final bill was much more reasonable. I guess you are paying a premium for the name & location here. Overall it was a special occasion meal so glad that we tried it although I would probably not rush back.

title: Sushi Samba ......we will return
comment: First is the ear popping glass lift ride, amazing views of London as long as you don't have vertigo, then the wow factor of the views in the bar, if the terrace is open the a look. The cocktails are to die for but are expensive, you are paying for the view at 12 quid a cocktail. The food and service were fantastic, gyoza, prawn tempura, black cod all unbelievable amazing views to boot. But be prepared this is not a cheap at 150 pounds for 2 people with drinks, however I would highly recommend the whole experience.

title: Simply amazing
comment: We went there for drinks on a sunday afternoon. The terrace is relatively small with few tables but we were lucky enough to get one, the cocktails are really unique and presented in a very peculiar way, wih fruits and leaves.  The view from the terrace is quite limited but I am sure that there is a much better view from the restaurant. Drinks are really expensive but definitely worth it. We loved the lift, with an amazing view and a little scary speed!

title: Absolutely divine!
comment: Being a big fan of sushi I was very excited to get a table here. I was plesently surprised that this was quite possibly the best Sushi that I have ever had in one of the most beautiful restaurants that I have ever been to. The Sommelier was very knowledgeable and the waiting staff were very friendly and provided excellent guidance on the food. For such an opulent resturant there was no air of arrogance. I would defintely reccomend to my friends.

title: Selling Point
comment: ...it was really crazy how the waiters tried and pushed hard for selling all kind of dishes, even if they wouldn't match. The welcoming was great though, with loads of friendly advice and creating atmosphere. Price per head was like 180 GBP, ending having wine from a bottle from a table next to us. But what the heck...it's the samba :) I highly recommend the venue, however go your own way. Have a good one

title: Delicious
comment: I've been there 3 times. And I was a bit disappointed last time. The food still amazing. But the staff was not friendly at all. It's a shame because the atmosphere is perfect.

title: Fantastic dinning experience
comment: Ate here a few weeks ago, everything was fabulous from the food to the service! Best view in all of London too - great to dine as the sunsets

title: Really, really, really good food and what a view across London
comment: Amazing food, great view across London, high prices, buzzing place - can't recommend it highly enough. Has an outdoor bar and outdoor restaurant seating for those occasional warm days/evenings in London!

title: Amazing!!!
comment: We booked to go to sushi samba 2 months before the date we wanted as it's a long wait especially on a sat night for a table. We were not disappointed! The lift alone going up to the restaurant is fantastic! We had a drink at the bar first before going to our table, I would recommend the bar just for drinks even if you didn't want to eat. It's such a lovely setting, amazing views and big fire pits where you can chill with a cocktail. The cocktails are £13.50 each but worth every penny! When we went through to the restaurant we had a great table next to the window, the waitress was so helpful, explained the menu to us, nothing was too much trouble, great customer service! We ordered a couple of starters/small plates then had a couple of sushi plates which were fantastic, if you like sushi and sashimi this is the restaurant for you! Excellent quality ingredients! Our bill came to £100 including service charge which for a special occasion I think is not too bad, afterwards we went to the bar upstairs where the views are even more spectacular! Amazing night and probably one of my fav London bars and restaurants! Would def recommend!

title: Superb experience - over and over again ...
comment: Excellent food and service at a great location! Second time at the SushiSamba in London and still a great experience. The quality of the food and service is high and up to par with the other SushiSamba's around the globe. London and Las Vegas are absolutely great and serve dishes which I had never tasted before. Don't just pick something from the menu - set out a budget and let the chef surprise you! This place is so popular that you will need to book your table a few weeks upfront. Also make sure to be in time for your reservation. Be early and make sure to have a Mojito at the roof terrace and enjoy the view!

title: Great experience and worth it.
comment: If you don't already know, it's really high and the lift is fast. The service is decent and the cocktails are great. Get all over it.

title: 4 stars just for the view
comment: Well, the evening here didn't start here very well... Huge queue on outside bar and only one bartender to serve people. So after 15 mins of waiting for 2 glasses of wine (there was possibility of ordering either wine or beer) they even put service charge on this drinks! Well, I guess you pay for this high level of entertaining - 39th floor = great view and good music in background.  So despite the beginning I'm happy to come again as stuff is smiling and inside they do nice cocktails.

title: Fav place
comment: I have been there every weekend of this month after the weather has been good. Even think the price is a bit high, but the service, the atmosphere, the food and the cocktails are amazing. It's one of the best place to hang out with friends if you love a quality lifestyle

title: go once!!!
comment: £45 for 4 drinks but it was an amazing experience. The cocktails are delicious and taking the lift to the 38th floor on the outside of the building gives you an amazing view of the city. Really somewhere you should go once just to experience it.

title: WOW.........................
comment: We first visited the restaurant/bar on the top floor above Sushi and thankfully they did not have a table free..................so by pure chance we stopped at the Sushi Samba and the hostess was extremely helpful and said there was seating in the entrance area, sounds a weird description but it was in a semi-circle around the cooking area which for us was absolutely fine a fine view of the food being prepared. Well absolutely faultless from beginning to end. The food was the best we have tasted and we did seem to eat a fair amount, naughty, naughty......and seem to be there for about 4 hours time just flew. The staff were so helpful and we know we were lucky to get seated and we will return again and actually request to sit in exactly the same place which is okay for 3 people but any more could be a bit anti-social.  All in all excellent and faultless along with the view of London - amazing.

title: Excellent service, matched only by the view!
comment: I visited this restaurant with my partner for her 21st and we were considerably impressed with the attentiveness of staff and quality of food. I sent an email to Sushisamba beforehand when making a reservation and included a few words under the comments section explaining how it was my partner's 21st and politely requested a spot by the window to see the view. I was chuffed upon arrival to find we had arguably the best table in the house! On top of this, my partner was also presented with a small token wishing her happy birthday (as shown in the picture included) which was a particular highlight of our visit. I was also thoroughlly impressed on how conversational and friendly staff were across the restuarant floor and bar area. This was the first time I ever tried sushi and I have Sushisamba to thank for making this such an enjoyable occasion, great stuff!

title: Amazing experience
comment: I was visiting the UK for business and met my partners in the restaurant. The ride up in the elevator was an experience in itself (not recommended for anyone with vertigo!) incredibly quick. The staff were very efficient and friendly, we ate in the restaurant which was full. Great atmosphere and not cramped. The waitress explained the menu to us and after asking what sort of food we liked and disliked recommended several platters. The food was absolutely delicious and very pretty to look at too. This restaurant is rather expensive but worth every penny due to the food, views and wow factor. I can't wait to bring my family next time.

title: It's the service that lets it down
comment: This place is beautiful - gorgeous views (although you can't see them from the garden, which seems a bit of a shame) and the cocktails are amazing. Unfortunately though the service is just awful. The bar people are rude, they walk off in the middle of serving, one laughed at my boyfriend for his choice of cocktail! Go there if you like posh, pretentious people. Otherwise, stay away

title: Great lift
comment: The express lift makes your ears pop, its great. The restaurant decor was a bit odd with large bamboo poles. The waiters didn't have good English and when they described what they brought to the table had to be asked to repeat slowly the description. Food was so so. In fact we left about 8 portions of sushi untouched. Not a patch on Zuma or Coya but its worth a visit just for the lift experience.

title: Scale the heights for this Brazilian adventure
comment: Mixing sushi and traditional Brazilian fare seems a 'nuts' idea. Fusion is called and you will certainly feel confused by the menu options when you step out of the glass lift at floor 38. The views over London are staggering, the outside terraces provide a good opportunity to experience the weather, good or bad (this is London after all). Its no place for quiet conversation as people who book this place are making a statement. This is where money meets and talks, advertising types, rub shoulders with city bankers and brokers (many on expense accounts). Bamboo poles set up an eccentric style of east meets southern american. There's mood music in the background and louder music later (dj provided). Ok so I haven't mentioned the food. There is sushi and there is a south american slant to this. Never confused by menus this one stumped me so we had to ask the waiter what they sell most of. This provided 5 different solutions which were delicious, carefully presented as a piece of art. Mind you its an expensive art form there. Wine, to several hundred pounds reassures you of the pseudo exclusivity here. It is expensive but worth a visit for a special occasion. There are other restaurants which offer similar good food at better value but the view is worthy of some sort of premium. I'm just not sure of how much. Another option is just 3 floors above this restaurant (Duck and Waffle). But as they say 'you pays your money so you takes your choice'. Service and was superb and very informative. Some of the best anywhere,

title: Great food and view, comes with a price
comment: Was here trying to get some drinks and small bites on a saturday night. It was so crowded so we ended up at the bar. The sushi was excellent, the service was not bad either. There is a cloak room outside. Honestly i wouldn't come here again if it is just the two of us, this place is suitable for a group of friends.

title: The best food ever
comment: This was the best meal ever I had with excellent service and in addition the most interesting and tasty cocktails I had in London. And the views were spectacular. I was worried that it would be little expensive being in the Heron tower and having such good reviews. But the bill didn't come to too much considering we had many cocktails and bottles of wine.

title: Amazing view!
comment: This place offers great view!! You can see the sun going down and the sky changing colors.. Amazing! The cocktails are fancy and a bit pricey as well but I guess you are paying for the view!!  The lift ride is a cool touch..!

title: Worth it
comment: The entrance is not the best but the trip up to it fab. The lift gives you a stomach turning ride to the 38th floor. The short walk to the bar gives you the excitement when you reach to the amazing views you get on every turn you make. A little less seating then expected so you need to be quick if you want to just sit and drink. Once inside the resteraurant we were a little Dissappointed that we couldn't sit outside due to weather conditions. And that we didn't get a window seat even though we did request but they couldn't accommodate it.

title: Absolutely worth it
comment: Superb view, service and food. It took us 4 attempts to get a table because they are so busy. But it was worth the wait. Try and get a table by the window if you can.

title: WHOOHOO! WE GOT IN
comment: Been trying to get a table which has proved very difficult but so worth the wait. Yes the views are great but the service, food and ambience are better. Can see why it is so difficult to get into. The place is buzzy, great cocktails and the food really is Wow. Very different twists and the staff are so well informed. Tip: Go there!

title: Worth the wait!
comment: We've been waiting to eat here for ages!  So finally we got a lunch time table (....more like 4pm but still...) and we weren't disappointed.  The food is fantastic, and the views are great, too!  Would recommend:  - Black cod skewers  - Beef fillet - Prawn Tempura Great overall experience - comparable to the other top restaurants in London - even if it falls slightly short of only a couple of them!

title: you must go
comment: We sat outside for drinks the views are amazing when our table was ready we went to the main restaurant. The food was amazing I recommend the black cod, tempura prawns, lemon sole and sea bass. Cocktails were around £12 each and the cheapest bottle of red wine was £90. The waiter was very helpful and explained some of the dishes. For each course to arrive did take some time best bet is to order everything all at once.  Definitely recommend this place you must try it especially in the summer when you can sit outside and enjoy the views.

title: WOW,and that was just the lift ride!!
comment: My wife managed to get us in here for our one year anniversary on a Sunday afternoon,and boy what a place.Let's start with the views,the night before I took her to the park lane hotel,28th floor,nothing could beat this,but Sushi Samba is on the 38th FLOOR.Just going up in the lift is an experience,and when your sitting there eating and looking out,it's mind blowing.Now the food,i don't like sushi but my wife does,she has travelled the world and rates this as the BEST sushi she has ever eaten.Now if like me you don't like sushi,fear not,there are a few things that you will like,the pork belly is amazingly good,the beef fillet on skewers is so succulent and juicy.The waiters will give you their selections,i tried one of these but didn't like the food,so he spoke to the manager and it was taken off the bill,nice touch.I would very highly recommend going here whether you like sushi or not,it's an amazing restaurant,great staff and we are definitely going back soon.

title: Great food, exceptional views, very noisy !
comment: Lunch on Sunday with friends. Food is served in small portions, which allowas you to taste many different things; it is a mixture of Japanese and Peruvian tastes, very enjoyable and similar to Nobu. Service is very attentive, Spanish waiters flying around you and taking care of every detail, maybe a bit too much. The place however is very noisy, a party of four girls next to us was laughing so loud that we could not even hear the person in front at our table.. They must do something, it becomes really annoying after some time. I had a Pisco Sour at the bar and it was good swing it been made in front of me.

title: Views add that something special
comment: Lovely evening with friends, good wine selection and really good service - food fresh and a good variety so everyone found something they liked! Beautiful restaurant the views are really amazing! Very very special!

title: Great taste, great views
comment: We ate here at lunchtime with friends. From our pre-lunch cocktails to the various courses we ordered everything was prepared to a high standard and tasted amazing. The desserts were even better. The fusion of the best of South America and Japanese cuisine works really well. We were lucky to eat on a fine sunny day and you have great views over London. The fact it has an outside balcony also gives this restaurant an added dimension. Some slight criticisms concern the wine list where our first choice Sauv Blanc wasn't available and the alternate Sauv Blanc was a much poorer taste. It was definitely a wine to have with food. Also in regards to the restrooms there are only two urinals and one cubicle for gents on the restaurant floor. With the numbers dining plus others at the bar this is inadequate as I had to queue on each occasion.  Overall the quality of the food and the views make this a must do dining experience in London.

title: Good business lunch on Bishopsgate
comment: Great food,but pricey. 6 people for business lunch and the waiter offered to chose our food for each course - a tasting menu. It has to be said the food was excellent but in the end it was pricey enough, we drank nothing (a few soft drinks) and the bill was 60+ per head. But the location is fantastic, the service was good and the food was really good so would definitely go back.

title: Top of the world, top prices
comment: You can't deny that the restaurant is an experience and the views across the city are lovely but beyond that I found the whole atmosphere a little pretentious. To charge £19 for a beer and a Bacardi is not expensive rather more a rip off, how can this be justified? The food is good quality and well presented but nothing overly special. Paying good money does not guarantee value for money and I felt I'd overpaid for what we had, leaving a restaurant having not satisfied your appetite is never a good sign. I wouldn't recommend the restaurant unless you are happy to spend and question the value you are receiving. Having been I can't see me returning!

title: Not just a restaurant...an Experience!
comment: A friend dined at Sushi Samba in Miami Beach and kept raving about it and was emphatic that we dine here in London.  Now I know why. It was a very memorable meal in a pretty wild restaurant / bar and rooftop deck. The view alone is worth it, from the 38th floor of Heron Tower in Central London. Check out the outdoor bar area with the orange tree.  We didn't order off the menu and let the Manager choose our courses, as we dined in waves of delicious and incredibly crafted food. It was one of the better dining experiences. By the way - this is also one of those places "to see and to be seen", but even this middle aged business man was comfortable and happy there.  By the way - this is a Brazilian Peruvian Sushi Bar. Quite a menu. Get a reservation.

title: What an experience!
comment: We came for my birthday and were not disappointed. Our waiter was excellent in suggesting how we ordered and the food was out of this world.  We had a truly amazing time and all left wanting more of the pork belly and lamb chops. We were never rushed and each plate was brought out timing it well. I think we were in the restaurant for well over 3 hours.  The restaurant is beautiful and views wonderful overlooking London. The bar gets rammed but what do you expect in town at a popular place?  Will definitely be back

title: Amazing view and a meal to match
comment: I was a little dubious about the garish sign plastered on the outside of the Heron Tower and whether the Brazilian-Japanese fusion would match the hype or the high price tag. The view is stunning and has the added bonus of looking down on the Gherkin. The seating within the bar area is sparse and not the most convenient for a large group, but the seating and comfort outside was excellent. Perhaps it was because of the bank holiday, or perhaps the price tag, but I love the fact that, whilst full, the restaurant and bar were not overcrowded. The most important thing: the food!  Whilst I'm not convinced by the whole menu (the coconut rice didn't do it for me), there was enough to make the meal worth it's price tag; the mix of herbs and spices in the sauce made the prawn tempura one of the best things I have tasted in a long time.

title: GREAT LOOKING RESTAURANT AND BAR
comment: We went here as a group of 4 on a saturday evening and it did not disappoint us. The front of house when arriving out of the lift could have been better as we thought this was the only bar only to fine a great outside bar upstairs. The bar outside is really special but you will pay over £15 for 2 bottles of larger but all taken in to account well worth it. The restaurant looks and feels great with a really nice ambience. The food was very good, we went for 15 dishes between 4 of us. The staff were good as well, with only one complaint which is about the wine. Both bottles we chose they did not have and the ones that where offered in their place were very average. I would stay the food at Nobu was a little better but as a whole package we all agreed that Sushisamba was better and we are looking forward to going back David

title: Sunday lunch
comment: This restaurant was recently recommended to me by a friend. I took some close Italian friends there for Sunday lunch. The food was adventurous and excellent. And the service was highly attentive, with great recommendations. There is room for improving the ambience but this did not detract from our pleasure. Certainly one for repeat visits.

title: Drinks with a view!
comment: I just had drinks with my parents on Mother's day at Sushi Samba. The view was so clear that day and was brilliant to sit by the window and enjoy a glass of wine. I had expected the drinks to be ridiculously overpriced given the location, but I was very pleasantly suprised that they weren't hideously overpriced. £7.50 for a glass of wine wasn't too bad given the experience you get along with it!
