Would definitely recommend it and will visit again.

title: Amazing
comment: Late lunch on a sunny sunday afternoon, I have to say this place is amazing. The waiting staff really know their stuff advising us what was best on the menu and explaining everything in detail. They are highly trained, professional and friendly. The food was fabulous it really is a taste sensation we enjoyed all of the 10 dishes we had. We had a window seat, great views. Yes it's slightly more costly than other places, you really get what you pay for here. Will be back soon! Thanks for a great day sushi samba!!!

title: Left feeling rather ill
comment: Having read quite a few shocking reviews about the 'bouncer' at the door I'm pleased to say we didn't have any of those issues. The lift on the way up was rather fast and made me feel quite nervous! But that's just me :)  The drinks were quite nice if not very over priced and the views were stunning. We had to inform them that we had arrived and were quite unsure as to how it worked as no one approached us. Once seated the views were lovely and the staff very attentive.  The food was very pretty but the sushi it's self was average, the pork belly however,was  stunning. It was a surprise to find something we didn't order on the bill- do check!! It was very expensive and I'm not sure it was really worth the cost!  To top it off I woke up in the middle of the night very unwell indeed, and have had to take the morning off work!  Without the novelty of being so high up and one/ two of the dishes I'm left questioning if if is worth if.

title: exceeded expectation
comment: After booking this ages ago I did wonder if this restaurant could match my excitement , just going up in the lift and seeing all of London is such a thrill . We had a brilliant lunch and one of the most special dining experiences I have ever had . The staff were so well trained , very friendly and warm , no one was pretentious nor having attitude because they looked so good . Plus even our fellow dinners , a very international crowd were warm and smiley . It was buzzy and like having a special treat . The food can best be described as a circus of flavours in the mouth and we decided to experiment across the menu ; sea bass mono [ posh goujons ] , vegetable tempura [ delicious squash], yellowtail tiradto cerviche , sasa tempura shrimp sushi , plaintain chips and then Japanese mocha rice cake ice cream . So exciting . Plus the rose wine was excellent and so was the coffee . Then there is the fun of the lift back to reality and seeing London before your eyes . Must come back and try it all again at night to see all the lights and try all the other amazing foods on menu .

title: great place and food, atmosphere is terrific!
comment: I really loved sushi samba and I Always recommed to my friends, its in the top a bulding with a beautiful view of the city, the food and the service was great, the atmosphere is terrific! there is a tree with lights in the bar outside so nice.

title: Love this restaurant but service not brilliant today
comment: I love the food here and the ambience. Asked the waiter for a selection for our party of four. The chefs selection arrived, superb flavour and everything beautifully presented. We finished the initial wonderful selection of food and we're asked if we wanted more, we said 'yes please' and we were recommended a further dish and we were told it would be a couple of minutes. Half an hour later we were still waiting and my guest client finally asked me to request the bill. A shame as the food, the ambience and the view are perfect. This partially ruined what should have been an excellent experience. I'm back next week so hopefully this won't happen again. As a final note, don't be put off, this is a must visit destination for foodys. I love it, just not as much today as I usually do.

title: great food.. great view... bring your wallet.
comment: Ive been wanting to go here since it opened, and through either hype or genuine demand it was seemingly impossible to make a booking at a time I wanted to eat. We went on a monday, as it was the only available day which did offer a 6.30 sitting. The experience here is good, starting with the super fast lift which shoots you up to the 38th floor in seconds. The bar area outside is great, but fairly average inside. There is a bar upstairs which was closed off , which was strange considering the place was fairly empty....maybe it was just that it was monday. The restaurant is light and open and filled up fairly quickly, and has a good feel to it. The food was great, with the brazilian influence making a nice fit with the more traditional japanese food. However as with all things good, there is a price to pay. £700 for 4 is top end especially as we were mainly drinking beer, though maybe too many to be a cheap bill. I am glad I went, but in truth for that money, I prefer Nobu for their quality of food. After you have seen the view its sort of irrelevant.

title: Must visit!!
comment: It's the second time I've been and it was an absolute pleasure to return. I took the waiters tip this time of sharing my small plates and so I was able to try more. Despite hating heights (well the lift because I loved the view whilst seated) this restaurant is worth plucking up the courage to visit. The staff is absolutely wonderful and do go the extra mile and the food is outstanding both in flavour and presentation.

title: One of London's must-gos right now
comment: A great location, on top of the Heron Tower, right next to Liverpool Street Station, with amazing views and an outdoor bar.  The decor is very trendy and service very attentive.  The food is a pan-south american-japanese mix, with fusion dishes and modern takes on some classics. All very well executed. Do try the black cod skewers, the wagyu beef tataki and the wagyu gyosas. Oh and the deserts are incredible as well.

title: Fantastic experience but pricey!
comment: The restaurant was booked by a friend so I can't really comment on that experience - except he said it was very difficult to get the booking. The experience in the lift was fantastic but the views were marred by the weather, which did eventually clear so we had a good view over London but unfortunately not distance viewing. The restaurant looks amazing and there are loads of staff who were really attentive without being over the top. I wish I'd got the name of our waiting as he was so good, explaining the menu and offering advice. I was so worried about going as I don't like fish but there was plenty of meat on the menu. It was almost like a tapas restaurant - having a few dishes at a time and sharing. We had the tempura prawns and pork belly then the tuna in pomegranate juice, taco shells (not sure what was in them but very tasty) and the beef skewers. The flavours were fantastic and everything was cooked to perfection (unless raw of course!!) and presented beautifully. We finished with two different dessert dishes (both icecream based). All the dishes were small but nice to pick at. We also had two rounds of drinks (vodka and coke together with two bottles of lager). The bill was over £170 for the three of us so very expensive but we paid for the experience. I'll definitely return, hopefully when the weather is better, and I would recommend the place to anyone for the delicious food and the experience. The staff were brilliant and a credit to the management.

title: Poor
comment: Average quality for 38th floor prices. Following a problem with the wine, a staff consultation took place and they sent the "boy" to the table to offer a pathetic excuse. Don't bother waiting for a table booking - go elsewhere. Pretentious "bouncers" trying to look like JFK's bodyguards, just sum the place up !

title: Good View but overpriced
comment: We visited Sushi Samba during our one year London anniversary as we wanted a restaurant with a view of the city that we have been living in for a year. The view was nice and the outside area was enjoyable. The service was great and the cocktails were fun. The food was tasty but as expected, it was overpriced. I expected this given the name.

title: Five Star
comment: Firstly, I have read a lot of reviews about Sushi Samba being overpriced. Yes it is expensive, lunch last Wednesday set me back 144 GB pounds however it was quite possibly one of the most enjoyable and tastiest lunches I have had in London. This isn´t somewhere you go for a quick bite to eat on your lunch break, it´s a treat, an experience. Furthermore, I think people fail to understand that you are paying for the following:  - Incredible views overlooking London  - Excellent Food - Immaculate Service  - Strong alcoholic cocktails that are NOT watered down Of course it is going to be expensive! Anyways, moving on… Food was fab! We ordered around ten dishes in total, to name a few; we had the duck breast, beef fillet, coconut rice, the prawns, the samba rolls, the aubergine dish and we shared the banana cake in rum with vanilla ice-cream for dessert! The cocktails were tasty and very strong, just how we like them! All dishes were amazing, fresh and full on flavor. I really cannot fault any of them.  The service was very attentive, professional and it is so nice to see happy and SMILEY staff! Upon booking, I requested a table by the window which Sushi Samba fulfilled.  Honestly, it was such a lovely afternoon and they even remembered that it was my Boyfriend´s birthday (I told them upon booking the table a month in advance and they remembered!). Really exceptional service and we found the lunch was a nice treat before an afternoon at the Theatre.  My only advice would be, BOOK in advance. I booked exactly a month in advance and was only given the option of 11.30am for an early lunch or 10.30pm for a late dinner, I took the 11.30am and by the time we had cocktails and checked out the views, it was lunch time! I would say book at least 6 weeks in advance to avoid disappointment!  I just want to say, thank you Sushi Samba – we will be back very soon!

title: Nice sushi and great views
comment: Very nice sushi, I liked the South American influence. Great service, cocktails and desserts. Quite expensive but you pay for the views.

title: Stunning views but very overpriced
comment: Visited Sushi Samba for a birthday dinner of one of my friends. The food was nice (although the menu was very, very limited for gluten-free diners) - the hamachi kama was tasty, but slightly over-salted. The Samba London Roll was presented beautifully, but in terms of the content it was pretty average as far as sushi goes - the one stand-out element was the wagyu roll, it was different, and delicious! It was very over-priced for what you got (being London, you expect extortionate prices for a small amount of food, but I felt this was especially ridiculous: I had a normal size dinner slightly earlier than I ordinarily would at 4pm, before going to Sushi Samba and eating at around 6.30, and had to have a snack when I came home!). In particular, the only thing on the dessert menu that I could eat was a fruit salad, at the frankly shocking price of £12! I politely declined. For a 'different' evening out, though, it certainly was somewhere to try once. The views from the restaurant were stunning, and I would be tempted to go back just for the excitement of the glass lift whizzing you up over London! Our waiters were lovely, very helpful and friendly, although you couldn't always hear what they were saying due to the background noise.  One other tip would be to book well in advance - my friend only managed to get a booking for 4 people at a relatively early time for dinner (6pm) about 2 months in advance!

title: Stunning view but tiny bar
comment: Just went up for the view and a beer. Bar is small and can be rather busy. Some seating but not much room. Bar should have been away from the window as stupidly the area where staff come and go and drop off empties etc is right where people want to look out the window. Other open bar has a bit more room but ironically should have been smaller. View is bland from that side too. Not well thought out really. Be prepared for premium prices. £8 for a bottle of so called beer.

title: Amaaaaazing
comment: Best servce, best food, best staff everyone should go atleast once!! I love the South American Influence on the menu which makes it soooo different from traditional Sushi X

title: Perfect in every way
comment: I have visited Sushi Samba a number of times and they have never disappointed. The service is amazing, very attentive, the management always checking in with customers and introducing themselves, the waiters very charming. The views are exceptional, no seat is a bad one and if the weather is good it's lovely sitting outside so high up. The food is just as good as the view. Highly recommend the rock shrimp tempura and the black cod. One of the best restaurants in London, you must give it a try.

title: A tall order, and you'd better be smart
comment: Sushisamba is on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower in Bishopsgate ... so it's certainly haute cuisine. The ride in the glass elevator is exhilarating, both up (in the daylight) and down (in the dark), with London stretching before you, but make sure you have put some decent clothes on because the meet-and-greeters on the door enforce the smart casual rule. There were four of us and we anticipated something special since we had had to wait three months to get a table (that's par for the course apparently). And we weren't disappointed. I love sashimi, have eaten it all around the world, including one of the best places in Tokyo, and the chef's selection platter of seven dishes was excellent. In fact it was hard to fault anything we ate, including the banana and passion fruit desserts.  The service was faultless, and the sommelier steered us through an extensive sake menu before we settled on a beauty. But at £50+ a bottle it should be. There were many far more expensive than that. In fact eating out at Sushisamba is quite pricey, but what do you expect slap bang in the middle of the City? It's brimming with you people with lots of money to spend. An altogether enjoyable experience.  And on the way out, don't forget to take a long, lingering look over London. What a wonderful city.

title: over the cucumber skyscraper!
comment: Stunny cocktail and sushi bar, a bit crowd but funny, panoramic over the cucumber tower, with beautiful people and good drinks. Expensive but for once it worths the visit, recommended! Close to the bar there is also the restaurant, not visited.

title: Great food let down by the service.
comment: After all the hype we looked forward to trying out sushi samba and got there an hour early for our 6.30pm reservation, just in time for a cocktail. The cocktail preparation itself was messy, splashes went on the bar, he did not realise I got drops on my shirt. Well he didn't even realise we were stood at the empty bar ready to order until his colleague pointed it out. Nevertheless paid the 12.5% service charge, drinks were delicious. Well at £30 for 2 cocktails shouldn't they be?  The Food was excellent, however, one again the service was the problem. We had 2 male french staff switching, looking elsewhere when taking orders and odd comment in French. I stopped one during the meal and told him, so far I don't intend on paying the service charge. Well, after that, the attentiveness of the service picked up. Food bill £105 for 2 lightly hungry people and another £30 for 2 cocktails.  Yes you get a personal welcome as yin walk irk the restaurant but it's scripted, not genuine, nip out to the toilet and they don't remember who you are. Also watch out for the bouncer style guy running around the restaurant with an earpiece, I guess it's the restaurant manager.  Shame about your service, it's clear non of the staff we came across have been to école hôtelière or anything sort of catering school and at this level they really should be. Is it about the view, just the food or the overall experience? You can come here for a special event but if you've been to other pleasant restaurants (me hotel bar/ restaurant, Buddha bar etc) you realise that the service killed it.  The owner should really send mystery shoppers to see what's going on.

title: Great food poor customer service/atmosphere
comment: The venue was spectacular and the sushi was among the best we've ever had however, there were lots of rules and regulations i.e we couldn't take drinks we'd purchased from the bar to a different level in sushi samba. The staff were cold and unwelcoming and after spending nearly £200 and finishing off our drinks, we were then asked to leave the table because the next customers were waiting. We felt this was incredibly rude and unfortunately for us, their customer service didn't match the quality of the food.

title: Great venue - everything else a bit so so
comment: If you come here expecting the best food and service London has to offer you're going to be bitterly disappointed, but if you take into consideration the views and the venue its not a bad place to splash out once. The lift alone makes it is worth a visit. A small bar area leads round to a relatively small dining room, with open terraces either side with views across London. Warmly welcomed and introduced to our waiter for the day, service took a bit of a nose dive...a different waiter every time served us (and I noticed this was the case for a lot of other tables). It was all over the place even though there was plenty of staff on hand. Food is overpriced, but OK... nothing stand out. All sharing plates.. don't come too hungry unless you're got deep pockets. The wine list is a joke... one bottle under £30 and a few around the £40 to £50, and many heading to £100 mark and carrying on. Lunch for 2 adults and 2 children, with cocktails and a bottle of wine came to £200 (and we weren't pushing to boat out). It was fun but after your first visit, eating at these prices needs something more than just the view. Definitely a case of style over substance. But we liked the lift!

title: The City of London in your plate!
comment: The lift trip to the 38th floor is fantastic! The Bar scene is excellent and most enjoyable. The service is good but not very good. We had to search for our waiter a couple of times. The food quality is good but it has to get a little better to compete with the best that London offers.

title: Five Star Expectations, Six Star Delivery
comment: I've eaten at some of the finest sushi restaurants in America, and this chain restaurant at the top of a skyscraper in London blew all of them away. We had been to the Duck and Waffle in the same building earlier in the year and decided to make it a point to have a dinner at Sushi Samba. This last weekend we finally made that happen. It's always fun to skip lines, and when we walked to the velvet ropes and gave our names for the reservation, my wife and I were ushered into the glass elevator. Our table wasn't ready yet as we were early, so we enjoyed a quick cocktail at the upstairs bar. The hostess hunted us down in the crowd and escorted us and our drinks to a lovely intimate table next to the window with an amazing view of London.  The service was spectacular. I often find my fellow Americans have an opinion on service that simply doesn't apply to Europe as other reviewers of this restaurant seem to demonstrate. Compared to a lazy French bistro, Sushi Samba was downright speedy in terms of service. With fresh drinks in hand, we ordered a sampling of various items from the wonderful fusion menu. We asked that they bring items out as they were ready and not all at once, and they succeeding in keeping something tasty and interesting on our table for the entire evening. The food was marvellous. Each roll was something special and unique, challenging our palates. I must recommend the sticky ribs if you don't mind getting your hands dirty in a nice restaurant. We are already planning our next visit and are excited to try a completely different batch of items.

title: Service is wonderful, food is wonderful, view is wonderful
comment: I am surprised if anybody doesn't like this place, you have a view, amazing service, so attentive and friendly, food is interesting, such variety for sushi etc, bar if you wish to stay on and drink, ok so it's expensive but you know that before you decide to go, such a special place I hope it maintains it's quality and originality.

title: Great Views
comment: Great Sushi with some good choices on the menu for non-Sushi loving people. Cocktails were good if a little on the pricey side. There is a nice outdoor space which I imagine will be amazing if we get a hot summer. Views over the city were amazing.

title: Nice food, nice cocktails, nice views.
comment: Visited at the beginning of April with some friends. All was good - the food was great, cocktails were nice (if a bit pricey), and the staff were very professional. Very high quality with fabulous views of London. Would recommend!

title: 5 star view
comment: Amazing views, just incredible. The food is average but who cares!? It's not expensive at all and you're on top of the world! Even the glass lift up there is a unique experience. There's a cocktail bar upstairs too which does great drinks with seats facing out onto the London Skyline.

title: Pricey but worth it!
comment: Visited on Bank Holiday weekend just gone and must say that it exceeded expectations. The food portions, although small and pricey, were fantastic. The Taquitos and Waygu Beef are a must. Service was fantastic too, Paolo made sure we had everything and our glass was never empty, table never messy and recommendations were on point! A great experience look forward to returning one day.

title: Best night ever!
comment: Having lived in NY for a decade, Sushi Samba was one of my favourite restaurants there. One of the reasons was because I had my first date with my now husband there, and we also got engaged there. For my husband’s birthday, I took him to the new London restaurant and we loved it. The view is breath taking, and the food was outstanding, just as I remembered. Our server, Max, was very attentive and explained the food in detail. He even told the manager, Remi, about our close ties with the restaurant, and kindly treated us to some desert and champagne. If you want to impress your date, friends or clients, this is the place to be!

title: Excellent !
comment: On the 34th floor of the Heron in the heart of the City off London. The lift up Heron Tower is just as spectacular as the views at the top, which has some of the best views in London. It was fantastic. Great food, great service and fantastic cocktails. And for that view ….looking forward to going back!

title: have to go back again
comment: After a disaster at this restaurant last year when our booking was running almost 2 hours late so we left after an hour and half before being seated this years experience was a revelation. Food, service, atmosphere all excellent. Extremely helpful waiter who talked us 'first timers' through the process and made wonderful recommends all of which we loved. The chefs deserve the highest praise, the unsung hero's. They should all be very proud of what they create and are worthy of a special mention.

title: Fantastic evening!
comment: Had a fantastic meal here Sunday night with two friends. We reserved at 6:00 PM so we could enjoy the view by day, sunset and night. The place is incredibly. We loved everything we ate - yellowtail, ezo sushi, daikon and carrot dish was like a work of art. All of the food is gorgeous and incredibly fresh. And the cheescake dessert is one of a kind - absolutely amazing both in presentation and taste. Perfect to share. All of this was only exceeded by the staff. Tareq and Andrea took care of us - Tareq is top notch and could work at any top hotel anywhere in the world. Genuinely helpful guiding us through the almost intimidating menu and recommending dishes which worked well together, as well as the best sake. He and everyone else were attentive yet unobtrusive. We even went to the Duck and Waffle bar on the floor below for an after dinner drink before we left. All around an amazing night and we can't wait to return. I can't recommend this highly enough.

title: Spectacular views
comment: I'd previously eaten at the Sushi Samba restaurant in Heron Tower, but recently held a business celebration at the bar one flight down. The views from this 38th floor bar are amazing. There is also an open air terrace and for excellent dining go either one floor up to Sushi Samba restaurant or one flight down to Duck and Waffle restaurant - all with spectacular views. Reservations, even for the bar, are a must.

title: Its like the london eye...with alcohol and food
comment: For any reason you may have for going out in London (business, touristic, wanting to impress a date or having your family visiting), this place is an absolute delight. Placed on the 30th-something floor, it offers a great 360 degree view of the City, staff is friendly and the service is quite fast. The bar area is packed with people trying to get seats by the 'panoramic' windows and on the other side there is an impressive Japanese style terrace. Can't really say much about the restaurant as we didn't eat in but I would definitely be keen to try it next time.

title: View yes but...
comment: Wow for the decor and view....then there is not much that can really make me come back. The outdoor terrace is not covered so when it rained like it did that night it become a mess. The sushi are ok but pricey. The service is fast but nothing special about it at the end. Not recommended

title: Great
comment: Great night and great food for london trip with family  Our waiter explained all details really well the view is amazing, although we did have to wait a little longer even though we booked a table but the wait was more than worth it.

title: Amazing!
comment: My husband and I went to Sushi Samba for an anniversary celebratory dinner, it was the first time we had visited. While we waited for our table we were shown into the bar area which had a very buzzy atmosphere and great music. Obviously the views were great too. Once shown to our table our waiter, Azamad, explained the different dishes and the way they were served. He knew exactly what to suggest and how much we needed to order, we tried to order more and he suggested we wait until we had eaten all our dishes, which were all delicious. That was great advice as we couldn't have eaten any more! During our meal the restaurant manager, Remi, came to introduce himself and welcome us to the restaurant. He made us feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. Remi looked after us with his exceptional hospitality. At the end of the meal he insisted we had a dessert - which he then presented to us along with a 'Happy Anniversary' message. Thank you very much to Remi and his team for making our evening very special, we will be back again soon to experience another outstanding evening.

title: Appalling service from bar staff
comment: I have been here twice in recent weeks for drinks. On the first occasion, I brought clients who were visiting the UK and was frankly embarrassed by how slow the service was. Several staff were hanging around behind the tiny bar with only a couple serving during a busy evening. On the second visit, the bar tender made my cocktails very slowly while chatting to another member of staff. Also used a different whisky to make one of the drinks, shrugging when I pointed out the one on the menu. There are plenty of other places in London with decent views for these prices, won't be going back.

title: By far, best sushi restaurant in London!
comment: This was my first time up the Heron Tower and to Sushi Samba and I can say I feel like I have seriously been missing out! The most beautiful views of London, we were thankful to have a beautiful sunny Friday night getting to watch the sun go down.  The menu is quite confusing however the servers couldn't do enough to help. We went all on Jacob's suggestions and we were not disappointed.  Every single dish ordered was amazing!  Cocktails also amazing and the rooftop bar was beautiful. It is very pricey but so worth every penny.  Thoroughly recommend!!!!  5*

title: Amazing View, Unique
comment: We celebrated my partners birthday here and had a really lovely time. The view was amazing. Ambience great. Food and drink excellent. Staff were also attentive. Well worth the money spend which was considerable.

title: Sushilicious
comment: I recently had an amazing evening at Sushi Samba in the Heron Tower for my birthday. This place has beautiful lighting and a original decor you will love. The atmosphere is elegant with romantic view. It's a must if your visiting London. Don't miss out!

title: Tastiest Meal Ever?
comment: This has got to rank amongst the Michelin starred restaurants! Every course was so tasty and fresh and cooked to perfection. I am a philistine and like my meat without blood! They even put my meat separate to our party so I could have mine without the blood! The concept was a good one mixing Japanese with Brazilian and Peruvian. Waiters well knowledgeable about the food. And the view!

title: Completely Overrated - poor food & very poor service
comment: Went here for my birthday and I was really looking forward to it after reading some reviews and having a personal recommendation. I really like eating out and enjoy good food and good service. I do a lot of cooking, so always interested in the more creative combinations. Also, I appreciate it can be hard work for kitchens and staff to please a wide range of clientèle. The pay for staff is not always great, and the work hard, so it is worth trying to overlook genuine mistakes (in a busy environment, these things can happen). However, at Sushi Samba it started badly and continued downhill. First, we were not welcomed, so didn't know where to go or who to see for our booking. Once found this out, we ordered a cocktail while waiting for our table and the barman had finger up his nose (!) while making the drinks (not ours), but even so... how disgusting!  After tentatively drinking the cocktails (which we now called boggie drinks), I asked bar waitress if our table was ready (as it was 10 minutes past out booking time) and was told to go get up and speak to staff other side of the room... Really!? So I did while she just hung around doing nothing! Toilets are not labelled clearly (it is a dark area with dark labels - genius!) and a male cleaner wondered in while my wife was in the bathroom (no knock, or excuse me...). She couldn't believe it. The food is poor, and I mean for the price, it is shocking. Sushi with chilli - that is basically it. Not exactly amazing. There are no timing issues, its just brought to you when it is ready - Wagamama style. The staff didn't know the restaurants provenance policy - but eventually we were told that the duck and chicken is battery cage produced! For these prices, that is really terrible! Flavours were very bland and we began to wonder if any of this is had actually been made on site, much almost tasting like supermarket ready-meals. The more adventurous dishes just didn't work. The staff had there own way of serving - which is really amateur. This is compared with many other established 'proper' restaurants who have a restaurant 'standard' of service. Professionals know how to 'read' customers and fit accordingly. Staff here seem to think they are a bit more part of the experience than they should be and like to impose this - there seems to be a habit of making stupid, cheesy comments which comes from an ill-fated attempt of trying to be informative and 'entertaining' at the same time. This becomes instantly irritating because it seems everyone wants to communicate like this. Save it for Nandos, However, important stuff like knowing the dishes, where food is sourced, explaining the menu etc. was missing. Describing a dish as 'yeah, that is my favourite, it really niiiice' is not good enough. One or two were just barging in the middle of our conversation (which was rude and not an attempt at being efficient), or kept asking if the food okay in that 'like I really care' manner. One turned away and walked off in the middle of our standard 'its nice thanks' reply!  The manner was basically similar to a cold-calling sales agent for personal injury claims, trying to be charming, but really just being instantly repellent. I got annoyed at one who kept banging the top of my chair with his hand when walking passed - every single time. Also, they insisted in barging through short-cut gaps between the tables, rather than just using the wider aisles. One lifting her leg near my shoulder so I had to lean forward.  By the end of our meal, we had passed to annoyed phase, and just found it funny and amazing this place really behaved the way it did. Even the music was grating and too loud. We asked for the service charge to be removed from the bill (it has been a long time since we've done that). The staff are dressed in black with orange ties, and this sum up Sushi Samba. It is all about trying to be trendy and 'now', but it is not a proper restaurant in my book. The appeal is the location and views, other than that, it has nothing but an hollow farce for the fickle to be seen; it is a crèche for 20 to 30 somethings with too much money. The fast lift down was the most welcome end to the evening.

title: Best views in London
comment: Not eaten here yet but a great place to stop for drinks. Having said that, you absolutely pay for the view, last time I was in there I think I paid £28 for 2 cocktails (inc service charge). Breathtaking views and amazing decor however!

title: Sushi Samba, London
comment: Absolutely love it here. This was my 2nd visit ;-) Thrilling ride in the lift, up to the 38th floor! Awesome views of our beautiful City, both in the lift and from the restaurant Delicious food, very yummy flavours – I highly recommend the black cod Varied price range. Nicely presented; very quirky/trendy. Great for sharing and trying different dishes. Excellent service, they took the time to recommend food, and were very attentive.

title: Amazing view, actually great food
comment: No need to mention that the view from this place is absolutely stunning. I kind of had a low expectation to the food, given the fusion/weird sushi themes. (e.g., sushi with strawberries) But they turned out to be very tasty and looked so creative. It's an expensive place where you dress up and go. But for such occasion and you are ready to pay, it is an excellent choice!

title: Just had a drink in the bar. Didnt Eat. Nice place!
comment: Nice place to go for a drink in the bar. Expect to pay about £15 a drink for cocktails but beer is about £6 a bottle. Nice perk this. But you dont PAY to go up. Its not like the Shard who pull £30 out of your pocket to go up in the lift. Would have eaten here but I dont like sushi. It was the wifes birthday and we came out of Guacho City (Steaks) and wanted a nightcap. Close to Liverpool St Stn this was the ideal way to get a drink and a view. About the view... Late night and it was a little bit push and shove with a lot of people doing cameras and facebook shots etc. But to be expected. We didnt really look out the window too much. Maybe next time. The views are there for those who want to enjoy them and prepared to push past people sitting on the tables.  Overall a good attraction mainly because it was free entry and a fun ride in the open glass lift. Fast!

title: Sushi Samba with Sights!
comment: I found the service from the moment we walked into the time we left was amazing. The waiter explained the menu and all the dishes, which helped. The staff were very friendly which made our dining experience that much more enjoyable. The food was brilliant and was great in portion and taste. Would go back time and time again, especially for the amazing views of London.

title: View is everything
comment: From the lift trip to the scenery view, what a fabulous place! I dont care if it is expensive it is worth the price. Fantastic fro drinks in one of the aeras or outside on their terrace. Definetly will go back.

title: Exceptional!!
comment: I went there to celebrate my sons birthday not knowing quite what to expect!  The experience began by taking the elevator up to the 38th floor and from there the experience got even better. Breathtaking views over Central London and beyond with a roof terrace where you can take in the views.  Two bars on two levels and plenty of room for a Thursday. Amazing cocktails with a superb whiskey sour! Fantastic table by the window with panoramic views. Food and service was absolutely faultless. Attentive, not rushed and extremely polite. I'd go as far to say its one of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had. Amazing!!!!

title: "Late" night dining
comment: I live in NYC & have been to Sushi Samba before. It's definitely not where I thought I'd end up in Iceland, but they are open late (until 11), and there's not many options after 10 for eating. I ordered some vegetable sushi, & tempura jalapeños. The sushi was good & larger than I expected, but the jalapeños didn't taste very good without the blue cheese, otherwise it was basically like eating a jalapeño by itself bc the tempura batter was really light (which is good bc I don't like it heavy, I just don't think jalapeños are a good choice for this dish, mixed vegetables along with them prob would've tasted better. Who just bites into a whole jalapeño by itself?) I love them in my food, but usually cut up. The staff was nice & food came fast, & the restaurant did have a nice atmosphere. I could see it being a good place to hang out on the weekend to have drinks. I thought the food was overpriced (what isn't though, in Iceland?) and wasn't spectacular for what I paid (around 18 for a sushi roll with no fish.) I've gotten much cheaper, better roles back home. I would go again only if I had to eat late. It seemed it was more popular with locals, bc why would you go to Sushi Samba as a tourist?

title: The best sushi in London
comment: Just - the BEST sushi in London city! with a good panorama from 38th floor and super friendly service :)

title: Great Sushi!
comment: This was probably the best meal I have eaten in a long time. The location was amazing we turned up and they probably gave us one of the best tables in the room which was right next to the window with a fantastic view. We both felt a bit out of our depth with the menu but we made the best choices everything we selected was mouth watering. Then the service our waiter was helpful, polite and just what you need a waiter to be. I could not fault the place. Yes it is expensive but with all of the positives I don't mind paying good money for good food.

title: Best service ever - shame about the music...
comment: I loved this pace - the food is wonderful, and the service is the best I have ever had in a dining experience - the staff are truly amazing and so on the ball, but are up for a bit of banter if you fancy it. The ambience is the low point - the view saves it completely, but the music coming from the rather atmosphereless bar just lets the place down - lots of designer threads but just no soul. The interior of the restauant is just a bit odd - expensively odd, but a misfire nonetheless. They should try and separate themselves from the bar completely as it's letting them down. Saying that it is still worth going - but not for a romantic meal - more a group dining bit of fun.

title: Breathtaking views of London and fantastic food and service
comment: Sushi Samba is one of those go to places for special occasions. Like Barbecoa - you don't go to Sushi Samba for any old reason. This place can be expensive. Stress on the word "can" because it doesn't have to be. Our booking for dinner was at 4.30pm - a little early you might think but it worked out to our advantage as we were taken great care of and served promptly and attentively. We had never been to Sushi Samba before. I had read mixed reviews about service so i was a bit apprehensive. We took the breath taking lift up all the way to the 39th floor and was greeted by front of house in the casual eating/bar area. The lady took our coats and we were lost after that as she didn't direct us where to go. No matter. We saw another lady behind a desk and approached her about our reservation (you must book for seated eating in the main restaurant. It gets fully booked very easily no matter what day of the week - even more so fri-sun). We were promptly shown to our table and given a menu. Our waiter explained the menu and made recommendations. We didn't order any of the large main course plates. We ordered a variety of the smaller tapas style dishes so as to get a taste of the different dishes. We told our waiter could he please tell/advise us if we were ordering too much and told us we ordered enough: yellow fin taquitos, poussin and beef robata, samba london sushi roll and tiger maki (see photos) Dessert was chocolate banana cake and yuzu tart cheesecake (recommended and amazing!) We ordered dessert wine to go with the dessert. When the waitress arrived and asked us who ordered which wine - I had a freak out because I couldn't remember and she simply asked who had ordered what dessert and gave the right wine to each of us. Excellent knowledge of the menu and accompaniments! Very impressed. Overall very happy with the treatment by the staff. We were well looked after and made to feel welcome. I'd definitely go back - in fact I'm returning with some girlfriends very soon - I enjoyed the experience that much! Their big fruit cocktails look amazing!

title: Amazing Food
comment: Our waiter Pablo was so helpful telling us which dishes to order. I would say this is one of the most enjoyable meals we have had. And the views are spectacular.

title: Great location and views - pity about the bar staff
comment: I enjoyed this restaurant when I finally sat down. The one drawback from my perspective is the bar service and staff attitude. Now maybe its beacuse this is a popular city venue but I felt that the staff were just not interested and were going through the motions. The restaurant on the other hand was excellent and the staff just great. London does look magnificent from that height. The food is outsanding and yes if you dont know the menu, take advice from the serving staff. They will guide you along very nicely. Because of my experience in the bar I'm having to mark it down. That apart I'd recommend this place to eat.

title: From a chef
comment: I arrived at your restaurant this evening with my girlfriend and my sister. Firstly the food/ ambience/ concept and view are great. As a chef from a michelin star restaurant, I love food. All food! Service is always an integral part of a dining experience. No more so have I ever felt this than at your restaurant. We ate at your sushi bar and we have never felt so unwelcome in any restaurant. I have never felt the need to negatively review a restaurant before. However, the obnoxious and down right rude staff made this more of an necessity than a choice.

title: Great views, awful bouncers.
comment: If you're wearing a suit and tie then come whenever and enjoy the views and average service, but god forbid it's casual Fridays and after 9pm - you'll be told you've had too much to drink and turned away. As the name suggests - brilliant views but horribly tainted by such an unfriendly and arrogant approach.

title: Excellent
comment: We came here for a birthday meal with couple of friends. Very attentive service and the food was just amazing! great ambiance and music too! will def come back.

title: Perfect
comment: Reserved a table for two at 11pm (the latest they take reservations apparently), subtly requested a window seat and I was told that they couldn't guarantee it, but they took note of it anyway - and upon arrival (after a pretty exhilarating elavator ride) we were led to a perfect little table on the far side of the restaurant with breathtaking panoramic views. That, coupled with a brilliant greeting from our waiter Jacob made for a great first impression. ...and the evening simply continued in the same fashion. Jacob was helpful, attentive and incredibly knowledgable about everything in the menu(s), to the point that we went almost solely on his recommendations, for both food and drinks. The food was stunning; quite unlike anything I've had before, a mixture of flavours I'd never have expected to enjoy quite so much, and the cocktails were spot on. This is the kind of meal that I see almost as an investment. The bill would have made me yelp under any other circumstances, but given the fact that this was indeed one of the best restaurant experiences I have ever had (and possibly ever WILL have), money simply didn't seem to be an issue.  Bravo.

title: Fantastic business lunch, loved the fusion menu
comment: A great business lunch, party of 5. Menu very different to what I'd expected, unusual to see lamb cutlets and sushi on the same menu. We put ourselves in the hands of the waiter and asked him to arrange for a 'selection'. The food was delicious and very varied, nothing too hot, everything was consumed and every mouthful was delicious. Service was also perfect and friendly. The ambience and atmosphere is also 10/10' a real feeing of space with of course amazing views. Cost wise, worked out at £50 per head for lunch (no alcohol). We had a big selection of food for this. On the value side, unlike most Asian restaurant they charge per cup of green tea (at £4.50 per cup) which is a bit pricey. A great experience (so long as you don't mind going up 38 floors in a glass lift). I will be back very soon. Highly recommended.

title: Wonderful, definitely worth a visit!
comment: The thrill begins with the ride in the lift unto the top. Breath taking views on the way up and obviously once you reach the restaurant.  The bar area is quite small and even bet very crowded once it is busy. Lovely range of cocktails that are around £13.00 each. The restaurant is lovely and spacious and the again, the views are fabulous.  Service was excellent, staff took the time to explain the menu and advised on dishes to order for our group. Food came quickly and was delicious. Very very nice flavours and presented very well on the plates. Wonderfully pleasant experience and I cannot wait to return!

title: Okay.. Just ok.
comment: We would maybe visit sushi samba in the summer when the roof area would be open. We payed for a cocktail (which was very nice) and proceeded to the open area which we were very aggressively told was 'shut' despite a number of people out there and we had no explanation as to why we could not go outside.  The view was good.. But definitely not worth the £30 we paid for two cocktails.  Overall we were disappointed by the small bar and non descript experience. Not worth the time or effort, we much preferred the sky bar near St. Paul's cathedral!

title: Outstanding Service once again from Remi and the team
comment: This is my second visit here and i can safely say it's my favourate restaurant!! Remi the restaurant manager greeted us and nothing was a problem, we had Andrea and Clemont as our waiters and we werent sure what to order so they asked us what we liked and picked the rest. Without doubt the best service I have had the pleasure of getting. An amazing experience with fantastic views and worth every penny. Will be going back here very soon. Thanks again to Remi, Andrea and Clemont for making us feel so special.

title: Always a treat!
comment: I went a few times so far for various occasions, and am loving it every time. You need to book quite far in advance (about 8 weeks), but it's worth the wait. The food is outstanding, the service always been very good, the views from the 38th floor are beautiful. Definitely a nice treat for a special occasion!

title: yes
comment: i've been just couple of times last year and i've been back for business recently with some colleagues that never been over here. for sure the location is super wow...top floor and super place. You can come for a drink...as well as there are 2 restaurants...but my experience stopped all times just at the sushi one; which is always very great variety with an excellent service. also if you look for a place where to bring HER...there you are for sure.... But don get me wrong, this is not only for the scenario; the food is really at high level

title: Customer service shambles!
comment: I had booked a table for noon on a Sunday for my daughter's 18 birthday but owing to a delay on our train line, tried to call the restaurant at 11:30am to advise that we would not be there until 12:20. A recorded message told us that the line was open from 10am on Sundays but it then repeatedly just rang and rang until it cut off. I finally got my call answers on my 14th attempt at calling, some 40 minutes after I first tried. By now it was 12:10. I explained that we had been delayed and that we would be at the restaurant at 12:20. The man I spoke to said that the table would be cancelled automatically at 12:15. I asked if this could be extended as we were on our way and I promised that we would still vacate the table by 2:30, as we had been given a 2.5 hour table time. The man said that he was in a call centre and couldn't do anything more to help, the table would therefore be cancelled at 12:15 if we hasn't arrived by then. He then suggested that we turn up at the restaurant and 'ask really nicely' if they would still accommodate us, although he couldn't promise that we wouldn't be turned away. I didn't fancy having to spend my daughter's 18th birthday grovelling so we didn't bother going at all - the chance of being turned away at the door just wasn't worth it. I see no reason why they couldn't have kept the table given the lengths I went to to advise them we were en route. The train delay was bad enough on a special day but the inflexibility of the restaurant's customer service guy was ridiculous. Jobs worth!

title: Amazing place - great athmosphere - great food
comment: Hi I recently had a meal here on a Saturday. Great experience. I love sushi anyway so was really looking forward to the experience. We had the black cod, HAMACHI yellow tail, EL TOPO and TIGER MAKI. All of which were great especially the yellow tail. We also had the duck which we did not like. It was a bit fatty and chewy. The highlight though was the desert - YUZU TART CHEESECAKE!! You cannot miss this! its stunning and so tasty if your a cheesecake fan! One point though its tough to get a good time. We had a 6.30pm time which was actually quite nice as we got the sunset when we arrived and also saw the night lights when we were finishing up! All in all i would definitely recommend this place.

title: Fresh!
comment: The fish was great quality and very fresh. Lovely mix of flavours. Great service and atmosphere but comes with the price tag.

title: Cocktails with a view
comment: We stopped by for a quick pre dinner cocktail. We didn't eat in the restaurant. The views of London are brilliant and the cocktails are delicious. Next time I am in London I will call in for some food as it looked lovely

title: Cocktails again at Sushi
comment: Great place to chill and enjoy the sun setting over old London town, that's if you can focus on the setting sun, great cocktails buzzy atmosphere. Have not eaten here but made a number of visits late at night for a drink with family and friends. Don't go early, you will have to stand out in the cold as there is a limit to how many people they let in at the time. Best time to go is summer when the sun sets latish. One thing it's not cheap but you are paying for a great view.

title: Great Sushi/Brazilian Fusion
comment: The view is spectacular, the food delicious, the staff terrific. It is a place I'd recommend to anyone traveling to London...Be sure to call ahead for reservation!

title: Great Food
comment: We have been to a branch of Sushi Samba before but that was in Chicago a few years ago and remembered it being a good experience so decided to give the newish London branch a go. Its on the 38th floor of the Heron tower(close to Gherkin and Shard) and has fantastic views of London. We had ordered half a dozen dishes between us which probably enough but everything was absolutely delicious so ordered another couple. Highlights for us were to miso glazed ribs off the robata grill, some grilled flank with amazing giant corn kernels, the tuna seviche and really good samba rolls. Service slick and speedy. Only one negative thought the cocktails lacked a bit of strength and tasted a little too much of the fruits included within them. 2 cocktails, 4 glasses of wine and 8 courses for £185. Not bad value but if we were here for dinner the bill could get very hefty! Will return.

title: Fan-Flippin-Tastic
comment: The menu is amazing and we just couldn't decide so went with the lovely Jacob's suggestion to let him chose for us, we were not disappointed, he chose well, we had about seven dishes and I cannot say which one was better, they were all amazing. A slightly chilled pinot noir complimented the food beautifully and just added to the magic of the evening.  This is not just sushi, this is sushi and then some!! The location is fab and what is even better is that its not too crowded, after dinner we secured a lovely spot by the window in the bar and enjoyed some cocktails, again the service here was just lovely.  Put this restaurant on your bucket list, its amazing.

title: Good. But impossible to look beyond the view
comment: Sushi Samba is great. Sushi and a great view of London, what else can you want? Not cheap, but you have to pay a premium for each of those 38 Floors.  The sushi is good, it's not Japanese sushi more urban contemporary sushi with a twist, which is nice, but don't go there for your Spicy Tuna Roll. Service is standard London service, a little bit clumsy and not as welcoming as it could be. But this is the city of London, clientele consists of business meetings, special occasions and rich tourists. Doesn't seem to have much repeat customers.  If someone else is paying and the weather is either clear and sunning or horrendous day storm - GO. It's a fine restaurant.

title: Stunning views!
comment: Well I took the opportunity to visit the Heron Building in the heart of London and as couldn't get a booking at The Shard Oblix, took the bait and came here and boy what a swanky place with some of London coolest and stylish people in attendance! If you suffer vertigo it's not for you but if you want superb food that's freshly prepared and amazing cocktails that are professionally served (our hostess was the lovely Sophia) then make this place a must visit location. I will definitely be back when I'm in London next and strongly advise you to do the same! Duck and Waffle upstairs is also a gem!

title: a must whilst in London
comment: cant recommend this place enough.. the staff the food the views.. its dosnt get much better then this as far as im concerned. our waiter was excellent and had us giggling throughout our afternoon there.

title: Great place
comment: This restaurant has a really nice atmosphere. The staff is helpful, they explain everything and give you good options on what to order. The view is fantastic. You have to make a reservation if you wanna go, as most of the good restaurants in London, but I did it on the afternoon of the same day there I went there, so no big deal. It is not a cheap place though totally worth it.

title: The best restaurant I have been to
comment: Perfect food, I can recommend tempura prawns ! Also the view of London is amazing. The restaurant must be pre-booked but everyone can just pop in to the bar for a drink. Highly recommended

title: Great view and great food!
comment: Sushi was very good, but have to say that yuzu cheese cake was unfogettable! Sushi Samba is nice experience, because the view is great! You can same time enjoy great food and see whole beautiful London. Cool!

title: Good service and food
comment: Had a very lovely dinner with friends, we was sitting close to the window and the view was fantastic.  The food was very good and the service too.  We will come back for sure.

title: Beautiful views of London and well made cocktails
comment: Stop by after work (but leave work early) and take the elevators on Bishopsgate to the 38th floor. Order a pre-dinner cocktail and enjoy London laid out at your feet. The terrace bar is stunning when the weather is nice.

title: Great View
comment: Very much enjoyed the view and the great cocktails at Sushi Samba, I've been a number of times and they've always been great,

title: Heaven
comment: quite frankly this is one of the best meals I have had in London. amazing venue, amazing views and lovely staff. The food is to die for and I cant wait to go back

title: Exceptional food, exceptional service.
comment: It was a tall order for sushisamba to live up to my expectations following my first visit to the restaurant but I was not disappointed. The roof terrace is beautiful and the view is just breath taking. The staff are very attentive and genuinely friendly, and helpful with the menu if you are new to sushi cuisine. The food was just lovely as I remembered it, my personal favourites were the tempura prawns, takitos & yellowtail with jalepino & lemongrass. It is not cheap but it is very good value and I was happy to settle the bill for such great food and service. I look forward very much to my next visit I just wished I lived closer.

title: Great experience!
comment: Great location, friendly and helpful staff and most importantly incredible food. The staff seemed to enjoy explaining the menu and each course; we tried something from each section and they were all delicious and immaculately presented. We weren't sure whether to try warm or cold sake so the waiter suggested having half each way, a good idea for a first timer.  Booking weeks in advance is recommended, it's very popular.

title: Good food by fussy service
comment: Food is lovely indeed but the service is way over the top fussy - the serving staff top up your wine glass for you and each time only by a very small amount so they had to keep coming back which is quite distracting. We had the menu painstakingly explained to us in far more detail than necessary and were interrupted to be informed of the existence of the sashimi restaurant on the floor above.... well I was already eating in one of their restaurants so not sure why I needed to be informed in the middle of my meal!? It felt like it was all a bit over the top to justify the 12.5% service charge they whack on the bill at the end....

title: Fantastic experience
comment: Went for my daughters birthday, great location and views excellent friendly service, food choices explained well and presented beautifully . Fantastic choice of saki however I think the wine prices are over the top even for top london prices .

title: Beautiful view and experience
comment: The food is overpriced but it compensates for the amazing views and relaxing atmosphere. I had a wedding anniversary lunch and our 5 -year son tagged along and we all had a great time. The sushi portions are quite big, however the mains may be too small for some. Staff is attentive and very polite and they truly make the whole experience worthy. From the sweet h Girl at the cloakroom, to the host Slava and our waiter (I'm sorry I forgot your name). We had cocktails and beer and our anniversary were made extra especial by complimentary scallops and champagne. We were looking for a romantic yet family friendly place and Sushisamba was just perfect. We will definitely be back for other especial occasions.

title: Exquisite
comment: Perfectly served and cooked! Would highly recommend. The views from the bar were breathtaking. For the 2 of us our bill came to £150 but we'll worth it.

title: Style over substance
comment: So after being scrutinised by a man on the door who looked suspiciously like Captain Haddock from Tin Tin (seriously he even had the cap!) we were allowed in for our table booking. I'll get the good bits out of the way first.... the staff are really lovely, very up beat and friendly and the portions of food are massive (we ate at 11.30pm there were 4 of us, we had 2 large plates and 6 small plates and there was way too much food!), but it really was average. I had 2 Sake and Elderflower Collins while I was there and they both tasted completely different, although both were over sweet. The bar area was full of the usual posers this kind of venue will attract and I noticed a massive amount of cobwebs hanging from the beautiful glass that was everywhere, seriously have a word with the cleaners this is not a good look for this kind of establishment! We were then shown to the restaurant, the decor was fantastic and the views were good, although there were girls posing by the windows for selfies every 2 minutes so it was a little hard to focus after beign blinded by the flashes. We ate Sushi and grilled meat, that is what they serve, meat and fish, it was ok. The presentation was very good and the staff seemed overly proud of the food they were serving, almost like we shouldn't really be eating it it was so good, but it wasn't. The fish was fresh and the steak was beef but it was by no means the best food I have ever tasted I'm afraid. It was very expensive but then you expect to pay these prices for this kind of place, I was expecting more food wise and I left disappointed. There are way better places to eat in London with lovely views, I can tick it off the list but I won't be returning.

title: First class service
comment: This is the first time I've eaten at this resaurant and what an experience. Nothing was to much trouble. When we went in the waitress came over and introduced herself and the restaurant manager Remi even came over to check how we were getting on. Food was fantastic and would recommend the tuna.Would definately go again only downside was the waiting list to get a table. I can now see why that is.

title: Pure theatre
comment: This restaurant is an 'experience' from the moment you get in the lift at ground level, to the moment you find yourself deposited back there two hours later. Everything about my vist there with my daughters was excellent. The views were breathtaking, the food was surprising, unusual and very good and the service was fantastic. All of the above helped to temper the shock (and it was a real shock) when the bill arrived. Loved it though, not often a restaurant experience wow's this restaurant cynic.

title: Great location
comment: This was the second time we had eaten at Sushi Samba. The views from the restaurant and terrace are impressive and the ride in the lift up to the restaurant also provides a great view. Our second visit was on a Friday evening and the bar area was overcrowded. It was difficult to push through to get to the restaurant. Even the stairs were crowded. The food and service are generally good although there is a feeling that you are being rushed along to get the next table booking in. It is very expensive but I guess the location justifies it. The meats from the Robata grill are good as are the samba rolls and the wagyu gyoza. The Peruvian corn is worth trying although the shrimp ponzu was disappointing and not as good as Nobu. We enjoyed the evening and I would recommend it for a special occasion.

title: Total disappointment
comment: The fact that the place offers a book-menu with drinks and one sheet of paper with food means that this is definitely not a place for eating but for outing with friends for cocktails with a view to the city. Limited number of dishes, average sushi, tasteless and cold miso. Service is average, our waiter has overturned my wine (almost one third of a glass) when taking away plates and has not offered to add what was spilt. Prices in menu does not include 12.5% service tax, so be prepared to have your bill with extra charges for service.

title: Absolutely mindblowingly awesome food!
comment: Japanese food is a favourite of mine, and I've been wanting to visit Sushisamba for ages after hearing great things about it, so was it worth the wait? Without a doubt, yes. It's a mixture of Japanese, Brazilian, and Peruvian food. We had the yellowtail taquitos, sweet and sour calamari, pork belly, vegetable tempura, and mango mousse and mochi for dessert. Everything was just mouthwateringly good. The flavours were intense and delicious, and the service brilliant.  I'd recommend this place to anyone, and the view is just gorgeous! Definitely one of the best restaurants I've ever eaten at.

title: Food heaven
comment: Some of the best food ever. Four of us took around 10 mins to make our selection & once completed even the waiter said a great choice. Every course was just heavenly & some of the best food I & the other 3 have tasted, the combination of the style of food just splendid. Service & atmosphere great. Will definately be returning & worth every penny. One of my favourite eating spots ever.

title: Amazing!
comment: Sushisamba is now the best dining experience I've ever had in my life. The food was incredible, the view spectacular and the staff were all extremely helpful and friendly. I felt so elevated during my time there, there was this sense of wonderment, I don't know, how to call it! Maybe it was the high altitude! Seriously, though, it is worth every penny we paid, it was truly amazing! I want to mention and personally thank, Carolina, who greeted us and tried her best to allocate us the table of our preference, Pablo, who took great care of us and Patrik, the floor manager, whose attention to detail created an evening we will never forget! Thank you!

title: Amazing view, great food, enjoyable birthday celebration!
comment: The view is amazing! It has to be said. Especially when you get to sit next to the windows right in the centre. This was a night out for my husbands birthday, so we were grateful for the seating arrangement. We decided to leave most of the decision to the staff with a little input from us and we were not disappointed. The highlight was the wagyu beef on hot stones which we both loved (although it is expensive for what it is) we also had various other dishes and sushi. The sushi was good but the last thing to come out and by this time I was full. (we had quite a lot) The cocktail were good and my husband was presented with a birthday dessert, nice touch! It was a great night, if a little expensive.

title: Good but overrated
comment: The plus sides are excellent service, if a little pretentious, and a phenomenal view over the city. We went on a cold winters night and I can only imagine that seeing a summer's sunset here is even better.  However moving on to the the food, while the tast perhaps justifies the price, the disappointing portion size certainly does not. I would certainly recommend not coming here hungry unless you are really willing to spend a small fortune. Overall it was an enjoyable experience, but more so for the novelty of the view and the decor than for the food itself. Unfortunately I think the restaurent trades on the hype surrounding it rather than than on its product, and there isn't anyone that believes it more than the waiters themselves, who will describe at great lengths the brilliance of a certain dish, which will taste great for a single mouthful but ultimately leave you rather disappointed. I would certainly recommend it as an experience, but reccomend stopping for an Itsu takeaway box on the way home to fulfill ones appetite.

title: Great view but poor service
comment: The view from 38th floor is indubitably beautiful with London nightlights, but the service by the female hostess at the Sushi Bar could do with some improvement.  Walked in on a Thursday night when the bar was empty. When we mentioned we made no reservations, the female hostess at the stand gave us a glare and was very rude and snotty in her tone - as if we are not allowed to eat. Then we asked the Brazilian male waiter who explained we could sit at the sushi bar which was totally empty at that time.

title: Restaurant with a view
comment: I booked a table for two for lunch. Sushisamba then emailed my confirmation and also rang to confirm two days before. I found this reassuring as I have arrived at restaurants before and although I have had a confirmation number my booking was nowhere to be found! From the moment we arrived to take the lift to the 38th floor we were looked after superbly. From the gentlemen on the ground floor, the girl who took our coats, and the waiter who we could not fault. We had the waiters recommendations for food and drinks which as I was with a well travelled colleague I was waiting to hear his criticisms. He normally manages to find something wrong but not this time. If you are visiting the City and only have time to visit one restaurant for lunch/dinner I would not hesitate in recommending this place.  Oh, and sipping cocktails whilst enjoying the view of London, simply priceless!

title: Great restaurant and a view to die for
comment: Well just the view is breathtaking. Went and had a look at restaurant on 40th floor decor not as nice. Food was good but I think Sushi Samba in Miami slightly better. From an atmosphere point of view a bit quiet, Miami pumps but maybe from a classy point of view London has the view and the class.

title: Lovely!
comment: Very good, fresh sushi fusion. The view is of course amazing, and the service efficient but a little unfriendly

title: Sushi like no other!
comment: This was an amazing eating experience, which begins with a spectacular lift ride to floor 38 of Heron Tower. The food marries sushi with South American cuisine in a way that is innovative and delicious. If unsure, the staff are eager to explain. We just wanted to keep eating! Strongly recommended to book ahead.

title: LONDON SKY LINE!
comment: icredible point of view of London!!!!!!! super... i want be back there in summer time and drink a super glass of champagne outside and breaf from the garden!  best location never seen before, amaizing.........and i tought to spend more then 100 euro each person with bottle of champagne, meat and sushi/sashimi. Meat very good with all dressing also good. Sushi nothing special for me, i ate very good sushi in other places! however, go there and enjoy the club!

title: It was OK...
comment: To be honest, it wasn't amazing and none of the dishes we had were very memorable. It was nice but for the price we paid it should have been sensational. It wasn't. The decor is nice but who goes to restaurants for that?!? I don't recommend it.

title: Great place to go for a cocktail.....
comment: We visited the Sushi Samba bar for pre-dinner drinks on Valentine's Day. We arrived at about 7:15pm and there was no need to queue. The doormen are polite and friendly, and we were ushered into the scenic lift as soon as we arrived. The venue really is fantastic, and the views from the 38th floor bar are certainly worth seeing. The cocktail menu is original and extensive, and we had a Chucumber (Hendrick’s gin, plum wine and Maraschino liqueur, shaken with freshly pressed cucumber water, lime, sugar and plum bitters, served up) and a Karririnha (fragrant Kaffir lime leaves infused in cachaça, churned with lime and sugar, served short over crushed ice). Both cocktails were expertly made and we enjoyed them. Overall i would rate the venue as excellent and we shall be returning to eat here in the summer when we can take advantage of the outdoor dining terraces.

title: fantastic food
comment: came here with some friends and the food is delicious - it is pricey but worth it for a special occasion and the views!!! well the views are to die for.

title: Brazilian-Peruvian sushi experience!
comment: Finally we got a reservation to this magnificent restaurant up in sky at the 38th floor of Heron Tower. The location is stunning as well as the food we had. Under the suggestion of a cool waiter, we tried a dish from all section of the menu. I've never tasted a Black cod that juicy and tender like that one. Our selection of maki was really well presented, and the fusion of these 3 different cuisine worked perfectly for us. The balance is: - great location - amazing food  - perfectly matching drinks - quite expensive meal. The cost is the reflection of the location, but primary quality food was served, so we'll come back as soon as possible!

title: Great food, helpful staff
comment: Food was excellent was exactly what I expected from a recommendation from a friend. It took longer than expected for someone to approach our table for our order although when they did they were very helpful in helping us determine what was a good dish.  Prices are on the extraordinarily side compared to places similar in States, but I guess that is the norm in such a central area of London and such a fantastic building with an amazing view.

title: great cocktails
comment: After a long walk in the city on the Sunday afternoon we decided to go for a nice cocktail and weren't disappointed, what a nice experience when my friends and I enjoyed some cosmopolitans over the sunset... beautiful experience and great drinks, would most definitely recommend!

title: not so great
comment: Yes, it has a nice view and the food is okay but their success has gone to their head. I took us a long time to get a booking, and they only gave us a table at 11.30 for lunch, we arrived promptly however the table wasn’t ready and they made us wait even though the restaurant was empty. The prices are ridiculous. Normally, in Japanese restaurants tea is complementary or at least they will refill your cup for free, not here!. We were charged £25 for 3 cups of green tea (£8.50 each small cup).

title: Mat
comment: Lovely meal. Had great time with my frinds. Atmosphere is ok. Service is great.Food come little bit late. Still its worth full.enjoyed it

title: Food is good but is not worth it. You are paying the locations
comment: I booked a table for four and then I tried to add one more. The booking system is very very poor. I called them several times without any success, on arrival they said we didn't have a table for five so we had to wait at the bar. In regards the food no complains, it was good, not excellent, but overpriced. We follow what the waitress suggested and some of the dishes were very nice others average: Black cod was dry, Ceviches were ok, and meet average. I think there are much better Japanese restaurants in London. If you are looking for Peruvian or Brazilian food, you have other restaurants to go.  If you are curious with the place go for cocktails.

title: expensive
comment: great food - good service - small portions - very very casual with average quality of diners and atmosphere average better view at The Shard, busy restaurant. will go again but on a summer day as in winter you dont get to enjoy the balcony

title: Spectacular outside seating area.
comment: We arrived here after drinks at the Shard (33rd floor v 38th here). The place was bustling, great selection of cocktails around £12.50 a drink. I think what makes this place favourable to the Shard bars is the outside area. It has a large outside area with a firepit and great views over the city. Can't wait to take other friends here now I've found it.

title: Great views but pricey
comment: Went here for drinks on a Friday night around 8pm - no problems getting in just to have drinks - waited about 5-10 mins in the queue.  Really impressive lift and views - the Heron Tower offices next door look amazing - cool fish tanks and escalators. We went up to the 38th and 39th floor to Sushi Samba - we had some Chuecumber cocktails - so so delicious but very pricey, it came to £43 for three but then I guess you could argue this is London prices and anywhere with great views does seem to charge more. Bar area was impressive, cool artwork on the wall and of course the great views. There was an interesting looking big orange tree outside which apparently you can go and sit under when the weather is warmer which sounds great. The bar on the 40th floor looked good, the music seemed better up there but we were not allowed up there with our cocktails we had bought from the 39th - something to do with if customers at the 40th floor bar saw them they might ask for them and they werent on the menu - bit strange as we were all willing to come up there and get more drinks. Friend had a tray of sushi and tuna steak which was delicious but came to £27 for one portion.  Good place, good location, amazing views but rather pricey.

title: Awesome!!!
comment: We arrived and the nice lady at the door told us we were in the right place and told us the floor to go up to in the lift. the lift gives you that sort of g-force that you get when going over a hump in the car. it made me giggle. :) the view from the lift alone was fab. we got to the top and walked into the bustling bar area and a lady took our coats and gave us a token and guided us to the reservation desk. There was a mix up with the dates of our reservation and for some reason, we had booked the week after when we actually wanted to go (miscommunication on the phone and i didn't recheck the email booking). Luckily, there was a table available for us. They guided us to our table and the lovely man pulled my chair out for me. The waiter was so attentive in that he started with drinks and they came so fast and then explained the menu to us as it was our first visit. We struggled to hear him and understand his accent but we managed to get the gist. He gave us 5-10 minutes to study the menu and then came back to take our order, we had no idea what to order (portion sizes etc) and he made some suggestions and we just left it all up to him to sort it out for us and boy, he made good choices. We started with tacos (yellowish and a sort of vegetarian option), then had the rock shrimp (so delicious i could have eaten a whole bucket of them!), then we had some raw fish and some beef, then sushi rolls with seafood in and wasabi mayo (they were so nice, and full of flavour and made you want to eat more to see what else you could taste!), then after that we had something else that i can't remember....i think i was full and just overwhelmed at this point! The other good thing was that the waiter (one of many!!!) explained everything in detail before we ate each course. they couldn't have been more attentive and were on hand at ANY point. The bill was just over £100 and we had a beer and a bottle of water which I don't think is unreasonable given the service (which was a discretionary 12.5% and included in my aforementioned bill price), the view (which was exceptional!!!), the food and the overall experience and wow factor. On the whole, we would definitely go again for a special occasion or if we want to wow some friends or family with the place.

title: Too expensive for what it was.
comment: The restaurant is really dark although it has a trendy feel to it. The food was very expensive and the portions were very small. The sushi was unlike any I've tasted before, it was great to try something new, but I prefer more traditional sushi. http://lifeofalondonstudent.blogspot.co.uk/2014/02/sushi-samba.html

title: Amazing views
