comment: Popped in here for a drink in January, having been recommended by a friend, just as the sun was setting. The views were fantastic - London is the best city in the world!

title: Great views is not worth cost.
comment: Went to a sushi samba up Heron tower in London Friday 7th Feb'. As I went up the glass lift the view was amazing to see London at night even with the terrible weather we have experienced. Walked into a really cool place. It was busy and vibrant. The champagne was the right type but the expense was significant however it was equal with other prices £77 a bottle so....ok.  Our host had booked a table and we got to it late (about 40mins) after lots of nudging we got to the table with our friends. We had a set menu, guys it was not worth £70 per head, with the wine it rocketed to over £100 per head. Sorry the wine was not what it could have been. It's was meant to be cloudy bay, not a chance.... I love that wine normally and it was the poorest example I have ever drunk. Then we get to the food, not the sushi it should have been. Over priced sporadic service with food that could have glued your insides together.  The ambience was good, the views cool, it was the food, certainly was not worth the bill and needs a big improvement for me to go and eat there again. Have a drink yes, enjoy the views but don't eat there it's far to expensive for what you get.

title: Amazing view, good service, below average food and cocktails
comment: The view is amazing, the interior design of the restaurant impressive too. But that's it...The food was not even close to my expectations, the cocktails we drunk were very bad too...not what you expect from such a restaurant. Also when we left our clothes were smelling like we had dinner in a fish and chips shop... I will visit it again just to have a whiskey with ice and enjoy the view...

title: Fabulous place
comment: My partner and I decided to treat ourselves to an evening here and it was every bit as good as we had hoped. Managed to get a table, but sitting at the bar, perhaps because of the tube strike it was easier to get a booking. The cocktails were fabulous - including non alcoholic ones. We ate sushi which was super fresh, interesting flavours and very good. This is a fairly expensive night out, but the atmosphere, food and service are really worth it.

title: Business Dinner
comment: Great food, really good service. Brilliant views and bar. Lots of choice. Really nice crowd, got talking to lots of good folk. Will be going back very soon.

title: Pretty average restaurant on the 38th floor of a tower
comment: I am a food lover and I often eat out. This restaurant pretend to be a fusion of Japanese, Brazilian and Peruvian food....to be fair, their menu is simply divided into 3 parts one per each food type. The food was good but nothing outstanding, now given the price they charge I would expect a lot more. The wine list is also very good, but it is extremely expensive, the cheapest wine is wound £ 30. The only good point about this restaurant is the view, it is really breathtaking, shame that when I booked the take (two month before) I did ask a window table, but we were given in the complete opposite corner. This place simply does not worth the money they charge.

title: Ok, nothing amazing though....l
comment: If you suffer from vertigo, beware the lift! If not, enjoy the ride. It is spectacular. Views from restaurant are also fabulous. Food.....mainly average. The special sushi rolls though are a victim of style over substance. They look incredibly pretty and presentation is awesome but sadly the taste doesn't match. I tried a few different types and I couldn't find any I liked. Their gyoza were very good though, rock shrimps were good (but not at Roka level).....traditional style sushi was good. But overall not good enough and won't be rushing back.....

title: Great drinks.... meh food
comment: Great great drinks... food average and a little overpriced. Overall a good spot to try, but certainly not to rave about. Concept is good and place is vibrant. P

title: Very good but poor staffing
comment: I was taken here as part of a Christmas treat and the overall experience was very good with the exception of the staff. Ambience, company, food, cocktail, timing and views were excellent. However, the staff couldn't care less - there were no smiles and very little communication except from the "booted and suited" members of staff. There were too many occasions when we were asked if the food was okay, on two occasions I stated that I would give it only 5 marks out of ten, guess what, they did not bother to find out why, they just walked away - another place where once you are in, they couldn't care less. Shame really, the food was very good.

title: Diabolical
comment: I used to be a regular patron of sushi samba (both for dining with clients & evening drinks) but I will never set foot in the establishment again. I called in the week to confirm that their door policy was still the same- that if you are arriving for drinks that you do not need to book, and that as a male in my mid-thirties with two friends that we would not have any issues with the door staff. Whilst the person I spoke to in the week was very helpful and said that we would be able to arrive without booking, and that 3 males in their thirties would be more than welcome, unfortunately this was not the case. Immediately when we joined the queue the smaller doorman in a woolly hat immediately took dislike to us and pointed to us and then spoke to his colleague. It took 20 minutes for us to get to the front which in itself isn’t a problem, and we were then held at the rope for an additional 10 minutes. The taller of the two doormen engaged us in conversation, and asked the same old Sushi Samba question when they are trying to get rid of you- “Have you had any other drinks tonight?”. We had actually been out for dinner prior to arriving at Sushi Samba so responded honestly- we had consumed ONE glass of red wine each. ONE! In his opinion this was too much and we got told to clear off.  If we were drunk I would have understood. If we were dressed inappropriately I would have understood. If he had told us the minute we joined the queue that he had no intention of letting us in I would not be as annoyed as I am. He kept us waiting there for 30 minutes in the cold and completely wasted our time. This is not a one off occurrence. Read through the some of the other reviews left on here and you will find many left by people of the same demographic as myself who experienced the same treatment. Prior to Christmas the smaller of the two door staff (let’s call him Mr Hat, as on both occasions was wearing his woolly head-wear) treated me with similar disregard. He accused me of jumping the queue and it was only with the backing of a group of strangers behind me who confirmed that this was not the case that he finally let me in. The arrogance of the two guys on the door has left me dumbfounded. It is not what I expect from such an establishment. I would suggest that Sushi Samba need to invest in some training for these two people, or perhaps replace them with individuals who would represent their brand more appropriately. If you are set on paying them a visit perhaps bring a breathalyser with you so that you can prove you haven’t had anything to drink, at least they will have to think of another excuse to turn you away. I would suggest to people considering visiting Sushi Samba to go elsewhere. The Shard offers better views of London. Nobu offers better sushi.

title: Amazing view, a little bit more food would have been good
comment: This is a truly amazing experience on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower. It takes 34 seconds to get to the restaurant, friendly staff at the door make you feel really welcome, the customer service is brilliant. Everyone wants to make sure you're having a good time, everything is to your liking but aren't intrusive in your conversation. It is pretty pricey, but you're in central London. Four of us ordered two dishes each, there was enough on the plate for one piece each. I had to go home and have my dinner. I'd recommend you order a lot more than what's recommended, but be prepared to spend.

title: A real treat
comment: We booked in advance for an evening meal and had an early sitting. On arrival we were greeted and shown straight to the lift by the staff jumping the already lengthy queue. Even the lift had great views but once upstairs we were wowed by the city sights in all directions. The place is buzzing and friendly and staff tried hard to serve as quickly as was possible despite the crowd. Once seated we found the menu baffling so asked the waiter for advice. He was friendly and keen to help and knew what he was taking about. The food was great and well presented and we didn't feel rushed. We stayed on for drinks in the bar after and felt it was fairly priced for the venue and city location but not somewhere we would eat often. Would recommend for family meal (our children are young adults) or celebration outing if you want a treat or are trying to impress visitors. We will definitely be back.

title: An excellent evening
comment: Visited SushiSamba for the second time for a Birthday and it was brilliant. We arrived around 630 and the queue was very quick, the views are spectacular especially at night time. The restaurant is an expensive place to visit but for special occasions it is worthwhile. The service was very good and the staff were always helpful to explain things. The dishes are small but I prefer this as you are able to try more of the different food categories. I would recommend the Rock Shrimp, It was absolutely delicious, and the Cheesecake.

title: Great evening!
comment: Me and friends went on a Monday evening. Getting a reservation is very difficult so book well in advance. The staff were lovely and helpful guiding us through the menu and we even managed to have a few laughs with them too which is nice as sometimes waiters can be quite robotic doing what they need to do without really engaging with their diners. The food was exceptional we ordered between 1-2 dishes from each section which was advised so that we could try a little of everything.  With wine, cocktails, food an dessert we paid £90 each (between 3) which yes to some is expensive but it was expected and the food was great so I didn't resent paying. Oh and the view up in the elevator and in the restaurant was beautiful. Only downside was I wish I had a table by the window!

title: Sky high views and prices!!
comment: Have been a few times just for a drink which is great albeit very expensive but last week managed to have lunch there. There were 6 of us and we opted to let the chef choose our food for us.  We had an absolute banquet and the food was incredible. We had a really good variety of sushi, sashimi, rice dishes, meat and some fried fish too. There were a few highlights but I think the beef served on hot stones was the best thing I ate. This was a business lunch but I would definitely go and spend my own money there.

title: Decent but expensive
comment: Great views from restaurant Service very good and good fantastic Great sake menu but overall very pricey especially the wine which is small put off

title: Lunch
comment: Very good menu selection, excellent food, great views (even on a cloudy day) and attentive service. Cannot wait to return.

title: Pleasant surprise! Really great fusion food!
comment: The Sushisamba Restaurant is located on the 38th floor of the Heron building, meaning the view itself is worth a visit. Add to that a really friendly staff, great drinks and some delicious Japanese/Peruvian/Brazilian food. It was clear that this was a popular place for business, friends and couples alike and there was a great vibe throughout our visit. The salmon nigiri with melted mozzarella made quite an impression. Tastes much better than it sounds :)

title: Just for Drinks
comment: Turned up out the blue and had two drinks. Fantastic view, really well made cocktails and good, busy atmosphere! Prices were extortionate, however you're paying for the venue. Ashame about how rude the staff appeared to be, which is probably what happens when you serve bankers all week. All in all, I will definitely be back!

title: Amazing Food
comment: Simply put, every dish was very tasty! And their Chorizo is amazing. Service is very good and the view of the Girken is cool! Bar is fun and you can head up to duck and waffle when they close. The only criticism I have is that the decor and design is a bit boring and nothing special. It's ok but other than that, the place is always full and buzzy. Definitely a cool funky alternative to places like Nobu which is also great!

title: Superb location and food
comment: The food was superb. My friend and I just left it to the waiter to bring us what he wanted. Very good indeed. Great atmosphere, great food, great location, great views. Awful hangover!

title: Incredible views!
comment: Took the missus and whilst it was expensive to stay for more than a couple of drinks the view is breathtaking on an evening and the staff were all very welcoming. Would recommend it if you have visitors and you want to give them the 'wow' factor.

title: Glad I went for the experience - very nice lunch & great service
comment: It took a few weeks to bag a Friday lunch table but I'm glad I made the effort. We didn't get a great view but the food is excellent. We had 5 dishes to share plus a side and it was a lot of food. The pork ribs were meltingly delicious and I loved the wagyu gyoza.  There is a large sake menu but I opted for Asahi.  The service was great and very friendly. They know the menu very well and even let you know the order the food will be brought out in.

title: Used to be a big fan...
comment: When we moved to London in July 13 we quickly made this place one of our monthly treats for drinks. After raving about it to my parents they couldn't wait to try to cocktails on their visit in December. Host on the ground floor was very professional but the waitress we had who served our drinks was very dismissive and rather haughty. After dumping our drinks on us she then handed us a bill and left. The service charge for 4 drinks came to around £15!! I am happy to tip for good service (although cannot say I agree with 12.5% automatically being added) but absolutely not for one round of drinks and no service at all. We paid the bill omitting the service charge. The waitress then confronted us very loudly demanding to know if we were going to pay the service charge, again we said no, to this she sighed and stormed off. We haven't been since.

title: Slightly disappointed
comment: Went with a large group last week and had one of the set menus in a private room. Our party left feeling that the food was just OK, with the addition of a sushi course after the mains had long since gone very odd indeed. Excellent Peruvian starters, but could have taken on left the remainder - not what I would expect for a restaurant of this reputation (and price!) Service was also slow, although we had two staff in the room; they were very slow with the drinks and it was definitely noticed. Perhaps their desire to sell was negated by the incredible minimum spend imposed on our party.  All in all, probably wouldn't return. Great views and a stunning venue, but let down by the core elements of food and service in my opinion.

title: Great experience book it now!
comment: I booked a few months in advance to celebrate our anniversary. We arrived early to get some drinks at the bar and take in the expeirence which was nice with the views. My feedback is they let anyone in anyone from the street so it gets busy and we had to wait a long time to get a drink which detracts from the experience as not everyone is dressed to impress. Our table was delayed by an hour which was frustrating however the manager sorted us out with complimentary champagne and starters which was a nice touch he then ensured we had a great evening. The food, ambiance and location was great I would recommend anyone. My only feedback would be have a separate bar area for the paying customers at the restaurant so when waiting we don’t have to queue up and wait hours!

title: Great for an occasion
comment: I went to sushi samba for a late lunch. I wasn't sure that it would be worth it as I've read how expensive it is and that the service was poor. I'm really glad we went as the view was wonderful, food was excellent and service was good too. It was expensive but worth it. Great selection of small plates - pork belly, goyza, prawns and sushi rolls were fab! Nice cocktail too - I recommend the chucumber if you like gin.

title: Amazing!
comment: This place is amazing! Views to die for!  It is not cheap but def worth it. The food is fantastic and the service outstanding.

title: Great food and experience
comment: I would highly recommend Sushi Samba to anyone looking for a great meal and experience. If you have time, arrive early so that you can relax in the bar with amazing views of downtown London.  We arrived on time, but found that there was a delay in getting our table. The wait staff was amazing and made it worth the wait. The staff made sure that we were well tended to during our wait. We were given complimentary glasses of champagne and a few starters. The dinner was absolutely amazing. The assistant manager did a great job recommending an assortment of dishes - starter dishes (Tuna tataki, Wagyu), raw dishes (assortment of ceviches), seafood (lobster) and meats (churassco rio grande). I can't wait to come back here again.

title: 'Wow' factor dining above London.
comment: Was lucky enough to be taken here for an early evening birthday dinner on a Saturday night in December - it was a surprise, and the meal, service and restaurant ambiance did not disappoint. First of all the wait for our table - there was none, we were invited straight in to the main dining area (after a breathtaking elevator ride to the top of Heron tower - 30 plus floors) though we could have ordered drinks and paused briefly in the bar if we wished. Outstanding views across London can be had almost anywhere - the restaurant has huge glass windows and is not huge - and all the bar areas look out across London - you can literally peer down onto The Gherkin and St Pauls. There's an outdoor patio balcony as well which is breathtaking. Service throughout is impeccable as you'd expect, and there is a formidable drinks menu. Food choices are less exhaustive , with around 20-30 items. It's also fairly eclectic so be prepared for that. I chose a £50 steak, which came on its own with several dipping sauces - and it was superb - though the food may not tick everyone's boxes. Prices reflect where you are, and with drinks you'll be looking at a hefty price tag, though no doubt it will be worth it when you factor in the setting and experience - for a special occasion, or to impress, this is hard to beat.

title: Cocktails and View +++
comment: If you go there, it is not for the food but for the view and atmosphere. Great place for special occasion. I have been there with my whole family, we had a wonderful evening. The food was OK, we had some average started but we finished on a such nice touch (the japanese deserts Mochi) that we quickly forgot about the starters. I have to say that I got one of my best cocktails in London there, I will go back for cocktails and Mochi. In terms of comparison I have been to the Oblix on the top of the Shard but I definitely preferred Sushisamba.

title: No photography allowed.
comment: A small group of us tried to get up to the bar to enjoy the view. Upon seeing a camera when arriving at street level, we were told very bluntly and quite rudely that there was no photography what-so-ever allowed when inside. Disappointed with their attitude, and perplexed at the no camera (or photography of any kind) policy.  We ended up going across the road to Tower 42 and were made to feel very welcome, cameras and all at the Vertigo 42 cafe/bar.

title: Amazing food with amazing views
comment: This is the 2nd time I have dined here and the food is amazing. Both times every single dish has been stunning. The service is excellent and the cocktails are something to be admired. You couldn't ask for a better back drop, you have panoramic views of London. Highly recommend it.

title: Good, but would probably not go back
comment: First impression: BAD. We had the most horrible and unacceptable treatment by the receptionist. Our reservation was for 18:30 and we arrived at 18:45. The receptionist did not even say hello and like a strict school teacher she told us off! She said "your reservation was for 18:30, your are 15-20 minutes late and we need the table back at 20:30". Unacceptable! We were so angry. We were shown to our table. We did not like it so we changed. It was drafty there, so we had to change again!  The cocktails were very good. The food was nice, se nice flavours, some indifferent. The ambience is ok, but something was missing from both food and ambience.  I was going to give it 3 out of 5 (based on food and ambience), but as our waiter Tariq really made our night, I am giving it 4. He was really attentive, smiley, helpful and we felt really lucky that he was our waiter. If it wasn't for him who cheered us up after the terrible treatment from the receptionist, I would have given it only 1 just to make a statement that customers who go there and spend quite a lot of money (our bill was £160) should be treated respectfully.

title: Ticks all the box's
comment: Even with the rain fulling the views were fantastic.  Really enjoyed the cocktails and the food was most enjoyable.  Take your credit cards it's as you would expect priced to impress.

title: Incredible food, amazing views, expensive
comment: Having been wanting to visit for many months, and booking a table over two months ago, finally visited tonight.  It's based in a pretty awesome location, the 38th floor of the Heron Tower. On arriving, you can see the lifts whizzing up and down. The lift up is breathtaking. We were greeted by a friendly lady who showed us to the reception area and then we were introduced to another lady who showed us to our table. Luckily we had pretty amazing seats at the front of the restaurant, by the window so it made me pretty happy to have such a good table. Another 3 staff attended to us over the course of the meal, all were incredibly polite, attentive, friendly and really knowledgable on the menu and what Sushi Samba represents and a little bit of restaurant background. This was all nicely welcomed. We ordered cocktails which were really tasty. So tasty we had 3 each. We were helped with the menu and given some recommendations, some we went with, some we didn't. Prawn Tempura was incredible. Pardon Peppers and Edamame were lovely too, but you can't go wrong really there. Loads of Edamame but perhaps more of the peppers. Tuna Nigiri was melt in the mouth delicious. Strawberry Maki was the highlight, really delicious. Samba London rolls also really really good. The main meal was so lovely and plentiful too, just stunning. Even though we were full, we really wanted to try out the desserts and they looked really interesting. This is what was a slight letdown. Tasty, but just nowhere near as good as the sushi dishes. The deconstructed cheese cake was really lovely, looked amazing on the plate, but was just a but meh. The chocolate chilli mouse, I found to be bland. The only thing that was really nice was the sorbet that came with it. It was not horrible by any means, just compared to everything else was a slight disappointment and what prevents this from being a 5 star review. The only other thing to mention was the toilets were a bit rank! For a fancy restaurant with a stunning setting, incredible food and lovely attentive staff, was a little surprised to find quite a shabby and slightly dirty bathroom. The bill was nearly 200 pounds. So, really quite pricey for two people, however, this was expected and we did have a lot of food and 70 odd was on drinks alone, but as long as you know it's fairly pricey, then it shouldn't be too shocking! Will I be back? Most definitely

title: Great food, great view
comment: I had sampled the food at the Taste of London last summer and really enjoyed it, so I was looking forward to dining here. The food was great - we tried a variety of small plates, which is what the waiter recommended for "first time visitors". The dishes that combine the various cuisines were the best, in my opinion. The other dishes are all very well done, but about what you would expect from any high-end restaurant. Overall, I really enjoyed the meal and the unique and tasty dishes, as well as the great view of the city.

title: Very cool!!
comment: What can I say about this place? Just three things: the food was great, the view was amazing (the restaurant is located on the 38th floor) and the staff was helpfull. In one word, excellent! I will come back!

title: What a view!
comment: The food was tasty! We ordered a lot but the potions very small left hungry! All I can say is thank god I didn't have to pick up the bill!

title: very nice and trendy place
comment: this is a really cool place to go in London. close to liverpool station, you will enjoy amazing view over london. price are ok as the food is as good as the view. really recommend this restaurant. to be book in advance ;)

title: Definitely worth the wait
comment: This place has the whole package - knowledgeable staff providing excellent service, fantastic food and amazing views and atmosphere. We went for a New Year lunch and were totally impressed after the numerous places offering bad service over the Christmas period. Was well worth booking in advance and having something to look forward to - it didn't disappoint!!

title: Again great food, but the service remains weak
comment: Again went to Sushisamba. Food was great as usual. Unfortunately, service remains somehow snobby. Everything far to hectic, not customer focussed nor authentic. Feels like being treated from the top. Best thing was that our waitress poured to times the water on the table instead of the glass, the 2nd time she even hit one of our group. At least I would have expect to get a new bottle of water, but it looks like you need to accept such recurring issues. Overall, food wise a good spot to go, but definitely not for a romantic and peaceful dinner.

title: Great food and view
comment: The most important thing for this place: book in advance a table for the dinner close to the windows. One of the plus for this place is the great view of London form the 39th floor expecially by night. The food is a curious mix of japanese and south american cuisine. If the waiter looks helpful (as it happened to me) ask for some suggestion, but don't miss a couple of dishes: Black Cod and El Topo, that were the best from my point of view. Be careful that a formal/elegant dress is required. Good food, great charme and incredible view. What you can ask more?

title: Simply amazing!
comment: My boyfriend surprised me for out third anniversary taking me to this amazing place! He told me he had to book a table three months in advance, because it is always very busy. I actually can see why; the quality of the food is unbelievable, its pure perfection, the service was incredibly nice, our waitress was very helpful when we asked for advice and I also appreciated when she asked for allergies, not every restaurant cares about it.  In the end they also brought the dessert with happy anniversary written on the plate. Not every place does this extra effort to make the customer happy.  To enjoy the beautiful view we also had a drink at the bar after dinner. I definitely want to go back!

title: An excellent Japanese food with an amazing view!
comment: Everything there is perfect! The food is excellent, the menu has a great variety of selection. The ambience is cool with nice people, the waiters are very kind and the view of London is fantastic!

title: Wonderful meal
comment: A fantastic experience from start to finish. The food was delicious and the service was impeccable. The restaurant has fantastic views over London, book a table by the window if you can! Tables are usually booked way in advance but if you are in London it is worth calling on the day to see if there are any cancellations. Dinner and wine for two people cost £140

title: A view to die for……..
comment: Had to book three months in advance. Speedy lift to 38th floor of Heron Tower in the city. Reception desk on opposite side of entrance from lift - so confused group of people in front of us. Did not know where to find reception. Not very efficient front of house staff. Very busy but fun and buzzy. Restaurant at the back of the building. Simple decor (great lighting features) - food expensive and complicated, but delicious. Good wine menu but had warm saki to go with Japanese, Mexican sushi menu. Staff friendly but noisy room so unable to hear what they said clearly. The Prof paid £200 for three people, not sure if we will go again ! Still hungry when we left restaurant !

title: Expensive and just not worth the money
comment: We went for the £90 set menu - which I hoped would mean I would get something to eat! How wrong was I, for £90 I hardly ate anything! Yes the views are amazing - and for that I would go back for a drink. I love sushi but didn't feel that it lived up to the hype. Don't get the sushi, Latin mix either!  Service was okay but then for the £200 service we paid I expect it to be. There were 11 of us and the bill was £1,550.  We had a table booked for 9:30pm - we were asked to arrive at 9pm -which we did, however, we were seated about 9:50pm - this was quite a wait seeing as we booked and our party was ready. Such a shame as I was really looking forward to my meal here - back to Nobu!!

title: Good sushi, good city view, nice eye candy
comment: One of the best sushi places in London, not really close to city center - so you need to spend some money on a taxi. The overall experience and quality of service and food is great. Sushi is great, but missing the signature dish quality, which you would find at Nobu. However the price is also lower here compared to Nobu, so good value for money. The city view is magnificent, eye candy is all around you and better atmosphere than at Nobu (Mayfair). Down site is, that due the lower price, you will also encounter low-end tourists, which won't happen at Nobu.

title: Lovely food and great service
comment: Took my wife to Sushisamba on a Tuesday evening after booking two months in advance.  Now I have been, I can see why the waiting list is so long. Great food cooked with fresh ingredients. The black cod is definitely worth a try! Looking forward to going back!

title: Views...
comment: This restaurant is top throughout the year, particularly in the summertime when one can have a drink outside. Cocktails are very pricey but good.

title: Stellar view, waaaay overpriced
comment: The view cannot be beat - breathtaking... Right in the Square Mile and the financial district, so easy to get a reservation for dinner. But snotty service, fairly rude management and overpriced items mean I will not go back. I travel very often on business, so don't get sticker shock often. But when we had to pay 35bps for 2 Bloody Mary's, I should have known not to stay for dinner. Dinner was a staggering 180bps each. For that price, the staff should have been bowing and scraping, not deigning to speak with us when we repeatedly had to ask for our server...

title: Good food, great service, fantastic view
comment: Great fusion cuisine, everything we ordered we liked and some of the dishes were exceptional. Attentive service, good atmosphere. All at a price but worth it.

title: 38th floor foodie haven
comment: I decided to try this place on personnal recommendation despite the variable reviews. The setting is superb and, yes, you are in the middle of London so don't expect a bargain. Service was a delight from beginning to end (friendly and informative) with my only quibble being the usual mix of heavily accented staff which can make dish descriptions difficult to pick up against any background noise. The food is terrific. Visually stunning and with subtle flavour variations. The duck robata and Sao Paulo samba rolls were particularly good. Make sure you have desert, 'With love from Rio' is a great example of the fusion ideas at the heart of their dishes. If I'm picky, the tables were a bit too close, you shouldnt have to struggle to get up without disturbing fellow eaters. The price is high but largely justified, we spent £130 as a couple including alcoholic drinks and ate plenty.

title: Fun in the City
comment: I had my birthday dinner here recently and loved it - from the amazing view to the varied menu. I especially liked the yellowtail tacquitos. My only criticism would be that on arrival you have to walk through the crowded bar/lounge area to the booking desk, and the corridor leading the bar area was crowded with people waiting for their coats.

title: Lovely place, average food
comment: This restaurant - bar is located on the 38th floor of a building next to Liverpool street station. The view was fantastic and the decoration was also iunique. Can't say much about the food. We had sushi and 4-5 other small plates. The sushi was good but the other plates were average. There were some odd combinations like salmon with chocolate which we didn't like at all.  Would go there again only for the bar since there is an outside bar that operates during summer time. If you like to see a nice view of London do go there but if you are there for the food try somewhere else e.g. Zuma

title: LOVELY MEAL & GREAT VIEWS OF LONDON
comment: Must pre book this place as it is right by Liverppol st buisness district, get very busy. It has great food & reasonable prices / Mixture of Brazilian & Japanesse cuisine / great views of london in the bar & restaurant. The lift upto the reastaurant is very cool (Outside of the building)

title: Not worth it. Terrible service, OK food
comment: The food was OK, in very small portions for the price paid. The service was terrible, the waiter was constantly standing behind our backs, rushing us, he was all over the place, interrupting and too insistant. The whole evening was destroyed, because we felt like we had to rush through our food and leave soon. The view is only good if you sit outside or next to a window, but if the weather is bad, you cannot see anything from the window.  I would recommend to instead go only to the bar, as dining is not at appropriate level. In the bar there is a limit access to a clear window with a great view. The restaurant is not very good at all, giving 'poor' instead of 'terrible' for the good location and a nice elevator ride with an amazing view, which was the highlight (the only one) of the evening.

title: amazing view
comment: This is the place to go for a free luxury view of london with a bar with tasty drinks and sushi food that is over priced.

title: Great View, but poor expensive food
comment: The food is for sharing like tapas. So food came at different times. Not everyone received their food.

title: No1 restaurant in London FACT
comment: Went here and everything was truly fabulous... the menu, the winelist, the champers, the service... and the food. Waiters helpful when trying to decide, lots of choice, you dont have to be a hardcore raw fish sushi fan. The meat platter was unbelievable, all you #fitfam out there will not be disappointed.  Will be returning as soon as.

title: great sushi, even better view
comment: Was in the bar on the second floor; the service was very attentive although by 8-9pm when the place was full to the brim wished for a few more staff - as much as they tried could not serve fast enough. Sushi were simply amazing, although we failed to see the Latin twist. The glass lift (face inwards if you suffer from vertigo) and the monkey in the orange tree were the highlights of the evening otherwise.

title: Loved every aspect!
comment: Sushisamba exceeded all our expectations. It was perfect from A to Z. The staff was absolutely adorable and made everything possible to make our time at Sushisamba perfect. The food was to die for! We had asked our waiter to put a few dishes together for us. He had brought us a composition of 7 plates. We absolutely loved: green bean tempura with a black truffle aioli; wagyu tataki with foie gras, ahi panca and fried quail egg; yellowtail crispy taquitos. Sushisamba has become one of our favourite restaurants in London. We are looking forward to come back.

title: Great view
comment: Food is delicious, service is good and dine with a view of London city - so you can imagine how busy this restaurant can get to. Be sure you book early if you don't want to miss out.

title: Fantastic place...
comment: I absolutelly sure this is currentlly the best place in the city. It's everying in one single place: 1) stanning view of all London from the 40th flour! 2) Three flours of cozy bars with amaiding views and perfect drinkes. 3) the best restaurants in the city - Jupanese cusine and another flour - Chinese "gouse and vafle". Trendy people and moleculare innovative people. It's really the best spot fo dimmer and before- and afre- drinks! Oou, music and DJ's are also ousome.. Go there and will not regret!

title: Perfect place to enjoy London
comment: Sophisticated, modern and special. This restaurant really shows off what London is about - fusion cuisine with staff from all over the world, a dazzling elevator ride and a view that takes your breath away. I took my girlfriend there for her birthday on Saturday and we both really enjoyed the evening. The bar area and outdoor balcony are a nice welcome into the place - some very elaborate cocktails which work so well and the decor and music give this special feeling. In the restaurant, nice welcome and great service by all the staff - nothing better than a smiling waiter who knows the menu and ingredients used. We sat right next to the window and the view from our table was astonishing. We were very impressed with the wine (south african chardonnay) that we chose as well as all the dishes. The duck breast was truly exquisite with coconut rice and plantain chips. Enjoyed the vibe throughout the night, a bit on the pricey side but definitely worth every penny.

title: Really good!
comment: I needed to choose a restaurant to celebrate the birthday of my fiancé, and I wanted it to be special... and this one was special indeed: from the lift that brings you to the 38th Floor of the Heron Tower, to the terrace bar at the entrance with a stunning view over the city, to the impeccable service we had throughout the night. Our waiter (Andrea) helped us in the choice of what was worth trying, and any of the dish that arrived on the table was worth the visit. He even brought us a little improvised birthday cake complete with a candle for my fiancee at the end of the meal, which was a very nice touch! Needless to say, an unforgettable experience has its price tag, which was relatively hefty (but we ate a lot, and had 2 glasses of champagne on top). All in all though, definitely worth trying! Booking in advance required, but you can be sometimes lucky when the non-confirmed bookings become available in the late morning/early afternoon on the day you want to visit the restaurant.

title: Brilliant
comment: The food is amazing. Service is brilliant. The lift ride to the 38th floor is an experience. I happened to mention when booking the table that it is my girlfriend's birthday. After out meal the waiter brought out a lovely little cake with a candle. What a nice touch. So well done to both the restaurant and the reservations team. Can't wait to go back

title: Great view, nice atmosphere
comment: Just visited the bar but a great 'experience'. Expensive drinks as you would expect but a great date location.

title: Great views of London!
comment: Good cocktail selection, friendly staff, amazing views of London but can get quite busy. Highly recommended!

title: Brilliant - great for a business lunch
comment: unlike any other restaurant I've been to in London - so many restaurants are so alike these days that its great to find somewhere serving different food in a very different location due to its height. reminded me of restaurants in North America or Hong Kong than England. great experience from the amazing lift up with its spectacular views to the food and drink. pricey so perfect for a business lunch.

title: Sushi Samba
comment: Great Venues - Great Food The View is Spectacular. Service was good and friendly. Nice environment overall

title: Judgmental staff and pricey drinks!
comment: We visited for drinks and to check out the views. The drinks were incredibly pricey, even by London standards but the view was incredible. We started by being eyed up and down by the staff at the bottom of the tower, we all agreed it felt rather like we were being judged as to whether we looked decent enough to enter. Apparently we passed this test and were able to enter the building and wait for a lift. The service was poor, waiting 20+ mins to be served as there weren't enough staff. Worth it for maybe one drink to sip whilst enjoying the view!

title: Very good... but a bit pretentious
comment: To be expected I guess. Really good food and lovely cocktails, with an unassailable view over London! Great to mingle, or with colleagues, but not quite charming enough for a romantic meet. Well worth a visit, if you can afford it.

title: Amazing views, great service and food
comment: We went as a family of 4 with 2 kids for my wife's birthday. We were happy and content. The ear popping ride in the lift was great. The service was good, the waiter took time to explain the menu and recommend the dishes. The manager took time to show us around the restaurant and upstairs bar, that was a nice gesture on his part. Thank you.

title: Vibes and Views
comment: We stumbled across this venue towards the end of the night on a weekend visiting friends in London in November....At first, being northerners, we were worried that this kind of place would have a guest list or be a silly price just to get in the door - but it turned out the door staff on the ground floor were very friendly and welcoming, inviting us straight into the lift. This is where the experience started - What a lift!!!! (yep, you can tell I'm a northerner!!) It was smooth and swift and the views were fabulous - we knew that this was going to be a great last late night drink. On arriving into the bar area of Sushi Samba we were delighted by the funky music, modern decoration and stunning glass panelling allowing all customers to see the views at any time - definitely had the "something special" vibe. Instead of treating ourselves to a cocktail (VERY pricey) we all had a japenese bottled beer - delicious and a reasonable price too, and took ourselves outside onto the spacious and sparkly roof terrace. This was the most comfortable area of the bar - a lot of space and seating, plus heaters, a fire pit and a huge magical tree lit up in a thousand orange glowing lights, stunning!!!! Overall this place certainly delivered what we were expecting - a "cool" place to have a last beer and certainly gave us a story to tell the next day. I would definitely reccommend the bar for a great refreshment coupled with fantastic views across the city.

title: Excellent!!!
comment: We had one of the best meals at Sushi Samba the food is unique, delicious and creative! The service was incredible and the outside bar and views were stunning! It is expensive but well worth it!!!

title: Amazing view, service not brilliant
comment: The lift experience at night is amazing . Choice of wine & champagne is very limited on the bar list and you are not allow to get the one from the restaurant. Decoration in the dinner room is great but space is really optimised ! Feeling like in a canteen and the view on this side is not the most impressive. Forget this place if you want a romantic night but great for group or business lunch. On the wine list , the only cheap bottle of french wine at 40£ is unfortunaltely no more available. No need to say that it`s over priced but food is really fresh and good and you will need to order many of these mini portions to be feed. The good surprise is that they kindly offered us dessertfor our wedding anniversary as I mentionned in my booking.

title: OMG this is worth trekking to the city for!
comment: If you like Zuma you will absolutely adore this Extraordinary venue. London hasn't seen a restaurant venue like this with a great party atmosphere and a duplex bar that looks down on the "gherkin". Food, cocktails and service excell and whilst not cheap, you don't feel like your pockets have been picked. Best new restaurant of 2013 in my humble opinion. Congrats to the Ronsons for having the vision to let SS locate here.

title: Nice concept, great views, service could be better
comment: Quick overview first: Are the views great? Yep Does the fusion concept work here? Yeah, I think so Is it better than more traditional sushi elsewhere? Not convinced Is it a nice experience? Yep Is it one of the best meal I've had in London? Nope Is the service any good? Not bad More details now for those interested. It was an interesting experience, liked the concept and nice for a change plus loved the views. No real problems with the service and my waiter was very good although the reception and departure was a bit strange. You are met at the door and not clear if they work at Duck and Waffle (upstairs) or Sushi Samba. They have no idea if tables are free. Not overly friendly and literally just open the door (smiles absent). Up arrival, you walk through the bar to be seated which was not particularly intuitive to me and staff would not point you in the right direction. Upon leaving, told to collect my coat from the other side of the bar, but nobody there and nobody trying to help. Having rented one the highest floors of Heron Tower, you would think that getting staff to smile, check availability and be generally a bit more helpful would be the easy part. Not as good as it could be.

title: very expensive
comment: nice place to come to but very expensive...other than that customer service is quite good which is the most important thing

title: great food and service
comment: i went there for a birthday celebration and it lives up to the special hype. the view we had from our table was stunning and the waiter helped us select from the menu so we could enjoy a good selection of the best dishes.  the sea bass and pork belly were melt in your mouth gorgeous and the different sushi we had we also top class.  Wines were a little over the top on prices hence the 4 stars instead of 5. will go again at the drop of a hat!

title: Excellent creative food and unbeatable views
comment: I dined here last month with some business colleagues and we all loved our meal. The setting is pretty spectacular, with floor to ceiling windows on the 38th floor of one of London's tallest buildings. The food was both creative and delicious. The waiter made recommendations and we wren't disappointed. You definitely should try bro reserve early for this place, especially if you want a table by the windows.

title: Excellent food and service
comment: We visited Sushisamba around this time last year - and I still tell people how wonderful our experience was, so I thought I should share this on tripadvisor! Our waiter was wonderful - very helpful in explaining the menu and made us some great recommendations. When the food arrived, we could not fault anything, it was all fantastic! Due to the combination of such high standards of food and service I highly recommend this restaurant.

title: Great view, good food, excellent service
comment: Thankfully we had a reservation, otherwise the door man might have stopped us too.... However, when he asks "do you have a reservation" just say yes. Does he know? The lift ride is indeed amazing. We were lucky to be there last Wednesday evening: clear sky. Just stunning. The place has a great vibe about it. The menu is different and I'd recommend the let the waiter choose after you gave him your likes/not likes. The bill is indeed hefty but someone has to pay the doorman.....

title: Superb
comment: First visit to Heron tower's Sushi Samba and I thought it was fantastic!! Service was excellent, menu explained clearly to us, no wait for anything. Food was delicious and although quite expensive was very good value for money. Would highly recommend this place. Dessert was terrific. Not a complex formula here...great service + great food + great view = a very good night out.

title: Lovely birthday dinner with friends.
comment: We visited this place for my birthday dinner. We had a lovely time. The cocktails were amazing but could do with more variety. The food was tasty and everything was perfect. The view and atmosphere was just perfect and we all had a great time celebrating.

title: Fantastic venue, service and food!
comment: As a party of six adults we asked the waiter to use his initative and bring us a selection of different food and courses during the the evening. The food was excellent, a great selection of different continents, and served with precision timing. Great service and good value.

title: Exceptional Service and quiality
comment: Service was very good. Table was right in front of the window therefore the view was breathtaking. Most of the dishes were really tasty and everything was in perfect quality. Although next time I will be more knowledgeable of what to order so it fits my taste exactly. I wanted also to comment Remi Blanc, the assistant restaurant manager who catered into finding our table and also provided us with very good service.

title: Overpriced but fun
comment: We came as a group. Service was lovely. Clientele was mixed, plenty of well healed yummy mummy types as well as some meet the parents type folk. Most people were dressed in jeans and boots type attire. View is amazing and this really is what you pay a premium for. Menu very confusing. They insist on sharing everything and that you "order for the table". Waitress made this more confusing. There was a group of 6 of us and we were advised to choose 10-15 dishes between us. We ignored this completely and chose to have our own dish each and just share some sushi and rice which actually was plenty. Don't be pushed into ordering too much!! I has a smallish plate of tepanaki chicken - nice except the for the slimy skin left on, some gorgeous coconut rice and some apple juice which was £30. Nice food but like I said, you pay for the view and good atmosphere. I'd go again, probably.

title: Awesome views, Food expensive
comment: Went there for a work do, got to experience the amazing views from Heron Towers. Definitely has a nice buzz to the place, however food was very expensive especially for the portion size.

title: Still better value than Itsu
comment: The prices at Sushisamba definitely make your eyes go just slightly bigger than the sushi pieces being served. Given it's location and the size of the doormen, one would have to guess that the money has to go somewhere. That being said, the sushi was good quality and sufficiently creative enough to live up to its namesake of putting a samba in your mouth and the service is in line with the price (You'd dam* well hope so too!). While I wouldn't say this place is amazing value, I would have struggled to find an equivalent establishment in London putting on this type cuisine for this view and is a simple winner when taking the lady out as a treat.

title: Terrible door policy
comment: Hi I would like to say that I was very disappointed and not happy at all that my partner and I were denied access as our clothing was not considered "smart casual" when it clearly was. We were both wearing black and its clearly discrimination on the part of your doorman. He would have let us in if we had a reservation but denied us access to the bar! I think its outrageous. Therefore, we will NOT be recommending sushisamba to our friends and family as it was a very bad experience for us.

title: Outstanding
comment: One of the best meals I have ever had. Setting, atmosphere, food, drink and service are all out of this world. Wasn't cheap but half our bill was on drinks.  100% will return!

title: Perfect place for sushi lovers!
comment: I was there few times already and was never disappointed.  Food, service, atmosphere and views amazing. Japanese kitchen with the modern twist, great selection of Sake.  After the meal you can enjoy fantastic cocktails and great music in the lounge on the upper level. Very trendy and cool place to eat. Often visited by celebrity's. Definitely recommend for a romantic evening, business meeting or night out with friends.  Not for people who are scared of hights as it is on the 38th floor!

title: Didn't get past the 'thug' on the door - thank goodness
comment: Our faces obviously didn't fit and so the place was instantly 'full', according to the sinister, dressed-in-black bouncer guarding the door as me and the family approached. Funny how others without reservations were graciously given permission to enter mere seconds later - curses, I should have used more Oil of Olay that morning. Anyway, tne bouncer was now fawning over some pretty ladies leaving the place so we left and found K10 - a wonderful Sushi place not far away that had fantastic food at prices that made far more sense to us plebs. We'll leave Sushisamba for the pretty people.

title: Extraordinary Food... bit overpriced
comment: The only reason it did not get a 5 star review is because it is a bit over priced but I guess that at the end of the day you pay for what you get! And at Sushi Samba you get AMAZING food!  The service was also very good. They removed my cocktail from the table when I went to the loo (there was still 1/3 left) and I complained to the waiter who promptly ordered a new cocktail and did not charge for it.  We were advised to order a few dishes from the menu since the principle is to share your food.  The Gyoza were the best Gyoza I have ever had! (I am a japanese food fanatic). The Moqueca was also excellent. You can tell everything is fresh since the traditional moqueca recipe takes Peppers and I am allergic to Peppers and they made it to order!  All in all an amazing experience. Highly recommended.

title: Not sure if paying for view or food?
comment: Went there for my friend's bday after reading good review about this place. We ordered the coconut rice, sashimi mixto and 2 of the samba rolls neo tokyo and ezo. From all this the only thing I like was the coconut rice all the rest was okay but nothing wow and definitely not worth it's money worth. We were so disappointed that we had to go to another place and eat cause we were still hungry. The service was not great either, the waiter without asking us opened a bottle of water which is unacceptable. If you want to go to a place that is "chic" and has nice view sushi samba is for you but don't expect mind blowing food (well except the rice which was really good)

title: Sushi Samba for lunch
comment: The journey up to the top of the Heron Tower in the lift was great fun and the view from the restaurant is phenomenal. I was a bit curious as to the sushi samba fusion approach but I wasn't to be disappointed. We had hoped for a table by the window but the manager apologised that there were none available and gave us a free drink and some free starters. The food was superb and I preferred the samba style than the sushi. We had a bottle of sake with the meal and the wine waiter went through all of the options with us and it was the first time that I had considered it like wine, having previously drank it hot. It complimented the food well. The service was great and I would definitely go again.

title: Great but...
comment: Me and two friends went for dinner at Sushisamba . We had no reservation, had no idea about the hype of this restaurant and therefore did not know what to expect. (Did I wish I had read some reviews before) On the ground floor we were told by a girl at the door that it was not busy in the restaurant so we were very likely to get a table, we just had to speak to the receptionist. We went up the magical lifts (that really is a once in a life time experience and reminds me of Charlie in the chocolate factory when he flies through the roof with Mr. Wonka) to find ourselfs a few seconds later in the restaurant. The lady at the cloakroom seemed lost and handed us over to the receptionist who informed us it was really busy and we could not have a table. (Communication?!)  Since we were not too fussed, we were happy to sit down in the bar area to have some drinks and then later see if a table was available. The waiter that served is was correct but very pushy with his sales. Everything that came out of his mouth sounded forced and not genuine. What confused the tree of us more was the accent (same for the receptionist). The three of us are not natives but speak good English ourselves and all of us work in hospitality. The way the menu is set up is very confusing. A couple next to us had a fantastic platter of sushi that we wanted to have as well. When asking the waiter for advice, the menu beame even more of a mistery! And when our plate arrived it looked nothing like the plate of the couple next to us!!  With the sushi you have no idea how many pieces you receive for the price stated. We had to ask another waiter to make things more clear to us (hoping for someone with better English) which seemed to annoy our personal waiter and that showed in his service. A second bottle of wine was served and never finished at the table, we all noticed and asked the waiter to which his reply was "no, the bottle is not in the ice bucket anymore so I have finished it" we all noticed there was a bit left and commented on it but the waiter did not know how to deal with this. We were wrong and he was right. We didn't want to make a fuss so we just asked for the bill without the service charge as we all felt the service was very poor. The waiter rolled his eyes and sent a manager to our table. We explained the situation and were offered a glass of prosecco which yes is a nice gesture but does not make up for the service and the experience of the night. In a nutshell, the food was good, the desserts were amazing but the service and the price are not worth going there. Even if you have no expectations, the least you want is friendly service and the feeling that you're welcome and that was not the case. If I want to go back for the views, (which of course are stunning!!) I'll make a reservation at duck and waffle or go for cocktails at the Shard. Never again to Sushisamba!

title: Buzzy, busy and fun
comment: One of the hot spots in London. Great food, nice venue. If you like Nobu, you will love SushiSamba. Definitely worth a visit. Book in advance.

title: Taste Fusion? Or Blah?
comment: I went here with a friend on a whim for lunch - yes, the view is amazing. We were seated fairly quickly and our waiter tended to our table but I have to say, it was a little overdone. I felt like we were interrupted every time we started a conversation (our waiter was over zealous) and I think that showing us the still water we ordered as though it were an expensive bottle of wine was one tedious step too far. There is such a thing as overdoing customer service and I think we found it here at Sushi Samba. In terms of the food - well, it was okay. But it was not the best I have ever eaten so I do not think it deserves the hefty price tag it comes with. It was a rather expensive light meal and I left feeling hungry and unsatisfied but lighter in the wallet. There is nothing at all worth raving about at Sushi Samba but it is not terrible either. It is one of those places that promises more than it delivers and there are far finer dining establishments in London. Go up for a (pricey) drink if the view is a must - otherwise, give it a miss.

title: Food - Excellent : Service - Poor
comment: Let's start with the positives: - Food is exceptional. The pork belly is fabulous. We ordered a number a dishes and all were superb, fresh and delicious. Top marks all round and hats off to the kitchen staff. - Excellent wine list and bar  - Views, décor and ambiance were good. Negatives: - Don't believe your own hype. A restaurant with such terrible customer service will not last long in any city, the hipsters and the money will move onto where it is looked after better. - The food is great and expensive prices are fine, but the whole package must be right including service. - Front of house were appalling - What is the point of making a reservation if you are made to stand, yes stand, and wait 30 minutes for your fictional table to be ready without even a hint of a sorry, would you like a drink of even water whilst you wait. There you have it. A mixed experience. Superb food, but the kitchen staff are let down and like much in London the focus on style over customer experience will make sure there will be a new flavour of the month in town soon unless it is addressed. I would very much doubt I will go again.

title: Great food, great drinks, great staff
comment: I was a bit worried about choosing this restaurant for a family meal, given some of the reviews. All I can say is that we had a wonderful time. We were told on arrival that the table was ours for the next 3 hours. So went and had cocktails which we took to the outside bar until we got a bit cold, then went to the bar upstairs. The cocktails really are very good. Then went to the table. Our waiter was Owen, from Manilla. He was very knowledgeable and guided us through the menu very expertly. He looked after us wonderfully for the evening. The sake sommelier gave us equally excellent advice. I have been trying to recall exactly what everyone had, but no-one can quite remember!!! So I think our message would be - take the waiter's advice!!! Because each dish was spectacular. We recall having had: Padron peppers and Green bean tempura to start while we looked at the menu. Both were different and very delicious. To start, the four of us shared Rock Shrimp, Pork Belly, Tuna and Chicharron - each of which were absolutely delicious also. The seabass in miso was as spectacular as the Nobu black cod, and the flank steak, and duck breast equally as amazing. We then had Samba London and Sao Paulo rolls which were mind blowing!!! To drink we had sake, chosen by the sommelier which was wonderful and a condrieu, chosen by by me, which, to be honest, wasn't the greatest condrieu I've drunk. Not awful but just not great. We had four different desserts, each of which were beautifully presented and delicious to eat. Forgot to mention the ambience - amazing venue!! There's a bar out side with great views; a bar upstairs if you get cold and a bar in between. The staff were great. So, in summary, everything was five star.  Do go if you have the chance.

title: Interesting...
comment: Being fairly short myself I rarely get the opportunity to look down on things so I jumped at the chance to go for drinks in this horrendously tall tower. On entering it was so busy there was no where to sit or even stand, I spent most of the night getting pushed from piller to post (small people problems) and It was one of the strangest atmospheres with a very interesting mix of people. The staff seemed nice but very over worked and stressed, I also wouldn't rate well on the safety I nearly fell down the dazzling orange stairs probably more my clumsynes but when a glass fell from two floors up on to the people sitting next to me I began to question whether the place was worth the risk! It was also fairly pricy but then that's as expected from such a place.

title: Impresive restaurant
comment: I went to this lovely restaurant last summer with my work colleges, it was a busy Friday evening. Were sit in doors but the weather was nice and we requested to sit outside terrace, after a short time they arranged our table outside, I was very impressed with their effort to comply request. The food was amazing and service was attentive. it was a great experience to have our meal with lovely London view.

title: not on par with it's US counterparts
comment: I've been to two Sushi Sambas in the US and I am not American or British, so hopefully can be objective. I'd give this a 3/5 if the rating system allowed halves. The location an fit out are top notch - very funky. The service was fast and enthusiastic. Where this place fell down for me was the food and drinks. Don't get me wrong, nothing was really bad, but little was amazing either. I remember being enthralled by this restaurant chain in the USA more because of the food and drinks than the surroundings and it seems the UK version did the opposite for me - great view and nice fit out. This is a great tourist destination, but if I lived in London I wouldn't be returning over and over. Perhaps we didn't choose widely enough, but the south American influence on the food was lacking. The lobster was not worth the money and showed little effort or imagination next to other dishes. The Sasa hand roll was inspired, as are the mochi. Other dishes ok. The two cocktails I had sounded great, but lacked depth, alcohol and were so loaded with ice they were watery. The staff were great, but we had to stop 4 different waiters taking an unfinished dish from our table in the course of 10 minutes.

title: Excellent restaurant, but pricey
comment: I've been to Sushi Samba twice now; I had a drinks reception there when canapes were served (which I did not think particuarly impressive at all); at the time I felt that insufficient to base a review upon, however I recently ate there and can now formulate a view on the place.  The restaurant itself has good views of the city - since the Cheesegrater was built you can no longer see the shard, however the views are pleasant enough. The restaurant is welcoming, and our waiter made us feel welcome and helped us interpret the menu, which is a little different to most, being that the dishes are intended for sharing. This brings me to my next point; the sharing plates are in the £10 - £15 range (some are more) in the main, and for that you will get one item of food - we had 5 people at our table and we ordered 18 plates, and I didn't leave feeling bloated by any means... That being said, the food was good, with a couple of dishes being excellent. Particuarly of note was the Baby Monkfish and Pork Belly Wraps, the sashimi and sushi I personally did not feel were anything to particuarly write home about however. Its a nice restaurant, however I did feel it a little pricey for the food and experience it offers.

title: Sky high Fusion
comment: Enjoyed my lunchtime experience at this Fusion style restaurant . A mix of Peru/ Brazil meets Japan . We chose a mix of 5 dishes to share. It was enough for me , maybe not for someone looking for a man-size meal. Please try the kefirinha cocktail - delicious. We loved the lift that whisks you up on the outside of the building up to the 38th floor . The views are amazing. Having recently spent £25 to go to the top of the Shard, why not splash out a bit more and have lunch at this fun , trendy eatery. I would go here again , when I saved up. (London prices)

title: Something different!
comment: 38th floor, dramatic lift experience and brilliant views. The mixture of Peruvian, Brazilian and Japanese flavours EXPLODE on your taste buds. Is expensive for lunch, but for special occasions definitly worth it. The cocktails are delicious. Pretty good service overall (although they did forget 2 of our plates) but enjoyed the buzz and ambience. Seems we were lucky with the doorman, and the food judging by some of the other reviews. Perhaps lunchtime is better than evenings.

title: Fantastic!
comment: The food, the location and the service make this restaurant a true experience. The food is just fantastic - not being too familiar with how to read the menu we asked a waiter to help us out, he chose for us and made a concerted effort to serve us our food each time it came out and explain what each course was and we were more than impressed. The location makes this restaurant an experience as well, would highly recommend! If you don't like sushi - you probably do - you just haven't tried it at sushi samba! The price is justified by the food quality, service and whole experience!

title: Impressive Restobar
comment: Went there for drinks with a friend. Obviously the view is incredible, but not only the view is amazing, the interior is also worth a look. Crowd is after-work style. Prices are appropriate for such a location, though I can not comment on the food.

title: STUNNING!
comment: From the location of the restaurant, on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower (third tallest building in London), to the food itself, the cocktails and the service, Sushi Samba is truly deserving of 5 stars. I went there at Saturday lunchtime with my partner, celebrating her birthday. The waiter talked us through the menu and recommended how to order - essentially, each dish is designed to share - working your way through various different styles of food. Japanese / Brazilian / Peruvian styles, influences and fusions - each dish so so tasty and very presented. Difficult to recommend one single dish as all were as good as each other. The memorable meal was finished off with a personal 'Happy Birthday' message written on the dessert we shared. The restaurant decor is great and as you would expect, with all but one wall fully glazed. Service could not be faulted (and 12.5% service charge added to bill easily justified). The cocktails were on a par with the food, and there is a separate bar outside of the restaurant area where you can visit and admire the view over London. The restaurant is ideal for special occasions, and while I do like to try different restaurants, I would love to come here again (perhaps my other half can return the favour for my birthday!).

title: Amazing location, great food, suspect portions.
comment: Sushi Samba is situated on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower on Bishopsgate. The restaurant is reached via a super fast glass lift that runs up the outside of the building and affords fabulous views across the city. Ok so it's not as high as the Shard, but then you're not paying £25 for the privilege either. The view from the restaurant and outside on the terrace is similarly spectacular - albeit it was cold and wet the night we visited. The bar upstairs was pretty funky too.  We visited this restaurant in early November as a party of 10 people. As is often the way we were asked to pre-order, and slightly disappointingly could only choose from the set menus. We were seated in the middle of the restaurant so could not enjoy the views as well as some others. The quality of the food was generally excellent. The beef in particular was fabulous. Service was slick, friendly and entirely appropriate. Top marks to the guys and girls who waited on us.  The one big problem was the quantity of food. More than one of our party complained of being hungry afterwards. When you're spending £200 a head I don't think that this is on. Clearly SS is an "occasion" restaurant for most people, and you shouldn't leave feeling that you haven't been fed properly! I toyed with the idea of rating Sushi Samba 3 blobs (average) but think that this would be very harsh bearing in mind the quality of food. Perhaps a fairer reflection is that I would probably go back. The "experience" overcomes the shortcomings, but portion size really is something that the restaurant should address.

title: Meal with an experience
comment: We watched the sun set from the bar in Sushi Samba with some experimental cocktails before moving into the restaurant for some food. We would definitely recommend doing this it was amazing to see London and the lights from 38 floors up go from daylight to the night. The location is amazing, the decor fun and modern, the brazilian and peruvian influences really come out in the interior. Sushi Samba has a great atmosphere, 'not stuffy' like we had experienced in Japanese Nozomi the night before.  The food was excellent especially the seabass skewers and the prawn tempura with a twist, we shared them all. Would recommend to anyone and of any ages.

title: Amazing meal
comment: Came here for lunch and had a fantastic meal. Service was impeccable - friendly and efficient staff who know the menu well. We shared six dishes between the two of us, and every one was presented beautifully and tasted amazing. Cocktails were also great. Views were far-reaching, even on a rather overcast & rainy day. Loved it!

title: Worth going just for the ride up!
comment: As many people have commented on already, the lift journey up (and down) the Heron Tower is truly amazing. The glass lift shaft launches you into the London skyline with breathtaking speed barely allowing you to take in the magnificent views Westwards.  The venue is clearly very much in demand. We walked through the bar to get to the restaurant and it became obvious to us that the bar and restaurant were packed (there was also a long queue of people waiting outside in the cold for tables outside the ground floor entrance). There is no doubting how glamorous the location is (which had the air of an upmarket nightclub about it) and clearly this allure has brought a very eclectic crowd to the Liverpool Street area - as opposed to the usual corporate types. The food itself was good - some of the dishes were indeed very tasty though others were hit and miss. I don't, however, think I would go back just for the food and, as one might expect the prices are sky high. A meal for two with a modest bottle of Spanish Viognier and a couple of glasses of sake came to just shy of £200. Another magical moment was on the way out when we spotted an outside terrace on the 38th floor. On going outside we realised how close to the clouds we were but, more remarkable, that this seemed to be the one place in London you could actually see the stars! It was very pretty. All in all, we had a lovely time.

title: Sky high prices for a sky high view
comment: SushiSamba seems to have lost a good deal of the panache it had when it opened. The food is still good (though I would stick to the raw stuff, with the exception of the tempura beans to start, which are exceptional) but the execution and attention to detail seemed to have faltered somewhat. The place still has a buzz to it and I am willing to give it another try - maybe they were having an off day.

title: top view, tasty pricey bites
comment: Jaw-dropping view, well worth the expensive dining! Great for a special night out with someone special

title: Amazing views, food & service.
comment: Booked two month in advance and was well worth the wait! Came here with my partner. Blown away by the views, food and great service. The tree that looks like its on fire, great at night. The elevator to sushi samba is pretty exciting as its all glass so you see out as your transported up. Can't wait to go back!

title: Never take NO for an answer :)
comment: Today was a first for us at this fantastic restaurant! After an office move, we took our helpers - our son and his friend - to Sushi Samba for a "thank you" late lunch. We arrived at around 2:15 and asked the gentleman at the ground floor entrance if we could go up for lunch. He said "no tables, fully booked" and had a "go away" attitude. He even made the boys stand outside (he probably thought they were not dressed properly given they were wearing tracksuit bottoms and jeans, but they had just been hauling boxes). My husband and I however asked to go upstairs to "take a look". I headed straight to the reception desk and asked for a table for 6. The lady at reception found us one!!!! I know she made an effort to do this and we were very grateful she did. We were then led to our table by the immensely friendly, courteous and charming Remy. Little did I know that we were not only given a table but the BEST table in the house with spectacular views!!!! Our waiter was extremely polite, helpful and knowledgeable. each one of his recommendations were spot on and we had an absolutely amazing lunch and fabulous Saki.  Remy checked in on us frequently and not once was a glass left empty. This is how attentive they all were. Remy then personally saw us out, gave us his card and asked us to return with a genuine welcome. This we will indeed do - no question. Rarely does one get such fantastic service, food and views and I have two morals of this story - "Never take no for an answer" - otherwise we would have gone home if we had listened to the guy at the entrance. In addition - and this is a message for you Mr Gatekeeper "don't judge a book by its cover"...the two boys you made stand outside are Etonians and they were in scruffy clothes because they were helping us move!! Lucky for us that the experience inside the restaurant was A+ and we thank Remy, the lovely waiter and the reception lady for finding us a table - despite our scruffy appearance!! See you very soon - God willing and thank you once again!

title: Really trendy, amazing views
comment: The outside terrace area with the orange tree is pretty impressive, very good atmosphere and amazing food.

title: Amazing food and views
comment: From the moment you step in the lift and ascend to the top of Heron Tower in the City of London, the Sushi samba experience is one of pure class. The food was beautifully cooked and perfectly presented. Our favourites were the sticky calamari and coconut rice. The waiter was attentive without crowding us and the price you pay is more than fair, especially when the fantastic views across London are considered. Try to get a table on the balcony on a clear day. All in all, a special experience.

title: Great Views. Great Cocktails
comment: Chosen as a first date venue. Let's just say that we're still together so it must have worked...  Cocktails make use of some really interesing ingredients. I wish I had stayed for food, but there were no tables available when I looked to book same day (Saturday evening), but you can still go up for drinks. Recommend this over paying for any of the other "views" in the area.

title: Expensive, but well worth it.
comment: First impressions were not so good. After stepping out of the rollercoaster of the lift with popped ears we were greeted by an empty terrace and quite a few staff milling around but not really pointing us in the direction of the table. However all this was swiftly changed when we stepped into the restaurant and got a table next to the window overlooking Shoreditch and beyond. It was buzzing at 2.15pm right through until we left at 5.30pm.  After staring in slight bewilderment at the menu the young waiter stepped up to the mark and offered to order for us, after asking us what we did and didn't like. Despite having mixed tastes this really worked well. The highlights to me where the Chilean sea bass cubes,which melted in the mouth with a deliciously creamy taste, and the fresh and diverse mound of sashimi. Everything was excellent.  I got slightly worried about the bill when the courses didn't stop coming but we were tempted by the desserts. Thankfully we ordered 2 between 3 as they were massive and very tasty.
