Cocktails are different and almost taste healthy with a balanced amount of alcohol, which helps keep you on an even keel when the lunch goes on for a fair while. Another of the increasing number and diverse views of the London townscape. Only slight gripe was the wine waiter who just tried the sell us the most expensive bottle of wine regardless of our taste.  It is expensive but its worth it for special occasions and maybe I should be giving it 5 stars.

title: Amazing Sushi
comment: Agree that the doorman at the entrance are not the nicest of people. We ordered our drinks and food at the same time and unfortunately as there was a big party that ordered before us and our drinks arrived half way through the meal. We had the most amazing sushi and best lamb chops I ever had. we finished off with o-toro nigiri which was also amazing. Highly recommend the food and the view. Great place to watch the fireworks!

title: Delicious and lively
comment: Amazing, knowledgeable service Delicious food (pork belly YUM) Great drinks - service and choice Buzzy atmosphere and beautiful roof top bar with amazing tree lit up with 100's of lights - great for romantic date or special meal of any type.

title: Great bar!
comment: A brilliant bar, waaaaay up on the 38th floor at Heron Tower. Firstly, the lift is great fun. Then the bar itself is a riot of pink and orange. With great views of the north bank. Drinks are expensive (cocktails between £12-15) but were delicious. Definitely go for the one involving star anise and a lit block of sugar -it tastes like fudge. The only reason I didn't give it full marks is that they put an automatic £1.50 on the bill, I guess as a tip. Quite annoying for obvious reasons.  Otherwise it was great fun. Definitely go!

title: Well worth a visit, but window seats are not what they seem!
comment: Took a friend as a treat recently. Had asked for a window seat, which we got, but unfortunately, it looked over a roof. There are only 3 or 4 tables with fab views and, from memory, I think they are tables for two! Staff were very knowledgeable and, I must say, some of the best sushi I've eaten in a long time. We were very excited by the food and it did not disappoint. Cocktails and the saki list seemed to go on forever, so we did need a bit of help choosing, but everything was delicious! Was full of tourists and City parties, but a good mix. There are tables outside on the balcony, although not sure it would be warm enough to sit out in the winter. There are heaters, so take a coffee outside and enjoy the wonderful views! The bar at Sushi Samba is very busy - been to the bar a few times and, to be honest, the service is exceptionally slow, so be patient! Fridays and Saturdays at Sushi Samba are crazy busy, so I'd avoid those like the plague, if possible. Monday night was a great night to go, although they do close the upper level bar at Sushi Samba, which is very pretty. The outside area, with the fabulous trip, which lights up the sky is fun. Could't tire of Sushi Samba, just a bit of a shame about the slow bar service. Still wouldn't deter me from going back, especially to the restaurant, which was fabulous!

title: Absolutely brilliant
comment: Went here for the first time with a client the other week and had a brilliant time. From the brilliant 'Shiso Fine' cocktails, to their wide selection of excellent food, I honestly could not fault it. I cannot understand why you would have a bad experience in here.  Ordered a mixed selection of sushi as one of the dishes....which came with fresh crab. My highlight was asking the waiter "Excuse me, is that a crab stick?" with the response of "NO SIR, it is NOT crab stick. Crab sticks are made with polluted fish". Oh, how I laughed. I was picturing alarms going off in the kitchen and boxes of Iceland's own crab sticks being launched off the top of Heron Tower.  Joking aside, this really is a great restaurant and highly recommended. One to go to if you really want to impress.

title: A fun night out
comment: A very buzzy place and so busy, great food and service loved the outside bar and terrace will return, parking was a nightmare though.

title: Great view and atmosphere, ok food
comment: Would recomend just going up for a drink we did dinner which was nice, good service and a fun place to be very corporate, got the pork belly which was amazing and quite big and the sushi samba london assorted sushi combo was ok nothing to write home about. Would do it once to tick it off and try for yourself but would only go back again for a drink and the view.

title: Arrogant door staff and a dodgy tummy the next day.
comment: A group of colleagues and myself decided to visit on Tuesday night, but a few of my party were turned away by the obnoxious door man on the grounds that they were not looking smart enough. Well, we work in IT so we don't wear suits to work, but we still have cash to spend. And the doorman was dressed in Matalan-type clothes!! My colleagues spent their money elsewhere that night. They will not even try to visit this place ever again, as a dress code is so pretentious in twenty first century London. I should have followed them but I decided to see what the hype was about. The tempura prawns tasted a bit odd, and I am pretty sure that they were the cause of my bad stomach a few hours later. I was too ill to go to work the next day. I might expect a greasy kebab joint to give me food poisoning!! What a pity I did not save a stool sample so that my GP could get it analysed.

title: Average, certainly not worth the price
comment: What's with the obsession with lemon juice/rice vinegar at Sushisamba? It was present in everything... the tempura prawns (which were soggy btw), the padron peppers (which just tasted weird)... the seabass... even the coconut rice (why??). The only redeeming thing was my deconstructed cheesecake which was kind of cool, but may be a disappointment if you were looking for a proper dessert. Great views though, and attentive, if unwarm service. Would i go back? Maybe for a drink to see the view, but never again for that food. I prefer vinegar with my sushi or my fish and chips.

title: lovely concept
comment: I visited this lovely venue last summer for our friends gathering. We were so lucky to have a table outside terrace, it was amazing to watch the sunset over whole London. We enjoyed every part of our meal and time in there. The bill was less than i expected too.

title: Great views
comment: Only visited the bar; amazing views. Pricey as one would expect! Nothing special apart from the views.

title: Wow
comment: Was so looking forward to going to sushi samba and omg I wasn't disappointed. To begin with just going up in the lift was an experience fab views. We had drinks on the terrace it's so beautiful with the orange oak tree. The food was up there in my top ten every dish was so special and delicious. I WILL be back. Although not cheap well worth a visit for a special occasion or any other occasion !!!!

title: So Average
comment: I cannot believe how disappointed I am with this restaurant. Tables are usually difficult to get at night, for this reason I expected something spectacular. Firstly, food is very average.. sushi is just there.. Secondly, staff act like they have no clue of whats going on. It seems like there was only one waiter serving the whole restaurant. The atmosphere is similar to that of its u or yo sushi. I usually go to Nobu and Zuma because they probably have the best sushi in london.. Sushisamba does NOT come close.. I will definitely stick to Zuma and Nobu.. don't waste your time here.

title: Excellent food and amazing views
comment: 38 floors above the City of London and in your own perfect space. A menu that spoils you for choice but select wisely as this is not a cheap dining experience.

title: Excellent food, Not so Great Service
comment: Four of us went to Sushi Samba on a Saturday night. The restaurant was very cool, views obviously amazing and the food was very interesting, very well cooked and beautifully presented. The service was OK (actually pretty shocking considering the prices!) three of our dishes obviously hadn’t been ordered as they came about 30 minutes after the others (and asking twice), I ordered a beer that took around 20 minutes to arrive (also asked for it twice). On the flip side we stayed in the bar until 2.00am and had a really great night there. The restaurant would get a 5, but will only give a 3 based on the poor service.

title: Excellent
comment: Hard to fault this new hotspot. Only thing I would say is the last time I had Shushi Samba it was in Miami in the main mall - was $20USD pp all you could eat early bird special. Now the same dishes are on a roof top in London and add a zero and make it in ££. Still is is exceptional.

title: great view nice cocktails
comment: I was showing a german friend the city and noticed this bar. Must be new ish. Lift was fast. Glass sided so good view. Slightly dizzy when arrived on 40 floor. Cocktails were innovative. Raw sugar cane sticks as stirrers. Great view. Will return.

title: Creative and fun sushi
comment: A friend and I chanced a Sunday lunch visit to sushi samba at the top of the Heron Tower. We didn't expect to get a seat (you really do need to book), but we snagged a table and were really happy we did. The staff were really friendly and the food and drinks were fantastic. The food presentation is particular was incredible.  Sushi Samba isn't cheap - so don't go there if you think you're going to have a cheap meal. But for my mind, it was good fun.  When we visited, the London sky was typically pea soup like. But, you could imagine at night or on a clear day that the view would be spectacular.

title: Delicious sushi with a view
comment: I called to book a table for me and my friend the same day and we were lucky to have a place thanks to a cancellation. Book in advance because the restaurant is busy. We first had a drink at the bar with the breathtaking view on the city. Afterwards we went up to the restaurant room. The sushi was delicious and from high quality sushi. They were like small creations, very fresh and tasty.  I can recommend this place to people who like a fancy place and asian food with a panoramic view on the city.

title: Great view, great food
comment: Went there to celebrate my partner birthday, everything was perfect, from the service to the food, from the cocktails to the view. Really well done, keep it this way! will definitely go back!

title: Great food, view and service
comment: Amazing food, and the views are stunning, the service was excellent, very polite and friendly It's not the cheapest place to eat sushi and not the most romantic place, but great atmosphere and feel, nice bar upstairs also Would recommend and go again!

title: AMAZING PLACE
comment: Great food, service, but above all the view - outside bar is fantastic for a sunny night - highly recommended!

title: Sushi what?
comment: When a restaurant has too much fame on the begining your start wondering why? And then you go there and customer services are only terrificly bad and the food not impressive, expensive and not fun at all

title: Overpriced but worth it for a special occasion
comment: Came here with a group of friends on a Friday night. As its near the top of the Heron Tower, the views over London are amazing. The food was good - everything is designed to be shared, a bit like tapas. I particularly liked the seabass skewers. It was overpriced, though, and we probably ordered too much. The service was very attentive, but they do try to give you the hard sell in extras such as saki whcih got a bit annoying. The bar is spread over two floors, with a glass spiral staircase connecting the two, right next to floor to ceiling glass 40 stories up - not for anyone wary of heights!. There is an outdoor section of the bar with a big orange tree. Nice atmosphere but it was a bit crowded when we were there.

title: Great Japanese
comment: Very pricey but worth it for a special occasion. Excellent food, service and stunning views. Would recommend to a friend.

title: Definatley worth a visit!
comment: Good place to go and celebrate a special occasion or for a few drinks with friends. No reservations are needed for the bar but they are for the restaurant. The fun starts as soon as you enter the lift! Its high speed and glass, so you get wonderful views of the city as you go up to the 40th floor My experience of service in the bar was fast & friendly and the terrace area had a buzzing and lively atmosphere. Also loved the orange tree bar - very cool :)  I will be returning again.

title: Perfect location and food
comment: The location is amazing, there is a breathless view of London from each table. The food is served as small dishes to share, so that you can try with your partners the multiple tastes of both Brazil and Japan. Definetely suggested for a special occasion.

title: Perfect birthday surprise
comment: I booked the table 3 months in advance for my girlfriends birthday as a surprise. 3 months later, we arrived on the 38th floor where we expected to be greeted and seated, however the arrangement was slightly confusing but we did eventually find someone who showed us to a lovely little table with great views of London. Whilst our waiter began to explain the concept of sushi samba to us, a James Bond style gentleman (Remi - floor manager), came over and told us he had a better table for us. Our things were all picked up and we were guided over to a gorgeous table with an even better view where the royal treatment began.  Remi started by bringing us a glass of champers each (which was on the house). We now had a new waitress (Valerie), who was just as lovely and proceeded to explain the menu to us. We decided to go one dish at a time, for which Val was extremely knowledgable and was happy to give us her personal recommendations, we gladly followed and were not disappointed.  Throughout our evening we were well looked after with a waiter only ever a couple of steps away ready to help. Remi was amazing throughout the night and even sent us a dish which he said was his favourite in the menu, the yellow tail taquitos, which were delicious! We sampled plenty of dishes and cocktails and at the end of the night our desert was brought with a candle and happy birthday message for my girlfriend which was a lovely touch.  We visited the bar upstairs for a couple of more cocktails after.  All in all we had an amazing night with fantastic service which we could not praise enough. Remi is an absolute star and made this a really memorable evening and birthday for the girlfriend.  Although quite pricey and upmarket, it really wasn't pretentious and we will definitely be back!

title: worth saving for a special occasion
comment: amazing views, buzzy, trendy atmosphere, staff very knowledgeable about the menu. It is expensive but i think you pay for the location as well as the food and cocktails. I took my husband for his bday and it went down well , i was worried being a monday it might be quiet but it was still buzzing, we had cocktails at duck and waffle first which is also very cool! The outside part with the orange tree at sushi samba is very cool and different. The lift was not as scary as i thought, although it is like a ride in itself! I had to face the door on the way up - good idea if your scared of heights like me and i was absolutely fine!it takes 8 seconds i think to get up there and i braved looking out on the way down - fantastic view! food was very good and the sake is defo worth trying - its very light and im not hungover yet so it must be good!! Defo recommend for a buzzy, fun night out of trying different sushi - there iare lots of options for those who dont eat seafood too like me!! It was a treat for my husband as he loves sushi and it went down very well! Woul like to return!! Thankyou for having us!

title: Terrible.
comment: Awful food, terrible service and way overpriced. I called a central line to make a reservation and they could not tell me if there were any spaces for a walk in as they were on another floor. Had to go all the way upstairs to the restaurant to find it almost empty. Despite there being 4 of us for lunch, I had to wait 40 minutes to be served. None of these awful aspects were made up for with the food - quite honestly terrible.

title: Best meal ever!
comment: After having visited SushiSamba in Las Vegas quite a few times in the past we decided to try the SushiSamba in London as well. In Vegas we were overwhelmed with the food we had eaten there ... so the team in London was up for a challenge. Similar to Vegas our evening in London was spectacular: the drinks, the food, the staff, the setting ... everything is just right! I think this is the genuine SushiSamba experience.  Two things to recommended: 1) go in early and have a few Mojito's on the rooftop terrace ... the view is amazing (and so is the tree). 2) Don't order from the menu ... instead set a budget per person and let the chef amaze you! Highly recommended. We will definitely be back in SushiSamba London in the future.

title: Really liked the Sushi
comment: Went here for a special occasion. Had to make a reservation a few weeks in advance. The view and the food were worth it though. The waitress gave excellent suggestions and I personally liked the El Topo and Samba London rolls.

title: You go for the view and the fun, you come back for the food
comment: I believe that fashionable, fun restaurants, part of a chain with a view will have average overpriced food and overwhelmed staff. In this case everything is perfect and creative and very decently priced. We loved the pork belly, the veg tempura, the wagyu taquitos and seabass tempura. We did not try the sushis as the above seemed much more interesting. Desserts were fine but nothing special except for a spicy chocolate with spicy sorbet. This restaurant is already busy and it deserves it.

title: Sips and bites from above
comment: Our night at one of the 'hype restaurants' of London was very enjoyable for a Saturday night. Queuing 10 min to get into those high speed lifts wasn't much of a problem for us . The 'close to midnight' atmosphere at both bars was chilled and bearable however we've got badly surprised to get to know at the tree open air bar that we could only have a supermarket shelf single option of Champagne.  Have decided to grab a cocktail at the lounge bar we then got rather happy by the quality . We waited 30 min to get a restaurant table , lovely waiters , delicious food , beautiful and funky room with amazing view , Brazilian classics songs ,pricey wine list and the feeling that the night was ours !!

title: Futuristic lift, superb views, awesome food, great cocktails
comment: We had a brilliant time at SushiSamba. The arrival through the high speed lift is breathtaking. Even on a slightly rainy/ foggy night, the views over London were amazing. Service was very attentive and friendly. Food was truly delicious: special mention for the tempura beans appetiser (we could not get enough of those). There was so much delicious food on the table that I could not begin to describe what I ate, but it was all fantastic - reminded me of Hakkasan/ Yauatcha, but with a Brazilian twist (some mozzarella/ chilli peppers thrown in the mix). Great cocktails and a fab wine selection. The atmosphere on a Friday night was buzzing.  Not cheap, so be prepared for a steep bill. But worth it.

title: Only had drinks but was impressed!
comment: Stopped by for a cocktail or four on a Saturday early evening. Not too busy, great views, friendly staff - drinks weren't ridiculously over-priced either. Plan on returning to try the food soon.  One negative was there were little clusters of groups sat in the best seats without a drink between them - they were happily snug there a fair while, which was a shame for paying customers to stand further in.

title: Great view, well presented food, but too expensive for quality of food
comment: When we arrived, we were given a table next to a thoroughfare, but managed to spot one next to the glass barrier directly overlooking the city. Service was ok and staff knowledgeable, aside from forgetting to bring my drink. After asking again twice it came and I was offered it complimentary as a gesture of goodwill. Food was well presented and some interesting combinations on the menu, but the price was too high for what it was. Bottom line - decent restaurant, but you pay for the view. One to visit once but not somewhere I will be dining again in the near future.

title: excellent
comment: Had a great lunch here with my husband and ate a wonderful meal, the selection of dishes was amazing and had something to suit all, highlights for me were the beef with fois gras and quails egg and the coated prawns. The sparkling sake was delicious, so too the after dinner lemon one. The waiter was extremely helpful and the service was great, in all I would highly recommend and have done to several friends!

title: Drinks review did'nt have Food
comment: I'm reviewing this for views and ambience not the food because we did'nt eat. The lift up is magnificent in both views and speed. At 4.00pm no doorman as previous reviewers have said but maybe a little early on a Thursday for that. cocktail menu was good if not extensive but not cheap and neither is the bottled beer, but considering it cost's £25 to go up the 'Shard' just for views and you get nothing I'm maybe being a bit harsh but for 6 drinks it was £75. Did'nt eat because after looking at the menu the sushi just did'nt quite appeal and the other restraunt was fully booked. Views were fantastic and a great perspective of London.

title: Pricey but worth it
comment: I'd always wondered why there was a queue at the bottom of the high rise but now I know what's at the top I will be joining it more often. Quality cocktails and delicious food in a smart atmosphere which is less pretentious than some of the bars in the Shard.

title: Food fusion with fantastic nice view of London
comment: I heard a lot about this venue and when I finally went there I understood what's the hype is all about. The place is really nice but for me the food, although a bit pricey, makes all the difference. The atmosphere is a little too cool for my liking: I mean the type of place where people go to see and been seen rather then a nice chill out restaurant and the fact that a member of the security staff was trying to stop us taking a picture on the terrace, after we had dinner, added to the feeling. However once you forget about the 'uber cool' surrounding and sit down for dinner, the mixture of taste and texture of south american and Japanese dishes is amazing. With the help of friendly and knowledgeable staff we went through a selection of fish dishes followed by the churrasco platter served on hot rocks: a must try!

title: Fantastic food, Excellent service, Splended view!
comment: I liked EVERYTHING about this place. And even if you're not a huge sushi fan, there are lots of other things for you to eat. I even tried some sushi that my accompanying friend ordered and fell in love with it. Definitely world class food, impeccable service, really nice decor (including and outdoor area), and views to die for. All in the middle of a nice buzzing area of London. Make sure you get a chance to visit here on your visit to London. Book about 2 months in advance to get the proper dinner time you want as getting dinner reservations for a 'normal dinner time' on short notice can be tricky ;)

title: Flash, cosmopolitan atmosphere, worth a visit just for drinks (food not tested)
comment: We had heard lots of bad press about this place so we came here just to enjoy a few drinks, and the stunning views. At the street level entrance, visitors are checked if they comply with the dress code, and a couple in from of us were not let in as they wore trainers.  With no annoying security checks, we were shown to the lift which shuttled us to the 40th floor. The lift runs through a glass structure at the outside of the building, allowing for panoramic views toward the West.  Upon arrival it is best to head downstairs for the Samba Sushi area, past the orange themed walls, covered with feathers and glitzy chandeliers and a great look onto the gherkin and the cheesegrater. There is a bar “downstairs”, i.e on the 38th floor and there is an outside space with a giant orange trees, barkeepers dressed in orange outdoor jackets to defy the polar temperatures up here /out here. The drinks available outside are just champagne, one rose, two white and two reds. All wines are around £8 per small glass, and the red was far too cold, but honestly, we were not bothered. You come here for the atmosphere, and the views and what we now call “experience”. It is clearly a touristy place (including those from Essex), and is all about showing off. But certainly is a nice place to enjoy the cosmopolitan, swanky atmosphere on the top of London.

title: Great View
comment: This place had very good food (not excellent though) and the service was not great for the sommelier, he clearly had his hands full and you had to wait to get a top up but the food and view made up for it. On a side note, the staff are some of the most beautiful people you will see in the same place at the same time.

title: Top View
comment: One of the top views in london. Convieniently located near Liverpool street this bar / restaurant has stunning views of the city of London. Time your visit for sunset for soem great photo opportunities. The drinks are a bit pricey, but the location more than makes up for it. Interior design is modern and funky. Set over three floors all connected with a sweeping staircase. If you dont want to pay the £25 cost of going up the shard, this is a brilliant alternative. Plus you can have a drink whilst you enjoy the view. Highly recommended!

title: Gets better and better
comment: Have dined here several times with friends family and on business and it has never failed to impress. This time my wife and I were celebrating our anniversary, she was grinning from ear to ear and we had only been in the lift! Having read some of the negative reviews on this site, all I can say to you guys is let your hair down, live a little and enjoy the ride of sushi samba! We arrived and were sat at a small table near the entrance to the restaurant. This was disappointing to say the least. Lucky enough I was recognised by the maitre d and whisked off to an amazing table by the window with the most spectacular views of London. Cue instant brownie points scored for me. On previous occasions the food has been good, but a little hit and miss. This time we decided to leave it to our excellent waiter, Edwin from Lithuania and it didn't disappoint at all, in fact it was truly memorable. All in all a superb evening. Thank you sushi samba. Little tip for all you people. Let the staff take you on a culinary journey, they know what's good and get to know the maitre d Patrick and you are sure to be well looked after.

title: Only went for drinks
comment: Not sure what all the fuss is about, the drinks are somewhat overpriced and it was too busy with people trying too hard to be cool. Views are good though

title: A sky high experience
comment: Hi, I went to sushi samba for drinks and nibbles. We had a table on the terrace next to the big tree. We had wine and a few bits to eat. Everything was very tasty and well presented. Price was a bit on the high end but the amazing views over London are definitely worth it. I really recommend this place to anyone!

title: Amazing views and delicious food
comment: One of our favorite places for special occasions Book in advance! Try to book sunset time for both day and night views. If warm enough sit on the terrace outside. Black cod, waygu potstickers and sashimi tiradito, yum!

title: Great restaurant
comment: Lovely food, great service with friendly staff. fantastic views over the Liverpool street. Highly recommended.

title: Best views, great food, expensive but worth it!
comment: Loved Sushi Samba London, the bar outside is fantastic and food is delicious. Have to say the non-sushi dishes were much better than the sushi but all round fantastic service and great views of the Gerkin!

title: Breathtaking
comment: Everything about this place is excellent. Sushi, drinks, atmosphere, stuff and the view were all brilliant. Definitely a place to come back!

title: Martini Cocktails with The BEST View
comment: There are Sushi Samba's all over the world. I have eaten several times at the Las Vegas location.  Here, I went for drinks! Their Sushi Samba signature cocktail is insane. If you're into guava juice, this is the drink for you! Also tried their Espresso Martini -- amazing! The drinks at Sushi Samba are full of flavor!!  This is a great place to meet up for drinks before dinner or just for a late night meet up with friends! Not to mention the restaurant is nearly 40 stories high and overlooks a breathtaking view of London....night or day, it's worth the elevator ride!

title: Best Rooftop Spot in the City
comment: Just went to the bar, so I can't say anything about the sushi or the roof garden for restaurant guests. The drinks were fine, and so were some of the views from the bar, particularly from the staircases connecting the three levels. The bar is a pleasant alternative to its older rooftop rival, Vertigo 42. At SushiSamba you don't need a reservation for the bar, don't have to undergo x-ray/metal detector, but get to ride in a glass elevator. Recommended if you're looking for a rooftop bar in the City, though the bar atop the shorter Hilton on Park Lane in Westminster has better views.

title: Simply stunning from start to finish.
comment: A first time visit and an amazing place to boot.The service was superb,the food was excellent and the setting was beyond our expectations.We were totally blown away by the entire experience and cannot wait to visit again.Still can't quite wipe the smiles off our faces!!Many,many thanks.

title: Terrible bar staff
comment: Unattentive, unforgivably slow service. Yes the setting is nice, more so when the balcony is open. However if you leave your customers hanging at the bar for over 30mins without even an acknowledgement then it doesn't matter how nice the view is, you'll be so bored and frustrated that you'll move on. I have been twice and whilst the first time I put down to a busyish Friday night, I went recently on a Saturday afternoon and found the service was even slower despite 3 men behind the bar and a queue not even one deep. The problem?One painfully slow drink made at a time. Lack of queue management, e.g. the poor guy next to me was already waiting when I turned up and all he wanted was 4 bottles of beer!; failure to know which section of the bar they were serving, failure to work down the line. No surprise that I left embarrassed at having suggested the venue.

title: Pre-Dinner Drinks
comment: We went here in a group for a pre-dinner drink on a Friday night. The place was absolutely packed. It was difficult to enjoy the views. I think it would be better if they had a limit as to the number of people they allow in especially in an establishment like this one. It was hard to enjoy the views and have a conversation. Yes, the venue is nice and the views are good. The cocktails were lovely too, however for £14 a drink I would expect them to be. What was ridiculous was the 12.5% service charge they add to your bill!!! What the hell for? There was no table service and the bartenders were not exactly friendly! I thought that was ridiculous. Overall, I think there are far better places in London to enjoy views and have a nice relaxed drink. I did not have the food, but I do not think I would want to in that noisy busy environment.

title: Amazing views and rooftop bar
comment: Personally I wouldn't eat here again, the shushi really is nothing special but the views and the rooftop bar are well worth another visit. Stunning views over London and a relaxed bar serving some lovely cocktails. Service is slow but the waiters were so friendly, they recommended items from the menu and took time to explain what the items were when served.  I will definately go back but not for dinner.

title: Best sushi in London
comment: Booked for after the theatre for my wife's 30th. People were great, did a special desert with her name on it, and food and drink was incredible. Could not think of a better place to go for a special occasion.

title: Great Night Out
comment: On the 34th floor of the Heron in the heart of the City off London, SushiSamba offers a wonderful atmosphere. The decor is very contemporary and really well done.  The bars has great cocktails: tasty and beautiful. The crowd averages from mid-30s to late-40s, which made us feel right at home. The food is fabulous. Just as the name suggests; japanese/south-american fusion. The sushi is delicious, however that should not be the reason for going there as the other dishes are truly spectacular. The chilean sea-bass is most definitely a must. Service is good. Our waiter was helpful, pleasant and full of suggestions. However, it was very busy and they did forget to bring one dish and we had to order a bottle of water a couple times before it finally made its way to our table. Great selection of Saki including a delicious sparkling version. The only downside (hence 4 stars as opposed to 5) is the music at the dining area which is definitely way too loud for conversation.  Reservations are required and they offer some very strange hours such as 4pm or 2am. We had to wait almost months for a 10:30pm slot. That puts me off in terms of going back.

title: Go for the view but the food is seriously overpriced
comment: Its like being the child with Willy Wonka zooming toward the glass ceiling as your stomach drops to the ground and the City of London is laid out before you and glass lift hurtles towards the 38th floor. The restaurant itself is also impressive a glass atrium with views for miles on two sides (not all sides though), but it will depend greatly on where you sit as to whether the impressive view will be your meal companion. We were luckily to be seated by the window with a breathtaking view of London. I really wanted to give this restaurant a better rating and the reason I haven't is purely because our charming waiter explained the concept of small plates based on sharing and suggested we had at least one from each section. Needless to say neither the concept was foreign, or was my surprise that a plate from each section was unnecessary when we only ordered four dishes and it was plently of food for two. We were told that they brought everything when it was cooked. However, we were also told that dishes followed through the sections and I thought they would follow in stages.  We had been sitting for not quite 15 minutes since entering the building enjoying some edamame beans, which were supposed to be the prelude to a great meal when everything arrived together. This meant by the time we reached the half lobster, whilst was delicious it was a tad cold and it was all a bit overwhelming. I slightly feared the whole experience would be done in half an hour. The staff are attentive, but almost to the point of annoying with the constant water topping up and desperation to whisk dishes away before they were finished. There is a definite desire to up-sell, although it is done politely. As we were paying a table behind us had just sat down and these two gentlemen were told exactly the opposite and asked how and when they would like their courses. Was this because they ordered the wagyu at about £50? Same waiter different story. As my guest for lunch had loved it and I genuinely enjoyed the food and the view despite everything arriving together, I did not see any reason for a fuss, but they need to sort this out.  The food itself was good. The sashimi combination was full of interesting flavours, but £21 for three of thinnest slices of fish I have ever seen is a bit of joke even by London standards. The tuna was in a great sauce, but I actually struggled to identify it as tuna and having eaten some truly delicious tuna in California recently this was a real let down. I would suggest you go for the grilled or other items which were decent sized portions for sharing plates and the tempura prawns were excellent. Would I go again? Despite the moan, this restaurant has an amazing view and decent food for which you are being overcharged for the view. There are loads of places like this around the world and its not to say that you will not enjoy it, but its worth remembering to ask that they bring your dishes in stages so that you can enjoy the view that little bit longer.

title: Best expierence on food ever !
comment: A first time visit for London with 3 very good friends. In one word an amazing place to visit. An absolute must do from getting in the lift to get to the 38th floor setting, having cocktails at the champagne tree, eating some great dishes which were explained in detail. One tip for visitors , work with a budget. We spend 100 pound each without drinks and asked the chef to surprise us as we had already visited 8-10 times Sushi Samba in Las Vegas and never disappointed us. The service and the food was excellent. The setting was amazing and beyond our expectations. We were totally blown away by the entire experience and cannot wait to visit again. A must do and better served then many Michelin star restaurants.  The only minor was that the terrace with the champagne tree was a little to crowded , but hey , everyone wants to have the London skyline when drinking one of the best mojito's :-P

title: Very poor service ruins evening
comment: Despite it's great location the attitude of staff, starting with the odious, rude door men and an average dining experience make this a spot not worth going out of your way to attend.

title: Birthday Girl
comment: I went at Sushi Samba for my Birthday and I had an amazing experience. The atmosphere was welcoming and warm. I was with my friends and I think they loved the restaurant and especially the tree.... The food was very tasteful and unusual but in a really good way. the mix between the different food makes me want more.The waiter explain to use that the concept was to share the plate so we could test different things. he was helpful and patient. When the floor manager knew that it was my birthday he offered me a glass of champagne. and that make me feel special. The view is amazing and it was like being on top of London. The Staff were all really nice. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to celebrate a special event.

title: Dinner with a breathtaking view
comment: Hi  Went for our 3 years anniversary at Sushi Samba this week. We had to choose between The Savoy Hotel and here. I do not regret the choice at all.   We were welcomed by a lovely host and pointed to the Orange tree bar to enjoy a glass of Champagne while waiting to be seated.we got there 30 min before out reservation time.   We enjoyed a bit of time by the fire in the terrace then we got seated by the window, the best table in the house and explained the menu.   As the first starter arrived we had the pleasure if meeting the GM, Romain , a fabulous and very attentive person that explained us the Concept of sushi samba and recommended us a dish outside our order which we were thrilled by the taste of it after enjoying it.   The place doesn't need any advertising as the standards are set from the moment you push the 38 th floor button on the elevator to the farewell and the hand shake you receive upon leaving the restaurant.   Am amazing experience and definitely we will be back and recommend the place to all of out friends.   Enjoy the view....

title: Excellent an experience to enjoy
comment: This was our second trip and it was a superb dining experience. This is a restaurant for a special occasion and best to go with at least 4 people because the style of eating is share  You start at beginning of menu and work through ,,,we choose less than the recommended mixture of small plates and large plates and had a enough for 4 in 9 plates . The food is a completely different taste so we would advise try things you don't expect to like ...

title: Love the orange light tree on the terrace
comment: Great place to have a few drinks, stunning views of London from the bar on the 39th floor! great cocktails too and not terribly pricey! Go early as the queues get pretty bad in the evening by all accounts.

title: Excellent Resturant with fantastic views
comment: A colleague recommend that eat at Sushi Samba, rather than pay £25 each to go up the Shard tower and we were not disappointed. Brilliant views over London from the 38th floor and terrific food. You need help to navigate the menu, but the knowledgable and friendly staff are keen to advise. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience and the £50 saved by not visiting the Shard, went a long way to offset the bill!

title: Great food, bad vibes
comment: This is everything but a restaurant. A bar atmosphere without a bar comfort. Bar tables are too narrow for sharing food, too much human traffic even in seating areas, hostesses think they are in the hottest place on earth (and they are not...) and the general experience is more stressful than enjoyable. BUT... great food, if you're up for it.

title: Amazing views, with a hard sell
comment: Views are amazing and is an impressive venue for a business lunch. Food was also very good, but should be at the cost. What let it down was the real sense that the recommendations from the waiting staff moved very quickly to a borderline hard sell. I don't mind advice, I don't appreciate being pushed into additional dishes I do not want or need. Small point and the hint was eventually taken. Wagyu grade 9 beef on the hot stones was great fun.

title: Breath-taking view! :)
comment: I love this place, possibly my favourite bar! There is and a restaurant too. Great service and nice coctails! I've never tried the food, because we went there for a couple of drinks, but when I looked around saw only pleased people , so it looks like the food has a great tasting and great portions.The coctails were all good (from those which we've tried). :) And the view - what can I say!!!! Spectacular! Amazing! Just - go there and you will never be sorry! Recommend it!

title: amazing experience but horrible treatment by the security guards
comment: Really amazing foods and beautiful view of London. But I had the worst treatment at the door when the security accused me of being drunk just because I was laughing with my friends in the queue. I had never been accused of anything in anywhere else I've ever attended. Completely different treatment at Zuma.

title: Excellent meal in a fun environment
comment: Despite trekking over about 18 tube stops on a Monday evening, our trip to Sushi Samba was a genuinely fantastic experience. First of all, the (extremely quick) lift up to the 38th floor gave fantastic views over London, as did the restaurant and bar itself. The atmosphere was excellent - very buzzy, but also friendly. We had visited Sushi Samba in Las Vegas, and this branch is just as good. The menu could be a little confusing, but our waiter pointed us in the right direction, and his suggested number of (sharing) dishes was just about spot on. We were full, but not bloated at the end of the meal. The food itself is a mix of sushi (obviously), sashimi, small sharing plates and also large main courses, but all are meant to be shared by the table. Particularly good, were the rock shrimp tempura, glazed pork belly wraps and sea bass tempura. Our sashimi seviche was interesting, although i'm not sure I would have it again - nice to try something new though. Dessert was fabulous - a yuzu tart cheesecake, with dinky little sugar sphere over the top - superb! One small point (if I could have knocked half a point off, I would have done). If a restaurant is going to charge a fiver for an orange juice, please ensure it is freshly squeezed and not straight out of a carton - not good.  Despite this, it was a great meal out, and we would definitely return

title: Good for drinks only!
comment: I went to this reataurant yesterday. The view was amazing the food and service was poor to average. Go for the view and a coktail

title: Brilliant restaurant experience
comment: Great restaurant in a fantastic venue with a brilliant views of the city - the food is amazing and the atmosphere is great. It is expensive but great choice for a special occasion.

title: Eclectic food if you are looking for something out of the ordinary
comment: All the other reviews have said all there is to say about the views. The loos are funkier than the restaurant, which is a little spartan rather than minimalist. This is posh prices and posh views without posh comfort, I suspect it looks better at night. The bar is one of the most uninviting I have ever had a drink in. That said the staff were terrific, they held our table and let us run over, the food was excellent; a little precious if you are hungry but superb flavours. The beef 'cook your own dinner' show is mildly amusing but over-priced so I recommend picking dishes that involve the skills of the cooks. Compared to the Las Vegas Sushisamba the food is not as exciting and the atmoshere rather muted, but at least you can speak to each other.

title: Food - great Views - great Atmosphere - great
comment: Went there following a few recommendations for a special dinner and wasn't disappointed. The food is top notch, with a unique combination of sushi, Brazillian and Peruvian food dovetailing very well. The service was attentive without being overbearing, and the views a cross London are to die for. I will definitely go back.

title: What a treat!!
comment: Love love love!!! Great sushi, hot and cold....hot soup was to die for. There is a great outside area to drink, with an enormous tree with lights...fab considering you are 41 floors high....great views across the city. The music had a south American vibe, the waiter helped us choose the food, and it was a real treat....it's definitely a must. Great fun!!

title: Superb
comment: An absolute must to try - the whole experience from getting on the lift to get to the 38th floor setting, to getting into a party mood, having lush cocktails, eating some great dishes which were explained in detail, to the yummiest choc chilli desert to stepping onto the terrace to catch the London skyline at night made my evening amazing. The attentive staff made sure nothing was too much when we asked questions. Can't wait to go back there again

title: Disappointing
comment: I went for dinner last night, spent quite a lot for a very ordinary meal. Their standards have dropped significantly since January! Gone is the polite manager from Christmas, replaced by someone who remarks 'Perhaps you have no awareness of good food!' Gone are the positive and vibrant waiting staff - replaced by tired and robotic ones The portion sizes are smaller, and I daren't say the quality of food. Last time the waiter was SO helpful, that he spent ages explaining non-alcoholic options for drinks and the wonderful story of their English mineral water. THEY'VE EVEN CHANGED THE WATER - why? (Seriously) Even though they were informed it was my brother in law's birthday - they put us next to a rowdy hen party! Honestly, it was really quite a poor experience all round - there are many better options in London!

title: Such a treat, can't wait to go again!
comment: Love this place, possibly my favourite restaurant ever! Great service relaxed yet attentive waiters who never let you wait for anything! Perfect food great tasting, great portions I live sushi and the fusion type food is fantastic and as someone who loves sharing plates it was perfect! Cocktails to die for! They do a great amaretto sour! To top it all off it has a great ambience about the place, style music lighting all spot on and there are amazing views of a great city from the roof too bar! Perfect place for the 30 something's of London. I would love to go back with the girls as it was an amazing experience! It is very expensive though perhaps a little overpriced but I understand you pay for the spectacular views of the heron tower! Defo worth a visit even if it's just once. I shall be going back next year though! Excited already!

title: Fantastic
comment: My daughter and I went to sushi samba on a day trip to London. The staff were truly fantastic, attentive without being intrusive and were available for any query one might have. The food was amazing, different and so tempting that it was easy to keep ordering. We had several cocktails that were all very different and delicious. All the food arrived looking beautiful and tasted magnificent. I can't wait to go again and would recommend this to anyone who wants something a little different. The views were outstanding and the outside sofas, where we had cocktails were comfortable and the views of London were breathtaking. If you have only time for one outing/ meal in London then this is the place. However not cheap, but worth every penny.

title: Misleading rating..see below for details...
comment: The four stars are for the view and the service. The food is better than average but in no way either justifies the price tag or the setting. The crowd in the bars is pretty obnoxious and there is clearly a competitive nature in the way the cash is being flaunted. This was a Friday though, so probably better in the week. Views are unparalleled in London (haven't been up the Shard yet though) and the experience is well worth one visit. I would suggest going for a drink but save your money for a better restaurant - can't fault the staff though. In the face of some very "demanding" customers they were exceptionally professional and charming. Who likes this place? Bankers and footballers and anyone with a head for heights. The glass lifts that make you feel like you are flying are extraordinary. Highlight dish was the sea bass tempura which was light and succulent and very well judged.

title: Delicious
comment: This is an expensive restaurant and you do have to book in advance. If you turn up at the door without a reservation, you will be disappointed because the wait is really long! I've been with friends and clients and both times, the food has been delicious. Try and get a table overlooking south and Canary Wharf, as it is a nice area of the restaurant. If going for lunch, get a few starters to share. The lunch menu can be heavy! Otherwise, great location and the views are excellent, especially on a sunny day!

title: Great Fusion food overlooking the city
comment: I booked Sushisamba to have dinner with a couple of colleagues who were over from abroad. I wanted to show off the London skyline and have a sophisticated dining experience. We were shown to our table quickly and helped with the menu. We had drunk a bottle of the bubbly Prosecco by the time the first course arrived. All the food was carefully put together and the quality came through. Our waiter was very good and advised on our specific tastes as well as the number of dishes needed to be ordered. It's a fantastic glass house on top of one of the tallest buildings in the city and you can't compare it to another view except perhaps at the yet to open Shard restaurants. Later, we went outside to the busy terrace for some cocktails which were well balanced and hit the spot. Apart from the rather curt service of all the staff (except our waiter) - which it seems has been written about extensively by others here, I thought it was a great experience.

title: Yum, yum, yum!!
comment: Have been hearing great things about this place and have wanted to go for a while. My experience did not disappoint! We arrived early and managed to get a table without a booking. The service was great and the food was out of this world. Great flavours and presentation. My only negative comment was that all our food came a little too quickly so it felt a little rushed. Guessing this is due to the 2 hour table policy which is a real shame as we didn't quite get enough time to savour our meal as much as we could have. The views from this amazing place are another story in themselves! Well worth the visit.

title: A fab experience but the food is overpriced and average!
comment: This restaurant is a great concept, it really feels like you're eating in the clouds and the lift to the 38th floor is so fast you feel like you're on a ride! Great atmosphere, lovely waiters and decent priced wine. However the food was average for the extortionate price, £21 for tempura and £8 for one portion of below average sushi. Plus 12.5% gratuity added to bill. Starters are around £15 too, it just doesn't reflect in the quality but it is nicely presented. Go for the experience and the views but don't expect luxury quality food. A great first date place if you want to impress.

title: Cancelled our booking without informing us!
comment: Booked two weeks ago.  Received an email confirmation.  Arranged a babysitter.  Brought the whole extended family up, walking sticks and all. £200 in rail tickets.  Drivers booked for the return.  Get there, and... "Sorry. Private party on. Your reservation has been cancelled! We did try and call you, honest!"

title: Delicious food with sweeping views on London – great for special occasions
comment: Sushi Sumba London is a great place for a special occasion! Excellent sushi and sweeping views of London. We had a fantastic night there and stayed on in the rooftop bar for post dinner cocktails. Beautiful balcony area for a drink before or after dinner.

title: Worth every pound
comment: We took the great glass elevator up to floor 40 then walked down two floors of glass stairs We started with cocktails under the Orange tree -and very nice they were too. The place was full of city bods but what would you expect Then into eat -food was incredible views unbelievable the waiters were very attentive  Looking forward to going back

title: Delicious Fusion food with views to die for
comment: Tough to get a booking at this place ( What recession eh). But keep trying. Took my wife a few weeks ago and everything about this place was good, Super Glass elevator on the OUTSIDE of the building whisks you to the restaurant some 30odd floors up. Cocktails are fun and fresh, service is slick and the whole Menu looks delicious. Pricey, but most fresh fish is and the rents here must be off the charts.. its a big noisy restaurant but I love it

title: Genuinely good!
comment: I was apprehensive that Sushi Samba would be overpriced hype and no substance but it was actually genuinely very good! The views and restaurant were impressive, our waiter was very knowledgable and helpful and the food was delicious (and not half as meagre as we were expecting!). The wagu gyoza to start and the lamb chop robata were excellent and the moqueca mista was good. The variety of sushi, robata and hot dishes together worked well and we had a fun evening.

title: Try it
comment: I must admit wanting to try this place for a while and I definitely was not dissapointed. The lift is not ideal if you don't like heights but does offer a great view of the city. I read some reviews about the service and was a bit concerned but we were treated really well. There is an outside terrace for dinners which is lovely on a warm sunny evening. We spent an hour or so here working our way through the cocktail list and soaking up the atmosphere before heading to our table. The views are excellent from most seats but we were lucky and sat by the window. There is also an outside terrace and another bar area too if you want to dine alfresco. It's very buzzy, very well lit and the food is really good. We had great service from the minute we arrived, very attentive, lots of interaction, great advice and information about food and sake - I was really impressed. You have gotta try it. Big thumbs up from me.

title: Lovely food, great view
comment: This is the place to go if you want to have an awesome view from London while having great food. Our waiter was unbelievably fun and helped a lot with some food recommendations. Even if we didn't get there with time to have our cocktail before dinner, we were able to do it while we were waiting for the food. Our waiter went outside to call us as soon as the food was arriving. So, just go outside and enjoy the sunset over London. The food was great! Please try the antichuchos - chilean sea bass miso. You won’t regret it! I bet that all of the dishes are as good as the ones we had, but unfortunately you can’t have them all at once. So, I’ll be back to try a couple more. Keep in mind that you pay for the quality… and for the view in this case. But it’s worth it when you pay and you like it. Drink with moderation and you will be able to make it a little bit cheaper.

title: Amazing place, a MUST in London for the food, the view, the atmosphere and amazing vibe.
comment: Japanese and brazillian food combined, it couldnt get better... Its really amazing what they've done to the place. Definetly one of the best meals I've ever had, and I'm a chef!

title: Great views, interesting food
comment: This is a pricey restaurant but you pay for the interesting food and the views (my goodness, the views!). I seemed pretty busy but the service was prompt and not intrusive. The food arrived quickly and was very tasty. Overall a good place for a special meal.

title: Nice place .....poor service!!
comment: Place with incredible view ....which is unfortunately ruined with poor service!! Ordering drinks is taking ages and quality is rather disappointing. Staff is rude and treats customer like dirt.....shame.

title: Outstanding Food and Atmosphere!
comment: Best view I've had while eating! Dishes are family style and meant to be shared. Although prices are expensive, don't hold back from trying as much as possible. We order some rolls, sashimi, raw scallops, calamari, pepper shrimp, just to name a few. Each dish was better than the other. This was a fantastic experience for all your senses!

title: Very Good
comment: Irrespective of the view, the food here is delectable, menu decent, service sharp and prices that go with the territory. An enjoyable experience and the restaurant is well worth a visit.

title: Nice but improvements could be made
comment: We arrived at the restaurant 10 minutes late for our reservation and were told there would be a 5 minute wait and someone would come and get us when the table was ready. After half an hour, my bf went back over to the desk to ask what was going on and was told there was a large party that had over run and there was no room for us until they left. We were given a complimentary glass of prosecco whilst we continued to wait. After another half an hour we went back to the desk again and said we wanted to eat or we'd have to leave as it was 11pm by this time. We were shown to a table and sat there for around 15 minutes before we were seen. The service up until we were eventually served was horrendous and really disappointing when paying high prices. The guy who served our food was fantastic. We weren't sure what to have so we told him things we didn't like and he had the chef make us a selection of foods, all of which were delicious. The music was very loud which is fine but it ruined the atmosphere a little. The terrace bar outside is quite small and areas were sectioned off for people, so it was quite cramped unless you had a seat in the sectioned off area. However, all this being said, I would recommend this restaurant for the food and cocktails as both were lovely, also, how can I not mention the views...the lift is made of glass so you have a panoramic view of London which is absolutely stunning at night. After our meal we went up another floor to duck and waffles for more drinks and more stunning views, well worth it.

title: Unprofessional and bad service
comment: I must say, with a lot of surprise, this was the worst hospitality experience my friends and I ever had. We spent 45 minutes at the bar waiting for our table where having a couple of drinks together and it was really annoying being served a hot champagne because the barmaid while preparing the glasses spent time chatting with her colleague instead that taking care of her customers, in addition finished the champagne we ordered four cocktails and again the barmaid was unkind not only not begin helpful with the cocktail list moreover completely ignorant on the existence of the one ordered. The worst was her laughing on our face as if we were asking for her to prepare something needing a degree to do so. We will not definitely come back to this place where there is not clientele selection neither staff training. I feel like advise against paying to be treated in a such of unprofessional way (one of the two managers we asked to speak with to report the disappoint wasn't at all considering our point). The only person I feel to thank for helping us finishing the night is the floor manager Remi Blanc with his kind and professional approach to the situation.

title: Drinks with a view
comment: Came here for drinks after work and i was surprised at how much i enjoyed it. We got a seat in the corner by the window, it was a lovely sunny evening, and my friend and i drank and chatted the evening away with being disturbed by anyone. The drinks are on the pricey side, however you are compensated with the view. I'd definitely come back, probably for dinner next time, but i would recommend to all.

title: Great view, great service, great restaurant!
comment: Booked a table here for a romantic meal and we weren't disappointed! The staff were attentive and helpful without being remotely pretentious (Vincent, in particular, was great fun!) and we found an excellent selection of vegetarian-friendly food on the menu - look out for the grilled pepper starter. Both the house cocktails and the Saké menu were very good - I'd strongly recommend their Pisco cocktail and the Black Dragon Saké. And it would be unfair to leave a review for Sushisamba without mentioning the view! We requested a table with a view and were moved accordingly, with minimal fuss, and the outdoor terrace is a lovely place to enjoy dessert / a drink, particularly when the sun goes down! Reasonably priced considering what you get for your money. Would definitely visit again.

title: Cocktails at cost
comment: We ate breakfast at another establishment based in this building (see additional review) and decided to call in for cocktails on the recommendation of a friend. Although we were seated by the window there was a very limited amount of seats, some which were accessed under a spiral staircase and required the guests to crouch down significantly to reach their seats.  Noticing a 12.5% service charge we went to the bar to order our cocktails only to be advised to return to our seats and a waitress will be over shortly. With the bar area only being about 5 steps away from where we were sat this is obviously a ploy to get the charge from you. That said, the cocktails were lovely and not one complaint. 4 cocktails and a bill of over £50 does seem a little steep but you are in London and taking in some of the best views around.

title: Underwhelmed
comment: I booked this restaurant for 11pm on a Friday night.  The ride up to the restaurant in the glass lift is impressive and the views when you get up to the restaurant are jaw-dropping! From the terrace next to the restaurant, you appear to be looking over the Heron Tower - my dinner friend and I spent quite a while just checking out the view and taking it in. The food is generally pretty good (except for the watermelon cervice - the watermelon was so overpowering that the cervice could have been anything quite frankly) - however, I thought the two tiny morsels of salmon that were delivered as the salmon nigiri were so measly as to be insulting. We wanted to finish off the evening with a drink at the bar, which is underneath a tree that has been lit up by lots of orange lights - the setting is really buzzing and gorgeous. However, half of the standing area appeared to have been cordoned off for a few individuals, making the other half so packed we decided not to bother. All in all, the view more than made up for salmon-nigiri-gate. However, I am surprised no other reviews seem to mention the noise level of the music. I found the music level unbearably loud (the music itself is some kind of thumping, non-stop, techno-samba?) Perhaps I am getting old but I dont really like shouting over my samba roll ...!

title: Excellent views although not many places to sit
comment: Only went for drinks and would definitely go again. Went for a friends birthday and had to stand up for the most part but by the end of the night we had taken up a sofa so was nice. Drinks were 10 pounds and service charge is added on to this even if you only have one. I thought it was a bit too much, why not just include that in the price. Drinks were nice. Lovely views!

title: Nice bar with stunning views , but it has a price!
comment: We tried to book a table for 2 but the only available time was 4:30 PM or 9:30PM. We went anyway for a drink . 2 single Bacardi & coke is £23.50. Just to give you an idea. It's not for budget conscious people. Love the atmosphere and the view is amazing. It gets very busy early in the evening so it's better to go there after 9PM when the city workers starts to leave to catch the train home. It has a nice terrace but it's very crowded especially when the weather is nice.

title: Good experience!
comment: I don't share some reviews about sushisamba where their experiences were poor based on a bad customer service and awful food. Sushisamba is exactly what you would expect from busy restaurants: a good experience at the top of one of the tallest buildings in London, decent food but not the best in London, decent and fast service without any interaction with your server and a great ambience in a sunny saturday afternoon where everyone seemed to have a great time. It is the kind of place where the only thing that you have to do is relax and enjoy the whole experience without trying to find mistakes during your time there. I would recommend it without a doubt.

title: Brilliant. Amazing food, location and experience
comment: What a wonderful experience. Great cocktails, amazing food, wonderful fresh flavours. Extremely attentive staff in restaurant, who helped with menu, and did not rush us at all.  Drinks garden was lovely with the fairy lights in tree, however hard to get a drink, and expensive.  Restaurant was fantastic, well worth the money for a truly lovely night.  Tip, go for an early dinner so you see the view in daylight and then change to night skyline. Wonderful.

title: Poor experience, overpriced and rude
comment: Ive been to Sushi Samba several times before but their customer service has gone massively downhill in recent weeks. Having been raving about the place to a friend, I took him for drinks on Wednesday and was left somewhat embarrassed The outside bar area is now 75% cordoned off, with access only allowed if you have a dinner reservation or buy a bottle of champagne. I asked the security staff how long this has been the rule and was told rather abruptly that 'this has always been the case'. It most certainly as not as I've been coming since the place opened. -this seems to be a new thing in the last few weeks. (I'd also called in advance to see if there were any party bookings and if the whole pace was open and had been told it was). We then had to squeeze in to a tiny area with a lot of other people while most of the reserved area remained empty. This resulted in us constantly being knocked by the bar staff who were struggling to get through the customers.  We then ordered drinks. Sushi Samba have massively reduced their cocktail menu. Fair enough, but we ordered one normal cocktail and one non-alcoholic and were charged the same full price for both. -£25 for two drinks! One of which was no more than juice and soda water. I asked if this was correct (non alco cocktails always were charged at £6.50 each on previous visits). I was they don't do non alcoholic cocktails?!? (they do, I've had them and they were delicious!) And beside these ones contained ' special' ingredients. Not sure how elderflower cordial and soda water constitute 'special' and a £12.50 charge.  It's a real shame Sushi Samba are going down this route. It used to be a great place to visit, but I'd struggle to recommend it while they are implementing silly rules and ripping off their customers.  I note they are still charging service charge when you buy your drinks at the bar too. This is disgraceful considering we can't exactly jump over the bar and make them ourselves.

title: It's Sushi Jim, but not as we know it...
comment: In a nut shell - amazing place! Very similar to Embassy Club in Dubai. High up with great views and cool atmosphere. The food is great. Service wise we didn't have any problem unlike a few who have recently posted. Go early and have a drink in the bar and on the terrace.

title: Rude staff
comment: I took my boyfriend out for an early dinner last weekend and overall the food was great and the chap that served our food was lovely but the staff that EVENTUALLY greet you are arrogant and rude. We were 5 minutes late and were spoken to as if we were hours late. It made us feel uncomfortable and us want to leave. If it hasn't been for the gentleman serving our food we would have walked out. I wouldn't recommend!

title: Atrocious, rude door staff - Best avoided
comment: I will try to keep this one brief. On 27/07/2013 we stayed in London (for my partner's birthday. A special treat), at the lovely Andaz hotel on Liverpool Street, just around the corner from the Heron Tower and Sushisamba.  Upon returning to the hotel, we found that the cocktail bar had closed. We asked the Concierge where else we could go, as that night I had proposed to my girlfriend and we had just got engaged. Understandably, we were over the moon and didn't want the night to end.  After being directed to Sushisamba, we made our way over to the entrance, upon which we were "greeted" by a sneering Asian (stated only to help identify this individual to the management, if they care) "gentleman" who basically treated us as though we were scum. We were accused of being drunk and not fitting in with their desired clientele, basically. I'd like to thank this cretin personally for putting a huge dent in our celebrations and for ensuring that we will never return to Sushisamba, nor will any of our family or friends now that they know how people are treated there.  When we returned to the hotel and informed the Concierge, he was horrified and arranged for a bottle of wine to be sent straight to our room by way of apology. Now THAT is how you treat your customers. Sushisamba take note.

title: Beautiful Views
comment: We went for cocktails, and is a must when in London It was a beautiful day and the scenery is simply amazing. Great atmosphere, its a pretty cool place and we enjoyed our visit.

title: Very nice place.
comment: We went on the of chance to Sushi Samba but only wanted a drink. The bar is on the 38/39 floors which is a great ride up in itself. Very buzzy and loud, very busy but you could move around, fantastic views if you managed to get a space to take some photos. We had a cocktail each and not cheap, £23.50 for two but they were very nice and glad we went.

title: Bottom line ok'e, its a SHAMBLES!
comment: A year down the line and they still can’t get it right. This was my 3rd visit at Sushi Shambles since the opening and it will be my last.  My first visit was last year shortly after they opened and service and food was atrocious. I remember ordering desserts and left 40 min later with no dessert. The food was terrible, service even worse, but being in the hospitality industry myself I know that the first 3 to 6 months can sometimes be a bit touch and go, so I gave them the benefit of the doubt and thought I might return at a later stage when they are more settled in. My second visit was in February and although the service was poor, the food had drastically improve, my favorite dish being the monk fish (that gets sliced at the table) and little meat skewers with aji panca and corn. My third visit however, was the worst. Got interrogated by a very rude chap at the door and now apparently there is a dress code. This takes away from the casual, South American theme and certainly Sushi Samba Miami would close its doors if they had a dress code policy. After a heated debate I was allowed in. Reach the top in a lift ride that is exhilarating and not a friendly face in site. Staff must be really unhappy at this place and it shows. Being in the hospitality industry myself, I understand the meaning of the word, but clearly no one here does, especially the arrogant French management. Apparently they are turning around more head chefs than tables, yet the food is ok (except for the Monk fish, that is now served with a horrible orange butter sauce that better suits something from China town) The desserts are good, but I suspect some of it is bought in as I have seen the exact Mochi ice cream dessert at Novikov a while back.  Bottom line ok'e, if Sushi Shambles was a restaurant on the ground floor in  London, it would be closed by now as the views is the only wow factor here.

title: Well worth a visit
comment: Spent an evening here mid week. Food is amazing but be prepared to pay well for it. Also be aware of some very expensive saki which bar waiting staff were keen to keep your glasses full of. Stunning views from the restaurant and also in the bar just above. High on the list of places to re-visit but not in the top 10.

title: Very underwhelmed..
comment: Crowded, pokey, huge areas cordoned off for private parties. And a discretionary service tip added and that was at the bar, where he didn't have to do anything. I'm cross with myself or not asking hi to take it off. Expensive and not worth it..

title: Not worth it
comment: As my father came to visit me in London I reserved a table at SushiSamba on a Sunday afternoon. It was a special occasion so I wanted to go somewhere nice. I have never been there before but I read the reviews previous to our visit and had really high expectations.  We arrived half an hour early and decided to go for a drink on the terrace where we could enjoy our "Cocktails" for about 10 minutes ´as we first had to wait 10 minutes until somebody came to our table and then another 10 minutes until our drinks were served. Quite annoying but I just thought it can't get worse. If you go to a place which is quite expensive and where you even be advised to come in Smart clothing, you have high expectations not only about the food but also about the Service. After our Cocktails somebody showed us to our table. Our waiter welcomed us very friendly and explained us everything on the menu. As we've never been there before, we ordered his recommendations. The first course came and we had no cutlery/chopsticks, no glasses and no napkins. We had to ask for it and as we only got the chopsticks my father finally had to get the napkins by himself. It happened 3 times that a waiter served something we actually didn't order. I always had to ask "our" waiter if that is the food we ordered - "oh no - that's not yours" he answered. He wasn't really bothered anymore. On top of that they charged us 60pounds more for dishes and drinks we never ordered and dishes we ordered but never reached our table. I had to tell them that there is something wrong with the bill, they would have just charged 60 more. I don't want to know how many people do not doublecheck their bill before they make the payment. So although the food was delightful and outstanding and the views were amazing everything together was a total clanger. I would never go there again.

title: Breathtaking Views
comment: WOW as usual I read other peoples reviews before I jump in with my own contribution and I have to say I am astonished at the divergence of the comments which range from terrible to amazing. I was lucky enough to be taken there by my daughter her husband and two boys during my annual visit to the UK and I have to say it was an extraordinary experience in many ways. First the weather was magnificent and one of those evenings you so rarely get in England, soft and balmy with clear skies all the way to the horizon, the view really is something and for someone from Hong Kong that was really very special. The lift ride was fun but for one who lives in a high rise nothing too special, the bar on the other hand is very special and was incredibly busy, a large tree dominates with a circular bar and tables surrounding it. The food was delicious and served in small portions to be eaten with chopsticks, some of the dishes were so good we re-ordered them. The contrast between the sushi type dishes and the traditional Brazilian meats was something to remember and clearly is very successful. Desserts were original and imaginative especially the organic red chocolate chilli peppers. Wine was very expensive but then this is a very special place and one should be prepared to pay high prices for such a top location Service was of a very high standard with our table server taking great care to make sure we had a great evening, management was highly visible and not the least bit arrogant, I came away with a menu signed by Executive Chef Claudio Cardoso and General Manager Romain Pottier. It is easy to understand why the restaurant was voted “Best Restaurant for Inventive Cuisine.” we will certainly return.

title: Fantasic
comment: My daughter booked a table at Sushisamba to celebrate our wedding anniversary. There were four of us eating and we had a fantastic evening. The food was suburb as was the service, ambiance and view (despite the rain). It was quite an experience and I will definitely be going back. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes to try something different and enjoys a bit of glitz. If you don’t crazy with the booze it’s not too expensive, we paid about £46 ph, and that included pudding – all of which were unusual and very delicious. Go on give it a try – you won’t regret it!

title: Great food, good service, worth it!
comment: Went here for our 5 year anniversary. Started off with quite an exciting lift that takes you 38floors up. Upon arrival there is a bar. Go one level up as theres another bar if you want a slightly higher view. Either way the view was superb even though it was raining all day. Being next to the Gherkin building makes great pictures. Drinks at the bar are expensive but what would you expect considering the location. They have an outside terrace too with a heated area it looks. Must be great during summer nights. We had a window seat and the restaurant itself is not that big. I think it must look better at night than during the day. Anyhow, we were greeted with smiles, I think it helps when attending for a special occasion. The food was great...you could taste the high quality. As with the drinks, the food is also quite expensive but again what do you expect? They provided some nice gestures in giving us a fresh bowl of rice when our main dish came out even though we only ordered one portion with starters.
