They also gave a free desert, well it was only chocolate macaroons but its the gesture that counts. Service was great from most of the staff, others seemed like they had enough of serving! All in all a great experience and I would recommend.

title: best food and view
comment: I loved everything about Sushi Samba, the music, the view and the food. The food has a mixture of everything so you can order from sushi to a huge piece of meat. The service is very polite and they will help you order if its the first time visiting. Very romantic place to go to enjoy London's amazing view! PS: it is not cheap, be ready to spend at least 50 pounds per person!

title: Excellent food and amazing views
comment: Really loved susi samba, the food was exceptional and the service was very attentive. We had a table by the window and enjoyed the view! Make sure you have a drink at the bar outside if you visit in good weather, the cocktails are amazing!

title: The Best night out I have ever had!!!!
comment: I took my Husband to Sushi Samba on Friday night for his Birthday. We both had a fabulous time. The experience from booking (ok I had to book about 6 weeks in advance) to finishing my last cocktail in the roof top bar was seemless. The lift to the bar, started the evening, followed by cocktails on the back roof over looking the Gerkin. The food was sooooo tasty, with a cross section of flavours, textures and taste. The staff were fantastic; Vincent and Marcin catered to our every need. We didnt feel rushed and savoured every last taste and view! I have to say, it was the best evening out; and before you ask...yes we go out a lot in London!

title: One of the best
comment: Amazing food. Everything tasted perfect. Service best that I've ever experienced. Lovely views, lovely outdoor seatings. Just perfect. A must if you're visiting London

title: Such a pity about the staff
comment: Ate here as a group of 3 on Sunday night and would love to say its absolutely amazing - lift was great, the decor and view all were brilliant and the food was really amazing - the staff on the other hand were so rude and totally let down the whole experience. At first there appears to be a million staff - one to take you to the table, one to put your napkin on your lap, one to take drinks order etc. but then it takes ages to get attention to order food by the time it got to desert it took about half an hour to just get hold of a menu.  The bartender in the bar though was by far the worst and wasnt just slow like in the restaurant he has down right rude and had a bad attitude. It really is a pity for such a great place that the staff treat people like that.

title: Sushi samba? Really?
comment: I went to Sushi Samba with four friends this past weekend. Was lucky enough to get a booking at short notice as it's August, I think. It's quite challenging at other times. I have had some amazing sushi in the US and in Colombia (who would have thought!) and was hoping to get comparable sushi at Sushi Samba. All I can say is that the sushi was a waste of money. I've had better sushi from the corner sushi shop elsewhere, for a fraction of the price. When I think South American / Japanese fusion, I think traditional sushi fused with South American ingredients, but that zing was missing. It was regular sushi. The non-sushi food was good though. The miso grilled seabass was to die for, and so was the yellowtail taquito.  The ceviche was average - I've eaten better in cheaper places in South America. The desserts were huge and looked fancy, but there was nothing extraordinary, or even above average, about them.  The ambiance was good - but certainly not worth paying £15 for a sushi roll just for that ambiance. I would go back for the miso seabass - it was worth it!

title: WOW!!!
comment: Took my wife for our 10th Wedding Anniversary on Saturday, what a great experience.  The great view was complemented by great food but what made the difference was the service. Our waiter for the evening Eddison was fabulous. We took his advice and let him order for us I didn't even see the menu.  His choice of food was sublime and we enjoyed all dishes and the exc Chef Claudio came to see us which was a very nice touch.  And not to forget floor manager Remi who topped of the evening with making sure everything went smoothly. Best surprise of all the price !!!! We thought it would've been more for the 5 courses we enjoyed. Looking forward to returning!!!

title: Nice food & view but expensive, especially the drinks
comment: Went here for a family lunch. Ambiance was pleasant, service a little slow & erratic e.g. they had to be reminded about drink orders and completely forgot one order. Not acceptable at this price point.The food is decent, but you can run up a terrific bill here - we paid £300 for 4 people, without splurging on alcohol. This was partly because the wine is so expensive - around £35 for the cheapest bottle. We also didn't feel particularly full afterwards. I guess a lot of the clientele is on expenses - I have been here a couple of times and wouldn't spend my own money here again.

title: Exspensive but worth IT
comment: Great venue, superb food, excellent service but a bit pricey. Atmosphere is very good and view unbeatable.

title: A WOW view and better than expected meal
comment: That lift that brings you up within seconds to the 38th floor, with a spectacular view on the city...it's already worth the visit! There are a couple of bars on different floors, the main restaurant is in a great open room surrounded by an outdoor terrace. The hundreds of light bulbs in the room create a stardome effect, really well designed.  So, what are the plus?  - Unique view on London. Haven't been yet to the Shard myself, but here you are taller than the majority of London's buildings. At night the view was stunning - food is much better than what we expected. There are a couple of good innovative dishes, as well as more traditional sushi. I had a great churrasco! - service is very good With my friends we have been quite conservative on drinks, and ended up with £50 each. Considering the place and view, absolutely worth it in my eyes.

title: Excellent food and service!
comment: We had a reservation to lunch at Sushi Samba atop the Heron Tower on the 38th Floor. The view wasnt that spectacular as you couldnt really see all the iconic London landmarks. I think it will all look very pretty at night when the lights come on. The food however was simply superbe! The menu is meant for sharing so it's best if you dine here in a group. The waiters are all very helpful and reccomended to us to try a little from each section of the menu. We started with a couple of small plates and ended up with the MOQUECA MISTA from the Large Plates . Simply yummy! We ended our lunch experience with the ORGANIC RED CHOCOLATE CHILI PEPPERS ..too yummy to describe . You have to try it!

title: Amazing views, great service, good.."ish" food
comment: My partner had booked this restaurant 3 months in advance from Australia, after getting a tip from a friend. When we arrived the atmosphere was fantastic. Unbelievable, panoramic views of London, a restaurant and outdoor terrace filled with customers all seemingly having a fantastic time. This seemed like the hip place to be! Amazingly, as we were waiting to be seated we were told that the kitchen was only providing cold food as their gas ovens had failed! I looked around and no one seemed to care!! Then it dawned on me....the food here was not the attraction. It's the vibe, the ambiance.......and this is exactly as it transpired. The wait staff were amazingly attentive, the views were to die for and the Brazilian/Sushi fusion food was, at best, above average Sushi...but nothing special. The cost.......2 people $258 pounds for 5 tasting plates, 2 cocktails, a bottle of wine and 2 deserts. The verdict......go there...it's a must....but just have a drink and a bar snack and eat down the road.

title: We loved it !
comment: We went there because of the venue: the top of Heron Tower, expected amazing views over the Gherkin and the city. And I shall say that the views didn't disappoint at all. Being there you feel you're privileged. If it were only for the views I would already recommend the restaurant. But we also enjoyed a very good dinner with one of the best services I've enjoyed in London. Re the food: We found the Rock Shrimp tempura outstanding, as well as the Seabass with miso. We loved the 2 samba rolls we ordered ("el topo" and another one called "tiger somethingIdontremember"). And the rest of the food we ordered: Seviches, deserts... was as good as expected. And I shall say that the Pisco Sour were great as well.  Summarizing: I'll be back.

title: Glad we went but I wouldn't bother to go again
comment: It took us ages to get a booking and we finally went at 7.30 on a Sunday evening. The reservations staff are very snotty - the first couple of time I phoned to try and book they said 'Do you want 5.30pm or 11.30pm and seemed amazed that for a midweek neither of these times suited! They then offered their sister restaurant The Duck and Waffle but if I'd wanted to go there, I'd have rung them not Sushi Samba. On the day we went, there was a private function in the upstairs bar so very limited seating for before dinner drinks but the views were wonderful. The food is absolutely delicious but the service is dreadful. Half of the stuff we ordered didn't arrive despite us asking several times and they overcharged us for dishes that we did get. As it was my son's birthday, we ordered champagne which wasn't cold enough but the waiters just seemed intent on pouring as much into your glasses as quickly as possible so they could bring another bottle. We had to ask 6 different waiters to please leave in the ice bucket for a bit longer - it was very tiresome. They offered us complimentary desserts to make up for their mistakes but these never arrived and eventually we asked for the bill at 11pm (we had been told very forcefully at 7.30 that we would have to vacate the table by 10.30) and of course it was wrong. Ultimately the overcharge was probably only about £25 and by then we'd given up the will to live so we just paid it and left. You will be impressed by the views, you will be impressed by the food (if you actually get what you order) but you will not be impressed by the service or their attitude.

title: Very good
comment: Great views over London. Cool place, hip crowd mostly. Food pretty good but nothing special (overpriced but then you pay for the location). Well worth a visit but suggest just go there for a drink!

title: Best views best all round experience in eating in London
comment: Having read a lot of reviews before going, we went with mixed feelings and were  amazingly surprised. Yes you have to dress smartly, and it is enforced, so.... We found the waiters extremely attentive, explaining the menu with appropriate suggestions. The food was exceptionally good, drinks were expensive, but you are forewarned. It is the old adage "if you can't stand the heat..... The views are stunning and we cannot wait to return in the near future. P.s. if you don't like the lift, just close your eyes, it's very quick. ROYBAR

title: Exceptional food and atmosphere
comment: I must admit I made my reservation to Sushi Samba London more because friends wanted to go and I half-heartedly agreed as I wasn't impressed by Sushisamba 7 in NYC years ago. We were promptly seated upon arriving. One of us ordered a coke and it was flat. Took a long time for the waiter to replace it for us, and when it finally arrived, they had brought us a diet coke. We got the right coke finally and it came in a glass bottle. So not too sure how the first coke was flat if it's fresh out of the bottle. Ordered some edamame and padron peppers while we waited for the rest of the group to turn up and only the edamame arrived. We had to order the padron peppers again. I wouldn't bother with padron peppers again next time as they arrived borderline cremated. At this point, expectations were quite low. And then, the rock shrimp tempura and the pork belly wrap turned up and WOW, how the table has turned. The rock shrimp tempura was seriously amazing. It's the kinda food you put in my mouth and all you want to do is savour every flavour and texture you have going on with that first bite and nothing else matters. The pork belly wrap was also very tasty but there's almost no graceful way to eat a chunky piece of pork belly with a pair of chopsticks. We also had the wagyu tataki which came with foie gras and fried quail egg - more yum! Everything else which came after was absolutely delightful: 1/2 lobster with spicy ikura vinaigrette, Samba London, Ezo, Neo Tokyo and Sasa rolls. It's been a long while since I had sushi so fresh, melt-in-the-mouth, and tasty.  For dessert, we shared chocolate banana cake, mango mousse and yuzu tart cheesecake amongst us. The chocolate banana cake was a clear winner in terms of taste but the yuzu tart cheesecake was very well presented. With the restaurant filling up by the time we were ready to leave (around 7.30pm), we had a hard time flagging our waiter for the bill. When the bill finally came, we have raked up £223 with gratuity included - not too bad for three happily-stuffed people, couple of cocktails and cokes.  Yes, the view is to die for. But in the end, it was the food that wow-ed us. Absolutely worth every penny and we will most definitely return.

title: Disappointing
comment: The views are great, I can see my office nearby. The initial impression is a nice midern rooftop restaurant . The food was good but over priced, one of the main courses was £47 and was disappointing for that price. The drinks we ordered with the main course came when we'd reached plate 5 and after reminding them 3 times. It took 15 minutes to bring a dessert menu and a further 20 to actually come and take the order. We ended up asking for bill instead of dessert. After such a long wait we just wanted to leave! The waiter realised we were annoyed and apologised. Overall it was a nice restaurant, but as usual in London it was let down by too few service staff who aren't properly trained.

title: My expectations were exceeded!!
comment: Having read the reviews previous to our visit, I went with an open mind. Firstly we were advised to park in White Row multi-story car park. The whole visit costs us only £2!!!! (it was a Sunday). The door Staff were polite & courteous. The elevator to the 38th Floor was very quick & an experience with superb views. We had pre-dinner drinks out on the terrace. There is a beautiful full sized tree in the centre of the bar lit perfectly with warm ambient fairy lights. A fantastic fire pit to keep warm together with live flamed burners scattered thoughtfully. Our Waiter was second to none! His name was Max & he was French. Ask for him to serve you - he was amazing. We trusted him to choose our food for us (he asked about allergies and dislikes). He didn't disappoint. The food was pretty in appearance & had flavours beyond belief.  After dinner we took our drinks outside to take in the panorama of London by night. I am looking forward to visiting SushiSamba in New York - I am addicted!!! If you are reading this, I urge you to go and try it for yourself!!

title: Fabulous views from the 38th floor
comment: The food was imaginative and delicious. The noise level was devastating. Upscale expensive restaurant overlooking the city. Well dressed crowd, fun drinks.

title: Bad Service Bad Food Great View
comment: I have been to sushi samba in LV and Miami and am a huge fan. First time visiting this one an have to say service and food was poor. We got there and the gas was not working we were not informed before offered an apology or the option to come another time the manager was arrogant with no concept of customer service - so no hot food. We thought lets make the best of it and proceeded to order sushi, ceviche and sashimi honestly the same quality can be eaten at k10 (at a fraction of the cost) the sushi rolls were below par even with the neon seaweed did not disguise the poor workmanship and average taste. The only saving grace was the dessert!! If you want to see the view go to the bar do not waste money on the food Nobu, Zuma or Roka are 100000% better.

title: Amazing view - amazing prices
comment: Everyone has talked about the view - which of course comes at a price especially if you have vertigo like I do - the open glass lift is a challenge although it does go direct to the 38th floor so does not take very long at all!! The food is interesting - very creative with use of colour wraps on the sushi - not the best quality sushi in london but the fish is excellent. I agree the waiters are full on - ours was knowledgable at the food and trained to sell more - but a couple of times was not happy with our choices which felt a bit odd. It IS expensive - £132 for two for lunch with no alcohol - we were full but only due to pudding Would go again for the view and cocktails for sure

title: Good but not as expected
comment: Really nice place, but cocktails were not that spectacular. Nothing special.  Wonderful view of London

title: I Didn't Realise Eggplant Could Taste THAT Amazing!
comment: My friend and I recently visited SushiSamba for lunch after a recommendation - plus, owing to the fabulous London summer we wanted somewhere with a view and an outdoor option. It did not disappoint. I'm not usually one for heights but the view was fabulous. The waiters were great and adequately attentive without being off putting. It's always good when trying a place for the first time that the waiters can give you a steer as to the menu without making you feel stupid. They did this perfectly. There was a French waiter who was particularly friendly - a real credit to the restaurant. As the title suggests; the eggplant is simply amazing; the food all round was really enjoyable. A gem in the city.

title: Sexual discrimination
comment: An email I sent to guest relations last weekend (during the very hot weather) and have not had a reply.... I want to complain about the draconian and archaic approach by your door staff in the administration of your dress code policy. I have previously visited with family and witnessed other members of the public being permitted entrance whilst wearing sports clothing. On that occasion we were impressed with the non-pretentious and relaxed feel in the bar. Tonight however, I and 3 friends have been turned away for our attire. The two females in the group were wearing sandals and the bouncer admitted he would allow them entry however my friend and I were not permitted as we had similar footwear. Two of the party are visiting from Australia and were very excited to visit the bar and the views it offers. Unfortunately, they will now return to Australia with a sour taste of London hospitality. Further to this, they also feel your bar has discriminated against them as opened toed footwear is considered the national dress of Australia. I hope this email will help in a small way to create a better, less discrimatory world. Regards, A disgruntled but cool footed customer.

title: Shocked by the service
comment: I have been really excited about introducing Sushi Samba and Duck & Waffle for a very long time now. So I thought I would save it for a special occasion. I called the reservation team to book for my 21st birthday which is in 2 weeks time. The lady I spoke to was so rude I was shocked, she didn't try to converse apart from time and numbers at all and while I was trying to ask her details she was very rude in any reply. While she ended making a booking, I left the call so upset I am seriously now considering cancelling and going elsewhere. It really seems their is an air of we don't need you here so don't care among the staff here.

title: Ok
comment: There is no denying the views here are spectacular, however I thought the food was over priced and the service was not exceptional. Our waiter was arrogant instead of helpful, and for the price we paid for our meal this is not acceptable! The food was very nice, but too expensive for what it was. I'm glad I've been here once, but I wouldn't return again.

title: Arrogance beyond compare
comment: Went to Sushi Samba on a Weds night with some friends and family to celebrate some good news. Greeted at the Heron Tower entrance by bouncers who told one of us that they were not dressed up enough at the same time as letting someone else in with an almost identical outfit. Not a great start and my friend was forced to go home, get changed and come back. After being ignored for several minutes, we were (not) greeted by the most arrogant barman I have ever encountered. I honestly thought he was looking to start a fight, the way he was carrying on. When asking about which champagnes were available and what the prices were, he proceeded to mock us with comments such as "oh, if this one is too expensive we serve shampoo". Terrible jokes aside, we bought an extremely overpriced bottle and were ushered into the cordoned off area, on the roof terrace. I should point out that a few of the other bar staff were excellent and very well mannered - such a shame they are let down by their idiot co-worker. As we were leaving we felt condescended enough to quietly complain to the bar manager who really could not have cared less about what we were saying. I can honestly say I have NEVER experienced such awful and rude service and will certainly make a point of steering people away from this place. Having spoken to friends about this, it seems that we are just one of many to have had the same terrible experience. I'm a very proud Londoner, but it embarrasses me that we have 'upmarket' bars like this.

title: Total rubbish
comment: If you want a night out at a cool bar with a good vibe keep well clear. You have to buy your way into the terrace which has rubbish views although inside they are good, however staff are harassing you continuously and rude with so many bars in town you would bea mug to go...

title: Amazing view of london
comment: The most beautiful thing that I appreciate in this place was the great view of London, I recommend you to go in this restaurant during the night because the light of the skyscraper and the moon give a special atmosphere to your night, moreover the food was excellent and you'll find a mix of peruvian brazilian and japanese cousine. Very good! Then a polite waiter help us to choose the best food in the menu and he explained us the plates

title: Cannot believe the other reviews - best restaurant experience I've ever had
comment: I'm lucky to have eaten in many amazing places, but today on a random whim we went to sushi samba I nearly died and went to heaven.  We couldn't get a reservation but the nice lady at the bottom of heron tower told us we could sit at the sushi bar as it is first come first serve. You don't get the view benefits here but you can wander around and take photos! The lift is good fun - watch your full tummy drop on the way down!!!  Our waiter was great and when he didn't know how something was made, one of the chefs came out and explained to us the ingredient and how it was cooked. I even got sent a little extra on a plate free of charge.  We marvelled at the stunning food as it came out in different settings. This was nice because we couldn't eat erythng at once. It was fun to see what would come out next! Some may not like this, but it is all so fresh it literally comes out once its ready.  Recommend the foie gras with quail egg - the meat with this is almost tartar but literally MELTS in the mouth. Also recommend the small plates rock shrimp. I nearly cried it was so good. How dramatic!  After a lot of food and two gins it came to 117.48 with service charge. This is a lot but the experience, quality and atmosphere literally meant I couldn't care less how much it was.  I will be saving the pennies and going again!! Best anniversary lunch ever.

title: Great Drink, Odd Door Staff, Fab Bar staff and Amazing Views!
comment: OK slightly mixed emotions about this place!! First of all we didn't eat here, it was just for a social Sunday afternoon drink, you don't need reservations for drinks in the bar only to eat in the restaurant. We arrived and there was a slight queue at the door, with people being turned away (reservationless) for the restaurant but also for the bar. The petite lady on the door was adamant no one was getting through. So with knowledge from the lady that the bar was full my friend and I hung around for 10 minutes to see if enough people left. Low and behold lifts of about a dozen people left, so I attempted to see if we could now go up. After a phone call to upstairs (and for some reason being told it was 2 females may have helped) we were allowed up.  The lift was amazing, flying up the side of a building in a glass cube to 40 stories had me shaking once we reached the top! We walked into the bar and it was empty?!  Anyway we took pictures of the view, sat down, perused the cocktail menu and didn't recognise a single ingredient haha, so chose a recommendation from the barman. A lagerita, a nice bottle brahma lager with added tequila and lime - yum!  It felt really chilled out up there, in the middle of the bar was a large golden tree with fairy lights, in the corner was a fire pit surrounded by sofas, the music was funky and when it started raining they handed you a brolly. The indoor bar had amazing views too. I would go back, ignore the door staff and enjoy myself in the bar.

title: Great place for cocktail
comment: Didn't eat here but a friend took me for a drink after work. The most amazing views of London great service and just seemed like a great place to treat yourself to a cocktail near Liverpool street station. Was expensive but then I am not use to London prices. Would go back and try the food one day.

title: Great views, service and food
comment: First off it is visually stunning. Beautiful architecture, roof terraces, lots of glass, oh yes and the views! Now that's all fine and great, but if the food and service is boll*cks then what is the point? Well let me tell you they are both 10s across the board. God did we have fun with the bartender, our waiter, and head of house. He is on top of everything, and simply a nice guy. Usually places as trendy as this have staff with attitude. The attitude here-what can we do to make you happy. Really, I mean it. My 2 friends and I had a wonderful time. The food? Great! Delicious, interesting. Get the pork belly. I will be again tomorrow. Ok, it's expensive, but it's the price of being on top of the City and the whole experience.

title: Doorman better suited to wetherspoons
comment: I dine here very frequently but I just can't get over how poorly people are treated on arriving downstairs at the front entrance, one gentleman an Italian looking chap is terrible at his job. He's obnoxious, arrogant, rude to say the least. It's as if his goal is to agitate people before entering the venue... Which, customer service aside, is terrible door supervising. Sushisamba take note- this man is seriously damaging your reputation and certainly hurting your repeat business.

title: Totally the best meal of my life in the best surroundings !!!!
comment: If you want to wine and dine in the sky this is the place to go !!! With the best view in London this is the place to eat The wagyu beef melts in the mouth, and the sea bass is to die for !!! Listen to the recommendations the staff know what they are saying listen to Edwin !!! He knows his food !!!

title: The stunning views come at a price!
comment: Having heard so much about it, and booked months in advance, I was excited to finally go to Sushi Samba with my husband and two friends. It certainly was an “experience”. The views were stunning, having booked for 7 – 9pm we saw London in day light as well as at sunset and it was pretty impressive. The food was good but no more exceptional than at Zuma or even Tsunami. The wine was ridiculously expensive – the cheapest bottles start at £45 and there are only a few. Service was friendly and I was disappointed only when they insisted we vacate the table at 9 (which was in accordance with our booking and which we knew in advance, but nevertheless meant we could not have pudding or coffee and having spent a small fortune on food and wine, this was a real let down) despite many tables being empty. The noise in the bar was unbearable so staying any longer was not option. I am glad I went, but I do not think I’d go back seeing it was so expensive and the views were really the only thing that made this place stand out from its competition.

title: Food with a view
comment: To get a reservation at peak time will take you months. However, we reserved a table for 4pm for a birthday, and the place was still half full. We started by having some cocktails at the bar and a walk on the terrace, which were really good. The service was extremely attentive, and only started to slip slightly as we reached 7pm and the restaurant started to fill up.  The food was a close challenge to London's Nobu. Although in comparison, Sushi Samba is over priced, however, you are not only paying for the food, but also for the great view.  Sushi Samaba offers a much more modern take on japanese food, with lots of flavour and twists on the traditional dishes. We had a wide range of dishes, from across the menu, all of a high standard. The London roll was one of the stand out dishes, as well as the yellow tail tiradito.  The waiters where all extremely friendly and pleasant, and made our meal much more enjoyable. For me this is a strong contestant for London's Nobu, but doesn't quite compare fully. However, on a summers evening in London, it is a must, and I would definitely return for a special occasion.

title: Don't upset the waiters!...
comment: It might sound odd to say the elevator impresses, but boy is it smooth and fast...you can look away and it'll be over in a whisk if heights scare you. The views from the restaurant are impressive from a height point of view, but it is just a wide reaching sprawl of urban clutter with some other tall buildings getting in the way. I liked the layout and general minimal design, it suited the smart city building with many visitors being well paid city workers. That can give an air of pretentiousness at times but if you wanted down to earth you wouldn't be seeking out 38th floor restaurants in the city! The food was very good and interesting, everything had great flavour combinations and cooking skill. What spoilt the whole thing (and other reviewers have said this) was the arrogance / attitude of some of the waiters.  Without going into details they made us feel like we were lucky to be there and did well to listen to their superior advice...order something outside of their recommendations (based on making you spend more than you might have planned) and they actually used clear body language that said "your mistake then..." e.g. beer instead of sake or not balancing all 3 nationality influences in your menu choice.  If someone else was paying and you were happy for them them to order for you then I'm sure you'd not pick up on the arrogance and be giving 4 or 5 stars....but the price per person would be astronomical!...well beyond justification to anyone with a sane business head.

title: Good Bar, Great Views, could be better (particularly service)
comment: We visited here for the same reason everyone does – fantastic open air views 40 floors above London – and it is pretty special. The roof terrace was small, and was closed for a private party – which we not told about at the entrance on the ground floor when arriving despite saying that’s what we were here for. However, there are three floors, with the whole wall of glass providing great light (especially sunset) and amazing views.  We had 4 cocktails each (8 in total all different) – none of them particularly impressive, which was disappointing when paying £13 a cocktail, I know I am paying for the novelty and experience but even so I would expect better quality. We also found a lack energy and enthusiasm for the bar staff, they were slow and often milling around despite queues at the bar. Not a great encouragement to hand over another £26 for two drinks. I enjoy paying for quality experiences, and this place has the potential to be an amazing place.  We were due to have food here too, however, following the poor service and quality drinks, I wasn’t willing part with £130 + for two meals if the service and quality was to be the same. I would recommend for the views, and it is a cocktail bar looking over London, which is always going to be great. However once the novelty wore off we left and went to a better quality place up the road, which was fantastic. I really really wanted to love this place, hence my slight disappointed. I couldn’t rate a disappointing because overall it’s a nice bar – but it is made by the location, views, and layout. I did have a really good evening for reasons above and the company and therefore you forget about the little things - but It could be so much more with quality products and service.  I would like to go back in the future hopefully this place will get 5 stars. I would still recommend though – particularly on a sunny day – it is a different experience and one to remember.

title: Great views
comment: Went for my granddaughter's 21st birthday. Very expensive and poor service, but worth it for the experience.

title: Sack the unhelpful staff
comment: I suggested taking a work colleague there for their leaving drinks, apart from over priced drinks served by staff who really couldn't be bothered. We had the great treat of the knicker less waitress who buys her legg

title: Sushi with a twist!
comment: Thought we'd try Sushi Samba on a whim as we walked past. After a swift elevator ride to floor 38, the views of London were amazing. The atmosphere was vibrant and the service was excellent with our waiter walking us through the menu and recommendations. The pork belly roll and Samba London Sushi platter were to die for! Great find. We will be back!

title: Nice views from the elevator – that’s it
comment: Avoid this place. The food is good, but so it is in many London restaurants. You go to Sushi Samba with an expectation to eat while enjoying breathtaking views from the 38th floor, with London at your feet. After all this unique position offered by this place is the reason why you put up with premium prices they charge, right? Only that you don’t get any views. Let’s get it straight – the only view you are ever to get from your trip to Sushi Samba is during your 15 seconds journey in the glass elevator. Then you might catch a glimpse of the Gurkin from one of the bars, from behind the backs of other punters crowded under the stairs (this place was designed by a moron) and that’s it. The terrace bar has a view of an extended roof below and the sky above - enjoy. The glass-clad walls of the restaurant have a side view to this extended roof on one side and to another terrace (for private parties) on the other. The only place where you could catch a panoramic sight of London (to its east, less attractive side anyway) is the front window. There are three tables at this window; however they are closely guarded by the restaurant’s numerous staff, whose only job seems to be protecting theses precious assets from unworthy crowd. Even if you book a table explicitly asking for one with a view, you won’t get it (perhaps unless you have an OBE or are at least £0.5 billion net worth). This bizarre policy is nonsense, especially as in our case, all three tables remained unoccupied throughout our entire stay at Sushi Samba. So, save yourself disappointment (and some cash) and book yourself into one of London’s many restaurant, which do not pretend to offer any extras, keep their prices reasonable and do not fail to deliver what they promise.

title: Amazing view, average food
comment: We finally got a booking here after a few months of trying. We were greeted by a stern looking lady with a clipboard and a red rope. We explained we had a booking and she made us wander in a loop around the red rope (even though we were the only people there). When we eventually got upstairs we said hello etc and were told our table needed to be vacated by X time. Not a great start. We ordered some cocktails which were nice and had a mix of food. The sushi and general menu of food was nice but certainly not worth all the fuss and pomposity that people generate around this place. It's nice for tourists coming into London but not a wonderful Asian culinary experience unfortunately.

title: Amazing views, good restaurant but bad service at the bar
comment: Booked a table for dinner. We arrived early and decided to have some drinks at the bar while we waited. There was only one person serving in the terrace bar. It was extremely busy and he looked overwhelmed. When we asked about having drinks he was rude and unhelpful. We decided to go straight to the table. The host asked us to wait for a few minutes for a better table and he didn't disappoint us. We got an amazing table outside in the terrace with spectacular views of London. Our waiter was extremely helpful and he recommended us some incredible dishes - hint: try the yellowtail taquitos, delicious!. So overall, the bar service was disappointing but the food and the service in the restaurant area were the best. Will definitely go back but avoid the bar at all costs.

title: Absolutely Amazing Food
comment: Myself and 3 other colleagues came here for a special lunch after hitting great figures within the company.  I must say the food in this place is truly amazing, I couldn't fault it one bit. I am a true food lover and have been to many restaurants all over the world and I put this as one of my favourites.  I do think it is way overpriced, our bill came to almost £700!!  I thought the staff were good, I didn't feel the décor of the place was that great but the food was.  We sat outside and the table is quite low, which means you are leaning over a bit to eat, this didn't sit well with my tummy. We let the waiter recommend some dishes and they included chargrilled chicken, little lamb cutlets in amazing sauce, little tacos filled with gorgeous stuff. Also had big chunks of fish on skewers.  I would be very cautious if I was paying the bill!! Would I go back hell yeah!!

title: Worst front door staff ever
comment: Went to enjoy some cocktails at Sushisamba prior to a dinner reservation on the weekend and was greeted by the rudest door staff ever. With an extremely judgmental look up and down we were told that there was a dress code and no flip flops were permitted. We then watched multiple guests leave wearing crocs, and flip flops, shorts and t-shirts. Pointing this out to the security was answered with 'If they have a reservation we make exceptions' Even though our party had a reservation for dinner apparently the same exceptions of the 'dress code' was not extended to us.  The manner and tone of these 'doorman' was unbelievable. Then he proceeded to say that we were rude and that this was the reason we were not allowed in today, calming one of our party swore at him. This was a blatant lie but it probably took all of his intelligence to conjure up.  Restaurants with a view will always be busy but the pretentious attitude of the staff will ensure I and anyone who asks for a recommendation will never return.

title: Disappointing
comment: We had been saving for a while to enjoy a trip down to London and dine again at Sushi Samba London, as I had dined there before and promised to take my wife. We're sad to say that we were left feeling very disappointed - the food preparation appeared rushed, the service was inattentive and the attention to detail was lacking. Whilst it should be noted that my first visit in February was much better, I found it rather disappointing that in the four months between visits cutbacks had been made: the food quality was poorer and even their selection of the local English Tufa mineral water had been exchanged for a standard high street water! The duck breast was slightly dry and overcooked - and my complaint to staff was met with a shrug. Disappointing. I will visit another sushi establishment in future.

title: Pretentious? Moi?
comment: It was tackier than the photos on the net suggested. We were early so had to wait in the bar area and found it difficult to get service. When communication between desk and dining room was by microphone but was so inefficient that the girl on the desk had to come through and talk to the manager in person there was a severe outbreak of sniggering. The views and our waitress were amazing, food was good except for the scallops which were unforgiveably chewy, and the wine was reprehensively expensive. But it was an experience.

title: Great view and food to match!
comment: We visited this restaurant in the Heron Tower for lunch with a group of teenagers for a special occasion. The views were amazing and the food was excellent although pricey. It is possible to visit the (open air) bar area without going to the restaurant which is worth a trip in itself. The restaurant has inside and outside seating and a very good vibe. The service was a little haphazard (some orders were forgotten etc) but all in all it is a restaurant to which we will return. They say that you don't get good food and a good view; I disagree but it comes at a price!

title: INCREDIBLE!
comment: We had a fabulous Sunday lunch at Sushi Samba; the 360degree views of London are quite simply breathtaking, especially on a perfect summer’s afternoon! Started our lunch with a drink out on the large terrace, when we went back indoors there was no problem with requesting a window table, in fact all the tables have wonderful views. The service was perfect and the staff extremely polite. The food is incredible and the choice made it difficult to decide, thankfully our patient and knowledgeable waiter helped us! Loved the innovative combination of Peruvian, Japanese and Brazilian dishes, we could have tried everything on the menu. The restaurant interior is chic and airy; the lift going up and down is an experience! Sushi Samba is now most definitely our favourite restaurant!

title: The view always gets me!
comment: Been here serveral times whilst working in the city, and everytime I go the view impresses me. Equally the outside area with the fun 'light-tree' provides a good experience too. My first time having Sushi here (a year ago or so) was my first experience of Sushi anywhere, and I feel a bit spoilt to have lost my Sushi-Virginity here! Very finely prepared and served with excellent knowledge from the waiters - who spotted myself as an amature a mile off and pointed me in the right dirrection. The price at times seems a little over the top, but not unexpected given the quality of the food, the incredible views, but probably more important the location in the city. Would definetly reccommend to anyone, I usually resort to returning here when thinking of taking someone somewhere to impress!

title: Don't bother
comment: The title of this post says it all. Six of us (all men) wanted to go up for a drink. We were all business colleagues and had just been for dinner and wanted a post dinner drink.  On arrival we were asked "how many" as soon as we said six and were all men we were told that we couldn't come I as we had "had a drink". We then stated we had only been for dinner and were not drunk. At this point the (less than nice) doorman and women stated the owner has told them "anyone not stone cold sober couldn't come in".  At this stage I asked if they would let me in if I had a reservation and had had a single drink. They said "if you had had a drink we would still turn you away even if you had booked".  This is a return to the bad old days of over zealous bouncers not wanting to let 6 men in.  Incredible. Avoid avoid avoid.

title: Outstanding.
comment: A fantastic destination restaurant that offers the best views over London, and some of the best food. We booked very last minute but managed to get a brilliant table. The staff were so friendly and couldn't have done more to help. After our meals we went onto the outdoor terrace and spent time taking in the breath-taking views. It was a wonderful experience which I cannot recommend enough. Yes the prices are a little high, but its not a restaurant you will eat in everyday of the week.

title: Arrogant and overpriced...
comment: I'd heard a lot about Sushi Samba before visiting for the first time, and to say it didn't live up to expectations is an understatement.  I arrived and was greeted by an arrogant and rude door woman whose first words to me were "for future reference this is an elegant and upmarket bar". (To set the scene - I was practically wearing my Sunday best - a long skirt, black silk top and flat leather sandals). I asked her if I was deemed 'not elegant enough', to which she replied that I was 'a bit scruffy'. Seemed a bit rich when she was wearing a poncho and the two people she had let in in-front of me were wearing scruffy trainers, jeans and t-shirts.  With my ego just about intact I continued up to the bar where I spent my time sipping on overpriced champagne, balancing on a wobbly stool, and cursing that I hadn't chosen my 'elegant' trainers and jeans like everyone else around me. Granted the view is good, but we weren't allowed to properly enjoy it due to a 'private function', so the best view I got was when I visited the toilet. This place is in an amazing position and I may have just had a bad experience, but if you're thinking about going here be warned that as well as your wallet taking a bashing your ego may well do to.  For the money and hassle, there are plenty of better alternatives.

title: Best sushi I've had in London!!
comment: When we arrived at Sushi Samba last Friday (after a slightly hair-raising but exciting journey up 38floors in a glass lift) we were instantly impressed by the cool decor and amazing views of London. We found 2 stools by the window overlooking the gherkin and sipped a few of the yummy cocktails whilst waiting for our table. (We turned up early for this reason!) When we were shown to the table our waiter instantly welcomed us and provided us with a brief overview of the menu and suggested that 4 dishes between 2 would be enough and it was! We had 2 selections of sushi rolls, foie gras with quails egg and kobi beef and japanese style fillet steak - delicious!! After dinner I would definately recommend a couple of after dinner drinks on the outside terrace - again, amazing views and very cool atmosphere. Even though this restaurant is in the heart of the city, we didn't feel underdressed in smart/casual attire (we were off to the o2 for a concert afterwards) although there are a lot of city types in the bar, but that's the city for you! We will definately be back - I'm already looking for a date in the diary!

title: Delicious cocktails with a view
comment: The Inca Swizzle cocktail is my new favourite, amazing taste. Pricey here as expected but service was good and friendly and the views are great. Went on a Thursday evening just for a couple of drinks with friends and loved it. Will try the food next time but what we saw coming from the kitchen looked good.

title: Sushi in the sky..
comment: Interesting Jap and South American combo menu is surprisingly good but its the view that takes you away. So all senses are satisfied. Best time to go is sunset and at the right time on a clear day, sipping your cocktails in their outdoor bar is special. Is it the best sushi I have ever tasted ? No. But then again, it is not often you get to do that with an amazing view of London.

title: Great experience and stunning views
comment: I booked the beginning of May for Saturday 29th June and could only get a reservation for 10pm but that was fine for us. We made our way to the restaurant about 9:30pm to have a drink before and that alone was amazing. The views were unreal and the lit up golden tree on the roof terrace is beautiful! I did really fancy a cocktail out here but was told "no cocktails" when I asked for one, a little disappointing (and blunt) but made our way inside to the other bar to get one where you can see the views of the Gherkin, and were greeted by a much friendlier barman who really took time and care to make delicious cocktails all with a smile!  We were shown to our table about 10:10pm so only had to wait an extra 10 minutes and it was very, very busy so I was expecting that. When I made the booking online through Top Table I stated that we were celebrating my Boyfriend's birthday but wasn't expecting anything special as I hadn't followed this up and thought that the message wouldn't have been received anywhere, but was so delighted to hear the waitress say 'Happy Birthday' to my boyfriend as we sat down - a nice touch!  The waiter was really helpful and helped us with the menu to which we ordered 7 plates and he did rope us into trying a very small glass of sake that set us back £14 each I believe!! But we wanted to make the most of the experience and celebration and could have easily said no. The food was delicious - anyone a bit apprehensive about sushi should just try it, it's not the same as what you would buy in supermarkets at all and there were so many flavours and textures to try, I really want to go back! To top it all off - the stunning views, atmosphere, great food - the waitress brought out a birthday dessert for my Boyfriend with a candle which was lovely and made the night really special. After the meal we went out onto another roof terrace next to the restaurant where you get even more great views, it feels like you're standing on top of the gherkin!  The food prices were reasonable it was just the drink prices that set us back but what else can you expect from London. I would definitely recommend.

title: Stunning views
comment: Great place to have a few drinks, stunning views of London from the bar on the 39th floor! great cocktails too and not terribly pricey! Go early as the queues get pretty bad in the evening by all accounts.

title: Didn't live up to the hype
comment: Just went for a drink at Sushi Samba on a Thursday evening so can't comment on the food but wasn't hugely impressed and can't see myself returning. The bar was ridiculously crowded and chaotic and the welcome from the hosts was pretty cold. The view from the terrace is OK, but you're almost too high to see anything interesting and it faces the wrong way for the sunset - kind of like looking out of a plane window. It was about £12 for 2 soft drinks which seems pretty outrageous to me, even for London. I'd say the best part of the whole experience was the fast lift, other than that, I'm sorry to say I wouldn't bother again.

title: FANTASTIC
comment: What is there not to like from the exciting ride to the 38 floor to the excellent staff ,We went en famille and could not have been better looked after the views are totally wonderful and the food was totally divine, the menu was explained to us by a super young man full of enthusiasm and it would have been so much better if any of us could have understood a word he said as he went into full explanation of each dish.But it did not matter at all as we ordered and were not dissapoined at all. We tried something off most of the different sections and there was not one single thing that did not delight us. Even if you are full you must try the desserts again amazing the presentation of the cheesecake is just fantastic and the little ice creams in the different flavours are mind blowing mmm mmm . Still brings a huge smile to my face we had champagne ,cocktails and wine and in comparison to other places in London l think it is good value for money .THey are so busy so book as soon as you can but it is worth the wait the only time l could get was 4.45pm on a Saturday which was not a normal time for me to eat my Saturday dinner l still went ahead and the time became irrelevant as it was so good. Daylight the views are even better.

title: Amazing food, cocktails & views!
comment: We were a group of 5 girls all of whom had a number of dietary requirements – many of us only ate seafood, no meat – but for me in particular, in addition to being pescetarian, I also have a list of other severe allergies to food groups such as citrus (yes citrus!) & all dairy ingredients.  We’d had a few amazing cocktails in the bar prior to coming to dinner, so when it came time to ordering, not only did our waiter – Vincent – need to deal with us all throwing questions & ordering with him whilst talking over the top of one another (as girls so often do after a couple of drinks!), but also needed to take into account the many dietary requirements at our table. Vincent was amazing the whole night! So incredibly calm & collected, professional, knowledgeable & highly experienced – I felt so comfortable that he knew what to recommend to me & I wasn’t going to eat something I couldn’t. I cannot say the same for many other places I’ve visited who claim to be of a similar standard to Sushi Samba. His service & that of any of the other staff we dealt with that night was exceptional - both in the restaurant & the bar. It wasn’t just the service which was fabulous – the quality of the dishes we ordered & the variety of the menu was second to none. We were just so impressed & our expectations were surpassed.  Yes as many of the other reviews indicate, it's not a cheap night out!! - but unlike some restaurants who have similar prices to Sushi Samba, these guys are able to back it up with excellent service & food quality as well as that incredible view, so we didn't leave feeling ripped off. Without a doubt, I’ll be coming back & this time will bring my fiancé who is French & in hospitality, so has super high expectations, I have already raved to him that Sushi Samba is absolutely worth it & a fantastic experience I look forward to returning to.

title: Great view, great staff, great sushi
comment: My partner and I took my mum, who was visiting from NZ, to Sushisamba for lunch at the end of June. It was a sunny day and we got there just as it opened at 11.30, though we were booked for after 12. It was a great time to visit - the staff welcomed us in with big smiles and we got to explore the terrace (and take lots of touristy photos!) virtually on our own. We also were able to request a great table at the front of the restaurant next to the window.  The service and sushi were both excellent, with a bill of around £80 for a light lunch and a drink for three (incl service). Definitely recommend, a bit of a treat and a great place to take visitors!

title: Nice views from the elevator - that's it
comment: Avoid this place. The food is good, but so it is in many London restaurants. You go to Sushi Samba with an expectation to eat while enjoying breathtaking views from the 38th floor, with London at your feet. After all this unique position offered by this place is the reason why you put up with premium prices they charge, right? Only that you don’t get any views. Let’s get it straight – the only view you are ever to get from your trip to Sushi Samba is during your 15 seconds journey in the glass elevator. Then you might catch a glimpse of the Gurkin from one of the bars, from behind the backs of other punters crowded under the stairs (this place was designed by a moron) and that’s it. The terrace bar has a view of an extended roof below and the sky above - enjoy. The glass-clad walls of the restaurant have a side view to this extended roof on one side and to another terrace (for private parties) on the other. The only place where you could catch a panoramic sight of London (to its east, less attractive side anyway) is the front window. There are three tables at this window; however they are closely guarded by the restaurant’s numerous staff, whose only job seems to be protecting theses precious assets from unworthy crowd. Even if you book a table explicitly asking for one with a view, you won’t get it (perhaps unless you have an OBE or are at least £0.5 billion net worth). This bizarre policy is nonsense, especially as in our case, all three tables remained unoccupied throughout our entire stay at Sushi Samba. So, save yourself disappointment (and some cash) and book yourself into one of London’s many restaurant, which do not pretend to offer any extras, keep their prices reasonable and do not fail to deliver what they promise.

title: Away with the stars
comment: fabb loody tastic. Just great up on the 2o something floor of the Heron tower over looking the gherkin. Great sushi with a spirited twist

title: Pricey, but great experience
comment: Food was delicious, the atmosphere was great and the service friendly. Our waiter even pointed out when he thought that we were over-ordering. View is unmissable.

title: You need a head for heights!
comment: This restaurant has one of the best views in London, in fact I would say there are only a couple that are higher. Food is excellent, so is the wine selection and the service.  Prices are on the salty side but then you are high above the capital, and the only thing you have to provide to provide a perfect experience is good company. I wasn't sure if I would enjoy the glass lift ride to the 39th floor where you alight for the restaurant, but you are so absorbed in the surrounding view of the city you forget it for a moment and enjoy the ride. Worth a visit with a loved one or even a business client.

title: Cecilia
comment: Great food and fantastic view over London. The kitchen is interesting with a taste mix from different countries. But, it is mostly a sushi restaurant in my opinion. If the weather is nice there is a fantastic roof top terrace, but quite windy.

title: Great food and good service
comment: Saturday night might be dead in the city, but it was just right for this place. Food was excellent. We had one coeliac in our group and unlike other main trendy Japanese fusion restaurants this one managed to get a limited but none the less great selection together for our coeliac! For the rest of us, we went whole hog for tasting of as many options as we could and when combined with the drinks and views, the overall experience did not disappoint. The tastes are not as exotic as you may hope for or expect, but the selections are solidly enjoyable.  Wine list entry level is expensive, but they complement that with savings by offering tap water. Views from the restaurant are towards the olympic stadium and the tables by the windows are really great. I loved the design and decorations as well. Outside seating area was brilliant with a view of the Gherkin; meanwhile from the bar are the great tourist views.

title: Amazing views and great atmosphere
comment: Had a great afternoon with some old friends at this restaurant. The food we had was excellent. We had the set menu and there was plenty of food (even for 12 hungry men). The food seemed to just keep coming at a nice relaxed pace and we spent a good 3 or 4 hours at our table. The service was really good too.  The views were just incredible and the atmosphere in the restaurant was also really good. It's not cheap but you understand why once you get up there. I'm scared of heights so the lift up to the 38th floor (which is the first stop as it's dedicated to the restaurant) was frankly terrifying! But, it's a great ride for anyone who doesn't mind heights! Not cheap but highly recommended.

title: Good dining 40 floors up !
comment: Had a really pleasant meal here recently.The evening started on a downer as couldnt get served at one of the 3 available bars . Too many people too little staff ! However once we were seated and drinks came the night improved. Service considering this place is rammed all the time was excellent .. the food was also very tasty and varied. The sushi was fresh and a bit different from the norm.. Special mention must go to the lamb chops though ! Add the view and its worth the hassle .. Not cheap but as a one off a must .. Would i go back ? Probably not.. Better and cheaper on the ground ..

title: Really Nice Restaurant Interesting Menu
comment: This is an interesting and fun restaurant. Ok, the service is not brilliant. You cannot order a drink in the bar in the foyer and charge it to your table in the restaurant. The waiters do have a little attitude but overall the food is so good and the menu so interesting that it makes up for it. Everything we tried was great and we tried everything from the fillet steak to the London roll. It is a truley magnificantly put together menu. The staff especially at the front desk need work. They are slow, a little hesitant, give you the impression of being scared to death of something but the restaurant itself is bright and cheerful. Give it a go !

title: Very good but expensive ....
comment: Amazing experience that starts from the moment you enter the building on the ground floor being met by the concierge who directs you to the lift.  The lift journey is very fast with an amazing view as you rise above the London skyline. The bar area is vibe win amazing cocktails.  The restaurant is quite trendy. Had a selection of sushi with accompanying sake. Then a selection of lobster and beef. Amazing service with spectacular views. Rather pricey though ... £250 for two ...

title: Service
comment: My daughter booked this restaurant on the first day bookings were open for the date we wanted. She requested a table on the RHS of the restaurant that adjoins the private balcony but was told this could not be guaranteed. (Weird since it was the first day of Bookings for that date). Our reservation was for 7.30pm. Due to problems with the Underground we didn't arrive until 7.45pm and were told our table wasn't ready. We weren't impressed because we had been told there is a strict 2 hour table policy. We ordered a drink at the bar which was packed. At 8pm we were told our table was ready but when we went to go through the receptionist said they were trying to get us a better table. When we were seated it was not any of the tables my daughter had requested.The waiter introduced himself and then disappeared from the face of the earth. Finally we ordered a bottle of wine and some courses. They all arrived together. Not what you would expect at a $$$ Japanese. These are usually stagnated over the evening. We had finished eating within half an hour. Pretty disappointing. The food was delicious!! We ordered another bottle of wine and were reminded that we had the table until 9.30pm. We said we were staying until 10pm since we didn't get the table until 8pm. The service was appalling. Such a shame because the food and the fit out are amazing. This is one place where I hated paying the service charge because there was no service!

title: Fabulous
comment: I really enjoyed everything about this place... The service was fantastic .. Friendly staff, amazing views and perfect food.. Snow crab to die for not to mention the pork... Really nicely presented and to top off our fabulous meal we were able to sit on the terrace outside with some of the best views of london I have ever seen. This is one place I will be visiting again SOON !!!

title: Superb
comment: Food was awesome and very different. Loved the venue, loved the menu and the sharing plates. Our table wasn't great but in all seriousness we never noticed. I had no complaints. Yes it was loud and busy but that's part of the atmosphere.

title: Amazing views
comment: Incredible views and the lift to the 39th floor is just amazing and worth doing. The venue is impressive and has a lovely terrace. It is expensive, we had two drinks and they add on a small service charge but it is worth it for the views and atmosphere. We didn't eat there.

title: Good Dining but woof ... you pay for the view....
comment: We had a booking in the afternoon and it turned out to be still be very busy; lively place and very attentive service by the team who is almost made of Italians. The food was really fresh and good but I think the main attraction here is the fast lift journey and the amazing views of the London skyline. I think is this restaurant was on the ground floor could not stand a chance of surviving on those prices. Don't be fool by the seemingly not to expensive menu: just wait for the final bill to arrive. 2 Mojito's, 1 water and 2 mixed sushi dishes = £ 210.

title: Very very good and very very expensive
comment: Christmas break lunch and we head up to Sushi Samba, fresh off the red eye from Washington DC. We decide to allow the waiter to select what he thinks is best. something like 8 courses later we stagger out. Beautiful food, lovely location, very high quality. very expensive. But that was our own fault - it need not have run to over 200 bucks per person if we had had any control. I blame the jet lag. Still a very good meal - high altitude dining at its best.

title: Enjoy the view, certainly not the service.
comment: I took my wife to Sushisamba primarily for the wow factor and somewhere unique. The meet and greet was good, however the waiter was arrogant and had poor English. When we wanted an explanation of the menue, hopefully to enhance this special dining experience to be honest he appeared bored and rattled through the menu. We asked for recommendations and to be honest wish we hadn't. A nice touch was the restaurant had remembered from my booking that it was my wife's birthday, and a complimentary desert with "happy birthday" was presented. Would we go again no, would we recommend it, not unless they guarantee the staff have had extensive training in customer service. Good service is expected and not a privalidge, excellent service is as memorable as poor service. If you add a service charge ensure you deliver. A great shame.

title: Magnificent view, great food and drinks
comment: Situated on the 38 and 39th floor of the Herron Tower, the restaurant has a magnificent view over London. The food, drinks and service was excellent.

title: Wow!!!
comment: Brilliant on all levels! Wow factor of amazing views but delighted that the food and service was spot on too! Surprised by some of the other reviews but perhaps if you only 'pop in' for a drink the experience is different..... We were celebrating our son's engagement on Father's Day early evening so the restaurant was busy from the end of the lunchtime service and filled up again as the evening went on. However, this only added to the exciting buzz and razzamatazz atmosphere. Right from arrival the service was terrific. The doorman explained the lift, floor number, reception handed us over to the sitter who took us to a booth-type table with panoramic views and introduced our waiter who was brilliant. Just the right amount of lively humour and attentiveness, recommending dishes, drinks etc. The food was wonderful and we took his advice and sampled a range of deliciously fresh and interesting sharing plates including sushi, taquitos, grilled meats, lobster, samba rolls and hot stone beef - all devine! Puds were equally delightful and the 'Congratulations' peach plate at the end was a great finish! A stunningly visual restaurant experience with excellent feel-good factor in design and concept. It appears it attracts people going for drinks just to experience the views but we feel it is primarily a restaurant NOT a tourist attraction and as such we would definitely return and recommend but as with all restaurants in the city - pre-book!

title: Amazing views, good food
comment: The view from the 38th floor of the Heron Tower is amazing. The expierence starts with the trip up in the elevator. The food is really good and cracking views. An interesting mix of both Japanese and Brazilian. Sushi is good and their grilled meats were near perfect. We had a cocktail downstairs whilst admiring the clear views and how much green space London actually has to offer! They had closed off the outside seating area due to winds which was a shame. It was a sunny evening and as mad as this sounds, they need some well placed blinds for those evenings as lots of the guests seemed to be squinting.  The service was professional and they took time to explain each individual dish which was appreciated. It is expensive but the views and good food more than make up for it.

title: Great food, fabulous views
comment: I was lucky enough to get taken for lunch here, so cannot comment on the the prices.  The place is clean and smart, with an airy feel in the main restaurant. The views are fantastic, and there is an impressive outside terrace.  It was my first visit to any sort of Sushi restaurant. However, the staff members were really excellent in helping on the food choices. We had a selection of dishes to share, including salad, tempura, quinoa and aubergine. I thought it was all excellent, both in taste and presentation.  We shared desserts; chilli chocolate berry and another based on ingredients from Brazil. Both unusual and delicious.  I will bring my wife here next time we are in London.

title: Refused to let us in!
comment: I was a regular customer of both Sushi Samba and Duck and Waffle and additionally regularly entertain clients at both venues, considering them (in the past) to be excellent. However, this evening I, my colleagues, and clients were refused entry because 'we possibly looked a little bit drunk'. We were only hoping for a drink at the bar so that our clients could enjoy the view. Door staff were pretentious and therefore I have no immediate plans to return and will be recommending the same for colleagues and friends alike.

title: Amazing Venue, Great Food
comment: I've been to Sushisamba many times now, but my most recent visit was probably the best yet. As mentioned in some of the other reviews, the door staff seem to have started taking an interest in how much you've had to drink before arriving. I suppose this is acceptable - it's a late night bar that will attract a lot of customers after nearby pubs close, so I can certainly understand why they'd want to keep anyone who's too drunk and likely to be disruptive outside.  We had planned to have another couple of drinks and a plate or two of sushi in the bar, but after we arrived we thought we'd check whether or not a table might be available in the restuarant, and were given a great spot right in the window. The views here are spectacular, night or day, it's really worth visiting even if only for a drink, so getting a good table was really appreciated.  I also love the sushi here - it's original, fresh, well-made, and they definitely pull off the Japanese / Brazilian fusion flavours like nowhere else I've ever been. Also, surprisingly good value for a dinner for 4 (£130), which I wasn't expecting!

title: much improved
comment: I wrote a review after a visit in January this year when the accessible toilets were inaccessible and of a completely different standard to the rest of the premises. After staff contacted me, I revisited yesterday with my son who uses a wheelchair. The food, view and service were fantastic. We checked out the 'new' accessible toilet which is, unfortunately on another floor so you get to it via elevator. Standard was absolutely fine, plenty of scented soap, hand cream, paper etc. I would point out that disabled people also like a mirror(!) but apart from that, no criticism. Vanerie served us and was charming throughout, Romaine was also particularly welcoming and helpful.

title: AMAZING Restaurant
comment: I have been to SushiSamba quite a few times and I have to say this has to be one of my top restaurants in London. The food is top class, the service is excellent and the view is amazing. I enjoyed every minute that I was there and I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone. It is a must for anyone visiting London or for anyone who lives in London. The price was more than reasonable and I can't wait to go again.

title: Wow! What an experience!
comment: The experience is starting of with a thrilling outside lift to the 38th floor - breathtaking and a bit scary at the same time. If you are scared of heights, close your eyes! The view is simply just amazing! The staff are super friendly. And the sushi - words fail me - the best sushi I ever had! this is one of the places you will not forget after you have been there! Completely loved it!

title: Breath taking views
comment: Even if you are not a fun of sushi go to this place for a cocktail and a dessert which are great...so you can experience the sensational views!! The staff is attentive, funny and it adds to make it a wonderful evening!

title: Best place to eat and relax :)
comment: I went to Sushisamba with my husband on Sunday afternoon. We were so surprised with the view, style of the restaurant and the food everything was amazing. We stayed there all day eating, drinking a d relaxing it was perfect. The food was very delicious if you don't like uncooked fish please don't go because as you can imagine of course is raw fish it is a sushi place :) the plates are all very well presented please try sake they have a list of them :) don't forget the desert anything you eat there you will love it :) we will comeback :)

title: Visiting Sushi Samba Bar for the first and last time
comment: 1. Very rude behaviour at the entrance. The blond girl responsible for the reservations at the ground floor on Saturday night the 8th of June let people without reservations get in through the reservations queue whilst there were 60 other people standing waiting in the cold. At one point the bouncer realized that she let people get in without any reservation and he told her off. The bouncers preferred to send the lift half-empty with people who ‘had’ reservations instead of letting in people who were waiting at the queue. The quality of a place is always reflected on the way its bouncers behave. This is the main reason I’m not gonna visit Sushi Samba again. 2. Astonishing view is the biggest + of the bar. The space is having architectural mistakes though; it is having an impressive and original interior design but the view is blocked at many places because of unfortunate interior solutions.  3. Prices are just ok for the quality of drinks.  4. The staff was polite enough (apart from the unfortunate behavior at the entrance of course).

title: Food sumptuous... Service unprofessional
comment: We had an eclectic selection of food and each choice was excellent! Each of the 5 of us were so happy with our choice of restaurant as the food was delicious.  Although the service was relatively good throughout the dinner, it took a turn at the end of the night when the bill came. The service charge was included in the bill and as there was no reason not to tip our servers and as such paid the bill with the service charge included. However, upon paying the bill we must have miscalculated and missed the full 12.5% which equalled £5. So instead of the server receiving £30 he received £25. This was unintentional oversight on our part. The shocking part of the story was that the server returned the £25 to the table and stated that the full service charge was missing.  One of our friends, who owns and operates a successful restaurant was shocked at his behaviour as it appeared as though he was attempting to manipulate the table into giving him the full service charge. In my view, a very passive aggressive AND risky measure to make as we left the table, taking our change with us. Not too bright on his part. A different way of handling the situation would have been for him to ask if everything had been to our satisfaction. This would have triggered us into thinking that we had made a mistake and he most likely would have been given more than the 12.5% service charge.  Overall the food was excellent, the view outstanding, the service was satisfactory but the expected service charge was definitely too reliant on being the new "trendy" and "place to be" in London.

title: Unforgetable experience
comment: Spending the evening at this restaurant was a magnificent experience!the mix of top japanese, brazilian and peruvian cuisine was delicous!the view is incredible as you can see the whole city of london from up there!you are physically and culinary wise almost in heaven!

title: Sushi Samba- Impressive bar
comment: I took 2 friends who came to visit me in London last Saturday night for a quick cocktail before hitting a club in Shoreditch. We turned up at about 10.30pm to a queue of at least 50 people, the doorman was very dismissive and said you’ll be waiting at least 30mins to get in. We decided to wait, and indeed it took half an hour to get up to the bar. Worth the wait- we got served quickly by a great barman with some good banter. Cocktails were small for the price, which included a 12% service?! But they looked and tasted good.  We got a great seat by the window with amazing views. Sadly the terrace was closed due to windy conditions, but looked gorgeous with lots of twinkly lights. The music was great, commercial stuff, we could have stayed there a lot longer. The vibe was fun and relaxed, seemed to be a lot of suits and corporate outings though so we moved on after midnight.  Fun bar, great place to impress out of towners, id say get there early for pre-drinks as i wouldn't want to queue again, but definitely worth checking out.

title: Complete and utter dissapointment
comment: Last Saturday, I booked a table for 4 at 22:00 to celebrate my friend’s hen-do. We actually ended up having 5 people attend. We were quite pleased as the hostess was very accommodating and able to add an extra chair to our table, including the unexpected friend. We were delighted and impressed by the service and atmosphere we encountered upon arrival to the restaurant and it really seemed to exceed our expectations. The drinks at the bar were fantastic, the host staff was extremely welcoming and the view and overall ambience of the place were incredible.    The service continued to be very good after we were seated and attended to. Our drinks were ordered and received promptly, and our food was absolutely outstanding and delivered correctly. We really felt very special and attended to during the first half of our experience.    The problems started arising towards the end of our dinner. There seemed to be a number of birthdays going on around us and the staff was concentrating on these larger tables – which is understandable to a point. However, we felt that we were still paying customers, like the remainder of the other tables, and expected the great service we had in the beginning to continue throughout the night. Our drinks were empty for 15 minutes without anyone coming to attend to them prior to us having to ask for more.  Upon booking the table on TopTable, I advised that we were celebrating my friend’s upcoming wedding and requested something special for her. I was pleased as an employee rang me the day prior to the booking and asked if I would like a special dessert with a message on it which I thought was great. I advised that I would like the message to say “It’s about time, [friend's name]” which the employee said would be no problem. On the night of our dinner before the dessert was brought out, the server came round showing me the typed message to make sure it was correct, which I confirmed.
