Once the server brought the dessert out, it said round the plate “Happy Birthday” and the staff started singing to us. I quickly told them it was not Heather’s birthday and they had made a mistake. This was yet another letdown for the evening as it made me think that my friend felt we had gotten the dessert wrong and had not pre-planned for her as we had. Also, when the staff brought the dessert, they took all of our dessert menus and never asked us if we wanted extra desserts, after-dinner drinks, coffees or anything else – again showing poor upselling skills by your staff because we were keen for more drinks and desserts and felt quite dismissed like we were not as important as the other guests. We had to get a server’s attention to come back over with the dessert menus to order our desserts and drinks.    Then the bill came. We split the bill differently between the 5 of us as some people were paying on credit card and others cash. We thought we had paid the exact amount which was listed on the bill, including the 12.5% gratuity charge added, and provided this to the server. We were finishing up our drinks and about to leave when the server abruptly came back with £25 in the tray. He rudely put the tray with the money in the middle of the table in front of us. He then stated with a discourteous tone that we were £5 short on the bill with the service charge so he was refunding the entire service charge for us. He then hastily went off without saying anything else or asking us if we had unintentionally miscalculated (which is exactly what we had done). The server was actually incorrect and we were not £5 as he was claiming. Our bill had come to £248.06. Of that, the 12.5% service charge was 27.56. We gave him £25 – unintentionally missing £2.56. We could not believe that someone who was supposed to be serving us had reacted in such an embarrassing and completely inappropriate manner after we had spent nearly £250 and were expecting a carefree, beautiful dining experience where our friend would be made to feel like she was being pampered and spoiled in preparation for her marriage.  We ended up taking the remainder of the gratuity and left quite angrily and upset. We did this because the service had slacked so much towards the end of the evening as well as how we were treated at the end by the server in regards to the payment. I have never refused to tip a server in my life as I have been a server in the past so this was quite unusual for me.  I will not be patronizing Sushisamba ever again because of this negative experience and I wanted to let other potential customers know. It is quite a shame because the food, view and atmosphere was great, but I have never felt so worthless and expendable as I had that night.

title: very very nice place and good food
comment: my husband booked a table at SushiSamba London for our 1st wedding anniversary and we really enjoyed it; the views were fantastic; the food was fresh and tasty and the service was very good; also lovely cocktails if you fancy some. thinking of going back for my birthday later this year. slightly pricey, but worth it. definitely one of the best restaurants in London.

title: Rude door and bar staff
comment: Went out for dinner with a friend near Spitalfields market and thought it was a nice idea to try Sushisamba for a post dinner drink. I wish we hadn't bothered! The bouncer downstairs was downright rude aggressively asking if we had been drinking before (we'd had a bottle of wine between the two of us) and then proceeding to tell us that we may be refused a drink upstairs at the discretion of the bar. We should have left there and then. Once in the bar we went to the outside bar where, after the barmen had finished messing around on his phone, we asked for a drinks menu. Apparently there was no drinks menu and his response to the question 'well what do you serve?' was 'wine and champagne'. No attempt at describing which wine or champagne. We ended up going for 2 glasses of pink champagne which we ended up paying through the roof for, undoubtedly because he chose the most expensive bottle and there was no menu with prices for us to look at. The view from the bar was pretty impressive, however the bad service and rudeness tarnished the experience.

title: Well worth the trip
comment: The view from the 38th floor of the Heron Tower where Sushi Samba is situated is simply amazing, even the trip up in the elevator. Probably one of the reasons I had to book so far in advance to get a table. The food is an interesting twist of Japanese and Brazilian but mostly Japanese. They do sushi very well but their grilled meats while delicious, are the not best robata I have had. Their cocktails were excellent, the service was highly professional and they took time to explain each individual dish which I appreicated. It isn't too cheap, but for the view and the quality of the food it is worth it.

title: Excellent food and stunning views
comment: The food is amazing and the views of the London skyline are spectacular. Although it is relatively pricey, it cost 3 of us £200 for lunch, including alcohol, the whole experience makes it worthwhile.

title: Just Drinks for us
comment: Wow.......discovered Heron Tower near both Fenchurch St & Liverpool St Stations. 24 Hour Bar with a FANTASTIC View of the City. Take the elevator to the 38th Floor and enjoy the Bar & Panorama. We only popped in / up for a beer & to see the view so cannot comment on the Restaurant. Beer £5 per bottle, plus 12.5% service charge !!

title: Your time is up, now shove off!
comment: I would like to thank the young man last night in his smart black suit, with his walkie talkie along with his discreet security earpiece for pointing out while we were eating our very nice meal the terms and conditions of our dining reservation. My guests and I are fully capable of working out that there are 15 minutes between 18.45 & 19.00. The food and the service are excellent, but we did find the ejection process from the table a little rude and unnecessary.

title: Great food, great service, great views!
comment: I have been to sushi samba twice now and love it! The food is amazing and we love the atmosphere and views. Last night we were served by Mantas, who was really helpful and attentive, look forward to our next visit, when we can get a table!

title: Sushi Samba
comment: I wasn't sure what to expect as I have only just started dabbling with sushi. But my friend suggested this for our regular meet up. This was probably the best meal I have eaten in a long time. The location was amazing we turned up and they probably gave us one of the best tables in the room which was right next to the window with a fantastic view. We both felt a bit out of our depth with the menu but we made the best choices everything we selected was mouth watering. Then the service our waiter was helpful, polite and just what you need a waiter to be. I could not fault the place. Yes it is expensive but with all of the positives I don't mind paying good money for good food.

title: Great experience, fantastic food and amazing views from the bathrom ;)
comment: I wasn't sure what to expect as I had heard some very poor reviews especially relating to the service - but had a great time. We had to book this Friday night slot two months in advance but I would say it was worth it, I saw some people waiting nearly all night and couldn't get a table - would say though that I am surprised as at least 4 tables around us were empty (we arrived 6.30 and left around 9). 1) Service - was good, had to queue to get into the building and then had to queue again once on the 38th floor. Wasn't always sure where I had to go next. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. I would say though initially, the platters came very quickly, we barely had time to put our forks down before the next plate came, would have preferred a little breathing time between the courses.  2) Food - was excellent! The menu was broken down into four different categories (selection of raw dishes, samba rolls and differently cooked food on BBQ) and then a large platter menu. We were two couples and chose about 2 dishes from each category and then 1 from the large platter (meat platter was amazing). The food portions were tiny - but very delicious. No complaints at all (to be fair not very cheap - but you know that going in). 3) Drinks - fairly good selection, overpriced even by City standards. Glass of wine would set you back about £10, beers were pretty competitive if you like Japanese, Peruvian or Brazilian variety.  4) Ambiance - the restaurant spreads over 2 floors (38 and 39) in Heron Tower. The 38th floor has the restaurant, the sushi bar and an outdoor bar/ terrace, as well as some outside dining. Amazing views of London on a clear day, pretty much in whatever direction you look. The 39th floor has another bar type area and the washrooms. I have to say the washrooms had the best views of London - now how many places can say that? After dinner, we went up to the bar and had drinks till midnight - dj playing some music but not excessively busy like some places can get in the City on a Friday night. All in all, a novel place to go to once in a while. The price would stop me from going to eat on a regular basis, but would come to eat on a special occasion or come by for a drink on a nice summer's day. Highly recommend it!

title: Fab cocktails, wonderful sushi, sensational views
comment: Sunny Friday thought would wonder up for a late lunch, greeted by friendly staff, plenty of seating fabulous cocktails and the sushi WOW best I've had in london. I had the special samba roll of the day & really it was sensational! Even though the place got busier as we sat basking in the sunshine we were never made to feel like it was 'time to leave' and we were dressed pretty casually I didn't once feel like the place was too pretentious for this we were treated really well :)

title: Best food in London
comment: Food was great. View from 38 floor Heron tower amazing. Prices are very high. If you want a restaurant - should reserve ahead. There is a bar only options for those who want drink and view only.

title: (con)fusion
comment: Like other reviewers we were "greeted" at this "Japanese-Peruvian" fusion restaurant with the statement that we had to make sure that we were out in two hours. This greeting was one of the few interactions we had with the staff who milled around in large numbers, but who were reluctant to offer any kind of service. We had ordered hot sake to accompany our food. The sake eventually turned up, but it was pretty cold by the time that the food made its appearance. The first unfortunate example of fusion is that instead of serving the sake in pottery cups and jar, as in Japanese restaurants, it comes in sherry glasses and glass bottle. Is this the Peruvian contribution to the "fusion"? The sashimi was carved off blocks of frozen fish and was not much improved by the heaped granules of sea salt. The meat dishes were gelatinous, probably from being left lying around waiting for a waiter to finish socialising to fit in a customer. This place is vastly over-rated and vastly inferior to any even average Japanese restaurant. We refused to pay the service charge, which is only the second time we have done this in restaurant-going over a 40 year period.

title: Great food, great views
comment: Went to SushiSamba with some girlfriends and would highly recommend it. Great food, and great views. DELICIOUS!

title: Fab - u - lous!
comment: Wow! What a find. We were taken to Suchisamba by our son and his wife, and were more than a little surprised to find our reservation was for 5.15 pm. Why so early? Simply because the place was packed out - and deservedly so. The food was amazing, a fusion of Peruvian, Brazilian and Japanese, beautifully cooked and presented, and served expertly by our waiter, who took time to explain the dishes to us. All the staff were friendly, and lightening fast. There was an accident on the next table, where glassware was broken. No damage was done to ourselves, but we had two apologies within seconds, and the fragments were secured and disposed of very quickly. The wine selection was good, if pricy, and the wine waiter was a master both of timing and precision. The puddings also deserve a special mention, for presentation, and for the explosion of taste they imparted. The whole restaurant had a real buzz, which is always an indication of a contented clientele. Finally, the views from both the 38th and 39th floors are amazing.

title: Superb views, great food, service unpredictable...
comment: Being an avid fan of the Sushisamba restaurants in New York and Las Vegas I was thrilled to hear that one would be opening in London and could not wait to visit. I have now been a number of times and the experiences have varied drastically. I have had a superb lunch here where the food, service and ambience were second-to-none but I have also been here when the service has been so terrible that it was hard to believe it was the same place! This is a Jekyll & Hyde of a restaurant, which is not ideal as if you want to have a special occasion here or bring important clients then you are wary of running the risk of a poor experience. However, it is definitely a restaurant worth experiencing, especially for the views which are superb and so unique for a London restaurant, but for the hefty price tag of your bill it is not ideal when you are not sure what you are in for.

title: Amazing cocktails
comment: We had a selection of 5 or 6 dishes. The food was delicious. Cocktails were even better. Our waiter was very friendly. We ate between 6 and 8 and there wasn't much of an atmosphere and we didn't have the best seat. If you want the most amazing views you will need to book months in advance.

title: Drinks Only
comment: The views at this place are amazing! It is worth going just for that. Went for drinks the other night and it did take absolutely ages to get served. As mentioned in other review the place seems to cater to wanna be important people - who knows maybe they were! Towards the end of the night there were some dubious character around - overall service is good but apart from the views nothing special.

title: Brilliant Experience !
comment: With a forthcoming trip to London to visit our son and his fiancée, he told us he had booked us all in at Sushisamba following our theatre visit. Having read some quite disparaging reviews on these pages needless to say,we embarked with some trepidation.  We needn't have worried. The whole experience was exceptional from the external lift on arrival up to the 38th floor of the Heron Tower to the finest espresso martini's we've ever tasted, and believe me, we've had a few !! In between the two was a fine dining experience only matched by a wonderful visit to Rhodes 24 some years ago. Although very busy indeed, the service was superb but not intrusive. The sushi was utterly sublime and perfectly complimented by some very well chosen wines ( thanks son !! ).  As we transcended from early evening into the night the views were just incredible.  Although not particularly cheap it's certainly well worth a visit if ever you find yourselves down that way.

title: amazing view
comment: had been to sushisamba just for the drinks. amazing view from the 40th floor. nice way to spend your evening having drinks and enjoying the London view. would recommend everyone. please don't forget to book your table 2 weeks in advance if you have to dine there.

title: Surprised about negative reviews Sushisamba is simply amazing
comment: We came here for our wedding anniversary, initially I was sceptical as there are some negative reviews on Tripadvisor. Having experienced and eaten at Sushisamba I am honestly surprised why anybody would give this restaurant a negative review. We had such friendly service from Saul our waiter, the menu he devised was great (good cross-section of Japanese and Fusion food, i.e. Sashimi, grilled beef, lobster, etc.) and actually came at a reasonable price. The view is breath-taking and usually to get this scenic view one has to pay in London without it being included in the food order. We will be coming again and thanks to Sushisamba for making our wedding anniversary special!

title: Wow wow wow
comment: Popped up for a drink and sushi at the bar and absolutely adored it!!! Great atmosphere and sushi and the view is spectacular!!

title: Sushisamba
comment: This is a very outstanding restaurant in London on 38th floor. It is very well done with high ceiling and a terrace. The food is excellent Japanese. The selection is outstanding. The Wine Steward was very helpful;l and took us through many Sake suitable to each dish. IT is always full and is advisable to book in advance without which you cant get in. The very ride in the glass elevator to the 38th floor is quite an experience.

title: Every dish was a delight!
comment: First you should go for the elevator ride alone. The restaurant is on the 38th floor of Heron Tower. The elevators are glass and outside. The ride up is exhilarating. The restaurant itself has amazing views all across London. As I hate sushi -- I know, I know -- I got tempura veg, skewers, shrimp rolls, miso soup, and sesame asparagus. Every single course was delicious. Service was spot on as well. And the prices were surprisingly good.

title: Stunning location, sumptous food, beautiful staff, a MUST!
comment: A wonderful new and very beloved friend of mine took me here for dinner in April. I loved the fact that it's on the 39th floor as the views are outstanding! Not good for vertigo sufferers though! The Sushi here is presented stunningly and I would say it's some of the finest and most delicious Sushi I've ever tasted. We had a wonderful waiter who was an utter sweetheart and very attentive.  The decor is stunning and it has a fab roof terrace with a very funky tree. Must be seen! I loved this place, and would go back in a heart beat!

title: Great view and cocktails
comment: I went there to celebrate a friend's birthday and I wished that it was mine! Great views of London from the bar area and from the outside space ( good to know if there are smokers among your party). Eric served us cocktails and he was very enthusiastic and was keen on us trying their drinks ( loved their Inca Swizzle). I cannot comment on the food as we only had drinks. Would recommend it and would go again!

title: Fabulous food, what a view!
comment: Pre-dinner cocktails were amazing, and with the outdoor terrace and fireplace, it is quite a venue to behold. The seared tuna was excellent. Really good service and helpful advice given on which dishes complement each other and the portion sizes. Stick to the sushi and seafood dishes, this seems to be their area of specialty!

title: Gorgeous view to enjoy some great cocktails!
comment: Have been here a couple of times now still amazed by the great view you get from all bar floors. Has a cute little outdoor bar which is great for a non rainy day in the evening to enjoy some cocktails. Staff are very welcoming and certainly know how to make a fabulous cocktail! Have been to many bars but have found here at Sushisamba all bartenders put effort into each cocktail they make. Have tried almost every cocktail on the list, though they are a little pricey they are defiantly worth it. Would recommend this place for birthday cocktails, general get together or even pre drinks before heading out for a bonus you'll get a good view to take pictures!

title: Great Views and Food, a real trat
comment: I love this place; I came across it by accident looking for a late booking at Xmas. I have since gone back with clients and socially. Once with my 7 year old, for whom they had special chopsticks (I was not expecting that) there were a couple of other children there as well. It was during the Xmas break. I have not been to the upstairs bar as it’s busy, but have been out side and downstairs; they made a special cocktail for my son. The view is amazing. On our client dinner, we had the wagu beef, which was a real treat, but also the sashimi is also very good and the Brazilian Pork belly is also good. There were 8 of us and the dishes are 4 to 5 bites per portion. So we ordered 5 starters and the sushi platters plus one main and the beef. We all shared and it was fun and enough. Do not over order to start with, it is easy to get carried away and since the dishes come quickly its better to top up. Cheapest wine is about £45.00 that I could see, expect to pay around £100 for two at lunch and more in the evening.

title: Great Views
comment: My friends and I didn't actually eat here, but went for a drink and to observe the amazing views of the Gerkin and St. Pauls cathedral. I've lived in NYC for a while, where these kinds of views are often taken for granted, but to see this perspective of london, was just spectacular. Drinks are on the expensive side, but it is well worth it!

title: Contradictions..............at high altitude.........avoid avoid avoid !
comment: Ok ,so this is the second highest restaurant in Europe ..... spectacular view of London from the Terrace but you can't see the Thames so it loses some attraction. Fast elevator to the 38th floor and a small bar area.......much larger restaurant area if you want to eat normally for £ 75 each ! However 4 Japanese cooks also do sushi in the bar area so you can have a quick bite as well. The good things : spectacular view , outside terrace and trendy atmosphere with a couple of Chelsea players in for the night , who left after 5 minutes !!! The bad things: In a city called London , reknowned for the beer amongst other things , here you can only drink bottled beer.......from..........wait for it..........Peru , Japan or Brazil !!! What the heck does that mean ? What is wrong with European beer........by the way the Brazilian Brahma beer is awfully bad........the Peruvian is sweet and sticky........didn't try the Japanese beer........not exactly great beer traditions in these countries. Pricey at £ 5 a bottle ......but the cute thing is there is a discretionary ( stated on the menu ) 12.5% service charge even at the bar..........but NOT AT CUSTOMER DISCRETION.......AT BAR STAFF DISCRETION so they load 12.5% to your drinks bill......they TIP THEMSELVES !!! The 'Man at the Door' also forbids you to take a camera into the bar and terrace area......but pays no heed to photo's taken with iPhones , iPads etc.........what sense is that ????? If you want to try it ....go ahead.....allow 20 minutes for the bar staff to notice you exist........see the terrace..........then go across the street to a decent London Pub for the rest of the evening. If you are a poser...........stay all night !! As for me ? Never again !

title: Excellent food and amazing view
comment: I've been to Sushi Samba a few times in NY and always loved it, but going to the London version was an even more amazing experience. Cocktails in the bar and outside were lovely and then the food was to die for - especially the fish taco starters! And the view and atmosphere was stunning and had such a buzz. The service was impeccable and staff friendly and helpful. Can't wait for my next visit!

title: poor service and dreadful management
comment: I would like to say that our meal for four that was booked two months in advance of arrival, confirmed by e mail and again by telephone the day before the scheduled booking was a great experience but it most definatly was not. We walked out having not been seated almost an hour after our booked time and with no guarantee of us being taken into the restaurant as the second hour ticked by. Arriving half an hour before the set time we duly paid almost 40 gbp for four 'normal' drinks but this was in line with our expectations. There was nowhere to sit as most people appeared to be there just for drinks. Diners were standing in a queue waiting to be seated in the restaurant. Some had been there 45 mins and were already more than half an hour past their booking time. Repeated enquiries by many in the queue went unanswered. Management were nowhere to be seen and the ladies on the front desk appeared to be so at ease with the situation we drew the conclusion that this shoddy way of treating customers was normal. A complimentary glass of wine that eventually was offered to everyone was no substitute for what should have been a special night out with friends. Such a let down and a very poor example of what London has to offer. We will not be going back.

title: Amazing food with an incredible view!
comment: Sushisamba is a great restaurant high up on a building in the City that serves a fusion of Japanese, Peruvian & Brazillian cuisines. The food & cocktails are delicious and the menus for both are big. Fortunately the wait staff are helpful in guiding you through the menu and providing recommendations.  The view across the city is nothing short of amazing. The restaurant is on the top floor of one of the highest buildings in the City so the views are uninterrupted and it is a great way to see London from a different perspective. It is a little pricey and can be impossible to get a table without a booking, but is definitely worth the visit if you are looking for a special night out.

title: Excellent food and service with prices to match!
comment: This is the second time we have been here. The first time they fitted us in without a booking for 2 people, at a not great table but we didn't have a booking so they did the best they could and it was fine. The second time we did book and we had a nice table in the main restaurant. The staff could not have been more attentive or helpful, and they had a good sommelier who also advised my husband well on his choice of sake. It was my mother's first experience of sushi and she absolutely loved it, and our wine was very good too. It's not cheap, but you're paying for the amazing view as well as the food.The lift going up to and down from them (on the 38th floor) was very fast and made my mum feel a bit woozy but we can't hold that against the restaurant. A great place to go for a treat. Full of people there to be seen wearing far too much make up (and that was just the men) but just don't look at them!

title: Fab food, great service
comment: My husband and I had heard this restaurant had teething problems, but thought we would try it out on our wedding anniversary (a Sunday evening). Well, it is so much more than just a view. Innovative cocktails, fantastic food (pork belly is amazing) and the service was great (thanks Marco!). We live nearby and will definitely be returning soon. It is a bit pricey but well worth it.

title: Had a blast
comment: What an amazing restaurant From the decor to the food and service, not enough space to write how fabulous it is just go! Amazing cocktails and try the wrapped pork belly, still thinking about it , going back for my birthday.

title: Better value than a trip up the Shard
comment: I popped in here for a drink with some colleagues. I didn't try the food and I didn't pick up the bill, so I can't comment on value. Having been up the Shard a few weeks ago, I was shocked at how good the views were for a place that you can visit without paying to get in. OK you aren't as high, but this is the 3rd biggest building in London. You get a great close up view of the Gherkin and can see St Paul's and the river. Try this first and if you haven't seen enough, fork out the entrance fee for the Shard. I will go back and try the food next time.

title: Beautiful food and dramatic venue
comment: I went as a treat with colleagues and had a wonderful time. The food was beautifully presented - hybrid Japanese and Brazilian and the sauces were delicious. It was not a problem being vegetarian either. The restaurant itself was lovely on a sunny day with incredible views of London, the service was very attentive to make it 'an experience' for diners and the outside areas were great for the view and having a smoke. There is a tree up there too, bedecked with lights. It's a corporate experience but a luxurious 'City' one and made a nice change for me.

title: Amazing views, service & food
comment: I was taken here by my boyfriend for my birthday, with a 5.30pm reservation it was nice to see the place and the views in the light. All staff were very friendly and helpful, from the coat staff to the waiters. We asked if we could have a drink in the bar first and a wander to take photos, they were fine with this but said they'd still need the table back by 7.30pm.  When we were seated our waiter was extremely helpful with the menu, and he kept coming back throughout the night without being too hands on, a balance difficult to get right. The dishes he recommended were our particular favourites (beef gyoza), and at the end he brought over an amazing dessert with a candle in & 'happy birthday' piped in chocolate (my boyfriend didn't even ask for this, the waiter had asked if it was a special occasion when I went to the bathroom), a nice touch :) We ended up departing our table at approx 7.55pm, but not once did we feel pressured to leave or were rushed, which is great considering the place was busy by that time.  The bill came to £109 with service, this was for approx 7 small plates to share (which we found enough for the 2 of us), plus 2 glasses of wine and 1 beer. We said no to water when first seated, then our waiter brought a jug of water anyway & kept this replenished throughout the night, so I'd recommend doing the same to save paying over the odds for bottled water.  Although not cheap, this place really is divine from the interior to the views, from the food to the service. We would like to go again in the dark so we can experience the views then too. Recommend going for a special occasion.

title: Night drinks
comment: we had wine and soft drink in price of 14.00 pounds . the night view from 38th floor was breathtaking. the booking wasn't nessesary for a drink. Slow servise i was waiting 15minutes to get the drinks from the bar. but in this view you forget everything!

title: Great combination of Japanese and Brazilian food beautifully cooked in a 5star location
comment: The place is vibrant with nice background music and a beautiful view of London from an iconic building. The food is greatly cooked from open cooking stations and the combination of Japanese and Brazilian cuisine works surprisingly well. Highly recommended!

title: AMAZING FOOD, SERVICE AND VIEWS
comment: Lovely place – INCREDIBLE VIEWS. Beautiful service and the food (especially the daikon salad) was like little works of art. Faultless and worth every penny.

title: Very enjoyable
comment: I went in on Saturday night, just for drinks, whilst visiting my sister in London. We had a great time and loved the views and ambience. The terrace was lovely and we eventually got a fab seat by the glass overlooking the city. I would certainly recommend, my only slight gripe was that we were charged 12.5% service for a bottle of Chardonnay. We had to stand at the bar for about 15 minutes before we were served, and at £43 the bottle was quite expensive without the added 12.5%! £11 pounds service is steep for opening a bottle of wine! We didn't grumble or let it affect our night, but it is worth pointing out I think.

title: A truly magical culinary experience
comment: I have visited SushiSamba's sister restaurant Duck ands Waffle dozens of times partly because a relation works there but always because it is awesome, so it took a lot to persuade me to try the restaurant two floors down. So I knew all about the view of course and the lifts etc but it was a corporate event I organised at Sushisamba that left me determined to try it. The attention to detail under the direction of Phil Nankivell was breathtaking and the food and wine at the event was spellbinding. The staff were among the best I am my guests have ever been served by. So when my mate said that Sushisamba was his preferred venue for our next catch up as he had visited one in the US I didn't need convincing. Seafood dishes were perfection, especially the Sea Bass (they had run out of the special Halibut. We explained our preferences to the waiter and left it all to him; Cervice, Sushi Rolls, dish after dish came and all accompanied by my favourite wine which the sommelier had found out from Duck and Waffle, real five star service. Can't wait to go back and would highly recommend it.

title: Food, Views, Service
comment: Ate here a week ago, having checked the reviews on TripAdvisor before my visit I was concerned about what to expect - a place like this is in the spotlight and as such is bound to have mixed reviews as high expectations may disappoint at times, nevertheless I maintained an open mind and this is how I found the experience... The location of the restaurant is incredibly difficult to beat - the nature of London's skyline is such that buildings like this tend to stick out, but with very few buildings which match the height of the Heron Tower in London the views from the restaurant section are uninterrupted to the North and East, from our table we could see both the Olympic Park and Canary Wharf - we were dining on a spectacular day for weather so the view as the sun set was fantastic as was the night time view that followed.  Four of us were dining and there was one birthday in the group - after a glass elevator ride to the top floor we were greeted by very friendly staff who wished a happy birthday to our member of the group, we were seated promptly and it was clear they had made a conscious effort to ensure our table had a good view. As ever in places like this the service makes a huge difference, I am pleased to say our waiter Marco was a very friendly and polite individual who clearly explained the menu to us as well as the sizes of the dishes (which is hugely important here).  The quality of the food was very high, much of the sushi had a South American twist which was a great touch - I eat a lot of sushi so this made a great change, ideas like Yellowtail in taco shells and mini Pork Belly sushi were both interesting and tasted fantastic. Things not to miss are the Shrimp Tempura and the Black Cod Miso, the Sushi Samba rolls and if you are hungry enough to order a large plate (which are for sharing) the selection of Kobe Beef, Chorizo and Fillet Steak - the meat was fantastic, although I would imagine they are all very tasty.  You need money to eat here! Although one does get full as plate after plate arrives it is not a night which can be done effectively on a budget, everything from the cocktails (which are very creative), wine list and food is very expensive but it is important to bear in mind the restaurant chain you are eating in (which is very well known worldwide) and the location you are in! Many people have complained about the price - do not go expecting bargains.  As the title of the review would suggest, the food views and service make this place a rather special experience - I found the serving staff to all be very tentative, observant and extremely helpful in explaining the content of the food and where it was sourced from. The staff here clearly have a good knowledge of the food they are serving (and a good knowledge of London from 245 metres).  Thank you for a truly impressive evening.

title: Great expectations and disappointing service
comment: The view is amazing, the elevator ride breathtaking. But alas, we were treated with such little care...the wines actually served were worse than stated on the menu (different year) but at the same price, the bartenders were slow and phlegmatic, made you want to go and spend your money somewhere else. It's all about the view really. The cliche' upmarket City place that counts on people going back because it's cool, not because they get valued as a customer.

title: Sushi Samba
comment: The food was excellent. The decor, simple but so effective, and the views were just stunning. There was a fabulous ambeince about the place. Our waiter Vincent was brilliant he guided us on what to order without being pretentious or overbearing. His knowledge of the menu was 1st class, and he helped make the choice of food a meal to remember. The bill was quite expensive, but then we expected it to be, and did not feel ripped off in any way. Came out of there completely full up and very happy from a great night out. We will most definitely be going back there.

title: Awesome view
comment: Being a tourist in London, my local friend suggested going to grab a drink over at this place with the awesome view of the Gherkin. And boy was he right.  Not surprisingly, everybody wants to get a drink there but there were more the business folks down there for a happy hour beer/cocktail rather than tourist like myself, at least the day when I was there.  But the view on the 29th floor with wall to ceiling windows over looking the Gherkin towering over some of the older buildings in the City was just awesome.  Price of the beer was ok but then there's an extra 12.5% of gratitude automatically included on the tab. And all that for handing me the beer? Well I guess that was to pay for the awesome view.  Highly recommended to get a beer or two.

title: Only went for a drink.. Disgraceful service at the bar!
comment: I came with a lot of expectations, couldn't get a reservation to take a friend there who was visiting from out of town so went up for a drink after dinner instead on a Tuesday night! The bar wasn't too busy but service was bad.. I can't say it's everyone because most staff were very friendly. What really got me was the bartender who seems more interested in hitting on a female customer then serving all. He was flirting with her while few customers were waiting.. Eventually they swap details but even then he continued with the conversation and eventually another bar tender served me. We finished our drink and left.. Not sure I'd bother going for

title: Great atmosphere and even better views!
comment: First time there, a bit of a queue but it went down very quickly. was only visiting the bar for cocktails (which were lovely), great atmosphere and decor. The views were spectacular and a great place to end an evening.

title: Bad service & full of wannabes millionaires!
comment: Went just for a drink (and thank God for that): the bar was full, the outside terrace is not big at all and the waiters were not enough. The people were just very pretentious & wannabe millionaires. The waiters took ages to serve us. We left after one drink and will not be going back. If you want good service with a view, go to Madison at One New Change or to Vertigo on Tower 42.

title: The view!
comment: The view is worth the visit, the food, drinks and service are just the icing on the cake.  However, food and service was great. Sufficient choice of dishes and drinks. Prices are OK. the only bothersome points are the noise level and the insufficient space. But otherwise it was a great dining experience and I would like to come back soon.

title: Superb
comment: Blown away from the moment you enter. THe lifts whisk you up at pace whilst watching the London skyline unfold in front of you. Crowd a little tacky in bar, but well made cocktails. We'd booked but had to wait nearly 3o mins to be seated. Once we were sat in the restaurant we were immediately greeted by the charming maitre d Patrick. He offered some food to get us going to apologise for the wait, a nice touch, and also pointed us in the right direction with our drink choice. Recommended a sake to start. Neither of us had tried quality sake before, but this was fantastic. Wish I could remember the bloody name of it! We also asked for a wine recommendation. He came up with a few and we plumped for a beautiful Chateau Neuf du Pape. We let the waiter, also excellent, select a menu for us. The choices were inspired. All delicious. I would highly recommend this place to anyone wishing to impress a date, client or whoever. Can't understand some of the negative reviews that sushi samba has received. Check it out!

title: Beautiful views
comment: The Sushisamba experience is one not to be missed. Even entering the restaurant is exciting. The lift (very speedily) whisks you up to the 38th floor where you a met by a friendly maitre'd and a beautiful bar area. Unfortunately, as I visited on a Sunday, the 39th floor bar was not open, but luckily the outdoor area still was. It is sort of a surreal situation, you are high above the city of London with a beautiful view of the skyline and on top of this building is a large tree covered in lights (not as tacky as it sounds) and open fires. The food itself was good. Not the best sushi I have ever had by far, but still delicious and presented beautifully. I would personally recommend the beef tataki from the small plates menu. The menu was quite pricey but that is only to be expected in such a beautiful setting. However, we did find the waiting staff to be very pushy and despite ordering more food than we could manage, it seemed the waiter was trying to make us order food that we did not want and after saying no, he almost seemed to be annoyed at us. Despite that, it was a wonderful evening and I will definitely be going back.

title: special place in London!
comment: Good food, very good service, fantastic views, nice atmosphere. Will be back for sure! Summer time open terrace of the restaurant! Be sure to reserve restaurant, no reservation for the bar

title: Loved it
comment: The attention and service they applied to my visit on the 23rd March was phenomenal. I came with my friend who had booked for my birthday, and the management arranged a table with the upmost attention and ease.   The food was delicious, the view incredible, and the service 150%.

title: jaded londoner overwhelmed by beauty and food
comment: Had to write as can't imagine a more beautiful and exciting place to eat dinner. service was great (waiter knew everything about menu and clearly loved working there). scenery was spectacular - never seen such amazing views in london and the food was sublime. (am a big fan of roka, zuma etc, but this had the edge on them even). cocktails delicious, vibe fun and can't wait to go back sometime to celebrate another special ocassion.

title: Absolutely Amazing Experience!
comment: We went here for a belated Valentines dinner and our experience was perfect from start to finish! The service was impeccable - friendly, informative and very very efficient. Julian was our waiter and he was fun and helpful. The food was amazing, we ordered a wide variety of dishes that were mostly new to us and every one of them was incredible! I am not sure how anyone could write a negative review about this place. The food, service and views are all brilliant and I would recommend to anyone! We loved it!

title: Wonderful
comment: We were taken here recently by some friends who live in London and I went expecting the usual tourist trap food in this kind of restaurant - I could not have been more wrong. The food and service are brilliant.  The place is packed and the atmosphere is good but the views are simply stunning. The waiters are great and really helpful and the service would efficient. I would definitely go again and would recommend it to anyone visiting London.

title: Wonderful food, great cocktails, excellent service.
comment: I recently ate at Sushisamba, and was very pleasantly surprised. The food was exquisite, and I had great difficulty in stopping myself from ordering the entire menu. The cocktails were delicious, and the waiting staff were friendly and efficient. The food isn't cheap, but neither is it outrageously expensive, and given the high quality displayed it is worth every penny. My only complaint is that the music was so loud that I had to raise my voice quite high to converse with my friend, but otherwise this was an excellent experience and I will definitely be back in the near future!

title: Not bad
comment: We had high expectations. The elevator ride up and outside bar with its gold centre tree were impressive. Also, it was quite buzzy..everyone was having a good time even though 'everyone' seemed to be from the back office internal audit department rather than the 'hollywood glamour circle' we was expecting...not a big deal but surprising. Food...I love fusion (think Zuma, Nobu and Wabi) and was expecting a lot. Sorry to say the food disappointed. It was edible, but more along the lines of a well run Yo Sushi (like that of Harvey Nics - which I love for the right occasion.) The drinks were better. Try the Sambatini. In summary, start your evening here, but maybe line something else up for dinner.

title: Unexpectedly great food
comment: I went to SushiSamba a few weeks back with a large work group. An amazing space and view. Packed to the rafters (we were there early, like 5pm on a Wednesday). It is like the 80s never ended - City types necking pricey cocktails and snacks in the bar, and tables were never empty. We ordered lots of little things. I was expecting ok-to-not-nice food, after seeing some reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised. Sushi was fresh and tasty. I especially loved little taquitos made with minced raw tuna and jalapeno - crunchy, spicy, and fresh. Also great was robata black cod, perfectly done, like pats of butter on a stick. Wagyu beef dumplings were a little greasy and heavy but overall, great food. And very efficient and friendly service. Downside was price - we got away for just under £100 a head - but granted we did eat ourselves silly and had many cocktails. We overstayed our three hour time slot but no one urged us on. SS is a fun night out, especially if someone else is paying.

title: View to die for! Rude unhelpful manager and miserable unhelpful staff!
comment: Couldn't wait to go to this bar. Rang the day before to see what time was best as I understood that it gets very busy with diners and we just wanted cocktails. The info service said to get there before 630 or after 930. We arrived at 430 only to be told by the doorman that they were busy and we would have to wait till 5 when the second floor opened. We waited in the pouring rain and chilling wind to enter even though the lobby entrance was empty. Eventually we entered the lift.... Which is a wow, zoomed up in seconds to the 38 floor. Fantastic view of London. The bar very edgy and colourful, couldn't see the restaurant a you are not allowed to view unless you are eating. Very disappointing! The view is absolutely what people go for. Nice cocktails but nothing really under a tenner. We were going to order a bar snack of sushi of 7 pieces but as it was over 50 quid decided against it. There isn't many places to sit mainly side seating. I asked the barman if we could sit in a room that I found just off of the bar. He said yes so we moved to go into the room then was very rudely told by the manager that we couldn't......... What a very rude man he was..... I am sure the success of this place is absolutely not due to his managing or customer care skills. In fact many of the staff had an attitude problem except for our waitress, she was lovely! This place is defiantly worth a visit but take plenty of money especially if you want to eat. The surroundings are great but I can't help thinking if it wasnt where it was with the view that it has it wouldn't be so popular and the staff would have to try harder. I do think this place would have been much more enjoyable if the staff had a more welcoming persona. It doesn't feel wam and inviting. It's the view that draws people in! Don't think I will be going back and would warn people who were thinking of going what to expect.

title: Wow
comment: Wow location and food. Lift ride to the 38th floor exhilarating, with amazing views over London. We had seen luke warm reviews but restaurant highly recommended by friends. We were not disappointed. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the staff made it very special. Our first time eating sushi and staff took there time to run through the menu. Food was wonderful as was the overall experience. Will go again and recommend to friends.

title: Great views, Food Superb
comment: I love SS in London. The waiters are friendly, the decor is nice, and the views are stunning. Great terraces on either side with ample space. Even in the cold, the fires are lit and blankets are available. The food at SS is a limited menu but we have enjoyed multiple times. The cocktails are delicious - the chucumber being one of my favourites. A great spot to have just a drink, or a full on evening.

title: mind blowing
comment: well...where to start...the lift up to the restaurant/bar gets you excited. Then on arrival at the bar the view is superb and the cocktail menu is extremely varied. After a couple of drinks you ascend further to the restaurant. Try to get a table by the edge next to windows for full effect of the view. The menu is top notch and although pricey the quality is obvious to the palet. Id recommend the monkfish and black cod skewer. Obviously pricey but you get what you pay for

title: Food with a Twist
comment: I was looking for a sushi joint to take my partner for his Birthday and came across SS. Asked around and had mixed reviews. So visited yesterday and was amazed. The place is very busy, and why not, if possible I would also want to eat there every day. I am so glad to have visited SS. The food was just amazing, right quantity and I feel worth the spend. The SS team specially was so friendly and made us comfortable right from the start. Special mention to Julien who took special care of not just us, but every one he was responsible for The order came faster than we thought and tasted great.Finally the thoughtful team brought Japanese Ice cream cakes to celebrate the birthday, This place just became one of our favorite joints.Thanks for the yummy food and wow experience. P:S: The lift ride up and down was mind blowing..:)

title: OMG!
comment: Sushisamba is an amazing place- the views are stunning and the food is delicious! It is the perfect spot for a special occasion- it is a bit pricey but worth trying! We also tried the bar on the top and the cocktails are delicious!

title: Excellent food amazing setting!
comment: Went several Times. Great service, high quality extravagant sushi and best view over london. Not easy to find a table.

title: Wow
comment: Having read other reviews I was hesitant in booking a meal here. Thankfully I listened to my daughter Amy, who encouraged me to book. This place is not just a fabulous restaurant, but a fabulous experience. From the moment the lift rockets you up 38 floors, to the incredible views round London. Every single member of staff was pleasant and welcoming. Our waiter (from Lithuania) was very pleasant and informative, without being overbearing. The recommendations and advice about the food and wine were very accurate and didn't disappoint. The starter, Green bean Tempura, had us off to a great start, delicious. I had Moqueta & my daughter had Chilean Seabass for our main. Again both were delicious. The sweet was Yuzu tart for me & Mango mousse for Amy. Beautiful. All washed down with a bottle of Johnson Sauvignon Blanc. Mmmmmmm. If you want a night out with a WOW factor this is defiantly worth considering.  If you can find fault here you need to stay in more!! This is a top recommendation from myself and my daughter. Do it.

title: Amazing food with an incredible view
comment: Went to Sushi Samba for my boyfriends birthday. Got there at lunchtime & enjoyed some cocktails whilst admiring the view before sitting down for food.  We were sat by the window with views over to Canary Wharf, the waiter was really helpful & went through the menu with us and recommended various dishes.  We shared some starters - tempura green beans, yellow fin tuna sushi & salmon rolls. For the main we had fillet steak strips cooked on the bbq and baby monkfish tail. The first monkfish tail cake out luke warm so we asked for it to be sent back & the chefs cooked us a fresh one which came out perfectly fine & it tasted incredible!! The waiter gave us a glass of wine on the house & took off the price of the starter & side dishes which was a nice gesture.  A really nice restaurant with great food would definitely recommend a visit!

title: The Perfect Place to Celebrate...
comment: I went here for my Birthday and could not have asked for a more perfect evening! SushiSamba boasts incredible views, not only from the bar and restaurant but also from the lift, which I have to admit was one of the best parts! The food was incredible and service was quick, very helpful at explaining the menu and our waiter made sure that all of our needs were seen to.  It has a very chic atmosphere and the design is modern and fun, great for any occasion, birthdays, client hosting or even just a cocktail admiring the view.  I wanted something swish and sophisticated for my birthday and this was both of those and more, I would definitely recommend going here, make sure you go outside and see the tree and views because they are breathtaking.  The menu may seem daunting at first if you are not used to Sushi, however everything was delicious and the waiters are so helpful if you don't know what something is just ask!  SushiSamba is a great fun, young and chic place, very Sex and The City!

title: Slightly overated.
comment: Worth a visit but don't get your hopes up. Four of us went and had a table booked for 7.30pm. We arrived at 6.30 for some pre dinner drinks and it took us over 20 minutes to get served.  At 7.30 we were then told our table would not be ready until at least 8pm witjout an apology.  On the plus side the food was good but not good enough for me to consider going back.

title: Amazing views
comment: Lovely meal, certainly not the best I've had but the atmosphere and views made up for any shortfalls. Beautiful place, well worth a visit. Outside terrace was stunning so I imagine the summer there will be fabulous

title: Great location
comment: The location is great on the top of one of the highest buildings in London. Ambience is very good . Service is good but could be better for the price they charge. Overall experience is very good but would go there occasionally

title: An experience beyond just food
comment: This was one of the most beautiful restaurants we've ever been. The food, the drinks, the staff and the view are brilliant! Don't forget to ask for Rafael, the most amazing somelier, he'll take you through a sake adventure, you will never forget! We're definitely coming back before we leave London.

title: Good restaurant - no complaints - service was great
comment: We were unlucky enough to go for lunch on a snowy, opaque day so the vaunted view did not materialize. However, the upwardly swirling snow was an interesting variation. Food was small-ish portions but good, and, although not cheap, in no way extortionate. Kim was a friendly and attentive waitress. We arrived very early (1.15 when our table was for 2.45 pm) and when we asked for a table, we were immediately seated. No long waits, we enjoyed the experience, especially the view of the Gherkin and the lift ride. The other diners were varied, mixed groups, business groups and couples, and the atmosphere was very pleasant.

title: Great food with fantastic views of the city
comment: I booked this table for a special occasion with my partner. The restaurant is on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower which gives you great views over the city. Great cocktails at the bar with fantastic views while we waited for our table, the cocktails are expensive but they don't skimp on the ingredients and they are very well made.  We had a table next to the windows so could really appreciate the views while enjoying some of the best sushi I have ever had in London. I can (and have) thoroughly recommended this restaurant especially if you want to make an impression for a special occasion.

title: Worth a visit
comment: A wonderful lunch...very tasty food served at a leisurely pace so that all the flavours could be appreciated. The sushi rolls were exquisite and waiters both helpul and knowledgable without being overbearing. We visited as a family during a lunch hour frequented by 'city gents' and did not feel in any way out of place. A delicious meal that was not extortionate given the location and the quality.

title: Incredible view with fresh and exciting food
comment: It is difficult to beat this location and it's worth a visit just for the view, but the food is just as exciting. Had been to sushisamba in New York (park) before, which was interesting, but not that memorable - this one is much much better. Very fresh, amazing colours and flavour combinations and lovely location. Staff a little bit too formal for my liking, but not all of them and just a minor thing. Highly recommend this and would rate it over the upstairs restaurant the duck and waffle

title: Bit of experience on a different level
comment: As other reviewers mentioned, the spot itself is great, seeing the city from the top is an extraordinary experience, specially if that is accompanied by great food. Service wasn't as impeccable as I could have imagined, but we were in a good company and they were topping up the wine when needed so it didn't bother us much. All in all, 4 out of 5.

title: Amazing View on Top of Amazing food
comment: Having read some reviews, My Partner wasnt sure whether to book it or not, it was a surprise date. Which went amazingly well. We were put by the window. Which was just amazing, the waiter was lovely, he came and explained the menu to us, gave us his recommendations and left us to it. Our food came out in time, it wasnt a lengthy wait. My partner ordered the duck, I ordered the calamari, some starters etc. food tasted amazing, the duck was cooked perfectly (even though they didnt ask us how we wanted it) The cocktails great. I like the touch of sugar cane on the side.  You should all definitely visit, we missed our reservations and another table was available 15minutes later, even though we did go on a Sunday. The restaurant was full, but not noisy.  Probably one of the best I have been to in a while.  Pleased and will be returning very soon

title: Good service, but felt very rushed
comment: I booked dinner here with my husband fr his birthday. The staff generally seem quite aloof, although our waiter was the exception to the rule and was very friendly and helpful. The food was very tasty, and cocktails were ok, but I'm not sure any of it was absolutely outstanding and warranted the prices.  Biggest disappointment was the distinct feeling we were being rushed and the only thing of importance to the staff was turning the tables.  The views are definitely amazing but I wouldn't be rushing back there.

title: Very Poor Service & V.Expensive
comment: We had this lunch booked in for months and having previously had drinks there was really looking forward to eating here as the location and views are second to none. However overall we were very disappointed. There were 7 of us and whilst in places like this the food comes out at different times, we were literally getting one plate at a time meaning some of us were waiting about 20 minutes between each small plate shared between 7. Some of the prices as well were eye raising for such small quantity. The funniest moment for us however was when one of our party told one of the staff the toilet had run out of hand towels - so she passed him a stack of hand towels and asked him to go back in and put them in there himself. They did knock us off a decent amount on the bill however they shouldn't have had to if the service had been up to scratch. Whilst the food was of good quality when it came and the views are amazing, the service was as bad as I've seen in a long time and having been to places like Hakasan and Zuma before, this place just doesn't get close.

title: FANTASTIC - and WHAT A VIEW
comment: From the start, the all experience is special from the elevator to the restaurant, the decoration. Staff was helpful and food. Drinks a bit pricey, but understanable when you see the location. Best bar of London to bring foreign Friends...

title: Great food, good place- eye watering if you're paying the bill though!
comment: We came for a late lunch (3pm) and had a great time. We had a great waiter who was very professional yet laid back.   Some of the food was to die for- ceviche, fillet steak, the sashimi to name but a few. The only duff dish was the prawn tempura, which lacked the lightness of touch you would normally expect in a good restaurant. Instead the batter was chewy and glutinous.  Not cheap though! If you're hosting get ready for a decently sized bill!  Finally, the view- with the Shard waiting for its first restaurants and bars next month, this is still be best meal with a view in London!

title: Lovely night out
comment: A lovely meal out. The food is amazing, the view is stunning and the atmosphere is great. We all really enjoyed the chicken and black Cod. The eggplant was also very tasty. The service is also brilliant but it is not a cheap night out.

title: London at its worst - ridiculously pretentious with awful service
comment: My boyfriend took me here as a treat after hearing a buzz about the place and the fantastic view. We arrived early and it was a Tuesday night. It was busy but not that busy but on average it took us 15 minutes to get drinks..twice!! This was really frustrating as the bar area was not crowded but clearly there were not enough people serving. Regardless of the fact we had to wait, we were then slapped with a service charge on Both occasions when we went to the bar! Service for what?!! The bartender hadn't even poured our bottle of wine! We had a table booked for 9.30pm. After constantly asking if it was ready and being told 'in a miunte' we were seated at 10pm!! This really isn't acceptable when you have booked a table in advance..on a Tuesday night!  The blonde American girl on the desk couldn't care less and was too busy chatting to her friend even though the table situation was clearly out of hand (a lot of other diners were also waiting). When we got inside the service improved and the waiters tried to make amends. But after being told we would be looked after by one person, they seemed to change over and it all felt quite false as they clearly didn't care about the customer. The food just summed up the whole evening - average food, dressed up to be something else. Some dishes were better than others but everything seemed to be quite obviously pretentious. It is pretty pricey and I think if Sushisamba don't sort out their service, customers will go elsewhere. For the same amount of money you can have Michelin starred cuisine with exceptional service. They may have the view but they need to start living up to their expectations.

title: Overall a good experience
comment: Our visit late last night was a bit of a mixed bag in terms of experience, but overall I felt that I enjoyed the visit.  We were in a nearby pub and decided to swing by to see if we could get into the lounge and have a drink or two. First we turned up at about 9.30 pm and the queue seemed quite long. I asked the security guy how long the wait would roughly be, to which he said he didn't know (although later that night he miraculously developed the ability to estimate the waiting time to other people who asked. Perhaps I got him at a wrong time). So we left and went back to the pub, had more drinks, returned just before 11 pm, and queued for about 30-35 mins. Not too bad (without reservation) but it was a bit frustrating, especially when we saw so many people trying to blag their way in. The lady who managed the queue was nice, though.  We got to the lounge, and the view was incredible. Minus points - long wait to get any drinks at the bar, and many people there were quite drunk. This created a rather downmarket atmosphere. We decided to ask if we could get a table at the restaurant proper (there is a sushi bar in the lounge, but the place was too loud/busy). The ladies at the restaurant reception table were very nice, and luckily they got us a table after 20 mins wait (then again, this was already 11.30 pm).  We ordered 3 dishes to share - one ceviche (about £12, nice seasoning, unfortunately some pieces of the fish were slightly tough and sinewy), one salmon roll (about £12. very nice. no complaints there), and grilled chicken teriyaki skewers (£8 for 2 skewers I think, decent enough. not best teriyaki I've tasted. Although boasting organic chicken, the taste of the chicken itself was rather lacking). The portion sizes were on the small-ish side. It was a light late-night grazing which knocked us back about £50 (no alcoholic drinks, just a bottle of fizzy water to share). But we knew the sort of price you can expect from this place before we decided to go, so no surprise there. Giles Coren (the food critic) reckons you pay more premiums the higher the restaurant is located. I think that is quite true.  But the overall experience was very pleasant. The service was good throughout our meal. The view was fantastic, and the food, overall, was very decent. Personally I wouldn't choose this place based purely on the quality of the food, but perhaps for the combinations of things. For me it's the view which tips the scale.

title: Incredible!
comment: I didn't actually eat here, just came for drinks, but the experience was utterly brilliant! The views and decor are stunning, and the cocktails are delicious. I want to say a particular thank you to the staff. I feel over on the stairs (distracted by the view!) and smashed up my drinks, and the staff were lovely, checking I was alright, and then replacing the drinks for free! I was really touched by this, so thank you! I will certainly be coming back, hopefully to eat next time, as the food looked incredible!

title: Wow
comment: This was a WOW experience. The view, the food, and the service were all excellent. Service with a smile! Great selection of sake and the red chili chocolate desert was to die for.... Best espresso in town...Will certainly return and look forward to the SushiSamba Amsterdam! Mona & Michiel

title: Terrible service would not recommend!
comment: Went for a drink in the bar with friends, we were left waiting to be served for over half an hour which was unacceptable considering the bar wasn't even that busy! Staff not particularly friendly/ accommodating. Fantastic views however bar lacked atmosphere and space felt awkward! Views are worth seeing but wouldn't rush back anytime soon!

title: Capital Restaurant in the Capital City
comment: Was this worth the 3 month wait? Yes. Absolutely. I went with 4 friends for my birthday and loved it. The joyride starts (quite literally) in the glass elevator which zips you up 38 floors with effortless speed. Once inside, you walk along a dark, wooden corridor (wondering what on earth to expect) and emerge somewhat elated on top of London. The feeling does not go down. We were quickly whisked to our seats and the waiter was on hand to welcome us and take a drinks order. He (the waiter) asked if this was our first time (it was) and took time to tell us a little bit about the place. The time was about 6pm and the restaurant was about half full so this was very much appreciated. The food was incredible (providing you like that, steak on a skewer, raw fish thing) and came quickly. It was on the expensive side, however, this is London, in a niche restaurant in a location with a difference. Expect the prices to reflect that. Anything wrong with it? Well, having a bit more time there (we'd been given a time slot) would've been nicer but alas all was not lost as we slipped down the lift and into the nearest bar. Having said this, I would definitely go back: good food with incredible views with great service. I had a great birthday - this was one of the reasons why - many thanks.

title: Will definitely be going back!
comment: My husband and I went yesterday for an early dinner (4.30pm) and had a fantastic time from start to finish. All the tables for 2 are seated by the window which was handy! Our waiter (the guy from Lithuania incase Sushi Samba read this!) was so helpful and friendly, he made it a better experience for us. The food was delicious and the Shiso Fine cocktail is my new favourite drink. The place was very busy and the only wait we had was for our second round of drinks but the manager came over and gave them to us for free as an apology, that was a nice touch. We loved the tempura prawn, wagyu goyza, black cod and samba London sushi. Can't wait to go back and have it all again. The terrace will be amazing in the warmer weather.  The upstairs bar has a DJ and opens at 7pm and we would have stayed but left at 6.15pm to meet friends, when we got downstairs there was already quite a queue forming for the bar. Reading previous reviews I don't think I'd go when there is a set price menu or tasting menu but more than happy to go again like we did yesterday.

title: horrible service
comment: not my first time there , but definitely the last one , we were there waiting to order the food until a waiter told us after 15 minutes that the kitchen was already close , we ask to talk to the manager but nobody gave us an answer

title: What a treat with stunning views over London
comment: This restaurant is on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower in the city of London so the glass tower lift ride itself is quite an event. I was invited here by a client who despite booking in advance could only get a reservation at 11.30am on a Thursday. The restaurant is like a big glass box (there is also seating outside in the summer) but yet the way it is decorated inside meant that it didnt feel soulless. The views over London are stunning so for me a really fun, funky special place to come to especially if the weather is good. The food was wonderful too and not too expensive considering where you are. There was plenty of choice. The waiters are helpful as the menu could be a bit confusing ie there's sushi but also south american dishes. Our food was excellent, beautifully presented and the portion size was perfect. It would be very easy to spend the whole afternoon there. Sushi Samba and the Gerkin nearby must be the best places to eat in the city if you want great food together with stunning views

title: Terrific!!!!
comment: The location is amazing, the food perfect, the staff in particular Patrick and Mathew so smart! The view incredible, not only from the window but also the special girl in front of me... GREAT NIGHT!

title: amazing sushi, beautiful location...on the pricey side
comment: The location is amazing....a high rise tower on bishopgate...restaurant and bar on the 38th floor and bar on the 39th. Amazing terrace where to sit and have a drink in summer and winter time, unless windy. I typically take rolls, some of them really unusual and tasty and they are not particulary expensive. Some other food as well as wine are a bit overpriced (for london as well) but the bars have cocktails at fair price. In addition, really cool atmopshere with music and lots of people. The bars can be packed but the restaurant is always very enjoyable. Booking is needed and you can book from their website and even if fully booked you can always try to find a last minute table on the given day at around 3pm.

title: Buzzy with Great Views
comment: The cuisine here is a blend of Peruvian, Brazilian and Japanese with a variety of small plates to mix and share plus a few larger main course size dishes. Sashimi, Ngiri and Rolls all feature, plus a range of offerings cooked on the Robata grill. It is an exciting and extensive menu and the food looks very tempting. We were going to go for a range of small tasting plates but the sight of the Churrasco Rio Grande, a mixed plate of Wagyu Picanha, Ribeye and Chorizo with dips changed our minds. It wasn't as good as it looked unfortunately. Good, but not amazing beef. Thoroughly enjoyed our selection of tasting plates though and an assiette for pudding was fantastic. Service was attentive and fun, we were blessed with a real character from Tuscany who provided a laugh as well as good service. The restaurant interior is trendy and airy but not a particularly thrilling design, I guess they figure the views provide the glory. And they do. Sushisamba occupies the 38th floor of Heron Tower so the views are far reaching and there are outdoor areas for soaking these up on sunnier days. It is an enjoyable environment and buzzes with atmosphere. Our wine wasnt adequately chilled which is unforgiveable at these mark ups but this was rectified satisfactorily. The bill soon racks up here, expect to hit £100 a head if you are going for it and enjoy a drop of wine and cocktails.

title: The place to be in London!
comment: The food was excellent, the menu is a great mix of sushi and south american cuisine. Everything was tasty. The view is awesome, and the design great. What else to stay. Book in advance as this place is very hip!!

title: Concerned then Convinced
comment: Having heard many good reviews about Sushi Samba we were really looking forward to going there, we waited until friends were in from Overseas, we wanted a special evening with "Lord and Lady W" ( they are very fussy). As soon as we arrived we knew we had a problem Lord W is not good with heights ( I did not know that ) so the very fast glass lift on the outside of the building was an interesting white knuckle ride for him. Anyway upon arrival at the bar greeters desk there was "no greeter" so we hung around until after a couple of minutes she arrived, we gave our reservation details and as we were early decided to get a drink at the bar. Unfortunately the outdoor TreeBar was closed, as it was very cold, the inside bar was simply a mess, not enough seating, and the bar layout is so badly designed. We eventually got served by the barman who was the love child of Mr Miserable and Mrs Slow. taking about 8 minutes to make 4 drinks without any acknowledgement of others waiting for drinks around us. The bar was busy ( but not packed) with people that looked as if they were simply trying to get out of the cold, coats and the days shopping all over the place. The bar clientele were very young and casual, I was beginning to get concerned that we ( Mid 40's) were in the wrong place. Anyway our table was ready for us on time, and the very nice restaurant hostess came to collect us just in time, and then..........WOW, quite simply what a difference, the restaurant is amazing. Immediately the welcome and service impressed ( thanks Martin ), we were given menus, advised of the shared dining concept and recommended a few options. Yes I could list everything we ate, but quite simply the food was excellent, evrything was fresh, tasty and well presented, even the desserts were fab. Sure it is not cheap, but we enjoyed ourselves and would go back, just not to the bar.

title: Come for the Views, the Customer Service & the Food – all amazing
comment: I was invited by two friends of mine, told to meet at Heron Tower at 5.45pm, tight so like normal I arrive early, see it’s call Sushi Samba and I don’t do Sushi and then I see the glass lifts (elevators) and go – no way! So I begin to text my friend and for about 40 mins or trying to get in to the lift I just feel sick. OK so upstairs the manager is getting a little uneasy as the table had a later booking, he went to my friends to check where the last of the party was, he was told what was wrong and said no problem. He had a message sent to me that one of the staff would bring me up in the ‘service lift’. I also met Drew Peterson, the General Manager, in the lift area who advised that if no one showed in 5 to have the door guy radio up. They did show up and escort me upstairs in the service lift – with some slagging and jokes it was fine.  Boy was it worth the ride, the views were unreal and the ambiance was electric. Ouw waiter, sorry forgot his name, was great – he was informed that two did not do sushi and all of us liked meat. The menu’s was taken away and I have to say the food kept coming, dish and dish was better each time, the taste the freshness were all fantastic. I really enjoyed the Black Cod, the lamb, the prawns just brilliant.  The staff were extremely attentive in every way and not in your face at all. We had a night cap at the bar and the outside bar taking in all the views and then they had to get me down again. For London this was amazing food and customer service. I would say that Drew, the GM and Romain Pottier, the Restaurant General Manager, they have a really excellent product offering and the staff to match. I’m sorry I don’t remember the waiter or the maître d' who escorted me to the restaurant but they were so accommodating and provided a fantastic night with great wine and food. As others said it’s pricy but it’s London and I thought it was great value. I will be returning.

title: Too expensive - go only if you got a hefty bonus today
comment: The location is amazing The view incredible. However this was my 1st and last visit to this place which is pricey as the height of tower. Once seated, we waited ages to get the menu, had to ask numerous times and that was a sign of things to come.. rude waiter, didn't explain any of the dishes to the guests, huffed and puffed, had to continuously wait for ages to re-order, completely ignored us, his explanation was something along the lines of "very busy tonight and you're not the only guests". This might one of the most expensive place in London. They did make a couple of mistakes (brought us wrong dish twice) but that was ok. But it was incredibly expensive £100 per person! he clientele was not great, a mixture of city boys and very down market trendy types. Some of the dishes were confused.

title: Great for a special occasion
comment: I had been eagerly waiting the opening of sushi samba london, when it did I like many others got on to the two month waiting list to get a booking for a Saturday night which is usually virtually impossible! The day finally arrived, the view from the bar area is phenomenon, our booking was for 7pm, unfortunately before we had arrived there was a private event at the venue which had run over time, we were kept waiting for over half an hour...once we were finally shown to our table there was a lot of hustle and bustle of the waiting staff still mopping and cleaning etc ( not a great atmosphere to start off with!) after all the cleaning etc had been sorted there was a more relaxed ambiance and we had a very enjoyable evening, the food was delicious as well as the drinks. We also had a great waiter who was full of recommendations from the menu!...It is pricey so I would recommend going for an occasion.

title: Too many people in the bar, but great food!
comment: Visited the restaurant for valentines day and the food was incredible. It's just a shame they didn't really seem to mind how many people was in the bar/restaurant. It seemed too busy and took 20 minutes to get served a drink. But the food was incredible and I will definitely be visiting again. I'm putting the high volume of people down to the fact it was valentines day.

title: Fantastic
comment: Went to sushi samba for dinner on 25 Feb. The atmosphere was great, the place was packed on a Monday night, very diverse crowd, the food was absolutely brilliant.
