We ordered some sashimi, chicken anticuchos, and the churrasco rio grande with some sides, everything was delicious. The service was spot-on, cordial but not in your face.  Perfect for dinner, the views are breathtaking! I cant wait to go back to sushi samba.

title: Extremely Disappointing
comment: At first i called to book a table for four people on a sunday night for my birthday, i was left on hold for over an hour with no response. I therefore emailed the restaurant for a booking, and asked them if there was any form of entertainment/music available on sundays (as it was mothers day) also information about the venue because i have never been before, i received a reply for the booking, but they failed to answer my question about the entertainment/restaurant. The email said they will call me back on the Saturday to confirm the booking which they did not. As i arrived on the Sunday evening, i was greeted at the door by the host, she informed us that i only have the table for 2 hours. a waiter than took me took our table, i was disappointed as this restaurant is located on the 38th floor, and supposed to have a fantastic view, however our table was far away from the window and in fact the layout of the restaurant unless one is sitting by the window you cant see anything. I felt extremely rushed by one of the waiters who did not give us a chance to look at the menu, as soon as we sat down he asked for drinks, i explained that my partner is in the bathroom, and i need to look at the cocktail list, but he was very persistent. upon the waiters return he explained that the food is a taster menu, which involved small portions to share! the restaurant failed to inform me about this when i booked, and i dont recall seeing this on there website. the waiter again was very persistent to take our order, i did not feel comfortable in fact i found it rather rude. The food was average, the sushi did not taste fresh rather refrigerated, the waiter also forgot bits of our order, i can understand if it was busy however it was a causal sunday evening with not alot of customers, i dont understand why our exact table was booked, as it does not have a fantastic view and there are 4 other exact tables empty behind us.The waiter decided to take upon him self to add dishes to my order which i did not ask for ! and specified i do not want. of course when i called him over to explain with attitude he told me he will remove one dish from the bill. As soon as the last dish was removed from the table the waiter asked us for dessert, i could barely take a second to breathe. I told him i wish to wait slightly. My partner wanted to surprise me with a birthday dessert, and informed the waiter from the beginning o the evening. we ordered the sharing dessert, which are small samples of all the dessert menu. Not nice at all! i did not enjoy even one of them, also my partner was disappointed that they did not even bother to put a candle on my dessert as he requested. The bill came very quickly before the dessert was removed, even though i still had more than 20 min for my table. it was very expensive for what we had. after all i left hungry and disappointed that the waiter was rude, and rushing us! we informed the host about him, and how they did not get my birthday dessert. she said they will remove the service charge but did not in the end! I am very disappointed in the service and overall experience, it ruined my birthday! and i will not recommend sushi samba to anyone and will not be returning.

title: Amazing view and food
comment: I took my husband here for his birthday earlier this week. We were given a lovely table by the window with a great view of London. The waiters were great, really enthusiastic and made our experience there enjoyable. As vegetarians, a sushi restaurant is not always the best choice, but there were plenty of veggie options for us. Food was brought our quickly and was incredible. We were too full for dessert but the waiters still brought out a complimentary dessert with a candle on it, a nice touch and end to our meal. The cocktails are great too. The only downside it that it is quite pricey! For this reason, I probably wouldn't go back.

title: Best Sushi Experience
comment: We were invited by a friend who has become a regular with his colleagues. I must admit I was a never a big fan of sushi only because it's raw. This place however changed my view completely and I realised that as with everything it depends where you go. All the dishes were excellent with the duck risotto and lobster scoring full marks. The wine was recommended by the superb waiter from Malta and turned out to be one of the best I've tried. The deserts are to die for and the whole vibe and ambience is super. The view is the icing on the cake and it was about time for a good restaurant to combine good food with a view and not just relax on its view as a selling point. You can literally see the whole of London and going at night makes all the difference. Considering there is not that many places offering views from above in London this place is worth the whole experience. We went on a week day in order to avoid all the troubles with reservation timings and it paid of as we were sat fairly quickly. If you are asked to wait you can try the bar and gaze at London for a while but the drinks are on the pricy side.

title: Great food served in great surroundings, but also pricey
comment: The combination of Japanese Food and Brazilian Food sounds a bit odd at first, but it actually works extremely well. The food is really good, the service is excellent, and in addition to the nice views the restaurant has a nice ambience to it. It's a pricey restaurant, dinner for two will easily cost £200, but it is a worthwhile experience.

title: First Impressions Count
comment: Didn't eat here but when we reached 38th floor at 4 o'clock in the afternoon, we were not acknowledged by any staff (at least three staff walked right by us) and the sky lounge on 39th floor was roped off so we couldn't have a look up there. If staff had acknowledged us then we may have had a drink and some food but if sushisamba can't be bothered to show any signs of customer service then we can't be bothered to patronise their establishment. Pity, because views are amazing. The bar and restaurant on the 38th floor actually looked surprisingly tacky and cheap looking. We were expecting something fairly swish considering the prices being charged. Just because you have a fantastic location does not mean you can ignore the basics particularly when it comes to showing some courtesy to your clients. These comments do not apply to the young lady at the lift entrance who was very helpful, friendly and courteous.

title: Amazing views & amazing food
comment: I loved my late lunch in SushiSamba. Attentive waiter, delicious fusion food, high end & worth every penny. The decor is simply fabulous!

title: Mischarging at sushisamba
comment: A great restaurant and food but you need to watch the staff very carefully when it comes to your bill. I ordered a bottle of champagne for myself and two friends at the bar. It says £65 on the menu however to take the bottle out of the fridge, open it and put in an ice bucket will cost you an £8 service charge apparently. This was the same in the restaurant when the waiter gave us some tempura beans with a dip which he said was complimentary later we discovered they had added this to our bill, and it didn't stop there, the waiter also offered us three glasses of wine which also later appeared on our bill. We queried it and it was taken off. But it seems to me that all the staff there are encouraged to fleece you as much as possible at the bar and in the restaurant, that said the food was very good and the view amazing but just keep an eye on your bill and only pay for what you have asked for.

title: For business or special occasion
comment: Went here for a birthday slash business lunch. First of the all, the setting is amazing. Based on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower, it is a fantastic location and the views stunning. Service was not bad but they do push for you to have at least 5 to 7 dishes. We actually found that 4 was enough between the two of us. I suppose the waiting staff are told to try and sell as much as possible. They weren't pushy but did mention it 3 or 4 times when we ordered. The food was really nice. One of the best pork belly dishes I have ever had and the sushi London and sushi Tokyo were both also very good. It is pricey but because of the location it is worth going to at least once to try.

title: WOW
comment: Visited the bar here on a very busy friday night for a few birthday drinks. The venue is stunning and offers amazing views of London. The bar staff were very friendly and accomodating. I would definately recommend this place and cannot wait to go back

title: Nice evening out but don't believe the waiters/cloakroom attendant
comment: We enjoyed our meal but be warned, the waiter will suggest you get 5-7 "small plates" between 2 but the plates aren't that small so 4 is fine. The waiter will also try to get you to buy a saki drink and will try to make you get a bottle. No need. We also had some problems in the cloak room which was attended buy a woman who kept insisting that we had not handed items in because she couldn't see them (coat was on the floor). Never got a pair of gloves back and it seems to be impossible to speak to anyone by telephone. Apart from that, we did really enjoyed the food. The pork belly is lovely. And the bar is fun with a good DJ. Lovely views obviously. If Sushisamba read this, please find our gloves and call me back. Much appreciated!

title: great view poor service
comment: wow what a thrill to ride the lift, what high expectations you have after getting past the door staff. what a shame that the staff seem indifferent and can't provide you with the correct sake and serve cold edemame. its a great place to chill for a quiet drink on a sunday lunch or saturday morning coffee. but don't bother for an evening meal or even think about a thursday or friday evening.

title: Amazing food, great view and excellent service
comment: We visited SushiSamba for my husband's birthday after hearing lots of good reports. The mix of Brazilian and Japanese food was very tasty. Rich and fresh. Our waiter explained that the menu was like a tasting menu and we should order 5-7 plates... we only needed 4.  The blackened cod and the Yellowtail were my favourites along with the Samba London samba roll selection. The only item we weren't keen on was the El Topo which was salmon jalapeño and mozzarella .... melted cheese on sushi didn't feel right. The view was immense why go to The Shard this place has a spectacular view.

title: fussion japanese sushi, brazilian and peru food
comment: you want fashion fusion food in a young and fresh atmosphere, go to sushisamba. you want traditional sushi, do not go. this is just about fashion food. food ok, not great, a little expensive for what they offer. the terrace is great on good weather.

title: Fantastic food and service
comment: A lift catapults you 38 floors in about 8 secs, we headed straight out to the most beautiful terrace its centrepiece being a large leaved oak tree lit by hundreds to tiny orange lights, stunning. Feeling like I was on holiday in New York, we quaffed a nice bottle of Bodgas 5 for a reasonable £20, sat outside on our first day of spring. The dining room was ilt by a thousand naked lightbulb that reflected through the windows, floating like a lake of lights we sat next to a window and marvelled at our view, both Antonio and Julian lour waiters, looked after our every need. The food was sublime, and the strange combination of Brazilian tapas and Japanese sushi worked well, we had the jalapeno peppers and tempura green beans with truffled ailoi to start, divine. The black bean cod and yellowfin tuna where gorgeous, as were our sushi rolls. It isnt cheap here but its worth every penny, we retired back to the terrace totally relaxed and in seventh heaven, for just one more glass, you too wont want to leave!

title: Great!
comment: Great food, great service. Will definitely return again. Rob.. etc etc etc etc etc wetc etc etc wtxc betc etc etc etc

title: Best views of London
comment: Sushi Samba is a very hip and happening place with views that are amazing right across the whole of London from the 38 / 39 floor of the Heron Building. The bar is excellent and its a great venue for a drink and the fusion of Sushi and Brazilian works really well.  An excellent venue destination for a special night, but keep an eye on that bar bill. As this is obviously a popular venue I would suggest booking so you aren't stood outside in the line.

title: Amazing setting, good sushi, not so great hot food and average service
comment: The setting is amazing with some of the best views over London out there. The bar's within the restaurant serve some really good cocktails at not so stupid prices. We were originally told that we would have to wait over an house for the table which we had booked in advance; this is not acceptable for what is meant to be a high class restaurant. The sushi that we ordered at the table within the main restaurant was very good and unusual and tasted very fresh. However the hot food that we had ordered I did not rate very highly with some of it tasting like it was from a take away lunch place in town. However with the negatives put aside the restaurant and experience as a whole is quite good and very enjoyable but more because of the location rather than anything else.

title: Awful night
comment: I've been to Sushi Samba several times before and have enjoyed the food and view. The waiter at my last dinner was fantastic and very attentive. I regret to say that last nights experience has left me not wanting to return to Sushi Samba again which is a shame as I really like the food. We booked our table 8 weeks in advance as we were going there for a special occasion dinner.  We were misinformed several times about the status of our table and had to wait over an hour to be seated (by the kitchen).  The service was extremely slow resulting in us having to leave the restaurant at 12.05am without even receiving our main courses.  We were truly disappointed with the poor service and the fact that we had to wait over an hour for a table by the kitchen without a view (even though it was booked 8 weeks ago).

title: A perfect meal!
comment: Not only is the view spectacular but so is the food! We had been to Duck and Waffle in the same building which we loved...I was concerned it couldn't be as perfect but they proved me wrong. We loved every bite!  The funny thing is that they're open 24 hrs. a day...seems odd but yes..we were there for dinner and yummy it was!

title: Its new so its cool
comment: Had 6pm reservation, could not get any later, think you need to book two months in advance. The building also house Duck and Waffle. The central bar serves both restaurants, if you want drinks only, you need to be there before 5pm or after 9pm, between those times they give priority to the diners. Wasn't impressed with the service at the bar, female waitress seemed to be doing all the work while the male waiters just chatted among themselves. Fancied a glass of red, they only had two on the menu and both were equally not great. Thank goodness when we got the restaurant itself things started to improve. We decided to try seven different things, all amazing except the squid which was rubbery and overcooked. We started with the rock shrimp and the wagyu gyoza both delicious. We then went onto sashimi and tried the tiradito trio nothing amazing its sashimi so it does what it says on the tin. From the grill we had the black cod this was our favorite, we also tried the fillet steak and squid. By the time we got to the rolls we were full, but we had ordered the Sao Paulo which was awesome. The food was good bit pricy. Service was good nothing out of the ordinary just what you'd expect in this type of restaurant. Been once and think probably don't need to go again.

title: Food poisoning from Valentines meal
comment: My boyfriend and I went there for the first time on Valentines evening. We had the best table (with the best view) and the staff were attentive and polite. They did make a couple of mistakes (brought us double of a dish twice) but that was ok. The food tasted great and was cooked nicely, but it was incredibly expensive (£85p/person! It said £85 for the set Valentines meal and all the dishes were served on 1 dish to share between 2 people so to have them say it's £85 EACH was a shocker). Anyway, 36 hours later we were both very sick. Throwing up, diarrhoea, nausea, aches, sweats, the works. My boyfriend was sick for about 3 days, much worse than me. I had written to Sushi Samba twice about it and noone has replied. However, they were quick to reply when he emailed to question the bill to make sure they didn't double charge accidently. Duck and Waffle next door had their Valentines meals for £80 for 2 people, so we're not sure where they think they can mislead people into their expensive meal which gave them food poisoning and not even apologise. So what would've been a nice meal turned bad due to poor post-meal customer service. Would not be visiting again and will not recommend to friends.

title: Wow Views are amazing! Good Food Too!
comment: Went here 19th February with hubbie for my birthday Drinks at the bar were very good and outside bar area is huge will be great in the summer Loved all the food shrimp was amazing service was a bit slow but really didnt mind as views of commercial road and Tower Bridge etc are great and was nice to sit and look Nice touch when little cake with candle came out to me Great night

title: "Appualling time management "
comment: View from the 38th floor of the Heron building is to die for.  Terrace would be great in the summer. Very appualling time management we waited 50min for our table as well as every other person with same time slot. Managment behavoius to delay is to seat who creat the most fuss and loudest voice not who arrived first (note i looked in reatuarant their were a few of empty tables while we waited). Food average comapared to London restuatrants, nothing special. Would not recomend the restuarant, go to the bar if you want to enjoy the view, try to catch it during the day so you can see the london sky line.

title: Worth to visit
comment: The place is lovely. Very nice decor and view from the 38th floor is amazing. We had a cocktail before dinner and really liked it. Service was good but not too sure about the Sushi. My first Sushi try was Zuma so the line was so high i guess. But prices are ok so definitely worth to visit even just for the view and cocktails.

title: By Far, the best Service and Food in London
comment: This 38th floor London gem is the sexiset, hippest, most fun restaurant in London. The food is an impeccable combination of Sushi and Samba (grilled meats). The restaurant redifines customer service in the whole of the UK (where it is nearly impossible to find really good service. I highly recommend crashing the velvet rope on the outside of Heron Tower and taking the elevator on up to experience a new concept, a new standard in London. While there, wander upstairs before or after dinner to the 39th floor and have a drink at Duck and Waffle - owned by the same restaurant group, it has a beauriful view and the rum selsection is amazing....

title: Some good, mainly bad!
comment: Starting with the positives... Some of the dishes were nice, one or two exceptional. Atmosphere loud, good music, can imagine terrace and bar could be a good night if in the mood, lift up and down was an experience.. Negatives. They give you your table over 45 minutes after reservation time and point you towards the bar. I happened to be with people who this option was unsuitable. I also felt it was a way to increase revenue. The maitre d was an arrogant bald idiot who thought this practice of making me wait was perfectly acceptable. The clientele was not great, a mixture of city boys and very down market trendy types. Some of the dishes were confused. The price was well over £100 per person without alcohol. View was not good from wihin the restaurant. Summary; try zuma or nobu. They are considerably better value, and the staff know how to treat customers.

title: Phenomenal food in a fabulous setting
comment: I cannot begin to describe how wonderful this food is - it is expensive but you are in fantastic surroundings, with impeccable service and a wonderful ambience. Worth every penny!

title: Delicious lunch
comment: We had a delicious Mother's Day lunch (decided to go on the Saturday to experience the full menu rather than Mother's Day one) with the most breathtaking views over London, beginning with a fast glide up to the 38th floor in the glass lift taking in fantastic views of the Gherkin, the Shard etc on into the bar for pre-lunch drinks perhaps the only disappointment 3 x G&T's a whopping £41.70 including service charge so would skip the bar next time and save it for the lunch! however the food did not disappoint (hence the 5 stars) we chose 1 large plate Moqueca mista a divine creamy zesty broth with shellfish and chimichurri rice, 5 smaller plates hot edamame,yellowtail jalapeno and lemongrass,duck breast sansho pepper vinaigrette,snow crab sashimi and sao paulo samba rolls every plate was amazing and so much more to try. Next time will try the Currasco Rio Grande as several guests were ordering and it looked amazing Ribeye,Chorizo and wagyu picanha. Dessert was Chocolate banana cake with maple butter,plantain chip and vanilla rum ice cream. Will visit in the evening next time as there is an outside bar and eating area and would love to see the London skyline at night!

title: So excited but let down
comment: Birthday meal been looking forward to it for weeks. Arrived at 2030 for a 2100 booking. Cloakroom full, upstairs rented out for a private function.  Got a cocktail. Chatted. 2115 came and went we asked. They said a couple of minutes not worth going to the bar. At 2130 still waiting. Others had arrived and been seated.  We felt of no consequence and left. Moment ruined. Really disappointed. I was expecting great things. Maybe my expectations were too high. Not sure if we'll try again.

title: Valentines Up high!
comment: I booked a set menu for my wife and I at sushi samba. The venue, cocktails, atmosphere were fantastic as was the service. The food was good but terribly overpriced. I'm not sure that the set menu was reflective of the normal prices but we had to order more food! It was a 5 course set menu that came in tiny portions on shared plates. I suspect that prices all over London are bumped up all on valentines. All in all great night but i would have expected something extra special from the food.

title: Quirky with a view
comment: Brilliant place, really nice cocktails, wonderful fusion food (Japanese / south american) and very pleasant helpful staff. I have to say I really enjoyed my night here, but don't take a proper digital camera (DSLR)...they don't like it, but you are welcome to use a camera phone! (to simplify the rule) it's PR ball c***p But don't let that put you off..excellent sushi, and the view from the top is most excellent This place will empty your wallet as fast as centeral London casino. expensive but worth it for a treat

title: Great place for a long weekend lunch
comment: This place is good. So good that it is very popular during the week in the evenings. We visited on a Saturday and were seated immediately (still better to make a reservation). Good mix of Japan/Brazil/Peru flavours. Helpful and friendly staff. Delicious contemporary food. Will return again in the summer for the outdoor sky bar.

title: Great for a special occassion
comment: The ride to the 38th floor had my Mum holding onto the handrail but the view on the way up was brilliant. The reception desk is small and sort of in the corridor but it extends onto the bar area which, although not large, has amazing views over London. As this was our first visit we were unsure of what to order however, although the waiters were really lovely and willing to assist. I ventured outside to take some photos however a cold windy January day is not the best time to be hanging around 38 floors up! As you can read from other reviews, it’s not a cheap place to eat however the fusion food was delicious, we didn’t have a single bad plate and all left wanting to return again in the future.

title: Badly organized
comment: I went to Sushisamba with a work colleague having waited two weeks to get a table. We were told the only time available was 7.30pm. We arrived a little early and went to the bar for a drink first. There were no seats but were happy to stand for the 15 minutes before our table would be ready. Forty minutes later when we had not been called and our feet were not happy at standing in high heels, we checked what was happening with our table. We were told it wold be ready soon. Twenty minutes later to say we were frustrated would be putting it mildly. When we went back to ask I made it clear that the experience did not exactly leave us feeling a desire to come back. At this stage, we were finally treated like valued customers and given a complimentary glass of champagne. We were then sat at a table within five minutes. We were also given 3 starter dishes which were complimentary. This, of course, made us feel better. The quality of the food is excellent and there is good choice if you like Asian food. Once seated, the waiting staff were very helpful and friendly. The view is a amazing and it is definitely be place to go. However, if you make a reservation for a certain time, you should expect to be seated within 15 minutes of that time. I would like to think that as female guests we were not treated any differently than male guests but we were certainly left with a less than perfect experience.

title: Excellent food, service, venue and views.
comment: I took 4 of my top performing sales people here for an exclusive all expenses paid early evening meal. This was my second time here, and eveyone else's first. We concluded that the meal was exceptional (but don't expect cheap); service was very good, attentive, helpful and informative; lovely venue, being located in one of the newest and tallest skyscrapers in London, and there are good views of London.  I can highly recommend. If you love Sushi, or just great food, then you'll love this. I look forward to going back again.

title: Absolutely disappointed
comment: Hey all, I am writing to share (unfortunately) my terrible experience in this Restaurant.. my boyfriend and I had planned our short Christmas break in London this year and we wanted to spend a nice night out eating Sushi..so following many good tripadvisor reviews.we come across Sushi Samba..and apparently it would have been a great night with amazing view, wonderful food etc etc.. So to make sure not to miss this opportunity we sent an e mail 10 days in advance to the Sushi Samba to reserve a table "possibly with a nice window view" and someone replied that for a specific day they could reserve a window table for us! and we were extremely happy even because it would be the last day of our holiday!! On wednesday at 09:00 p.m. very punctual we went to Sushi Samba and a man at the bottom of the building checked our reservation and ticked our name form the list and let us take the elevator to the restaurant!! Once we arrived we asked to the lady at the entrance e she verified our resevation and told us to wait for a few minutes at the bar just in front of us!!(the restaurant and the bar were realy crowded ) anyways...we waited for about half an our than we came back to the lady which replied only that we hade to be patient because the restaurant was very busy..but after almost 40 minutes no one gave us news...so we went again to the lady and after arguing a bit she told us that there wasn't a table next to the window available, that they normally do not reserve "special table" and that if it was ok for us they had a table at the entrance of the restaurant and maybe after our dinner we could (probably) move to another table next to window..AND THAT WAS ALL THEY COULD DO FOR US!! I believe this is not a correct behavior..i don't want to add anything else..but at the end we left the restaurant without having dinner, WE will never return to this restaurant and more we are convinced that the fact that there are many requests does not justify rude behavior with customers! a simple view is not worth the rudeness watch out!!

title: A delightful surprise
comment: From entering the lift with its spectacular views on a cold snowy night in London until stepping out the door again several hours later we had a great night out. Decor, food, staff and timing all in the very-good to excellent range. Price a pleasant surprise.

title: Great quality sushi
comment: Seeing how many were disappointed with their service, I will say that during my meal in December 2012, I had a meal that did not disappoint. We stumbled upon the restaurant following a business meeting across the street. Arriving before the rush, we sat at the sushi bar where our service was fine. The sushi quality and variety of rolls was outstanding and our waiter selected several for us - each one better than the next.  The atmosphere was a bit pretentious but as a sushi lover, my only concern was the food.

title: worth visiting at least once....
comment: An average meal with extraordinary views. This sentence sums up sushi samba. The mixed reviews on TA had me concerned but I can understand why....service was hit and miss based on the staff at the table and the food was a case of using a crystal ball to predict the quality. We ordered the fillet steak robata and the first one we received was fantastic I could not fault the dish and so...as there were 6 of us...we ordered another. The second was like another dish entirely, poorly cooked and presented. Overall the food was very up and down but I will say you must try the green bean and rock shrimp tempura....both incredible dishes...sadly theyre balanced out by equally underwhelming offerings. Despite these facts which normally would have annoyed me we had a good night. The atmosphere was brilliant and the views are spectacular...I imagine a brilliant date restaurant as all the tables of 2 are by the windows!! Put it near the top of your must visit list but once its ticked off you can forget about it....

title: Great views.
comment: Went for work drinks and although the views were amazing I was less than inspired by the cocktails which I had looked forward to with relish. Had hoped to try the bar food (which looked amazing) but once it hit 7pm the music became so loud we couldn't hear each other speak so we decided to move on to pastures new for food. Definitely with it for the amazing views over London, but wouldn't spend a whole night here drinking!

title: Go for the view
comment: The views are breath-taking on the way up and nothing in London comes close to the view from the terrace. Hard to believe I was just minutes from my desk. No gripes about the service which was friendly. The sushi platter was gorgeous, both in presentation and taste. Loved the Japanese pop-art decor. Would definitely go back, esp with out-of-towners.

title: fresh sashimi, stale offer
comment: we booked in advance. we anticipated the evening. we sat near the waiter's station. we were cold. we ate some great sashimi with some mediocre sushi. we decided that drinks would be a better thing to do up there. oh, and we took a picture of the tree.

title: High @ sushi samba
comment: One to remember.celebrating late valentines with friends. Loved the atmosphere there. Being up high there means great view esp at night. So breathtaking its just a shame I'm not good with heights.we enjoyed the night. We ordered champagne and baileys but I was captivated by the views of shard and gherkin and. The traffic below.would definitely come back again and stay a bit longer and take more photos from definitely angle

title: HIT & MISS
comment: Very excited about Sushi Samba coming to london as frequent visitor to Miami and New York Branches (and big fan of purple mash which they dont do in London Branch). First time I went here Food and Service was both excellent. Staff were attentive, explained dished, food tasted great and so we booked another table as soon as we left to take some friends at a later date. Unfortunately second time was very disappointing. Bouncer type staff at door extremely rude and arrogant, looked us up and down, left us waiting in the cold, while he glanced over his clip board. Finally after realising we had a reservation, we were "allowed" past him to the lift. Great first impression for our guests (not!) Once seated, we waited ages to get the menu, had to ask numerous times and that was a sign of things to come.. rude waiter, didn't explain any of the dishes to the guests, huffed and puffed, had to continuously wait for ages to re-order, completely ignored us, his explanation was something along the lines of "very busy tonight and you're not the only guests". Appalling service, mediocre food and embarrassing when inviting people and having told them so much great things about sushi samba prior! Real shame!

title: Disappointing end to what promised to be a great evening
comment: Was really excited about going on Valentines day as the set menu looked amazing - the first 4 courses were brilliant and we were both really enjoying the atmosphere and the experience. Unfortunately the final course of pork was overcooked and the dessert was extremely disappointing - A shame as the lasting impression was the final two dishes which were not a patch on the first 4. Also slightly disappointing when you get over cooked pork at a restaurant where you are paying in excess of 250 pounds for 2 people

title: fantastic
comment: excellent view..great cocktails..lovely staff! don't miss if u'r in town..just a few meters from liverpool st station..

title: Yummy food
comment: We booked a table for four at 9:45 but decided to go earlier and have a drink at the bar. As we arrived the doorman was extremely rude and rough. we went up to the bar which was lovely with amazing views over london, nice buzzing atmosphere, good selection of cocktails and wine. Our table was slightly delayed but we were offered a glass of champaign and they were very apologetic for the delay. We ordered a lot of food and every platter that arrived was even more delicious than the previous. we ate lots drank lots and had a rally good time. It is on the expensive side but worth it. will defiantly go back.

title: It's sea bream not sea bass..
comment: We heard about this place from our friend. We decided to go there just while we were passing by the place.  The place is very nice, one of the best view in London. The food generally are fusion dishes with variety tastes. The waiter was very nice and very enthusiastic to provide a service for us.  Unfortunately, the large dish (and that's the last dish) we ordered, which was recommended by the waiter was sea-bass (which is my favourite fish) but it turned out that the dish was sea bream. At that time I was quite full so didn't want to exchange or anything.  Apart from that, everything was perfect. Recommend anyone who want to enjoy a good view on their special occasion.  Don't forget to book the place before you go there.

title: Cattle Market with amazing food.
comment: Very disappointing on 3rd visit. It's very expensive, and I expect much better service and not to be kept waiting almost an hour for my (9.30pm) table. Food still fantastic, but was still be brought out at 11.40pm. No thanks! I felt as if I was in a cattle market, not somewhere I'd be spending upwards of £100 per head. I'd like much more 'fawning' for this type of dining experience. They are going to lose repeat customers soon and only get the 'bridge and tunnel' crew coming in from outside. Views are amazing, outdoor terrace unfortunately closed though.

title: the best sushi
comment: apart from the amazing views from the outdoor bar overlooking london, the food was exquisite and you are left wanting more. highly recommend the tortilla filled with yellow tuna, the venison, yes, venison and the waggu beef tasted amazing.............................infact everything tasted different and amazing. Not cheap but well worth every penny.

title: Spectacular .........
comment: View ,  38 floors up and adjacent to the gherkin . It's heady stuff. Food fresh, varied imaginative. Excellent service . Great atmosphere .

title: Fantastic experience
comment: To top a special weekend in London, I decided to book Sushi Samba for Sunday afternoon as a surprise for my fiance. We arrived an hour early for a quiet pre-lunch drink and to take in the fantastic views of the London skyline.  Booked for 2:30pm, we were shown to our table at 2:40pm.... another stunning view looking out towards the Olympic Stadium. The service was attentive, informed and genuinely interested in the customers. The food was outstanding in quality and taste, especially the steak. The desserts were absolutely fabulous especially the chilli chocolate which my fiance summed up by saying that it's the best dessert she has EVER tasted!! The only gripe that I would offer is that there is no need to include a service charge for the meal, personally I would have tipped more than the service charge which was added to the bill. As I have said previously, the service was brilliant. All in all, a restaurant worth visiting for the experience, the views and the chilli chocolate dessert.... We'll be back.

title: Brilliant day or night!
comment: I came first for lunch in summer and thoroughly enjoyed the view and the amazing innovative food. Admittedly it is pricey but well worthwhile. Returned again for drinks at the bar on a friday night this time and it was quite a different experience. Glam folks mixed up with office suits for a good night out. Same great quality sushi to boot even in the bar. Bonus! Watch how much you drink though, it really adds up!

title: Incredible experience with best views in London
comment: Sushi Samba is really a special place to visit for exquisite food, attentive service and a really cool vibe. We were pretty dazzled by the menu, so told the waiter what we liked, and trusted him to surprise us. Well that turned out to be the best decision ever, as he brought an incredible selection if dishes all in a sequence of perfection. We had a couple of vegetarians in our group of 6, and they too were delighted with the choices he brought out. In all it was really a wonderful night, and although it is a little more expensive than other restaurants, you will feel immensely happy with your experience, and booking your next dinner on the way out to the glass lifts .

title: Top Restaurant - Amazing View
comment: We've visited Sushi Samba many times in the US and we had a great experience, but the London one is even better.  Located on the 38th floor in Heron Tower, the restaurant has an amazing view of London. Even better, there is a balcony around the restaurant, so when the weather allows you can eat outside.  The food is a combination of Japanese, Peruvian and Brazilian kitchen and it is very unique. The service is very good but given that the place is packed all the time, you have to be patient. Book well in advance as this place is a hit!

title: Stunning views, stunning food!
comment: You will not disappointed with the Sushi Samba experience - i ate there on 'That Saturday' when Jess, Mo & Greg all won Gold and given that it overlooks the Olympic stadium heightened the experience. Outstanding food, services and surroundings. An absolute must!

title: Heron Tower Amaze Balls
comment: We went for a pre dinner drink on the night of the 04/01/13. I have to say I absolutely love Heron Tower, what a great location to put a bar, a fantastic place with some of the best views of London, cant wait for the Shard to be finished. The drinks; ok yes they are expensive and there is very little if any seating, but you go for the atmosphere, and it was quality. The fire pit outside I think it a great touch and love the little blankets I saw people with. (I believe they were yours anyway) Will return.

title: What about inclusion!!
comment: This was a spontaneous, surprise lunch with a close friend and my son who is a 12 year old who loves gastronomic experiences and is fond of sushi. He is a wheelchair user. We were in the area and saw the sign and ended up in an amazing bar and restaurant. Just travelling up in the lift was thrilling (or scary, depending on your response to heights!). We ate casually at the bar, felt welcomed and were appropriately given information about some lesser known food on the menu.by our waiter. It is an expensive experience but imaginative food and very special surroundings made that bearable. I used the ladies loo which was up two steps, off the corridor. This was a lovely, well designed room with good soap and hand lotion. After we had paid our bill, my son said he would like to use the loo. I asked where the accessible toilet was and, with lots of smiles, was asked to wait a moment. After 5 minutes the waiter came back and showed us to a door that led to the accessible toilet. No problem with the access but, no soap!!!! no toilet paper!!! I realised as we left the loo that the staff had had to move a rack of coats to the corridor that leads into and out of the restaurant. Obviously the rack of coats was usually kept in front of the door to the disabled loo. I complained to a member of staff who apologised profusely about the lack of basic facilities in the disabled loo. She then asked me to pass on my comments to the manager, and called him to come to reception. I waited 10minutes for him to arrive....he said sorry!! He then tried to excuse the barrier created by the rack of coats by saying it was very cold outside, and lots of people were wearing coats. Because they had had to move the coat rack to give us access to the loo, it was impossible for us to leave the restaurant until they moved the coat rack back! There was niot room in the corridor for the coat rack and the wheelchir. It's basic, we've just celebrated London's ability to manage an inclusive Olympic experience, and we were made to feel that disabled people matter less at this restaurant.

title: Amezing view.... but do we wanna talk about the food?
comment: I have to say, I love hights, and the view from the sushi samba, is one of the best in London!!! however like a friend of mine would say, if you wanna just a view, get into a plane! We ordered a selection of 7 different sashimi. The resentation was great, shame they all tasted the same!!! Every selection was set on a salad leaf which was set on ice, nice to look at, but unfortunately the cold of the ice made the food tastless... We ordered several starters, including the black cod.... a fish finger would have had more taste, once again a total disappointment. To conclude, it is a fantastic place for the view, but dont bother with the food or the cocktails.... just have a beer

title: I loved everything about this place!
comment: I celebrated my birthday with friends at Sushi Samba last Saturday night and, I have to say, I was not disappointed. I had a few issues on the telephone earlier that day with somebody from Reservations, though I soon forgot about that when I got there. The lift up to the 38th floor provided stunning views of London and, although I have a fear of heights, I absolutely loved it!  Our coats were taken as soon as we arrived and a member of staff directed me to the terrace as requested. It was a beautifully-decorated terrace with comfortable seating and a relaxed vibe. The blankets provided were a really nice touch for what was quite a windy night. Unfortunately, the bar on the terrace was closed, which was a real shame, as the main bar is quite small and very busy. This meant that it took a while to order drinks. The cocktails were a little pricey, but no more than any other classy establishment in Central London.  We were informed by a member of staff that our table was ready earlier than scheduled, which I was really pleased about. When we were seated, I was approached by a very pleasant member of staff who introduced himself and acknowledged the fact that it was my birthday. A waiter brought the menus over and kindly gave me his torch when he overheard me saying that I couldn't see the menu properly (not to say that it was particularly dark in there!). The staff were all really good humoured and friendly. I'm generally not a huge fan of sushi, but I really enjoyed the taste, quality, variety and presentation of the food. The flavours were strong and distinctive. The waiters came over after we finished our food to sing happy birthday, and presented me with a complimentary dessert. They didn't even seem too annoyed with me when I cluttered the place with wrapping paper after opening all my presents at the table! They cleared the mess with minimal fuss. After dinner we went back to the bar for some more drinks. It's a real shame that the upstairs was closed due to a private function, however, the bar had a good vibe and a great view. Overall, the staff were friendly and attentive, the views were amazing, and the food was great! We all loved the lift so much that on our way out, we decided to go back up for another ride, much to the security man's confusion. I would definitely go back to Sushi Samba and hope that I can experience a similar night.

title: PERFECT for New Years Eve!!
comment: So my partner and I like to travel to a different country every year for new years. We ended up in London this year. Since I'm always in charge of the new years dinner plans, I spoke with the concierge at our hotel (the Four Seasons Canary Wharf). Soon we were set to experience the Brazillian-Japanese fusion of Sushi Samba on the 38th floor.  Upon arrival, we were elevated 38 floors in the glass elevator on the skin of the building. Should you have a problem with heights, this isn't a ride for you! But if you like one of the highest views in London while not in an airplane, DO IT! We arrived at the restaurant, our coats were checked, and off we went to our table. Had it not been raining, we would have stopped out onto the patio and had a drink. But, it was cold, and raining so we went to our table and got started.  So, our waiter was some Italian guy that was a bit impatient, and seemed to order for us when we were uncertain. Whatever. We are go-with-the-flow men so it was cool. Here's what we ultimately ordered: Yellow tail tacos - Yummy Scallops Tiradit - Yummy Salmon tiraditio - Yummy chicken - we don't remember this. But it was 8 pounds Wild mushrooms - delicious Arroz xon pato - delicious! Hamachi - its hamachi, it was fine sake - Don't remember this!!! mango mousse - excellent chocolata banana cake - um, totally worth it By the end of it, and the beginning of 2013, we had ordered three bottles of wine. The best was the Antinori Cervaro at 110 pounds. If you want something special, order this bottle. We also had the Colin St Aubin (70), and the Vietti Arnies (60).  Yes, it was new years eve. We drank a lot. But through our experience we received great service, especially from the Sommelier. HE WAS AMAZING!  There were dancers, live music, and this venue was great to watch the fireworks over the river. Folks, we had a lovely time. If you found this review even remotely helpful, please tap on the yes button below. Cheers

title: Awful Experience
comment: The lift ride and the view were the only positives. We arrived at the time of our reservation but there was no table for us so we were made to wait in the loud bar where it was too busy to get a drink. When we did order cocktails at our table, they were small glasses filled with ice that just tasted like melted ice, with no garnish or bells and whistles which you kind of expect when you pay £12.50 for a drink. A couple of the dishes were fair in quality but the aubergine was so burnt on the outside it turned to ash in my mouth, chicken skewers were over cooked to a hard chewy texture and burnt as well.  The Venison tataki dish was recommended to us by the waiter and was so bad it made me wretch and run the bathroom. Our final dish was rice that disintegrated at the touch of a chopstick, topped with such a small piece of salmon it was barely detectable, and some melted oily salty cheese. Disgusting. At this point we got our bill and left. Never again. I eat out regularly all over London and this has to be the most over rated place I've ever been.

title: Great experience
comment: Went here for a meal with friends, and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We arrived early to have a cocktail in the bar, which is pretty loud and buzzing, but we sat on the roof terrace which was great, and will be spectacular in Summer. It was very cold (Jan!!) but there we fires on the terrace and we were brought fleece blankets to keep us warm. The restaurant if very lively and busy, but the food really was fantastic. We went to Nobu a few weeks earlier, and I think the food was just as good, but better value. This is the kind of place you would go for a treat, but personally thought it was worth it. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The lift ride up to the restaurant was really spectacular and the views from the large staircase was amazing!!

title: Interesting concept restaurant
comment: Fusion food with a view - worth a visit, but highly priced. That said, enjoyed the visit! Food comes frequently to the table - so variety is the spice - sadly if on a table for two, the tables are not big enough.

title: Disappointed and hungry
comment: I love food. Food from every corner of the globe. But I am always a little sceptical about fusion - Japanese and Brazilian? Hmmmm. A little apprehensive, I accepted an invitation to lunch at Sushisamba with a client and a colleague. First of all, the setting on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower is amazing. Although we were not next to a window, the views are stunning from wherever you sit. And the restaurant, if a little cavernous, is light and airy. But that's just about all that impressed me really. The menu was ok, nothing special frankly, and the food quality, seasoning and presentation all rather ordinary. We were proposed a tasting selection - great - but the dishes were, well, ordinary and unadventurous as well. I have had good Japanese food and good Brazilian food and one would assume that a fusion would produce a wow factor. Nope, that was missing too. And the portions were lacking on the size front. Maybe my expectations were too high. Who knows. But the weirdest part of all was the service. The server would bring the food to you and explain what it was and then a minute later the waiter would explain it all again. And often the accounts were different! But each vanished as soon as the job was done and trying to attract their attention to have explained (third time) what was what proved futile. The day we went the maitre d' was wearing what could only be described as a day-glo orange long dress. I couldn't work out whether she doubled up as a fire warden as well. Or perhaps she's sponsored by Stabilo and has a set of dresses to match her highlighter pens. I'll never know as I don't think I'll be going back. Shame really because if it did have a wow factor in terms of food and service it could be amazing. For now the views are the only thing to take your breath away.

title: Excellent service, amazing food and great view!!!
comment: I decided to have a surprise dinner for my boyfriend..and it has been the best restauarant experience in London... The service is excellent and the food is amazing , i like very much the sharing concept and the fusion of three cuisines is just a brilliant idea.... The view is spectacular... there is nothing negative about this Restaurant... We truly enjoyed the whole experience and I would recommend to try it..... Fantastic!!!!!

title: A bird's eye view from the heron tower!
comment: On a recent trip to London to visit our son, he took us to the Sushisamba restaurant on the 38th floor for drinks. Whilst the latter were not cheap, the spectacular views from this all glass building are truly phenomenal. It dwarfs the gherkin and other landmark skyscrapers. Being there just as dusk fell over the city meant that an ever changing kaleidoscope enhanced the experience even more! I cannot comment on the cuisine itself save to say that the nest top setting of this restaurant is like something out of a Bond movie! An experience I shall never forget!

title: At last the city does fun and the best cocktail!
comment: Yes it is corporate but then what else can be expected in the City. An exciting entrance, I felt like I was in a scene from Charlie and the chocolate factory as I shot up the side of the building in the smoothest glass lift. Entrance door was a little elusive, lots of people wandering between the two floors trying to find the entrance as there were no signs.  I really liked the outside terrace with the enormous steel tree in the middle of the bar, it looked quite ghostly as I was there on one of the coldest nights in November, good job there were lots of outside heaters. It is busy, bustling and noisy but great fun too. The staff were very friendly and there was not a single dish I could criticise. I had sashimi, black cod and an assortment of seviche, all perfect. The best thing of all was the cocktail recommended by the waiter, the chamomile gimlet, I've spent the last month trying to make my own cordial to replicate this at home. Not a place to go on a new date but great for those who like to experiment with their food and drink and need a venue to impress.

title: Amazing view
comment: Came here for a drink, bar rather small. outdoors is nice, epic view. Some of the staff were a bit miserable. Bar men were good though.

title: Fantastic Sushisamba London
comment: Gliding up the lift soaring above an ever- changing perspective of London was an exciting start. The view from the top was astounding: never has London looked so beautiful as this year. We were welcomed into this amazing restaurant with its gleaming orange-lit tree on the terrace from which you could look up even further to the pinnacle of Heron Tower in ethereal blue shrouded mist. The restaurant itself looks delightfully quirky with unusual ceiling hangings! Even the toilets are creative.  We were guided through the complicated sounding menu by a delightful waiter and he was right to suggest "Have something from each section". what amazing flavours! can't remember all we had but highlights included:- sashimi beans, black cod, takati venison, risotto with duck and foie gras, chilli chocolate mousse- and many sakes, limoncello .. wow- yes it was pricey but not overly so and well, well, well worth it for such a special gorgeous experience. thank you!

title: Views to die for and delicious food
comment: I dined here on a Sunday evening at 6,30pm. There was initially a small glitch with our reservation for 4 people and whilst they sorted it, which they did very promptly, they kindly offered to cover the cost of our first round of drinks. the Heron Tower is just amazing with the most breath taking views. Sushisamba is very much all about sharing dining. Our waiter suggested we had a couple of plates to share from about 6 different sections. Be careful you dont over order as it is really easy to take this advice. we decided on 2 bowls of edamame beans to snack on 4 small plates to share, a coconut rice and a couple of anticuchos which was plenty for 4 people. you can always order more as you go, the food had all round "uumms and aaaaahh", it was gorgeous and the service was spectacular. it reminded me of being in new york again. i look forward to returning. the bill for 4 which included 5 glasses of wine and 2 puddings was £177.

title: A big let down
comment: This was our second time visiting Sushi Samba, and in the interest of full disclosure, I have to say we were really impressed on the first visit with the atmosphere, service, and food. This time was a different experience entirely. The atmosphere is of course the same, and still impressive - the views alone are worth a trip up the lift. It's the food and service that fell far short this time, though. We went for an early dinner on Saturday, and were seated around 4:30. The restaurant staff still seemed to be preparing for the evening rush, and I suspect this is in large part what led to the poor food quality and weird service.  We started off with a round of appetizers consisting of the pork belly and the wagyu gyoza. Both tasted ok, but were served luke warm - room temperature really. We ordered salmon rolls for our son, which he enjoyed, and the black cod and fillet from the robata grill for mains, along with a couple of the sushi rolls. The fillet, like the appetizers, was served at room temperature. We'd ordered it medium rare, and it was that, but felt tough, as though it had been sitting for a long time. The cod was actually very nice, and one of the few things we really enjoyed. The rolls we ordered were all decent, and the one with shrimp tempura and chili mayo was actually quite good.  We also ordered a couple of pieces each of yellow tail and salmon from the nigiri sushi selection. We asked our waiter if it was possible to get it aburri style - flame seared on top. He at first told us no, not possible because there was no grill at the sushi bar. A different waiter overheard this and said it was in fact possible, so the initial waiter confirmed our order of sushi, and returned several minutes later with salmon and yellow tail sashimi. We explained that we had ordered the sushi, rather than the sashimi, and he took the dish without comment and returned to the kitchen, coming back several minutes later with the proper dish. Overall, the food was just not up to what we expected from the place - especially given the price.  The service as well was strange. Our waiter seemed impatient most of the time. We spent a minute discussing which main we wanted, and he was shifting from foot to foot, looking at his watch, the kitchen, other waitstaff, etc, and generally giving off the impression that he had better things to do. We told him the first main we wanted, and he said 'very good' and walked off - so we had to call him back to give him the rest of our order, and when we did he seemed quite irritated. One of the strangest parts of the meal was when, shortly after our appetizers arrived, the cleaning staff came in and started mopping the floor around our table. The smell of bleach was an extremely unpleasant accompaniment to the meal, but none of the staff found it even slightly strange that they'd be cleaning around us while we were eating. I saw another table that was boxed in against the window by a 'wet floor' sign at one point.  As I mentioned at the start of this review, I think a number of these issues were due to the staff preparing for the evening rush, but this is absolutely no excuse. If you're going to keep your restaurant open between lunch and dinner, you should be prepared to give the guests that visit during that time the same quality of food and service as you would at any other time. And mopping the floors between tables that are seated is just weird, and unprofessional.

title: Nice cocktails, stunning view
comment: Been to Sushi samba a couple of times now for drinks, good quality original cocktail menu at a reasonable price considering! Highlight for me is the outdoor terrace which is very rare at this hight! The best place to celebrate in style over the best city in the world! The lifts are so cool as well, 38 floors in 38 seconds in a glass box! Good fun http://youtu.be/urTLdhDF6S8

title: Location, location location
comment: We visited Sushi Samba to celebrate a friends birthday, we were a little apprehensive due to the mixed reviews.    This is my view; The lift to the 38th floor is amazing it enables the passenger to see across the city. When we arrived at the restaurant our coats were taken from us and hung up. We arrived early to have a view drinks before the meal. The bar is small, only three bar staff and due to the array of cocktails on offer it did take sometime to be serviced. Three drinks = £39 but they were delicious. The bar area was very crowded and we were unable to go upstairs due to a private function so forced to stand, in killer heels!  For the smokers - there is a lovely terrace area over looking the city. Blankets are provided and a large fire to keep warm. There was a bar outside but this was closed. We were shown to our tables, the chairs are heavy but the waiters did assist. The food was okay but not out of this world. The staff presented my friend with a birthday dessert and sang happy birthday.  Staff were friendly and willing to help.  Overall - I would not go back to Sushi Samba as the food was not to my aqcuired taste. However, I am glad to have experienced a quirky restaurant in the heart of the city.

title: Amazing view
comment: I went to Sushi Samba with my fiance and our friends. The service is not quite up to scratch. However, the views are amazing, especially just going into the glass lift on the way up is something different. I would recommend going for dinner. However, my fiance has been for lunch and was equally impressed.  The food was amazing if albeit costly. Its a shame that the bar area is not slightly bigger with more seating as this would be a great place to come for a few snacks and drinks.  We are already booked to go again and would def recommend this restaurant.

title: Totally yum
comment: I took clients to Sushi Samba with no idea what to expect, wow the food and service was out of this world. The trip up in the see through lift was great seeing views for miles over london - if not slightly too quick I am glad I hadn't eaten at that point! None of my guests knew what to order and our waiter chose a number of dishes for us to share, there was not one dish we didn't enjoy. The black cod was outstanding. The bill was £400 for 5 of us with one bottle of white wine so not cheap, however the views and quality of the experience made it more than worthwhile. I am going to get my husband to take me one evening in spring so we can admire the views from the terraces overlooking london.

title: Amazing view, good food.
comment: You can't beat the lifts up there or the view when you get to the top. The welcome is a little chaotic if there are a few people there, not a great space for a reception. The food was really good, super fish and meat, some really interesting appetisers. It isn't cheap, but it is very good quality and you are paying for the experience too I guess. The restaurant was full so quite noisy, but not intrusive so you didn't have to shout. The service was ok, a little patchy and definitely on the relaxed side. I would go back, but I think in terms of food and atmosphere I still prefer Nobu (Berkely Sq) as it is less frenetic and the service is more polished.

title: Pretentious aand Dissapointing
comment: I chose to celebrate my birthday here with a group of friends. I regret this decision as I was overwhelmed with the degree of dissapointment I felt. In fairness service and therefore ambience are the real problems. I have never experienced such a degree of pretenciousness in London before as I did here and that's really saying something!  In the first place they choose to try and create a sense of exclusivity by being aloof as to whether you can get a reservation at all- which is not that unusual in a big place like London.  When I eventually made mine 5 days in advance I was told by the person I made it with that we had 2.5hrs in order to finish, only to be contradicted on the day(!), by perhaps the rudest woman in the industry, that we had Only 2 hours and that we would be asked to give up our table if we over ran(???!!!) After this unpleasant telephone episode I arrived at the dedicated entrance on the side of the Heron tower to be greeted by a confusing security door. I had to buzz in order to be granted the attention of the smartly dressed guardian to the restaurant, only for him to further annoy me.  He told us that even though we had a reservation we 'might' get our table....errrr sorry? We've got reservations??? I thought because English wasn't his 1st language I misunderstood and gave him the benefit of the doubt only to be told the same thing by others in my party that arrived slightly later than me AND to see him doing exactly the same thing again to a group on the way out!! It looked almost scripted. Once reaching the 38th floor you realise that there's no sign indicating that this is Sushi Samba, the reason this is a problem is because another restaurant is directly above them- I wonder how many people arrive at Duck and Waffle thinking they're at Sushi Samba? After deciphering that I had the correct place I arrived at the reception recognising the frosty voice of the charming lady that stole my 30 mins on the phone earlier. She greeted me with the disdain that I was now expecting and handed me over to my hostess. The table staff were nice and acceptably helpful. They knew their menus and were genuine when trying to advise, but still had the air of grandeur that you expect from a Michelin starred French restaurant, which can be easily fixed (hopefully). The management made some effort to make sure we were okay and kept things in order on the floor- perhaps blissfully unaware that customers were being put off by staff before actually getting to that point- what does that say about their abilities? (if management respond to this review- I respectfully decline emailing you, I'll just go back to the NYC branch and avoid you like the plauge) On a positive note it really isnt expensive and the food was excellent, it is an honest attempt of trying to combine flavours from two culinary distinct cultures and it works! The food takes far too long to get to you but that's bearable as you have the views and decor to feed your senses till it arrives.

title: Wow! beautiful...
comment: Amazing views..very attractive restaurant. food presented beautifully although I think the cod was miniscule compared to Nobu...The waiter was charming. Service quick. loved it. woukd definately come back..and did for drinks two days later! all the staff very pleasant!!

title: Door staff have zero common sense
comment: A small group of six clients and colleagues attempted to visit Sushi Samba at the Heron Tower yesterday evening for a quiet cocktail. One of our clients became separated from the group because there was no room left in the lift when we all boarded. Not a major problem you would think, he can join us in the next lift. This is a problem however, when the door staff suddenly decide to stop letting people without reservations into the venue. Our client told the door staff that he was the last remaining member of a group that had just gone into the restaurant but was bluntly told that he was not getting in, end of story. Thankfully he managed to call us before we ordered drinks and the entire party was forced to leave and go somewhere else. Unlike these jokers, we understood that you cannot just leave a client stood on the street. I am not so desperate for an elevated view of the City that I'm going to allow myself or my clients to be treated so poorly. I cannot imagine that I will be going back here. PS I've been to the champagne bar at Tower 42 many times and never had a problem - the view is just as good and the staff treat the customers properly - will stick with them from now on!

title: Unusual mix but it work at a price
comment: Very unusual mix of food very nobu in style on the 38th floor great views , the service was excellent and very friendly we let our server pick the meal really good choices , the right mix of sushi etc with Peruvian grill and Brazilian touches to the rools god suff ,we pick a reasonable wine  Not much change on £50 for wine easy £100plus for a meal ,worth going we had a great night  It's important to pick good fun people to go with ,a treat place at night ,bankers who lunch  During the day

title: Amazing view, Great food, Shame about the people...
comment: Focusing on the sushi dishes as that is what i went there for. Me and my friend were thoroughly impressed with the food. Not necessarily the 'best' sushi we had had but the inventive recipes and combinations for sushi was refreshing and truly delicious. It was bordering on expensive but I guess part of the bill is the location and it was not extortionate. Me and my partner ended up with a bill of around £75 if I remember correctly. The gentleman we had serving us was very nice and always on hand, we were at the sushi bar. The views were beautiful but although I did not get the opportunity to explore the whole restaurant, I feel that it could have been made more accessible. Perhaps when seated at a table rather than the sushi bar, the higher level may offer a better viewing platform. The main negative of the place is what I have heard in many of the other reviews. It seems as if they have tailored the place to serve the bankers in the area and have to maintain a somewhat exclusive seeming entry policy which appears to be smart dress for men and any trashy essex bird looking for a wealthy husband. Im sure you can guess what kind of atmosphere this tends itself to inside. Very superficial, lots of tarted up women wearing different colours of the same tight dress, arrogant men trying to flaunt it and a lot of staff, especially door staff who seem to make lots of judgments of you based on your clothing or how you speak. Now I was well dressed at the time and speak well due to my education but I still felt myself being scrutinized unnecessarily especially considering the mouthy essex woman demanding a table next to me because 'Shut aap, I need to get get in quick and get a drink down me'. An absolutely beautiful place, just wish they hadnt intentionally attracted such a pretentious collection of people on purpose.

title: Family friendly lunch
comment: Went on Christmas Eve for lunch after having the kids to the office. 2 adults and 3 kids. Youngest 3 oldest 11. The staff were great with the kids. Views amazing! Lifts, amazing! Especially on the way down, we all loved it. Food was good. Edamame and tempura beans really tasty. Sashimi a bit on the thick side but very tasty, eldest loved it. Assorted tiradito really nice. Black cod ok, bit under cooked for me, not as good as nobu. Coconut rice tasty and great with the cod and the pork. Didn't stay for pudding as just a lunch. Asked the waiter what Peruvian corn was and he answered "it's like big corn...from Peru" not a great description, it was served very sweet. Quite tasty but could have maybe been better described.  In all setting and experience really good. Food good and some interesting stuff on the menu.

title: It's all about the view, very New York come Tokyo
comment: OK, the views from the bar are unbelievable. The whole place is very "Nobu like" in being quite corporate. The food is good, but very expensive for what it is. Our table wasn't in a great place in the restaurant - so don't assume you'll get a view for dinner itself. Maybe just go to the bar, if that's possible?

title: With great price comes great responsibility
comment: To me, what counts in a restaurant/bar is quality. The food must be great and top notch, the drinks must be well-prepared and made to the recipe. I am willing to pay premium price for excellent food and drinks, and that's what I was expecting from SushiSamba, especially given the premium price they charge. You can imagine my dismay then at being served a £12 mojito which was both watered down and lacking in sugar. I have never been served such a bad mojito in my life. I then decided to switch to beer, that can't be bad I thought. Wrong again! The beer hadn't been in a fridge long enough, and was fairly warm which is NOT ok if the beer in question is a light, refreshing lager like Kirin. This is how I decided I'd avoid dining there and went somewhere else. The view is absolutely amazing, and the ride up is definitely thrilling. But the drinks were abysmal, and you can't make up for poor drinks with presentation and scenery I'm afraid.

title: Great food, energetic and attentive service, the best views of London
comment: I treated my younger sister and two friends to dinner at Sushi Samba last Saturday, and we had a great time! The waiter read our table and really made our night an enjoyable one, both being informative and knowledgeable about the food and drink, while also being friendly and non-pretentious with my younger guests. The menu all looked so good that we actually left it up to the waiter to decide what we had, meaning we only needed to make him aware of dietary requirements and meat/flavour preferences. He got it spot on and we loved everything that was brought out. Leave room for dessert and a post-meal cocktail upstairs in the lounge bar, which looks over the restaurant... you might even spot a celeb :)

title: Great view over London; however, overpriced with inconsistent service quality
comment: We went there already many times. Conclusions made (i) great, unique view over London (ii) stylish location (iii) good drinks (bar tenders flexible to prepare drinks outside of menu), however, (iv) overpriced with inconsistent service quality. Irrespectively of ordering @ the bar or from a waiter, Sushisamba is charging a service charge. Even then, if you had to wait for 30mins being able to order a drink. Once we asked to remove the charge and the reaction was not very friendly.

title: Thanks for nothing
comment: I wanted to book this restaurant for my 50th birthday celebration with 15 friends this Christmas. My only concern was poor reviews for service but in the end I decided the location over-rode all other concerns and I'd go ahead and book.  Unfortunately I'll never know what it would have been like. When I called the restaurant to make the reservation this morning (Dec 7th, 2012) it was clear from the outset that I was in a race with the very rude girl on the phone to see if I could actually make a reservation before she just hung up on me.  I didn't make it. Very condescending and dismissive and in the end I ended up shouting at her that I couldn't believe how rude she was and had to hang up because I was so upset at the way I was spoken to.

title: Sushi "I can't hear myself think" Samba
comment: Firstly, being a party of eight and being squeezed onto a table clearly meant for a maximum of six was not a good start. After complaining we were moved to a better table and although the food was good the evening was completely blighted by the fact that the music was so loud, I could not even hear the person next to me - let alone anyone else on our table.  Won't bother going back.

title: Great view, good food, awful service
comment: Unbelievable views of London for the 39th? Floor. Good food (although not roka/nobu standard). Service however on both my trips here was appalling, if you can get a table,(yes I had a reservation, doesn't mean you can actually get a table!) bar service also awful. As much as I'd like to of given it 1* the view alone is worth the visit!

title: feast your eyes on this...
comment: Sushi Samba... The Rough Guide... 1. The view is everything you would expect and a little better. Go after dark.  2. Expect to pay a premium for the location.  3. Velvet Rope - advance booking essential for entry to the building.  4. Enjoy the ride (the elevator is fun) 5. Avoid gimmicks - the wagyu beef is more gimmick than good food and not worth the high price. Wine is also pricey, but the other items on the menu and cocktail list are delicious and well executed.  6. squeeze in a pudding - excellent contrasting yet complimentary flavours and textures. not to be missed.

title: Wow
comment: Amazing place, like eating at Nobu without the pretenciousness of Mayfair and with stunning views. The food is excellent but it is not just the food that amazes. The service if friendly and efficient and the views are unsurpassed in London. Its hard to get a table but well worth the effort. A must for anyone wanting to experience why London is now one of the best places in the world to eat!

title: impressive
comment: Six of us went here a couple of weeks back and had a really enjoyable evening. First off, the trip up in the elevator was fab - awesome views across London on a starry winter's night. We had a great table right in the middle of the restaurant and we thought the atmosphere was excellent. The waiting staff were attentive, a little too attentive really and way too smug about the restaurant 'I like to call it a fusion...' etc - over the top and unnecessary. Food was ace! We went up to the bar afterwards for a couple of drinks and to look out over the City - really good. Flipping expensive - but what else would you expect really...?

title: LOVED it
comment: Total opposite to the last breview. The service was top class. Patrick our waiter got the attitude and attentiveness just right. the guy who met us and took us to our table was also perfect. I do not give reviews like this lightly. The view from the restaurant is a whole lot better than you think it's going to be. Go at night!! The food was good, some things better than others - for example the pork was fantastic. It was our son's 9th birthday and our friend from Italy was leaving the city so a family celebration - the welcome couldn't have been better - sincere and fun. Coming from Hackney - we felt like we'd been on holiday for an evening!

title: Great experience
comment: I really enjoyed my evening here. A relaxed atmosphere, great drinks, and the view of London below you is awesome. (It was nightime). We ate at the sushi bar. The food was beautifully prepared and presented by dedicated chefs, and the service from a young man from Barcelona was first class. And good wine. They have an outside terrace, with a firepit, and a beautiful lit up ornamental tree, which also looks amazing, but this was closed because of high winds. Next time I will keep my fingers crossed for this as well!!

title: sushisamba
comment: best when its sunny to enjoy the views. caipirinhas had inconsistent taste, but nevertheless well prepared. kobe beef was very tasty. the tamal was a bit dry, mochi desert was very good.  service was overall good, changed our table to a warmer location, but added wrong dishes to bill.

title: The elevator ride up doesn't justify their appalling service.
comment: I have been a big fan of Sushi Samba since it opened unofficially a few months back. The food is fresh and delicious, and the view spectacular. After 6 visits unfortunately, their service has deteriorated, painfully so. Yesterday I took some very important clients for lunch. At one point I gave my credit card to the manager by their computer station and asked him to make sure I paid for the bill. He recognised me from prior visits and said no problem. When my clients left to take some sunset pictures, our server acknowledged they had my card all ready. Once I asked for the check, they couldn't find my card. Obviously they had a change of staff from lunch to dinner, and the new server knew nothing about it.
