A second server approached us, (french) bald with glasses, and he proceeded to berate me and question me as if I committed some crime. I was mortified. I had to stop him after a 10 minute interrogation, and asked him to go to the side to discuss this, away from my clients. I asked to speak to his manager. Minutes later, another very young frenchman came charging at me. Never gave me the opportunity to explain what happened, and clearly based on what the server told him, he demanded an explanation aggressively. Apparently in an American restaurant, the concept of the customer is always right, or at the very least given the benefit of the doubt, hasn't crossed the pond yet. I asked him to stop, and give me an opportunity to explain myself. Once I did, he denied my story, as restaurant policy is to give customers a numbered card, in lieu of a stored credit card. Unfortunately I wasn't given one. Needless to say I finally snapped. How is this any of my fault? Eventually, after a 30 minute incident, another server casually walked by with my credit card, as the previous server had given it to him. So yes I cursed them both, and the day they were born, for I have never been humiliated like this before. At that point no apologies from either frenchmen, too arrogant to recognise that they're supposedly working a nice restaurant and who clearly, have allowed the heights of Sushi Samba to go to their heads.  If it weren't for the lovely Maitre d' who saw our group visibly shaken on the way out, and took a genuine interest in us, the whole day was ruined. At this rate, it won't take long for London to take notice. NEVER AGAIN

title: Go
comment: What an awesome experience! Went with a couple of girlfriends for lunch. Asked our waiter to recommend dishes and drinks for us. What we received was innovative, classy and flavourful. I don't often comment on restaurants, but feel I need to in this case. Great drinks, great service, pricey but definitely worth it. The best was at the end. We asked for the bill, but we were brought a birthday treat instead. How they knew it was my birthday I do not know. They must have overheard us chatting about it. Hats off to our waiter, Patrick and all at Sushi Samba.

title: Everyone mentions the views yes..but lets talk about the food
comment: OK so the view is fantastic. The restaurant is beautiful and the service was excellent and the staff very friendly and efficient. The big problem for me was the food was very poor especially for the price , and given how difficult it is to book this place I was really expecting more.  I should say now that I am not a big foody and don't claim to know all there is about food, only what I like and what i don't, BUT, if you're expecting something along the lines of Roka or Zuma etc then forget it.  It's well presented but lacked in taste and quality and didn't have that feeling of being fresh , although I'm sure it was, it just didn't taste that way.The sushi and rolls were just plain average to poor.  My fiance is South American and we were also expecting more from the latin twist but didn't get it. The plantains were OK but the tamales were really dry and flavourless and just didn't taste right at all.  We will go back in futire if only for a drink and for the views but I will need to know that the food has improved before I eat here again.

title: You have to go!
comment: Myself and a friend just popped in for a drink. The views from the 38th floor of the Heron Tower are just breathtaking. The staff are incredibly friendly and attentive, even taking our photo with the whole city spread out behind us. Ok, it's pricey, even for a couple of G&T's, but you get what you pay for! Will go back and eat.

title: shes so fine !
comment: Fun place. Had cocktails outside really loved my 'shes so fine' Friday night in November sat outside by the firepit ! loved this place.

title: Terrible service, badly-made drinks and awkward layout
comment: The service was the worst service I have ever received in a bar/ restaurant of this supposed standard. I've never written an online review, but the service was so bad I felt compelled to.  After waiting roughly 15 minutes to be served at the bar, my drink was made incorrectly without an apology. It then took 45 minutes to receive a cup of tea - the wrong cup of tea.  I had been up once to check on it's status where the staff took a very strange approach to customer service and didn't give an apology.  After 40 minutes, I complained to the manager who first ignored my ask to talk. He then proceeded to discuss/ argue with the bar person. He then apologised by telling me, in a very rushed way, the bar staff should have notified him. He did not offer a free drink or real apology. For a bar/ restaurant that is aiming to attract people who happy to pay £12 + for a cocktail, the service just isn't up to standard. Anywhere at these prices where you might have waited 45 minutes to receive something as simple as a tea would have responded in a very different way.  After all this, comedy ensued when it was found that we, along with roughly 12 other people, had been seated on an art installation. The manager then proceeded to rush around sweeping the 'chairs' from under us. We were all left in confusion.  The lack of seating in the bar and the layout is just terrible and wastes, what are, amazing views. If you are looking for city views I would look elsewhere.

title: Great food....really terrible atmosphere!
comment: I was really looking forward to this night out. My friend and I arrived at the door with our reservation to be told "next time lads, it's no casual dress"....by some young guy in a cheap suit and even cheaper shoes. I may have had jeans and a cap on but I spend a lot of money on clothes and you should never presume someone in 'casual' wear can't afford a bit of raw fish! This annoyed me from the offset only to arrive upstairs to deafening music so my friends and I couldn't hear each other speak. The place was full of cheap clothes, cheap women, wearing cheap perfume, sniffing around wealthy 'bankers' with cheap taste. Amazing views outside but certainly not inside. Avoid like the plague!

title: Not worth the money, it's a shame, the view is to die for!
comment: Last night I was taken out to SushiSamba in the Heron Tower. Amazing lift up to the restaurant where we were kept waiting for our table for nearly 10 mins, despite being on time ish (5 mins late) We were shown to a fantastic table overlooking North London, lovely. We had a charming waiter who brought over our menus, yes there are 3 of them, food cocktails and wine. 1 Nina Fresa @ 10.50 value 4/5 1 Kaffirihna @ 9.50 value 4/5 ( I wanted the Cha-Cumbra but the didn’t have one of the ingredients but the waiter said I wouldn’t have noticed the difference anyway) odd thing to say about an ingredient. This theme would shine through. First thing we ordered was Hamachi Nigiri ( I was corrected on the pronunciation ) @ 11 This was nice, the rice was room temp and both pieces even though they were very small were tasty. Value for Money? 2/5 Second was the Jalea Seviche @ 10 value 4/5 (sic) This was three pieces of squid (rings) on top of a seviche of white tail fish? with the classic accompaniments of shaved onion, peppers and lime juice and thai green curry ‘milk’?.  Third was the pork belly @ 12 value 5/5, this dish comprised of small cubes of deep fried but melting pork belly on a small leaf with citrus and pepper shavings. I could have eaten a kilo of this stuff, amazing. SO well flavoured and balanced. For mains (but you can’t call them mains at SushiSamba, you will get in trouble) we had Grade 9 Waygu @ 49 value 3.5/5 that you cook yourself on a very VERY hot stone. Even the waiter commented on it being a little too hot. This comes with a selection of sauces, bizarrely they supply you with sesame oil for stopping the meat stick which flavours very strongly, a soy and spring onion, and two others that were not worth mentioning. Meh, it was nice and tasty but not worth £49. We also ordered duck with foie gras ontop of rice @ 28 value 4/5. The combination of the duck and foie gras was epic but the rice, what on EARTH were they thinking about. It was some kind of warm, rice pudding affair with not enough seasoning. once combined with the mushroom sauce (waaaait, I will get to that in a min) which was a sharp soy and yuzu flavour made all the difference. The rice has to go! for sides we got some asparagus @8.5 value 1/5 and mushrooms @8 value 5/5!  Asparagus was just that, grilled and I could do the same in less than 30 seconds on a BBQ for 1/8th of the price. Mushrooms were fat, plump, juicy and delicious! sharp from the soy, tangy from the yuzu ( I think it was that anyways ) an utter delight! put the juice on the rice from the duck dish to make it edible.  For dessert we ordered the Yuzu tart @ 12 value 5/5 - amazing! blown suger, little meringues, crumble base and other tastes I couldn’t work out! stand out dish for me.  Second dessert was Red choc chilli @ 9.5 value 4/5 - lovely dessert, nice tastes and great presentation. Overall. Food was good, not worth the price tag IMO but good all the same. The desserts were fantastic! well thought out and presented. It was a shame we had to wait nearly 40 mins for them to arrive as we were on the cusp of walking out due to the wait. Wine was nice, we had a bottle of St. Veran Thomas Burgundy @ 40 value 4/5 Water, well we order once bottle but were charged for 2 as the waiter got us a second without asking if we wanted to shell out another £4. I was annoyed by this. Service. 1/5 - this was the major problem. I counted my chair being knocked by waiters and waitresses on more than 21 occasions during the meal as after about the 5th or 6th time I was sad enough to start counting. I asked for no cilantro (as it is called on the menu, I know it is coriander) and was CORRECTED that it was indeed coriander as it arrived on my main even though I had asked for none! We were kept waiting for too long at the start and charged for water we didn’t order. Would we go back? no. Would we recommend it? no. Why? There is better food, abet without the view, for the money. @£243 for a meal for 2 with one bottle of wine and two cocktails I expect more from the food and a hell of a lot more from the staff.  I did however have a fantastic time and really enjoyed my time looking out over London, maybe if I was a banker with no grasp of money and its value I would have had a better time. Looking out over the restaurant and the clientèle, it seems this place will continue to be busy, simply, there are far too many bankers with far too much money to warrant this restaurant changing a damn thing!  Oct 2012

title: This place has everything.........amazing
comment: Went to the Sushi Samba last night for the first time..........WOW !!  The food was excellent and the views were too......38th floor of the Heron tower in the heart of London......we didnt get there until 11pm and it was still buzzing with some really good loud music running throughout the bars & even in the restaurant which I really liked. The glass lift is an experience on its own......... All of the staff were really friendly and couldnt do enough to help explain the food options available....we had an excellent table looking straight out onto the london skyline.............if you want to impress someone and have a good lively evening out.....try this place out...........I would personally stick with the fish dishes across the board...we ordered some beef on skewers which were just ok........BUT the fish.........oh yeah !! cant wait to go again with friends to introduce them to our new gem find !! Enjoy

title: What a disappointment.
comment: Ok. Lets get something straight. I must be a glutton for punishment when I try to make sense of fusion food. Some of them work (Asia de cuba) some of them dont. But ive been to Sushi Samba in NYC and and Miami. I was expecting the same kind of food as this is a chain. At least the same type of quality. What I got is 'little value for money' food with your view. Ok, but thats not what I am there for. The food was pretty average if you ask me. Nothing to tell your friends about. Thats not really good for a place that charges that much. Brazilian Japanese Peruvian? I guess its not for me. The service was ok, not rushed, but may be a little slow.

title: On the Up & Up
comment: This was a surprise treat for my wife & I, organised by my son. Little did I realise it was on the 39 floor of the Heron building which you access by an outside lift with a glass bottom (not for the faint hearted). On arrival, the reception was warm, attentive & very friendly. We had an amazing evening, great food, which our waiter helped us chose, exceptional wine & saki, again helped by the sommelier with a few tasters thrown in & exceptional views over London. Great experience & highly recommended but remember, it's very high up.

title: A great addition to the city restaurant scene
comment: Loved it. Great bar. Great food. Great atmosphere. Great views. Great views from the toilet(!). Altogether a wonderful night. Check it out!

title: Mixed feelings
comment: Went to Sushi Samba recently after it opened. I have mixed feelings - mainly due to the service. It was very inconsistent and slow. Half the staff did not seem to know what they were doing. This was probably due to the fact the restaurant had recently opened, but I do not think that this is acceptable for a restaurant of this calibre. I believe the restaurant was in the soft-opening stage, but we found this out at a later date. We ordered wine to start - it did not arrive. Asked a waiter, wine still did not arrive. We asked several times and eventually they brought the wine, but it was the wrong one. They finally brought the right wine, at least 25 / 30 minutes after we first sat down!  When the mains came, my side of quinoa did not arrive. I asked and asked but it did not appear. Eventually they said it is being made. By the time it came I had finished my main and they told me it was on the house. I would expect this, and would have much rather have paid for it and had it with my main at the same time. The food itself was delicious. Most of the staff were friendly although all seemed hurried, and often did not stop even when they could see us trying to get their attention. It is a shame - I had high expectations of Sushi Samba. It is just near my office, fantastic location and is somewhere that I would be keen to frequent had I been impressed with my initial visit. I am willing to give Sushi Samba another chance - but if the service is a repeat of last time then I shall not return again.

title: Great experience!
comment: The whole experience was great, unforgettable, shame about the rude bartenders (just two), but besides that it was a very good experience. Not the perfect place for a birthday (you have to bring your own cake and pay for them to bring it out, not ideal), but besides that it's a very good place.

title: Magnificent view
comment: I loved the whole concept .... The views of London in that sunny afternoon...were expectacular. the Caffirhina....you have to try it They have our thumbs up....

title: Go for the view
comment: The best thing, and its a great thing, about this restaurant is the view. Spectacular. After such an opener any food is going to struggle but what we ate was pretty good. Purists will cringe the 'messed about with' sushi, but the deep fried shrimp, saki and desserts were all great. Not cheap but a great venue for a festive lunch with friends

title: Outstanding experience all round
comment: From the remarkably quick elevator rides to the stunning views from the 38th floor, this is one hell of an experience. Once on the 38th floor and in the SushiSamba Restaurant, things get better. OK, OK, one caveat now - save up your pennies, a couple of cocktails is going to be on the wrong side of £20. And the food is not cheap, but it IS worth it. Try the London Roll, tamales and any amount of the sushi. The staff are outstanding and all seem to be very knowledgeable.  It is well worth the investment. We will return especially in the summer - the views will be spectacular.  One downside is that if you have a later booking (8;00 pm isn) it may be bit of a zoo to get in.  But, get your reservation and go!!

title: great afternoon lunch here
comment: I joined a friend for lunch here  booked several weeks before excellent venue- beautiful views and lovely food  Shame we were place opposite the clear-down area, so I had to witness every member of staff scraping plates ! This said, the plates were really good and the staff gladly replaced a bottle of Laurent Perrier which they opened in error Dont expect a cheap meal here - it's gonna cost you bucks but this said, Great friendly staff - sassy music - excellent ambience Well done Sushi Samba - I'll be back !!

title: Terrible
comment: After loving Sushisamba in both Chicao and New York, I was really excited to hear news that it was to open in London. When finally securing a table for two, I was looking forward to the night with abandon. After being whizzed by glass lift to the 39th floor, and enjoying a couple of cocktails at the outdoor roof terrace bar, enjoying spectcular views of London and to the east the whole Olympic Park, I was ready to eat, and was hungry. My partner and I ordered three starters to share, and a main each. The starters came and were divine, the mains however really disappointed, bland and rather tasteless. After dinner we made our way to the bar inside and orderd a few more cocktails. The bar staff were rather rude and abrupt, and I think I finally got to the bottom of this in my mind before I left. How the heck can staff in a customer service environment be chirpy, happy and friendly when their superiors are terrible control freks. The whole evening the manager's were much more concerned with marching round the restaurant and bar, pointing here, and pointing there, wanting nothing more than to look important on theiir walkie talikies than either the well-being of their staff or customers. The atmosphere in this place has the potential to be fantastic, just not until the atmosphere created by the staff has improved.

title: View, view, view
comment: Go for the awesome view of London and beautiful people but don't expect your drinks in a hurry! Good atmosphere, good meet up point.

title: Awesome night
comment: Great location 38 floors above London, the bar is busy , the view amazing and the food is good value with something for even the impossible to please, as good as Vegas , drink prices are reasonable taking into it's rip off London . This is a great place with a real vibe and beat to it. Well done to all the team who looked after a table of 4 on 2 nov

title: Go there for the view...that's about it
comment: A lot of hype, but huge disappointment. There late Friday night, busy but not packed. Hostess, is in the middle of a busy aisle, between people walking by, people trying to figure when their tables would be ready and her friends stopping to chat, things were uneccesarily messy. Ordered drinks at the bar, probably 10 people waiting and 3 bartenders, took 40 minutes. Bar staff more interested in chatting up the waitresses and joking with each other than serving drinks, I saw a few people give up and walk away without a drink. When drinks finally came, average at best is being kind, neither of us finished them. Been in London for many years and don't mind busy places where you need to wait a bit for a drink, but this was hands down the most incompetent bar staff I have ever seen. Food was ok but unremarkable, Rokka, Zuma, plenty of other places with similar/much better food, atmosphere and better services. Yes the view is nice, but nowhere close to compensate for the bad service and average food

title: Luxury italian shoes aren't enough to be allowed at the bar
comment: I wasn't allowed to enter the bar because my shoes were considered inadequate. I was just wearing a pair of black classy shoes of the value of £ 250 of a well known luxury Italian brand. That's ridiculous. The man at the entrance should learn some basics of fashion. I'm really disappointed, I would never go back.

title: Never arrange parties in Sushi Samba
comment: I have organised my husband's 30th Birthday party at Sushi Samba and I can say that they have ruined it! The reason was the dress code which is casual elegant. I am not originally from this country and for me wasn't cristal clear what exactly that means and I can say that I have checked many times their website for some information before organising the event.  It was me and my husband who went first for a dinner and we expected our guests in the bar area after that. It turned up that some of the guests couldn't come in because they were wearing particular type of trainers. As no one mentioned it before let me tell you that DARK COLOUR TRAINERS FOR THE MEN ARE ALLOWED AND LIGHT COLOUR TRAINERS ARE ALLOWED ONLY FOR THOSE WHO ARE EATING IN THE RESTAURANT! This doesn't make any sense at all or even if they are so strict about the rules, why this is not mentioned anywhere?  Me and my husband spent a lot of money for a dinner and we had some people already in when that happened and even after speaking with the manager explaining that we have special occasion and I wasn't made clear about their rules about the dress code, they have sent our guests back! We ended up leaving the place and looking for a quick plan B which absolutely spoiled my husband's birthday mood.  I find that very unprofessional and I strongly recommend DON'T organise parties there, if they don't like someone's appearance and don't let the guests in, the whole event will be spoiled!

title: Great place to see London
comment: The view is stunning, the staff are helpful but don't quite get it right and the atmosphere is very false, ah yes as its a restaurant, the food is good but way over priced. Been here a few times, the first visit leaves an impressive feeling, but in retrospect that was purely the view, and I will say it is worth going up there for an early lunchtime drink just to see the view, at the moment you don't have to eat, sure that will change as people realise the best bit is free! Staff were lovely, friendly, over helpful and very ineffective, seemed to be about how much water they could serve (are all waiting staff in major cities on water commission ?) and how quickly they got the food to you. This meant dishes randomly turning up as they were ready, told it was part of the charm. The set up is also a little strange with the general feel of squeezing in what they could to the space given, the place probably works best in the summer when the outside 39th floor balcony will really kick in, but again, you will be there for London not SS, unlike in the states where the restaurant is on par with Nobu. Funny thing is I will go again, but a snack at the bar and a martini outside thanks.

title: Wow Factor
comment: Went in there couple of weeks ago , I can easily say that this is one of the best places I ever been to .As someone said before -all started at the moment you step inside that lift...picturise it ...Friday evening , the whole city in your feet , full of lights , and you are all above it ! We had table booked by a friend , didn't have to wait for it , as I took a look while the security downstairs was checking for the reservation ( with a high-lither saying :No wait for a table) , so I guess some people do wait , to be seated ...anyway , just pass trough the bar -looked pretty good to me .. I will be back for a drink in there . The actual restaurant is very spacious , interior very nice ,I loved the bamboo lights hanging from the celling . We had a table by the window...and again we come to the view...I felt like I saw London for a first time ever...:) . Now service : Very friendly and helpful , the guy asked as if we ever been there before , and if we need help with the menu and while I was waiting for my friend to come back and just looking around , the manager(which I found out later) came to me just to say "Hello" ,if I'm waiting for somebody , do I like the place ,that they open just before the Olympics , and still working on the menu , service etc... he told me a lot about the food - that they trying to accommodate all tastes and that's why you can have sushi as you know it or even if you are not a great sushi lover like me -you will find something to eat- sushi American Style :)...and I loved it ! Breakdown : 2 glasses of Red wine , 1 Bloody Mary , 2 plates of sushi , 1 bottle of water -£ 60 . Not bad I believe..., ahhh and yes , some coated, fried French beans on the house...:) , very tasty I have to say ,coming from someone who eats vegetables because I have to , not because I like to... Also they have this great terrace , but it was closed at the time because of the strong wind, as we been told , but I can see myself next summer sitting outside watching the world go by ... Bottom line : Highly recommended !

title: Spectacular views
comment: See London in a total different light. The food is a mix of sushi and Peruvian delicacies. We had a great time and will certainly visit again.

title: Fantastic view, excellent food, ok service
comment: Ate with some college friends at Sushi Samba. Everything we tried was delicious. I have eaten at the Sushi Samba's in Chicago & New York. London is by far the best. I believe service will get better since they only opened recently. Will go back for sure.

title: Worth it for the view or the food alone, the other is a bonus
comment: This is my favourite City restaurant at the moment. I'd go for the food if it was in a windowless basesment, or for the view if it served burger and chips. The fact that you get both wonderful, innovative and genuinely different food, and one of the best views in London combined into the one experience is just brilliant.

title: Fantastic view, food and service!
comment: Clearly the reviewer before me just had some bad luck. From the second we got in the lift the experience was brilliant. The views in the all glass lift are worth it alone. Our waiter Mark was attentive and well informed. The drinks arrived with haste and were innovative by means of presentation and ingredients. The style is very tapas based in terms of service to table, everything is for sharing and comes out at a nice comfortable base. Particular favourites from what was ordered on the night - rock shrimp tempura in spicy mayo, the wagyu beef served on the hot stone and the lamp chop robata................all extremely tasty. Mark also advised us on the quantity to ensure we didn't over order which I always appreciate. So is it expensive? In a word yes, but it is on the 39th floor in the middle of the square mile serving great food and drinks...........my view you pay for what you get!

title: Asian fusion reaches new heights in London
comment: Great venue on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower. It was a horrible rainy day but the view over London was still breathtaking. The food is good - Brazilian/ Japanese, but we ate mainly Asian Fusion food. The dishes ranged from good to very good, and the prices were about what you would expect when you eat "on top of the world". The service was efficient and friendly. Mental note made to return on a sunny evening in summer.

title: Sushi with sytle in the City
comment: Went on a Wednesday night, 4 of us (two couples) with a 9pm reservation (which had required a 4 week notice to book). Location is convenient (2-3 mins walk from Liverpool St station) and the situation on the 38th floor simply stunning - with the added excitement of a very fast-moving lift! The bar is what one would expect from a new glitzy/upmarket City bar both in terms of appearance and clientele.  Our visit got off to a bad start when we were seat 45 minutes late, bad enough but it was a 9pm reservation so we didn't eat before 10pm! This was unacceptably poor and very disappointing from such an establishment that no compensation was offered (e.g. free glass of wine). Once we sat though, the experience was wonderful, a real treat. The restaurant was busy and humming with activity and not overwhelmed by the bar at all. The food was fabulous, el topo and samba London rolls were a particular delight. As per previous reviews, I did find the wine list sky-rocketed but we enjoyed a nice white for £25 which was fine (twice!). Price-wise it did feel like everything came with a £2-3 premium for what it was, which, when you don't have the view because it's dark and foggy made it feel a little pricey. That said, £55 per head including half a bottle of wine each and half a bottle of mineral water isn't bad - I've certainly paid similar for worse food and experience. Definitely recommend, as a treat rather than a regular occassion though.

title: MAKE THIS A PRIORITY
comment: Sushi Samba is the best package you'll get for London 2012 in terms of atmosphere, hot spot, food, vibe, crowd, and view! There's nowhere else like it in London and it puts all Mayfair venus to shame!  They have an amazing peruvian chilli sauce that they can be stingy with telling you about. They should have a wider vegetarian selection - but they'll realise this when the hype dies down and people won't trek to the city.  Cocktails are also too strong. And they never ever pick up their reservation lines within a decent time-frame! Also their tea portions are a joke. How can they be stingy on hot water. However, i keep going back for the views + the food - make sure to have the green bean tempura with truffle sauce. Out of this world.

title: Thank god for class.
comment: Finally a venue that prides itself with making sure its clientele dress appropriately,don't get me wrong it is not the cheapest restaurant/bar but undeniably one of the top in London if not Europe 37.5 seconds to the 40th floor wow.but the best factor is the people there i did not have to worry about people getting drunk and falling over the place as the clients were all in control which is very rare to see these days.final thoughts if you want a high class venue with a all round team? Duck and waffle and sushi samba is the place to be.

title: Overpriced, good food served by pushy, bad-mannered staff
comment: The sushi is definitely good, however it is way overpriced! Three small dishes cost £50.  There was a long queue at the entrance due to shortage of staff rather than lack of seating.  The waiter was extremely bad mannered and kept pushing for us to order more food when we only wanted a light lunch. The constant water pouring even though my glass was almost full was annoying, just so that he can ask whether we wanted another bottle of water.  The decor was nice, and the view superb however due to the clientele it attracts over weekday lunches, the atmosphere was boring and corporate to say the least.

title: Awful service, sub-standard food
comment: My friends and I visited this restaurant for a birthday dinner, and we were extremely disappointed with the service, and underwhelmed by the food. The entire experience was awful. There is a lot of hype surrounding this restaurant at the moment, which is completely unjustified.  The staff were anal, rude, and incompetent (especially ill mannered, badly dressed hostesses who had huge chips on their shoulders and had clearly received no training). I have never been treated so badly by staff in a restaurant, and were it not for the fact that this restaurant is in the middle of nowhere, making it difficult to move to another restaurant, we would have left before starting our meal. The restaurant itself was absolutely freezing to the point that we had to put our coats on while we were eating (it felt like we were sitting in a draughty conservatory) and our table was in the middle of a walkway right next to the till, so we had the pleasure of enjoying hearing the manager shout at the waiters all evening. We asked to move up to the next table which was empty and in a less noisy and draughty position, but were refused, for absolutely no reason.  The food was “take out” sushi standard, and one dish was so burnt we had to send it back. Food quality to value ratio was extremely poor. There are far better Japanese and South American restaurants in London, in more central locations, with far better food, better service and at a better value.  The restaurant is trying to appeal to an exclusive international crowd, but the reality was very different. This restaurant works well in the States because it appeals to the masses, the atmosphere is casual and the prices are reasonable, which match the quality of the food. However, here, the restaurant is trying to appeal to a better crowd, and tries to market itself at an up-market venue serving great food with perfect service. It fails dismally on all accounts.  The only redeeming feature of this restaurant is the view (which we were unable to see from our table). If you are looking for a restaurant with good atmosphere , good service, and good food, do not go here.

title: Dreadful doorstaff, what a poor welcome
comment: Absolutely the worst doorstaff I ave ever experienced. The restaurant clientele are reminiscent of a party scene in The Only Way is Essex. Wonderful food and waiting staff but the 360º experience is what make a restaurant so massive FAIL.

title: Awful Experience
comment: Not enjoyable at all. The staff were rude when we arrived. The table we were given was in the entrance to the restaurant with a continuous draft and the hustle and bustle of people continually walking in and out. Not relaxing or enjoyable. Asked to move seats when we saw a table came available and they refused to do so. We ate with our jackets on. Food was OK but one dish came out burnt so we had to send it back. Overall experience was very poor especially as we waited a month for a reservation. I wouldn't bother going back, the food does no way outweigh the appalling service.

title: Overpriced over rated over everything!
comment: What an absolute load of money for nothing! Great views, but the service was appalling. Drinks were ridiculously expensive. The service was slow. The food was very average. Very small portions. Very expensive. We left the restaurant hungry after spending a fortune on dinner. The only great thing was the view. We will not be returning. I haven't done a review for a while, but felt this was so bad I had to tell everyone.

title: The view is the only reason to visit
comment: We ate at Sushi Samba soon after it opened and were looking forward to experiencing this chain. We were whisked up in the lift to a very buzzy bar that was crowded but not packed. Drinks took a long time to make and were very expensive. The view is spectacular though. Sat at our table and our evening started to go down hill. Staff were unhelpful, slow to serve and did not explain the menu well. We were a party of 6 and most of dishes were set up for 4-5 people so at least one person missed out on each dish. In my opinion the wait staff should have explained this so that we could have ordered more portions.  After we had eaten all that we had first ordered, the table was cleared and dessert menus were given out despite us being told we could order main dishes as we needed them. This meant that most of us were still hungry after eating a meal we payed £100pp for.  We left having felt swindled. Poor service, expensive food and drink, and portions that would leave a size 0 model feeling hungry.  Go up to the bar, take some photos of the view and then go straight back down again.

title: Excellent views, excellent dinner!
comment: Its hard to fault this restaurant. The view at night is quite superb from the 38th floor of the Heron Tower, and the 30 second glass lift journey from street level is a real talking point! We kicked things off with some very well made cocktails at the funky bar on the outdoor terrace and then went in for dinner. The service was excellent from start to finish. Our waiter helped us through dining choices and to his credit, clearly knew the menu inside out. The food was delicious. The menu also contained some unusual South American / Sushi fusion dishes which were all well executed and tasty.  London top level sushi restaurants are already at a very high standard, and this is no exception. This made a nice change from dining in the West End. Its expensive, but that comes with the territory.

title: Who is not trendy enough?
comment: Excellent fusion sushi - check [Japan and Peru?] Best views over London - check [38th Floor] Trendy young things - check [Spot the intruder] Good service - check Self-important and obnoxious hostesses - checkmate!

title: Great food and a great view
comment: Great food choice, the mix of japanese and brazillian food is great. The menu is extensive as if the drinks menu. Great service and the waiters are all very knowledgeable.

title: Delicious food, cocktails, atmosphere and view
comment: Had a extremely memorable night with friends. A very busy night, but the staff coped amazingly. The sushi was out of this world - a fusion of South American tastes with Japanese. Definitely worth a visit. Every dish was perfect. The outside terrace with views across London was spectacular as was the outside bar. Cocktails were great too and the staff were not arrogant in the slightest - a real bugbear of mine. Can't wait to go again. Think this will be a regular haunt.

title: Great Food, Strange Service
comment: Menu was great and a decent wine list. Only negative was the service, slow at times (especially drinks), dishes clearly to share not cut (fish served whole), and the order in which the dishes arrived seemed completely random (beef followed by fish followed by Sushi). Worth a try for its atmosphere but expect erratic service.

title: Average. View's are amazing and we had a great night but I felt we were laughing at rather than with.
comment: An impromptu meet up with a very good mate followed a long work lunch so I'd had a few that day and maybe arrived feeling a little judgemental. All the city hype about the place had built my expectations. Having visited in Vegas I wasn't sure what all the fuss was about. Anyway, after an espresso martini at another bar, just to wake the senses, they let us through the street door and took the lift to the whatever floor of the tower. Think i was expecting an updated Patrick Bateman-esque experience, on a Thursday night too, when the city gets on it. FAIL. Amazing views over the city but aside, just full of the usual suits trying to impress someone. Managed to get seats at the bar to eat. Restaurant fully booked as you'd expect. So we hit the menu. Selection of rolls. Nice. Wagyu beef on a hot stone. V nice. Jalapeño yellowtail, my favourite but just OK. Wine list rockets from 25-30 quid to 80-100 to 200 plus pretty quick so if you're a 'choose the 3rd from the bottom' trying to make a good impression then they've got you. Hate to know what the bill came to. Whatever, do a tasting menu at Roka or Nobu where each dish really teases you, and book a helicopter ride over the city instead! We did have a great night but we paid for an incredible one and provided our own entertainment.

title: Great food if you order carefully
comment: I have been to Sushi Samba now 3 times since it opened, and have enoyed each experience progessively more with each visit. Its a fabulous view and location, the service is improving, and if you know how to naviagte the menu, some of the food is truly fabulous. Its a bit lively on the price, the bar area a tad souless with a poor selection of drinks expecially wine by the glass. But, its a lovely light restaurant space, the sashimi selection, pop corn shrimp, wagyu beef sushi are just some of the really delicious food we ate. Its close to where I work, I wouldnt use it for drinks, but for a nice meal, it certainly does the trick.

title: Another fantastic evening !
comment: What to say that has not been said on this place? A restaurant is three things, the place, the food and the people.  The place is gorgeous, 3 levels and a beautiful terrace, superb setting and amazing views over London.  The food is superb, this time I had the occasion to taste the brilliant desserts and to enjoy again the excellent tiradito trio...  Add to this a very caring service, a nice crew and definitely a better crowd on weekend than in the week, more glam and sexy, less business, and all is said:  I have found my favourite restaurant in London!!! A brilliant adaptation of the concept to the city, you have to go there and experience it, definitely !

title: Fantastic
comment: Visited sushisamba last sunday and it was brilliant. From the glass lift which sweeps you up to the 38th floor to the wonderful food. The bar area is relaxed and once again the views amazing. The service and knowledge of our waiter was first class. A MUST

title: Great location and food
comment: The heron tower is a fantastic building, and being able to have a drink on the roofterrace 58 stories up, is pretty spectacular. The food at sushi samba is innovative and tasty.  The only thing that let's the place down is the service is haphazard at best.

title: Amazing!
comment: Had an amazing night in here, bar, atmosphere, food were all incredible. Would recommend for a great experience. Delight to have in the City and much needed. Not the cheapest place but was well worth it. I still felt the WOW factor a couple of days after. Definitely worth a try and food was some of the best Japanese I have ever had and I have been to Japan...

title: hi joanna do you really care
comment: well after writing a review over a month ago and personally contacting joanna as requested, have i heard from her? The answer is no, but her reply to my review sounded very caring and sincere and i had hoped for some sort of response. Now it leaves me to believe that her response was to make you the reader believe sushi samba really cared and you would have never have know if she had contacted me unless i posted this. Well heres your answer she hasnt.

title: Great food, service and view
comment: I went with 3 friends to Sushisamba on Sunday. The restaurant was busy but not full. We had lovely drinks at the bar, and moved to the restaurant on the 38th floor. We chose a salad, 2 different sushi dishes and the pork belly, as it was different. The food was incredible! Well seasoned, fresh and with lovely presentation. As we could not make our minds about desert, they suggested a desert platter, that was a surprise and delight. I will return on a sunny day, to be able to use the outside gardens and enjoy the London skyline!

title: Just perfect
comment: Visited with friends to celebrate a birthday. Service and food were faultless, our waiter Marco did everything to make the evening seamless, next time I would book earlier so that we could watch night fall over London. The views are just amazing. Well worth a visit. We will be back!

title: Perfect food, perfect drinks in a perfect location
comment: The title says it all. A unique Peruvian-Japanese fusion is the main attraction of a restaurant that offers the best vibe, very original and tasty drinks and a one of a kind 360º view of London from a 38th floor. Service is great and waiters reall know their job. A five start without doubts.

title: open air bar and restaurant 600 feet above London
comment: amazing new restaurant.. We had drinks next to a fire pit 600 feet above london on a sofa ion the open air!! we then mover through to the restaurant, where the food is a blend of Japan and Latin fusion.. Extraordinary service, fiood was excellent quality, served soooooooo n quickly. I have already rebooked ...this will be a very regular haunt for me works for business and for priovate life.. Not cheap but nothing this good comes cheap.. The views are amazing over london,...i could see St albans easily 25 miles away.. this is without doubt the most spectacular restaurant in London ....

title: Very nice lunch with perfect vews
comment: Went to Sushi Samba couple of weeks ago with my colleagues for business lunch. Will agree with everyone that ride on a lift is an experience itself. Views are amazing and are included in a price you pay for a food (it is expensive). Waiters were very friendly, but quite informal and laid back, that is probably why some people may not like service. It was four of us and we have been advised to order 2 dishes from each sections, but we decided to skip sashimi section... And there was the FOOD!!! Food is extremely delicious, especially liked black cod on a squers and rib eye steak. Though sushi in the end was too much, we didn't manage to finish it. But there were the dessert! - Couldn't resist that one, I think it was called "Yuzu", it looked like a crystal ball and was extremely tasty. Definitely worth a visit, however won't suit people who are afraid of heights.

title: 10/10 All round.. Amazing
comment: My boyfriend and I visited Sushi Samb today. We were amazed by the breath taking views. We had a cocktail on the terrace before our dinner - The barman was amazing! We then went through to have our dinner. The ambience of the entire resturant is stunning. The food & Sushi were - AMAZING. The waitor recommended us having 5-7 small meals to start. We went for 7 but I was SOO stuffed after 5. Everything was just gorgeous. Especially the dessert & Tea for afters. Thank you Sushi Samba - will recommend you to anyone. Be warned, It is pricey - But your paying for an experience and not just amazing food and location.

title: Would never return
comment: Like another reviewer I was asked to make contact with guest relations after a visit. I was impressed by this thinking they genuinely cared. Despite contacting them I never heard back. Contacted them again and received an email back apologizing saying someone would contact me. This has still not happened so their response was just a marketing act. Very very poor indeed.

title: great views of london & fab sushi...although sushi is slow
comment: this bar is great as its open all the time. the bar itself was great and the views were amazing. the service however is on the slow side, and drinks are you would expect at a place like this were pricey. the sushi, however was fabulous, and well worth paying for. the look of each dish is like a masterpiece!

title: Views to die for!!!!
comment: Visited there on a weekday for a late lunch, and were greeted at floor level by a "no trainers" policy. After a little conversation, receptionist shows us (reluctantly) the lifts. Now I understand that it might be a way of preventing it turning into a free tourist hotspot but when we got up after the head spinning lift ride and found the place almost empty, made that rule feel inadequate. Maybe apply for evenings only?  Sat outside, amazing views all round, food was fine service also. Pricing is not of the cheapest but considering the fun factor, it's pretty good. Low points : toilets were messy, no loo paper dispenser in the gents, just a roll sitting there, air freshner on the floor like at home. Not too classy! Went up for a cocktail after lunch on the top floor, only 5 (I think) cocktails on the menu, got told they had run out of my first choice. what, with only so few items on the list and at 4pm?! Menu card, was dirty, cocktails not great. Overall, still an enjoyable experience, they haven't been opened for long so few things need fine tuning.... Fun place.

title: Stunning views
comment: Amazing views and great outdoor bar but were not seated for over an hour after the booked time. Go for the drinks and view..

title: good views,but room for improvement inside!
comment: once your up on floor 38 all looks good , however after half an hour waiting at the bar NO DRINKS! ; once seated still NO DRINKS!! . . . . however, the staff were very friendly. overall a nice meal , but poor service.

title: Perfect
comment: The beginning is the start of an amazing experience, going up in the lift! Sushisamba has the best views of London, better than London eye! The waiters were amazing, they picked all our dishes after telling them who likes fish and/or meat, the best way to do it as they choice a good selection and they know the dishes the best.

title: Ignore the bad reviews - this place is great
comment: Really puzzled by some of the bad reviews - some people just aren't satisfied. For me, the views from the restaurant, the interior decor were enough to keep me happy. But there was more than that - the staff were so friendly, warm, knowledgeable and professional. And then the cocktails were superb. Admittedly it is expensive, but what do you expect? It is one of the most stunning restaurants in the world. I have been to Duck & Waffle too. I would say the food is more of a gourmet, high end quality there whereas Sushisamba is a place to have cocktails and some fusion food. Having said that I loved the Brazilian dish on the menu - it was great and the ceviche was fresh and tasty. As I say, there are some really unfair reviews of this restaurant. It was busy with happy people the last time I was there. This place is a wonderful restaurant with breathtaking views. The bar is also banging on a Friday night!

title: Nice place, quite hype
comment: Good bar and restaurant. I mean nice bar, good terrace, good food , but a bit alien ro the Latam spirit given the crowd of City Yuppies and "wish to be". This being said, nice place to go out... So you won't be disappointed but do not expect a Miami experience in London...

title: Great food, great views but terrible service
comment: We went to SushiSamba last friday and really enjoyed the food, excellent quality sushi, with many items in the menu which were quite original, and different to what I have experienced in Tokyo. The lift up Heron Tower is just as spectacular as the views at the top, which has some of the best views in London - its funny as I really felt I was in Tokyo where one spend most of you existence at 40 floors. We were lucky with the wind and it was lovely outside (shame about the smokers). Its a beautiful restaurant with lovely decor, a great place and comfortable place to eat. My big bone of contention with this place though is the service, there are plenty of places in London where I can get this quality of food at a much cheaper price, I dont mind paying these prices but both the food and the service must be excellent.  I felt the waiters were very inexperienced, not knowing how to pronounce things on the menu as well as knowing the menu partucularily well, that made making choices on the menu quite difficult to make. Due to thier lack of understanding of the menu we also ended up with food on our table we didnt order, and some items missing. There were many staff there but things just seemed very disorganised and asking for a waiters assistance ended up being a long waiting game at times. I could see many staff waiting by the side who did not react to our calls for assistance - with a "not my job" look on their faces. I wrote this review as a call out to the management to get their act together, I dont want to detract from the great food, many of the issues with service could be easily ironed out with better management and staff training.

title: The worst value for money - strange flavor mish mash - average service
comment: I have never written a review before in my life, but will take the time to summarize and share my experience in the most objective way possible. Positive: - spectacular views - several bar areas, outside terrace, nice decor Negative: - slow service during busy periods - average/poor food quality - completely overpriced - staff try too hard to sell lots of stuff After we were seated the waiters started to explain the menu which is a good idea unless you comment on almost every dish on the menu, and how phantastic it is. After 3 minutes I couldn't remember anything he told us. The waiter has a story for every dish and how it is prepared, and every dish is every waiters favourite. Also, staff are trying hard to sell small bites, beans and dips - which are absolutely nothing special to me.  Initially, the service was good, and food was brought to our table quickly. As the restaurant filled with business people it got slower and slower. There was at least a 30 minute break between starters and main course, and by the time the main was delivered I wasn't hungry anymore. The quality was mixed: all dishes look extremely well presented on the plate, but didn't taste very special. The strategy in the kitchen seems to be to put a lot of truffle oil on everything, which is very intense (and tastes ok), but of course kills any other flavors. The exotic food combinations seem somewhat strange to me, and you should only come here if you like unusual dishes. In my personal opinion cooking is not about mixing all sorts of exotic flavors and spices together in one dish - this trend has long passed. Simplicity and pureness are far more important. For instance, the waiter mentioned that the scallops were cooked somehow with tuna to make them crisp on the outside while remaining soft on the inside. To me, these were the strangest tasting scallops I have ever been served (very fishy). Why would you force another fishy flavor onto scallops? Be informed that there is no ordinary side dish on the menu, no potatos, normal rice (without coconut milk in it), normal vegetables...  The scallops, as well as a duck egg accompanying a main course were slightly undercooked. I am unsure if this is the reason why I didn't feel well a few hours after lunch... Luckily I did not try any sushi which my colleagues ordered for our table (personal dislike) - I don't think all products are as fresh as they should be. This is somewhat speculative, but would not surprise given the commercial nature of US chain restaurants. However, back to more objective and serious points: the numbers don't lie - unfortunately(!), as I couldn't believe my ears when I was told that lunch was 65 pounds per head - as we only had coke for drinks, this is almost all due to food! The amount and quality of food does not even remotely justify this price. You can easily have lunch at a Michelin star restaurant for less. Therefore, I can only conclude that given the average quality, slow service at the end, the value for money of this lunch experience was the worst in my life! PS: If you like views, there are far better restaurants in London which offer great views. A champagne ride on the London Eye (Fast Track) will also be a cheaper alternative...

title: Great food, great venue...service could be a little better!
comment: I went on Thursday lunch time, the weather was good so we were able to sit out on the terrace which just added to the experience! The food was just amazing, we had a mix of sushi and japanese small plates...everything was beautiful. The venue itself is lovely, with fantastic views of the city. The only negative was that he staff were not very attentive, and not the standard that you would expect from this type of place...waiting staff hugging each other right by your table when they arrive on shift was quite strange!  However I will definitley go back, I am sure in time the service standards will improve to meet the quality of the venue and the food.

title: Terrible terrible nothing like the USA sushi sambas
comment: Went here a week ago for a friends birthday as we love going to sushi samba in NYC & Miami. What we didn't realise was what a truly terrible night was ahead of us and no the views don't make up for it. First of all we went to the bar area to wait for the rest of our party. There were at least ten staff there but only two bagmen serving. I ordered a cocktail&a gin and tonic. Ten minutes later the cocktail was ready (nobody indicates that is your drink- I guess psychic abilities are de rigeur). After a further 20 min wait and going up and ordering another person a cocktail (which was made) I asked another bar man to make me a gin&tonic. How hard is that?! Gin plus tonic is not a 30 min wait drink! First barman then slams down original g&t a few mins after 2nd one. I refuse to pay for either as it's just plain ridiculous "service"made worse by seeing more staff milling around but noone serving. Oh and the cocktail list is crap! None of the great cocktails in the USA branches. There were further issues when my friend tried to then move to the table, blocked by a member of staff who thought we didn't have a reservation but didn't bother to listen or speak with us civilly.  Then came food debacles. First of all most of the wines had "sold out" we were recommended a horrible one. Then food orders came out in dribs and drabs. Some of the items we ordered never came to our table but we were helpfully told "we haven't charged you for the last one" off course you bloody shouldn't, we didn't get it!!!!! The food tasted great but the overall experience was shambolic, stressful and enjoyable. The manageress did try to resolve our issues with some "free desserts" but it was too little too late. At over 60 pounds a head I won't be back. Recommend spending your money elsewhere and if you have to see the view take the elevator up have a look and come down because you won't get served at the bar anytime soon anyway.

title: Hopefully It Will Improve?
comment: Situated way up in the clouds at the top of the Heron Tower this is an impressive location. The restaurant is part of a group which has a fairly good reputation. Everyone who works there is trying there best to be genial and well meaning but the service just does not gel at all. It was very busy with city types drinking beer straight from the bottle at £6 which was the cheapest alcohol you could have at the outside bar. The night we went the refigeration had broken down so these beers were having to be cooled in large buckets of ice and water. It was so windy that cocktail lists etc were blowing away down to the pavement of the City below. I can't imagine what it is going to be like in one our cold winters. There is no clear indication as to where you eat or can just drink. The men's lavatory has space for just two people and am surprised that for a restaurant and bar this size which must hold at least 250 people there are not more space devoted to this necessity. The food however was good and did come out of the kitchen within a reasonable time. At the same price as Nobu there was nothing to compare the two, Nobu every time. They must have invested millions and i wish the owners well, but money is not everything in making a good restaurant. Let's see whta's happening with it in a year's time?

title: Good view - otherwise mixed feelings
comment: I would agree that the lift to the top was an experience and the view from the restaurant terrace was great (the bar's less so) but unfortunately I was seated in the unprepossessing entrance corridor, with small tables being free on the terrace. They seem to have strict rules: closing the terrace after the merest hint of rain. That might have had something to do with their reluctance to give me a table with a view. So best to pick a cloudless day. Even then you might have to dodge a leak from the ceiling in the indoor bar area, which seemed unrelated to any rain The prices were almost as elevated as the restaurant, so I limited myself to a Kaffirinha (sic) - a pointless variation on a great drink, 2 sea urchin nigiri (passable but so new to me I was not sure what to make of it, but even I knew more than the engaging waiter who well after advising me to go for the nigiri rather than the sashimi confessed he had never eaten raw fish!), a stunningly good Jalea sashimi seviche (sic): squid tempura, white ﬁsh, sweet potato, aji limo, fresh jalapeño, leche de tigre; and a (too-subtle for me) mango-coriander mousse. Clearly the operation is needing time to bed down and train its staff, but they seem to have a very willing crew and the food is at or near the highest level. So, at these prices I probably won't be back in a hurry.

title: Über cool!
comment: Sushi Samba is the new Nobu! Über trendy Über sexy crowd Über expensive Über worth it! (get off @ Liverpool street station and walk for 1 minute. Inside Heron Tower @ 40th floor)

title: Mojitos are a must!
comment: You have got to visit this bar if you are in london. We enjoyed a mojito each, they were £12 but it was worth it. Amazing views, and an exhilerating ride in the glass elevator to get there! Would have liked to have seen some of the food but it had literally just opened when we arrived.

title: Amazing views and wonderful service with superb food
comment: Honestly one of the best restaurants I have been to for some time. Service is impeccable with extremely welcoming and friendly staff. The team are chatty but not too intrusive. V imformative about the food and view - which are both incredible. All round 10/10 as there isn't one thing I could fault.

title: Service needs improvement
comment: When hearing sushi samba was opening in London I was on the phone immediately booking a table and maybe this was my mistake in not waiting a few months for teething troubles to be ironed out. Undoubtably this must have the finest views in London. We arrive 30 mins before our table was due to get some drinks at the bar. Unfortunately the weather was bad so we couldn't enjoy the outside bar area. No offer to take our coats so had to stand there with them. I told the staff to get us at 9pm when out table was ready. At 9.05 I asked if we cold sit down as we were getting very hungry but was greeted with a blank look. At 9.15 we were eventually taken to our table. We ordered more drinks which took over 20 mins to arrive. We asked our waiter for some suggestions and whilst he seemed very nice we all found it very difficult to understand him. We eventually ordered and the food was superb. The twist of Japanese and south American is excellent and if I was just commenting on the food i would have given it 4 or 5 out of 5. After our mains and thirty minutes later we had to ask for the dessert menus and coffees. Overall we had a good evening due to the company and food. Ordering further drinks again took over 20 minutes and confusion in some cases and the drinks bill would have been far higher if not being so slow. For the prices the service needs to be greatly improved. We spent over 600 pounds for the 6 of us which is on par with nobu and Zuma. The venue and food could make it one of the best venues in London but the management need to do something very quickly to ensure the service is on par as this greatly reduced the experience.

title: Special Treat
comment: Jump in the glass lift & you are whizzed up to the 38th floor for SushiSamba. We have been waiting for a long time for this venue to be opened, delayed a couple of times. Finally we got to try this eagerly awaited restaurant!  The panoramic views are breathtaking. There is an outdoor bar area & then an open space the other side, reported to be the highest outdoor space in London! We popped out there after our lunch & took in the views of Tower Bridge, Greenwich & the Olympic Park! The staff were very welcoming, friendly & attentive. They offered advice on the menu as I was a little confused what certain dishes were!  Let's cut to the chase. The food is expensive, so visiting this restaurant would only be for a special treat for some people, including me. The inside was bright & airy, high ceilings, but higher than Duck & Waffle, located above on the 40th floor. Back to the food & menu, many of the dishes are unusual, so we decided to order a few plates at a time to see portion sizes & decide as we go. Pretty much the same as when you dine at D&W above! We ordered skewers of the Chicken Teriyaki (safe) but also ordered a bunch of the Samba Rolls. A variety of rolls - an assortment of Crab, Tuna, Salmon, Yellowtail, Prawn, Scallop, Wagyu, Avocado, Tempura, Wasabi Mayo, Aji panca & a housemade soy reduction.  We also ordered the EL TOPO® (salmon, jalapeño, shiso leaf, fresh melted mozzarella, crispy onion) which was our favourite! We were actually full by then & after 1 drink each & a coffee the bill was very high, but we knew it wouldn't be cheap! I personally felt it was worth the cost, just to experience such great service, wonderful exciting food & stunning views of London. If you don't get all 3, I can appreciate the negative reviews.

title: GREAT VIEW DECENT FOOD A FEW PROBLEMS
comment: We went to Sushisamba on a Monday night and the restaurant was full. We sat outside as it was a lovely evening but when dusk came there was no outside lighting at all. The staff tried to put candles on the tables but at 30 odd floors high, they stayed alight all of 30 seconds. 2 of my glasses of vodka were both chipped which the staff rectified. The food was good but expensive and if we hadn't sat outside the restaurant was ok inside. This place could be fabulous but at these early stages, a few tweeks are necessary. The staff did respond by giving us free deserts that were very unusual and good. Would i go back again............watch this space

title: Great food
comment: I enjoyed lunch here. The service at the outside bar was dreadful, standing there for about 5 minutes and eventually having to ask one of the under-emplyed staff if we might have a drink. We sat outside the restaurant; we were warned it was a bit cold & the wind made it uncomfortable. I am not sure if the outside terrace has a future given the high location & the English weather. Service was a bit slow to arrive but helpful; food was excellent. I have been to Sushi Samba in Las Vegas & atmosphere was not as good but was a quiet Friday lunchtime. I would not come here if you want a quick meal.

title: Great Food, Great Views!
comment: The restaurant is on the 38th floor of the Heron Tower and the views from the glass elevator are pretty impressive but nothing compared to the view once you get inside.  The is an outdoor bar/terrace with spectacular views over London - St. Paul's Cathederal, The Gherkin, and The Shard all in full view. We had an early reservation (18.30) and were lucky enough to have a table by the window, it was still light and watching the transformation of the city from day to night was beautiful so I'd definitely seize the opportunity to visit around the same time if day if you can.  Now onto the food - as it's name suggests the food is a fusion between Japanese and South American cuisine. I must admit I found the menu a little bit confusing but the waiters were happy to explain everything without being patronising - they suggested we go for a combination of some of the small plates, the sushi, the raw section and the grill section and share them between us. There is the option if taking a large plate/main meal if you're a "it's my dinner and I'm not sharing" kind of person but there is so much choice on the rest of the menu it would seem a shame to do this.  Our food arrived in stages and was lovely - my favourite by far was the Tuna Tataki - sliced pieces of seared tuna - which was really good. I don't normally do deserts but our waiter suggested we try the Chocolate Banana cake which was more like a chocolate fondant and tasted amazing and the Assorted Mochi which were different flavoured ice cream and sorbet balls wrapped in Japanese rice paper which again were lovely. The wine selection was good and if you are a Sake fan, there was plenty of choice.  Altogether dinner came to around £170 including wine and service so this place is not cheap. It is worth it however, especially if you are celebrating something special. I'll definitely be back!

title: What a night!!
comment: Sushi Samba rocked last night! It was fantastic. Great food, great service and fantastic cocktails. And for that view...I can not wait to go again. The tempura green beans and the rock shrimp started us off nicely and the sushi platter our server put together for us was of the highest quality, it was excellent. I get excited just writing this! It does get very busy by the bar but the service was still quick and our waiter knew the menu to the finest detail. Recommended!!!

title: Great service in an iconic location
comment: Sushi samba in the Heron Tower London is breathtaking. From the moment you get into the fast lift to the 39th floor to the views of London to the food and service this is a great, but not cheap place to enjoy My wife treated me on an evening which was warm, views were amazing, but windy, indoor seating recommended ! The wine we wanted was not available but we were advised on some others which would compliment our choice of food, there is a great selection so pick carefully ! Our favourites were almost all of it but the gyozo and large meat plates were amazing. I would also recommend the cocktails a great way to start what was a great evening

title: Amazing views and food.. Stay away from the diabetic cocktails
comment: I went in the first fortnight of opening, so admittedly teething problems... The Japanzilian sushi is out of this world, as is the view.. The cocktails on the other hand are jailbait sweet, avoid..

title: Amazing views and delicious food on the 39th floor of the Heron Tower
comment: I treated my husband to dinner here on Saturday. I am scared of heights, but am normally fine with views so thought this restaurant would be ok. The lift is clear glass and I had to stand with my back to the view. Once inside, the decor was modern, bright and funky. We were shown to a table inside as it was too windy to sit outside and we had a view of the bar and a glass roof for the space below. The service was very good and friendly, but it did take 20 mins for our order to be taken. The food was great and we would recommend the gyoza, black cod and meat large platter. We also had a couple of glasses of wine which were lovely and recommended by the waitress which we were pleased to not we're the cheapest on the menu. The price for a meal for two plus wine, coffee and a desert was £170. Not somewhere for everyday, but for a special occasion, perfect. I will be going again!

title: Experience trumps food
comment: Definitely worth the visit for the amazing views, but the food itself is lackluster. As with other Sushi Sambas, they try to get a bit too precious with all the "hyphenated" fusion plates, so it often ends up with the food weighted down by too many ingredients and sauces. Nothing we had struck me as either impressive or disagreeable, and the prices are reasonable enough that if you stick to 4 or 5 plates and a drink between two people you should be walking out spending £30 each. However, if you want to see a breaktaking London skyline, I would definitely recommend checking this place out. Only problem is it feels particularly impressive at sunset, and in a London winter that's going to mean a dinner at 4.30pm!

title: Stunning views in an iconic location
comment: This is my second visit to Sushi Samba and this time I opted to try the "Duck and Waffle" offering. We tried a number of eclectic dishes from the menu which we shared among us. The food and service was excellent and you've got to try the spanish sounding dessert which is just too delicious to fully describe in words!!!

title: Sushi Shambles
comment: We could not wait to get back to earth and deal with reality.By far the most disappointing and worst restaurant experience in my life to date, sorry Sushi Samba but why open a restaurant with the best views in london, rude waiters, dirty floors, dirty walls, terrible table service, poor, poor, poor, Wake up!!! your situated in the financial capital of the globe what ever happened to standards, uniform , and organisation, Food was an Embarrassment. I advise anyone to visit and on your return from the 39th floor PLLEASE!!! PLEASE!!! PLEASE!!! go across the road and visit 1901 Bar Andaz - Liverpool street - you will realise what class is all about and what keeping your feet on the ground really means :), please don't be fooled by the heady heights of sushi shambles thinking that you'll have a fantastic dinning experience that's all i have to say.

title: nice view terrible food & service
comment: terrible, terrible, terribe, bad service, bad food. infact nearly £1000 for four people for dinner and drinks and the only good thing was the view and that belongs to London. i have never wriiten a reiview but then i have never paid so much for something so ordinary. Lucky i was with great company.

title: Sushi Samba - Heron Tower - hip & happening
comment: This is the 2nd highest restaurant in Europe the view is magnificent. The lift itself is an experience, they had to slow it down as it was also the fastest in Europe. It's still pretty quick, it's glass and it's on the outside of the building. It was like a ride! On arrival your greeted by a buzz of waitresses in orange, a magnificent view, and a glass stairwell leading to a cool bar with a terrace area. We learned you do not need to pre book the bar which is good. It's Monday night, they've been open for 3 weeks, it's busy and lively. We sit down to order a bottle of champagne between the 4 of us. None in stock only by the glass. I'm 8 months pregnant and was allowing myself 1 glass of champagne, I ordered 1 glass and it came out flat. Not a bubble in sight, I sent it back.  They replaced it with another, that was slightly better.  The idea is to pick lots of dishes from different sections and share. you can always order more of something, as it comes out quickly. Popping the tempura shrimp in your mouth was a delight, it was so unptious, and perfectly cooked. A good start. We ordered a lot of food to try a large variety, the Japanese/Peruvian/Brazilian fusion works wonderfully, a hint of salsa, fresh lime, wasabi, who'd of ever thought it. The black cod was falling off the skewer perfectly cooked, the lamb chops where melt in your mouth. The rib eye my husband raved about as the most tasty steak he'd eaten, however we where all let down by the wagu beef that you couldn't even cut with a steak knife let alone chew. The poussin teriyaki was a waste if time, boney, hardly any meat, and my husband and I bit into it and it was pink. We where assured by the waiter it was perfectly cooked, they then took away half the dish re cooked it until it had charcoal on it and was dry and brought back the half eaten meal. A big let down they should of replaced it all together. I was asked by the group not to complain again as it may ruin the evening. The civiche salmon pleasure over load in the mouth, the sushi rolls tasty, interesting and creative although I would never put truffle near sushi it dosen't work.  The banana and chocolate cake could do with some work, the one I make at home is tastier than it, but my husband was happy with the chilli chocolate dish. The service was rooky, it felt like they had never worked in a restaurant before. When pouring the wine out initially for the chap who choose the wine, they then forgot to top his glass up. They poured me wine 3 times even though every time I pointed out I wasn't drinking it and that I was very clearly visibly 8 months pregnant. They poured too much wine into the glasses which left it to go warm, when asking for water it wouldn't turn up, the incident with the chicken and no replacing the whole dish etc.  However I say all of this purely for them hopefully to rectify as they are only 3 weeks into opening. The food as a general was fantastic, I will go back and I will recommend it. We where in a joyful mood, and didn't want to let anything get to us we still had a fabulous evening, sat on the terrace over looking the best city in the world it felt like being on holiday. This restaurant is impressive, if they can refine the details it could become my favourite local for food, view, ambiance. Here's hoping!  At £75 a head they really need to.
